Summary: Excellent hotel! Super location! We've stayed at the Grand Californian several times. It's always a great stay! Love being right there near the parks. It's so convenient. The food options are also good. Mousekeeping was good and efficient.

The staff was phenomenal!  A special shout out to Zack and Danny, the bellman at the hotel.  My wife and I were allowed to recharge our phone at the bell captain station, instead of up in our room so that we could maximize our time at the park.  Thanks again Danny and Zack!!!

The only reason I can possibly think of staying here is if you value proximity to the park over everything else, and I mean *everything*. $65 for valet parking (!), which we only find out after we‚Äôve given keys to the valet and are checking in at the front desk. Checked in at 5:45pm and they still didn‚Äôt have one of our rooms ready (seriously?). The other room they gave us had someone else in it. Took another 1+ hrs to get an alternate room.   The courtyard is LOUD - live music throughout the evening including a show that started at 8pm so good luck trying to get little kids to sleep.   Rooms are serviceable but far from fancy. It‚Äôs about a 3 star chain hotel experience on a good day. Avoid unless you have more money than you know what to do with and don‚Äôt mind loud obnoxious

The price is absolutely not justified at this low Marriott level hotel.    If you have little kids that need to sleep this is a terrible hotel!  We are on the 5th floor overlooking the pool and my kids could not sleep.  Loud, live music that blares into your room.  I get it, I usually love entertainment but it‚Äôs LOUD!!  I asked to be moved they said every single suite in the hotel; 1 and 2 bedrooms were fully booked.  It‚Äôs almost like they get this same complaint throughout the night so they just say no.    I did like convenience of adventure park access.  Last time we stayed at the Marriott across the street.  Honestly that was WAY better IMO!  If you‚Äôre using the hotel to sleep go there if you have kids.  They have bunk beds for kids too.  And way cheaper!  Pros:   Soft good
Room tip: Ask where your room is?  Find the quietest area if that matters.  If you‚Äôre a night owl, go enjoy...

Summary Heading: Good but not worth the price
Summary: This is the nicest on site hotel at Disneyland but is not a $600/night hotel in any other regard.  You are paying for proximity to the park.  The rooms are nicer and larger than the other two on site hotels and the pools are nice but the proximity to the park also comes with the overnight noise that happens while the third shift works their magic.

Summary Heading: Beware of hidden fees, missing disclosures and treatment of people with disabilities
Summary: Came for lunch. Lunch was good but valet parking cost us $65 because we went shopping afterward, spend over $1000 dollars at Disney store. They do not care!! Rates are well hidden and they steered us to valet parking. We were with a disabled person with a severe mobility issue and I did not want to repark. If I knew how much it would cost I would definitely repark as they initially offer 3 hours validated parking They also managed to loose green ticket for the car. Horrible customer service!! Happy Holiday to the unhelpful employees of definitely not Happy Place.

This is by far the best way to go if you‚Äôre doing a Disneyland/California Adventure trip. From the minute we drove up to the sad time we had to say goodbye the next night, service was impeccable. First, we were greeted at the gate by our family name after they checked to see whether we were guests. That made our kids feel like, ‚ÄúWow, we are really doing this!‚Äù  Then we checked our bags with a really nice bell service and our car with a friendly valet. Still great service.  When we entered the lobby, my family was awed. It‚Äôs appointed beautifully at Christmastime. I was also able to check in within a few minutes and told to come back at 3 for our room. We got back from our first park day at 4:30 and the room was ready. It‚Äôs warmly decorated and the beds were comfortable. We could
Room tip: We valeted. It was worth it. Yes, you pay for everything, but this is a special trip. Less stress...

Summary Heading: The best family experience in a 5-Star resort. Everyone is treated like royalty here.
Summary: The Disney Magic started as soon as we pulled our car into the parking lane. We arrived at high check in time and the lanes were a bit congested. Almost instantly we were upgraded to valet parking for the duration of our stay (5 Days). Inside at the check in desk it was the most pleasant experience we have ever had. Our reservation cast member explained everything we needed to know about the property. She made sure we had the best experience a person could have. Attentive customer service is not lost on any cast member at this hotel. We probably interacted with 30 different cast members during our stay and every single one gave their full attention and stellar 5-Star service. We would definitely love to stay here again for future stays. A bit pricey but you pay for location and
Room tip: Learn to use the Disneyland app before you go, fear not because there are plenty of cast members...

Summary Heading: A great hotel, in a great location for the family.
Summary: As it's been said here, it's pretty hard (if not impossible right now) to beat the location of Disney's Grand Californian (here, "DGC") for a family Disney stay.  We've stayed at the Courtyard Marriott Theme Park Entrance, which as the name implies is well-situated near the entrance to the Disneyland Esplanade (ticket entrance) - and while the Courtyard Marriott IS a good hotel with a really good location, it is a relatively non-descript walk down the long driveway to Harbor Boulevard, then a walk up the Boulevard to the hotel.   Contrastingly, the walk from the Esplanade to DGC is through Downtown Disney, past the huge World of Disney store and various shops.  Essentially, if you don't want to keep the Disney vibe going, you don't leave it while walking from the parks to your

The beds and pillows  are so comfortable. Housekeeping staff are amazing they can never do enough for guests. As soon as you walk into the hotel it takes you back to being a child. Thank you for all the extra touches ‚ù§Ô∏è
Room tip: Just put on your Mickey ears and enjoy

Summary: First, let me say we have stayed at this hotel several times, and generally enjoyed our stay.   It is comfortable and convenient, if not, despite its price point, particularly high end.  However,  for a our first post Covid stay, we struck a problem. The hotel effectively checked  us out of our room , after we moved into it, and returned it to the system as if it was available. We only discovered this when our keys stopped working. The front desk issued us with another set without question - but for another room number. In effect they had checked us out and into  another room, meaning our room , and all our belongings, was  available for another guest to enter.  Worse, they had no idea they had done this, and they were expecting a guest to check into it.  We had to spend

We stayed here for 3 nights and really enjoyed our stay.  Our room was clean (housekeeping came every day) and well maintained, the bed was very comfortable.  We didn't hear any noise from outside the room.  The room had a small balcony which overlooked the pool in the distance.  The hotel is very big, our room was quite a way from the elevators although this wasn't a problem.  It is a bit of a maze as well at first, but we found our bearings quite quickly.    The location was the best thing for us, the entrance into California Adventure park was great as was the short walk to Disneyland.  I don't think we made the most of what the hotel had to offer though as we spent all our time in the parks.  The cost would mean I would only be likely to stay here again if we could have some

Still the best hotel in the Disney Resort. We‚Äôve stayed here for all of our Disney trips except our last. After that we decided Grand California is the hotel for us. The Concierge level is great. The hotel offers a great military discount, which enables us to stay at the concierge level. The Veranda saved us about $300 a day if food costs.

I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Yes, it's expensive, but every cast member and every amenity was superb. From the moment we arrived at 11:45am with a text saying our room was ready, everything went beautifully. We had a pool view on the third floor and could see the ferris wheel as well (photo attached!) It was my husband's first time at the GCH and we are both so impressed by the things Disney does to make your stay memorable. We had lunch at the Craftsman Bar which was delicious, spent a day in the pool/hot tub and attended Oogie Boogie bash which was so much fun! We even got to eat at Napa Rose without a reservation in the bar area and that dinner was just amazing and our server, Julio, made us feel like he knew us.I know some say the magic is gone, but I

Summary Heading: Not up to the usual Disney standards.
Summary: We are DVC members and travel to Disneyworld a lot. This time we decided to use our points  that we have at Grand California. We started the stay trying to make a dinner reservation in Disneyland. The Bell service wanted to put our personal things in storage. They did not like that we decided to go put them our room ourselves.   When we tried to get a key card, the line at the desk was so long. We gave up.  No trash pickup or towel change until 3rd day unless you ask. We just put our trash in the hall.   No convenient restaurants in the hotel without reservations. The bar and grill by the pool did not have good food. There is only one place to get pickup food items, and sometimes they are out of fruit.  We had an efficiency room because we didn‚Äôt have enough points for the

The reason for the four stars is because the location of this hotel is superb. You walk out of the back doors and you are in Downtown Disney. Turn right and you are a 2 minute walk from both Disney Parks.  The rooms are very basic. For the money in any other hotel you would expect a lot more.  Pre-book breakfasts and any other main meals if you can on the Disney app. You can also use virtual lines on there too and they work well.  Checkin is very swift and they are very helpful. The same for the Concierge.  I did have to call for housekeeping to clean the room on arrival. Dust everywhere, drink must have been spilled on the nightstand and not cleaned and something all over the net curtains. They did arrive very quickly. Be aware - if there is no one moving in the room the AC

Summary Heading: Not what it used to be
Summary: We have stayed a couple of times before.  Never again.  Hotel is showing signs of wear and tear in the rooms.  Having to use a cell phone to get in the room doesn't always work.  When we requested a key card, that didn't work either.  Prices are inflated like everything else Disney and unless you have made reservations at least 3 months in advance, Good Luck on eating a sit down meal anywhere in the hotel. The Hotel staff was very pleasant and friendly though and housekeeping did a great job on our room.  Just wouldn't spend that much money again to line Disney pockets.

I was nervous paying so much for the hotel when the reviews were so poor, but we had an amazing time. The location near to the parks and the private DCA entrance made the cost worthwhile. We had a standard room but ended up with a balcony and we could see the fireworks show. My teenage son loved the fact that it had a sofa/twin bed that he could sleep on. We had robes and slippers in the closet, housekeeping every day and lots of plug-ins for charging. No microwave, but a mini fridge kept milk cold for cereal in the morning before Early Entry. Quiet hallways even though they were completely booked, and the parks were packed. Cast members always greeted us as we were coming and going. In the Oogie Boogie themed lobby, there was a quartet of singers in the afternoon and a piano

The Grand Californian's rating here seems to have gone down lately, but our experience was terrific. There really is something more magical staying at a Disney property. Yes, it's much more expensive on property. But the room was large, comfortable, well furnished, and I had no complaints about it at all. I also really like the mini succulent plant they added to the bathroom sink-- just a nice Disney touch that you wouldn't get at regular hotels.  The front desk clerk who checked us in was extremely warm and friendly. When we were taking pictures in the lobby, a passing staff member offered to take out photo for us. It's just small moments like these that really set Disney apart.   Also--- the hotel has a very distinctive smell that just brings back lots of nostalgia for me.

Many said this was old and worn. I didn‚Äôt find that at all. Clean, very comfortable. Excellent staff. Expensive but you are paying for location. One bad point..security line to get into Downtown Disney from the hotel was extremely slow and poorly run. Forget getting  to rides early. In all, a wonderful experience.

I stayed from 10/2-10/6 and it was worth it to me to pay triple the price of other local hotels because those other hotels do not have a beautiful huge lobby with leather chairs (even little leather rocking chairs in front of cartoons for kids!) a fireplace, holiday decorations, a pianist playing music, and an a cappella  group entertaining their guests.  They accommodated my request for a room with a day bed and no less than 3 employees greeted me and offered to help me find my room.  I did the online check in and digital key so I never had to wait in line.  Brian at the front desk on 10/5 helped to comfort me when I had a really difficult time trying to order dinner and I wish I could remember the name of the valet (maybe Manny?) on 10/6 who made our day by giving us a gift

Summary Heading: Not The Happiness Place on The Planet
Summary: We just stayed at the hotel for our sons 2nd birthday. I left the hotel in shock how a $1,000 a night room could be such a stressful experience. To start with, when we went up to the room hours later, they put us in the wrong room. They wanted us to go back and wait in 10 mins line to change it. No one seemed to be able to help us make reservations: they kept sending us to different spots. Made us wait 1 hour for our bags. Didn‚Äôt bother to text us when the room was ready. The room was less than average with no mini bar or just water, which I was ok with, but the service just stressed me out. Went to check out and called the bellmen to pick up our bags to store so we can hang by the pool. They didn‚Äôt do it because they said I needed to be in the room. I wasn‚Äôt going to wait 30

Summary Heading: Key Location & Concierge Level Great Value
Summary: Staying at the Grand Californian Hotel & Spa, you enter the Disney bubble, and you forget your worries.  We have stayed at here before, but this is the first time we sprung for the Concierge Level.  First, we were checked in with the Concierge and while we waited, we were introduced to the concierge lounge, which had coninental breakfast of meats, cheeses, muffins, lox, bagels, yogurt, fruit, mimosas, juices, cappucino meaker, hot chocolate, teas, coffee, mimosas and bottled waters.  We ate here before we headed to the park.   We had a room with two queen beds and a sofa that would make out in a bed if we had needed it.  Inside the room was a refrigerator, a couple bottles of water. There was a walk-in shower with a waterfall shower head and a 2nd showerhead with a wand as well.

The only reason to stay here is the location. The rooms are typical rooms, albeit worn down. The hotel lobby, while spectacular, is kept cold to ‚Äúencourage‚Äù guests to get outside. Our house keeping was spotty at best, as we stayed four nights and our room was made up twice! Be sure to bring your own water as complimentary is no longer in the Disney vernacular. While they are fully operational, they are still short staffed and it is reflected in the s l o w service. Again can‚Äôt best the location, you decide if the price is worth the convenience.

If you are staying on Disneylands property The Adventure Spa & Resort will make your magical dreams come to a reality. Everything from character dinning, to an Orange County Award winning Spa. The room suite accommodations are ultra sanitized (even prior to the pandemic) with a California mountain vibe. You can exit the resort into California Adventure land or into Downtown Disney or take the monorail to Disneyland. At Christmas time, the entire resort is decorated with Christmas Disney  and have the most beautiful musical entertainment with hot chocolate drinks and Bavarian style desserts.

Summary Heading: Great location and vibe, disappointing service.
Summary: (To Disney Company)   We stayed at the California grand hotel and spa. This was our first time staying on the resort. I have been a passholder since 1990. I have seen Disney grow and change for 3 decades. Our experience was not the magical high standard that your company has promised and preached.  We arrived on 10:30am. We visited CA adventure until our room was ready. We returned to the hotel at 2:45 to see if our room would be ready soon for checkin after 3:00. We saw our other family members and they received a text prior to 2:30 for checking in. (We received no text still.) We arranged to have adjoining doors which your staff member Brent accommodated.  Since we have a 4 month old and 2 year old, our family and your staff allowed us to wait in their room until ours was

This is my favorite hotel in California--hands down. Yes, it is expensive, but very worth it. We were there for two nights over Labor Day weekend and to celebrate our 57th wedding anniversary. We added the concierge service, and our room was on the club level. We had access to the Veranda Room. ALL the restaurants inside the parks and in Downtown Disney have become outrageously expensive, if you can find them on the Disneyland app. (Some are booked months ahead.) We ate exclusively in the Veranda Room--and enjoyed it. Special kudos to Joanie! She served with a smile and went above and beyond to be accommodating.  Our room was exceptional, and the service more than met our expectations. (I adore craftsman style--especially Rennie-McIntosh, and the style is everywhere. We have

The line for check in is unbelievable.  And they make you stand in it for a simple question!  There is no 'information desk' or 'concierge desk' downstairs to ask anything.  I wanted to upgrade my park pass and it took 2 hours.  So disappointing, this is not the same hotel it used to be.  And their mandatory smart phone requirement for EVERYTHING is not fair to disabled or elderly people.  My parents could never stay here because of that.  The rooms are ADA compliant, but the constant suggestion to use the mobile app makes it impossible and frustrating for a blind person (no screen on their braille units) or an elderly person with a flip phone.  I tried to contact them ahead of time to educate myself on how to navigate their system without a smart phone and was assured its

So disappointing on so many levels...I really tried to look past so many flaws üòï but it makes me sad that Disney has fallen to Six Flags quality and service üò¢.   Cheap corporate beancounters have taken over.  Don't waste your time or money.

Summary Heading: Not worth the top dollar they charge
Summary: You don‚Äôt get what you pay for it‚Äôs too dollar but the hotel is in need of some upgrading . We were put in a wheel chair accessible room when it was not needed. Everything was chair height. The coffee machine was missing the lights didn‚Äôt work on the one side of the bed . When we asked to be switched to a regular room we were told we would have to store our luggage and go get it when a room was available . Did not offer to move the luggage for us so we just stayed rather than pack up store our luggage and move . They were less than accommodating !! Not worth what they charge  here anymore .

Summary Heading: Extremely overpriced and Bad Customer Service
Summary: We stayed at the Grand Californian on a Saturday night with a pool view room. First of all, I used the Disneyland app to do online check in (which they suggested 5+ times via emails prior to our visit) and though the room was support to be available at 3pm it wasn't available until almost 4:30PM! In addition, we had to wait in line at the check in desk because the Disneyland app doesn't function correctly and wouldn't assign us a room. Once we FINALLY were able to get to our room, we were told our bags would be delivered within 30 minutes. It took them almost an hour to deliver the bags - they wasted almost 3+ hours of our time, time we could've spent enjoying the park. The room was OK, the comforter looked super old and definitely needed to be replaced. For costing almost

Summary Heading: Some great elements, some not as good.
Summary: We are DVC and bagged a room at the VGC in early August. First thing- the building and lobby and overall vibe are beautiful. The bell person who greeted us was outstanding, Sorry didn‚Äôt get his name but he‚Äôs 50s, slim guy, and extremely talkative and helpful, the true ‚ÄòDisney Difference‚Äô type employee. Check in was a very slow and lengthy experience although the lady was very nice. Queues at 3pm. This could be speeded up. Room wasn‚Äôt obtained until just after 4. We had a disappointing outlook room, ground floor, corner, facing directly at back entrance to Californian Adventure. Security guards stood around and no real barrier for privacy so never sat on patio. However, we realised the room had some advantages in that you could be in the park in about 40 steps. Room was nice

Summary Heading: Overhyped and far from Disney standard
Summary: Had our first family trip to this hotel and was quite disappointed.   Room is beautiful but appliances are clearly worn out.   The pool is a zoo and CMs do nothing to keep things under control.   Yes, it‚Äôs great to be just a few steps from the park but the lines are huge and quite messy - with CMs checking if you have a hotel reservation which tells me people are sneaking in to access the parks.   No decent food options onsite, if downtown Disney is closed you‚Äôre basically SOL‚Ä¶  The check out was crowded and it was clear how understaffed and unprepared they are to deal with a large amount of people going in/out.   All in all my kids had lots of fun with Disney but this hotel sits at the bottom of my DVC experiences

The location of the hotel with entrances to DCA and downtown Disney cannot be beat and that is what you are paying for.  We had neither terrible nor magical experiences. The room was tired, but that was to be expected from other reviews.  The pool was very crowded and hard to find chairs. The breakfast buffet at Storytellers was one of our better trip meals.  This hotel is very expensive, but we would stay again (1-2 nights only) for the convenience of the entry.

This is our go-to place to stay. when we visit DL. Yes, it is expensive. For me, though, it is worth the convenience of being able to nap in the middle of the day to recharge my batteries before the night time shows. Hopefully they will reinstitute the early Magic Morning access which is also a perk of this hotel.  They usually have a character like Pluto strolling through the lobby. During Christmas, they have carolers singing and an elaborate gingerbread house in the lobby as well.  It‚Äôs always fun to look for the hidden Mickeys in the hotel (check the bathroom wallpaper and the hallway carpets). And in the past there were staff members happy to trade DL pins with you.  The hotel is clean, the interior is beautiful, and the easy access cannot be beat. This is the only hotel

Summary Heading: You don't get what you pay for
Summary: Read all the reviews and hoped for the best but they are right. Not worth the money at all. Getting in the park 30 min early is a plus but get in line at 6:45 or it won't matter bc the security is so slow. The pools were broken and closed at the heat of the day so don't let your kids know their is a water slide or you'll be set up for big tears. It's almost impossible to get food, the rooms are tiny and not that clean. Won't stay here again for sure.

Summary Heading: Hard to say if worth the $$
Summary: We've stayed at Disneyland Hotel before and one of the main draw cards was the extra magic hour in the morning. Unfortunately due to Covid, this hadn't resumed for our stay. I believe it has now but is only half an hour.  Anyway, coming from Australia, 2 nights was extremely expensive for us. It was priced highly anyway, but factoring in our poor dollar against the USD, was next-level expensive. That said, the foyer was lovely (although far too cold!). The rooms were good and spacious, but a long walk from the elevator. We had a standard view and as a result was a half view of Downtown Disney, but did actually have a fireworks view which was a nice surprise.  We found that a lot of times the front desk was too busy (the queue was too long) to get assistance so we gave up. Same

We stayed at this hotel in July. The room was in bad condition. The bathroom was dirty. Hair left on the wall in a few spots. Called guest service-they didn‚Äôt seem to bother. The next day, hair was still there. The toilet was so loud when flushing down. Not so much Disney decorations in the room. Just way too expensive for such a bad and run down room, with poor amenities. Good location-that is  one positive. Beautiful Lobby. We didn‚Äôt have early entrance for hotel guests at that period of stay so the benefit was even less. It‚Äôs not grand like its name.

Summary Heading: Not So Grand Experiences at The Grand (2nd time still terrible)
Summary: We have stayed at The Grand about a year ago when things first reopened. That time, in 2021, we had a pretty poor experience. We tried to write it off as bad timing and the hotel just being overwhelmed with reopening etc. .. NOPE!! This place seriously lacks in consistently, efficiency, and overall magic. If levels of Magic were measured by characters (and Mickey were the top level) this place would get GOOFY as a rating‚Ä¶. Lacking magic and other things just falling apart in its wake.   This trip was for our daughter birthday. On our first night stay, we we enjoyed a broken AC unit in our room. No matter what we did, the room would not get cold. We called for maintenance and he came to our room. Nice enough guy. At 11pm he‚Äôs in our room taking apart our vent for the AC (we the

Summary Heading: Grand Californian July 2022 ups and downs
Summary: Standard room, nice amenities, decent size, good mattress, happy that Disney sleeps 5 to a room for a family. Some issues below. Love the decor in the main hall. Check in was a mess, the app didn't notify when the room was available, after online check in. Sat in lounge waiting for an hour, then went through 30 minute line and they said room had been available and weren't sure why app failed. Room phone handset didn't work, only speakerphone worked. Sink on left (nice to have 2) drained very slowly. Fridge wasn't that cold. No in room water, but there was a Keurig. Toss us a bone at $800/nt and maybe put a complimentary bottle or two in the room. Housekeepers were polite, same with bell staff and front desk. AC worked. Like the arts and crafts style, but overall probably

Summary Heading: As an East Coast DVC member the west coast Grand Californian has a long way to go.
Summary: We are East Coast DVC Disney people so this is our first time experience West Coast Disney. We decided to try the best on the West Coast which is the grand Californian. They won not impressed. (This trip we did not stay as DVC members.) -strike 1 as we left the East Coast we called to confirm we had a king bed, seven hours later we show up at the grand Californian and no king beds left. -strike 2 we crashed at 9 PM because our bodies run East Coast time. 30 minutes later we get a knocking at the door asking if we requested turn down service. - strike 3 I wake up at 6 AM for some coffee and there‚Äôs no place on this five-star resort to get fresh coffee. They referred me to a vending machine across the street or a Starbucks in downtown Disney they will open up later. That is mine

We stayed for three nights at the end of a 2 week trip, and it was a great way to finish our holiday. The room was a DVC studio, which was big enough for our family of four, which included 2 teenagers. Had a theme park view of Incredicoaster and Goofys Sky School, which was unexpected but nice. Very convenient for access to parks and Downtown Disney Ate in the Craftsman Grill a couple of times as very convenient and the food was fresh and very tasty. Pools were great and towels plentiful. Would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Want a Magical Stay? Avoid this place!
Summary: It was our anniversary and we always go to Disneyland around May 4th also Star Wars Day. Decided to stay here because at the time our Baby was around 1 and we would like the convenience of being able to go back to the hotel for rests and also feeding. Booked almost 2 months in advanced.   Check in day: We were still in the car traveling and our ETA was about an hour, the app reminded us to do a quick check in so we can bypass through the line and straight to our room, again for our son who's been in the car all day. That didn't happen.   What actually happened is we get there, some lady is spewing some racist stuff about some black person was looking at her and that person didn't exist, all the while holding up the line. It took another 45mins for us to get checked in. I kept my

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel but too crowded, small and poor value for money.
Summary: Really high hopes but just constantly let down. For the price (and it‚Äôs a high price) this just doesn‚Äôt live up. It is a beautiful building but everything is too crowded, too small or too expensive. And that impacts the quality of everything.   You can‚Äôt get a spot at the pool and if you do ( we got lucky once) we couldn‚Äôt ever get the attention of the waiters (and they are hustling - just too many people).  The rooms are downright tiny. And we‚Äôre only a family of three.  Prices are outrageous and we‚Äôre usher to NYC or WDW prices and these are at least 30-50% higher.   I‚Äôm going to stick to Florida in the future. Substantially more bang for your buck. Everything is nicer. Bigger. Cleaner. I hate having to spend money in the state of Florida right now but Disneyland vs Disney

Wow wow wow‚Ä¶ we stayed in a 2 bedroom DVC villa and had the best stay. The place was huge and felt such a home away from home‚Ä¶ in fact I would live here instead of home in a heartbeat haha!  Beautiful theming, amazing lobby, the place was incredible. We did character breakfast at storybook dining, spent time around the gorgeous pools and sampled a fair few beverages around the hotel . The access into California adventure park is perfect, it saves the main park queues and launches you straight into the fun of the park. Even the short walk through downtown disney into the main entrances is easy. A perfect base for Disney but we could‚Äôve easily just spent all of our time just in the resort.  I‚Äôve always been an Orlando Disney girl but the Grand Cali may have just taken a piece of

Over the years we stayed at several Disney resorts in California and Florida but this is our favorite. Our last trip we stayed in a one bedroom suite and it was very spacious. The rooms are a bit dated, and could definitely use some upgrading but they are still quite charming. Overall we had an excellent experience, largely due to the service at this resort, and the close proximity to both Disneyland parks.

The Grand Californian was A+ on service from the time we drove up to the valet out front until we checked out. We were very pleased with the kindness and helpfulness shown at check-in. Our room was ready when we arrived and was a Downtown Disney View with a nightly view of Fireworks. Noise from DD was not a problem for us as some others have mentioned - We only heard the noise if we opened the doors to our balcony. Our room was clean and had comfortable beds. We were thrilled with how quickly we could access either park from our room/hotel each day - It seemed too easy! The security lines were very short going from the hotel into either park. I honestly don't think we had any complaints.

The Grand is an amazing hotel and Nic, the GM, has created a property with impeccable service that's absolutely world class.  Jovani, one of the team leaders, greeted us outside, walked us around and even offered his cellphone when helping us with our Disneyland tickets.    The lobby was spotless with amazing florals, and the Veranda on the sixth floor has an incredible spread of coffee, juices (and donuts!) when we stopped by for breakfast.  (It's a must for families.)     Last but not least, I have never had a valet service as fast as we had at the Grand.  Before I even finished saying my last name, the valet said "Absolutely, sir!" and our car pulled up in short order.  The Grand is amazing!

We are long time Disney World travelers and decided to make a trip to the original in Anaheim.  We had a very magical trip!  We were impressed with the location of the GC and truly found it to be very walkable to both parks.  We usually stay at the Polynesian at WDW, and we found the deluxe status to be comparable.  We splurged on the club level for the first time and found the food offerings to be ample enough to eat almost three meals a day in the lounge (side note‚Äîwe don‚Äôt love heavy meals, so the healthful options in the lounge worked well alongside popcorn and Mickey pretzels in the park!).  It was great to have a glass of wine or mimosa or beer, too.  In the mornings, we‚Äôd grab some waters, a coffee, and a bagel and be out the door for rope drop!  My only complaint for

We had a terrific and magical stay. Few things are better than having the convenience of being able to visit the park and walk right back to the room so quickly. We had a woods view room, but we‚Äôre able to look into the park. Top quality room. They even brought robes to the room for us to use.

Summary Heading: Location is only benefit. Dated, worn rooms; poor service.
Summary: My daughter and I visited on a whim. I thought, let‚Äôs splurge and stay and the ‚ÄòGrand‚Äô Californian. Yes, the location was amazing‚Ä¶..but that‚Äôs it. Not very Grand, at all.  The room was dated, worn, and felt dirty. The TV did not work properly, the coffee maker didn‚Äôt work. Employees were curt and either very overworked or just continually tired, nary a smile the four days we were there.  Long wait for check in; over 45 minutes. Long wait to get the car, almost an hour. And then because it took so long to get the car, almost an hour, my daughter had to use the restroom‚Ä¶the bellman let out a huge sigh and lectured, we were holding ‚Äòeveryone‚Äô up.  We really did have a great time at Disney, will be back sooner rather than later‚Ä¶..Genie + was great, mobile check-out at stores is a

This was the 2nd time staying here and was still great. We came to celebrate my nephew's 4th birthday and my sister's Air Force retirement. The lady at check in was really friendly and made check in easy. They accommodated our request for adjoining rooms and even gave us a better view than what we booked. The bell hops were always extremely nice and room service was great. One of the reasons we stayed here again, besides the great theme and decor, was because of the close proximity to the park. It was very convenient to the park which makes it very easy for a family with toddlers or kids to make it back to the room for nap time or a break. The beds were very comfy, the bathrooms we'll equipped and just very cute. Our room had 2 queen beds and one day bed that pulled out to a

Summary Heading: This is not the Disney I remember!
Summary: Been visiting Disneyland since I was 4, over 60 years. I have stayed at the Grand Californian and the Disneyland Hotel in the past. We have never been treated like this. Must be morale is really low. Bell services refused to help us at check in and check out. Front desk was rude and gave out misinformation. Craftsman Grill opened after the parks opened so was useless. We paid for an upgraded room for over $800 a night. Others in our party stayed at the much closer to the parks Anahiem Best Western Plus Park Place Inn  for a quarter of the price and were treated better. I used to love Disney but this was really off-putting. Nor am I one that normally writes bad reviews but this was bad.

We waited for a very long time to check in, was told our room was not ready, which is fine. When the room was ready, we got a text, and then i have to line up again to get our room key fix. Then, the bell man who was pushing the luggage cart, rudely told our kids to get out of the way when they were in front of him. It just didn't feel right to talk to my kids that way. The hotel is busy and chaotic. The room is small, old and with musty carpet. Room service is only with limited hours. However, we did manage to get food delivery to the hotel. The only reason that's worth staying here is really just for the special entrance and short distant to Disney.

Haven't been to disney in about 5 years. Decided we'd do GCH this time. It is so worth it! There were three of us staying here and we all came by separate ubers. I arrived first and from the lady at the gate to the gentleman that opened the car door you knew you were in for a treat. They were all so kind, tagged my bags and put them in storage as we arrived about 9:30am. I went inside to check in and there was a bit of a line. To be expected at a busy place but they handled the line quickly and attended to the needs of guests infront of me. They were all so lovely and efficient. We booked a club level room so I went up to the verandah to grab a bite after breakfast. I had a delicious mimosa (perhaps every morning..I don't want to talk about that part!!!). We had a vegan with us

Twin 16 birthday weekend with connected rooms at Grand Californian ruined by sketchy service.   Housekeeping refused to put sheets on the sofa bed - told me to do it myself with spare blankets in the closet.  I asked for a supervisor who told me ‚Äúwe only do that for suites.‚Äù  For what we paid for adjoining rooms that weekend there was no way I was making up the bed myself!  Supervisor then said she‚Äôd ‚Äúmake an exception this one time.‚Äù  Horrible. Funny thing is the bellman specifically told us if we wanted to use the sofa bed, we should call housekeeping to make up the bed! Storyteller Cafe was the worst part.  I made reservations weeks in advance, but they didn‚Äôt want to seat us even when I showed the reservation because ‚Äúour staff has worked a long shift and they want to close

I am a Disney regular, having worked in the park previously, but this was my first time staying at the Grand Californian because I was in town for a work conference at the resort.  I was definitely disappointed by the whole experience.  When I first checked in, I was given a room on the first floor at the corner of the hotel, and it was dark and very small.  It felt similar to a motel room.  I called guest services to ask if there was any way I could switch rooms, and luckily, I was able to be moved to a much bigger and nicer room.  During my stay, I ordered room service a few times, but for some reason, my room service trays and plates were never taken out when housekeeping would come (I was not present when housekeeping would be in my room).  I called down to the front desk to

My husband and I have stayed at this hotel before and everything has been decent prior. However, this time around was a NIGHTMARE. From the second we got to the hotel there were problems. A little back story, our socal passes were expiring at the end of may and there were no reservations available to use up our last day on the ticket. In order to explore more options for us, I spent HOURS on hold/speaking with multiple hotel reps and Disneyland customer service reps. I wanted to know what options we had available to us since we couldn't use the last day on our ticket. Amongst upgrading to annual passes, they also advised me that if we stayed at one of the Disneyland hotels we could be accommodated with reservations for the days we would be staying. After more calls to the hotel

Summary Heading: Worth it-with kids or mobility issues.
Summary: Expensive -YES, worth it? YES!! for us. We brought our five year old grandson for his first trip to the Disney parks. We needed to drive from the north Bay Area, but wanted to keep the trip short for his first time far from home as well. The lodgings and amenities were great, and we paid the extra for the concierge level with lounge. (Also expensive but worth it) .  Check in was the only frustration: we arrived earlier than expected, so wanted to check in at the front desk as well as online to be sure they knew we were waiting: arrived before one on a Monday: waited a loooong time for the 2-4 staffed windows. (But they have a nice great room for waiting with cartoons for kids. ) Check in time:3pm, we didn‚Äôt get in till after 5, even after the front desk and the concierge made

Summary Heading: Average for the price, stay elsewhere
Summary: The only benefit I can write about is proximity to the parks and the steadfast attitude of a select few members of staff who have not yet been ground down by pedaling the same stuff to mountains of guests. Overpriced, pile them high 3 star at best hotel. Covid has long past as a serious threat and they still cite it as a reason to only clean your room once every two days... just say you're struggling to recruit enough staff. Per title, stay at one of the nearby v reasonable (relatively) priced hotels.

Super expensive and very crowded. Rooms adequate and clean, access to California Adventure is a huge plus. Ask for a room near the elevators as it can be a long walk. Napa Rose delicious but lacking in service. Must reserve 3 months in advance. Pool area needed cleaning with staff just walking past empty water bottles on the ground. Minimum housecleaning but we did get good responses when we called. Valet parking chaotic. Communication with valet to not deposit our bags in our room. Ended up having to go back down and transport ourself. Promised us a credit for the $50 day parking but it never showed on out bill.

I generally love this hotel. It‚Äôs super crowded so it loses some of its charm. Not enough chairs at the pool for all the guests they cram in there. The HoJo across the street does a better job at managing their pool. I was unfortunately put in a room under the veranda area. It was fine until about 930 or so. The amount of moving furniture is wild. After an hour of listening to the lullaby of furniture moving and vacuuming while trying to sleep, I called the desk. They offered no solution and said it should be over soon. Gee thanks. For $700 a night I should be able to sleep. Cast members seem worn down. It‚Äôs understandable, but makes for a dim experience. Not worth the splurge anymore.  If you want to sleep, request a room away from any verandas. It was the worst experience I‚Äôve

Summary Heading: Spoiled for life - location CANNOT be beat
Summary: With only 2 nights & 3 days at Disneyland, I decided to splurge when I saw the Sunday/Monday Spring 25% off deal which made this very affordable (still a splurge, but an affordable splurge!) I never could have stayed here at full price. My trip to Disney was elevated to a completely different level by staying here. Being able to walk from the hotel INTO THE PARK was absolutely amazing. I was stressing about the drive to property, the parking, the tram, the security line...none of that was at play and it Made.My. Vacation. I cannot imagine ever staying anywhere else! The LOCATION makes this just outstanding. Get wet on the rides and need to change clothes? Just hop to the hotel. Want to take a break and sit at the pool for a few hours before going back to the park? Easy peasy.

I was impressed with my recent stay at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel.  I read reviews from previous guests and they weren't too complimentary, so I was a bit on guard when booking this hotel.  We have stayed here several times prior to Covid and remember it's former glory.  After my stay, I can say that all my fears and trepidation were for not.  The Grand Californian is getting back to it's former glory, albeit it still has a ways to go.  The check-in process was tedious.  I did the on-line check-in as soon as it was offered to me (2 days before my actual check in date).  Not entirely trusting the on-line check in process, I physically checked in at the front desk around 1PM.    Check-In time is 3 PM.  I was told that I should receive a check in notice via my on-line check

Summary Heading: Good trip but not impressed with Club level for the cost
Summary: I LOVE all things Disney, and that is a huge understatement. My family and I have been fortunate enough to take at least one annual trip to Disney World every year since 2018, we‚Äôre Castaway Club members and I look forward to planning these trips all year. I devour content, listen to podcasts, etc. So it‚Äôs with a heavy heart that I disclose that our recent trip to Disneyland/CA and our club level stay at Disney‚Äôs Grand Californian was just ‚Ä¶ ok. I used to feel that if we took the time to research and plan accordingly in advance (and yes, sometimes pay extra) that we could really get to do everything our family wanted on a Disney parks vacation.The Genie+ system has changed that. We went to Universal Studios Orlando a few months ago for Christmas and while the unlimited express

I don't typically write reviews, but felt the need to after reading some of the recent negative reviews. Just before leaving for a 3 day stay here, I reread the reviews and got really worried based on some of the comments. Take away - This was an outstanding experience over Easter weekend for a party of 12 in three rooms (including teens and young children). Reservations were easily done. We checked in digitally two days before our trip. Our rooms were actually ready BEFORE we even got to hotel (around noon) and it was great to see the digital key arrive while we were still at the airport!!! We drove up to the property and were warmly welcomed at the guard shack. There was more than adequate help with checking in and it was a breeze. Everyone... and I mean everyone, was super

Summary Heading: Don't go unless you want to spend $1,000s to hear "We're All Out" and "We Can't Do That"
Summary: I'll start by saying: I've been coming to Disneyland for 37+ years, and it's heartbreaking to write this.  My in-laws, who have been Disney Vacation Club members for 30+ years, generously used their DVC points for a family suite (2 BR, 3 BTH). I wish they hadn't, because their points are much better spent at their "home" resorts at Disney World, and the cash they spent on food is much better spent off-property at places like Anaheim's Packing District.   If you grew up visiting Disney World and Disneyland, you've likely been accustomed to expect a standard of service that goes the extra mile to delight and create "magic." Unfortunately, magic is hard to find on this property.  Let's start with the food. The bottom line: If you like eating a variety of delicious cuisines, don't

Summary Heading: Just got robbed of my money after no refund for cancelling a trip a month out.
Summary: I had to cancel my reservation today, 4/11/22,  after pushing back this vacation two times due to my dog's cancer surgery and chemo.  I found out I will not be able to go May 11.  When I canceled my reservation after an hour on hold, I was told there were no refunds "for the type of package I booked."   My package was four nights and park tickets.  I am out $4,660.60 for a trip that was supposed to be for a milestone birthday.  I was never told I had a reservation that couldn't be cancelled and everything online says you can get a refund up to five days before you come except for a $200.  Don't book here.

Summary Heading: no value for huge amount of money
Summary: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Grand Californian hotel. We are seasoned travelers and have stayed at many 5 star hotels around the world. We expected for the price of the room, close to $1000.00 a night that we would receive some degree of cleanliness and comfort. None of that occurred. I understand that included in the exorbitant cost of the room is the proximity to the parks. However, that perk is not worth the deficiencies of the hotel. We stayed in a club level room which did have access to a small club providing finger food during the day. Still not worth the price of the room. If you book here for the park option be aware of the following: 1. the beds are old and are on platforms, no box springs 2. the bed coverings and pillows are hospital grade 3. the

Just awful. For the money you pay, I'm going to assume that it's all for the privilege of easier access to the park. Otherwise, there are better hotels outside of the park that will take much better care of your needs. Either we slipped through the cracks or service has gone downhill.  Here's what I have so far, having checked in yesterday and checking out tomorrow:   -when we arrived, there was a good size line to check in, however we used the app to check in and things went a bit smoother. There was a concierge who was going up and down the line asking folks for details on their stay and she was ushering them to the next available opening, which was great, however we simply wanted some physical room keys rather use our phones to access to room. We were ushered to the next

We booked this hotel as it is closest to Disney, which is why we came (family trip with kids).  I can handle the fact that it‚Äôs old, etc. but here‚Äôs why we rated it a 1 star:  - day one of stay: we left room late, so I called to ask for housekeeping as I thought maybe they wouldn‚Äôt stop by; I was told they don‚Äôt do housekeeping daily unless requested (because of COVID?!?! In late March of 22?). Anyway, I don‚Äôt mind calling daily. They came while we were out (as expected) that day. Great!  - day two: I called to let them know we were leaving room aNS we wanted housekeeping (small room with a family of 4, yeah‚Ä¶ we need it). We returned late that day and ‚Ä¶ the room was the same! No one came by.  - day three: called again, waited 30 minutes for front desk to pick up (what? In a

Summary Heading: Worn, short staffed and still wonderful
Summary: Our worst visit to the Grand Californian, but no matter how worn or short staffed, this is one of the most magical, if not the most magical Disney hotel of all.  Check-in was pleasant as we arrived late, without crowds. Our two bedroom room set up was wonderful as always- which is exactly why we purchased a DVC share here. But wow, is it worn down. The carpets are aged (it felt like we were greeted with a bleached out murder stain on entry). All the woodwork is flecked, chipped and peeling.  One of the bathroom lights was out, the clocks weren‚Äôt changed. The drain in the third shower ran really slow. It was bizarre.  I tried calling for help three times and NEVER made it to a human, waiting at one point for over 20 minutes. For people needing major assistance, I‚Äôd be upset. And

Summary Heading: Not worth it - no extra magic hours - slow service
Summary: We have stayed here many times, but it's no longer worth it.  They cancelled extra magic hours which is a huge benefit to staying in this very expensive hotel. In the morning, they cue you up in a very long security line at the entrance to downtown disney.  I used the mobile app to be notified when my room was ready - it never notified me so I had to go to the front desk and wait in line and they could not figure out how to print my room keys.  Argh.  We left our bags with the hotel on our departure day and when we came to collect our bags, it took 40 minutes to get them!  The line was huge to collect your bags and then we waited forever after they took out tickets.  Also the person collecting our ticket wanted a tip because she said that they don't share tips so we're supposed

I left a bank debit card and a pair of headphones in my room safe when checking out. I called the hotel 30 minutes later while waiting for my flight home. I was told to fill out an online form. I did and received a notice the next day that the items haven't been located. Really? I gotta think leaving items in a room safe happens occasionally and that the staff must have a master code for breaking safes so that the next guests can use the room safe. At the least, the staff could call me and ask what the combination was so they could open it and then return the items to me.  I also think the staff would have a log on which housekeeper was assigned to clean up the room after our stay. A simple interview with the employee would expedite the process of returning my lost items.  This

We did a quick 3 night stay and our entire family enjoyed every bit of the parks + staying at the resort. Aside from convenience, we enjoy the beauty of this resort and the amazing cast members. Samantha at the Front Desk was exceptional and remembered our family throughout our stay from check in to check out. Its the little things that make it magical! Roberto (DVC) was kind and welcomed us, provided us with suggestions on things to do as we waited for our room. We needed towels and bellservice once during our stay and both were prompt and kind in delivery. Mahalo Disney for another magical stay for our family!

Of all the locations and placed I have visited; this hotel is my favorite. It is like you are living in a Disney Park. The staff treats you like royalty. The Spa is amazing. Foods are great. I can't think of anything I don't like about the Grand Californian. It is pricy, but worth the splurge.

The only redeeming quality of this hotel was its location relative to the parks and the ability to use the security lines at the hotel and the separate entrance to California Adventure. With no magic mornings there was little else to justify the expense of the hotel.   Don‚Äôt get me wrong, the ability to not stand in annoyingly long security lines and the ability to pop into the hotel during the day for a quick breather was nice.  But though we can afford the price of the hotel it was hard to forget about given how small the rooms are, and our room was well worn. tv setup wasn‚Äôt great, could never get the casting to work and the other options to watch were limited. Walls were paper thin, and as we stayed above downtown Disney the music they were blasting till late in the night

We spent 4 nights during the week of President‚Äôs Day at GCH. We were last here in spring 2019. I had set my expectations low based on recent reviews in terms of service, cleanliness and amenities. I booked a standard club-level room using the 25% off weekday promotion many months ago. The same room is $500 more per night for spring break! You are paying for location. At any other hotel, the quality of the rooms would be $200-$300 range.   We arrived just before noon and left our bags with the Bell. No one tells you what to do but since we had been here before I asked how to get to the 6th floor. Last time we were greeted and escorted to the Concierge. I checked in online but I was skeptical of the digital key so we talked to the Concierge and she gave us physical keys that we

Summary Heading: Location is the Key to the Magic
Summary: The location is second to none in the area.  The proximity to the parks is a unique offering - the gate to California Adventure is an added plus for anyone staying on-site, eliminating the need for any additional parking, car service, trams or other transportation.   The hotel remains majestic, but corners have been cut in this covid-era as turn-down service and plush in-room robes have been eliminated.  The stay was comfortable, and the individual toiletries remain top notch.  Views can be debated as a premium pool room overlooked only a room & lifeguard chair (but was rectified later in the stay).  Staff ('cast members') helpful as always, assisting with issues, directions at every turn.    However, Disney would do the guests well to expand/return on-site benefits to guests

We booked our trip after a year of so many let downs. I am beyond pleased to share that this stay was anything but a let down. Every single cast member throughout the property truly made us feel like they were grateful for the opportunity to help us. I have a few regrets from day 1 but that's more related to how to plan your day using Genie + and not the hotel itself. The location for Grand Californian for your day in California Adventure could not have been any better. It was wonderful on day 2 after walking back and forth so much on day 1 to be able to easily come back to our room mid-day and rest for a bit before heading out to enjoy the park at night. The beds were so comfortable and the room was clean. Room service was phenomenal. It was worth every single penny. My only

I wish I could put in words how magical Sonia is!! Her 16 years of Disney Knowledge was very much appreciated and admirable. Covid has made reservations and magic moment  very harder to plan. However that did not Stop Sonia  but that has not stopped breathtaking smile and can do attitude to making our Disney dreams come true!! I hope Disney know How lucky they are to have Sonia on their team.  From the bottom of my heart Thank you for all you do Sonia!!

We just returned from a night trip at Disney‚Äôs Grand Californian Hotel. We had a great time. All the cast members were so nice to us during our visit.I would like to really thank Grandma Julie our server at the poolside Cabana. She was so friendly and attentive to all our needs. Nanatte at the Hearthstone lounge remembered us from our last trip and made our lobby experience very special. I also want to thank Arlene and the entire staff on the club level for taking such good care of myself and my family. I was really nice getting to know some of them on a more personal level. I know a lot of people think that the hotel is to expensive but the service you get is well worth it.

An amazing hotel. VERY pricey, but it‚Äôs great. The average price is $700 a night. I‚Äôve stayed here 3 separate times and it‚Äôs been lovely each time. The first time we had the view of the pool, the next 2 times it was Downtown Disney. Such great views! You are basically paying for convenience. You can‚Äôt beat the location.  After a long day it‚Äôs nice to have a short walk to the hotel. The bathrooms are modern and the details are so cute. I love the rain shower! My favorite time to stay here is during holidays. In the center of the lobby is a huge Christmas tree and gingerbread house. Definitely a must to stay here, at least once.

5 nights. 5 park days. Perfect location.  We stayed in room 5151 and the room was perfect for my 75 year old  mom and I.  The hotel was perfect for mid-day breaks. The ease of access to the parks was worth the cost alone.  The rooms were clean.  Beds were so comfortable.  At check-in we were advised of limited housekeeping during our stay.  Every other day trash was removed and I'm not sure what else.  We kept our rooms tidy ourselves.  There were fireworks,  we could see perfectly from the room.

We had a great experience at The Grand Californian.  Our flight arrived 40 minutes early and we were surprised that within minutes of arrival we received a text that our room was ready (well before the 4:00pm check in time).  Our one-bedroom suite was what we were used to, being DVC members we always stay in a one-bedroom suite, but we were surprised by the great theme park view we had.  We were also very pleased with the cleanliness of the room.  The only down side was that our 14 year old ended up sleeping on the couch because the twin size Murphy bed and the sofa bed were both uncomfortable.   First world problem though when you're staying in a suite in a Deluxe resort at Disneyland.  The cast members at the front desk were very helpful in upgrading our tickets from 4 to 5

Excellent stay. I'm giving this 4 stars because I don't think the 2 bedroom suite is worth $1800 a night.  I thought it had better sleeping for the sofa bed. I actually like the day bed in regular rooms. It was a little more space but not worth the cost.

My fianc√© and I are big Disney World fans and normally stay at Grand Floridian in Florida. For Christmas we stayed at Grand Californian at a rate of $1200 a night. First, the location is great with being able to walk to the parks. THIS is what you are paying for. The rooms themselves are old and in dire need of an update. I would compare them to a value resort room at Disney World. We had a pool view and were put in a corner room that has a high wall balcony so you don‚Äôt really see the pool unless standing. With that, we enjoyed our stay because of the convenience to the park. The lobby is beautiful and the fireplace is nice as a gathering spot. The pool bar is nice with great staff. We are lunch there a few times. We will come back for the convenience to the park, just with a

I just returned home after a week with girlfriends at Disney. We all loved this beautiful resort. It was so relaxing with the huge fireplace and so clean. The cast members were so helpful and friendly. We requested an early check in and we did receive it. When we checked in we were told that maid service was every other day and they would pick up towels and trash. That did indeed happen, and when we called down for an extra blanket it was sent up within 15 minutes. The spa was spectacular! We all loved the ease of going to the parks every morning. We had the best time and definitely will be back!

My recent stay at the Grand Californian hotel and vacation and just how a nightmare this experience was for my family and I. I booked this reservation fairly far in advance. Because it‚Äôs really the first time since the world went into chaos I wanted to make sure my family had a comfortable stay for the short period of time we stayed at the park. I choose the deluxe hotel for comfort and convenience. Our party consisted of 4 adults 2 teens and 3 under the age of 10. Because we were so large and I work in California I asked a friend if I could borrow his car as well as we rented a SUV. My family and I drove up to the grand Californian and that‚Äôs when our difficulty began. My family in the rental drove up to the guard shack and were greeted with ‚Äúhello how are you? Checking in?‚Äù

Disney Anaheim is a safe , vibrant place to visit during Covid, in so many ways. Great clean outdoor place, friendly, delicious. The experience is an overall excellent place to experience some light in this time of doom. Be safe , bring hand sanitizer, and your mask , and visit Disney.

Staying at the Grand Californian Hotel and Spa has been a bucket list item of mine ever since my first visit to California Adventure. It is an absolutely beautiful hotel right next to California Adventure and Downtown Disney.  Now that I am older, it is difficult for me to  be on my feet and walking all day. Staying at the Grand Californian seemed like the best option when we decided to visit California Adventure and Disneyland for my adult son‚Äôs birthday.  We arrived at the hotel, a little after 8:00 am. We checked in at the security gate and were able to valet park ($50) our car within minutes. There was a long line of people wanting to check in (check in time is 3;00 pm) and I wanted to get a Happy Birthday button for my son. A cast member was directing guests to the

This was our Welcome Home stay as DVC members. We wanted to buy to book at 11 months because renting points here is impossible anymore. The trip was postponed from May due to the property's closure (a trip which was in turn postponed from September 2020). The only minor hiccups were no toiletries in our room. Housekeeping took a while to bring up the soaps and shampoos, but they did bring a huge bagful of products.   The hotel looked great for Halloween with a huge Oogie Boogie in the lobby. Everything was immaculate as usual, and our balcony looked right into Pixar Pier. We ate breakfast while the Silly Symphony Swings and Golden Zephyr tested each morning.

Summary Heading: High end, could have been better
Summary: It's a lovely property -- gorgeous lobby and proximity is worth paying the outrageous(!) prices. Disney does try to keep the customer top of mind at this property, but it's clear that there are so many people willing and able to pay for everything Disney, sometimes they can be careless. There was no shampoo or conditioner in the room, the floor (recently spot cleaned?) was damp in places when we checked in. No one responded to a call, so we had to stop at the desk downstairs. They were friendly and helpful, but I would think at that price level those things should be absolute. Noisy in the morning, the staff should have been more careful about banging in and out of the maintenance room across the hall. Yes, some people are up by 7am, but some are sleeping in. Overall it was a

Not worth the money  At $685 a night the main thing they have is location location location.  The carolers in the lobby were a nice touch and, the bartenders, and the  valet and other staff I encountered were all amazingly friendly.  But for the price they need to work on basics and that's just sad for a disney property  You had two people check in that work in hotels.  Surprised for that price to find a used k cup in my machine, no cups, no creamers, no coffees, no condiment kits.  A tv that doesn't work and that I fixed myself with my knowledge of hotels as I didn't have time to wait an hour for staff to come up.  No fitted sheets so the bottom sheets come untucked and to top it off that sheet was stained with black grease marks.  Blood stains on a bath towel, a worn hole in

We just returned from our fourth stay at the Grand Californian.  We had Club Level with a beautiful room on the 6th floor and a private dining room just down the hall.  Food options were available from 6:30 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.  It was  well worth it as we have two teen-aged boys and it was cheaper than eating in the park.  You could have as much as you wanted and even take food  and snacks back to your room for later.   The location makes it worth whatever they charge as I have limited mobility and could return to our room at any time in just a few minutes.  We highly recommend the Grand Californian!

Summary Heading: Location not worth the money here! Go ANYWHERE else!
Summary: I have to agree with everyone else who says this hotel has location ONLY. For $950/night this is at best a low rent motel. The rooms are drab, worn and poorly designed for families- for example you cannot use the bathroom sink without waking up the entire room as there is no door. The closet is non existent and as others mentioned the service is TERRIBLE. The hotel is loud, crowded and not worth the money at all. There are 0 tangible benefits to staying here. Not worth the money at all. My parents stayed at a nearby Radisson Blu and paid $2.50 for a daily shuttle to the park and their room (got 1/3 out cost) was outstanding.

All you get is location. Rooms are dated. Service is almost completely nonexistent.   This hotel has always been expensive‚Ä¶. But it used to partly justify that cost with pretty awesome service. Daily housekeeping and even turndown service were standard with chocolates on your pillow and towel animals at night. No more. There‚Äôs trash in the hallways, no daily housekeeping (‚Äúyou can make your dam* bed for $600/night!‚Äù) and the rooms themselves feel quite drab and dated.   For the ridiculous prices Disney really should restore service‚Ä¶

Summary Heading: Sorry Disney, harsh criticism is required to make this better
Summary: For over three decades I have been the one constantly pushing the need to stay at Disney properties to enhance your vacation. Unfortunately, I can no longer say that and it is painful. We have had two stays since COVID, one at Disney‚Äôs Yacht Club at Disney World and our most recent at Disney‚Äôs Grand Californian at Disneyland Resort. I am aware of the difficulties presented during this time to the hospitality industry (I have immediate family that acts as the GM of a large hotel), and the discrepancies we faced were not directly resulted from that. It was more a lack of caring and attention to detail. The main contributing factor for the negative review over my previous two stays post-COVID has to do with room service. When you‚Äôre paying $600-$700 a night for a hotel that we all

Summary Heading: Magic and services definitely has gone down post COVID
Summary: We are a military family and wow Disney sure knows how to treat its service individuals. For paying over $400 a night we couldn‚Äôt get a late checkout, since our first day out of four days, we requested to have our room cleaned and NO ONE CAME. We were probably in the parks for 2-3 hours until we had to come back for our kid‚Äôs nap and within that time no one showed up, even though we have told the lady we are leaving right now. Disney also definitely is trying to earn whatever they lost during COVID because we brought a wagon type stroller which isn‚Äôt as big as the strollers we have seen other parents bring in AND we saw others with an actual wagon stroller in the parks BUT alas we weren‚Äôt allowed to take ours in and we had to go rent their strollers.   The character interactions

Summary Heading: Not Ready for a Post-Covid World
Summary: My partner and I stayed here with our family for a quick one night stay to visit Disney Land after it finally opened up post-pandemic. I didn't have high hopes going into it, given all the recent reviews, but man was I even more disappointed than I expected. Check-in was great and efficient - though they never got our note requesting a king-bed, they were able to accommodate. That is where the magic ended. We went to the bell hop to pick up our bags and were told it would be 15 minutes of standing in the lobby before someone could retrieve them. We ended up having them delivered which took an about an hour for delivery. Our request for late check-out by one hour was denied and it took over 45 minutes for us to receive our car upon checkout  (with a $50 fee attached). As other

We booked this hotel mostly because of the great location. There's one entrance right in Downtown Disney and another directly into California Adventure Park. Self-parking is across the street from the hotel and very close to another entrance to Downtown Disney. The lobby is beautiful, with high ceilings and a luxury lodge feel. Staff were friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. Our room was not spectacular, but the beds were very comfortable. I would stay here again just for the convenient location, even though it was expensive.

I, like many others, had high hopes for this hotel. It was our first time staying at a Disney resort, and I'll admit my expectations were high for $750/night. I was not disappointed when we first arrived. The lobby is stunning. Check in was smooth as we arrived on a Thursday afternoon. Being close to the parks and Downtown Disney was awesome.  That's where the magic ended. We tried to make dinner reservations at the onsite restaurants and they were all booked. Solid. For the whole weekend. Breakfast. Lunch. Dinner. No availability. The next day we decided to take the kids to the pool. I wasn't surprised the cabanas were all booked, but the whole time we were there, not a single lounge chair was available. We hounded the poolside bar till we could get a spot, even though there

Summary Heading: Looking to Spend a lit of money?
Summary: I had never been able to stay at a Disneyland hotel.  Too expensive!  This trip proved my concern.  I planned a 2 night trip to attend the Oogy Boogie Bash. Since it was just 2 nights I decided to stay at the Disney Grand Californian.  Total 2 night stay for 5 people in 2 rooms was $3156.  The rooms are typical for an upgrade hotel.  They didn't seen to  big any bigger or fancy. We ate breakfast at one of the restaurants.  I'm assuming due to Covid-19 they had menus via a QR code.  I didn't realize it was a Character Breakfast.   It was a buffet, which I seldom go to since I don't eat a lot. We ordered 2 mimosas.  Breakfast for 5 was over $300.  I know when you do Disney it's going to be expensive,  this trip was excessive.  On top of the tickets to the Oogy Boogy Bash $845 for

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel in an amazing location (big and expensive though)
Summary: You can't beat the location of this hotel in regards to proximity to any of the 6 Disney Parks (Florida included).  You have your own entrance to California Adventure and Downtown Disney directly from the hotel.    The hotel is beautiful.  Rooms are fine but not very big.  They have a fridge.    I was tempted to drop the rating to a 4/5 for these reasons: -The hotel is HUGE.  It was a very long walk from our room to the exit/pool/restaurants. -As with any large hotel the front desk could get swamped at times and have a long line. -It's an extremely expensive hotel (by far the most we've ever paid for a hotel).  We have definitely stayed in far more luxurious hotels for half the price.  You are definitely paying for the location first and foremost.  It was a dream to stay here

Summary Heading: Ask what‚Äôs on the floor above your room
Summary: We are staying at The Grand Californian right now and our room on the fifth floor is immediately below the Club Level Lounge called The Veranda. They begin setting up the lounge at 6am every morning and cleanup until 11:30pm. This results in a lot of noise for any room below with furniture being dragged around a hardwood floor. We asked the front desk to be relocated because of this but were told that it was not possible because they were sold out. Beware of where they put you, this hotel costs way to much money to not be able to sleep.

Our family (2 kids ages 9 & 10) stayed at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel & Spa a week ago & loved it! Everyone was required to wear masks indoors & if you didn't have one they would give you one. We really appreciated the way the staff made that mandatory. Plenty of sanitizer stations as well. Would of liked to see more people sanitizing the elevator & common areas around the clock. My kids loved the pool slide but did not like the cold water on the colder days in all 3 pools. There's also not enough for them to do at the pools especially if the waters going to be cold. No pool noodles or floats nor more than the one main slide (& mini slide for littles). Really need more slides & activities that can keep kids interested over a few hours. We adults loved watching the kids play

Summary Heading: Paying for the Location Because Other Perks Not Offered
Summary: We've stayed at this hotel many times over the years and the main draw for us besides the location has always been the access to Magic Mornings where you get into the park one hour earlier than those not staying at one of the three Disney properties. This perk is no longer available and you have to stand in line and get in at the same time as everyone else. This is such a bummer because Magic Mornings have always made this hotel more special.   Our stay this time was good, location cannot be beat and the room was small but comfortable. Check-in was the fastest we've ever had even though the told us the hotel was at 97% capacity the day we arrived. A big con is like many other hotels during the pandemic they will only service your room every other day. We had garbage overflowing

There is a lot to like in this hotel with the details in the architecture and furnishings being quite amazing. The staff was very friendly and the restaurants provided quality and fresh food. It was not without a couple things that could have been done better. First the phone in the room did not work. Second there was no housekeeping or maybe you need to request that which the person checking us in should have told us. When the room wasn't serviced we requested towels the same evening which never came and since the phone didn't work well... Location can't be beat and not seeing or stepping on to a street for 3 days adds to the feeling of being totally away from reality.

Summary Heading: The location and convenience are what you pay for
Summary: Yes it‚Äôs overpriced like many Disney things, and the room is basic, but there isn‚Äôt any other hotel where you have a private entrance to California Adventure, and a 5 minutes walk to Disneyland. With young kids, avoiding the parking and bag check craziness is worth a lot.   The pools were really nice and the staff is awesome as always. Fridge in the room and microwave in the vending room helped a lot. The walls and windows muffled sound really well. We rarely had to wait more than 10 seconds for an elevator. The princess breakfast was on the ground floor.   The next time I go back to Disneyland, I‚Äôm not staying anywhere else.

Summary Heading: Great location, lovely property, but not worth the price
Summary: This was our first stay at the Grand Californian after staying off property many times previously. The hotel itself was beautiful, but its massive. Our room was ready early which was great, but was in a far corner, so it was a longer walk to get to the DTD and CA security checkpoints. The rooms were good size and I enjoyed the updated bathrooms. The outdoor patio is small, but due to the heat, we didn't spend any time out there.  The walls were thinner then expected, I could hear my neighbors throughout the day and night.  You absolutely pay for location and convenience with this resort. Our mid day breaks were a lot easier because of how close we were. The heat was brutal so that was really helpful.  The room and resort felt clean, and I felt most people followed the mask rule

I stayed here this past weekend. I Went on a Disney European cruise, and my expectations on that trip were 1000% exceeded. I expected the same quality for this property. Early check-in is not guaranteed, which I understand ‚Äì however I did expect to be checked in at the 3 PM check-in time. I had arrived early, expecting to hang around the property until the room was ready. What I wasn‚Äôt expecting was for all of the hotel restaurants to turn away walk up guests. There were signs all over the property for mobile ordering, which was fine except none of them were actually accepting mobile orders. Operations modified due to COVID, ok fine.   After all this waiting, four hours to be exact, my phone was running on single digit battery life. I did mobile check-in in the morning, but

Love this hotel. It is usually our favorite but this stay was extremely lacking. For 2 nights we had no hot water. Long hot days at the parks but came to the room late evening and had no hot water. We had to take cold showers Saturday and Sunday evening. We even tried Sunday morning and it was cold. The bathroom cabinets were also in bad shape.
