It was a handicapped room and the toilet in the bathroom was so small that a normal sized man couldn‚Äôt even fit on it. Maybe it was so others won‚Äôt fall in? But it was tiny. For a 5 star hotel and the amount of money we pay per night it was very sub par.

Summary Heading: A POOR knock-off of Disney World's Wilderness Lodge
Summary: I hate to be savage, but this hotel was a nightmare! While they used the same architecht as the Wilderness Lodge in Disney World, it is a cheaper version, the details are missing (carved headboards, geyser, outdoor activities, even the pools are sub-standard). Masks are required, but hotel staff didn't seem to enforce it for guests! They would walk past without a mask and no one would make a peep. The Club-level lounge was aweful! The food just ok, the coffee really bad and the special seating for fireworks was very limited and uncomfortable. At the pools there are no toys, no games, nothing except one slide that is closed the majority of the day (due to limited staff I persume). The rooms are very small and not very comfortable. The hotel is NOT a resort, not a place you want

The location is great for access to the parks, but the room rate is well over-priced. Rooms are centered around the lobby, so lobby noise carries into the rooms. Check-in process was smooth and friendly. Limited breakfast dining options, possibly due to Covid residual. Rooms decent.

Spent 2 days here as part of our 10th anniversary SoCal road trip. This was our first visit to Disneyland after being to Disney World 20-25 times. We loved the close proximity to everything. It helped us maximize our time in the parks as well as allowed us to come back for a break easily. We were able to watch the Disneyland fireworks from our balcony. The king bed is extremely comfortable and the rain shower is an added bonus.  This resort is with the splurge if you want to be right in the center of the magic.

Summary Heading: COVID is not going well here - rude, overworked staff, rules, rules, rules, security guards on hand to enforce
Summary: I went here with my family for a vacation, hoping alas to make it a working trip. Once we got beyond the sugary sweet greeting at the front desk, everything began to deteriorate. We were told there would be no housekeeping, no room service, no minibar, etc, which we are used to given circumstances. I asked if there was a business center and was told someone would get back to me. Not having heard back by the next morning, I simply followed the directions to the business center, which is near the conference rooms, all of which are clearly signed. Once there, I plugged-in my computer and began to work, joining a Zoom call. Having had difficulty getting anyone to speak to me up to that point, I was surprised to be confronted immediately by two employees asking me to leave. I told

This was the second time we stayed here and both experiences were very good. The hotel is expensive which is to be expected. You are right next to DCA which is incredibly convenient and cannot be overstated. Even though other hotels in the area are also very close, nothing beats walking right from the park to your hotel at the end of the day (or making mid-day stops). The shop in the hotel has a bunch of convenient items which ended up being helpful. The lobby is absolutely beautiful and the room was very clean and comfortable. We did not hear any neighbors at all; it wasn't clear if this was because the walls were well insulated or because we just didn't have neighbors. Our only complaints:  - there was no shampoo, soap, or conditioner in our room. We called down and they

First off, I will always stay here. It is one of my favorite hotels literally in the world.  However,  Disney has continued to ask enormous prices (yes, I have a choice, and yes, I choose to pay it) with an enormous drop off in what one gets for that.  I have been twice since reopening and am going again in two weeks.  Others have addressed much, so I will stick to this particular, and that is of the Arcadia Suite which is absolutely gorgeous and exponentially more expensive than other rooms.  When I booked it, I was told that within days a Disney specialist would be contacting me to arrange our stay, as we get personalized service for this level of room.  Not only did this NEVER happen, but I kept calling and calling and got jerked around albeit unwittingly from person to

This review happened during CoVID, August 2021. My wife and I went for a weekend getaway. The hotel is gorgeous in everyway. The design is of an old mountain lodge the kind you would find in Yosemite. The hotel really looks like a blast form the past but with all the modern amenities you would want. The staff is very friendly and they really go out of there way to make sure you are comfortable. The pool and gym and some restaurants are open. At the time we went you need reservations for the Napa Rose and the Storytellers Caf√© need reservations. You can ask if they had any cancelations or if they will take in walk ins but its not guaranteed. Hearthstone lounge and GCH Craftsman Bar and Grill are open and you can just walk in. No room service at the time. Obviously your next to

Had room with balcony overlooking park and the view was amazing. This place is all about the location which can not be faulted. However checked in at 7pm but room was still not ready. The front desk were amazing and reimbursed for the inconvenience. Would only stay here at disneyland

We arrived at the resort on July 5th.  The lobby was crowded, but we elected to check our bags and head to the parks.  We came back around two, to a very short check in line and our room was ready!  Talk about convenience, you can pop back in your room to change, and you even have your own entry into California Adventure.  The pool is large and gorgeous and has full service with drinks and food.   The room was spotless and the beds were very comfortable.  Disney did a great job of theming with this gorgeous craftsman style property.  All the employees were so friendly.   If you can afford a stay, DON'T hesitate.  Well worth the cost on so many levels.  We had a courtyard view and a lovely balcony.

Every place is hurting from lack of staff and it shows. Employees with experience and institutional knowledge are gone and newcomers are unable to keep up. From this hotel, you can walk right into Downtown Disney. Unfortunately, the in-hotel security line was often only staffed by one individual and the queue snaked almost to the hotel lobby. Employees did not know basic information, such as how to find our elevator from the hotel lobby. Pool staff do not enforce a maximum time limit for people saving chairs so families would save chairs in the morning when the pool opened until late in the afternoon. Pool staff merely shrugged their shoulders when asked if something could be done for those who were actually present at the pool. In sum, our stay was disappointing. For such high

Summary Heading: Great Location, but lower your expections
Summary: Lets get the obvious out the way. Location is as best as it can be. It has a downtown disney entrance which takes you to most of where the restaurants are. It has it's own disney california adventure entrance and a short walk to the disneyland entrance. The hotel lobby decor is amazing. At check in we were warned about the difficulty to get food if you don't have reservations. We had no problem. We were there Saturday night and was able to get a table for 6 at Naples with a 20 min wait at 6:30 pm. Getting food at both park on Saturday and Sunday wasn't difficult if you plan everything out on the app. We were able to order food within a 30 min arrival window at peak meal times. People are expecting way too much post-pandemic. I understand its no longer what its used to be at the

Crowded, poorly staffed, and lackluster. We booked in March, paying exorbitant rates for a limited occupancy disney experience, only to find the hotel and parks jammed at 100%.   Wait for our room was over 5 hrs, way beyond the guaranteed check in time.  Front desk just stopped answering the phone after awhile.  The whole Disney thing is a scam- - wait until the post-pandemic crowds die down and go somewhere other than a disney hotel.

For the price, this is not a top hotel room.  It is nice but not what you would expect at this price.  You are paying for convenience.  No robes, slippers, the rooms allow hallway noise, the shower control needs a manual, the room is dimly lit.    If I were to build a hotel at the Disneyland property??  Absolutely sound proof the room as most people visiting have young children who need to get to sleep, need a nap or maybe just to sleep in.  Not possible with the sounds from the hallway--other guests and employees making noise.  Towels are ok not plush.  Bedding was good, sheets nice.    Check-in took a long time so much time that we abandoned our luggage in line to a bell man to get to our dinner reservation at Storytellers.  Food was mehh there.  But what are your options??

Summary Heading: Cannot beat the location but service is really disappointing.
Summary: Given the normal Disney experience perhaps my expectations were high and I want to believe it is due to the covid impact on staff but alas it was a big disappointment. Food was incredibly limited and staff either couldn't keep up or just wasn't all that interested in the guests. At the pool we waited for someone to take our order for well over 30mins and finally gave up and walked up to the bar to order because we couldn't get any help otherwise. It was this way everywhere in the hotel.   Additionally I am gluten free and the options were just not there. It was quite disappointing because there just was not much I could eat.   Overall good location, and clean hotel but sadly disappointed.

We stayed a few weeks after Disneyland reopened after the shutdown. We chose to pay the exorbitant price to stay here simply to make our lives easier getting in and out of the parks and not having to wait in long security lines. I‚Äôd say it was worth it, I think my husband may not agree. They had a security line for hotel guests and it was always a quick and pleasant experience. They did not have the side entrance open into DCA, which was a bummer, but you could leave the park and enter the hotel from that entrance, just not the other way around.  The hotel itself is of course awesome. It is clean and well kept. We were in a room that was FAR from the lobby, in fact, I didn‚Äôt realize how large this hotel was until we had to find our room. The room was a good size, could be larger

Summary Heading: 5 Star Hotel, except in plague times...
Summary: The Grand Californian is a spectacular hotel. It had been a number of years since we last stayed and I had forgotten how wonderful the location, staff, rooms, and common spaces are.  That said, I don't know if I can recommend staying here at the moment. The epic fail was the lack of valets to return our car before 6AM. Never mentioned while parking, checking in, and/or picking up our car on previous days, we were late getting to LAX. We did make our flight to Hawaii thanks to a number of kind airport agents...but just barely.  Also, for whatever reason the business center is closed and there is no where for you to print out documents - in particular the Hawaii COVID test results and Hawaii Safe Travels QR codes we needed. A kind cast member took pity and allowed us to email them

Summary Heading: A Refreshing Break from the park!
Summary: the hotel outside is absolutely gorgeous.  have always wanted to stay here.  if you are expecting a 4 diamond resort i think it‚Äôs a bit of a stretch.  as far as amenities for the room itself etc it‚Äôs more of a hilton garden inn.  the ‚Äúfridge‚Äù is really more like a cooler.  the phone is crackly, and it‚Äôs hard to get to somebody, but the people are really nice.  but as usual for disney, expect long waits and line and lines and more lines.  was trying to get here when things were still on semi lock down, but after i booked this trip everything opened back up!  it‚Äôs expensive for what you get if you were only staying for the hotel.  but what it is great for... is taking a break from the park.  park hopping and disneyland in the heat is exhausting.  but when you and the kids can nap

Summary Heading: A perfect, magical four night stay.
Summary: We booked this quickly when Disney opened up to California residents a month or so ago, and for various reasons, booked two rooms in three different concurrent reservations. The rooms were two different types because that‚Äôs all that was available.  Upon check-in, a wonderfully patient woman seamlessly fixed all of this, giving us two adjacent rooms overlooking the park on the fourth floor in a prime location: three doors down from a little-used bank of elevators that open right next to the California Adventure entrance, and the pool.  It can‚Äôt be overstated how convenient it was to zip back into the hotel from the Grizzly River Rapids ride and be back in the park in less than five minutes. Quite an upgrade from our days staying in value hotels across the street from Disneyland

Summary Heading: Great location, but service has slipped
Summary: This was my second time staying at Grand Californian, and it‚Äôs a beautiful and relaxing hotel. The location can‚Äôt be beat for proximity to Disneyland parks; we used the private entrance into DCA on reopening day and it saved us long waits at the front gates of the park.   While staff were trying their best, the new systems to control attendance in the pool and restaurants, were frustrating to navigate. For example, we joined the new waitlist for the pool every day, and it took 3-4 hours to be allowed in. I liked being guaranteed  a seat, but there must be a better way to manage this, as there was a constant line of crying children and screaming Karens trying to get in the pool.   We usually eat at Storytellers Cafe, even when staying at another hotel, but the waitlist was full

First trip after the pandemic. The choice of the hotel is a no brainer. Disney never disappoints. Friendly and happy staff and Ultra clean rooms made our visit very relaxed. Walking to Disney downtown is a great way to entertain the family. They have allowed valet parking which has been missing at other eateries since the pandemic.

The standard room for $700+ is equivalent to any other average airport hotel room. You are essentially paying to save time walking to the parking structure from the park.  The food situation was sad - the granola was just a smashed up Nature Valley granola bar, lol.  The cocktails at the pool were weak and used cheap liquor (of course the price tag is *not* cheap).  When I called guest services about the food-ordering app not working, the employee on the phone was dismissive and rude.  I am so mad at myself for spending the money on what amounts to a very average hotel stay.  I'm sure if you are incredibly wealthy and have access to the best this hotel has to offer, you will have a MAGICAL TIME.  But if you're a regular person who is considering splurging on a special vacation,

Summary Heading: Spectacular view! A magical return to a better future! Thanks, Disney!
Summary: We stayed on the 6th floor with a view of Disney‚Äôs Californian Adventures. It was amazing. I felt like we were part of the magic as we sat on the balcony looking at the fun view from the colorful Ferris wheel to the Cars monumental Southwestern landscape. I‚Äôve never paid so much for a hotel but I‚Äôm happy to help keep Disney in business after the year and a half shutdown forced on them. We had such a wonderful stay, it washed away the memories of the pandemic. Happy, healthy and ready for good times ahead. Ringing in the new era with Disney was perfect. Everyone should stay there at least once to experience the beauty, view, majestic lobby, sunny numerous pools and staff that went the extra mile.

Summary Heading: The high price is for park access with a mediocre hotel.
Summary: Paying close to $700 per night for our room at Disney Grand Californian Hotel, I‚Äôm not sure it was worth the price. BUT I think we paid that due to their high demand and recent opening. I see that another Disney hotel, Paradise Pier, is reopening soon with rooms for $435/night. That would be WELL worth the price. The pools at Grand Californian were amazing, there was a water slide, and the loungers were super cushiony. I recommend a pool day set aside. We arrived late morning dressed for the pool and had them store our luggage until our room was ready for check-in while we headed to the pool. But the Paradise Pier Hotel also has pools with a water slide and they are rooftop pools with fireworks viewing (when that‚Äôs a thing again). So I‚Äôm excited to try that hotel. There

Summary Heading: A Disappointed Disney Grand Californian Fan
Summary: Our family came to the reopening of the Disney Grand California on 4-28-21 for 4 nights. This has always been our go to hotel when visiting Disneyland and probably have stayed over 50 times over the years.  I must say the staff was very friendly upon arrival and in full Disney excitement for the opening and return of guests but it went downhilll from there. We checked in to a room that had not been occupied for more than a year and found that there was stray hairs all over the bathroom, sinks and counters.  We were told that we would receive room service every other day but would be able to request anything we needed any time and they would bring it to us.   In the 4 nights that we spend, we never had room service, no one ever came to the room. They never came to collect the

Summary Heading: Probably the worst very expensive hotel where I ever stayed
Summary: The Disney Grand Californian Hotel & Spa at Disneyland may not be the worst hotel where I‚Äôve ever stayed, but it certainly is the worst expensive hotel where I‚Äôve ever stayed.  Presumably the Grand Hotel just re-opened with the re-opening of Disneyland (mid-April 2021), but the hotel really has no business re-opening.  They totally lack the ‚Äúinfrastructure‚Äù to support their guests.  The first morning of a three-night stay at the Grand, we asked where we could obtain breakfast.  The ‚ÄúCraftsman Grille‚Äù is the only place open in the general region before 8:00 to feed four hungry grandchildren.  To order breakfast at the ‚ÄúCraftsman‚Äù you have to download their app and key in your order.  If you don‚Äôt want yet another app on your phone, you go hungry.  The app is reported as easy, but

My husband and I (no kids) have visited Disneyland around 30 times and visited Disney World about 35 times. We‚Äôve stayed at our fair share of deluxe resorts so we have quite a few to compare to. If you aren‚Äôt concerned at all about room prices, then this a great option. The location can‚Äôt be beat but unfortunately, entry to DCA is currently closed due to Covid but this isn‚Äôt expressed to guests until check in. You are able to exit to the hotel from DCA entrance. Another downside was the bathroom set up. The sinks are not separated by a door to the bedroom like many Disney hotels, which prohibits someone getting ready while the other sleeps in.   I did app check-in upon arriving due to it being highly encouraged during Covid. This worked great at Disney World resorts and we were

Summary Heading: I just don't get all the hype..... (also some changes due to Covid)
Summary: We are a family that lives in Northern California and has done a fair amount of traveling around the globe.  Our typical "splurge" item on a vacation is the hotel room.  We often go for suites, large square footage, and 4-5 star ratings.  Since our daughter was born (5 years old now) we've taken at least two vacations per year to Disneyland since 2017 and did annual passes in 2019.  We had 2020 plans canceled due to Covid.  This was actually our first time staying at the Grand Californian, as it was the only Disney hotel open at the time.  Typically we would stay at the Disneyland Hotel because it seemed like the best for a little kid and also because we had a lot of fun staying in the fairytale suite some years back before she was born.  Summary first:    In a nutshell, if

We are Disney afficionados, and that mean we are a little picky and expect perfection.  Always delivered there, never let down.  From the guest service which is top notch, to the rooms which are cozy to the lobby which is outstanding!

I totally suggest staying here the beds are SO comfortable right inside of downtown Disney it even has its own entrance to California adventure. Although it is overpriced it is SO magical the rooms have two beds and a small couch that flips into a bed the pool area is lovely. The prices just are really expensive although worth it you even get free magic morning hour and free coppertone sunscreen. We can‚Äôt stay anywhere else after we stayed here .

We stayed for three days which was in my opinion to long as part of a road trip across California.  We are frequent travelers to Disney in Orlando. The hotel was good and a must do if your a Disney fan but this is not the Grand Floridian.  It‚Äôs a good hotel with a decent room, pool was crowded but nice.  You can do Disney in one day in California as it is very small compared to Florida. Nevertheless, it was a nice break for our kids to splash a little Disney feel into the road trip. Restaurant at the hotel is out of this world as is typical for most Disney signature restaurants.

Summary Heading: Expensive, but go at least once if you can swing it!
Summary: Comfortable rooms, good bathroom, kindest housekeeping staff, good food choices, comfortable beds, good facilities. What more can I say?! Hope to come back one day, wish they would make the prices a little more reasonable!

The service is always above average from check-in to check-out. Staff is helpful, bellmen are attentive & prompt, hotel desk staff goes out of their way to serve, guest services help with special arrangements and dining requests. Rooms are comfortable and well appointed, housekeeping keep rooms immacualtely clean. Location is prime for Disneyland, Downtown Disney, & California Adventure, but also short distances to Knotts Berry farm, Angel Stadium, Ducks' Hockey, and many other attractions in Orange County-Buena park

Stayed here with our Adventures by Disney group and it was an incredible vacation from the minute we arrived!  This hotel is grand but comfortable at the same time.  We had a king bed with a sofa so we had lots of room to spread out and from our balcony we were able to see the Grizzly Peak Bear from the park.  Storytellers Cafe does a fun character breakfast buffet and the Craftsman Grill has great grab and go items.  Can't say enough wonderful things about this hotel but we especially enjoyed the special theme park entrance to California Adventure Park and also to Downtown Disney.

This was my first time staying at the Grand Californian. What can I say but incredible! It is pricey, I splurged big time as this was a special birthday trip for myself. Disney magic was great, especially for my birthday. Parking was easy, I opted for the valet for the convenience of it. The staff were very friendly, from check in to encounters with housekeeping. The room was impeccably clean. I was in a standard room with a standard view. But I found it to be comparable in size to most hotel rooms. Maybe a large family would not fit so comfortably. The balcony overlooking the pool was fabulous. I sat out there a few times to enjoy the ambiance. While the hotel does not have a bunch of Mickey mouse paraphernalia, I did enjoy the little touches with Chip and Dale in my room as

We stayed in a one bedroom villa on the DVC side. It was amazing! We requested a high floor, park view ‚Äî which we got. The view was obstructed by a tree, but it still felt as though we were inside of California Adventure. Our kids absolutely loved the small pull down bed. We also utilized the pullout sofa bed and a pack n play, but still had plenty of room for our small family. Having two bathrooms with five people was great! We also cooked a few meals in our room, since we had a full kitchen. Loved having access to the in-room washer and dryer, especially since it rained our first day.  The location is fantastic! We‚Äôre Disney World people so being able to be THAT close to the inside of a park was magical. We were able to have a partial view of World of Color from our balcony,

I have stayed here several times and it is always an enjoyable experience. It is grand in it's decor and the comfort level of the rooms is on point. The parking is convenient and the proximity to Disneyland and California Adventure is excellent. You also have the option of Downtown Disney right out the door too. I will always recommend this place as it is my top choice when going to Disneyland!

It had been a while since I had the chance to stay at The Grand! This was a siblings trip, and now we are all older adults, being in the hotel brought so many memories. The Grand has defiantly evolved in the best way possible. Being a Hotelier myself, there are a few things I look at and appreciate. Our room had 2 queen beds and a sofa/day bed, this was probably a standard style, but gave us all enough room for our belongings and own sleeping space. Thermostat worked great (we like it cool in the room), the shower only bathroom was a highlight, i LOVE rainfall shower heads and the soap amenities are my absolute favorite line by H20.  please never change this!!  The front office staff, bell/valet team, always cheerful and accommodating. its never easy catering to the masses and

Summary Heading: You're paying for location; it's still a massive, crowded property
Summary: It's wonderful to stay here for the proximity to the parks. As someone else mentioned, never before have we paid this kind of price for a hotel, but it was a special trip and we wanted to make it extra memorable.  Check-in takes much longer than it should at such a luxury facility. Lines are long and the actual process is lengthy compared to any other hotel we've visited.   The rooms are fine, on the small side compared to something like HGI. The hotel is very clean; the housekeeping staff is just wonderful and goes the extra mile to provide excellent service.   The restaurants are expensive, but the menu is not appealing to vegetarians. Disney has replace real veggie burgers with the Beyond/Impossible burgers throughout their properties, taking away an option for people who

This was my fourth trip staying at a WDW property and I‚Äôd say this hotel definitely ranks up there with in terms of quality and service. Check in was quick and easy, despite how busy it was the day we arrived and the bellman delivered our bags pretty quickly. We booked a courtyard view room which wasn‚Äôt anything to phone home about except the monorail traveled through the courtyard every once in awhile, something that my kids liked to see. The room was tastefully appointed and comfortable, serviced twice a day. I loved the proximity to the parks, especially the easy access to California Adventures. My only complaints would be that for such a large hotel, there were only two laundry rooms basically at opposite ends of the compound which was not convenient. Also, the security line

Summary Heading: The rooms were dirty, uncomfortable, and smelly.
Summary: Worse holidays ever. Very dirty and uncomfortable room. Apparently the staff doesn‚Äôt feel the need to clean the rooms upon a first arrival. The room was also very cold or unbearably hot. Definitely not comfortable.

Very very pricey hotel but worth every penny for us.  We needed a hotel for 3 nights that was in close proximity of both parks.  Two people in our party have health issues and would need to rest during the day, along with our 3 year old granddaughter.  The Grand California was perfect. We could walk back whenever we wanted, no car, no parking, etc.  It was so convenient!  We had 7 in our party and booked a 3 bedroom suite.  It suited our group perfectly.  The best part was that each family had their own bathroom which made it easier for early departure to the parks.  Rooms were clean and comfortable.  We actually were able to access the rooms several hours before check-in time.  We also added the "concierge" service to our reservation.  Agin, expensive but again, well worth it!

We enjoyed this hotel. It reminded us of the Wilderness Lodge in Disney World. The lobby is stunning. The pools were fun for our kids. The location can‚Äôt be beat, especially for access to California Adventure.  The staff was friendly and accommodating.   So why only 4 stars?  The value isn‚Äôt there. We stayed at another ‚Äúgood neighbor‚Äù hotel for half of our stay and actually preferred it for half the price.  Disneyland doesn‚Äôt really succeed at cultivating the ‚ÄúDisney bubble‚Äù that Disney World does. For that reason, there‚Äôs little difference between a Disneyland hotel and a good neighbor hotel (as long as you carefully research the right one) aside from the price.

We surprised the kids with a trip to Disneyland for Christmas.  We arrived in property around 8 am and our room wasn‚Äôt ready (Check in is not until 4).  No problem!  How about a little pool time.  I inquired about renting a cabana as it was really cool outside but they were a little out of budget for us.  A few minutes later two fantastic young women called my name.  They offered us a little Disney Magic...  they gifted us the use of a Cabana...  I thought I was dreaming.  Not only did they gift us the use of the beautiful cabana but they were the most friendly and attentive cast members!  Aislynn and Vanessa put that extra Disney Magic in our trip.  They took fantastic care of us.  My daughter accidentally hit her teeth on the edge of the pool while swimming and they even had a

Summary Heading: Got what we paid for- Great hotel; Convenient location
Summary: Many of the excellent points I would make here have been commented on in other reviews. I would say that, from the time we pulled into the driveway and were met by the greeters, we only encountered wonderful, smiling, friendly and helpful employees during our stay at this hotel. Parking was a breeze- both for checking in and during our stay. Nearby access to both parks from our hotel was great. As you would expect, our room was excellent and very clean. I know this place is expensive but we thought, we are only going here once so let's treat ourselves.

Summary Heading: Lots of things to do as a non-guest
Summary: Of all the hotels at the Disneyland Resort, the Grand Californian Hotel is my favorite. I‚Äôve never actually stayed the night here but my friends have and I‚Äôve seen their rooms. I‚Äôve also hung out in the lobby with friends. I‚Äôve had drinks at the Hearthstone Lounge, Craftsman Grill, and Napa Rose. I‚Äôve also dined at Napa Rose at their Chef‚Äôs Counter and picked up food at Whitewater Snacks. I‚Äôve also had spa services done at the (now defunct) Mandara Spa. There is so much to do at this hotel and you don‚Äôt have to be a guest! One of the neat things you can get in the lobby is treats and snacks. They have boozy cookie shots here. The best thing about the hotel is the location which is walking distance to the parks. It even has its own entrance into DCA. The nice thing also is if you

Summary Heading: You are only paying for the easy access to the parks - hotel and room not worth it
Summary: I expected an amazing, over the top experience when booking a Disney hotel.  Unfortunately it was not.  The room was more than I have ever paid for a room, but I figured it was worth it to get the "Disney Experience".  I have stayed at much better hotels and a much lower rate.  You are literally only paying for the easy access to the parks.  The hotel is comparable to a Holiday Inn.  The lobby is pretty, but not as impressive as I expected.  The rooms are very standard.  Our room wasn't ready when we checked in, which was fine.  We checked in early because we had bought a package that included Park Hopper tickets.  We spent the day at the parks and were told we would get a text when our room was ready (which we did).  By the time we got to the room and got our luggage we were

We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Grand Californian. This was my second stay but first with a toddler. As you can tell by the photographs on the website and trip advisor, the lobby is gorgeous. The rooms are nothing out of the ordinary maybe compared to a Hyatt or Hampton. The beds were very high off the ground so my daughter had to use a stool to get on them; I am thrilled they have stools for the little ones in the room.  The reason one should stay here is for the location and kid friendly accommodations. Do not expect something opulent. The location is what makes this place a must for our family. We could exit easily and get to the room to let our toddler rest and take a break. When she was ready to go again it, was just a few minutes and we were back in the park.

Just beware you‚Äôre are paying for convenience/proximity to the parks and downtown Disney.  That‚Äôs about all.   I have stayed here once before and did not have a great experience.  I tried it again.  No different.  When you call anywhere in the hotel, they place you on hold more times than not. Then, it will take forever to receive your request.  That includes retrieving your car, having a bellman get to the room to assist with bags, extra blanket for the room through housekeeping, etc.  Room service...sat on hold, then ordered, then waited an hour for food.  The prices are literally those of a Four Seasons with service and amenities that are not even close, far inferior.  I gave the extra star because the staff was courteous.  I‚Äôll be staying at nearby hotels in the future.

We just returned from a 3 night stay. I‚Äôve stayed at all three onsite properties, this is the best! The location is unbeatable. It is a short 5 minute walk to the parks. Check in in was a breeze, we arrived before our room was ready but the bell desk stored our luggage and we headed to the park. We were given our keys and our room number was sent via text once the room was ready.   The pool is nice and because it is so close to the park popping over for a midday break is very simple. Especially on a magic morning day, we were able to head to California Adventure and do several things before the park opens to the public, then take a break and go back that evening.   We ate at Storytellers the day we left, very nice for a buffet, but quite pricey.  All in all this will be my first

Summary Heading: Great location, beautiful lobby, crazy busy, average rooms, very expensive
Summary: We‚Äôve been to all the Disney parks around the world and have been fortunate to have stayed at some of the nicer Disney resorts.  The Grand Californian is nice but doesn‚Äôt really live up to the standards set by some of the other resorts, particularly for the price.    We rented DVC points for a 5 night stay in a studio villa.  This is basically just a regular hotel room enhanced with a few extra kitchen amenities, and no charge for parking.  But we also paid significantly less than we would have for a regular room, so it was worth the anxiety of potentially showing up and not having a reservation since the reservation was made by an unknown third party.  Our reservation was all set though.    We arrived on a Sunday morning at around 11am and the parking area was absolute chaos.

We had a wonderful experience at this hotel.  We booked a Woods/Courtyard view.  Arrived early and had a room in about 45 minutes.  It was clean and in great condition.  The staff was amazing! We had a few snafu's, all our doing.  We had a severely clogged toilet (teenage son) that took a couple of attempts to unclog but they were so gracious!   Had a lightsaber fall off of our balcony.  Yep - Mousekeeping got it for my son.   I did not expect perfection, but they blew me away! It was all I hoped for and much more!

On our first trip to Disneyland to celebrate our daughter‚Äôs birthday, we splurged on 3 nights at Disney‚Äôs Grand Californian (GC). We chose Club Level accommodations, and were NOT disappointed. Because it was our first trip, we also ended up spending 2 additional nights at a Good Neighbor hotel across the street, and while that hotel was nice, the Grand Californian offers that extra Disney magic touch which we missed when we left.   At $700+/night (during the off season), Club Level at GC is expensive. Rooms are not guaranteed to be available until 4 pm. The trim itself was a nice size, 2 queen beds & a sofa ‚Äúdaybed‚Äù which, when opened, had an enchanting Bambi fresco painted on the wood. Our family of 3 fit easily & comfortably in the space. The room had thoughtfully arranged

Summary Heading: Decent Hotel; Not Worth $350+ a Night; Look for Deals
Summary: I stayed at the Disney Grand Californian Hotel & Spa for 5 days, and let me tell you that this is a decent hotel: beautiful lobby, decent customer service, and nice amenities. Would I pay $400-$600+ a night??? Absolutely not. Given it's location is an amenity, I would probably tap out at $350/night. I get that it is Disney and there is a mark up for this, but this is an extreme. Given this said, I will go through Pros and Cons for families wishing to stay here as this may be helpful to folks considering the splurge.   PROS: Close to park (has park access), easy to get to Downtown Disney. nice customer service with daily turn-down services (they stop by each night), and plenty of space to have kids running around, adult areas to sit, as well as decent restaurants. There is plenty

Summary Heading: Convenient but missing the Disney magic
Summary: The hotel feels more like Yosemite than Disneyland. It is beautiful but pricey. We had a very basic double on the third floor that overlooked the park/tram. The location was convenient-near the pool and CA Adventure Entrance but a trek from the lobby. Nothing special at all about the room. It was clean, had adequate space for 3, a balcony, plenty of USB ports/plugs, good lighting. Had a coffee maker, fridge. Large TV mounted on the wall above a 6 drawer dresser, plenty of counter space. The armoire had plenty of room to hang items and contained the iron/board, plus bathrobes. Bathroom was not very private, it has a sliding barn door and the vanity area is pretty open. The shower was not great -a handheld and a rain shower option but not great pressure and never hot water in the

This hotel is a rort. The hotel costs as much as a 5 star luxury hotel but offers nothing to back it up. The hotel food is simply garbage. The staff are referred to as cast members. I think it is because they are all acting like they care but the so don‚Äôt.  Our booking was messed up and at first I was blamed for the mistakes only after getting through 3 ‚Äúcast members‚Äù I found someone that could work out what was happening and I actually got an apology. Don‚Äôt take camera equipment as you will get a call from security asking what your intentions are. Ummmm take photos!! I have stayed 3 times. Silly me, never again.

We are so terribly disappointed in our stay. We expected and paid for a Disney experience and had a Holiday Inn experience instead. If we had paid Holiday Inn Prices it would have been fine. We did not, however.  I must say, the lobby is stunning. When we arrived, our room was not ready. We were early so it was not a problem. We waited an hour and a half beyond check-in for our room. No apologies Were given. We asked to have bags brought up when the room was ready and They said no. They don‚Äôt do that. I was expecting a package, which had arrived hours earlier and I stood around waiting least 15 or twenty minutes For someone to retrieve it.  The room was as ordinary as can be. Chip and Dale painted on the wall did not make for the size of the room, to say nothing of the ‚Äúbalcony‚Äù

We stay here every December for the convenience factor, beautiful Christmas decor and special offerings including live singers, Santa in the lobby, and a holiday bar set up with great drinks and treats. This last stay we hung out in the lobby for an hour and Pluto was roaming through the lobby and my boys got to give him a hug and hang out with him. The rooms aren't overly large but you can comfortably fit 3 kids and 2 adults and it has a nice little outdoor balcony to have coffee on.  The pool and slides are great and I am loving the great new outdoor restaurant/bar space by the pool.  And you just can't beat the direct access to CA adventure or DT Disney.  I also think the GC has the best character breakfast offering with Story teller's Cafe. It's pricey but the food is good

Yes, the hotel is expensive,  but it is a wonderful place to stay! Clean rooms and the location can't be beat! We were able to wander over to downtown Disney and eat which was very convenient! Also the Magic Morning perk makes the cost a little easier to stomach! No complaints from me! We'll definitely be back!

Second time visiting this property in the last three years. The hotel is very clean and very well-kept. Magic morning was an excellent perk getting into the park I had of the crowds. You cannot beat the convenience of being able to walk back to the room to rest or grab a snack. Overall even though this property was pricey it is very nice.   We had an upgraded room with a bed that converted from a couch. The room also had a small mini fridge and a coffee maker.   Double sinks in the room made getting ready easier with 4 people in the room.   Elevators worked great never had to wait very long.   Only down side was the parking. It is valet only or you have to walk quite a distance. Additionally having to pay for valet parking was not very good.

Summary Heading: Great Location but it needs work
Summary: We stayed there for 4 nights for my wife's 50th Birthday using DVC points for the Club Level.  The room was nice and spacious.  Nice view of the fireworks and it was clean.  We never got turn down service at night.  My daughter did ask them not to come do it the last night, but the other 3 we were not in the room and it never occurred.  The Cast Member's in The Veranda were VERY nice and helpful.  Some families w/ smaller children let their children run around like it was a playground and scream, which was a little annoying.  Understand they are children and it's ok for them to be excited, but not again and again.  The location of the hotel it great with an entrance to California Adventure.  They have laundry service and also self serve laundry.  We used the self serve and it

I really hesitated to book this hotel due to the cost. We have stayed at nearby hotels many times for half the price. But I have to say it was well worth it. The convenience of having its own entrance to California adventure and downtown Disney cannot be overstated. It was so nice to come back to the room and drop of packages or grab a jacket before changing parks or going to dinner.   The hotel was beautifully decorated for Christmas and had a huge tree and gingerbread house. There was also a temporary little snack and beverage station with holiday treats and beverages. The staff was friendly and efficient. A Christmas choir sang a couple of times each evening in front of the gingerbread house.   There are a number of restaurants as well as a lobby lounge and pool lounge. There

Summary Heading: Necklace stolen from room by cleaners
Summary: The cleaning staff stole my daughter‚Äôs necklace from the nightstand in the room. We have been dedicated visitors to this hotel for years, but this is not the first time their ‚ÄúLost and Found‚Äù service has ‚Äúfailed to locate‚Äù an item left in the room.  This necklace had great value to my daughter and after pretending to try to help us, the Claims dept., Robbie and her manager, just refused to call me back, eventually saying if their cleaning crew steals my items from the room, they are not responsible. It‚Äôs hard to call a hotel 5 star if your belongings are not safe in the room, and the hotel‚Äôs customer service is terrible.

Summary Heading: Awesome Hotel Disney knows how to do things right.a
Summary: The Hotel is beautiful inside and around the grounds, walk right to the park from your room, and if you pick the right location to stay you can hear the water falls from your room all night long. Need a little rest walk to your room, want a glass of wine walk to your room it‚Äôs cold and you need your jacket walk to your room. Staying so close to the park made our trip that much better and to top it off you get in the park one hour early and no parking your car or waiting for a shuttle ride that you may have just missed. Highly recommended.

There is not 1 single bad thing about this hotel. It is amazing! I work for Hilton and can stay nearby Disneyland for next to nothing but I am willing to pay full price for this hotel.   The convenience to California Adventure,  Disneyland, and the  Disney City Walk is well worth the price (especially so near to Christmas).  The decorations in the lobby alone are stunning from the tree, to the gingerbread house with a glowing fireplace, to a meet Santa.   The staff is great. They don't nickel and dime you to pay for upgrades or extras like early check in. We were given our room number and keys at about 10:30am. We were able to drip our luggage in our room and leave for the park within an hour after arriving. There is NO Resort Fee either.   The room is normal size. The beds are

When got a last minute reservation for he holiday weekend. It was a lifesaver for the packed weekend. Service excellent and easy walking distance to DL and DD.   They closed the park this past weekend to control the crowds and so we were able to chill in hotel to let the crowds die down.  Service was good! I booked through hotels.com. There was a error in he reservation so it appeared we did not have a reservation. The hotel fixed it not problem and upgraded us. Thanks!

The check-in & check-out experience is seamless. Entering the hotel driveway the traffic flow is managed to ensure a quick exit from your car and into the main hotel lobby and to check-in. I opted for self parking, so had to re-park my Hertz rental across the road for $25/night.  Our room key also acted as a charge card for the various hotel facilities and some restaurants in the area. This was very convenient.   Our room overlooked the front of the hotel and road. Beds were comfortable and the bathrooms were nice, with quality amenities. The TV had plenty of Disney channels for the kids to enjoy in their downtime. Access to the park was quick and easy, so from a location perspective it this hotel is fantastic.   We booked breakfasts at Goofy‚Äôs Kitchen which was enjoyed by the

The hotel is conveniently located between Downtown Disney and California Adventure Park.  With a 5min walk to Disneyland.  It has its own entrance to California Adventure Park, which makes it really easy to bypass lines to get into the park in the mornings.  The hotel staff is very friendly and the rooms clean.  Don't expect the Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons in terms of fit and finish, but it is fine for a fun holiday with the kids.  We stayed at the club level and the Veranda room was great for those early morning and mid-day snacks.  TIPS: 1. Avoid bring a bag into the park, the security line into downtown Disney can get long and if you don't have a bag, you can walk past the line.  2. If you have a 'magic morning' ticket that lets you get into the park at 7 am, be aware that

The hotel is worth around $200 / night (see more below).  The rest of what you‚Äôre being asked to pay is premium for the Magic Hour, park entrance 1 hour before the public, available to all guests at Disney-owned hotels.  What the Magic Hour is worth is for you to decide ‚Äî but with smart use of FastPass I do not think it is necessary.   Note that Magic Hour is only at one of the parks each day, so check the calendar to avoid disappointment.    This hotel has a direct entrance into the California Adventure park, but access to Disneyland is via Downtown Disney.  You could probably get to Disneyland almost as quickly by taking a taxi from a nearby hotel.   None of the rooms have a nice view, so do not pay more for a view.  You may want to pay for a bigger room, as ours (not the

This was our third stay at the Grand Californian.  We always thought the concierge level was beyond our budget.  Last year I was diagnosed with cancer the day my husband went into Hospice.  He died two days before my surgery.  When you have a cancer diagnosis and a death in the same week you realize how quickly your life can change.  So we splurged this year and tried concierge service in The Veranda dining room.  It was worth every dime and was less expensive than eating in the parks.  And the convenience was priceless.  So try it on your next visit.  You will not be disappointed.  There was unlimited food, drinks and desserts served throughout the day and we could take whatever we wanted back to our room for later.  We will always get concierge level in the future.

Summary Heading: Even with a low expectation, they never fail to disappoint us
Summary: We keep making reservations to this hotel for the convenience of parking and location to the park but never for their customer service. It‚Äôs like night and day compared to the customer service from other disney resorts but we already accepted that and we have very low expectations. This stay was the worst since the heater in our studio villa did not work. They tried to fix it late at night but they couldn‚Äôt so they just gave us extra blankets since they don‚Äôt even have space heater available. We weren‚Äôt even offered to be moved to another room or anything. It was a miserable night and they did not really seem to care. I just hope that one day the management would do something about these bad reviews. Oh well :(((((

Ok, it‚Äôs expensive. Now let‚Äôs get on with the review. Our experience was one of exemplary service, wonderful accommodations, and LOCATION!  All of the cast members go out of their way to make the magic happen at this beautiful hotel. From the time we arrived, until we were met by the Uber driver, ever cast member we encountered was positive and very helpful. They do an excellent job of paying close attention to detail. Room service for breakfast was very good and quite reasonably priced. We have only one issue, water pressure. I understand the water shortage in California, however with the room rates it would be nice to add a bit more pressure. I really don‚Äôt care to spend additional time getting the shampoo out of my hair due to the very low pressure.  Enjoy!

We are DVC members and always stay at the Grand Californian. It is always our hotel of choice. The staff treats you like family and the grand lobby is awe inspiring. Trust me it is worth your time to visit the Grand Californian!

We recently stayed Club Level at Disney‚Äôs Grand Californian Resort for my daughter‚Äôs birthday. The resort is amazingly beautiful and worth the stay, but I can‚Äôt say the same for Club Level.  As context, we are big Disney fans. We live in Southern California and have annual passes to Disneyland. We‚Äôve gone multiple times to Disney World and stayed Club Level at the Polynesian, Grand Floridian, and Animal Kingdom Lodge. Stayed at Aulani in Hawaii, and the Tokyo Disneyland Hotel.   The Grand Californian Resort is amazing. For those who love Arts & Craft architecture, which was a hallmark for California home construction in the early 1900s, this place captures it so well. The great hall is huge and during the holidays, there‚Äôs always some gigantic cake structure to be amazed with.

This hotel is attached to California Adventure, which comes in very handy after a long day at the park.  The hotel has a lovely woodlands theme and during my stay it was transformed overnight with Christmas decorations and a gingerbread house display. It was wonderful!  I love staying at this hotel. It is a bit expensive but I think the perk of being so close to the theme parks and Downtown Disney make it worth the extra money.

This is our 3rd time staying here since August. Service is impeccable from character dining in the hotel, bar & room service- everything on point. This time we stayed in the concierge level and it was worth event penny.  We will return next month!

The first thing that you experience is the beautiful lobby - craftsman style decor with a fireplace. In typical Disney style the check in was smooth - a greeter comes up to you as you walk up so you feel engaged. The room was spacious with a balcony. Easy access to the Disneyland Hotel where my conference was thru Downtown Disney - you just need to go thru rigorous security every time which was ok. Tip - don‚Äôt bring bags with a lot of pockets and a lot of stuff! It was the holidays so there was a huge Christmas tree in the lobby and a ginger bread house. Definitely recommended.

This is my first stay at this particular Disney Hotel and the second for my family. The hotel is conveniently located closer to Disneyland Magic Kingdom entry than the other onsite hotels, and also has direct entry access to California Adventure Park.  Our holiday started with a bit of a challenge when the hotel staff were unable to find our pre-ordered park tickets. This delayed our first day entry for over an hour. Once sorted, we had a great time exploring the hotel, the halloween specific decorations, pool area and restaurants.  Our room was modern, clean and very well-kept by hotel staff.  Overall, absolutely wonderful holiday experience.

Summary Heading: Hotel Access to California Adventure Park
Summary: Recently stayed here for a 4-night Disney vacation.  The Grand Californian has a separate side entrance for California Adventure Park.  This is a huge advantage especially on the days when the extra magic hour (7-8 AM) is at California Adventure.  We were able to ride the majority of the premium rides in California Adventure Park each day during the extra magic hour. The separate side entrance allows you to avoid the crowds at the main gate which can otherwise eat into your magic hour time.  The hotel itself is fantastic.  The beds in the rooms are amazingly comfortable.  Rooms are super clean.  Nice to be able to easily walk back to your hotel after a long day at the parks.

I stay at the Grand Californian several times a year, mostly for work.   Typically I stay for just one night, on the last night of a business trip, due to the flight schedule out of John Wayne Airport. It's a good opportunity to get out of a standard Marriott type accommodation and have some fun. I enjoy theme parks.  I checked in at the Grand Californian for one night on Tuesday 11/12 and asked for a King bed. The perfectly pleasant cast member must have searched for a solid ten minutes before telling me there were none available.  I get the keys to my room and head up. Open the door. And to my surprise... the room hasn't been touched by housekeeping. Sheets are pulled back, all the trash cans are full. Drinks and cans on the counter tops. Basically was not a clean and ready

The hotel. Is beautiful and the rooms are very spacious and updated.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating and the theme park view from our balcony was amazing. It was also great that we were always able to get into California adventure with no lines!  Would definitely stay here again if visiting.

Summary Heading: More than a family could hope for
Summary: Pulling up in the front of the hotel was just like many resorts we've been to, very clean , lots of room. Staff were helpful directing people.  I later was impressed how smoothly it was run after realizing the volume of guests coming and going at the resort.  Check in was quick and easy, the front desk staff wasted no time getting to know everyone by name and knew absolutely everything about the hotel, resort and parks. And we threw a lot of questions out there! The room was equipped as a normal room would be, but had power outlets and USB charging absolutely anywhere you could think to put them, which was great for all our phones and devices we brought to make sure we were all connected while in the parks.  Pool area was very well kept and had a lot of different areas so kids

Just wrapped up a stay here for my bachelorette party and I think the cost is completely justified! We had a fabulous weekend and this hotel is great for a big group. Here are some pros and cons to this hotel.  Pros:  - Park access and downtown Disney access. - Easy check in and friendly cast members. - Fabulous restaurants! - The pool was amazing and perfect for a mid day break. - Great big rooms that are perfect for large groups.  Cons:  - Its very expensive, but I think it is well worth it to be next to DCA and Downtown Disney. - Busy, very busy! - Huge and sometimes easy to forget how to get somewhere.

Summary Heading: Not the happiest place on earth
Summary: Stayed at Disneyland Grand Californian Hotel and Spa. Booked two very expensive rooms almost a year ago. Am temporarily in a wheelchair. Tried to book a handicapped accessible room two months ago - told that it could only be done 10 days prior to arrival ‚Äì which we did  Receptionist danced around the issue of handicapped room ‚Äì  acknowledged that was what we booked -  asked if I would like a room with bath.  No!  Given rooms 5023/5024. Take note of numbers.  Room not for handicapped -but we made do.  Night one - awful racket upstairs ‚Äì starting at 10 pm lasting an hour.   Noise started 6:30 next morning. Same noise night/morning two. Sent my husband upstairs.  Hospitality Suite above these rooms. Night three called Front Desk ‚Äì told they would be done by 10 pm.  Pointed out that

Our family stayed here to celebrate two big birthdays and our wedding anniversary. The lobby is a wow factor. We've stayed here before and when we want to splurge, we stay here, primarily due to the location. It is so convenient. It's very expensive for what you get. We stayed in standard rooms and while the view was nothing to speak of, it was very quiet. The rooms were nice and spacious. I do feel the lotions aren't as good as they used to be. We had the best housekeepers! They were so nice and did such a great job with a smile on their face.   I felt it was important to eat at a character breakfast and I made reservations at the Storytellers Caf√©. It was worth every penny! The food was delicious and plentiful. When I made the reservation, I informed them it was our grandson's

You're basically forced to use the valet. If you don't, you have to haul everything yourself, you can't use their carts. So we used the valet and they put a HUGE crack in my windshield and refuse to pay fornthe damage. I paid a lot of money to have my property damaged! Total rip off!

As a DVC owner, this is the best purchase we‚Äôve ever made.  The convenience of this hotel goes without saying, but to emphasize‚Äî we went into California Adventure for an hour, then walked back out to our amazing room, started a load of laundry, changed into Halloween costumes and went back in for the night- within the next hour.  The pools and rooms were perfectly clean, kept up and QUIET for sleep, even next to the park.  But the Disney service is still the highlight.  I was waiting for the towel guy to come back and give me some towels for the pool when the manager saw me waiting, came over and got me towels while asking if he could do anything else for me.  That level of service shows me everyone, no matter what his or her position, is doing absolutely everything to make your

Summary Heading: Average for type of hotel it is
Summary: Although this is a beautiful hotel, it is only average at best for the type that it is.  Gorgeous lobby that really wows when you enter, but the service and staff are in great need of training.  The housekeeping staff seemed top notch while we were there, however, the front desk staff contradicted one another from one shift to another.  We were told to request a king bed on check-in, but the front clerk told us that "this is a family hotel, we only have 75 king beds here".  I'm not sure what a king bed and a "family hotel" had to do with one another, but when one person in the party is over 6'3", it's nice to have a bed they can sleep in.  We were given a room with 2 queens, and my husband slept in one bed diagonally while I slept in the other.  Not preferable, but doable.

Great location. Hotel looks amazing. We have stayed in this, the pier and Disneyland hotel. I prefer the Disney hotel.  The Californian is such a busy hotel. The bar area is just too small for the size hotel.  Disney has lost its Disney. We have been going for over 10 years. It is now a hotel with a theme park. It used to be all Disney... the staff now act like it is a job and a theme park. They used to appreciate it is Disney and magical.  The hotel is nice and a perfect location. You can go into California park from This hotel.  You can walk out to get a coffee and food options. Room service was fast.  We had a suite and it was large and had a balcony.  The pool area is nice and a great way to relax.

spent 5 nights here recently. hotel itself is nice but several issues for cost. room service not answering phone at all one night followed by breakfast deliver failure another morning . was told at pool restaurant for lunch food was backed up 45 minutes because staff called out for day-really at a "premium hotel". worst experience though was the ridiculous security for the hotel entrance into the park.  several of these unfriendly cast members seemed to get enjoyment from being rude and came across as a power hungry cop-especially one by the name LORRAINE!-hotel should dump this shrill unhappy , not like her job women.

Summary Heading: A Soothing Home Away From Disney
Summary: Just entering the gorgeous front door, you know you've found a high-end, delightful place to stay.  The architecture is outstanding, the public areas are fun to sit in and your room will be a place you'll want to enjoy.  Napa Rose, the high end dining place, is a must-visit and the pool gives you a lovely break from hiking around the parks.  Enjoy a meal or a drink there as well.  You could easily stay here for a week and never leave - it's that nice. Everyone seems delighted to help you and you'll find your every need met.  Don't miss the Arts & Crafts tour offered weekly.

Summary Heading: Not sure how I'll be able to stay anywhere else now...
Summary: We've never stayed on property at Disneyland during any of our previous 15+ trips but we were able to get a great convention rate for this trip so we thought we'd try it.  Now I'm not sure how I can ever go back across the street to the other hotels...  Let's start with the pros: The location. Having that entrance into California Adventure was AMAZING! And the few steps to DIsneyland park were perfect. The extra hours on a daily basis for hotel guests was awesome. California Adventure was the best one to use those on and we got so much done during that first hour in the morning. The rooms were so clean and spacious (we stayed in a best 2 queen room.) And the showers were amazing! The rooms even had turn down service each night, complete with a chocolate on the pillow.  When we

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, Park Access Points and shopping
Summary: This is a must stay for families traveling to and from Disneyland, period. They have everything from lifeguarded pools, character restaurants, separate park access points and nearby shopping. And, there is an on-site store that sells children‚Äôs Tylenol, swim suites and snacks... We stayed for 5 days and had a wonderful time!!!!

Amazing place to stay. Pricey but worth it. This is designed by the same person that did the Wilderness lodge and the animal Kingdom resort. I is reminiscent of the main lodge at Yellowstone national park.

There is NO question this hotel is by far one of the best I have ever stayed in. Everyone at the resort is a joy to interact with and they all offer you a 5 star experience. The beds are comfortable and the entire resort is spotless!!!  The room service is excellent and the concierge level is worth every penny you pay for the experience and delicious treats! We can not wait to return so we can again enjoy all of the amazing perks of staying here....can not wait for the spa to open back up!!!!

We stayed for 6 nights while visiting the parks in September. It‚Äôs convenience to the parks can‚Äôt be beat, especially if you request a room near the Napa Rose elevators. The rooms are large, we had two queen beds for our family of four. Everything was spotless. The laundry was easy to access and had plenty of washing machines and dryers available whenever I went. The swimming pools are magnificent and very safe for children due to the many life savers around who already very vigilant. There were also plenty of pool chairs available whenever we went.

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel with location that can't be beat
Summary: I have to say that we would not have been able to justify staying that this property at normal rack rates. It is extremely expensive! But a friend who works for Disney offered us a Friends and Family discount so we had to try it out.  I'm afraid it has spoiled us for good. The location right next to DCA made getting into the parks so easy. And the access the The Early Magic Hour every day gave us a great jump start on the day.  The beds were extremely comfortable, probably the best hotel beds I've ever had.  My only minor complaint is that the rooms are a little small compared to our previous experience at the Marriott Themepark entrance hotel.  We traveled with our family of four plus a grandma, and we had a room with 2 queens and a daybed.  It worked fine, but the quarters

We've stayed at the Grand Californian six times now, I think.  The first few times, the kids were small enough that we got a room with bunk beds for them (I'm not sure this is still an option, but we loved it.  Out most recent visit was a couple of weeks ago, and the Grand Californian never disappoints.  No detail is too small to be overlooked.  From the soaring Arts and Crafts lobby to the Ghirardelli chocolates left on our pillows each night, everything is done to excel.    One could rightly remark that why should you stay in a fancy hotel when you're likely to spend most of your day in one of the parks.  But you've got to stay somewhere, and why not stay at the best?  The staff is unceasingly helpful and friendly.  They knew the answer to all our questions regarding the hotel

Summary Heading: Excellent accommodations & customer service... just what you expect from Disney.
Summary: THE best reason to stay here is the easy access to Calif. Adventure Park. SO easy. Great place for kids to cool off, dip in the pool while we had an adult beverage. We had a standard view room for 4 people... it wasn't cheap but about $200 less/night than when we looked at staying here in May 2019. My advice is, yes it's expensive but the service & location are perfect. There is a pretty wide range of prices, depending on the time of the year. I have stayed here before when it was buy two nights get the third at big discount. So if your schedule allows it, watch for the sales and then book your airfare. The place is like a big, craftsman style lodge. Perfect place to watch the World of Color show for free.

We are Disney people and have been to Disney Wold numerous times.  We always had Disneyland on the radar and finally had the opportunity to go.  Great room, great hotel, great theme parks, great food.  I think we like Disneyland better than Disney World now which I though we would never say.  The fact that you can step foot into the park from the hotel is great.

We stayed here four nights. We paid a lot of extra money for a premium pool view room, which is their top tier. What a waste! To see the pools, you had to be out on the balcony and standing to look over the railing. You couldn't see pools from inside the room. The railing on the balcony was solid, no slats, so you couldn't see them while sitting outside. There were balconies on a perpendicular wing that appeared to have slats in their balcony railing and they would have looked directly out across the pool complex. Those would be premium pool view.  They also do not keep there vending machines well stocked. The machines, drinks only no snacks, were well picked over when we arrived. Each day they were even more empty.  On the plus side, the room was clean and comfortable. The

We have stayed at all the other Disney hotels in California so we decided this time to splurge and do the Grand Californian.  The location to California adventure can not be beat.  The best part was being able to go back to the hotel put on our swimsuits and cover ups, then run out and ride the Grizzly river ride 3 times in a row! However, you have paying a premium for that adventure.  They have opened a new pool bar/restaurant called the Craftsman grill, a cheeseburger is $22, you are really better off eating the park.  They got rid of the white water snacks, so there are no reasonable priced restaurants at the hotel.  The hotel has under gone a remodel, the rooms are very nice.  We had a standard view which included two queen beds and a sofa which folded into a single bed.  It

My wife and I vacation to Disneyland in Anaheim twice every summer, having opted to stay at the Grand Californian every time. We pay extra for rooms on the 6th floor because of the access to their veranda and (occasionally) some great views of the park. However, the rooms don't always have the nice view they guarantee that they will, and also feel like they're ten miles away from civilization. It's nice to have access to the veranda, but it isn't convenient at all to spend twenty minutes away from your room just trying to get a snack or a beverage in there. Or feeling as if you're walking through a never-ending set of hallways to get to the elevator you need. I understand that sometimes things happen and there is no way to control where you place your guests, but it happens to

We've stayed at the hotel and it was great (see other review), but hands down, the timeshare was the best. We rented it from an owner, but treated like an owner every minute of our stay. We rented the 2 bedroom 3 bath timeshare for 9 people and it was the perfect fit (We even split the cost). The space and location can't be beat. You can walk right into California Adventure Park or to Downtown Disney. The pool was open this time and really nice with the refurbishments that were done to it. Given the price of the rental, it also paid off to cook almost every meal during our stay. We could come and go from the park for a nap, lunch or dinner. It was worth all that extra cost!

This is a wonderful hotel. Kind of a rustic luxury. We stayed by renting someone‚Äôs vacation club points through an online dealer. A fraction of the price but still expensive but worth it! We actually stayed in January 2018 but trip advisor doesn‚Äôt go back that far if you wait to review. The only downside - if you are in a vacation club room - is that housekeeping is once a week and it‚Äôs very light. Regular rooms get cleaned daily like any other hotel.   They do have a kitchen but they seem to encourage you not to use it - it‚Äôs small and ill equipped (not even a cookie sheet). If you ask though they will bring to your room and they did empty our trash an extra time upon request. Not with the familiar Disney attitude but they did it. Having said that, you can stay on property,

Enjoyed a wonderful 3 day / 2 night visit with my wife and our 2 daughters this past August at the Grand Californian Hotel.    A few thoughts:  1) Hotel is best possible and closest location to everything Disney. Literally connected to California Adventureland and 5 minutes from Disneyland Park (but within the Disney village), which allowed us to sneak back whenever we wanted a recharge.  2) The magic morning opportunity when staying at the park is special...we were able to snag 8-10 rides in the course of 1 hour before up the park officially opened.  This in itself was worth the stay.  Another time we got tons of rides was in the evening during the electric parade and fireworks show....no lines during that time.  3) LA during August was extremely hot. The pool was wonderful for

Summary Heading: Could this hotel actually be worth the price?
Summary: I'll start by saying that this hotel is quite expensive for what you actually get in the room.  So, you just can't look at it that way.  There was much more to this hotel and the experience than just the room and we had to remind ourselves of that throughout the stay.  With that in mind and the fact that we stayed here for an event, I would say it was worth it.  Here are a few things of note: Check-in:  I had read reviews that this was a nightmare and was prepared for that, but we had no problems.  More detail that follows -  My brother's family was also staying at the hotel and we had asked for adjoining room.  Zero problem with that.  We knew we wanted to get in there early on our first day to take advantage of the magic morning.  We were worried that this would be a problem.

Summary Heading: Loved some of the changes....others, not so much.
Summary: This was our third visit to the Grand Californian. Since our last visit, they have made several changes. We loved the renovations in the rooms, especially the Chip & Dale mural above the bed. Also, the Rainshower was amazing. The best part was the consistency of the service, that has remained world-class. We were disappointed though in the changes to the Storyteller restaurant. They have made it buffet only, and the price tag is very high. We loved stopping by for cornbread and their incredible corn chowder, but that is no more. They did add a new restaurant near the pool, and though the food was good it is not the same as Storytellers.

Stayed as part of visit to Disneyland and was impressed by the hotel, staff and service which included a turn down service. It‚Äôs the detail which only Disney do such as branded toiletries including the soap, lovely decor with discreetly hidden Mickey Mouse images and Bambi painting by the kids bed. Access to Downtown Disney and Adventure Park really easy direct from hotel and this is the only of the three Disney hotels which has this. Price is not cheap, however worth it. Would also recommend the Storyteller Cafe characters meet and the Mickey Mouse waffles.

I recently went on vacation to Disneyland.  One thing I wanted to do was stop by this hotel to eat at the Storyteller restaurant and then go to the gift shop for some clothes that had California and Disney on it (as I live in CA).  I took an Uber car over.    When we got there we were stopped by a woman at the gate.  She said I would have to go all the way to Downtown Disney and walk back up to the side gate.  She said this very rudely.  What?  I told her I wanted to eat and shop in the hotel.  She said it didn‚Äôt matter.  I ended up never going or spending any money there.  When I am treated like that I remember and won‚Äôt be staying or visiting there in the future.    What kind of policy is it that you don‚Äôt allow any guests in to visit easily?  This was on a super slow day as

Summary Heading: Expensive Hotel that does match up to its quality or service
Summary: Its been about 3 months since I stayed at this hotel and just have been too busy to leave this review after exhausting myself after weeks of trying to just speak to someone who cared and never actually getting that satisfaction.  To save time I am just going to post the email I wrote on June 7th.  Hello- I was a recent guest at the hotel staying in room 3333. I wanted to address some concerns I had with my stay. I did try on four occasions to address the various issues, but none seemed to be taken seriously. I am hoping that on this 5th try that someone shows some type of concern. I am going to just jump ahead to the most concerning part of my stay and one that needs to be fixed ASAP before another guest gets injured.  On the morning of June 5th as I was getting ready to leave

This is a stunning hotel.  Unfortunately they just closed down the spa!  We had an 8 day stay.  The rooms are newly refurbished with granite countertops in the bedroom and bathroom.  Would have preferred more space for a luggage rack.  There is one chair where you can sit to eat at the small desk.  The hotel feels safe and luxurious.  We had some electrical problems with the bathroom lights not turning on - which caused us to have to move rooms - which the front desk handled well.  You have a wonderful breakfast (though very pricey) at StoryTellers restaurant in the hotel.  You have fine dining at Napa Rose - superb cuts of meat - for dinner.  The food at the quick service grille was not that great - recommend going elsewhere.  You have your own entrance into California

Summary Heading: The Best Place to Stay Onsite at Disneyland
Summary: Disney's Grand Californian Hotel is one of three Disney hotels located onsite at Disneyland. Without question, it is the most upscale property of the three. This is a family friendly resort with excellent amenities, top-notch dining and even a private entrance directly into Disney California Adventure Park. Housekeeping is a bit underwhelming (otherwise this would have been a five star review), but beyond the half-cleaned room, it is still the best place to stay for any Disneyland vacation.

Don‚Äôt get me wrong, I‚Äôve stayed in many high end hotels but the Grand California is definitely overpriced. Well, it‚Äôs Disney!!!    The nice thing about it is the nearness to the park and downtown Disney. Rooms are good size. The employees are great.  Advantage on staying here is the extra early magic hour- which helps you see or ride 4-5 attractions before the crowd comes in or Star Wars edge opens up.   The walls are thin.  You can hear your next door or people in the hallway running.  It‚Äôs not as Grand as the Grand Floridian.

I flew into LAX and took the Super Shuttle to the Grand Californian. I had my 6 year old granddaughter who had to sit alone in the backseat of the vehicle as the only other seat available was the one in the front. I had my backpack with a special iPad for learning with me in the shuttle. When I checked in I had the backpack with me at the reception desk, while checking in my granddaughter came running up to me and I put the backpack down and forgot to pick it up when I left the reception area. I went back to the desk within minutes but it was gone. I asked to see the security video but the person at the reception desk refused telling me I would have to wait 3 days. Which I find absolutely ridiculous as what is the point of having cameras if you have to wait days to watch them. I

I was pleasantly surprised at the elegance that is the Grand California!   At first, when I rolled into my room, I was dissapointed by the furnature and size of the room. But I quickly got over it when I realized how awesome the amenities offered! I loved having a walk-in steam shower (rare in Disney hotels), thoughtful amentities such as a laundry basket and stool, USB ports by the bed, and park security and entrances on site. Even the housekeeping was wonderful and was better than the 5* resort I stayed in Beverly Hills earlier that week!  The food onsite was good.
