The buffet character breakfast wasn't cheap but was so much better than Chef Mickey's in Orlando. Napa Rose was excellent.   I'd happily return to this hotel!

This is my favourite place to stay because it has a special entrance to California Adventure Park. It has an awesome pool with good pool side service.  The kids love the water slide.  The service is impeccable. We have stayed three times and always been happy.  The decor is very cool like a rustic California cabin.

I have stayed at Disneyland Hotel and Disney Paradise Pier and my expectation where quite high for the Grand. At check in I found out that the King room and sofa that I had requested was changed to Two queen beds. Since the hotel as sold out there was nothing they could do. The room as nice and what I had expected, Bathroom with the rain shower head was a nice touch. We arrived around 5pm and were hungry. We did not want the Storyteller caf√© buffet style, went to the Craftsman Bar no seats available, outside bar style seating. Was advise of the Grill and not in the mood for a Disneyland park grab and go ( tons of screaming kids running from table to table) like McDonald‚Äôs. Went to the Napa Rose and they were full. (It was 545pm) Ask to speak to the concierge desk but since we

Disney offers a 40% off rack rate for military folks. This is not a guarantee there has to be availability.  Also when you make reservation utilizing the military rate, Disney asks 2 questions: 1. Can you shop at a Commissary? 2. Can you be seen on a base for medical?   On my own I do not rate this discount. I only served 4 years and am just a Vet. My husband is a retiree and I am his dependent so I am able to book a military rate.   When you check in if you can‚Äôt produce the dependent, retiree or active CAC card the room rate reverts to original rate.  That being said, I am always grateful to Disney for taking care of those who have served.  This gorgeous resort takes my breath away. At CHRISTmas there are no words to describe its beauty.  Check in is first class commensurate

My family has stayed in the Grand Californian 5 times over the last 10 years and every trip gets better. We‚Äôve paid for concierge which was really nice when our kids were small and stayed in suites when they started having their own kids. This resort is perfection‚Äîif you like classy luxury with an authentic Art Deco flavor. It‚Äôs worth every penny to be close to both parks and still be able to walk right into a luxurious pool or restaurant within minutes.

We are DVC members and our "home" is Grand Floridian at Disney World.  Our grandkids live in Oregon and we surprised them with a trip to Disneyland last year shortly before Christmas.  We stayed at the Grand Californian and were not disappointed.  The hotel was beautifully decorated for the holidays.  We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite which was very comfortable.  The bonus was the close walking proximity  and access to both parts of Disneyland.  At the end of each day the kids were in the pool which was virtually out our back door.  The staff were friendly and met our every wish!

We always love traveling to Disney and the Grand Californian did not disappoint.  We stayed in a basic room without a premium view.  It didn‚Äôt really matter!  The room is clean with comfortable beds.  The staff is Disney friendly and remembers your name.  The valet guy greeted us by name, the registration was fast, and the housekeepers knew us by name!  We‚Äôve stayed at Disneyland Resort and now the Grand Californian.  The kids like the headboards at the the resort but it‚Äôs a good trade off for quick and easy park access from the Grand Californian.  Let‚Äôs face it, you‚Äôll never be disappointed staying at any Disney property.  It‚Äôs worth it for my family to stay on property for a hassle free and Disney experience.

Summary Heading: Hotels at Disney World are much better
Summary: We stayed in a DVC studio villa for 5 nights. Room was dark and seemed out dated. Carpet seemed dirty and had wet spots. We usually stay at the Polynesian in Disney World which rates much higher in my opinion. Not sure I would choose to stay here again.

It's a Disney property so what could be bad about it.  All the employees were great and friendly. Room was nice but nothing remarkable. I would return.  We stayed there for early park admission to see star wars new ride.  Not worth the wait

My wife, 5 year old son and I have stayed at many of the Disney Hotels and at other Good Neighbor Hotels as well. This trip we just took last weekend in August 2019 was truly the best we have ever experienced in every way possible. It was truly beyond amazing and magical, and was made even more enchanting thanks to a staff that takes Customer Service to an entire new level. The room was spacious, clean, so comfortable and had a beautiful view of DCA. Being there with my family was lovely indeed, and add in the magical ambiance that this hotel creates and you have a vacation that lifted our spirits, and will be treasured in our hearts forever and beyond. We will stay here again next year, and cannot wait for that time to come.

Summary Heading: Luxury Rooms at the Heart of the Disneyland Resort
Summary: Pros: The hotel is stunning and the location is perfect if you're visiting the Disney parks.  The rooms are thoughtfully designed, comfortable, and gorgeous.  Staff is friendly, housekeeping is impeccable, and the range of amenities, dining options, and activities is impressive. Cons: The rooms are not sound-proof. We were next to a room with ice and vending machines, and the door to this room slammed all night long. However, the hotel was undergoing fire alarm testing, and we noticed that many of the doors which would typically stay open were closed. This may have been just a stroke of bad luck/timing. The front desk was consistently short-staffed, leading to long waits at check-in, check-out, etc. The rooms are priced much higher than other hotels in the area.

We‚Äôve just been to this hotel for 4 nights. It was part of a trip down the west coast. The hotel is beautiful and magical. It was direct access to both parks. You have to go through security each time though.  On the first day we had trouble with our checking in card and couldn‚Äôt get into the park for 2 hours, they compensated us with free fast track tickets.  The room was lovely, and we spent some time around the pool. It‚Äôs waiter service which is good. But if your not there by lunch time your unlikely to get a sun bed. So we‚Äôd go in the park at 7.30/8am and come back about 12pm, sunbathe for a bit then go back to the park after tea.  Staff are very helpful and make you feel special.  We did the princess breakfast which was good but very expensive. But then we were in Disney.

Plan in a day for the pools!! Such a fun atmosphere and the poolside snack shack is lovely. Amusement park entrance of your very own! The character dining on site is also so so fun! The little details are spot on. We stayed two summers ago and they even had aloe for us after all the sun. This most recent stay, they didn‚Äôt do aloe. Not sure if they did away with that super fun perk. But it‚Äôs still great! Mini-fridge in the room too. üôåüèº

We had the pleasure of staying at the Grand Californian hotel for 4 nights and I was absolutely blown away with it. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful and upon checking in we were upgraded from a standard view room to a room with a woodland/pool view. The rooms themselves are very spacious and very clean and they have a daily housekeeping and turn down service with some great extra touches such as notes or chocolates being left for us and the kids.  The location is great and both parks and downtown Disney are right on your doorstep which is perfect after a long day of walking and rides. The pool area is nice and it was ideal for cooling off and getting a bit of downtime in the afternoon heat before venturing out to the park6for the evening.  All in all I highly

This hotel was pricey but if I had to do it over, I‚Äôd do it again. The only draw back next to cost I‚Äôd say is how long the hallways are to get to your room. My advice, get a room close to the elevator!!

Great location and nice to walk right up to the room after a long day in the park. Hassle free checkout and as is the disney standard, the customer service is always amazing. Food was good and room are clean.

Disney is famous for extravagant rides and it didn't disappoint. However, the popular rides are not properly managed. They give out fast passes and have a standard ride. We made the mistake of going to carsland first. The race ride was a 50 min wait I'm the standard line. We figured we could handle that. But then the ride broke. They were only letting the fast passes through  After 2 hours of waiting they announced it was going to be 2+ more hours. This was our first ride of the day and we didn't get done for nearly 4 hours. It's really unacceptable to charge families $149/ day per person to ride when the lines are not managed properly. I don't think it was worth the money. We split Our family up so we could fit in the things the big kids and little kids wanted to do. Disney

Summary Heading: The convenience makes this hotel worth every penny!
Summary: Room was good. Not $700/night good, but it was fine and had plenty of space for us. The pool was really crowded (no fault of the hotel) but the service at the pool was non existent and felt stressed out. Additionally, I slipped and fell while walking 2 times at the pool. I fell into the pool once and no one seemed to care. Food was great, cocktails reasonably priced (surprising considering this is Disney). Staff was amazing and accommodating in every possible way!  Convenience and friendliness/helpfulness of hotel staff (minus the pool) was outstanding.   Bottom line, we had 2 toddlers and my mom who is a recent cancer survivor. We were able to go back to the room with ease for a break from the heat and amusement parks, i was able to rent a wheelchair in the hotel, and while the

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at The Grand Californian. It was on my must do list for our family vacation this year. From the moment you drive onto the property, you are treated like you are the only guest that matters. The check in process was seamless. I was granted my request for a theme park view room. I  love the decor of the resort...true Northern California nature. The location of the resort is fantastic! Guests are able to walk right in to Disney's California Adventures. The early morning magic, a perk for hotel guests, was incredible!  We rode all the popular rides before the park even opened to the public. Another plus, was the short walk to Downtown Disney and Disneyland. The convenience allowed for my daughter and her cousin(teenagers) to stay in the park by

Our first trip to the West Coast and of course that included a stay at Disneyland!  We booked the Paradise Pier hotel to save a few bucks and got a complimentary upgrade to Disney's Grand Californian Hotel & Spa. This hotel is gorgeous, pool area is amazing and the rooms were spacious, clean and beautiful. We had a view of Disney's Grand California Park and the hotel had it's own private entrance to that park as well.  Everything is in walking distance (Both parks and Downtown Disney/Restaurants and Shops). It's the PERFECT location when visiting Disneyland!

This hotel is very nice but it's really not worth the extra money to stay. Yes it Is has an entrance to the park but to pay 400.00 or more per night than the other hotels that are across the street. The rooms were not so special. We stayed there 2 nights than moved to the Anaheim Majestic hotel which was only 140.00 a night for a suite.

The location of this hotel cannot be beat, no question.  However, at the time of checkin there was a loooooong line.  I say it was at least a 45 min wait.  They did try to make up for it by giving out little cupcakes, which I thought was cute.  Upon walking to our room we noticed we were sent to a far building and were given the last room down a long hallway.  The room was decent, the beds comfortable.  However, we were next to a walkway that the employees used to cart items throughout the day which did not allow for a rest during the day.  I believe there was also a service elevator that was heard in our room as well.  At over $450+ a night my expectations were high.  I was disappointed because I wanted to love it.  I will stick to Paradise Pier and Disneyland Hotel.  I feel

The stay was incredibly good. Great rooms,  great service, fantastic food, great place to be. It is not cheap, and can run into some very high prices sty peak travel times,  but nearly worth it. The best thing is being able to go into the parks an hour earlier than when it opens for the rest of people.  Being able to get into sw land early is a treat.

Summary Heading: It's busy, but nobody can do it like Disney
Summary: The place is super busy, probably because of the size, but Disney is a master at managing crowds. Checking in was super easy, people are eager to help, and they have this whole process down to a science. Self parking is located across the street, but in 3 days we never moved our car anyway.  Stayed in a 2 bedroom Villa and it was more room than we needed.  In fact the room was a bit too large even for Disney because the room looked a little light on furniture, it needed like another couch or a couple of chairs in the living room to fill it out, it did have one couch though.  Big screen TV's in each room plus the living room.  Room was quiet, but a bit of a walk from the elevator...maybe that's where they put the larger rooms at the end of a very long hallway.  Used the work out

I mean it's a nice hotel. Very clean. Friendly 'cast members'. Big rooms, well equipped.   It just really is entirely lifeless. It's really, really very dull. Like the hotel from The Shining. Disorientating corridors and claustrophobic public spaces. Heavy greens and browns. Why is it so deliberately drab? The cavernous great hall has no real focal point or wow factor. Couldn't some character art or elements have been worked into the fabric of the rooms - apart from Chip&Dale? The rooms are cabin lodge chic - with very little wow factor. Tiny balconies that are useless too. Bed was super rcomfy. Very quiet overall. Good bathroom and selection of amenities. The location is exceptional - the only hotel in the Disney Universe to open directly into a park - you can't beat that when

We stayed in the DVC condos. The two bedroom units have 3 bathrooms, a Murphy bed and a great second bedroom with a good little balcony. We had a wonderful view overlooking California Adventure. The top floor has a nice patio that overlooks the park.    The lobby in this resort just could not be any nicer.  Self parking (no charge for DVC guests) is easy to get to.  You need to tell the valet that you are DVC if that applies.   The bell services are outstanding. Truly amazing.  They conveniently store items and deliver to the room in the most effortless manner.    They have a brand new pool bar that is excellent and several eating locations. But the best part is location. You can walk right into California Adventure or Downtown Disney.

The best of the disney hotels at Disneyland. Very expensive, but so relaxing and convenient. Everyone is so nice and helpful. The pools are great. Room service is good. Rooms are clean and comfortable and quiet even though it's right next to an amusement park.

Summary Heading: Unexpectedly nice California design at Disneyland, but distant from rides
Summary: Unexpectedly nice bungalow design at Disneyland, California style property.   Still a distance from the park and too far for kids to walk to the rides, but tram service is regularly available for guests. Pricey.

I come here annually for a conference, which I enjoy. We get a discounted room rate so it‚Äôs fine, but I would never pay the $600ish full price for a room here. It‚Äôs not that great.   Mainly I‚Äôm annoyed because I was looking forward to having a spa treatment at what is currently called ‚ÄúDisney‚Äôs Grand Californian Hotel & Spa‚Äù only to find out from the FIFTH person I asked that there is no more spa. (The first four staff members, excuse me cast member, had heard of the spa but had no idea where it was.)  I‚Äôm not sure why everything down to my room key says Hotel & Spa, but if they‚Äôre going to suddenly close the spa, I think they should get on changing the name ASAP.

I can't express enough how nice this place is!  We stayed club level, so this was an extra special treat for us!  Everything was so nice.  We were offered a discount because my daughter is with the "Dance the Magic" performing group.  Otherwise, probably wouldn't be able to swing it for this many nights.  Even with the discount, it's still steep.  But oh what an amazing thing to experience.  I had called ahead regarding food at the Verandah.  My kids and I are vegetarian.  They went over it all with me and said they would make notes to the chef when we arrived.  didn't really seem like this was done or anything different was done.  While there are plenty of options, I found it annoying that the entire time we were there, the deviled eggs had bacon in them.  When asking about

My family and I stayed here for a few nights at the beginning of July. This hotel is so convenient!  Steps away from entrance of California Adventure, downtown Disney and a super short walk to Disneyland.  It was our first time to these parks and it was hard for me to imagine the logistical relationship between the parks and hotel because I am used to Orlando and everything being soooo spread out.  The rooms were comfortable and my husband and I enjoyed the balcony in the evening.  One thing I did not like about this property was the temperature of the lobby.  While I know this seems like a silly comment my family and I avoided the lobby at all costs because it was way too cold.  I was told it was supposed to imitate Northern California temperatures but I think this is a feature

Summary Heading: Don't expect to drop off or pickup anyone handicap by the entrance.
Summary: I'd give it more of a 3.5.  Pros: The villas are roomy and nice.  Restaurants are nice.  Staff is in generally friendly.  Convenient walking to Downtown Disney  and California Adventure.  Con: The only unfriendly we seem to encounter are the people in the hotel drive up.  My mom is handicap.  Not only handicap, but she slipped on a wet floor (the sign was sideways to her and the worker was standing at the side letting people walk by).  It was tooth and nails to get a wheelchair for the 2 days left of our stay.  In addition, being able to pick her up in the lane adjacent to the entrance is a no.  I was told to park in the farthest lane because the other was an "emergency lane" only to find people unloading there later that evening.  On the second incident, I was told to park in

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, loved the access to California Adventure
Summary: Our room was spacious, good service from hotel staff, and we loved the easy access to Downtown Disney and California Adventure. This is my second time to stay at a Disney hotel, but my first at the Grand Californian. Several restaurants, decent fitness center, decent swimming pools. Overall, a good choice for couples and families.

Summary Heading: Best location but too pricey for what it was
Summary: We have stayed in the Disneyland Hotel and the Courtyard Theme Park Entrance before. This hotel had the best location of the 3, but I preferred the other hotels. They both had better water areas and had better pricing.  The only thing I preferred at the GC was the location. Check in time was hectic, and our room was not ready on time. There seemed to be many others hanging out in the lobby with us with the same problem.The pool area was just okay and not impressive. The lobby was gorgeous! I did love the lobby. We even hung out with Pluto one night there. We could also show our key card to get free coffee and hot chocolate at White Water Snacks. We visited the store there several times.  The nachos at White Water Snacks were really good! Our room was kind of far into the maze of

Great brief 2 night stay at the Grand California Location can‚Äôt be beaten and you are steps away from the park. Hotel was quite busy and we were surprised to see a queue for the main lounge/bar.   We ate in Napa Rose which was a little disappointing and service wasn‚Äôt great. As an example they asked if we were celebrating anything - yes my birthday. They asked my name and then..... nothing happened!!!! Why ask if you‚Äôre not going to do anything). The lounge in Napa Rose was nice though and was cosier and had more atmosphere than the main hotel lounge.  The main lobby of the hotel is stunning and has some great attention to detail. Rooms were nice, refurbished and spacious. Hopefully the next area to be refurbished is the Hearthstone Lounge.   Both parks were fun as ever although

Summary Heading: good thematic a little bit expensive though but worth it
Summary: we visited disney last year and it was always a dream of mine to stay in this famous hotel, it was just as good as I was expecting but it was a little bit too expensive to be honest., so if you go there just better be prepared you and your wallet

I have stayed at Disney's Grand California Hotel many times and is one of my all time favorites.  The price is high but the experience and being close to the park are well worth it.  The hotel decor and lobby are amazing.  I love to just sit in the lobby and have a drink and people watch.

Summary Heading: Can't go wrong with Disney's Grand Californian Hotel and Spa!
Summary: Stayed here this past spring.  It has been a hotel on our bucket list for quite some time.  We have stayed at the Disneyland resort before and wanted to give this hotel a try.  We booked a pool view room.  While you could see the pool through the trees, I'm not sure the upgraded room with this view was worth the price.  This hotel is near Downtown Disney and has its own entrance to California adventure park, this convenience can't be beat, especially if you have children with you.  The beds were comfortable and the room was very clean.  Overall, I would stay here again if the price was right.  However, if you are seeking a more "Mickey feel" rather than a wooded cabin feel, then, I think the Disneyland Hotel fits the bill.

This is by far the best hotel in Disneyland  The location is great, the rooms are very nice, the pool‚Äôs is very good, they have a pool party for the kids every afternoon  The restaurant are very good  The story tellers restaurant has chip and Dale coming around to the table‚Äôs

My family and I stayed here during the first week of July 2019. The hotel provides exemplary service, anticipating every need and cheerfully handling every request. The beds are heavenly, the rooms are quiet and the location is fabulous! Cannot imagine staying anywhere else when visiting Disneyland.

Summary Heading: As usual another piece of Disney Magic....
Summary: Extremely beautiful.  Easy access to the parks and shopping.  Absolutely loved the character dining in the hotel.  Parking was a little tricky at first.  Having to pay to park and then walk a very long distance was a little annoying.  However, you can pull up to the front door and they will take your luggage out and take it into the hotel  for you.  Overall a beautiful, convenient and happy place to stay.

This Hotel is in the heart of everything.  Just steps from Downtown Disney and there is an entrance for hotel guests directly into California Adventures.  The lobby is one of the most beautiful places I have ever seen that isn't outdoors.  The inlaid floor, fire place, vaulted ceiling and piano music are all part of the welcoming ambiance.  The staff is very helpful and friendly.  The rooms aren't any larger than any other hotel but there are all kinds of little Disney touches that make things special.  Even if you don't stay at this hotel, it is definitly worth a visit.  The Storytellers Cafe is a great place to start your Disney day and it is located right in the hotel.

( if you paid $95 or $1000. Per night ).  People want 5 core things when they  stay at any Hotel.  1. Clean Room. 2. Comfortable bed. 3. Good working Air conditioning & Heating 4. No Nasty smells. ( No sewer smells ). 5. Peace & Quiet when resting or sleeping.  Negatives: Very Expensive, Place is busy all the time,   room had a sewer smell coming from the plumbing. They moved us out of the room, 2nd room had sewer smell, they fixed the problem that night. All this wasted time from our Celebration,  We had the smell longer than we wanted.  Positives: 1.  Concierge‚Äôs very helpful & informative !  2. Room service very  cordial. 3. Front desk helpful. 4. Maid service is good.  Thank you  Billy Travel

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, fantastic location and perks!
Summary: This is the best place to stay when visiting Disneyland.  It is a nice hotel, though somewhat overpriced, but what really makes it worthwhile is its location, and the perks that come with being a Disney property.  The rooms are good-sized, quiet and comfortable. They have a balcony, good beds and bedside lighting, lots of drawer and closet space, in-room safe, a coffee maker, refrigerator, iron & board, lighted makeup mirror and dual sinks in the bathroom, and plentiful electrical and USB outlets ‚Äì the most I‚Äôve ever seen in one room, including on the wall and on the alarm clock bedside, plus more on the opposite wall at the desk and over the dresser.  I also appreciated that the tub/shower and toilet were in a separate room from the vanity, which facilitates multiple people

So it's a fantastic Disney Hotel. You get what you pay (and you pay a lot). The grounds are beautiful. The hotel is wonderful. Check-in had many people working in a busy time and that is always appreciated. Valets are great. Every time we called down there was a person who could help answer any question. And you are right INSIDE the park and downtown Disney. Can't ask for anything else. But the kids are right: "It's like a Great Wolf Lodge without the amenities" my son said. Not quite: parents will get it's A LOT BETTER than a Great Wolf Lodge (those are junky and falling apart). But for kids, where's the magic. If you don't do the character breakfast here (and why would you not want to just dash into the park quickly and use your "extra magic hour") there's very little Disney

Due to the demand of Galaxy‚Äôs Edge reservations. In comparison to DisneyWorld Orlando- there really is no comparison. The high end places in DW blow away this experience. Some of the better features are the bigger rooms and turndown service, as well as the ability to walk directly into the Park from a private entrance. However the pools are nothing special and the prices of the restaurants are on the high side.  Overall the hotel was really good, however I expect a better Disney experience for the price paid.

Summary Heading: Pricey, but at least they deliver
Summary: So to be fair, contributing to the high cost was probably our last minute booking. We decided to take the grand kids 1 week before due to our schedules lining up. While I was caught off guard with the price, I can say that we were not disappointed. We remarked at how comfortable the beds were, the facilities impeccably clean & everyone went out of their way to greet you with a smile. We upgraded our room to a Downtown Disney facing view for $39 per night. This allowed us to view the fireworks from the comfort of our own balcony, which we did each night. While my expectations  of a Downtown Disney View were different from what we received, so much so that I actually called down to confirm with the front desk to verify we were issued the upgrade correctly. If it hadn't been for

The location is amazing and actually opens into Disney downtown or California adventure!  The staff is awesome  going above and beyond all expectations.  We had  a balcony where we could watch the fireworks at night...spoiled us for any other hotel. The rooms are so clean and the bed/bedding is extremely comfortable. The beds are on the tall side so you can place your luggage under them. Mini fridge and turndown service.  Loved it!

The service here is over the top. From the front desk to turn down service with chocolates on the pillow. The rooms are beautiful and modern. The beds were very comfortable. There is direct access to California Adventure and it's easy to go back to the hotel to rest. My biggest issue with this hotel is the price. I just can't justify paying the usual price which is so much higher than either the Disneyland Hotel or Paradise Pier. We got upgraded from Paradise Pier for this stay. We were very grateful for that and wish we could stay here more often.

Summary Heading: Beautiful, wish I could stay here more often!
Summary: I got to stay here for several nights for a work-related event, and really enjoyed it. I think this is perfect if you are staying for several days as a park hopper, because there is easy access to California Adventure as well as the main park. You don't have to use valet for this hotel, which is another nice perk of this location as well. The rooms are spotless, and there is lots to do in the main level, for adults and kids alike. I wish they would consider lowering the price on some of the rooms...While I totally get that its Disney, they could do more to make some things more reasonable.

This is a hotel with a great location. I was part of a convention and had the opportunity of staying at the Grand Californian for 5 nights. I had not seen or heard about this hotel and then after a quick online search I realized how expensive this hotel usually is, and was wondering why. The hotel is like a big cabin. I believe the hotel has seen better years, but it is overall a very nice property. Service is of course amazing, but sometimes fake. The room is nice, not very nice. I was surprised I couldn't access YouTube on the TV, which I was expecting for the price of the room. Then, when I went to Disneyland is when I understood why the hotel is so expensive: it is located about 10 minutes walking from both parks and it is located in Downtown Disney. If you are willing to

Very nice hotel, similar to Wilderness Lodge in WDW.  The place has direct access to one Disney Park and close-to-direct access to the other.  Nice pool, nice rooms, but compared to what we've seen at WDW Florida's Grand Floridian and other high-end Disney resorts there, we found the place to be much too expensive, especially when much cheaper competition is only right across the street, unlike WDW Florida's competition, which is far away from the parks there.

We‚Äôve stayed at this hotel several times and never did we ever get lucky of checking in before 4pm or be granted of our requests for room locations. They always say that the villas take awhile to clean or they are already pre-assigned etc...  It‚Äôs just very disappointing in comparison to other DVC hotels like Disney Aulani and Disney world hotels where we always or most of the time get to check in early and be granted of our requests. If it‚Äôs not for the convenience of location to the parks and the free self-parking, I don‚Äôt think we will be considering using our precious DVC points in this hotel. The management should look into it. There must be something they can do to give guests a more pleasant experience than this.

It‚Äôs just stunning.   And not a speck of dust to be found.  When we first checked in, we immediately ran into Mickey and Minnie in the atrium.  We had a room where the monorail went by and the kids (and my husband) just loved it every time they saw it.  It‚Äôs so nice that it has it‚Äôs own entrance into the parks.  Definitely saves you time and you can easily drop things off back at the room.  Or, you can change if you get soaked on a ride.  You can have things delivered for free to your room from the parks too.  The attention to every single little detail is amazing.   They even do a turn down service in the evening with Ghiradelli chocolates.  The pools were heated and had a fun water slide.  A small baby water slide for toddlers or less adventurous kiddos too.  The only bad

What a beautiful resort and Grand location! It's own entrance to California Adventure! We had a studio and just enough room for 3 adults. Like having the coffee maker in the room for quick coffee before hitting the parks.  We were there in January so did not use the pool.  The lobby store is a little limited, but the lobby bar is lovely.

We stayed here using our DVC points.  Since we were unable to get a studio (this are rare at the resort), we booked a one bedroom.  We lucked out with an awesome view of Disney's California Adventure.  Beautiful view both day and night.  We didn't really neat all the space, but it was nice to have some room to spread out, almost like being at home.  The master bath is very roomy, allowing both of us to get ready at the same time.  One of the little things that we loved was that the bed was high enough off the floor to allow us to put our suitcases beneath it and complete out of the way.  This was our second stay here and we have loved that it has its own entrance to California Adventure.

We spent 3 days at Disneyland to kick off a weeklong California trip. For the most part, Disney continues to do things right. The hotel and parks were clean, the staff friendly and responsive. The only hiccup came with check in. We arrived early and asked for an early check in, but understood that was unlikely. The hotel allowed us to complete the process, and promised that we‚Äôd receive a text with our room number when our room was ready. But 3 pm (the check in time) came and went without a text. We returned to the front desk around 3:45 for an update, which meant waiting in line again. As we approached a clerk, the fire alarm sounded (I don‚Äôt knock Disney for this; it happens). We returned around 4:20 and finally received a room assignment; as we opened the door to our room (at

Summary Heading: a Grand Time + a Visit to the Galaxy‚Äôs Edge.
Summary: Love the hotel (price is obscene, but you are paying for location and service) - arrived at 6:30 am, gave the car to the valet, the bags to bellhop, checked in, got our pre-purchased tickets (we got the whole package through Costco), were given a room, took a few things to the room, and were at the Disneyland gates for 7 am Extra Magic Morning!  - rooms are thoughtfully designed for a family. There are 6 drawers in a dresser, at least 8 USB ports, plenty of counter space, and a small closet. The two queen beds are raised so it is easy to store suitcases and the sink is separate from the shower making it easier to get multiple people ready. The shampoo, conditioner, and soap are slightly larger than normal travel size and housekeeping does a turn down service and restocks

This might be the most beautiful Disney hotel ever built. The location can‚Äôt be beat, especially having it‚Äôs own entrance into Disney California Adventure.   The rooms were clean and beautiful, love the new look!   Front desk staff were great, as always!   The early entry to DCA is fantastic!   Having a balcony was very appreciated!   A few things that I didn‚Äôt love...  The piano in the lobby playing super early in the morning! We were just off the lobby and it woke us up!  The pool was open until 9pm but the lifeguards told us to pack up and vacate the area at 8:45.   The attitude from two women working in the gift shop, not very friendly.   We felt the bathroom, the closed-off area with the shower and toilet, was very small.   Overall, we enjoyed our stay in this luxurious

Stayed here in 2018 and can't wait to stay again.  The lobby is marvelous, the hospitality is superb, and the entry to California Adventure is close and convenient.  Rooms are clean and comfortable. Stay here!

We stayed here while visiting Disney!  We loved this hotel.  The proximity to parks can‚Äôt be beat!  Literally took me 5 min to run to my room to grab a sweater from California Adventure.  The lobby is gorgeous.  Our room was lovely and clean.  The beds were sooooo comfy!  We had such a wonderful stay here it will be hard to stay at any other hotel when visiting Disney again.  This is a great way to visit Disney and feel a little pampered!

I stayed here to get an automatic reservation for Galaxy‚Äôs Edge. I enjoyed my brief stay. Unfortunately I was not able to get a later check out. My Galaxy‚Äôs Edge reservation was from 8-noon. And there was no way I would leave Galaxy‚Äôs Edge before noon to check out. So I checked out at 5:30am. And storing my souvenirs was such a hassle. Anyways, the room was comfortable. I loved the waterfall shower head. The staff were friendly. And there‚Äôs easy access to Downtown Disney and the parks. The price for my stay was ridiculously expensive. But it was worth it getting an automatic reservation for Galaxy‚Äôs Edge.

Here on business trip and have stayed before on vacation. This is, hands down, the best place to be if you need to stay in Anaheim for business. Beautiful homage to the craftsman style down to every detail and if Disney isn‚Äôt your thing those references are relatively subtle on property. Staff accommodating and friendly and very good standard of service- 24 hr room service, business center and Napa Rose restaurant excellent spot for bringing clients.

Staying at the Grand is all about the location! It‚Äôs a lovely hotel with nice restaurants and amenities too. You can mobile order at White Water Snacks, just swing by and pickup! The real plus comes with being able to leave the parks in the afternoon for a bit of a break then come right back in again for the evening hours! We have two teenagers. The rooms offer sufficient space, a keurig for coffee/tea and mini fridge. We really enjoyed our stay and will definitely be back!

Spent 3 nights here before our cruise-- what a beauty!  Rooms are well appointed, bathroom is spacious.  Rooms are quiet, despite being next to a theme park and filled with families & children.  Gift shop was very nice, pools were wonderful with very comfy lounge chairs, restaurants were delicious.  A little on the pricey side, but well worth the splurge!

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel, but not very organized
Summary: The hotel is beautiful. The private entrance into California Adventure is a big plus. We booked a 3 bedroom suite for our group of 8. It was pricey, but it was for a special family trip. I was expecting things to run smoothly and a hotel of this caliber to be professional and organized, but we had some issues. I requested ahead of time a tub in one of the rooms since my 3 year old has sensory issues and can‚Äôt take a shower yet. I also requested a monorail view room for the kids. I understand these are both subject to availability. Upon check in, we found out neither of these requests went through ahead of time and at the time of our arrival there weren‚Äôt any tubs. We were given pool view rooms, which were so noisy! There is construction going on for the pool bar which affected

We upgraded to the Veranda level at the Grand Californian for this stay and it was worth every bit extra.  Greeted like VIPs, ushered up to a private check in on the sixth floor. Family brought into the Veranda room for breakfast while I completed the check in process. Lisa even helped me load our park tickets onto my app!!  Plenty of breakfast and lunch choices to avoid eating in the park. We had already made dinner reservations prior to our arrival but certainly could have eaten that meal as well. Dessert and hot chocolate bar while watching fireworks, private visit with Pluto. Will definitely make this our new ‚Äúmust‚Äù for future visits

Everything was fantastic at this resort. The pool was very nice to hang out at. The lounge was excellent with free drinks and food. The hour early entry to the California Adventure park was great! The only complaint is the beds were not very comfortable. I woke up with a back ache every morning.

We spent a week here with our 2 young kids. Room was clean and spacious, beds were super comfy. Even with a park view of California Adventure Park it was not noisy at all. My son unfortunately tripped and hit his head at the pool and the staff were amazing with helping us get to the hospital for stitches and etc. Hotel grounds were clean and beautiful and staff were so polite and helpful. Nice and easy access to both parks from the hotel.

Summary Heading: It's The Best Hotel At Disneyland
Summary: We had a great time at the Grand Californian Hotel.  It is the best hotel at Disneyland.  It is refined and the staff is quite helpful with any need you may have.  It is a perfect addition to a visit to Disneyland.

Brought my two granddaughters and their mommy for three days in Disneyland; I was not looking forward to the onslaught of Disney music, marketing and confusion.  However, from the very first checking in process to the non-existent check out the helpfulness, patience and understanding of every ‚Äòcast-member‚Äô proved my anticipation of chaos was unfounded. We loved it.  All of us. We navigated through the confusion of Maxpass/fastpass, ride wait times, appropriateness of each attraction for our 5 year old while satisfying our 9 year old without missing too much.  We even enjoyed ‚Äòshopping‚Äô in the zillions of shops selling everything Disney, marveling at the multitude of Mouse hats and all the happy families with their Disney decked out outfits.  We loved being able to se the

This hotel is by far the most convenient to the parks. It has it's own entrance to California Adventure which drops you right in the park. It also has an entrance into downtown Disney. The interior of the hotel is very nice, and done in an arts and crafts motif. We had very friendly, helpful interactions with all the staff. The check in process needs some improvement. At that caliber of hotel, you don't expect to wait in a long line to have to check in. They know when all the arrivals are coming, so it seems they should be able to plan for it.  We arrived at 2:30pm and our hotel room was not ready until 4:30pm. This was a long time to wait with a child. The pools are very nice, although they need more chairs and shade for the guests. We rented a pool cabana because on our

The lobby is very spacious and beautiful. We had a business conference at the Disneyland Hotel and we could choose between the Disneyland Hotel and the Grand Californian hotel. I chose this one because of the photos of this hotel. The rooms are just as beautiful. There are three restaurants on site - Storyteller's Cafe is all you can eat buffet (expensive), Napa Rose (more expensive) and White Water Snacks (affordable). The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Downtown Disney is very close and easy to walk to.

Location wise it‚Äôs a plus going to this hotel. You get to go inside the parks one hour ahead than the usual start time. Has easy access to the Disneyland and California Adventure parks. No need to chase up the Disney characters inside Disneyland as the characters will be roaming around the Storytellers Cafe during breakfast buffet.   While doing the check in or check out, there‚Äôs an area for kids where they could sit and watch tv along with the other kids.  Spacious rooms with toiletries. Don‚Äôt forget to bring your toothpaste and toothbrushes.   If you have kids who‚Äôd like to swim, there are several pools available for adult and kids. No need to worry as there are life vests available and there are several lifeguards on standby.  For improvement: Air conditioning goes on and

We arrived to smiles and a great welcome.. and everyone always eager to assist.. even though the room wasn‚Äôt ready the person helping us with registration was helpful.. the room was spacious and two beds fit for a queen.. the cleaning staff were friendly and always smiling.. the rooms were clean.. the night time routine of chocolate on the bed was perfect way to end a day.. the bonus of having a seperate security entrance into California land was perfect..

Summary Heading: Disney Grand Californian Hotel simply not worth the cost
Summary: We arrived on a Monday to find that our hotel room wasn't ready yet and would have to wait a full hour +.  With 2 little boys in tow this wasn't ideal.  The hotel lobby is very nice, but the rooms are so small, there was little if any play room for the children.  We've stayed at other Disney resort hotels as well as good neighbor hotels and I have to say that the good neighbor hotels can be every bit as impressive for the children, many include a breakfast definitely a much better deal for your money.  I ran into several guests who agreed and said they wouldn't be booking there again.  Oh and it is huge, it was at least a 10 minute walk to our room from the elevator.

Summary Heading: Couldn't have picked a better hotel
Summary: Every cast member in the hotel was so helpful! Plus the amenities are great. Love having the private entrance to California Adventure as well as much smaller bag check lines getting into the parks/Downtown Disney. So quick to walk between here and the parks!  Only issue was on day 1 when we tried to use the pool and every single chair was filled with a towel. No one had been clearing them throughout the day so it was impossible to tell who was still at the pool/who had left. We couldn't even stay in the area because there was literally nowhere to sit.  Other than that, what an amazing time! The people at the front desk/concierge were so helpful with all of our questions (and because it was our first visit there were many). They were also great about redirecting us toward the

My family of three Stayed at the Grand California Hotel May 3 through May 6 to celebrate my husband‚Äôs birthday. We have stayed there dozens of times in the past but due to some economic hardships we were unable to visit in a long time. This was our first trip in 10 years. It was even better than I remembered! Honestly I almost cried while checking in. The hotel is absolutely stunningly beautiful, and I really love the upgrades that they did to the rooms. The remodel is excellent. Bathroom has a glass enclosed shower rather than a gross outdated shower curtain, which we were ecstatic about. The room is pristinely clean, housekeeping did a great job every day. Beds and pillows were heavenly. The room is very functionally laid out. Our room had two queen beds and a sofa bed. We

Our greeting was stand in line, Then here is your tickets and stuff.    We did get a birthday pin that the check-in girl wrote our daughters name on with a sharpie (not quite the birthday greeting we had hoped for). Our grand two room suite was an adjoining room, thought it would be a true suite  Both mini bars were completely bare.  Little key details we missed but would liked to have known at check-in; kids pool closes at six, early park admittance is when and where. The place seemed so busy that they have forgotten to train their staff.  This became very apparent when I did an internal and not so good review I received an email from a manager whom asked when he could call.  That 2 day window came and went without a call. Our stay was by no means bad and we had a great time

As always customer service no 1. We were checked in by Linda who explained everything about the hotel, the Disney tickets we purchased, she suggested a great room that suited our needs perfectly. Room extremely comfy the only exception was that the beds are so high ( all guests must be treated like the princess and the pea) but never fear Disney provides a step for you to use.

Summary Heading: Amazing Stay at the Grand Californian
Summary: Amazing resort for families visiting Disneyland! Made for a magical vacation! Arrived at the stunning lobby, themed after the Majestic Lodge at Yosemite.  The pools are inviting, fun for the kids, well attended.  Roaring Forks served excellent quick service food.  Napa Rose steakhouse provided a wonderful more formal sit down meal, catered to families with children wonderfully.  Rooms clean, tastefully decorated mountain lodge feel.  Having direct access to California Adventure park, as well as Downtown Disney shopping and dining is unmatched! And private viewing balcony for World of Color show is a bonus.  Will definitely return!

We used our DVC points to stay here for about a week. We got a 2 bedroom villa with kitchen. The room was clean and the housekeeping staff did a very good job while we were there. They collect the trash everyday now has part of their new security policies to check the room everyday. We had room service for breakfast in the morning which is a bit pricey but easier than trying to get it in the quick service area; it's a bit of a walk. The resort offers a daily character breakfast at Storyteller's Caf√©. The resort is very similar to the Wilderness Lodge in Disney World. The staff was very friendly. You can pick up your park purchases at Bell Services. You can also ship items home using UPS though Bell Services; we utilized it to send home popcorn buckets and refillable mugs. My

We live in Los Angeles and we wanted to get away for a couple of nights and have some fun.  Not having been to Disneyland in many years, my husband and I decide to drive south to visit the park.  We didn't want to stay offsite, and weekends like this are rare for us, so we decided to stay at the Grand Californian and boy are we happy we didi.  The hotel is huge, but tastefully done.  We loved the exterior and interior design as well as the furniture in the lobby and inside our room.  This hotel is VERY expensive, but well worth it because of service, food quality, cast member support and ease of getting in and out of the park.  We will never stay anywhere else.  We arrived very early in the morning, wanting to put in a full day at the park.  We were greeted by very friendly

We had the good fortune to stay at the Grand Californian again this month. We stayed in two suites - one bedroom and three bedroom - and they were right near each other at the end of a long hall (so quiet!). The rooms have been renovated since we went two years ago and were spacious, clean, and nicely decorated. Ditto for the rest of the hotel. The three bedroom was a one bedroom suite with doors to two regular hotel rooms so the seven of us could spread out a bit. I have an infant and they provided a regular (yet small) crib - not a pack & play. That's nice! There are loads of USB ports in the room to charge various devices - really handy.   We could hear noise from the park, from the room, but it was fun to stand on the balcony and watch rides at CA Adventure. We were able to

First Impression:  Lobby and hotel are beautiful. Our room was ready when we got there at 10:30 AM. There were many USB plugs and outlets. There is only a shower. NO TUB. Two sinks. WiFi worked great. We bought our tickets at front desk at check in. We ate brunch at Storytellers Cafe and headed to park.  TIP. I had family walk into California Adventure park and back out right before brunch so I could make FastPass with Maxpass while eating. We had FastPass for Soarin when we went to park.  Convenient to everything ‚Äî Short walk to Downtown Disney and California Adventure park.  A pretty good walk to Disneyland but not terrible. Also you can ride Monorail from Downtown Disney into Disneyland. Pool was awesome.  Water was cool but tolerable. Lounge chairs by pool are so

Best thing about the resort is that they have a single room for a family of 5! It‚Äôs a well kept property with easy walkability to Downtown Disney and the parks right from the hotel. Only complaint- the hotel pool has LOTS of rules (no beverages within 6 ft of pool/jacuzzi, no snorkel masks in pool). All the life guards were very nice about it, but that doesn‚Äôt feel like the freedom of vacation.

We have stayed at a number of Disney Hotels, and this is probably our favourite.  Indeed a ‚Äògrand‚Äô hotel.  Rooms are very comfortable with modern facilities even though the dark wood style is in keeping with hotel theme.  Our room had more power and USB connections than any hotel room we have stayed in. Fantastic location with direct access to mid-Downtown Disney.  Reception/bell service was ‚ÄòDisney-friendly‚Äô and super efficient.

Everything we could have thought of and more. Location was spectacular with regards to the two Disney parks. Of course, the staff was great. Service was great. Atmosphere was very welcoming. Loved the close proximity to multiple dining and entertainment options.

I recently stayed at the resort for a conference.  The hotel itself is furnished from top to bottom in craftsman's design.  The staff is friendly and very attentive.  And in true Disney fashion everyone tries to strive to be helpful. My only reservation is the cost.  The room is well over $500 per night.  And while the linens and bedding are quite nice--the room is small , the  bathroom has a bath/shower combo and is also small. This is not a 5 star hotel by conventional standards.  But the hotel is perfect for going to California Adventure or Downtown Disney.

We were at Disneyland for 4 days over the kids' spring break. It was our first trip so we don't have another nearby hotel to compare it to, but we really appreciated the convenience. If you are going to Disneyland, you walk through Downtown Disney. You can place an order for pick up at the Starbucks and save time.  If you are going to California Adventure, there is direct access directly into the park. It saves so much time especially when it's early in the morning and you want to get onto the rides before the crowds arrive and in the afternoon/evening when everyone is exhausted.   Inside the room, there are several conveniences. We loved the shower stall; no grimy bathtub. The shower has a handheld sprayer and a rain shower head. The bath amenities are great, with nice touches

I stayed at the Grand end of last October with my assistant/employee, my December stay was with sister, niece & my 80 year old mother.  And the third stay in February was with large group of 24 family and friends. It is important to take note that although I stay 3-4 times a year I do not always give five stars. These stays were so consistent with service and the Disney smile.   I am a DVC member, but about half of my stays are not as DVC due to availability and I feel either stay is the same in comparison with the exception of housekeeping & missing my turn down service ‚Äúchocolate surprise ‚Äú  I am going to list a few of my experiences and opinions that may be helpful for you to know for your next time you vacation at the Grand.   So many people complain about the price and

This is the most beautiful hotel I‚Äôve ever visited and I know I‚Äôll be coming back here one day, hopefully soon enough! I cannot wait, it‚Äôs been way too long since 2009, a whole decade already from now Through June. It can be expensive tho I negotiated a deal back in the day so it was a winner winner! Thank you grand!!!

Summary Heading: A clip joint for gullible tourists
Summary: We stayed here for two nights to visit Disney with our two young girls. We booked it from London some months ago.   On the plus side...  You get the magic hour in the morning (which they clearly trade off) and that makes a huge difference to your trip.   The general manager, Dan, genuinely tried to fix the many problems we encountered (see below) and seemed a decent guy.   The lobby is imposing and attractive (if entirely fake, but this is Disney), they have a decent wine list.   On the down side...  It is so, so, so expensive. I‚Äôve just got our bill and it was ROOM ONLY for the most basic room in the hotel (and it was really basic) $850 a night. For a room that wouldn‚Äôt be out of place in a motel. That we could barely fit in, that overlooked a parking lot, that didn‚Äôt include

I booked the standard garden view room and upon check in they upgraded our view. I didn't not noticed anything different about the view or room than the standard view room I had booked in years past. We arrived in the evening and grabbed dinner at white water snacks. It was a quick and easy with a variety of options. It was great to have a quick eats dinner option without having to go to Downtown Disney.  I have two younger boys and a 20 year old. She is 5.3 feet and fit fine in the twin bed. Our family of five fit comfortably in the room. We stay once a year and it never disappoints, very convenient.

We had a fantastic stay this past weekend.  We stayed Thursday-Sunday. I booked a courtyard/woods view room.  Our elevator was right by Napa rose and storyteller‚Äôs cafe.  Super convenient to the park entrance of California Adventure, the pool, and white water snacks.  Loved the new breakfast Mickey Adventure breakfast at StoryTeller‚Äôs.   Spent 3 days in both parks, ate great food, swam, and really enjoyed the parks at night.  Our kids enjoyed all three pools and the water slide.  Our room had two queen beds and a day bed.  Nice walk in shower, Keurig coffee, and our favorite turn down service with ghiradelli chocolate on our pillows.  Magic hours are another great perk!  We have stayed several times at the Disneyland hotel and the convenience of this hotel is hard to beat.  We

I love staying at Disney.  As a SoCal local, I don't often get the opportunity to stay on property at Disneyland, but stayed there last year for my birthday.  It was a very pleasant experience. The room was well-appointed and comfortable for three of us, incredible views of the ferris wheel at CA and the service was impeccable.  It's Disney-expensive, but well worth it. OVERALL REVIEW: Disney Did Do This Grand! / Worth the $!

Pros- Close to the parks Early entry Comfortable beds Big TV w/good cable Room service Multiple pools & cabanas  Cons- Overpriced  Not enough people working the gates in the morning  Crabby room service guy Thin walls. I heard my neighbors coughing all night  This was my 2nd stay here. The location is great, but not sure that‚Äôs worth the outrageous cost. The rooms are small, but nice. Both times I booked via phone directly with Disneyland. Both times I was quoted a price for a park view room. Both times at check-in I was told that a park view room was not available and given a pool view room :/ I think they should just say when booking that they do not guarantee views, because they don‚Äôt. So that was disappointing.

Beautiful resort, happy employees, makes you feel special.  Very convenient to parks and you can access downtown Disney from hotel! Lots of amenities, beautiful pools and sitting areas. Although theres alot of people,  you dont feel crowded, good layout.

Summary Heading: Great stay with Disney (but what‚Äôs up with the lack of pool chairs???)
Summary: We are big Disney fans and stay at a Disney property whenever we are at Disneyland. The Grand Californian is my family‚Äôs go to hotel. You can‚Äôt beat the location, the staff are all pleasant and ready to assist but hands down they have the best house keeping crew.  When we checked in we received a room without a bathtub, shower only. We asked to be changed to a room with a bathtub (my toddler is afraid of the shower) the staff accommodated us but it took them awhile to even find a room with a tub. They said as they‚Äôve been renovating rooms they‚Äôve gone away from tubs. This struck me as odd since so many little kids come and stay with their families.  We will most likely stay here again because of the conscience and location. I personally prefer the Disneyland Hotel but this is

Summary Heading: Great with meeting discount otherwise pricey!
Summary: Overall a very clean, comfortable hotel. Check in took over 20 minutes for 4 rooms. Their system is new apparently and the staff is slow. Rooms supposed to be ready by 3pm but half were not. They said the room is guaranteed at 3pm but really they mean between 3 and 4. That is rough when you were at the airport at 4am and at Disney all day and just want to relax. The convenience is the direct entrance to California Adventure right by Grizzly ride and a churro cart or you can enter to Downtown Disney right by Sephora. Room service available but after 11pm limited menu. 3rd floor has club 33 concierge. Our rooms were 299 a night because of our dental meeting rate. Overall would come again for convenience but not for spending extensive time at actual hotel. Meeting facilities were

We had a party of 14, which included our 4 adult children, 3 spouses, and 5 grandchildren for a 4 day Disney vacation. We‚Äôve always wanted to stay at the Grand Californian and just about everything at the hotel was perfect. Our only issues were a few problems with the Bell desk and housekeeping. First day we had rented strollers so we didn‚Äôt have to fly with them and the bell desk could only find one and after going between them and the rental company it finally turned up the second day. The housekeeping service is who brings cribs to the rooms and I had called several times before arriving and reminded the desk while checking in that my daughters wanted cribs not port a packs for the two babies. We didn‚Äôt get into our room for about 4 hours after arriving and in our rooms we

We were quite happy with the service at this hotel and all of the staff were so friendly. We pre-booked breakfast one morning, as they guarantee a delivery window, and did have to phone when it had not arrived. But aside from that it was really good.   Rooms were very clean and the obvious advantage is being right near Disney entrance.

This property has the best location of all at Disneyland/DCA.  Enter DCA or Downtown Disney directly from the hotel.  It doesn't get any better than that. We are DVC members with our primary hotel option in Florida.  I was unable to get a DVC room with my points but was able to trade-in points to get a regular 2 queen bed room on the 5th floor for 2 nights.  Our room (5424) overlooked DCA but we could really only see a lot of trees, the top of Guardians of the Galaxy, and Grizzly Peak.  We had a balcony with a table and two chairs.  It was quiet and peaceful even though the park was not far away. Disney staff are all friendly and very helpful and will go out of their way to help.  One security office even walked us most of the way to the doors leading to our wing when we asked

If this hotel were located anywhere else it would cost a fraction of the price. It really needs a refresh and some modern touches.  I get that they‚Äôre going for a foresty/cabin style but the yellow, brown & green decor is just so ugly and outdated. The rooms are certainly not grand, the only thing remotely grand is the lobby. The staff uniforms look like the curtain outfits from Sound of Music with the baggy green ankle length skirts.  The rooms have heinous brown stone bench tops and beige textured wall paper. The tiles were eww. It was also quite annoying as a couple to have two double beds. We ended up rearranging the furniture so the beds were together. After a few nights we switched to a king room - this also got us bigger bathroom, walk in shower and separate toilet

My daughter and I stayed for 4 nights at the Grand Californian. We are DVC members and this was the first time at the hotel. The hotel was beautiful, convenient, and had an excellent spa. The only down side was the pool area didn‚Äôt have enough chairs for everyone. We will be back!

I feel like this time around I was not terribly impressed by the Grand Californian. The main draw is definitely the location because it can‚Äôt be beat, but outside of that, there is not much benefit. We stayed in a (VERY expensive) one bedroom suite this time and it really wasn‚Äôt worth it. You get the exact same benefits if you stay in their least expensive room. The suite did not include the concierge lounge access, or any kind of special welcome/check in, or anything special really other than the fact that it has a living room. If we came back, we‚Äôd stay in the cheapest room, buys ourselves season passes to Disneyland, and still save thousands of dollars. I also would not take advantage of the magical mornings (at least not for Disneyland) because we woke up really early and

Summary Heading: Impressive looking and great access, but spendy.
Summary: My wife and I took our adult daughter, teenage daughter, and a friend of our teenager to the Grand Californian (GC) for perhaps our last visit to Disneyland for a while. We've stayed at the GC before so we knew what we were getting: great access to the park at a high price.   Thanks to the generosity of friends who are Club members, we were able to stay in a one bedroom villa. It was probably a $1200 to $1500 value per night. Back when we used to come to disneyland with little kids every year we considered getting suites or villas, but always ended up getting two adjoining rooms. There are positives to either approach; two of the regular rooms with lousy views come in cheaper so that's what we did, but I can also see how a kitchen and laundry set would come in handy.  As usual,

Had the opportunity to stay here in early March through my sisters time share.  The rooms were nice, the bathrooms spacious, and we had a nice balcony.  The staff was fantastic and the location was perfect.  I did not expect the pools to be open but they were even though the weather was only in the 60's.  I used the spa, while the kids went into the park; the entrance to the park is right outside of the hotel.  Downtown Disney is located on the other side of the hotel and also has easy access.  There are may locations to eat both in the hotel and at Downtown Disney, some are moderately priced and some have a higher price tag.  My biggest complaint was the beds, they were so soft the girls took to sleeping on the floor the last nigh,  I couldn't do that, I would never be able to

Summary Heading: Frustrating check-in, but then great service and ideal location
Summary: We arrived at the hotel after driving from the L.A. area.  Although it was very busy, our arrival by car was handled efficiently and patiently (as a family of 5 we had over 10 bags with clothing, snacks, toys and other items).  Check-in was painfully slow, however - we were on a line that moved so slowly and several of the "cast members" at registration were busy on computers or talking to each other which seemed unhelpful as the check-in line kept getting longer.  Our actual check-in experience was very pleasant, with all questions answered.  Our suite wasn't available then (which we expected) so we went off to enjoy Disneyland, but unfortunately, we never got a call letting us know our room number and that it was ready.  I called around 4:30 p.m. (we were told the room would

After a 16 hour flight and arriving at the hotel at 7.30 am we were extremely happy to find that our room was ready ( we were not expecting to be able to check in til 2pm and we're prepared to wait) and we had been upgraded. Hotel staff are amazingly helpful, room was clean and beds super comfy. All amenities were amazing. My kids spent everyday in the pools even though it was winter, the pools are generously heated. The proximity to the park is fantastic. Loved this hotel. We have stayed at Disneyland Hotel in the past and loved that but Grand Californian is worth the extra $$.

I stayed with my family in April 2018 for Spring Break for at a significant cost.  Much of the experience was as good as our first stay in April 2017; however, we experienced what I would consider to be a significant problem with noise -- paper thin walls, no insulation; the neighbors were just having a normal conversation and we could hear every word until 1am.  They were not being loud as I would consider loud.  I e-mailed guest services about this with zero admission that they had a problem with the walls.  Disney sort of blamed the neighbors.  For quite a while I left it at that, but recently I was in a customer service class that said what a great job disney does, and I had to disagree.  I communicated with them yet again, and got a call.  In spite of me making my point

This hotel is by far the best if you want the immersive Disney experience. Located 3 minutes walking to Disneyland and connected to California adventure you feel like your in the middle of it all. Hotel was decorated nice and although a bit pricey worth every penny.

Waiting in line for 50 minutes to check in as they did not have the registration desk fully staffed. Not sure why Disney feels they can get away with this when charging 600 a night. Room is a basic hotel room. There is nothing luxury or 4 star about this place outside of the beautiful lobby.

This was our first Disneyland trip. We are DVC members and used that to get a studio for 4 days before a spring break cruise. The proximity of the two parks and Disney Springs made this a terrific choice for us. We were able to go to both parks each day and generally really benefited from the location. The hotel was nice and the attention to detail was impressive. However, our specific experiences with staff members was less than magical. Check in was poor and pool service was awful (Disney needs to get a digital hand-hand POS there...30-45 minutes to get a beer!).We will stay here again for the location. I hope Disney can figure out how to make this great location feel as special as the Disney World parks and resorts.

Too expensive for what it offers, yes is impressive to watch the main lobby, but you can do it even if you are not a hotel guest.  Quality of beds and linens are not what I expected for a hotel costing this much.  Better stay at another chain around Disney next time

Summary Heading: Great Location - Disappointing Customer Service, Repairs, Noise
Summary: This was a special week long trip for my daughter's birthday and since we would fly all night my primary request was a quiet room with a view and early checkin; we booked over 6 monthhs' in advance. After arrival in the early afternoon, we waited in line  for check-in for almost an hour since the front desk was short-staffed. I watched other guests  check in; my daughter was sick; our room was not ready  and she was trying to sleep in the lounge as we waited. I agreed to give up my upper level view room for a non view quiet room since we needed sleep. The manager assured me that I was receiving a quiet room; I was given a discount for downgrading my reservation. Unfortunately the room was not quiet on the 3 early park entry days when loud speakers outside our window started

We paid extra for park view and all we saw were trees and fire pit below so that was disappointing.  Check in was a dream.  We did early check in and received a text when room was ready which was great.   Valet and doorman service made everything better.

A great place to stay. We had the woods courtyard view and overlooked the hotel entrance to the park. The monorail would sail by and we could hear the joy coming from the park. The extra magic hour was awesome! 1 entire hour to basically gave the park to yourself. Clean, friendly and a wonderful spring break vacation!

We are Disney Vacation Club members and we stay at the Grand Californian twice a year! They always treat us like family and welcome us with a smile! The villas are fabulous and the convenience to the parks is wonderful. Believe me if you and your family stay there you will not be disappointed!

Summary Heading: Not a great bang for your buck!
Summary: We stayed for two nights in a Premier Class room. We‚Äôd reserved one with a King bed with bath and I‚Äôd asked for a really nice view room as it was my husband‚Äôs Birthday. Upon check in we were told that the resort does not block rooms, it is just the luck of the draw....... and we were not lucky.  Our  pre-paid reservation confirmed our King bed etc and there was not one on the Premier Club Class floor. The only one with a bath was on the third floor, again with two double beds.  The room was meant for families with children , very basic, extremely small bathroom with a minute bathtub. The products in the bathroom were lovely.   We spent some time in the Premier Lounge again quite basic. As I am Vegan there was very little food for me . I was told that unless you had an

Summary Heading: Superb Hotel for Disneyland Family Vacation
Summary: The Grand Californian is a wonderful hotel, with a great location for access to both parks and Downtown Disney. The rooms are comfortable and sleep 2 kids and 2 adults in well air-conditioned comfort. The flatscreen TV's have plenty of kid-friendly programs to get them to sleep for the big days at the parks. The bathrooms are modern and the shower amenities are great. The staff was extremely friendly and went above and beyond to help us with directions, and helping with luggage, parking. The very expansive lobby is fun for the kids to explore and they have a kids TV viewing area for them to spend time while the parents are at the front desk getting the room paperwork completed. The restaurants are excellent. We had dinner at the Napa Rose restaurant which features a very large

Summary Heading: Here‚Äôs the scoop on the Grand
Summary: Here‚Äôs the skinny on the Disney Grand. No question the convenience to the Parks and Downtown Disney goes unmatched by other properties. However, if you are going to spend most of the day off property I would weigh spending the money on these accommodations because there are other properties that are clean and get the job done. Pros: location, beds are amazing, clean, friendly staff, quiet rooms Cons: hot tubs are warm baby pool, pools close at 9pm, rooms are nothing special, busy lobby and commons area. Feels like this gets the price tag because of location more than amenities, but had a lovely time and enjoyed our stay.

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel! Disappointing Bell Desk/ Valet
Summary: Let me go ahead and get the (really) bad part out of the way. The operation of the bell desk/ valet in front of the hotel is an absolute joke. There is no order, no signage directing people where to go/ what to do, and every single bellman and valet attendant were extremely unhelpful. We basically stood around for 30 minutes trying to get someone to bring us our luggage we had stored and simply catch a taxi. Some simple crowd control and order to the chaos would make the biggest difference. Also, it would be nice if the bellmen were at a minimum polite, but even more so, if they were proactive to help your customers. Now...since we ripped off the band aid, so to say.  The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are nicely decorated. Beds are super comfy! Front desk staff were nice.

2nd time being fortunate enough to stay at this hotel. Rooms are great friendly Disney style employees. Love the ability to hang out in the lobby. Movies for the kids large fire place comfortable seating. Great place to relax!!  Piano player music is enjoyable as well. The convenience and Magic Morning is definitely worth it!!!  Once you stay here you won‚Äôt want to stay anywhere else when visiting Mickey Mouse

We are huge Disney fans and decided to visit the park as it turned from fall to holiday decor. Wow...it did not disappoint! When we arrived, the hotel was beautifully decorated in fall decor. Then, the next day, it was magically transformed into holiday decor complete with an enormous gingerbread house that the team worked on throughout the week. The hotel is beautiful and well-maintained. The easy access to the park is a huge bonus that we were grateful for throughout our stay. The staff is extremely friendly too.  Our only sticking point was the check in the line. It took over an hour to check in bc they had new systems. But everyone was soooo nice and we even received a meal voucher bc of the issue.  This is the only hotel we would stay at on property. Well worth the extra

Comfortable rooms, great service. Deserves the name ‚ÄúGrand‚Äù.  Openings from hotel right into Downtown Disney and California Adventure. Kids loved the pools. We had a 3 bedroom suite shared by 9 of our extended family and were not crowded at all. Quiet rooms, nice shared space. Would gladly do this again.

The Good: Location. Easy access to California Adventure and Downtown Disney. Friendly atmosphere and Napa Rose offers a pretty good dining experience. The hotel wasn‚Äôt at max capacity which made for a significantly better experience. The resort is consistent with a California Lodge type ambiance but obviously with some nice added touches. The pool area is a good break from the park and rejuvenated us to tackle the park later on in the early evening. Whitewater Snacks is great for a quick morning bite.   The Not-So-Good: As we exited the elevator to get to our room we were floored with the smell of a kitchen grease trap. I recognize the smell from previous experience. It is revolting to say the least. I tracked down the nearest employee I could find. I would like at this moment

There is nothing wrong with the Grand Californian. Loved this place 10 years ago and it continues to impress me.  Comfortable beds, clean rooms, quiet hallways, and wonderful amenities. We loved the soap, shampoo and conditioners in the room. We ate and drank at the bar with exceptional service. Long line and check in but staff kept ensuring we were comfortable and continued to pay attention to all of us. Lots of nooks to sit and read books and the lobby is wonderful for people watching.  Revamped rooms are really nice.  One of my favorite hotels in the world. And proximity to the Disney parks is worth the extra money.

This is a beautiful resort. The convenience to access the parks is amazing. I doubt that I would pay for an upgraded view, the next time I visit. The room was clean and quiet. Staying here is worth it for the easy entrance into the parks.

I stayed in Anaheim for a work trip, but I was hoping to find time to go to Disneyland, so I chose the Grand Californian. It is the best hotel if you are trying to go to Disneyland. You walk out the back door of the hotel and you are in the Disney shopping district that leads right to the park. It is so close.   The hotel is built like an old lodge which makes it a bit dark, but charming. There is a wonderful huge fire place where you can hang out and see characters walk by. The rooms were clean and spacious and the bathrooms were nice.

There is nothing better if you are visiting Disney Land.  The value of the room comes from the location, amenities and easy access to both parks, especially the private accesses to California Adventure. There are some things to consider when paying five star money for this hotel. You are paying to be ‚Äúin‚Äù Disney.  The accommodation is great but if you are familiar with true five star properties you could be left wanting for a more luxurious experience. It is a large extremely busy property. Our stay was not without hick ups but the staff was very good and efficient at resolving our issues. One quick note for Disney ‚Äì The early morning access to California Adventure was fantastic but we found the same early access to Disney Land needs some improvements.

2 nights, $2,000 after taxes for one room.  4 calls to housekeeping.  Could not get them to come and clean room....said they would come.  Never showed up.  Response from guest services when I called to make a complaint and said thanks for terrible service..‚Äùmy pleasure‚Äù.Had to make my own bed and ended up showering with last dry hand towel.
