Stayed 4 nights in a room with "partial park view".  Very comfortable room that slept 5.  Beds were quite comfy but worst toilet paper ever.  Toiletries were great as was the rain shower.  Our room looked out over Downtown Disney but was still very quiet when sliding doors were closed.  We were very excited to discover that we could see the fireworks from our balcony.  The hotel is beautifully appointed and staff at all levels are friendly and helpful.  Park access is so easy, whether going to Disneyland or private entry to California Adventure.  We especially enjoyed the free service of having purchases delivered from parks to the hotel, as well as being able to charge them to our room.  Any Disney hotel is a great but the Grand California is our favorite Disney splurge.

Parents anniversary and grandchild‚Äôs first time at Disneyland. Wonderful time. Room had plenty of space, kitchen, 3 bathrooms , beds for 7. All of the staff was very helpful. Dropped luggage, and it comes to room, same at check out since we wanted a full day at the park then collect our luggage, &  food. We ate in one meal everyday since we had kitchen. Great to take a nap for the little one and Grandparents.  Loved parking the car and never having to go out for four days. Plenty of places to eat at Downtown Disney. Son in laws had time for work outs . Character breakfast was a treat for little guy. We ate late morning to take advantage of the breakfast, and main dish fair at noon.

Summary Heading: Top quality hotel In the heart of the action
Summary: This hotel is top quality in facilities and services with amazing room features like the high quality Disney touches in decor and modern bathroom.  The fridge is quite small and for some rooms the walk to the park entrance is quite extensive, so be careful about what you are booking.  We booked the more economical room and found ourselves almost the same distance as the Pier hotel across the street.   The pool was nice, however we also only used that a few times as we focused on time in the parks.  The checkin took a long time, which surprised us, however the service (Great concierge) and amazing location made up for it.

Summary Heading: Fabulous location but needs a bit of TLC
Summary: We‚Äôve stayed at the Grand Californian many times since it opened in its glorious hay day. As a couple in our late fifties and early 60‚Äôs traveling with an adult child with both intellectual and physical disabilities it‚Äôs worth the expense for the excellent access to both parks and Downtown Disney. Service is excellent despite the crowds. Staff goes out of their way for every guest. On this visit we noticed some signs of aging, a fridge that didn‚Äôt cool the special foods our daughter needs, despite the time I spent defrosting the ice pack blocking airflow, and worn mattresses. I only mention these things because if I‚Äôd checked them out before unloading all our stuff I would‚Äôve requested a room change.

Summary Heading: Entrances to Parks from Hotel are Great!
Summary: I really struggled on whether to pay the premiums at this hotel compared to others close by.  I am very happy we decided to and would do it again!  Being able to enter straight into California Adventure was a huge plus!  The Disney characters also walked through the hotel frequently, which was fun!  The staff was unbelievably friendly and over the top accommodating to make certain our stay was extra special!  We stayed in a standard room, and were hardly ever in it except to sleep.  I would not recommend paying the extra money for a ‚Äúview.‚Äù I feel we saved significant money by doing this, and we didn‚Äôt miss out on anything.

We just got home from a 4-day stay at this beautiful hotel. We had a Woods View room and the Monorail ran right under our room. We didn't even notice it.  The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. We had a couch that folded down to an adorable twin bed. My only complaint would be the down pillows. I called to see if their was another option and there wasn't.  Staying right in the park was so convenient and made it so easy with a little one. We could easily pop in for our jackets or just to take a break from all of the activities .  We were here celebrating my Granddaughter's sixth birthday and the staff all made it so special. They all wished her a Happy Birthday and addressed her as Princess Lilly.  While it was expensive, it was well worth the experience.

Summary Heading: Ask some questions before you book
Summary: This is a beautiful (and expensive) hotel.  The service was very good.  There were some things I wish I had known about before I booked.  The room we had had only a shower and no bathtub.  I understand tubs are available, but you have to ask.  We had a little child with us, and a tub would have been much better.  The rooms are classified by "view" and we chose a "woods" view--where the monorail from Disneyland went right past our balcony several times an hour.  The noise is minimal, but you might want to ask about noise levels of the various "views."  The access to California Adventure Park is a wonderful bonus.  Room service was prompt and the food good, but again, very expensive.  A stay here is a special treat, but the costs make it prohibitive for regular trips to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Outstanding Arrival and Departure (great stay too)
Summary: We had a great time at the Grand Californian. The location can't be beat, the theme is tremendous, the rooms are well appointed, and the dedicated entrance to California Adventure park is terrific. I wanted to highlight how helpful the bell staff was upon arrival and departure. We arrived in a rental car that we were going to drop off after dropping our bags at the hotel. This can be a stressful affair with kids and a car full of stuff, but the guys helping made it easy breezy. Same with departure. We dropped our bags before checking out later that day and it couldn't have been easier and less stressful. A lot of hotels don't get this right, and I appreciate the amount of thought and staffing Disney puts into this at the Grand Californian.

Summary Heading: Great room with lots of charging outlets
Summary: We had one of the rooms facing the courtyard, mostly because we wanted it to be quiet.  It was quiet with only a slight sound of the monorail swoshing by.  I was most impressed with the number of USB outlets available in the walls and clock - 4 by the beds and another 4 by the desk and tv.  We did feel that we got a more immersive Disney experience at the Disneyland Hotel, but there are nice subtle Disney touches at the Grand Californian.  We loved the convenience to the parks and the customer service is unmatched.

This is a splendid hotel; beautifully designed, well-maintained, and easy access to the parks.  And, as a plus for staying at a Disney hotel, early access to the parks, which is a real bonus.  From check-in to checkout, our experience was wonderful.  The staff are exceedingly friendly and helpful, the rooms are well-appointed and up-to date, and the beds are very plush while still being very supportive.  The TV automatically gives vital park information, like opening and closing hours and temperature as well as which park has early hours.  The smallest rooms have a queen-size bed plus a sofa sleeper that was roomy enough for two pre-teens to sleep.  The are several good restaurants from which to choose, from casual to fine dining, as well as a cafe/bar serving smaller plates.  A

First off, the front desk had someone greeting you and checking your reservations before you even get to a check in staff person. Adam was terrific and entertaining after a 7+ hour trek to get to Grand Californian.  The place looks so much like Yellowstone Lodge. Even the lights on the desks. Love the Chip and Dale motifs and hidden Mickeys.  Check-in is officially 3pm, but they had our rooms ready for our 130 check-in. We thought we'd need to leave our luggage and go to the park, but this was a nice alternative.  Too cool for swimming, but rooms were spacious with refrigerators, hair dryers and great bathroom products, shampoos etc. Whitewater Grill is a quick serve restaurant on property, but the K cup in room coffee service was fine.  Hotel has a private entrance to

Summary Heading: Room with a view of the park
Summary: What a treat! I had the pleasure of staying here with friends over Dapper Day weekend. Our room was well stocked, comfortable, pristine, and elegantly Mickey Mouse themed with beautiful views of California Adventure Park. Our balcony overlooked Grizzly River Run so although we were staying in a Disney Hotel at the park, it simultaneously felt like we were in a lodge somewhere out in Northern Cali. Since we were at the hotel during the DD expo, the magic of the hotel's design which celebrates the early 20th Century Arts and Crafts era was truly showcased alongside the fabulous old fashioned ensembles. It was surreal and breathtaking to sit in the lobby of the hotel sipping on cocktails in a sea of fancy wing-tipped shoes and felt hats. The customer service, the ambiance, an extra

This is by far the most convenient hotel for access to the Disneyland Parks. The rooms are nice but small and we realized our kids are too old to have just one room so we opted to add a second room for the remaining 2 nights we had left. Hotel staff does a great job of creating a magical environment for the children. My son lost his hat in the park during the fireworks show the first night we were there and we found out later there was no other place to purchase the hat but in the park. We were about to check out of the hotel and they offered to provide a ticket for my wife to run into the park to purchase the hat which was very thoughtful. But they went above and beyond and sent an employee in the park(Incredicoaster shop) and picked up the hat for us. Adding they didn't even

I have done Disneyland before and always stayed off site even done Disney World but nothing beats staying at a hotel that is connected to the park. It was so convenient. The beds were surprisingly comfortable and the toiletries was pretty awesome too. Some hotel toiletries make my hair feel like dried up hay but these were even better then my stuff at home.  You can hear music from the park if you have a park view.  It didn‚Äôt bother us though.  The fireworks are extremely loud.  The check in process could have been a little better but no different then checking in at a Vegas resort.  It‚Äôs just a really big hotel so you kids out on the overly helpful let me do anything you need for you vibe. We landed before check in and would have like to had our room but we had to wait until 3.

Very nice hotel, but very pricey. Very well located with great restaurants, gift shop and easy entry into California Adventureland!! The Storyteller Cafe with all the Disney Characters is fantastic but also a bit pricey!!

I had the opportunity to stay here for two nights while on a work trip. The room was very clean and relaxing. I would stay here again.  The main foyer has a gigantic fireplace and the piano music was great to listen to while sipping on Disney Select Bourbons.

Beautiful accommodations, clean, quiet and the staff was above and beyond helpful and friendly.  As a grandma wanting to spend time with my young grandchildren (3-7 yrs} I wanted to feel safe, and check all the boxes for myself and the kids.  There was so much for the young kids to do from an art class to folded towel sculptures, pin trading in the lobby every night plus the magnificent pool and Disneyland right out the back door and shopping out the front with no walking to a hotel or car I don't know who was happier, me or the kids. We spent 2 nights there and just barely discovered all that was available to us. I thought it was more than I was comfortable paying but it turned out to be more than worth it in so many ways that we're planning to do it again.

I should begin by saying that I love Disneyland and visit often. I have stayed at this hotel previously and had a great experience. I arrived early for check in and expected to check my bags and come back later to get into my room - which was the case. Totally fine. However, it ultimately took me 35 minutes just to check in. There was a huge line and every guest took upwards of 10+ minutes to check in. That wait time was insane and nobody in line could figure out what it was taking so long. The cast member who ultimately checked me in told me that I had to come back to claim my luggage and that it could not be delivered to my room once I was assigned a room. She told me to walk to the end of the desk to check my bags. When I arrived to that spot I was told to walk across the

Spent a couple nights at the Villas of the Grand Californian hotel and spa in a one bedroom.  The one bedroom was nice, the separate bedroom is always great.  Had a bit of a view of California adventure. So that was nice.  Line to check in was a disappointment as it was so long, as was driving up and feeling like there was no choice but to give your luggage to the porters when self parking. Was not informed about the short parking to just check in. Not as much of a welcome home as we are used to at the Florida resorts.  Once we got the room we called for the luggage and was told it would be over an hour to get.  It add faster to go back downstairs ourself and ask for it.  Over all it is a great location for visiting the parks .

Summary Heading: Grand California concierge level - expensive but worth it!!
Summary: My daughter and I just got back from a 3-day trip to Disneyland/California Adventure and a stay on the concierge level of the Grand Californian (the splurge of a lifetime!).  So, yes, it wasn't just a little expensive.  It was VERY expensive.  But for us, it was worth every penny.  First of all, we arrived at the Grand Californian via Lyft and somehow, some way, a concierge staff member was waiting for us outside the entrance to greet us by name and escort us to check-in on the 6th floor.  My daughter had no idea we were staying on that level, so this level of service made her feel like a princess!  Our room wasn't ready, but we were able to enjoy the amazing food and service at The Veranda immediately, and again on our last day after we checked out while we waited for our ride

I stayed here on points 1/29/19-2/6/19. On Jan 31 between 2-4 pm I went down to the front desk to get my Laundry card as laundry is free to dvc member. I stood in line and a guy who directed me to a lady at the  front desk. I got my laundry card and went  back to my room to get my laundry. I had 3 loads. I went to the dvc laundry room and both washers were in use so I proceeded to  the Napa building laundry room. I loaded 3  washers, added soap and went to the payment kiosk and slid my laundry card. NO credit on card. I then call from the laundry room and told the front desk my situation. They said to go back down to the fron desk to get another card. I go back to the front desk and the same guy who helped me  earliar was there and I told him the  situation. He completely

We stopped in to see thye Gingerbread house and all of the other Christmas decorations. As usual with everything that Disney does ...it was perfect. Don't miss if you in the area for Christmas or New Years

Summary Heading: What more needs be said it's Disney.
Summary: We came for Special Event at Disneyland and wanted to stay close.   And there is nothing closer than the Grand.   The rooms are as always with the Disney Properties immaculate.   Can't beat the short walk from the Park to your Room at the end of any day at Disneyland, just come and enjoy.

This is a high end, fully functioning resort on the Disneyland property. It has direct access to downtown Disney and the parks. It is designed in a very thoughtful way based on Southern California architecture. I have a tour that explains it all and it‚Äôs well worth the time. Rooms are spacious and comfortable with full amenities.  There are several pools, however they don‚Äôt open until 10 AM and close by 8 PM. I wish the hours were a little longer. But they do provide towels and lifeguards.  There are several restaurants, shops, bars and places to relax.  The main lobby is very spacious with living room type seating, a large fireplace both inside and outside, and access to a TV for the kids and the restaurants.  Each floor of the hotel is different, and there are several outside

Summary Heading: The Very Best Disneyland Resort Experience
Summary: Yes, this property is very expensive. The rates have gone up over the past few years. So, it‚Äôs not for everyone. I have stayed at the other Disney properties on site as well as many of the other hotels in the area. There are lots of choices and many of them are excellent.  But, if you can afford it and want the very best Disneyland Resort experience possible, this is your place.  You just simply can‚Äôt beat the location. We love the nights at the parks and usually stay till closing. It‚Äôs so great to have a short walk back to the hotel after a late night.  It‚Äôs a beautiful property in an awesome location. One recommendation - save a little money by choosing a Woods/Courtyard room rather than one with a view of the park or Downtown Disney. These rooms are much quieter and usually a

So we‚Äôve just arrived for our hotel stay. We‚Äôve stayed here before and disabled parking is near the convention center entrance. Has been for years. They‚Äôve changed it to 20 minute parking which means this hotel does NOT have any disabled parking on site.  They will only allow us to pay $25 to have the vehicle valet parked. I think Disney needs to read up on California law for disabled parking and placard use

The Grand Californian is truly my favorite Disneyland hotel. The location is convenient to Downtown Disney and the parks. The renovation of the rooms was a huge bonus and much more comfortable. The resort itself feels like you are in Disney but not with that flashy feel.  The one issue I‚Äôve found over the years is housekeeping. This last trip truly demonstrated the issues with the housekeeping department. Often times we would be out of the room before 9:30am and would come back in the afternoon at 3:00pm or 4:00pm to find the room had not been cleaned. One day we had to search for housekeeping in order to get towels and soap. The housekeeper we found was shocked to hear the room had not been cleaned yet. We felt like the room was constantly forgotten during the trip. Another

Summary Heading: Best Hotel in and around Disneyland...but rooms are underwhelming
Summary: You're paying for the service, distance from Disneyland, and theming. In this respect its 11/10. You're in the heart of downtown Disney and connected to California Adventure. What else could you ask for? The hotel is very very well done. You can tell the lobby and grounds received the same care and detail as many of the attractions in the parks themselves. The staff is great and super friendly. Definitely a Disney signature. The only con is the actual room themselves. Don't expect your typical 4 star hotel room. Instead, expect a slightly lesser midrange Marriott accommodations. The rooms are clean, but they are not luxurious. Not an issue for me because I'm not spending a lot of time in the room, but might be for some people. Overall, I wouldn't stay anywhere else. Its superior

We loved the location - parking your car and walking to Downtown Disney, Disneyland and then the private entrance to California Adventure (with early hour included)... WOW. Really increased the appeal of this hotel. Loved Storytellers Breakfast with our four year old. We'd definitely stay again but I wouldn't pay for the premium view - Room 4444. It was a view of barren deciduous trees in January with the grizzly peaking out. If you went out to the balcony at night you could see CA Adventure to the far left (Hollywood Section). It was quiet but definitely not a premium view in my book. When I contacted front desk at check-in, I was told nothing else was available and that someone would follow up with me, which didn't happen. My only other negative ... the pool was too chilly for

Summary Heading: Disney's Grand Californian Newly Refurbished Hotel & Spa
Summary: This on site Disney Hotel is beautiful. We found the cast members friendly and helpful. The lobby was so cozy, it was raining so the Grand Fireplace (Grand Lobby)  was very welcoming.  The Hearthstone Lounge was serving quick service breakfast temporarily, while White Water Snacks expansion is being completed.  Storyteller's Cafe - full service restaurant has a character breakfast and brunch.  Classics like Mickey, Minnie, Chip 'n Dale are there for photos.

Disney‚Äôs Grand Californian Hotel is insanely gorgeous. Looks like the Majestic Yosemite Hotel (formerly the Ahwahnee Hotel) in Yosemite National Park in the Arts & Crafts/Prairie School architectural style. Lobby adorned with Stickley furniture and Mission style lamps. Our balcony overlooked California Adventure Park. The landscaping is done with such precision, it‚Äôs almost impossible not to feel you‚Äôre at a mountain retreat, while conversely in a county of millions.   Pictures of oranges adorn the walls and some whimsy with Chip & Dale. Disneyana is actually eclipsed by the architectural influences. Good call for a place as grand as this lady.   About the room: Keurig coffee. Mini fridge. Super soft sheets and comfy but soft, not firm, beds. Shower had overhead ‚Äòrain‚Äô head AND

We stayed as a family of four. The room was up-market with a modern bathroom and two queen beds. A bit tight on space with kids but you spend most of your time in the park so not a big deal. Private access to California park a huge bonus particularly the magic hour before the public arrive. Friendly staff and close to amenities.

I took my daughter and two of her friends to Disneyland for her birthday. We stayed club level at the Grand Californian. This resort is so beautiful. Our room was spotless and the beds were so comfortable. The best thing about this resort is the proximity to the parks. We loved the club level access. We utilized it the most for breakfast but did stop back a couple times for appetizers and desserts. I did not utilize the concierge hosts themselves. I think it would be nice if the concierge called you prior to check in like they do when you stay club level at Walt Disney World. We has a fantastic visit and will definitely be back.

Our family of 2 adults and 2 children recently stayed in a 2 bedroom suite for 3 nights.  Positives; + impressive lobby + lots of staff (‚Äòcast members‚Äô) + location in relation to DCA and Downtown Disney  + huge room + guest laundry + small sink in ‚Äòkitchen‚Äô area of the suite + friendly, helpful staff + quick and easy check in and check out (I was bracing myself for the worst, based on reviews) + pool looked nice, but too chilly for us to try it out...this time. + huge TVs with information on the parks, plus Disney channels of course!  Things that let it down for us; - requested a King bed in one of the bedrooms, but had 2 queens instead. - as others have said, the rooms are quite bland - room service :-/ waited on hold for 15 minutes just to place our order, then told it‚Äôd be

Disney's Grand Californian Hotel is very expensive, but also very relaxing. Being close to the park is a big plus. Watching fireworks from our balcony was great. They did a 30 minute practice run one night. The bed and pillows make for a great sleep. The only things that disappointed me were that the clock was not set, there was no toilet paper in the bathroom when we arrived and the complimentary coffee and hot chocolate were missed, but all corrected quickly. Everyone was very nice! The shower was great, but lacked pressure.

I stayed here in December 2018 for three nights.  I arrived early, 11am,  and was able to pre-check in and store bags. The process was very quick.  While walking around Downtown Disney I received a text message at 1:15pm stating the room was ready! I went directly to the room, called the bell service desk and the luggage was brought up within 5 minutes.  From entering the beautiful stained glass door at 11am until I left 3 days later everything was perfect.  The hotel was beautifully decorated for Christmas, with a piano player, nice warm roaring fire to nice snacks.  The room I had had 2 queen beds, robes, balcony, toiletries, frig, coffee maker, plenty of towels.  The room was spotless.  Beds so comfortable.  GREAT shower.  The only thing I can say about the room that isn't

We were a big group and had 4 rooms with one of the suites that connected to two others. I have to say for the price the service isn't out of the world, Maybe because I am used to Disney World properties. The communication is bad. We checked in early and rooms weren't ready but they would call us when they became available. After a couple hours we checked in again and yes they were so we all got settled into our un stocked rooms. Then 3 hours later get a call the rooms were ready once we were already in. I did like the lounge upgrade. Its worth the money since you can stop in for breakfast, lunch, dinner and snacks. The bar is a great perk. Its limited but something for everyone and they even have a kid section as well.

Summary Heading: Let down by check in wait
Summary: Staff were lovely and room was really spacious, but check in was disappointing as we had to wait 2 hours past the time we were advised and that was only after we complained that they somehow "managed to find something". Restaurant's very limited but luckily room service was amazing and good value.

We stayed at Disney‚Äôs Grand Californian Hotel for my wife‚Äôs 50th birthday which is on New Years Eve. The service is top notch, the grounds are  impeccable and everything about it screams Disney.  While we were there we had a couples massage at the Spa and it was first class. It was very relaxing from the time we checked in, to relaxing in the sauna afterwards.  There is also many restrurants in the hotel that offer a wide variety of food and prices that are all world class.  We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights, but we could have stayed a couple of more.  We will be going back again this year for sure.

Don‚Äôt stay at this tired old restaurant with staff that actually hurrumph if you ask them a question, you can hear people in the next door room talking, all food arrives cold and does not actually taste like food .........  Really really horrible

Summary Heading: Built on the grand scale of the Wanee
Summary: Room was comfortable clean as expected at this price point. The hotel feels warm and enviting but the real benefis it's location. Easy access to both Disney parks Disneyland and Disney California Adventure.  Granted DCA is just out it's back door and Disneyland a short walk but well worth it.

This place is just amazing and worth every penny for us. Our room was spacious, very clean, nice features such as dim the light in the whole room, and USB ports all over for charging all of our stuff. Nice amount of coffee, creamer and tea. The room service menu is extensive and you can get all of it until 10pm. Pool are is huge with super comfy sun chairs, great menu and drinks. All of the food we had at the hotel was delicious - from Napa Rose to Hearthstone Lounge. What makes is amazing is the fast access to the park and extra magic morning. You can pop over to your room in no time. All cast members were treating us with magic all through our stay. Love this place, thank you, Disney.

After 3 previous stays over about 8 yrs I had become concerned that the hotel was trading on its name and location alone and was letting things go a bit. Perish the thought! The Grand Californian is fantastic after what appears to be some renovations and a picking up of service levels. First our room. Beautiful. Huge, super clean and with a great Downtown view from the balcony. Well appointed with Keurig for coffee/tea/chocolate, a small but nice bathroom with the basins outside and loads of room for cases. Good shower, nice amenities and very comfy beds. Very happy. Staff seem attentive and friendly - more so than we recall from our last visit (admittedly 3 yrs ago). Public areas kept neat and tidy, staff brought an extra chair in the lobby without being asked...small but good

Recently visited Disneyland with the family and stayed at the Grand Californian. Great hotel right between both theme parks makes for easy access and beats the crowds. Good restaurants and bars with rooms that are spacious and well appointed. Staff are friendly and helpful without being imposing. The hotel has an Awesome atrium and really helps you get the most out of your visit to Disneyland. The hotel isn‚Äôt cheap but as is usually the case you get what you pay for, well worth a visit cheers. üëçüëç

Summary Heading: Great Location for both Disney parks
Summary: This is a beautiful hotel located basically inside Disney's California Adventure park. It has great and easy access to both Disney parks as well as Downtown Disney. The hotel however, is pretty pricey and it was very busy (went at the busiest time on year). At night, you could hear the other guests in the hallway and it was impossible to eat at the restaurants without a reservation. This is one negative things about Disney - you can't be spontaneous when it comes to most things. Everything has to be planned to maximize your experience. In my option, hotel guests should get priority at the hotel restaurants. The hotel also messed up our reservation - we did not have connecting rooms even though I called the day in advance (as recommend) to confirm my request. Overall though, I

Coming from the East Coast, this property reminds me of Disney's Wilderness Lodge.  It is a HUGE hotel, and we had quite a walk from our room to go anywhere.  We stayed in a one bedroom, which I believe was an upgrade from the original reservation.  Our room was clean and comfortable, and we could look off our balcony into the Downtown Disney Area.  I loved being able to walk into DCA and Disneyland, and we dined at Napa Rose.  Great place, wish we could have stayed more than one night!

Our experience:    Check in - slow but delightful service where got to counter.  The lady checking us in did not rush us and too time to offer personal service and answer all questions. This was delightful but resulted in excessive wait times. I appreciate the level of service and expect it for the rates charged but suggest managing the number of agents a little better.     Room- spacious, comfortable and clean!  The room was wonderful!  Very clean and spacious with amazingly comfortable beds & pillows. The toiletries were also high quality.  Nightly turn down service and accommodating housekeeping service.     Location - second to none!    Bell desk -  luggage arrived promptly when called and as picked up promptly (very early call‚Äî 6:30a)    Check out‚Äî took very long to get

Staying at Grand Californian again. Love staying here for easy entry into California Adventure park. Beautiful hotel. Great Location. They have a few restaurants. We have done the character breakfast many times. Always fun. Check in can be long but this time we did it before going to park and line was minimal. Enjoy the resort everytime

We visit Disneyland and Disney World at least a couple times per year. WDW offers a variety of resorts under their 3 levels unlike DL. I can't honestly say that the GC doesn't measures up as to what WDW considers a Deluxe hotel in m opinion. It is very beautiful for the holidays, it was decorated festively. The checking process was extremely inexplicably slow, it is not our 1st visit but it has been like that for every visit, we know not to expect early check in but for the last 3 times the rooms have been ready well past 3:00 p.m. This time around, not only did we have to wait a long time but our reservation was earmarked as Downtown Disney Partial View,  I remember distinctly making it for Downtown Disney View, I would never make a partial view reservation, we know those

Summary Heading: The BEST Proximity to the Park!
Summary: Sure, it is on the pricey side, but it is worth every cent IF you take advantage of the magic hour.  Our family lives in Southern California, yet we still find ourselves at The Grand for a few weeks a year.  The best advice I can provide is to definitely drag yourselves out of bed for the extra Magic Hour at 7am for the parks.  Spend the extra $10/ticket on MaxPass Fast Passes which you can get from your phone using the app once your tickets are scanned in.  The old days where you had to dash from station to station to get your next pass are long gone, and it is well worth the added cost.  The Grand has direct access to California Adventure park, so you are able check into the park and ride virtually every ride before 10 am.  Then, lounge by the pools while you score your

I travelled with three of my grandkids for a pre-Christmas surprise trip to Disneyland! This hotel made the trip even better! Private entrance to Downtown  Disney and California Adventure really enhanced the trip! The room was spacious, clean and extremely comfortable! Christmas decorations and music kept me in the holiday spirit! Prepare to spend some money but well worth it! Napa Rose was a great lounge to unwind!

Checked in Dec. 26. Having stayed in a variety of perimeter hotels near Disney over the past 30 years we decided to treat ourselves to our Disney dream stay. Here‚Äôs the good and bad to help you decide if you want to spend all that extra dough.  Good: we felt like we lived in Disney, hotel decorations for December were beautiful Could be in park by 7 am with room key. We were able to get fast more passes with the early start as you must be in park to get fast passes on the app.  Bad: check in slow, baggage check slow, employees pleasant to dispel guest anger. Do not expect any extras here as far as coffee in the lobby, treats, or food of any kind without paying a steep price. No bottled water was available in the room or in the lobby.   Overall: I would not pay the cost to stay

My son and I checked into the Grand on Sunday, December 16. With a long check-in line, the staff did their best to keep people happy by distributing bottles of water and chocolate cookies for people waiting in line. We arrived early to stay at the Vacation Club Villas and our room wasn't ready yet so we checked our bags with bell services and headed to the Hearthstone Lounge inside the lobby area.  The food at the Hearthstone Lounge was excellent with my adult child and I easily splitting one sandwich because of the portion size. After about 90 minutes we received a text that our room was ready. We were in a studio which, while not terribly spacious, had a small microwave, fridge, sink and plates/cutlery/glasses for meal preparation. The room had a view of the pool area and we

Summary Heading: Good overall, impressive lobby, annoying check in
Summary: The Grand Californian is very nice and very convenient to the parks, with a direct entrance to California Adventure Park. The lobby is gorgeous and was even more stunning at Christmas with a giant lit tree and gingerbread house. The Art Nouveau/Arts and Crafts decor was very beautiful and unique, with the attention to detail Disney is famous for. The room was comfortable and had everything we needed, including a small balcony. The bathroom was very small, but the room size was fine. Don't miss the character breakfast at the beautiful Storyteller's Caf√©.  Check in was a bit of a runaround. We had a few requests (such as a king bed and non adjoining room) and this seemed to trip them up quite a bit. Our check in clerk disappeared for quite a while, then still couldn't fulfill our

Now let me tell you right away - Disneyland is awesome!!! This hotel however is not! Not sure my opinion about it will change by the end of our stay. First of all - from desk( reception) is absolutely unprofessional and sort of passive aggressive. Second of all - simple things like bottled water that 4 star hotel has to have by definition is absent - meaning they just never provide it- sleepers, you have to ask for it. Basically- not 4 star at all.  As a late check in they always try to put you in a creepiest room - like, literally, in-front of construction side!  And only when you bring it up - again in a very passive agreement way they move you to a slightly better room. I mean - you pay almost 8K for 4 night - some very simple requirements have to be met!   Once again - The

It‚Äôs a great hotel, it has a gift shop and 3 pools and 3 hot tubs, during the holiday season, they have the, Grand Gingerbread House, and you can make your own, they have a character breakfast. It‚Äôs the only hotel out of Paradise Pier, Disneyland Hotel, and Grand Californian, it is a DVC hotel.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel but WAY Overpriced for What You Get
Summary: We (couple) stayed 3 nights in the Grand California in December.     Honestly, for the price, I was expecting more luxurious rooms.   The decor in the lobbies is outstanding, but the rooms, although very nice, are not quite up to  super luxurious standards.    We stayed in Animal Kingdom in Disneyworld and thought the luxurious feel was better.  For $600 plus a night I expected service to be individualized and attentive.  This is NOT what you get here.   The hotel common areas are HEAVING with people and you have to stand in lines whenever you want to get to the front desk, or valet, or bell service.       The access to the parks is obviously what you are paying for, but honestly, with one point of access each into Disneyland mall and California Grand Adventure, the lines

My wife, son and I stayed at the hotel Saturday (12/15/18) through Wednesday morning (12/19/18).  The hotel was beautiful and service was mostly very good. We spent 3 days at the park and on our final night after the park, we wanted room service.  We had a breakfast menu but no dinner menu in the room.  I requested a dinner menu and after about 45 minutes still hand not received it.  I went to the front desk to request one but they did not have one so they requested one be sent to the room.  After another 30 minutes, I went back down to the front desk and a menu was finally brought up to the room.  I know I'm being a little "petty" about a room service  dinner menu but for the money we paid, I think I have to be.  Overall though, a very good experience and we would definitely

We arrived much earlier then the check in time and they still had a room ready for us which was awesome. We were able to freshener up after our long drive and then hit the parks. Everyone at the hotel is super nice also thank you for everything Trip advisor and Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Rather Spare Rooms for such an expensive resort
Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights in mid-November during a visit to Disneyland and let me say straight off that the location so close to the entrance of the park is its most sensational attribute. It is also immediately adjacent to Downtown Disney and the California Adventure Park that makes up one of Disneyland's two parks. The lobby is quite beautiful and the only meal I had at the hotel itself was breakfast for the character dining. The food there was plentiful and somewhat tasty and it was worth the expense (great) so that my granddaughter could have her picture taken with so many of the Disney characters who roam around the dining room. The rooms themselves were rather plain and nondescript. The heat was wholly inadequate for the chilly nights. In fact there was no heat. You mean

The Grand Californian hotel is the nicest place to be when you go to Disneyland!  I love it at Christmas, the tree sitting at the fireplace! Eating at Napa Rose just beautiful! Little busy at Christmas but fun!

Summary Heading: Beautiful for one time but wouldn't stay here again
Summary: Since we are repeat Disney Park people, we have stayed at Disneyland Hotel and Paradise Pier and decided to try Grand California Hotel and Spa.  We knew it was a beautiful hotel since we had walked through the lobby on another visit.  We're happy we stayed here and tried it, but we did not feel it was worth the price.  Things we liked: Entrance to California Adventures and close to Downtown Disney, the room was lovely,we had a coffee maker in our room, and the maid and valet service was great.  What we weren't crazy about: no bottled water in the room for the coffee maker (which should have been included considering the price of the hotel), the loud speaker in the park came on at 6:30 on "Magic" Days and 7:30 on regular days.  It was LOUD!   At Storyteller's caf√© the only option

Summary Heading: Great stay right at the edge of the park
Summary: We spent 5 nights and it was amazing. They had carolers and Santa in lobby.  Everything was decorated like Christmas and there was our own entrance right into Disney's California adventure park. The rooms were a good size with a view of the pool (which was very nice. 3 pools and 3 hot tubs).

I was lucky enough to stay in one of only two Grand villas ( sleeps 12 ) at Disney Grand Californian hotel, the settin* was amazing with views over the Disneyland Theme Park Lovely open plan large dinning area and kitchen, three separate bedrooms. Two lounge areas, 9ne with large TV and the other a pool table. Plus two separate balconies

Last hotel to be put on my list. The service is so bad! Valet takes 30 mins to get my car and it takes 1 hour to check in. It also takes like 30 mins to check out. The only good thing is a bed. I still don‚Äôt recommend coming here unless you are prepared to wait like 2 hours.

Summary Heading: Happiest Place on Earth ! Happiest Place to rest your head ! Go Mickey Mouse !!!
Summary: The greatest experience we have ever had. Try it once... And you go back for a repeat performance. Truly has everything you want for a great awesome vacation ! Amen to Mickey Mouse... Walt Disney too !

Summary Heading: A Practical Review of Disney‚Äôs Grand Californian Resort and Spa
Summary: Over the past several years, I have written a number of these ‚Äúpractical review‚Äù to Disney Hotels, and considering the number of ‚Äúhelpful‚Äù votes I‚Äôve earned (195 on 5 reviews, so far) and the number of emails I have received from people asking for advice on their upcoming vacations, I think it‚Äôs fair to say, I‚Äôm pretty good at it. As such, this review will be in the same tone. I will not drone on about how Disney is the most magical place on Earth and can do no wrong. Instead, I am going to focus on the major points of Disney‚Äôs Grand Californian Resort and Spa (hereinafter GC) in order to help anyone who chooses to read this be better informed before they spend a small fortune on a hotel room. This is the part where I normally tell readers to feel free to email me with questions

It's better now. Mattresses are greatly improved; much more plush, which is comfortable to me. The rooms have been refurbished. Of course, for the price they charge, they should be opulent. The benefits of the Grand Cal. are (1) ease of entry to the parks and Downtown Disney (2) great lobby, with piano, periodic entertainment and big fireplace that is always going; close proximity to the bar, which serves good drinks and decent food. Most of the rooms are quite distant from the lobby. The lobby is much closer to the parks than the rooms.

Hi gang,      Haven‚Äôt been to a Disneyland for 30 years but we‚Äôre here for my Granddaughter to dance in a parade.  Paid $379 total per night.  Very clean, comfortable room.  Stayed 4 nights and walked e-v-e-r-y-w-h-e-r-e.   For a December visit I estimate 80-100,000 visitors per day.   We had a fast-pass to skip many lines, but this old body took a beating from the plastic seats found in rides like Matterhorn, Space Mountain and Thunder Mtn RR.   Add walking 4-5 mi per day, bumpy rides and this old coot sure himself got some exercise !!!!     Food prices are high‚Äî $7 corn dog, $4 for a 20 oz fountain soda, $20 fried chicken plate and $5 churros.   Lots of crowds, a coupla parades per day add to the conglomeration.     Being with family made it all worth while, but I doubt if

I usually stay at the club level. This time I decided it was too expensive. What a difference in service. I waited one and a half hours to check in- it was 3:00 pm and the room was not ready yet. I had a room with a pull out couch that made into a bed.It was not made up and we couldn't figure out how it opened. Called housekeeping - they never responded. They don't change the sheets every day which is fine. I had to straighten them every night.The room faced the lobby and the noise level was off the chart. It's a totally different experience at club level. I think the soundproofing in the room is better - housekeeping had the sheets on the pull out couch ready for the guest. I know the hotel was full, but for the price they charge for a room you expect more. Was not a magical

In years past we have stayed at Disney properties across the street from DL.  Before we were able to walk across the street and access Downtown Disney or have a quick access to California Adventures by walking through the Grand Hotel.  I guess now Disney feels they have to block lower society from the high society by eliminating that by putting a gate on the sidewalk with a security code to gain access.  I have to wonder if this is in line with what Walt would have wanted...

Just returned from a quick overnight to the Grand Californian hotel.  My parents are DVC members visiting from the east coast and they treated us to 2 rooms at the hotel for my family of four and themselves.  We found the hotel's recent refurbishment enhanced the quality of our stay from when we visited in 2014.  The rooms, while still quite small, were nicely redone, comfortable beds, really nice shower & bathroom.  Christmas decorations in the lobby - including the giant gingerbread "Californian" hotel were lovely!  My six year old son really enjoyed spotting the hidden Mickeys :)  Cast members were very friendly and helpful - we were able to get some great family pictures in front of the lobby's giant Christmas tree.  Loved that they had Santa at night for the kids along with

We splurged on this hotel for a belated birthday celebration trip and it was great. There were 3 adults and no one wanted to share a bed, thankfully they were able to accommodate out request for a room with a day bed/couch. The bed/couch was actually pretty comfortable. The room was equipped with many spots to plug in electronics. I liked that the shower/toilet area was separate from the sink area although I personally prefer the whole bathroom section to be on its own, it was still better than nothing. The front desk cast member asked if we had a preference for location of the room throughout the hotel. We had never stayed there before so just asked for a room away from elevators to hopefully reduce noise. We got our wish but it wasn't the most convenient location, pretty far

Was hesitant on spending the money on this hotel but so glad we did.  We stayed 3 days and the proximity to the parks was main selling feature.  So convenient.  Definitely worth it if you want to return to the room throughout the day.  The hotel itself is very relaxing and comfortable and absolutely beautiful.  Beds very comfy, decorations are cute, and bathroom luxurious.  Great breakfast buffet (character meal) - although pricey - good variety and tasted great also.  We could actually see the fireworks from our balcony.

We will as stated in an older review stay at this Disneyland hotel every visit. It's worth every penny for us. I was 7 months pregnant attending Disneyland with my husband and our 6 year old celebrating a suprise birthday gift.  The distance alone is worth it. Yes I know you walk a lot in Disneyland so some dont see the big deal to walk a little further to go to your hotel. However in a 118¬∞ heat wave and walking around exhausted it's so great to walk right into your hotel from the park and take as many breaks as you need.  The rooms are now remodeled and look much more up to cost. It's such a beautiful well taken hotel. If you can afford to get a park view I HIGHLY recommend it! You will never want anything else.   The food for room service is always great. Their is a Keurig

Summary Heading: Put it on your bucket list
Summary: Expensive!  But, it should be experienced at least once by every Disney fan. The room was immaculate with a boring view of a courtyard, but that's what I paid for.  Super comfortable beds, linen, pillows and clean!  Huge TV and nice bathroom design.  I appreciate in-room safes and this one seemed larger than typical.  Customer service was awesome!  When we checked in, there was quite a long line of people doing the same.  I'd guesstimate that we waited in line for about 45 minutes (about par for any ride in the park!).  There were many staff checking in folks, but there was just a lot of folks...  Anyhow, the next morning, there was a note slipped under a door that offered us 20% any Grand Californian restaurant for our inconvenience of waiting to check in.  Certainly, Disney

We stayed at the Disney Grand Californian Hotel and Spa for 3 nights just prior to Thanksgiving.  The goods:  You can't beat the convenience.  We took Uber from John Wayne airport so we did not have to park a car.  The hotel has its' own entrance to Downtown Disney and to the Disney California Adventure (no separate entrance to Disneyland).  After security it is about a quarter of a mile walk through Downtown Disney to the main entrance to Disneyland.  It is fabulous not to have to park and ride the people movers from the Disney parking lot.  The staff are super friendly and the place is immaculate.  We stayed in a 1-bedroom suite as we had our 5 year old grandson with us.  The room quality is about equivalent to a nice Marriott - i.e. nicely appointed but not exactly luxurious.

Stayed here for my sons b day. We wanted to stay at a Disney resort to get that magic feeling. Even though the rooms just got remodeled, We knew the rooms would be underwhelming based on the pics online but decided to say here (and pay a fortune anyways) because of the easy access to California Adventure. The kids pool is also probably also the best in all of Anaheim so if you will make use of that and you have a lot of extra money, I would say go for it. Also if you will take advantage of the ‚Äúmagic‚Äù hour (getting early access to the park for hotel guests) then it‚Äôs worth the $$$$$

Summary Heading: Wonderful experience - must try at least once
Summary: Stayed with my daughter and her family over the long weekend in Novemeber.  It was an incredible experience.  Disneyland had just changed over from Halloween to Christmas.  There was Christmas songs, gingerbread houses, lights all over the place.  It truly looked magical.  I needed a wheel chair and had reserved an electric scooter.  The park and the hotel was well prepared for scooters.  I had room to maneuver all over the place.  The rides in both parks were very accommodating in terms of space and comfort.  The food was awesome; they had the Festival of Foods for Christmas and we got to try some amazing foods such as the pork belly with garlic rissoto.  I loved the Mickey ice cream bar; it was SO good.  The turkey leg was HUGE and should be tried.  Love it's a small world.

Summary Heading: Met my expectations and then some!
Summary: I have never stayed on property prior to this trip having always stayed at our WorldMark time share down the street.  This was a special mommy vacation however, and we chose it as a one time experience.  My friend and I arrived very early (around 11am), several hours before check-in.  There was no line or waiting.  We were given a slight upgrade from the standard room to the woods view!  LOVED IT.  We were able to get right in and we were in the Park long before "check in" time.   While I agree with some of the comments that the room was smaller than I am used to as we usually stay in a timeshare, it was just as described online and met my expectations and then some.  The view was overlooking the rail and I only really noticed the view that first day on check-in.  The rest of

Stayed at Disneyland Hotel before and stayed at Grand Californian this time. Disneyland Hotel was a lot more for families and that "magic" was missing at Grand. By "magic", characters around the property, design, art, etc . . . all was not there. Service was great but you just felt that something was missing and that was those special touches that just Disney normally does. Even at the Character breakfast, there was no photo opportunity like the other properties.

We stay here for the location.  Best by far in Disneyland.  After walking all day and your feet are sore, it is great to be close to your hotel.  Your clothes are wet after grizzly river run?  No problem!  You can be back in your room in no time (via the private park entrance).   Getting cold at night?  Want a jacket?  Need a quick nap?  No problem.  Your room is just steps away.    Overpriced?  For sure.  But the hotel is almost always fully booked anyways.  Why would Disney lower the price?  We were hesitant between DGC and the Disneyland hotel and were glad we chose DGC.  The West side of downtown Disney looks like a ghost town right now.  Disney closed many facilities on that end due to the new hotel project that has now been cancelled.   We would stay there again.

Pros: free coffee till 11am in the lounge. Sofa turns into a bed for one child, awesome and simple. You get an extra hour in the park before the general public. Easy entrance into Disney California and close enough if you need a break in the afternoon.  Cons: pool isn‚Äôt heated, rooms are a little more but really it‚Äôs Disney. Check in is a little bit of a disaster.  Overall I‚Äôd stay for the less hassles and such. They are always busy so they aren‚Äôt hurting for business. B Grade

Summary Heading: Most other recent reviews are accurate - 3 Star Property in 5 Star Location
Summary: Great Access to the park - it was nice to be able to be in our room just a few minutes after being in the park. Now with said - no way the rooms are up to 5 star calibre, nor are the dining options, cleanliness, check in/out, concierge etc. When paying the rates for this property I think it is fair to expect a higher degree of care and service than we experienced, I think that is on the management of the property. One item to note, that the early entry to the park is only applicable to one park per day (based on their schedule), and in the actual Disney Park none of the rides were open early, which left me in a stampede at the gate with my 6 year old son, not the best experience. We were in a group of 20 and every pretty much agreed. In the past I have also been on a Disney

Summary Heading: A three star experience in a five star location
Summary: We stayed here last year and had a great experience.  This year, our experience was not nearly as good.  We love the location of this hotel, it has a private entrance directly into California Adventure.  However, the hotel has poor service and the rooms are dated and in need of an update.  The service this year was a total mess.  Whoever manages this hotel should be ashamed of themselves. There were at least twenty people in line waiting to check in when we got there.  Check-in took over an hour, which doesn't give a great first impression.  They said they had gotten a new reservation system a few days before and it was obvious the front desk agents didn't know how to use it.  They should have added more front desk staff to compensate or trained the front desk agents better.  We

Summary Heading: One of the worst Disney hotel experiences ever!
Summary: $600 a night gets you: 1 hour check in The concierge made all of our dining arrangements for the weekend prior, so no reservations for us! Never ending hallways laid out like a maze to get to your room?   check! $120 for 4 for breakfast, for cold awful food?  yes! Room door that wouldn't lock with calls to the overworked front desk, finally a room service guy showed us how to rig the lock o it would work. Surly mall security each time you leave the property that so make you feel " magical" Beautiful lobby ,but you're so angry you wasted $600/night, you just look past that feature

Summary Heading: Hotel amazing - service needs to match price
Summary: We visited here in September of 2017 and couldn't find a single fault in the property.  It was amazing.  Decided to come back in November of 2018.  Per the other recent reviews I saw, we too encountered some problems.   Check in was a disaster.  At least an hour.  I was told they implemented a new computer system that week and that was why the wait was so long.  Quite frankly, I don't care.  I paid $600 a night for a room - they need to fix that immediately.  My kids hanging in the lobby for an hour wasn't exactly the way to get the vacation started either. Pool closure - We didn't care as much about the water slide pool being closed because our kids don't love slides, but it was closed for most of the three days we were there.  I understand they are trying to get it done prior

Visited late oct 3 nites nearly $1000AUD a nite. Checked in and was told u have been upgraded ü§£WTF would hate 2 c the other room view was overgrown trees , room small and miles to walk to. Never again. Oh you get early entry into the 2 parks. Great I thought (been to DL and CAL ADV PARK) heaps of times so thought beat the crowd. Why bother no stores were open and only 2 rides were working. Was told all the other rides had tech faults yet 9 am when the parks opened they miraculously were working Didn‚Äôt bother going to the early entry for the next day.  Also fast past are a joke if you get one when you get there and the time on the card is like late that night we‚Äôll you can‚Äôt get another one for another ride until u used that one. How about having something you can trade your

Summary Heading: Great access to Disneyland is only positive
Summary: The hotel is fantastic for access to the resort but everything else was a let down.   Check in - be prepared for check in to take a couple of hours. Disney staff don't seem to think this is an issue. We had a major issue at check in - we were allocated room keys to a room that was already in use and our family ended up accessing their room. It took Disney another 1.5 hours to fix this and get us into a new room. By that time the park had almost closed for the day. Disney staff tried to rectify this with some fastpasses  Pools - Disney decided to close the waterslide pool for 80% of the duration of our 3 day stay. This was really disappointing for our kids. This pool didn't need to be closed - it was just because workmen needed to get access to the pool snacks area which was

Summary Heading: Disneyland will never be the same...
Summary: We have taken our family vacation to Disneyland a lot!  We love it there!  We have rented beautiful houses close by and stayed in much less expensive hotels right across the street from Disneyland that were literally (we actually timed it) less than 5 minutes from the time you walked out the front gates to the time you were at the hotel.  But staying here is the ultimate in Disney vacationing!  We have also stayed at the Disneyland Hotel, (which is awesome!) but it is quite a long walk from the gates, all the way through downtown Disney to finally reach the hotel.  This was the best experience for our family!  Mind you, not cheap, but the best!  As far as the staff goes, I would say that they are your typical Disneyland Hotel staff, friendly, kind, but uncompromising on pretty

Assistant Manager Eric Hada went above and beyond to ensure our stay was magical.  Rooms are comfortable and clean. We had a bad start to our vacation but Eric was fantastic at correcting the mishaps to the best of his ability.

First of all, the location and park access scores a 5, but the rest of the experience was a total disappointment, and rates a 3, especially for the price.  Check In- A long process, especially when you have kids that are tired, and are ready for the Disney Magic.  Housekeeping- We arrived to food crumbs on the floor, a dirty blanket for the pull-out, and a stained sheet, and only 4 towels for a family of 5.  It took many conversations, and a multiple trips back down to the desk to right the wrongs.  Not the way to start a vacation.  Room,- The rooms at the Disneyland Hotel are bigger and much better overall.  I know the Grand Ca, was recently renovated, but they have aged horribly.  Stained chair cushions, worn out daybed cushions, dirty walls... I feel people would feel better

Summary Heading: Plan to wait for mediocrity.  A lot.
Summary: We recently stayed here with our family for a family reunion.  We selected the Grand CA hotel in part because of the easy access and reputation of being an upscale hotel.    The location and easy park access is for sure a bonus but it is significantly overpriced for what you get, more than $500 per night with Saturday night being over $700.  In short this is not up to the standards for a four star hotel. Below are my points of feedback.   1) It took us over an hour to check in.   They claimed the delay was a new system but if that is the case then why for every day of our stay was there a queue of more than 20 people to check in?  After we checked in, over an hour later, the front desk called us back and said we need a credit card on your account can you come back?  We were in a

The hotel is beautiful and fun for kiddos of all ages, the pools are excellent, the customer service is top notch. The best way to get in to parks early. Convenient for families with smaller kids to go back for naps or pool time or if you get soaked at Grizzly River!

My wife and I stayed during our visit to Disneyland. Although we were disappointed with the theme parks, the hotel was terrific. It is beautiful inside and out; and although it was very crowded while were there, the service was excellent.

We visited this hotel with high expectations but had read reviews prior to travel so I was aware of some of the challenges we would likely face during our stay.   The trip was for business conference but was mixed with extra days for Disney fun.  1) The convienence to the parks is absolutely the best!!! 2) We arrived early and were allowed to check in several hours early, which was great! I will say the registration desk personnel I encountered could use some additional training in customer relations as they seem stressed and are not as friendly/approachable as I would expect.  3) The Housekeeping team for the are we were staying (second floor above the restaurants) was AMAZING, the best I‚Äôve encountered (and I travel LOTs)!!! 4) The pools are awesome and lifeguards are present

Summary Heading: Average hotel with amazing Disney access
Summary: 5-stars for location: - super convenient access to both Disney Parks - direct, private entrance to California Adventure  4-stars for the pool: - provided a great little break after hours of walking in the heat - family friendly pool area with an average of about 3-feet depth - good luck finding a lounge chair after lunch  3-stars for the rooms:  - dark wood and almost outdated feel  - uncomfortable king-size bed (with ample under bed storage) - no bathtub for our 3-year old's daily bath routine  2- stars for the restaurants: - almost IMPOSSIBLE to make changes to your reservations. Can't do it on the app, can't do it online, you have to stop by or call.... and I ended up being on hold for almost 20 minutes trying to reschedule reservations.   1-star for check-in: - we were there

The room was one of the best I had stayed in. True Disney service and quality. The cast members were very friendly. Room service was good but a little on the pricy side. One of the most comfortable beds I have slept on. The room has definitely felt updated and high quality. Great atmosphere for the resort. I loved the rain shower head.

Summary Heading: At first it seems like too much to pay...
Summary: But the entrance is SO MUCH CLOSER to the park entrance. Yes, you're paying more than the hotel itself is probably worth but thats how everything at disney is. You pay more. So ask yourself how much is it worth to cart your whole family back and forth each time you leave the park? I've stayed at the other properties there and the walk is ok day one, then ti really starts to wear on you.  The staff is great, the pools are really nice. There is a good character dining place there too. Rooms are comfortable - comparable to a westin.

I am a huge Disneyland fan and have been twice previously, both times all I wanted was to be able to stay at Grand Californian as it seemed to be the pinnacle of Disneyland accommodation but at the time we couldn‚Äôt afford it. This time around we were finally able to afford to stay here and I was SUPER excited. It was going to be the highlight of my trip. We caught the Disneyland Resort bus as we had previously, and were a little annoyed to discover that the bus couldn‚Äôt drop us at the Grand due to work‚Äôs being done at the hotel, so instead we were dropped at Paradise Pier. My husband sought out a Paradise Pier Staff member and they happily took us to the Grand in like a golf cart. This was fun and the kids loved it, so we got over our initial annoyance. The lobby of the Grand is

My husband and I stayed here for our last trip to Disney and oh my goodness it was amazing! The staff are incredibly friendly and eager to help in any way they can. The rooms are to die for. We had a standard room view which didn‚Äôt give us views of California Adventure or downtown Disney but I was ok with that. Mostly because we wanted to just get some peace and quiet at the end of our long days in the parks. This hotel was so nice because we were able to get into California Adventure and downtown Disney without having to go through the mess of Harbor Blvd security check. It‚Äôs definitely not a cheap hotel but it‚Äôs worth it for all the conveniences you get with staying there. Very good experience and I‚Äôd definitely stay here again when we have the funds to do so.

Very nice, as Disney properties usually are, and very convenient with its own entrance to DW. Would stay here again next time we're in California. Just don't fly across the country and eat breakfast if you're not used to time zone changes - it was an expensive meal (as is usual for Disney) and we wound up not eating everything.

We have been DVC since 2001,  we have been here before and loved it. But like someone else had said, you can‚Äôt close up your main store and not have any other options for dvc members. Since we couldn‚Äôt buy any groceries we were forced to eat breakfast in the bar area, which was totally not good. They serve your food in a brown paper box. Like please take it to go. Also the sawing and jack hammering by the pool everyday was really annoying.  The vending machine in the villas is a joke, spent about 30 minutes trying to get some water bottles. I think Florida has much more to offer for dvc members.  Won‚Äôt be returning any time soon .

Summary Heading: This is not the experience I‚Äôve come to expect from Disney
Summary: I‚Äôll start this off by saying we‚Äôve traveled over 10x to various Disney World hotels and DVC properties. Since we had never made it out to the west coast - we thought it was time to go.   All I can say, is that if this had been my first Disney hotel stay I would never go back. We stayed 4 nights/5 days in a deluxe studio on the DVC tower at the Grand Californian. This rounded out a 2.5 week trip to LA and surroundings and we had (mistakenly) assumed that this would be our highlight.   The hotel itself was fine. But the following were my biggest complaints.   1) there is no quick service/market on property. As i said, this is not our first DVC rodeo and we have never stayed at a place where we couldn‚Äôt purchase some yogurt/milk/snacks for the room. We‚Äôve been Ubering it around

We stayed here for our honeymoon and only wish we could have stayed longer. The rooms are beautiful, cast members were so friendly and helpful, and the theming is perfectly well done with tons of little details. The private entrance to DCA is a dream - I never want to stay in another Disney hotel after this! If only I could afford this one every time... totally worth the money!

Summary Heading: Only Disney hotel which opens onto the park
Summary: Stayed as a family of four. Very clean and comfortable. Has the advantage of being the only Disney hotel to open onto the park. If you stay here you are allowed to access park one hour earlier than general public. Pool just ok rather than great - food was overpriced but mostly nice.

Summary Heading: Very Convenient For Both Parks But Nothing Special
Summary: We didn‚Äôt love the hotel by any means but it‚Äôs the best on-site offer & ideally placed for speedy access into both parks. As is the Disney way it‚Äôs a mammoth of a place, the central lobby/lounge a vast, cheerless space done out in faux lodge style. Our Premium View Room had a small balcony & pleasant view overlooking the pool. It was reasonably proportioned with 2 good sized double beds but functional in fit out & design & not nearly worth the outlandish room rate. Check-in & out was Disney slick & service throughout the hotel top notch with the exception of one sour puss in Guest Relations. The hotel has an array of restaurants, mainly large, soulless move ‚Äòem through type spots. We sought to swerve these by pre-booking the fine dining restaurant ‚ÄòNapa Rose‚Äô for the duration of

This was my second stay at Disney's Grand Californian Resort and the first after the recent renovation of all the rooms.  We were assigned a Garden View room in the center of the hotel and we could see Downtown Disney from our small balcony.  The Disneyland Monorail ran right below our room, but we never heard it when the sliding glass door was closed.  The room have been full renovated with a California Craftsman style and orange groves theming.  Our room had a King bed that sat high off the floor and had lot of open storage under it.  There was also a sofa that turned very easily into a single bed.  The wall paper over the king bed was fun as there was Chip and Dale  They were also in some of the design of the bathroom.  There was a large flat screen TV which was a vast

Summary Heading: Amazing being right at the door!
Summary: Staying at the hotel was expensive but an amazing experience, approx $1000/ngt Au, the best things were you can walk straight into the disney California adventure park or down town disney district, the room we stayed in had 2 double beds, it was clean and tidy, bath shower and toilet. The pools were faboulous to come back to and r eelax with kids, with poolside service for drinks and snacks. The Laundry was unfortunately not working on level 5, and l ikmited machines available at level 2 so the resort were very nice and provided the wash clothes 4 us, after trying to get the washing machine fixed by calling the number ourselves (as not operated by the resort). Overall its so good to be so close to the resort, only a walking distance away when you have young children 4 and 6 and

First time at a Disney hotel,  and I can say I was thoroughly impressed! The hotel has just stunning decor,  the staff were exceptional,  we had just a wonderful stay.  The proximity to the parks and downtown Disney is amazing. The room was clean and comfortable and as expected.  It was fine for my family of 5 with 3 young children.  I did request a bath and an early check in,  as we flew in at 6am,  unfortunately neither of these requests were granted. We ate at Storytellers for brunch and this was lovely food and great character interaction.   We did grab some pastries from the bar downstairs for breakfast and had the free coffee.

I don't stay at Disney properties very often but every time I do, it's amazing.  The Grand Californian is no exception.  I was here for a business trip and they definitely had no problem hosting our meetings.  The two big takeaways are the Disney standard accommodations (clean, professional staff, impeccable decor) and the location (right next door to the California Adventure theme park with its own entrance, and a short walk to the Disneyland main entrance).  It's also right in the heart of Downtown Disney.   The room was comfortable and luxurious!  Great for business or families.  Would definitely stay here again if given the opportunity.

You're probably staying here to be super close to Disneyland and you know you're paying a premium to do so. While the location is superb, the dining is very good and the pool area is nice, the rooms are so very small and underwhelming. The customer service was top-notch, but again the cost of the hotel did not match the value.

My adult son and I stayed for three nights and had a terrific experience. Our room overlooked California Adventure - such fun! And we appreciated that the soundproofing was so good. We heard no noise from the park. (Can't say the same for our noisy next-door neighbors, though.)  Check in was swift and very friendly. We were impressed with the gorgeous lobby, live music, free ice water and coffee (in the morning) and of course, the convenient access right into California Adventure. Probably one of the most compelling reasons for staying here. We also enjoyed the lovely pool area, complimentary bottle of sunscreen, ample loungers, and large hot tubs.  Our room was very nice but we did wish for a little more counter space in the sink area and I hate rain shower heads! Seriously why

So far, there is no reasonable thing to complain about here. Did I have to walk from Paradise Pier? Yes! Is that a part of keeping the resort fresh and up to date? Yep! It is Nice to read about it in the reviews and know what‚Äôs ahead, but it‚Äôs certainly not anything to hold against them.  Every single person on this staff has been wonderfully pleasant during our entire stay. They have been helpful, considerate, and gone above and beyond. We even received a complementary swim diaper for our son, seeing as we forgot them. The breakfast with the characters pays for itself  in convenience entirely! The convenience of the proximity to Disney/ California Adventure is also worth the price! The pool is wonderful, and housekeeping has been great as well!

Only positive things to say about this stunning hotel. Every staff member was the friendliest and kindest people. They really ensure you are happy.  Room was lovely, we had a woods courtyard view and we could watch the monorail go past. The room was clean, bathroom perfect. Coffee supplies updated daily. Housekeeping were so kind and friendly. Loved white water snacks and storytellers caf√©. Direct access to California adventure park was wonderful. We even saw Pluto walk through the lobby, and had photos with my children. No other hotel can now match up to this hotel. It was the best 10 nights we have had and now planning to go back and will be staying even longer.

I've stayed there now six times this Halloween will be seven I enjoy staying there and one it's very close to the park I have issues with my feet so it makes it easier for me to come and go into the parks then if I was at any of the other hotels around Disneyland i've only had one time where we had problems with check and we did not get the room that we requested nor did we pay for it we got a lesser room but I seem to open my big mouth to the right person at one point and we got our money back for the whole entire time we were there plus we got some other really nice perks for an apology I could not stand in a bathtub and take a shower because I could not stand in standing water and shower was what I requested and I was told I'll get you a plastic bag you can wrap around your

Summary Heading: Convenient to Downtown Disney, Near Convention Center
Summary: Room was very nice with ample space and bathroom. The wait to check-in was over a half hour; not a long line, but very slow. The pool complex is attractive with multiple pools and hot tub, but the  hours are not convenient for the business traveler, opening at 9AM (for that reason also I would not stay here again). A very short walk through the hotel to Downtown Disney shopping and restaurants and about a 15 minute walk to the Convention Center. We ate at a Chipotle-type tacqueria with comparable prices to Chipotle itself.Last night I moved across the street from the  Convention Center. If you are going to Disneyland, this is probably a good choice, due to its close proximity, otherwise, it is nothing  exceptional.

The best ever , it is worth it to go  A thing that you can‚Äôt miss in your life  You can wake up early and go right in to the park Disney California Adventure  Everybody is amazing they are so nice  The room have a lot of space and is an small bed üõè for a kid it is soooo cute  Love the chocolate üç´ that we got by the bed ,  Attention to detail it‚Äôs amazing  It‚Äôs Disney to another level ü§ó

Last leg of 3 week family holiday use this site for access to LA but travel time with traffic 90mins.  We had a 1 bedroom villa which was ok, but the site has not much Disney magic you get in orlando .

Summary Heading: A great way to experience Disneyland
Summary: We enjoyed a four night stay in a newly refurbished pool view room.  It was clean and comfortable and, most of all, convenient to the Parks.  It is a great hotel to come back to for a break during the day and the magic morning early access passes really allowed us to enjoy some of the more popular rides before the Parks opened up to the public. In room dining was very good and the housekeepers were excellent.  A couple of things took the gloss off an otherwise excellent stay.  First, on a couple of occasions when we opened the doors to our outdoor balcony, a very strong smell of marijuana enveloped our room.  Not what I want my 9 year old exposed to at a family friendly resort.  It's meant to be a non-smoking hotel but I witnessed several guests smoking on their balconies.  I

Summary Heading: Nice, high end place to take a break
Summary: My husband and I just wanted a couple days a way to play.  This was perfect.  we could enter the park early in the morning, do everything we could manage.  Go back to he room in the mid afternoon, take a nap, shower and relax, and then go back without little extra time or energy spent.

This was by far the nicest hotel we have ever stayed at well at least the most expensive. The rooms are clean with simple decor, balcony's and about the same size as any standard hotel room but they really do maximize the space for example the beds are raised so you can put luggage under the bed its great. there is keurig in the room and they restock the pods each day. The room we had booked was not available but they did there best to try and accommodate me. I wanted one king with the day bed but instead i got two queens. This was on HOTELS.com not them so no worries. The lobby has so many places to just sit and enjoy the scene. The giant fire place is a great place to sit and enjoy a glass of wine or coffee. There is even a small area with little rocking chairs for kids to sit
