My last visit here was a few months ago and it was amazing. It has great restaurants and a great pool area. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. This place even has a private entrance into Disney California Adventure.

Summary Heading: Loved it from start to finish!
Summary: We recently stayed at the Grand Californian Hotel & Spa for 5 nights. Our check in went smoothly and quickly. Our room was not ready, but we were anxious to see the Disneyland Park for the first time anyway. At around 4:30 we received the text with our room information. Our room was lovely and clean. Everything was in perfect working order. Beds were super comfy!  We had a great first time visit and would definitely stay again. Yes it is pricey, but for our first "bucket list" visit we insisted on doing it right. It is very convenient to the park entrances and the special entrance into California Adventure allowed us to go back and take much needed breaks. I highly recommend the Grand Californian Hotel. Loved it!!

Summary Heading: Great location, great service, worth the price
Summary: We had a wonderful stay! You cannot beat the direct and early morning access that is available here.  It is very expensive to stay here, but we felt it was worth every penny.  We also stayed on the club level which gave you access to the veranda room for breakfast, snacks, light lunch, drinks, and desserts throughout the day.  It was so easy to get a fast breakfast and then get on our way.  When you needed a break it was easy to go up and relax with a snack and a glass of wine, bubbly, or beer.  Lovely place to enjoy the fireworks as well. Everything was presented well and the service in the veranda room was outstanding. You even have a private area for check-in and checkout, with someone at the desk to help with any reservations or questions.  Our rooms were newly remodeled and

Summary Heading: Convenient to the parks, but there were highs and lows
Summary: It‚Äôs certainly grand and well located to the properties. There is a side access to California Adventure which makes it easy to pop in and out of the park.  There is a lot of construction going on.  You might want to ask about how it will impact your room or the spa!  The rooms are well apportioned, but a tad cramped. They have mini fridges and coffee makers.  I thought the beds and pillows were very comfortable. I slept great.  Room 3211 looks out the front of the hotel.  You do not face either park and do not (could not) see fireworks.  We ordered breakfast in the room which was prompt and generally good, but the ‚Äúcontinental breakfast‚Äù option was a joke. 2 mini muffins 2 mini croissants and a tiny plate of fruit. $33 once delivery fees and tip went on there.  I recommend the

We took our teenage kids to Disneyland and wanted to stay in a park hotel.   This is the most lavish hotel but worth the extra money.   You walk out the gate and into California adventure park.  Getting into a park an hour before the public his a huge benefit.  We would have ridden 5-7 rides in that hour.  The rooms spotless and the housekeeping staff very accommodating.   You will find that you don't spend a lot of time in your room when you can be by the pool or in the enormous lobby.  The decor makes you feel like you are high up in the Sierras.  We loved that we could let our kids go and find their own adventure.   If you haven't been stayed on a park property this is your hotel.

Love the location, hotel is very nice.   I don‚Äôt feel it‚Äôs a good value though.  We waited in line for 25 minutes to get to the check in desk. Our room was clean but some weird issues with housekeeping.  There was a half drunk water bottle in the frig and a used coffee pod in the maker.  Also no toilet paper in the bathroom.  Not what I would expect from this type of hotel.  Even though we were booked for 5 and ages included there was no bedding for the daybed.  We had to call twice to get bedding and it took almost an hour total.  The next day, for some reason housekeeping only left 3 towels and no coffee or cups.  I thought at first the previous guests were a lot of work.  But we are pretty tidy and left a decent tip for housekeeping.  This hotel would be up in the 4/5 star

This is our 4th stay at the hotel. We love the close proximity. The atmosphere can‚Äôt be beat. The customer service for the most part is stellar. Every time we get room service they delight us with something extra on the tray. The Story Tellers restaurant has some nice offering. There was a ton of construction going on around the building that we were unaware of, but it didn‚Äôt impact our comfort level- just the beauty of it because we know what to expect. It‚Äôs strange thou... I have to say that this is the second time we had issues with NO HOT water. As with the last stay we called, they acknowledged there was a problem, they weren‚Äôt apologetic and they did nothing to fix it. 2 of the 3 days we were there we all took COLD showers. It happened last time we stayed at the hotel too.

Summary Heading: We had a great time, the access to the parks is the best
Summary: I recently went to this hotel with girlfriends. The front desk person Nick was fabulous. I had called the day before and the Disney person on the phone was VERY unhelpful. I expect Disney to always do everything at a high level and that person set a tone that was not good but thankfully Nick made up for it. The suites are nice but not awesome but the access to the park makes it all worthwhile. We ended up having a great time and it was nice that they offered very good free coffee to hotel guests by the bar in the mornings.Especially with kids the early access is the only way to go!

Summary Heading: Worth it for access & early entrance
Summary: We‚Äôve been coming to Disneyland at least once a year for the last 12+ years. This was our first stay at. Disney property.  First thing to note, the hotel was quite literally 4x‚Äôs what I would have paid for the Hyatt Place or Marriott we frequent. We arrived late so check-in was a breeze with no lines. The room was fine. Nice & clean, comfortable beds, fine bathroom amenities. We were told we were given a complimentary upgrade to the ‚Äúwoods‚Äù view (instead of the parking lot). Basically it was the back over Soarin‚Äô. What was super cool is every time we opened our patio door you could hear the music! The very best part is the access!! We got in line 15 minutes before the park opened & we were through the line, in the park by 7a. Every morning within about 3.5 hours we‚Äôd ridden

The most expensive of Disneyland hotels. Is it worth it? For us it was, but it really depends on your priorities. If you value newer setting, a bit more luxury, slightly better pool area and closer proximity to the parks then you should go here instead of the classic Disneyland Hotel.  The only issue is really the price. You can find a nice hotel room just outside of Disneyland Park(s) with 1/3 of the price you'll pay here.  Staff is friendly and helpful, there's plenty of onsite restaurants to choose from and you really, truly can't beat the location. I would not pay extra for a room with a view.

I stayed back in May and found poop smears in the shower.  I overlooked that and stayed again last week (Sept) our room was loud, we could hear furniture being dragged across the floor in the morning and at night before bed, we found out the room was right below club level so we would hear them cleaning up and setting for the day.  Right across from the room is the terrace and if theres a party you hear it all, guests of the party standing outside for door having conversations. First 3 nights the heater did not work, 4th night we decided to call and have it fixed, they came and fixed it, while gathering out stuff to check out we realized the AC was now broken and the room got very hot.  Stressful trying to pack while sweating.  Then the roof starting dripping, presumably

We rolled into town about 9am fully expecting to show our luggage and play in the parks until it was time to check in. However, the amazing Gracie from Eugene, Oregon found us a room that was ready to go! Awesome! Got checked in, got our welcome packet with our tickets and passes as well as a gift card! I had actually gone for work to do a social media blitz for our radio stations. They were ready with all the perks! Even received a fed ex the day before with tons of Disney swag! We got settled in the room, which was amazing and had a beautiful view of the pool and mountains in California Adventure! We got our walking shoes on and took off to play! About 4pm we came back for a little break. Took a shower, got a quick nap, ordered a wonderful turkey club that was delivered

We have stayed at the Grand Californian several times.  We just got back from a week for my daughter's birthday.  This hotel is worth every penny.  Is it pricey?  Of course.  This is Disneyland.  Get over it.  You have to take advantage of the perks of staying at this hotel or you might not understand what you are paying for.  Pretty much every day you get into Disneyland or DCA an hour early.  That is a huge perk in itself.  You are steps from the parks and Downtown Disney.  If you need a nap, forget something, just walk back..no tram, no parking lines..nothing.  Also, we use their courier service in the parks when we shop.  I don't want to haul around a stuffed Simba so the parks just sent it back to the hotel for you.  We also utilize their room service and express breakfast

We loved our time at the hotel. The room was beautiful and the bed was comfy. The access to the park was great. The main lobby of the hotel was breathtaking. We had dinner at the Storyteller‚Äôs Cafe. The buffet was great, try the corn soup.

My adult daughter spoiled me with this special room to celebrate my 50th birthday. We arrived at about 9am after an early flight. Our room was not ready so we needed to store our 2 pieces of carry-on luggage. Once we got back home, we were stunned to see a charge from front desk for $130.00. We could not for the life of us figure out what it is for except to store our luggage for a couple of hours. The room was beautiful. The terrace offered a view of the monorail whizzing by. It was a shame that every afternoon when we went back for a nap, that they would test the fire alarms.

Aside from the primo location within California Adventure, excellent food, fabulous pool complex, and beautiful lobby, this hotel has the dreamiest beds. They envelope you in softness and you feel like you are floating on a cloud. They are even better than the deluxe hotel beds at WDW! The rooms were, well roomy, and extremely clean. The hotel is GIGANTIC and it felt like it took forever to get to and from the room, especially at the end of the day with aching feet. The hotel staff were very polite and helpful as we struggled with a Disney Visa backpack issue that they were never able to resolve though they did try their hardest.   The breakfast at Storyteller‚Äôs Cafe was excellent and they are very accommodating to food allergies. The characters are great but you don‚Äôt get to

You can‚Äôt go wrong. This was our first trip to Disneyland and I would highly recommend staying at the Grand Californian. We are a family of 4 including two boys 8&5, the room had two queen size beds and a convertible couch to single bed which was comfortable enough. The room was smaller than we thought when we first arrived, especially the bathroom, but it worked for us. We were exhausted after each day at the park so we all slept soundly, the queen beds were very comfortable. We made use of the magic hour each day which is worth every dollar of staying at the GC. We ate at the Park mostly and did the character breakfast on site on our last day, this was a fun way to meet the characters, however the food was underwhelming and the servers seemed very stretched. We will come back.

It was a wonderful place to stay!  I had my 85 year old mother with me and we were able to make arraignments to have a motorized wheel chair at the hotel when we arrived. Everybody was so helpful with any requests we had.  We could go to California Advertures by just going thru a tunnel. To get to Disneyland we went thru another tunnel to Downtown Disney then from there to Disneyland. We went to the Downtown Disney every morning for breakfast, there were several different restaurants to choose from. My mother appreciated how someone her age could do Disneyland one more time.

Summary Heading: A DEAD honest review of Disney‚Äôs Grand California‚Äôs Hotel
Summary: This is a DEAD honest review of our stay September 2018 at Disney‚Äôs Grand Californian Hotel. We arrived after a 14 hour flight from Australia to LAX airport to be told upon climbing aboard our Disney Coach Liner/Bus that they were unable to  drop us off at the entrance of Disneys Grand Californian Hotel because the valet/entrance section is undergoing a refurb so they need to drop us off across and down the road at another hotel and we would have to walk across with our bags, you can imagine how fun that was after flying for 14 hours 3 kids in tow plus 6 bags and a baby car seat. Upon checking in we were greeted with fire alarm sirens going off in the foyer as this week they were testing the smoke alarms, several times during check in we were interrupted by the noise which had

By far the best hotel when going to Disneyland and California Adventure. We are members of DVC so we always book right at the 7 months. There are so many perks to staying here. You get the special entrance, the extra magic hours, and the convince of being so close to the park. And during Christmas time it is magically decorated. And the service and staff is amazing! Love, love, love the Grand Californian.

It is baffling that this establishment is able to maintain a 4.5-star rating when the only thing that comes close to that is the grandeur of the lobby along with the location of the property. While the king bed in our ‚ÄúWoods View‚Äù room was quite comfortable, and there are nice room features like hooks for your jackets, a step stool in the sink area for the littles, and plenty of USB plugs for charging all your devices, many other aspects of the hotel fall short. We received no verbal or written notice of the fire system testing going on between now and September 19th, so extremely loud alarms were going off at random times (including during our toddler‚Äôs nap). The fire doors in our corridor were always closed so we had to manually open 3 sets of doors to get to our room ‚Äî felt

The hotel is beautiful and upscale: the lobby, the grounds, and the availability of a gym and spa.  The rooms were less so: anytime the layout includes a sink OUTSIDE of the actual toilet and shower room smacks of a roadside motel and feels unhygienic.  The beds are comfy, and they even honored our request of having a king room next to a room w/ 2 queens (apparently, a king room is not common in this property). The BEST part about this hotel, though, is its proximity to Calif. Adventure and Downtown Disney (they are literally connected to it), and Disneyland is just a short walk from Calif. Adventure.  This allowed us to go back and forth to rest or to freshen up in our rooms without feeling like it's a chore or a trek -- a nice luxury to have when it's 93 degrees outside!  It's

The hotel lobby is very nice. Something I expected from Disney. They know how to make you feel like your someplace else which is what they wanted. When we got there, we couldn‚Äôt get a king bed which was odd but we couldn‚Äôt back out, we already paid for it.   Then, the room was way smaller than pictured and the amenities were average. Also, the park view we paid for looked like a partial view of a wall.   The cast was nice even when they couldn‚Äôt do anything. I‚Äôm not sure Disney empowers their employees. How bad is it? We just checked in and I am writing the review. Save your money, go anywhere else but here.   S.

Summary Heading: Cabin vibes, clean rooms, expensive parking and room service
Summary: We arrived on a Friday night and left Sunday morning. Entering the hotel there is a gate guard where you have to verify your reservation before heading to valet. You have an option to self park for $20/night or valet for $30/night.   Checking in and was and easy. The atmosphere was very upscale cabin with rocking chairs, fireplaces and exposed beams. From the lobby you had hotel entrances directly in to Disney California Adventure Park and Downtown Disney.   The rooms were spacious and very clean. Unfortunately on the day of checkout housekeeping woke us up at 9am, and came back again around 10am, although check out was not until 11am. We assume they wanted to turn the rooms over quickly but it was bothersome and made us feel rushed to leave.   Overall it was a beautiful hotel

This is the second time the family have stayed here, in a 2 bedroom suite. Very nice overlooking the park, but they do the rehearsals after and before opening so there was quite a bit of noise late at night/early morning. The suites are very good to accommodate upto  9 people, 3 bathrooms, full kitchen BUT not a lot to cook with...only a soup ladle and one small knife! we didn't even have a sink plug. Spoke to guest services several times but nothing was forthcoming, so assume over the years items have gone "missing" and Disney has no replacement provision. I will say the rooms are of a good standard bur beginning to look a little tired for some of the furniture. The hotel was busy to the extent if you went to the pool after lunch it was a struggle to find any spare sun

My husband and I came here with our 3 yr old, 1 yr old, and Grandma for our first Disneyland experience. We came in September (after Labor Day and after school started) by design. We knew the park and hotel would be less crowded.   We took the Disneyland Express shuttle so we would not need to bring car seats and knew we would not need to leave the park. When we arrived on the shuttle, we learned that the bus does not drop off at the hotel due to construction. This proved to be a HUGE pain because after traveling all day, the last thing you want to do with 2 small kids is to load up after the bus into ANOTHER vehicle. And when we were trying to get back to the airport after checkout, it was a circus trying to get the Grand Californian staff to give us a ride over to the OTHER

We last stayed here 15 years ago when our children were small and returned when they are now all adults. The hotel still has the same wonderful feel from our last visit. The pool  area is great, as is the early access to the parks. The food and services are also first class for a resort hotel. It is expensive but for a few nights it is worth it

Summary Heading: Pool & Partial Park View Beats Downtown Disney View
Summary: We were fortunate to spend the past two weekends at the Grand Californian. First time we had a Downtown Disney. Nice view during the day and great at night as you can see the fireworks.   Second time had a pool and partial park view of California Adventure. Preferred this view and location. No matter day or night the view from the balcony was great. Really can‚Äôt go wrong with either view however our choice would be pool & park.

Our family stayed here over the weekend for a short family vacation to visit Disneyland and Disney's California Adventure. Though a bit on the pricey side, the hotel is spectacular and the friendliness, helpfulness, and courtesy of the staff is tremendous. We booked our stay through Costco Travel which included the hotel accommodations, tickets to Disneyland and California Adventure, vouchers for Premium Character Dining, and a Disney gift card to use for merchandise.  We were assigned a room on the 6th floor of the hotel, which is where guests who pay for the additional Club Level services would stay. Our package did not include Club Level services so although we were on the sixth floor we were not able to utilize the services of The Veranda. The room was a good size for a

Summary Heading: Second time here, not quite as good
Summary: We stayed 4 nights here before moving to the Hyatt House due to cost only. We have previously stayed here and really enjoyed it the first time. While we did enjoy it this time it just wasn‚Äôt as great. We arrived at 3 in the afternoon and the checkin line was only 5 deep but it took nearly an hour to Check in. Absolutely appalling really. Vegas is faster. The staff at the desk just didn‚Äôt seem to know what they were doing.  Our room was on the 5th floor over looking a construction site. We paid USD 500 per night for a standard view but got workmen straight under our balcony. There was no mention of the hotel under construction on their website. We couldn‚Äôt even use the balcony because of the workmen who kept watching us. They also started work by 7 in the morning so it was very

After an amazing 24th wedding anniversary stay, we returned for our 25th anniversary!  We had an absolute blast at the Grand Californian!  Our room was clean, the staff was friendly and helpful, the pool was wonderful and we loved the ambience!  I am always impressed with how smooth things run, the check in was quick and our room was ready. (it was 11:00am!)  The biggest perk is the easy access to California Adventure.  Even though the hotel is expensive, this perk makes it worth every penny!  Thank you for the best anniversary yet!

Brought my family here for a quick trip before my business trip started.  Hotel was amazing, right next to the park.  Staff is extremely helpful, nice and pleasant.  Price tag is high, but I complain after the great service.  Disneyland was also great, but that goes without saying

We stayed here 8 years ago and loved it. We just stayed again with our son and his family, including a 1 and 3 year old. We loved it again! My feeling is that it is the perfect place to stay with small children, not only because of amenities, but also because of the proximity and ease of going back and forth between the hotel and either Downtown Disney, Disneyland or California Adventure. The hotel actually has its own entrance to CA Adventure. It was super easy to come back for naps or rests before the next adventure. Hotel "cast members" clearly love their jobs and subscribe to Disney ideals. The pool area clearly caters to children, including little people pools, a little slide and life jackets for anyone who wants to use them for their children. Our room was clean and roomy

I should start by saying that we are huge Walt Disney World fans so when we wrapped up a four-day stay in Sedona we HAD to drive to Disneyland to experience it even though we only had a day and a half before we had to be on a plane in Phoenix to head home.   Our first impression of the staff was not exactly what we had been expecting given our years of service in Florida. My son and I were so excited to let them know at the front desk that it was our first visit and get buttons stating that...the cast member didn't really care and had no pins. This was disappointing, but not the end of the world.   When we got to our room she had upgraded us to a park view (we were looking right at the giant Grizzly Bear in California Adventure).

We were disappointed in our room - the view was nice but we ended paying 600 per night.  They charged us $20.00 parking and $75.00 taxes per night.  The people are not overly friendly like you would expect from Disney.  The room service breakfast was terrible, eggs runny, potatoes cold. It was over $100.00.

This place seriously is magical. I don‚Äôt even have words to describe how much I enjoyed getting to stay here. The perk of getting in the park early is such an added bonus. I love the Chip and Dale themed rooms. The staff was more than helpful! I hope to return!

Summary Heading: Location but not all the benefits...
Summary: This was a short visit to Disneyland with the family.   We had a pool view room on the 5th floor.  Room was clean and housekeeping did a great job.  Room fully equipped with plenty of USB ports! Large trash cans with recycle bins a big plus.  Well designed layouts for families with raised beds for suitcases.  Very thoughtful design points that more hotels should take lessons from.  We didn‚Äôt use the pool but had dinner at Napa Rose and breakfast at White Water Snacks.  Both very good and enjoyed what we ordered there.  We had a very enjoyable stay and would stay here given the location.    But some service improvement is needed.  A few minor points. -	One of the benefits is having access directly into California Adventures.  We got to the entrance at 7:35 for the 8:00am Early

Staying in a 2 Bedroom at the Disney Vacation Club. Hotel is very upscale great amenities. Location to the parks and Downtown Disney can not be beat. Had issues with the housekeeping staff from leaving our door opened for anybody to walk into while we were out to actually stealing a few dollars worth of change left covered up on the desk. Hotel security acted like this is a common occurrence with the staff here. Never heard back from the management staff or a follow up with security. If staying on property lock up anything that is valuable or it will walk out the door with the hotel staff.

What a great place to stay and so close to all the Disneyland attractions. Nostalgic atmosphere and large comfy rooms. Service from all at the hotel was fantastic. Not cheap by any means but worth every dollar for the experience. A lovely treat and family fun.

Every aspect of our stay at GC was exceptional. The room was large, clean, and well-appointed, with a good sized patio and a beautiful view of trees, the pool, and the Ferris wheel. Room service was very accommodating, timely, and delicious. Our room was on the second floor in the portion of the hotel between Storyteller's and the gate to DCA; it was so convenient to laundry facilities, pool access, Whitewater Cafe, and the park gate. We also found it to be very quiet, which was appreciated after a long day at the park. Turn down service, the magic hour, direct access into the park, cookies and drinks in the lobby, friendly staff members, character meet and greet in the lobby, fabulous pools with waterslides, and pool side food and drink service were just a few more of the

Summary Heading: Nothing beats staying on Disney property
Summary: I stayed here at the end of August. If you're going to do a Disney vacation you have to do it right and fork over all that extra money to stay on property. You're entire Disney vacation experience will be a million times better if you splurge and stay at a Disney hotel.   I am always torn between The Disneyland Hotel and the Grand Californian. The Disneyland Hotel has a better pool, much better room themes/decor, larger rooms and floor to ceiling windows and is cheaper, BUT the Grand Californian is much closer to the parks and has better views and balconies. It's so nice to be able to open the door and stand out on the balcony and hear the sounds of the park. The Grand has nice rooms and double sinks that are separate from the toilet and shower, but the decor and room themes are

The rooms are spacious, beds are comfortable, very quiet,  close to the entrance to California Adventure . Great restaurant. Very friendly employees, ready to help with anything you need! If you stay on the Downtown Disney side you can watch the fireworks display and listen to the street performers!  Love this place

If you are coming to the Disneyland Resort, then this is your best bet.  The lobby is one of the most amazing that I have ever seen.  You really feel like you are checking into somewhere special.  Sadly, that feeling do not extend to the very bland rooms, or fairly average food options.

Being conveniently located to the 2 parks and Downtown Disney was the best thing about this hotel, followed by the super comfortable beds.  The rooms were very clean and all staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. The minuses were the very crowded pools and the understaffed security at the ‚Äúextra hour‚Äù morning at California Adventure. The latter should be corrected immediately!

My young daughter and I just returned from a three night stay in a premium view room. We were on the third floor and had a view of the pools. We arrived on a Sunday via the Disneyland Resort Express from LAX. The shuttle driver advised the drop off for the Grand Californian was at the Paradise Pier Hotel, but stated they would send over a car to take us across the street. We waited a few minutes for the car, but decided just to walk over. Upon check in there was quite a long line. It moved quickly and they had a very nice cast member checking in with people as they waited. He made sure no one didn‚Äôt need anything and advised us of the fruit infused water and cookie station. There was also a tv area with cute little chairs for the children.  We utilized the special entrance for

We were a family of 4 visiting from the uk as part of a bigger Californian adventure. We had had a long drive from Avila Beach via Malibu the day we arrived and the kids were keen to get in the park.  Parking is accross the street so we needed to get out at the entrance with the bags and wait for husband to come back, there were refreshments while we waited. Parking is chargeable. There was vallet parking, but we didn‚Äôt realise until later.  We were slightly early for check in but they found us a room on the 5th floor. The room was immaculate with 2 double beds and a single sofa bed if you needed. It was exactly what you would expect, we had tasteful references to Disney, chip and dale on the wall paper etc. The kids wanted it more Disney, I loved it. We had booked accommodation

Spent an amazing time with my family. POOL hours are from 8am - 10pm, pool with slide opens at 9am. Three pools plus a toddler pool. All three pools are under 5 feet. Servers are available after 11am. FOOD - free coffee until 10:30am. We ordered lunch & dinner at the pool - food & drinks were delicious. Kids menu offered. For breakfast by the pool you must go to White Water Snacks (located front of pool) and bring it to the pool to eat. ROOM was ready at 2pm. Family of 5 slept comfortably. Sofa flipped over with a twin size mattress and closet had pillow, sheets and blanket for it. Mini fridge, blow dryer, iron, Keurig etc in room. Our room had a view of trees and the monorail. We had a great view of the fireworks at night. Room was quiet and we all slept like a baby. VALET was

We absolutely loved our five night stay at the Grand Californian.  I would not stay anywhere else on Disneyland property with children.  The proximity to the parks is unparalleled and perfect for those planning to take a midday break at the pool or nap in the room.  We took a mid afternoon break almost daily, and this would have seemed so much more inconvenient if we had stayed at any other Disneyland property.  We had debated whether to pay up to stay here, but are so glad we decided to splurge.  My one criticism is that the club level service was not quite up to par. We have stayed club level at other locations, and check in has always made us feel extra special.  Here, the concierge did not seem to add that extra magic I have come to expect from Club Level at Disney.  Despite

Expensive? Well, yes. You can definitely find a much cheaper hotel walking distance from Disney. Worth it? Definitely!   Everything about our stay was perfect. We arrived around 9 AM and were told our room would be ready after 3 PM, but were issued keys so we had access to hotel amenities while we waited. Lucky for us, our room was ready early (around 2:15)!  We found the entrance into California Adventure + Magic Morning made the stay well worth it. Seriously, use that time to make FASTpass/MAXPass selections before the rest of the park opens to the public; and, ride those popular rides before the lines build up (because they will, and they‚Äôll be loooonnnng).   The pool area was nice but it did get crowded. So if you want a to enjoy the pool with a chair and/or umbrella your

We stayed here in a 2 bedroom villa (we are Disney Vacation Club members) and really enjoyed our stay.  It‚Äôs very convenient....just a short walk into the parks.  The staff we came in contact with were very friendly.  Our room was excellent...no issues at all.

We arrived on Friday around 2pm. It was really busy at the valet but everything run smoothly. Staff are very friendly and efficient same as the check in desk. Even though check in time is 3pm, but our room was ready.   There are two entrances, one to Downtown Disney and one to California Adventure park which is very convenience. We have two small children 3 and 5. Because we stayed on Disney property we can get in 1 hour early before the park open to the public, came back to take a nap in the afternoon, shower and change , stroll back in again for dinner and more rides. Our room were on Downtown Disney side, we were able to watch the fireworks every night from our balcony. Bonus point for 3 swimming pool for the kids.   Staffs are friendly and nice. Everything went smoothly for

Having an entrance directly into DCA is very convenient. We frequent WDW and stay on property there, it was a surprise how basic the rooms are at Grand Californian (no fold down beds to accommodate multiple children). It was fun to see characters freely walking throughout the lobby, the kids loved that! We

We stayed here for the convenience and were sorely disappointed.   1. The private entrance to CA Adventure was so crowded with only 2 people running security that it would have been faster to go to the main entrance and wait in that line  2. Our room was not ready by the guaranteed 3pm check in  3. Just FYI, The water slide closes every hour or so   No idea why we paid a premium to spend extra time waiting for everything.

Had a truly magical visit with our 6 month old son. The entire staff was so friendly and went out of their way to provide amazing service.  Special shout-outs to Megan (front desk), Louis (bell desk), and Michael (Napa Rose) for their service.  The hotel is conveniently attached to Downtown Disney and a 5 minute walk to Disneyland.  Hotel guests get access to the parks an hour early.  There are little touches that really make a difference.  For example, there are at least 14 or so open electrical outlets in each room (whereas it's sometimes a challenge to find even one open outlet at other hotels). We never waited more than a few seconds for an elevator in our wing of the hotel despite it being a busy weekend.  Also, our room was made up twice a day without fail, including

Got the opportunity to stay at the Grand Californian Hotel for a conference. I was happy with the location for the conference and my family to go to Dland. The staff is professional and has the traditional Disney customer service. My only issue is the price of the rooms, you do not get that much extra and I am not sure it is worth the price when you can spend it at Dland. It is the perfect location if money is no object.

Summary Heading: Location, location, location...with a few warts
Summary: We booked a family reservation for a four-day stay at the Disneyland Resort and chose the Grand Californian Hotel for it's location directly adjacent to Disneyland and California Adventure. Since we could park our car for the duration of the stay ($20/day, self-park), we would not have to deal with getting into and out of the mammoth Mickey & Friends parking structure each day. Arriving shortly after 3:00PM, we were told our room was not ready and we could use the pool facilities until the room was ready.  We received a text message around 4:00PM that the room was ready. Upon picking up our room keys, I was astonished to find out that the first three "cast members" we asked couldn't provide us with directions to the room. We finally were pointed in the right direction on our

Great location and great service.  We spent three days at the GC and it made our visit to Disneyland so much more enjoyable.  The location is perfect.  We spent the mornings in the park and walked to our hotel to swim and relax in the heat of the afternoon.  A short walk back at night was easy as well.  The staff was helpful and pleasant at every turn.  We stayed in the courtyard view room and it was wonderful.  Sleeping for five and very comfortable beds and bedding.  The air conditioning worked perfectly and we had a nice balcony to sit and enjoy the sounds of Disney.  Inside the room it was very quiet day and night.

Summary Heading: Save your money and stay somewhere else
Summary: We have stayed at the Grand several times over the years with no major complaints but this time was not a good experience. We arrived in August 17th and our room wasn't ready so they gave us Keys to show down at the pool which is fine. During the time (about 2 hours or so) we were asked to show our keys 3 different times. The hotel room itself was clean and pleasant. Though the next morning we woke up to housekeeping shouting and talking very loudly. Despite having our do not disturb sign out they pounded on out door several times (before 11 am check out). There was also a baking dog in one of the rooms. Not sure what that was about. Then when we checked out (because we chose not to valet the bell man dropped my luggage on the side of the building a took off. There were other

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but morning buffet way too expensive
Summary: This resort grants access to the 2 parks which are smaller than in Florida but at least they are accessible by foot. The rooms are nice with space under the beds for suitcases (very convenient) and easy access to friendly and competent nurse. Nice kids pools but missing bathrooms around the pool area (and no lap pool). Menu was much better than in Florida in the parks (more healthy options at the parks) BUT limited restaurant choices at the hotel and WAY too expensive morning buffet: 40$ a person, even for tweens (so 160$ to eat eggs in the morning for a family of 4 - kids 11 and 12.... too expensive...). Another issue at the parks is that rides kept on breaking down (3 out of 12 rides that we were in line for broke down - maybe the rides are getting old?).

Summary Heading: The Greatest Fake Woodside Cabin Award
Summary: This hotel is an amazing place to stay. I would take this over ANY Disneyland Hotel INCLUDING good neighbor hotels. The pool may not be the best but has restaurants at AMAZING quality, great convenience to the parks, amazing rooms and suites, and the fact there‚Äôs so much to do here.

Nice to escape the heat and exhaustion of Disney into the cool, crisp air in the hotel.  Very conveniently located in the park and close to downtown Disney.  Cute amenties such as Disney complimentary toiletries.  Room is a bit worn and dated, so is the bathroom with the exception of a modern rain shower head.  The actual bathroom is quite small.  Nice pool area.  Cookies and Lemonade served in the afternoon.  Overall, would recommend for convenience but not value.  Very expensive at peak season.

This hotel is definitely your best option when visiting Disneyland resort. It is pricey but worth every penny. We arrived at 11am and immediately got our room after check in so we were able to leave our stuff and go to the park. The best part was that after a few hours of walking in the heat we were able to come back to the hotel and go to the pool. The pool has the best lounge chairs. The best I have ever seen at a hotel. There aren't many but the pool is not too crowded and you can always find a lounger. The best part of this hotel of course is that you can walk in directly into the Disney California Adventure Park. I would highly recommend it to people with little kids. I would definitely stay there every time, wish we stayed there before when my kids were little. Now they

Summary Heading: Worst Disney hotel, egotistical and unapologetic staff
Summary: Easily the worst experience I‚Äôve ever had with Disney. We had a major misunderstanding where we booked a 2 bed room suite but they told us no we booked a room with 2 beds.I figured for over $1000 a night, that‚Äôd be a 2 bedroom suite, not a room with 2 beds. Staff made no efforts to make it right or apologize. Room is not worth the price at all. Stay at the Disneyland hotel instead or on the street. The people on the street will be kinder to you here than this hotels staff. Never again will I return. I always always stay at the Disneyland hotel, where the staff are friendly and uphold to the Disney customer service requirements. Management should be ashamed of themselves.

This place is the absolute best at Disneyland/California Adventure.  Just being able to walk to both parks plus Downtown Disney is enough in itself and throw in the Disney ambiance, it's unbelievable!  My daughter and I checked in and were given a room with one king.  We wanted 2 beds, so we had to wait maybe 10 minutes, but were given an upgrade with a view of the pools for no extra charge, now that's how you do it!  Everyone knows Disney goes above all expectations and this hotel certainly makes you feel that way!  Can't say enough about how courteous all cast members are and so helpful.  We love Disney and have no problem paying for the exceptional attentiveness and experiences that we get to have!  This hotel immerses you in everything so much Disney that you forget that

Stayed at the Villas, which unfortunately backed up to a roller coaster - which proved to be quite loud.  If staying at the Villas - stay away from this location!   Otherwise, room was beautiful, typical Disney world class service, spacious and clean.   Every staff member we encountered was friendly and polite.  Nice location adjacent to parks and DD.  Pretty far from Hollywood /downtown LA for those who want to explore- but still accessible via taxi/Uber.    Lobby looks a lot of like Wilderness Lodge.

Summary Heading: Extra magic hour and close proximity to both parks
Summary: Main two reasons to stay at this hotel is for early entrance to both parks, depending on the day, and the convenience of walking directly into California adventures and Downtown Disney from your hotel.  We decided that for our 2 night visit, both of these were very important to us and therefore we overlooked a few things that might otherwise prevent us from staying at this hotel.  First, the positives, besides the early entrance and location, the rooms are very spacious and very well laid out.  Great drawer space, large bathroom and nice sitting area in the rooms.  The hotel was very lively and always had an upbeat vibe.  The negatives were the very long check-in lines, the check-out lines, the valet lines, very poor quality of sheets and the difficulties to get seats at the

We have stayed in Disney hotels a few times now and always say it's like the Disney bubble! It extends your Disney time to 24 hours a day, we saw characters in the lobby, the staff were great, the pool was amazing, busy, but the staff were good at finding you loungers and you just generally felt safe and happy!  We were here for four nights and if it was nearer home would definitely return. My only criticism was to do with the character breakfast, we booked this in advance but still had to wait for our table and at a price of $190 this was disappointing!

We recently stayed in a two bedroom unit in the villas.  The check in was long, our room was late (after 4 pm) and the baggage took over 2 hours to get to the room from bell services.  I understand that there are busy times - but the hotel staff really should not use that as an excuse - Disney knows who is arriving, what the peak times are etc etc.  Hire more resources to deal with this - in particular given the price of the rooms and the tremendous amounts that people are paying to stay there.

I stayed here for a weekend trip with my mom and sister and we had the best time. It is the only hotel that you can enter California adventure park from and it was clean, quiet and convenient. We really enjoyed " magic hour" at California adventure and rode 6 rides (that normally have the longest lines before the park opened!) it is expensive but worth every penny! We dined at downtown Disney and had great meals at reasonable prices. The pizza place Napoli had great drinks and pizza. Highly recommend it.

Great location for the Disney experience. Room was nice, but a bit small. Overlooked the pool are which was really nice. Checking in was very quick and we were able to check into our room early. We had prepaid for 3 day hopper passes and a buffet breakfast at Goofy's kitchen, but when we checked in the person at the desk did not mention this, even as I asked her to check for our reservations. Thank goodness I went back down a little later to ask someone, as if I had waited until the next morning we would have lost a lot of time. Seems the desk help at the hotel across the street is much more knowledgeable. We were the only people checking in, so the young lady was not rushed

Lots to do around the area * easy access to Disneyland.   Clean room very nice.  Eat breakfast lunch & Dinner with the Disney characters .  Or have cocktails with the adults    So much fun even for the Adults.

Summary Heading: You have to treat yourself even if only for 1 night!
Summary: It's extremely pricey but you literally walk out the back door and you are in the middle of Disney's California Adventure Park.  Until the new hotels are built, this property puts the other 2 to shame.  The staff is tip-top in every aspect and the rooms are stunning.  #WorthTheMoney

Summary Heading: One night stay as a special treat
Summary: After years of wanting to stay here we finally did .   We checked in at 7am to make use of the guest early park access benefit.  To our amazement our room was ready ,  so we quickly dropped off our bags and then joined the line for the early access .   I would love to stay again - room was wonderful , plenty of room for the 4 of us.    Early access on 2 days meant that we go on lots of rides before using the max pass option .  It is an expensive hotel to stay at , I couldn‚Äôt justify a longer stay , but thoroughly enjoyed it . The location is ideal , theming is wonderful . Having to avoid parking on site at the multi storey parking was great .

Summary Heading: Just don‚Äôt look at the price and you will be fine
Summary: Decided to stay here for a few nights at the start of a holiday before heading onwards.  Very competent in all respects as you would expect but we are talking Marriott levels of service rather than Four Seasons/Mandarin Oriental. The room was larger than I expected and was fine for the limited amount of time that we used it. You pay (a lot) for convenience at this hotel so I don‚Äôt understand the negative reviews on service or value as they are not really the selling points.  Car valet and bell service worked as advertised and no complaints on housekeeping either.

I have nothing negative to say about our stay at the Grand Californian.  Rooms were clean, the housekeeping staff are some of the hardest working I've seen, the general areas were clean, the pool was great.  I love the ability to get into the California resort without going around to the 'front'.  The front desk staff were very helpful and friendly.  The valet folks were awesome.  I have nothing bad to say about the resort or the folks working there.  Great job!

Summary Heading: Worst hotel experience I've ever had, and on my honeymoon.
Summary: The shower in the room was broken, it took 2 hours for someone to finally fix it. They tested in room alarms at 9am and never mentioned it online or during the booking process but told us when we arrived to check in. And checking out, they lost our valeted car and our luggage. It took them over an hour to locate our car and luggage, when I requested to speak to a hotel general manager or someone with oversight to the entire hotel I was brought out "valet leads". Never got to speak to a manager, never got my several calls or emails responded to. The room was prepaid for so I was left at their whim. Did I mention I was on my honeymoon? There are many affordable and lovely hotels right near the park, save yourself a headache.

We had a great stay at the Grand Californian. The front desk staff was so helpful finding us an available room for early check in. The pools, grounds and especially lobby are gorgeous. There were characters available for pictures in the lobby. The room was spotless and this resort does turn down service. I love turn down service. This was our first time with a downtown Disney view. It was noisy and I probably would go another route in the future. It wasn't enough to keep us up but definitely noticable. A nearby restaurant is also under construction and the noise was significant midday.   One of the best parts of staying on property and at this hotel in particular is proximity to the parks and Extra Magic Hours. We were the first ones on the Incredicoaster. The wait times through

Summary Heading: Super resort worth every cent - and more!
Summary: The first port of call on our US trip. Staff and services all excellent. A place where your satisfaction is never assumed with staff always going that extra mile to make sure you have the very best experience. Smiles at every juncture that are backed up with sincerity.  The room was comfortable and perfectly suited to our needs. The breakfast experience was truly wonderful, the choices of the buffet are outstanding as waiting staff really know their stuff. Lots of gluten free produce available including 3 kinds of bread and muffins & pancakes too. Mickey & crew come out periodically to do a show for the kids which was a tremendous experience.  Service at the pool was also great and I would praise the hotel on the pool safety staff, lots of them making sure kids swim safely. The

I have to say I‚Äôve never had such great service in any hotel. Smiles, how can I help you? And just super friendly service. I had a business event at another Disney hotel and had a huge a suitcase filled with business materials and the staff asked if I needed help and drive me over in a gold cart. Really went out of the way to help me. The hotel was beautiful.

We visited the bar/lounge for a late night snack after a long day at Disney. We were pleased to find a very nice glass of Rodney Strong/Chalk Hill Chardonnay for just $11.00, surprising as it's usually more everyplace else. The bar area is lovely & beautifully designed with comfortable couches. The menu is limited, as expected, but nicely varied. I'd definitely recommend the very good Wagyu Burger.  The only complaint we had was with the accompanying fries.  They are straight out frozen, crinkle fries!   Really surprising to serve with a high-end burger. Geeze, would rather have had chips if they don't want to serve better potatoes.  We ended by taking a glass of wine to the rockers by the fireplace & ended the evening relaxing by the fire.  Worth the visit for sure!

Overall this was a very memorable experience. The staff are wonderful and location is awesome. Granted, the food is expensive but if you have a rental vehicle you can go hit a grocery store or other restaurants and save. This is the only place my family stays when we come to Disneyland - this is our third time visiting.

Summary Heading: Luxury stay, double showerheads, and love the pull-out chair and couch options!
Summary: We had a fantastic stay at the Grand Californian!  We absolutely loved being so close to the park entrances and enjoyed the private entrance straight into California Adventure.  The Grand Californian has a beautiful lobby, very expansive and open.  It was reminiscent (to me) of the Animal Kingdom lodge in Orlando.  The pool was great having a small slide for the younger kids and a bigger, windy ones for the older and more brave kids.  Kids and adults were enjoying the pool everyday of our stay.  We split up our day by visiting the park in the morning, pool mid-day to cool down, and then the parks again in the evening.  The rooms themselves were very nicely appointed and had the amenities of a refrigerator and coffee maker (but no microwave).  My husband had to use a camping jet

Summary Heading: Just got back from our only DVC property where it all started...Disneyland !!
Summary: Wow when you hear someone say location, location, location...it's never been more appropriate than this resort. For those who are familiar with DVC properties, many are frankly better resorts overall...( GFV, Poly, etc), but none offers the convenience of inside-the-theme park location that this resort offers. You are literally 5 minutes away from Disneyland, DCA, or Downtown Disney. The lobby is awesome and reminds you very much of DVC's stunning Wilderness Lodge ( Copper Creek/ Boulder Ridge). Not surprising to learn they had the same architect. The rooms are the weak point...pretty average for a DVC studio...certainly not in the league of the newer DVC properties like Poly, VGF, Copper Creek, etc. Pool / activities, etc were also on the average side in the DVC world. Bottom

Title says it all. We had a "suite" which was a small room with 2 queen beds overlooking downtown Disney. We were woken every morning by the building works happening directly opposite - AT 6AM!!! The room was VERY expensive for its size - I think you pay for being inside the resort. The staff are exceptionally helpful. No breakfast facilities here either.

The cost of this hotel is somewhat high and what you are paying for - is the ability to walk to Disney and have ease of access to the park.  Another Plus is that  the rooms in the hotel are such that you are able to accommodate a large number of people by combining the two bedroom suites with an  adjacent room (conceivably having up to 12 people if you use the sofa bed in the living room).   The rooms themselves were clean - but nothing I would describe as luxurious; they are a little dated and more like a Hampton Inn.  The cleaning staff were very friendly - but the front desk/down stairs  was run  with somewhat military precision - which is efficient,  but not friendly.    Maybe they need more staff?  As someone else mentioned - having a room with a balcony is great - unless

Summary Heading: Would not stay here again.  The rooms are small and the service sub par.
Summary: Spent two nights here and was not impressed at all.  The rooms are so small and the balcony's (if you are lucky to get one) look right into someone else's room.  At best you could sit outside at 6am but the monorail starts so early it wakes everyone up and then you see everyone sitting on the balcony and there is NO privacy.

Summary Heading: Worth every penny to be in the Disney Bubble.
Summary: We arrived at the Grand Californian Hotel around 10 o‚Äôclock, it reminded us of Aulani, it is indeed grand, the lobby is beautiful. The cast members were lovely, this was true for the entire stay. It was so great to be in the Disney bubble, we really noticed it when we went to Universal for the day, the world is so abrasive out there.    We got our room 3 hours later, it was lovely, the fold out bed was super comfortable, we had a park view which brought me endless joy! The pool was lovely, but the thing that let the hotel down was the awful internet and weird plumbing noises.   The pin trading here was lots of fun, and the cast members were always excellent. You can get a wake up call by a Disney character, everywhere I read that you had to contact the concierge to do this, you

Summary Heading: The only Disney Hotel I Will Stay At!
Summary: I have stayed at the DGC at least 7-8 times in the last 4 years and have two more trips booked for this year.  I have never rated this hotel under a 3.5 and that was only twice.  Once was do to my DVC reservation in a disable room (These are necessary rooms to have don't get me wrong), but as a non disabled person on the first floor looking at a fence and the room design just wasn't the same.  And one time I had a not so pleasant check in and check out experience (same CM).  The only thing I do hold Disney accountable 24/7 for no matter what I am paying, is a "Happy Attitude with a Smile"  So the consistency of this hotel has been great service, very accommodating to my request at all times.  As all other reviews state you can't beat this hotel for location.  And you are paying

Summary Heading: Convenience Location right next to the Park
Summary: Best hotel at Disneyland as there's direct access into California Adventure and Downtown Disney. Staff were very friendly and the pool was great.  Comfortable beds and love the Chip and Dale decorations inside.   Wish that there could be more food choices in the mornings.

Summary Heading: Fantastic location, spacious, great pools for families.
Summary: Our family stayed here for a week & the location was perfect for our first time to Disneyland. Very convenient just a stone throw away from Disneyland & Downtown Disney district especially with two young children & beating the crowds. The rooms are clean & spacious with plenty of storage for clothes. Our room unfortunately faced a car park so the view was unsightly. Hence, we only used the balcony to dry our bathers. That was ok since we were out at the crack of dawn & back late from the theme parks or dinner. The bar fridge was empty & no complimentary bottled water for the room either - unusual, we‚Äôve never experienced that at a hotel before. The gym has basic equipments and wasn‚Äôt too busy even though the hotel was fully booked. The pool on the contrary, was fully occupied

I love the location of this hotel. It‚Äôs my preference when we visit Disneyland and aren‚Äôt trying to keep the cost down.   Love being able to easily access DCA and Downtown Disney. I took away one star because while the hotel itself is great the rooms aren‚Äôt anything special and when they remodeled they did away with the bunk beds which were a great setup for my family of five (3 Kids).  Customer service could also be a little more outstanding given the price.

Summary Heading: Best Disneyland Resort Ever! Worth Every Penny.
Summary: Now, now before you start arguing with me. This is the ONLY Disney resort with access to the Park and their version of downtown Disney. WALKING ACCESS. I don‚Äôt think I even used the bathroom in the park since I can just walk back to our room. It was the PERFECT hotel to stay in for our daughter‚Äôs first trip to Disney. We will always be #teamdisneyworld but this hotel has my heart. The convenience of the hotel‚Äôs location is the best. The money is well worth it since my 2 year old needed to take her afternoon naps comfortably on the bed. We loved how the bedrooms were set up too. We were able to fit 5 people in the room comfortably. The room wasn‚Äôt as big as I hoped BUT the beds were elevated that it allowed us to put all of our luggage‚Äôs underneath the beds so it gave us room to

We have visited this hotel many times and never had a problem ü§ûüèª. The location is great because you can walk into the park and get started right away without having to take a long walk outside of the Disney resort. If you forget something or get wet on Grizzly River run you can quickly go back to your room and change quickly. You get magic morning with each day of your stay which is when you get to go into the parks 1 hour before the park opens and ride all the rides before the crowd comes. The rooms are decorated super cute like the woods. On the wall you can even spot Chip and Dale hanging out in the tree! The views are always amazing, from the view that we usually purchase we get to watch the monorail go right though the hotel! The monorail isn‚Äôt loud from inside the room

We stayed on the hottest day of the year in Southern California at Disney Grand Californian.   Wanting to be able to retrieve things from our car more conveniently, originally we wanted to self park. Then realized we had to park across the street at another hotel and walk back so we changed our mind.   Self park is $20 while valet is $30. Unless you don't already have enough walking around the theme park, it's well worth the little extra to have valet parking.  The lady who checked us in was very friendly and thorough in explaining things. We needed a scooter for a family member and they even called it in for us while we were waiting at the front desk. Somehow the rental company dropped the call while we were waiting. After a while she realized there could be a problem when we

We stayed the first week of June in a one bedroom vacation club villas. The stay as always was fantastic. The staff, the pool, the lobby everything about this hotel is 5 star. From the moment you drive up and have someone open your car door greeting you,you quickly realize this truly is a 5 star experience.This is our favorite Disney hotel. Everything about the stay here is magical. If you can afford the little extra money I recommend staying here at least one time. It is well worth it.      The room we stayed in is for Disney vacation club members so as far I know it is not available to everyone. The room was great lots of room for everyone. Having the full kitchen was awesome to be able to cook meals and having a full size refrigerator was so nice. We were able to fill it with

Summary Heading: One of the nicest Disney properties
Summary: I have to preface this review by saying that we have never paid cash for our rooms as we are Vacation Club members and use points.   With that said, we‚Äôve never been able to get one of the VC villas; they are booked it seems a year in advance.  This was the first time visiting the resort after the rooms were remodeled, which made a tremendous impact.  The rooms are now more up to date; particularly the bathroom.  The pool area is large.  Only complaints are: I wish the resort had an adults only pool; and, it would be nice if you could drink a beverage while in the pool.

Every time I come here it has the same magic as the last time. There is just something about Disney, Christmas and staying on the property. It just feels like home. I know it is expensive but it is worth every penny that you will spend staying there. The memories alone are worth it.

Amazingly decorated hotel (California Craftsman style), that is much bigger than it looks from outside.  Plenty of room options (standard, pool, or theme park views), the theme park rooms are great - offering views of Pixar Pier or Grizzly Peak.  The hotel has its own entrance to Disney California Adventure or take a short walk to Disneyland through Downtown Disney.  All rooms have balconies with chairs and a table - something not available at The Disneyland Hotel.  Pool area is large, though you're likely to have difficulty finding chairs in the middle of the day (we arrived each day around 3 and it was just beginning to thin out).  Servers are available in the pool area for food an beverages (including adult beverages), but there is not a bar easily accessible from within the

Our second visit to Disneyland and our second stay at The Grand Californian.  The hotel open directly into the park which is its big draw for me with grandchildren.  We love Disney and the hotel was newly refurbished but absolutely the most expensive trip I have ever taken and I've taken some fabulous trips.  I need to win the lottery to ever go back!

Summary Heading: A must stay if you‚Äôre visiting Disneyland
Summary: We have stayed here many times and absolutely love it.  The service is top notch and the location can‚Äôt be beat particularly if you have small kids and are visiting the parks.  You can come back for some pool time or a nap to break up your park day.  The private entrance into California Adventure makes it very easy to do so.  They recently renovated the rooms which were honestly, in need of a freshening up.  Rooms are good sized for a family of four and beds are comfy although you‚Äôre so tired by the end of the day, you may not notice as you‚Äôll be asleep before your head hits the pillow anyway.  Ask for a room with a view of the park if you can as it‚Äôs nice to sit on the balcony and people watch or in the early morning and appreciate the quiet of the park before opening.  It‚Äôs

Summary Heading: Very Nice Hotel Stay, But There Were Flaws
Summary: First, the good stuff.  The hotel is very nice and beautiful, (as it should be for the price,) the rooms were clean and well appointed, the concierge food service was excellent and a huge convenience for our family, the early entry into the parks was greatly appreciated and for the most part, the staff was extremely helpful.   But, there were some glitches in our stay.  First, I asked during the time that I made the reservation for a quiet room.  We had booked a 3-bedroom suite to accommodate our entire family and we had paid for it completely in advance. When I asked again at the concierge desk about a quite room, I was given a long song and dance about how our room would get a little noise from Downtown Disney, but that would all be over with by 9-10PM, so no worries.   She

We took our family here to celebrate a big wedding anniversary. Tickets to the Park were part of the celebration. We could come and go, be together or function as separate family units. The concierge level (Club Room) is outstanding for all ages, including the storytime in the evenings.

We Found the room comfortable and clean. We had an odd smell from the shower that we couldn't figure out.  Disneyland needs to work on the food within the park, I believe they would be better served if they may an effort to serve more fresh food and less processed foods.

It's all about the location. Worth the higher prices to be right at California Adventure - easy entrance to the park and includes the early magic hour. So key when the littles get tired, it's an easy walk back to take a break or jump in the pool. Love the decor of the hotel; service is prompt; two restaurants downstairs are convenient. Pool area is great, just go before it gets too crowded. Have never used the fitness center, spa or kids club. This last trip was after their recent renovation. If you've never stayed before, I don't think you'd even realize anything or much had been updated. The overall style is still the same. Bathrooms upgraded to nicer tile and fixtures and USB ports in the outlets now. The biggest thing for us was they got rid of the bunkbed + pullout trundle

We stayed here with our two daughters and although we were absolutely amazed my Disneyland was a bit underwhelmed with the hotel.  To start with we payed quite a bit extra for a room with a view and requested a quieter room. When we checked in we had been given a room overlooking Goofey‚Äôs roller coaster, which was not only ugly but ridiculously loud from all the screaming. (We requested a room change and got a pool view room).  Secondly we asked if there were VIP tours available as we had at Universal Studios and were advised by reception that only ‚Äòfast pass‚Äô is an option. We were disappointed to later learn this information was incorrect and VIP access is available. Consequently we missed out on seeing quite a bit.  I think the main disappointment however was a lack of ‚Äòmagic‚Äô

We were so excited to finally be staying here. This was the trip of all trips to Disneyland. We did it first class all the way. This was the trip we had been dreaming of. We got home this afternoon to find emails saying on July 4th and twice on July 6th charges were hitting our credit card that we registered at THe Grand Californian with. We NEVER charged anything to the hotel. We paid as we went. On July 4th over 3,000. tried to hit our account from the registration desk at the Grand Californian. It was declined. Then early July 7th another charge tried to hit our credit card for almost 1600. Thank goodness it was declined but a minute later again the lodge tried to hit our account for 800. and it went through. I instantly called my card company and they said yes the Lodge had

We really enjoyed our stay at the Grand California Hotel. It perfectly located walking distance to Disneyland, DCA & Downtown Disney.  The bed was amazing and very comfortable.  The staff was very helpful and always around.  We did have to call because our neighbors were being really loud around 1AM. Security handled it very professionally and we had quiet.  The only negative of our whole stay was that the Storyteller's restaurant only did buffet for breakfast.  We prefer to order off the menu.   One regret was not going to the White Water snacks before we headed to the extra Magic Hours.   Because most Downtown Disney restaurants don't open until 7am. One of the best family Hotels we've ever stayed.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay while visiting Disney
Summary: The best kept secret is the 6th floor upgrade... a private floor that provides 3 meals a day and drinks all day.  Wine and cheese at night.  Ability to take food, snacks, and drinks into the park will save you SO much money and makes the extra price of the upgrade to 6th floor worth every penny!  Not to mention all the other goodies you get while staying in a Disney hotel; early entry, etc.  This property was perfect because the hotel is right next door to the park so you can easily come back to your room, rest and go right back.  Staying here made this my best Disney vacation ever!

Summary Heading: Luxury accommodations and convenience well worth the expense
Summary: I don't really understand when I read reviews of the Grand Californian that lament the high price. Yes, it is expensive and there are numerous, cheaper places to stay nearby, but this is a premier Disney resort comparable to Florida counterparts like the Grand Floridian, Contemporary, and Polynesian Resorts. One could enjoy the hotel's accommodations without ever setting foot in the main-attraction amusement parks. The inspiring Arts-and-Crafts architecture and design elements, public fireplaces, relaxing swimming pool, full-service spa, kids' events, and dining and lounge options add up to a fully inclusive resort that warrants the nightly rate.  Of course, we weren't staying confined to the hotel during our visit. We made full use of the very convenient entry to Disney's

Summary Heading: "Overpriced but would do it again out of convenience"
Summary: This resort is beautiful and comfortable but overpriced. We stayed due to the convenience of location.  We love the fact that when we park the car on day 1 of vacation we don't get back in the car until we leave to go home.  When you exit the resort on the theme park side you can walk a very short distance and be in Downtown Disney, Disneyland, and Grand California Adventure   While visiting we were treated kindly and with respect by the resort employees. We will go back and when we do we will stay at the Grand Californian Hotel.

Summary Heading: The price is ridiculous but if you love Disney parks it's a must
Summary: I had very high expectations for staying in Disneyland's flagship hotel.  While it is certainly nice - the lobby is great; the beds are comfy; and the food is good - it did not "wow" me in the way I expected.  I much prefer the Animal Kingdom Lodge, the Polynesian, and even the Yacht Club at WDW.  HOWEVER - if you love to tour Disney parks; especially intensively - it is by far the most convenient hotel in any American Disney resort.  The private DCA entrance means you can easily run back to the room if you forget something.  Imagine doing that at the Magic Kingdom in WDW!  No way.  We absolutely loved the convenience and spent a ton of time at DCA.  Disneyland is about a 8-minute walk through Downtown Disney, so also convenient.  It is fabulous to just walk right out of the

Loved it!!    We are avid Disney World fans. We even ended up at Disneyland Paris last summer. I did not have high hopes for Disneyland.  I heard it was landlocked and Sleeping Beauty‚Äôs castle was much smaller than Cinderella‚Äôs in Orlando.  We were also limited for lodging options since there are only two Disney properties at Disneyland.    We booked our one bedroom suite through the Disney Vacation Club. We were initially on a waitlist, but officially secured our room 3 months before our reservation (Shout out to the family that cancelled - Thanks!).   We arrived at the resort via the Disney Express. The Disney Express from LAX is different from the Disney Magical Express in Orlando.  No reservations are required but it costs money to ride. We paid on the shuttle once we

Very beautiful family hotel to stay at, if you're willing to pay the price.  However, what you are buying is really the proximity to Disney Town, the parks and really nothing else. For a so-called "luxury" hotel, I couldn't identify anything special that would make this hotel standout over other similar "luxury" type hotels. We occupied a very nice one-bedroom suite with a connecting room to accommodate our family but the rooms were nothing special that would single them out over others that we have stayed at.   The check-in process took a little longer than what you would expect from a "luxury" hotel but part of the reason could have been that we had checked in during their peak check-in hours.  Nonetheless, some improvements could be made to expedite the process especially for

Summary Heading: Very old room horrible price high
Summary: Stayed here and big mistake, bad experience in a old outdated hotel. Stayed in business level and room dirty lounge limited, food in lounge good only, will not ever return to this hotel was told it was the best Hotel in which case I feel really sorry for the others staying in other hotels.

Updated review: this is an update from my last review from Feb. 2017. We cane this time for a couples trip. Rooms are newly renovated. Not too many changes in decor but the bathrooms have been fully renovated. Great shower but no tub. Our room was pretty comfortable and my only complaints are that there is no microwave and the pillows provided are too fluffy. I usually bring my pillow but not the case this time. I slept awfully. The pool area was really nice. Great service and plenty of chairs and umbrellas. We rented a cabana for the day and it was great! Highly Recommended this for couples. It's the next best thing to an adult pool area. Security checkpoints were very smooth getting into California Adventure and Downtown Disney. Again, you are paying for the accessibility to

Made a last minute decision to stay at the Grand.  We usually stay at the paradise pier or Disneyland Hotel.  All three hotels are nice in their own way... The Grand is beautifully decorated and the craftsman art work and architecture of s amazing, the rooms are one of the smaller ones of the three hotels though.  The pool are is nice as well and they had a small slide for the little ones which is always a plus for me, because my 2 year loves the slides in the pool... Another plus for the hotel is that you can enter the park from the hotel by the entrance by Napa Rose restaurant the lines are a little shorter too... The only issue I really have the the Security check point, I don‚Äôt mind them because I k ow their there for our safety but most of them are just so rude or am just

Our family has stayed here multiple times. The hotel is pricey and rooms are small with bathrooms being very small. Rooms aren‚Äôt worth the price ,we‚Äôre mostly paying for the convenience of being close to both parks and downtown Disney. Resort has a nice lounge area to relax along with a few restaurants/snack options.  Large pool area with servers available for drinks/food but there weren‚Äôt many chairs available in the afternoon. People were leaving towels on chairs so it was difficult to know if chairs were being used or not. My husband spoke to an employee walking by and she said the life guards were responsible for keeping eye on empty chairs, clearing towels and making them available. We spent 3 days at pool and never saw them clear towels. With guests ordering food/ drinks

The location makes this hotel worth the price.  If you are expecting a real 5-star hotel experience - look elsewhere, but at Disneyland this is the best there is.  Love that you are steps away from the parks and Downtown Disney.  Recently renovated rooms have definitely improved the quality of your stay.  The rooms and baths are much more welcoming now. Will definitely return soon.

great beds - nice sheets and comfortable pillows - nice rooms - intricate design - great service and nice atmosphere - nice lobby with giant fireplace and shops with good restaurants and snack places close by

From the moment I got out of my car I was greeted with professionalism and class, the gal (Linda) at registration was excellent, even upgraded me, plus got me in my room super early. Every staff member was pleasant. The room was beautiful, but more importantly the atmosphere of the whole hotel was five stars. From the decor to the piano playing in the main room. Easy access to the park. My new and now only place I'll stay when I visit Disney. Karyn Pringle

I've never spent so much money for a hotel stay but we don't visit Disneyland very often so I decided to splurge. The only downside is I could never visit DL again and stay somewhere else. The pool was heated to the perfect temperature- not hot or cold. Pool chairs in the afternoon could be tough to get but we always managed. We stayed on the second floor facing the park. There was no view but we could open the sliding doors and hear the park music and sounds which was great. The location was the best and the cleaning staff was amazing. I think the DL employees checking us in could have done a better job going over the resort and "perks" of staying there. We found out a lot of info by mistake and that would have been nice to know up front. Examples like coffee in Whitewater

The good: easy access to the park, and an hour early entry.  The bad: too expensive for what you get. Rooms are very plain. There was a bandaid stuck to the smoke detector, and smudges all over the balcony door.  Paid 900 dollars for 2 nights and felt like I was staying in A best western (nothing against that). I wanted and paid the Disney  magical experience but didn‚Äôt feel it or see it. Food was expensive and parking was 30 bucks a night. Save your money and go to a hotel across the street. When I told them I was upset with the quality of my room, they offered me fast passes, which was strange. Don‚Äôt pay anything over 250 for the room. That‚Äôs all it‚Äôs worth, won‚Äôt be back.

Summary Heading: Lobby Fireplace room chairs move independently
Summary: I was able to purchase a room for $358. with a "triple discount" because I had some points saved up on the travel site, plus their special code popped up, and there was already a discount for off-season travel. I researched for this deal for over 2 years and finally hit on it! We went for 3 days just after Christmas decor went up and it was a dream.   I can't find any post that noted that the "gated" fireplace room is haunted. While waiting for my sister in-law, I stood outside the room about 3 feet away toward the right, and just cross from me was a boy about 4 years old on the left side. We both saw 2 chairs begin fully rocking and he tried to tell his Mom, but the two adults ignored him. He and I stared at each other for a moment, then I nodded my head to give him a bit of

Although quite highly price, the Disney Grand Californian is a good compliment towards a Disneyland and especially California Adventure visit(s).
