Staying on property gives you a 1-hour early entry perk into the park(s) which is a plus for the popular rides.  The Grand Californian also renovated their rooms which allows its guests to slide their bags underneath their beds to provide more space.  The firm bed is perfect for guest with bad backs and the maid service was excellent.  Definitely a must return stay if you are visiting Disneyland and Californian Adventures.

This was a perfect hotel for me and my family.  The 5 of us stayed in a 1 bedroom.  We had amazon deliver some sundry groceries.  This was helpful to get snacks to the kids.  The location of the hotel is absolutely unbeatable.  To clear security, we never wanted more than 3-4 minutes.  From the hotel we cold do this.  This was amazing!   The hotel has a bit of grandeur, but is not ‚Äústuffy‚Äù.  THe restaurants are plentiful. Typical Disney prices.  Food quality is fine.  Not great but fine.   Plenty of types of cuisine.   Hotel pools are fun for the whole family.  Hot tubs were a little too cool for my taste though.  The room itself was plenty of room for the 5 of us.  Roomy and highly functional.  Nice to have a 2 full baths.   In short, the hotel made the stay at Disneyland

Summary Heading: It's All About The Location and Convenience
Summary: We've been staying at the Disney's Grand Californian for years.  Yes - it is expensive, but I feel the cost is worth the location and convenience. It is newly renovated and we love the renovations. It's much brighter in the room. They had a great pull out couch. We have 2 kids and they didn't have to share a bed - they loved it. The shower is great. They have a fridge in the room.   We place an order for room service at night for breakfast in the morning. The kids shared a breakfast and my husband and I shared a breakfast. It's more than enough food for the 4 of us. We love the convenience of being able to get ready and not have to go anywhere for breakfast. We've even done room service at night and was very surprised with how good the food was.    It was very hot during our

The best place to stay for your family trip to Disneyland! Having your own entrance into California Adventure is absolutely perfect!  There is plenty of pools to accommodate too! Loved the connection to Downtown Disney too!

Summary Heading: Best of the Disneyland Hotels - Expensive But Worth It
Summary: Thousands of reviews on this property but here's my take after at least 5 visits over the last 3 years.  What's great: - Location.  Your own gate from the hotel to CA Adventure and a very short walk to Disney.  The Disneyland Hotel is MUCH farther to both parks.  The only reason I would stay at the Disneyland hotel again is for the pool.  Fun slides and a more tropical atmosphere.  Every else is better at Grand CA in my opinion.  Best part about staying here is you can come back and rest in the afternoon, use the pool and then be back in the park in 10 minutes.  Huge upgrade not the experience. - Remodeled rooms.  Big upgrade with the remodel in 2017.  Rooms are modern and well appointed.  Great bed and awesome climate control.  If you want to sleep in 65 degrees the AC will do

So much fun here! The look of the motel really fitted with Disney. Was a perfect location to the park, would highly recommend staying here as you can easily come and go and we had 5 rooms with our family so we could all go at different times and come back to the room to get refreshed or for naps etc and then go back again. Friendly staff, very clean.

Be prepared to pay a premium for the stay, parking, etc., but this place is sooo nice and relaxing‚Äîa quiet respite from the hubbub of the parks. I‚Äôd have been just as happy lazing by the pool, having drinks delivered. And by the way, poolside drinks were relatively reasonably priced. It‚Äôs cool and dark inside the building, lending to the overall feeling of serenity. The room was spacious, and wait for the adorable surprise in the hide-a-bed! We had a balcony overlooking the pool area, and a dove was nesting there. My husband thought it was animatronic üòÇ.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel, Awesome location, but not perfect
Summary: Just got back from staying 4 nights at Disney's Grand California Hotel. Overall, we had a very positive experience there.   Pros: - Location, location location.     - It was a 2 minute walk from our hotel to the Adventure park. and 5-7 minute walk to Disney park. Very convenient. We came back to our hotel several times during the day to grab something, use the restroom, take a break and etc. The location made traveling with a 4 year old very easy  - Clean     - The hotel was clean. Didn't see any bugs, spiderwebs or stains anywhere. Overall, we felt comfortable there. Then again, for the price you pay, it better be clean  - Friendly staff     - The staff were very friendly and helpful.  - Early checkin and late checkout     - We were able to check in to our room as soon as we

Summary Heading: For Croatia Extranganza. Lionsgate is the best
Summary: The most wonderful place.  Front desk very friendly,  Beautiful clean rooms.  Cafe was wonderful.  The whole place is awesome.  Wonderful housekeeping. Front desk the best.Good Breakfast and if you hot breakfast you can have that too,

This hotel is clearly very beautiful and very good condition. I really liked how it was feet away from the park and we did not have to take any sort of shuttle, the pool area also was very neat with water slides. The only downside to the trip was how far the parking was. We had to walk across the street to park. There was no free breakfast even though the price is outrageous, and there is a bit of a wait to check in. The customer service was great. There was no microwave in our room and within 15 minute someone delivered us one. It was a great hotel but too expensive.

2 star for the nice location and swimming pool  This is a $600 a night hotel and it doesn‚Äôt have 1. Complimentary parking: I‚Äôm a guest staying here and they ask me to pay $30, wth 2. No hot water kettle in the room, how do we make formula for or baby?  3. No tooth brush 4. No razor  5. No kid potty 6. No complimentary breakfast.   I‚Äôve stayed at hotels all over the world and this is by far one of the worst service hotel I stayed. If not for its location, I‚Äôd never come here again.

Summary Heading: Paying Extra Dollars for the Convenience
Summary: Having experienced staying in multiple hotels in Asia, Europe and North America, I totally understand how hotel rating works. Here in Disney Grand Californian Hotel, we paid a deluxe room rate close to the rate offered by Four  Seasons Hotel in Silicon Valley. Everything in the lobby looks perfect: the lodge-style decor, the cozy fireplace and the spacious rest area. The swimming  pools (with life guards on standby) are small but pleasant. Amenities and customer service wise, it certainly does not meet the standard of any good  five-star hotel. The room is quite small (good for 2 parents and a toddler, but too cramped for 4 persons). It is generally neat and clean. You get  basics like toiletries (thank God they still provide some premium toiletries!) and hot beverages, even a

No complaints - this was a beautiful Grand Hotel, just like the name implies. We had a lovely stay of four nights and the location was perfect for access to both parks, allowing us to slip back to the room for recovery and then get straight back into the action.  Summary:  - Old hotel, but perfect fits the classical Disney environment - The lobby is HUGE and beautiful - WiFi free and reliable - Staff were VERY friendly and helpful - The pool is very large and perfect for families

This hotel has a full spa and is fancier then Hotel Disney.  It is more expensive then Hotel Disney.  It is also inside Downtown Disney and closer to the tram.  Great location and beautiful inside. Good food too.

Definitely my favorite Disney hotel but also one of my favorite hotels anywhere, have been going here for years. I am disappointed that they now only honor club level service until check out which is 11:00 am. The Grand Floridian at Disney World allows you to use the club the entire day of check out. Considering it costs several hundred dollars extra per night (500.00+) I think the Californian should allow use at least until the evening. There has been so much renovation going on for what seems like years it would be nice for them to finish. Rooms are always clean and linens are fresh. Unfortunately you never know when your room is going to be cleaned which can be inconvenient if you want to take a nap. Cast members are generally very nice and polite. Love the convienence of

Summary Heading: Perfect Place to Celebrate Magical Memories
Summary: My wife and I came to Disney's Grand Californian Hotel & Spa to celebrate her birthday! The hotel was amazingly beautiful, and we had an incredible time! This place is perfect for couples, families, and if your flying "Solo". There's also conference areas attached to the hotel for business conventions too.   Overall Experience:  * Outstanding Service with a smile! * Beautiful Hotel Room and Resort grounds * Tons of activities at the Resort * Lots of dining options in-room, in hotel and within walking distance at Downtown Disney * Connected to Disney California Adventure & Downtown Disney, and short walk to Disneyland  Things to Do: * Disney California Adventure is connected to the Grand Californian Hotel, this special entrance puts you right alongside Grizzly River Run. *

I don‚Äôt know how this hotel isn‚Äôt rated higher. What more could you ask for? This hotel is obviously in the perfect location for Disneyland.  It has its own entrance into California Adventure. It‚Äôs also so elegant and stunning. The pool area is amazing. If you can afford it, stay here!

Customer service is the hallmark of Disney properties and the Disney Vacation Club Villas at the Grand Californian Hotel was on the mark....with one exception.  We booked a 2 bedroom king villa with DVC points for our 4-generation family of 8 guests from ages 68 to 2. The accommodations were fine for our group and up to the quality level we've come to expect from DVC.   We arrived at 10 AM having driven from Las Vegas. We checked in at the hotel, knowing "official" check-in time isn't until 3 PM. Our villa wasn't ready for occupancy, but we got all the paperwork out of the way. No keys issued at 10 AM. A reasonable person could easily think that checking in at 10 Am would increase the chance that the room would be ready at 3 PM (thinking first come, first served) but such was

I've stayed in a few Disney hotels and this one was my favourite!  The lobby is gorgeous and has a lot of different seating areas for if you want to hang out or if you're waiting for your room.  The rooms are gorgeous and cutely decorated with subtle Disney themes.  Never went to the pool area but it was always being enjoyed by at least one family.  Great location to the parks and downtown Disney as well!

My family and I stayed Memorial Day Weekend for a conference.  This hotel was great.  We arrived early in the morning and were given our room right away.  Up we went and we were met with a beautiful renovated room.  We loved every minute or our stay.  The convenience of this hotel is unmatched.  The pool area was great and my 2 year old loved the mini water slide just for him.  Can't wait until our next stay!

Summary Heading: What Can You Say, It's Disneyland's Premier Hotel
Summary: My family and I were Disneyland passholders for years and on occasion have stayed at the other two hotels on the property, Paradise Pier and The Disneyland Hotel.  They are great hotels.  This one is a step beyond.  I'll be honest, its expensive (we were lucky to get a great rate for a dance competition event held at the Disneyland Hotel) and I'm not sure I'll be able to stay here again, but I can hope!  The thing that sets this hotel (and all of Disney) apart is the service.  Its impeccable.  Everything you want or request is taken care of happily.    I didn't get a picture to include of the lobby but its gorgeous, like an enormous winter chalet/cabin. With a fire burning in a cavernous stone fireplace, lots of comfy chairs and couches set about in conversation groups.    The

We stayed at the Grand Californian as a family of 5 before heading to California Adventure.  We have stayed at this hotel before, but not for many years.  The remodel of the rooms they did recently made us want to come back and see.  They did a wonderful job.  The hotel has always been majestic, with the lobby being such an amazing focal point.  Now the rooms are up to date again, and we enjoyed our stay.  The service is impeccable.  We checked in very early in the morning so we could drop our bags and head to Storytellers Cafe for breakfast.  The woman checking us in got us all into the Disney spirit immediately.  She was SO helpful, and so joyful, and took care of our every need.  Two of my sons were celebrating a birthday, and one son was having his first Disney visit, so she

Disney's Grand Californian Hotel & Spa is one of my favorite places to visit. The grand, soaring lobby, the refined wood and subtle art and craft style details, the warm stone fireplace with rocking chairs - the entire resort screams "Welcome! Come stay a while." From the rose-etched leather blotters at the front reception to the various sculpted pottery throughout the resort, every little detail tells a story. And there are so many places you can find within the resort to get cozy and chill - from the outdoor fireplace with inviting loungers, to the leather chairs in the lobby near the piano (with live musician), to the Hearthstone Lounge with crafted cocktails and a lovely fireplace - you'll find your spot.  The rooms are equally beautiful - refined and elegant, yet warm and

Okay, this hotel has spoiled and ruined me for other hotels. We stayed at the Club level and everything was amazing from start to finish. I can‚Äôt comment on how it accommodates families with children, but it made me feel like a kid, a big kid who can drink champagne on her birthday! Club level food was great and the access to DCA, is crazy cool! Loved the roaring fireplace in the lobby while Disney songs were being played by on the piano. Room was great, super comfy bed and the messages we received on the in-room phone letting us know the forecast for the following day and the park hours, was a very nice touch. Had an amazing time, we‚Äôre still talking about it!

Disclaimer: I‚Äôm a Disney DVC member and all of my experience is with Disney World resorts.  That having been said-I wasn‚Äôt that impressed. I would not have paid rack rate for this property-I used my DVC points. It‚Äôs a very nice property. Service was exceptional. Housekeeping was outstanding. It‚Äôs just not the same caliber as Disney World resorts. Maybe it‚Äôs a space thing...I don‚Äôt know. Amenities and rooms are smaller than I‚Äôm accustomed to.  It is very nice to walk into a park directly from your hotel...you do not get that at Disney World.  But we didn‚Äôt feel the ‚ÄòMagic‚Äô we feel at Disney World and frankly it made us miss the ‚ÄòWorld‚Äô. A friend joined us at the property and remarked upon entering, ‚ÄòThe lobby is gorgeous‚Äô He should see the lobby at Animal Kingdom Lodge;)

We stayed here during a peak time, so our rate was pretty high... for the high price ($400-500/nt), it was "very good", not quite "excellent" yet. This was before any remodels or recent upgrades, which means it could be much better now. The lobby though---I could camp out in it if it were allowed. I prefer entering the parks through this hotel just so I can walk through the lobby, especially during Christmas. For the price, I prefer the Disneyland Hotel; however, I would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Our first time at a Disney Resort
Summary: Although a considerable investment, staying as close to the parks as possible was a great way to go with small kids. It allowed us to take breaks for dinner and naps, and not need to wake up quite as early to get into the parks with our daily magic hours.  Although I would love to give the resort 5*, there were things that weren't quite up to Disney standards at this resort. The first was not telling us the pools were heated and had a towel stand even during Spring (when most people think we are crazy to swim as it's cold outside). The second reason for my reduced rating is that the restaurant host at Storyteller gave us a ten minute wait estimate for a walk in for our group of 8 people. It was lower season when we visited so we thought wow that's great, except for the twenty

We stayed at the Grand Californian for our honeymoon, due to our friends having DVC. It was incredible. Probably one of my favorite Disney hotels we have stayed at! I loved being so close to everything. The theming was gorgeous and loved the restaurants there! If you get a chance, absolutely stay here! The DCA entrance is worth every penny!

I made reservations through Disney Travel Service.  4 Nights in the Californian Hotel is not inexpensive when you have 6 people.  The "Business Center" blocks you from printing any documents except Boarding Passes.  When I went there at 11:00 PM to print mine, it was locked.  I can print documents at a $ 60 a night Comfort Inn but not at an $ 1,100 a night hotel.  We made reservations for a "Character Breakfast."  Which the children greatly enjoyed although its $ 40 a head for buffet cold french toast and bacon. The problem is, Disney Travel takes your money for this reservation but does not tell you that you also have to call the restaurant and make a reservation.  All you have done with Disney Travel is prepay.  We also reserved dinner at the Carthay in California Adventure to

Just returned from a 5-night stay at the Grand Californian and loved every moment of it.  The proximity to both parks and downtown Disney is obviously the key feature of this hotel, and having an entrance directly into DCA is amazing.  One of the perks of staying in a Disney property is having the "extra magic hour" every day - this gives you quality time in selected areas of each park before they get busy, and makes a real difference to your day.  The hotel itself is beautifully decorated and furnished with all the little details which sets Disney above and beyond its competitors.  The staff are super-friendly and helpful all the time and the facilities are all first-class.  We spent one afternoon by the pools; I don't think I've ever had such comfortable sun loungers anywhere.

I just got back from a wonderful stay at the Grand Californian!  I will have to say based on some of the previous reviews, I was a bit nervous checking in.  However, I did not have any issues during my stay.  My room was ready upon arrival and I was off to the parks.  The proximity to California Adventure is just amazing.  Plus, you are not far from Disneyland either.  The rooms were clean and I had a nice view of California Adventure.  I would return here on future visits.

Stayed at Grand Californian for 3 nights in mid-May for a short family vacation.  Views from room of California Adventure were fantastic.  2 bedroom villa was large and well appointed.  The yoga class was fantastic.  Instructor was very helpful and knowledgeable.  A great class - wish I was staying longer for more classes.  Definitely will be coming back!!

Highly recommended Club Level at Grand California! Service and amenities are well worth the additional cost. Staff is friendly and welcoming. From the moment you arrive all the way to the moment you depart you are treated like a valued guest. I couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better experience! The convenient access to the park is great, and makes it easy to take a refreshing break in the club lounge any time throughout the day. The beds were very comfortable, and our view fantastic. In the evening you can enjoy the fireworks from the comfort of the lounge. I really wanted to give it a 5 but I have to be honest and say that we did experience problems with the AC in our room. It became very warm and the air would not cool down. Techs attempted to fix it twice, but could not resolve the

Summary Heading: Family Vacation - Location is worth the price!!!
Summary: We had a great stay! We payed for a premium view but, we were right above construction. I called and they corrected the price of the room right away. We had a great time at the pool a few key people to give kudos to Nick Nanfito, Nick Rubay, Kelli D., Trish Camargo and Ruth. I'm in the hospitality industry and I know its important to recognize employees for there hospitality! Iris at check in was very helpful and had all our information needed for our trip. All the bell staff extremely helpful upon check in and check out! We will return and definitely stay here again. Hopefully with a better view!

Stayed here in a 1 bedroom Villa with some friends and loved it. The room was gorgeous and the hotel itself was incredible. The pools were fantastic and the restaurants in the hotel were delicious.   We especially loved the private entrance into California Adventure.   Highly recommend!

While we have enjoyed several nice stays at the Disneyland Hotel this hotel will now be our go to hotel for future visits.  We took a one bedroom suite and the layout is perfect and we also added on the concierge club lounge and that was terrific between the outstanding service, the food and the drink and its beauty.  It is very convenient to both Parks.  I highly recommend the hotel.

My favorite hotel in the Disney group bar none. Yes we are DVC members and have stayed at many different Disney properties. Disney has a level of service that others could learn from. Only complaint took awhile for our room to be ready but hey not a big deal.

The Grand Californian has really benefited from a major upgrade completed in the last year.  The rooms are comfortable if not exactly spacious--- a standard two-queen bedroom can feel pretty small for a family of four, especially with all the gear you have to haul around for the typical vacation with small kids.  But I suppose you're not really paying for lots of space at the GCH&S.  You're paying for virtually instant access to the 2 Disney parks and an unbeatable location on Main Street of Downtown Disney.    The food options inside the hotel are plentiful and really good.  The Napa Rose restaurant is wonderful--- worth a trip even if you're not staying at the hotel.  The swimming pool areas are enormous and so kid-friendly that you may shorten your trip to the parks by a

I am a personal support worker for mentally challenged adults in Hood River Oregon. This hotel not only met our expectations and needs but went beyond. The short and quick access into California Adventure and Downtown Disney was amazing and a must for the people my wife and I had with us due to their physical  and mental disabilities. They have so many restaurants on site including character dinning plus three nice pools along with three hot tubs. The staff is very accommodating to people who need a little more help in life and went out of their way to make us feel welcomed and that they were glad we were there. When booking the rooms they asked lots of questions to make sure our rooms met are needs, were in the right location, and were safe for people with disabilities.They

Summary Heading: Simply put, you are paying for location.
Summary: Arrived on a Sunday afternoon and spent 45 mins in a huge check in process.  Lobby was very impressive and despite the 3 star rating, I found all the staff I dealt with to be very friendly and helpful (especially Claudia at the front desk who helped us get matches).Now my beef is simply the price you pay per night.  I don‚Äôt mind paying the higher price but my expectations go up.  If I paid $200-$300 a night I wouldn‚Äôt be so picky.  Little things like a small hand towel that somehow ended up tossed in the corner (never got picked up in 3 days), I could have easily picked it up after day 1 but from that point I wanted to see how long it would take.  Also there was a big dust build up on the pull out bed (more than a three day amount).  A lot of comments have been made about the

Summary Heading: Mostly worth it for World of Color Viewing Deck
Summary: This was my first time staying at a Disneyland resort hotel.  We stayed there primarily as I opened up a Disney credit card back in college and had accrued over $700 in rewards and honestly we didn't know what else to do with that much credit.  So we booked a flight with flight rewards for a mostly free trip.  For a free trip, it was worth it; if I'd had to pay what most folks spend, definitely not worth it at all.  Rooms are a bit on the small side, bed is only ok comfort wise.  The architecture of the hotel is very nice and the fire place is warm and inviting especially as the lobby is kept quite cold.  The restaurants were mostly ok (lots of bread baskets, and not as healthy as they could be).  Napa Rose was very nice though and we enjoyed our meal there.  One of the major

Summary Heading: Only stay here for the location as customer service is non-existant
Summary: The only reason I am giving this a hotel an average review is for the location and for the access to magic hours you get for staying at this property.  We arrived fairly late in the day on a Sunday, to a welcome of about 15 valet attendants.  Upon entering the hotel it all went down hill.  This hotel has at least 10 stations for welcoming guests.  When we arrived only 2 were in service.  We stood in a line about 14 people deep.  At this point I realized we were doomed to be stuck in our first miserably long Disney line.  Checking into a Disney hotel is not as simple as getting a room key and being sent on your way, no you have to get your tickets and 30 minute presentation on how magic hours work and all of the perks of staying at a Disney property.  I got so frustrated seeing

Summary Heading: Grand is not so Grand when it comes to Customer Service
Summary: If you want a beautiful hotel, on property than this could be the place for you. However if you are looking for customer service this is not the hotel.   My husband and I got married on May 5, 2018. When we were planning our honeymoon we decided to buy points from a DVC member. As we were wanting to buy into the membership, but wanted to test the system before we invested. And we were so glad that we did. Because after our stay at the Grand we were not impressed. Ironically, there was a Customer Service Summit happening at the resort during our stay, Hopefully, some took notes.  Our biggest complaint was the check in process. We arrived in early 11am. Gentleman said our room was not ready yet and would be ready shortly. So we waited. And waited, and waited. Total wait time was

Summary Heading: Disney's Best Luxury Hotel In California At The Center Of It All...
Summary: My family and I became DVC (Disney Vacation Club) members a couple of years ago with Disney's Grand Californian Hotel & Spa as our home resort.  This was by far the best decision we have made, in terms of timeshare, and we should have done it sooner. Most of the rooms in the hotel are available to the general public and a few (villas) are dedicated to DVC owners. Having stayed at Disney properties in Hawaii and Florida before, we were left speechless on each of our stay, but the Grand Californian brings the experience to another level of exclusivity.   The resort is masterfully located in between Disneyland and California Adventure.  Car entrance is by Disneyland drive which has very tight security.   You're only permitted to enter if you have a reservation for a room or an

We are in the Happiest place on earth! We loved our hotel room! Especially the bathrobes, wow what luxury! I told my husband should we buy them! hee! hee!( Yeah right thinking of the price). Anyway we loved them maybe go back just to wear them again. (Maybe) Thank you Staff you were amazing, so gracious, so respectful and listen when we had a problem come up. Amazing place, busy, crazy, at times pushy people, but we were in Disneyland so what, enjoy my short time there! Love the adventure and our memories. 2 happy seniors, Bob & izzy! God Bless all of YOU!!

It was so nice to be right on property. Having its own entrance to CA adventure is a nice perk. Makes going back and forth from park to hotel very easy with little kids. Room was a standard room, nice and clean. Bathroom was very nice with an amazing rain shower but there was no tub for giving kids a bath which I found surprising. Pools looked very nice but it was only in the 60s when we were there, too cold for us with little kids for outdoor pool. Our room door handle broke, they responded quickly and had it fixed for us in a few minutes I would highly recommend this hotel. We felt it was well worth the money over the close local hotels which we had stayed at on our last visit

The property is gorgeous. Rooms were clean and as expected. Room service and Housekeeping were the sweetest people ever! Very conveniently located to the parks and Downtown Disney. Unfortunately some of the staff was lacking smiles, friendly customer service and park knowledge.  Checking In - Disney in known for printing all guests names on room keys. We had two rooms reserved and needed to move my 17 yr old nephew from one room to the other. Seems like a simple request, and we didn't mind waiting the time to make the adjustment (no one was rushing the agent) but he seemed extremely annoyed with us and our request. He walked away from the desk and returned with good news - able to move my nephew AND give us adjoining rooms (that were NOT requested). But no matter how many times

This hotel never ceases to impress. The staff are phenomenal especially with the kids. It is expensive, and personally it depends on what type of trip you are on if it will be worth it. We decided to splurge and I feel that we wholeheartedly got our money‚Äôs worth. We have stayed at other Disneyland and Good Neighbor Hotels and in terms of access to the park none hold a candle. It is fantastic for small kids to be able to have direct access in and out of both California Adventure and Downtown Disney. We took breaks throughout the day and didn‚Äôt waste time with transit.  They have Disney short movies in the lobby that the kids loved. We had late night bites and drinks at the Hearthstone after returning from the park. We did the breakfast buffet at the Storyteller Cafe and it was

There are many hotels at or around Disneyland, but if you want the best hotel with the best location and best services, the Grand Californian is it.  It is adjacent to California Adventure, with a separate entrance to beat the crowds.  If you stay there, you get a "magic hour" entrance (one hour before the general public is allowed into the park) which alternates between Disneyland and California Adventure.  This is also available to guests of the Disneyland Hotel and Paradise Pier Hotel, but they are farther away.  The rooms are pricey but spacious and the ambiance is outstanding.  If you want extra convenience and flexibility, spend a little more for the concierge floor.  It is situated on the 6th floor with its own registration and concierge personnel.  Your room key allows

How many other Disney hotels are a five minute walk to the park? Or less for California adventure? Worth the additional cost for that alone. Especially after the fireworks when kids are cranky and done for the day. But room is also nice, amenities are well done.   White water snacks is a good alternative to park food. Relatively cheap, fast and good.

Summary Heading: Gorgeous replica of an old lodge
Summary: I highly recommend staying here for easy access to the parks, Disneyland and California Adventure.  Nice amenities, staff and restaurants.  We older room service every morning for breakfast and it was wonderful.

This is such a beautiful Disney Resort!! Amazing customer service!! Beautiful room!! We were able to check in at 11 am. We stayed for 3 days. We were contemplating staying at a hotel for a cheaper price, but decided to keep our reservations at this resort so my son could fully take in all of Disney. The price of the resort is so worth it!! I will always stay at one of the Disneyland Resorts when visiting Disneyland. Especially for families with children this is a must. You get to access the park 1 hour early. We were able to visit the park in the morning to afternoon & go back to the room to take a break & rest. Then hit the park again. I was impressed that they cleaned the room twice & left chocolates on the beds.  The room was so beautiful. Looks better than the pics. The pics

My husband and I stayed at the GC for a week, we could not find fault with the hotel cleanliness, service,and location which is excellent, we did discover that our room, along with I think most of the rooms have a lot of outside noise which is frustrating after returning to the hotel for some R an R after a busy day in the park. Most of the rooms border either downtown disney where they play loud canned D music on a one hour loop over and over and over again until 2-3am every night! Our roomed faced CA and we would hear the speakers fire up the same ol' music at sometimes as early as 4am and as late as 1am. Also the music at the pool was the SAME tired music on a one hour loop everyday that must drive the staff crazy! It's a shame because there is such a rich and diverse archive

I took my kids to Disneyland for a quick 4 day trip.  Our room was ready when we arrived and the desk clerk was amazing.  She was fast, friendly and super helpful.  Our room was very clean and we loved the DCA park view.  Bell services was great as well, bringing our bags right up to the room.  We enjoyed a private cabana by the pool on our first day and had a wonderful and relaxing experience.  Our cabana host ‚ÄúAlexis‚Äù was great.  Very friendly and took care of our needs.  Our servers were also very attentive and friendly.  This was my first stay at the GC.  I have to say, even though I prefer the Disneyland Hotel just because of the Disney touches, the Grand made a quick trip into a memorable vacation.  Beautiful hotel, top notch service and excellent staff.

We've stayed here numerous times (because, yes, we have young children).  We've also stayed at Disneyland Hotel and Paradise Pier.  The Grand Californian has gotten increasingly expensive and is probably not the best value.  However, if it's within your budget (and/or if you have really young children), it is hands down the most convenient and best option for Disneyland Resort.  I have increased the overall rating from 4 stars to 5 stars this time around because Disney did an excellent job with its recent remodel of this hotel.  The rooms are brighter, better designed, and seemingly more spacious (due to improved layout).  As has always been the case, this is by far the most convenient hotel to the parks -- I can't stress this point enough.    If your children are older (or if

Summary Heading: Great location and service. Worth the splurge.
Summary: We booked three rooms here for a family vacation because we thought it was the best choice when traveling with a toddler who needed to go back to the hotel for a nap. Turned out to be the best choice for the tired grandparents too - there were days when I could not have walked an inch further. Hotel is newly renovated. We had a room on the atrium, so got noise from the lobby, but were able to run the fan continuously to block that out. Room had a walk-in shower and balcony. There is a step stool under the sink for those, like me, who find the bed high. Another room was on the monorail, but that was not as noisy as you would expect, and the kids loved it. They also loved the foldout couch in that room. The third room was supposed to be the quietest, but there was loud banging at

Summary Heading: Beautiful Hotel spoiled by the layout
Summary: Disney's GC is a beautiful hotel and the renovation really gave an uplift to some of the dreary overused rooms. We recently stayed in a 2 bedroom suite which had more than ample space for my party of 6. Additionally, it had a wrap around balcony overlooking Downtown Disney and small portions of both Parks which offered an excellent view of the fireworks. The suite showed no sign of wear, everything worked properly and housekeeping was excellent. I have one major problem with this hotel and that is the layout. We had a half mile walk from the entrance to our suite! I find this unacceptable since, with just a little planning, this hotel could have been conveniently accessible to both parks and Downtown Disney. This made going back to the hotel during the course of the day very

Great location right near the parks with direct access to both parks and downtown disney. All spaces are cozy and warm, and the rooms are nice. Great shower. I admit that I was expecting a more "themed" room, but it was not even close. Just plain classic interiors. Breakfast at the Storytellers Cafe is basic but the experience with the Disney characters (we had Goofy, Pluto, Chip & Dale, Kenai...) is awesome for kids. Service at the hotel is great, the staff is very friendly. Room service takes like forever, but the food is good.  Consider that, being a Disney hotel, everything is quite expensive.

We actually travelled December 2016 but TripAdvisor doesn't have that as an option. We have stayed at this hotel twice now and absolutely love it. I agree that the rooms are seriously in need of an update (and I believe that has now happened) but there is almost no price that you can put on the convenience offered to you by this resort. Although we didn't use the private entrance for early morning access to the park as we found it quicker to go around to the main entry, we used this throughout the day to come and go from the parks. It was actually quicker to go from Disneyland, through into California Adventure and then into our hotel rather than walking through Downtown Disney. The staff were wonderful ,service was terrific and the lobby is breathtaking. Yes you can stay at

Summary Heading: The Cost of the Convenience of Walking Directly Into the Park Is Worth It
Summary: We stayed at the Grand Californian for our honeymoon in March 2018 during California Adventure's Food and Wine Festival.  Hotel Indigo is our go to spot but we wanted to make this trip special so we decided to splurge for the Grand Californian.    We only stayed two nights, Saturday and Sunday, and our room each night was in excess of $600.00.  Just writing that gives me chills.  We could have stayed at Hotel Indigo during the off-season for 4 days for the price of 2 days at the Grand Californian.  Granted we could have stayed at Paradise Pier or the Disneyland Hotel but the purpose of staying at the Grand Californian was to have easy access to the parks.   We arrived at the hotel from the airport via Lyft.  The Lyft ride from John Wayne Airport was relatively quick.  We debated

We are DVC members so stay in DVC rooms, but the resort overall is excellent. They have their own entrance into California Adventure Park and access for extra magic hours. The quick service restaurant is fine, but not great. The rooms are spacious and have a high class cabin like feel. The pools are fairly large, but often busy. Would recommend for a family since it is a short walk to Magic Kingdom from the resort. Be aware that some rooms have park views which in theory is great to see World of Color, but when the parks are open late you have noise from the rides. Goofy's Sky School is near some of the rooms and if you get a room near there you can hear guests screaming until the park closes. Would recommend getting a room not near there.

Summary Heading: Nice Place But Make No Mistake - You're Paying For Location
Summary: Our first trip to Disneyland, we figured why not go all out and stay at the Grand Californian for a week. The price was a little easier to swallow with their Canadian promotion, basically making the dollar on par.  We booked a "Woods-Courtyard View" which equaled the 3rd floor, looking out the back onto the monorail track. It was a pretty cool view actually - fun sitting on the small balcony and watch the monorail go by. (very good sound proofing in the room - you could not hear it with the windows closed). Our double queen room was very spacious. A very well designed room that allowed for luggage to be stored neatly under the bed, lots of storage and sitting space, separate sink and bathroom areas, and power outlets and USB plugs everywhere including bedside. This was deisgned

Stunning resort! We stayed in a two bedroom villa that two bedrooms and three full bathrooms. Room slept 9! Pool is amazing as well. You feel like you are secluded from Disneyland there! Easy access to both theme parks, especially California Adventure.

Summary Heading: Great rooms and location, busy pool
Summary: We chose to stay at this hotel during a trip to Disneyland and Disney California adventure. The rooms are well laid out for a family. In comparison to some of the rooms in Disney World, including on property hotels, these rooms are slightly larger, and are very modern and comfortable. Rooms were very clean and without any visible repair needs.  The pool area was extremely busy, making access to lounge chairs and to the hot tub, difficult. The location is excellent with respect to proximity to Disneyland and California Adventure. It is so nice to walk right into the parks.  The quick serve eating area is smaller than Disneyworld hotels, but the proximity to Downtown Disney, and, other eating locations, certainly makes this a non-issue.  Overall service at the hotel is consistent

By staying at the hotel you get magic hours, which is great to be able to visit the park an hour before it opens. The rooms are very practical, recently remolded with family in mind. The bed are high off the ground allowing for plenty of storage for luggage under the bed. The little twin bed that can be flipped over into a couch was actually big enough for my 3 year old and 5 year old to share. They slept with their heads at opposite ends, this allowed our teenager to have her own bed. Staying at the hotel allowed us to maximize our the 2 days we have at Disney.

Summary Heading: At best 2 star service and accomodation
Summary: The only positive for this hotel is it‚Äôs outstanding location. Other than that you will be paying $1000 a night for: /- small outdated room  - zero Disney character or decor in the hotel - signs of wear and tear everywhere  - waiting up to an hour for someone to answer the phone for your luggage - very ordinary but overpriced food & beverage  At least at Disneyland Hotel in Hong Kong you pay a premium but the place is full of Disney character and entertainment. At Grand Californian, you pay Ritz Carlton prices for a motor inn accomodation and service.

Ok so we travelled in the busy time thanks giving and even though this hotel was being renovated at the time the location is what sells it every time. You enter the park an hour before everyone else so before rope drop each day one of the parks opens early each day -at this busy time it makes it worth because wait times on cars can blow out to over 90 mins even with max pass I saw them even close the normal line off. By the way max pass is the way too go no runners needed just a phone the Disney app away you go and when you go on a ride that ride still stays valid for a period hence we went on cars again and quickly again toy story. Anyway enough about the parks we booked club level it was a waste the room was small and at the time no club level so no benefit at all I‚Äôm sure it

This isn't a bad hotel.  It is the only one of the three Disney hotels built by Disney.  It has a lot of exposed wood in the lobby, and looks kind of like  a lodge.  There is nothing particularly fancy about the rooms, and the hallways can be long.  The hotel has six floors.  Some of the rooms look over the two parks, others look over the city.  The showers have a glass wall which looks very classy, and two shower heads.  Each room has a Keurig coffee maker.  Each morning there is a 2-mile power walk in the Grand California Adventure Park before it opens.  There is also an entrance to the Grand California Adventure Park exclusively for the hotel guests.  Wifi is good.  There is also a good selection of channels on the TV, for those times when you are tired of the park.  Is it

Location can‚Äôt be beat! Beautiful hotel with incredibly easy access to parks. Rooms, bar, restaurant, pools all gorgeous and up to Disney primo standards. Comfy beds and great amenities. In my opinion much better than Disneyland hotel.

It's Disney.   For Disneyland it was great!    Our room was wonderful, clean and inviting and quiet. It was great to have a go to place when the crowds became to much.   We were there after Christmas so enjoyed the decorations.   We did not have a great many staff encounters, but those we did have were nice.   We did eat one of our meals at the Cafe there.  It was an odd hour and we were seated right away.  The food was actually quite good.  We did do the same Cafe for brunch and were not as pleased, for the price.   We have never been able to stay here due to the prices, however, this time we were lucky to find a discount.   Yes, we would stay here again, if we could get that discount.  More expensive than the "local" hotels but well worth the price!!

The location of this hotel is well worth the cost. The staff is one of the best I have ever encountered. The rooms are clean and the hotel itself is an adventure. Security was great they have to check all bags but they are polite and it moves along quickly. The surroundings are beautiful, you feel like you are miles away from the city. The lobby is like a lodge in Yellowstone Park. The extra cost is worth it just for the location.

Remember the scene in the Wizard of Oz when they pull back the curtain, only to find it's not what it appears to be?      My family and I stayed here late January for my birthday.  But what was soon to follow was more along the lines of a one-star hotel. First off,    If you skim the 1 & 2 star reviews you will see one common thread amongst all of them... terrible service. I am here to say that this is 100% true. There seems to be this belief that Disney's service is the best. Not true. In fact, I've noticed more employees of The Grand Californian Hotel who "just do their job." It's very robotic. And not once did I catch that feeling of the exceptional service and going above and beyond.   DAY ONE.  In the evening, we went down to their bar just off of the grand lobby. The area

This hotel has been so disappointing--it's been one bad experience after another.  I have stayed at many Disney hotels at Disneyworld--Floridian, Polynesian-- and the Four Seasons Orlando--and they were all less expensive with 10 times the service. 1. We had booked one night and wanted to extend to two nights. I asked the front desk to  extend our room and they told me I had to call Disney to extend the trip??? What front desk can't extend a room stay with no problem? I then spent another 20 minutes on hold with Disney while my kids were dying to get to the park--and Disney told me the hotel was sold out and I would have to ask the front desk--WTF?? I almost started crying. Finally I called and asked to talk to the manager and they extended our stay (although at this point I

Summary Heading: Stunning decor, Super Close Proximity to the Parks!!!!!
Summary: This is a great hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The decor is gorgeous. There is a separate entrance to Disney's California Adventure Park. Very convenient. There is a quick service restaurant with the usual including Mickey waffles of course. The proximity to Downtown Disney and the two parks is just unbeatable. You walk outside and you're right there.  The rooms are spacious and decorated nicely. The bathroom has a large shower with a small bench. The sinks are separated from the toilet and shower which is nice for a larger family trying to get ready.  They have regular turn down service which is so nice.  If you are going to Disneyland and staying on property this the hotel you want to be at for sure.

We were celebrating a very special birthday.  We all traveled to Anaheim on our own, but were reunited in the lobby of the Grand Californian.  The Disney people managed to get us all booked into rooms next to each other.  All the employees have a "can do" attitude.  We took our car off the property twice while we were guests.  Each time it was so easy and they made us feel welcome every time. The valet, bellboys, the front desk clerks, the maids--all the employees make you feel very special.  While it is not inexpensive to stay at the hotel, it is totally worth it.  Having early access to Disneyland and California Adventure on alternating days is very important.  Also having access to Downtown Disney is really great.  I can only say that this trip was extremely nice.  The rooms

Summary Heading: Stunning on site Disney hotel, v. expensive though
Summary: Stayed for three nights at the Grand Californian at the end of our American adventure. Had just come from 5 nights at the yacht club Walt Disney world which I really enjoyed.   Stayed in a standard view room so no view to speak of except over the roof of part of the hotel! Did see the monorail go by every six minutes so that was cool. See my photo.   Asked for an upgrade to California Adventure park view if possible. Was told in no uncertain terms by the check in agent that I had only paid for a woods view room. Fine.   I was glad I got my request for near the lobby and elevator fulfilled. I rang ahead and actually somehow got through to the hotel. We were in the first floor and could use the stairwell to get to the lobby and out from there. Surprising how often you go in and

Summary Heading: Good location parking a bit confusing
Summary: Stayed here for 6 nights, pulling in to unload was a bit confusing and we only had to luggages and did not need assistance they had me park in their 20 min parking area which is ok but why couldn‚Äôt I unload first then park. To me that was not a good start, but other than that our experience was good. Checkin went smoothly and my daughter got a birthday button and got some great info about the park ours and activities. Our room was clean but whatever updates they did I could not see here unless this room was not updated (dvc studio room). Bed was comfy and we had several good nights sleep on it. I have an issue with ac system it did not cool the room good enough and did not run long enough. Entrance to dca is amazing and very convenient, we love it. Downtown Disney and Disneyland

Our family of 6 (4 adults and 2 small children) rented 2 standard adjoining rooms for 3 nights at this hotel. While it is not inexpensive, its location made our choice perfect. It is located with a 100 meters from the entrance to the Disneyland Theme park, which was our destination. Being located on the Downtown Disney thoroughfare of shops and eateries made it very convenient. The hotel rooms were well appointed, although I found the mattress too soft for my taste. The rooms are well insulated. Located on the 6th floor we had a nice view of the sunset and Downtown Disney. There are 3 restaurants on the premises with 3 different price points for fare. The Storyteller caf√© was excellent for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The Storyteller breakfast buffet and dinner buffet were

We went with the family and got a three bedroom suite.  The entire stay and experience were amazing!  The staff from the valets, bellmen, front desk, housekeeping were all fantastic!!    The suite was amazing!  Great views, great bed, furniture, etc.

Summary Heading: Touring the hotel, not wheelchair friendly
Summary: Entering from the park, DCA, is easy enough, although if should you walk away from this hotel toward the street-side, you cant get back into it!, at least not while sitting in a Disneyland rented wheelchair. If your wearing a business suit, youll have no problem walking past the sidewalk goons in yellow jackets, however they will stop and scream at anyone entering the property who is in a wheel chair for some reason. The security guards wont tell you any of this until you have already left, only then tell you, a they did me, to walk about a mile and a half through downtown disney to regain access to DCA.

Great location for a holiday celebration service is excellent, great views of the park. The room  although for two people could‚Äôve accommodated at least four. Character dining.  Rooms newly remodeled,  loved our stay

When making our reservation, I did mention that the hotel stay was for my birthday. When we arrived, we were warmly greeted and I was presented with a happy birthday button. The  staff member helping with the luggage led us on and on- we wondered where he could possibly be taking us!!!  I had paid for a standard room. We were led into a three room suite with a wraparound balcony overlooking the park, downtown Disney, and with a view of the castle. The bedroom was easily twice as large as a standard hotel room. There was a bathroom nearly the size of a hotel room. Gorgeous marble. Double sinks. There was a wet bar! In the living room.  We were amazed. I was  truly estatic that Disney upgraded us. Without even mentioning it. For a romantic get away, the Grand Californian is well

Summary Heading: Location is sometimes overvalued especially in this case
Summary: So you stay here for that once in a lifetime experience. With taxes I paid $500 per night your money would be better spent 1 block away at another hotel. Yes it is close but you still have to walk a long way to get into Disneyland because of security . If your just doing California Disney it is closer. Does the location justify the cost. Absolutely not. See my pictures nothing really special about this overpriced room. I only had a drink on the property and the food is crazy high in the restaurants. No microwave in rooms but they do have a refrigerator and safe.I would never go back you can uber in from another hotel. And the pool closed at 8 pm can you believe that . Way to early. The rooms were all renovated so I was underwhelmed and dread the bill I still have to pay .I

I so wanted to love this hotel it is SO beautiful, however, we had problem after problem, the rooms were small, and slightly shabby, not a 4 star experience more like 2. Wall paper was ripped. There was a fire alarm that went off and the supervisor Marie at the gate from Ca Adventure to the hotel refused to let ANYONE through the gate, those trying to evacuate the hotel or us who had handicapped people in the room. Leaving our adult loved ones for 10 minutes should not have been an issue, but Marie made it a huge issue. She should not be in charge of an ant farm. Trip ruined, afraid to leave the room at this place with any physically handicapped person

Summary Heading: Premium Quality Resort Connected to the Disneyland Parks
Summary: The Grand Californian is a great hotel for Disneyland Parks guests.  Depending on when you go, the price may not match the value of convenience.  The staff and service are top notch! The room is very similar to most Disney resort hotels.  I decided to surprise my wife for her birthday by booking a weekend at the Grand Californian.  She knew we were going to Disneyland but I forged a Marriott hotel order from the previous year to look like it was for this trip.  I found the best deal from Costco.com where they give you meal vouchers, discounted tickets, discounted room prices.  I called ahead to mention we were celebrating my wife's birthday.  When we arrived, the wife was super surprised!  The checkin staff is pretty efficient so we were able to get our room pretty quickly.

Summary Heading: A Disneyland trip made even better!
Summary: From the moment we checked in, I knew I had made the right choice to book us into the Grand Californian. The location and ease of moving between the two parks makes this hotel a perfection selection. The early morning access to the parks was a bonus.

We have stayed at this property numerous times and have always loved it. The staff is great, the rooms are clean and the the ambiance is just wonderful. My husband and I will be vising again (kid free) for our 10 year anniversary and are so excited to enjoy the hotel just the two of us. This will most likely be our last trip for a while as prices for the parks and hotels are getting a bit too high for us to afford our family annual trip. We love this hotel though and if you can afford it we definitely recommend it!

We stayed here for 2 nights recently and were super impressed with the style of the hotel and it‚Äôs location close to Disneyland and The California Adventure Park. The location easily allows one to come back to the hotel and go back out in the same day. Facilities and restaurants were all excellent. It costs a bit more but I would highly recommend

Summary Heading: I really did try to find something wrong...
Summary: It is rare that I would review a hotel and not have a suggestion for improvement. This Disney property exceeded my expectations in all areas. Staff is ever-present but never bothersome. I always felt well-taken care of in all respects. There is a sense of friendly respect and safety that is part of the culture at this resort. Location is ideal in its proximity to the park and Downtown Disney. Room accommodations were superb and I was unable to find fault with anything. The hotel is built in the style of the grand lodges of our National Parks. Decorating ambiance is rooted in the American Arts and Crafts era.There are many unique features that create a genuine WOW factor. This property is ideal for families but I was traveling for business and found it to meet all my needs as

We decided to indulge as we had two 70+ year old travelling with us so we thought the proximity to the parks would help, but there was so much more to staying here than the location!  The place has the most incredible atmosphere.  The service is very good (although with lots of people the check in is very attentive and helpful but still a bit slow to get to the front of the line), the foyer is breathtaking and a destination in itself, and the rooms are gorgeous.  Beds were comfy, and we were given interconnecting rooms without even asking which was brilliant!  The bathroom is very nice, there is plenty of room to move (it's not enormous but plenty when you're only really going there to sleep!) and the ability to stow your luggage under the bed allows you to maximise the space.

I've stayed here many times, and if the price is in your budget, go for it. The rooms are clean and comfy, and our balcony usually overlooks Downtown Disney or the pool. You can access California Adventure right from the hotel, you also walk right into Downtown Disney. It's a real treat to stay here. The hotel's architecture is really beautiful, from the lamps at check it, to the beautiful woodwork. It's our favorite place to stay when visiting Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Can‚Äôt beat the location, overall great stay
Summary: Overall we really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We spent three nights here and visited the parks for three days. You cannot beat the location of this hotel. You have a private entrance into California Adventure, and a private entrance into downtown Disney which is about a 3 minute walk from the main Disneyland entrance. From the time we left our room on the third floor to getting into California adventure it was literally under 5 minutes, and the walk to Disneyland from our room was probably 5-7 minutes door to door. You can‚Äôt beat that   In terms of the actual hotel and the rooms I thought they were nice. Everything has been renovated and the level of service and security particularly when you arrive was fantastic. The rooms are nice but nothing special, however I really

Summary Heading: Possibly the best place to stay at Disneyland.
Summary: My experience on the concierge floor was near perfection - food & drink in the lounge were very good and they did not restrict taking them to your room. It is a huge complex so be sure to obtain a map and get familiar with the layout when you check in.  The concierge ladies were truly exceptional - over my three days there they fully answered all questions and offered additional tips.  There was one lady I kidded about sleeping there - she was there when I retired in the evening and there in the morning - she exceeded my expectations.  The only reason I did not give five stars was the employee who I first met downstairs and followed to the concierge floor seemed very distracted - focused on anything but the person he was checking in.  Also, the promised "view" of the park

One review out of almost 5000 wont make much of a difference. Great location. Rooms are a bit on the small size. Nice pools and amenities. We were there on a normal weekend and found it very difficult to get meal reservations.

Summary Heading: Entirely Overpriced, Even for the Location
Summary: Came for a wedding, and, even with the discounted event rates, it's not worth it.  When I came into reception, it was a madhouse.  Many, many folks trying to check-in early to in order to drop their luggage and go into the parks.  The cast member at the front of the line who should have been helping direct people spent most of her time writing down names and marking them off, and chit-chatting with people about random stuff.  Rooms are never ready early because no one has to actively check out.  You're allowed to just leave your room before 11:00a.  This is convenient, but housekeeping cannot get a head start because they don't know which rooms are unoccupied.  I had reservations for different rooms for different nights, and this seemed to confuse the desk agent.  He eventually

I was hesitant about booking here after reading many negative reviews; however, I really liked this hotel.  The lobby was beautiful and the room was spacious.  Other than eating breakfast in White Water Snacks and having a few drinks in the lounge, we didn't use any of the other amenities.  But I feel like the price of the room was justified as the location can't be beat.  No time was wasted riding buses or the monorail to get to the parks.  It was a quick 5 min walk through Downtown Disney to Disneyland and access to California Adventure was super convenient and quick as hotel guests have direct access to it.  My only complaint is that the walls are a bit thin.  I could hear my neighbors having a conversation.  And I wish the sink part of the bathroom had a sliding door so that

Upon arriving in our room on an unusually cold day we discovered our room heat was not working.  Maintenance came into our room and decided that the problem was a valve that needed to be turned on somewhere else in the hotel in order for our room to get heat.  After several hours of waiting the valve was located and it was found in the off position.  Maintenance resolved our problem and at last we had heat.  The lobby area was very cold and guests were sitting in the lobby with coats on.  The staff was exceptional!!  Many of the rides at the Park were experiencing malfunctions and long repair times.  There is a lot of construction inside the park.  Housekeeping is top notch!  Overall a wonderful stay except for the initial heat problem which was resolved in a most professional

Summary Heading: You are paying for location- that's mostly it.
Summary: I agree with the previous reviewers- this is not a 5 star hotel. Not even 4 stars really when it comes to the rooms.  The main areas are beautiful, but, the rooms are basic in the extreme.  The staff is decent, but not exceptional ( we just returned from the Ritz Carlton in Honolulu, so, we have seen exceptional).  We only got turn down service the first night.  Not sure what the situation was after that.  We were also there for the midnight evacuation which was scary, and freezing, and were also pretty surprised that there was no mention of it during the rest of our stay from the staff.   We stay here every year because we like having the dedicated entrance into the park, and that we don't have to drive anywhere once we get here.  If you are happy paying for that convenience,

Summary Heading: Hard To Find Something I Actually Liked
Summary: This hotel is about one thing: you‚Äôre close to Disneyland. Beyond that it is incredibly difficult to find anything else that was positive or that I could recommend. This resort is below a Courtyard by Marriott level experience at a 5 star plus price. Waste of money. Skip it.

There are both some positives and negative‚Äòs about the hotel. The location first off is fabulous. You are literally steps from the park and downtown Disney. After that it all goes downhill.  We found the service to be lacking. The staff was not friendly. The rooms were small and basic. They were certainly clean and comfortable but nothing more than what you would expect from a standard Marriott hotel. While they advertise on their websites that their runs can accommodate five people, they do not guarantee anything. So if you are looking for a room that can accommodate a family of five I would suggest looking elsewhere. When we checked in we were not able to get a room that could accommodate our family and ended up having someone sleep on the floor. Well we were able to switch to

Stayed here for the 2nd time recently, after a previous stay maybe 8 years ago. Public facilities are as nice as ever, and rooms have been renovated, now modern with a great shower and nice decor. It's a nice hotel, but when you're paying this much you expect higher quality service than you get. Staff was friendly and professional, but without the extra touches of a 5 star hotel. No bottled water in the rooms, turn down service knocks once, and if you're in the room at that moment, never returns. We had a midnight fire alarm go off one night, leaving all of us outside for about 20 minutes. Next morning, was there a note from management apologizing for the inconvenience, or offering some token of appreciation? Nope! You're clearly paying for the Disney proximity, and I still

This was our 1st stay at the Grand Californian. We stayed 3 nights/4 day. We stayed on the 5th floor premium view with balcony room. The view of the pools & you could clearly see the wolf of Grizzly Peak & Guardians/Galaxy from our window. One of my good friends exclusively stays here for her DL trips. It‚Äôs truly beautiful & we couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better experience. The easy entrance to Cali Adventures & Magic Hour made all the difference! We were able to go into Cali Adventures & ride 5 of the top rides the first hour without the wait on Friday morning. Then got fast passes as we went from ride to ride with my friends planning expertise. That‚Äôs amazing! We had a blast! I only have a few pics of the inside of the hotel & a pool/slide. Enjoy

I've stayed at this property at least 50x...which is why I was pleasantly surprised to discover a room update had finally taken place. This was badly needed. The update I must declare is very good. The most significant update was to the shower area; they finally went modern! They have showers now with overhead rain head nozzle option ...a pleasant update to say the least. There is even a bench seat in the shower, which women should appreciate for shaving. The downside of this stay was that the Napa Rose was closed the night I had people meeting me there. Closed for a private party. I hate that, so rude to all other guests. Another negative was that the driveway was a mess, they closed an entire lane and just don't have the room to accommodate everyone. Not too big a deal. One

Summary Heading: Great Location, But Lacking Hospitality Basics
Summary: This is a great location, with Downtown Disney and the theme parks right out the door.  The hotel itself is probably the same level as the standard Hilton or Marriott.  However, I found the hospitality lacking.  The employees didn't seem to do the basics of hospitality, such as greeting the guests first.  Several times an employee would be in the same elevator as we were, or simply pass us in the hotel corridor, with not so much as an acknowledgment. This includes security, housekeeping, concierge, and restaurant employees. I usually stay at Hilton's and Marriott's and employees there, no matter what luxury level of the property, always seem to greet and acknowledge me no matter where they see me.  Sometimes it's as simple as a smile and a "good morning".  These seemed to be

The room is lovely, but has the worst hotel shower I‚Äôve ever experienced. It looks fancy, but completely useless. I understand the need to conserve water, but there comes a point when you waste more by trying to rinse in a trickle. The overhead rain shower, even when not activated, drips torturous cold water. No fun at all, and nothing like the relaxing experience I was hoping for.

I love, love, love this hotel!!!! Staff is so friendly! Rooms are spacious and such comfortable beds!!!! Made it hard to get out of bed in the mornings!!! The fact that you can walk right out of the hotel into California Adventure Park is a major plus!! Hotel has several dining choices with great food. And one of my favorite places is the lobby! The grand fireplace with a fire always burning and rocking chairs to sit in as you sit by the fire is just another reason I love this place!! And not to mention it is in the middle of the Happiest Place on Earth....Disneyland!!!

We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite. Was well laid out, spacious and clean. The renovations have made a difference. Our only issue was the room was sooooooo far away from the lobby, it took forever to get there. Painful given it is literally overseeing the Disney Downtown yet you had to go through the lobby but you can't take that away from the hotel :)

Loved our stay at this hotel leading up to Christmas 2017. Double rooms are a bit on the small side but we didn't spend that much time in the room given the theme parks are a short walk from the hotel. Room service food quality was good and the food came promptly. The character breakfast buffet at this hotel we had on Christmas day was average considering the price we paid. Aside from that this is a character filled wonderful hotel with the best location to access the theme parks.

It‚Äôs 3:20 am and right outside my sliding window is a full on construction crew with bulldozers, forklifts generators and the constant beep, beep beep of vehicles backing up making it impossible to sleep. Called to complain and told sorry we do construction 24 hours a day. The first 2 days with non-stop jack hammering right outside our our window we lived with because we were off to the parks, but all night long is too much! So now we had to move rooms in the middle of the night from our ‚Äúupgraded‚Äù Downtown Disney view to a room with a half size balcony overlooking a rooftop. Worst, worst night I have ever had at a hotel! Wish I could post a video to show how truly bad it was.

Hotel is located just 10 min walk to Disney parks as the best part you could break your day from parks and rest in hotel. Also it has direct access to Disney Californian adventure park  (mostly people might not know).  We visited during Christmas time the lobby decorated festive with gingerbread house. Hotel is located in Disney downtown and Cinema is in there to enjoy holiday times movies.  We also used the spa facility, while kids at Kids club ( Secure facility) Jacuzzi was great and also Christmas eve dinner with characters.

This hotel is connected to the California Adventure Park but along with being a Disney resort it is very expensive. The customer service is excellent and everything looks new. The restaurants are very good and it has a nice fitness center. It has multiple pools with a water slide.

Chose a great time to come to Disneyland! The weather was amazing and the lines were short. Reserved a premium view room, got a view of the pool if you came out on the balcony. The room was small but nice. Beds were comfortable and service was always good. Brought our own Keurig pods for the machine which was convenient. Used room service twice, was very quick. Food was okay, nothing outstanding. There is construction going on that started at 7:45 outside our sliding door but we were up already to go to the parks. Overall it was expensive but convenient.

I stay in suites. I reserved a king suite. I checked in - the LONGEST check in EVER- and went to a room with 2 beds.   I will say this to anyone reading: try the Disneyland Hotel first. Please. If you are open to it? Stay at a NON Disney hotel.  You get points AND its a far better value! I decided to reserve too late, it seems and ended up thinking the Grand Californian would be cool.   It is not.  The rooms are very very cheap. I have stayed in Residence Inn's that are better than these rooms.   This hotel is ridiculously loud. The bathrooms are embarrassing. Room service is not ok. (If you are unable to eat pork? Their menu option shows chicken sausage but they :: dont have that anymore:: and their workers don't know that bacon and ham don't have pork in them... request turkey

The location of this hotel is very convenient.  However I was quite disappointed in some services.  Specifically the room was not cleaned one day before we returned very late. The housekeeping did not refurbish basics such as shampoo, conditioner, shower cap, and body wash.  They did not refurbish the coffee or cups. The ice machine from the floor didn't work.  After telling at least eight employees about it, it still was not fixed.  Would I stay here again.  No, I would not.  If you pay these kind of prices, a person should have the service the payment deserves.

We live in Los Angeles, as don't go to the park very often- keeping it for occasions, etc. This time I decided to go all out (it was leading up to my bday weekend) and create a nice memory. We stayed at this hotel and it didn't disappoint- to the point that i'm not sure I can ever stay anywhere else.. maybe another disney hotel... but having your own entrance to the park is pretty amazing. My husband got sick on the Star Tour ride so it was perfect to have the hotel right there. The day before that my daughter wanted some time to rest and play with toys- so we went to the room and I took a nap for about 30 min before heading back out into the park.  The hotel is pretty amazing from the moment you pull up to LA. The valet are wearing old fashion outfits- and you know your

The resort was very nice, decor was great. The only issue I had was eating. Limited restaurants in the hotel, and very expensive. For an example, the storyteller restaurant only offers a buffet breakfast, nothing else, and it is $34.00 US. That $40 Canadian.  Total gouging.

Stuck on a customer service issue. For 2 days was hunting down morning coffee because I didn't want to wake the others in my room. The hotel has nothing available until 6:30am. Being from the east coast, I'm up for a few hours already. The second day, the coffee outlet failed to open. I went to the front desk twice. Instead of helping me (there has to be someplace I can get coffee) they were more concerned that the food group had not notified them there was an issue. I dont care, i just want coffee. Several times I said, "there has to be someplace open because I see people with drinks". It wasn't until a passing woman heard the conversation and said that the Starbucks in Downtown Disney was open. Not any more of a walk than the only place in the hotel to get late night coffee.

The hotel is average to below average for the cost and the amenities in the room, but completely worth it for location.  It has direct access to California Adventures with a special gate (get in fast, easy, and early).

I felt spoiled here.  The bed sheets and towels were so soft.  The shower was perfect and so happy for great in room coffee. Everyone went out of the way to help in the hotel.  Even through I was there for work it was relaxing.  The walking proximity to Disney for food and parks was fantastic. Highly recommend!

Outstanding location and quality hotel. Lots of Disney attentiveness everywhere. The Critters breakfast is the best of the Disney character dining options across the parks and is conveniently located next to the private entrance into CalAdventure park. Regular rooms easily fit family of five people without extra charge.  Only downside is the cost. But you‚Äôre paying for the location and the Disney brand.

Part II of family trip with kids and grandkids...  Grandma and Grandpa stay at The Grand Californian when going to Disneyland.  It is adjacent to Downtown Disney and a relatively short walk to Disneyland and even has its own entrance to California Adventures!  Our room was recently refurbished in the theme appropriate to this hotel.  Sooo handy to have a refrigerator in the room and a walk-in shower in the bathroom.  USB charge ports were part of the nightstand lighting!  Sooo nice!  Bell staff were super helpful, making sure we knew about hidden wallpaper (I‚Äôm not telling!) and restaurant hints.  Room service was delivered within 30 minutes and breakfast was delicious!   Although it is expensive to stay here, it is oh sooooo convenient to go to your room to relax, then go back

The hotel was nice, the rooms were comfortable and the staff was great. I think the only thing I was disappointed with was they had a "cold menu" for room service. I think they were renovating their kitchen or something. This was kind of a pain because the kids just wanted to get something and not go out again. Bed was comfortable and room was clean. Nice hotel for sure!

Summary Heading: Wish we‚Äôd had hot water, but...
Summary: Was in town for a convention, not for the Disney experience. The hotel had boiler problems, which warranted in a complete water turn off (over night in the wee hours), which was ok. But resulted in no hot water for next two days. Cold showers are not my thing! If kids had been on this trip, would have been a huge problem. That being said, the hotel has amazing perks for the little ones! Cute area to relax while the adults check in. Perfect height peep holes to look through the upstairs railings to the lobby below. Sweetest Murphy-style couch/beds a kid could hope for. Lovely pool area. And no one should be able to say there were not enough electrical plugs in the room. Multi plugs for electric and USB cords in three convenient spots!

Summary Heading: Beware. Thieves in the Bell Service
Summary: I‚Äôm quite disappointed with our stay and the service by their employees. It starts with, I left my purse with the Bell Service and 50 dollars was taken from it. (I know dumb move leaving cash. But heck, it‚Äôs Disney!?). I know specifically that it was 50 dollars because I had a 50 dollar bill and some other money but only the 50 dollar bill was taken. Of course, this was disheartening but then when I called to report it I was told I would have to file a report with security. Okay, bothered because I would have to take time out of my day from the parks. However, I agreed and it took about an hour. I was given a ticket by security and said to call back a number in three days for results of investigation and then was given an option to file a police report. I asked to speak again
