We had to change our plans last minute so there was very limited hotel availability for our 3 nights we planned on staying at disney. This was our first visit to Disney. So we decided to splurge and stay here.  Check in was fairly quick, we arrived a little before 3.  A personalized button was given to our youngest daughter since we were celebrating her 10th birthday. We used the pool facilities until our room was ready at about 330.  We asked a pool attendant for a band aid because our daughter had scraped her leg on the beach the day before. He was very agreeable but the bandaid never came (small things like this do make a difference when paying over 500 a night)  Luggage brought up quickly. Remodeled room was very nicely done, not large but adequate.    The room cleanliness

My family stayed there earlier this week. Water was shut off from midnight to 5 a.m. There was no hot water in the morning. When this was raised with the front desk, absolutely no concern about the problem it caused my family. Worst experience at a Disneyland facility ever.

Summary Heading: Disney hotels are always nice, and this was no different!
Summary: Friendly staff, quick check in. They have chairs in the lobby for little ones to watch TV while you wait if your room isn't ready. Lots of places to sit in the lobby for visiting and waiting, too. I believe the rooms have been recently renovated and they did a great job. Loved the large shower that included a rain shower as well as removable head/sprayer. Wished the bathroom sink area was included in the toilet/shower area and that it could have been closed off by a door -- I was staying with my 12 year old daughter and a friend so having no private place to change clothes was awkward unless you changed in with the toilet/shower -- which was tight.  One other peculiar thing: the bed height. TALL. I mean really tall.  I'm 5'5" and needed a step. I decided to sleep on the pull out

We stayed a weekend at the Grand. I always wanted to stay there. Boy was I disappointed. The rooms are just average rooms. I guess I was expecting to be wowed for the 630.00 I paid per night. There is not much in the hotel, but of course you do have down town Disney. The way the fireplace is set up you cant enjoy it, unless you get the chairs that are in the front. Otherwise you are looking at other peoples chairs. Bad set up. The beds are hard, the shower had very low pressure. I would not stay there again for the price. I will stay across the street and have the same type of room for a 1/4 of the price. It might even have some Disney decor in it because The Grand did not have that either.   Oh and before you plan your trip you should check and make sure the attractions you are

When my baby sitter plans fell through my husband decided to surprise me with a one night staycation at Disneyland for our 15 wedding anniversary (we have annual passes).  We valet parked ($30 a day) and with only one overnight bag we took our one suitcase inside. Though there was a short line it took about 15 minutes and another 20 to check in. We were upgraded to a park view, though my husband had paid for what he thought was a partial Park view- turns out a view of Downtown Disney is also part of that price point. Being one night we were lucky enough to get a room facing the bear and looking over the hotel entrance from inside California Adventure. I could see grizzly river rapids ( closed at the time) and Soaring, but the trees off to the right hindered much of the view. It

Summary Heading: Location is good but honestly expected a little better for $600/n
Summary: We had dinner reservations in the park so stayed at the GC for convenience.  Even so, it was a long long walk to our room.  Our free upgrade gave us a balcony overlooking California Adventure, which was nice if you don't mind the constant noise from music and people.  The only place to smoke on this huge property is a small space at the front of the hotel between valet parking and the conference center. Uncovered and unheated, but there are a couple of benches.  Bell and valet service was pretty good considering that we called during the busiest times.    The room has a convenient charging station over the nightstand.  Our charging station made a constant high-pitched squealing noise (almost like tinnitus or feedback) that was just relentless.  I thought I could ignore it but as

For this cost, I would think that they could print me one sheet of paper, valet takes 20 minutes, $50 breakfast, $7 yogart, ...   Save your money. The place is nice, but not even close to worth the cost. It is just a hotel, with 2-star service.

Summary Heading: Great location but that's about it!
Summary: Considering that this is a Disney Hotel and a very expensive hotel, I really expected a lot more!! This Hotel was very disappointing. Here are a few reasons...The view from our room was a gravel roof. They didn't have any children's activities or Characters in the hotel or at the pool. We were excitied about the pool side movie at night, but then learned that it was actually at another Hotel.  The food was below average quality at a premium price. There was simply nothing "magical" about this hotel! I will say that the location was obviously convenient and the staff was friendly.    We spent the first half of our vacation at the Universal Studios Hotel and theme park and we thought we were saving the best for last (Disney)!! With all things considered, Universal was a much

This was our first stay here, so I was expecting greatness, being this is an almost 5-star resort. The rooms are $400/night, so you'd expect GRAND. Once we got to the hotel, we waited in a line of cars 30 mins to get valet, there were THAT many cars waiting and this was on a Sunday. Once we got in, the lines to check in were ghastly, to pay $400/night and to be treated like you were in some party hotel in Vegas was a joke.   Well in advanced, a month actually, and again at check-in, I asked them for an early check in because I had two babies under 3 that needed to get a nap in at least around 3pm, because we had in-park dinner reservations at 6:15. Of course our rooms were not ready, it was only 12 noon, so we checked our luggage and went into the park for a few hours. Finally

Summary Heading: Best place to stay at the park
Summary: There is no better place to stay if you plan to visit the park. Valet your car, check in, enjoy a drink in the lobby or coffee and a pastry on the patio, then hit the park via your private guest entrance. Three lovely pools and a spa for relaxing. Adjacent to downtown Disney for dining, shopping or snacking. Staff are excellent. Rooms are not large, but adequate, many with balconies.

What a great time. You walk out from your hotel and you are in downtown Disney! Then walk right into park and have fun. The 1 bedroom suites are fantastic if they are in budget. Pool and hot tub is beautiful! Food is also perfect. We are at critters restaurant and themed characters come by to pose for pictures!

While Disneyland is 'the most magical place on Earth', it seems that sometimes hotels and food lack the same magic as the park. Grand Californian definitely has some magic. It's a four-star hotel with a nice pool, a nice lobby, and nice rooms. Nothing outstanding or awe-worthy. The staff is probably the most outstanding part. They were always so friendly. The biggest point of the interest at the Grand Californian is the location. Without that, it wouldn't be worth it's generally hefty price per night. Grand Californian is located right next to California Adventure. No shuttles, no extra walking- it's a mere stroll from the lobby and into the park (or into Disney Springs for that matter). During a hot afternoon, we could book fast-passes on our phones, hang out in our rooms or

Let me start by saying that Dan(Raleigh NC) the hotel GM stopped to chat and discovered we were on our honeymoon and promptly brought us two glasses of champagne. What a fantastic start to our stay at the Grand. We were there for Christmas and everything was perfect. The piano player started at 1:30 then the carolers at around 6 pm. We were in the main hotel which was wonderful.  The carolers were professional vocalists and did a variety of Christmas songs. All were amazing. All of the restaurants are great. White water cafe for a quick breakfast is the way to go. Napa Rose has an amazing menu with service that is second to none.  Dan (Raleigh NC) really knows how to run a hotel. The lobby decorations are worth the nightly rate alone. The concierge staff were a little crabby and

After undergoing renovations at this resort, the place is immaculate. I enjoyed 3 days at this resort. The staff was outstanding from front desk, bellman, restaurant worker, bar, and shop staff! My wife and I had a great time and felt spoiled. It was a highlight and a life lasting memory. The hotel is pricey, but it was well worth it. The entrance to DCA is on property and well worth it after getting wet on the river raft ride. Room service was reasonable and portions were large.

We chose to stay here because the Disney Resort Hotel was fully booked and the room offered bunk beds for our children.  The children both said the pool wasn‚Äôt as good as the Disneyland Resort Hotel, especially the slide.    I felt like we got far better value for money at DRH.    Que early or Magic Morning to enter California Adventure Park as the lines get long very quickly.   I will say it was convenient to be able to come and go from the park very easily but I would not stay here again. The rooms were tired and need renovating.

Summary Heading: Not worth the price but great location
Summary: We stayed at the Grand Californian over the Christmas holiday.  The hotel had all of the Disney magic, the lobby and grounds were beautifully decorated and you're as close as you're going to get to the Disneyland entrance.  However, at the price point the room was not worth it.  The beds were very comfortable but the rooms were rather small and the newly renovated bathrooms only had a door to the shower/toilet....which meant waking the kids up with the light when accessing the sink.    There are many hotels in the area where rooms are comparable (and half the price) but the location is pretty spectacular.

Pros- Close to the parks Early entry Comfortable beds Big TV w/good cable Room service Multiple pools & cabanas  Cons- Overpriced  Not enough people working the gates in the morning  Crabby room service guy Thin walls. I heard my neighbors coughing all night

Summary Heading: Just the right amount of Disney.
Summary: Just returned from a convention where we stayed at the Disney Grand Californian.  Had a wonderful experience at this hotel.  It is a beautiful very well maintained property.  It was not over the top Disney-fied which can be a relief after spending the entire day surrounded by Disney.  It has great access to both Disneyland and California Adventure Park.  The staff was wonderful and very friendly.  I would definitely recommend this property if you are taking a trip to Disneyland.

The Grand Californian just finished being renovated and the rooms are beautiful.  I'd say this hotel is great for tweens- adults.  While the room does provide a stool for little ones to reach the sinks (and now two sinks) - the beds are rather tall to get into and there is no bathtub (at least not in our room).  They made the rooms great for the convenience of plugging in multiple devices, I think we counted 12 usb plugs and at least 6 regular - so you can charge anything with a ton of counter space.  A small refrigerator is also available and a pod coffee/tea machine.  There are multiple pools- our girls used 2 of them often- they are heated but one was warmer than the other but they still loved the slide in the cooler pool.  Chairs etc are plush and comfy.  The Hotel itself is

Summary Heading: Nice hotel close to all the action
Summary: My wife and I decided to take an adult trip to disney land. We stayed in a park view room and really liked how close everything was to us. Parks and restaurants were just a short walk away. The lobby was all decorated for Christmas and after a long day at the parks and a great meal at one of the signature restaurants sitting down in front of the fire in the lobby was a great ending to a fun day. We met Santa and some really good Christmas carolers in the lobby. We would stay at the Grand Californian next time we decide to get away to Disney Land.

My second time staying here and they just renovated it. Extremely nice with more power outlets than we could count! This hotel is less kid friendly now is my only complaint, but luckily my kids are getting older now. No bathtubs, no bunk beds, no babysitting anymore. But going at Christmas and being attached to California Adventures more than makes up for those changes. If I had really small kids though, I would stay somewhere else.

I don't even know where to start! This hotel was 100% worth every single penny we paid!  LOVE LOVE.  The staff was over the top helpful, rooms were amazing (we had a court view)! Food was awesome, location location!  I can't say enough!  We left this hotel to go to Universal and I was so upset we were leaving!  I am a travel agent and would recommend this to my clients!!! We ate at every restaurant and it was AMAZING.  I could go on and on!!!!

The disney experience starts here, the lobby is grand and magical but still home-like and comfortable, with little rocking chairs for kids to watch disney cartoons while parents check in. Everyone from the front gate, to the valet, to the staff at check-in are Disney's best. The rooms are all new, with amazing LED lighting, so many places to plug in phones and IPADS, you won't ever run out of power. The bathrooms are all newly renovated, along with the bedding, and furniture. The pool deck and pools are also newly restored. There is special access to Disney's California Adventure. I will never stay anywhere else. This is a must have to enjoy the magical experience of staying on property with children. Take a break from the Park, take a swim, enjoy the a rest in the room and

Summary Heading: Taking the Magic out of the Kingdom ... What a rip-off
Summary: If we had paid $200 (and not $600) for the room, and if this had not been touted as the "best" hotel in Disneyland, I would have given it 3 stars. We had just arrived from a true five-star hotel and what a let-down this place was compared to our previous one.   The room reminded me of a Courtyard (very basic - they didn't even provide any water) but priced like a Four Seasons. Staff looked like they had been overworked and cannot wait for you to get out of their faces. When we ordered room service (which incidentally did not have any healthy food for kids - albeit we ordered from the late night menu as we were in the park till closing time) we were put on hold and when the lady answered the phone, we were barked at (quite literally) and then told to wait an hour for our food.

We Love staying at Disney‚Äôs Grand Californian Hotel. It is our favorite of the Disney hotels at Disneyland. It recently was renovated and the rooms look better than ever and has a fresh new feeling with lovely new carpets throughout. The lobby is spectacular with its 3 story fireplace and it‚Äôs mission style design and lighting.  It was a very busy day when we checked in but the front desk got us checked in quickly and our 3 bedroom suite was ready so we were able to get our bags brought up to the room before going to dinner.  My daughter was having surgery the following week so we brought her to Disneyland to have a little fun before her surgery. We were able to rent a scooter for her through the concierge desk with no reservation. That was an awesome convenience, plus they

This is the premium hotel at Disneyland, and no surprise it‚Äôs very nice.  Great location easy walk to the parks, decent restaurants, nice room.  Lobby has a nice coffee bar and even some musical entertainment.  Well worth it.

We actually stayed here the Night Before Christmas Eve and went to the parks both days had a very nice room with an adjoining room with the rest of our family very good views of the pool which by the way are heated and are still open even if it is a little cold selling hot cocoa in the lobby lots of things to do there besides going to the park or parks I do want to say that the service was good and prompt also very very high marks for the valet just an note on the day you check out you can still use the valet for the entire day which cuts down on the hassle of going through the tram and all the parking that you would have to fight with all the other guests of the park and you can just walk through California Adventure to the Grand Californian and leave very easily all in all

3rd time staying at this hotel. We‚Äôve stayed at the  studio and 2 bedroom villas in the past. This time, we stayed at the 1 bedroom villa on the 1st floor and it was a good stay. We got lucky this time because our room was ready at 3pm, check-in time. For our past 2 stays, we never got a text about the room being ready and it wasn‚Äôt ready until past 4. That was totally disappointing.  The primary reason of staying at this hotel is the location‚Äî close to Disney parks and to Downtown Disney. However, if we are not DVC members using points, it may be a different story. Parking across the street is free for up to 2 cars for DVC members staying on points or valet for a fee. Like everyone says, it is a very expensive accommodation.

Disney offered our family a very relaxing Christmas! The amenities were great, the staff was very attentive and helpful and the food was delicious. The seasonal touches with garlands, Christmas trees and lights set the mood. There were singers in the lobby and lots for the kids to do. Consider spending Christmas here sometime!

Summary Heading: A little disappointed this time around
Summary: I have been lucky enough to stay at this hotel before, and was really looking forward to seeing the completed renovations.  The main hall was decorated for Christmas, and looked spectacular as usual! It was my room that I felt a bit letdown by.  I stayed in a Downtown Disney View room and the new Chip & Dale theme on the walls in the room are super cute and the view into Disneytown Disney was amazing, especially at night when the trees lights were on. The new beds however, were not comfortable. They are now quite high off the floor and the mattress was too soft for me, as where the pillows.  The lounge and armchair weren‚Äôt very comfortable either. The material was rather stiff and scratchy, but I guess over time they will soften.  The first night there the tv remote stopped

convenient location - close to california adventure and disneyland - comfortable beds - nice lobby with huge fireplace - conveniently close to nice restaurants and  shops - piano player in lobby - comfortable furniture

Ok - so we‚Äôre finally on our long-awaited family holiday travelling from Sydney to LA. We kick off our trip with a 4 night stay at the Disney California Grand Hotel. It starts off promising, but on the morning we are meant to check out, our son is unwell (half a day at the doctor‚Äôs), and our next accommodation (booked through Oasis, One Fine Stay) is cancelled due to electrical problems in the house. With no help from Oasis, but a fairly weak apology and the promise of a refund in 7 days, we are left to scramble for alternative accommodation options in holiday peak season 2 days out from Christmas, with 3 young children in tow.  My husband goes to California Grand reception to organise to extend our stay while we sort out other options for the next leg of our trip. Although we

The property is gorgeous. I loved the Craftsman style of the hotel, everything was clean, the holiday decorations were lovely. It is however a large property and there is no easy way to get from point A to point B.  The bellman was wonderful and friendly. I wish he would give lessons to our front desk agent. In fact, each time I was at the front desk I got the impression I was bothering them.The Hearthstone Lounge seemed to have only one server and one bartender each time we went and it was hard to get a drink. We wanted to have our drinks in the lobby, but no one showed up. Inside the lounge was not much better. Same with drinks by the pool. The pool was average. Kids area seemed small.  Room service was also wonderful. Food was OK, but it was hot when it arrived and we had

We stayed here last weekend for 2 night stay(Dec 15 & 16). We've stayed here before and upgraded to the "Club Level Service"  We are Annual Pass Holders. For over $2,400 plus tax, resort fees, parking, etc.,. Not worth it at all! Disappointed!!  Service/The Veranda Room:  This has nothing to do with the service of check in  OR The Veranda Room.  The Veranda Room servers are smiley and friendly.  Most of them remember us from all of the years we've paid for the "Club Level Service."  They checked often to ask if we needed anything.  Note the hours.  If I'm paying over $1,200 a night then the Veranda Room should close at midnight!!The park closes at midnight.  I had to pay extra for drinks/snacks because the Veranda Room  closes at 10:00P.M.!! For that kind of money, the Veranda

Staying here right now & I tried repeatedly to get front desk & the Napa Rose restaurant (7+ times) to get a dinner reservation for me & my husband, not only did I not get through on the phone (ever), but the vm' s left at the Napa Rose were never returned.  Also, when I made the reservations for two rooms (2 days ago) the agent asked if it was a special occasion & I said it was. My husband & I both have the same birthday (12/18). We came here with our kids as soon as they were done with school & we could get here for our family to celebrate. Nothing was mentioned at check in or in our rooms. Kind of disappointing.

Summary Heading: Remodel makes Grand worth the price
Summary: We've stayed here mutiple times in the past, but the rooms were getting pretty tired.  Rooms are now completely remodeled.  Beds comfortable.  Got rid of useless bath tubs and replaced with a luxurious rainfall shower.  Nice lighting, clean AC filters and great balconies.  Only complaint is they need those luggage stands in closets.  Service is always A+.   Location is the best for Disney and CA Adventure.  Plus you get the Magic Hour acccess in the morning.

This is a terrific hotel which we visit every year for the Holidays. There is no place more Christmasy. The rooms have been upgraded with lighter colors, but the Craftsman style is still everywhere.  Great lobby with Santa and a roaring fire, spacious guest rooms and a wonderful staff. Downtown Disney is right outside the door, as are the two amusement parks (which open to hotel guests at 7:00 am -- one our earlier than to the general public).

Honestly, Disney.  You know customer service.  Like no other.  Last year we stayed at the DLH, loved it.  This year, we were booked for PPH, but there was a special where we could stay at GCH for the same rate, so, DUH!  We did!  It was newly renovated, it was lovely, it was clean, it was close, it was everything.  This is the new benchmark.

My family has stayed at the Grand many times before and this time it was between December 3-5 2017.  We had connecting rooms on the third floor with an interior courtyard view, it was great! The newly remodeled rooms have more features than ever before. Our‚Äôs had great lighting, multiple USB charging points, a large flat screen, dual sinks, a full size tub and both regular and rain shower heads. The beds and bedding were brand new, very comfortable and high enough off the floor that you could store your suite cases underneath. The rooms had two Queen Beds and and a couch that could be converted to a Trundle Bed to sleep a total of five. Over our stay we used the early morning access benefit every day, enjoyed the Grand Lobby entertainment and room service. All of the Cast

We often like to stay close to the park, as a family it helps to be close for nap-time. This time we decided to treat ourselves to a ‚ÄúDowntown Disney view‚Äù and it was SO worth it. It made the trip magical for my little ones. We were treated with Disney service and Scott at the bell desk was absolutely phenomenal! He taught my daughter to pin-trade and took his time to ensure she understood and was excited to participate. The Santa and Christmas tree in the lobby (along with the grand piano, and carollers) and don‚Äôt forget the HUGE gingerbread mansion - made Christmas magical for our family.  Yes it was busy, and yes a little hectic with the Christmas/Holiday rush - but the experience was completely magical and the room was wonderful (clean, well organized and stocked). I would

I love this resort and our second stay there.  I love it not only because it‚Äôs so convenient if you‚Äôre visiting the amusement parks but the staff are friendly, attentive and accommodating. The design is, well, grand and there are plenty of options to eat and lounge while there. Rooms are well appointed and comfortable as are their beds. A comfortable bed is very important after a day at Disneyland. Walking a few steps from your room into the parks can‚Äôt be beat. Unfortunately, this hotel has spoiled us and we won‚Äôt stay anywhere else when visiting Disneyland and California Adventure!

The Grand Californian is always my top choice when choosing between the three resorts at Disneyland. The room quality, the dining options and the proximity to the parks can't be beat at any other Disney hotel in the area.   Favorite Features: Entrance from the hotel into California Adventure Park, Napa Rose Restaurant, stunning lobby and nice pool area. Also the extra morning hours are nice that come with staying at a Disney Property.   Biggest cons: Disney hotels do not guarantee you a specific room type - for example my party had a three bedroom suite and they would not guarantee two queens in two rooms and a king in the other etc... it makes it really hard to plan and makes it easier for them NOT the customer. This happens in regular room situations are well when requesting a

Summary Heading: Time to upgrade the Reservation, Check-in and Max Pass Systems
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel every year for the past 5-6 years, most recently during the first week-end in November 2017.  The location is outstanding and the new room renovations are lovely but now it is well past time to bring the reservation and check-in systems up to date.  The Max Pass is a very new system but it really needs improving too.  Reservations - in order to reserve two rooms, you have to call the Disney Travel Company.  I am almost always put on hold but there is no mention at the time of the hold how long it will be.  Once you are talking to a phone agent, you need to repeat your name and address, as a "security measure".  Then more delay begins, not sure what the agent is doing but it takes a long time, and it is apparently complicated to have the two room

This is often a pricey place but I have stayed there for under $300 a couple of times over the years.  I love the convenience of coming in and out of the park easily when I want to.   Splurging for a room with a balcony overlooking the park and the fireworks is very cool.   Breakfast is fun if you have kids--it's like most breakfasts.  But dinner at the Napa Rose restaurant is very special (and pricey too).  Probably one of the best restaurants I've ever been to.

This hotel is beautiful.  A little expensive, but worth it for the location. Right off Downtown Disney and it own entrance into California Adventure.  Hotel pool is beautiful.  Hotel has a few restaurants, some expensive, but hey, your right off Downtown Disney. Rooms have a balcony,, ours overlooked California Adventure and the pool.

I've been coming to the Grand Californian every Thanksgiving for the last 9 years.  The rooms at the Grand Californian were renovated this year, and I really liked what they did.  The shower curtains are gone and have been replaced with real shower doors and a combined hand shower and rain shower.  We had a single king so the room came with just the full shower and no tub (I'd assume the 2 queen rooms would have a tub but don't know).  There's also Keurig coffee makers with complimentary K-cups, sweetener, and coffee mate.

Summary Heading: Not as much as I'd hoped
Summary: The location is THE BEST.  Entry right into Downtown Disney District, amazingly quick proximity to the gates.  PRIVATE ENTRY into DCA.  As soon as we arrived, we felt like we were at a 5-star hotel.  The staff/cast were amazing, clearly defining 'hospitality'.  Most details provided before we could ask, and additional questions were spelled out clearly.  We had ordered a stroller from one of the local rental companies, and it was standing-by for us.  Valet service for our car (paid each day) was usually very quick.  The rooms were being remodeled when we came.  No rooms available with the bunkbeds for our boys, and they were being phased out.  We didn't need a view but there was enough space on the balcony to sit and have some fresh air, or set out damp clothes.    We had two

The hotel lobby is about the only thing charming about this place. The breakfast was one of the worst I've experienced. Really just a couple of pastries and the service was lacking.   We had a two bedroom suite and there were no tubs in the bathrooms! Disney is supposed to be kid friendly with no tubs? It just didn't make sense. The bathrooms should have doors to the sink area as well not just the toilet and shower.   Upon arrival there was a mix up with our luggage and when leaving it felt like all of the bellmen were just standing around and we were waiting for quite a while and had to ask twice for help. When we pulled up the attended said hello then we said "oh he's dropping us off" and she totally snapped and said "nope you can't be here" which we then replied "no were

We stayed in the Disney Vacation Club one-bedroom villa, of which we are members. All of the rooms in the Grand Californian are being refurbished and I fear that some of the little things that made the location completely magical are disappearing. In our room they had replaced the carpet which used to have hidden Mickeys. The current carpet looks  dull and doesn't add anything to the room. They used to provide robes for guests, but now they don't. I hate to see Disney cheapen their facilities.

The hotel has one redeeming quality... It‚Äôs location. It is really nice to be right inside the park area and walk in and out of Disneyland and California Adventure. However, the hotel, food, service and staff are underwhelming and beyond Disney standards. Our room was TINY and not especially clean. Also... here‚Äôs a tip... DON‚ÄôT get a room overlooking Main Street unless you want to be kept awake until 2:00am listening to the parking shuttles honk their horns. When I asked the front desk about it, their response was flippant and without empathy. I would not stay here again.

Just here for a Monday night as a treat for our daughter.  I just asked for a Resort View Room, but alas, they didn't have one available.  So we were upgraded to a Junior Presidential Suite!  This is why I always book though a travel agent. But I digress.  This room was...incredible. A MASSIVE dining and living room, 2-1/4 bathrooms, full kitchen with Sub-Zero Fridge, steam shower, jacuzzi tub, THREE Balconies facing California Adventure Park. I mean, C'mon!!!  But... We spent no time in our room because we were out in the park the whole time!  We felt so guilty!  But what we did do is swear to ourselves that if we ever come back, we're gonna request this room and pay full price for a week during a quiet week (when is that by the way) because the room as already stated, was just

Stayed at this hotel for the first time in November to go see the Disney parks during the holiday season. We had a fantastic experience. The rooms are about as expensive as a slightly used Mercedes Benz, but the convenience factor can't be beat. You have direct access to the California Adventure park and there are some amazing eateries in and around the hotel because of Downtown Disney. Ralph Brennan's is a personal favorite. World of Disney is also conveniently located close by also.

Summary Heading: Amazing 2 night stay at the Grand Californian
Summary: We were doing a super-quick in-and-out trip to Disneyland and California Adventure so location was key for us. We stayed at the Grand Californian and our stay was wonderful! The room was very clean and comfortably appointed with 2 queen beds and a daybed/sofa.   We were at the resort while they were decorating for Christmas and it was wonderful waking up each morning to find the Lobby with additional decorations each morning.   Even on the shortest trip, schedule at least an hour just to sit back in the evening in the Lobby, take in the beautiful decorations, the elegant live piano music, enjoy a drink (a server will take your order and bring it to you anywhere in the lobby) and save room for a gingerbread cookie, it's the best I've ever had!  This resort just had that special

Summary Heading: It‚Äôs Disney! But loved being stress free.
Summary: We really wanted to surprise the kids by staying here. It‚Äôs pricey, but we payed to have a stress free experience. The hotel is nice and has great amenities such as  a pool, gym and restaurants, but you can‚Äôt beat the ease of being able to access the park and not have to go through the front to access. The room was large enough for a party of 4 and even had a Day bed. The room also has a small mini fridge, no freezer but has shelves that are wide enough to hold caprisuns or a small container of fruit. The room is nicely kept up and housekeeping came around twice a day. We did experience some construction and the first day was rough as they only had one running elevator, but by the second day the other two were up and running. No problems here and really enjoyed the room and the

Summary Heading: The Refurbishments Made Our Stay Grander
Summary: This was our fourth visit to this hotel.  It is expensive as one might expect being part of Disney properties.  We were very pleased with the refurbished room and lodge.  Still has the original vibe with wonderful updates.  The service was excellent and the bed was super comfy.  We enjoy everything this hotel has to offer and love the direct access to Downtown Disney and California Adventure Park.  If you can afford it, stay here!

Summary Heading: On my bucket list but disappointed
Summary: Nice and convenient hotel but it is sooooo busy. It took 30 minutes to check in which is not great with kids and another 30 minutes to get the bags to the room (which they took from us when we arrived). decent sixed well maintained rooms with a small bathroom and lumpy pillows. Anyone in the complex can use the Wifi so it is really slow - there should be a separate Wifi for guests only. There are plenty of more affordable options a short walk from the park so look around, however I would recommend this hotel.

This is a delightful hotel, as one might expect from Disney. It is expensive, but has much to offer. The styling and landscaping are beautiful. Great onsite restaurant choices. Pool. Work out facility. And best of all, it connects right to Disneyland! You have your own private entrance/exit making it super easy to in and out of the park. If you have the money, go for it!

The great things; Location - direct access to the parks & Downtown Disney Disney-theme, if you love it (as we do) you will love this hotel albeit a little more understated than some of their hotels around the world  Service (from some, but definitely not all - please see below) IÔ∏è thought the way they handled the construction work going on at the hotel at present was very good, we were aware when booking, it is well screened & no real inconvenience   The ‚Äònot so good‚Äô Many rooms, including ours, are way too far from the lifts for a hotel in this class - it was frankly unacceptable What was also unacceptable was the issue we had with check in, given keys to a room mikes away on the 4th floor only they were for our room the 5th floor this took way, way too much time to resolve

Summary Heading: Better once construction is over with
Summary: Overall a great hotel that gets 4 stars instead of 5 because during our stay there was construction/refurbishment everywhere which impacted on our stay. The biggest annoyance with this was in our section of the 3 elevators present, they shut down 2, meaning there was long lines just to use the only elevator get to your room, and alternative routes through the hotel were not possible due to areas blocked off! In the end we just took the fire/emergency stairs up and down.  Pros: -On site gym -On site self service laundry facilities -Large room, comfortable bed, walk in shower -Free wifi -Closest hotel to both parks. Which after a long, busy, hot day was definitely worth the extra price tag of this hotel  Cons: -Refurbishment everywhere -Bathroom area (shower and toilet) on the

Summary Heading: Everything we wanted and more for our trip with 2 little kids!
Summary: This was our first family trip to Disneyland, and our first stay in a Disney hotel, and I must say almost everything about our stay at the Grand Californian was magical. We stayed 4 nights (M-F) in a newly renovated room with that was called a "deluxe partial view." I was pleasantly surprised to find our room had a large foyer area where we were able to park our double stroller easily that was out of the way. We also had a bathtub so we could easily bathe our two littles (ages 2 and 4). The partial view really was partial looking directly at the back of the Mickey Mouse and his airplane that is on top of down town Disney's store. If you leaned out of the balcony you could see downtown Disney. My kids were super excited to look at the back of Mickey's head, so it was a win for us

We had a bad experience last time (our room wasn't ready until midnight!) so I was concerned about returning.  However, this visit, our room was ready when we checked in, and it was well appointed.  Excellent lighting, many convenient electric outlets, and lighted vanity mirror.  Loved having double sinks outside the shower area.  Keurig coffee maker and mini fridge conveniently located in the room.  We were near both stairs and elevator, but never waited for an elevator.  We like the convenience of going directly into California Adventure.  We enjoy the raft ride, but always get soaked so like dashing back into the hotel for a quick shower and change of clothes before going on other rides.  The self parking is directly across the street so easy to access.  The safe in the room

Traveled to this hotel with wife and two boys ages 6 and 8. I was attending a convetion.  Got a renovated room and it was awesome.  Super clean with nice amenities.  Really liked that we had a mini fridge in the room when traveling with kids.  The shower was really nice and had a rain shower head.  The direct access to the park next store was nice.  A great perk that is not discussed in many reviews is that staying at a Disney Hotel gets you into the park an hour before the general public.  This is huge and helps you get a lot of rides in before the crowds start showing up.  This probably the best perk of staying at a Disney Hotel.   The pools were nice with some of the best lounge chairs I have ever had the pleasure of sitting on.  Great location that is basically halfway of

My daughter and I stayed for just one night in October for the Halloween party. We arrived a little too early so we headed out to Downtown Disney but after a while were just really tired and they thankfully gave us our room a little early. I believe most of the rooms are now renovated and we really enjoyed the new features. The look is fresh with nice touches of California and Disney in the look and art on the walls. The outlets have been updated to provide plenty of plugs and USB ports for everyone's electronics. We used to bring a small power strip and have to move the end table to plug it in, but no more. There are outlets by the bed and at the new desk space, which is also a nice addition to the rooms. There is plenty of space for everything. I also like the new couch as the

Summary Heading: Watch out for the dusting crew & bell hop service!!!
Summary: This hotel turned into a construction site 10pm due to dusting the lobby. We couldn't walk thru the lobby to get from the restaurant. Told to go this way, then that way. There were about 20 other patrons doing the same thing walking aimlessly. The employees that were guarding the restricted areas didn't know where to point us in the right direction. After 35 minutes we got back to our room. Nightmare!   Trying to leave this place it took 45 minutes to get our bags from the bell hop holding! It was 9:20 pm and we were about the only ones trying to leave. It was not busy. Not sure what happened but it sucked!   Ugh

My family (husband and 1.5yr old toddler) recently stayed at this hotel. We were super excited as this was our first time staying at an Anaheim Disney Hotel and the Grand Californian is supposedly the most luxurious out of the 3 on site (which is captured in the price point of the hotel - about 2-3 times the cost of the others)  We arrived early (7:30am) to drop off our bags and check in before hitting the park. We waited at least 25 minutes in line to get checked in. There were only 2 individuals working and the line continued to grow behind us. This was not the best way to start our day.  It was convenient to receive our keys when we checked in, so we did not have to go back to the desk and pick them up when our room was available. Once our room was available we received  a

My husband and I stayed here to attend a gala being held in the hotel. We have stayed here before and have enjoyed the amenities even though it is very expensive. Because we booked the hotel so late the only rooms available were "premium" rooms which of course were even more outrageously costly than the already expensive "standard" rooms. I requested to have a room with a King bed but when we checked in we were told they only had a room with two queen beds. This happened to us on our last visit here too. Very disappointing. This was our first time staying in a "premium" room and was very disappointed in that it was no different than the standard rooms we had stayed in before! The only difference was that we overlooked the California Adventure park. Big deal! So we paid and extra

DVC member, but was unable to secure a DVC room. I was concerned that the standard hotel would be a ‚Äònormal‚Äô hotel, but was pleasantly surprised. We had adjoining rooms which was ideal for 2 adults and 4 kids. The furnishing, were all very nice, hide-a-beds were comfortable, and the bathrooms were luxurious. The location is tremendous with Downtown Disney and the Disney Parks being just outside the door.

Summary Heading: Very operational, in great location, but definitely not magic or special, tiny bedrooms
Summary: If you are considering this hotel, you already know that the location can't be beaten if your purpose is to visit Disneyland and California Adventure. Depending on how much you value that proximity, the hotel may be a good choice. For us, location was the only saving grace honestly, but still if we absolutely had to visit Disney again for a few days (which we don't think we will, as a day trip when we are in LA is enough) we would still stay here. But let me be clear, there is NO DISNEY MAGIC in this hotel. It is an operational, solid bland hotel, with plenty of staff (usually just checking things around at the lobby) and they don't act or feel like "cast members". In other words, there is no "Disney Bubble" here, Anaheim gets at you from the tired looks on workers and park

Had been staying at the regular Disneyland Hotel behind the ESPN. We thought we liked it lol but when we tried the Grand... there‚Äôs just no comparison. The lobby, the rooms and the location. Foremost the location- no contest. That‚Äôs really what sealed the decision for us in regards to deciding to now only stay at the Grand. The reason for the 4 stars (as opposed to 5)- the pool area had much better amenities for us grown ups, but the small kids missed the fun features the Disney hotel has for them. We liked the quiet and the up quality of the lawn chairs- but the kids didn‚Äôt like the vibe and the little slide didn‚Äôt make up for the lack of other water features the Disney hotel boasts. My daughter and son in law both missed the tiki bar/restaurant that the Disney hotel had. We

We got our first room, it was nice but in the middle of the night (around 1-2am) all the lights turned on and I swear I heard my name being called. It really freaked me out because there was no logical reason for it. When I asked the front desk if there was any explanation or if there had been complaints before, they looked bewildered. I asked if anyone had died in that room. No one had an answer. Needless to say we switched rooms meeely for my personal peace of mind because let‚Äôs face it, that was creepy. There was no sort of extra accommodation, as a matter of fact the room we got switched to was a down grade because it was smaller! I am very disappointed with their customer service since it was an inconvenience for us to switch rooms and pack and no one offered any sort of

Summary Heading: Wonderful staff, but noisy construction and broken elevators ruin the Disney magic.
Summary: First time in Disneyland but we had stayed in Disneyworld resorts before and thought we knew what to expect. Unfortunately the hotel was undergoing renovations at the time. We were told construction would only be during daytime hours but at night we were kept awake by trucks and their warning alarms as they were backing up. Maybe due to the renovation (or maybe unrelated) there was only one elevator working in our area of the hotel and we spent a lot of time waiting to go up or down (no stairs). The elevator would arrive full by the time it got to our floor and it could take 15+ minutes to squeeze into one with space. Also because of the construction our room preference (king bed) was unavailable too. It's a huge hotel and we expected Disney to be able to accommodate this

Summary Heading: Good deal, but parts of the hotel were closed
Summary: We got a deal on this hotel, because the pool area was closed for refurbishment. No problem, because we spent most of the time in the park. Nice big rooms, and we got a pass to enter the park early. Great location, we could pop back for a rest quickly throughout the day. I would stay again.

Summary Heading: Too Big for its own good, doesn't meet the Disney level you'd expect
Summary: The room itself was wonderful.  The internet was even fairly quick, but that's where the good part ends.  1st the hotel floors are just too big.  If you are unlucky enough to get a room at the end of the hall, it's a significant walk to get anywhere.  Seriously, there are hundreds of rooms to this hotel, and only a few elevators.  The second problem is that the area I was in was under renovation.  They shut down not one but two of the three elevators for that area.  Literally hundreds of people trying to get up and down though one elevator.  If you tried to leave in the morning, it would seriously take 15 min to get out.  They opened up the stairs, but they aren't direct, and that takes forever too.  The next problem was parking.  If you didn't want to pay a ton for Valet

Summary Heading: Beautiful Hotel, Amazing Staff, Bring Lots of Money
Summary: Prior to going on our 7th Disney cruise leaving San Diego for a week along the Mexican Riviera, my wife and I decided to spend a few days at Disneyland.  We honeymooned at Disneyland 35 years ago, and since we were going to be in the neighborhood, my wife wanted to visit to see if anything had changed in that time.  Didn't seem like an unreasonable request and since it was her birthday why not splurge a bit?  We booked three nights at the Disney Grand Californian.  We're frequent visitors to Walt Disney World and very familiar with the numerous Disney resorts in Florida so we were comfortable in knowing that GC would certainly offer the same quality of service Disney is well known for.  The hotel is quite beautiful.  Upon arrival you can see why it is the jewel in the crown of

Summary Heading: We love the Napa Rose Restaurant inside the hotel...
Summary: The service, food and wine selection is great.  Location is perfect for getting in and out of the park for dinner..  Kym was one of the servers who took care of all our dietary special needs.  She went out of her way to make us feel welcome.  Wine selection is superb!

We stayed at the Grand Californian for 6 nights at the end of September for our first trip to Disneyland.  The hotel is very conveniently located to the Downtown Disney District and has a separate entrance to the Californian Adventure Park. Staying at a Disney hotel and having access to the early mornings ia definitely beneficial.  The rooms are nice and the hotel provides after sun lotion and a foot scrub in addition to shampoo, conditioner etc.  The staff in the hotel were all very helpful and friendly.  We will definitely staff here again.

This hotel is so nice,  clean and very comfortable.  It is very expensive though. We only stayed here because it was part of a package we won.  It does have easy access to the parks and everyone is friendly. The rooms are NICE! Beds are comfy.

We love this hotel. We had a good sized room, with two double beds and a cute themed day bed, decorated with Disney animals. The rooms have been recently refurbished and everything was superb quality. We like the new showers with a tiled seat, a big improvement on the tiny bath/ shower combination.  The theming was just right, with a very relaxing feel to the place. The pool was excellent with a fun slide. Everywhere was spotless. It's great having such easy access to the theme park too. The kids loved popping into the California Adventure Park through the back door. We had very good food in the restaurants and the chefs took great care to make sure our meals were gluten free.  This hotel is expensive but very much worth it. Go there and enjoy!

The hotel is nice, service is great but for the price it was just ok. The elevators in our building, 2 were down for repairs which made travelling in scooter difficult esp in busy times. It was nearly impossible to get down elevator. I waited a half hour. The rooms are nice, clean and bed is comfortable.  The easy access to the parks is nice.

We stayed here for six nights and enjoyed the hotel , the swimming pool and the really convenient entry to both Disneyland parks. We felt two things could have been better....first early morning access to the parks from the hotel had long queues driven by the bottleneck of two security guards checking bags whilst multiple other Disney staff from ‚Äòother departments‚Äô looked on, poor really for a hotel of this scale and easily fixed....second the welcome at the signature restaurant Napa Rose was bordering on rude ‚Äòstand over there and wait‚Äô with no smile or welcome or enquiry about allergies. Also don‚Äôt order Pork Loin unless you want Pork Chop which they then tell you is Pork Loin. With those two exceptions we had a lovely stay with many of the usual Disney details that we love.

The room was nice (had to call to request a change as to what our Disney travel agent had promised). One elevator to get all people who stayed on our end to their rooms (a 10 to 20 minute wait)... stairs were "out" due to construction. "Concierge service" was also less than expected due to our Disney travel agent giving us misguided information. There were a lot of treats, but not items that you could fill your bag, as was told. I have loved Disneyland since I was 5... so was a little disappointed to this lack of service.

The only thing Disney about our hotel room was the picture on the wall above the toilet. Chip and Dale, I believe. In addition, our room was tiny and drab and the view off our balcony was marginal. We paid for a pricey room to have a view that overlooked the Disney Walk and what we got was a view of the tops of the dirty, ugly tops of the units below us...though we did have a partial view of the Walk, so at least that was something. And as far as service goes, we ordered by the pool and our order never came so we had to cancel and get a refund. We also took postcards to the concierge to be mailed and two out of our four cards were sent without stamps. In my opinion, hotels should be like airlines. If you pay for first class, you get first class service and products. If a person

Summary Heading: Getting Closer to Getting Your Money's Worth
Summary: The Grand Californian is meant to evoke a time gone by of majestic National Park Lodges reached by horse or train.  These are modern times, however, and the hotel has been long overdue for a renovation and finally, FINALLY, got it.    I revisited the Grand Californian with excitement to check out the new renovation.  They were still about a month away from having it completely done, with work still being completed around the pool and to the elevators, but the room I stayed in was newly renovated and I have to say it was a thoughtful renovation in keeping with the hotel's Lodge feel.  DECOR:  It's all very woodsy and disneyfied and pleasant with soothing colors and nice artwork, all in keeping with the theme and bright and shiny and new.  The rooms, in general, are much brighter

If you want quick and easy access it does not get better than this. We had a great pool day too although they probably missed some sales opportunities in drinks. A cabana is a good way to go at the pool.

Summary Heading: Disney Magic at work (for the most part!)
Summary: They are just completing all remodeling, but we did not  have any interruption to our vacation (rooms, lobby and pools are complete we were told).  We received a remodeled room 5246, that looked out over California adventure right at the Ferris Wheel and could see the World of Color from our deck. It is right behind Goofy's Sky School, but that was closed for refurbishment, so I don't know if that would make a difference in noise level.  For our stay, with the sliding glass door shut you could not hear a thing. Comfortable beds, but they are tall ( a small step that could slide under the bed would have been helpful.  Showers are nice and accessible. Fitness Center is fine, treadmills, weights, but not an concern for us since we were at the parks walking all day everyday.  Gift

Disney has had three on-property hotels for the Disneyland theme park in Anaheim, California: The Disneyland Hotel (formerly the Disneyland Grand Hotel), the Paradise Pier Hotel (formerly the Emerald, which was also formerly owned by a non-Disney company), and the Disney Grand Californian Hotel. While they all have their charms and perks, there can be no dispute that the best experience overall is with the Grand Californian. This hotel has various aspects that make it great whether you are a family with young children, a family with older children, or even just adults looking to enjoy the park and stay in comfort.  Let's address the biggest elephant in the room: cost. This hotel is not cheap. Not by a long shot. You could stay a week in some surrounding properties for the same

The main appeal of this hotel is the proximity to Disneyland and California adventure parks.     Although it is marketed as upscale the only thing upscale about it are the prices.   From the beds, to the linens, the towels and the bathroom amenities, it screams average.  Having said that it is clean and the refurbished rooms are nice with the large TV and lots of plug-ins for devices.    The bathrooms don't have much counter space though.  If you get a room on the downtown Disney side, be aware that it can be very noisy until late at night.    The soundproofing is decent but you likely won't be sleeping with the window open.  Also be aware that they are doing extensive renovations so it can be noisy during the day.  Overall the stay was nice, it is definitely convenient to be so

Unbelievable prices unbelievably poor service.  The price point matches up with luxury but you can't get room service to answer the phone.  When you order a drink in the bar it takes forever and when it comes is incorrect.   Looking at the quality of food and beverage over all its apparent the grand California didn't expect many replete guests.   Overall GCR could be the best of the options but be patient and have full knowledge of the financial calamity.

Summary Heading: Still under construction, but magnificent anyway
Summary: My husband and I checked in early to this hotel on 10/9/17 to find all our special requests honored and our room ready for us.  We had adjoining rooms for our son's family with a day bed in both rooms for our 2 1/2 year old grandson to nap in.  That came in especially handy for naps and early bedtimes.  The day bed has Bambi artwork and is the perfect size for a toddler who has outgrown a crib.  Great idea Disney designers!!  The new rooms are quite lovely and comfortable.  AND Yes - there is construction!  We were well aware of that on the website when we booked our stay.  However, I must say that our room was separated from the construction by just a breezeway and there was absolutely no noise noticeable in our room.  The soundproofing worked great!  Since we had a two year

We recently attended a 2 day event at Disneyland and I FINALLY got to stay on property!  Since we live in San Diego it never made sense to stay overnight.  This trip we spent two nights at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel & Spa while we were visiting Disneyland and California Adventure.  Driving onto the property we were greeted by a guard and a barrier.  We were asked our names and welcomed.  Valet was prompt and courteous and also welcomed us.  We glided through the stained glass doors to a very smooth check in process.  A cast member immediately greeted us, welcomed and asked our names.  We were whisked to another cast member who greeted us by name and directed us to an awaiting cast member for check in.  Because of the ongoing construction/renovations, we were upgraded to a

So, the elephant in the room . . . this hotel is simply crazy expensive for what it is.  You can stay 30 minutes away in a remarkable, five-star hotel on the beach for less.   Separating the hotel from the price is challenging, but if price is no object or you can somehow forget how much a basic room costs, the hotel is quite a treat.  The pools, lobby, and location somewhat (but only partially) justify the cost.   We checked into the hotel at about noon on a hot, Saturday.  Our room was ready (a nice plus) and we decided to spend a few hours at the pool complex.  There are three pools and one with a nice water slide.  I had a challenge finding a chair and had to troll for about 30 minutes, but eventually found a place to relax while the kids swam.  I received good pool-side

I was looking for a quieter place to meet a friend that I hadn‚Äôt seen in a long time while my family was visiting Disneyland and couldn‚Äôt have picked a better place than the lobby of Disney‚Äôs Grand Californian.  I love its‚Äô cozy atmosphere and even though there is a lot of foot traffic, it feels like you are sitting in your own bubble.  The service was fantastic; with a server appearing before we even sat down.  The drink menu was varied and plentiful and we really enjoyed the complimentary snack mix (a little too much!).  My only word of advice is that with Downtown Disney‚Äôs new parking policy, the Resort hotels DO NOT VALIDATE, so we wound up paying a whopping $42 for parking.  Be warned!

A return visit to this magnificent establishment. Very early arrival so limited staff at registration but they were fabulous, and fun. It really made the start of the day very enjoyable. Early entry to Disneyland on the day so early start and everything was smooth & efficient. Self parking and the bell hop checked the luggage for later return. A message promised for when the room was ready too. It came through earlier than expected which turned out to be a blessing on the day. The room was very good and comfortable. The bathroom was a reasonable size - you could actually turn around in it! One bed and a fold out bed - apparently not as comfortable as on previous visit(s).  Nice "balcony" as well. One feels safe here - security obvious and even with security dogs patrolling

Beautiful hotel with nice amenities, a bit expensive, but worth it! It is noisey that s to be expected. Rooms are  clean they are upgrading not much noise at night due to construction just during day. They have three nice size pools. The buffet at the cafe is good in the morning. The menu is ok in the evening not great. The hotel lobby bar has great drinks the appetizers are just ok. The hotel is beautiful the word work and the main entrance just is amazing.....

The folks who greeted us are nice, and the lobby area looks into a large room that I suppose resembles the Awahnee... but the elevators, hallways, and rooms seem awfully tired for a hotel that was just built in 2001 and costs what it does.  The lighting is wan rather than warm.  The rooms are as small as rooms found in hotels built at the turn of the LAST century, as are the bathrooms. The linens are nice and the beds are fine, but if you turn the air conditioner up in your room the humidity will leave everything feeling misted and damp, which ruins the effect of crisp sheets. The pool area is very nice and refreshing after a long day in the parks -- which is AMAZINGLY accessible from this hotel and makes up for a ton of its other shortcomings.  When you're exhausted (our

This was my first time not staying at the Disney resort we decided to spend more money and see what the difference really is  First off noticed this is a more adult style experience  You won‚Äôt find characters like goofy wandering around but your closer to the park so give and take I guess  That being said I loved the renovated room we upgraded to a suite so we could put the baby down in the other room and not disturb her while we get ready for bed It was a very nice room it had 2 bathrooms and two 70in TVs so no squinting!  We didn‚Äôt have a view of the park but we will be in it most of the time anyways The sofa was comfortable and the service was friendly from start to end  I did notice when you call down to the front desk or bell hop you will be waiting 10-15 minutes just to

Summary Heading: Family fun at a great place.
Summary: We were fortunate to have a Family reunion with some of our family this past weekend. We stayed in a 2 bedroom 3 bath suite that accommodated 10 people. It had a kitchen stocked with pots, pans, plates etc. There was a long table with bench seating as well as chairs. The family room had a couch with a pull out bed, and also a Murphy type double bed across the room. One bedroom had a king bed, the other had 2 queen beds. Both bedrooms had patios, There was also a door from the family room to access the patio. All staff members were Awesome. I am handicapped and was able to rent a scooter there at the hotel. The man at the bell desk whose name is Craig, took the information that was needed, and brought it to me.  The lines for the rides were long, but we had a great time, but

After having stayed at the Disneyland hotel in the Ambassador Suite where we were treated like royalty, I was very disappointed in this hotel.  We also paid $600.00 more per night for the grand californian.  At the Disneyland hotel when you check into your room you will find a complimentary plate of Mickey and Minnie cookies.  Nothing at all when we opened our door to our newly renovated room at the Grand.  We were in an accessible room which had only one mirror in the entire room.  It was in the bathroom so you couldn't get ready if someone else was in there.  Also, there's nowhere to sit.  Only the bed. The closet is open so if anyone (housekeeping included) comes over to your room, everything you plan to wear is on display.  Speaking of housekeeping, when they cleaned our

Summary Heading: I expected more from Disney - especially for the price point
Summary: when they say its "under construction" ... they mean ITS UNDER CONSTRUCTION. You can't even take a nap in between park visits because the fire alarms are under test (every one of days we are there ). I asked when this would end, was given a "we don't know" answer, staff was pretty much un-caring about the situation. Painting and the smell of fumes in the hallway, sound of saws going off from the Hearthstone lodge while trying to have a nice snack.  I can say the newly renovated room was nice and clean, good park view. The location is also convenient. Pools were heated and also nice.  However, I can't justify this price point over say the Disneyland hotel, which isn't that much farther away.  After this experience I'm actually questioning an upcoming stay at the Aulani property.

We arrived by black car from LAX through stop-n-go traffic and first glimpse of Disney by seeing the metal structures soon to be Galaxy‚Äôs Edge (aka Star Wars Land).  We pull up to the entrance where a guard stopped us.  My back window went down to tell the guard I was checking in.  There was a bunch of cabs drivers standing by for guests.  We get out of our ride and tipped our driver a lift extra since he had to battle LA traffic.  We decided to have luggage sent to our room.  I have done this at another Disney resort in WDW and they let you enjoy the resort without worrying about luggage. The check in and luggage service was spectacular as always.  It took a bit for registration to find a room with a single king bed but only found two queens. I could not upgrade since the

My husband and I took our almost 5 year old son to Disneyland for the first time September 12-16.  We stayed at the Grand Californian hotel and paid extra for the premium view with club services.  We had the time of our lives!!  The hotel lobby was simply breathtaking and we got to check in on the 6th floor in peace and quiet. The concierge let my husband and son into the craftsman's lounge to enjoy some snacks while I checked in.  The renovated room was lovely, clean, and we had a nice view of the pool.  We arrived at 11am and I didnt expect the room to be ready- the bell services held our luggage for us while we went to the park for a couple hours- luggage was brought up promptly when the room was ready.  Had breakfast every morning in the craftsmans lounge- delicious and I

AMAZING hotel!!!!!! So clean, friendly staff, GREAT view from our room, price was right and the convenience of walking right into the park was awesome. Definitely will stay here again! 10 stars! There was not 1 complaint from any one in our party.

Ok the hotel is under renovations as stated but we didn't expect paint fumes throughout the passage ways, they acknowledged and gave us a sweetener.  Now we paid for a private concierge his name "Danny", I'll be as brief as possible he was useless, offered nothing was a little creepy could not answer any questions. Asked him to assist us with the Fastpass at Disney "sorry cannot touch your phone". I asked about gym "no gym really" I discovered there was one.  Top it off he wanted a tip.  Other concierge where mildly better, we went to Disneyland Hotel concierge and they were superb.  Not sure how they can employ a person of that standard, hence 2 stars.

We came back hoping for a change for the better. Well the refurbished rooms are lovely and nicely finished. The service is still concerning. Over an hour waiting for bell services. Saying this we often saw 8+ valets standing around talking - surely they could help the bell services team. Hard to get hold of a manager to express concerns. Needs to have an improvement on client based services.

Money well spent. The location is fantastic, no lines, direct access into California adventure park and a small walk to Disneyland. we even took the monorail from downtown Disney directly into tomorrowland. Monorail is an easy walk from the grand Californian Hotel. I'm glad there is security it keeps us safe when we are in the park. I would definitely stay there again. We were in a concierge's level room which included Craftsmans club. The hotel staff are fantastic and they're friendly. The rooms were large and the beds are very comfortable. It was nice before we went to the park we stopped at Craftsman club and had tea,coffee, fruit and some pastries. they also offered cereal, hard boiled eggs and oatmeal. In the afternoon we went back and had sandwiches, fruit, vegetables,

Everything here was first rate. It's expensive, yes, but totally worth it. Rooms are comfortable, amenities are first rate, restaurants and bars are awesome, and it's steps away from Disneyland while being located in California Adventure.

I wrote a review in December 2016 and gave the worst review I have ever given for any hotel we have stayed at.  We decided to give them another chance and we are glad we did.  We spent two nights in September 2017.  We opted not to do the club floor this time as we found on the last visit there were few perks for the extra charge.  What we did get this time is one of the newly renovated rooms and wow!  They have hit it out of the Park (pardon the pun).  All of my grievances from the tired decor, poorly maintained sinks and uncomfortable beds - all are now remedied.  I will note some things that I wish they had considered.  We arrived with suitcases in tow and as noted we were there only for two nights.  So we didn‚Äôt want to unpack everything (we had been on a cruise and in Palm

Summary Heading: Meh. No reason to return other than great location
Summary: Average property in every way, from the service to the linens on the bed. Nothing stands out as positive or negative, and I share that in case there's a better value somewhere else nearby to consider.

I stay here a lot and I‚Äôm never disappointed. From the minute you enter the front valet parking and lobby entrance, you are greeted with majesty and beauty.  The hotel is very big but somehow cozy, with a huge fireplace in the center lobby area and a great bar and really nice shop.  They sell nice wines and beers in the shop, along with their nicer merchandise. My room was recently renovated and was beautiful! The bedding was really soft and comfortable. I had a view overlooking California Adventure, which you can enter from the hotel pool area. The pool area is amazing too, with oversized chaises and really thick comfy cushions. Loved my stay!!!

This hotel was great, room was just what we were looking for with a reasonable balcony. Interior of hotel was outstanding and the hotel staff extremely helpful. Close proximity to the parks. Can‚Äôt wait to return.

Summary Heading: Was supposed to be a trip of a lifetime..... Extremely disappointed!
Summary: Where to start?? The rooms are very small and dark and don't have any Disney feel to them at all. We are travelling with my young children and it's our first stop after travelling all the way from Australia and we are supposed to be staying at "Disney's" Grand Californian hotel with no reference to Disney at all! It's dark and brown, no colour and no character reference at all.  The rooms are very basic, the beds are uncomfortable and move around.  On our first night we were tired and wanted something quick to eat and were told to check out the hotels Storytellers cafe.  My goodness the worst food we have ever eaten! The kids pasta was like plain pasta with tomato sauce poured over it.....my daughter couldn't eat it. We choose the buffet option, I struggled to find anything I

Very well done Disney. We arrived this morning just after 9:00. Bell hop took my bags to hold until my room was ready. He told me where to check in. I ask where the concierge was, I then was directed past check in to another small check in area. All went smoothly, I was informed that my room was not ready and I would receive a call from them. Great. We were then taken to an alternate eating area for craftmans and had a light continental breakfast. Very pleasurable. Then off to California adventure park for some fun. I received 2 calls from the hotel. Our room was ready. So far a great trip.

Summary Heading: A splurge that is worth it!
Summary: You've heard it--location, location, location! This is the best located Disney hotel of any I've experienced. There is an entrance directly into the Disney California Adventure (DCA) and also into Downtown Disney. You are in DCA in 5 minutes, even if you are on the other side of the hotel. You can take advantage of the Magic Mornings and walk into park one hour earlier than those with regular tickets. This may be the time to buy the Park Hopper tickets, since the parks are an esplanade apart and you easily walk back to your hotel.   The Rooms are newly renovated and classic, with a few Hidden Mickeys. Staying in a studio villa afforded us some extra space and a microwave. The pool area is lovely and boasts three pools and two whirlpools in a very large area between the hotel

Summary Heading: Avoid the club level during the remodel
Summary: We love Disneyland and the Grand Californian is a great location for the park, but avoid the Club level during its remodeling.  Instead of the the regular Craftsman Club which is closed they moved things throughout the hotel.   The moved the snacks and noon and later food outdoors which is okay unless it is too hot, cold or raining.  They don't have proper food chilling, I ended  up sick from food poisoning, only to see a day later they were finally coming out and measuring food temperatures.    The morning food is in Napa Rose which is great but the manager had know clue what was going on, regular staff came over and let us know just to ask them if we had questions.    Finally, instead of viewing fireworks from the Craftsman Club, we were offered "VIP" seating for one of

Excellent location! Staff very good and helped us a lot when we needed. On the other hand, in the day before check-out, the front desk was not so helpful; we needed a luggage scale, they had it, were not using it (it was very late in the night) but I could not borrow for five minutes... the response was just "unfortunately the scale must stay here".   Except for that and for the hotel rates that are a bit overpriced, I would have rated 5 stars.

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel and very convenient to the Disney parks
Summary: We stayed at the resort for 2 nights while we were visiting Disneyland and California Adventure.  The room was recently renovated and was beautiful.  Spacious w/ 2 queen beds and a sofa.  The balcony looked out over woods and was very relaxing in the evening.  The pools were great - next time we visit, I want to spend at least 1/2 a day in the beautiful cabanas by the pool.  Service in the hotel and around the pools was wonderful.

This is the best location possible- the hotel have a gate straight to California adventure. We got a wonderful suite where we could watch the fireworks from balcony. And it was great to get a short nap and go back to the park. We also love the breakfast with characters at storyteller cafe- very good food.

The service is beyond belief. Amazing staff. Beautiful place and soooo handy to get right into park and downtown Disney. They were going through renovations and we had a room just about as far as you can get. 2 super long hallways and one short one to the elevators. The walls were throes and plastic on the floors. I have difficulty walking (I had a scooter delivered) so it was a little far.   Pool closes at 9 so we didn't get to enjoy the pool. Too early I think.   Room was. Beautiful and the shower amazing.   Restaurants were great. I was there for my 50th b day party. Our view was over the world of Disney store in down town Disney and could see a little into California adventure, too.   Great trip.

Summary Heading: The resort is overrated - Villas small, bed VERY uncomfortable and overpriced for what you get
Summary: I wanted a nice convenient resort for my grandson's 2nd Bday trip to Disneyland.  I was not concerned about the price as long as it was a 4-5 start hotel.  The check in process was easy but they did not tell us about the security check going into Downtown Disney.  The hotel never offered to check our backpacks and when we got to gate it was AWEFUL!.  Daniel and the tall security lady with fake blonde hair were rude, disrespectful, unprofessional and hostel.  They treated us like criminals and was traumatized by the experience. I ask to speak to supervisor but he was like 18 yrs old and useless.  I also spoke to hotel management about the experience and they were also no help.  My daughter had 2 yr old on her back (in ergo) and we told them we did not understand what to do or

I've stayed at all 3 of the Disneyland resort hotels and this one was by far my favourite!  It is the least Disney of them all but that is what I liked about it.  It is a fairly large property and beautifully maintained.  The best part was the easy access (and short walk) to enter Downtown Disney and California Adventure.  The rooms are a decent size; I stayed with my 3 children and we were able to reserve a room with a double bed and a bunk bed with a trundle bed so each had their own bed. Our room also had a small balcony that overlooked the pool which was nice.    We were travelling with another family and the front desk staff were very accommodating in putting us not only on the same floor but right beside each other.  It seemed any staff member we dealt with was beyond

After a lot of walking, a LOT of walking it was so great to see entrance to grand Californian (5 minutes from soarin).  We stayed club and there was a bit of confusion because none of the valets could tell me how to get there.  Finally got up to check in at 8 am and when I asked if I had a renovated room (only thing that mattered to me) he said no.  I told him politely I wanted a renovated room and he made a call and not only did he get me new room but it was ready!!!  We went to it and it had amazing view of soarin and guardians (we paid for theme park view).  Room was brand new and fabulous.  The club level was good, not the best I've stayed but good.  Attendants were very nice. Oh and toiletries were awesome.  One thing that rankled us a bit was they have security people

Reluctantly booked this hotel for our first trip to Disneyland with our first family trip with our new little girl. I was reluctant because at $600 a night it rates as the priciest hotel all the way down to Pelican Hill in Newport Beach.    Our issues: As the elevator pics shown below demonstrate, our tower is under construction.  Disgusting the amount of filth the elevator had. Vents fully exposed with nothing but nasty particle being blown in.   Advised of this at check-in with the comment "You may hear some noise but it shouldn't be too bad". This immediately rang bells for us because we travel frequently and realize what hotel construction sites sound and look like.   Sure enough at 5:00 on Monday morning loud noises woke us up as work began.    Finally, it took 3 calls to

My family and I have stayed at this hotel twice and both times we received outstanding service.
