The rooms were beautifully laid out and clean, with each room offering a different view of either the parks, Downtown Disney or the pool area. By far the best hotel in the Disneyland area!   With such close proximity to Downtown Disney, Disneyland and apart of Californian Adventure Park, you couldn't ask for more. The hotel has fantastic restaurants, we particularly loved storytellers cafe. The staff were so accommodating and ensured that we felt welcomed as soon as we walk through the doors. Additionally the architecture is out of this world! So beautiful and warm, you will never want to leave!

Summary Heading: I am in LOVE LOVE LOVE with this hotel!
Summary: I am an Annual Passholder and stay at the Grand Californian frequently. Best, best location in the parks. I have read some reviews that were less then flattering and I am shocked. This hotel is magnificent. Rooms are always clean and they always try to accommodate my room requests. Check in is at 3 and it is hit or miss. No big deal. Most time I get in earlier but depending on the time of year could be closer to 4ish. That being said, you just check your bags at the bell stand and hit the parks. The hotel itself is architecturally amazing and they actually do have tour of the hotel and explain the different rooms and architecture (Craftsman Style). I was there a week ago and had one of the refurbished room. Very nicely done and the showers are great! The mattresses are to die

Everything you would expect of one of Disney's top locations - beautifully done, very friendly staff, great access to the two parks (short walk right into both) and loads of activities. Great access right to Downtown Disney which we found much better for our daily meals. As with Disney's other top attractions, be prepared to pay for the convenience.

Summary Heading: King Arthur's Log Cabin - No. Just no.
Summary: We have been to DL many times but this was our first stay at the Grand Californian. We selected this hotel as our twins are toddlers and proximity to the parks was worth the expense - we thought. I travel for business and we have travelled internationally exetensively for pleasure so when I say this is a very average hotel, I have good benchmarks.   Let's start with the decor...it is like a woodsy cottage-with no Disney references at all. The material in room states it harkens back to early California. I suppose. I am not a California resident but I can assure you it does not remind me of California in any way. It also has no Disney characters or decor at all. King Arthur's log cabin.  The rooms themselves are small and standard layout. For reference, the Sheraton Park hotel a

Summary Heading: Ok hotel but I don't think its worth the premium.
Summary: This was our third trip to Disneyland in as many years and decided to stay onsite this time, the room was ok, but cant say much about the food, We were here when the pools were being renovated which was a major hassle being shuttled back and forth to another property. Encountered some very angry want to be TSA security people going into the Downtown Disney area, and it was not a one time only occurrence. I don't really know if the magic hour is worth the hassle, with offsite hotels being so close I suspect I will just stay outside the gates next time.

Summary Heading: Upgraded to the Mt Whitney Suite!
Summary: My boyfriend and I have always wanted to stay here. For his birthday back in May, I decided to look for rooms and they just happened to have a Annual Passholder discount that made it reasonably priced, so I booked immediately. I also happened to book the Chef's Counter at Napa Rose and a character breakfast at Storyteller's Cafe. Now, I am research addicted whereas my boyfriend likes to be surprised, so by the time our vacation was approaching, I knew the Grand Californian inside and out. Through my research, I discovered that you can arrive early in the morning the day of your reservation and they will store your bags for you while you enjoy Extra Magic Hour and they will text you when your room is ready. We arrived at 7am on our check in day and the lady at the desk told us

My new husband and I consider ourselves Disney fanatics - we are annual pass holders who travel regularly from Las Vegas to spend our time and hard earned money at the most magical place on earth. For honeymoon, we thought we'd do something extra special and splurge by staying at the Grand Californian. I can honestly say for how much we paid (around $550 a night), I was so under-whelmed and disappointed that he and I have both decided that we will not be returning. My husband and I both work at five star, five diamond properties in Vegas and while we certainly have high expectations due to our occupations, we do not usually hold other resorts or properties to that standard. I can honestly say that the experience I had at the Grand Californian was no better than what I get at the

Summary Heading: We are not happy with the renovations.
Summary: I love the Grand Californian hotel however we did not like the renovations, but in an emergency this is the place to be. I travel with my mom who is handicapped we were put in a handicap room which I requested. When we first entered the room and there was no air conditioning the room was hot and stuffy. The sent some one up right away and they fixed it but 2 days later we were calling down to have them fix it again. The room design was not great  even though there was a lot of room. When you entered it was wide and then right be for the room the had the closet and across from the closet was a coat rack. There was plenty of space to park the scooter before the closet but there was no outlet. It was hard to get the scooter across the room and the lack of outlets left us parking it

A very good hotel with helpful staff and right next to Disney park so very easy access. We stayed in a suite with two bedrooms that was very spacious and could easily accommodate a large family / group of friends with comfort.

Summary Heading: No equal for proximity to the parks
Summary: Though you are paying Beverly Hills prices for an Anaheim hotel, you'll likely not regret staying here as it essentially sits in the parks. Request a Downtown Disney-view for a fantastic view of the nightly fireworks. There's also an in-room TV network that plays the synched music to the show. The recent room renovations make the rooms feel a bit more elegant, as they were really starting to show their age. Wake-up calls from Mickey are a really fun touch.   So, yes, it's expensive but it's the closest thing you'll find to being able to spend the night at Disneyland.

Where do I even begin? It's hard for me to think of all the things that went wrong for us. My family and I are frequent Disney World attendees we've stayed at multiple Disney resorts (Grand Floridian, Yacht and Beach, Contemporary etc) we have a certain level of expectations when we attend a Disney hotel and are on Disney property. Disneyland and Disney World are literally on two different levels. Upon our arrival, no one offered to help us with our bags or even take them inside for us we just got off a 7 hour flight and a 1 hour car ride from LAX to Anaheim. So we dragged our bags in just kind of guessing where to go. Check in went smooth, we were told we got an upgrade. Great so we are working our way to our room to find out we are actually at the end of two long snaking

I'm writing a review if Disney's Grand Californian because I read so many negative reviews as we sat in LA traffic on our way there. This is an expensive hotel, but you already know that. You are paying for the location, the Disney touches, the location, and a gorgeous building.   Yes, I said "location" twice. Have you ever had to trek half a mile to an off-resort hotel with tired 6-year-olds? I have. At this hotel, we dropped off our sweatshirts at 10 am, ate a snack in our room, and re-entered the park 10 minutes later. After riding the water ride, we went up to our room and changed. When it got too hot, we spent a few hours at the pools, and then returned. It's SO NICE to have this option!  I will also say that, thanks to Magic Morning and our strategic use of fast passes, we

We spent our Mom's 75th birthday at Disney and enjoyed the convenience Grand Californian.  The entrance from the hotel to the park made it easier to come in and out of the California Adventure.  We also had a lovely time having a character breakfast as part of our celebration. The lobby is impressive and the hotel is large-- could be a long walk to the room-- next time we'll request for a room closer to the lobby.

Summary Heading: Our first time staying at the Grand Californian and it was pretty close to perfect!
Summary: We stayed for 6 nights at the Grand Californian and had a fabulous experience!  We had a newly renovated standard room (no view but we could see the fireworks at night which was a nice surprise!) with two queen beds and a day bed.  This was perfect for our family as we have 3 kids 17, 14, and 13.  The rooms are quite large, with a huge flat screen t.v., lots of outlets to charge phones, a fridge, closet (we used this as our food pantry) and good size bathroom area.  There was no bathtub, just a huge walk-in shower which we loved!  Everyone at the hotel was super friendly and polite.  Housekeeping did a great job cleaning the room each day and the turn-down service at night was awesome!  We loved hanging out at the pool in the afternoon, the loungers were super comfy and there

Summary Heading: Best hotel in Disney land for young kids
Summary: We traveled with 3 kids and the reason I believe this hotel is the best it's because of the direct access to the park from hotel lobby . The hotel itself has charming feel and rustic although I loved Disney land hotel in Paris way more but when in La I believe it's the best option . They have rooms with bunk beds which is comfortable for families . We took vip service and managed to skip all the lines , if your willing to pay extra money then it's worth the experience .

I went with my 3 1/2 year old daughter and my sister. I was there for one night and had a park hopper pass to both parks: Disney Land and California Adventures. The hotel put us facing the park, but the walk from the elevator was lengthy ---not ideal after walking the entire 12 hour day. It was very quiet and restful though. The room was adequate. It was clean. It was presentable. But this property is not meant for you to stay indoors considering everything that is happening outside. The check-in was at 3pm and we arrived at 11 am. We couldn't get in but we checked in. We left our bags in the car. So when I arrived to the room, at 11:45 pm, I had to go outside and get my bags. I wish I would have been given more options with my luggage. Aside from that, the Concierge was most

Summary Heading: Worst feeling trip iv ever had
Summary: I don't know where to start with this place, I'll start by saying I have a 8 and 14 year old daughters who love Disneyland. We took a trip here four years ago and had a blast. unfortunately this time was truly one of the worst experience with a hotel I have ever had, we were told when booked that rooms were on a first come first serve bases, we live in Southern California so we got there at 9 am to check in paid for a upgraded room to see the world of colors, we were told we would be checked in early and would send us a text when the room was ready, we hung out and the pool tell 3 pm went and asked when our room would be ready, and they said right now he gave us the map of where are room was and it was not a view of world of colors, we let him know we had been there since 9 am

What a great place to stay. The amenities of the Grand Californian are fantastic. Super clean and a friendly staff. Close proximity to Downtown Disney makes shopping easy. Walking distance to theme parks makes it kid friendly. Small pets that are well behaved are welcome. And the pool is, well Disney all over. Your imagination will have to describe it for you as you look at the lush vegetation around the pool. Perfectly manicured shrubs and walkways. And the water, Perfect.

Summary Heading: A mixed bag, but I guess I would try it again...hoping for better.
Summary: We've stayed in many Disney resorts and are rarely disappointed.  This one was a disappointing experience in a couple of ways, but hopefully our experience was an anomaly. First off, the hotel is beautiful and the lobby is breathtaking, reminiscent of  The Wilderness Lodge in Disney World in Florida. The  theming  is outstanding  in typical Disney style, and the amenities and close proximity to Disneyland and California adventure parks can't be beat. Unfortunately, we checked in at  10 PM to find a very dirty room. Clearly this is unacceptable, and just as unacceptable was the hour it took to have housekeeping respond and reclean the room. I'm sorry, but when you're paying top dollar for a Disney experience, finding previous guests' hair, soap scum, and trash along with a

Disney is always a great experience. We stayed in a beautiful vacation club two bedroom room. Staff goes above and beyond to make you feel welcome and to help with any issues. Dining options at this resort is expensive, but it generally is at Disney. Pools were great and having entrance into California Adventure park is great.

About the most expense place to stay around Disney, but you get what you pay for.  The hotel is beautiful and true to the theme of a grand lodge.  The rooms, recently upgraded (though I hear some wings aren‚Äôt yet) were great.  Beds very comfortable.  Luxury showers (though water pressure wasn‚Äôt great, as expected in California).  The staff was plentiful, professional and helpful.  Our rooms (by request) had two queens and what they call a ‚Äúday bed‚Äù which was an ingenious piece of magic that went from a very nice couch to a hidden bed by flipping over, so it doesn‚Äôt take any more space like a sofa bed would and has a thicker, standard twin mattress.  What you are really paying for though is location, location, location.  This hotel is wedged between the California Adventure park

This is a great resort and the highlight is the great service. From valet to checking in to the housekeeping staff, we were delighted with the level of service received.  We were in a renovated room and after reading some of the neg reviews, we were pleasantly surprised. Great linens and comfy beds, quiet room, no noisy ac, lovely rain shower head. Very clean and well appointed. Housekeeping provided excellent service. We always had fresh towels. We used the laundry room and found it clean and nice. Pool area was good though they could use more servers as drinks were slow. There is a viewing terrace for World of Color on 6th floor which was nice surprise. You can't beat the location to California Adventure nor Downtown Disney District. Disneyland is only five minute walk. The

Summary Heading: Great hotel, Great location, amazing view
Summary: We loved this hotel. We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa and we had plenty of space. We traveled with another family, so there were 8 people. We loved having a full kitchen, 3 bathrooms, and a dryer for our wet swimsuits. The major downside was the check-in process. I called a week before arrival to request early check in. I understand this isn't guaranteed. We arrived at 10 am, were told our room would be ready soon. It was eventually ready at 4:45 pm, even though check in was 4:00 and it was promised by 4:00.

It was our child's first time visiting Disneyland. We stayed at Disney Grand Hotel for 4days.   That was a great experience from the moment we arrived, to the end of our stay. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We arrived early in the morning, therefore, the hotel checked our bags in while we hung out at the pool. There are 3 pools for all ages, slides, and kid friedly.  I loved the soothing music in the background at the pool, along with the friendly service, to their delicious margarita drink.  A perfect way to arrive for our first day.  We started our Disney experience the following day for 3 days. It will be costly for dining.  The snack shop will have food that will be a little more affordable. To find an affordable restaurant, you will want to go off of the Disney

What a wonderful trip we had!  We had a park view room so I expected a distant view of the parks--instead California Screamin was pretty much right outside our balcony--it was really cool.  We were right in the middle of the action with the special entrance to Downtown Disney and California Adventure right from the hotel.  The pool and slide were awesome.  I found it odd that there was no food/drink service counter at the pool but there was waitstaff and the cafe was not too far away.  Our room had a king sized bed and a day bed (and a chair bed, though we did not use it) so we had ample flexibility.  The bathrooms were quite nice and very clean.  I would love to go back to this resort, it really felt like we were right in the middle of the magic!

A wonderful hotel, great restaurants, all the staff are knowledgeable and will to go the extra mile to serve. Truly the happiest place on earth. Spa, exercise room, laundry in the room, kitchenette. A great suite like hotel.

We stayed at DGC from August 20th-22nd.  This was our first trip to Disneyland without our kids (ages 16 and 20) and we were celebrating our 24th wedding anniversary.  We decided to splurge and stay on property and it was amazing.  We stayed in a beautiful updated room on the second floor with no view.  We didn't pay extra for a view room, too expensive, but were hoping for a free upgrade for our anniversary, didn't happen but that's ok!  Every employee was friendly and helpful, just a delight.  Check in was easy and well organized.  Loved the park staying open an hour later for the Guardians ride, we rode it 4 times during the Magic Hour!  We had a few hiccups, the first was that our room wasn't stocked correctly when we arrived, I guess each room gets checked before it's

This was (probably) our one trip to Disneyland and I wanted the convenience of a hotel where we could walk right into the parks.  I can't imagine going to DL and staying in another hotel after our experience there.  We've stayed in one other Disney property (Animal Kingdom Lodge) and so I can only compare the two but the Grand Californian isn't very Disney like.  It's an upscale hotel but you won't get the cutesy characters if that is what you are looking for.  You will get a professionally played piano with classical Disney toons in soft inviting musical style.  The pool area is amazing as are the lounge chairs.  They also brought out sweets around 2-3 every afternoon for you to sample.  You can order from the wait staff or go into a little cafe of sorts that is hidden over by

This was our first family trip to Disney. We are a family of 2 adults and 2  boys. We stayed for one night  in room 1254 on August 18th to celebrate their 7th birthday, We were driving from santa monica and checked in at the front desk at 7AM. Why so early you ask? It turns out you can get that extra morning magic hour the day you are checking in as well as the day you leave. And we managed to leverage that magic hour into about 5 rides in one hour! It was nice to go back to the hotel pools during the day and take a break from the theme parks. Probably my favorite memory of the trip is of my sons going down the water slides for the first time. So that alone was with it for me. And there were some really little kids going down that big slide that spins around that faux tree. And

We had a great 4 nights at Disney's GC. Check-in was great. Front desk worked with us to get a view away and be from construction. Bags were held until the room was ready.  Got a refurbished room that was nice, even with 5 even the room. Shower was great. Housekeeping even tucked all the Disney pillow pets in daily. Could hear World of Color Music each night. Lights from the ferris wheel were enjoyable.  Pool was relaxing. Tried the new Max Pass, which was worth it for the amount of rides we could get on easily with the fast passes thru the app instead of walking up to distribution areas. Summary: GREAT family vacation. Service as wonderful. Thanks Grand Californian.

Summary Heading: Not as magical as we'd hoped!
Summary: Key to this hotel is the direct access to Disney's California Adventure Park - this was brilliant and worth being in the hotel.  But the hotel itself didn't have the magic or fun we were expecting and certainly didn't have the wow factor.  The great hall is indeed very grand - but also freezing cold (fake coldness to make the log fire seem inviting?? What an extravagant and unnecessary environmental drain).    Staff were generally polite but not really cheerful or happy. The guy who checked us in was great and gave a really personal service explaining all sorts of details about the park - but the next day blanked us twice.   Our room had been newly renovated - but was disappointing. The carpet was rough underfoot - not very cosy and didn't feel particularly clean. The room was

We stayed for three days with direct entry into Disney California Park. This hotel is really friendly and makes you feel young again. It was my wife's birthday as well as our thirtieth wedding anniversary and the staff and crew mad her feel special. Being a guest at this hotel also lets you into the parks an hour earlier than general admission and you get to keep a personalized door swipe card key when you leave. You can use this as a charge card in all the parks and shops as well and have it all charged to your room. Careful as room service does incur a further 19% surcharge on top of the pricing, but plenty of cheaper options 5 minutes walk in Downtown Disneyland. Can't highly recommend this place for fun, adventure and closeness to all facilities and parks.

Could not believe this is a Disney property. Last year we stayed at the Grand Floridian and had an amazing experience. This year we decided to go west and regret the decision. The staff was very rude and unaccommodating from the start. We booked a park view room and arrived to a room facing trees and the motor of a noisy roller coaster. When I went to the front desk to request a room change they couldn't have been less sincere. I asked for a manager and it was even worse! The manager "Courtney" came out and was very stern and scripted. Not a sincere bone in her. After all this place is supposed to be "magical".  Regardless, after accepting the circumstances and not wanting to waste anymore time at the front desk we settled into our room. The rest of the stay was just ok. Most of

Summary Heading: So close to the action and true Disney Feel - a little dated though.
Summary: As a family of 4 we arrived on Dec 31 - just in time for the highly anticipated New Year Celebration. Unfortunately our room wasn't ready for us arriving and we had to take a nap in the lobby until 2 pm. Thankfully the staff didn't mind as we'd arrived from Australia - once we were shown where our room was we took a well-earned rest and woke just in time to make it to the Park for the Fireworks. Amazing is the only word we could think of at the time as we were overwhelmed at the scale. The room was comfortable but a little dated, the beds were fantastic, really cosy and plenty of blankets to keep us warm. Food options were good with a choice of varying $$ eateries although not much for the health-conscious traveller. Staff were friendly and accomodating, eager to know that we

Summary Heading: More beautiful in person -- even with renovations ongoing.
Summary: We weren't sure what to expect our first stay at a Disney resort. It met and exceeded our expectations. Beautiful property. The lobby is really something to see. The renovated rooms are fantastic. Our room was spotless. Room service breakfast was right on time and delicious both mornings we ordered. Proximity to parks cannot be beat. So nice to take a park break and go for a swim. Kids loved the pool with the slide. Excellent service throughout the hotel, and by the pools. Very attentive. We also loved Napa Rose for dinner.

This is our 7th annual Disneyland trip. We had stayed at the Paradise Pier and The Disneyland Hotel twice. We had great stays and expected the same at the Grand Californian. It looked better and seemed more impressive (technically it's a 4.5 star not a 5). At $600 per night, I expected it to be great but it wasn't!  It's under renovation which we didn't know. The carpets were covered in plastic (impossible to pull luggage down) and there were workings in the halls constantly. The room looked more like a best western room than a $600 per night hotel. They were very plain and not impressive at all. The Hilton down the street has nicer rooms and fireworks views. No twinkle headboard like the Disneyland Hotel. The beds were okay but over all I give this room a C. There were no

This a beautiful hotel with fabulous grounds and pools.  The lobby is striking.  I think we had a renovated room on the first floor which was perfect.  Access to the parks and downtown Disney is very fast and easy.  Self Parking was simple. We had breakfast at the Storyteller Cafe in the hotel which was a character breakfast and great fun.  First time to this hotel and Californian Adventure Park.  Had been to Disneyland a long time ago and its surroundings have been transformed.  It's now a resort, not just a park in the center of a bunch of motel.  It was worth every penny of the price.  Would go back.

Summary Heading: Great stay and perfect location for a Dad with 2 little boys!
Summary: We arrived to find out that we had been upgraded from a standard room to a premium view room! We were in room 4007. Hallway overlooking the lobby and outside overlooking the pool and some of DCA. I had my two young boys with me, so this was the PERFECT location in respect to the parks. It was so convenient to have the access to DCA! The bell desk people were great with taking my bags while I parked and waited for my room to be ready. The room was spacious. it had a queen bed and a bunk bed with a pull out trundle bed. There was a pack and play in the closet that I used for my toddler. The pool was great and everyone there was very friendly and helpful. It would be nice if they had a toddler pool that was only a foot or 2 deep for the little ones. The maid service did not seem

We checked in to the hotel with family with two rooms booked. Strangely the two rooms were booked differently but the check in staff worked it all out fairly quickly. The hotel was very nice - clean, modern, felt like a high quality hotel. Great location for the parks and downtown Disney.  The rooms were nice, clean and tidy. We booked a view room of Disneyland and the view was mainly of a tree with a peeaboo view of the Disneyland wheel behind it.  It was a little disappointing but as we were barely in the room it did not bother us. I would not pay extra for that room again though.   Breakfast in the cafe was extra but well worth it - seeing the characters was fun, and the choice was good.   Front desk staff, breakfast caf√© staff, and bar staff were all great.  The hotel is

Stayed at Disney Grand Californian hotel Sunday to Tuesday with my family. It's always been a dream goal to Disney all day and stay adjasent to California Adventure. Well worth it. Not a cheap or frugal stay, but worth the cost. If you can do it, do it and go all out. Staff was Disney 1st class, amenities were great,and you can't get a better location. When staying here you are made to feel like your part of the total experience. Food was ok, still had a theme park feel and quality,  but with downtown Disney a few steps away you have a lot of choices.

So close AND extra magic hour in the morning at California Adventure AND extra extra magic hour to ride Guardians of the Galaxy after park hours.    I've stayed at all the Disney hotels and several of property hotels. The older I get... The more I love the Grand Californian and how close it is to the parks. This was my second visit to the Grave Californian.   We did get the renovated rooms and I really appreciate the extra outlets for charging electronics as well as the hardwood floors. Definitely a cleaner look and feel.   I found the bed and pillows super comfy and the staff were very helpful. (Front desk, concierge and bell services.)  After staying here it is hard to stay anywhere else, especially since this is now the only hotel that gives you access to the special entrance

Summary Heading: It was a good stay with some hiccups
Summary: We had a great time and we added the Concierge to our reservation.   We got to have breakfast, lunch , dinner and desert with our reservation.  It also included all you could drink.  Which was  a big plus for us.  LOL  Their Cabanas are awesome also.   We had great service our cabana host was awesome.   Great time had all around will visit again.

We stayed here for 4 nights while my husband attended a medical conference and immediately were impressed with the beauty of this hotel. The room we got seemed to have been recently renovated so it was very clean and well appointed with plenty of closet and drawer space (with self-closing hinges), fancy mini fridge, very comfortable beds and linens, and a tub/shower combo with a rain shower head as well as a handheld shower head (good for hosing down my kids). Our view from the third floor was a roof and Disneyland Drive which wasn't bad but we weren't there for the view anyway. The pools were a hit with my 4 and 2 year olds, especially the little water slide. If you plan to use the pool, go in the morning as by midday, all the lounge chairs are taken but mostly by people

I was a little leery after reading some comments about construction noise and old rooms at this hotel. Because for the price, you do not want to have a bad experience! We didn't see, hear, or smell one bit of construction/renovation our entire stay. From the moment we pulled up until we checked out we were treated wonderfully. Every single staff member was friendly and helpful. The convenience of being able to walk right into California Adventure is incomparable. It was the BEST! The pools are phenomenal. Every inch of this hotel is beautiful and exquisite. The beds were very comfortable. We booked a room that didn't have a fancy view. It said it would have a 'street or rooftop' view. But the grounds are so well-done that our view was still like we were in the woods, it was

My family and I were attempting to ask for directions of at the Disney Californian regarding entry into California Adventure. I stopped a man, identified as "Joshua" who appeared to be enroute to some other business. He immediately stopped and addressed my question as though it was of the utmost importance. We had been given instructions from the Disneyland Hotel upon checkin that the park would open an hour early so we were prepared to enter at 0700am, only to be advised by Joshua that the schedule had changed to new hours and it wasn't until 0900am. We were extremely disappointed and tired from being at Disneyland late the night before. Without hesitation, Joshua asked if we would be interested in eating breakfast compliments of the hotel. Talk about outstanding customer

I stayed at the Grand Californian while attending a conference for a week at the Disneyland Hotel Conference Center. The Hotel was undergoing extensive renovations during my stay, but this did not detract much from my guest experience.  Arrival was quick and easy. I was checked in and had keys to my room in less than 5 minutes. The room was on a high floor, spacious, very comfortable and had a cozy balcony. I stayed in one of the newly renovated rooms (they were still renovating rooms further down the hall but I never heard construction sounds). The bathroom was lovely with a spacious shower and the bed was very very comfortable. It was so comfortable that I lifted the sheets to find out the brand and then purchased a similar mattress from the same manufacturer for my own

Summary Heading: A good experience but probably won't stay again.
Summary: Pains me to give this hotel only 3 stars but we've stayed at the Disney Hotel and when you compare the two, the California Disney Hotel should be your #1 choice. When you pay for this overly expensive hotel, your paying for the convenience if it being so close by to the park. Being so close to the park is perfect when you have little ones.  As always, everyone there was very kind. The pool is great but the slide that is featured on the website is a lot smaller than what they make it seem on the website (which is usually the case for most website but this one was exaggerated). Everything is over priced as most things are in Disneyland but you would think they would give the guest a bit more of a break since they are already paying so much for the rooms. We ordered a pizza and one

Face it, you're looking into staying here because you prefer not to deal with the noise and congestion of Anaheim. Of course there are some decent hotels sprinkled in among the glorified crash-pads that crowd Harbor blvd, but nothing sucks the magic out of your Disneyland trip than a smelly bus ride or traversing Disney's Titanic parking structure. Of course the Disneyland Hotel with all it's whimsy is absolutely a big recommend, but nothing beats being able to walk out of the hotel and into the adjacent California Adventure park. It's also a quick walk to DL from there and you're in the heart of downtown Disney as well. In short, all the action is directly outside your hotel room.

I was speaking at a medical conference and stayed at the Grand Californian. The physical structure is impressive with lots of wood trim. My room was quite spacious and had a excellent bathroom with a good shower. There was no bath tub. There was an adequate fitness facility that was never crowded. The staff were very attentive and helpful. The hotel is located next to both Downtown Disney and the Adventure Park. In addition, there are 2 restaurants on site and there are many other choices in Downtown Disney or at the Disneyland hotel which is a 10 min walk from this hotel. I was very satisfied with this hotel and would stay here again when I am in the Anaheim area.

First, this hotel is under major reconstruction/remodel summer 2017. Second, we drove 15 hours and checked in tired. Third, we paid for a view and asked for a wheelchair accessible room. Lastly, bottom line, all the rooms are large enough to accommodate a wheel chair; however, not all rooms come with a view and the so called Disney "accessible" rooms from our experience are tight, small, and there's no view- closeted!!! Don't ask for an accessible room, they all come with step in tubs and or a roll in shower BUT not a view.   If you ask and pay for a view even if you're requesting an accessible room, then you should get an accessible room with a view, be assertive. They have everything you want and more, you pay, you get, be assertive.   We checked in early Sunday for our 3

This hotel offers it all!  Location to the parks, big rooms and baths, good pool service, and nice hotel staff!  The check in was very easy and our room was ready even though it was 9am!  We had a room on the 3rd floor and it was super quite.  The location to California Adventure Park can not be beat!!  And it is an easy walk to Disneyland and Downtown Disney for dinner and shopping.  The beds are comfortable and the rooms are very clean.  You do have a refrigerator in your room and that is nice to keep cold water and snacks for the kids. This hotel is expensive, but worth it!  Would definitely pick it again!!

Summary Heading: Location can't be beat! 2 bedroom villa with pool views, 5th floor
Summary: We booked a 2 bedroom villa for 4 nights through our DVC membership for 7/9-7/12. It was very luxurious and a perfect location to not only Disneyland and California parks but for the Disney marketplace which you walked directly into from the resort! We never needed our car! My husband self parked instead of valet to save us some $ since we knew we wouldn't need it until the last day.  The pools were very nice and never felt overcrowded. Nice touch was having ice water available pool side.  It was so hot while we were there that we would take a break during the hottest part of the day and go back to the resort to cool off at the pool and then go back to the parks later.   I highly recommend staying at the Grand Californian.  The one issue I had (which was maybe just my

The location of the hotel for the Disney California Adventure Park is amazing. The pools are nice but they are crazy about having an armband on. I was asleep on a lounge chair and a pool worker shook my foot to wake me up so I could show my room key. The rooms are nice, a little small for the price. We had access to the club room. Watching the fireworks from the balcony of the club room was super nice. The service in the club room was a bit slow. The food was good except for the evening appetizers. The hot choices tasted like they came out of a card board box. I definitely think for the price they could have offered more choices during the evening reception. The concierge service kept bragging about how they were more than willing to help us. We asked for help finding a hat in

This was our first time staying here.  I would love to stay again. But the price is so high.  I liked that is was so close to downtown disney and we could enter disney California adventure early and get our world of color fastpass, And than go ride Cars.  The lobby of the Hotel was amazing,  The halloween display was so incredible.  Rooms were clean and the turndown service with chocolate on your pillow nice touch

Summary Heading: Don't invite guests onto the hotel property?
Summary: Location cannot be beat.  Service from valet can be slow, but is otherwise excellent.  Room service, excellent.  There is some construction going on now, but it is clearly described on their web site, and really wasn't an issue at all.  They do have a private entrance for Grand Californian guests only to California Adventure which we used once, and it took 10 minutes longer to get through than through the main entrance (some family used the main park entrance at the same time as we used the hotel private entrance); the line is just too long to be of benefit on entry when the California Adventure park opens.  So why only an average rating of '3'?  We made a dinner reservation for 12 family members at one of the Grand Californian's restaurants, which included family who were

We stayed here on my husband's 50th birthday because he is a Disneyland freak and staying here was on his bucket list. While the service at this hotel is exceptional, it is necessarily slow because of the number of guests. Valet parking...room service...baggage check-in all required substantial waits.  But my main complaint here is the price. $700+ for one night. I have stayed in hotels all over Anaheim and this Grand Californian room was just slightly better than a Holiday Inn Express. It truly will be a once-in-a-lifetime experience for us.

Love this hotel.  The newly remodeled rooms are wonderful.  Lots of light,  USB plugs & comfortable  beds. 5 Stat service. Located near Disney California Adventure Park. Had its own entrance into ghost park.

This hotel features the Disney magic that we love and expect. The moment you walk in you are greeted by a majestic lobby that seems to be straight out of a story book. The staff are incredible as well. We had one minor issue, which was handled with grace and ease. Now for the best part, "Location...location...location."  In staying at this property you are literally inside the DIsney California Adventure park.  I cannot stress how convenient this is and how much better we were able to use our time because of this convenience. Yes, this hotel is pricier than pretty much every other option, but worth every penny in time saved and in capturing the feeling of being a part of the park itself.

Stayed here for 2 nights in the 2 bedroom suite.This room easily sleep 8 - or 10 if several are smaller children. There is 3 - yes 3 bathrooms - which come in handy in the morning or after full day at parks. One room has king bed, second bedroom has 2 queens. In the living room is Murphy bed and pull out couch. But with the Murphy bed and couch pulled out there is no room to walk. The kitchen is a full kitchen and table. Adjacent to bathroom is washer/dryer combination in one unit. There is 2 balconies. Our room overlooked the pool - so we had good view of Disneyland fireworks.  There are multiple pools and 2 hot tubs. The larger pool has a slide. I have stayed at multiple deluxe hotels at Disney World - so I was disappointed with this pool. The afternoon we were swimming there

My daughter and I had only one night to spend at Disney. We stayed here to be the closest and it was worth it. The separate entrance into California Adventure was amazing and super fast. Downtown is right out  the front door. We used the laundry and it was nice. My only complaint is that I either paid for or was upgraded to concierge level and no one ever explained how that worked so I didn't get any of the advantages. Next time I visit Disneyland I will stay here if I can afford it!

Reading reviews before we arrived, I was a little worried about the Grand Californian. I read that  the rooms were getting old. When booking, I noticed that refurbishments were being done during our stay and it worried me more. Once we arrived in the beautiful entrance, I asked the check in staff if they had any refurbished room available, none were available, my worry grew... Once we got our room ( standard view ) I was very impressed. Although it was an "old" room, everything was perfect, working and in good order.The rooms were clean and the staff cleaned very well everyday. This was the first time in 15 years that we stayed at the Grand Californian and it looked like it did 15 years ago. The location of the hotel is, for lack of a better word, perfect. We would go to

Just waste of money.... nothing special about this hotel except the proximity to Disney adventure park. For the Disneyland park it's not close much more than the not expensive hotels across the street. The hotel itself not worth the 600 dollars!!! The rooms are extremely disappointing. The hotel didn't offer anything that justifies the price. We got the room with the bunk bed and it looked like a room you expect to see at your grandma house...maybe.  The bathroom is tiny and outdated. We wanted to see a movie all the family together... the TV was so small that we couldn't see the movie,although the TV was right in front of us....This is a 600 dollar hotel !  And that Not including the parking witch is 30 dollar ( other hotels across the street charge 17-18 dollars) and had to

Although we were forewarned about ongoing renovations at this hotel way back last year when we booked our stay, I did not expect that we would be roomed at a section where the hallway carpets are covered with plastic. The room is as old as time, was dark and had that moldy feel walking on it. We asked for a King bed and was placed in a queen with bunk beds? and then once in the room, the front desk said that the hotel is full and we can't be transferred anymore. We had a patio but we kept it closed with 2 toddlers in the room. Nice pool area and loved that both parks are directly accessible from this hotel. Really worth that extra convenience to walk in and out of the hotel to go to the park esp when it get's really hot. Also enjoyed partial view of the fireworks from our room.

We have had (so far) a very mixed experience at a property we have stayed in many times. The hotel is being renovated so some amenities have been curtailed. The cast members in the hotel have been fantastic although it irks me that when we arrive at the stipulated check-in time that, as my eldest daughter reminds me, the rooms are never ready. We like the hotel and it offers direct access to the theme parks and has a great pool area. The restaurants are generally fine and the cast members super friendly. Our issue is with the theme park cast members, some of whom have been incredibly rude to my wife who does not for health reasons do the many flumes and rides. I have never such petti-fogging bureaucracy as the new rules over the fast pass system this year. The new Max Pass

Summary Heading: Nice rooms, great location, (mostly) good staff
Summary: We stayed for four days at the club level at the Disney Grand Californian.    Overall, it was a great experience- we were met by a team member at the check in desk and taken directly to our room for check in.  The team member also showed us around the lounge and the amenities available at the club level (e.g., DVD players and movies on loan- which btw, is a great option when it is 100+F outside and we have been in the parks since 7 AM).    The Magic Morning access is great.  It gives you an extra hour in the parks without the crowds.  Our three day park hopper pass allowed us one Magic Morning (which we used) but when we went early to the second park on the next day (the Magic Morning keeps flipping between the Disney Adventure Park and the Disneyland) they allowed us to get in

This was quite possibly one of the nicest experiences we've had as a family. The Disney experience is on full display in this amazing hotel. The extra hour at the parks was very much enjoyed as well. We were sad to leave but can't wait to be back!

Lovely views from almost all rooms. The hotel staff are always excellent. Efficient. Eager and happy to meet every expectation to make your stay excellent. It costs a lot but you get what you pay for. Outstanding!!

This was our first stay in this hotel although we've been DVC members in the Grand Californian since 2010. We had a great time and hated to leave.  We used banked, current, and future points for 6 nights in the 2BR unit, an indulgence as we wanted our 13 y/o son to have his own room, and we skipped vacay last year.  Pros: 3 baths in a 2BR unit--the villa can sleep 5 adults/teens and 1 child comfortably, with an additional 3 children snugly. One king suite, one dual queen suite, sleeper sofa and a Murphy bed for a child. We had tons of space.   The full kitchen is great for making breakfast or dinner, and you can still get room service as an occasional treat.  We had a pool view and it looked great, but along with the 24/7 gym, we were too busy/tired to use them after days in the

Summary Heading: Nice resort located within the Disney California Adventure
Summary: we stayed room 4606 it was cleaned no bugs . we were a family of 5 we had two queen beds plus a guest bed. we had a fridge . we had access to the pool area and you need to bring all your room guest cards in order to get towels . there are 3 pools and one with a kid water slide the only negative thing is you dont see your kids in the stairs from far so if something happens you dont see what happened. it would be nice to remove the bricks ramps and put a window ramp so we can see the people wait. that's a small detail.the personnel staff very professional and courteous. You have easy access to Disney California adventure or downtown disneyland which is great to access the Parks early. but we didnt take advantage of it because with family with young children we hard to get out of

Parking: both hotels are a breeze to pull up to, drop off luggage, and head to self parking.  Verdict: both were awesome  Arrival: The Grand Californian lobby was under construction so check in was around the big black curtain and was very noisy.  We were upgraded to a renovated room and service was friendly.  The Disneyland Hotel (DH) was much more calm, and the front desk clerk activated our park tickets.   Verdict: Disneyland Hotel was better.  While the agent at the GC was super nice, he didn't activate our tickets, and the lobby noise was a bit off putting for a first impression, but didn't impact any part of our stay.   Access to rooms: Our room at the GC was very easy to get to, and the elevators were super fast.  There were lots of "cast members" standing around the

I am writing this to warn people who plan to stay at this hotel.  They are currently undergoing renovations and will warn you about noise.  However, it seems that they are using strong smelling cleaners(?) or chemicals(?) during this renovation.  We had checked in earlier and our room was not ready yet.  We finally received a text in the afternoon that our room was ready on the second floor.  We used the main elevators.  When we came out of the elevators to the main corridor on the second floor, the carpet was covered with plastic, and there was a strong chemical or detergent smell.  There were no signs to warn you about this.  We had to run with our mouths and noses covered until we reached our room.  However, the smell gave me a headache which would not go away even with

Summary Heading: This place is great, top down
Summary: We were sitting poolside today and a man in a suit came by, personally greeting guests, asking about their experiences, with an honest sincerity.  After a chat, we exchanged introductions and it turns out we were speaking with the hotel general manager.  We travel extensively and cannot recall ever having experienced a leader so interested in individual feedback.  He was sincerely welcoming and engaging.  It's no wonder this place runs so smoothly and every detail is a positive experience for guests.

We are so grateful we received a newly remodeled room (thanks Rafael at the front desk, who was such a great help to us).  This room is nice, clean, crisp and quiet. The lobby is majestic and I'm planning on spending some time in front of their gigantic fireplace (and yes, I'm aware it is July in California but it just looks so inviting). The pool is also very inviting and the chairs are among the nicest I have seen in any hotel.  We are here for a conference room. Our group is very large (hundreds) and the food  at out dinner was amazing. I usually am not a fan of mass produced food.

We stayed for four nights at the grand during my daughters dance the magic parade event. We got a good rate, which helped.  Check in was a breeze and so perfect!! We wanted a bunk room, as they will be phased out and this is the last opportunity. The kids loved it!! Our room was ready early, which was so awesome! The bell service delivered our bags immediately once I called them. The ease of all of this was so nice after the long travel to arrive and the kids ready to go and play in the parks.  Housekeeping did a great job, very friendly. It was just difficult with our timing. One day they were really early and had to leave because I had to get my daughter ready for the parade. Then next day it was after 4. That made it a little hard.  The pool area was gorgeous and fun. The

This hotel delivers as good as it can.  The location is fantastic being that it's right next to the parks with a private entrance to the park making it even more wonderful. Can't say enough about the great decor and first class comfort. Must see!!

Summary Heading: No air-conditioning.  Dishonest thermostats. Indiffererent management
Summary: Hello Disney Management We are currently at the hotel. We came to celebrate my daughter's 8th birthday.   The air conditioning does not work.  We have been trying to resolve this with the front desk since 330 pm when we were told it was fixed.  and with the night manager Fabiana when we asked for a room change.  Nope. No room change. Here are are sweating the night away.   Apparently Disney turns off your air-conditioning when you leave the room. This is not good policy for those with allergies to dust. Mildew or mold.   They saithey can over ride  the system..  yes please.  We did this at 3 pm. Except they don't fix it.   We returned after Dinner.  Then we spent 2 hours trying to get to fixed.  It is sri. not fixed.   We simply want a room with working air conditioning, which

Summary Heading: A Beautiful resort next to California Adventure and Downtown Disney
Summary: We have lived in SoCal our entire life and this is our first stay at the resort.. We stayed in one of the old rooms (remodeling is going on). but enjoyed it just the same. The room had all the amenities including a bathtub and a crib if needed. Our patio faced California Adventure so we were able to open the sliding door and listen to the sounds of the park and smell the food. We did not have the opportunity to enjoy the park as we were there for a conference. But resort guests are offered the opportunity to enter the parks on a rotating basis one hour before opening to the public(The Magic Hour). You can't beat the Disney experience. Friendly, welcoming staff.  It should be noted that Disney security is now screening everyone entering Downtown Disney from the Grand Californian

My wife, daughter and I spent 4 fantastic nights at the Grand Californian. Check-in was a breeze, taking only a few minutes. We were able to purchase our Park tickets while checking in. We stayed in a 1 bedroom villa, which could easily accommodate 5 adults and included 2 bathrooms, a full kitchen and a nice balcony. Unfortunately, our room was on the second floor and our view was of trees that were used in an attempt to block our view into the California Adventure park. The resort is connected to Disney's California Adventure park, through a private entrance and also has another entrance to Downtown Disney, which is used to walk to Disneyland via a 10 minute walk. Having our room so close to the parks made returning for lunch and a trip to the pool a breeze. The pool area is

Summary Heading: Lovely hotel with great location, undergoing some renovations
Summary: We stayed for two nights at this Disney hotel.  With direct access to Downtown Disney and California Adventure, this hotel is in the heart of the Disneyland action.  We had originally booked a two queen room for our party of four (grandma, mom and kids) but were told at check in that they needed to put us into a room with a king bed and a sofa bed.  None of us are particularly fond of sofa beds but since we could get into the room earlier than the usual check in time, we went with it.  Having a sofa to sit on during the day was a real plus in the end and we found the pull out bed to be just fine.  We had a nice little balcony overlooking the pool area.  The room also had a coffee table, a mini fridge, and a table with two chairs.  There are not enough outlets in the room, so if

We stayed with our 5 and 7 year old children in a recently renovated room for 3 nights.  The room was very comfortable.  The room was very clean and the staff were excellent.  They were still renovating the foyer at the time but this was not too disruptive. It is more expensive then other non-disneyland hotels but we found the dedicated entrance into California Adventure Park to be excellent and the magic hour made such a difference to getting on the more popular rides with only short wait times. The location was excellent and we thought the food at the Wildnerness Cafe was quite good. The laundry was also very handy.

Summary Heading: Grand Californian with a new look
Summary: Stayed in a newly remodeled room at the hotel. WOW! What change. The room seemed brighter but still that craftsman look.  You walk into the room that starts with wood floors moving into carpeting.  There is a coffee maker that uses K-cups.  The new TV must have been a 50 inch and mounted directly to the wall instead of furniture, like before.  In the past, electric outlets were limited to those on a desk.  Now, there were plugs everywhere including the night stand.  To add to that there were 12 USB plugs as well.  That is a great change.  There is more lighting in the room and a safe in the closet for laptops.  Another great change was the removal of the tub shower and replacement of a large walk in shower. And many more lights making the bathroom really nice and bright.  The

Summary Heading: All that its advertised to be
Summary: If you want to maximize your time at Disneyland, this is the perfect hotel.   Literally footsteps away to the entrance to both parks, with early access to one park each (alternating) day.   The 4 pools make for a nice respite during the day, and then so easy to head back to the park in the late afternoon.  Our room was large, comfy and clean.  It's expensive, no doubt, but make our trip very enjoyable.

Summary Heading: Nice location, everything else still needs work.
Summary: We had hoped the renovation would be done already by the time we stayed but it was not.  Doesn't really matter anyway because we stayed in an already renovated room and it still needed lots of work.  It looked like a five year old painted it.  Walls still messy and old looking.  Some new pictures and furniture but the actual building still looks old.  The location was good, able to walk to Disneyland.  I always appreciate hotels with all crisp white bedding so it had that going for it.  As others have said it is RIGHT on the highway, so the noise is loud.  We ran the air conditioner most of the time so we slept through the noise but it is loud.  We stayed using SPG points so it made sense for us but if you are going to be paying $$ I would think you could find a better hotel as

We read about the DVC Rental Store and decided to try them for a 6 night stay in a 2 bedroom suite at the Grand Californian.  It was a simple process and we were very happy with the savings, although even so it is a very expensive hotel.  Check in was just as if we had reserved rooms directly with the hotel.  The suite was beautiful -- 2 bedrooms (each with a balcony), 3 baths, a lovely, fully-equipped kitchen and a living room (also with a balcony).  The unit had a washer/dryer which was very handy.  We paid an additional $60 per night for daily housekeeping.  The hotel is under renovation but we were able to enjoy the entire lobby area including the seating around the fireplace and grand piano player.  A great perk is the direct access to California Adventure.  I highly

Summary Heading: Great family day wth young kids
Summary: This was a. Super day.  Our four year old was not as overwhelmed as we feared and enjoyed all of the characters.  The lines were a bit long and fast pass was not helpful as the rides we wanted for the child were not able to use fast pass.  The park was clean and fun. Really enjoyed the day

This should be the great Disney hotel experience. Grand lodge architecture perfect location for parks and make believe feel but it isn't (while it has those nice echoes)  The problem starts with the front desk. Really Long 10 minute wait just to drop bags with no large group arrival or departure. Looks like bell desk is HR decision. Same thing in the napa bar. 40 minute wait for cocktail poorly made which on the prior night was really exceptional. Turns out first day for new bartender with no experienced hand to get it right. AgAin perhaps an HUMAN RESOURCE management issue  Rooms are really needing updating. Carpet in bath TV is small and analog stations fuzzy. Bath tub old and poorly draining  With all said most of stAff was lovely hard working and body of hotel is beautiful.

Summary Heading: This hotel has it all! It is walking distance to the parks and the rooms and pools are terrific!
Summary: Recently traveled to Disneyland for the first time with our family.  The Grand California is situated right in the middle of Downtown Disney and a very short walk (5 minutes) to both Disneyland and California Adventure. This was such a plus and so easy to go back and forth from the parks to the hotel! The pools and the villas are beautiful and it is the best location in terms of places to stay!

Summary Heading: A great hotel but don't do club level
Summary: Staffs are very friendly (except for club level's reception) and overall service is much better than other hotels with similar price range.  Location is the best part and while the hotel is going through some major renovation, it didn't affect us much.  Think Disney has done everything it can to minimize the impact.  However, we also did the club (concierge) access, which we thought were mediocre, especially compare to other major international hotel chain.  There were some small issues with the reception desk when we checked in and after we complained, they only told us they would look into it, which is again very uncommon comparing to other major international hotel chain.  I think in this case, they didn't care and probably figured we already checked in with small child (3

After reading the reviews we weren't sure what to expect, but I have to say we were pleasantly surprised. It was a splurge for our family, and one that I would do again. We travelled with our 8 kids, and the extras made our trip so much easier. The early morning hour in the parks, the entrance right into the park, the swimming pools, the easy access to restaurants in the hotel and in Downtown Disney‚Ä¶ it made our family vacation easier and even more special. We booked two adjoining rooms that accommodated all 10 of us without feeling cramped. We didn't get one of the updated rooms, but my sister in law did and the updates add more of the Disney magic that was lacking in the rooms we had.   The staff was spectacular and seemed to go the extra mile to help our stay be even more

This was second time I had been to Disneyland. The first was nearly 13 years ago at some hotel near the grounds. This time we splurged and stayed on site. The Grand Californian front the outside looks like a giant craftsman, inside it looks like a hunting lodge.  Long story short, I loved it. The room was huge. We slept in separate beds. The bathroom had no tub, but a nice shower. The vanity was outside the bathroom, which I'm not a fan of. The bed was always made and at night, we got turn down service. Each night the maid left two Ghiradelli's chocolates.  The upside of staying on site is the proximity to the park. In and out ( after a lengthy security search) in minutes. The price is prohibitive, but if you can afford it, treat yourself.   I'm never going back to Disneyland

Amezing it was great, we stay from Friday to Sunday from arriving to leaving it was a super experience. Every one was very friendly, we decided to use the Valet Parking the guy was very helpful, room was not ready but they hold our stuff until room became available, we then went to pool are we reserve a Cabana super great choice (you really don't need a cabana) the whole pool area is really nice  Then when room was ready they deliver a plate with Mike and Minnie cookies that was really nice. The room was very comfortable we had a great relaxing evenings  Saturday we went to California Adventure it was just amazing I really appreciated the  security, when we go from hotel to Downtown Disney or to the park they check everything so its nice to have that extra security This only

we had so much fun! the staff was really nice and helpful, the beds were sooo comfortable. the best part about staying here was the early access into the park. the only downside is the price :( we ended up paying 625 per night.

Does it get boring hearing how Disney does everything right? We hope not. Once again Disney has created magic, this time its sandwiched between two theme parks, two other hotels and downtown Disney. It's an oasis among the bustle of LA / Anaheim. The location can't be beat with a private entrance to California Adventure. The theme takes you back to an era of the great Northern State Parks, dining wonderful including high end and character breakfast, great pools and lounge areas and renovated rooms in what is really a very young hotel.  Sure you can stay cheaper elsewhere but why. Here it's not just a hotel room, it's part of the California experience.

Third visit to Disney California first time staying here. Hotel is under renovation which our agent did not tell us about. Construction noise from 9am (sometimes before that) until 5pm. For the price, totally unacceptable I believe. Also for two of the three days we were there, there were interruptions to the hot water between 9am and 3pm. This is the premium Disney hotel so for the price expected a lot more. Staff need more training they are not good at handling customer concerns. At one stage we were locked out of our room because the lock failed. It took over an hour and at least 10 different staff members before they were able to open the door, all the while we were left sitting in the corridor!! Disneyland hotel much better for the price, value and staff.

This was my first visit at The Grand Californian.  It is pricey, but a lovely venue.  The location is ideal with direct access to Disney California Adventure park and Downtown Disney (and only a short walk to Disneyland).  The shop is a bit small.  The lobby is a gem.  I've stayed at all 3 Anaheim Disney resorts and enjoy this one - all have their own flavor.  Not sure that this one wins the comparison - upsides are ambiance and location and downsides are the price tag.  A great spot to give a whirl for a special Disney trip.

I own DVC at the Grand Californian and stay multiple times per year. The villas differ from the hotel rooms in that you can get anything from a studio to a multiple-bedroom accommodation. All villas include at a minimum a sink, refrigerator and microwave. There is no daily maid service at the villas, but you get maid services at different levels depending on how long your stay is. My favorite part about this hotel is the ease of access into Disney's California Adventure Park. Also, when you stay, there are days you get in early to either California Adventure or Disneyland. It is by far my favorite property at the Disneyland resort!

We stayed in a one bedroom suite with a pull out sofa. Asked for a king bed, but was told they do not have king beds in one bedroom suites even though the website states otherwise. So we got 2 queens instead which thank goodness there were 2 because the so called queens are about the same size as a twin bed. The Wife and I had to sleep separately due to small size. Room was dated, but sufficient in size. Asked for a quite room, but later was told there are no quite rooms where the one bedroom suites are located. So be prepared....park noise on some mornings stared at 5:30am.

Summary Heading: Front door entrance to Guardians of the Galaxy
Summary: This was I believe our fifth stay here, we were right behind Goofys sky school in a premium view room.  We requested a newly refurbished room, fortunately they already had some that were completed.  I'll be honest I prefer the old rooms, they were more cozy and had bath tubs. The new rooms have a retro California look to them, I don't know if they are trying to get away from the cabin look but we prefer the dark woodsy furniture and carpet.  The pools were refurbished, I didn't notice a difference I think they just repainted maybe. Staff is always friendly and of course the entrance right into the park is awesome.  Now for the magic morning... It starts an hour before the park opens but I would recommend getting down there at least 45 mins before that, they allowed us into the

This is Disney's premier hotel in California, as it affords direct access to the California Adventure theme park and is closer to the entrance to Disneyland than the other two Disney hotel properties.  When booking for early June, there were several warnings on Disney's website about ongoing renovations, but as of June 1, the lobby was completely clear of any such work, as was a good portion of the guest room area.  The pool area appeared fully operational, and so was the excellent wait staff.  We were given a newly decorated room that was in a far corner of the sprawling hotel but had a partial view of California Adventure including the night time water/light show which we were not expecting and appreciated.  The hotel is spotless, the staff upbeat and aiming to please, as

Summary Heading: Under renovations, but still the best location
Summary: When I was booking  my room, the website indicated that the hotel was under renovation and I was concerned it might be very unpleasant to stay here, but decided that we weren't like to be in our room much during construction hours and the location still was more important than a little construction dust.  We checked in around noon and the lobby was uncharacteristically empty - we were registered immediately and were lucky enough to get a room right away so we didn't have to park our bags with the bellman.  The room was on the fourth floor and had already been renovated.  The basic layout is the same, but the rooms are more sophisticated.  The bed linens are simple white duvets and the beds are extremely comfortable.  The bathroom had been updated to a tiled walk-in shower with a

Summary Heading: Our bad expetience from a great hotel
Summary: When we arrived on Thursday, we were given a room with a different view of what we originally reserved. I called the front desk and spoke about the situation and they gave us a new room with the right specifications. We moved all our bags, and my son forgot some dry cleaned shirts in the old room. The people that stayed in the old room turned in the shirts to the front desk. The front desk, guest services, housekeeping, etc, insisted they did not know anything about it. We had to have security to come to the room for a claim before contacting Anaheim police. The latest  security officer ended finding the shirts.  In conclusion, I spoke to several people, including a security manager who kept insisting that they have not seen the dry clean shirts, but at least the other guests

Every time we go to Disneyland, we stay at the Grand Californian. Not only is it extremely convenient because it is located inside the park, but the staff is great, also.  You are completely taken care of and they have so many amenities for families.  The lobby is stunning and it's so peaceful inside.   The Resort is the perfect escape from a busy, fun-filled day at Disneyland.

My husband booked this hotel with a travel agent to celebrate my graduation from nursing school.  The magic started from the moment we pulled in the driveway.  At the guard gate we were asked our name and then instructed to pull through.  When we pulled up to the lobby the Valets opened our doors and said "welcome home Ward family". My kids were so excited that they knew our names.  Someone greeted our family at the door and personally walked us over to check in.  Once at check in the cast member after getting our information asked for patience he had to double check something.  I got worried because I thought something in our reservation had gone but he soon reappeared and said we just want to congratulate you on your accomplishment of graduating nursing school and we would

Summary Heading: Great stay for Disneyland and Disney California Adventure visit
Summary: We are WDW veterans but had not been to Disneyland yet and as DVC members, really wanted to try out the Grand Californian as well. Our expectations were low as most told us Disneyland did not have the offerings of WDW but we were pleasantly surprised by the whole situation - hotel, DL, and DCA! As for the hotel, we stayed in a 2 bedroom villa. This seemed to be the largest 2 bedroom DVC villa we have stayed in. (We have stayed at all except Hilton Head). It could just be the layout but could not believe the size. The staff here were beyond nice. I know it is a "Disney" thing but they seemed to go out of their way. The pools had just reopened and were very nice. The location is the key, as everyone said. Special entrance into DCA and right there for DL and Downtown Disney as

Great location for the Park and the restaurant row of Downtown Disney. But that's about it for positives. OK it was clean.  Currently under renovation,this is a very expensive hotel that doesn't live up to the price. There are some lovely architectural features, but too bad the grand hall is so dark it's difficult to really see them and appreciate them. Our room was fairly standard by most standard larger chain hotels. Room service was relatively inexpensive but mediocre when we used it. Overall we were disappointed at the value for the price. We have stayed at Disney property hotels before and I've gotten the same feeling. YouYou are paying for location which is a wonderful thing.  Typically if I plan to spend a lot of time in the hotel or hotel room, I will look for the more

Grand dreams in California do come true! As a longtime fan of the Florida parks and the hotels, this one did not disappoint. We only stayed for one night and enjoyed the breakfast immensely. The hotel was lavishly appointed and the property itself was massive. Be prepared to walk, alot, from one end the next.   The Downtown Disney entrance was really handy as you leave the hotel, but to go through a security line? Was wierd you did not need to check security going back to the hotel. mmmm.  We lucked out and stayed in one of the newer rooms.

Summary Heading: You get little for a LOT
Summary: All you are paying for here is location, location, LOCATION! Unfortunately, even my usual favorite location of Disneyland isn't what it used to be. Constantly crowded and customer service way way down. Now to the hotel...I'm paying over $400 per night for a room and the concierge can't arrange a Disney dining reservation for me?? Well why else would people stay here if not to enjoy the parks? What's the point of concierge? Then there's the security guards on a power trip. At 6am while in valet I took a quick puff of my vape pen and an elderly, gruff security guard yelled out "there's no smoking here!" NO ONE except myself, one valet, and grumpy were out there. And then there was the security guard who demanded to see my room key. Now I can't be sure it's because my daughter and

I stayed here over the weekend for the Disneyland Half Marathon and the location can't be beat. The hotel is beautiful and the pool was perfect for the summer heat. My friends and I were able to walk everywhere over the three days we were there. I really enjoyed my time there.

Amazing place and excellent staff , My daughter enjoyed her 4 th birthday like she was a princess We loved it , they made everything to make our time magic. If the sun was stronger would be better , but we had amazing holidays

1) Pros:  a) The main reason to stay here is its location. You are a short walk (5-10 minute walk) to decent restaurants at Downtown Disney and slightly longer but convenient walk (10-15 minutes) to Disneyland itself and California Adventure.  b) Staff. I grew up in Orange County forty years ago. What was true then remains true today: Disney treats its employees well. As a result, most Disney employees try very hard and helpful to guests. This has been my experience for many decades and it has been my experience at each stay at this hotel. Strong, helpful, motivated staff.  2) Considerations:  a) The restaurants in the hotel itself are adequate (for kids especially) but not especially good. You can easily try better restaurants (e.g., Catal and Uva; Naples) in nearby Downtown

Summary Heading: Great First Time Stay for DVC members
Summary: Our family of 4 including 2 teenagers stayed in a one bedroom villa at DGC. Our entire stay from check in to check was absolutely enjoyable. One of the managers greeted us upon check-in and escorted us to our room. The staff that we interacted with during our stay was extremely helpful. The close proximity to California Adventure was a bonus. The dined at Storytellers for dinner and it was ok. We would definitely stay here again.

We have stayed at the resort in the past and found it to be amazing so were excited to return.  The check-in experience was disappointing - we had requested a room with a queen bed and bunk beds with a trundle.  They offered us two queen beds.  The family checking in next to us was given a queen bed with bunk beds and a trundle, they wanted two queen beds.  It seemed obvious to both families what to do but this was lost on front desk staff.  While the hotel was under refurbishment, it did not cause us any issues.  The lack of customer service was disappointing.  Immediate access to the park was outstanding though!

Summary Heading: No tubs in newly renovated rooms
Summary: It is a real disappointment not to be able to come in from a long day in the park and soak tired arching grown up legs, but it almost impossible to bathe a two and a five year old in a shower. If saving water was the goal, it was not achieved by the time we finished.  The rest of the room was well suited for a couple or family with older kids. Comfortable beds, mini fridge, small balcony, attractive furnishings.   The hotel location can't be beat for park guest. You are within a few feet of Downtown Disney and Disneyland and literally at back gate of California Adventure. Very convenient.

To start off this trip was planned 8 months ago Disney Resort is absolutely beautiful The staff needs manner classes  from staff in Florida Never so rude nor noncaring attitudes !!!!! Never spoke about "Welcome Home" which is a motto used by Disney when you belong to time share . the only people who really took care of you At the resort was  the bell staff and Housekeeping -our attendant Eluid was the best example of what Disney staff should be .Absolutely Wonderful !!!!Took great care of us and very attentive  the resort was close to all park activities  walking distance to everything  self parking was to far away from resort across the street there is security at all entrances except from Downtown Disney which i thought was very surprising food was very expensive - Earl of

Summary Heading: Fewer amenities during construction but still top notch
Summary: We stayed in a Studio Villa by renting points through a third party (getting a room steeply discounted from rack rates). This was our second stay in four years. The rooms have been refurbished since last time and are much lighter. Definitely seemed less rustic and more homey. The DVC side is removed and a bit quieter than the main part of the resort but is still really close to all of the main amenities. It even has its own amenities like a private pool, gas grills, and even its own laundry room. We loved the laundry because we could pack less and not have to lug our dirty clothes bag across this nice hotel. The DVC side only had two washers and four dryers, however, so use the laundryview website to see what is available. You may have to use the hotels larger laundry room in a

Summary Heading: Great location if you're doing the Disney thing
Summary: Classy, expensive!!, and convenient to Disneyland and California Adventure.  Great restaurants for breakfast, lunch and dinner in hotel or in adjacent Downtown Disney.  I'd go to eat and spend a night or two doing Downtown Disney, but this time of year and at Spring Break and Christmas, I'd stay way away from the parks.  The Disney suits have started overcrowding the parks to maximize income while detracting from ability to enjoy the parks due to the massive (oppressive) crowds that are now allowed in (up to 30-35,000 more per day than in years past when cutoff point was there so you could actually get on a ride or even to a restroom.  The Hotels are great but the parks (at the current prices) are to be avoided this time of year.
