We were fortunate to secure a discounted rate on our one night stay and was given a newly renovated room.  The room was well appointed, the bed was SO comfortable and the bathroom was perfect.  Service with a warm and genuine smile..,.,

As Disney Vacation Club members, we stayed here on points in a Studio Villa in the Villas section of the resort.  Compared to other DVC properties our room was adequate but nothing special, with the usual Studio Villa amenities:  microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker, kitchenette, supplies, etc.  One queen bed and a pull-out sofa, and a small sitting area.  No Murphy bed like the newer or refurbished DVC properties have. The toilet and tub/shower are separate from the sink/vanity/dressing area.  I enjoy using balconies, but unfortunately this one overlooked the ‚Äúbackstage‚Äù area of the hotel.  As masters of illusion, you‚Äôd think that Disney could work some of their magic to seclude these service areas from guest view.  Instead I was treated to the sound of construction equipment

I am in my mid-70's and my husband is in his early 80's.  We booked at this hotel while attending a granddaughter's college graduation.  We thought it would be a pleasant get away in the midst of Disney chaos.  Wrong!  Check-in was awful.  Hoards of cars. Lines of people.   Our daughter and son-in-law drove us there and stayed for a day in the park.  We had booked the concierge floor.  They could not come up with us because they were not booked there.  The area was under construction.  We realized immediately we should not have booked the concierge floor because we could not have them there.  So that was a big waste of money.  Our other daughter drove up from L.A. to have lunch and sit by the pool in the shade.  We were told that she could not go there with us because she was

Summary Heading: Super convenient, awesome hotel, worth every penny
Summary: Lets start with location, just in-between California Adventure and Downtown Disney and steps away from the monorail for easy access to Disneyland. The location can't be beat. Walking into California Adventure easily, escaping to your room within minutes, its great.   The hotel is undergoing refurbishments and I will stay away from that topic as it is temporary. I will say though that the new rooms are lightyears ahead of the old rooms. I saw pictures, especially the bathroom and wow. The new rooms are modern, safe for babies and the bathrooms have been totally redone. As you enter there is a handy space for your stroller just adjacent to the connecting room door. Then you have a closet, Keurig coffee machine that sits on top of a fridge, great if you have breastmilk or other

Summary Heading: My favorite hotel at Disneyland (when not under construction)
Summary: Every since my first stay, the Grand Californian has been my favorite hotel at the Disneyland resort. The pools are super fun for the kids and the hotel offers direct access to both Disney's California Adventure park and Downtown Disney. The cast members are always friendly and willing to help. They have fun scavenger hunts on rides throughout Disneyland and also in the hotel itself.   However, first thing to check when booking your stay is whether or not the hotel is under construction. I went this past spring break and, unlucky for me, all of the pools were being remodeled. Not only did that mean I didn't have access to my favorite pools, but it was very noisy and provided for a very unfortunate view. But Disney, being how it is, made sure to provide shuttles so guests could

We stayed here around Christmas. It was great for the kids to see Santa walking around, the HUGE tree, all the decorations, and of course the best part is that you can walk out of the doors and be in the park. This was especially great for the late nights in California Adventure when exhaustion sets in or for visiting Downtown Disney.  My daughter got horribly sick just one day in to our trip. We had to call the front desk for new bedding/blankets and the ladies from housekeeping brought us a silver bucket with wet wash cloths, Perrier, and crackers at 2am! They really took care of us.   The pool is great. Even in December we were able to get in a couple of hours throughout our trip to let the kids go down the slides.   Club Service: This was AMAZING. Being able to have access

Summary Heading: Great Stay at the Grand Californian.
Summary: This is a great hotel. Many will argue that this much money doesn't correspond to the hotel itself. You're buying location and ease of access to the park. I have a 2.5 year old who really needs a nap at least once during the day and an escape from the park. This place is CLOSE and easy to get in and out of.   It's currently under refurbishment and all the pools were closed except one as of the day we left (May 16, 2017). It looked as if they were getting CLOSE to opening another one soon though. They offered a shuttle over to either the Disneyland Hotel pool or the Paradise Pier pool, which we did not take advantage of, but I could see running back and forth at regular intervals.  They have currently restricted access to entrance to the park (California Adventure) from the Grand

It is a beautiful property inside the Disneyland resort. Walking distance to the parks and Downtown Disnwy and even a special entrance into Disney's California Adventure park. The rooms are beautiful and spacious and newly renovated! Love it every time!!!

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in a vacation club suite at the Grand Californian.  Rooms had all the amenities of home and were well-maintained.  Proximity to parks was great, however the security line to enter the parks in the mornings was always long.  In the interest of safety, that was a small price to pay.  Staff was incredibly kind, helpful, and cheerful.  We'll be back!

Summary Heading: Great hotel in a great location
Summary: The beauty starts with driving up to the Grand Californian.  It continues with approaching the stained glass doors portraying a terrific mountain scene.  The large five story lobby seems to be right out of a national park.  The staff is professonal, helpful, and always welcoming.  The rooms combine the natiional park look with a Disney feel.

Loved this place! Everything was so nice and clean. All the staff was extremely nice and helpful. The room we got had bunk beds which the boys loved! Everything is so kid friendly from the movies in the lobby to the restaurants. The best part was walking out to downtown Disney/Ca Adventure park! We were able to come back to our room for naps and just to rest. I definitely will want to stay here again!

If staying at the Grand Californian please ask to not be put in room 1516. The view was of piles and piles of garbage. Construction guys outside the window at 7:30 am talking loudly, hammering started at 8am. We were staying on Disney Vacation Points (their timeshare) and there were no rooms to move us too the previous evening so the guest service gal offered us breakfast, I said we're not really a breakfast family but I appreciate the gesture. She said just take them and then call members services tomorrow, they'll get it take. Care of. So that's what I did. Good trick! Because I accepted the breakfast, which was not that good (Burnt Omelettes) we would not be getting anything else. For the cost of the room I find this utterly disappointing and unacceptable. So if staying at

This was our first stay at the Grand California but not our first Disney hotel brand stay.  One thing we have noticed is that Disney is consistently a world apart from other theme park experiences.  Staff across the board is amazing.  Some helpful hints:  World of Color:  If you go to the sixth floor, there is a viewing area for the world of color.  Arrive 15 minutes prior to show start time and you‚Äôll have a fabulous view of the show.  This is available to all hotel guests.  It didn‚Äôt get too crowded when we went but if you want an unobstructed view, you‚Äôve got to get there a little early.  Big Families:  We have four kids but two are infants.  According to the website, we‚Äôd be required to stay in a one bedroom and it‚Äôs not a financial possibility for us.  We talked to the

We stayed one night in an old room and it was ok and clean. We then finished the week in a new room and it was better. Loved the double sinks and the daybed/couch was easy to open and good for the kids. The new rooms have showers which for smaller kids I thought would be difficult but it's a double shower, two heads and the one on the wall is adjustable for small people. I would shower with my six and two year old. Beds were comfy. Lots of space for suitcases and strollers etc. I wish the decor was more themed for kids but it works, I mean we payed for nice, clean and location. We did the club level and it was great to get food whenever the girls were hungry and ended up eating there alot.  We saw the firework show there as well. Couldn't see the castle but could see the rest

Summary Heading: Best hotel we've stayed in our 7 - 9  visits to Disneyland
Summary: Let me start off by stating that we will always stay here when going to Disneyland.  This hotel was immaculate, the staff and service was outstanding!  I have attended Disneyland 7 times. My husband 9 and our son 2. We have stayed at other Disneyland hotels and good neighbor hotels near the park.  We now after our recent stay have an addiction to stay here.   Lets start by the first day of our arrival. When we arrived we needed to drop off our luggage and return our rental car.  We pulled up to the main entrance and was greeted by such kind happy staff members.  We told them what we were doing and they gladly took our luggage for us gave us our ticket for our luggage with instructions on how to have or luggage delivered to our room. They also help guide us to where we would drop

I have been going to Disneyland since I was a child.  I remember when California Adventure was a parking lot.  I remember when Downtown Disney was a street.  I have had multiple stays at this property and wanted to relate my previous experiences.  The Grand Californian is exactly that - GRAND.  Everything on the property is held to the impeccable Disney standard and it definitely shows.  The rooms were always clean, the beds amazing, the bell desk was always very helpful and the check in process is in my opinion, WAY above and beyond the industry standard. Not only that, the hotel has an entrance right into California Adventure! SO - with all that being stated - I recently booked a room once again for the upcoming holidays and even found the reservation process awesome.  Thank

Summary Heading: Nice stay, but a few disappointments
Summary: At the last minute we decided to book three nights at the Disney Grand Californian Hotel because of the awesome rate we found!  This was our second time staying at the hotel.  We were not fortunate enough to get a renovated room, however Anthony (GSA) was able to accommodate our request of getting the Downtown Disney view to watch the fireworks.  When it was time to go to DL or CAP, we were surprised to find security checkpoints at each entrance.  Both the DL checkpoint and CAP checkpoint lines were long at times, which were pretty disappointing, especially when you have a limited amount of time at the parks.  For the most part, we had a nice stay, but there were some areas that could use a little improvement, like the wait times for both the Bell Desk and the Telephone

Summary Heading: Not So Grand of Stay in Rm 5024
Summary: We booked this hotel primarily for it's close proximity to the parks. Even though it is a Disney hotel, we figured it would also be a nice cozy stay for a couple. The hotel exterior and  lobby are beautiful, but the rooms are very dark and need updating. I now know the hotel rooms are going through a much needed renovation, just wish I knew before our stay. In the early mornings, we could here constriction workers walking past our room with their radios buzzing. On top of that this room is located directly UNDER a private restaurant,  had I known, I would not have accepted the room. The restaurant is from 630am-10p. In the mornings, evenings and our midday breaks- we can hear non-stop banging and chairs dragging above us. If it weren't such a hassle to move rooms, we would have.

Great experience from the time we pulled in the driveway. Highly recommended the resort. The restaurants are worth it, and it's a short walk into downtown disney or California Adventure. Our room overlooked  the grizzly mountain and we were able to watch the fireworks from the balcony.

We were meeting cousins at Disney and other family members at Downtown Disney for dinner.  The hotel was ridiculously expensive and surprisingly run-down.  The best thing I can say is that the people working there are so sweet and nice, it's hard to stay cranky about traffic or wait times.  This hotel is actually part of the California Adventure park.  Buy something?  Take it to your room.  Need your jacket?  Go get it.  Really valuable with kids.  We bought 2 day park hopper tickets.  The first day was crazy with lines and stress that we had missed much of the day.  I felt money just flying out of my wallet.  A nice dinner, a little wine and a decent nights sleep helped a lot!  We woke up early and bolted to the Magical Hour.  This was worth EVERYTHING!  We had completed 5

We had stayed 5th floor downtown Disney view. We opted for this over a newly renovated room since renovated room was pool facing and seemed work would be noisy. It was. I enjoyed the view and was surprised with all the noise outside from downtown Disney when patio door was shut you could not hear a lot of noise. The only thing that was somewhat bothersome was constant "beep beep" of train that carpools to parking lots. That is all day thing and into night. Room was clean. Our house keeper did miss a night of turn down service and we should have gotten that. This hotel makes it so easy to enter each park and short walk to return when tired. I honestly have to say I still enjoyed the Disneyland Hotel over this one and probebly will Return to Disneyland hotel next time. It just

Summary Heading: Why it's Grand to stay here
Summary: We are annual season pass holders. My husband and I take our kids to Disneyland and we often stay at hotels in the area. We chose our hotel based on the type of trip we're having. If it's a quick casual trip to hit the park- we'll usually stay at one of the many less expensive hotels right outside of Disneyland. However for special occasions we like to stay at Disney's Grand Californian.  The rooms are clean, nice and well done. However for the price the rooms are not very big and are quite basic. The bathroom is small but "nice." I like that the rooms have a balcony. No complaints about the room other than for the price paid I typically like a little more luxury.  The hotel itself is wonderful. The lobby is gorgeous and the feeling one gets when walking in to The Grand lobby to

Summary Heading: There is nothing Grand about the Grand Californian
Summary: After a 6hr car drive, we were happy to have arrived. We were really excited to stay here as it was out of our budget. We figured more money, nicer place, lets experience it. We were in awe at the facade. Beautiful building. Check in was great. The bell hop, super friendly and knowledgeable.   We finally got to our room and I took a few pictures, before needing to use the restroom. I lifted the toilet seat and to my shock, it wasn't clean. See pictures. Naturally I was upset, and decided to give the concierge a ring and to my surprise the phone didn't work. So now I am furious. So we grab our stuff, go back downstairs and talk with the concierge and all I got a sorry and a new room. That's it. No help to the room, no freebies, just a sorry and a new room. You would think, for

Disney's Grand CA Hotel is always a pleasure to stay at. The NEW room appointments of furniture and lamps is very inviting and comfortable. The rustic woods look has been updated. The pool & whirlpool areas are undergoing Major renovation and will be open by mid-May. The pool use at Disneyland Hotel is available with a shuttle between the two areas. The Spring celebrations of the release of the lady bugs and the honey bees is fun for the kids and educational to all that watch. The gym is usefull and well laid out for a workout before or after a day in the parks. FUN!!! Architecture addicts will love the Craftsman style wood and stone. Huge fireplaces in lobby for sitting and relaxing. in evenings there are storytellers near the fireplaces for the kids. and always a Disney catoon

Summary Heading: Yes it is Disney but yes it is good
Summary: We stayed here once before some years ago.  Yes it is a big Disneyland hotel but it is also a very good hotel.  The staff were friendly and super-efficient.  Everything was as we wanted it, the spare bed was made up for us on request.  Everything was very clean, the hotel was quiet, we slept well and the beds were great.  Convenient for Disneyland of course.  We did not eat here as my kids don't want to be bothered by woodland creatures first thing in the morning.

My family and I had a wonderful time at the Grand Californian hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was clean and my children loved the bunk beds. We had a wonderful view of California adventure park and were able to watch Disneyland's fireworks from our balcony. The magic hour was an added bonus and the private entrance to the California park was perfect!

This is the fifth time I have stayed at the Grand Californian and I was not disappointed. The private entrance to California Adventure alone is worth it, but the service, rooms and special touches really make staying here a great value. I don't plan on staying anywhere else when visiting Disneyland in the future.

The Grand is definitely worth the money.  The friendliness off the staff cater to your every need. With direct access to Downtown Disney and California Adventure this is a must place to stay. The newly renovated rooms are relaxing and have 28 charging ports. No more unplugging clocks to charge your phone. I highly recommend staying at the Grand.

I have now stayed at the Grand Californian twice, and I have been happy with my stay on each occassion.  I will stay here again if I return to Anaheim Disney for sure.  The greatest thing about the resort is the location immediately adjacent to Califiornia Adventure Park and Downtown Disney.  Disneyland is slightly further away, however no hotel is closer.  The facilities are comfortable rather than luxurious, but we spent very little time in our rooms.  If anything, the foyer, corridors and rooms could use a little more light, although they are going for the dark log-cabin look, so it all fits.  The hotel is quite busy, and check in feels a bit like lining up in the tuck shop queue in high school.  But who cares? The happiest place on earth really is a hop skip and a jump away.

Summary Heading: A great location to downtown disney and Disney land
Summary: My experience at this resort was above and beyond. The staff went above and beyond to help me at the conference. I was expecting a package and envelop from another part of the country when I got there. They looked extra hard and they found it in time the staff made sure I was happy and went above and beyond to exceed my expectations as a guest. If you have a family this is a good place because they even have rooms with bunk beds in it.

If you can afford it, do it.  It is so worth it!  Our room was great, newly remodeled, clean, comfortable and beautiful.  The whole place is just awesome.  Very well kept and absolutely gorgeous.  You can't beat the location.  I will have a hard time staying anywhere else while at Disneyland now.  I've been spoiled. :)

The hotel was great, access to both parks was awesome, rides were inconveniently taken off line too often, you'd think they would do more maintenance work when park is closedü§îhotel staff was average, room service was efficient. Not wowed and would not stay again.

Summary Heading: Fantastic stay for family of four at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel
Summary: Our family travelled from Sydney to Disneyland Anaheim and stayed for five nights at the Grand Californian hotel. Our son is 5 and our daughter is 7.  We were worried when we were notified that the hotel was under going renovations and while we were there the pool area was closed and boarded up. Other than that we were not impacted by the renovations.  The service is excellent. This hotels service was better than the service at the other resorts we stayed at on this trip.  The location is extremely convenient and we loved being able to go quickly back to the room from within California adventure park and with a shorter walk from Disneyland than any other location. This was particularly helpful as we found some mornings cold and it was great to be able to go back to the room and

Summary Heading: Great location, but not up to Disney World standards
Summary: Stayed here with the family over Easter weekend.  Beautiful facility but not told that the pool was closed for renovations when booking the reservation.   Staff was cordial but not bubbly like at Disney world.  Rooms were average but not for the price.   Very convenient to enter parks and downtown Disney.   Overall good start but not up to Disney standards in my opinion.

I reserved the 3 bedroom Grand Villa for just one night, for my birthday. The staff knew, and greeted me everywhere I went, and a bellhop even came to the suite to deliver a plate of freshly baked Mickey Mouse-shaped chocolate-covered cookies. Every single member of the Disney staff spoke to me with courtesy and so much deference --- a refreshing change from the typical rushed/harassed demeanors of most hotel employees.  The rooms themselves were well-appointed. Every single bathroom was clean and replenished with toiletries. The towels were fluffy. The beds were comfortable.   The kitchen is a fully-functioning one, as it had an oven. There was a sizeable refrigerator that held several beers and canned drinks, as well as leftovers from my party. There were rolls of paper towels

I love this hotel and the majestic lobby, surroundings and the fact that it's located inside California Adventure Park. I knew it was under refurbishment, and the pools were closed. The room we were assigned was one of the tired, worn out rooms. That being said, there was no discount, accommodation for the inconvenience etc. I was a little disappointed since I had hoped for a renovated room. The prices are so incredibly high, one can only hope they would give their returning (frequent) guest consideration for their inconvenience during this time. I won't be staying here again until the entire hotel has been completed and I would recommend others do so also. I have seen the new decor for the hotel rooms and I will withhold my final judgement. But, I was disappointed with the

Loved our stay in this beautiful hotel, only gripe was that we weren't told about the renovations on pool area, but the convenient shuttle to the Disney Hotel pool made it pretty easy for us to still enjoy some pool time.

Yup, location sums it up.  We will never stay anywhere else.  Don't try to talk me out of it.  Walk out of room, stop for breakfast, walk in to park, walk back in to the hotel, sleep.  Repeat.  I'm sure we'll change our minds once our child gets older but until then, location, location, location.

OMG, we absolutely love this place! If it wasn't costing me an arm and a leg, we would stay here forever!¬† I might be an adult, but "I magically turn into a teenager whenever I come here!"  There's not much I didn't cover about this magnificent hotel that I haven't covered in my previous review.  We're here for the week and we will make daily trips from here.¬† The lobby is huge and just breathtaking for any first time guests.  The check in people greet you as you enter the lobby and guide you through the check-in process.¬†   There is a huge fireplace where stories are told to the younger guests while the grown ups can mingle in the various stores.  Your also connected to Downtown Disney with the many stores and restaurants to satisfy any appetites.¬† And of course your just

Summary Heading: Once in a Lifetime Experience - Would Stay Here Again!
Summary: Thinking we may have stayed in a room that has gone through some renovations already.  At least from looking at the other guest pictures.    Our room consisted of two queens and a daybed. Bedding was not dated in anyway.  Fresh, clean, white very comfortable bedding. Double vanity with plenty of space for myself and two teenage daughters to stand and move around in. This area is separate from the toilet/shower area as well as the sleeping area. Shower was a very nice dual head shower with glass doors. No shower curtain. No bathtub. No fan either which was odd. But I had read that in a previous guest's comments. So it didn't surprise me.  Nice closet and dresser for clothing storage. Small balcony with two chairs and small table. (We weren't in the room enough to really use it

Summary Heading: Location, location, location is key in travelling with a baby!
Summary: This Disney trip was multi-generational . . . three generations from 6 months to 60 . . . two young children . . . three adults.  Our stay at the Grand Californian made a (very) busy week at the parks totally magical.  The location was the key.  It offered us easy access to the parks - early or late as needed with the baby.  It gave us a quick return to the room, but also a quick return to the Disney fun. We enjoyed the hotel (even as construction continued).   I would highly recommend the hotel if you are travelling with an infant or need to save some of your steps for walking around in the parks all day.  The reduced stars in my review are due to the aging room interiors . . . but then that's what the remodel is all about!

This is a great hotel, with nice rooms, good service and a quiet and friendly ambiance.  However, in those respects, it is just like any other hotel, only are three to four times the cost.   As such, the only real reason to stay here is the Grand's dedicated entrance to the California Adventure Park. We arrived at 7:50, and were disappointed to discover that the line was already stretching down one side of the building and around the corner.  However, once it started moving, we got in very quickly - less than ten minutes - and grabbed our early rides with no fuss.  All of which was much easier than our experience the next morning, when we had to use the main gates.  Despite it being 7am, the lines were huge, and it took nearly 20 minutes to get through, by which time the lines

Summary Heading: Stop Whining! GC is undergoing renovations
Summary: As clearly announced on the website, the hotel is undergoing renovations inside and out. It is the first room renovation since the opening 17 years ago. Disney knows it's needed and they are doing it as we speak. The decor will be freshened but more importantly outlets and electronics will be upgraded to life in 2017. The pool renovation has been a long slog- literally- due to record rainfall this winter. Hopefully the pools will open May 1, 2017. In the meantime, if you get a pool facing room (normally the best) you will hear jackhammers all day. I got one of those rooms, complained to the front desk and was moved immediately ( to a courtyard room). Yes, the GC is expensive but you are paying for location, location, location! Avoiding the parking structure, getting the extra

We decided to go to Disney a couple of weeks before Spring break since our Navy daughter was in port that weekend. She drove from San Diego and we flew in from NorCal. We arrived early in the morning and took the Disneyland Express Bus from LAX (book online and look for a coupon code!). When we arrived around 1130am the staff was extremely helpful. They checked our bags with the Bellman and the front desk checked us into our room even though it wouldnt be ready until 2:30pm. That was fine with us. We sat in the lobby for a bit while charging our phones and did some research on where to eat an inexpensive lunch. We chose Earl Of Sandwich in Downtown Disney. Great prices and excellent food! We ate there for breakfast the next day and one more time for lunch another day. A combo

Summary Heading: All the comfort and luxery you could expect!
Summary: Everything from check in to check out and everything in between has been handled with care and a sense of magic and luxury. Well worth the price for a truly special and luxury experience. The room is beautiful, the extra events going on at the hotels are fun and exciting and the staff is amazing.

Everyone deserves a break. Though a bit pricey, the Grand California's location is the best for those that enjoy the park, but like to take a break and go to the pool. Though the pool is closed for refurbishment, was able to enjoy the Disneyland hotels pools. Very nice, with fun water slides to keep everyone entertained. If you are looking for a lite bite the inside bar has a fabulous atmosphere, friendly staff and awesome quesadillas.   A great location for a family of five as they offer an option to have two queens and a trundle which worked perfectly for the family. We also had a nice view of California Adventure which was nice to have morning coffee on the patio and see the park before all the hustle and bustle.

Summary Heading: It's Expensive, but Tough to Beat
Summary: This was not our first time staying here. The resort has aged a bit and is in some ways a little out of date (no docking stations in the rooms for example). The Arts and Crafts themed rooms are very clean and there is an average amount of storage  and space. But there are two things you get here so that you cannot find off site, location location location and that amazing Disney staff. Even with teenagers it was wonderful to be able to go back to the room and take a break in the middle of the day when lots of little children are in prime melt down mode. Getting up in the morning and walking in is really great, and the early entrance is priceless! We were able to hit so many of our "must do" list before the park filled up. The staff at the hotel are just wonderful.   Every person

Recently stayed in a suite, FABULOUS! It was very clean and had so many extra amenities. You can walk directly from the hotel into the park, which was very convenient. We were not able to actually get into the room until around 5pm which is later that the 4pm check in listed but it was worth the wait. The pools are being redone so if you are looking for pool time you have to go to one of the other hotels now. Since we were not planning on using the pool, it wasn't a problem. Most of the staff was very accommodating and courteous. I would definitely stay here again when visiting Disneyland.

My family and I stayed at the Grand Californian this past weeekend.  Valet - outstanding, prompt, friendly, accommodating  Guess check in - Roy assisted us with check in. GREAT service!!! I hope management sees this post and recognizes how pleased I was with him. Room was clean and comfortable-  I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!! In the future when my travel plans include Disneyland I will stay at this hotel every time hands down. Well done Grand Californian, well done!!!!

Summary Heading: The Disney magic is in the public spaces, the rest, not so much. Parking nightmare.
Summary: The most beautiful and outstanding aspects of this hotel are the public spaces and restaurants, which may be enjoyed by anyone who has paid to enter California Adventure park.  The lovingly designed arts and crafts style lobby is a beauty to behold!  The live pianist in the evening makes it feel like heaven, but again, anyone visiting the park may enjoy this.  The Story Teller's Cafe and Napa Rose also provide enchanting decor, wonderful service, and the food at Napa Rose was outstanding. The best part of our room was being able to watch the fire works on our small balcony. The beds were also very comfy. The room was clean and in keeping with the arts and crafts style. The biggest disappointment was the difficulty with parking.  The website said to park at the Mickey and Minnie

Staying at a Disney property offered the convenience and experience we were looking for. You're steps away from the California Adventure entrance and all the dinning and shopping options at Downtown Disney. We stayed in a recently renovated room and it offered the essential amenities. There were tons of outlets, a coffee maker and small fridge. The room layout was functional for all our luggage and strollers while still having enough space to move around. We are a family of 5, two toddlers and a teenager. One small improvement would be more than one trashcan and a fan in the bathroom. We will be staying here again on our next Disney trip.

Summary Heading: Mostly Good Stay / A Few Nits
Summary: My family stayed at the Grand Californian on March 26th and March 27th.  We've enjoyed other Disney hotels before, but this was our first stay here.  First, some things to be aware of:  - The hotel is undergoing a massive renovation.  As a result, there are rooms being reconditioned and the pools are all out.  - They do allow access to pools at Disney's Paradise Pier and the Disneyland Hotel.  We took a shuttle to the Disneyland Hotel pool which was quick and easy.  Other than that, the hotel was very nice and we enjoyed our stay.  We stayed in one of the renovated rooms and it was very well furnished and appointed. It was a bit small for the 5 of us - but having a hotel room that accommodates 5 is pretty rare.  Also, we weren't in the room much (typical for Disney when we

This hotel is clean and well appointed.  It provides an ideal location for Disney travelers and the entrance into the California Adventure Park is a wonderful bonus.  For experienced travelers who may be expecting a luxury or '5 star' resort, please know GC Hotel & Spa is not one. The staff are friendly and helpful, and I give them top marks for dealing with tired and overstimulated tourists at a non-stop pace.

Stayed for a weekend for a corporate meeting.  Rooms are very standard with some requiring a long walk down hallways from the elevator.  You are paying for the location and convenience.   Our meetings were at the onsite conference center. Service is typical Disney efficiency with a polite smile.  Two main restaurants, expensive but good Napa Rose and still expensive but more family oriented Storytellers Cafe.  Reservations a must or you will be waiting in a crowd of restless kids and unhappy parents. Also a lounge for small bites as well as another smaller snack bar that serves sandwiches, wraps, and to go items including larger format juice, wine, milk, etc.  There is a refrigerator in the room.  Downtown Disney with its stores and restaurants is directly accessible from the

So for 400.00 per night, my family of 4 opened the door to our room on the second floor, FAR away from entrance and registration desk, to see a small, poorly lit, very dated room.  Really the room was quite ugly.  The toilet was incredibly short (shorter than standard.)  No continental breakfast.  When we went out onto the tiny patio, we were blasted by the loud construction work going on at the pool below.    The one positive was the staff (housekeeping,  guest relations, food services at dining in the hotel) were all very friendly and helpful.  I see that the first review I read from this app spoke about an unfriendly staff.... perhaps that has changed since reviewers complained?  It is pure arrogance and greed to charge the price they do for the room we stayed in.  I guess

Front desk told my mom they put us in a great room with a view of downtown Disney.  You have to be kidding me because our room was right across the trolley stop which meant every 30 seconds from sunrise to past midnight all you can hear is honking from the trolleys.  On the second night I was so tired but was awaken by barking dogs in downtown Disney right outside our room at 2:30am!! Room was very dated and the drains to the sink took forever to drain as well as the drain in the tub.  Passed about 15 housekeepers during our 2 night stay, only 1 said good morning or hello.  Our room number was #4447, VERY FAR from the front desk and entrance.  Gonna stay somewhere else next time.

This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel. Last time was 10 years ago and it needs some upgrades to the rooms.  The food is okay but way overpriced for what you get. We ate once at the hotel and took uber/lyft to go off property to eat for the next three days. $5 each way and you can save $50-$100+ a meal.  Staff is nice and try to help. I realize going during a busy time is not the best but my granddaughter was performing at Disneyland and I would not miss such a special occasion.  Although I didn't want a pool, it wasn't mentioned until after I booked. The construction was very loud for our room and if you opened the sliding door all you heard was screaming children and construction. Then if you opened the sliding door at night, many times we could smell cigarettes

Nice hotel, but expensive.should have been a discount as the pools were being refurbished. We ate there at the buffet and the food was very good and reasonably priced. Decor very pleasant.its a bonus being able to enter the park an hour early but there were still long queues even at 8 an!

Summary Heading: 2:30 am Post - can't sleep due to noise
Summary: What am I doing writing a review at 2:30am - well, I can't sleep because of the equipment or scaffolding that is being torn down right out side my door with five men laughing and carrying on.    Not just for a few moments - at least 45 minutes.  And when I call to complain, I'm told the only work being done is they are bugging the floors in the lobby - Really????  At my second call which they now apparently dispatched security to find out what's going on; as nobody is working on anything that they are aware of.  I wonder how they are going to get that gigantic equipment out the door without being detected.  Maybe they will use pixie dust.   Alcoholic beverages average 13-14 dollars a piece.  Bring your own bottle.   It's cheaper.   You pay 124.00 to get into the park only to

This resort is the perfect place to retreat to after a long day in the parks. It offers the convenience of being literally inside California Adventure Park as well as a hop, skip and a jump away from Disneyland and Downtown Disney. We were lucky and got a newly renovated room-- I mean, it still smelled like fresh paint. We might have been one of the first ones to stay there, as the rooms just past ours were still being redone. Therefore, it was clean and spotless. The bathroom was modern and fresh, with wooden/tile floors, and the rest of the room was tastefully decorated with new carpet. The beds were definitely the comfiest I've ever slept on in a hotel. Turndown service with Disney Resort Ghiradelli chocolate on the pillows as a nice touch. Service was very friendly overall

If you're planning a 3 or more day stay at Disneyland and want to take full advantage of the early-morning entry, there is no better place that the Grand Californian, especially with its hotel-guest-only private entrance into California Adventure (right next to the Rapids ride).  It's also very close to the Disneyland entrance as well. It has the best pool among the other Disney hotels as well.

i think this has got to be the worst experience ever. We spent the weekend here to celebrate my daughter and sister's birthdays. This is also my parents and sister first time staying at this hotel after me raving about how nice the hotel is!   we didn't get our hotel until 4pm which i thought was a bit later than usual. My daughter ended sleeping in the lobby because she was so exhausted.   When we got into our rooms, we saw so many mosquitoes and gnats flying around. It was SO gross. They were all flying around the kitchen area, the living room area and they were all hovering around the drapes! I even saw some that were dead (like someone had killed them prior and left it there; didn't even bother cleaning it up afterwards) on the bathroom ceiling I tried to switch rooms but

If you are travelers to whom this level of resort is a splurge, a rare treat, and you have determined to set aside the disproportionate amount to stay at DGC,then you will enjoy your stay here. It is a very nice hotel with great amenities (when they are open or available). We stated here as a treat for our daughter's 30th, and we had several 30 somethings (all pass holders) up for cake, so it was convenient. They all wished to see if they would stay at DGC.   If you are a traveler accustomed to this style of resort, I think you will find the service below par.  There is a lot of smiling, greeting, and inquiry "how are you doing?:. Not so much on actual follow through when there is an issue to be addressed.   We had more than one issue on our overnight stay. One of which I

Summary Heading: Super Convenient to BOTH California Adventure and Disneyyland Resort
Summary: This was by far a better experience than I expected based on some of the reviews I found. The property is the closest by far to Disneyland, California Adventure, and Downtown Disney. We stayed from Sunday to Thursday, and didn't need to get the car once. We have stayed at nearby neighbor hotels, and I don't think I could go back to that after staying here...  The room was cozy, not huge, but we had adequate space, and a balcony. We had a view of the pool which was being renovated, but they never started making noise before we woke up. There was also a nice big tree blocking the view of the pool which was nice because of the construction. I can imagine that if the pool was something to look at, the tree would be a nuisance. But it gave us privacy. We had bunk beds for the kids

We wanted to stay on a Disney Property on our last visit to Disneyland (especially because we've stayed in several hotels outside the park district and felt so exhausted to make it back at the end of the day). With the three options they had (the Disneyland Hotel, Paradise Pier, and Grand Californian), we really weren't sure which one would be a better fit. We were booking through Costco, so they offered some great deals at each of the three hotels, with the Grand Californian being the most expensive. The reviews didn't help much because each of the three were all rated high and had little differences in amenities. So, we just picked this place because we loved the way if felt like a lodge rather than a hotel.   We are sure glad we did, not one regret from paying the extra cost.

We've stayed at 10 different Disney properties.  This one, the Sequoia Lodge at Disney Paris, and 8 properties at Disney World ranging from the value hotels to the Deluxe hotels.  The Grand Californian is what you would expect comparing Disney to Disney.  Our room was very clean.  No mold, no stained carpets, no dirty toilets, or dust on the walls.  The beds were comfortable and the view of Downtown Disney was very nice.  Our room was quiet, even during the day when we came back to rest or take a nap.  You always pay more for convenience at Disney and we found the entrance to California Adventure a huge plus.  The line can get really long in the morning but it moves quickly.  You go in  close to Soarin so if you want to ride it with a short line or grab a fastpass first thing,

Summary Heading: Nice but bummer about the pool remodel.
Summary: This hotel was nice. We got a room with bunk beds which our kids ages 13 and 8 really enjoyed. Bring so close to the parks, especially California Adventure was a huge plus!  We did a character breakfast at the hotel which was tasty and fun.   Though we were aware of the pool remodel when we booked this hotel, it was a bummer and wish that would have been reflected in the price. Though we had access to the other pools it just seemed too far for a quick dip to cool off.

This is a beautiful property right in the heart of Disney.  There is immediate access to California Adventure and access to Downtown Disney. The staff was extremely kind and helpful plus hospitality left a ghirardelli chocolate on your pillow each night.  The room was spacious and the bed was comfortable.  The only downfall to the room is that the water was less than Luke warm in the morning but that was probably due to everyone getting ready to head out to the park for a day of adventure.  We did the character breakfast at the storyteller cafe and it was delicious and lovely.  This hotel is worth the extra cash that you will pay for it.  I would certainly stay there again.  (If you play Pok√©mon there are several stops in the hotel too.  What a plus!).

Overall, the best hotel to stay at when visiting the Disney parks. A bit pricey but service is good and staff are friendly and helpful.  The room was clean and amenities were the usual.  Location is great and allows you to take a break in the middle of the day and get back to the parks very easily. For those not wanting to go far to get reasonably priced food, White Water Snacks in the hotel has really good burgers.  It's just around the back but within the hotel (ask a cast member as its not very easy to find and you might end up in the more expensive sit down restaurants). The little chocolates they give at turn down service are good too :)

After being fortunate enough to stay at the Disneyland Hotel, we decided to try the Grand Californian for our next trip. It was great to be right onsite again and just steps away from the California Adventure park. The rooms were great and the restaurants too.

Summary Heading: Massive hotel but still knows how to deliver
Summary: We stayed here for my son's 5th birthday.  Two adults and two kids under 10 years old. Check in was easy. Staff was helpful and kind. We went out to Adventureland until our room was ready, then checked in, had lunch, and rested for an hour. Then we spent several more hours at Adventureland and the entire next day at Disneyland.  Even though it was a weekend, it didn't feel too loud or too busy.  The food options were solid and we enjoyed the Characters Breakfast on Monday morning with Chip and Dale and little bear.  Overall, it was exactly the experience we were hoping for.  There was only one small downside for my daughter, she could hear the music outside until 10pm and had trouble falling asleep.  So if you're sound sensitive and going to bed on the early side you might ask

Overall the rooms are nice and the staff is friendly but the hotel has a lot of issues right now.  1.  The pool is closed for construction.  We were not told this until after we booked. 2.  The construction (both pool and rooms) is noisy. 3.  Because of the construction, we have to go up 3 floors for ice/vending. 4.  They turned off our water (again construction) one of the nights. 5.  Fire alarm testing.... 6.  We only got a tiny mini skillet (staying in the Villa's with a full kitchen).  When we called we were only able to get one slightly bigger.

Planned our family's dream Disneyland vacay over Thanksgiving. We saved up for a long time to stay at what is supposed to be the BEST hotel and do all the extras (character dining, etc.). We have two small children, 6 months and 2.5 years old at the time.   Upon arrival, the lobby is stunning. It was very crowded and I assumed busy because it was check-in/check-out time. However, as we came to find out, many of the people sitting in the lobby aren't even guests of the hotel. Anyone can just walk right in and camp out on their sofas. There was never a single seat available during our stay. Try walking down to the pool and passing through the lobby. It's as if you are walking through the mall in your swim suit. Even my husband thought it was awkward walking through that big crowd

We enjoyed our trip to Disneyland and California Adventure tremendously because we stayed on site at Disney's Grand Californian. We were there for a week and had adjoining rooms with our son and his family. Another son shared our spacious room. We were very comfortable in the cozy beds. We especially enjoyed getting into California Adventure earlier than outside visitors due to the gate connected to our hotel. We have been to Disneyland, Disney World, Disney Tokyo, and Disney Paris. I can say without a doubt that staying at a Disney resort was, by far, the best overall experience.

Summary Heading: Awesome hotel, wish i stayed longer
Summary: Chose this hotel due to winning a vacation package, paid for a third night. Awsome experience. Room was clean and well designed. It was a standard room that came with a balcony.  I did not get to check out the pool due to renovations but the hotel is phenominal and all staff was what you would expect from Disney cast members. We also loved getting into the parks early everyday based on planning what days to go. If I could justify the extra money, i would stay every time!

This is my favorite of the Disney properties due mostly to its location backing Disneys California Adventure theme park. When you stay at this hotel you can get early entry into the park, one hour prior to opening. It changes day to day for early entry into different parks. One key thing you should know, is if you plan on going to disneyland the day you are checking in, you can actually check in before the park opens, if your room is ready they will give you your room keys, if it is not they still give you room keys but text you your room number when it is ready, this way you can use your room key for early entry into the park not only the next day but the day you check in as well.   Water heater gave us issues, but once I called the front desk, they had maintenance fix the

First time here, friends told us to stay at the disney hotel so we can experience the whole magical place. We went to restaurant and my husband got a drink that came with a glowing ice cube, so cute. Then when we went to our hotel we got choclate covered strawberried with little tux's. The details in the room were pretty cool. We got a complementary upgrade for my sons bday. Very nice. I just adored the kids sitting area in the lobby with the old mickey mouse cartoons. So cute. Easy to leave resort and walk towards disneyland. Im sure we will be back to enjoy more. Great stay.

The lobby, grounds, hallways, etc were all very well-kept and clean. The lobby is huge and grandly beautiful! Very rustic-y, cabin-y feeling. The location can't be beat if you're interested in Disneyland, CA Adventure, or Downtown Disney. All of the staff I encountered were very kind and helpful. There was quite a lot of construction, with the pool being closed for renovations and also some kind of work being done on the roof, but the noise wasn't noticeable. All of the construction workers were kind and did their best to stay out of the way.   The room itself wasn't worth what you pay for it. Outdated and not exceedingly clean. When I pulled out the nightstand to access the outlets, the carpet and wall behind it was super dusty. The bathroom walls had bits of staining (perhaps

My friend recently won an overnight package from Disney Land. Little did I realize we would be staying at the Disney Grand Hotel. This place is jaw dropping beautiful! I met some friends here for breakfast a few years ago but that was about the extent of it. I never thought I'd see the day I would actually get to spend a night here. Valet service was extremely efficient, the registration desk staff super helpful and polite. We arrive early and they stored our luggage until the room was available. It was only 8:30 so we didn't expect it to be ready since check in wasn't until 3:00, as in all hotels. They said they would text us as soon as it was ready. By noon, we received our text. So we walked back to check the room out. Spotless and comfy. Our room looked right over downtown

Very personal service. We were treated like visiting royalty. One of the loveliest hotels we have ever stayed with. The construction was no issue and the entrance to Downtown Disney was swift and easy. Bell hop took our bags to the car while we played at Disneyland. And when they delivered the car to me they even provided excellent directions to our route home. Pricey but you get what you pay for.

We stayed at The Grand Californian Hotel from February 27th-March 3rd. We loved it! It was our first time and we were very happy with our choice. The lobby is breathtaking and loved the beautiful grounds of the resort. The pools were closed for refurbishment but we knew this ahead of time and we were able to use the Disneyland Hotel pool if we wanted to.  The staff were all very happy and helpful to our family. We loved seeing Chip and Dale walk through and interact with the kids. All of the little Disney touches throughout the hotel make it magical. We stayed in a room with a queen size bed and bunk beds. I have read reviews about the rooms being dated. I disagree. They are not brand new and modern but that isn't the theme of the hotel. The rooms have a lodge/mission style. We

Once again I've had a magical stay at the grand Californian. Every time I have encountered cast members they've always been helpful with the Disney Magic touch.  I save all year for my trips here with many  Credit card and Disney reward cards. So you can imagine what check out would be with three reservations and they've always been so patient with me I never felt rushed. So when it comes to one on one customer service at DGC. I would give it five out of five stars.   The reason I only give it a four out of five is because I'm always still trying to compare the price to the room but I'm also a realist  and location means everything to me and I know the hotel knows that so that is why am willing to pay the extra dollar and I do feel it's worth it, but having said that, my only

Summary Heading: A relaxing oasis within a "primary colored" world of activity.
Summary: The hotel is truly grand. The architecture is so stunning that at times we found it hard to leave the Great Hall to go into the parks! The staff is above reproach, and by staff I mean ALL who work within the hotel. I would like acknowledge the housekeeping and lost and found staff (thank you, Veronica) for retrieving my belongings ... several times! (Did you ever have one of those trips where you keep misplacing your belongings?!) The two-bedroom villa was gorgeous, the kitchen was stocked with every utensil, pot, or pan we needed. The decor was stunning. We had a phenomenal view of DCA, along with views of beautiful sunrises and sunsets. The only "needs improvement" comment I can make ...  the mattresses in both the "master" and the second bedroom were terribly hard and

My room was very clean and the location is amazing. The food in the napa rose is phenomenal, and the service is outstanding. I have stayed there several times and will stay there several more times. Love it so much. So central.

Summary Heading: This Resort's Renovation is Overdue | Delay Stay until Renovation is Complete
Summary: Through David's Vacation Club (highly recommend this company) we reserved a two bedroom villa as part of Disney's Grand Californian DVC-wing, on the south end of the hotel.  We were informed in advance that there would be construction around us as the resort is undergoing a renovation. We were also informed the pool would be closed. So these things did not take us by surprise.   We stayed at the Grand Californian in adjoining standard rooms in 2013, so also had an impression of the hotel from that experience.   The rooms were showing some wear back in 2013 (especially for the price point) so by 2017 there was no doubt upgrades were necessary - and in fact overdue.   The lobby continues to be a lovely and impressive place. The resort grounds are fine. The pool was a disaster but

This hotel has a great location and a beautiful lobby. The staff was also very nice BUT The room we had was VERY noisy. After 10 pm it was better but it sounded like we had kids walking through our room continuously. I would suggest not staying close to the elevator. Also there was construction going on so that was annoying. I was sick for two days and in the room and i kept waking up to pounding and drilling. On another visit this review might have been totally different but the noise, price and no pool due to construction does not equal 5 stars.

Summary Heading: 30th Anniversary At Disney's Grand California Hotel And Spa
Summary: Arrived December 20, 2017 after quite a traffic jam on I-5. Upon arrival, notified valet of need to check in quickly to make dinner reservations at Steak House 57. Valet assisted us greatly with free shuttle ride to the restaurant making it rather special. Great room and very accessible to Story Teller Caf√© the following morning. The much needed rain was falling early morning and throughout the entire day. Purchased ponchos and took in both parks. Lunch reservations at Cafe Orleans were delayed for 1.5 hours (with no notification by cell phone to us), but staff was very accommodating when we raised serious disappointment. Gumbo was excellent and warmed us up. Dinner at Main Street Caf√© was also met with delay as approximately 50 customers ahead of us had to wait until a woman

We spent a night a Disney's Grand Californian on a recent trip to LA. We wanted to visit Disneyland and were looking for class and convenience. Our room provided a view of the Brisa courtyard. Little did we know, the monorail ran through the courtyard just outside our window. We were thrilled as we are Disney enthusiasts.I had heard that this hotel and resort was in Disney California adventure, but did not grasp the convenience of the location to EVERYTHING Disney. We walked out the back door and passed the security check directly in the middle of Downtown Disney. A short walk later we were at the front gate to Disneyland. It was a bit cool later in the evening and we were able to walk back to our room, order breakfast room service, get our jackets and be back in the park in

So this hotel is fun.  It is Disney.  It is in a great location.  The park is super easy to get to.  Lots of restaurants and shops right outside of the doors.  A strategic Frozen gift shop right by the door that will suck the money right out of your pocket every time you come and go with a kid.  A breakfast restaurant with okay food but chipmunks and bears roam around and it makes the kiddo way happy.    The big downside is at $300 plus a night, our room was very small and it came with a queen and a bunkbed.  We did not enjoy having a bunkbed and I suppose it substituted for another queen bed but took up less space so they could get more rooms on the property.  However, I would stay in this small room with the bunkbed in lieu of walking another 30 mins to another hotel or to the

I was here for business meeting in February, the resort is kept immaculate as well as the rooms. Is a very family friendly resort all staff will go out of their way to help. Two minute walk to Downtown Disney, Disneyland, and California Adventure

Summary Heading: Elevate Your Vacay with a stay Here!
Summary: Wanting to elevate that trip to Disney? Book a room at Disney's Grand Californian! From the moment you step onto their property you are treated like royalty. From check in to check out, our stay was wonderful!  The biggest reason to stay here is the location! It cannot be beat and you are mere steps from the parks and downtown Disney that you've come to enjoy!  They offer many dining options on site, including Whitewater Snacks, a great place to grab a quick bite, and Storytellers Cafe, with an amazing dinner buffet!   The grounds are gorgeous, including the giant hearth fireplace in the lobby and the sprawling pool outside.  If you can afford to splurge, splurge here! You won't regret it.

Summary Heading: Great visit - Craftsman Club is worth it!
Summary: We had a terrific time at the Grand Californian last month. Going in, we knew there was going to be construction, but it did not impact our stay. We booked the club level and had access to the Craftsman Club, which was terrific. Highly recommended! They met us in the lobby and took us straight upstairs to register, so we did not have to wait in line. We booked two rooms, which were not adjoining when we arrived, but the concierge was able to remedy that quickly (and thankfully). The club has food (& booze!) available nearly all day, which was perfect so we did not have to hassle getting everyone down to breakfast at the same time, and we could snack or have a pre-dinner drink and appetizers before going back out in the evenings. The rooms are pretty standard, but comfortable.

This was our second time at the Grand.  Way too much construction for a relaxing stay and not worth paying the higher cost right now.  The pool area was completely closed during our stay and we were awoken by horrible construction noise at 3am our first night. The staff is helpful but the construction is beyond their control.  We loved our last stay at the Grand and look forward to returning at a later date.

We stayed here one night while visiting the Disney Adventure Park. You pay for the Disney name and everything is expensive, expensive, expensive (not worth the money, IMHO) but we had to give it a try. The location is great and the staff was friendly, professional and helpful.  Lobby is lovely but rooms definitely need some updating. I much prefer the Hilton.

Summary Heading: This is the place, but not the time.
Summary: One of our favorite hotels but under heavy construction. Believe it or not, California does have a winter so the fact that the pool is closed isn't really that big of a deal for us. The noise wasn't that bad for us either. One of the the things that bothered us about this stay is the way the construction people interact with the guests. There is work being done in the guest rooms and guest corridors. I understand that we are likely to see some aspects of the activities including the workers. What I don't expect is for the construction workers to be tying up guest elevators. Are there no service elevators in this place? I also expect that when guests are dragging bags down the hallway, construction workers will yield to the guests. Maybe even acknowledge and perhaps greet the

It pains me to say, but I was pretty disappointed with our stay. The hotel itself is nice. The lobby is big. But it's not that "grand". I guess I expected more and for the price should get more. You obviously pay for the Disney name. Everything here is crazy expensive. The hotel was just not worth the cost though. The good part...location location location. This was amazing and what you pay for. It was so nice to leave California Adventure and be right at the hotel. My favorite part was being able to ride Grizzly River Run several times at the end of the night with no wait (because it was cold) but being able to get right to the room. It was nice to be able to get back quickly and pick up a jacket or drop off sunglasses, etc. It wasn't as easy from Disneyland as you had to go

Summary Heading: The convenience is second to none
Summary: Make no mistake- this hotel is expensive. It is not worth the money you pay, even with the annual pass discount. The pools were being refurbished (there was a shuttle to the Disneyland hotel). The rooms were clean and comfortable, and the balcony was great. But what almost makes up for it is the 10 feet it is away from the entrance of Disney California Adventure. if you have the money to pay for this convenience, this is the only place to stay. There is disney magic here. We were given a nice picture when we arrived, and there is the convenience of the guest laundry (takes credit card only). But if on a budget, there are plenty of other more appropriate options.

This is the third or fourth time I have stayed at the hotel. Location is incredible. Staff was helpful in extending our stay. It is very expensive and always has been. That being said they are freshening it up. It needs it. Bathrooms are not up to standards for 700$ a night. If you want convenience it can't be beat do not expect luxury.

I stay at a lot of nice hotels so I am not afraid to spend the bucks but this hotel was highly overrated.... Both of my kids stayed in separate rooms( they each had 2 children with them) and had numerous issues with their rooms...phone not working, no warm water at 7:30AM, beds were very uncomfortable and service was VERY slow if not forgotten.... The reason I even gave it 3 stars was for the convenient location and the beautiful lobby. Try and stay at a Marriott or Hilton..... you will have a much nicer room with more ammenities.....I would say the biggest problem is the management is weak if things like this are going wrong with the rooms and service.

I don't know what happened with Disney. The Hotel is expensive but thinking it would    be convenient and a Disney property thought it would be well worth the price. But, immediately upon arrival I was abruptly made aware that something is definitely gone wrong here. The bell service at curbside was rude and when I asked the bags not be put away until I had a chance to check in at registration I was greeted rather rudely and with a roll of his eyes. Prior to my arrival I had requested an early check in and while others were getting rooms I was told the rooms would be ready soon just one more to be made( always understandable when you request an early checkin). They would text when ready. At 1:30 we came back to the hotel, to check for the room and was rudely told by 2 people

I have stayed at the Grand Californian a total of 4 times and each time it has been as good as the last. The hotel is due for some renovations (which have been started) but the maintenance on the property is top notch. From the moment you enter the grand lobby you know you are in for an excellent stay. The rooms are generous, the beds are comfortable and the hotel is convenient to both parks and Downtown. There is even a little private entrance to Californian Adventure Land for guests. The facilities are decent with an adequate gym and a lovely pool (under renovations currently) with great restaurants and bar/cafe.

We had a broken iron and I called the Operator two separate times to request a replacement be brought up to our room. It never came. I even said this is urgent for a meeting I need to be ready for and they never showed up. I was beyond disappointed that they ignored my request completely and it was THEIR broken iron. No one followed up with me or asked for feedback so I'm reviewing them here. Don't expect them to go above & beyond. If the location wasn't so convenient, I'd rather stay at a more reputable branded hotel.

What a beautiful hotel. It was so convenient to walk out of the hotel and be in either Disneyland or California Adventure in 10 minutes!  The beds were comfortable and every night they would turn down the bed and leave us a sweet treat.  The hotel had a lodge feel which was I found relaxing.

We have stayed at the Grand Californian multiple times and have never been disappointed.  We love everything about this resort property:the feel, the decor, the room set-up, the proximity, the staff.  It is definitely the best place to stay at the Disneyland Resort, in our opinion.

Summary Heading: Two visits, standard hotel not out of the ordinary
Summary: I have stayed here twice for meetings.  The location is nice for Downtown Disney,  Rooms are decent size, service is good, but didn't require anything extraordinary.  Very pricey however, even with convention rate rooms were $300/night.  Pool was under construction so people who had hoped to use pool were out of luck.  It was January and was raining almost the entire time, but not certain customers were aware of that until they arrived.

We went a little overboard on selecting this resort.  We knew we would likely not return to Disneyland since we prefer Disney World and we recently became engaged so we decided to splurge.  The hotel itself is amazing! It is huge from the moment you walk in.  We were there to see the set up of the tree and the gingerbread house for Christmas which was a nice touch.  The staff was very friendly as well.  Our only issue was that our room butted up against the backside of the California adventure so when people were screaming on rides, we heard it!  It was very nice to be able to enter and exit into both parks so easily from the hotel.

Summary Heading: Always my favorite but don't get concierge
Summary: We stay here every time we come to Disneyland and it didn't disappoint this time. Don't waste money on the concierge. They were almost rude and didn't supply much. We will be back at the hotel though.

I stayed at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel for 2 nights for a work offsite. After a long (and extremely fun) day in DisneyLand, I arrived back to my room to find everything I had left in the hotel room (that was not in the safe) was missing. Thankful I did not have anything valuable with me. I only was missing some clothes and a cell phone charger.   I assumed that there must have been some sort of a mix-up with my checkout date, and house keeping thought that I was checking out on Friday, not Saturday and removed everything from the room. I went down to the front desk to attempt to retrieve my stuff which I presumed would be held in lost and found. No such luck, my things were not in lost and found. A security guard was then called, who seemed to be working off the

As a lot of others have said, literally the ONLY reason to stay at this hotel is the location. It's convenient, and especially with little ones it's nice to be so close to the room but other than that it will be a big let down. The rooms are your average hotel room, it's pretty dated. The beds are ridiculously uncomfortable. The cleaning was lacking. Our room was constantly dusty, one day we had a dried contact lense (which did not belong to us) in our bedding, and I kept finding strands of dark black hair (also didn't belong to any of us) around our room. The hotel was under construction which was annoying and all of the pools were closed. When you are spending over $500 a night and they are doing construction and the pools are closed you would think they would either lower the

I've visited this amazing hotel many times over the years and will continue choosing this one. the interior is beautiful! there is a piano in the lobby which most of the time is being played, and a fireplace which has chairs so you may rest in front of it. this hotel is such a relaxing place to stay. for me and my family, it feels like a home away from home. beautiful hotel, beautiful pool area, guest entrance straight into California adventure park, lovely atmosphere and friendly staff. could not recommend more.

I was disappointed at the room size and old/dirty decor (seems old and used), I wasn't aware the pool was going to be closed so that was also a huge let down for my kids. Convenient and close to park, but overpriced and NOT worth it. Won't be back.

The Grand Californian was extremely upfront during booking, after booking, and prior to check in that the pool areas would be closed and under construction during our visit.  It was made very clear that construction would occur ONLY between 9am and 5PM.   This is all true BUT we booked a premium room overlooking the California Adventure park.  Our room overlooks an attraction that is closed 'for our future enjoyment'.  Apparently THAT construction follows different rules.   I am here for four nights.  Just finished my third night and EVERY morning my sleep ends at 5:30 to the sounds of metal grinders and sledge hammers working 200 feet away.  Clearly this is under Disney control.  Shame on you Disney.  Hotel is great location and I was willing to pay the premium for the

This is my third time staying at the Grand Californian in Anaheim. The hotel is very expensive for what you get, but it's my preferred place to stay simply because it's so close to the parks.  PROS -As I mentioned above, this hotel is very close to Disneyland and California Adventure. If you need to grab a nap, or even just a coat, distance is not a detractor. -Disney service is wonderful. I've found that Anaheim hotels aren't necessarily service focused (people are always going to stay near Disneyland, right?), so it's a refreshing difference with any Disneyland hotel. -The rooms are thoughtfully laid out, especially for families. The toilet and shower are separate from the double-sink vanity. There are two other mirrors in the room too, so it seems like a whole family could be

Summary Heading: Great Location but expensive and hotel is under refurbishment. Also be aware of new security measures.
Summary: This is the second time I've stayed in the hotel.  The first time was in 2009 and I thought the hotel was the bee's knees -- beautiful, stylish and clean.  But there hasn't been any updates since then and although the lobby is still breathtaking, the rooms desperately need a refresh and an update.  Our room had two queen beds, a mini-fridge and a safe.  A microwave is available for guest use in Whitewater Snacks.  We stayed here four nights in late January.  Check-in was annoying as a cast member attempted to give us a room without the view we booked.  We booked three months early and paid a premium to get our desired the Downtown Disney view (plus we called twice prior to our stay to confirm our reservation) and Disney still tried to pawn off a less desired view on us.  Bit

Summary Heading: Good if you like cold showers
Summary: Stayed here for 6 nights in room 4004. Had cold showers when taken around 8am for 4 of the 6 mornings. The water was not even lukewarm. Spoke to guest services who said they get this complaint a lot and attributed it to renovations. They did give us family fastpasses for 3 rides and a complimentary character breakfast for our cold showers.

Summary Heading: Would stay here again for the convenience factors
Summary: I have heard raving reviews from friends about this hotel so for our kids' fifth birthday we booked two nights here.  Pros:  1. No need to worry about having to find parking. The hotel is a five min walk to Disneyland or to California Adventure. 2. Guests get Magic Hour. 3. If traveling with family, you can come back to the hotel to rest and then head back to the park. 4. There is a small mini fridge to store deli meats to make lunches.  Cons:  1. The price 2. The musty odor in the hallway 3. The $37 fee for valet parking

Summary Heading: It's all about location and convenience!
Summary: I stayed here with my 7 & 10 year old sons the first week of February (mon- fri).  PERFECT time of year.  We got an incredible deal on a room with a balcony overlooking downtown Disney.  Free upgrade from a standard room was given at check in.  We were also able to check in early an hour early.  There was no check in line at all.  Kids had a sitting area to watch tv while parents checked in which was nice because my husband couldn't come this trip to help!!    I thought the craftsman lodge style was very beautiful.  My children, however, were disappointed because they wanted more Disneyland decorated lodging.  They had been to Legoland hotel and were hoping for something as spectacularly decorated.  There really is nothing in the hotel or rooms to indicate you are at Disney.

The Grand Californian is undergoing a major renovation, but we arrived the week before it began and for the final week of the Christmas season.  The "cast members" as they call the staff, were all delightful, and truly looked like they could have walked right out of old California.  The lobby is breathtaking, with entertainment every night, and a nice nook for comfortable seating and a massive fire place.  Our room was nice, with a small balcony and a view of the "garden" and Downtown Disney.  The room service was excellent, with the exception of one early breakfast before we were out of bed.  The hotel is close to the monorail for entry to Disneyland, and has a private entry to California Adventure!  It is right in the middle of downtown Disney, so all the shops and restaurants

We had a wonderful visit to Disneyland.  The staff at the Grand California hotel were very friendly.  They went out of their way to be friendly. The Character Breakfast at the Storyteller cafe was great.  The food was hot and tasted great.  We got to visit with al the characters available that day.

Summary Heading: Great hotel and location to the disney parks.
Summary: We enjoyed this hotel, they didn't have our room request when we checked in which was disappointing, but we received the room we wanted the next day.  We were able to watch the World of Color from a balcony on the hotel which was nice so we didn't have to fight the crowds to see the show.  I liked the convince of having our room close if we wanted to go back to the room to relax for a while.

We had the Vacation Club 2 bedroom suite condo on the 6th floor directly adjacent the World of Colour viewing area. The Suite was huge; it had a full kitchen with dining table as well as in suite laundry. The living room had a hide-a-bed couch and a Murphy bed and a washroom with shower. On either side of the kitchen are the bedrooms. One had a king bed with a jet tub and separate shower and large balcony. The other bedroom had two double beds and a separate shower/tub combo. That room also had a balcony. 1 package of laundry detergent, 2 packages of dishwasher detergent as well as 1 small bottle of Palmolive was provided. A couple packages of coffee and tea are also provided. If you stay 7 days or less with DVC, on the 4th day they replenish the soap and detergent as well as

Summary Heading: Most convenient hotel to all The Magic Kingdom has to offer
Summary: I booked a week-end room to celebrate a special birthday that coincided with Chinese New Year's (although I'm not Asian). I had people coming from all over the US for the celebration. The location of this hotel can't be matched - it was a quick walk to Downtown Disney. Disneyland was accessible from one end of the hotel & the California Adventure entrance is in the middle of Grizzly Peak. Some stayed with me & others stayed at other hotels. Having access to the Concierge Lounge (Craftsman's Club) meant that people could come in and have a snack after hours on the freeway, or join me for breakfast as we planned our day. The staff there was outstanding. They helped with ticketing my guests for the parks, and confirmed  restaurant reservations within the hotel. I also got a

Location, location, location! Best hotel in Disneyland! You walk right out into Downtown Disney and you'll be at the park entrance within 2-3 minutes. There's also a personal entrance from the hotel into California Adventure so you can skip all the crowds in Downtown Disney all together.. The early morning access to the park was also really nice! We were able to hit a lot of the major rides before the park was really open to the public!  The room was pretty standard. We had 2 queen sized beds, a balcony overlooking the Disneyland Hotel, a fridge, and DVD player.. There wasn't much Disney theme to the room or hotel but had a really nice cozy log cabin feel to the lobby. The bathroom wasn't all that impressive being that it was pretty small. The room kind of compares to any other
