This was not the first time we have stayed at this hotel. It is a fantastic place to stay whilst visiting Disney. The entrance directly into California Adventure Park is always a great asset, and the location so close to both parks main entrances is perfect. You can step straight out into Downtown Disney at any time, so it really is ideal.   The hotel itself is quite old fashioned looking, but that is part of its charm. All the amenities are there and accessible for hotel guests. The rooms are a good size and always clean and tidy.   The staff are always happy to help and go out of their way to assist you. We were there at Christmas, so it was extremely busy, however the staff were always attentive and welcoming.   We would certainly stay here again on our next visit to Disney.

Summary Heading: Dated and Tired but being renovated.
Summary: We stayed at this hotel in January 2017 and were not aware that the pool area was being closed for renovations.. As you can imagine this was extremely disappointing, they told us that they emailed us notifying us the pool area would be shut but I definitely never received any email... The location of this hotel is great, it's bang smack in the middle of Downtown Disney, just make sure you do not go at the same time as everyone else as you could be queuing up to 30 mins to get in and it's just shopping and restaurants. They have extensive security checks before you are allowed in, bags, coats, metal detectors, the works!! Security are rude and slow.  This particular hotel seems to have lost it's Disney Magic!  The staff/cast are a lot less helpful and happy than I have

Summary Heading: Beautiful lobby, amazing location, great staff, "meh" rooms
Summary: Our family stayed in mid-January for 6 days around the Star Wars Half Marathon Weekend. We are a couple in our 30s and have a 9-year old daughter. We are frequent Disney resort visitors (and runDisney athletes). We have stayed in almost all of the Disney properties in Orlando, and have stayed at both the Grand Californian and off-site Disney resorts in Anaheim. Also, I travel quite a bit for work and stay in every type of hotel around the US and UK. I was disappointed in the room here - it was comfortable, clean, and an adequate size - but it didn't feel anywhere near luxury. I had just stayed in a Holiday Inn in Kentucky a few weeks ago, and this didn't feel much nicer. In fact, the Holiday Inn was actually more updated in terms of room amenities. The rooms need some serious

We were greeted right away by the bell staff but opted to hold on to our bags and ended up being able to check in right away. The desk staff offered us a room facing the pool which is under refurbishment and we took it since it meant immediate unpacking. The other advantage was that it was very quiet at night since there was no activity at the pool. During our stay, we experienced one of the worst rain storms on record so that surely contributed to the low activity levels also. The hotel is nice looking from the outside and the lobby. We weren't as impressed as we were with the Wilderness Lodge in Orlando though. The Grand Californian just seemed a little lacking in Disney magic for some reason. There are three restaurants, Napa Rose, which was great and I will review

We booked this through Costco Travel and paid a reasonable price for the "off-season".  The rooms were larger than when we stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and were clean and comfortable.  We stayed in a queen/bunk bed room with 3 people and had plenty of room, but it may have been tight for 5.  The in-room amenities were fair (toiletries, bed, bedding, linens, etc.) but the real allure of the hotel I think is its convenience!  You can't beat walking right into the park and being able to go back and forth!  Didn't eat at any of the restaurants on property but visited the Hearthstone Lounge a couple of times and the gift shop; both clean and reasonably priced.   The staff were friendly and helpful!  I'd definitely stay here again if not for anything else for the convenience!

The bell service staff is the worst I have ever used do not under any circumstance ship to the resort!! They are now telling me this system is down and can not create room keys come back between now and whenever

Summary Heading: Housekeeping STOLE our souvenirs/ Terrible management/ average room
Summary: I am a avid Disney fan and couldn't wait to stay at Disney's most expensive resort, Disney's Grand Californian Hotel & Spa. The rooms were average looking, lobby for Christmas was nice, BUT WE HAD OUR SOUVENIRS STOLEN on our second day. HOUSEKEEPING STOLE OUR SOUVENIRS OFF THE TABLE IN ROOM!!  Overall disappointed with customer service and management. We WASTED half a park day trying to resolve this issue and ONLY RECEIVED 1 Fast Pass for the trouble, which is the same reparation we received at the park for the parade being 10 minutes late. DOESN'T ADD UP, 10 MINUTES and 1/2 a day SAME COMPENSATION. We received the bare minimum of replacement of items, but a half day of park fun was wasted. We NEVER RECEIVED ANY APOLOGIES, JUST EXCUSES TRYING TO SAY IT WASN'T THEIR FAULT,

Summary Heading: Mistake in reservations but worth it in the end
Summary: Well we were supposed to be staying in the Ramada Inn across the street from the Disney entrance, but had a problem upon check in with the room being too small for our family of 6, long story short we had to find another hotel last minute. We decided to splurge and stay here. After the reservation phone agent got us our reservation and agreed upon price we went over to The Grand Californian. It was sooooooo beautiful. However, once we were checking in we found out that our reservation agent only booked us for one night and gave us all sorts of incorrect pricing (we were staying 4 nights and he told us that our total was for 4 nights, turned out it was just for ONE NIGHT!). After having a mini melt down and telling the cast member about our mishap they helped as much as they

Summary Heading: The Concierge Level -- And they are undergoing an refurbishment (no more bunk beds!)
Summary: So, I still stand by my previous review about the value and the distance to the park.  You are paying for proximity and the Disney ambiance.  Even with the upcoming refurbishment, they are not so much an upgrade as making the rooms able to withstand wear and tear better -- stone countertops instead of wood. So, nothing to sing about. The biggest change is that they are doing away with the bunk beds with the change. Rooms will come with 2 double beds and a couch. That may be better for families with teenagers, who usually would break the bunk beds. I still find it a loss.  So I will explain the upgraded ration. Now, for the past few years, I have been paying the extra price of the concierge level. You get personal service from the curbside to your room on the 8th or 7th floor.

We stood at the Grand California for a stay-cation with our 15 month daughter. Location is perfect. It connects to California Adventure theme park and Downtown Disney, which also connects to Disneyland via the monorail. The accommodations were just average. The hotel lobby is beautiful. Great ambiance, beautiful fireplace & relaxing pianist playing Disney songs. The rooms were small, clean and outdated. They are remodeling so I'm sure in the future the rooms will feel "grand" but as of now they are pretty basic hotel rooms. Service did not feel luxurious BUT we were given great service by our staff. The price does not reflect the quality of your stay but rather the convenience to theme park entry. I would stay here again with a good discount but otherwise there are other great

The main advantage of staying here is the proximity to Disneyland, and shopping will be delivered direct. On the plus side staff were very friendly (extending the Disney experience), postcards were sent free of charge and the room was maintained spotlessly. Wifi was not available in the room, but was accessible in the lobby. The pool was undergoing maintenance

Seven days at Disney provided magic, mayhem and more than a few disappointing moments. Magic is being able to gain easy access to California Land, but as always make due you arrive 30 minutes early to join the hotel queue. The hotel had easily accessible facilities, laundry for families, and a well stocked shop serving ready to eat meals (breakfast cereals). Mayhem, real theme of staff not thinking outside the script, we used guest services on numerous times only to them next to incompetent or incapable. I wanted to buy stamps, and was sent to three different people without success, or try to find what time the park opens or closes (esp marathon time, or light show pre screening), or try using the toilet at Napa Rose before 5pm "sorry sir you will need to wait, it's only 4.58

Loved this hotel! The grand foyer is just beautiful and everything is on such a grand scale. The location is perfect and getting into the parks early is such a bonus. It is expensive but highly recommend it if you want to really enhance your disneyland experience.

January is such a great month to travel!  This hotel was so nice!  We were pampered the whole stay. We have three boys and the space was enough for all of us. The pool was being renovated, but they were offering shuttles to the other Disney hotel nearby if you wanted to go to a pool. The park itself was empty with minimal lines. I would stay here again in a second.

From checkin to checkout this place rocks, the bar, the room, the shop, the restaurants and most of all the staff, this resort is a 15/10 we will be back for sure... The room we had was very clean, very big and great views. Great to have park access and get in early was fantastic. Big resort, yet felt at home and completely safe..

Summary Heading: I'd think twice before booking again
Summary: We booked this hotel purely because of proximity to the park. This and the fact that you get Magic morning EVERY day at the parks makes it worth it.  I booked a standard view room with one queen bed and bunks for our two children. It is just fine. I would have appreciated a lamp and beside table on both sides of the bed and more frequent linen changes rather than 'when you ask us to' given the 4.5 star advertised quality of the hotel. The floor could also do with a thorough vacuum  The style of the hotel is Arts and Craft. Some comment in previous posts that it is dated but that's they theme that Disney has chosen. Apparently it's supposed to make you feel like you are in a mountain lodge, also hence the reason why it's freezing cold throughout  My only frustrations are perhaps

We had a three bedroom suite which was outstanding in every respect. Great location close to everything. Loved the foyer. We chose to pay extra to join the club which gave us access to the private room on the 6th floor at any time for food and drink all day. Got our park hopper tickets there which gave us early entry to Disneyland and adventure park.

We were super excited for our stay here and were amazed by the gorgeous lobby as we walked into the hotel. As far as service, it was spectacular as always by Disney. While the hotel is pretty, we were slightly disappointed with our room...just basic. Our view was just ok...most of it was the side wall of Goofy's Sky School, but we could still see Mickey's Fun Wheel and the lights were gorgeous at night time. The best part of the hotel is the access to Downtown Disney and California Adventure. It was extremely easy to stop by our room to drop of bags or take a rest if needed.   For the same price, we would probably choose to go back to the Disneyland Hotel for our next visit.

Summary Heading: Luxury hotel with amazing Disney Service
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for a Disney spring break staycation.   The Good:   The hotel itself is beautiful and grand! As soon as we entered the valet area the Disney service started! Fast, and friendly check in that made you feel that they would go above and beyond to make your stay magical. Not to mention the fast pass you get for one ride plus magic hour.   You can't beat the location of this hotel! There is a entrance right into CA Adventure.   Storyteller's cafe has great food and even a woodland character breakfast!   Pool has the most comfortable pool chairs that I've ever been in. The kids loved the pool and water slides.   The rooms were clean and cozy.   The I wish it could have been better:   The price!!!!! Ok I get it it's Disney but I've stayed at hotels in terms of

We live local and have stayed here 3 times: we keep coming back for the location only. Nothing about it feels worth the $650/night we paid.   All 3 times same experience: awesome valet, check in service and lobby. The rooms are small and extremely dated, and we have had none or 1 bottle of amenities (for a family of 4-6), and last year they moved us from a suite with 2 bathrooms (for all 6 of us) into a suite with one bathroom. For 6 people! This time we called to book 2 rooms together (maybe not joining but next to each other) and they put us 2 floors away! One room had water bottles, one room didn't. The $200 extra for club level isn't worth it unless you are in the hotel a lot. And they have free cocktails but the staff is borderline rude when you ask. And they have to go

The location could not be beat. We were in town for the Disney marathon and location was perfect, with easy access to California Adventure and Downtown Disney. The bad part is this hotel is old and in desperate need of an upgrade. Unfortunately I have found this with several Disney hotels. Very disappointing considering how expensive it is.

I have stayed in this resort at least four times over the past 8 years and I had my best stay yet this past holiday season.  I get the impression that they have been working to improve the rooms and it shows. The best part of staying here is their location in proximity to the parks. Convenient is an understatement.  It's exhausting taking kids to Disney, even if you take your time. So staying here is a way to give yourself a break.  On this stay, I had hoped to stay in their main lodge but was offered a room outside that was available for early checkin and therefor was an offer I could not refuse.  I upgraded my room upon arrival from a "courtyard view" to a "park view", they handled it quickly and effortlessly and improved my experience significantly without making me pay a big

I love this hotel due to the Arts and Crafts decor. It is very thoughtfully done. There is even a free tour you can sign up for about the design history and implementation in the hotel. We were the only ones on the tour - it would probably bore the kids and few people would want to take the time to do it with Disneyland right out the door. But it was a wonderful experience for those of us who love Arts and Crafts style.

Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Grand Californian!  We stayed two nights and, of course, wish we stayed longer.  We had a deluxe partial view and our room overlooked Grizzly River Run - it was a quiet room even though the monorail was nearby.  My brother had a woods/courtyard view and he overlooked the monorail and had a bit of a Downtown Disney view - he could hear the monorail a bit more than us.  The rooms were a decent size to move around in, had a small balcony, and the sink area was a double vanity (which helped us to get ready faster).  The beds were pretty comfortable.  The only 2 drawbacks were that 1.  the "flat" sheet on our bed had some brown, tea-like stains on the edge (I could have called to have it changed but it was so late and I was so tired) and 2. the TV

Summary Heading: Great access to the Park but has some issues
Summary: This hotel has access to both Disney parks and Downtown Disney. That is a big plus. Now, hotel is a really way overdue for restoration - carpets and all furniture in the room belong to 80s. We booked room in October (we were staying in December) - 2 adults and one 4-year old. We got small room with one bunk bed and one small bed. It wouldn't be a problem if bunk bed was intended for adults - it was really short (so I slept with my feet outside the bed). Bathroom doors were sliding doors (did not wanted to close). For a price we paid - this is really, really awful. We were placed @ 6th floor and had a balcony -which is great. Now, during a night time we couldn't sleep as hotel walls are really thin and we could hear conversation and kids screaming from a room that was bellow us -

Although the pools were close I still recommend staying at least once. Clean, beautiful and easy access to both Disney parks and Downtown Disney. Staff was amazing and took great care of all our needs. Our room had a view of  the fireworks and they did not disappoint.

Summary Heading: Disney's Grand Californian VS. Disneyland Hotel
Summary: First let me start by saying we have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for the past 14 years. We are a family of four, two sons ages 17 and 24. We decided to stay at the Grand Californian as a treat to my 24 year old who is graduating from college this year. I have to say that we did have higher expectations for the Grand being it is billed as a step above the Disneyland Hotel. The hotel lobby and surrounding areas are beautiful and we love the ambiance of the craftsman style decorations.  Now, why I am giving the hotel an average rating is because we had a Club Level room that includes their Craftsman Club, a lounge that provides complimentary food and drinks throughout the day. We have had the same at the Disneyland Hotel so had some expectations, as our experience with the Club

We stayed at the Grand for 5 nights in October. It was our first time saying at a Disney resort, we usually stay off site. We will no longer stay anywhere but this resort! Staff were incredible, they bent over backwards to get us the room we wanted, and for our party to be as close together as possible (there were 10 if us total). Our room was perfect.I don't find anything in this hotel to be outdated as previous people have commented. Yes, its pricey. But we chose to stay there anyways, its not like the price is a surprise, you know when you book what the price is, so take it or leave it. We did not find the hotel overly busy at all, even the pool area. If you don't like busy, don't go at peak time. We loved everything about this hotel. The best part was waking up early and

Summary Heading: Christmas Day holiday from Australia with 4 year old
Summary: This was the worst hotel I have stayed at, the place is over priced, and they can't even give in house guest a booking in restaurants for Christmas Day, nor at the Disneyland, we have been to many Disney places and this is a big disappointed, over $5000 for 5 nights in standard room and then we ordered in room and my 4 year old got raw burger for his Christmas dinner, who does this, kills a kids Christmas Day and a 4 year old at that, he wanted to leave, long waits to get our hire car, like 40 mins, so we had to take taxi to our tour at a cost of 250 return, which is like 320 in our dollars, I call them up to express my anger and how they BROKE MY 4 year old heart with a worst Christmas Day, wish we spent it at home with family, and they lady just hung up on me, you are the

Summary Heading: The best of the Disney Hotels
Summary: I was here for a work trip on New Year's Eve and the hotel was extremely busy. Room service took 2 hours for dinner and I think that could have been managed a lot better. Disney knew their expected occupancy and could have planned for it. The fireworks at midnight were visible from my room and they were beautiful.Staff was friendly and helpful. Valet was organized and I suggest you call for your car ahead of time to avoid waiting for a while downstairs/outside. Cookies were brought in at turndown service and they were tasty. Who doesn't love cookies?! The rooms are a clean and stocked,the bed was comfortable and the balcony nice and roomy. I would definitely stay here again as this is the closest hotel to the park entrance.Enjoy your trip to the happiest place on earth!

Summary Heading: It is really really really old...needs to be updated badly
Summary: For how expensive this hotel is, it should have been updated a decade ago.  All the furnishing and carpets are vintage 1970-80.  The carpets are dated and worned out.  The doors don't close to the bathroom.  The couch has holes.  The chairs creek.  You get the picture.  As far as location is concerned, it is perfect with direct access to Disney California theme park and a short walk to Disneyland itself.  Being located on Downtown Disney, it can be very loud at night due to all the activities in Downtown Disneyland (performance, crowds, etc).  If noise bothers you, request a room facing Disney California.    No complaints about the service or amenities.  The restaurants on premise were all excellent (especially Napa Rose).  Valet and check-in was a breeze though self-parking is

We stayed in a two bedroom suite. It was spacious, clean and very comfortable for the five of us. Unfortunately, on our first night, there was an emergency water shutdown. Initially, we were horrified. Our two sons were driven to another hotel to bathe. The next morning the water took longer than expected to come back on. It did and we survived. The maids did two daily visits including one to turn down our beds. We enjoyed the living room where we were able to view the fireworks. Yay! That was a treat. This hotel is close to California Adventure, Disneyland and Downtown Disney. It's also very convenient to come back to for a short nap and head out again at night. We will certainly be back, hopefully, when our grandson turns five.

Summary Heading: Service disappointing- front desk personnel just rude
Summary: As a DVC member I expect great service and a magical experience when I visit Disney properties.  Our stay at the  Grand Californian started terribly at the front desk.  First we had to stand in a line (while other people went straight to the desk) and then wait and watch the front desk people not helping people.  Of the 6 or so people at the desk, only 1 person at a time helped people check in- the others looked like they were too busy reading their emails to help.  I had requested 2 king rooms and was told we could get them, but the front desk lady took off for about 10 minutes and returned telling us we just missed getting the king rooms (must have gone to the people who cut in and went straight to the desk).  The rooms were fine, a bit noisy, but nothing special. Upon our

Summary Heading: overpriced but if you want to be close to the park...
Summary: This hotel is exorbitantly overpriced.  The lobby is quite lovely but the rooms are extremely basic.  The staff are all very friendly, however, and do their best to make your child feel special.  We loved the convenience of being so close to the park but probably won't stay here again - even with the special discounts they sometimes offer to pass holders.  In some ways, our recent modest stay at nearby Candy Cane Inn was easier/more convenient because we self parked (no long waits at the valet on both ends), no line at check-in, no long corridors and elevators...). I'm sure the club level is another world but we are just looking for something practical, easy, basic and clean for our little 1-2 nights stays visiting disney (from l.a.).  I think if you're coming in from out of

This hotel is not very old but it is already a classic.  My favorite of the Disneyland park hotels.  Beautifully decorated at Christmas!  Excellent service and a nice balance of luxury and whimsy.  Can't wait to go back!

This hotel was amazing, just very expensive.When we first arrived there was one issue with our room being being ready, but we got free dinner vouchers, (Which was really awesome!). The rooms are regular sized and I really liked the balcony. The pools is great with like 5 different pools and a water slide. The California Adventure entrance is so nice, but sometimes in the morning going through the regular entrance is faster. Overall the stay was great.

I hate to say it but the Grand Californian took the magic out of Disney for us. We called the hotel on Monday to confirm our reservation for Wednesday and Thursday and let them know we are arriving late. We are celebrating our anniversary so we wanted everything to be perfect.  We arrived at 11 pm only to find out they had our reservation for Thursday and Friday. Front desk response was that we could cancel our reservation if we'd like. Great start. At 11:30 pm we are put out and looking for a room. Figured okay we'll make the best of it and return the following day and start over.  So we head back to the hotel after the previous day screw up and check in. Front desk says they are upgrading us and giving us a view. I though nice, they're making up for the snafu yesterday. We get

Summary Heading: Disney's Homage to California's Arts and Crafts Movement!
Summary: What a glorious hotel this is! I stayed in the Club Level of the Grand California Hotel. From the moment you step through the stained glass sliding door, you're transported into a decadent and elegant California's Arts and Crafts beauty. Huge wooden beams adorn the interior gallery. A large fireplace with boulders offer a welcoming site as a pianist plays on a black baby grand piano! The hearthstone bar should not be missed!   The Club Level lounge offers tea, snacks, and light foods throughout the day. Not to mention champagne and wine!   The room is adorn in the Arts and Crafts movement too! You cannot stray too far before you find a hidden mickey somewhere!   Did I forget to mention the heated pool?! There's a water slide in the main pool, Jacuzzi's and a secondary pool

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel with direct access to Disney California Adventure park
Summary: Husband and I stayed here in May 2016 for 6 nights as part of my 50th birthday celebration.  I have only walked through the foyer of the hotel on previous trips to Disneyland but wanted to stay at the hotel this last time as a special treat.  The room we had was spacious (well enough for the two of us) with 2 double beds.  We had a view of the courtyard where we could watch the monorail zoom by and we also had a great view of the evening fireworks.  The staff of the hotel were extremely friendly and i have nothing negative to add about my stay.  with the hotel being so close to the parks was a bonus as I could pop back to our room for a quick rest before heading out into the parks again.  The cost of this hotel is the most expensive in the area and I do feel that the Disneyland

As expected with any Disney property you are completely emersed in the magic that is Disney. Having an entrance into Downtown Disney and another to California Adventure is wonderful!  Saving steps after a long day in the parks is never a bad thing.  There is always something going on in the lobby as well as shopping and dining options on property. The rooms are nicely appointed and I truly enjoyed my morning coffee on the veranda watching California Adventure come to life.

Summary Heading: Great location, very Disney focussed service
Summary: I booked a two bedroom suite for my family at this hotel. It was not cheap but the room was very nice, with plenty of room and a great view over Downtown Disney and the Magic Kingdom. It has a very convenient location with direct access to the Californian Adventure park and is only 5 minutes walk to the Magic Kingdom. The service at the hotel as you may expect is very Disney oriented and probably not at the same level as similar standard non-Disney hotels. However if you are visiting Disneyland with your family it definitely has the best location available.

The best service and most convenient location into the parks. Awesome perk to get in the park an hour early, makes the popular rides practical and feasible with little kids. Comfortable sleeps. Good restaurants too. Fabulous pools! We couldn't be happier!!

Summary Heading: Stayed at many Disney hotels; ranks near top
Summary: Really enjoyed our stay at the Grand. Stayed at many Disney (World) properties (Grand Floridian, Polynesian, Yacht Club, Beach Club, Boardwalk, Animal Kingdom Lodge...) and the GC fits in nicely. This hotel isn't themed as throughly as the others mentioned, but it is nice (reminded us of Animal Kingdom Lodge) and has great Disney service like the rest. I LOVED that our room looked out into California Adventure and was also connected to Downtown Disney. Made it extremely convenient. I was worried that we wouldn't feel like we were in the "Disney bubble" but we certainly did. If you aren't familiar with Disney hotels, be aware you will probably have quite a walk to your room. Nice, heated pools as well. Napa Rose was wonderful and the Hearthstone Lounge was great after a day at

Like most older hotels, the rooms are not large but the comfort is amazing. The staff waits on you hand and foot and any problems are instantly corrected.  The building itself is an architectural wonder.  Grab a seat in front of the lobby fireplace with a cocktail and sit there for hours enjoying the fire and the piano music. The front desk staff is wonderful.  The are modernizing now but the tradition will continue.  A splurge cost-wise but worth every penny.

Nice hotel but the water stopped working for longer than expected so the front desk lied to us and said that they gave us a fast pass for all the rides, but we later found out IT WAS ONE RIDE! ridiculous!!!!

Summary Heading: If I Could Give Less I Would!
Summary: I will rank this as one of the worst stays ever at any hotel.  We came for a quick one night/one day visit.  We left feeling neither magical or happy.  The good items were as usual the staff who have a great attitude and approach for working here.  Though they seem misinformed about a lot of things which cost us a lot of running around when trying to resolve or original issue upon arrival.  The answers and advise we got were pleasant and friendly but the information we got was so wrong that it cost us 2 hours of running around that if they had just said we don't know we would have started with our final solution which was a phone call.  Next we were staying on the "prestigious"  club floor with the perks of a private concierge and a club lounge.  This was a treat to ourselves as

Summary Heading: it's all for the experience, right?
Summary: Newly married professionals (32 and 38 years old) on the first part of honeymoon. I am a seasoned Disneyland passholder and he is a good sport along for the ride!  We got engaged at the Grand Californian at my 'secret spot' (fireplace in the lobby) and because I have never stayed there, we wanted to make this our first stop on our honeymoon trip.  I did some research before hand and I knew that a lot of people felt as if they overpaid. And I agree in some regards.   First, the service is Disney service. They can't say no but not everything can be a yes! From the moment the valet took our car, it was pure smiles and try to please attitudes all the way.   Since I have been a passholder since I was practically born (my first visit was when I was a 6 month baby), I had this image

Went to celebrate daughters 21st birthday but wanted to go at Christmas. Stayed in a suite with our family and it was perfect. Perfect view of the fireworks so didn't have to fight the herds coming out of Disneyland at closing and heard all the music as well. Spoiled rotten! Love buying treasures and having them send directly to room. 24 hour room service. Concierge room was nice. A bit overpriced and seemed rather "police enforced" when we went as a group with only one of us having our room keys. Almost got frisked when we went in and had to send family member back to get alllll of the room keys. Really

Stayed on sight adjoining Disneyland California Disney & Downtown Disney. All facilities within walking distance with a choice of swimming pools to cool off for the summer visit. Lots of eating choices within walking distance nearby.

Summary Heading: The place to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: Went there with my daughter, son-in-law, and two grandchildren.   The hotel is pricey, but the convenience of the location makes up for the added cost.   Going from your hotel room to the two attractions is wonderful.  The hour of free reign in the parks from 7:00 - 8:00am is great, and it takes about an hour for the park to fill up during the peak tourist season.  The rooms are very nice, well lit, and I really liked the instant hot water.  The easy access back to your room to rest and freshen up for a latter day visit is great.

1 night stay on a quick trip to D-land. Prime location, hotel room was average, amenities were below average considering the cost of the room.  Considered other Disney properties but the ability to access California Adventure right from the hotel lobby was a huge selling point.

We stayed in a one bedroom suite for Halloween. The staff were friendly and vey nice after screwing up one of our orders to our room. My family always stays here when we go to Disneyland and the hotel has not dissapointed.

Summary Heading: Very average experience at the Bland California Hotel
Summary: we have stayed here before and thought it was fine - even 'nice' - once it was 'great'.  This time was very average - like bad motel six average.  we had breakfast at one restaurant and the price was exorbitant - something like $150 USD for four people to eat at a buffet and have coffees.  The room had multiple defects in drawers, bedding, bathrooms etc.

I always wanted to stay at the Grand Californian but we got in the habit of going to Disney World a few years ago so this hotel has been around awhile before I got to try it.  What you are paying for at the GC is mostly convenience.  Don't get me wrong, it is a fantastic hotel but the rooms are looking a bit dated. They are very clean and well maintained but our room might be close to needing a makeover.  Enough said there, nothing wrong with the room.  The convenience is how one of the hotel exits almost immediately into California Adventure while another exits on to Downtown Disney.  This is an invaluable plus when you have kids who get tired or you need to run back to the room for a forgotten item.  The main lodge area is amazing and the restaurants are great also.    We had

We checked in for a night to a 2 bedroom villa using points. Our villa wasn't available until 4:30pm, check-in is at 3pm. I also requested for the highest floor and theme park view but we were given the 1st floor and no view. So disapponted! It could be because it's only at the Grand Californian Hotel that any of my requests were never granted compare to all the other Disney hotels we stay at. We'll most probably not book again.

Great spot to rest between trips to the parks. The lobby is a comfortable place to relax, read a book and people-watch. Downtown Disney is adjacent and a great spot to step out and enjoy a walk, some street musicians or some nice shopping. Rooms are a reasonable size with comfortable balconies. Not the quietest hotel, owing to the large open atrium lobby and families with young guests, but overall very restful.

Overall....nice, however. Room was actually quite basic. We stayed in just as nice if not nicer Holiday Inn rooms on the way there and back and they had microwaves and nicer Coffee makers. Lobby was amazing but incredibly busy with people that are not staying there. We had a "Premium View" room...but...5 minutes into World of Color we heard this loud and clear right below our balcony coming from Goofy's Flying School. "Unloading car 1" BUZZZ BUZZZ BUZZZ BUZZZ BUZZZ etc. etc. etc. "Unloading car 2" BUZZZ BUZZZ BUZZZ BUZZZ BUZZZ etc. etc. etc. I think there were 10 cars unloaded.  When it comes right down to it...you're paying BIG for location/convenience. So unless you plan on riding Grizzly River Run 5-10 times a day and running back to your room to change...or...you have

The incredible price tag to stay at Grand California is all for the convenient location to the Disney parks. I've been looking forward to finally getting a chance to stay at the Grand California as I have been impressed with their lobby for many years. We finally saved up enough pennies to afford a short two night stay for my birthday last week. Although the lobby was beautiful decorated for the holiday season, the room itself was anything but grand. We are huge Disney fans, so we have stayed at many hotels in the Anaheim area. For the price of $600 per night (not inclusive of taxes and fees), I am expecting more than just a broken, unclean motel room. We had a pool facing room with two queen beds. The beds left us with bug bites all over our legs and faces. The AC system was

I was 8 months pregnant for our trip and wanted to stay close. We were lucky enough to get to stay in the concierge floor and got to visit the wonderful buffet daily for breakfast and at our daughters nap time! We even enjoyed the dessert bar at night one of the nights! Chocolate covered strawberries and cookies and milk!

Beautiful, excellent service, cozy and convenient. The concierge lounge was fantastic the pools are very nice and the staff are all helpful and friendly. It's nice to be able to walk right into the park from the hotel..the grand entrance is breathtaking.

I have stayed here five times but this is the first time I have reviewed it. My wife and I renewed our vows here 6 years ago. Our grandchildren loved it. As other reviewers have stated it's adjacent to California Adventure and it's a good location to get to quickly when the inevitable child meltdowns occur. A nap, a dip in one of the several pools and they are ready for more theme park adventures. That is worth its weight in gold. The other hotels are not as easy to get to or you have to take some sort of transportation to get there. The Grand Californian has its own entrance into California Adventure which makes getting inside (and back into the hotel) much easier. I highly recommend it.

We love staying at the Grand Californian every time we go to Disneyland. This trip though had some downfalls. First being that they now added a security/ body scanner inside the hotel/California park entrance.  It is a long slow line every morning and you have to get scanned/ and bags checked every time. If you pay extra money to enter the park from your hotel, you expect a different service. I waited in a longer line to enter though the hotel than when we left and entered through Downtown Disney after making a trip to the store.  We didn't have to go through the body scanner and barely had our bag checked, yet we did every time at the hotel? What? What a Waste of precious time. The hotel is showing its age in the rooms. The customer service is still excellent. The other down

Summary Heading: Pleasantly surprised and worth the price
Summary: To put it simply, you're paying extra for a little bit of sanity in an insane place that you're voluntarily going to. I have previously made 4 trips to Disneyland and this was by far the easiest due to the fact that:  #1 - I can walk right into the park from my hotel without massive crowds or delays.  #2 - I get to enter the park 1 hour early for every day that I stay there before the mad rush enters 1 hour later. I place a value on this bonus at about $100 per day - for 2 adults, my son is still free to enter the park.   #3 - I don't have to drive to the resort, take the stupid tram and deal with all the people that en devour entails.   #4 - They are set up to cater to you, and especially your children.  I paid $320 per night to stay at the Grand and I honestly think it was

Summary Heading: Rooms should be 1/5th the price for what they are
Summary: We stayed in a $1200 suite, which is basically just 2 rooms with a door in between.   The bad: Had to instantly call cleaning services when we entered to vacuum the floor as there was old pasta left on the floor.  Carpet is dirty. Rest feels like older best western. Creaky doors, clunky sliding doors to bathroom, TV's that barely look HD (if at all) etc. Room was supposed to be ready by 3pm, and wasn't. No king size beds available it seems, only duel queen Noisey hallways If you're unlucky like us, you get to hear the train/tram underneath come by every 10 minutes(?). Loud. For this price one would expect at least a microwave or coffeemaker in the room.  The good: amazing atmosphere in lobby and surroundings. Good service and friendly Instant access to disney California

Looking at the other reviews, yes, I would agree that the rooms are "slightly" dated, but give me a break, my kids had no clue.  When you stay at a hotel with a family of 5, and spend what it takes, you want SERVICE.  And we got it, Disney style.  I booked online and really wanted the room with the bunks and trundle, and the online chat person was very helpful, making sure that my request was high priority - and it worked (recommend making the room type request via online chat!!!!).  Our first night there, we hit the pool - needs an upgrade (in my parent spending money mind) - kids LOVED it, and the poolside drinks and service was amazing.  We got early access to Disneyland, which I HIGHLY recommend taking advantage of . . . . what a blast.  And then that evening as we were

We stayed at The Grand Californian for 4 nights, in a two bedroom suite. The hotel was phenomenal. The suite was among the nicest we have experienced. Our grandchildren loved the pool. It was very geared to families. The staff was helpful and personable. We loved the convenience of the hotel's proximity to the park.

Surprised our grandchildren with a trip to Disneyland.  As a Disney Vacation club member we were able to book a 2 bedroom villa.  Our villas was wonderful - 2 bedrooms one king size bed and the second 2 queens.  3 baths all with at least a shower, Fully equipped kitchen/living room.   Location was perfect easy walk to Disneyland Park and Adventureland as well as shopping. Pools and hot tops were great and fully staffed with life guards. Many activities within the resort. Love our time here!!!

Summary Heading: Can't beat the convenience or the view
Summary: As you would expect from Disney this is a great, family-friendly luxury hotel.  You can't beat being steps away from your room after a long day in the parks.  The rooms are nice, they have everything you need, and you can't beat the view.  The pool area is great for kids and there are tons of options for restaurants.  Worth if if you can find a discount.

This is hands down the best location for a hotel at Disneyland. That alone may be worth it depending on your situation. The common areas of the hotel are very pretty and our experiences with the staff were all very good. Don't expect nice rooms for the price though. The rooms are surprisingly dated. No easy places to plug in phones. Furniture is showing lots of wear and tear. Definitely time for a renovation of the rooms.

Summary Heading: Out of Convenience, I Would Stay Again
Summary: Upon arriving, we told our room wasn't ready, so we provided our cell number and headed to the "downtown" area to grab some lunch and visit the parks. After about 2 hours, we were called and told our room was ready. Told that our room keys were already programmed, we headed up to the room. The keys did not work and had to walk 3/4 around the hotel to get back to the elevators and down  to the 1st floor. After receiving new cards and entering the room....not only was there about an inch of dust covering the nightstands and dresser, there was a used band-aid stuck to the bathroom floor and hair in the tub and on the floor. Tried calling housekeeping for over 5 minutes; only received a busy signal. I finally called the front desk. 2 very kind and apologetic housekeepers arrived 10

Summary Heading: Location? The best.  Building? Very nice. Rooms? OK. Value? Not so much
Summary: Hands down the best location for the parks. Get drenched on Grizzly Mountain and  pop back to the room for a quick change or just for a break. The building and public spaces are really beautiful. The standard and premium view rooms are small but nicely appointed. This is NOT a value hotel but if location is your #1 priority then pack some sandwiches and stay here.  A few tips:  Drink Tip: Poolside service a plus big boozy Long Islands for $11.  Food Tip: Best breakfast value is at Whitewater snacks - $7 good size american breakfast, fresh fruit and other good options. Park Tip: Get in line 30 min early to enter the park through the hotel park entrance otherwise - don't use it. Shopping Tip: as a hotel guest all your purchases are delivered to the hotel for free - very convenient

Summary Heading: Seriously comfy beds but merely passible front desk service
Summary: I've been a Disneyland premium pass holder for several years and I decided to finally take the plunge and stay at the Grand Californian before moving out of state. While the hotel is gorgeous and the beds are quite possibly the most comfortable I have ever slept in, the front desk check in left much to be desired. On top of a rather large nightly cost for what is only an ok room, as a pass holder, I spend about a grand yearly in admission and to have free parking at Disneyland. I am not spending an additional amount to park at the hotel when it is a very short walk. The front desk worker was very rude about my choice to park in the Mickey and Friends lot and kept telling me I would be towed (news flash - I have parked there overnight on several occasions and have never been

Summary Heading: The Front Desk is a Joke
Summary: My family and I are from Tucson, so we've got about a 7-8 hour drive to make it to Anaheim. We left Tucson around 7:30pm, stopped for dinner, getting us into Anaheim around 2:00a local time, 3:00am Tucson time.  We've stayed at Grand as well as Paradise Pier many times. We come to Disney every year for our anniversary and every year we stay on property. I wasn't expecting to be checked in that early but my husband and I went in anyway to see if we could luck out like we had years prior.  The first front desk attendant we spoke to at 2:00am was named Megan and originally seemed very helpful and perky for 2:00. She did let us know that the systems were down, running for the next day but should be done in the next 30 minutes so if we would like to come back and check to see if a

I totally surprised my husband with this stay. We celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary and wanted an experience our family wouldn't forget.  A week before arriving, they called to confirm reservations and explained our arrival.  We got a 2 bedroom  (reg room attached to 1 bedroom suite) suite located on the 5th floor above the Disney Store looking out to Disneyland, Downtown Disney and Ca Adventure. We had such a huge balcony that we enjoyed. The room was very clean and spacious, the theme was very woodsy very little "Disney" d√©cor, but that's fine.  Lots of closets, and storage areas, everything was comfortable. Cast members were so helpful and friendly. It was extremely convenient to get into the parks early, spend a few hours, go back to the room and rest to return to the

Summary Heading: This is the best hotel if you are visiting Disneyland!
Summary: It is close to California Adventure and Disneyland. It is clean, the beds are very comfortable, it has room service, restaurants and bar on premises, a spa, and pool. We went for Thanksgiving and the hotel and Disneyland is decked out for Christmas.

The Grand California is a beautiful hotel located adjacent to California Adventure and almost as close to Disneyland.  In terms of Disneyland hotels, it is the nicest (Paradise Pier, Disneyland Hotel).  But, it also runs about $600/night, which is at least double, and usually more, of all other non-Disney hotels in Anaheim.  So you ask yourself, why?  Well, the reason is the proximity to the park, the ability to get into the park an hour early, the restaurants with characters (kids love that) and other neat little amenities in the hotel.  In terms of customer service, etc., this hotel fails miserably.    Again, the hotel is very nice, and well taken care of.  At the same time, there are only three elevator bays that service a huge hotel spread over a very large area.  You can

Stayed for a few days over Thanksgiving...paid more than I have ever paid for a personal hotel stay...and got about a motel 6 experience.  We had a room on the club level(level 6).  So you get a pretty small 2 bedroom room, then a concierge on your floor and there is a club a room that has some food and games in it.  For what you pay for the room, it is outrageous how dated and dumpy the decor is.  We werent there for the room but still, we paid top dollar for the Disney experience, and found it wanting.  The concierge was nice, the club room with the food...basically a small continental breakfast, cheese and snacks throughout the day.  Kind of a nice to have but  there really wasnt anything special here that would be worth paying extra for.  The carpet in the room looks 20

Summary Heading: Reasonable hotel but don't expect anything fancy
Summary: We booked a single room with bunk beds for the kids for 4 nights.  There was really nothing special about the room.  It was fairly small and drab but still comfortable.  We were staying in the last room on the end of an unusually long musty corridor.  This meant that while the hotel was technically close to the park gates, it felt like our room was miles away.  We could probably have saved money by staying at a hotel a little further away.  The Pinocchio 'kids club' looked depressing.  I was thinking of having some quality time with my partner so I checked it out.  There was one kid in there playing by himself.  There didn't seem to by anything interesting to do except watch some TV.  A staff member at the Pinocchio workshop explained they are a registered child care facility

Summary Heading: Convenient. Disney has it Figured Out
Summary: It's a large hotel. Spending three days at Disneyland and California Adventure - worth the stay. Having three kids, the hotel allowed us to get into the parks when it opened, do some of the key rides. Able to come back to the hotel for a break in the afternoon and then go back to the park in the evening. I know the kids had fun.

We just got home, so I want to leave these tips while they are fresh in my mind. We had a fantastic one night stay the Tuesday before Thanksgiving. My husband booked the cheapest (crappiest view) room- we are a family of four with 8 & 10 year olds. We arrived early -about 11am.    Tip #1, sweet talk check-in person.  Be extra nice & friendly no matter how harried & grumpy you feel!  I asked our lady if there were any nicer views available- a room where kids could see the fireworks perhaps? She was noncommittal, but nice, and I said anything she could do would be great.  They don't tell you what kind of bed situation you have til you check in. They gave us 2 queens, which was fine. They also offer to text you when the room is ready. I said that I understood that rooms were not

The truth is that its proximity to the park allows this resort to coast in terms of service, room decor, and food. The cost of this hotel demands an elevated experience and that did not happen for us.  Our arrival was fine. We waited a bit in line but it was the weekend before Thanksgiving and we know that is a very busy time. The staff at this point was cordial, but their canned responses and joyless approach hinted at poor upper management. We asked for an upgrade and the reservationist looked for something but then informed us nothing was available.   The main area of the hotel is lovely -- a lot of time and effort went into its Craftsman-inspired design. There was a video playing that kids could sit and watch at check-in (very smart), a huge gingerbread house being made in

This was our second stay at this hotel.  On both occasions, the service was unacceptable.  This time, we booked 2 rooms, with ours being a balcony with a view of the park. The balcony was above a deep fry station and the view was primarily of a large, lovely tree.  The room was dingy.  The service in the lounge was amazingly poor - all the patrons were discussing it.  The food was not good.  Everything was a disappointment.  We purchased our food off the premises whenever possible.  However, this remains an excellent property due to the location and with the grandkids since you can return to your room at will, and put the children in the pool for a break.

Summary Heading: I will NEVER stay anywhere else!!
Summary: I could not adequately express how much I love the Grand Californian! We are big Disney lovers and have stayed on-site twice (thus far). The first time was at Paradise Pier and while I have nothing negative to say about the resort itself, I did not walk away from it feeling utterly heartbroken to leave! The same cannot be said about the Grand Californian however!! From the moment you walk into those giant stain glass doors you are immersed in the beauty of the GC. The staff is very attentive (although that's true of Disney service no matter where you go) and incredibly helpful. We used the valet service which was fantastic because it allowed us to unload our car and have it parked before our room was even ready, leaving us free to enjoy Downtown Disney unencumbered, then return

As life-long Walt Disney World visitors, it finally came the time for us to make a trip out to the Disneyland Resort.   We chose the Grand Californian Hotel due to its location, theme & decor, and easy access to Disney California Adventure (private entrance).  We had a Courtyard View room on the 4th floor, which was just fine.  The monorail track was below us, but it didn't create any noise issues for us.  Plus its really freaking cool!   The hotel lobby is gorgeous and we certainly enjoyed having some drinks by the fireplace after a long travel day.  The staff was exceptional, as expected for a Disney resort.  We chose to park in the General Parking lot, instead of Valet.  This saved some money and it was literally across the street -- not like we used our car the entire time.

There were a few service updates going on during our stay - hot water and fire alarms, but we were kept well informed of this throughout our stay, so not a problem.  Our room was quite a walk from the lobby, but a good size and a nice surprise awaited us to celebrate our anniversary. Disney songs on the piano in the lobby by the open fire were a lovely feature.  We didn't get time to use the pool area but the loungers looked comfy.  The location is great, right in Downtown Disney and adjoining the California Adventure park with its own entrance - the queue was very busy at opening though, I almost wonder if it'd be quicker using the main entrance as there's a bigger team to do bag checks etc, but during the day this entrance was great!  I'd definitely recommend staying here,

Summary Heading: A real treat whether resting or amusing yourself at Disneyland!
Summary: Amazing hotel! Extremely comfortable rooms, real cozy pool chairs and the Disney attention everywhere! Park is just a few steps from hotel. You can book breakfast with characters (my son had it with Minnie, Chip & Dale, Goofy, Daisy and Stitch.

We just made reservations less than 2 weeks ago and just received a letter stating that their pools will be unavailable until later in the spring.  They will also be "enhancing" their rooms, so you may hear construction work...  Nowhere on their website is it mentioned they will be under construction.  And what irritates me the most is that no discount was offered for any of the inconvenience.    No thanks, we will be cancelling our reservation!  Very poor taste Disney!

This hotel is beautiful, and the views of the California Adventure are exciting! The slider windows to our balcony overlooking the park were incredible for blocking out the loudness of the park--fantastic. The cast members are friendly and helpful, and the proximity to the Parks is pretty great. You will be paying out the nose for the experience and convenience, but for a first and likely only experience for one night, it was worthwhile for us.

The Grand Californian hotel is at the top of my list of any I've visited. As you walk through the entrance, you will be reminded of a western national park lodge. There is a soaring lobby and large welcoming fireplace. Be certain to make time to enjoy the scenery from one of the comfortable chairs and recliners. For the fireplace, the best times are early in the morning or late in the evening. Mornings there is coffee available in the Hearthstone Lounge right next door. One evening I dozed off lounging in front of the fire - it was so peaceful and relaxing. If the lobby fireplace area is crowded, try the one outside. It essentially shares the same wall and has a sitting area of its own.   Our 1st floor one bedroom suite included two bathrooms and could sleep five via a pull down

My wife, son and I live only a twenty minute drive away, but we always wanted to stay here for a couple of nights. We chose this hotel over the other Disneyland hotels because it was right in downtown Disney, had its own private entrance to California Adventure, and had a club level.  We book a club level room and drove in and arrived at 9am.  We valet our car at the front and proceeded to a check in desk, where they told us because we had club level rooms, a concierge would escort us to the 6th floor right away.  In a matter of minutes, a concierge greeted us and took us upstairs.     He took us upstairs to the 6th floor and checked us in while in the lounge.  He said our room wasn't ready yet (check in is at 3pm) but we would get a text when it was.  We received a packet

Summary Heading: Poor service, locked out of our expensive room
Summary: Our family left for breakfast.  When we returned at 10:20, none of our 4 keys could open the door to our room.  Trip to the front desk, wait in line, issued new keys and were told that the batteries in our door lock could be dead.  Told us if the new keys didn't work, to call from the elevator lobby or come back down and they would send maintenance.  We asked for a maintenance dispatch immediately, and we would call to cancel if we could get into our room.  It took 30 minutes for a maintenance person to come to our room, and he could not open the door.  He said the door was not out of batteries but was deadbolted from the inside?  How does that even happen? He called security to open the door.  When Jim from security responded, he treated us like it was no big deal.  No

Don't waste your hard-earned money here.  Rooms usually run $500+, and they are tiny, dated, and disappointing.  I've stayed here >10 times over the last few years, and each time, the experience has gotten worse.   This time, there were hairs from the previous guests all over the bathtub and sinks.   Truly disgusting.  The carpet appears grungy.   And the glassware is hazy.   There is no quality control at work here.     The check in is cold and not in anyway reflective of Disney spirit.   The agents are condescending ans idiotic.   They talk to you like you're 5 years old.    Parking is terrible whether you self or valet.   If you self park, you've got to trek across TWO traffic lights or fight the crowds like salmon swimming uphill through Downtown Disney.   If you valet, be

This hotel is amazing. The foyer was certainly grand. The theme of 'California woods' is everywhere even in the smallest details like wallpaper and lights. Stunning. In terms of hotel, excellent service, guest laundry!, bar service at pool, close to everything you need and want to go to. No negatives, highly recommend.

Met my best friend, her husband and their daughter at The Grand Californian which has immediate access with its own entrance into California Adventure Park. You can't beat it! We stayed at a discounted group rate with her daughter's very large dance company and were here to see them perform during the taping of the Disney Christmas parade.  Pluses: Quick moving line and efficient check in, expansive lodge feeling lobby with fireplace, everyone from check in to departure was exceptionally helpful and pleasant, nice pools on property, Disney gifts and convenience item store conveniently located off lobby, several dining options including a nice pool area snack cafe, Disney movies every night at 8:00 for kiddos and the hotel's location, location, location.  Negatives: rate is

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel, but it's not my favorite hotel in Disneyland.
Summary: This was my second visit to Disneyland this year. I stayed at the Disneyland hotel in February and this time I decided to try Grand Californian Hotel & Spa. My favorite characteristic of this hotel is the location. It's location is excellent with it's own entrance to the park and it's extremely easy to get in and out of Disney. In every other aspect of the hotel, I think that the Disneyland hotel is a nice property. The rooms at the Disneyland Hotel seem cleaner, newer, bigger and more luxurious.  I felt the Grand Californian rooms are ready for a facelift. The carpet, furniture, and everything about the actual room felt a bit worn down. At the Disneyland Hotel everything is tied into Disney, even my room service breakfast Huevos Ranchos were in the shape of Mickey Mouse. The

Summary Heading: What a RIP OFF-Beware $100 extra in taxes!!
Summary: I have stayed at the Anaheim Hilton and I can tell you it is a better price and quality! Very disappointed in service and extra taxes they charged. I called and asked their guest services why the extra charges. They said it was written!! No wonder they are a billion dollar company; they know how to get you! I paid $704 for one night! I was supposed to pay $600. That was not worth it! Please consider other neighboring hotel services. The hospitality was not 4 1/2 worth. Trust me I have been in 5 Stars hotels.

Summary Heading: Great location but not worth the price
Summary: We stayed in a 1 bedroom unit -- part of Disney Vacation Club. It was spacious and had2 full bathrooms. There were a few problems, though. The heat/air conditioning temperature control had too wide a range and it was either very cold or way too hot -- all without touching the controls. The bigger issue was the water. We received advanced notice that there would be no water from 11:45 PM Monday to 5 AM Tuesday. We checked and this appears to be a regular occurrence. None of the staff seem apologetic or concerned at all. When I mentioned that I had an early morning flight and wouldn't be able to wash up or shower I was told to just shower the evening before.

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel in great location for California Adventure, Downtown Disney, and Disneyland
Summary: If you can afford this lovely Craftsman California style hotel I encourage you to stay here.  The open lobby is fantastic with a fireplace nook and pianist playing in the late afternoon and evening.  The rooms are spacious with nice amenities and comfortable beds.  You can walk past the pool and use an entrance to California Adventure Park or exit past the conference center to get to Downtown Disney with many shops and restaurants. It's a short walk from there to Disneyland.  There is of course a fee for parking. Dining is expensive unless you get a snack/meal at the White Water Snacks cafe near the pool.  Napa Rose is lovely for fine dining. Staff is very pleasant and helpful throughout the resort.  This is a very expensive hotel  but if you can manage to splurge I highly

Summary Heading: Great location.  Not so great price or service
Summary: The location could not be better.    The rooms are a step up from the Disneyland Hotel and certainly better than Paradise Island.   But at $600-plus a night they should be.    And at that price you get a "view" of some trees and other buildings.   If you are going to stay there make sure your reservation details (1) the bed configuration, and (2) your view.   The staff is very Disneyland-like-pleasant but that only means they can say "no" six different ways while maintaining a smile.

Just returned from our trip.  The check-in process started promising, I was ask if I wanted bunk beds and the kids were delighted.  Well from then on went down hill.  Went to room after day at the park, bathroom was dirty, no luggage in room (although promise made).  Had to call twice to housekeeping to get service.  All of were very tired and just wanted a shower and bed but had to wait for 45 minutes for luggage and additional time for bathroom to be cleaned.  When I say it was dirty I mean DIRTY!!  Housekeeping had to clean it all.  So disappointing after spending time last year at Disney World was hoping for a great experience.  This hotel was not it.  Car valet is a joke and rude all for $28.00!  I would not stay here again.

We actually got a poor first impression. Disney is the best in the world on service but still they managed to loose our extended stay. They wanted us to pay extra to make the extension. They also managed to not deliver a baby crib that we ordered. And on top of that we didnt det any beddings to go with it. Impreasive facilities though. Free wifi. Expensive breakfast. Nice rooms. All in all, okey.

Summary Heading: HORRIBLE service- thought I was in candid camera.
Summary: If you really MUST stay at a Disney hotel, then choose another. I have not been to other Disney hotels in Anaheim but if I thought their service is half as TERRIBLE as this, I'd recommend you should just stay outside of Disney.  Price is not worth the quality, and although many Disney hotels have high prices for their quality, this is (negatively) beyond anything I would have thought of.  A day that the park closed at midnight, I started calling room service at 11:50pm and waited like 50 MINUTES for them to PICK UP the phone.  When they finally did answer the phone, they said anything I order will take 60 MINUTES because they "only have one cook" so I ask if they could at least bring me bread and butter (which they don't need to cook) because my 3 kids are starving, and their

Summary Heading: Disney Vacation Club room was convenient and clean!
Summary: We stayed at the Grand Californian using our DVC points.  We had a 1 bedroom on the 3rd floor overlooking the California Adventure park.  The room was one of the nicest we have ever had at a DVC resort (possibly recently renovated).  The location was great and conveniently located to both Disneyland and the California Adventure park.  (The hotel even has its own entrance into California Adventure.)  There is also an entrance into Downtown Disney which has a plentiful supply of restaurants and shops.

Summary Heading: Brunch With Friends At Story Teller Restaurant Disney Grand California Hotel
Summary: Celebrated reunion and anniversary with friends at Story Teller Restaurant at Disneyland's Grand California Hotel. Spent the next 10 hours taking in both parks as well. Perfect service and food was excellent ! Will return soon.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay at Disneyland
Summary: Such a convenient location for enjoying the park, easy access, lovely rooms,, comfortable and amazing! Lived staying here, but the cost is astronomical üòúnice pools, thick towels, good pillows and beds.

The hotel is awesome, I'm thinking a little over priced . The one thing I will say, the beds are horrible. The 2nd night I ended up sleeping on the flr instead of bed, they ran out of cots. The bar and lobby are awesome. Pool and hot tub closed a bit early at 9pm. Lots are things to see and do, VERY CONVIENENT park entrance from hotel. Might stay again if they could give me some better beds. Staying at a Disney hotel while Visiting park is a must.

Perhaps I was influenced by the terrible stay I'd just experienced in Vegas, but this hotel really did impress me. It wasn't what you would call luxurious; but everything was just as it should be. When I checked in, I noticed immediately the professionalism and the friendliness of the staff. As at all Disney entities, they referred to the staff as "cast members". No matter how you refer to them, every one I came into contact with was friendly, asked how everything was, offered directions, or was just overall very helpful. The room was very clean and comfortable. It was equipped with a refrigerator and a coffee maker, which are always appreciated when I'm traveling. I can't comment on the restaurants, as I wasn't able to utilize them during my brief stay. I did, however, order

We stayed in a three-bedroom villa because we belong to the Disney Club, and  the villa was fantastic.  We had three large bedrooms in a huge condo, and everything was in excellent condition. The two-story windows in the living area gave a perfect view of the fireworks each night. Because we could easily walk to both parks and Downtown Disney from the Grand Californian, the location was exceptionally convenient. And, as you might expect, the Disney employees were unfailingly friendly and helpful. Two of my grandchildren asked that we move there permanently.

It was awesome. The Halloween spirit and decorations where off the charts in the whole park. Can't wait till next year so we can go again. The rides all had decorations too. The hotel was decorated and clean. Great friendly service from door to door

We've stayed at the Grand Californian twice, the Disneyland Hotel once and visited Paradise Pier and this is by far our favourite.  It's clean and well maintained, the staff are very good and they have more services & amenities than we could ever need.  The rooms are very average size but more than exceeded our expectations.  The restaurants are good (Napa Rose is the best around), the cafe/grab n' go are very good and access to California Adventure is unbelievable.   Downtown Disney is only a few steps away along with all of their shops & restaurants.  It's expensive but worth it. The extra hour in the morning (for all Disney hotel guests) is easily worth the additional spend.    Only critical feedback would be the lack of signage.  It's hard to know where to go and how to get

Summary Heading: The best place to stay at Disneyland
Summary: If you are willing to splurge or if you are a Disney Vacation Club Member (like us), this is the place to stay. Beautiful hotel, beautiful spacious room (studio villa) with kitchenette. With the proximity to the parks, it is easy to take a pool or nap break. Private entry to California adventure is also convenient to get to Disneyland if you have a park hopper ticket. Excellent helpful staff. A perfect vacation. Thank you Disney!

It's a shame you can't sleep in the lobby:). Overall the hotel is really nice and the staff is great.  Unfortunately, the room itself is no better than budget accommodations.  The furniture has some damage and there are wires hanging everywhere.  The TV doesn't even swivel and the shower head is damaged.  These may seem like petty things, but when considering the price of the room, there should be a lot more attention to detail.  Disneyland Hotel is a better place to stay for the money.

Our stay at the Grand California was great but disappointing. We could not get any Wifi even though the front desk kept trying to inform us different ways to connect. It's 2016 and a 4 or 5 star Hotel should have impeccable Wifi coverage/service. Every day, for 4 days, we requested 3 coffee mugs, we had 3 people in our room, but only 2 were stocked. And at check-out, inspected my bill and was charged for 4 days of Valet service even though I didn't have a car. They stated a car was parked in my room number so needed to pay, issue was finally resolved. Please check your bill! With higher costs come higher expectations which were not meet at the Grand California. The staff was great but will stay at Paradise Pier, bigger rooms, or across the street next time. Steve

The reason for my review being average is that we checked-in on a Sunday.  We got their early so we dropped our bags and waited for a text to say which room we could check into.  I never got a text.  I had to come back to hotel and then was asked to get in-line again in order to find out my room number.  Then they allowed me to call guest services from the phone in the hotel in order to not wait in line.  They had my room number and I could then go to my room.  Then it took another 30-40 minutes for bags to arrive in the room.  This is frustrating given my expectations with the cost of this hotel and my service expectations were far below what we received on day 1.  After day 1 everything was fine but I still think this is below expectation of a high end resort.

My sister and had a great trip to Disneyland and California land.  We stayed at the Grand and it was very nice.  Clean, employees very helpful, nice rooms and so close to California Land which we both agree we enjoyed more than Disneyland.   We spent one day at the pool and rented a Cabana which  was so fabulous!   Edward , our cabana boy was so fun and right on it when we wanted something.   The Grand is lovely, but I decided it was way to big for me!  I was constantly lost and finding the right wing where my room was a challenge.  But, I do get lost easily!!!!! Go, you will enjoy!

We stayed at Disneys Grand California Hotel and spa. It was beautiful. The concierge service was spectacular. The view from our room was amazing. We were able to see the fireworks at Disneyland as well as The world of color presentation from comfortable chairs on our own balcony. It was a wonderful experience. The hotel itself was clean and the staff was very friendly. If you like to be pampered this is the place to visit. I am looking forward to staying here again.

This hotel tat Disneyland in California was absolutely amazing we spent three days here with my two boys ages 1 and 3 and you can't enter the park right from your hotel which was very convenient the rooms are spacious and very nice call them there was a old water bottle in the fridge and some garbage under the bed but otherwise the room was great and that's very comfortable I like how they had two sinks and plenty of counter space and they ours had a balcony and from what I saw all rooms have a balcony and at breakfast Disneyland characters come up here table and interact with the children,, we did have a chance to go to the pool and the pool is all so incredible it has a somewhat larger slide and then a very small slide for little kids and a kiddie pool and adult pool all

Summary Heading: Great location and that's pretty much it
Summary: The resort is huge, rooms are old and expensive. Breakfast was fool and reservation was needed even for the guests.  You can access park (Disney California Adventure) from a separate entrance from the hotel before the park is open for all the guests (1 hour) . Though there was a huge line to enter for an early admission

Summary Heading: First Visit Had Some Issues. Second Visit Was Amazing!
Summary: We usually stay at the Disneyland Hotel, but last year for our anniversary we decided to splurge and stay at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel. It was wonderful, with the exception of a few setbacks....the shower leaked a pool of water on the bathroom floor, and our room was under one of their club rooms for guests on their concierge level: the club room set-up started at 6:00 AM and then the break-down/cleaning crew started at 11:00 PM - and it was right over head and LOUD, so we were woken up early with chairs being clanked and screeching across the floors, and then kept awake late at night by the cleaning/break-down of the club room....not pleasant. Sorry, I don't remember the room number, but it's a couple of floors up over looking the lobby and the room door is directly

This hotel is too big.  I was unlucky enough to have a room far away from the elevators.  Like really far...  The floors are too big, it took forever to get to and from my room.  It's not up to the standards you'd expect from Disney.  It's like any other hotel that is trying to look like a Colorado Ski Lodge.  The self park is clear across the street.  The internet was super slow too.  You're way better off at the Disneyland Hotel if you want to stay on property.  The rooms are bigger, the floors are reasonably sized, the internet is faster, and it is what you'd expect from Disney, with mouse shaped faucets, and cool Disney pictures and headboards and stuff.

Beautiful hotel. My daughter was obsessed with the pool and the fact that it looked like Mickey. I would suggest to the park to bring out portable heaters in the evening for parents who are just hanging out so their children can swim. As I was exhausted from the parks I didn't want to swim but I wanted my daughter to still have fun so we went to the pool and I was freezing. I must have had 10 towels over me. Yes it is nice in California but when the sun goes down in the fall it is cold. They have a great activity schedule and they have a direct entrance to California Adventure which is very nice.

This property is outstanding.  The rooms are spacious, the beds are comfortable, and the hotel is beautiful.  The best part is that you ave access to California Adventure directly from the hotel.  The pool area is terrific, and there are good restaurants within the hotel.  the staff is friendly.

After arriving in our room (#3164), we noticed we could not connect to the internet via phones, iPad, or laptop.  Clearly, something was wrong. We immediately phoned the front desk and their suggestion was to restart the device.  In this day and age with all of the Wi-Fi networks out there, I think I know how to connect . This did not work and I asked them to send an IT person up as we were headed into the park.  Returned from the park around 4pm.  There was no indication that anyone had been there.  I called front desk again and reiterated the problem.  They said they would sent IT up.  Left hotel for dinner and returned around 9:30pm.  Again, no internet.  Called front desk and they stated that 'internet is not guaranteed at any of the Disneyland hotels".  What?  It's 2016!

We had two teens and two adults and were very comfortable in a room that had a daybed in addition to two queens. The bathroom setup is as family friendly as can be with the sink outside the bath and toilet room. Hotel rooms are outdated and tired but all was forgiven as it was very clean and of Disney standard. For the price I would have liked a nicer room but we paid for convenience. The lobby was lovely but crowded with conference people. Loved how they put out baskets of fresh towels and sheets every day (I assume) for anyone to grab as needed. Another family friendly detail is a rack of hooks for wet towels. Nice small porch off room - fresh air. With 4 adults in a room it's nice to know where your towel is! Overall good stay and will change consider staying again.

Summary Heading: Stayed here twice and they are pretty consistent with their terrible service!
Summary: Extremely rude staff.  Very bad service.  I have stayed at this hotel twice and both times the service was horrible.  I will NEVER stay here again.  It almost seems like the check-in desk goes out of their way to make sure you DON‚ÄôT get anything you booked or requested.  I was so upset after my check-in experience that I was almost in tears.
