I had booked my room more than 6 months in advance and called them and emailed them before my arrival to request 2 queen beds (because we have 2 kids) and at check in they are like too bad it‚Äôs based on availability, you get what you get, and you get a bunk-bed room.  Which means all 4 of us have to sleep on a queen bed.   You would think when you pay $600 per night for a room, they would be a little nicer.

My wife and I had a year filled with a lot of stress dues to a recent move, new job, new area, death of a family member, etc... so we decided to go to Disneyland for a loooong overdue vacation filled with fun.  Happiest place on earth right?!  So we bought season tickets and splurged by booking a reservation at the Disney California Grand Hotel.  My wife had always wanted to stay there and it looks beautiful in the online pictures.  On Labor Day this year we were off on our journey to happiness and fun!  However, when we got into our room we definitely felt let down.  The room STUNK like sewer drain and some sort of food.  The fact the pizza boxes and other trash were left outside my door from the previous guest concerned me upon entering the room and now my suspicions were

Summary Heading: Location, location, location, but a bit dated
Summary: With an entrance to CA Adventure located in the hotel, this is a great location.  The lobby is beautiful, the staff is just wonderful.  From a sticky door handle, to black hairs (not mine) the the tub, I expected a bit more for a $500/night room in the way of cleanliness and size.

Summary Heading: It was all about the kids, sensastional stay, some awesome memiors
Summary: We booked at short notice so room availability was limited  However in saying that we managed to book Downtown Disney View room for 5, which I thought at first would be tight with 3 kids but it was comfortable  The room was made up of one queen bed with set of bunks and pull out bed, dining table which was too small for party of five, storage for bags etc was good, & bathroom area lots of space and clean  The great thing about this resort is the size, don't notice all the people, pool & play area for the kids, dining   Added bonus was the easy access to the park, roll out of bed, down the lift and around the corner and you are in the park, convenience was awesome to go back for lunch, change or rest within walking distance and the early start you get before the crowds arrive

Stayed in a 2 bedroom suite with family and the suite was awesome!  When we walked in, the suite was very clean.  It came with a living room, full equipped kitchen, 1 master bedroom and 1 room.  We had a beautiful view of Disney California Adventure.    The lobby is really nice.  It was Halloween time so there was some Halloween decorations and some singing performances.  They have some stores and a bar/restaurant.  We bought some alcoholic drinks there and it was a bit pricey but delicious.  They provide some bar snack mix for free which was nice.    This hotel has its own entry to Disney California Adventure which is just a few steps away from your hotel room.  If you stay at a Disney resort, you can also enter the park an hour before it opens to public which we took advantage

I love this place. The guest services were helpful to get me adjoining rooms with my family and they have express checkout. The fireplaces are a nice touch and the hotel wings are all connected. Had great views of California Adventure park and could hear the world of color show music. Rooms are quiet, beds are quite soft and dented.

This was our third stay at the Grand Californian and I still have no complaints. Perfect hotel for quick access to California Adventure Park since it has its own park entrance. The pool area is really nice. Staff service was excellent. Couple different places to eat at the hotel. My favorite place out of all three Disneyland Resorts. Also had a really cool gingerbread house as par of its Christmas decorations.

Summary Heading: Worth the splurge for a special occasion!
Summary: My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary and it was a truly amazing stay-cation! The entire hotel is beautiful, with the lobby being the crowning jewel.  Bonus Tip: Try to grab a rocking chair by the large fireplace in the lobby! If your timing is good you'll be treated to music from a live pianist just behind you :)

We recently stayed for 3 nights and found the hotel to be everything we thought it would be. Smallish rooms with some Disney touches but really you could have been anywhere. We were tucked into a corner and even though it was a Premium View room we could only see a tiny bit of the pool. Anyway - we really only stayed in the room to sleep. We enjoyed some time at the pool and basically worked the location for all it was worth. Access to Downtown Disney, Character Buffets, Restaurants and the 2 Parks were our number 1 priorities and this hotel delivered on that. We could use our own entrance to the California Adventure and even snuck back for a swim at 4pm one day just to cool off. Early entry meant we raced to Radiator Springs at 7am and rode it 3 times before 740am.  Our

My family of four stayed at Disney's Grand California for four nights in September.  We LOVED the close proximity of everything to this hotel.  With its own entrance to California Adventure, it truly is in the heart of it all.    The Hotel  Our room was clean, the staff was friendly and we loved the huge open lobby.  There were so many activities for kids and the pool area was their favorite.    The Restaurants  We dined at both the White Water Snacks (quick breakfast) and the Napa Rose.  The White Water Snacks was quick service food but the kids enjoyed Mickey Waffles and my husband and I had fruit and oatmeal.  The Napa Rose was our last dinner there and it was delicious!  It was very expensive but the food was wonderful.  Mandala Spa  I had a pedicure in the spa and they were

The only reason to stay at the Grand Californian is that you have no budget for your trip and/or you want to be in the best location possible.    Location The hotel is located right in the heart of Downtown Disney and is the closest to both theme parks.  That made it very convenient for us because we were traveling with two kids (4 and 2).  The hotel entrance to DCA from the hotel isn't that convenient as lines get very, very long for park entrance (like 20-30 minutes) at the start of the day.  We wound up having to go over to the main entrance to get in.  Service The service wasn't anywhere near appropriate for a hotel that runs $500 a night.  The hotel is HUGE and they clearly don't have the staff to provide proper guest attention.  The people are all nice, but wait times for

I've been here five hours in a five day trip and it is obvious the magic is gone.  This from a HUGE former fan.  Surly front desk and bell staff.  The elimination of amenities and areas that I loved.  Will not be back.

We supposedly went at a quiet time but Disney was unbelievably busy.  I mean the busiest Easter Show in Australia. If someone in our group moved ahead in 10 seconds you could lose them as the crowd advanced ahead and left no prisoners. I enjoyed California land better as there was less people and more facilities. Great experience but I wouldn't return.

My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights and we loved the hotel! The location is awesome and every employee we encountered was courteous and kind. The ambiance is not really our favorite but Disney did a great job with details like rocking chairs by the fireplace in the lobby, helpful staff who gave many tips and clean, comfortable rooms. The price is a little high for the size and ammenities but it's so convenient to be able to walk to the parks every day! We would definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Amazing hotel and backdoor to Disney California adventure.
Summary: I always wish I had extra days at a resort like this one since the ambience of the place is so fantastic. We had two short days and spent them in them parks or in our lovely one bedroom villa. I would have liked another half day to hang at pool or enjoy the lobby or easy access to downtown Disney. This is the hotel to be at though if you can. Early hour park access and a backdoor to Disney's California adventure.  Love it!!

We took a family vacation to Disneyland.  We stayed at the Grand Californian because we desired convenient access to both parks.  The Room was very average, the pool area was overcrowded which made it difficult to find lounge chairs.  The dining options were limited and priced as you might expect, high.  The Hotel itself was under construction (as was much of the park).  During our stay, the hotel was hosting a large group who "took over" the lobby and pool area.

I was really not looking forward to going to this hotel, since we had such an awful experience a couple of month ago at the Saratoga Springs in Orlando, but I am so glad that I was wrong.  My 11 day stay at the Grand California made me a believer in Disney once again.  The best part of this hotel is that you have both parks and Dowtonw Disney at your door steps, something you wont find in any of the Orlando resorts.  The rooms, beds, bathrooms, etc... is everything you expect to find in a Disney Resort, the managers at Saratoga Springs should come to this hotel to learn what a Disney experience is.

We stayed 2 nights at Disney's Grand Californian. We got there early in the day, check in went smoothly and our room was ready. The room itself is really not anything special, but the lobby and grounds are beautiful. It is nice to stay at a Disney hotel so you get in early to the parks and you really can't beat the location!

If you can spring for this hotel, do it.  It took me a long time to come to terms with how much I would be spending on this trip, but it was truly worth every penny.  Yes, the biggest draw is absolutely the convenience of the proximity to the park. However this hotel makes it entirety more than just that. If this is a huge vacation (which let's face it, all Disney vacations end up being huge) then being able to walk mere minutes from your room to the parks is perfect. We were able to leave Disneyland in the heat of the day to go for a swim and eat a snack in our room and we were only out of the park for a couple hours before returning. I feel that if we had to take a shuttle, or the tram plus walking however many blocks to and then from the hotel again we would not have taken

It may be blasphemy to say, and I do run the risk of having two rough looking mice come beat me up in the middle of the night, but Disney's Grand Californian Hotel is overpriced and underwhelming.   Take your average Holiday Inn, add a lot of plastic Craftsman's style logs, timber and metal (again, all plastic - look closely the next time you are in a lobby), put a few Disney decorations in the very small rooms, toss in a few mouse shaped soaps and you have the "Grand" California Hotel.  Did I mention the small rooms; you'll feel like you are in a sleeper on Amtrak.  They do have good room service, but at $20 or more per person per meal and a very hefty service fee, the food should be delivered by Mickey himself (which, we were disappointed to discover, it's not).  $300 to $400

We've always wanted to stay here, and so we booked our room. However, what they didn't tell us is that the hotel is under construction, and with a toddler who naps twice a day, that would be an issue. The Disney website noted another hotel on property that was under construction, so I assumed that they would do the same for the Grand Californian if that was the case‚Ä¶ they didn't. Luckily they moved us after a day of torment for my toddler. The hotel itself is amazing. The rooms are very nice and clean, along with the rest of the property. I was worried with other reviews that the rooms would be dated, but they weren't; they were very nice. Character dining was so much fun! The characters really made every effort to amuse my toddler, even though he was a little shy. The staff was

A stay at the Grand Californian for me is a rare event and I was really looking forward to it.  It was going to be 3 days of total Disney and I found I never left the property during that time. I was able to get a discounted rate because of being part of a convention and that is the main reason for my stay.    My room was on the 3rd floor facing the Disneyland Hotel across the street.  There was balcony but I never really used it.  There was 2 chairs and a table.  Perhaps if one ordered room service they might enjoy their meal out there.    This is a top of the line hotel.  There is bell service to take care of your luggage.  For most nights I used the self parking which is $17 a night and a bit of a walk across the street from the hotel.  The last night I used valet and that is

The location is excellent, and is one of the reasons that this hotel is so pricey.  It was worth it for us, with two younger children, to be so close and travel back and forth to the parks.  The staff we encountered were all very friendly.  Daniel was very friendly at check in and helped find us a room with bunk beds.  Our kids loved them! (Although they would be rather small for a teen or adult). Our experience with house keeping was good.  They had always cleaned our room by mid afternoon when we returned for the kids to nap.  (However, we did see them cleaning rooms until late in the evening as others have noted in their reviews.)  We enjoyed a pool view from the 2nd floor.  The room was quiet and a great location from elevators or the staircase to the lobby.  The private

This was my first time staying here; stayed 4 nights Aug. 3rd to 7th. I always stay at the Disneyland Hotel, but this trip my family of 5 decided to try the Grand, and we all really loved it! I'm torn between which hotel I like better, so this review will be kind of a comparison.  - At the Grand, all rooms have balconies. It's so nice to be able to open the door and get fresh air and to sit outside and enjoy the view. Our room was on the 4th floor with an amazing view of Grizzly Peak, Tower of Terror and Carthay Circle. I could not get enough of our view! I called the hotel several times leading up to our arrival to confirm my request for that view. They won't guarantee anything, so I was so lucky that during the busy summer months, I got exactly what I requested. Plus we

Summary Heading: Wow. The customer just doesn't matter
Summary: My husband and I recently adopted a baby. Then all three of our birthdays just happened.  I called to make a reservation. Said I wanted a nice room. I wanted quiet so our 2 year old could nap. That's NOT going to happen. This celebratory trip to celebrate birthdays and the adoption was special. I've stayed here before. But we aren't happy. I'm sad because I loved Disneyland. But they just don't really care. I paid for the most premium room before you get to club level. I deeply regret not looking into that. I thought my approximately $690 a night room would be awesome. No naps for her. Not sure we will stay the entire time and I'm positive I'm not coming back. I called and Matt told me the girl that checked me in told me I get a pool view. She didn't. Verified by my husband.

So, Disney is wonderful, we've been to Disney World, Disneyland, and the cruise so its hard to go wrong with anything Disney, but there are better hotels in the area. We stayed at the Residence Inn Marriott the 1st day of our trip due to the price of the Disney Grand Hotel being $650 /night. We checked in to the Grand Californian on a Sunday and out on a Wednesday for $350 / night. The Marriott was $180 / night with $5.50 Uber ride will drop you off at the front door of the Grand Californian. So when you do the math I recommend staying offsite and using Uber. There is no doubt it is a beautiful place, but the rooms were dated and not Disney quality. The hotel is grand and beautiful, but they need to invest in updating the rooms. If you stay at the Grand Californian or at another

The grounds were beautiful as was the loby. The rooms were  just an average hotel/motel room. The room and bathroom were small and the decor was dated. For $375 a night I expected more. The housekeeping was exceptional and the three pools were very nice. It was also super convenient to enter downtown Disney and California Adventure from the property, and it is obvious that you pay a premium for this convenience.It was super annoying to pay $18 a day for parking as registered guests, I suppose that's the norm for major markets... but stll. I don't know if the price is worth convenience, not sure if we will stay there again.

We stayed at the Grand Californian last week for our sons first trip to Disneyland. He is 20 months old. We loved it and didn't have any issues. The location is what you pay for and we felt it was justified. We went back to the room for an afternoon nap and it made getting into California Adventure Land so easy. Love the perks like the hour early in the park too.   We were fortunate enough to be able to check in early (on a Monday) (and check in was so special since it was his first time, thanks Disney cast members) so we spent the day at the pool which we all loved. Drink prices were not bad at all and it was very tasty. Loved that life vests are provided.   Our room was wonderful. I got the requested room with the bunk bed and the little pull out section on the bottom was

Summary Heading: Perfect place to Stay at Disneyland!!
Summary: My family and I stayed at The Grand second week in September. Check in was fairly quick there was a big line but Disney cast members knock it out quickly. Cast members were amazing went above and beyond and help us with several questions .My husband is retired 20 year Navy so Disney gives us 40% off the Hotels Thank you Disney!! You also can by your military tickets at the hotel front desk. I have stayed at all 3 Disneyland Hotels and have to say I love The Grand ! the Lobby is amazing I loved walking through every day to hear the Piano playing, So may reviews said the walls were thin I never herd a soul in our room. It was very quiet the beds were so comfortable the size of the room  was fine we had 3 adults and 2 small kids. The d√©cor is fine it does not have a Disney

Summary Heading: Pretty hotel, nice staff but a little disorganised and our stuff went missing....
Summary: A very charming hotel, with staff that are eager to please. But after a mix up with our room booking and then a subsequent change of rooms our son's car booster seat was lost - last seen on the bell service's trolley. We enquired five times with various staff at reception, concierge and bell services desks, and, while they tried hard none could shed any light on what happened to it.  Staff were willing to send it to our home address -  if it was ever recovered - but the reason we took the booster seat on holidays was so we could use it on holidays...

I rented two rooms for my daughter and her family and my husband and I. They were wonderful!  Clean, bathtub and separate shower.  Very Quiet, however buck bed rails squeak (put a piece of paper in the corner, it helps).      Water park was a bunch of fun.  Very close to Disney and Cal Adventure. Breakfast in the morning was good.  I had the oatmeal, and there was a good amount.  Forgot my phone charger, and they found it and mailed it back to me.  Great place. I would highly recommend.

This place was perfect for us! It's the closest resort to Disneyland, and it was worth it! We booked a one bedroom suite, and I was surprised at how large it was and it had two full bathrooms. With three teens, it was perfect! They were even willing to bring up an air mattress for us (so each kid had their own bed). The only thing I would suggest to Disney is to upgrade the pull out couch sleeper. It was just okay for my 14 year old, and probably okay for most kids, but it would have been very uncomfortable for an adult. The food at the resort is pricey, but just go expecting that. We ate most of our meals at the White Water Snacks. We ordered pizzas, burgers, sandwiches and it wasn't as pricey as some of the other restaurants or room service. Disney main street is just right

I've stayed several times at the DGC but this was the first time staying on the 6th floor with access to the Craftsman Club - what a benefit!  They open the club at 6am and close at 10pm.  All day long they have light food (sometimes hot food!) and drinks.  Great way to load up before heading out to the park.  We really enjoyed breakfast every day (great savings) and would stop in throughout the day for light snacks and drinks.  They encourage you to take food and drink back to your room so enjoy!!!

Summary Heading: Very Ordinary. Disney Hotel not the happiest place on earth.
Summary: It is obvious that Disney hold the monopoly for the area. Only stayed there 2 nights and for the money paid it is very ordinary. Very expensive food and drinks. Staff do not offer any service. Rooms are very dated and smell 'musty'. One good thing is that the hotel is well located (close to both parks), apart from that I would recommend people stay elsewhere.

Summary Heading: Pricey, but worth it for the location
Summary: We went to Disneyland this summer for my son's first trip to any Disney park. It was also my wife's and my first time to visit Disneyland in over 30 years, so we decided to splurge and stay at the Disney Grand Californian. While a lot of reviewers were disappointed at their stay, we were quite pleased with our entire experience. When we drove up, we were immediately greeted by one of the Disney staff, who took our luggage, took care of our rental, and guided us to the front desk for check in. In the lobby, they have a television running classic Mickey Mouse cartoons for the kids to watch while the parents do the paperwork. They even have kid sized furniture. We were fortunate enough to get rooms on the inner courtyard, so my son was able to see which color monorail trains were

I have stayed at both the Disneyland Hotel and Grand Californian at the concierge level at least 15 times over the last 20 years.  I will no longer pay the premium to stay on the concierge level.  It is still very convenient to just pop into the lounge and get a snack or drink but the quality of the wine (terrible) and service (we had to flag down a server who always seem to be talking to each other to get any service) and food has gone down hill.  Do bring a refillable water bottle to fill up from the carafes of cold water to take with you.  No more bottled water.  I will still probably stay at the hotel because it is beautiful and very convenient.  One example of the drop off in service....At checkin we inquired about the World of Color Dessert Party and were told to call

This hotel has a lot going for it. It's arts and crafts theme is beautiful. It's location to DCA and DL cannot be beat. The direct access to DCA allowed for easy access, especially coming back to the hotel. The villas are lovely (my woodworker spouse particularly appreciated the solid oak furniture with dovetail joints). The guest relations desk has trivia that you can do on certain attractions at DL to "win" a cute prize. The pre-dawn power walk in DCA was quite fun.   But for the price that we paid for this hotel we expected quite a bit more. Like a room that was available when we were told it was going to be. Like a shower that actually gets hot (it was disturbing to have large "Watch Your Water" notices next to the shower that you're letting running for seven minutes to get

Summary Heading: Great location and hotel, but not perfect
Summary: On our first trip to Disneyland, we had the luxury of staying at the Grand Californian hotel. This is a beautiful hotel and the location is amazing. We had our own private entrance into California Adventure theme park and were a slight walk away from Disneyland's front gate. It was a nice pleasure to be able to walk through Downtown Disney to get there. If you have Early Morning Magic as part of your package, definitely go the Starbucks inside Disneyland on Main St. instead of DD on the way there. Way less busy and much faster as not everyone in the park yet, but everyone is in DD.   The reason I did not give it 5 Stars was the staff. The bell hop service was great and should be commended for being so courteous. The room and the staff were a little more iffy. Our room had a

We loved our stay at the Grand Californian! The hotel is very close to the parks, even having its own entrance into California Adventure!   We were fortunate enough to stay on club level. Kim met us at the front for express check-in. She showed us to our rooms and checked us in and filled us in on everything, answers all our questions and even helped plan a special surprise for my parents! This check in was very convenient, no waiting and personalized!   The club lounge was very nice, breakfast, lite lunch, lite appetizers and desert with spirits! Staff was very nice and constantly working! All the food was great! The only complaint I had was that the food was the same every day. I think they should rotate every other day with different foods, like at the WDW resorts clubs. Just

Chose this hotel after much research. Elected to stay here because it's part of Disney and easy access and if that's your priority then spend a little extra and stay here. We had Club floor which was a good option as you have breakfast and snacks available all day. Check in unfortunately was a real hassle and I felt they tried to get us to take a room with construction outside. Once I declined the room I actually requested became available. The food is Disney average but overall I'd still stay here if I came again.

Summary Heading: Location, Location, Location!  (especially if you have a little one)
Summary: for the past 3 years, I've been taking my little ones to Disneyland each year, each time we stayed at Grand California for 5 days and I've always done concierge.   When i first started planning my trip, I picked the Grand California for it's location, I love that it's inside CA and I can easily take my kids back for a nap and back to park again.  and I was right, it was super nice to be able to take them back for naps without walking a long distance or deal with trams or cars/parking.   We have always booked concierge as it provided a space for the kids to hang out and adults to relax in the afternoon while the kids nap (dont worry, there is always an adult in the room with them when they napped).  the concierge lounge services finger snacks all day as well as coffee, tea,

Summary Heading: Go for the location, not the amenities
Summary: We used DVC points to stay in a two-bedroom villa and it was appointed as other similar accommodations in Disney properties--a large open kitchen, eating, living area flanked by two bedrooms, each with their own bath. We arrived at 3 pm, as noted on our reservation, but our room was not ready until 5. With the lobby totally packed and not even a single chair to sit in, we stored our luggage with the bellman and headed straight to Disneyland. The front desk texted us when the room was ready. The ability to just walk into either DCA through the back gate or to walk through Downtown Disney to the main entrances of both parks was the main advantage to this hotel. Another is that, as an on-site property, the Grand Californian affords customers Early Morning Hours at both DL and DCA.

As others have mentioned- the location is great. Mainly because you can come and go to Disneyland throughout the day- & because you get an hour of access to the park before it opens to the public. These are two huge benefits, as it avoids lengthy wait times that can be up to an hour for the popular rides and in hot weather you can hang out by the pool in the middle of the day and spend the morning (it's a 7am start) & evening at the park. We also watched the fireworks from our room balcony which was great. For the price you pay though, the rooms are very substandard. I'm surprised breakfast isn't included given the price (& we have had breakfast included at all hotels in the US when paying much much less), there's a DVD player but no DVDs available, no toaster, kettle or

My husband and I stayed two nights in a standard room overlooking the Downtown Disney area.  We checked in around 10:30 am and the front desk helped us get a room quickly, along with providing our park tickets from a vacation package he won from our local radio station in Seattle.  This hotel is HUGE and kind of confusing to navigate when you first arrive, but there are plenty of kind Cast Members to help.  The room was kind of loud from the music and people on the street, but otherwise comfortable and clean.  Like another reviewer mentioned, the secret entrance to California Adventure gets busy, and people cue up an hour early to enter the park, which we found on a magic morning.  Get in line early, or find yourself stuck in the security line for another hour.  My only

Yes, it was pricey.  But you can't beat the location.  We didn't have to worry about parking at the parks every day - we walked everywhere the entire trip.  We even came back to the hotel for a nap during the afternoon every day.  I wish there were more dining options right IN the hotel, but Downtown Disney offers enough that it's really not a big deal.  The service was what you expect from Disney - attentive, but not bothersome.  Bottom line:  Very expensive, but so convenient.  We'd do it again.

The hotel is just beautiful.  Arts and crafts details are throughout, in lamps, carpet, wallpaper, door hardware, etc.  Bell services and Guest services were helpful and accommodating.  The entrance from the hotel into California Adventure is very handy when you need to pick up something from your room during the day, although some mornings, the Cast Member at that entrance said it would be faster to enter through the main entrance because of the number of guests already waiting in line.  White Water Snacks was very handy for breakfast.  The room was comfortable with a large bed and a couch, with pull out bed I think, and coffee table.  The lighting is on the low side.  Yes, it's expensive, but if you can treat yourself, it's worth it!

This is a decent hotel with a fabulous location. You pay (a lot) for the location, which is indeed wonderful, but don't expect anything dazzling from the hotel itself. It's comfy, it's mostly clean, but it's just not what you expect when you pay $$$$ for a hotel/resort. The maid service was slow (they finally got our room done at 4pm one day), and I was surprised to find NO microwave in the room. Aren't those kind of standard features in a high-end room now? The exclusive entrance into California Adventure was surprisingly crowded and slow to get through -- didn't feel like the great perk it should've been.   On the good side, the pools were very nice, especially the water slide. (It's not just for the kids!) Overall, we slept well and it was nice to be able to duck back to our

Summary Heading: Pricey indeed, but too grand and convenient to stay elsewhere; avoid rooms facing California Adventure
Summary: This was our third two-day stay in 15 years at this unique hotel.  We had two adjoining rooms for our family of 6.  The rooms are a bit smallish and definitely expensive.  However, the spacious public areas of the hotel and its grounds are really Disney grand and its direct entry to California Adventure and close proximity to Disneyland seals the deal.  Breakfast with Chip and Dale and Goofy, also expensive, remains over the top.  You can find less expensive hotels nearby, but this is the only one where you feel you are in Disneyland the entire time.  And yes, it is still a magical place.

If you want to stay close to Disneyland and your children are young then stay here if not find another Hotel.  This hotel is very expensive for what you get.  The rooms are small and in poor condition, the TV is old and only works on some channels.  The rooms need new furniture, proper fitting bar fridges and a carpet that should have never been put in these rooms.  All rooms are small.  They are doing renovations on the outside of this hotel but they should have started in the inside.  For $400.00 plus i expected far better.  The staff is very friendly and check in and check out was very fast even though it was very busy.  Please remember this is a kids hotel.  Each restaurant is hit or miss so you get what you get.

Summary Heading: Disneyland and California adventure with 2 kids (5 and 7)
Summary: We splurged and stayed at Disneys Grand California hotel. The hotel is incredible and our room (1 queen and 1 bunk) was huge. The pool area is also huge and the kids loved the water slides and spa.  I would highly recommend staying here. It's 1 minute walk to Downtown Disney. 5min walk to Disneyland and only 2 min walk to Grand California - which you can enter from the hotel. Must do magic mornings and pay the park hopper. Each day we came back to the hotel at around lunchtime for a swim/nap and then back out to the parks. The kids loved Radiator Springs Racers and toy story mania at California adventure.  Fantasy land was their fave area at Disney. Matterhorn scary noises and monsters terrified them. Indiana jones wasn't much better...  Us adults loved it all!

Summary Heading: Poor service. Even worse value for the money.
Summary: I posted a detailed review about my terrible experience at this hotel on Trip Advisor 4 weeks ago. It was a very clean and honest review about my poor experience there. I am told it is "Under review" 4 weeks later. Does Disney also have their hands over Trip Advisor?

Summary Heading: Convenient Hotel to California Adventure and close to Downtown Disney and Disneyland
Summary: This hotel is pretty standard. It is one of the older Disney hotels and the hotel exudes a more rustic, woodland feel. We stayed here because of the convenient entrance that lets you inside California Adventure and the Magic hours. Our shower wasn't great where the faucet was leaking when you had it in shower mode so your feet was always in a pool of water. The hotel is right next to Downtown Disney and Disneyland so it was very convenient to change or go for a swim then go back to the parks.

From the moment we walked through the door until we left a few days later, this hotel met and exceeded my expectations. The room was really nice, the bed mighty comfy and the location perfect! Would stay there again for sure.

Let's get this out of the way: staying here is a splurge.  That being said: it has to be one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in!  The decor is classic and classy.  The rooms are large and the beds are comfortable.  There is a specific entry into Disney's California Adventure that only people staying in the hotel get to use - this makes waiting in those long lines early in the morning MUCH quicker.  Also, there are times when you can enter the park an hour before everyone else!  The cast members at the resort are extremely enthusiastic and eager to help.

Coming here is one of the few things I look forward to each year. The atmosphere is great and having a separate park entrance is really nice on busy days. It always smells clean and looks nice.   I love that they do movie nights by the fireplace and I really think just everything about it adds to the Disney magic. I like to get the deluxe partial view rooms. The time we went we were above downtown Disney and could sit outside and smell the fresh caramel corn.   I try to not expect much from hotels especially here because I'd rather spend more time in the park but when we come to Disneyland I will only stay here now.

Summary Heading: Can't beat the location, but the magic was in short supply
Summary: 4 stars based MOSTLY on the amazing location right inside the California Adventure Park and on our wonderful front desk cast member who was kind enough to get us into a great room with more beds, and who gave us some extra goodies for our girls who were celebrating Birthdays this month. The magic sort of ends there.  We stayed at a discounted rate, and even at that price, it was expensive considering the room and service. The rooms do not have much of a magical Disney feel to them and are becoming a bit dated. We had to call down to request robes for the room (a little perk we had heard so much about or we would not have known to call and ask). Housekeeping did not come until very late in the afternoon, usually when we were returning for a break with a sleeping 2 year old. We

Summary Heading: Good to be close - but needs updating
Summary: Loved the position of this hotel. Easy walk to down town Disney.   Had a great view from the balcony of California Adventure. Lots of activities and places to see the light show at night.  The rooms were a little old feeling and seemed dark. There is a need for a bit of a refresh. The staff were excellent and can not be faulted. The restaurants and service were great. More than one laundry would be appreciated for longer stays.

We stayed at the resort past weekend to celebrate my daughter's birthday. For $1300 one bedroom suite, the room was nothing special. For a five star resort, we weren't even offered free bottles of water. One of the sink wasn't draining. Once again, for the kind of money they charge, I expect everything to be working.  I slipped and felt hard in their bathtub. I called and filed a report. After the report was taken, no one offered complimentary breakfast, lunch, or even fast passes to show good customer service.  The magic hour next morning was a joke. With my aching back, I still got up and went to the park to entertain my daughter. Three of their most popular rides weren't working! (Soar, cars and toy story) we walked opposite side of the park for nothing and wasted our morning

Summary Heading: The Grand Dame needs a fluffing...
Summary: The Arts and Crafts inspired lobby is impressive in scale and evocative of great lodge "parkitecture" and California's great natural beauty ‚Äîpiano-playing and great, roaring, bouldered fireplace and all. (Including mini-Stickley rockers for the littles). The rooms, though... meh. Luxury travelers will wince at the ho-hum rooms and the dispiriting motel-style bathrooms, even at Concierge level service. But the necessities are there. The service is chipper and accommodating and the promise of Disneyland magic trumps the so-so rooms. The pool area also needs a freshening. My five year old son and his buddy begged for a whoosh down the waterslide but I redirected their enthusiasm for the downscale pool environment to the Disneyland fun beckoning beyond the Downtown Disney outdoor

I wanted to do a final family trip before the kids returned to school and for my youngest's 5th birthday.  I have three young daughters and the room was very spacious for a family of five.  Initially wasn't planning to stay at the resort because I had free nights at another location....but my husband watched an episode of the Disney resorts available and he wanted to try this place.  It was way out of my price range but we had gift cards to use. The main feature was the location close to Disneyland and California Adventures.  There is an entrance from the hotel directly to California adventures which helped.  And a few mornings we got to be inside the park before the general public and it wasn't the magic hour.  So thankful we had the park hopper tickets.  Can't beat the

I was undecided about staying here as the reviews were so mixed. We thought we would give it a try!  On arrival we were greeted by the valet attendants. They quickly took our bags and showed my husband where to park as we needed a disabled space.  We were seen very quickly at the check in so I was pleasantly surprised. Bree was extremely pleasant and friendly.  I had booked a downtown view room that would sleep 5 of us. Bree told us that because we had 2 teenagers the room we booked was probably not the best because the beds would be too small. (The age of children was in the booking form so as a point of view they should state that older children will not fit in these beds) Bree explained that we could get another room but it didn't have the view we wanted. They could provide

My family has visited Disney World in Florida several times, so we decided to try Disneyland instead this year.  We booked a 4 night stay at the Grand Californian.   The staff was excellent, the grounds are nice, the rooms are nice, the pool was nice...but compared with most Deluxe Disney accommodations at Disney World, it fell short.  I was a bit surprised this was the top level accommodation for a Disney property.    Don't get me wrong, there was nothing truly bad about our stay.  After staying at the Grand Floridian, Beach Club, Wilderness Lodge, and Bay Lakes Villas, the Grand Californian would rank lowest among those properties.  Even the Dolphin and Swan have better theming and it isn't a Disney property.    Location is the key to this property.  In and out of the parks in

This hotel is absolutely beautiful.  The rooms were very clean and comfortable.  We had a premium view room.  It had a balcony that overlooked parts of California Adventure park.  It had a queen bed, a set of bunk beds and a trundle.  The room felt a little cramped for 5 people, but that is to be expected in any Disney hotel.  I loved having the private entrance into the park and also the entrance into Downtown Disney.  I would definitely stay here again.

I just love coming back to this hotel.  It's always the first hotel I stay at when I come to the US.  After 15+ hours in the air t nice to drive into GCH.  The warm welcome of the staff to the grand foyer.  The rooms whilst a little small are comfortable.  The access to the Downtown Disney and the Parks is a bonus, but the ability to just emerse yourself in the Disney Atmosphere 100% of the time is its hidden gem.

Lets talk about the Grand Hall, Lobby and the Grounds, Amazing! The stained glass sliding entry door, the Lobby with the exposed wood beams and lodge feel were great. The grounds were well managed and Disney beautiful. Also Bree at the Front Desk was Amazing with here Hospitality.  The rooms were, best described as average and dated. The furniture was "well loved", the decor was dated (late 90's) and halls very dark. The parking was very expensive at $28 a day ($18 for self park which was full on our stay).  I was a little upset at the parking cost as Deluxe hotels at Disney World do charge for parking. I am glad we stayed but I do believe it was a "one and done".

The main reason we stayed here was for the convenient location to both parks. The lobby and the hotel grounds are pretty but the rooms seem to be lacking some Disney charm. All the employees were friendly and helpful. Room service was quick but pricey. We had a Courtyard/woods view which was nice and peaceful except for our last night when there was a wedding and the DJ was playing loud music till 10pm. Otherwise we had a good stay.

I am a huge Disney fan and go to Disney World in FL multiple times each year, usually staying at a Deluxe resort.  On my last visit to DL in CA, I stayed at the Disneyland hotel and found the room to be fantastic but the walk a bit long (stroller, kids, etc) through the whole Downtown Disney district.  So this trip, we splurged for the Grand Californian.  The pros are definitely its location, located next to the park with its own entrance to DCA.    We however had a few issues - 1) the room was TINY.  Much smaller than any Deluxe at WDW I've ever stayed in.  I would say it's on par with a Moderate or maybe even a Value resort at Disney World.  We had a room with two queens, so I'm sure there are larger configurations out there, but a room that costs 500/night should not be

Have visited Disneyland Resort several times - and have stayed at the Grand California Hotel many times as well.  We find the Grand California experience to be very good and consistent - many positives, but a couple opportunities.  We've also stayed at other "Friendly Neighbor" hotels adjacent to Disneyland when The Grand California has been sold out - some are a close walk - but tend to be dumpy and poorly maintained.  Albeit expensive, try to stick with the Disney on-site properties.  Following are some points regarding The Grand California: Location: Absolutely perfect - this is the best thing about the Grand California - adjacent to Downtown Disney and California Adventure, and just a 2 minute walk to Disneyland Park.  Does not get any better for convenience. Interior &

Summary Heading: It's all about location (and the beautiful lobby)
Summary: We have stayed here several times, and each time, we feel approximately the same way: gosh we love Disney; gosh the lobby is beautiful (especially when the piano player is there; gosh it's convenient to be able to run out of Disneyland and back to the room for a nap; gosh why are we paying _so much money_ for a room that's just "meh"? This visit was much the same. The welcome from the valets and the check-in staff is always top-notch, 100% pure Disney magic. The carpets on our floor have been updated from the last time we were there, so that was nice. I know they are working with an older building so there's only so much they can do, but there is one thing I WISH they would do: stop storing the clean towels on top of the toilet in the bathroom. Everyone knows that when you flush

Such a beautiful resort. The staff was very friendly. The room was great and very clean. We had a view of the park which was great. Easy access to the parks from the hotel as well as downtown disney. Would definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Amazing Disney Hotel in the Park
Summary: We are DVC Members and stayed here on points in a 2 bedroom villa. The rooms were huge and we loved having 3 full bathrooms! Everything was in great condition and clean! Our room overlooked the back of the Redwood Challenge, so it was a very quiet location! We loved walking out of the hotel and right into the park!  Beds were comfy and the pool area is great! Can't wait to go back again!

Warning -- I'm one of THOSE people.  An adult who loves Disney.  I'm an annual pass holder and go to Disneyland several times a year, always staying at the resort.  I also go to the resort in Florida and have been on more Disney cruises than even my son ever wanted to go on.  So I have a decades long relationship with the Happiest Place on Earth and love all that is wonderful about it and, therefore, I'm also hyper critical when anything goes wrong.  My son and I visited the Grand Californian for two days in August, probably the 10+ time we've stayed at the nicest hotel in the Disney resort/Downtown Disney complex.  We love the place.  But I have to admit --- I'm worried.  For the first time I felt that standards had slipped at not only the hotel but across the whole resort.

My husband and I traveled to Disneyland for my birthday and to experience the 60th Anniversary celebration. I am a travel agent and still had a hard time picking between The Grand Californian and the Disneyland Hotel. After much back and forth with myself, youtube videos, tripadvisor reviews and TA friend recommendations I selected The Grand Californian.  Upon check in, I was told that the room that I had requested (king room) wasn't available and that I would not be able to get one. Well, that wasn't exactly the magical beginning to my birthday weekend that I had hoped for. I explained that we had already missed a full day due to a delayed flight causing us to miss our connection and we spent the night in the airport. At this point I was just ready for bed. The castmember had

We stayed in a one bedroom as DVC members, Wednesday thru Saturday. I was really pleased with the location being right in the middle of everything. You can exit the hotel into Downtown Disney or into California Adventure. We arrived about 1 pm, checked our bags and spent a couple hours in Disneyland until the room was ready, which was right at 4pm. RM4508 ... nice view of Paradise Pier in DCA. Was able to see a portion of the World of Color water show. There was a faint noise of screaming people riding the attractions in DCA with the doors shut. Everyone we dealt with at the hotel was very nice. Appetizers in the lounge off the lobby were very good. We would definitely return.

I had a hard time rating this hotel. If your plan is to visit Disneyland, then this hotel is a solid 5 due to its location and theme. Otherwise it's closer to a 4 due to the fact that the rooms could use a little updating. But overall, this hotel provided us with a very good experience!   This hotel is huge and with a 1970s design. Amazing pool area with several pools and sun beds with really, really comfortable mattresses. Some of the staff is grumpy and not that helpful, but most members of the staff is wonderful. Apart from dry cleaning services, the hotel offers laundry rooms where you can wash your clothes for only 3 dollars (card only). Expect some waiting time though. Food at hotel restaurants is not that fun if you are a vegetarian and service is not fast. Better to eat

Summary Heading: Step back in time with outdated decor
Summary: Step back 30-40 years into the lobby of the hotel and again as you step through the door of your room, this place needs modernising. The fixed shower still has the old tiles my grandparents had in their house 40 years ago, it is dark and dismal in most other places of the hotel. The aircon in the lobby is way too cold, to the point where we tried to avoid it where possible. Having said that, the rooms were clean and the staff were all extremely friendly and helpful, and the hotel is conveniently located for Disneyland.  Very expensive on site shops and services, too expensive.

Spent 4 nights in the Grand Californian.  As a member of Disney Vacation Club we booked a two bedroom villa.  Beautifully appointed with 3 full baths, MBR with King Size Bed and 2nd BR with 2 Queens, washer/dryer, living room/full kitchen.  Kitchen is fully equipped.  Location cannot be beat - walk right into Downtown Disney to get to Disneyland or use the hotel's direct entrance into Disney California Adventure Park.  Service levels were standard Disney high level of service.  Would definitely return to the hotel if we were going back to Disneyland.  (As an east coaster we tend to visit WDW more frequently than Disneyland.)

Summary Heading: Property Grand, Rooms not so Much
Summary: Valet and Bell Hops. Upon entering the resort, you are greeted in true Disney style.  The bell hops are right there for you as well as the excellent service you will receive with their valet.  The valet, in my opinion was worth the money after the hustle and bustle we had to go through just to get there. The staff was very courteous and kind and super efficient. 5 Stars!!  Lobby. The beautiful lodge doors open for you and you enter a very large and welcoming lobby. Cast Members direct you immediately to the check-in staff.  The woman that checked me in did not have the Disney spirit and that was disappointing. All other Cast Members were right on top of their game and made this experience a little nicer.  The Lobby had a huge fire place with lots of chairs, a television with

Was there for the Disney Institute conference. Spacious room.  Balcony. Very clean. Didn't spend much time there because spent all my time in the conference and park! Service was excellent. Food was great, but CRAZY expensive. Would definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay at Disneyland
Summary: The room was clean and they were accommodating in providing a roll away bed.  I think they are pretty prepared for families to have special needs for kids and kids friends.  The hotel was busy but then again it pretty much always is busy.  The price was good.  Do not expect a bargain since it is Disney, but they do have the service thing down at this hotel.  The pool was great.  They had plenty of room midday and the pool attendant came around frequently for food and drink orders.

Stayed in October 2015. Construction was very loud downstairs so that was quite annoying. Overall a good stay. Very well designed The entry to the park was very convenient as was the take away place near the pool. Would definitely stay again

I have been lagging in this review; it was last October we visited.  Well, needless to say we are headed to this wonderful place again in less than 5 weeks. We stay here every year for a week and it is beyond worth it... Just so I am clear, this hotel is not just any hotel, it is wonderful due to the staff!!   Our room had a great view of the fireworks, easy elevator access, and the room itself was marvelous.  The pool area is family friendly and the lifeguards are trained in all types of rescue; I asked about training.  The ENTIRE staff has accommodated just about any request we had.  Our granddaughter did her homework on the 6th floor terrace and got a soda & treats while there; where else could one do homework with a view to Disneyland? One of our granddaughter's favorite

lets say we were so impressed from the valet, check in, the bell desk, the hostess all the way to the housekeepers and the piano player.  we started getting spoiled from the second we got there.  They catered to ALL of us ..even the one year old.  we had a beautiful room with super soft beds and towels.   a turn down service....never had to ask for anything we were on the 3rd floor right by the elevators.  we slept so well.  we got into the park earlier than others and I will tell you...that made a big difference for the kids riding rides.  we got to do a lot more than we ever got to do.  we will never stay any where else again.

Fun place new and improved since last time my kids and i was their it's stupid it coasts to much now Walt will be very disappointed if he sees how much it is to get into Disney Land and Disney World so thanks a lot because know my grandkids will never get to go their!!! üò°

Summary Heading: Awesome accommodations in the heart of the Disneyland Resort
Summary: Disneyland and California Adventure are co-located along with the Downtown Disney area.  The Grand Californian sits right in the middle of Downtown Disney so it is very convenient.  It is a casual but upscale resort with several restaurants, pools, a spa and recreation on site.  Guests who stay there can enter California Adventure through a back entrance which saves a lot of time and is very convenient. The resort was extremely clean and the service was great.  It had a woodsy theme and a lot of natural wood and rock used in its construction.

We loved our stay here. Everything you would want from a Disney hotel. Our room had a view of Downtown Disney but it was also a huge trek from the elevator. Can't think of anything bad to say about the hotel. We left a jacket in the room accidentally and they shipped it to us for free. Room prices are a bit crazy though.

I have to be honest, I didn't stay at this hotel, but we say in the lobby for quite awhile and chatted with the staff.  It is a wonderful hotel with VERY friendly staff.   In fact, the piano player even stopped as he was walking away to turn back and play happy birthday for my girlfriend.  We did have a few drinks in the bar and it was VERY nice.  Even the prices in the bar were reasonable, despite the room prices being off the chart.  The inside of the hotel is gorgeous as are the grounds.

Summary Heading: Last hoorah of summer before school
Summary: We decided to go to the West coast to seek solace as school is approaching as is the anniversary of my daughter's father as well. Last year was so hard to get a call on a Sunday morning that at age 45 he died when riding his bike and every single day since has been filled with the mess of probate and other legal issues and deep sadness and grief.  I needed a place where "the happiest place on earth" really does exist as well as the magic that only Walt Disney knew how to brand.  We received our Diamond Anniversary luggage tags and off we go to the resort and spa that is connected to Disneyland.  The decor is very nice- a complete change of pace for us as we've only gone to WDW Florida-- so the West coast vibe and original home to Mickey Mouse was just the thing to catch our

Summary Heading: Lack of consistency or communication.  Or water.
Summary: WARNING! We've all had uneven experiences from time to time, even at premium hotels.  Today is the last day of a four day family trip to Disneyland for my 50th birthday, and our experience at the Grand Californian has been more of a downward slide all the way.  Our check-in experience and concierge floor greeting was great, Bree at front desk set a nice tone and Concierge Brad was a wealth of info.  We visited the Craftsman Lounge several times on the first day and the service and staff were superb.  As a former Disney Imagineer and studio employee, the GC staff met all expectations.  The rot set in when we returned, hot, sticky and exhausted after park closed just after midnight, along with dozens of other GC guests.  All four of us anxious for a shower and good night sleep.

We paid am exorbitant amount of money for a stay here of 2 x 2 bedroom suites for our family party of 9 people. It can be summed up by the title, massively overpriced for what you get. Not 5 star by any stretch. Despite being told on booking that we would have next door suits the check in took hours and they couldn't get us anywhere near one another. The rooms are very very dated and in need of a revamp. They are dark and poorly lit. Whilst there is a fridge for a mini bar in the rooms, it's empty. Not even a complimentary bottle of water is provided. There's coffee and a hot water machine but no teaspoons or sachets of milk. Shower is over the bath and beyond pitiful. Struggled to get the shampoo our yoir hair. Very very disappointing. Certainly wouldn't go back and would

Convenient for the parks but very expensive. Don't think I would stay again as the sound insulation in the rooms is bad - there is lots of banging and clattering from floors above and below and we could hear people talking in the room next door - and we stayed in the newest part of the hotel! One night we could hear the people in the next room talking and snoring! The pools were nice with really comfy sun loungers and the life guards seemed very switched on and active around the pool. The staff were friendly and helpful.

The location of this hotel is amazing. It lets you right into California Adventure or into Downtown Disney. We stayed in a two bedroom suite that could have been a little more spacious for the 7 people we had staying in it. Granted we did have a lot of stuff with us but it was a little hard to maneuver throughout the room with all of us in it. It had a fridge which was really nice, good sized for all the drinks we brought with us. The lobby is really nice, very busy. The staff was incredible. We needed to rent a motorized scooter on our stay and they brought it right to the check-in counter for us. We tried to get lunch at Whitewater snacks one day and it was a half hour wait for hotdogs! A little frustrating but we eneded up getting Pizza at the Naples inside Downtown Disney

My family and I took a last minute weekend getaway before school started up again and this time chose not to go to the Disney parks but rather stay at the Grand Californian and use the resort amenities as a relaxing vacation.  As always, Disney puts out a fantastic product.  It was a great blend of Disney fun for the kids and relaxing resort for the adults.  Their standard rooms even accommodated 5 people at no extra cost which is always great when traveling with the family.  Can't wait to go back!

This is a great hotel that is super close to Disneyland! You get into the park early every other day by staying here. It is expensive!!!!!! But you get what you pay.  Restaurants are good as well as room service. Pool area fun with a slide. Staff are very friendly and the rooms are clean.

Summary Heading: All About Convenience to the Parks
Summary: Sure, the hotel was nice and service was good, but the high price is not reflective of the amenities. With that being said, we would stay there again due to the ease of access to the parks with small kids.

We enjoyed our stay at the Disney Grand California.  Everything was within walking distance which really helped as we had very young kids with us.  Also we could easily walk back to our room for quick naps as our kids had trouble napping in the stroller.  Then after the nap, another stroll back to the park and enjoyed the rest of our time there.

1st trip to Disney California having done Florida 3 times. Hotel was beautiful in design and facilities however the staff when checking in used a script and we didn't feel too welcome!  The luggage guy on the other hand was lovely. The room was lovely and a problem with a bathroom door that didn't lock was quickly fixed. One disappointment was the lounge bar. We went for an early breakfast.  The lounge was very grand but the windows were very dirty, there was a hole in the arm of a chair and chips in the wood paneling - also I would have liked my tea and pastry in a cup and on a plate instead of a paper cup and paper bag!

Summary Heading: Convenience and Luxury in Downtown Disney
Summary: I've stayed here a couple of times and both times we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Rooms are clean, very quiet and the beds are comfortable - all very necessary after a full day in the parks. The perks such as early mornings, hotel merchandise delivery, the ability to charge purchases to the room and the private entrance into California Adventures all help to make this hotel great. Cast members, at this hotel, were very helpful and pleasant. I would say that this hotel is overpriced, but I still loved every minute of my stays here.

We've stayed here a few times and have never been disappointed. The staff is always so pleasant and accommodating. The rooms are always clean and fresh. I suggest spending a little extra for a view. Even the Downtown Disney view is fun. It's the closet resort to the parks which is a huge plus at midnight when you've been at the park all day on your feet. Our family also enjoys the activities the have at the resort, like movie night. We all love the pool and the poolside drink service is great for adults. The common area is probably our favorite feature of the resort. Love to just hang out near the hige fireplace or listen to the piano player. My only suggestions, would be to reduce the wait time when checking in.

We stayed here for a week at the end of July 2016. I slipped on something slimey on the first step of the main pool with the slide and fell backwards hitting my back and bum on the ledge and step in pool. Not one Disney employee including the lifeguard asked me if I was ok. Not one. Human courtesy would have been nice or at least an ice pack for my bruised and swollen bum. Thankfully my husband took care of me. Very disappointed with Disney's lack of compassion. Other than that, the hotel was great.

Customer service dreadful Front desk and car parking is poor Phones dont work in room Maybe tomorrow will be better. But check in for a 5 star is poor after a long journey. Napa rose for dinner looks nice so hopefully this is good

Room 4438  Jul 29-31 2016  Negatives: No Wi-Fi. No king bed as expected per reservation. No view. Not enough light in room. Room needs upgrade, especially the carpets. This section of hotel is not attached to the main lodge. No value for price. Positives: one hour early entrance to Disneyland on Saturday. California Adventure on Sunday. Air Conditioning works.

Second year at the Grand Californian and will continue to be our spot in Disneyland. Great customer service, fun dining and bar areas, pools are great and proximation to parks is outstanding. Rooms are clean and beds are comfortable. It's the Disney experience you expect with great attention to detail and a smile everywhere you go. Expect higher prices, but enjoy higher level of service.

Summary Heading: Huge lodge style Hotel with all the bells and whistles.
Summary: We spent the Christmas season here, was very crowded but everything was easy to get to. A direct entrance into California Park was a great advantage and if you went to the other side of the hotel then you had direct entry to Disney town. Great rooms but a little small if you have more than 2 people in your party. Overall would most definitely return. The 6 story high Christmas tree and Christmas carols was a real treat.

I love Disney's Grand Californian - the ambiance (I'm a big fan of the arts and crafts style), the convenience to the parks, and the warm, friendly service.  So nice to be able to easily go back to your room if you have forgotten something or to change if you have gotten particularly wet on Grizzly River Rapids.  ; )

I have mixed feelings about this hotel. I chose to stay at the Grand Californian for the concierge level and proximity to the park.   The rooms are OK and not really much better than a motel. Beds are superior.  Being close to the park was a plus but there are motels that are a similar walking distance.   The Craftsman's club for the view of the fireworks was cool but had an obstructed view on one end and folks (including myself) jockeying for seats. Plus fireworks were canceled 4 of the 5 nights we were there. BTW, several non Disney motels have better fireworks views.  The part that really got me was the concierge service was not really able to help much more than the front desk. I had the impression that the concierge was an outpost for the front desk/guest services but it

Summary Heading: Love the GC but not fancy for the money
Summary: When we go to Disneyland, there is never a question about where we stay.  Yes, the GC is pricey but for the money, you can't beat the ease of use.  The location is fantastic with entrances into Downtown and California Adventure.  The rooms are very much Disney themesque.  Nothing fancy, by any means, but always clean and comfortable.  I especially like the foot refreshing lotion they give (I know, its the little things).  It is nice after a long day at the park!  The staff is always friendly (Disney trains their people right) and I always feel at home there as we are DVC owners in Florida.  I know there are many places to stay when you go to Anaheim but for us, there is only one place.

Summary Heading: Nice, but not what I expected for the price
Summary: I stayed here for 3 nights for a business conference. The accommodations were nice and clean but I guess I expected more for the price of this room. The parking situation is a big dissatisfier, not to mention expensive. The beds were super comfortable and the linens were very clean. Overall, this hotel was desirable but I would elect to stay somewhere less expensive the next time. I've stayed at nice hotels like this before that were a fraction of the cost.

This was our second time staying here and we would stay again.  Everyone is friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the concierge service and the food in the lounge.  There were 7 in our family and we all loved the food in the lounge.  The pool is a well enjoyed break from the parks.  Our 19 year old was thrilled to borrow an old favourite DVD, Indiana Jones.

Everything about our stay was perfect! Staff is so friendly, we never hesitated to ask them anything. Pools are gorgeous, warm, and well staffed with guards. Walkable to Disneyland, California Adventure and Downtown Disney. Staying here gets you into the parks an hour early for "Magic Hour" and that makes a huge difference in what you can get done in one day. We had a queen bed and a bunk with a trundle for our family of 5 and our boys loved their bunk! There are nice restaurants in the resort and opportunities for character meals. I'd highly recommend the breakfast with Mickey at the resort hotel right across the street.

Standard view room overlooking the front of the hotel (room 5245).  Was dreading getting a room with a yucky view given that we booked a standard room.  We usually do a Courtyard view with the monorail going through the courtyard.  Asked for an upgrade at check in but was told they were sold out and no upgrades were available.  We also were told our room was not ready at around 2pm.  Had to dig our bathing suits out in the lobby (have done this too many times to mention with a note to self to just pack a separate bag for check in day with swimwear to avoid the embarrassment of digging through the bags for goggles, suits, etc.).  Once we got our room I was pleasantly surprised with our view this time.  We overlooked the front of the hotel where people drive up to check in and the

Nobody knows custom service like Disney! All girls are Princesses and treated as such from beginning to end and beyond. Went for a work conference and brought my three daughters. Even while I was working I never had to worry about their enjoyment and security. Never an unpleasant staff member. A smile at every turn! Never felt any request was a burden. Staff and guests all alike were pleasant and happy. Makes it easy to relax and feel the magical happiness of the fantasy land that life should be more like! Thank you!

Having had to prepay the 3 night stay a month in advance and it being especially pricey, we arrived with high expectations. When led into the Craftsman Club for registration we felt a little let down. It was tired, requiring an overhaul. I felt like I had been taken back into the 80s, the ambience of the place looking like it needed some modernisation. Sure stick to the Californian Adventure theme but bring it into the current century.  Our room was similar with dated bathroom.   But the bed was fabulous. Really good. Big plus.   And the service. Nothing was too much trouble and generally done with a smile. From the housekeepers,the bell gents, and the staff in the Club, simply marvellous. They all carried the Disney ethic of providing a magical experience.   Tip: book a room

Have stayed here many times This time the room a premium club room was not up to the standard of the past stays The bathroom was not clean hair in the tub The sinks stank We complained they cleaned them but they still smelled The towels were worn Room appearance was tired Not a luxury hotel and not cheap Disapointed

We did not stay at the hotel but we did the Critters Breakfast at the Storytellers Cafe. The breakfast buffet was incredible but very pricey. Chip and Dale, Pluto and the Bear visited us at our table. We did a late breakfast so it was worth the price as it covered breakfast and dinner that day. You must have a Mickey Mouse waffle!!

Summary Heading: Ok but very expensive and not worth the Aus $
Summary: Better off staying outside of the park as only about 15 min walk to park. There is not much personal about this place. Close to park...yes. Value for money.....only if you get Club access and can have brekky for free. Nothing bad though...just no value for money.

The  Disney Grand Californian Villas is an exceptional 2 bedroom villa which sleeps up to 9, has three bathrooms, the master bath has a separate shower and a huge jacuzzi soaking tub.  Full kitchen with all dishes, pans etc. u could need. There's even a washing machine and drier. We were greeted as we walked into the hotel. Registration was quick and very efficient. It was great to be so close to Disneyland park and Downtown Disney with lots of shops restaurants, multi screen theatre and a Starbucks!

Summary Heading: Relax at the Grand Californian after visiting the parks
Summary: We have stayed there several times.  It is central to Down Town Disney and California Adventure.  It is beautiful and has good service.  We ate at the Storyteller Buffet and enjoyed the variety of foods. There is usually a piano player in the Great Room.

A large group from our company was traveling to this property last week and I have to say it was ups and downs.  The property is well maintained even if it's a bit older feel.  The rooms are due for a bit of refreshment for the price you pay every-night.  It's obviously a familly oriented resort and it is huge. The staff does a good jib in making sure they treat you as a guest and not a number and it is well done by the Front Desk staff.  I cannot say the same for the bellman service that obviously has issues.  From lost packages to answers that are completely rude. They lost ultiple parcels we have had delivered to the Hotel and it was always complicated to deal with this departement,  On the other side my room was not clean upon check in and found multiple traces of previous

Such a wonderful stay here.  So great having both parks and downtown Disney right outside the door!  The pool is great and provided a nice few hour break from the parks.    The on sight restaurants are pricy but it's Disney so you already resign yourself to that when you walk in the door.

The 1-bedroom suite is by far the best of the DVC properties.  Why?   There are 2 full separate bathrooms.    However the room was very dark.      The service at the restaurants and bars were not up to Disney standards.   This was true throughout the park.  We literally waited for 10 minutes for our check at the bar at the hotel.

I just came back from my vacation at The Grand Californian Resort & Spa.   The positives: It's aesthetically amazing. The reception/main area are beyond gorgeous.   There's a pianist who plays Disney ballads pretty much all day and it really adds to the atmosphere.  Everyone that works there, (with a few exceptions) was really kind and welcoming.   The negatives: My family and I were in a premium room with a view of Downtown Disney. The room itself was somewhat to be expected: two queen beds, a bathroom, etc. the "cleaning" wasn't that amazing but we chose to try to look past that. When it was time for bed, I attempted to find a comfortable position on my side of the bed but something was off. I asked the rest of my family if they felt that way and they didn't so I tried to

From the moment we walked in, I loved this place.  The lobby is grand and very open with a pianist in the middle.  My husband and I were traveling with our 2 teenage kids, so that's like putting 4 adults in 1 room.  The rooms were average size, but we didn't feel cramped.  Liked the layout of the bathroom, sink and vanity were separate from the shower and toilet.    Can't beat the location.  It's a very short walk to the Disneyland gate and you don't have to even leave the resort to get into California Adventure.  There is an entrance at the hotel and most often then not, we were the only guest using that entrance.  Pool side service was very friendly and quick.  Staff was very friendly and the resort was very clean.

This is the most expensive hotel of the 3 on Disney property. The hotel lobby is beautiful and the staff is nice but the rooms are small and showing signs of age. It does offer direct park access to California Adventure which is nice. If it is part of a package then you have to stay here, if you have a choice, the Disneyland Hotel is less expensive and the rooms are nicer. If you stay at one of the other Hotels you can still walk through the Grand Californian and see the lobby or sit by the fireplace.

We stayed here for 3 days and had a wonderful stay .  The hotel is clean, cool and easy to get around in , although its size is a bit overwhelming. Its lo action and special entrance to California Adventure is a real plus.  The pools were nice, but not over the top like some of Disneys hotels.  Overall, our high expectations for Disney were well satified; not one dissapointment.

Disneyland was awesome!  Loved this hotel.  Very convenient to rides and the restaurants are amazing.  Breakfast buffet is delicious and the characters interact with the kids every morning and evening.  Expensive tho.

The hotel is gorgeous, and sincerely loved the location.  We were in the middle of it all which we all agreed we loved. But for the price, the hotel was lacking amenities / service levels you'd expect at that price point. I got to the front desk after no one answered the bell hop number (they still had our luggage wand we wanted to swim).  The guy next to me had been waiting for his luggage for the same reason for AN HOUR!  And the bell hops were not nice to him. Loved the bar in the lobby, but as we sat at the bar several times, surprised to hear the bartenders openly complaining about other customers. Didn't seem very magical.   Also worried a little about our security, as people used the hotel as a cut through to and from downtown Disney, and other destinations.  So it didn't

We stayed here for the third time this February and it will be the last. Since our first stay in 2009, they have done nothing to update/refresh the rooms. The rooms are very dated, very tired and kind of grungy. Yes, the lobby area is beautiful and it is really nice to be able to walk into DCA from the hotel but it's no longer enough to justify the high price tag. I also find the check in process to be quite slow and there is often a long line. In short, this is an average hotel with a way above average price tag whose amenities are not enough to compensate for their rates.

Stayed four nights at the Villas at Grand Californian Hotel.  Loved being so close to Downtown Disney, and Disneyland with a direct entrance into Disney's California Adventure from the hotel.  The one bedroom villa overlooked the pool.  We could see a good bit of the fireworks from our balcony. Cast members were a pleasure.  The only downside - the bed had a lump straight down the center and the towels were quite thin.

Summary Heading: Great stay but seems to be losing some of it's Magic
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel many times in the past. Nothing beats this hotel in the area for location and customer service. The staff really step it up to give you a first class experience and service from when you check-in with the valet and bell hops to the front desk. In particular the front desk staff accommodated our request to move from a Downtown Disney view suite to a quieter one on the other side of the hotel. This would of been a perfect stay however there are a few things that made it less magical. For some reason there was cigarette smoke smell in our bathroom that became especially strong after taking a shower. Housekeeping did a fine job but was weird how the smell lingered maybe from an accompanying room who knows? Also, there are not enough lounge chairs by the

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay at the Grand Californian
Summary: This was a first time stay for our family at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel, we normally stay at the resorts in Disney World.  We are DVC members and somehow lucked out and got a 2 bedroom suite for a weekend in July of 2016.   Starting with check in we would like to thank Rafa for being so professional and doing everything he could to assist us with our many questions and taking care of details like assisting us in ticket purchasing, arranging for our groceries, etc. We had requested a park facing view and he worked his magic and we had a great view of mickey's fun wheel and paradise pier. Check in was busy on the Friday we checked in, the 22nd,, but they had a large amount of staff in attendance and the lines went quickly. (Kudos to management for properly staffing for a
