Overall this is a beautiful hotel!  The lobby is absolutely gorgeous, the people working are very friendly and willing to help out.  The only thing is that the hotel is not very updated.  The decor is old, there were areas where the wallpaper was peeling off the wall, and there are no sub ports to charge your devices in the room.  The outlets are very low, right behind the night stands, which means you have to pull out the night stand in order to plug your device in.  Overall great hotel, they even give you after sun gel, for those of us who do not tan easily :)

The grand Californian is more pricey than the Disneyland hotel resort but sadly not worth the extra penny. The rooms definitely need an upgrade.  The silver lining to our stay is the location of the hotel itself and also the lobby and corridors are absolutely beautiful. If planning a Disneyland trip, I highly advise staying at the Disneyland hotel.

Summary Heading: Great but not quite as good as...
Summary: The Disneyland Hotel... The Disneyland Hotel is my favorite Disney Hotel so I had high expectations for the Grand Californian when I had the chance to stay here, the hotel met my expectations in the Convenience to California Adventure and Disneyland Park as well as the great common areas however the rooms left a lot to be desired they were dark and can defiantly use a refurbishment! I would stay here again in a heartbeat if it was 150 cheaper a night... But for the cost and the room quality I still prefer the Disneyland Hotel!

Summary Heading: Great location and First Class Hotel
Summary: If you are park hopping from Disney to California Adventure this is the place to stay.   Even if you are just going to one of the parks, this is the place to stay.  Beautiful rooms, great service from the entrance to registration.  Great pool if you need a break.  Close to all the shops in Downtown Disney (literally outside the hotel).  A little more expensive than the other 2 Disney properties but well worth the money!

Spent three nights at Disney's Grand California Hotel with the family and definitely recommend on your trip to Disneyland and California Adventure.  Not the least expensive but the Grand Ness of the Hotel is worth it.  Makes your entire stay memorable and of course you have admittance into the parks an hour earlier - especially great for the little ones.   Spend the morning in one of the parks and afternoon by the pool.  Perfect for the entire family!

Summary Heading: Recommend if you are going to parks
Summary: The reviews about the view don't make sense to me. You are paying to be close to the parks, who cares what you can see off your balcony. The greatest thing about this hotel is the separate entrance to the DCA.  They will check your room key, so we passed unhappy people going the opposite way who were trying to use this perk who weren't staying at the hotel. It's a huge bonus. We got World of Color fast passes right by this entrance in the morning. The staff was nicer than the park staff and really helpful. We were able to get in our room early and they let us stay late because our conference ran past check out.  Free self parking was another bonus, plus the bar and proximity to Downtown Disney. I would definitely stay here again.

Wow! Just, wow! I booked 2 rooms in this gorgeous hotel to celebrate my husbands return from Afghanistan and our 16th wedding anniversary. The staff went far beyond our expectations and really made it special for us. We have a wheelchair bound son that needs some special consideration, and it seemed that they thought of what he would need even before us.The staff was extremely polite and accommodating. The hotel is very convenient to California Adventure, with its own entrance. We were traveling with small children so this made coming back to the room for naps and such really easy. We found everything we needed in the hotel. Laundry, a small sundries shop in addition to a gift shop. Dining choices were excellent. We would absolutely stay again. The hotel is worth every penny.

We stayed from July 10-15 2016. Check in staff were amazing (cast members helping my daughter find hidden Mickeys while we checked in was really sweet!). We booked a room with a "courtyard" view and ended up with a fantastic view of Grizzly River Run and Tower of Terror. The rooms were a good size for a family of 4 (we had a queen and bunk beds for the kids). The decor is very dated, and could really use a refresh - this was the only thing that was disappointing about the hotel. The pools (3 of them) were fantastic! Loved that they had a bigger waterslide and a smaller one for toddlers. They also included swim diapers and life jackets if you needed them. Lots of life guards on duty. Pool side food service was quick. Lots of chairs available each afternoon. Ate at Storytellers

Summary Heading: Disney - What else can you say
Summary: Check in was a challenge and a half.  When booking the call center convinced me that going with two separate rooms was the best versus the 2 bedroom suite.  They assured me that we would see fireworks from our room.  When we mentioned this on check in, the front desk person next to our check in person jumped over to our station and said they don't promise any room that they will see fireworks, so that was wrong.  When I started to explain that's what the call center said, she said that the information I had was incorrect and they did not guarantee any viewing of fireworks, and what did we think - that Disney was going to build the hotel higher so you could see fireworks.  Very inappropriate comment.  Our front desk person apologized for the comment and asked the manager to come

My family and I booked a standard view, concierge level room. I called to make requests for our room placement early (quiet room near a family with whom we were traveling). I also called to make arrangements for a surprise for my son and our family friends.   The staff was fabulous, they added a bit to the surprise I planned and made efforts to ensure we had reservations we would enjoy. The craftsman club was staffed with kind and helpful folks who ensured there room was always clean and that tasty treats were available based on the daily schedule. Even when treats weren't available there was someone around to help with your requests. Some are concerned with the cost of concierge not matching with what is received, but we found it to be appropriate when used. We found the food

We just returned from a family vacation and enjoyed our 5 nights at the Grand California resort.  The location is wonderful.  Having smaller kids it is so convenient to be able to go back and forth to take breaks from the heat.  The finishes in our room were very nice, and slightly better than what we were used to in other Disney Vacation Club rooms(Beds, solid wood doors,etc). The service was great, the dining options were good, and the pools were very nice.  My only comment would be that they need more seating and specifically shaded seating by the pools for families.   Overall we were very happy with our time at the resort.

My family and just returned from our trip to Disneyland last week where we stayed at this hotel. This is our first time staying here and if I was to return, I would absolutely stay here again. The lobby is beautiful and "grand". The hotel offers a wide array of services, from a spa, kids activities, fitness center, resturants on site and a large pool area with a slide for the kids. The room was exceptionally clean and large enough for the four of us. There is bed turn down service every night so when you return from a long day in the park the room is very welcoming. The staff was extremely friendly;always saying hello as you pass them and very helpful. The location of the hotel to the park is it's greatest feature. There is direct access to California Adventure from one of the

We always stay on property when visiting Disney World & decided to do the same in Disneyland.  Our choice was the Grand California.  It is a beautiful hotel, the mission style is authentic. You know Disney always does it better than the real thing.  We stayed in a 3 bedroom grand villa, very spacious & clean. The second level had two bedrooms, each with a bath.  The living area had a pool table that everyone had a great time playing many games of pool.  The view was not so great. It is the backside of California Adventure. Kind of put a damper on the Disney magic when you can see the workings.  The pool area did not have enough seating during peak hours & the cushions were always damp.  The slide was pretty tame compared to the Florida properties.  All that said, it is still

This is our fourth time to stay here. It's still a very nice hotel and the staff is amazing but....the rooms could use an update. Our AC was not working properly and the toilet kept running. The halls have peeling wallpaper. Just needs a refresh.

I hate writing bad stuff, especially about my stay...let me try to make this short. I would be happy to go into more detail if needed.  My stay began fine, nothing out of the normal. Room was great, food was good, the resort itself was awesome, except for the Staff. I didn't find this out until we were leaving the park and had noticed my son couldn't find his Samsung Tablet (that he's had for a little over a year), which was never connected to the WiFi. As soon as I found out I contacted the front desk asked to speak with the MOD and they connected me. I explained what had happened and that my son had left the tablet on the top bunk of the bed.  MOD explained they would send someone up right away and sweep the room, which they did and said they didn't find anything. So I thought

Summary Heading: Antidote to the Disney Death March
Summary: The Disney Grand Californian is a haven in the midst of crowds, heat, and lines. The rooms are thoughtfully designed with plenty of space and amenities. But the real plus is being so close to Disneyland, Downtown Disney, and especially, California Adventure. The ability to go to the parks and then return to the hotel within a 5 minute walk is by far, it's greatest advantage. We bought park hopper and took full advantage of going between the parks and coming back to the hotel several times a day. Yes, it is pricey but if you have small children or if you are tired of the Disney Death March, save your pennies and stay here. I don't think we will stay anywhere else when we come back.

This was our first time staying at GC and the best part was that it has convenient access to DCA and Downtown Disney! We got a Standard View room with two queen beds. The room wasn't anything special honestly. I'm not sure if it's really worth the regular rates. My sister works for DL and her discount was 50% off. The grounds were pristine although some renovating was happening. The lobby was gorgeous, loved the ambiance. Service was okay, they did misplace my sisters luggage and they didn't leave us with extra rolls of toilet paper. The housekeeping line was always busy. The pools were okay. It was nice to take a break from the parks and cool off in the room and by the pool. I would only stay again for the convenience of the location than anything else.

The prime advantage of this Disney hotel is park access.  Simply step outside and you are there.   After a full day at Disney it is great to be at your room in minutes to relax, change or freshen up.   This was our third visit and I'd give Disney staff full marks.  Friendly and helpful ( although, of course, rigorously on script )

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, but you are paying for location.
Summary: My family (me, my husband, mother and two kids, 10&7) stayed here this past week. This was our first trip to Disneyland after many trips to Disney World.  This hotel is very pretty with a gorgeous lobby.  The staff we encountered were all very nice and happy to help with any issues or questions.  The rooms are really not what you would expect for the price you are paying.  We checked in late and our party of 5 was given the option of a room with one queen bed and a bunk bed with trundle, or a room with 2 queens and an air mattress.  We unhappily chose the bunk bed option.  It was not a good option for 3 adults and two children.  They switched us to the original room we had requested ( 2 queens and a sofa bed)on our 3rd night.  But be warned, if you are a party of 5, you may get

Summary Heading: You're here because it's closest to the parks
Summary: We stayed at the Grand Californian for three nights in July as part of a family trip to Disneyland.  Honestly, the main reason to stay at the Grand Californian is being close to Disneyland.  We were traveling with a 5 year old nephew who burned out after a few hours.  Quick access to the park made it easy to wander back to the hotel to cool off or relax before heading back to the park.  It was easy to let part of the family head back, while others did more rides.  The private entrance to California Adventure was particularly nice - no need to go through the lines for X-ray or tickets at the main plaza between the parks.  I'd stay here again if I was traveling with kids or parents with mobility issues.  Otherwise, I'd probably try to stay away from the park.  The price premium is

Summary Heading: Wonderful place to visit the parks.
Summary: Clean, thoughtful and full of Disney spirit.  Enjoyed all of my experiences at Disney's Grand California Hotel and Spa.  The lounge was a nice relaxing place to visit with their delicious food and friendly staff.  Front desk was helpful and the bell staff generously shared their time.  The spa was a nice treat though expensive.

We love Disney, but this was our first stay at the Disney Grand.  It did not disappoint!  The only thing I would warn travelers about is that checkin is between 3-4, so do not expect to get in a room any earlier on checkin day.  The good news is you can go to the pool or Downtown Disney, so there is plenty to do! The location is great and saves many steps if you are going to the parks.  This is helpful with small kids and even adults.  When requesting a room I would recommend a higher floor with a park view or the pool.  Our room had a balcony and we looked out over California Adveture.  This was considered a premium view.  The Premium Views does come with a longer walk to the room. Overall we are very pleased with our trip and the hotel!

Family Disneyland vacation, mixed with a business conference.    Benefits: 1.)  Location.  You cannot beat the fact that the hotel has its own entry into California Adventure.  No other hotel offers such a benefit.  2.)  Wifi.  Free and speedy, I will take it.  3.)  Pool.  3 pools and each pool had at least 3 lifeguards.  There is even a small kiddie pool with lifejackets for kids of all ages.  This is what sets Disney apart from other resorts and companies, the attention to detail and service.   4.)  Registration.  Speedy and organized, most of these luxury hotels have 2-3 people per desk.  Nope, the registration desk had nearly a dozen people and very efficient.  Nothing is worse when you check in, and wait 30 minutes just to get into your room.    Risks 1.)   Cost.  The cost

As others have said, the location of this property is it's biggest asset.  You can't beat the location for access to the parks.  The close proximity makes it easy to return to the room to freshen up or rest before heading back out for more rides or World of Color/Paint the Night.    The room itself is rather basic, and not luxurious considering the price.  We had a one bedroom suite.  There had been a listing that some rooms have a powder room -- which we'd hoped for, but upon arrival, found out that only two of the one bedroom suites in the whole hotel have the powder rooms.  There is free Wi-Fi, but it is not secure, so I didn't use it. The shower pressure was really weak and somehow the shower/toilet area reminded me more of a motel, rather than a hotel of its price.  We

Summary Heading: It was a great decision to gether whole family and visit Disneyland in this Hotel.
Summary: It was a great holiday, for 6 adults and 5 children. First of all I had to say that this hotel has an unique look, with the "black palace" look lobby, the huge columns and the lighting.   The rooms were big and comfortable, very clean and good smelling. All our requests were fulfilled, including baby and two small children needs. The restaurants were well designed, breakfast was satisfactory and the service was great. The pre arrival assistance and advice was great. In order to plan the three day stay we had numerously phone calls to the concierge of the hotel that answered patiently and gave us very useful advice.  Secondly, the perfect location, including immediate connection to Adventureland and Disneyland, near restaurants and other food shops.

This is our second stay at the grand Californian with our two young girls. What made it worth it for us was early entry every day and being as close as possible. We almost stayed this time at the new courtyard but decided the early entry was worth the extra money. We only go every year and half and it was important to get all the big ticket rides over and then it was relaxation. The rooms are clean and a bit more than average but we love it. I also loved getting purchases sent to back to hotel. We toured the other two Disneyland hotels would only stay at this one.

Stayed for three nights while visiting Disney land. Family with three children.  Stayed in a family room with bunks. The best thing about this hotel is it's location. It is the closest hotel to the parks which makes it easy to pop back to the hotel during the day if you need to. However, it is VERY expensive and the rest of the hotel facilities don't really justify the cost. The rooms are small and the bathrooms are in need of a renovation. The food is also very over priced. We had stayed here before, when our children were younger and it worked better then, but now they are older we really couldn't fit into a so called family room comfortably.

We are Disney Vacation Club members and had hoped to book a vacation club villa.  Unfortunately we didn't make reservations early enough and were given a room with two queens.  We were not disappointed.  At first the room we were given overlooked the front of the hotel and the drive way.  I'm a light sleeper and asked for something else.  They were soo kind and accommodating, moving us to the first floor facing CA Adventure.  The room was very comfortable.  And if you have kids, they will love the depth of details everywhere you look.  It felt as though we were in a beautiful mountain cabin.

Summary Heading: Awesome place, can't beat the location
Summary: At first I was hesitant to stay here due to the price and other hotels close by.  However, I would not hesitate to return.  The location is the best!  It was perfect to go for an afternoon break from the parks at the pool or in the room.  The room was spacious and comfortable.  Overall, one of the best experiences ever.

We booked the hotel due to closeness to Disneyland - and it paid off.  We were able to break our day up by going back fro a swim in the middle of the day with ease.  First up - the hotel needs an upgrade.  The rooms are small and outdated so you are paying for convenience.  Check in was lovely and the staff member was happy and full of advise for us and helpful.  The staff at the rest of the resort, particularly the Storytellers Cafe need training in the 'Disney Way' and treating people as guests.  The only reason to visit the cafe is for the characters - the breakfast buffet was way overpriced and unfriendly staff and food very unappealing.   Apart from those couple of negatives it is worth the premium price simply for the location.

We stayed at the Grand Californian a handful of times in the past. We recently returned after a six year hiatus from Disneyland. Although it was tempting to book a more economical hotel, we knew we'd miss staying at the GCH. We didn't regret splurging for this portion of our trip, as the service and ambiance were as good as we remembered.   We reserved two rooms because we were traveling with four teenagers. The hotel staff honored our request to have the rooms close by. While they weren't connected, they were on the same floor and only a couple of doors away. We were pleased with the location and view of our rooms. We reserved a courtyard/woods view and were placed above the hotel entrance to California Adventure. This was the same area we've stayed in the past when that wing

Beautiful hotel with direct access to Disneyland's California adventure park and Downtown Disney. We were in the area as we were flying through LA and our son lives in Hollywood. We decided to use our points as we are DVC members and we were very impressed. The One bedroom villa was very big with lots of amenities possibly the nicest one we have stayed in.The resort and staff were outstanding !

The best hotel at Disneyland.  Easy access to the park with its own private entrance to California Adventures.  Nice pools.  Great people.   Be sure to get the concierge room access.  Cost is by guest room so if you have a family in one room it is a great deal.  It provides great food and snacks throughout the day plus drinks during the evening.  Be sure to check their hours for special events and food and drink.  Concierge rocks!

This hotel is very convenient to the parks. For that alone it's the place to be. The lobby is nice. 4 stars instead of 5 for a few reason. Rooms are a little dated and lack some amenities. They were unable to guarantee room type.  In Disney World I can get fireworks view, etc.  Here couldn't guarantee bed types, view, etc.  But convenience made up for a lot so enjoy.

We really enjoyed our four nights at the Grand Californian, for many reasons.  For one thing, we spent the first four nights of our trip at the Disneyland Hotel, and the GC was much nicer and much more "magical" by comparison.  Secondly, while this was our first trip to Disneyland, we go to Walt Disney World frequently and love staying at the resorts there --- and the Grand Californian was very similar to some of the WDW resort hotels, so we felt much more "at home" at the GC compared with the Disneyland Hotel. Thirdly, I can only repeat what all the other reviewers have said:  location, location, location.  Seriously, those reviewers wouldn't all be saying it if it wasn't something you should really pay attention to. The Grand Californian is, as are the other Disneyland

We were staying in the DLR area for 3 nights.  My sister chose the hotel, we did not stay at a DLR hotel.  Our first night we went to Downtown Disney to eat and we decided to do some light shopping before the Disneyland fireworks show at 930pm.  We were told you can watch it from the courtyard between the two parks.  We had about 2 hours to kill so we went into the hotel.  OMG it is just gorgeous.  They have it themed like a beautiful lodge in Northern California.  The atrium is beautiful and open.  You can walk through and visit the gift shop, or the restrooms (sooo nice).  We sat by the fire and then visited the gift shop.  Lots of nice Disney Merchandise, without the parks crowds.  We really wish were were staying there instead of the crap motel we chose.  The hotel is built

Summary Heading: Nicest DVC resort we've stayed in
Summary: We have stayed at the majority of Disney Vacation Club resorts in Walt Disney World but this was our first trip to the Grand Californian in Anaheim. It did not disappoint.  We stayed in a one-bedroom unit and it was immaculate. The king size bed was so comfortable. My kids said the pull out sofa in the living room was comfortable as well. The kitchen was clean and had everything we needed for our three day visit.  The resort itself is just beautiful. Service was top notch and we had zero complaints staying here. The pool area is lovely, and the lounge chairs were very comfortable, having cushions which they don't have at their Florida resorts.  I would love to return some day!

We've been staying at this beautiful hotel for 15 years, and it never disappoints! Yes it is pricier than other Disney hotels, but with the accessibility with the private California Adventure entrance and a shortcut to Downtown Disney, it's worth it. The hotel is so close to both parks that going back to the room is no problem, sometimes when it gets crowded we go back to nap. Would recommend to everyone!

The Party:      Family of 5, Grandparents, Mum & kids aged 4 and 9 Time Frame:  2 nights   Recommendations:  1. The 2-day park hopper card wasn't enough for both Disney & California Adventure land! We had to buy a 3rd day!  2. Make the effort to plan and use the early bird advantage + the fast track pass.  3. As well as the "Must See" parade & fireworks on the Disneyland side (check with the park info resource if there is any sign of wind for cancellations). And Do see the World of Colour at California Adventure land too. Find out about the viewing spots (best seen face on so plan an easy grab 'n go meal and get in the queue early - definitely worth it)  4. Kids loved the collecting and swapping of "pins".  5.The Brea Bakery is great for early breakfast and the restaurant for

Summary Heading: Amazing! Don't stay anywhere else for Disneyland.
Summary: We have stayed at the Grand Californian many times now with our 3 children and absolutely love it, would not stay anywhere else for Disneyland.  The convenience of being so close to the park can't be beat and is worth the extra $. Amazing atmosphere especially at Christmas time.

It's hard not to like Disneyland, but this hotel really goes the extra mile to push me in that direction.  The price tag was over $600/night for the cheapest room on the property.  I paid less at the four seasons in Hawaii and the grand californian looks like a motel 6 in comparison.  But, I knew that going in, right?  So, why did I pay it?  Because I was supposed to get the magic morning treatment that would allow us all into the park an hour before it opens.  I even called and made my reservation with a person in order to verify this important detail.  The problem?  They change which park it applies to every day and the day we were there it was California Adventure and not Disneyland.  Why not be more transparent about this and train your staff to tell people making

This hotel is a one of a kind. You never have to leave the park! You get an extra hour in the morning before anyone else plus there is an entrance to California Adventures in the hotel. The staff is so friendly and helpful! We took advantage of the magic morning hour and We got to go on 6 usually busy rides in under an hour! We also went to the Storyteller Cafe buffet at the hotel. It was a blast being able to eat with characters. The pool and spa was absolutely gorgeous. Don't get me started on the view in our room! We got to see the fireworks. It may be pricey but it is worth the memories that will be made.

I finally had an opportunity to stay at this Disneyland hotel. I believe it's the best one here. From the out, it's very impressive. The lobby is quite nice too. The pool is also nicely done.   The one area they haven't kept up with is the hotel rooms. They are small and dated. There's a "worn" look to it. They still have a DVD player in the room!  The wifi is terrible. I turn it off so it didn't freeze up my computer. Cell phone reception is not much better.   When we entered the room, the bathroom wasn't clean properly. Found a dirty towel and hair inside. Had housekeeping come back to clean correctly.   For the per night charge to stay here, the rooms should be the top priority in impressing guests.   You just expect better.

My daughter and I stayed for 3 nights. We had a restful stay. This resort is closest to the parks, reducing the walking quite a bit... The gardens and sitting areas inside are beautiful! The hotel has a low lighting and dim atmosphere, perfect for calming down after being in the parks. It is only a few steps to all the activity if Downtown Disney but you'd never know it! I highly recommend tgis hotel.

Summary Heading: Decent hotel room but really bad registration process
Summary: I planned our family vacation around my children's first visit to Disneyland.  I made the hotel and ticket reservations overseas and told the agent on the phone to keep the tickets at the desk of the hotel as I knew I wasn't going to visit my sister in San Diego before we went.  I know, over the course of about 5 international long distance phone calls, that I asked them to keep the tickets at the desk since we could not pick up the tickets elsewhere.  Of course...Disney's team sent the tickets to my sisters house (someone signed for them...we don't know who).  So...here we were sitting at the hotel front desk with no Disneyland tickets !  Our VIP tour was in 30 minutes...We had to argue with people at the front desk to tell them that Disney reservations made the mistake not

Summary Heading: Will likely just stay here from now on
Summary: I've now officially been to all 3 Disney resorts and this by far blows the other 2 out of the water (rightfully so when you consider the cost per night compared to the others).  This resort is just so much more convenient with regards to location.  California Adventure park is literally at the door step - so amazing!  Sometimes the line to get your bags checked vs. getting into the park is longer, so this private access to the park was well worth it.   We did have free Wi-Fi in the room, and I was also able to snag the free Wi-Fi in the pool area.  The rooms are so nice and clean and I can stay in the beds all day.  The gym was open for 24 hours, which was convenient for my partner who is a gym nut.  There are 3 pools but when I went, it took me over 20 minutes just to find a

Summary Heading: Great location and excellent customer service!
Summary: Disney's Grand Californian is all you would expect from a Disney hotel - and more! It is a huge complex and was full when we visited, but that didn't detract from our experience. There are staff around every corner to assist you with anything you could possibly need and they will do all they can to make your stay perfect!  The room we had (family room as we were travelling with our teenage son) was relatively small but well designed and suited us well. The room had a fridge which was handy and an enormous wardrobe - which was great as we were travelling with a lot of luggage!  The main advantage of this hotel is it's convenience. It is on the site of the two Disney theme parks so you can go in and out of the parks all day. Downtown Disney is also on site and that is hugely

Summary Heading: Great Location and Decor But Small Rooms and No Wifi
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel many times on visits to Disneyland. While the hotel has a beautiful lobby and decor, and is very convenient to Downtown Disney and Disneyland (and is the nicest hotel to stay at on property), for the money they charge, the rooms are small and so are the bathrooms. While they have balconies that overlook Downtown Disney and the rooms are updated, and nicely appointed, the bathroom is tiny and the toilet is so noisy when you flush it that you wake up everyone else if you have to go to the bathroom during the night. Also, the bathroom has the toilet and the shower in one room and the sinks and vanity just outside of the toilet and shower, but the space is very tight, especially if you have three or four people in the room. Also, the hotel does not have

This was my third time staying at the DGC and it won't be my last!  My husband and I brought the grandkids and of course the bunk beds were a hit again. Service was prompt & magical just as expected.  Registration took a little long, but that was because I was combining two separate reservations and I did not want to move to another room the last night. DGC prevailed I did not have to move & for a very small fee I up graded for a better view and watch the fireworks every night on the balcony room #431.  And to top it off for what I thought was a reasonable registration wait time, we were given fast passes for a ride of choice for our patience.       The only reason I give this hotel 4 stars instead of 5 is because the rooms are small for the price you pay. As everyone says you

Summary Heading: Felt the magic for a non believer
Summary: Im not a disney buff. I took my family of 4 here for a conference that my kids wanted to attend.The hotel is a very busy hotel. However, they have highly efficient and friendly staff to handle the crowds. Their service is commendable for a busy hotel. The hotel is a 3.5 hotel but because of its location, it is a must stay for disney lovers. The only way that i will goto disneyland again is to stay at this resort because it allows me to take the park in doses ! i walk back to my quiet room anytime and relax and then meet my kids back in the park.As far as the room, I am a light sleeper and amazingly the room was very quiet .Turndown service is a nice touch after returning from a hot day at the park. If you dont want to goto the park, downtown disney always has bands playing in

I visited Disney and stay in here due to business unfortunately. I left my family back in my country and participated Expo West; food and supplement exhibition. I could not find a place to stay like a business hotel in Annaheim however only accomodation was in Grand Californian Hotel and thanks God that is excellent hotel. Only issue is very busy and crowded.  Concierge can be more active for customer who might be encourged to see LA or around.

Summary Heading: Grand Price But The Hotel Wasn't That Grand....
Summary: First off the location of the hotel is what you are paying for. It's right in the middle of Downtown Disney and you can enter California Adventure from right within the hotel. That being said, I've also stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and I must say that the rooms, and hospitality was much better at the Disneyland Hotel than it was at the Grand. After checking in to the Grand and sleeping that night I woke up to make coffee only to find a used coffee pod still in the pod left by the previous guests. BLECK!!! The beds and pillows were horrible. I woke up with a crook in my neck every morning.  Our toiletries and coffee items were only replaced when I complained to the Guest Services Desk.  It looked like all of the rooms had a balcony, but we got stuck overlooking the taxicab bay.

Summary Heading: PRICEY BUT THE BEST WAY TO GO TO DISNEYLAND
Summary: I have to start out this review by saying why it was a 4 star and not a 5 star which I think is important because the cost of this hotel makes you notice little details while if you stay in a Budget Hotel you let it go. 1. Bring your own pillow-the pillows in our room were lumpy and hard and kept me from sleeping. I did bring to maid's attention but though she promised she would check into, I left a tip on my pillow when we left room to see if the pillows were changed, when I came back to room, my money and pillows were still where I left them. 2. Room Service--regular hamburger, coffee, glass of wine cost was $50.00.  If the coffee and burger had been good, I wouldn't mention it, but they were really mediocre and cold.   3. Strawberry Cheesecake at Storybook Cafe didn't

Beautiful hotel at a cost.  Love staying so close to Disneyland!  Hotel is nicely decorated and employees are beyond friendly!  We had a problem with the sink and maintenance was at our in less than 15 minutes.  A recommendation for future is to enclose bunk beds like Legoland for privacy.  We had a great 3 days!

Summary Heading: Beautiful Place, Ridiculously Good Customer Service
Summary: Stayed four nights beginning June 29th. Initially my family and I were placed in a room overlooking the CA park, but I had paid for a Downtown Disney view room. I was given an explanation about premium view rooms having three varaiables, and I think the park view was actually a bit more pricey, but it didn't matter: Our daughter had asked me a couple of months ago if we could  get a DTD view room; that's what I booked and so I politely insisted we be moved. We spent one night over looking the park and the following three nights overlooking the sights and sounds of DTD. The room, balcony and view was as awesome as we imagined it. The experience was perfect, the room was immaculate and the service in and around the hotel was off the hook! We stayed twice at the original Disneyland

Which is precisely what you are paying for.  Similar to the Wilderness Lodge at Disney World in many respects (though not quite as many cool features in my view).  Rooms are typical Disney - small but well designed and the beds are very comfortable.  Like most Disney hotels the bathroom is cramped.  Pool was not as clever as some Disney properties though beach chairs were easily the best I had seen at a Disney property - very comfy.  Pay laundry available - $3 each for washer and dryer - what can I say, Disney milks every nickel out of you they can.  What we did love was watching World of Color from the top floor deck overlooking CA Adventure - make sure to get there a little early as there is a rush to get in just as the show starts - you can't see it fully but you get the

Upon arrival was upgraded to El Capitan Suite.  What an amazing surprise.  Love the ability to walk in and out of California Adventure at will.  Couldn't have asked for a better resort and the staff was amazing.

The suite we stayed in was very nice. Two bedrooms ( one King, the other two queen) with a pull out sofa and Murphy bed in the great room.  Three full baths, too.  Well equipped kitchen.  There is a company that will deliver groceries to the hotel for you.  We took advantage of this because the restaurants are highly priced (although this was expected). Our rooms overlooked the park and we could enjoy much of the World of Color water show from our balconies.  Allowing guests an extra hour in California Adventure enabled us to enjoy the rides we wanted with no or very little wait time.

Summary Heading: So close, So nice, So expensive
Summary: I will join the majority of the reviewers that have nothing really bad to say about the Grand Californian, except for the crazy price.  We have stayed at Paradise Pier before, and my girls actually requested that we return there on our next visit.  We also visit Walt Disney World often and have stayed in nearly every resort at WDW.  We would likely not stay at the Grand Californian again.  Customer service was top notch.  Location was amazing.  Our room overlooked the private entrance to CA Adventure, and it took us 60 seconds to walk down to the entrance.  That was exciting for our kids!  However, the walk to Disneyland was a lot longer because we had to walk around the whole hotel to get out to DTD.    Our room was nice, but quite small.  The rooms at Paradise Pier were a lot

What a beautiful hotel so reminiscent of Yosemite's Ahwahnee Hotel. So convenient to get into Disney California Adventure for early morning access and to return for a break from the park. The hotel is spendy, as are the hotel food options, but convenience to the Disney parks and Downtown Disney make it worth it. Customer service you'd expect from Disney runs rampant throughout the hotel. Walt would be proud!

Located next to Disney's California Adventure park, Hotel guest have their own entrance to the park at the hotel.   With Disney's downtown Disney just steps away from the main entrance of the hotel and convenient with the parking trams and the Disneyland monorail nearby.

We loved the hotel. It had all the Disney you could hope for. The hotel was huge and we had a long walk from our room to the lobby/park. The best part about the hotel was the direct connection to California Adventure. This saves the feet with all the walking around the park. Also, guests get the magic morning every day. So nice to beat the crowd. We have young children so we go early and nap during the peak. There definitely cheaper places to stay around the park but this trip was definitely memorable!

Summary Heading: Read before booking on line - Not like all the other hotels
Summary: So I decided to bite the bullet and take my daughter to Disney california and pay the extremely high price for the Grand Californian. So I booked on line. When the transaction was complete it said that the entire balance was due 30 days before checkin. Only tells you about a 200 deposit before that. So then I go to call. I am in Canada and do not have a US plan. They do not have a toll free number. So in order to cancel my reservation I had to get a us package. Also I sent two emails with no response. I talked to someone online who assured me that the 714 number was toll free (it is not). So after waiting 10 or so minutes on the phone they cancelled my reservation and were unable to send me an email confirming the cancellation even though I got an emailed confirmation when I

Summary Heading: Perfect Base for a first visit
Summary: Our family (kids ages 14, 11 and 9) stayed here for four nights during our Disneyland visit.  We are East Coasters who won't be getting back there soon and wanted to make the most of our stay.  This was the perfect choice. There is actually a gate into the park right in the hotel.  It was so convenient to grab a coffee and a light breakfast and head directly into the park from our own hotel, just steps from our room!  The lobby was beautiful - gorgeous decor evoking the woodsy feel of the national parks, staff was impeccable (as Disney staff usually is), the pool was refreshing and the life guards were more than attentive. Since we are a family of 5, and two of the children are now taller than I am, we need a little more space.  So we stayed in one of the 1 bedroom villas.  We

Summary Heading: Perfect location to start your Disney adventure
Summary: We took our 8 year old grandson to Disneyland for the first time. To see Disneyland through a child's eye is awesome. The hotel is the perfect location. It was clean, safe, great pools and family friendly. The staff goes out of their way to give you the best experience ever. We had the park hopper package and the early entry. The one hour entry makes such a difference to go on the more popular rides first. We had the special concierge level room. We would go to the parks and come back for a little refuge from the crowds and have a snack or a glass of wine. We even watched the firework show from the balcony. The Walt Disney dream is still going on at this hotel. For a once in a lifetime experience stay here and let yourself go in all things Disney. Don't forgot to look for the

Summary Heading: First stay, not what I was hoping
Summary: I suppose you're kind of asking for it if you stay at the Disney Grand Californian Hotel during the last week of June. It was overrun with so many people who were there to enjoy the theme parks. I had been hoping that the hotel would be a relaxing respite when we needed to escape from the parks - and that simply was not the case. The pool area was crazy crowded. It was noisy all the time - and you couldn't get away from the noise in your own room. Like some other reviewers, I paid more for the premium view, expecting a great view of the parks. Instead, a second-floor room with an obstructed view of the pool also qualifies as premium. Had I known this, I would not have paid extra. All of this said, the staff did a really good job at keeping up with the throngs of visitors.

This was our second stay at the Grand Californian. (Our last trip to Disneyland was an extended one, so we tried out all three on-site properties.) The Grand Californian being our favorite, we decided to stay here again on our most recent trip back "home".  I would think that the average family traveler is searching for a place to stay during their Disneyland vacation and seeing the price tag of the Grand is wondering "is it really worth it?"  And my answer would be yes...and no.  Hopefully, my review will help your family decide if it's "worth it" for you!  The d√©cor has not changed since our last stay. It's tasteful and we enjoy the "woodsy" theming, the front lobby is truly grand-- and something about it is relaxing and helps calm you after the hustle and bustle of the parks

Summary Heading: Not what it used to be, premium view not worth it
Summary: We stayed at the Disney Grand Californian Hotel for my 40th birthday.  The hotel was grand and nice and we got the premium view room so we can watch the world of colors from our room as we have two little kids.    The room was really small, I can barely push my double stroller in the door.  Once we got through the door, the kids have to hop off and i have to fold up the stroller as there is no area that I can put the stroller and still be able to walk around.  The balcony has a covering on top so it makes the balcony dark and small.  We have the view of Goofy's sky school so most of the things were blocked.  As someone had mentioned before, the world of color is best view from DCA and it was basically a waste for us to watch it from the room as we can't really tell what is going

Usually we are on a budget, and the Grand is out of our price range. This time, we saved up and stayed 4 nights at this fantastic hotel. From the moment we walked into the building and waited for a few minutes at the check in desk, we were greeted like family members returning home. Loved the access to the parks and everything about our stay. We tried the Disneyland Hotel once as well, and though it was very nice, it did not compare with the overall quality and simple pleasures of the Grand. From now on, when we visit Disneyland, we'll be staying exclusively at the Grand!

Basic room with partial view of California Adventure rides, lobby is very nice and employees were helpful. The cost of this hotel per night is outrageous. We used the pool one night but it was very crowded because 2 of the 3 pools were not opened at that time. The best thing about this hotel is the side entrance to California Adventure Park and the short distance to Downtown Disney.  The location was great since we didn't rent a car and just stayed in that area for 4 days, but I will never pay that price again for the convenience. Not a luxury hotel as advertised.

As a DVC member we have stayed in many Disney resorts. The Grand California has to be the worst. Tiny rooms for so many points. The walls were paper thin, you could hear the family next door as if they were in our room. It was so bad we could hear the father snoring. 98 percent of the staff did not smile or even make eye contact. The first day we visited the Quick Serve restaurant the woman bringing our trays rudely dropped the trays on our tables and stormed off (nothing we did or said). The pools are small for a resort this size and were overcrowded. We had to sit on a brick wall to dry out. The self parking lot is far and you have to cross a busy 4 lane road to get there. The employees coming and going to work walk this same pathway and look miserable as they walk past you

From the time we walked through the doors, it was luxury.  While in the very short check in line on a recent visit with my 15 year old daughter, we were asked our name, then escorted to the check in desk and introduced to the desk clerk.  Our room was ready, despite being 3 hours early for check in time.  Our room was on the 5th floor.  Beautiful!!  Everything in working order and beautifully appointed.  Robes in the closet and mints on the pillows.  We were in a courtyard room, the monorail right outside which was fun to watch and so silent we had no idea it was there when we tried to sleep.  Additionally, we could see the fireworks from Disneyland from our balcony.  As if that wasn't enough, a kind hotel clerk let us know there was an additional viewing area on the roof.  The

Summary Heading: Not Up to the Disney Standard
Summary: Very disappointing, especially since this is supposed to be the deluxe hotel.  We have stayed in many Disney World Deluxe resorts, and this one pales in comparison.  Staff didn't seem to care at all.  They were just there doing their job.  Toward the end I started writing messages in the dust on the furniture to see if the cleaning staff would notice and finally clean.  First two nights had turn down service, but I guess they "forgot" the rest of our stay.  Shower was pathetic, but that may be due to the water shortage.   It certainly didn't inspire you to stay in too long.  Never enough pool chairs.  You basically had to stalk people as they left to get one chair for your entire family.  The only good thing I can say about this hotel is it's location.  Very convenient to

A monstrous hotel, with darker than necessary corridors, BUT it is exceedingly well run, efficient, totally tied into the theme park and just a wonderful place to use as your base while visiting either of the adjacent theme parks. In room service is very good, 24 hours and dependable.

The staff at this hotel are very well trained and accommodating.  Our rooms were always cleaned in a timely manner along with turn down.  The restaurants were different foods and varied in price range...most of all very kid friendly for our 5 grandchildren The original Disneyland, California Adventure and Downtown Disney were all greatly enjoyed by our family.  All walking distance from each other and we simply took the shuttle from the airport to the hotel. It was summed up, by my 8 year old grandson, "PawPaw this was the best vacation ever!"

Great hotel. Comfortable rooms and beds.  Three nice pools with comfortable lounge chairs.  Convenient to Disneyland, Grand California Adventure, and Downtown Disney.  We had club level service and the refreshments throughout the day were great.

Great location.  Next to Disney California Adventure.  Easy entry to parks and Downtown Disney.  Great service by staff.  Nice room and great view.  Kids enjoyed the pool and hot tub.  Food was OK, but expensive.

The check-in was quick and all the staff were friendly. Kids loved the pools and the water slides. This Hotel is the closet to the Disneyland. When you first walk in the room, you don't get that disney feel. The room decor and furniture is just worn and old. Beside the room, everything else was great.

We had an amazing time! It was expensive, but worth every penny! We are a family of 5 and our kids are 2,5,6 so we knew we wanted to be close. We paid for a premium view and it was great. We had a view of downtown Disney and got to see the fireworks right from our balcony. It's a quick walk into California adventures. The room itself isn't super fancy but the bunk beds were perfect for us and we knew that we were paying for convenience not luxury. The pool was super cool, the magic morning was great! The Storytellers breakfast was awesome. All in all if I had to do it all over again I'd do the same thing.

Great location for Disneyland, Great service from staff, Easy entry and exit into disneywalk so if you needed a rest you didn't have to go far.We had a standard or basic room and that was basically it, Room aside it was a great stay but on the pricey side.

Summary Heading: Very Convenient Place to Stay with Kids
Summary: Access to the parks, especially, Disney California Adventure is excellent. We like the convenience of having our hotel close to the park, as we go in first thing in the morning, and then take a break in the middle of the day when lines are longest and temperatures are hottest. Then we return around 4:00 to explore some more. Our mid-afternoon breaks are also a good time to take the kids to the pool and I would say the pool here was excellent. This hotel was very convenient for all of this. It also allowed us to watch World of Color and be back in our room in less than 10 minutes after it had ended. The hotel is nice, but for the cost I wouldn't say that the amenities, decor or service really stand out, but the access and convenience do. My family really values the time savings

I feel truly fortunate that my family and I can stay at this resort when we visit Disneyland. As a DVC member, we book in the Villa's, and it is wonderful having a full kitchen. I found the resort to be clean, convenient and spectacular. The private entrance into California Adventure is also pretty amazing.  I highly recommend this resort to anyone visiting Disneyland. Just one tip. Put the 'do not disturb' on your door on the day you are checking out, or housekeeping will be pounding on the door from 8am! So not cool...

This was my first stay at this hotel and I loved every minute of it. The location to getting to and from the Disney Parks can not be beat when your feet are tired. The pool area is large and has food and drink service so the kids can play while the adults lounge and relax. The onsite restaurant is nice for a dinner or lunch. The staff was all helpful and friendly and answered all my questions. I may never make another Disney trip if I can't stay at this hotel.

Summary Heading: Nice Disneyland Trip and stay at the Grand Californian
Summary: We had a two room suite at the Grand Californian and it was very nice.  Can't give the whole place and "excellent" as it's overpriced and overcrowded, but all in, we do it every time and the family really enjoyed being right next to the park.

This was our second time here but this past visit, we received a fantastic deal online for a Monday-Wednesday stay!  Even less than some hotels that were nearby and off of Disney property.  You can beat the location.  The hotel has its own private access/entry to California Adventure Park.  So when you get tired, you can just get to your room quickly. And there's a private entrance to Downtown Disney.  Room was average but adequate for our family.  The "lodge" downstairs was very inviting and comfortable.  And the lounge/bar was great (although a little pricey for drinks). As always, the staff was outstanding! Just be sure to check rates directly on the hotel website for weekly "flash" deals.  And consider staying during the beginning of week for cheaper rates.

Summary Heading: Great location and resort to see Disneyland
Summary: We stayed for 6 nights & 7 days with our 18month old daughter and 5 year old son. We had a great Disney experience. As the resort has direct entry to California adventure park and close to Disneyland no shuttle or bus is required each day allowing more time to enjoy the theme parks. The staff are friendly, amenities are awesome and rooms are comfortably 5 star. Would definitely stay again & recommend all our family and friends to stay there

This was my first time to Disneyland and we decided to stay here because past reviews from people said it was one of the best. That being said it was OK but not great- high prices but not overly friendly; a few staff people were good and helpful but several you would walk by and they sort of looked past you unless you said something first. I would not stay here again for the rates they charge.

This hotel was exactly what we were hoping for.  We had a family of 17 coming and they put us all right next to each other.  The rooms were clean and they had turndown service on several of the nights.  We did have to ask for towels several Times because they did not give us enough but other than that everything was fabulous.  We would definitely stay here again!  Pools were great but hard to find chairs.  Love being in the park..location makes this Hotel the place to stay.

We recently travelled from Australia to have a 'trip of a life time' with our family. On advice regarding the location of the hotel we chose this site. To be frank, our experience was appalling from the beginning.   Despite a request for an early check in (and prior checking that we would not need to pay for an extra night for convenience, with both our travel agent and the hotel directly, which we were happy to do), we could not get a room until well after 3pm, which after an all night flight was not what we expected. None of the staff could point us to a suitable area to get a meal, beyond recommending Downtown Disney. No one seemed to be able to show us the clear way there, though some helpful guests did.   Our induction into the Concierge (lounge) area for which we paid

Summary Heading: By Disney standards, this was ho-hum
Summary: On our family's first-ever Disneyland visit - we have been to Disney World a half-dozen times in the last decade - we decided to continue our tradition on staying at a Disney hotel. The Grand Californian did not disappoint but it didn't stand out either.  My observations:  -The location and staying-on-Disney-property benefits were great. It's an easy walk to either park and to Downtown Disney.  -The direct entrance to California Adventure is absolutely convenient. But on extra-magic-hour mornings, it makes more sense to walk to the park. It would be nice if they either shared that with guests or improved the express entrance. We lost close to 30 minutes of the hour just waiting in line, making us wonder if the premium price os worth it.  -After staying in deluxe Disney resorts

We visited DLR and DCA for the very first time a couple of weeks ago and stayed at the Grand Californian. I write this review from the aspect of a family who have been to WDW many times and stayed at all levels of Disney hotels. We stayed 4 nights and park hoppered the 2 parks for 3 days before ending our trip to Southern California at Dodger Stadium.   We reserved a preferred view room and upon check-in around 5p on a Tuesday afternoon, we asked if it would be possible to get a room with a murphy/day bed for our ever growing 13 year old son. The cast member worked to see what he could do (this did take about 20 minutes) and we were offered an upgraded view of the parks for an extra $24/night to have that type of room. We went for it and stayed in Room 5444. It had a view of the

Summary Heading: If You Have Children the Convenience of the Grand Californian Overcomes Any Limitations of this Hotel
Summary: There is no other hotel that even comes close to the Grand Californian for easy access in and out of the theme parks, especially California Adventure.  My wife and I just got back from a one-night stay - 2-park hopper tickets  - with two grandchildren ages 10 and 14, and the location of the hotel was perfect for early access and coming and going during the day to take care of whatever came up.  Agree that the hotel is getting slightly tired and is overpriced, but we found the convenience trumped for our two young adventurers.

Summary Heading: Got to stay here if you are going to Disney
Summary: This place is all about the location.  This hotel doesn't have the biggest or the most luxurious rooms for the price.  You are basically paying for the location and service.  The hotel is grand and when you first walk in, the lobby is just amazing.  It is so beautiful and large with rocking chairs to sit on by the fireplace and small chairs surrounding a little TV for the kids.  There is a grand piano played by a pianist everyday.  The unfortunate thing is that the lobby is easy access to any park goer that people who are not staying at the hotel would come in and occupy every chair in the lobby for respite.  The room is small but adequate since we are not in the room much.  Our room had a queen size bed and a bunk bed for my kids which they loved.  There are two sinks at least

We are DVC members and had a one-bed villa here.  The resort is gorgeous and everyone is very friendly and helpful.  The villa was large and spacious and beautifully decorated.  All the amenities needed - 2 bathrooms (love this feature in the newer one-bed villas).  The bed was super comfy and so were the pillows (bought one).  The showers were awesome - the main shower is huge with a seat (love this feature).  The living room is large with a murphy bed.  Large seating area for kitchen table and beautiful large galley kitchen with breakfast bar and island.  There is a washer and dryer.  The bedroom is spacious and there is a large balcony that you can access from the bedroom and the living room.  In the master bathroom there is a large vanity, Jacuzzi and separate water closet.

Summary Heading: Way Over priced for what you get
Summary: I recently stayed here for my daughters HS graduation gift. I paid $800  a night for a room with a premium view. When they put me in room 2021 overlooking a gravel rooftop I was extremely upset. I normally stay at Super 8 for $50 a night and can see the fireworks. It's the FIRST time I have ever been so disappointing by Disney and have been going for the past 50 years! I immediately shared my complaint at the front desk and they moved me to a better room on the 4th floor with a slight view of the walkway in front of Soarin'. It was better but not a "premium" view for $800. Housekeeping also took my jacket and water bottle which I had left in the room so I didn't have to carry them. When I came back at dusk to get my jacket, they were gone. So, again, I had to contact staff to

I think everyone should stay here at least one time if they get the chance. I love staying here everytime I go to Disneyland. For me it's calm and peaceful with the music they play outdoors. I absolutely adore the theme of the hotel and love the amenities as well.

Summary Heading: Location, Location, Location: Really great access to the parks!
Summary: We love staying at the Grand Californian Hotel - after a long day at the parks it is just so easy to get back to the hotel (especially with a special entrance from Grand CA to Ca Advt Park).  We stay onsite for the daily extra magic hour early entrance into either DL or Ca Advt.  That one hour is so worth it for the cost of the hotel to be able to ride so many rides!  The entrance lobby is spectacular, piano playing, and a nice lobby bar.  The pools are nice, not really heated very much, but fun despite the colder water.  White Water Snacks is very good to stop by for a quick bite in the morning on the way into Ca Advt (again during that early hour!)  This was our third stay, the first time we had a GREAT view of Ca Advt, last time we had a view of the valet parking, and this

Summary Heading: One of Disney's happiest places on earth.
Summary: This is our second time staying at Disney's Grand Californian. You cannot beat the location. The walk-in, private entrance into the park is amazing. It's even better with an extra hour every morning. Highly recommend getting the park hopper passes. Not necessary, but it makes it more fun when you can go from park to park for your favorite rides (and get fastpasses in each park for quicker lines). It was a total immersion in Disney happiness. Only one small issue - gurgling bathroom drain at night when trying to go to sleep. Other than the annoying drain, the rooms were very nice. Adequate swimming area and water slide, but nothing special. Exercise room was very comfortable and it is nice to start the day off with fresh fruit. Everyone at the resort (and parks) were amazing.

I stayed at the Disney Grand Californian Hotel as part of a family reunion, we managed to get 4 rooms near to each other and our rooms faced the pool area.  The food was plentiful and there was lots of choice.  Access to the parks was very easy via the walkway within the hotel.  The character breakfasts are great.  Only downside for me is I felt that the hotel was very dark, I know its themed but the huge grand reception hall was just really dark and depressing!  It is of course an expensive hotel but probably not one you should stay at if you are overly budget conscious unless you get a great deal when booking.

We checked-in around 1 but our room wasn't ready. The cake that we brought there to keep in the fridge malted. WIFI was not working. Showers did not drain. We asked for knives and the plates and they charged  $5!!  I can go on and on... Last time!!

Many reviews echo the same themes...great location button the money it's ultimately not worth it until they refresh it. The word that kept coming to mind was "tired." The room layout itself was great...separate living room and bedroom and two full bathrooms...a very nice touch when staying with 2 kids. The room decor and furniture is just worn and old. The pool area is fine but I prefer the Disneyland Hotel pools actually. You're paying for location and if you accept that going into it, you'll be fine. Once they revamp it a bit and refresh everything, it will be great but not there right now.

As a huge Disney fan (who mostly visits the East coast) and someone who had never stayed at a Disney Resort before, I really wanted to write a great review about the Grand Californian, but our 2-night stay really was a mixed bag.  There's plenty of things to like about the place - the staff are friendly and efficient, and the check-in process was smooth. The hotel is huge, and the art and craft architecture is amazing. Aside from the general amenities such as pool, gym, shops and restaurants, you can also get into California Adventure through the hotel's own private entrance. And upon checking out, all I needed to tell Guest Services was my airline, booking reference and surname, and they printed off my airline tickets for me.  I booked two rooms, which were spacious and

This place seems great due to location, but it's such a maze to get to our room it actually took longer than when we walked from hotels across the street.  The theming is great, but that can be enjoyed by anybody whether or not you're staying there. Nothing I saw justifies the high price. Service was great though, no problems and they went above and beyond.

Summary Heading: Location, location, location back door leads into California Adventureland.
Summary: Got money? Stay here. You are THE closest you can get to Disneyland. Steps away from downtown  Disney. If a child needs to nap, you are in the best location possible. The pools are amazing the foyer is amazing, the shops are amazing, the staff is amazing, the restaurants, especially Napa Rose are amazing.   What's not to  like? A classy place, the best Anaheim/ Disney to offer, I think.   Please let me know if this was helpful!

Summary Heading: The Best Vacation Ever right in the heart of Disneyland!
Summary: Stayed in a 2-bedroom villa for 5 days with a large family.  The hotel is humongous, with a lobby that looks like a grand, gigantic yet cozy log cabin.  Unit itself was very clean, spacious and complete with standard home appliances (stove, microwave, refrigerator, dishwasher, washing machine and dryer), kitchenware and utensils .  Beds and pillows were very very comfortable.  One of the hotel's entrances takes you directly to Disney's California Adventure while another takes you directly to Downtown Disney. These are then connected to Disneyland. Hotel guests can enjoy the parks earlier than the rest of the parks' visitors.

We spent two nights at this hotel and it wasn't what i was expecting. The rooms were average and so was the food. Fire alarm went off twice and we were force to evacuate around 11 o clock at night so very inconvenient, supposedly kitchen issues. One good thing is you are right there inside the park so no need for driving or parking.

I have not been dissatisfied with any DVC resort until now at Disney's Grand Californian (maybe just our room)   1. Absolutely no wifi  2. No view / no balcony railing  3. Bottom floor DVC rooms? (was told that wasn't a possibility) 4. Shower kind of works  5. Not worth using DVC at this resort   This is a poor rating solely based on our room.   The theme is amazing, gorgeous as expected, resort has its own entrance to california adventure which is nice just be aware there's still a line in the AM which I expected it's Disney.   Overall very convenient location as far as Disneyland goes. Everything's right here.   The pool is nice quiet. There are a few food options nothing that great same old. The retail shop is lacking what most DVC resorts offer.

First time staying at the Grand Californian.  We were in town for a convention and decided to take advantage of the rate.   Disney trips have always been high powered, on the go, stay at a bargain hotel because you're never in the room, etc.  It's just the nature of the beast.  As long as the rooms were clean we didn't complain.  Well, we were amazed at how QUIET our room was at the Grand Californian!  Every single night I slept great!  Our room was on the second floor looking into the California Adventure park, literally behind the Goofy's Sky School roller coaster.  Even in that location, when the sliding glass door was closed, it was quiet.   The standard 2 bed rooms have 2 queen beds which beat the usual full/double size you'll find everywhere else.  Beds are amazing, linens

I've stayed at all three properties in Anaheim. This time, we had a great pass-holder rate and I chose Grand Californian as it's close to both parks. We checked-in around 11 but our room wasn't ready, came back around 2:50 and it still wasn't ready. Dennis at check-in went off to talk to someone and came back to tell us we had been given an upgraded view on the 5th floor. It was too. We sat on the balcony watching the fireworks, and doesn't get better unless sitting on a bench in front of the castle. The beds were comfortable and the room has a small fridge. In the evening we could sit on the balcony and listen to the music below and watch people. Enough room on the balcony to move around if someone is sitting in a chair. Maid service was done early in the morning, they must

Stayed here from the 20th thru the 25th of May in a 2 bedroom villa. What an experience for our 1st ever family vacation. The villa was spacious enough to easily accommodate our party of 8. The use of the washer and dryer was also an added plus, as well as the full kitchen. I cannot imagine staying anywhere else the next time we go to Disneyland!

Summary Heading: Not a Four Seasons-like property, but best choice for Disneyland!
Summary: We stayed for 3 nights over Memorial Day Weekend.  Check-in:  Our check-in process was a little rough late on a Friday night----we had requested and paid for a premium view room (we wanted a view of the park with all the lights for our toddler)---instead we received an interior view of the edge of the pool.  That view is NOT worth any extra money.  After talking with room reservation specialists on-site and begging, they magically found us the perfect room on the even side of the 42** number rooms.  The view was truly amazing (loud during the day because the roller coaster was right there, but the night views and the sounds/lights from the water show were awesome)!  They should really separate out the room categories better and allow you to pay more for the specific view you

Stayed in the Grand Californian to celebrate my son's 7th birthday, we had a lovely time, he enjoyed it so much that he decided to relax at the hotel instead of going into the park, in his defense we are pass holders so he goes often.  The pools were wonderful so we decided to spend the day there and have dinner at the Storytellers Caf√©, which has the highlight of the trip. The accomodations were great and the big plus for my husband and myself was the early entry into California Adventure the next morning.  While the line to get in at 7am was not short, they managed to cover most of the park in the first two hours and we were able to go over to Disneyland and enjoy the day.  The viewing deck was not that great of a view of World of Color, but it saved us a trip and we were able

We stayed here for 5 nights to attend the Disneyland 60th Celebration.  Loved the hotel, lobby is fabulous and location is excellent.  We were disappointed we did not get a king bed, but everything else was to our liking.   Room and bathroom were clean and spotless.  Overall, a great hotel.

Summary Heading: Care & Comfort During a Medical Emergency
Summary: This was our second stay at The Grand. We were familiar with the gorgeous interior,  friendly service and amazing location but The Grand went above any expectations we had.   Shortly after checking in, we dropped off our items in our room and made our way to Disneyland. Minutes after exiting hotel and strolling in Downtown Disney my four year old son experienced a seizure. It was the most terrifying experience of my life. I called 911 and the first to arrive were the Disney Medics, then the paramedics. At the same time the manager of Downtown Disney was by my side making sure my daughter and I were taken care of while my husband rode in the ambulance with my son.   I was escorted back to the Grand Hotel where I was told that the hotel would provide transportation to/from the

We had such an awesome experience staying here! The room was clean, the food was good, the location was phenomenal! It might be expensive but its well worth the money. Our balcony overlooked the woods and the California Adventure. Our kids loved every moment.

After staying at the Disney World hotels, this was a big disappointment. It was nowhere near as nice as the moderate level resorts at Disney World. Without comparing this hotel to a Disney world hotel, it was not very clean. I found a pubic hair in the tub on the first night when I was bathing. The hotel sent someone up the next day to do a "thorough" cleaning. It was a very busy and crowded hotel. I would not stay here again.

We were fortunate to receive a stay in a suite here as a gift. The rooms were beautiful. Beds and bedding comfortable, bathrooms spotless. The lobby was a destination in itself. Big beautiful pools and quick access to the Disneyland Parks. Fun restaurants with Disney characters.

Several months in advance, we planned a trip to Disneyland and had our niece, who is a travel planner for Disney, book us in to the Disneyland Hotel, where we had previously enjoyed an excellent stay.  Several weeks before the trip, she called us to advise of a special at the Grand Californian by which we could book the same number of nights at a better rate than the Disneyland Hotel.  We had been through the lobby at the Grand Californian during our last stay, had been impressed, and expected an exceptional stay. We were disappointed.  The "can do" attitude of the staff at the Disneyland Hotel impressed us.  As soon as we arrived at the GC, we encountered a "we will see what we can do" attitude.  We made better time traveling than expected.  In his day and age of flight delays

After surviving hours in LA Traffic to get to the Hotel, it is incredibly fun and maybe a bit bizarre to be met at the parking kiosk by a smiling, almost dancing attendant!  Proceed onto the Valet Parking and the smilingest group of valets running around like a Disney Cartoon!  We were fairly quickly greeted at the reception desk and guided to our room.    There is a lovely spa on the premises where I received an excellent manicure and pedicure while my husband attended business meetings.  There are 3 centrally located pools and one pool with a waterslide that looked like a lot of fun for the kiddies and there were ample large jacuzzi type spas throughout the pool area. FYI, there is bar service at the pool and wait staff that will bring drinks and munchies poolside!  I was

To start with, the Grand Californian commands a premium price over the other two Disney properties and a large premium over the "Good Neighbor" hotels in the area.   With that said, I expected an over the top Disney experience... It didn't happen.  Not to detract from what is a nice, clean and spacious hotel, it just isn't special.    The Arts & Crafts style is much touted but the effect is that the hotel is just plain dark inside.   It is a jarring contrast going in and out of the Southern California sun and this moody dark hotel.     With Disney's usual efficiency, the check-in and check-out process were straightforward and hassle free, the restaurants in the hotel were good and the free wifi was welcome.  The largest tangible benefit though was the proximity to the California

The hotel lobby is gorgeous! There was a long line at Check-in but, the cast members were there to entertain and to manage the line.  Thank you to the castmember at registration (I'm sorry I didn't remember your name) I wanted to upgrade to a king room with DTD view. All of the DTD view rooms were booked. However, the cast member said he knew that he could put us in courtyard room with a partial view of downtown Disney, no additional cost. It was great! Had view of the Disneyland fireworks from the corner of our balcony (given its not the best view but I was happy!).  The room was good and clean. The bed could have been a little softer but it was alright...The rooms need to be updated, but the main thing is you're paying for location. Access to DCA through the hotel is awesome.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay at least once...
Summary: We got to stay here in a standard 2 bed room (still nearly $400 per night) because a relative was attending a nearby conference.  This hotel is BIG and the lobby is impressive, designed in the style of a Lake Tahoe lodge.  Amenities you would expect with any high end hotel including spa, fitness center, large pool area.  The pool was a bit disappointing because the water slide was not working for most of the days we were there.  We had the chance to do the Chip and Dale Critter Breakfast at  the hotel's Storyteller's Cafe.  It was a bit pricey for what we got, although the Mickey waffles are delish and the characters did an awesome job of entertaining us.  The very best part of this hotel, in my opinion, it the HOTEL GUESTS ONLY entrance which takes you right into California

Our family had an amazing weekend at Disneyland celebrating my husband and granddaughters birthdays. The hotel made it easy to enjoy both parks with two small children. It allowed us early access to the parks one hour before it opened.

This is our 2nd time staying at this hotel and after further review.... We are not sold on the hotel and esp. at the price point. This is the only Disney standard themed hotel on the Disneyland Property. The grand entrance looks like the Wilderness Lodge and at cheaper price point I would go to WL. We feel the Disneyland Hotel has better themed rooms and hallways. After the entrance into the GCH you are then greeted with a wood theme throughout the hotel. This is great for a hotel in Southern California, right? The rooms are tight as they are so very close together. Take a look at the outside of the hotel you will see how close the balconies are to each other. Check in works, bell hopes work, car park work. The pool is average at best. There is simply three different pools to

Summary Heading: Just Average. Left disappointed. Will not stay here again.
Summary: I completely regret not booking with one of the other two hotels instead of the Grand Californian. Check in time is supposed to be 3:30, however we did not get our room until almost 4:30. The rooms were average and nothing had that wow factor that I was expecting since it was a Disney resort. Nothing was above and beyond, customer service was par, room furniture was banged up quite a bit, and shower tile had mold. Convenient access to California Adventure was great, but still a ways away from Disneyland. For a quarter of the price, I could have had far superior room staying at the Sheraton and it's really not that much further away from the Disneyland park. We will not stay here again. I might try one of the other two hotels instead, but for now, Grand Californian is off my list.
