Summary Heading: Close to Disney is the BONUS
Summary: Great property with amazing customer service. The hotel quest only access to the park is what make it worth the stay. the rooms where good, a little out  dated buy still amazing  Disney downtown , oh so close as well  And of course the nain park...5 min walk  Overall great and will stay again

Stayed three nights..concierge level. Pricey? Yes. Worth it? Definitely. This hotel does not have a Disney "feel"  (Bambi on the shower curtain and a print of Snow White are the only indication of Disney in the room) but is a very upscale resort. Rooms are appropriate for this type of accommodation.  Concierge level has free wifi,  a lounge for breakfast/light snacks/appetizers/deserts til 10p along with drinks (including wine/beer) Can view Disneyland fireworks from the balcony although projections on castle/small world are not visible. I asked if pineapple juice was available and was told it was not but they would send someone to the restaurant downstairs to get it if required. Were able to get tickets and make dinner reservations with concierge staff on duty until 10p, They

We just came back from a 3 day trip to celebrate our grandson's 3rd birthday. We had adjoining rooms and the view of the Grizzly Bear Mountain was fantastic. We love the ambiance of the California Grand because it reminds us so much of the Ahwahnee Hotel in Yosemite which is one of our favorite hotels. The Grand is pricey, especially the view rooms, and it definitely is not a 5 star room. The carpet felt very dirty, the bathroom door was on rollers and very noisy when opening and closing. The beds were very comfy though. Unfortunately my daughter had to wait an hour and half for their luggage to be delivered which made the little boys unhappy as they were eager to get to the pool and didn't have their suits. When we called to ask about delivery, the man was quite rude and said

This is a nice hotel but I wouldn't rate it a 5star. It's extremely expensive because it joins Disneylands theme parks great convenient location but that's about it. The rooms are very out dated and old looking, the showers are step in baths with shower curtains and there is hardly any water pressure. The bed was comfortable but only a queen size they don't have many king size rooms.There is a small balcony but not many rooms have any sort of a view. Room service was ridiculously expensive with the food, tax, surcharge and tip you are better off taking food to your room. The walls were so thin I could hear the man in the room next door snoring all night. You can't even use the vending machines to buy any food or drinks in this hotel as they only except credit cards no notes or

One of the best, but I was expecting more.  The room was small for the price we payed.  The location was great spot after a long day at the parks.  We had a short walk to a clean room with a great view of the park.   We relaxed in the jacuzzi after a long day. Customer service was great, I lost my case at one of the stores and they it was found and returned it to me as soon as I was home.

Summary Heading: Resort pricing for hotel level quality
Summary: We have stayed in many Disney resorts. The Grand Californian does not live up to the standards we have come to expect. The room (a studio) was spacious and clean but a little dated. The room darkening curtains over the patio doors were full of holes. Service was substandard. When we arrived, there were dirty room service dishes outside of our door. Our neighbor kept pushing them in front of our door and yelled at me for moving them away from the door telling me they weren't hers. That means they had to have belonged to the previous residents of the room. (We didn't check in until after 5.) We tried to call guest services by pushing the button marked guest services on the phone. After 10 tries with no answer, my husband walked the dishes to the front desk. He was told he needed

My daughter, her fiance and I took my mom to Disneyland on May 19. As a special treat and also because both my mom and I have physical disabilities we decided to stay at the Grand Californian. My daughter and I stayed there for my birthday several years ago and fell in love with it. I have a Disney annual passport and was able to get a discount. It's very easy to make a reservation on line. A week before our trip I called the desk about renting electric scooters for us. They gave me the name of the company they deal with and I arranged to have 2 scooters waiting for us when we checked in. The cast member not only found us an open room so we could check in early but upgraded us at no charge when I explained it was my mom's last trip to Disneyland. As always all of the cast

thru the pool area and into the park...  easy as that Lovely rooms, excellent service  (Beds are pretty high off ground ... but still 5 stars since my grandson managed to stay atop all night) We ate at StoryTellers Rrestaurant which was excellent Also, if you need a scooter... Deckert Surgical... they work with hotel... deliver and pick up there, bellman charges battery overnight... cheaper than park rental and better by far.

If you‚Äôve been to the lodge at Yellowstone National Park, you‚Äôll feel nostalgic when you walk into the Grand Californian. Like Yellowstone, everything in this lobby is on a grand scale. There is a huge fireplace and numerous sitting areas filled with couches and chairs. Unlike Yellowstone, there is an area with small chairs and a television playing Disney cartoons.    You can check in anytime you arrive, but you won‚Äôt get your room number until 4:00 PM. The hotel texts you the room number and then you can proceed directly to your room with the key they gave at checkin. Around 3:00 PM the lobby fills up with people anxious to get to their room, some people tipped over in chairs or lying full out on a couch sleeping. Even with such a large lobby, it can be difficult during that

Decided to stay on the resort and don't regret any bit of it. You pull up to the front of the hotel where a valet unloads your car for you. We went for the early check-in so that we could maximize our time there.  The service is phenomenal here -- they walk you through everything. We were given buttons to wear on lanyards to announce birthdays, anniversaries, etc. Throughout the park people and staff would address you by name and tell you Happy Birthday for example. The buttons also equated to different discounts in different store and/or restaurants.   The rooms are beautiful as is the hotel --- a magical stay!   A word to the wise -- watch on line for cheaper rates -- they will fluctuate depending on room availability.

Summary Heading: Great choice if you understand and accept what you are paying for
Summary: I just returned from a 3 night stay with my wife and 4-yr old son. All in all it was a great trip and a great place to stay while visiting the theme parks.  About the price - There are a lot of online reviews comparing this hotel (unfavorably) with luxury hotels in the same price range. This is a big mistake. The GC is NOT a luxury hotel. They are not trying to be the Four Seasons, they are not competing with the Four Seasons. The Four Seasons is selling opulence and personal attention. Disney is selling access to their unique brand of mass-produced entertainment.  Different business models. You need to be ok with this fact before considering a booking. If you go in thinking that $400+ a night entitles you to 5 star amenities and personalized service, you WILL be disappointed,

Summary Heading: Family Trip to Disneyland and CA Adventure
Summary: My husband was attending a work conference and received a discounted rate to extend his stay at The Grand Californian.  We stayed Thursday-Sunday during the Tinkerbell half marathon weekend.  While the resort was busy we never felt overwhelmed by it. The staff was very friendly and accommodating.  The hotel is beautiful and well kept.  We stayed in rooms with the bunk beds which my boys loved. My kids are 2 and 5 so the youngest slept in the pack and play which was provided by the hotel (major bonus)!  I felt like we actually had a little more space due to have the bunk beds versus another queen bed.   The entrance to California Adventure is a definite bonus to staying at this resort.  It was in the high 60's when we stayed so we only visited the pool for a short time. The pool

Convenient location for both parks and downtown Disney, but DO NOT buy your park tickets from the front desk at this hotel -- appears convenient BUT they charge 10% more for the tickets -- They did not sell me the value day price and increased the cost by over 10% - when I questioned the price, they denied it and said that the value price didn't apply that day.  I later checked with the ticket office at the park entrance and it was a value priced day - but buying through the hotel I paid more.  Also, they don't have wireless internet in the rooms, just the lobby, the rooms have wired internet only  - great for laptops but not for smart phones or tablets.  I guess they don't want you in the rooms too long, they want you in the lobby buying their inflated priced tickets

Had a fantastic stay! The pool was awesome, and so was the room! We especially loved getting into the parks early and broke out ride record because of it. Very expensive so five of us shared a room and it was plenty of room for us in my opinion. :) Would stay again

We stayed here for a few nights as a couple - the property itself was perfectly located for Disney however the rooms were quite dated and we had an amazing view of a car park (that was extremely loud with the staff yelling). Location is highly recommended with families as its great to pop back for a small break. Others though its just as easy to save the $$ and stay just out the back with better standards.

First, it's very expensive, well over twice most high-end non-Disney hotels in the area, and quite a bit more than Disney's other hotels.   However.  It is by far the most convenient hotel to any of the parks, and since that's where the action is (what, you traveled hours to get to Downtown Disney? I didn't think so), that ticks a lot of boxes. Walk back to your hotel room from either park in like 15 minutes? Check. Early entry? Check. Extra quick morning entrance to DCA? Check. Keeps you in that DIsney state of mind from check-in to check-out? Check.  The rooms are pretty uniformly comfortable. Our last name is not Gates or Rockefeller, and we don't travel with a large party, so we stick to the regular-sized (not suite) non-concierge rooms. I think they really should separate

Summary Heading: Beautiful Resort with an amazing spa!
Summary: My friends and I stayed two nights here during our stay for the Tinkerbell Half Marathon.  Beautiful resort and room with convenient access to Downtown Disney.  We also went to the spa for a deep tissue massage after the marathon and were very pleased at the service there!

Summary Heading: View of downtown Disney and fireworks
Summary: Normally I stay in a room overlooking Woods - Courtyard, but the view of Disneyland fireworks is a bit obstructed.  The view from a room overlooking Downtown Disney (DD) has a more complete view of fireworks, not as good as in the park, but "hey!" you get to sit and sip a drink from your room. Be aware that it's a bit of a walk from the Grand Californian lobby, but you're closer to the DCA entrance.  The room furnishings are same in both categories but you'll spend about $50 more per night for DD view.

Summary Heading: Business and leisure in one luxurious stay
Summary: I had the rare fortune of needing to spend 10 days in Orange County for a business trip and also being without any childcare options for my 4-year-old son (who earned through this trip the title of Most Spoiled Child). So we spent 10 days at the Grand Californian, paying about what you would expect that to cost. Looking back on it, I don't think I would have done it any other way.  Through the assistance of a locally sourced short-term nanny, I was able to take care of business while my son lived large. But when you're in a high-stress travel situation, anything that can take away that feeling of risk or anxiety is worth it, and there wasn't a moment on this trip where I felt stressed. It was probably the most relaxing work trip I've ever had.  I had reserved a few days at the

This was our first stay at a Disneyland hotel and because of the high price of the Grand Californian, we assumed we were in for a "grand" experience.  The lobby and the pool area are great, but the rooms themselves are very worn and not very clean.  The proximity to the park was fantastic, but not for the price and run down room.  We will never waste our money again and will stay across the street.  We told management all of our issues and they were "very sorry" and only credited back about ten percent of our total.  We are so disappointed we wasted money and feel mislead.   Our issues... -Both Fridge and coffee maker did not work and had to get replacements -Shower would not drain so you had to stand in water up to your ankles -Toilet clogged almost every time you flushed (you

We enjoyed the luxury of being in the heart of everything including early entry into California Adventure park . You can't beat this property for logistics, however it surprises me that the hotel does not provide its customers with better Wifi. If you need to access your computer , cell phone etc you better head for the lobby. The Wifi in the room is horrible at best . Come on Disney. For over $500 a night, you can at least install routers on every floor so Wifi access can be at 2016 standards. Luxury sometimes is not all that you think it should be.   Our standard room was comfortable, housekeeping is great . If your in the park all day, your time in the room will be limited . There was a echoing noise in the shower/ drain that woke me up. It was annoying to say the least.

Let's get one thing out of the way: it ain't cheap. That said, people are willing to pay more for a little extra convenience with just about anything else (diapers, parking, laundry detergent, housing...) so why does anyone expect a hotel connected to THE southern California theme parks be any different?  If nothing else, Grand Californian is convenient. With its own entrance to California Adventure and a short walk to either the Disneyland main gate or Downtown Disney monorail station, access to the parks is unparalleled. If you're driving there's valet or self parking, and Disneyland Drive has its own exit off the I-5 freeway. Highway 22 is only a few lights south for access to Long Beach and the PCH.  This hotel offers more than just convenience though. Visually stunning,

Summary Heading: HIGHLY recommend (esp when traveling with child)
Summary: i've always loved staying at this hotel because not only is it new but you can enter CA Adventure from this hotel (there's a special entrance for guests). Now that i have a toddler it makes it even more sense to stay at this location because it is so convenient to bring the toddler back up to the hotel for nap times or for a change of clothes.   The hotel itself is clean, spacious, and new. Staffs are friendly (of course). Beds are super comfortable.   i highly recommend every family to stay here if they plan on bringing kids in tow.

My family stayed for two nights in a 2 bedroom three bathroom villa. I am a DVC member and have stayed in many of the Disneyworld resorts. I would highly recommend this hotel. The villa was fabulous and well maintained. The location was excellent. The desk staff could have given more information and been more helpful.

I loved it! Of course, I wasn't paying for it so I can't speak for value. Rooms are standard. Having that gate into the park is amazing! Early entry for hotel guests in certain days is also very nice. Getting one or two rides out of the way before the crowd comes.

We loved our stay at the Grand Californian.  I was there with a 12 and 15 year old and we enjoyed Disney, but used the hotel as our base for traveling around Southern California.  The very convenient car rental office right in Downtown Disney allowed us to take day trips elsewhere.  I wish the dining took less planning, but we finally found convenient take-out in downtown Disney. that allowed us to be spontaneous.  The hotel was lovely and homey and comfortable.  I highly recommend it.

Summary Heading: We Came, We Saw, We PAID
Summary: If you are going for the "Disney Experience" you may want to try this hotel since it was fairly nice, although overpriced. Beds were comfy, room was clean, staff was pleasant and helpful.  Its close to downtown Disney and the parks and I didn't have to rent a car.   Our four days at the property started off on a good foot, as we were allowed to enter our room well in advance of the posted check in time.  Since we were early, we decided to grab breakfast at the buffet at Storytellers Cafe on property. The food was average for a buffet. The check was not. . .after tip, we paid in excess of $80 for two of us. $80 for breakfast!? Really? It all just sort of went downhill from there. We thought maybe the White Water Snack Bar would be priced a little better and we could opt for room

Of course, this was expensive because it was Disney, but it was completely worth being so close to the parks, having the private park entrance and being near Downtown Disney (which made it easy to walk to other Disney hotels for character dining).  The pools and hot tub were also great.  We booked a package that included the bus transfer to and from SNA and it was completely worth it.  We wouldn't have left the property anyway, and it kept us from having to pay the parking or valet fees and we didn't have to deal with driving in Southern California.  We would absolutely stay here again on another Disneyland trip.

We had a very bad experience with our checkin. The cast member, Bri, was condescending, talking at us with a scolding tone as she tried to address her concerns with our reservation.  We are Disney Vacation Club members and we felt uncomfortable with the many disconnects that appear to exist between the DVC system and the hotel system. Bri was impatient and almost openly rude as she explained why our expectations were not appropriate, almost like we were out of line.  We had booked several rooms and were looking forward to our stay, until Bri effectively stomped out our excitement and replaced it with frustration and annoyance. We were the guests, but we definitely didn't feel welcome. Pretty bad since the Disney tag line for the vacation club is "Welcome Home".

Summary Heading: Grand? ...Maybe a little, but not too grand
Summary: We've stayed at both the other Disneyland Resort hotels in the past, but this was our first trip to Disney's Grand Californian.  We stayed 5/9/16 - 5/11/16 in a woods view room on the 5th floor, room #5001.  It was right around the corner from the elevator, but we didn't hear any elevator noise.  That particular room had 2 queen beds, but the room we could see around the corner from our balcony had bunkbeds.  It's not the best view, but you can watch the Disneyland fireworks from your balcony, which is nice if you're tired and want to get to bed @ 10:00 after the fireworks conclude.  It was nice to have a small refrigerator in the room.  The decor was nice and tasteful, but there was no Mickey features to be found, only a picture of Snow White.  Although the shower curtain had

Summary Heading: Closeness to parks great.. but a little over priced
Summary: Stayed in DGC in August booked a Garden view room but ended up with a partial view of DCA park. This was nice surprise and upgrade as the cast member was impressed with our travel book that we had made and asked to see it.. she was so impressed we got into our room early and with a lovely view.   The private entrance to the park was nice and if you timed it right (about 40 minutes before EMH opening you could be some of the first people in line but this doesn't matter really because they scan you in and walk you to the pier in a long line and people that were at the back make their way (excuse me push their way) to the front.   The hotel itself is lovely and cool and nice break from the heat and the closeness to the private entrance was really great especially when you were

We stayed here for one night back in April and it was great. The hotel was located right at the Disney village and very close to the entrance to both Disney parks. The rooms were comfirtable and big and had a great view into the grand Californian park. I would defiantly stay here again.

Summary Heading: Nice resort close to the parks
Summary: The Grand Californian is probably the best option for those seeking a hotel close to the Disney parks.  It is pricy but the proximity to the parks and the private entrance to California Adventure park makes it worth it.  Following are some of the pros and cons.  Pros:  - Location, location, location - I would recommend this over the Disneyland resort as it is much closer to both the parks - Private entrance to DCA as mentioned above.  This makes a big difference not just in terms of distance but also to avoid long lines at the main entrance - Accessibility to magic hours to the parks - Nice, spacious resort with good service - Room service available till 11 pm - Breakfast in the resort with Disney characters Chip N Dale available at an extra price  Cons  - Rooms are relatively

Summary Heading: The Place to Stay in Disneyland!
Summary: This was our second stay at the Grand Californian and our go to resort at Disneyland. We stayed in a standard view room on the 5th floor for 4 nights. Our room view was the  Paradise Pier Hotel. Room was very clean and spacious. Wifi in the rooms was pretty weak, though. The hotel lobby is gorgeous. We loved sitting in the lobby and unwinding after a long day in the parks.  The location to the parks can't be beat. It was extremely crowded when we went due to the Food & Wine Festival at DCA (California Adventure)  as well as Dapper Days, so we appreciated  being able to get into DCA via the entrance from the hotel. We were fortunate enough to get a room discount this time around, but the rack rate prices here are a bit steep.

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel, 3rd party booking had a glitch
Summary: This hotel is in the heart of Downtown Disney and very convenient to the park. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The staff is very friendly. The beds are like sleeping on a cloud. We had a view of TheTower of Terror ride and if we left our balcony door open we could listen to the Disney music from outside which made for a lovely ambience. I booked through Trip Adviser and I had some difficulty at check in because thy couldn't find my reservation. Apparently the spelling of my last name had changed in the translation from Trip Adviser to Disney. That was a little stressful, especially since I had prepaid for the room. This is the second time I have booked a Disney room through a third party system in order to get a room and both times I had problems. Otherwise the stay was

My family has stayed at this hotel on several occasions. I love the coziness of the hotel. The standard room isn't anything spectacular, but the ambiance of the hotel itself is great. Our favorite thing to do is sit by the grand hearth in a wooden rocking chair and listen to the story time or sing alongs with a glass of wine. The restaurants are pricey, but it seems that everything Disney is. We've only ever stayed at the hotel in the off season since we live fairly close. I've found that traveling in the fall and winter are the best times to get decent rates on rooms. The parks are typically not as crowded as well. We used to have season passes to Disneyland and California Adventure, but the increasing crowds and prices of tickets made us stop getting them. Staying at the hotel

We just spent five nights at the Grand Californian and could not be happier with our Disney experience. This was my first trip to Disneyland in 20 years and I was a little nervous not knowing what to expect, as we have 2 kids (2 and 4 years old). We chose the Grand Californian because of it's proximity to the parks, great reviews and amenities.   We LOVED the hotel, but especially the great benefits of staying there. Being able to take advantage of the Magic early hours was fantastic to be able to do some rides without big lines and get some good pictures with characters before the big crowds. We also loved having such direct access to the parks. My kids still nap and it was awesome to easily get back and forth from our room without too much effort.   Our room had a queen bed

From your arrival in the lobby you're immersed in the arts and crafts era of California. The location, adjacent to California Adventure, can't be beat. The pool and restaurants are good as well. Rooms, however, are a bit dated and in need of a refurb. For the price, I would recommend the Disneyland Hotel, more recently renovated and steeped in Disney lore. However, you can't really go wrong with the Grand either.

I stayed here for 3 nights for a work convention.  The room was big and had bunk beds and a patio. I did not need extra beds but would of been nice if kids were there.  The hotel has direct access to California adventure and is very close to Disney land entrance.  I had expected more Disney featured in hotel but there were none - more of a moderate hotel attached to the parks.  The staff was good and helpful and always available. The room was a direct bill but when looking at prices can get very high on peak times. If I returned I would probably stay across street at Hilton and walk over solely based on price - the connivence factor is not worth the hundreds more in cost for me.  If in range I would stay again.

A wonderful hotel experience from the nice room, to the bar, to the piano music in the lobby. Of course the main attraction is the proximity to California Adventure, particularly for those with mobility issues, which includes my husband and myself.  Having said all this, it is vastly overpriced.

We stayed four nights with our two year old and three year old. The convenient access to both parks, clean rooms, and abundant restaurant options made a very easy vacation. Pool was nice break from the lines at the park. Shuttle service from SNA was fast and easy.  It is pricey but well worth it with our crew.

Stayed at this hotel with my 5 year old and parents (66 year old). The location made it easier / less walking to get to Disneyland and California Adventure. You have an entrance to California Adventure in the hotel and it made the evening return so easy. The hotel was beautiful and clean. The pool area was very relaxing and luxurious! Staff were amazing. Only con was a weak wi-fi single!! We still prefer the Disneyland Hotel, but this would be our second choice!

Summary Heading: Excellent location, but service & quality is just okay
Summary: At the last minute we decided to stay at this hotel because of the convenience of being near the parks.  There's an entrance/exit next to Sephora in Downtown Disney, making it about 7-10 minutes walking distance to/from Disneyland and in an instant you are at California Adventure.  When we arrived to the resort, the valet staff was welcoming & friendly, while the Front Desk person who helped us wasn't so.  When we asked a couple questions, the response was pretty much one word answers with no expression or friendliness.  The Concierge staff was very helpful after I had to call out for their attention a couple times.  They had good advice and great recommendations.  Our first night at the resort, we ordered Room Service for dinner and we were told that the food could take up to

The grand California is a beautiful place to stay, it's very pricey but in my opinion it's not worth the money. It's way over priced like most things in Disney. Positives about it is that the parks are walking distance and downtown Disney is literally around the corner. It was convenient for us but I would only take this as a one time experience.

Bed 4/5Mattress firm/soft-very soft Room 5/5 room is clean.  Moderate number of outlets and lights.  Room has a flat screen TV. There is no desk area. Room has  refrigerator and a coffee maker. Shower warmed up moderate but has great pressure.  wi fi included in the resort fee. Central air conditioner.  Price $$$$ Proximity 4/5 walking distance to Disneyland. Special park entrance to Disney California Adventure. Guest staying at a Disney property can take advantage of Magic Hours (an extra hour in the park for hotel guests only) Lots off food options within the hotel and Downtown Disney.

Summary Heading: Everything I could have wanted for my anniversary!
Summary: I literally had nightmares over this hotel because of some of the reviews on here.  We arrived and it was the best experience. Our family loved it.  We got the room we requested, a room with bunk beds.  The lowest type room we could have when we booked was a woods/courtyard. I wasn't expecting much for a view.  When we got there it was 9:30am.  I knew we wouldn't be able to get our room.  We checked in,everything went smooth, and they said they would text us when our room was ready around 3 or 4. They held on to our luggage and said to call and they would deliver it when the room was ready.  We got a text at 11:30am way earlier then expected saying our room was ready.  We went back to unpack everything into our room.  Like I said we got the bunk beds we requested.  Our room was

Summary Heading: Beware of employee entering room while taking a nap
Summary: My family has stayed at the Grand California several times without any problems, however our most recent trip we received a message our room was ready. We settled in and had our luggage brought up. Room was clean and obviously ready for us. while taking a nap shortly after, we were awoken by an employee from the front desk. The employee walked into our room and said it wasn't ready yet and we needed to move. Good thing for family in the adjoining room. after moving our luggage next door we were told housekeeping needed to complete a check of our room. 30 minutes later received a phone call from front desk that room was now ready even though nobody ever checked our room. We felt a little confused and invaded. Not sure if we will stay here again.

Summary Heading: It's just not worth it. Whoever is running Disneyland now has ruined it.
Summary: We just returned from Disneyland and stayed at the Grand Californian. The Hotel itself is nice, great staff and decent rooms. It's really overpriced though, especially for how thin the walls are, idiots bring crying 2 month old babies. That and Disneyland itself is overrun by the local SoCal pass crowd. This no longer is a destination like it used to be. It's now the local cheap pass that keeps the lines long and now there is no off peak season. A lot of the rides were down or broke while we were in line, The ferris wheel, California Screamin', Matterhorn, Monorail, train, Autopia. It was a real waste of money. I'll book a cruise or stick to the local theme park next time. Disneyland is turning itself into a Six Flags. Oh and if you do go, just self park. The Valet is a rip off

Summary Heading: The best part is being so close to the parks
Summary: The Grand Californian Hotel at Disneyland is a great hotel.  I would recommend it just because you have such close access to Disneyland and direct access to California Adventure Park.  It makes your day much better if you can go to your room during the day if you want to rest or change clothes because you got wet on one of the rides.  It is pricey I think but that is Disney.  The rooms are comfortable and clean and the staff is very helpful.  My only complaint was that the lighting in the bathroom is low. All in all it was worth it because of the convenience.

This was our third stay and we return because of the proximity to the parks, the view, and the restaurants.  We had a strange problem with our park-hopper tickets not being accessible at check-in, which was a hassle but certainly not caused by hotel staff.  We talked to Sabrina about it, who was not very helpful at all and seemed to think a Fast Pass would move us along.  Lamar came to the rescue and had a much-appreciated solution.  He is outstanding.  The maid service is outstanding, the pools are very nice with good pool-side service and the Napa Rose is simply superb.  Wifi is included and is easy to access. We had a great stay and will certainly return.  The rating would be even higher but the cost of stay compared to quality/size of the room is off kilter, but it is

If you're going to Disneyland, you will balance convenience with costs, no doubt. The Grand Californian Hotel has both. For convenience, none can beat it. This is the only hotel within the park and hotel guests get to enter the park earlier than other outside guests.  (Check to verify that is the case for the dates you will be there). There is also a special entrance for hotel guests and you are able to come and go during the day - a tremendous convenience if you want to take a rest break during the day. The hotel and grounds are really beautiful and it's a lovely place to be. Ofcourse, that convenience comes with a cost and the rack rates here are considerably higher than the other luxe hotels near the park.

Highly recommend staying at the resort hotel when on extended stay at the park. Everything is within a comfortable walking distance from a well-managed hotel. For my wife and me, we typically grade hotels by the quality of their fitness centers and wifi strength. With the exception of poor wifi connection (recommend bring your mifi or hot spot), the state-of-the-art hotel gym was a huge plus. After a long day being dragged by grnadkids, and if we have any energy left, the gym is our perfect sanctuary to flush-out the stresses of the day. The hotel has the look and feel of a mountain lodge. Its cavernous class lobby area affords weary visitors a quiet spot to recharge throughout the day. The bar lounge is a fantastic watering hole ease the remaining aches of the day after a

Summary Heading: Pricy but worth it for location
Summary: Rooms just okay, we paid for a premium view room but ours overlooked a concrete walkway and parking area. Service at Napa rose was great, for meals and drinks. We rented the poolside cabana for $125/ day for two of the afternoons but were disappointed with service there, took forever to get drinks etc. expected more given the added expense. Overall it's worth it for location, but don't bother spending for cabanas.

We loved this hotel. Staff are friendly and it's a lovely, happy place. Our girls are 10, 13 and 16. It's so handy being right near the Disney Parks. Our room overlooked the park with the ferris wheel and we watched the light show every night from our room. We had tickets to watch in the park one night but it was too cool and we weren't dressed properly so we opted to go back to the room. The pools are great. Even though it wasn't really hot when we were there the last week of March, my youngest swam every day.   My only criticism would be the price of the food. We loved the Storybook Cafe but it's pricey, especially traveling on our low Canadian dollar. We didn't have time to buy groceries and eat breakfasts in the room, which was our initial plan. We'd love to visit again

The location absolutely could not have been beat, and we'd stay here again simply because of it. You could get everywhere you needed to go within five minutes. Staff were perfect, as you would expect from Disney. Common areas and pools were wonderful. We had both dinner and breakfast at Storytellers and they were fine. For breakfast, though, I'd recommend heading over to Goody's Kitchen at the Disneyland hotel. Much better selection and better characters.   Our favorite part of our stay was on Earth Day, when the hotel hosted a ladybug release. My kids were in heaven!   The rooms, however, are pretty bad, especially considering the price you pay. We stayed on the club level with a queen and bunk beds. My four year olds loved the bunk beds, but our queen was so unbelievably

Spent three days here for a work conference. Like everything else Disney does, it was so professional and well done. I don't think they missed a detail. I would definitely recommend it for anyone planning a conference who wants to have a little fun on the side.

Summary Heading: Young Living Essential Oils Event "Your Best 30 Minutes"
Summary: This was the very first time I stayed in this hotel. Needless to say it was absolutely amazing!! I loved how the room was sparkling clean and the service was excellent. Having the facilities for our event downstairs was perfect. While I was there they released lady bugs. The hotel has many things for kids to do.   One of my favorite conveniences, was having an entrance to Downtown Disney. This made for an easy walk for shops and places to eat. Also, being able to catch the Monorail into Disneyland was really wonderful. I had a twilight ticket and picked to visit Disneyland park. A twilight ticket was offered by Disney events for the oily event I attended. It was $60.00 at the time I purchased. The ticket was good for anytime after 4 p.m. and one park. I loved it! worked out

The rates are pricey, but worth it! It's all worth it! Every bit of it is worth it! The name says it all, Grand Californian! We arrived very early in the morning wanting to at least pre-register and get our room keys so we can get in early at 7:00 am to the parks and we did not expect for our room to be ready! Wow! Two thumbs up! We went in and out of room several throughout the day and were surprised to see that the trash cans were emptied out throughout our stay! The staff keeps on top of things and they even have a light turned on for you in your room on your return back at night! Another two thumbs up!  Rooms are very clean and spacious!  The walking distance to both parks is close, with it's own private entrance to California Adventure, it is at Grizzly river run. The other

We found the Grand Californian to be very underwhelming. As most people note, the hotel lobby is beautiful and inviting and you simply cannot argue with the location but the rooms are more in line with an interstate motel and a bad joke at $500 per night.  If you were anywhere else you would  demand your money back if you were paying more than $100 per night but this is Disney so you suck it up and take in the shorts.  The first thing my four year old said was "Daddy, I want to go back to our other hotel" (in reference to our previous night's stay at the Doubletree a few blocks away).  The rooms are small, dark, dingy and beat up.  I do have to say that the staff was pretty on point and between the valet, bellboy, and front desk probably had us processed and with tickets in hand

Summary Heading: The location and great Disney service were the best part of our stay
Summary: The best part about this resort is it's convenient locale to the parks-literally connected to California Adventure and a few minutes walk to Disney. When you are tired from traipsing around the parks and need a break, you can just stroll back to the hotel for a couple hours to rejuvenate. The resort itself is nice and beautifully maintained, albeit rather dark inside the lobby as other reviewers mention. Top notch Disney service and friendliness abound.  The pool area offers varied swimming options to please both kids and adults, and the poolside chaise lounges are a very comfortable place to relax.  Our room, however, was quite average. It was more cramped than the nightly price would suggest, smaller than some budget hotels we have stayed in.  Our room consisted of a queen and

This is a beautiful hotel reminiscent of a country ski lodge.  I've been here for both work and pleasure; all of which have been wonderful experiences.  Best time to visit is Christmas when the hotel celebrates the beauty and spirit of the holiday with exquisite decorations (including a large gingerbread house).  They also set up a hot cocoa and coffee bar and play beautiful seasonal music on the piano.  Excellent experience for kids of all ages.  Take time to sit by the beautiful fireplace and enjoy year-round live piano.  Negatives - the lobby and surrounding area is kept at frigid temperatures, in-room towels are very rough, water is a trickle in the shower (this is CA) and I wish there were more options for breakfast in the hotel (Storyteller's Cafe is great, but I don't

Summary Heading: Expect a bit more for the price
Summary: This was booked using Disney vacation club points but I have seen the price to pay for a room, and it is extortionately high.   The rooms were very nice and the hotel conveniently located, with its own entrance to the California park and within 5 minutes of Disneyland. It was right next to downtown Disney.   The staff were helpful however we couldn't get our room until 4:30pm on check in day- we needed to go out at 5:30 to a hockey match so ended up rushing and hanging about waiting for the room after a long journey (we arrived at 1:30, perhaps naively expecting a room as at other, cheaper places on our vacation this hadn't been an issue). On the last day, our flight wasn't until 9:30pm- having been at the park, I asked about showers and was told I could use a shower at the pool

Located in the middle of downtown Disney. Great place for adult family members to meet. Have celebrated several birthdays here. California Craftsman architecture with Northern California theme. Subtle Disney. Beautiful lobby with Grand Piano and giant fireplace.  Clean comfortable rooms with turn down service. Lots of special activities for young families.Three pools, always full of children.  Full bar. Two excellent restaurants and a spa. Snack bar has breakfast and lunch items. Hotel has it's own entrance to California Adventure Theme Park. Closest of the Disney Hotels to both parks. Prefer the rooms that face the garden, but the California Adventure side offers great views of the nightly water show. Concierge level is a treat with Magic Kingdom firework views. Will store

we took our 3 1/2 year old granddaughter april 10 to 14. it was magical,  with disney pricing. the hotel is beautiful, but a little dark in the lobby area. location is superb,  with its own entrance to Californian adventure. all restaurants were top notch. i had a massage at the dpa which was marvelous. our room was nice, spacious  and had a refrigerator and coffee maker, which we didn't use. it didn't have the magical disney touches that the disneyland hotel has in the headboards. the shower curtain was a bambi fabric,  keeping with the outdoorsy theme.  the products in bathroom were top notch. staff we encountered were friendly,  helpful and accommodating.  many remarked on our granddaughter dressed in princess attire! the front desk clerk even gave her a "signed" photo of

This is indeed a beautiful hotel and kids will love all the different pools available! We are local and stayed just for a night for my birthday and relaxed at the hotel, we didn't go anywhere else. It's a great big place and we enjoyed our time there.  However at around $500ish per night for our standard room, I expect a swankier looking room. Instead it was very very basic. Just your average room with double beds, tv, mini fridge, plain decor, and the bathtub had a shower curtain.   That was the only downside though, we were pretty happy with everything else. The staff was plentiful and pleasant. The pool is half saline and half chlorine which was great because chlorine pools really makes my husband's sensitive eyes sting like crazy. We bought a swim diaper for my baby before

Let me begin by saying that I had wondered for years what it would be like to stay here. For my 36th birthday this year I decided that it was time to find out. After weeks of pricing recon, I was excited to find an Easter stay that would come in under $500 per night. Shortly after booking, I came  across several reviews with complaints about cleanliness and began to have second thoughts about staying here. I decided to write an email about my concerns to hotel management because it worried me that Disney had not taken the time to respond to the negative reviews. I need not have worried. A copy of my email was on  file upon check in (in addition to the response I'd received). We were asked to wait while our room was double checked for cleanliness. As we were entering our room the

We stayed at the hotel from April 13 to 16th.  Having stayed previously at Aulani in Hawaii and loved our experience, we had high hopes.  This was our first trip to Disney as a family and we were prepared to pay a premium to stay at the park and in one of the Disney properties expecting that it would be an amazing experience.  Unfortunately, we were extremely disappointed with the entire experience.    - At check-in, our bags were taken from us and we were given a ticket.  It was not explained that once you got to your room, you would need to call down to request the bags be sent up.  We ended up waiting around for 45 minutes and left wondering what had happened.  When I called down, we were told that we should have just called.  No apologies given.  This seems like a very

For a Disney property, this place was really dark inside! For comparison, the Grand Floridian at Disneyworld is much lighter and more open. The people are as nice as you would expect, and the restaurants are close. Avoid the whit water cafe - really bad overpriced slop.

Summary Heading: My daughter-in-law and granddaughter's first visit to Disneyland!
Summary: Very convenient to the entrances of both Parks and Downtown Disney! Nice to have the hotel so close by at the end of the day. The restaurants on site are very good and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The pool area is a lot of fun for the kids with one big slide along with a small slide for the little ones. They have a great supply of life jackets for use by the kids who aren't strong swimmers. The lifeguards are very attentive and do a great job. We had a lot of fun here and will definitely be back!

Came here for our anniversary. The price was very high but that's what you'd expect from Mickey Mouse, he's the marketing genius.   Room was quaint, has special Disney carpet and everything in the room is Disney themed including; paintings, special Disney channel for kids on tv, shower curtain, lamps, bed sheets and toiletries.   Also has great restaurants, we ate at GOOFY's Kitchen, Napa Rose and Storyteller's Cafe all great and memorable restaurants.   Enjoy your stay here, the money spent is worth the experience at least once.

We stayed in a suite and found it spacious and comfortable.  It was quiet and filled with amenities in every bathroom.  We highly recommend this hotel for a family vacation at Disneyland.  It's not cheap, but it's well worth the money.

Summary Heading: Wow!  Like a mountaintop oasis in the middle of the parks!
Summary: As you walk in the lobby, you are blown away by the grandeur of this place!  Simply gorgeous, big lobby area with wood beamed ceilings, wood and leather furnishings, plush carpet and marble--it's like a swanky place you would find in Aspen!  The grounds are amazing...large "boulders" accent the woods-y exterior, with lots of pine trees, and little hidden spaces like a large gathering area away from the crowds, with a roaring fireplace and wooden rocking chairs.  This is a big property, with a beautiful pool area in the center, conference rooms on one side, a couple of restaurants and a lounge area.  When staying on property at Disney, your room key can also be used to charge purchases anywhere in Disney or California Adventure, a nice touch.  Our room was a bit more on the

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay while visiting Disneyland
Summary: We have visited Disney's Grand Californian Hotel and Spa four times now.  We stay in the timeshare part that is connected to the hotel.  We have Disney points at another Disney resort so are able to get in fairly easily.  It is usually completely booked and I would advise making your reservations far in advance.  The hotel is magical.  The service is excellent and the location perfect.  You have direct access from the back of the hotel to Grand Californian Adventure.  On select days you get into the parks one hour before it opens to the public.  You also have direct access to Downtown Disney and it is a short walk to Disneyland Park. The lobby is spacious and echoes the feel of a Great Lodge in a National Park.  In the evening they have story telling time in front of the large

Summary Heading: Our stay was far from being "Magical"
Summary: We came for a family reunion, most came from Hawaii and a few of us from the East Coast.  Our rooms were very far from one another.  When we asked the front desk about possibly switching rooms, 2 of the 3 staff were very rude, short and offered no suggestion.  Our rooms were very dark and the shower head in the bathroom did not work well.  The rooms are definitely not worth what you pay for, it definitely does not feel like you are staying in a 5 star spa resort.  And the wifi signal was very weak that it was most times not accessible.  Very disappointed and will most likely not stay here again.

Our trip last year was amazing. We had a good view of the park. We got amazing sleep. One our fast pass and I just was so amazed. I would like to stay again hopefully I will find a good rate for the days we will be there in California. I am so thankful we had a opportunity to be at this place. Next time I will use the pool hopefully.

This hotel is above par. Yes it is not a ritz but it is still nice enough. The included benefits are only available at this hotel. There are no hotels in Anaheim that are connected to a theme park. Nor do they get you into one park an hour early. The hotel also just feels Disney. Multiple dining establishments were available on site although they are Disney priced to be prepared. Free wifi was a nice bonus though. I can't remember her name but the only female bellhop was amazing(in our hotel if you know what I mean). Rooms were big enough but not huge. Beware:certain park view rooms are not as they seem and give you a good tree view. Everyone as usual was wet nice as well

You are paying for staying in the only hotel located in a disney park. We would not pay this premium again. For $500 a night, we were expecting luxury. What we got was a Marriott like room. We paid less than half this at the Legoland hotel and had a ton of amenities. The pool slide closed at 6 daily which was absolutely ridiculous. Our first room was dirty with food in the closet (opened and scattered so the maid shouldn't have missed it) and we practically had to beg for an equivalent room as they were sold out, which is again ridiculous as we paid for two beds or a king, not a bunk bed room. The terrace to watch the world of color was super crowded. The line to get in through the dedicated entrance in the morning is long but if you are coming back/forth during the day it's

If money‚Äôs no option, the clear choice is Anaheim‚Äôs only four-star resort, Disney‚Äôs Grand Californian Hotel and Spa. First of all, the location can‚Äôt be beat. It‚Äôs the nearest lodging to all three Disney attractions in California: Disneyland, California Adventure and Downtown Disney. Secondly, it‚Äôs a destination unto itself. A loving homage to the great National Park Lodges ‚Äî especially in the spectacular lobby and restaurants ‚Äì it‚Äôs a wonderland of design, sophistication and whimsy offering the finest in service and accommodations (including family suites with bunk beds). The exorbitant price tag is enough to scare off most families, however, which is a good or bad thing depending on your perspective.   Personally, I feel it‚Äôs so overpriced you can‚Äôt possibly get your money‚Äôs

Spent 3 night in November 2015, going back this November for 7 nights. We're DVC members so the price wasn't an issue. I think this hotel is amazing BUT I would never pay rack rates. If I paid 500+ a night I would be expecting more. If you want to go there and can plan well in advance, I recommend renting points for about 300-400 a night. The location is PERFECT, the pools (+hot tubs) and chairs are very comfortable and the service is amazing!

Overall a satisfactory hotel. The customer service is really great, the only problem we had was they told us they would text us when our room was ready the first day and so we came back from the parks to find out our room really wasn't ready which was frustrating. We even accidentally left something in the room and they mailed it to us! You pay for the early access to the parks and the convenience of being able to come back and rest and then return to the parks easily and that is worth it for sure! We had a bunk bed for our daughter which she loved, I only wish they had the option of a king bed for adults in the same room as the bunk bed for kids instead of only queen size with bunk beds. We also enjoyed a meal on site at the Storyteller cafe which had a great buffet dinner.

Well on a positive note was very close to Disneyland & California Adventure entrance. When we checked in and got to the room everything was ok till I picked up phone was dead the closest to the bed anyway the other one on desk had 1 line working. So next morning. They sent someone to replace the phones also the shower head was not working properly no pressure they sent someone to replace it on our balcony we see some trees & monorail when you look down mine you we were on 4th floor the roof below had beer bottles shampoo bottles & water bottles along with a ton of cigaret butts I did tell staff first thing Monday morning for we arrived late Sunday. They gave us 3 complimentary dinner vouchers to use at any one of the Disney properties which was nice of Disney but for $700 plus a

Very good hotel with great service. Only criticism is for the price the rooms could be refreshed a bit. They were a bit tired. But the service was amazing. You never had to wait as there plenty of staff on hand to assist with all our questions.

This Hotel s price/quality ratio is totally out of whack. If it would cost $200 and show three stars I wouldn't be writing this. The name and the stars however suggest that one would be in a top Hotel but this is far from it. The room is really small. The door filthy with finger marks (what else isn't  clean you can't tell as its all brown ), it says it sleeps 4 but there are 2 queen size beds - unless you sleep cuddled up like newly weds it's very uncomfortable for two people. There is no breakfast in the hotel (hence not included as you have to go to a restaurant outside) where  breakfast is over $40 for one person for absolutely filthy food.  The minibar is empty. Not even a bottle of water in the room. Children age 10 count as adults for pricing ! All in all not a pleasant

If you're planning to stay here in the suite, simply do not. Heck, don't bother with the entire hotel.  In short, the $1277 a night "two bedroom suite" was a disgrace. The pictures on the website show a grand, open room - one with big windows and an open area for sharing space. What we received was two interconnected rooms - clearly normal rooms that simply had one door leading to another - with a cramped, dingy-looking sitting area barely big enough for three people. The sinks were chipped, the showers were old and musty. If I buy a suite, I want a suite, not interconnected rooms. If I wanted that I'd...have bought two rooms. Somewhere else.   The suites were also at a the end of a hallway, a few minutes from the elevator. This is super fun when two of your party have ankle

Wish I had taken photos of how old and run down this hotel is... Nothing grand about it.  Staff at the entrance were excellent but once you walk through the doors it's nothing like its reviews. Loud hallways and rooms don't look like they have been touched since the 80s. Honestly not worth the location as still a good walk to Disney , stay somewhere much cheaper as this hotel not worth the money.

Summary Heading: Good Restaurants, Bar, and Afternoon Pianist - Grand Californian - and Mickey Mouse Socks
Summary: We found the Mickey Mouse socks I love to wear at the store at Grand Californian.  We bought six pairs.  Service was good.  We dined at the restaurants. In the morning we had breakfast at Storyteller.  In the evening one night, we had a superb fine dining dinner at  Napa Rose.  We enjoyed drinks at the Heartstone Lounge.  We also liked listening to the afternoon pianist playing Disney tunes.  It was so relaxing after a good morning and early afternoon at Disneyland.  We used the valet service which was very good.    We found the staff to be amazing throughout the hotel.

Hubby and I spent 3 nights at Grand Californian. I must say that it was wonderful.  The service was outstanding and our room was fabulous.  The lobby is impressive and lovely. You can access California Adventure directly from the hotel; that is a big plus! You walk from GC directly into Downtown Disney, and from there, you walk a very short distance through Downtown Disney and you're at the entrance to Disneyland and California Adventure! While we did not use the pool, it looked awesome. We took a taxi to the Angels game, and it was a short distance away. We ate at Napa Rose and Storyteller's Cafe, and both were great! The resort was clean and well maintained.  I highly recommend the Grand Californian.  We will stay at GC the next time we visit the area.

Summary Heading: Premium Location, Premium Price... Average Hotel
Summary: Firstly let me be very clear this review is about the hotel and not the park itself. Given the cost per night (5 star price range), feels like Disney has not quite got this quite right yet, and has some work to do make this Hotel as spectacular as the Park itself.  Let me start with what makes this hotel great.   Firstly from the minute you walk into reception the staff are exceptional, the hotel lobby is extremely impressive and the rooms are well maintained and clean. We had breakfast one of the days in the Storyteller cafe which was not just a great experience for the kids meeting the characters, but the food itself was really excellent. The pools are very well organised for the kids and no doubt the giant waterslide is a big hit. Importantly the Hotel has direct access to

Stayed for 8 nights in a 2 bed DVC Villa.  It was very clean and comfortable and had everything we needed for a stay with 2 adults and 2 children (9 and 4).  The convenience of the location can't be beaten when it comes to getting to the Disney attractions.  We had a view of the park and could watch the world of colour and fireworks from our window, balcony or the viewing area on the 6th floor.  The pool area was grreat and parking is free across the road.  It has to be the best place to say if visiting Disneyland.  The only issue we had was a fire alarm in another building at 2am one evening that resulted in false alarm messages being sounded in our building.  They were loud and it was difficult to determine what was happening.  It was a minor issue on an otherwise fantastic

Summary Heading: Great stay at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel
Summary: We just came back from a short, but very memorable stay at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel.  The hotel lobby and entrance is impressive!  Service is great and each cast member was genuinely great to interact with. Very happy with client services who helped form our plan for 'doing Disney in a day'!    We had paid for a Standard view room, and were upgraded at check in to a view of Downtown Disney.  If we'd known, we would have stayed in our room for the fireworks display instead of going outside- it was literally outside our window!    The room itself was adequate, but really not up-to scratch for the $560 USD we paid for one night!  It is definitely the location and convenience of being next to the park that you pay for...not the room.  That being said, we were happy with the

We stayed @ the Grand Hotel for first time April 1 and check out April 3, 2016. Extremely impressed with the Room and the Hotel staff. Room was very clean and had all the amenities. The Hotel was close to everything, not once we needed our car to go anywhere. Downtown Disney was extremely close and convenient. Stores everywhere and also places to eat. Everything walking distance. Everything was Top Notch. We will definitely stay again. The cost was so worth it. Thank You to the Hotel Staff for making our experience to be magical.

Summary Heading: You're paying for location but it's overpriced
Summary: We're Disney people - pass holders. When we go to Disneyland we typically stay within walking distance off property but our go to hotels were booked and it was a short stay so we gave the grand a try. It's gorgeous and it's all about location - you can run up to your room to drop off a bag from the park and you're stayed in California Adventure. That said, it's not worth the price. Typical thin Disney walls so it was loud and the price was crazy. On this same trip we stayed at Disney Aulani in Hawaii for less per night. It's beautiful but only stay if he price is within reach for you.

Great place to stay when doing Disney land. Nicely themed and very clean with different packages for early entry to both parks and admissions. The kids will love the activities on site and downtown Disney right out your door. A little pricey but worth it.

I absolutely loved staying at the Grand Californian. The thing I loved most was our view - we got to see World of Color from our window! They were practicing it during parts of the night so we got to see bits and pieces of it more than what the park goers get to. This was a really big plus for us as we had two small children with us who couldn't stay awake to watch the show at the park. The other really big perk is its own entrance to DCA. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others - very clean with a location you cannot beat!

My third trip ever to Disneyland but my first trip staying at a Disneyland resort and the cost is so worth it! I had nothing but a wonderful time the week I was staying here. The hotel had a seprate entrance to the California Adventure park for Disneyland hotel guests only (you have to have a room key or the people working the gate will make you turn around) The hotel offers many enjoyable add on's, we weren't able to take advantage of the pool because we were so busy enjoying everything else.  The story tellers cafe was great (espcially for breakfast) no complaints there. We requested a downtown Disney view and even though the walk to and from between the elevator and are room was a decent walk it was worth it. We were able to watch the firework show every night from are

In my opinion, staying on site at Disneyland is a must and this is by far the most conveniently located hotel. I would way rather stay at Disney‚Äôs Grand Californian Hotel for two nights than stay a whole week at a less expensive hotel off site. There are two other on-site hotels ‚Äì Paradise Pier and the Disneyland Hotel ‚Äì that are good options but they‚Äôre at the far end of Downtown Disney so they‚Äôre not nearly as convenient as the Grand Californian, which is literally inside Disney‚Äôs California Adventure and has entrances to both CA and Downtown Disney. My family prefers the Downtown Disney view to the California Adventure view because of how festive the music is on the balcony.   Another huge perk of staying on site is the Extra Magic Hour. Every day guests of the Disney hotels

Summary Heading: IT REALLY IS THE HAPPIEST PLACE ON EARTH
Summary: Since we are DVC members my family and I are here often and the Grand Californian gives 100% excellent service every time. From the moment you walk in to the grand lobby you feel as if you are somewhere magical.  Aside from the hotel having a separate entrance to California Adventure, guests of the hotel can take advantage of the magic mornings. Believe me, this makes a huge difference especially for the most popular rides. For those that are not part of the DVC program the rooms can be pricey but I still recommend staying a day or two here. It is definitely worth it.

I've stayed at all of the Disney "deluxe" hotels in California, Florida, Paris.  Disney hotels are all about the location in relation to their theme parks and the Disney feel (and getting the extra hour in the parks).  Disney also has welcoming and helpful staff.  The Grand Californian has a breathtaking lobby and a very nice restaurant (Napa Rose).  I thought the room was a letdown.  Disney rooms are generally small but these rooms are very small for the price and dark due to the theming.  I much prefer the rooms and pools at the Disneyland Hotel, even though the walk to the parks is longer.  I can always stop by the Grand to spend time in the amazing lobby and save $200/night.  And seriously, Disney, for the price you charge for rooms, can you please improve your wifi?

This hotel gave such a homey feel, from the couches in the lobby, to the fireplace and lounge areas it was really relaxing.  Plus the early access into the parks were great no hustle and bustle of the lines.  The location is great if you just want to hang around downtown Disney or take mini naps between park visits.  Reservations are tough to get but the guest services were so courteous and helpful, even when I had to extend the motorized scooter for my dad.  The Disney Vacation representatives are great too, willing to answer several questions I had and even assisted us with a monthly payment plan for our trip.  I would definitely love to come visit again and use Disney's Vacation services!

Summary Heading: TWO More Great DVC Trips at the Grand!!!
Summary: This review is actually for two reviews...I stayed here twice in 2015. For a week in January with my husband and daughter, and for one night with my sister and two of our friends for a concert/mom's night out. This year, 2016, we are staying a week in September, so I'll review again at a later date.  We are DVC Members and we used our points for a stay in January 2015 as we did in January 2014. This is one of our favorite hotels. The Grand has only a few DVC rooms so they do book up quite fast. We had a one-bedroom, two bathroom unit. These rooms are expansive, and feel as large as a two bedroom apartment. The living space is really comfortable, not crowded. The DVC rooms are upgraded with granite counters and stainless steel appliances.  We enjoyed the beauty and elegance, as

Summary Heading: Enjoyed the experience, but is it good value for money?
Summary: My wife and I stayed in The Grand Californian in Disneyland California for four nights as the tenth stop on a Seattle to San Diego road trip in the summer of 2015 and enjoyed the experience, although I would question whether it actually represents good value for money.  After a friendly check in we went to our room which was large and clean, albeit a little dated.  There was a small balcony but our pool view was constrained by roofs and trees which was a particularly disappointing as we had paid considerably more to be able to enjoy the whole Disney experience.  The hotel was also a bit chaotic and because of that I didn't feel like I was staying in the premier resort hotel that it's billed to be.  On the positive side, the Napa Rose restaurant was spectacular and we were very

We spent three nights here while we visited Disneyland. The hotel is slightly dated but clean, comfortable and spacious. It's well located and has everything you need as a base for the parks and downtown Disney.   What made our stay was the behaviour of the staff. We had a slightly traumatic arrival having nearly not made it due to a terrible stomach bug running through the family and an error in judgement resulting in 3 flat tyres. The staff could not have been more helpful. They spoke to our hire car company and arranged a treat for us. Due to their care, we fell back into holiday mode very quickly. Thanks in particular go to Matt the valet parking manger.  The room staff were also very helpful.   This hotel made you feel cared for in a resort where millions of people pass

Summary Heading: A trip for the young and young at heart.
Summary: My wife and I took our kids to Disneyland, and stayed at the Grand Californian. The rooms are nice, the service is Disney grade, and you're right on property for the parks. We had a blast! If you've never gone - go, if you have gone, go again. Disney is always updating their attractions.

Summary Heading: Perfect place if you want to be close to the park
Summary: I had a good time, even though that you can hear the noise of the people. If you have a child with a special need and want to be close to the park to avoid the lines on the monorail or going to rest before to return to the park, it is a nice place to stay. The security person were very helpful, when my son had a seizure and guide us toward the ambulance. I don't give them a five because I think that rooms could be upgraded for the cost.

Great experience.  This was our first time at Disneyland.  The convenience of the Grand Californian is wonderful.  We stayed two nights and wish we would have had more time to enjoy the hotel and spa.  Our room was on the sixth floor.  We really appreciated the mini fridge and how quiet the room was.  We loved that the hotel was "right in the middle of things".

Summary Heading: Pricey for such tiny rooms. You are paying for being in the park, the convenience, and the service.
Summary: The resort overall is beautiful, very well done Craftsman, especially the lobby and pool area which are pretty impressive. However that said, I think it is still very expensive for the tiny rooms you get. It is great if you aren't on a budget, don't have too high expectations about the room itself, and are paying merely for the convenience of staying at the park. Hotel guests have earlier entry to the park and their own entrance; awesome if you want to get into the park before the masses, hit the rides first, skip the lines. I think perhaps they should lighten up the rooms a bit to make it appear larger or possibly use smaller scaled non-bed furniture, some mirrors... just a thought. The Disney theme is very subtle and only on a few pieces in the room such as a framed picture

Summary Heading: The BEST Theme Park Location (and a good hotel too)
Summary: My family (especially oldest daughter) loves visiting the Disney parks and we have visited both WDW in FL and Disneyland in CA multiple times each. Between these stays we have stayed at the Wilderness Lodge, Polynesian and Grand Floridian in WDW but now The Grand California Hotel in Disneyland is our favorite.    To begin it is a very pretty hotel, inspired by the classic national park hotels in the California arts and crafts style and is very reminiscent of The Wilderness Lodge in FL, which was our favorite looking of the 3 Florida hotels we stayed at. Of course it is true to the typical "service with a smile" you find in all Disney hotels. The pool / courtyard area in the middle of the hotel is great and my kids loved the sequoia water slide. Finally, Disney hotels are all

The convenience alone makes it worth it if you have a little extra money to spend. We had a great 3 day stay. It was so nice to leave the park and not have to wait for the tram to take you to your car, then drive to another hotel. Also, stores and restaurants were still open to get food right there! Definitely will be staying again. PS- If you plan to get room service before the Magic morning hour, be prepared that it may not show up at the time you expect (6am-6:30). We wanted to get in line for Magic Morning for the Disney California Adventure early (6am since it opened at 7am) and our room service didn't come until 6:45am :( I'm sure they were very busy since everyone in the hotel wants food before they enter the park. I suggest to just get Starbucks in Downtown Disney. Great

We stayed here for 4 nights and it was wonderful!  We had a room on the 2nd floor overlooking the California Adventure Park.  It was great to have a special entrance into the park just for those staying on property.  Room was very spacious and in great condition.

The location alone is worth the extra money, it will save you lots of time and steps. You are literally just a few steps from DCA, Disneyland and Downtown Disney. The hotel is beautifully decorated and has LOTS of extra amenities.  The housekeeping visited our room several times a day to keep our room tidy.  The beds are super comfy and quiet.  Except during the fireworks bc you are so close to the parks.  The Storyteller restaurant is very good for breakfast. White water cafe is adequate, don't try to order at the window the little old lady will yell at you.:)

Summary Heading: You still get what you pay for but this place is getting a well-deserved updating in the fall of 2016
Summary: We have stayed here 3 times over the past 8 years and we have enjoyed each stay and the quality the place has to offer and the staff quality. The check in is smooth but if you catch it at the wrong time, it can be a bit of a fire drill. Staff is good at organizing the lines and getting you thru but they may want to consider a mobile check in feature in the future like many other chains-assuming you don't have any special needs or requests.  This was the first time we were not able to get a room with a bunk bed and we found out that once the room renovations are done, there won't be any more bunk bed set ups which is a bit of a bummer... But our kids a were getting a bit too big for them anyway! We were told the rooms will be renovated/updated in blocks starting in Sept 2016 and

Summary Heading: It's ok. I'd rather stay at Disneyland Hotel
Summary: Last year, I stayed at Disneyland Hotel and had Concierge Premium View. Paid top dollar for it and I was not disappointed at all. This time, we stayed at Disney's Grand to see if it's better considering it's supposed to be the BEST hotel inside Disney. Boy, was I disappointed. For the money that I spent, the rooms very very tiny compared to Disneyland Hotel. Service was ok. Would I come back? Probably not....

Disney's Grand Californian Hotel and Spa is a grand hotel by any standards.  The beautiful big hotel is situated overlooking Disney's California Adventure Park and can be accessed either thro the park, for hotel quests or by way of Downtown Disney.  It is well worth a visit just to see the magnificent entrance hall.  I had booked a spa visit so proceeded thro the hotel to the spa enjoying surroundings which is easy as all areas are accessible for disabled access.  The Spa visit was wonderful, I would recommend it to anyone.  It is the first time that I had had a full body massage and was well worth the cost.  The ambience of the spa is restful, the facilities were excellent, could not be faulted.  I was not rushed after my treatment and the staff were very helpful and friendly.

Summary Heading: Perfect location and good stay but seriously expensive for what you get
Summary: We stayed here 3 nights while visiting the parks.  The hotel is perfectly geared for families with little touches like a movie playing with small chairs next to reception to keep the kids happy while checking in.  We were able to get a bunk room and I highly recommend this for families as it gives you more floor space.  The room was comfortable and had everything we needed and we even got a partial view of the spectacular night show.  The pool area is good but a little clinical. It would have been elevated to greatness if it blended more into the neighbouring forest of California adventure and perhaps a river like feature.  The Napa rose was very good with the best service we have had in the USA. The food was also very good as was the wine. But at a bill of $500 AUD for 2 adults

Summary Heading: A Beautiful Hotel with Excellent Attention to Detail andComfort
Summary: Thanks to the graciousness of son in law and daughter, we celebrated daughter's 40th birthday on the concierge level (6th floor) as their guests.  The rooms are very clean with wonderful linens and such comfortable beds.  Our room was extremely quiet.  Breakfast, tea, and afternoon hors d'oeurves are served in the Craftsman Lounge and there is an excellent selection of  delicious foods to choose from.  I love to bake and their pastries are so tasty and artfully made.  The resort staff are wonderful and are always cleaning, whether it is the wrought iron fence adjoining the pool or the railings around balconies.  This hotel is clean, clean, clean!  I can't say enough for the lifeguard staff at the  three pools.  They are extremely attentive, especially in the area around the

Summary Heading: Be sure to check your stuff before you leave the hotel
Summary: I really can't recommend this hotel to my people. Stayed here for 5 nights and really didn't feel that they cared about us staying in the hotel.  Pros: 5 mins to parks downtown has all the eating and drinks you would want Lobby was good Live piano playing in the lobby  Cons: Unfriendly staff Not chic amenities Dated hotel rooms Broken fixtures in bathroom.   No early check in. When I reached hotel there were lines of cars, so I told I am going to park in the self parking so I started moving towards my car, this valet guy almost dashed into me and then parked the car infront of my car and stood infront with his hands on waist and stared aggressively.  Checkin front desk staff not very understanding people.   Stayed here for 5 nights and they gave us room which was facing incoming

Our family splurged, and spent one night at the hotel.  Due to past experiences with "Disney magic," we held great expectations for our stay.  We arrived very early (6:15am) on Wednesday of Spring Break. The valet staff wasn't very explicit about how to best handle our bags: were we supposed to unload our cars onto carts to be held until our rooms were ready, or would they do it for us (and would there be additional fees)?  Nor were they very friendly.  Another disappointment was the frustratingly slow free wifi.  Each of our 8 family members bailed on the wifi and used data to get anything done on email and social media.  We had two rooms, one for our 4 20-something kids and one for us parents and grandparents.  Both rooms were outfitted with only 2 coffee cups...although it

Summary Heading: Average Hotel But they all Are Here But best location.
Summary: If you are going to do Disney, just do it book 4 nights here and then you can say you  have done it all and done it in a relatively easy way.  We looked at all the hotels while here and this is the best of the hotels and has the best location.  In terms of a hotel, its a hotel small rooms but adequate and your not going to be in the room much so don't worry about it.  This one is located in downtown disney a 10 min walk to Disney land and it has its own entrance to Adventure land. So its location is the best of all the hotels.  Advice for the Lands.  OK YOU NEED TO BE ORGANISED.  a) If you can travel outside school holidays, public holidays and the weekend. DO IT. b) Magic Hour If staying at one of the Disney hotels you get an extra hour in the morning. This varies each day so
