This was our first time staying at the Grand Californian, but hopefully not our last!  The hotel is beautiful, and the staff was wonderful.  The line for early entry to California Adventures was long, but a staff member told us to enter through Downtown Disney, and it was a breeze!  A five minute walk easily saved 30 minutes waiting in line.

Enormous yet cozy. Busy but clean. Overwhelming but inviting. In a word‚Ä¶ Disney. In three words‚Ä¶ The Grand Californian.   This resort is nothing less than a modernized yet rustic home away from home in the middle of the Los Angeles Metropolis. Upon entering the resort, you immediately notice the wood in every part of the structure. Specifically, the floors, paneling, support beams‚Ä¶ even the front desk‚Ä¶ all have various hardwoods polished to a magnificent finish. Walk in a little farther, and you will find yourself in awe of the enormous lobby, which holds enough comfortable seating for you and about 50 of your closest friends to take a load off while waiting for dinner, character meet-and-greets, or evening fireworks. Directly ahead, depending on the time of day, you may find a

The Disney Grand Californian is lovely lovely lovely resort!  We stay at Disney often, as we are passholders who live about 2 1/2 hours north of the parks, and a drive home after a long day of walking, fireworks and parade-watching can be exhausting. We often stay "off-property" because it's significantly less expensive, but my lovely family surprised me with a special 2 day trip to Disney and a stay at this fabulous hotel! WOW!  The amenities (your own GATE to get in and out of the California Adventure park, lovely lobby and pool, fabulous restaurants and EVEN five park hopper passes given upon check-in) are SO worth a splurge!  AND.. my wonderful daughter knows how much I love "Behind the Scenes" opportunities at Disney, and scheduled a 6 a.m. PowerWalk through C.A. for myself

We have a great one night stay over spring break. ¬†As close as you can get to the park entrance. ¬†Checkin was a breeze. ¬†Staff was great. ¬†A bit of a hike to our room, which was ready when we checked in several hours early. ¬†The room was clean and in great shape. ¬†Despite overlooking Downtown Disney and the crowds, it was quiet with the door shut. ¬†We didn't have a chance to explore the ammentities. ¬†And while pricey, it was worth it for the location to minor commute time to the park and maximize our two days at the park.

Room was well kept, clean, a bit dated, but more than adequate. Be prepared to do a lot of walking! This hotel is huge and getting to the nearest elevator took a few minutes from our room. The best part of staying here is the Magic Morning Entrance to the park, but the rest of the hotel didn't blow us away. Service was decent, restaurants provided good food. Room service was quick and delicious, and well priced. Pool area was kid friendly, but a bit crowded. Overall, would stay here again based on the close proximity to Disney amenities and early entrance perks!

We requested a room with bunkbeds, since we were a family of 4. When we arrived they did not have a room with bunk beds available, they gave a suite with a pull out couch bed. The pull out bed was very small and barely fit my (2) girls. Our room was located back in the corner of the hotel right above the service road. At 4:00am we were awoken to the roars of the service trucks and their back up sirens. We did not get much sleep. When we confronted the customer service the next day, we were advised that it happens all the time and that there was nothing can could be done. Very disappointed for the amount of money we paid. I also emailed customer service with no response.

Summary Heading: Absolutely magical!  A luxury that i would stretch the budget for
Summary: Disneyland was EVERYTHING i had ever dreamt about as a child.  To stay at this hotel was the icing on the cake.  The hotel is older but traditional and very well thought out.  Perfect location for a family with plenty to keep the entire family amused.   Having such close access to the theme park made it even easier and more enjoyable.  Plenty to see and do at the hotel and surrounding it.   It was quite expensive for the type of room we got but we had that much fun that it was worth it

We had a 5th floor view overlooking the pools and part of the park.  It was very quiet and calming which is essential in your breaks from the hustle and bustle around you. Everyone can find things wrong but the Disney folks work hard to limit that attitude.  We enjoyed everything about our stay.

Summary Heading: 2nd Happiest place on earth Disneyland being the 1st.
Summary: I've been to the GCH several times mostly in the DVC rooms, but 2 times in the regular hotel. Other then a few personality-free front desk agents, I have never had any real problems. Love the pool(s) and loungers. Love Napa Rose, Storytellers, White Water and Hearthstone Lounge. Yes, it's expensive, but worth the location, and experience. If you can't afford it, don't stay there. The DVC rooms are newer then the rest of the hotel, so, as some of the reviews have pointed out the hotel rooms could use a good renovation.

Overall a nice, comfortable hotel.  It is the closest hotel to Disneyland, and right in the middle of Downtown Disney.  I was here at Christmas and the lobby was decorated nicely but was very crowded.  I waited until the next morning to explore.  The clerk at the front desk was helpful, friendly and efficient.  The hotel is very expensive and I would probably not stay here again.  Valet parking is in front of the hotel, and self-parking is across the street.

I had such high hopes for my most recent stay at a Disneyland property, and everything leading up to the stay was great (booking, making changes, etc.), but after all was said and done, I was pretty disappointed in the experience. When you pay so much for a hotel, especially at Disneyland, you expect to have a magical experience... I'd say this trip was anything but magical, it was standard. We decided on the Grand Californian because it was so close to the parks and we were taking our son for his 1st trip to disney and wanted it to be special. A couple of friends were coming with us, so we had some requirements for the room for sure.  At check in, we were told the room style we needed wasn't available until our second night, so we would have to change rooms. With a baby and

Summary Heading: I would never stay here again for any reason at all.
Summary: I will start by pointing out, when you read through tripadvisor, and see people post about a hotel, if the hotel cares at all about it's guests, or their experiences, the manager usually responds to people's posts. All good hotels do. Look through the reviews of this hotel and let me know if even once anyone has ever addressed any compliment or complaint. The point is, they just do not care. Whether  I rate it 2 stars, whether 4000 people rate it 2 stars, people will still come and stay here because it has the name disney. But this hotel has fallen into my top 5 least favorite hotels I have ever been in.   Where to start, When my car pulled up to drop me and my son off, no one ever greeted us, not one of the 5 cast members I walked by on the way to the front desk said hi. The

Nice hotel with good service.  Very pricey when compared with other properties but you are paying for the convenience of being able to walk directly into one of the parks (California Adventure). The service does not match the price that you pay.   Rooms are clean and reasonably quiet...a little frayed at the edges (i.e. stains on carpets, dents in furniture, small rips in curtains, etc.) but overall very passable for a 4-star experience.  Service, and the attention to detail, is nowhere near 5-star quality, (or consistency), compared to other hotels in the world, but, again, setting expectations of where you are and why you are there will still make it an "E-Ticket" experience.  The concierge level provides a nice respite from the hustle and bustle of the parks and the club

I have stayed at this resort as a guest, worked as a vendor at an event (photographer) and attended events as a guest many times and have never, ever had a negative experience. The resort is very clean, has plenty of dining and shopping options, and is in an awesome location adjacent to the parks with its own entrance. We love hitting Grizzly River Rapids and then running back up to our room for dry clothes. The dining options are all a hit, and we frequently stop in during a visit to Disneyland.

This is the fourth time our family has stayed at this hotel.  Service is second to none - Disney does this amazing!  I love everything about this hotel.  Our boys are teenagers now  and we got a extra cot in our room this time.  It worked really well.  Being on site is perfect for coming and going.  Hotel is pricey, but we've previously stayed across the street a few times and there is no comparison.  Highly recommend you stay here.

We traveled to Disneyland twice last year (both for weddings in SoCal, where we decided to make a trip of it).  The first time we stayed at a "good neighbor" and it was nice, but the walk to the parks took a lot out of us.  The next trip we decide to "go big or go home" and book at the Grand Californian.  WOW.  It was amazing right from the start.  The moment we pulled up the valets were amazing, each staff member was amazing and then our room was just ridiculously amazing. We could see Goofy's flight school from our balcony and we had a decent view of the water show each night.    Pros: The staff is fantastic (the best we experienced the whole trip) The location - easy access to both parks (a separate entrance from the hotel to DCA), easy access to Downtown Disney and lots of

Stayed here almost a year ago.  We got here late and the employee at hotel check in was very nice.  The hotel itself was very nice.  We had no major problems with the cleaners.  The room was very nice.  Also, there is a gate from the hotel straight into California Adventure, which is great for early mornings at the park with little waiting for rides.  The service was so good that one of the kids left their phone at the hotel and they found it and mailed it back!     Would definitely recommend to anyone staying at Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Take your Disneyland vacation to the next level
Summary: We've always liked visiting Disneyland, but staying at the Grand Californian made it even better. The property is beautiful and the employees are the best. I loved the convenience of walking straight from the hotel to California Adventure instead of waiting with the hordes of people at the general entrance. The best part was getting into the park an hour early before it gets crowded.

Bringing the family to Disneyland thought this would be the best place to stay. IN the off peak season so not as busy as maybe in summer and holidays but still pretty crowded. Staff very friendly and cheerful. Room was supposed to have a view and be deluxe but I certainly wouldn't describe it as such. A bit dark and no real view, except of the room next door. I opened the curtains to be looking pretty much straight at someone on the balcony at 90 degrees to ours. Couldn't get the wifi to work although apparently it was free (wouldn't know). Pool slide was not working and it seemed a lot of areas were not in service. Very close to California Adventure and handy to have entrance to park straight form hotel but the line was pretty long to get in for early pass, even though we got

The hotel and grounds are beautiful. Extremely convenient, every cast member we encountered went above and beyond what you would expect(A-1 service).The lobby is breath taking and a pure joy to have a coffee or night cap with the fire place and piano player. With all that being said we were totally let down by our room. As much money as we spent we felt it should have been a little bigger. This was the first time for us at The Grand Californian and maybe our last unless I hit the lotto and can upgrade to a suite. We've stayed at all three Disney Hotels now and find the Disneyland Hotel is the best bang for your buck if your a working class family.

We came with our grandchildren, it was so fantastic for us all. Any age will feel wonderful here. Loved the Disney products in the room! So easy to enter the park, kids where loving the Character breakfast! Managers where around and helpful! Such a magical adventure!! It was a November stay I'm late

This was my first opportunity to stay at the Grand Californian.  It's a beautiful resort.  So convenient with access directly into Disney California Adventure Park.  Also connects to Downtown Disney.  And less than 5 minute walk to Disneyland.  Spacious rooms. Great Disney service.

We've stayed here before and loved it. In fact, I adore Disney, the thoughtful design and attention to detail, the Stickley, and the Grand Californian is no exception from an aesthetic standpoint.  So it pains me to say ...  it's not worth it anymore.   While the staff are impeccable and friendly and accommodating, there were a few factors that led to this lowered rating:   -when you text to let us know our room is ready, why not bring our luggage up to the room so it's ready when we get there? If it's because of tips, why not add it to my bill for the amount I'd tip anyway? We got back to the room quite late and then had to wait, when our room had been ready for hours.  -if we're checking out that day, housekeeping shouldn't come. And, when there was no response to the knock

Had a conference here for a few days and stayed onsite.  The place was amazing with its architecture inside.  Rooms are a little tired and could do with a bit of a tidy up. Price is very high but you can get early entry to the park if staying there.  Nice and close to everything

Summary Heading: Great Hotel and Location at Disneyland
Summary: We had a nice stay at the Grand Californian Hotel.  The hotel is located in a great location next to Disneyland.  We have been going to this hotel since our kids were toddlers.  Our children are teenagers now and I feel that the rooms are small for our family.  Overall, we had a nice stay and good memories of the Grand Californian Hotel and Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel with some great amenities
Summary: There are lots of reviews on TripAdvisor so I will comment on some things I think were important.   Parking is easy..either valet or self park ($18/day) at the Disney Hotel lot across the street.  Plenty of bell boys to help out, they were very friendly.   Rooms are nice but not very big, ours had two queen beds and a cot in the closet but it would be very snug if there were 3 or more people.  Great option for families with small children though or close friends.   The access to California Adventure Park is awesome and could probably save families an hour or more in transit if staying outside the property, more time to spend at the three plus pools, including a kids wading pool,  and hot tubs.  Their pool area is a mecca for kids, with an easy slide well guarded by life guards.

Love this hotel. I've been staying here multiple times a year for many, many years now, and have yet to have a bad experience. The rooms don't feel quite as "Disney" as the Disneyland Hotel, but the overall ambiance of the Grand is unbeatable. The lobby is so zen and quaint - especially during the holidays when the huge Christmas tree is inside. You also can't beat the location. With it's own private entrance into DCA, the Grand is the closest you can get to the parks. If you're lucky, your room may even overlook California Adventure. Or, better yet, you may get a Downtown Disney view that allows you to watch the fireworks direct from your own balcony. So many opportunities for magic at this hotel.

We had a great trip!  I expected some let down from some of the reviews and planned not to let them bother me.  There was no let down at all!   Check in line was well managed and fairly quick.  We did the valet parking which was only a few dollars more a day but saved a half mile walk!  Baggage was managed well.  We got there before check in time.  They store our bags and texted us the room numbers. Wait time for bags at park close can be a bit - everyone left the park at the same time and all want their bags brought up then.  Tired and grumpy after a long day in the park - may annoy you.  We couldn't get through on phone, so one of us went down to bell hop and bags were delivered in minutes.  I suggest stopping by bell hop counter on the way up to your room.    Room was clean

We decided to spoil ourselves with a night at this luxurious hotel. My friend gave us a sweet discount and we figured it would be awesome...which it was!   The hotel was beautiful, the staff was fantastic, the proximity to the parks are unparalleled. We loved white water snacks and we even treated ourselves to a meal of room service. It was very well done, everything was clean and it smelled good and the hotel is gorgeous...  That being said, I don't think Ill be staying here ever for anything remotely close to what a normal price would be. Its a ton of money for something that didn't wow me. I knew that going in so I'm absolutely not mad about it. Its a treat! If you're looking for a good hotel thats gonna meet your needs but you're hesitant on the price, book elsewhere. This

Summary Heading: Super convenient, great staff, rooms only ok.
Summary: Super convenient, great staff, rooms only ok.  feels like a room at the Marriott but you pay a premium for the location.  With little kids, I would do this all day long!  Love the magic hours as well, early entry into the park is key.

Let me start by saying this was a trip booked on a wing & a prayer just to get to the Diamond Celebration. We went through Costco Travel for EVERYTHING, as it appeared least expensive to bundle it all together. I chose the Grand Californian for proximity to park, without a rental car, and ability to enter through Downtown Disney for visiting with friends in the area. I can very easily say, my husband & I were not disappointed with the hotel. Every staff member, from registration check-in to the cast members running the metal detectors, were all AMAZING. (I even got someone to write on 14 separate buttons for my very spontaneous college reunion group!)  When you first walk in, the hotel lobby takes you to a feeling of the Sierra Nevadas...think craftsman cabin in Lake Tahoe meets

My husband and I stayed at the Grand California Hotel for our anniversary/Valentine's Day.  We stayed in the Club level and requested a view of the park.  When we booked the room the person on the phone promised us a view and "Disney Magic touches" for such a special day. We had stayed at the club level before and last time we were greeted with an escort, balloons and special buttons to wear. This time we stood around the lobby for  1/2 hour waiting for our reservation person. We were then told we had to check our bags (another 1/2 hour). Upstairs we were left in the lounge until the clerk came back with our room keys.  No view!  And the wrong type of beds.  We negotiated with her for close to 2 hours before we reached a compromise.  Still no view, but the right type of bed.  We

Summary Heading: Amazing location, beautiful lobby but the rest feels like an old motel...
Summary: The hotel is next to California Adventure and offers a private entrance into the park which is great... it's also 2 mn walk from Disneyland Park... so location wise, this is unbeatable... The lobby looks really cool and reminded me of a hotel in Grand Canyon I stayed at years ago...  the rest of the hotel (corridors, rooms, equipment in the room) looks very old and desperately needs refurbishing... the carpet in the room looked ... sad... and the overall room was dark. the towels were worn out and paper thin like you find in cheap motels and the hair dryer didn't work (they replace it though). We had a room facing Downtown Disney ... I could probably have argued my way to another room but wanting to enjoy the time in the parks with my kids, I went for ear plugs... without that,

I love the location of this hotel.  I love walking off the elevator and into California Adventure.  With two crying kids in strollers it is nice not to have to  keep walking down to the Disneyland hotel.  I also love the proximity to Downtown Disney.  However, I think that you are paying entirely for the location.  It is lovely, but I may actually prefer the rooms at the Disneyland Hotel.  The rooms are nice, but certainly not luxurious.  You still have a small bathroom with  shower curtain, and a relatively small room.  Having recently spent similar money on a hotel in Maui, it was definitely a come down.  I guess that you just have to forget how much things cost when you are at Disney.

Summary Heading: Location and convenience, good customer service
Summary: The Grand Californian is the most expensive option for hotels in the area, but you are getting an added convenience and excellent location. The hotel is beautiful. The rooms are pretty typical hotel rooms. We had a double Queen and an added day bed, which comfortably fit our family of 4. The room was clean and well-maintained. There was a small fridge but no microwave. The restroom had a double sink. We had a Downtown Disney view, with a small deck where we could people-watch and also see the fireworks in the evening. One downside is that this area is loud since there are people out and about at Downtown Disney each night. If you are sensitive to noise this is something to consider.   The hotel has its own entrance into California Adventure and Downtown Disney, which is very

Summary Heading: It's Not All About the Location
Summary: The Grand Californian is actually a nice hotel even without it's prime location.  It's just that most people would never pay the same price for a room if it weren't right at the park.    This was my first trip to Disneyland, and I was traveling with my son and granddaughter.  I'd read enough, and talked enough to people who have been to the parks multiple times that I thought I understood how many others would be there with us.  While nothing fully prepares anyone for the masses of families and couples at Disneyland during a school holiday, I did get it enough to know that anything I could do to cut down waiting in lines and additional walking would pay dividends.  That's where the location aspect of the hotel adds value.  Going out one hotel entrance it's about a 2 minute walk

My wife, daughter, and I checked into the Grand Californian on 2/15/16 and checked out 2/18/16.  We had a great stay.  Room was clean, with all the amenities one would expect  from a hotel of this caliber.  All cast members  we encountered were friendly, helpful and accommodating.   The best thing though is the location.  A hotel guest only entrance into Disney's California Aventure.  Also very close proximity  to Downtown  Disney.  We chose to make advance reservations for breakfast, lunch, and dinner at other restaurants on Disney property instead of eating  at the hotel.  Meals at those restaurants was fine. All in all, a great short stay!!!

We stay at this hotel every year to celebrate my grandbaby's birthday. Here is the good and the bad. Excellent location- love the fact that we can walk to the park. Hotel is very clean and amenities are a good quality. Long line to valet and a longer line to check in. We had a villa and a regular room and our rooms were not ready until 5.30pm and 4.30pm respectively. When we asked for a late check out to compensate for the rooms not being available at 3.00pm we were denied a later check out that 11.00am. I did not feel that the staff was apologetic for this inconvenience. This is not the customer service I am accustomed to when paying a lot of money for a room.  Not sure that Walt Disney would approve of the sub par customer service.

Talk about an amazing location! Just walk out the door and you're in the middle of California Adventures. The rooms are always very clean and comfy, and there's a great view of the firework show every night. Of course the staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. This hotel spoils you and makes it very hard to want to stay anywhere else when you come to Disneyland!

I really cannot say anything negative about this hotel. The hotel is attached to Disney's California Adventure park and is also mid-point in Downtown Disney, which makes it the most convenient hotel for Disney goers. The hotel lobby is stunning, the service was amazing, and the bed was ultra comfortable. The only caution I would provide is the cost. This is a very expensive hotel, so weigh the comfort and convenience against the price. Is it worth the splurge? Yes.

Summary Heading: Way too expensive for what you get.
Summary: The hotel is design in a Arts and Crafts style making it attractive.  The hotel is large and regimented where you park and unload and when.  They make you feel you are dealing with the TSA. The service is cold as ice without feeling.    Ask for your car and they ask a bunch of questions.  The rooms are clean but somewhat dark as they use energy light bulbs.  The beds are comfortable.  Room service is on time but the food was cold and the potatoes were hard as a rock.  This hotel is expensive and not worth the money.

I recently spent 8 nights here, and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. This hotel is in a great spot as it's attached to California Adventure Park and DownTown Disney. It's a very quick walk to both parks and to go shopping or grab a meal. I also grabbed several meals from White Water Snacks and really enjoyed them all. Especially their American Breakfast! It's a tasty way to start the day.  I've stayed here once before, and I'll stay here again. It's not cheap but it's definitely worth saving for.

This is a perfect location for your Disneyland Vacation. Attached to Downtown Disney and the California Adventure Park. Less walking. Need I say more. Close to restaurants and the parks. Great Pool that is maintained very well.

This is definitely the most beautiful hotel on the property and the most convenient. In just a few steps, you can be at the gates of the Magic Kingdom or you can go through the hotel into the California Adventure Park. The rooms were fairly average and the WiFi was good, although we spent most of the day in the park so we didn't test it too much. Housekeeping was good and the cast members that helped us check-in were helpful and friendly. Overall, a decent place to stay that's worth it for the location more than anything else

Summary Heading: Great location. Need to work on hot water
Summary: We just got back from 3 days at the Grand. We love the location of the hotel but for the price they need to work on a few things. My main complaint is their hot water. When you take a shower you have to be fast because it goes from burning you to freezing in a few minutes. It was hard to shower the kids. Also the food on the property is horrible and expensive. We have been her several times hoping they might read reviews and make some changes... maybe next time.

We recently stayed here for the Thanksgiving holiday. The main entrance to the hotel is amazing and the customer service lived up to the Disney experience.   We loved getting early access to both parks as well as instant access to California Adventures. The breakfast buffet here was also amazing, and there are plenty of characters to go around for all the kids to see. Also, you are very close the Downtown Disney and the Disneyland Hotel as well which is right across the street.  The down side to the stay is that for the price/night the rooms were small and not in the best shape. The floors in our room were uneven, the floor boards were coming off and the wallpaper was holding on for dear life.   Our overall experience was great, we just expected more for what we had to pay.

Summary Heading: Beautiful Architecture, Expensive For What Is
Summary: Hands down its a beautiful hotel and the people are very accommodating, but I think it's too spendy for what it is. We got lucky with our view but I would be angry if we were a few doors down. It would've been considered Downtown Disney view but you would've been so far from it and looking at so much of a rooftop that you would have to ask yourself, why bother. Also, if you are staying here and paying the prices I would recommend paying for vallet parking. Your already pay $18 a day to park yourself you might as well go the extra mile. The reason I say that is the self parking is clear across the busy street and it's a pain. Positives, the bed was comfy and I loved the foot rub creme was wonderful. They also decorated our bed for our anniversary which was a HUGE surprise and

As a DVC member I had a villa with 2 rooms a full kitchen 3 bathroom !!! With the sofa bed and an extra bed hidden in a wall we were able to fit 8 persons comfortably. I know it's not your normal room, but I am reviewing my experience. It is true that this a very convenient location near the parks and Downtown Disney. I would like to mention the quality of the food at all the available restaurant in this hotel and specially The Napa Rose restaurant where we did have an excellent diner with very good service.

I know, I know! It's expensive. But, I have given my rating based on the overall experience. I've stayed in a variety of place when visiting Disneyland, and you can't beat the Grand Californian. It's actually IN CALIFORNIA ADVENTURE PARK! So, you can't get any closer. The magical experience and majestic lobby is worth every penny. The employees are helpful and we'll knowledges. Ask the concierge for tips. Or, perhaps have a conversation. With one of the many other staffers that are willing to help the magic come alive for your family. As always, if you want a great experience be courteous and pleasant. It's hard to help a negative angry person. Your magical day will come alive the minute you step through the doors of the lobby!

Great location and Great Service  that is it.  Stay here for 2 nights.  It was really convenience for us because our kids( 7, 5 and 1 1/2).  Great for going back to the room for nap and rest when they are tired. The kids pool did not open in the morning.  We paid over $500 usd per night plus $ 28 for Valet.  The room is very basic we had a queen with bunk beds.   Room is clean however, the faucet looks like it hasn't been scrub in a long time.  Tv shut off for no reason. They did fix it right away.   Magic morning only certain rides are open and its only one park that is early not both. This hotel takes you right into California adventure and downtown Disney.   They have turn down service with chocolate on the bed and Desani water bottle for everyone staying in the rm. Stay in

Summary Heading: Great location for you Disneyland stay
Summary: My wife and I decided to stay here for 4 nights as we had a three day pass for Disneyland Park and California Adventure. It was more expensive and we anticipated that everything else would be also. That way there were no disappointments. From the moment we arrived we were greeted with smiles and everyone was genuinely pleased to assist. At check-in the young lady organised our complimentary $150 gift card, the park entrance tickets, the breakfast with characters and lots of hints for our next three days. We arrived mid morning after a 14 hour flight from Australia and just wanted to freshen up. The young check-in lady went out of her way to find us a room with a king bed (very rare at the resort) and we were able to check-in early. We were warned about the half marathon and did

On a daddy/daughter weekend, we booked a room here about 2 months in advance.  Because the room was not ready at normal check-in of 3pm, they upgraded us to a suite.  You'd think I would be grateful and normally, I would have been.  But the suite had a king bed and sleeper sofa. Since my daughter and I needed 2 beds and had booked 2 queen beds, I requested to change back to a regular room, to which I was told that my booking for the 2 queen beds was a "preference" not an actual guarantee and they didn't have the room we requested...oh well, she slept on the sleeper sofa. (my back can't take those bars through the thin mattress). After a long day at Disneyland, we tried to get a decent meal at the park but the sit-down places were packed.  So we went to Downtown Disney and it was

Summary Heading: Not what you think... an honest review here.
Summary: This is really just a hotel of convenience there are no other perks or extras. The only thing disney about the hotel is a Bambi shower curtain other wise it is very basic and standard rooms. Don't expect anything extra other than the hour early entrance to the park and to be honest that wasn't worth it as we found some areas were closed until real opening and you can't get fast passes till the park actually opens. However the convenience of the location and being able to simply walk in and out of the park or straight into downtown disney was worth it. We did expect more for the money like maybe milk and cookies or characters roaming around or perhaps a special discount on purchases for staying at the resort but there was literally nothing. We had to pay $28.00 per day for valet

I stayed at the hotel Wednesday-Saturday. Housekeeping great. F&B mediocre. Front Desk not good. Long check in process. Guest services horrible. I got horribly sick while staying by myself the last night and could barely walk so I asked for water and medicine from the gift shop and they made me walk downstairs and get it myself. Selection poor  so instead got a cab at 4am. They said they would get me in the lobby when the taxi arrived but they forgot so I sat there becoming more and more sick. I'm sorry....but isn't going "out of your way" for guests Hospitality 101? I'm very disappointed in Disneyland CA.

When you stay in a Disney hotel, you expect to pay more for not very much more value.  We saw it as paying the premium for Magic Mornings and easy park access.  Otherwise, it was a tired hotel.  What we liked: 1)  Location, and direct entry to California Adventure.  Even with the direct entrance, we experienced long lines for early entry (post Xmas still seemed like peak season). 2)  Our room looking over the park area outside Soarin' Over California.  We hadn't booked a park view room, but got a nice one. 3)  Festive programs in the lobby during the Xmas season.  Enjoyed the carolling, acapella trio, and the huge christmas tree.  What we would have liked: a)  More entrances into Downtown Disney.  Our room was in a wing very near the Naples restaurant in Downtown Disney, no more

Summary Heading: Comfortable room, perks kinda "meh", so so service
Summary: Booked 2 nights via an Annual Pass holders discount.  Even at $318 per night I was expecting top level service.  The room was nice, though of course early check in never happens.  At first I was concerned by the location (far south western tip of the hotel), being as it was closest to the street and front.  However the room was perfectly quite.  The room felt a bit small compared to the equivalent room at the Disneyland Hotel, but big enough for me and my 6 year old.  The beds were quite comfortable.  The shower/bath felt a little small and the drain mechanism was not functioning, but since we took showers, this wasn't a problem, so we didn't report it.  The pool area was okay, though not nearly as fun as the Disneyland Hotel pools.  The Redwood water slide was underwhelming by

Grand Californian was by far, the best hotel I've stayed in when traveling to visit Disneyland. It is elegant, playing off a forest and Bambi theme, enchanted forest. The lobby is huge and the rooms are wonderfully spacious. The complimentary bathrobes were so soft, as were the slippers and the beds were comfortable. The pool could have been deeper for my liking, but the pool side service was an A+ bonus! And the water slide built into the rocks was cool.  The hotel is built inside California Adventure Park and it also connects to Downtown Disney. So guests have access directly into the park.  My favourite was the ability to buy items at the shops and within Disneyland, and have them sent and waiting for you at your room! The only thing I was appalled by was how expensive the

We booked a last minute trip to Disneyland and have stayed here before so we wanted to come back. We usually fly but this time we drove. When we arrived a valet got the bags out of the car and we needed them to hold the bags until our room was ready. This guy made sure I knew that we wouldn't see him again, so, you know, someone else will bring the bags to our room so this is the last time you will see me. He literally was asking me for a tip. I always tip but this guy really turned me off. Fast forward four days later. When we were leaving they brought my car and handed me the key fob. What? The fob was missing a piece. When I told them it was broken and missing a piece that also had a set of keys on it the guy basically said too bad. He had no intention of helping me at all.

Summary Heading: Very expensive, slightly tired.  Club Level NOT worth $250 EXTRA per day
Summary: The good.  Very friendly receptionist and reasonably priced room service.  Extremely comfy beds and very conveniently.   The bad.  We had a two room suite - 2 adults + four kids.  It was a HUGE hike from the lifts - not a big deal.  The room was very clean but I expected A LOT more for US $1700 per night - room only.  The decor was tired and the room waa very dark an not very inviting.  Adding in and additional $250 per night for the 'club level' is where I really did not see value.  The food offered was the same each day and it's freshness was questionable and the location on level 6 was a bit prison like (well located to watch fireworks).  Hint:  don't use the hotel entry point for early access to the park - we had to queue for 35 minutes.  It is far quicker to go through the

I am a Disneyland annual pass holder and we stayed here in January for the first time.  It was worth the price in my opinion and we were lucky enough to get a package deal special which saved us about $100. Parking was $28 for valet, $10 cheaper if you self-park (the same price as self parking to get in to Disneyland).  Self-parking is located across the street from the entrance of the Grand Californian which is a short 1 block away.  Check in service was very friendly and informative.  I wish I remembered the lady's name who checked me in so I could compliment her because she spent at least 10 minutes explaining everything to us. Our room was nicely sized and comfortable.  It had a sliding door that gave access to a balcony with an outdoor table and chairs. I did not reserve

We stayed 4 nights at the Disney Grand Californian Hotel just before a family Christmas trip to Hawaii. The hotel is a lovely arts and crafts lodge style hotel with gorgeous authentic decor. The lobby was beautifully decorated for Christmas with a large Christmas tree as the centerpiece and a toasty fire in the large fireplace. The addition of carols played by a pianist and evening vocal entertainment made it an inviting location to enjoy coffee or a drink. The rooms are nicely decorated and comfortable. We had a view  of the park, with the huge ferris wheel outside our windows. The location is outstanding with immediate access to The Grand Californian theme park, Downtown Disney and Disneyland a very short walk.There are several restaurants on the property as well as many

This hotel is beautiful, and functional. I was so impressed with the atmosphere, both family and couples friendly. You have got to experience this hotel, spa, bar and restaraunts. We always go to Disneyland Hotel and this was a really fun change in scenery and amenities.

Truly magical for my entire family. We all stayed at the hotel at the club level. It was great. As Disney Vacation Club members this was the first time in a while that we stayed in a hotel and not a condo. The club level made traveling with little ones so easy, all you have to do is go down the hall for breakfast, snacks, and milk at night. We had a California Adventure Park view and it was also great, the kids watch and heard the grizzly rapids and watched the monorail go by. So worth the money. I would stay there again and again. Concierge staff arranged transportation for us the next morning to LAX. There was nothing that we had to worry about. Well done Disney!

Summary Heading: Couldn't ask for a better location!
Summary: We just stayed her with my family and loved the location. You can access California adventure park right from the hotel. Everything is so nice and close. Was a little disappointed in the selection in the store for food items. We stayed in a two bedroom pool view villa. The room was large and had three bathrooms! My only complaint about the room was it was starting to look rundown in areas.  The best part was seeing the fireworks from our room! We will definitely return :)

Summary Heading: Great location, sound proofing from connecting rooms bad
Summary: The room was nice. Not sure it is worth paying more over Paradise Pier or Disneyland hotel.  We had a view of California Adventure which was nice. The sound proofing to the balcony was great, but we could hear every word that was said in the room next to ours. Not necessarily a bad thing if you are on the same schedule as your neighbors. We were not. We were up late and the awoken by the excited kiddo's in the room next to ours. I appreciate the excitement, just not at 7:30am.  The only other thing I would change is the pillows. All the pillow felt as if they were stuffed with a bunch of kids socks. Super lumpy.  I have stayed at Disneyland Hotel and feel the distance was similar to get from the park to our room. Plus it was a bigger room and sound proof. (well as sound proof as

Summary Heading: You need to experience this hotel.
Summary: Every few years my beloved and I book a room and revel in the special vibe of the California Grand.  We spend several hundred a night and enjoy every minute.  My favorite thing to do is wander and look at all the little details that add to the overall ambiance.  Find hand cast metal ornamentation and beautiful pottery in pools of warm light.  Stay near the holidays for a sweeping view of holiday decor the way it ought to be.  Take the tour to get interesting tips like the design process, the mosaic floors, paneling in the bar, or the creatures crouched atop pillars on each floor.  Yes you can spend lots of money for a room but all the rooms we have experienced were lovely.  Just wander, find a spot by the outdoor fireplace or lounge at the pool.

Summary Heading: Theme Park View....not worth it anymore.
Summary: Decided to make birthday special so I headed down to see Mickey! I have been an annual pass member since 2013.  I visit the resort at least 3 times a year and always stay here.  I'm not asking for marching bands upon check in but when you book a theme park view, you should get a theme park view.  Not a pool view which is basically a view of rooms so when you walk out on the balcony you are looking at everyone else.  The girl who checked me in said that was all they had.  She then said I didn't book thru the AP site, even though I got the AP rate (hmmmm....) so no fast pass for me.  Ok, again...where's the customer service.  If I got the AP rate, would it have killed her to just give me the pass?  I mean what would it cost them?  One more person who used a fast pass?  Uh oh.  Not

At Disney great possibilities to have a convention. Although diner facilities near the convention were hardly to find or to crowded the area itself was convenient. Hotel facilities are excellent if you are on holidays with the kids but if you are on a business trip this is too noisy, too crowded. Rooms are comfortable but need to be upgraded.

Summary Heading: A wonderful stay!  But...just a few tips.
Summary: My family and I recently stayed at the Disney Grand Californian Hotel and Spa.  While I can see some of the other reviews are mixed, I can honestly say our stay was wonderful!  Check in was great with Nick being very helpful in finding us a great room!  We had a Woods/Courtyard view, and were on the 5th floor.  We had a balcony and our kids loved watching the monorail pass by.  At night, we could see the fireworks from our balcony.  It wasn't a complete view, there was another building somewhat blocking the view, but we could see well enough that we had no complaints :)    Our room was very clean, and in good condition.  I did not see any signs of wear, as other reviewers have mentioned.  We had a queen bed and bunk beds, which our kids loved!  The room was equipped with a

Summary Heading: Average... so not worth the price
Summary: Good: Location, access to the theme parks, good soundproofing, hardly heard kids unless they are running  Not so good: Old hotel, tired rooms, housekeeping not up to scratch, average food, staff courtesy hit and miss, only the porter Bill seemed sincere to assist.

Summary Heading: A Great First Trip to Disneyland!
Summary: My daughter and I took a trip to celebrate Disneyland's Diamond Anniversary.  This was the first trip for her and I had not been to Disneyland for over 30 years.  The Grand Californian was a great hotel.  It did take longer than usual for check-in, but after that things went very smoothly.  The room was very clean and the bed was really comfortable.  The hotel is just a short stroll to the entrance of the park.  The people were very friendly and courteous.  I would most definitely stay at this hotel again.

This is a hotel that will stun you when you first enter the grand lobby. It is beautifully crafted and decorated. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The check-in process is a breeze and you get some perks, namely some fast pass tickets and maybe a signed character picture if you're celebrating something.  The proximity to the Downtown Disney shops and restaurants and the California Adventure theme park is probably the biggest perk. It is very convenient to drop by your room and drop stuff off or change if the weather turns. There are other perks, such as the pools and fitness room, but we did not take advantage of those (too cold to swim in February and we were walking all day and had no desire to get on a treadmill).  We got the most basic of rooms, so this review is only

We stayed here with our 3 kids (ages 6-9) during our Disneyland trip. It's the EASIEST way to make a Disney vacation the best it can be. The extra perks you receive--Magic Hour for ALL days you have a park pass for, private entrance into California Adventure, and easy access into Downtown Disney and Disneyland will make your stay so much smoother.   NOTE: The private hotel entrance to California Adventure is small and slower than the main entrance. You should NOT use the hotel special entrance for Magic Morning hours. Use the main Disney/California Adventure entrances and you will get to use up your full extra hour in the park, not waiting in line in the hotel.   The hotel itself is nice but not incredibly fancy. You are mostly paying for location, excellent service, and

The resort is pretty amazing in regards to architecture, service and convenience.  Check in went a bit slow and had to wait in a line for about 15 minutes.  Place is pretty hectic in the lobby at times but I found the room to be pretty quiet for the most part.  I would have like to see the hours of the restaurants extended in order to accommodate the early openings of the park.  Hard to get early breakfast without room service on those days.  Staff was friendly and the pool and workout area were good.

Summary Heading: This is very expensive, it has great perks
Summary: You can enter Disneyland's California Adventure Park from this hotel with no waiting at all, as well as the Downtown Disney District. Rooms are usually $500 a night, I get the book 3 or 4 nights with one free and find other promos, the cheaper rooms go fast so book early. beds and service are great. You have to pay for parking, its like $30 a night

This was our first (but not last!) stay at the Grand Californian. The service was great (what you would expect from Disney), the rooms were clean, and the walk to the parks was short. We had a room overlooking Downtown Disney which allowed us to see the fireworks in the park every night without battling the crowds in the park. The only thing that bothered me (just a little) was how small the room was for the price.

My husband and I spent part of our 2 week honeymoon at Disneyland and it was the best time! We stayed at the Grand Californian and they made it really special. Our room had a balcony that was directly over the California Adventure park. The big, beautiful trees around the grounds kept us hidden from direct view of park goers, but we could hear the hustle and bustle of the park if we had our doors open which was really fun. The bed was very comfortable and the room was nicely decorated with some Disney touches without being corny. But the best part of this hotel is really it's proximity to the parks and Disney Downtown. When it's the end of a fun, but long day in the parks there's nothing like the adrenaline leaving your body and the sudden surge of exhaustion and foot pain. If

We stayed here the last week of Oct 2015 and it was worth every penny for the convenience of the park alone. We we're laying by the pool one day and saw on our app that the line for Grizzy River Run had gone down so we walked over went on the ride and were back in our lounge chairs in about twenty minutes.

Stayed for 3 nights and loved the convenience of being so close to the parks.  It is more expensive than other surrounding hotels, but well worth the splurge.  After an early morning and long day at California Adventure, was able to have dinner at Ariel's Grotto and then go back to room for a rest, then walk right back into the park to see the World of Colors show.   Our room was clean and comfortable.  Staff were all very friendly.  No Stress!

King size bed, park view, my 22 month old's first trip. Could see the fireworks nightly and was located so centrally to the parks and downtown disney. Chocolate on the pillow each night. guest services was kind and helpful!! The hotel was decorated so beautifully and you could smell gingerbread throughout the lobby. The room was spotless and super comfy.

Ok, so its a little more pricey than the neighboring hotels. However, it was nice to smile as I watched people head to the parking lot shuttles as I strolled through the park on my way back to my room. Each morning you also get the magic morning, which is nice if your kid wants to do the Jedi Training or any other long line event/ride. It was all so nice. Definitely will do it this way again, even if I have to save more for a longer period of time. WELL WORTH IT!

Summary Heading: Great for a Disney visist, but maybe not for business
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for a business convention.  It is a beautiful hotel with nice sized rooms.  As a Disney hotel it is packed with kids and crowded all the time.   The room was nice with an adequate work space, coffee maker, safe, dual sinks and an OK bathroom.  I had a bad first experience in that I grabbed a glass to drink some water and the glass stuck to my lips.  It had what I am hoping with Sprite all over the rim.  Ugh‚Ä¶  I also asked to check out one hour late (noon instead of 11 am) and the request was denied.  Also, the rooms are noisy; glad I brought ear plugs.

The Grand Californian met our expectations! It was lovely, reminiscent of a national park lodge. Our room was clean, attractive, well-appointed. Staff were professional and friendly. Best of all--the location! You could easily access (by private entrance) the California Adventure; you can also easily access Downtown Disney (and then to Disneyland). This made taking an afternoon break (or when you are totally soaked from Splash Mountain) quite easy.   Some folks have noted that the wifi reception was poor. We had no trouble at all with wifi.  Would I stay here again? You betcha! However, as rates can be quite high, watch for discounts and off-season rates to make slightly more affordable.

Omg!  Great hotel and even better we were upgraded to the Mt Whitney suite!  The suite sf bigger than my home. Living room dry spacious and comfy!  3 bathrooms, kitchen and huge bedroom. So enjoyable!  We have stayed at the grand California before and will now stay again after this amazing experience

Architecturally beautiful building with first rate service. Convenient to Disneyland and they have a gate directly into California Adventure. Also in the middle of Downtown Disney so there are many dining options right there. The Monorail stops nearby and there is ESPN Zone if you have a game to watch during your visit.   Rooms are big enough but not huge. There are ones with park or Downtown Disney views (I like the park view).  These will be noisier.  If you want more quiet the inside views would be the choice. They keep the grounds nice so the views are still attractive. I just like the outside action. You can easily come back to the room for a mid-day break while visiting the parks.  If you want to have a little comfort while visiting Disney, this is the place.  They know

My Wife and I stayed here during the Disney Star Wars half marathon weekend (MLK weekend). Since my wife was running the race, we decided to go without kids, splurge a little, and stay here for the convenience. Everything during our stay was great, but just a few things to note.  1. During the race weekends, be ready to be woken up at 4:30 - 5:00 AM every morning as the starting line is very close to the front of the hotel. You can hear the hype man on the loud speaker and the music.  2. When we were leaving, i didn't know where to get a cab. I asked one of men who looked like a manager and they told me a Valet could get me one. Only issue, all the valets were standing across the way talking with each other. I had to walk across and asked one to get me a cab. I asked one of the

We stayed for 3 nights.  We found the service really good and it was very convenient to the parks and downtown Disney.  But for the price per night I really dont see the value.  next time I will stay someone more cost effective.

Summary Heading: Worth it for the convenience, but not what you would expect for the price
Summary: This is the second time we've stayed here and I honestly wouldn't stay anywhere else simply for the convenience of being able to hop right back to your room to take a break or something when you need it. The fact that it's connected to California Adventure and Downtown Disney is just perfect. The rooms are nice, but are not "luxury" as you would expect for paying $350-400/night. Room was clean, no complaints except for them having possibly the worst toilet paper ever! Seriously! This stuff is like sandpaper and they had the same stuff 2 years ago when they stayed there. I'm not normally one to complain about stuff like that, but this stuff is so bad it's something you can't forget. Great samples of toiletries by H2O plus. All employees were friendly and accommodating.

We only stayed one night for a 2 day Disneyland trip and it worked out really well. I was immediately impressed by how smooth our arrival was. We drove up to the hotel, we gave our car to the valet, checked our bags (as it was only 830 am when we arrived and our room was not yet available) and checked in all in a few short minutes. When we checked in we were given our room keys, they took our mobile number and we were sent a text as soon as our room was ready and could use our key to access our room from that point with no return to the desk. The hotel's lobby is gorgeous as are most all of the common areas. The decor is all inspired by California Craftsmen themes. The theme is also in the rooms but the execution in the rooms is not very impressive. The room was very clean and

As the other reviews say, this hotel is just really really pretty. It's got the over-the-top Disney vibe inside - the lobby alone is worth a trip even for people who aren't staying there. Rooms don't quite live up to the hype - they're a little generic and don't reflect the same fun of the lobby, but they're totally fine and comfortable. Foot cream in the bathroom is a nice touch. Service is impeccable. The private entrance to California Adventure was worth the cost all by itself.   The only restaurant I tried there was the Storyteller Cafe for the breakfast brunch, the quality of the food was disappointing but they know their audience. The variety is fine, nothing special for a decent hotel buffet, but it is skewed towards childhood favorites, and I doubt kids will notice that

Summary Heading: Well run Disney property with great location
Summary: Steps away from the parks and run with the typical Disney cleanliness and efficiency. Of course it comes at a price but considering the alternatives I would always choose on-property.Extra hours at the parks and no need to rent a car or worry about parking and traffic just walk out of the lobby and step into fun.My only two complaints are that the check-in process took much longer than expected especially given the fact that we already had booked a package and didn't need to determine what activities we needed or tickets to buy.Took us a good 45 minutes to complete the process with only one other group ahead of us in line and four front desk people working.Second complaint is the size and layout of the only bar/lounge in the hotel.It doubled as a coffee/pastry shop in the

This location on the Disneyland property is ideal for guests who like a little luxury and want to make it as easy as possible with small children. it is right at the gates of Disneyland and California adventure.  The hotel is BEAUTIFUL, especially if you can visit at the holidays when the enormous tree, gigantic gingerbread house and strolling carollers are present.   I cannot say enough about the cast members at this hotel (and the resort as a whole).  They have made each of our stays so comfortable. The rooms with bunk beds are IDEAL for families.  You can have Vons deliver groceries to the hotel and the bell desk will bring them to your room.   The only small complaints I could think of would be that the bathroom needs a fan (there's not much privacy with a pocket door in a

My wife and I take our 3 kids to Disneyland just about every year, 5 trips so far as a family.  We have stayed at a variety of hotels in our visits to the park and the Grand Californian was hands done the best.  GREAT food, phenomenal service, and an experience that simply made our overall visit exceptional.

Summary Heading: Amazingly Comfortable Beds with Theme Park Convenience
Summary: The Grand California is beautiful and pricey. It's convenience into California Adventure adds a little extra frosting to an already delicious cake though. I couldn't believe how comfortable the beds were in the room (which was average in size)!   There was nothing special about the bathroom - the sinks in the bathroom were separate from the tub and toilet, and the tub/shower had a shower curtain which isn't the most sanitary thing and especially bothers me when paying such a high rate for a room. There was a mini fridge in the room but no mini bar or bottles of water. We stayed in room 4415 which was quiet and somewhat private.  The pool on property is heated (but still seemed chilly) and has two water slides - one for big kids and adults and the other for little kids. The is a

Summary Heading: I didn't expect a lot and still disappointed.
Summary: I always say to people who are visiting any Disney resort - don't expect a great hotel. They are always average at best.   However we decided to stay here as it is regarded as the best of the best of the Disneyland hotels in Anaheim.   The lack of service on arrival shocked me. We had a lot of luggage and just came off a 23 hour flight. There were 5 Disneyland porters hanging around having a great chat and laugh and watched us struggle with a lot of luggage. Not what I expected it had ever experienced on our several trips to numerous Disney properties.   The room we had was okay and probably what I expected. The bathroom was typical Disney - dated and tired and I never understand why they have the basin outside of the bathroom in the living section.   We had a great view of the

Summary Heading: Location is the only Good thing
Summary: The only good thing about this hotel is the close proximity to the parks.  Staff was not helpful or friendly (except valet, valet was GREAT).    The Magic Morning "special" entrance is a joke.  The line wraps all the way around the building and we did not actually get to enter the park until 30 minutes after opening, so our magic hour turned into a magic 20 minutes.  Go to the main gate to avoid this long line!  The rooms are comparable to a Holiday Inn or something worse, very outdated and run down.  We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel in September and found these rooms to be much nice and much larger.  Also, our room was not ready until after 3pm, and we only got a room because we called and complained.  The staff told us, there is no guarantee check-in time its any time from

Summary Heading: The best Disneyland property in Anaheim
Summary: The GCH polarises a lot of travellers. Some love it (and you can easily see why), and some think it's way too expensive. All I can say is, it depends on what you want. We've stayed in all 3 Disney properties and several off-site properties in the last few years and this is undoubtedly the finest- with one caveat: it is expensive. We used our annual passport to get a significant discount so it didn't hurt as much. There are 5-star hotels elsewhere with better amenities, etc. But hey, this is Disney. You pay for the fact you are in the Happiest Place on Earth. You can easily absorb the atmosphere because you are right there, and you don't have to walk half an hour to get to and from the theme parks. There is a direct entrance to Disney California Adventure without having to

Summary Heading: Rooms equivalent to a standard motel
Summary: To begin with our family is not big Disney visitors and the last visit was 8 years ago. We came for a quick two night getaway with our kids and made the reservation at the last minute. Most of the rooms were booked and we were left with a premium room at over $500 a night. I know you over pay for anything Disney but I was surprised at the poor quality of the room. For as much money as we were paying and to be told it is a premium room with a view we were shocked at the room. The bathroom was tiny and had a small tub with a Disney shower curtain. There was a tile in the shower that had a hole in it with rolled up tissue paper filling the hole. The wallpaper had stains all over. The wifi did not work in the room and the view was looking at the unloading area for all the people

I love this hotel but it is so huge and so expensive.  The only reason I stayed here is because I got an annual pass holder deal.  Even then it's still overpriced.  The service is outstanding and the amenities are wonderful.  Early Entry into the parks, the fact that is right at California Adventure, the soaps in the room (especially the foot rub) are great perks.  Sitting in the lobby late at night is also a highlight for us.  The bar is friendly with good drinks.  The cons are the parking is expensive and the rooms are really too expensive.  You also usually have to walk a long way to get to your room.

Summary Heading: You Are Paying For The Location!
Summary: It probably goes without saying, but when you stay at a Disney property, you are mostly paying for the location.  We stayed here for three nights for my daughter's birthday.  We had specifically reserved and paid for an premium park view room.  When we checked in, they tried to check us into a handicapped accessible pool view room, which was not acceptable to us.  We were then told that no park view rooms were available, and were offered a room with a view of Downtown Disney.  Again, this was not what we had reserved and there was nothing offered by Disney to offset this problem.  The room was very noisy and we were basically told - too bad, we're full.  We asked if we could move to another room the next night and were told that we'd be put on a waiting list; we never got a call

Summary Heading: Minor things could've made a big difference
Summary: Overall our stay was good. Upon checking in I recieved a birthday badge and signed picture of Cinderella (even though I was turning 18). Staff were friendly enough and the foyer was nicely decorated with nightly piano. Great access to food - we had breakfast at White Water Snacks 4 mornings in a row, as well as easy access into California Park. The room was clean and the doors to the balcony were really sound-proof (the front door is pretty good too except we got woken up by screaming children in the hallway one morning). It was hard to tell whether the walls were sound proof as we didn't hear any noise the whole time until late one night when we could hear the tv, and people talking. Could also hear doors slamming and toilets flushing - quite common though. Beds were

Of course, the location is good and the staff is very friendly. But the good news stops there. Here are the highlights of our negative points:  Internet access is almost non-existent. The WiFi signal in the rooms and in the common areas is so weak that it continually disconnects and has to be re-authorized. The wired connection in our room was dead.  We bought a ticket to a concert at House of Blues at Downtown Disney and were told it had to be printed for presentation at the venue. We were charged $6.51 by the hotel's business center to print one page.  Having "Magic Morning" early access to the parks is nice, but you can't get a decent meal beforehand. Full-service restaurants don't open till 7AM. I should mention the same problem exists at DisneyWorld Orlando. Restaurants

Great location.  Impressive facility.  Met all expectations.  Easy park access is its claim to fame.  Staff personnel is extremely FAR above the norm! Rooms are nice, but no more so than many alternatives.  Little or no Disney theme to decorations.  Had expected more from a Disney location. Our room was very quiet.

I stayed here in january 2016. Check in was fairly quick and the cast members in the lobby were among the best I have ever encountered. After a thorough introduction to the the hotel and it amenities we walked to our room.  As soon as we walked in I was amazed by the woodland/cabin theme of the room. If you have stayed at any Disney "Deluxe" hotel this is pretty much what one would come to expect. I did notice the fire alarm not being attached to the wall instead it was dangling by its electrical cables but it really did not bother me. However the room cleaners left back a syringe on the bathroom sink. It was one used for putting glue on walls for wallpaper or sealing things so water does not get through. That was enough for my SO to want to change rooms.  We called the front

Summary Heading: Amazing attention to detail and fun!
Summary: Arrival in the lobby of the Grand Californian Hotel is a wow moment :: grand and whimsical and completely inviting. We stayed on the Club Level, and had access to The Craftsmans Club which was totally worth the extra expense :: great breakfast options and snacks when needed, as well as a nice place to just relax when needed (all included). The staff were friendly and efficient. We really appreciated getting our room a few hours earlier than normal after a long flight from Australia. Loved the exclusive access point to California Adventure Park too! Right next to Downtown Disney where there are shops and restaurants. This is the best place to stay when visiting Disneyland and the Adventure Park. We were sad to leave!

We stayed in a 2-bedroom suite with family, the beds were comfortable and the rooms were clean. The close proximity to the parks and Downtown Disney made traveling with little ones easier. The charm of this hotel is unbeatable and made our trip more magical. We ran in the half-marathon, so being close to the start and finish lines was a huge plus.

Beautiful hotel, great pool, friendly staff! The rooms are a little outdated, but still very roomy and decorated nicely. I cannot express how friendly all the staff members are. Love coming here. Great family activity!

The hotel is huge and really needs a bit of work specially the plumping which makes noise all night. The room aren't sound proof either, you can hear the people in the next room, which isn't great if you have kids who need their sleep. You can't get a better location and the 7am starts are fantastic to get on the rides which have the huge lines, specially in peak times. It's so easy to go back to the hotel and have a break specially if you have little kids, and return later in the day. Hotel shop is expensive, it's worth a trip to a supermarket to get a few snacks and drinks if you there for a few days.  The wifi is terrible, in fact I didn't get it to work in our room or in the lobby either, for the price you pay and the oversea visitors wanting to contact home its not

We stayed early December 2016 for 4 nights.  When we arrived, it was extremely hectic.  Not at all like our experience at any of the high-end WDW hotels.  Had to wait in line for quite a while and room was not ready.  No pre-check-in available as they do with WDW.  Everyone seemed very confused.    Two weeks before our trip, I faxed the hotel with a list of preferences concerning the guest room.  One of the staff members phoned me to assure me that I would be getting a king-sized bed and not a connecting a room. She was very pleasant.  When we checked-in, the attendant told us that we would definitely get a king-size bed and not a connecting room but that the room wasn't ready yet.    We went to the bell stand to have them hold our luggage and were told very firmly after waiting

I recently stayed here for 4 nights with my father and daughter for her 16th birthday.  It was all about the location which of course was fantastic.  However, the room was very cramped, handicapped accessibility via multiple small ramps to Disneyland park rather inconvenient, beds uncomfortable.  Staff for the most part friendly although we were very unhappy to find out the night before our departure that all roads would be closed in the morning which caused tremendous additional stress.  The much touted entrance to DCA was so backed up it took over 40 minutes to get through the gate arriving 20 minutes prior to opening at a supposedly uncrowded time.  Overall, I might stay there again with my elderly father as every additional step makes a difference, but wouldn't bother with

We stayed here for a Disney run, and the convenience to the run is worth it. Overall, every employee was great- except for the concierge. We needed park tickets- we went up to him to ask- and he sneered they only sold tickets to resort guests- which we were. Even my thirteen year old commented on how rude he was. Fortunately, the cast member who sold us our tickets was much nicer. The turn down service is a rather nice touch.

Summary Heading: West Coast Disney is terrible, go to DisneyWorld not Disneyland
Summary: We are Disney Vacation Club members (have been for 20 years) and we have NEVER had a worse experience than our recent trip to Disneyland and stat at Disney's Grand Californian hotel.  Nothing at all "Grand" about it - room was not fully cleaned when we arrived, small items like tissues etc. not refilled, called to make restaurant reservations at the hotel and was put on hold and then disconnected twice.  One morning the cleaning staff in mid stay knocked on our door at 7 am and then again at 7:15 - WHAT??  Disneyland itself is an old tired park not worth the money when every ride is open (which was) and being "frisked" by security each and every time I entered the park was a terrible experience.  When I called "management" I got sent to Housekeeping and nothing was taken care of

Summary Heading: Great Stay for Star Wars Half Marathon
Summary: This location is simply ideal for touring the two parks as it is RIGHT next to Downtown Disney and even has a back entrance (private) to California Adventure.  And Disneyland and the Disneyland Hotel are a very short walk.  You're going to walk a ton at these parks anyway, and with our 13.1 mile half marathon thrown in, being right next to everything was a must.  And, the race starts at 5:30 am and they line you up at 4:30 am.  To stay offsite and have to navigate this would have been a real chore.    The prices are fairly high but this is Disney and you're paying for the location.  If you can afford it, I would stay here in a heartbeat.  The rooms are nothing special here - basic two queens, double sinks and a small bathroom (with no fan unfortunately).  It got really hot in

Summary Heading: Disney's Grand Daddy of Resorts in California
Summary: Having arrived at Disneyland I had reached where I always wanted to go as a kid and, well, I also had my kids along as well. Now having visited Disneyworld two years earlier (see my review of the Disney Swan or Dolphin or whatever it was), makes things very difficult for Disneyland as DW is so big and impressive, it is pretty hard to beat. Soooo, I decided to get as close as I could to Disneyland and stay here at the Grand Californian. Let's talk turkey - this place is expensive but it is as close as you can get to both parks and you have your entrance into the Californian Adventure Park which is handy when you take advantage of the early start for hotel guests. However, you can also stay at Disneyland Hotel (5 minutes walk) and Paradise Pier (10 minutes walk) and take advantage

Summary Heading: Being close has advantages and disadvantages
Summary: The nice thing about this hotel is its direct entrance into Disney's California Adventure park: though a pretty big line builds up early, it moves quickly and you enter the park right across from the Grizzly Peak ride. That and the fact that you get in an hour before the park opens to the general public make it worth the few extra bucks you pay compared to nearby NON-Disney hotels.   The room itself was nothing special.  And the sheer size of the complex meant that we had a long, long walk from the front desk and the pool to our room. Another concern was that, when we wanted to add an extra day, we had to go to the front desk rather than do it by phone. And since they didn't have an answer right away, we had to go back several times.  They eventually did offer us that extra

I organized a trip to Disneyland Resort for myself and 2 of my coworkers. I had already stayed at Paradise Pier and Disneyland Hotel so I thought I'd like to see what it was like to stay at the Grand Californian.    You will be hard pressed to find a review that doesn't mention money.  For most of us this is an expensive hotel.  The three of us are Travel Counsellors and I utilized my discount Disney gives me for selling their product - and we split the cost 3 ways. This made it reasonable and we were happy with the cost.   We had to sacrifice our "Park View" room for a "Pool View" room so we could have a third bed, which was fine. Nice little balcony, comfortable beds, good water pressure in the shower and very close to the Private Entrance to Disney's California Adventure Park

Summary Heading: Great Convenenience- good if you get a deal!
Summary: Our extended family stayed in 3 rooms in the Woods. View category.  Our room was well appointed- and we were lucky to have the rooms toward the end of the hallway where there was a break- and we got a slight view of Downtown Disney and we could see a partial view of that evening's fireworks. We got a great price for the rooms. The check in staff were very helpful- as there were 9 of us - all adults- and we needed a varied bed requirement.  We ate at Goofys Kitchen for dinner that night- a fun character meal at the Disneyland hotel. We are local- most of the family was from out of state. We have visited both resorts in the past- eaten at each of the hotel's restaurants and they are all very good. The Hotel is very convenient to the parks entry- well worth it if you can afford it.

We stayed here for 5 nights, two children and two adults, and it was by far the best hotel experience we've ever had. The staff was amazing and upgraded us to a room with bunk beds for the kid's and the kids loved that they had someone playing Disney songs on the piano. We definitely will be staying here next time we go to DisneyLand, it's such a close distance to downtown disney and the parks, hands down best hotel if you're going to visit Disneyland.

Summary Heading: For the Prices charged, by any standard you should expect better
Summary: I am afraid the Disney brand just continues to suffer at the hands of the hotels such as the Grand Californian. Pretty basic rooms( we chose a delux view room) for such rediculously high prices. Clean yes, very dark( the lighting is poor) and to charge the same rates for park views v pool views is ridiculous in the extreme. To top it off, breakfast at Storytellers is just a plain rip off. You are forced to have the buffet, full price tag for kids over 9, yes I said 9, 2 characters for 2 minutes and the price is approx $35/40 pp. they used to at least provide a character waffle, that's been cut out now. Lastly, the WIFI is shamefully poor. Rating 2= convenience , otherwise....

Summary Heading: Magical Stay, But with a Couple of Hiccups
Summary: I've always dreamed about staying at the Grand Californian and I finally made that dream come true on my last visit to Disneyland. The hotel was quite lovely and I enjoyed the convience of being an easy walk to the parks without having to wait for the ART when staying at other area hotels. Especially enjoyed the private entrance to California Adventure. The hotel is beautifully designed and I love the California artwork and designs incorporated into everything around the hotel. Our room was decent, though I was disappointed that we had to sacrifice the theme park view room we had booked so we could get a room with 3 beds in it. The room we were told was a premium pool view, but unfortunately I wouldn't call it premium, trees blocked our view of the pool. Rooms were very clean

Summary Heading: Still pricey - but service has improved
Summary: 3rd (and surely last) visit to Disneyland and so we stayed at Grand Californian again - can't argue with the convenience.  This time round I felt that the service quality had gone up - staff generally more attentive and interested.  I'm sure the time of year you visit must have an impact...we came on the back end of Xmas - decorations were still up but tree was taken down during our stay.  The place looked great with decorations.  Generally all was good - housekeeping on the ball, reception very helpful with security box, valet and concierge were also good.  While the bar staff were lovely I don't see how I can't get a seat in a place I'm paying big money to stay at for a drink at the end of a long day.....seems crazy that there are so few tables in the bar for such a large

We spent 7 days in at the Grand California hotel in the 1 bedroom suite for Disney Vacation Club members.
