The room was very large, had a full kitchen, in-suite laundry, 1 full bathroom and 1 half bathroom. The bedroom had a king bed and the living room had a queen hide-a-bed and smaller Murphy bed. Each room had cable TV and wireless internet. We loved being so close to the parks, it was very easy to come back for a break or a bite to eat. We got full amenities from the hotel, including the early hotel only park access, free parking and free delivery to the hotel of anything we purchased in the parks. Our room faced California Adventure and was only loud when World of Colour was showing. We did the hotel scavenger hunt and received two free giant Mickey cookies and did the park

Summary Heading: Disney Magic in a 2 room Suite? Yes & No
Summary: Location Location location. Expensive- average type rooms..Don't expect the 5 Star treatment for the 5 Star money. Convenient/Nice. I Splurged on a two room suite for a special occasion and came in around noon. Have stayed here several times in the past and been able to get into the room upon early arrival. This time the room was not ready so we left our luggage and cruised around Downtown Disney for a few hours. Came back at 3:00pm and room still not ready. We wanted to wait in the bar but bar was closed (due to a water pipe leak-complete refurbishment), so we waited poolside. 45 minutes past check in and still no call for our Suite, ( we had dinner plans scheduled over at Disneyland Hotel's steak house), so we asked for a manager and Surprise! .. all of a sudden there was a

You cannot beat the convenience, but the Disney price tag isn't worth it. Our room was worn out and only moderately clean. Our housekeeper only did the basics each day and left dirty dishes and trash in our room all week. We had 5 people, 2 adults and 3 kids and it was tight. We also paid for the "premium" room that only had a decent view of the pine trees and you could barely see the Disneyland fireworks.   Overall, we wanted to try it just to see, but we were highly disappointed. Like all of Disney, they pack you in, charge you a premium, and then ask you to get out quick so the next wave of shmucks can come in. We just expected more of the Disney experience than we got. I recommend staying off site and saving your money, the extra walk is worth it.

We love the Grand Californian. The locations is perfect, walk out the door and there is Down Town Disney. Walk out a different door and your in California Adventure. The Cast members go out of their way to make our stay fabulous, including housekeeping. It's also nice to have a balcony to sit  and relax with a wonderful view. We really love it here. :)

Summary Heading: Great Family time inside Disney Park acommodation
Summary: This is a great, cozy, charming place to stay. If you are planning to spend some time visiting Disney parks in California and taking kids with you this is strongly recommended. You will be just steps away of the entrance of California Adventure making access easy and if younger kids are visiting too you can always take them back to rest a little and come back later. But, stay away from this hotel if busy lobbies are not your place. There are shows and visitors in the lobby all day long.

I just spent one night at the Grand Californian.   GIST:  It was a great experience. BUT considering you're going to Disneyland to GO TO DISNEYLAND... it blows my mind how people can spend ALLLLLLL that money on a room. It was wonderful being so close to the parks, but the proximity isn't enough to get me to go back.  My kids are 7.5 and 10 years old... so we can do opening to closing without naps, etc.  Maybe if you have babies... maybe.  POOLS: We got there early so we could have the afternoon before our day at Disneyland in the pools.  The pools were fun and my daughters LOVED the slide... but quite frankly, this is Disney.  Couldn't they do better than 1 pool slide and 1 baby slide? I will say that they had plenty of lifeguards.  Tons in fact.  4 on the big pool with the

For our first trip to Disneyland with my wife, I looked at all the hotel options in Anaheim to find the best hotel and the best value.  Location is another consideration as the closer you are, the more convenient, time efficient and pleasurable the trip can be.  Disney's Grand Californian wins on location and convenience.  Being able to easily walk to Disneyland, California Adventure and Downtown Disney was a better choice than any other hotel, even more convenient than the Disneyland Hotel or Paradise Pier.  Being just minutes from the  attractions gives you many more options and you don't need to trek to monorails, shuttles, or buses to get to and from your room.    We had a standard room, two queen beds and a partial courtyard view.  The room was clean and comfortable, had a

Summary Heading: Location great! Rooms, shower, beds, internet, food - subpar.
Summary: If you are going to Disneyland and staying then this is the best hotel - the location alone makes that so, but Disney could do a lot better. The showers are terrible consistently - They just put cheap stuff in and it doesn't work well. On our most recent visit we could only get either hot or cold water. I asked them to fix it and the next day it was only hot hot water that we could get. The internet is difficult to connect to - not sure why, but it is hit or miss and takes a while when there is success. The food is always marginal with Disney - that is true in the park, on a disney cruise, at this hotel and all their hotels, and even at the Aulani. Disney can't seem to get the food thing right. Otherwise, Grand California is located very well with direct access to California

We took our 11,8 and 5 year old to the Grand Californian for 1 night. Our main purpose in staying at the hotel was to get to the park early and we wanted to experience "The Magic Hour." The hotel itself is nothing really that special. The rooms are very plain for the price. You don't even get complimentary water. I thought that was unacceptable for paying $400 a night. It was clean. Room service arrived on time. Food was good. We went in January and it was still decorated for Christmas. It was pretty. The Magic Hour made it all worth while though. We were literally the second family to walk into California adventure at 7am. We had to then check out at 11, which was kind of a pain, but they let us put our luggage in the car and then they valeted it again. That was convenient.

Summary Heading: Good but not the magical experience id expect
Summary: We frequent Disneyland, but we do it on a budget.  My parents took their kids (my brother and me) families to Disneyland for Christmas.  Magic morning hour is awesome! The lobby is gorgeous.  We enjoyed the pools and to Spa at night.  Turn down is nice, but not so much with sleeping toddlers.  The rooms are adequate in size, the beds are comfy.  There were weird noises during the day and night from level 5 and on wall. The toilets barely flush, which is good for the environment, but seriously? We won't ever stay there again.

Summary Heading: Great location & Staff - Just don't go to the local hospital!
Summary: Good basic garden view room over monorail tracks. Didn't hear the monorail at all. Acoustically well insulated. The early morning passes were a blessing as long as we got up early enough to use!  Had a cardiac "event" at the bar and had to be whisked away to the hospital. Do not, and I repeat do not, let them send you to Global! The staff there were great but it is the most depressing hospital to go to! Aside from the prisoners with chains and the drug addicts it was only mildly depressing. We were there for 5 hours and had no food with us. By the time we got back to the hotel room service was closed so we had a stale bagel for dinner.  The staff there at the Grand Californian were very helpful in letting us check out late the next day from the hotel. Kids had a great time.

We had the bunk-bed room that included a queen size bed.  It was perfect for my husband and I along with our two teenagers!  We ate breakfast a few times at Storyteller's Cafe and each time it was perfection!  Such a great variety that we all were satisfied!  It was just before Christmas so we enjoyed the beautiful decor and Santa even came by each evening.  We all enjoyed the close proximity to California Adventure, Disneyland, and Downtown Disney.  We could all go in and out several times throughout the day, no problem!  We will definitely be returning to this wonderful hotel!

Big spacious lobby but has a homey feel to it.  We had a room with 2 queen beds and a courtyard view.  The room is ok and clean.  Looks like any other chain hotel room though.  I was expecting a lot more for the price.  It is so close to the parks so can't beat the location.

We have stayed at this fabulous hotel many times and I cannot staying anywhere else when we visit  Disneyland/Cal Adventure Park.  For starters, the hotel is just beautiful.  The lobby, the many little sitting areas, the pool areas, etc are all great.  The pools are a good place to go to burn some extra energy after a busy day of traveling.  The staff is always courteous and helpful.    We love the rooms too.  They all have a nice little balcony with a few of something pleasant (no back alleys here).  And they all have a built in fridge which is perfect for chilling those water bottles or storing food for meals in the room.  I also love that you can take a break from the parks for a quick meal, a rest, or a change of clothes.  Even though our kids are older (and not napping

Summary Heading: Tired Property, Crowded, Service is Poor
Summary: I'm sorry but at these prices I expect something other then a tired hotel room, bad service and crusty linens.    The pro is that your in the park and can with a 20 minute walk get to your room to take break.  The con is the property really expensive run down and busy!  ** For the kids they bring in a blow up mattress (which where dirty) - fortunate thing is that kids are so exhausted they pass out on anything!  Save your money - better choices exist for the same dollar (but not in the park).

The hotel is probably the best located place to stay if you want to get early access to the Disney theme parks. The rooms are comfortable, but fairly basic. That really doesn't matter as it is unlikely you will spend much time in them. I wouldn't bother about a room with a view. It's worth paying for the magic morning pass to get the most out of the parks before the crowds descend. The staff were mostly very good, though some of the luggage assistants were a little impolite and constantly pushing for tips. I would, however, stay here again next time I'm headed to Disneyland.

I had high hopes for this hotel as the Wilderness Lodge in Orlando is one of my favorites. Very well themed to give it a Cabin in the woods feel. They have a couple pools and always seemed to be packed. The fitness center was small and only has a few machines. The quick service food was pricey but really good, I recommend the nachos at the food court. What's really nice is that you can enter right in the middle of downtown Disney or directly enter the Disney's California Adventure park. The room was very clean well kept. It's my favorite of the Disney Land hotels

I've spent time in the Florida Disneyworld. Everything feels like Disney there. Here it feels like a expensive hotel. We have a standard room, with two toddlers is just fine! The fridge is perfect for the milk & couple things we got for the kids.  The room was always very clean and any request for towels or whatever was delivered!   3 restaurants were not used by us. They seemed inaccessible to us because they aren't quite cafeteria style we get in the Florida hotels. 2 are sit down restaurants and the third seems kinda shady--- we ate other places instead   The grounds are great The parking is horrible :: self parking is across the street::horrible if you have toddlers!! We chose valet for sanity The views are wonderful  You can see one of the shows from the 6th floor at night

Superb location - you will avoid driving to the park taking shuttles etc. a beautifully landscaped setting. Rooms are like a typical mid class Marriott or Sheraton. Easy access to nearby restaurants although their quality is generally underwhelming. Filled with children eager and enchanted about Disneyland! This is what makes the exorbitant rates here worthwhile!

This is  the fifth time we have stayed here and we will be back. The hotel and grounds are beautiful. The staff is always friendly and helpful. It is very expensive but we love the convenience and atmosphere. We had rooms next to California Adventure, this was a nice change from looking at the hotel entrance. For a fast breakfast use the room service and order over the phone the night before ( a few more options than the in room order card).

We've been to Disney World many many times but this was our first time coming to Disneyland. We debated and decided to pay extra for this hotel and it was definitely worth it - do it if you can. Disneyland is much smaller than the Orlando parks and everything was within walking distance from this hotel... Which was amazing, especially after a long day at the parks!!  We loved the access to DCA right from the hotel (literally!) and the walk to Disneyland was 5 mins. We were there for three days after Xmas and the hotel was still decorated for the holidays, it was beautifully done.  Rooms were typical Disney and no concerns at all.  Definitely staying here the next time we're back in California!

I was so happy that I chose this hotel for our Disneyland stay. Apart from the awesome ambiance of this place, nothing can go past its convenience to the parks. We were able to grab fast passes in California Adventure before going back to the room for a break and easily coming back to use them when it was time. The exclusive entry for hotel guests made going into California Adventure Park a breeze, it was also a pleasant short walk through Down Town Disney to Disneyland Park. We stayed in a DVC studio villa. It had a nice amount of space for a family of 4, nice design and bathroom. The only thing they could improve on would be cleanliness, the carpets left our feet black, I haven't experienced this in any other Disney property. Overall, I would still stay here again next time we

We just finished our first family trip to disneyland! We stayed at Disney's Californian Grand. What a beautiful hotel!  It was still decorated for Christmas with a stunning tree and a 60 lb gingerbread house.   We arrived early in the morning, checked our bags and took off to the park. The hotel called me directly when our room was ready.  We booked a 2 bedroom suite as we had extra family staying with us. It was worth the splurge. The room had a great view of the pools. As an added bonus you could see a sliver of the fireworks from disneyland and a sliver of fantastic in the adventure park from the balcony. Enough to satisfy my 4 year old when we didn't want to return to the park late at night.  The best feature of the hotel is the direct access to the adventure park. Saves a

This is a hotel I have stayed at many times and this time was a huge disappointment. The rooms tired and not in a clean state. Had numerous issues with staff in particular the valet crew. Tried to address it with the staff at the time with a terrible result. Took it further - no follow up - such a shame as we had loved staying here in the past - now looking for another option to stay in for our future visits to Disneyland.

I should first say the humans I encountered were so very nice, but the hotel is a 2 star, mediocre chain,commanded from above, with no real experience, expertise or caring.  The hotel itself is just 3 star.  It is clean but there is nothing there.  The rooms are small and good luck getting them made up.  We had to call down 3 times to get someone to clean the room, all before 4 pm.   We arranged to have oxygen delivered to the hotel because my friend requires it.  Uhm, duh.  If someone requires oxygen it should be in the room and ready to go on arrival.  After disaster after disaster I was able to hook my friend up to a portable electronic machine.  Disneygoof took hours to figure this out.  Eventually they did get the tanks up, but seriously, this could have been disastrous and

We had the opportunity to stay at this hotel for 2 nights, and it really was quite lovely.  There is so much to do, you could really stay and never go to Disneyland at all!  I had always wanted to see what the rooms were like.  The staff is definitely trained in Disney hospitality.  Everyone is very nice. You can check your bags when you arrive before check-in so you can visit the park, or they will hold them after you check-out, which is a great benefit.  Our kids loved playing in the pool area, and we wished we had a little more time to take advantage of that (or that it wasn't quite so cold!) There is a viewing platform on the 6th floor where you can watch "World of Color" without going into the park, which was perfect for us. There is also a babysitting service with crafts

We had a great stay at this hotel. They let us check in at 8 am on a Sunday! They met all our needs to sleep all three kids in separate beds. We had bunk beds, queen, trundle, and crib plus a portable crib! Room was spacious and clean. Cast members as always kept the kids happy with free stickers, chocolate, and pins! Super easy access to park, early access as well was awesome. We will be back.

We stayed here in September and it was such a beautiful place to stay. There's some good restaurants, the pool area is great, quick access to both theme parks, with an entrance to California Adventure Park just for guests staying at the resort. The lobby is huge and very welcoming. The only disappointing thing was that even though there is free Wi-Fi access, it's extremely hard to get access during the day as everyone else is doing the same thing. I was staying up late to upload my photos from each day but that's the only bad thing I can say about our holiday. I would definitely stay here again as we plan to return in a couple of years

Summary Heading: Five star prices and one-star quality
Summary: Had a great time visiting Disney with family but this hotel was infuriating.  They charge outrageous prices and are obnoxiously cheap about everything.  I especially appreciated running out of toilet paper the last night because housekeeping did not replace the nearly-depleted roll, or provide a spare.  Late at night no one answers the phones so we had to go downstairs to use the public restrooms. Customer service is impossible.  You always have to wait in line or on hold to talk to a human and front desk staff cannot actually do anything except make excuses for the Disney bureaucracy.  The food in the hotel restaurants is dismal yet incredibly expensive.  You have to make reservations far in advance using their slow, clumsy, and buggy web site, and if you need to make changes

We stayed at this hotel last Christmas, and it's a great hotel, the rooms are large and very comfortable, restaurants are at the ground level, there is an entrance to Disney California adventure, exit to downtown Disney is near the lobby, although pricier than the other two Disney hotels in the area, it's worth it, so if you are just Disney bound, this is the perfect hotel for you.

Summary Heading: A wonderful place to stay near the "Happiest Place On Earth"
Summary: This is my first review of the Grand Californian after staying there four times over the past ten years. I've stayed in a variety of rooms at the hotel during that time, and have gotten to know the grounds, the amenities, the restaurants and the bars at this wonderful place.  I love the faux "national park classic lodge" feel of the Grand Californian. The central lobby is awe-inspiring, and you'll see it the moment you enter the hotel to check in. The staff at the hotel is typical Disney -- doing everything they can to make sure that guests are happy with what's going on.  The rooms aren't ultra tiny, and vary depending on the class of room you book. Most of the rooms I've been in have been perfect for two people and would also work for a family of four with two youngsters. Some

My whole crew is in high hopes that her "higher ups" know what a perfect person they have to represent them.  From her smile,  to the quickness in her step, she is the perfect epitome of hospitality and grace.   I know that service managers are usually coached to go above and beyond,  but this woman does so just with her listening skills and ability to show empathy.   Thank you for turning a frustrating time in Disneyland around,  Christina. Your superb ability at your job also shows in the attitude and graciousness of the rest of your staff.  There may be nicer hotels, but there are none with better staff.  We really enjoyed our stay.

Summary Heading: Fine hotel but the main strength is proximity to DLR
Summary: Service at the GC is excellent.  You can tell that EVERY staff member has been coached to attend immediately to your needs with a smile.  The rooms are nice but not palatial.  I think the main strength-- along with the fantastic service-- is the walking proximity to the Disneyland Resort and the special perks you get.  The hotel has a special entrance for California Adventure and you get the Magic Morning which is a crucial part of any DLR visit.  Also you get to use your hotel room key to pay for any snacks, etc. which makes it decidedly convenient and obviates the need to carry cash or other credit cards.  Finally, the bell staff will store your stuff all day long after checkout in case you still have a day left at the resort.

We often stay at accommodation a little further afield than the Grand Californian and decided this time to treat our group of 9 to three adjoining rooms at this resort.  What a magical place!  Check-in was relatively a breeze although it was peak time when we arrived.  The staff was courteous and well-prepared for our arrival with our pre-paid packages handed over with the room keys etc.  Parking was offered via valet or self-park.  With two cars we chose self-park and didn't have a problem.  A porter took our considerable amount of luggage to our rooms.  The rooms were fascinating.  When the inter-connecting doors were opened it became a bit of a rabbit-warren.  They were clean and tidy, but were definitely looking tired, especially the carpet which was well-worn.    The light

Summary Heading: You've got to be in it to win it
Summary: This hotel has to be the easiest way to do Disney, for sure. There is an entrance from the hotel to both Downtown Disney and Disney's California Adventure. The open areas of the hotel are grand and festive (we were there the week before Xmas). It is in the best and most unbeatable location. It's true that the rooms are pricey and somewhat outdated, but you're paying for the location and convenience. We couldn't have been happier, with Disneyland on your doorstop, how much time do you spend in the room? If you have littlies, being here allows you to come and go as you please. The perfect way to see Disneyland.

Summary Heading: The perfect place to stay while at Disneyland & California Adventure
Summary: I don't know what to say except that every time me and my family visit Disneyland & California Adventure we stay here. The place is incredible from top to bottom. The incredible lobby with its giant fireplace and its beautiful wood work to the spa and work out room. Everything is beautiful and the staff is incredibly kind and always smiling. The pool area is fantastic on the hot summer days and nights with multiple saunas and pools to use when some are busier than others. Also the rooms are very big and have room for multiple people and you don't feel squashed in like sardines at all. The room service is also very good as we ordered quite a bit of food and were happy with it all. The hotel also helped us ship items out to our place so we didn't need to carry them back on the

Summary Heading: Nice place but if there is a big problem, they don't care and leave you in the dust
Summary: The hotel is beautiful and the valet, and the front desk people and the are very nice.   Except when you have a big problem like food poisoning.  My husband, my sister and myself ate Jambalaya at the Blue Bayou and got food poisoned. They both vomited several times and had severe diarrhea. When I talked to the front desk, they told me I will be talking to a nurse but it was actually security.  I don't know why I had to talk to security so then a guy nurse was talking to me.  I told him all the symptoms and he had the guts to tell me it was not likely it was food poisoning since the food goes out so fast. He said it was probably the flu.  No it was not the flu!  He said if we need paramedics there will be a charge and to go downstairs to buy pepto.  Wow... a hotel that expensive

Summary Heading: Clean, new in appearence, fantastic staff, but the left hand sink had a drip sound when used.
Summary: We stayed here over Christmas 2015 with family.  Very good service on check in.  Our room was clean and new.  We noticed that if the left hand sink was used there was a dripping sound for about an hour.  We contacted the front desk and they offered to send somebody up immediately, but it was bed time and we had traveled that day so they scheduled it for the next day.  The problem was never fixed but was not an issue if we just did not use the left hand sink for our stay.  The lobby was all decorated for the holidays.  The entry for hotel guests into California Adventure cut down on time to get into the parks and the early entry hours allowed us to catch many rides that normally have a huge wait time when the general public get there.  The WiFi was pretty slow because of the

Summary Heading: This is similar to a Motel 6, only in Disneyland
Summary: Disney seems to miss big on this experience.   With everything that Disney does correct in the parks, its amazing to me how poorly the hotel is ran, seeing as it is a $600 per night "resort".   As many of the reviews have correctly stated, it is location, location location...That doesn't excuse the fact that it is still a terrible hotel for the cost.   There is no good reason why you can't get room service during peak hours (at all), the rooms are old and tired, and basic friendliness is abhorrently missing.   For example, we were leaving our room and wanted to get some basic information on the pools, and found the employee didn't really speak English, and didn't bother helping us find someone who did.   She seemed terribly overworked, and just couldn't be bothered.  This theme

Summary Heading: First stay and Christmas Family Visit, Magical!!!!
Summary: What a beautiful hotel!  The festive decorations and proximity to the parks made our stay very special.  William, who checked us in was wonderful, Wilson who helped us with our bags was excellent and shared all kinds of great tips with us!  A little pricey, but it was well worth what we paid.   This was a special surprise for our kids and a bucket list stay for hubby and I.  Couple of small issues with trash under the vanity and in the closet from previous guests, but nothing major.

We took our children (adult) to be at Disney Land from the 23rd through the 26th. The greatest thing was not only the beauty and the service involved with this hotel... But my husband took ill with a high fever and sick in bed all of Christmas Eve.  I went downstairs in front of the Storyteller Cafe and asked the gentleman out front if there is any way I could get some soup for my ill husband.  Not only did he send up soup but he sent a tray of things that would help any sick husband from crackers, honey, tea and all sorts of sick happy goodies.  I can't tell you what this meant to our family.  Thank you so much for your kindness!

Summary Heading: Going to Disneyland. This is the best hotel.
Summary: I took my son here for a mother and son trip. He is 11 and nearing an age where Disney will potentially lose its charm. This is a excellent  hotel based on location. It is literally a 1 min walk into the CaliforniaAdventure park and in the heart of downtown Disney. I have been and stayed at Disneyland hotels multiple times over the last 10 years and the California grand hotel wins hands down for location. The Benefit of being able to just walk into the park minutes from your room via an entrance with no lines is worth the extra cost. Yes it is expensive for the quality of the room but it is worth it. I wish I had stayed here when my son was little. It would have been so much easier. We always stayed at Disneyland hotel which I like but is not nearly as close to the parks. The

Stayed here for a couple nights during the Christmas season, it was beautiful! I've been here over summer but staying here at Christmas was simply amazing. Club level staff were superb, from the concierges to the servers. Room was in fine shape. Yes, it's super expensive but if you're reading TA you've already gathered you're paying a premium for location & staying in the "disney bubble" NOT for an amazing room (because they aren't, they are SMALL).

This is by far the most beautiful disney hotel I have ever stayed at, and I've stayed at many! It's rustic yet elegant and the same time. It gives you a warm and inviting disney feeling that you can't get anywhere else. The service is great and it's extremely close to the Downtown Disney shopping and dining district making it convenient for your dining and shopping needs. It has a private entrance to the California Adventure park for guests of the hotel only. They also have villas which is a great option for large families and Disney Vacation Club Members. I can't speak highly enough of this hotel. If you're wanting to stay at a Disneyland hotel that has convenience, great service, lets not forget amazing rooms and with a beautiful ambiance that is reflected through the whole

The Grand California Hotel is ideally located to Disneyland and California Adventure park.  If you're going with a crowd, it's nice to have a place to relax between the hectic visits to both parks.  The younger children appreciated taking some time out in the afternoon for a swim at the pool and relaxing in the hot tub.

This is the second time we have stayed at The Grand Californian. The main reason for staying here is the close proximity to the parks. Aside from that it's expensive and disappointing. We found our check in experience slow, late and inefficient. There is very little Disney vibe in the hotel. One night I called for room service and was put on hold. After waiting about 10-15 minutes I hung up and called reception to be informed it was peak time for room service and I might have to wait 20 minutes to get through. It was suggested I go downstairs to get some food instead. My wife also had asked to have all our bed sheets changed, which subsequently did not happen. Only after repeated questioning did this get done. We were given incorrect directions to get to the guest laundry, and

Summary Heading: You are paying for the location.
Summary: The hotel is very beautiful and the location is key.  You literally walk to both Disneyland and California Adventure, and there are early entry privileges for hotel guests.  The cost for these benefits is stratospheric.      Pros:  Location and early-entry to parks.   Cons:  High price for a somewhat mediocre room.  We paid for a "garden view" and discovered it was a view of trees planted outside our balcony. There were long, long walks for some rooms in this huge hotel.  Rather limited food options at the hotel (either $30 breakfast buffet or limited grab-and-go choices such as $3.49 plain croissant).  The hotel is right next to Downtown Disney, a public shopping area very popular with the locals.  Expect it to be crowded, especially at night.  If you want to eat at the

We just completed a two night stay in a two bedroom suite.  The location is perfect for exploring both Disneyland and California Adventure.  The service was pretty good, and the room was spacious for our family.  The Napa Rose was very good and we ate their both nights.  If you don't mind paying the premium, this is the place to stay.  The pool and spa were a nice break in between Parks.  We will return.

Very disappointing. The poor service started from check in. Incorrect room allocated. When this mistake was picked up there was no apology and we were told we would be texted when our room was ready. No text till 3 hours after check in so we went to ask and we were told it was sent so too bad if we did not get it. No information about Disney park hours or holiday specials and we found this out from other people. Then our family got sick and we waited 4 hours for extra towels. We phone housekeeping three times and were told too bad we are busy!  Don't try ordering room service at any time between 5 and 7pm. We tried to call for 40 minutes then were told by the front desk when we called down that it was peak time and we would just have to wait.   With sickness in the room I asked

Actually, this is a review of the Disney Vacation Club accommodations. My wife and I have been members at the DVC property in the Grand Californian for about seven years. We have always enjoyed staying at the Grand Californian. The lobby is spectacular. Of the Disney Resort hotels, this is the most convenient with a direct access to Disney's California Adventure and an access to Downtown Disney and Disneyland.   Our room has always been comfortable, quiet, and very lovely. We prefer having a room on the ground floor (you can walk straight to your room without going up stairs or using an elevator), but we've had rooms in upper floors which had nice views.  The room cost is quite high, even the cost of buying into DVC is pricey.

I am studying architecture and have been told about a wonderful Arts and Crafts Period Tour at this hotel.  It is advertised as happening four times per week, with the number to sign up.  This is now TWICE I signed up, got confirmed by their hotel operators, drove all the way thru awful traffic, PAID $18.00 TO PARK - only to be told "we cancelled the tour today, sorry."  This time, an employee was nice enough to quietly tell me "this happens all the time, they have nobody trained to give it.  so they just cancel it."  I'm sure this is said often these days, about pretty much everything there, but Walt would be appalled!

We've been to the Disneyland Resort many times,but never stayed at the Grand Californian. My wife and I came down for 2 days to see all the Christmas decorations. We had been very impressed with the public areas on previous visits, so decided to try staying there. We loved it. The rooms are decorated with the rustic feel of the great room lobby. The staff was exceptional,which is expected at a Disney property. Our room overlooked California Adventure, which was very nice. We will be staying there again.

Summary Heading: This is not a luxury hotel
Summary: Our room was an upgrade with a view of California Adventure. It was over $600 for two queens. There was no trash can in the bathroom but there was large wicker basket. It was probably for towels but there was no other place for bathroom trash except a little trash can under the desk. There was no bottled water ( just to buy if you wanted to). No pay per view on the tv. No list of tv stations.  No stationary. Just a comfortable bed in a clean room. You pay for the convenience of being right in the park. Not worth it at this price.

First of all, the staff. Disney staff, not only at the hotel but inside the whole Disney complex, is one state of art. They are people who are 110% committed to provide information and willing to help. The proactive behavior is one beautiful thing. This huge hotel is located almost inside the Disney California Adventure Park, and this is one great advantages. It takes noon get than 5 minutes from the lobby to this park entrance. The rooms are quiet, cozy. In-room dining is an interesting option for those who don't want to go out for dinner after a whole day walking in the parks.

Perfect! Everything was perfect!! My family and I had the best stay ever here! Staff was perfect and friendly and kind. Our rooms were always clean. We had the best view ever! We can't wait to come back again!

I booked this hotel for our family upon our visit to California Disney.  Actually our three-night stay was included in the package which included all theme parks tickets as well.  The hotel is a 19th cenutry style which makes it cosy and comfortable, and in the heart of Disney Land.  Our double room was spacious, comfortable and cosy.  The scene from our balcony was beautiful and relaxing.  The location is fabulous as Disney down town, with its shops, restaurants and cafes, is two minutes away.  The check in and check out were quick and we didn't have to wait in lines, and this is due to the professional and friendly staff.  Thank you Disney Grand California Hotel & Spa, we will be back to your beautiful hotel.

We've been to all three Disneyland hotels and this is by far the best one. That's also reflected in the price but it is totally worth it. It has its own entrance into the California adventure park, and also an entrance right into the middle of Downtown Disney. The rooms are great and we could see Grizzly Peak from our room. The restaurants at the hotel that we ate at are also very good. This will probably be where we stay from now on every time we come here.

The location was fabulous, the hotel, it's staff, restaurants, accommodations all were first class! Downtown Disney was just outside the door and the two theme parks were a very short walk from there. We did Disneyland on Thursday and California Adventure on Friday. Just me and my husband were on this trip. It had been more than 15 years since we'd been to Disneyland, we had a ball!!

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: To celebrate our 30th anniversary, we decided to splurge and stay for the first time on-site in Disneyland.  Is it really worth an extra $75 -$200 per night to stay on property?  It really depends on what kind of vacation you want to have.  The ability to literally walk 20 feet to the elevator, and less than a minute to the entrance of California Adventure was such a huge perk to us, we were able to leave when the park crowds were too much (which they were every day) and take a break.  We did not eat at the hotel restaurants or use the spa so I cannot comment on that, all the employees we came in contact with at the hotel were superb, great customer service.  The rooms are simple and not large, we were lucky to get a king room that they called a woods room but that was located

We took our eight year old grandson to Disneyland in LA in late January, the best time to go, not too crowded, great weather overall just perfect. We stayed at the Grand Californian Hotel in Downtown Disney and could not speak any higher of the accommodation, staff and service. We did look at less expensive hotels but there was absolutely no comparison, regardless of the saving. We had a superior room overlooking the park as well as the pool area. One of the great advantages was entering one hour before the general public as well as  the proximity to the main attractions, We could ride Splash Mountain, get soaking wet and go through the private entrance to the Hotel, change int dry clothes and come back for more fun. We would thoroughly recommend both the Hotel and Disneyland yo

Stayed on the 6th floor. Check in was easy and the room was ready early. Everyone was nice and very friendly. I come to Disneyland several times a year and always stay here. It's so nice to be close to the parks.

Summary Heading: Nice Place; Things to consider if looking to stay
Summary: My wife and our two year old just got back from our trip. There are no shortage of reviews so I will just highlight our main take aways:  -Expensive; You dont get value in the room but in its proximity to the Parks. You can literally walk right out into CA Disney. Pretty Neat. -Small Rooms: At the price the rooms are not very spacious.  Limited Amenities in room: Low Flow Shower, slow wifi, ethernet a little better.  -Some Rooms have great views, we had a view of Grizzley Peak which was very cool.  - The Grand Room has a nice place to hang by fire listen to Christmas music and just relax.  - Downtown DIsney is right there, some different dining options and places to shop -Short walk to the Magic Kingdom- not far to walk there -Big Bath to bath kids in, which was nice.   Overall

Summary Heading: Grand in appearance; 5-star hotel prices, 4 star service levels
Summary: My family and I stayed at the Grand Californian as our first experience in a Disney property hotel.  In short, 5-star hotel prices, inconsistent service levels (don't expect 5-star customer service) - you are paying for the convenience of staying at the park, and it's a huge perk, the entrance to California Adventure and the included Magic Hour per each day is great.  We stayed on the first floor, next to the pool (which was heated, although we opted not to use it.) I would normally be concerned about noise levels, but it was not an issue whatsoever.  We had a double room - 2 queen beds; decent size.  Not wowed by finishes or amenities - but again, we did not spend that much time in our rooms. Laundry room just down the hall from our room was quite the lifesaver.  This is a

We have stayed here several times before in the past few years.  We love it!!!  We love the grand lodge decor, although we never seem to just relax in the lounge like we would like!  Too busy in the parks I think. The service is top notch, the rooms and beds are comfy, so much so that sometimes we weren't in a rush to get to the park. The swimming pools are very busy, so get there early if you want a chaise lounge.  The water is very comfortable, which is the only way I will go in anymore.  Kids don't mind cold water, but I like it on the warm side.  The pool side food and drink is very convenient and ordering from your chaise is nice! The convenience of being able to enter California Adventure is worth the price itself, but the ambiance is the best. Love this lodge and can't

Love the hotel! Great rooms. Food is very good ! But the location the the # one reason why you would stay here, walk right out of the hotel and you are on the grounds of Disney !!! Wow no parking getting on a tram , standing in line to get in, no just walk right in, and if you want to get a little rest well just walk into the hotel and take a nap or a swim and go right back to the fun!!!!

I debated rating this hotel 3 or 4 stars, but gave it 4 due to its beauty, amenities and convenience. The Grand California is a fabulous hotel. It connects directly to downtown Disney and California Adventure, which makes getting in and out of the park a breeze and the ability to take afternoon breaks extremely convenient.  You also get magic mornings to both Disneyland and California adventure if you book your hopper package with your hotel stay. The day's flip flop, one morning Disney, the next California Adventure. You also get free character dining vouchers, lanyards and specialty pins and a few other discounts and perks, making it all and added plus! The decor is very cabin and mountain feeling. It is so warm a cozy and is just a delightful treat during the fall and winter

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay at the Villas at the Grand Californian
Summary: I recently spent three nights in a studio villa at the Grand Californian.  It was my fourth stay at the hotel (second time in the villas). Our villa was on the fifth floor, and had an obstructed view of the Paradise Pier area of California Adventure.    Our room was larger than most DVC rooms.  It had a comfortable queen sized bed and sofa bed.  There were two chairs and a table, and a small kitchenette area with a coffee maker, toaster, fridge, and sink.  The bathroom was roomy with a sink outside in the main room.  The room was very clean and well maintained.   Interestingly, the sliders in the room could block out most (if not all) of the sounds from the theme park during park hours (we were surprised by how quiet it was), but it could not block out the sound of a single leaf

We travelled from Australia, to partake in Disney's 60th anniversary, and decided to spoil ourselves by staying at this hotel.  To their credit, they accommodated an extra night (owing to unforeseen circumstances on our end), and although we didn't get the room we had originally booked, we ended up with a lovely room near the corner, on the 5th floor, overlooking Downtown Disney, with views of the main railway station, and the tops of a couple of other Disney attractions.  With the balcony door open, one could hear the revellers and absorb the park ambience (which I enjoyed), but the doors are sufficiently glazed as to shut out external noise when closed.  The lobby is beautiful, but unfortunately, as its ostensibly a thoroughfare, many of the people relaxing in the area, are

Summary Heading: Disneyland is a racket and does not believe in true customer service
Summary: First they gave me a room that did not meet the request that I paid extra for and had to change rooms and wait to get in.  Then that night I tried to get on the Internet and the wifi would not connect and the LAN line was damaged so I had three days without Internet.  You bet they still charge the full rate.  The park has about a 400% markup on everything.  This visit was great with my daughter but I can not imagine how a average American can enjoy Disneyland and stay in the hotel.

The was our first trip to Disney's Grand Californian and we certainly weren't disappointed. The hotel lobby is stunning. We arrived to the resort early (10am) and were fortunate enough that our room was ready. The room was immaculate and very spacious. You can't be the private entrance to California Adventure either. Plenty of dining options too. The only drawback is that the hotel is very spread out, so you can get lost pretty easily if you're not sure where you're going. While the rooms are pricey, we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again!

Summary Heading: BEWARE DISNEY ONLY CARES ABOUT MONEY
Summary: My husband and I go to Disneyland every year during Christmas and decided to treat ourselves this year by staying at Grand Californian.  We found a good deal through our employee benefits. When we got there, the front desk clerk rudely said we were at the wrong hotel; our reservations were for Paradise Pier.  We had to go to the business center to print our confirmation where it clearly said Grand Californian.  When we went back to check in, we were told the third party erred and used to wrong hotel code.  If we wanted to stay there we had to pay an extra $459.  I spoke to the manager named Garret and asked that Disney do the correct thing and honor our reservation.  He said absolutely not since it was not Disney's fault, they should not have to pay the costs and to get my money

Summary Heading: Great corner room with a view
Summary: 6 people with two adjoining rooms in the corner overlooking the street where we could see the Christmas lights & fireworks.  We could not have asked for a better location.  The hotel was very clean, the lobby absolutely beautiful with a huge decorated Christmas tree.  In the evening they had a female trio singing holiday songs in perfect harmony.  Everyone is very friendly and requests for extra pillows and luggage service were handled in minutes.  Great locations to downtown Disney restaurants.  Its pricey but we were pleased with our overall experience.

Summary Heading: Where has the service in customer service gone
Summary: Booked 4 rooms for a family gathering at Great expense and needed some guidance navigating getting a scooter, answering general questions about Disney and dining.  It looked like the staff was there but not interested or qualified to help us.   Good Customer service should be at the top of any hotel at this level but not here, save your money and time to stay where somebody cares

Prior to booking a stay any where, we research, talk to people and read as many reviews as we can. We take both positive and negative reviews into consideration. I am so happy we chose to trust the positive reviews and walk in faith believing that this Disney related hotel would leave us with only a "happy, enjoyable and magical" experience to talk about.  Indeed it did!      I could go on and on but will just say that we 100% agree with the positive reviews and for all the reasons you'll find others making reference to.   We will most definitely be back!

Summary Heading: If location is your priority, this is the place to stay.  Otherwise it is not worth it.
Summary: We are frequent Disney travelers and have stayed in many of their hotels, always top floor club level rooms.  We have never been disappointed until our recent stay at the GC.  The check-in process was delayed and many mistakes were made, we were not taken to the Craftsman's Club for check-in, not one request was met even tho all were made 6 months in advance and we brought our written confirmation (i.e. 2 queen beds rather than a king, etc.), we were given incorrect key-cards, we were in a room near someone who chain-smoked on their balcony making it impossible for us to sit on our balcony or keep the door open to enjoy the beautiful night weather, when we asked if anything could be done, we were told we would be charged $250 if our room smelled like smoke, all the noise outside

We have stayed at the Grand Californian three times since 2008.  I read reviews on this site when trying to choose lodgings for my first time back to Disneyland since 1962, and decided to take a chance using all our travel points for this hotel, though I had some doubts based on various complaints.  But then somebody is always going to complain, yes?         Our entire four-day stay was enchanting.  Arts and Crafts architecture is my favorite, and this d√©cor is a true homage to that era and the National Parks historic lodges, which Disney World's Wilderness Lodge also probably reflects.  The theme carries through in the Storyteller Cafe, where service and menu were terrific.       The shower curtain had figures from "Bambi", and the art on the wall was a drop-dead gorgeous

Summary Heading: Very convenient, happy place to stay
Summary: The direct access to the California Adventure Park can't be beat, along with 1-hour early access to one of the parks daily for guests.  It was close enough to go back & forth rather than make a marathon visit to each park.  For quite an upgrade cost ($100+ per room daily, as I recall), one can have access to the Concierge Lounge (not all can do it; numbers are limited).  It provides continental breakfast and "tea service" (light lunch of salmon, cucumber sandwiches, peanut butter & jelly, scones, dipped strawberries), anytime sodas/ coffee/ wine/ beer.  Also evening hors d'oeuvres (2 hot items such as lumpia/ spring rolls/ empanadas/ coconut chicken fingers), raw veggies, cheese & crackers, flat breads and later in the evening, desserts.  The evening Disneyland fireworks can be

We chose to stay at the Grand Californian after looking at the internet photos and location. Well, the reality of the physical plant doesn't match the advertising. There were several surprises considering this is a Disneyland Hotel. First, there was nothing in the hotel or the rooms which had any Disney theme to it: no character tiles around the pools, no bushes shaped like characters, no characters walking around (except at brunch in the hotel), and no amenities for kids (like Mickey Mouse shampoo!). The lobby area is large and nice sporting a big Christmas tree and gingerbread houses, as well as little chairs for little folks to watch TV, but it is dark - lots of wood and low lighting. As there were 4 adults and a 5 year old in our group, we decided to take a 2-bedroom suite

We checked in on the morning of our wedding anniversary and were helped by a young lady who was "earning her ears" (in training).  She provided us with buttons to celebrate our anniversary (and my birthday!) and proceeded to assign us a gorgeous room with a Downtown Disney view.  We stayed two nights and never were disturbed by noise from the outside.  The hotel was booked to capacity with many travelers arriving for the upcoming Avengers marathon.  This did not dampen the enthusiasm from all the cast members at the hotel, from to the front desk, to the parking valet team, to the bellhops, we were provided with sincere, welcoming professionalism.    Our room showed no wear and tear and the room was cleaned to perfection.  We were allowed to store our luggage the day of checkout

Summary Heading: By Far the best place to stay if your going to he parks
Summary: Nothing can beat the location of this hotel, makes it simple to pop back and forth from hotel and parks (and Downtown Disney). By far the nicest of the 3 Disney hotels.  Rooms are nice and clean, standard size. I was just happy I could fit in the bed compared to my last Disney stay in the "miniature" beds at Miracosta at Tokyo Disney

I have always stayed in Disney accommodation wherever I visited Disneyland around the world. The top Disney hotel for me remains Miracosta at Tokyo Disneysea. In comparison, Grand California looks a little tired and food is average. However, Disney Magic is all over - cast members are responsive and hospitable. Will return to stay in future.

Stepped way up on this trip and booked a 3 room suit for our family. We were celebrating my 50th birthday with our adult children and 2 grandchildren plus my mother. We are annual pass holders so we were able to preview the layout on an earlier trip this year.   The hotel was fantastic! Need to explain the 4 and not 5 star. When we preview we were shown a master king room and 2 rooms with 2 queen beds each. Perfect. Plus the common living room with balcony. What we ended up with was far different. King room was awesome. 2nd room had a queen and bunk beds. Our young grandchildren where thrilled- beyond perfect!   The 3rd room was a sad fail. 1 queen and 1 couch that made into a bed, which our sons in the mid & upper 20's where to share. Girls got the bed. Due to space and size

The location of the Disney Grand Hotel & Spa is named Grand for a reason.  It is located near Shopping, Convention Center, Airport, etc. etc. Logistically located.  This hotel is a one stop shop.  You don't have to leave and you can enjoy the surroundsings!

Summary Heading: Obviously the best hotel on Disney property
Summary: We loved this hotel! We've stayed at all three on Disney property and of course this is the best and you'll pay for it. It's in the perfect location and the decor is beautifully done. The lobby reminds me somewhat of the wilderness lodge in Disney world that I love! We loved our room overlooking the pool, and you can see the bear mountain and the radiator springs of cars land. The added bonus was we got to watch the world of color from our balcony! In case you're not up for the loud music from the world of color, don't worry, the patio doors are very, very good at keeping the sound out. My kids were able to sleep while we enjoyed the show.

Summary Heading: Perfectly Situated and Stellar Guest Experience
Summary: There are not enough superlatives to review Disney's Grand Californian.  Located just south of Downtown Disney and adjacent to California Adventure, it is so easy to get to Downtown Disney or either of the Parks.  In fact, there is a entry into California Adventure (next to Grizzly Rapids) that is reserved for hotel guests.  While the Napa Rose restaurant gets most of the culinary attention, I found that the Storytellers Cafe to be the dining highlight.  It has the best breakfast buffet that I have had at any hotel anywhere.  Everyone on staff exudes a friendliness and warmth that defines the "Disney Experience".

Let's be honest, the Grand California is not a budget hotel!  But like all things, you get what you pay for!  And here, you get the best location, the best service and a feel of exclusivity and like your a VIP!  The rooms are beautiful with large bathrooms and some have great views of the park.  The lobby will literally take your breath away, especially during Christmas when they have the tree up and Santa in the lobby.  Access to CA Adventure is amazing!  and the staff will bend over backwards for you!  I am a huge Disney fan and this place just added to my love for all things Disney.  They know how to do luxury!  can't wait to go back.

This hotel is in the middle of all of the Disney action. Walk though to downtown Disney and its own entrance to Disney theme park. Kids enjoyed the Pinocchio club. They had a giant gingerbread display in the lobby and sold cookies and hot chocolate. Several great pools and walking distance to the monorail. Everyone was super helpful. Would love to stay again!

This is an outstanding hotel!  The setting is beautiful and all staff treat you like royalty. The convenience of being located right on the Disney property is worth the extra money to stay here. The rooms are pretty standard size ie. a bit small but we stayed here 2 nights with our 2 adult daughters and it was fine. We were in the parks all day and only in the room overnight. They have 2 sinks seperate from the toilet area which is very convenient.

Summary Heading: A little on the expensive side
Summary: What a beautiful grand entry hall, this hotel is very nice, the staff very friendly, the grounds and pool area's very nice. The ease of entry into California adventure park was a bonus. The room was nice, clean and well appointed.  I would give a 5 rating except for the price. We stayed nearby before at another motel, the room was on par, it was 10min walk away and free buffet breakfast for half the cost. Mind you, you don't have to leave the motel for anything with numerous places to eat, drink and relax. It was very nice staying there, but i would check nearby hotels and compare what you get for your buck.

We LOVED this Hotel so much! Everyone was so pleasant and helpful! It was our first visit to Disneyland and The Grand Californian. It couldn't have been more Magical, from the Park View Room, where we could see the World Of Color from our balcony, the extra chocolates at the second turn down, all the fun items from the group we were with, the Super Sweet "magic"--blankets & snowflakes left in our room from Olaf. Thank you for making our first visit so amazing!!

My husband and I have stayed here many times for the last 10 years (we have no kids).  We always choose to stay over our anniversary to celebrate.  We've always booked the standard view room and request a king bed (although, we never gotten a king).  The rooms are always clean and comfortable with a spacious bathroom.  Views have varied, from over looking the pool, downtown Disney to the parking lot.  You are just steps from downtown Disney and the park.  One of the better advantages to staying here is their private entrance into California Adventures Park. There was never a line to get in.  Even if you don't stay here, you should dine at Napa Rose.  What an amazing meal.  The truffle mac and cheese is to die for!!  Bottom line, we won't stay any where else when visiting

I want to love this hotel.  The location is unbeatable, right in the center of Downtown Disney and the lobby is magnificent.  Gigantic proportions of wood and stone and yet the environment is inviting and luxurious.  My favorite things: It's on property and when you are tired from all the Disney fun, it's fabulous to be so close to your hotel room It's a self-contained village with everything you need - spa, restaurants, convenience store, fitness center, bar, & tennis court The pool is wonderful High-speed free internet Star sightings are quite common Many rooms offer a beautiful view of the nightly firework display For a large hotel, the upkeep and maintenance is impressive  Some things are disappointing: The cost for a basic room is 3 - 4 times the price of an upgraded room

Summary Heading: Fabulous stay with my son and grandkids
Summary: We stayed 3 nights at The Grand California.  I met my oldest son there with his wife and my two grandsons.  We enjoyed Disneyland and California Adventure & I couldn't have asked for a better location.  The level of service was top-notch.  The lobby is gorgeous and the food at their character breakfast was outstanding.   However, i was there under a special price and wouldn't dream of returning at their rack rates.  The rooms were clean and nice, but not worth the regular high price.  the beds were terribly hard and uncomfortable.   The wifi reception was unreliable to say the least.

We stayed three nights at the Grand Californian and found the room to be priced out of proportion with what it offered. The room was in the newer section of the hotel and had a plumbing issue which caused the drainage system in the sinks to "burp" and "gurgle" all night. We did bring this to the attention of management. The response was that this section of the hotel is newer and does have this problem which they have not been able to resolve. So beware, this may disturb your sleep unless you are so tired after Disneyland that nothing bothers you!  The location of the room was at the far end of the resort overlooking the California Screamin' roller coaster. It is a long walk from there to the entrance to the parks, although there is a hotel entrance to the California Adventure

Summary Heading: Beautiful Hotel but has some Miscues
Summary: Stayed at the California Grand for a week for a family vacation to the Disneyland Parks. Beautiful, convenient,  and staff always met us with a smile and were eager to answer all our questions. Overall we enjoyed our stay. So for the miscues, first when we arrived we were instructed to park at the convention center entrance, because we choose to self park, and to unload and drag our bags thought the hotel to the front desk to check in, couple hundred yards. Asked if any of the bell hop carts were available, was told no and the attendant didn't even offer to call bell services for us. 2 adults 2 young kids and 7 heavy bags, not cool. Room had no microwave and there were none available on the floor. We had bought pop corn and other microwave snacks that we couldn't use. The hotel

First let me stay the hotel  is really nice. Very convenient  to both parks and Downtown  Disney. But I will also say the room itself was not worth the high price, even with a friend and family deal.  You really pay for the convenience. But it is Disney. For me I prefer  Disneyworld much cheaper.

Summary Heading: Some great things & some not so great
Summary: My husband and I stayed for one night to celebrate my birthday. The highlight was being selected "Grand Family" of the day (one family selected per day). We got to enjoy the fireworks from a special viewing area and a special dessert bar, coffees, wines, all the "sweet endings" of the day. It was the cherry atop the proverbial birthday cake!  The downside was that upon returning to our room for the evening we pulled off the extra pillows from the bed and a bug was beneath them, ran across the sheets and we smacked him so quick, too quick to determine if he was a spider or a roach, but a bug none the less.  We checked behind and under the bed for more and did not see anything else. Still, I didn't sleep very soundly as it was on my mind. In the morning we made our complaint at

We stayed at the Grand Californian, in Febuary. We were on our way to Hawaii to get married . I booked a concierge room,premium view. I will admit the first room was 2 doublebeds. I explained it was our honeymoon,and they changed our room. Great view, and suprised us with decorating our bed. The hotel was in the middle of the action,  I meet Family here was great that so close to dtd. Everything was first class. The staff was amazing, and could not do enough for us. Thank you for a magical trip.

A Family Three Night Stay was something special. We had 2 adjoining rooms that overlooked the park. Well presented and spotlessly maintained everyday. All Staff/ Cast members were keen to help advise and or assist at all times. Location is so Handy to the Park with an entrance almost at the lifts. A Magical Disney Experience.

We stayed for 3 days for business and to visit Disneyland and we had a great time and really enjoyed the hotel.  There is an entrance into the California Adventure right from the hotel and Disneyland is very close. Very nice room and everyone was very friendly. Not cheap but worth it for a true vacation when visiting Disneyland.

My husband and I stayed at the Grand Californian during Halloween.  When visiting the Disney theme parks I am a person who likes to go for 4 hour stretches of time and then rest and recharge for a few hours.  This hotel provided us with that opportunity!  It was such a treat to be able to get to our room in under 15 minutes.  The room itself was clean and comfortable.  I had originally reserved a King room but when we checked in the King rooms were sold out.  Because they couldn't get me what I requested they upgraded us to a park view room.  It was amazing to actually see the park from our balcony.  One night we had drinks and appetizers at the Hearthside Lounge.  This was a very enjoyable experience.  Although we did not partake, the hotel had Halloween activities for kids.

My husband and I stay in a one bedroom suite here 5 times every year. We love the atmosphere, the views of the park, etc. My husband says it feels like being home. The room is pristine. We also take our family twice a year. Love it!!!

Summary Heading: Worth EVERY penny! This place is great and a MUST stay for your next Disneyland visit
Summary: We had NEVER splurged before to stay here because we always felt like we could get more for our money and room options at the Disney partner hotels....boy were we wrong! This place is AWESOME and worth its weight in gold! We loved it. We stayed in a standard room with TWO queen beds and got two connecting. We were just upstairs from the registrations and lobby and so super convenient. The rooms are nothing spectacular but they are VERY nice, well sized and have everything you could need. After we arrived we drove over to Target and bought paper plates, lunch stuff, yogurts, waters, etc. There is a refrigerator in the room and we packed our own hot pot for coffee, tea, hot cocoa and soups. It was totally perfect! Being able to run back to the room or put the kids down for a

We had a 3 night club level stay. Room was nice with a view of Grizzly Peak and the pool. Unfortunately the power was out for (a planned) 4 hour period during one of the evenings and that was inconvenient as we were traveling with a baby and up in the dark in the night. The hotel provided glow sticks. Small tub and the water pressure in the bathroom was not good, partly due to a faulty tub/shower switch which didn't divert all the water from the tub spout to the shower head.  Rooms are spacious however, and we had a double queen room, but it was a good walk from the elevators which made going to the concierge club inconvenient. Our room was ready around 3pm.  Club level breakfast offerings were nice: hard-boiled eggs, bagels, meats, cheeses, pastries, cereal, fruit, yogurt, and

Summary Heading: A Great 4 Star Hotel... Cutting Corners These Days.
Summary: I'm an annual Disneyland passport holder and I've stayed at the Grand Californian Hotel many times over the last 15 years. I've returned again and again for the ambience, the DCA park entry and the concierge floor lounge. But, I'm sad to say that the hotel has become less and less impressive over the years, despite becoming more and more expensive.  We recently stayed in room 6413, checking in Oct 23, 2015 and checking out two days later (my birthday!) Check-in was friendly but sort of weird, because the hotel cast member comes into your room with you to take care of the paperwork and the room keys. Our room was far, far away from the elevator & it smelled strongly of perfume (ugh!)   The concierge lounge was great, the food and wine flowed freely, and the cast members working

The proximity to the Disneyland parks can't be beat.  The convenience of being able to quickly return to the hotel for a break and then hop right back into either park is well worth it.  The beds were very comfortable.  Otherwise the rooms are fairly average.  The resort itself is stunning.  Most staff were very pleasant to deal with.

This was my second stay at this resort, but my first in the dvc villas. I had a studio that faced the back wall of disney's California adventure. I was on the first floor at the end of the building where there was a little offshoot wing. There was just my studio and the 1 bar next to me so the noise was minimal. The negative was no cell service, maybe because of the stairwell next to my unit. One of the nights I was there they apparently were doing something with the water, as I got up to use the toilet and it would not flush. I received no notice when I had checked in and was pretty unhappy about it, worried about a broken toilet! Turns out it wasn't broken, but disturbed my sleep!

They literally do everything possible to keep the magic alive, the restaurants are filled with characters that would interact with guests. The only improvement I could suggest is related to the Wi-Fi network coverage, it is very good inside the rooms but outside it is very slow and hard to connect. Nevertheless, the experience was great.

Location is excellent as Downtown Disney and California Adventure are right outside the hotel. Booked a standard room with a view of Downtown Disney, but when we checked in, my wife and I were upgraded to the Mt. Whitney Suite. By far the largest and nicest hotel room I have ever stayed in. Found out through Google that the room goes for upwards of $3,500 a night. Not sure how we got so lucky. It has over 2,200 square feet with 2 balconies overlooking the courtyard and pools. Our front desk clerk was great. He was friendly, informative, and obviously genuinely wanted us to have a great time. That he upgraded us speaks to how he and the rest of the staff go above and beyond to satisfy their customers. We didn't even ask to be upgraded, so it was nice bonus to our mini getaway.

My husband and I checked in for a little getaway as we always wanted to stay at The Grand Californian. Once we got here every person we came into contact with was pleasant and welcoming in true Disney fashion. We had originally booked a downtown Disney view room, but upon check in with our awesome concierge Leroy we were upgraded to the Mt Whitney suite complimentary of the hotel.  This is the most gorgeous room we have ever seen let alone stay in. 2300 sq feet of floor to ceiling Windows, craftsman style decor, and luxury in every corner. Thank you Disney!

Where to start?  From arriving at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel to checking out, everything was exceptional!  The valet and check in process was handled by well trained, friendly cast members. The front desk clerk (I really need to start writing names down) was welcoming and took care of us quickly without making us feel rushed. She took the time to explain everything from where the different amenities were located throughout the hotel to the park hours. Check out was a breeze with the assistance of the bell captain who collected the luggage from the room and loaded it into our waiting car. I've said it before, all of the Disney Cast Members that I've had the pleasure of dealing with have all been top notch!  The room we reserved was a premium view room, that overlooked the

We chose to stay here because this is the closest hotel to the entrance of the park. The hotel has its own entry to the park. It‚Äôs only a 5min walk from your room. No buses, no trams. And an extra hour early entry to the park.  The foyer was awesome luxury. Check in was smooth and easy. Staff were friendly and helpful. Room was clean and well-appointed with a balcony overlooking the pool. Plenty of space in the room. The only negative were the bed covers that looked very old and dated. They need upgrading to match the pricey room rate.  I can‚Äôt applaud the housekeeping staff enough. We didn‚Äôt see them once, but they did a fabulous job with both the daily room clean and the turn downs.  I think a lot of people balk at spending the extra for the balcony room, but if you are

this hotel was absolutely amazing !the service was great we paid for the concierge service and it was great it saved me a lot of money on meals, i went wih my dad and brother.they served breakfest,lunch, and dinner they had sodas,juices ,milk, ice water, and alcohol. they didnt have such a great breakfast though, they did have eggs but not very many options of anything else. the hotel rooms were amazing althogh i do have one complaint, they didnt have a microwave but they did have a mini fridge with a good amount of space. The hotel room was so clean and it came with a bunch of great toiletries. The beds were extremely comfortable and pillowy and the pillows were amazingly comfortable. The room had great curtains so the sun couldnt shine in my face. Although it only had a

Summary Heading: Location and service win hands down
Summary: My daughter (23) and I stayed here for 3 nights and just loved the convenience to the parks and downtown Disney.  Let's be clear; Disneyland only consists of the the two parks and downtown Disney. This hotel has direct access to both.  Bonus of the early hour entry is a huge bonus. We were there during Halloween and the hour was well worth the extra $$s no doubt this hotel placement deserves.  We had a Club room; the staff were so accommodating although I did have to actively look for them a few times. This hotel does come this cost; if you have the money stay here if not Disneyland Hotel, then Pier.

We had 4 nights in a club level room.We were greeted at the entrance and taken right up to our room to check in.They had a scooter for my husband we had ordered beforehand. We were then taken to the lounge for cold drinks and snacks.The hotel room was the right size for 3 adults and 1 child, a little cozy but not bad. My husband backed his scooter in the corner, we had to move the table a little.The bed and pillows were comfortable.Our room was clean and chocolates were left on our pillows every night.The parks were close so my husband could come back for a nap while my son and I played a game in the lounge and went to the fitness center--which was small but we were the only people there.Everyone working at the hotel was extremely nice.It is very expensive to stay there but we

We arrived early (10 AM) but couldn't get into our room until 3 PM. They did store our luggage for us so we didn't have to carry it around. I expected more from the front desk on things we could do while we waited for 5 hours. We weren't told about Downtown Disney just down the hall, which is free access. We were not told about the pool hours, or room service hours. We weren't even told about the information desk.  The room we were given was a small room with a queen bed, bunk beds and a trundle bed. With 5 of us in the room we anticipated having more space. It was tiny! We barely had enough room for us and our luggage. We had to push in the trundle bed immediately in the morning so we had enough room to walk around.

The location of the hotel can‚Äôt be beat. Located steps from Disneyland Park, Disney Grand Adventure Park and Downtown Disney. Very convenient to everything.   The hotel is big and quite spread out. Check in was quick and easy. I found the lobby to be dark and uninviting. The room was OK. It was clean. Nothing luxurious. The room d√©cor is outdated and unappealing. The lighting in the sink area could be brighter. The bathroom is very basic. The room reminds me of a low-budget motel room. The hotel gym was tiny compared to the size of the resort. Did not eat at the hotel since we dined off-site. However, the one cup of coffee I got from the lobby was awful. Tasted like coffee from the neighborhood gas station.   Although staff was friendly, they weren‚Äôt very attentive. The service

We stayed here four nights and spent three days at Disneyland and California Adventure. It is a very expensive hotel, but we felt quite happy about our expenditures. It is as close to the parks as you can possibly stay (we are seniors and appreciated that this made it easier to take an afternoon nap break); the Napa Rose restaurant and the Storyteller's Cafe (again, both quite pricey) are delightful; the multiple swimming pools are beautifully designed and maintained; there were no children in our party so we were especially glad that the hotel does a nice job of occupying and amusing the small fry.  The beds were wonderful and the supplied toiletries were so pleasant--the scents were subtle. Staff was responsive and helpful. We visited during an October heat wave that might

Summary Heading: Great hotel, I just wish they had better EV charging capabilities
Summary: Very nice hotel with wonderful amenities and terrific service. Close to the park and very classy. The only issue I have is that they don't offer real electric vehicle charging. They will charge your car from a wall socket in valet parking, but from empty, it would take 3 days to charge it that way. I would stay here exclusively when traveling to the parks if they had 240v or Tesla convenience charging, but with the current situation, I need to make sure I am not using the car for several days when staying there. Please Disney....add more chargers!

We had a wonderful time with our grown daughters and infant grand children. The hotel was very accommodating with little ones and there was ample shade around the pool for us to enjoy. The benefit of staying right on the Disney property was worth every penny!  With little ones who need naps,(and adults too!) the convenience of having the hotel close and not having to waste time waiting for shuttles was perfect. The room was very luxurious and the hotel bars and restaurants were wonderful with the same Disney service...which is top notch!

Don't bother with this hotel. We booked this room months ago in anticipation of our anniversary and the Halloween season. So excited.....not for long. I should have known when the first Disney representative snapped at me when a payment I had made didn't show. Took hours on the phone and many call backs, all through Disney travel. Well we just checked in and guess what!?!? We have two double beds!  Called down and sorry nothing is available.   Isn't this place in the hospitality business?  Does not take an intellectual leap to figure out that a Mr. And Mrs. probably would have liked to spend their time TOGETHER!  Actually it is more the attitude than the situation. Disney gets you in the door and that's it. By the way..the wallpaper is peeling and we overlook an awning covered

Although I love Disneyland and could never say enough good things about it, the Grand Californian is an exception. For $600 a night, you won't get any internet service for those people needing to work or submit their homework (they actually told us to go to Starbucks at guest services), the pillows are had as rocks, the remotes and phones don't work and it's starting to look very run down.
