For a hotel that doesn't benefit from the extra dollars you spend in the park when you get in an hour early, you definitely question what they're doing with your room rate each night. And when you wait for 45 minutes for your bags and they load your car with bags that are not yours, it's the icing on the cake from a long and stressful stay. Maybe it's best to spend the rest of your life

Summary Heading: Underwhelmed with slow service and lackluster hotel. Location superb.
Summary: Our family went to stay at the Grand Californian with high expectations due to the high price tag.  To be clear: you are paying 5 star (Ritz-Carlton, Four Seasons) prices for a four-star property.  It's no secret that what you are paying for is the location of the hotel.  Being a Disney fan who has stayed at numerous other Disney properties I was expecting excellent service based on my previous experiences with the brand.    Our party had 3 rooms and the check-in process took approximately 1 hour, and to be clear that does not include time in line, that was the time the receptionist took to check us in.  The kids started melting down due to the excessive wait and I have not had that long of a check in process anywhere before.  After this long check in we then had to wait in a

It was our dream to stay in the Disney California Hotel. We got an excellent deal through Alaska Vacations that made it more affordable. Upon checking in, we received a complimentary upgrade so the kids were in a bunk bed which they loved! Service was excellent from housekeeping and staff. Our room overlooked the pool so it was quiet at night.

We stayed at the Grand Californian over Columbus Day weekend. We are DisneyWorld annual pass holders and expected the same level of service that we had always received at the WDW hotels but sadly found it lacking. The front desk cast member was not friendly. Our towels were not changed 2 days in a row even after we called housekeeping. I tried to get feather pillows but they weren't available. I tried to get plastic cups, but they weren't available. The only reason I'm giving the hotel 3 stars is that the location can't be beat. I expected a lot more from a so-called luxury Disney hotel.

I had always wanted to stay on site to go to Disneyland, and I FINALLY got to do it! And the experience was just as wonderful as I had hoped it would be. The hotel is gorgeous. Our room overlooked the swimming pool, and was very comfortable. The staff were all amazingly courteous and helpful, every single one we met. And the "Magic Hour" made a big difference in our ability to see the parks. I would love to go again!  My one complaint is that the free wifi was crummy. I would have preferred an option to purchase a better service

We stayed here three nights through an Adventures by Disney vacation.  The hotel is beautiful and very close to both parks, we used the DCA entrance several times.  Only morning there was a line up was an early entry morning but it moved quickly.    The room was beautiful, two sinks outside of the bathroom made getting ready in the morning quick and easy.  The pool area was beautiful, lots of towels and super comfy loungers.  We ate at Storytellers two mornings for breakfast, very good.  Went for a massage at the spa, very nice, lots of amenities in change room, sauna, steam room, lockers, very pricey, but enjoyable.  Only one issue, hotel had a maintenance problem that required some kind of jack hammering to repair, they only did it during business hours but prevented us for

After many years of waiting we finally managed to get to Disneyland....staff are very helpful & able to answer any question. The location is brilliant but the room was alittle small for a family of 4! Food on location is great & downtown Disney is great for everything, anytime of the day. Plenty of pools for a swim & poolside service was excellent. Loved being so close to California Disney & Disneyland.... For 1st timers it makes life easy! Enjoyed breaky with Mickey across the street too.

Summary Heading: This is what dreams are made of!
Summary: As a spoiled seasoned traveller of every Disney Park on the face of the planet including Disney Aulani I thought it would be hard to give me any more OMG Disney experiences in life. I was wrong! I had one here at Disney's California Grand on 10-19-15. I have read a few reviews that the California Grand hotel rooms were a bit run down and the Californian Disney staff was not quite up to snuff.  I decided to risk it anyway as I was treating a friend to a birthday weekend and wanted to experience something new with ease to get in and out of the park. I booked a basic room ( a bit pricey for me but what the heck it is a birthday) to check out the Californian Grand. We were upgraded to their "Captain Suite". Wow, wow, wow! How did that happen? This is what Disney dreams are made of!

Summary Heading: Couldn't ask for a better view
Summary: From the moment we stepped through the doors of the Grand Californian, we knew it would be a special experience. The lobby is larger than life, the music is soothing, and Cast Members immediately greeted us. Our room was very spacious (one bedroom suite), with room for the four of us to all have our seperate beds and stretch out to relax. We had a view of Paradise Pier, which was breathtaking... we could easily watch World of Color from the room, and didn't need to deal with crowds (the soundtrack is played through the TV, perfect). There was a convenient entrance to the California Adventure from the hotel lobby... Disneyland Park was a slightly longer walk... but seriously, we are talking 5-10 minutes TOPS. Traveling anywhere else in southern Cali??? Simply ask at the front

Well this was disappointing. Having stayed at a lot of different hotels for business and family travel, this hotel is nothing more than average and way over priced. Even taking into consideration the proximity to downtown Disney and the ability to enter California land directly from the hotel property, this place is really over rated and extremely expensive. This is not good value for a family vacation. The rooms are nothing more than average. The available upgrades to get a room with a view are over rated and over priced. Next time, we'll stay at a nearby 4 or 5 star hotel for half the price and get breakfast included and free parking!

Summary Heading: Grand - close to parks, calm and relaxing
Summary: We stayed for our honeymoon at the Villas in a 1 bedroom suite. Check-in was quick, no mention of our honeymoon which was odd - got to our room and we had a lovely view of the park. The room was well maintained and had no qualms. We enjoyed the tub at night with the view of California Adventure or opening the doors in the morning to hear the music of the park as we enjoyed our morning coffee.  Of the three hotels, my husband favors this one for it's convenience to the park and the style. I enjoy this spot because I find it quite relaxing and enjoy walking around the property or sitting on the patio which is the only property that still has this (minus some suites).   Overall our stay was enjoyable. Service was good and we even enjoyed some of the activities they offer through

Staying with two children we have a room with one queen and two single bunks for eight nights. The room was simple but included everything we needed. The beauty of this hotel is outside of the room - pools, amenities, washing facilities etc. We would not hestistate to stay again, and longer. Those who say two days at Disney is enough may not havseen it all. We could have filled another week with the kids playing in the pool during the busy afternoon hours at the theme parks, and catching a few rides and shows in the evening.

Summary Heading: Second time around wasn't any better
Summary: To start on a positive there isn't a better location to stay if your visiting the parks.   Having been 2yrs ago and paid for a premium room with club access we weren't about to make that mistake again.   The rooms are ordinary at best, bathrooms are hard to describe even as basic.  Staff weren't overly helpful, had to go to the box office to find out about the trick or treat party in the park having just spoken to guest relations and asked "if anything extra special was occurring which would be fun for our daughter"!  Needless to say, when checking in and picking up our passes they (check in) failed to mention that the park was closing early to accommodate the party so if Crissy in the box office hadn't mentioned it, we would have been none the wiser.   Food choices weren't that

We have been in this hotel in september 2015. The location is naturally in the park and close to the main shopping district between two parks. Our room was large enough to be comfortable however there is no soul...Just an ordinary hotel to me...Just to let you know , there is nothing special if you choose the park view...Go ahead and choose any room with less rate.

Check In: one of the WORST cons to the experience!  we have 3 kids under 7, so when i first booked our room 5 months ago, i specifically asked for a room with bunk beds and a trundle.  the official policy is a 'first come first served', but they "take requests into consideration".  understandable.  i called back at least 2 more times over the months leading up to out trip, to confirm my request for bunkbeds.  they say you can check in at 6:30am (or anytime on your check in day, really) but can't officially check in until 3 pm....ie:MOVE in.    we stayed at huntington beach the night before heading to Disney.  so the morning of our check in, my daughter and i drove over to Disney at 6AM.  we checked in, were given a room with bunk beds (HALLELUJAH!!!), given room keys that we

I'll start by saying that I am partial to staying on-site whenever we have visited a Disney property.  The Disneyland Hotel has been the most frequented site, but this was the first stay at the Grand Californian.  Forget about getting "value" for what you will pay for a room located on any Disney property, a vacation to Disneyland is, in my opinion, like going to Benihana instead of the local teriyaki joint.  You are paying a premium for the show,as well as the great food.  Value aside, I would highly recommend this hotel for any type of travelers.  The main reason for the Grand is the close proximity to both theme parks, especially California Adventure.  If you are with kids, or with seniors, really anybody, you will save time and wear and tear on your body, which has to offset

Summary Heading: A Good Property in a Great Location!
Summary: I've stayed at the Grand Californian twice in the last couple of months (one girls' weekend getaway and one family trip) and both times had a wonderful experience. The front desk and bell/parking staff is always friendly and helpful even in the early morning hours. The housekeeping staff does a great job, we had no issues with the room feeling dirty or unmaintained; everything felt clean and the room was well appointed. We stayed in standard room which had plenty of space and were very comfortable even for my family of four; we could have even had my mother stay with us in the room and still been comfortable (she booked her own hotel though, something about sleep which you miss out on when you share a room with a 17 month old). Our room had two queen beds, a day bed, and plenty

Summary Heading: Still my Favorite Places to stay at Disneyland
Summary: Our recent trip to Disneyland for the 60th Celebration had us staying at the Grand Californian Hotel, we did two days in the hotel then did 2 days at the DVC Villas at the Grand Californian.  The check in staff greet you with a smile and get you checked in very quickly, we did have to wait to get our room but they checked our luggage and our room keys allowed us access to the hotels amenities, pool and of course the private entrance to California Adventure Park. Both rooms were fantastic, clean with deep wood tones and warm Pacific North West architecture.  The park views are spectacular, watching the lights at the park all night is amazing. If you are looking for a relaxing place to stay that wraps you in luxury and Disney Magic then I highly recommend this hotel.

Booked this hotel for a conference at a GREAT price.  Stayed a couple of extra days to explore Disneyland.  The staff were wonderful, very cheerful and friendly.  The rooms are a great size and have all the amenities that you would need.  The location is perfect for being able to get around without a car.  The grounds were very well kept.  Overall a very pleasant experience and trip.

We stayed at the Disneyland Grand Californian Hotel and Spa for a 3 day weekend in early October2015. The service is very good and the hotel and rooms are spotlessly clean. The attention to detail is excellent. The prices are extremely high for everything so this was a one time splurge for us. The rooms are very expensive. We picked a room with a view of California Adventure but all we could see was just the very top of a couple of rides. Everything else was blocked by buildings and landscaping. Breakfast cost the two of us $70 for the buffet. The hotel is located right in the middle of The Magic Kingdom and California Adventure parks so it's a quick, few minute walk to get to the main attractions. The Napa Rose restaurant is excellent and expensive and you will need to make

There were four adults and three children.  We got a two bedroom two bath suite so the kids could go down at night and the adults could continue to visit in the living room.  It was beautifully appointed,with two large balconies and the bed room were large with a king sized bed in one room and two queen sized bed I the other.  The couch in the living also made into a bed and there were three pack an plays available.

Summary Heading: Never has so much been paid for so little!!!
Summary: Went during spring break with the kids and grandkids. Paid more for one room than I normally paid for three!!!! Wouldn't have been too bad except grandson had to sleep on the floor in a sleeping bag! I guess we were paying for the direct access to the park. Been to Disney many times over the years and never felt like I was taken advantage of until this visit. Plus, since it was spring break, the oark was really crowded!

This is the BEST place to be while visiting Disneyland. There is a separate entrance to California adventure and sometimes it is quicker just to get into Disneyland itself this way to avoid the huge bag-check lines. The hotel room was large and clean. We got the premium view and had a pool view which was a little disappointing because I was hoping for a park view but it was nice anyways. I have stayed here before with a downtown Disney view and was able to see the Disneyland fireworks! which ever room you choose, this is the most convenient hotel at the park and the proximity is perfect for little ones (and parents) who need to take a nap break. I spent the last day at the park at the Disneyland hotel (I needed to add a last minute night to my stay and the grand Californian was

Summary Heading: Convenient, comfortable respite in midst of Disney chaos
Summary: We were thankful that we choose the Grand Californian as our homebase for our first visit to Disneyland.   Being attached to California Adventure made it extremely easy to get into the park, take breaks as needed, and park hop to Disneyland without waiting in the security queue outside the parks.   Those perks alone likely justify the price.  The rooms themselves are fine - pretty standard hotel fare and nothing special.   We did request the bunkbed/trundle option along with a queen bed - this was a great way to go with children (ours are 10, 8, 4).   That room was not available upon arrival, so we had to move rooms after our first night - an inconvenience, but the hotel managed it as best as possible given the circumstance.    The 2 queens with a rollaway bed we had the first

Summary Heading: Just ok ... Napa Rose is what keeps us coming back...
Summary: The hotel is clearly perfectly located on the Disneyland property and quite honestly the only reason we stay is for the magic morning entrance and to dine at the marvelous Napa Rose which for us is the highlight of the hotel.  The rooms are average which is a little disappointing given what you actually pay but every year we're back purely for the convenience.

Summary Heading: Nice but not up to WDW standards
Summary: We've stayed at most of the WDW Deluxe properties (Poly, Contemporary, Grand Floridian, Animal Kingdom Lodge, Wilderness Lodge) and a few others (Caribbean, Coronado Springs) in both concierge and non-concierge rooms so we had certain expectations.  Short version:  Beds were comfortable, room was clean, air conditioning was slow to kick in but eventually comfortable.  Security, service and communication / consistency were all weak.  Theming is usually a strong suit of Disney.  This hotel had the towering lobby like Wilderness Lodge or Animal Kingdom Lodge but lacked a strong character.  I like the Arts and Crafts style but felt it was not used to its full extent.  The hotel lacks the charm and whimsey present in most WDW hotels.  Details: Our room was listed on the web as having

Run for the hills....run for you lives.  Disney Grand California is brutal.  Its dark, its crowded, its dirty.  You will line up for almost everything - so you'd better have lots of patience.  The wifi is unusable at the pool.  We were there for three nights (3 too many) - won't be going back....EVER.

3K for two nights. The connected rooms - here called suites - are probably similar to a low grade Best Western (and I really might be offending Best Western). Not too clean, not too comfortable, 1980's standards as far as the bathrooms are concerned. Service... why bother... they (the guests) will pay anyway. I wanted to order breakfast to be delivered to the room in the morning (as that price does not included it) but the hotel forgot to leave the order forms. I requested them at 10:45 and barely made it before midnight. My friend is staying at a nice hotel less than a mile away for 1/10 of the price - and her room includes breakfast. I expected more from a luxury suite at the Grand Californian.  We had a decent meal at the Napa Rose.

Summary Heading: Beautiful property with average rooms and less than average service
Summary: We went here on our first family vacation to Disneyland. Based on the reviews and the prices I had very high expectations for the Grand Californian - unfortunately those expectations did not pan out. The common areas of the hotel were generally very beautiful - lovely gardens and landscaping, beautiful and large pool area with multiple different pools and hot tubs, and lovely large common areas inside for meeting up with friends and family and travel companions. The location, immediately adjacent to California Adventure and very close to Disneyland and Downtown Disney, was excellent. That's were the positive things end. The room was decidedly average - we had a single room with two queen beds. Carpets seemed worn and dirty. Room was pretty small, as was bathroom. Drain in

We continue to love this hotel, although it does seem like it will be in need of an update soon.  Our room had a Downtown Disney view - we were directly over the World of Disney store.  One issue was that we could hear the trams coming and going - they seem to have a method of signalling each other by honking and we could hear the honking from early in the morning until late at night.  It didn't wake me up, but it did keep me up a bit at night. The bed sheets were so soft!  I had a hard time getting out of bed in the morning because I was so comfortable.  Unlike years past, this year we had a room that a had a shower with a good fairly strong flow and it was pretty easy to adjust the type of stream.  Also, unlike years past, we had no issues with the wifi in this room, although

For the first time, we splurged and stayed at a Disney property and loved it.  We had an amazing room with a very short walk.  Most rooms probably are not so well situated since it is so large!  We loved the pools.  We could see the World of Color from our room! We didn't eat at any restaurants there, rather had grocery delivery to save costs.  My husband wants me to add that the wifi was really poor, which is true.  Minor detail to me :)

Summary Heading: Perfect location but also a let down
Summary: It was a difficult decision to spend the money to stay on this property. We have always dreamed of staying at this location and were finally able to make it happen.   We were greeted warmly and after standing in line (welcome to Disney) given our room and paperwork. The room was underwhelming, especially for cost! Stained carpet and drapes, old worn and stained furniture. Bed was comfy.   The property itself was gorgeous but we found we were so limited by the huge crowds seemingly present at all hours. We never went to the pool because there were no chairs or lounges available. The main pool was closed one afternoon we presumed someone had been sick in the pool? I was also surprised the hotel did not feel like it has security anyone can enter and take the elevators up to the

An aged beauty! My husband, daughter (13) and I arrived at the 'happiest place on Earth' with great expectations on 18 September, for 4 nights, and we were not disappointed!  We were greeted by very friendly staff, who made us feel right at home.  Our room was on the 4th floor, room 4170, quite a long walk!  We shared a standard view room, consisting of 2 queen beds.  The room was in need of an upgrade, but in all it was very clean and comfortable.  A nightly turndown service by housekeeping was a lovely touch.  We had the added bonus of a balcony with a view of the Disneyland fireworks, if we chose to stay in.  The major bonus of the hotel is its location.  It is on the doorstep of Disneyland and has its own entrance to Disney's Californian Adventure Park.  After very long, hot

The benefit of Disney Grand Californian hotel is the location.  You can enter California Disney park straight from the hotel.  You get an extra hour magic morning every day in the parks.  This hotel is busy.  We waited 45 minutes for our bags to be bought to the room. Our room had a view of Downtown Disney.  The downside of this was it was noisy all night long.  It was like listening to rubbish trucks for 3-4 hours every night.  I wouldn't stay in these rooms again.   It was our second stay at DGC. For the price the rooms are average.  There's a massive price premium versus other hotels, but the benefit of the location with children made it worthwhile.

We stayed in a standard room - 5131 which was right across the hall from the place where the cleaning staff got their supplies or met at all hours of the day and  night - they were respectful that people would be sleeping, but there is a limit to tolerance to voices and doors opening and hitting the wall when it goes on 24 /7.  The room was really large with 2 sinks outside of the toilet and shower room two queen sized beds and a folded up crib in the closet - limited drawer space - 4 in total!! -there were  2 tiny wastebaskets for the room , which we filled to overflowing every day.the fridge was nice, wifi worked well. we could see a bit of the fireworks from the window near the elevators  -This hotel provides an hour early entrance  - 7AM to one park a day - we were at the

Have stayed here several times and it has always been a delight! The upscale craftsman style of the Grand California architecture and interior design is elegant and earthy at the same time giving you the feeling of relaxation and eye candy at the same time. The service is well..."Disney" where customer is king, enough said. This facility is a very close walking distance through downtown Disney to both parks, a definite plus. The rooms and Vacation Club Villas are spacious and well appointed. We always ask for a park view. This overlooks the California Adventure amusement park. This makes for a great scene outside the large window and from the verandas especially at night when all the colorful lights are turned on. It's a little surreal for major Disney fans to open up the

Summary Heading: AMAZING, QUIET, beautiful rooms, relaxing, BEAUTIFUL decor, and AWESOME STAFF!!
Summary: Visited August 31 - September 3, 2015  This year we decided to try another new location to stay and in celebration of our daughters 8th birthday we chose the Disney Grand Californian Hotel and Spa in Anaheim. What an awesome visit from the VERY beginning!  Clean, efficient, no waiting ANYWHERE, and after a long drive in heavy traffic, to have valet services that welcome you with a smile every time not matter how busy they may be was very refreshing! One gentleman at valet refused a tip, stating "I'm just a manager out here giving these guys a hand" - what? I made him take it to at least give to the others then because they were whistling while they worked!!  Check-in and check-out was a breeze, getting our car from valet a quick phone call before we headed downstairs, and

This has Disney quality but the reason I am giving it three stars instead of five stars is because of the crowds.... IF you are staying here as a couple. Housekeeping seems to be knocking on your door every five minutes. They locked me out on the balcony while I was eating and watching the fireworks during their turn down service. I had to wait there until my husband came back.  We prefer the Disneyland Hotel. It is much quieter and original Disney!

I brought my friend there for his first ever visit to Disney and as I have stayed in many hotels worldwide, I expected much more of the rooms.   He rarely has travelled (other than with the military) and as this was 'special' for him, I decided to pay for a 'better' room.   Having researched the internet and youtube for pics and videos of rooms, all I could find were 'suites' with kitchens, and family rooms with bunk beds.  I gathered most rooms would match the family rooms, so my extra expense may resemble a family room but perhaps may have a decent bathroom (as in the suites) or at least something similar ie  separate shower and bath, or marble somewhere.  No no no.  Basic basic basic all around.  Climb into the bath and pull the curtain. (One of my peeves).  The additional

It's pricey. It just is. But if you decide to go for it, I don't think you'll regret it.   First, location. For the first time ever on a Disney trip, we actually left the park EVERY DAY of our 5 day stay to go back to the room and rest or go swimming. That allowed our family of one teen, one tween and one toddler to regroup and refresh for more fun in the parks. The walk is negligible, especially if you're in the California Adventure park, which has a special entrance to the hotel.  The hotel is huge,  but the registration cast members are as accomodating as they can be about room selection. We had a standard view room, but wanted to be close to the pool area. The cast member was able to get me what I needed and we had a very short walk to the pools. View was of the front

Summary Heading: A great place to stay for your Disneyland adventure.
Summary: I have to preface this review with the fact that I am a Disney-holic and have been to Walt Disney World almost every year since it opened in 1971.  That being said, it's difficult for me not to compare the two.  I'll do my best to keep my biases in check for this review.  We checked in for a quick one night stay while we were visiting California.  Our check in was amazing!  Maggie at the front desk saw to it that everything was not only in order, she upgraded our room, made us the Grand Family of the Day, and had special pins made to commemorate my daughter's birthday.  I'll just say that we've never had this exuberant of a welcome at any resort in the Walt Disney World family of hotels.    The common areas of this hotel are pretty and well kept.  This hotel does not hold a

Service!  Clean!  Pools were nice. Huge place so you have to walk a lot.  Nice padded chairs at the pool and the "lobby" is beautiful.   All this said - it's expensive, but it's Disney. Just like the park, parking is extra. $25 for valet per day. Go. Enjoy!

Access to the theme parks is unbeatable, and nothing is quite as soothing after a long day at the parks as a drink in the stunning lobby while listening to the excellent pianist.  Rooms were very comfortable and quiet, with nice linens and mattresses, but the wi-fi was unusable. None of our special requests (king bed, location) were honored at check-in until we politely asked again (and at least got the location we wanted), so you may just need to be persistent with the front desk.  A caution to anyone who has difficulty with stairs: make sure you are assigned a room on a low floor. We had numerous fire alarms one night, and during the evacuation, we saw numerous people who were unable to walk having to painfully struggle down the stairs on their own. There were no cast members

Summary Heading: Not up to past Disney standards- very noisy
Summary: We have been wanting to stay at the Grand Californian for a while, but it every time we wanted to stay, the rates were for the time we were travelling were very expensive.  We finally lucked out on a group rate that made staying there a no brainer and we were looking forward to our visit.   We were not impressed with the room at all. The staff was wonderful and the location can not be beat, but there are better values elsewhere off of Disney property.  Pros: -Fantastic lobby- perhaps the most impressive things about the hotel -Outstanding staff- especially the housekeeping crew. Turned down our bed every night like clockwork.   Cons: -Extremely noisy! You can literally hear voices through the wall -"Super flush toliets" are very loud- so much so that you can hear them flush

Summary Heading: Another great stay at the Grand Californian!
Summary: We have just returned from our third trip to Anaheim and another stay at the Grand Californian Hotel.  We had a room on the 3rd floor with two double beds and a view of the car park.  Room was clean and comfortable and whilst we didn't pay extra for a view room, this room was close to the pool entry, had a laundry on the lobby level and was near the gym.  I was lucky enough to get a good rate thanks to Dapper Day and with the exchange rate dropping fast, fear that any future trips will be out of our budget.  The location is brilliant and the early entry was a great bonus for us, as was the quick return through the private entry from California Adventure Park.  The interesting thing is that we had to change hotels for the last 2 nights of our stay and moved to the Best Western

Magical Stay! Yes you pay a lot but location, location, location makes this my greatest trip to Disneyland! We had a text room was ready by 12:00pm at high 90s temperature with a 2 year old that was the greatest news. Got a king like we asked and downtown view without paying for it. Great staff!

It is a low end hotel for 5 star prices.   Really way below even a Marriott in basic services.   Not even basics like complimentary water in rooms.  Avoid at all costs.   Save money and book a hotel around Disneyland.  Much better experience.

This Resort was full of wows.  From the lobby, to the pool, to the room overlooking California adventure to our own private entrance to California Adventure and Downtown Disney, this Resort had it all.    The room was impeccable and the housekeeper truly was a master at what she does.  I couldn't have been more pleased with the room.  The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom area was great.  Loved the robes as well.    I cannot say enough good things and I hope to come back multiple times in the future.

We stayed 4 nights on our DVC points and we lived our stay. There is an entrance to grand California theme park from the hotel. The pool are was so nice and relaxing after spending time in the parks. The hotel staff was great. The rooms were so nice. We had a great stay and hope to return soon!

Summary Heading: I wanted to love this property....
Summary: We usually stay at The Disneyland Hotel, but due to a sale on rooms we could only find rooms at the Californian. We had friends/family rave about this property, so we were really excited to get to experience everything they'd talked about. Before I go on, let me say there were many pros here so this isn't an 'everything stunk' review.  Pulling into the resort (we drove from AZ) is a treat. It's a beautiful property. And it's HUGE!!! There's no end to this property, and it's a little overwhelming for first-timers. We chose the valet parking option because we hadn't a clue where the self-parking lot was and were concerned we'd never see Dad again. Got in line for check in and only had to wait about five minutes as they had every computer cooking to get folks checked in. We were

Summary Heading: Amazing location but rooms are just okay
Summary: What's great about this hotel is it's location - it's in the middle of Downtown Disney and right next to Disney California Adventure.  It's so close that it has it's own entrance to the park itself.  You can leave your room and are right in the middle of California Adventure in mere minutes - I almost wanted to walk into the park in my pajamas.  And if you're tired you can rest in your room for a bit and jump right back into the parks without spending too much time.  We stayed in a room that looked right into the park - you practically felt that you were staying inside the park itself.  However the only thing really 'Grand' about this hotel is the main lobby area and it's location.  The rooms themselves just seem average for the amount you are paying.  They are clean but there

My family took my oldest son to Disneyland for a early graduation trip.   We stayed at the grand Californian,  it was wonderful.  We booked our passes and hotel with the hotel.  we also received a free parking pass.  A really neat feature to the Grand Californian Is the private park entrance.  There polls are beautiful.  I called ahead and had a personal shopper pick up a specific t shirt for my son and they had it waiting in the room with balloons for him.   They also gave him a badge to wear in the park and it allowed him to get 10% off anything he bought.   We ate at the Story Book Cafe every morning.  The kids loved the great food and all of the attention the characters gave them.  It was the first time we had ever stayed in a Disney Resort,  and we won't ever go any other

I have no complaints. Yes, staying at a Disney resort come with a hefty price tag. But if you can swing the cost, the Gran Californian will not disappoint! Very comfortable, excellent service. Resort exits directly to Downtown Disney, a very short walk to the Disneyland and California Adventure Park gates passing all the Downtown Disney shops and restaurants on your way to and from the resort. The resort has private entrance right from the resort into the California Adventure Park if you don't want to walk through Downtown Disney for any reason. Forget about shuttles, monorail, or driving. It's just a very short walk from the resort hotel to the Disneyland park. The decor throughout the resort if beautiful, unlikely to be disappointed with your stay here. Nothing is ever perfect

Spent 5 nights with my family of 5 at the Grand Californian and must say I found the hotel itself a decade behind the times. Certainly cannot complain about the location, as being able to move in and out of the park at a whim makes the whole Disneyland/California Adventure experience much easier. This is a particular advantage in the morning, when using your magic morning pass and also late in the evening when the park numbers start to reduce. The rooms themselves are starting to look tired, but my biggest issue was the completely useless wireless access throughout the the hotel. As an international visitor I did not have access to mobile data. On lazy afternoons I like to read my local newspaper and check the odd work email as I watch the kids in one of the three very good

Summary Heading: Great Access to California Adventure and Downtown Disney with Fire Evacuation
Summary: My wife and I saved up a long time in order to stay at the Grand Californian because it is easily double the cost of off-property hotels. They were unable to accommodate our request for a king bed, but having two queens was okay, plus they upgraded us to a "wooded view" off the balcony, which was very nice. I agree with the other reviewer that you must make reservations at Napa Rose in advance - it was booked solid, so we missed out; however, room service was very good.  We loved the easy access and early time slots for both Disney parks as well.  Now for the downside.  The Hearthstone Lounge bar was crowded and slow and the food was cold. It improved slightly upon a second try.  The worst part was two fire alarms and hotel evacuations in one night! The alarm sounded at 2am so

Summary Heading: Not quite as wonderful as it was
Summary: We recently spent four nights at Disney's Grand Californian. Having stayed there before I was expecting a fairly high level of wonderfulness for my money The decor is still a marvelous mix of " National Park Lodge" and Disney Magic. The room was immaculately clean if a bit worn at the edges as you might expect with the full occupancy this hotel enjoys. I was surprised that the towels are no longer the soft fluffy amazing sheets of eiderdown I previously experienced but thick nubbled exfoliaters.  Then I realized both mattresses in our double queen room were broken down on the facing edges!  I am told rooms are being redone at this time.  As a slight trade off the 'amenities' are much upgraded including in-room coffee that is sort of drinkable and H2O products up to and including

Summary Heading: Average except for location and front desk.
Summary: The best thing about this hotel is its location and semi-private entrance into Adventureland. It also had a very large pool with several water slides. Check-in was quick and smooth, but it took 2 phone calls to get adjourning rooms. They also have washing machines available which was a plus too. The rooms designated "garden view" on the second floor look out over a 10 foot roof and the pine trees around the pool. The rooms are generous but not overly large when most will be sleeping more than 2 people. If more than 2 than the room is tight. I agree with other reviewers about the bathroom sink area which easily disturbs others who might be sleeping. The WiFi was terrible and we just used our own hotspot instead. Lighting is poor too. The AC is very strange. It is either freezing

My mom, daughter (2), and I stayed here last week and were pretty disappointed. We were pretty excited because we love the Disneyland Resort but this hotel was a little below average for quite a bit of money. We checked in early and left our bags with the bell desk. I did like the fact that the hotel gives you keys to the room and then texts you with a room number when your room is ready. When we went back to the hotel to check out our room we got there and it was dark and dingy. It was really hard to put makeup on because of the lighting, I know that's not a big deal to many but if you like to put on makeup each morning in somewhat decent light this is not the hotel for you. The carpet was stained and didn't look very clean, it was just sort of like a truck stop hotel. We were

Summary Heading: Expected more from the Grand Californian
Summary: Here now about to check out tomorrow. First let me say we've stayed at nearly every deluxe resort at WDW and we've also traveled to Disneyland Paris & Disneyland Tokyo and stayed on property at both parks. We love all things Disney but have been disappointed with the service at the Grand Californian especially considering the price paid per night.  The big positive for this resort is location. You can't get better access to the parks & Downtown Disney.   Negatives - Our room is spacious but very dated. The toilet is terrible and takes several flushes then makes a horrible noise every few flushes.  House keeping is frustrating. We only got turn down service once of 5 nights and they missed housekeeping altogether twice. Very annoying when traveling as a family of 4. We ran out of

My husband and I were excited to take our daughter and friend to Disney's Grand Californian Hotel and Spa. Unfortunately we were deeply disappointed with what you get for over 600 dollars a night. What you get it nothing. Not even a bottle of water. The room is clean but small and outdated. There is not even a proper bathroom for privacy. There is a sink when you enter the room to the right and a pocket door that has the toilet and shower. Not much privvacy. The beds are not that comfortable. It is a very basic room. It is really worth a third of the price of what they charge. We were expecting greatness not just average ehhh. The only pro I can think of is that it is a bit closer walking distance to the park. I have stayed at the Paradise Pier that is part of the Disney Hotels.

We love Disney and have stayed at Disney hotel before so we do see Disney with rose tinted glasses. Overall it is a great hotel. The ambience is great. Very warm. Has a log fire in the lobby with storytellers. All the wood features do create a very unique stay. Not very old school Disney though if that's what you're looking. Go to Disneyland hotel for that. But this hotel has other benefits. Much closer to the park, with its own unique special entrance. Has a much larger pool area. And rooms are larger (though definitely darker!). Rooms are no more fancy than Disney hotel though.  On the down side....wifi is terrible. Have seen a few complaints about this on this site and totally agree. It shouldn't even be advertised its that bad!! If you're here to do any business, forget it.

Summary Heading: Still the best place to stay at Disneyland.  If you can afford it.
Summary: Look, its crazy expensive.  I don't need to tell you that.    But its pretty great.  Nice pools.  Given the location we'd get a fast pass to Grizzy River Run, go back to the pool, then do the ride when our time came up.  Rinse and repeat.  Lots of fun.  Lovely lobby, decent bar.  Very very slow service (like usual).  Long wait times on hold.  Half hour wait for bellman take bags down at departure--can't get a late checkout?  Just call them to get your bags, you're really in no hurry at all apparently.    No problems with taxis this time though, perhaps that was a glitch last time.    Nice room but nothing special (nothing like the lovely headrest on the beds at the Disneyland Hotel say).  And we got mosquitos in the room if we opened the balcony door anytime after late afternoon

This is our second stay here and once again we were not disappointed at all. The room was very clean and comfortable, all staff were helpful and courteous.  We stayed in a DVC studio so having the kitchenette was great as we often had breakfast in the room before hitting the parks.  Our room overlooked DCA and we could watch world of colour on the balcony at night.  I love this place, for the people that moan about the costs, it's a 5* hotel, what do you expect? If you can't afford it then Stay elsewhere.

Summary Heading: Can't beat the locaion when going to Disneyland
Summary: There's a reason this hotel can get away with the high prices for average accomodations.  Location location location.  You have a dedicated entrance into California Adventure, you're smack in the middle of downtown Disney, and you have a great pool area.  I have stayed here several times in the past and will continue to stay here in the future.  Kudos for all of the kid activities that are always underway (outdoor movies, etc...).

I think most people are acquainted with what to expect at a Disneyland hotel, so I'm limiting my comments to the Internet and TV services.  The Internet speed was somewhat acceptable at about 3 mbps up and 1 mbps down, but logging in was an issue. I was told that the problem had to do with my use of Apple products. Still I grew tired of constantly having to choose the WiFi network, wait for "Success," start up the browser and choose different sites until I would be taken to a log in IP address, select "Accept Terms," and wait for the Disney web page to load. If this happened only once a day, I would have been fine. But this happens over and over again each day, just about every time you use a device. Between the 7 of us we had 4 iPhones, 5 iPads, and 2 computers. Lots of log

Front desk staff and Housekeeping staff totally rocked and were fantastic and went above and beyond. Unfortunately this hotel suffers from "I'm a Disney Hotel-itis". It's getting dated and old, While some things are still outstanding this hotel is losing its luster. Wifi would not work.

My family and I have been to Disneyland several times, but never stayed in any of the Disney Hotels. This trip, my daughter and I decided to try out the Grand Californian Hotel. I will say that as soon as you arrive by car, you are treated like somebody special. Check in took surpriseingly long. They do text you when your room is ready which was a nice feature as we went into the park to start having some fun. The room in my opinion was just average with no Disney themes at all. It was clean with comfortable beds, but I don't like hotel rooms that have glass drinking glass's as they seem unsanitary. Our room was no larger then the average Motel room, but it did have double wash basins in the bathroom area. Access to the park through the hotel's private entrance was a plus.

They say location is everything, and in this case it couldn't be more true. On previous Disney trips we have stayed off-property and spent a lot of time getting to and from the parks. When you're paying those outrageous entrance fees you want to get the most out of every minute, and staying here allowed us to enter the parks early and minimize commute time. There is a nice variety of swimming venues and the property is exceptionally maintained. The food and drink offerings are mediocre- if the food was a little better, I would have rated it 5 stars.  There were several employees who went above and beyond to help make our travel easier, especially the bell desk team. One gentleman gave us the tip that our balcony had a great view of fireworks and we could listen to the

This is the worst hotel I have stayed in. How they can justify the prices they charge is beyond me. There is nothing in the minbar and they were going to charge me $7.25 for a Heinken plus a $3.00 delivery charge plus a 20% tip on top. All up $12 for a beer and that was before I converted it back to Aussie dollars. The rooms are revolting. Ours overlooks a room top that looks as though it has been used as a tip. When we arrived this morning early to take advantage of the early entry to the park they had stuffed up our booking and the tickets were not ready. Advantage lost. We eventually got going 3 hours later. I would not recommend my worst enemy stayed here. We won't be coming back and in fact we will leave early. Absolute disgrace.

Summary Heading: Ideal for families but needs modernising
Summary: Very friendly staff and perfect for those who do not want to walk far to access the parks. Clearly, you are here for the parks and it's a good enough hotel for families / friends who are looking for somewhere to put their heads down after spending 12 hours in the park experiencing the magic of Disney. However, the rooms could do with being modernised - dark, surprisingly small for American hotel rooms and pool area was very unimaginative / dated for a resort. Food was as you expect - nothing overly complicated and catered to the masses but Napa Room could pass for a decent grill.  Checking in is at 3 but we were able to check in earlier so thank you - parking if self parking is across the street and the Alamo ( for those renting cars) is also across the road. Disneyland Walk has

My parents are DVC members, and take my siblings, our families, and I to Disneyland every couple years.  We always stay in the villas to accommodate all 12 of us.  It really is spectacular!  The views are incredible, and fun for the kids.  The room/s are very nicely decorated and quite comfortable, as well.  The kids always have a blast at the pool (when weather permits) and the restaurants are outstanding!  The park entrance is extremely convenient for those of us who like to experience the wet rides in cold weather and go upstairs to change :)  Disney definitely delivers each time, especially for their vacation club members.  Can't wait to go back with my husband and our two children during Christmastime!

Summary Heading: Magical Place, rooms could do with a nice sprucing up.
Summary: Let me start with saying that I love all things Disney so my opinion may be slightly skewed.   If you go here thinking that the Four Season's prices mean Four Season's quality rooms, you're going to be very disappointed. If you book the Grand Californian knowing that the high price tag is because of the convenience of being so close to the parks and the magic of staying in the "Disney Bubble" then you're going to LOVE it here.   It was our first time staying on site in a Disneyland resort hotel and after this experience I don't think I'll ever be happy coming to Disneyland and staying off property again! The whole experience was magical. Every cast member we encountered was extremely friendly and helpful from the first person we saw entering the parking lot to the last person

I never usually write reviews but after last stay at the the Disney Grand Californian I was very disappointed.  The last few stays we stayed at the Disneyland hotel which was great but with a 2 year the walk through downtown disney could get busy.  So we tried the Grand again (we had been disappointed during 2 prior stays).  The rooms are dark and small around 350 square feet(and this time VERY far from exit).  Several things are always broken and we need to have fixed (light, the bathroom door).  Also, the internet is useless and I had work to do while kids were napping and was unable to do it. When we called to inquire they said it was because the hotel is older and not wired for wifi.  Well then do not advertise wifi if you are not going to provide it.    If this is a once in

I stayed here for a week with my friends for a vacation and it was perfect!  We love everything Disney and the Disneyland parks are always fun to visit! The staff was great every time we interacted with them and the rooms were comfortable for everyone! We really enjoyed hanging out in the pool/hot tubs, the breakfast there was fantastic, and the best part was easy access to the park! I mean seriously, not having to take a bus to get to the park saved us so much time and it was great to be able to go back to our room or pool in the afternoon to cool off!  I plan on returning to stay at this hotel when I come to visit this October!

We stayed at the Grand Californian September 8th through the 12th. I'm use to staying at five star resorts wherever I go. As others have stated, you are paying a premium for convenience. This is by no stretch of the imagination a 5 star report (more like a 3 1/2 star). The rooms are small with a teeny tiny bathroom compared to other resorts in their price range. The rooms are also in serious need of updates. I paid for the premium view but that was just a view of the pool and definitely not worth it. Everything was lackluster from the food, room service and even customer service. The only reason why I would definitely stay here again is because of its location. It was so nice to be able to run back and forth from the park to the room so easily with a toddler especially given the

Summary Heading: Great Location, Good Hotel, Poor Value
Summary: Location can;t be beat, and the rooms are quite good (not Four Seasons good, but good).  The price point however is absurd.  Even in low season, basics rooms are extremely expensive.  Anywhere else in the world you'd be having an absolutely top-notch, world-class hotel experience.  Here, it is good, but at the price of exceptional luxury competitors.

I've stayed at this hotel twice for company meetings - the first time I didn't have a great experience. My room was so far away from the elevators, it was like walking through an endless maze to get to it. There were kids screaming a running through the hallways. It was honestly pretty miserable.  I'm happy to say my second visit was much better. I knew to ask for a room closer to the elevator. There weren't kids screaming and running. My room was very clean each visit, and the employees are all very friendly and helpful. Wifi wasn't very good, it kept going in and out which was really frustrating. Honestly with the rates charged at this hotel I was expecting something a little more luxurious or upscale, but that simply isn't the case. Very reminiscent of a chain hotel that

This hotel is worth the price for location and early entry to Downtown Disney, California Adventure park or Disneyland.  The staff is Disney helpful and pleasant. All the restaurants are overpriced which is typical for everything at Disney.  We were a group of eight and had trouble getting tables at all the restaurants.  The food was very average, even at the Napa Rose.  This hotel is probably double the price of the off park hotels.

We stayed in a 3 bedroom Disney Vacation Club villa. It has 4 bathrooms, full kitchen, dining table, living room, upstairs a sitting room with a pool table and a washer and dryer. Master bedroom has a king and is downstairs. The other 2 bedrooms are upstairs. They each have 2 queen beds. There is also a pull out downstairs and upstairs. The service was great as usual. We played in the pools as well. They have 3 large pools, 1 child pool and 2 hot tubs. One of the pools has a child and adult water slide.  They have swim diapers and water vests at the pool for your use. One of the great benefits to staying on Disney property is you get early admission to the parks each day of your start. You need your ticket for park admission and then you show your room key and get in 1 hour

This hotel is amazing. Expensive, but amazing. Our family's first trip to Disneyland so we went all out. Being so close was great with small kids as we could easily go up and rest in the afternoon. We took advantage of the extra hour every morning. The service is incredible - up to Disney standards. We got a corner room with a view of Downtown Disney and part of California Adventure. We could see most of the Disneyland fireworks from our balcony - pretty cool. We took advantage of the pools on our day off from the parks and our kids loved it. We could have done more time at the pools. Everything was great. The location being the best part.

Summary Heading: Disney delivers Comfort and Close to California Adventure
Summary: We wanted a view but opted for the cheaper partial view option and it met our needs.  We were able to have an overview of downtown Disney and saw spectacular fireworks from our outdoor balcony.   Breathtaking!   I liked the lodge decor with a wide open comfy seating area outside the lobby.  The room was comfortable and well appointed.  We took in the character breakfast which the kids enjoyed.  It is more about bears and chipmunks and not the Mickey and Minnie crowd if that matters to you.  The ease of direct access to California Adventure was a plus.  My daughter forgot a bag in her room and we came back expecting to be a hassle but the housekeeper had retrieved it and gave to us when we identified it.  Disney still delivers.  Rooms are costlier than other Disney resorts but

Check in and check out staff incompetent! Arrived at room it was dirty walk back a mile to desk to wait in line to walk a mile to new room. Bell hop was 45 min wait at check out. Hallway a cluttered mess.

Yes, staying here is not inexpensive but for me it is worth every penny for the nice rooms, extra park hours, private entrance to California Adventure and easy walk to Disneyland. The lobby is beautiful.  It is truly the staff the is the heart of the operation. Everyone one from the Valet Service to Linda at the front desk is exceptional.  Every Cast Member went above and beyond to make sure every need was met. The room have nice amenities like fluffy towels, bath robes and the beds are comfy.  The pool area is nice but the chlorine is exceptionally strong and hurt my eyes.  I will stay here when I can.

Spent a weekend here during X-mas. Biggest Christmas tree I ever saw. Room with a view was first class. Great dining choices, plenty of shopping next-door at Downtown Disney. Entrance to California Adventure from lobby. A little pricey but the central location kind of makes up for it.

Summary Heading: Very Average (think a basic Marriott) but Convenient at a (Deluxe) Cost
Summary: When I've asked others who have stayed at this property, I was told that this is a super nice hotel.  I supposed that everything is relative.  Compared to the other Disney hotels in Anaheim, it probably is and there is a sense of grandeur from the big lobby.  But that's about it.  The lobby is super bustling and in the Californian arts & crafts style.  Very imposing - feels like you are in a lodge up in Northern California with the redwoods.  From the lobby, you have access to the casual eating place that leads to the pools outside.    There were 3 decent-sized pools with a number of jacuzzis around them.  There is one pool that the kids love because it has a large water slide and a tiny one for tots.  The big water slide was a hit with my little one.  But being Disney, they

This hotel is great! The location is right next to Downtown Disney and has a back entrance into Disney's California Adventure. The decor is beautiful, rooms are very nice, very clean. Staff is very friendly‚Äìjust as you would expect with Disney. Loved everything about it!

Summary Heading: Worth the Price for Being Close to Parks
Summary: Stayed two nights with Orbitz booking - paid in advance, room was 317, but with tax was 375.   We paid for the convenience of being close to the park and we got what we paid for.   Had previously stayed at Paradise Pier and Disneyland Hotel and this was worth the extra money.  Everyone was very friendly and there was never a line at registration.  We had a courtyard view, first floor that fronted the pool closest to CA adventures.  We could actually see the fireworks from this room (1511).  The room was very large - two queens, but could have fit one more!   Very comfy beds.   Opted to self-park for $17 per day rather than the $25 valet fee, and it seemed like everyone else did too as the valet lot was nearly empty.   On Magic Mornings for CA Adventures, it worked best to go to

Great hotel except we had to wait until 4:45 for our room when we were told we could check on at 3. They didn't seem to care too much!!!!! The advantage of staying in the parks is worth the extra money this hotel charged. Kids loved the pool and being right in the thick of it.

Disney hotels are the best where ever you go, the high standards are Disney's reputation. Nothing is to much trouble for them to attend to any request. The Grand Californian is a lasting impact the moment you walk through those doors,  with a private tunnel for hotel guests to enter Californian Adventure Park direct. Avoiding the crowds at the admission gate. Higher the floor better the view. Corner rooms are bigger. At Downtown Disney's door step, where all the eateries, restaurants and shops are. Disneyland is opposite The Californian Adventure  Park. So if you want everything literally at your fingertips this hotel has it all.  Pricey yes but it's worth it. But be prepared for all the other outside hotel guests that do walk through the lobby to access Downy Town Disney for a

Absolutely beautiful stunning lobby.  The staff is excellent.  Warm, helpful and friendly.  Everything you expect in a Disney Experience.  Many rooms face into the CA Adventure park so you can watch the night time water show from the comfort of your room.

Came here with my mom, sister and husband. Never thought we would be able to stay here but after saving up we were able to. The check in was beyond easy and the staff was very friendly. We left our bags with the bell service and took advantage of the magic morning our hotel provided. When we got to our room we discovered we had an amazing view of Grizzly Peak inside of California Adventure. I honestly cant say enough good stuff about the hotel and the staff. We will be trying to stay here again next year!

We did it!  We finally splurged and stayed at the Grand Californian!  The amazing service began as soon as I booked our two night stay.  Information emails came every few days that were helpful in planning our time.  The enthusiastic greeting at the main entrance was so welcoming!  Cast members throughout the hotel were friendly and helpful.  We upgraded to the Disney District view room and it was well worth it.  Sitting on our balcony in the mornings was enjoyable.  Disney music plays as people head to the parks.  We also enjoyed the evenings on our balcony listening to live entertainment right below.  Our room was beautifully decorated with muted woodsy tones with attention to detail as only Disney does.  The hallways were even pretty! The lobby is a masterpiece in

Summary Heading: Great for the experience but too pricey
Summary: We love taking the kids to disney and staying at the hotel but the rooms are so pricey for standard accommodations. We've booked both 3 bedroom and 2 bedroom suites and there are zero perks. We stayed at the four seasons for less and they set up a tent for my kids and they even received Olaf stuffed animals one night. All in all we had a great time but I was expecting more of a magical experience for the price tag it commands.

Accommodations are very spacious and clean. Beautiful place to stay. Pool was great. Kids had fun! Very close to everything. Friendly staff and helpful and informative. Disney California park was fun for everyone.

Summary Heading: Disney is the class like no other
Summary: There are very little things you can complain about when you check into a Disney resort. The grand California is no exception.  The style of this resort is no match to any other on property. It is worth the extra money you will spend to stay there. Yes it is pricey but it is well worth it.  Quiet, clean, convenient, classy, and beautiful. The pool was amazing. Two hot tubs, a slide and three separate pools make lots of guest feel like they have the area to them selves. Well done Disney.

The convience of a 3 minute walk to park is  what attracted me to this hotel.  Especially with 2 toddlers in the heat of September ..   BUT honestly the $$$$ are not WORTH it.  Rooms are ok,  albeit clean.   The distance you have to walk to your room from elevator far outweighs the closeness to park.  Work stay at a cheaper hotel next time

I've read all the reviews before going to disneyland and appreciated that it was really near the gates to the two theme parks. First I paid for a downtown disney view but upon check in, they told me that they were going to give me a pool view so I had to correct her that I paid more not to be in the pool view area so I was given another room with hardly any downtown disney view since it was the third floor where the only view was an obstructing roof on one of the stores below so I called operator without even touching the beds and was moved to 2 floors up which was better, but shouldn't that info be on my reservations already? Was that done on purpose???Hmmm... So the lesson is this.... if your plan is to stay here for convenience, choose the least expensive room, you really

Perfect position! Includes early entry to disneyland and adventure park on certain days! We didnt travel with children but its definitely well equipped for them with a seperate pool, movies in the lobby and they are treated like kings! We had room service a couple of nights and also dined at the cafe by the pool both had fantastic food and quite reasonably priced (room service was a little extra) Staff are fantastic and so welcoming. Hotel was a little bit more then another hotel outside of the park (but not unaffordable) but we didnt mind as we had decided to spoil ourselves st the end of our trip!

This hotel is good if you go to Disney everyday of your stay. This hotel is packed with tourist and is loud. This is not the place to stay if you want a little quiet. The restaurants are packed with people not staying at the hotel. You need a reservation. The decor is amazing.

We visited this hotel in 2010 and again in August 2015.  We stayed 2 nights, because my kids wanted to go to California AdventureLand.    As with my prior visit, the line up and wait to check in was ridiculous.  Long and tiring and frustrating.  I don't understand how Disney doesn't do this better.    The most frustrating part is Disney's lack of data management.  My family, like so many, has a Disney profile (online) that includes our address, etc.  Instead of Disney accessing that, the check in person has the customer stand while they re-type the address, etc.  As a customer, this is a source of annoyance, and it's time consuming. This is part of why the check in line is so long.  The workers in the hotel are just ok. I find that they don't really interact with the guests.

We are big Disney fans from the UK..having been to WDW in Florida over 13 times.  Our all time favourite hotel is the Animal Kingdom Lodge which is a very relaxing and atmospheric place to stay.  This hotel has a similar ambiance ..but doesn't quite match up to the WDW hotels.  It is very grand with a huge lobby..but reminds me more of WDW  when we first started visiting in 1990.  WDW has modernised quite a bit since then with magic bands and wifi in rooms..but this hotel is more a nostalgic Disney. We did not have any problems with our rooms as some others unfortunately have.  The air conditioning was noisy..but then we find all American hotels have noisy air conditioning (as we don't need this in the chilly UK!).  They were cleaning the carpets while we were there..but

You cannot beat the location of this hotel if you intend to visit the Disney parks and there is no reason that I can see to stay in this hotel if you are not visiting the Disney parks.  You are within a short walking distance to both Disney theme parks and also Downtown Disney.  Being able to easily come back to the hotel from the parks whenever we were tired or just needed a break is a HUGE positive for this hotel. We stayed at the hotel for a week.  There were 10 of us in total, myself, my wife, our two children and their respective families.  We chose a standard room for everyone and there was nothing special about any of the rooms.  They were in fact a little dated.  Access to wifi was haphazard and in my son's room, totally non-existent.  The money spent on this hotel was

We absolutely loved our stay at the Grand Californian at Disneyland Resort.  Although the rooms are a little smaller than the deluxe rooms at the Walt Disney World resort in Orlando, Florida, the rooms at the Grand Californian were well appointed and very clean.   In fact, the entire resort was so clean and beautiful! The lobby is just awe inspiring beautiful!  We had a room that overlooked the California Adventure park.  So much fun! Love the style at the Grand Californian!  We also really appreciated how close this resort is to both parks.  It goes without saying that California Adventure is just steps away from the Grand Californian.  Disneyland is just a very short walk to the gates.  I'm a Disney World veteran, and I was blown away and totally excited about the Disneyland

Summary Heading: The "BEST" Disney Resort Experience Ever - Even Beats the Grand Floridian!!
Summary: My husband and I are no strangers to the Disney resort hotels.  We have tried many up and down the scale in FL; but this was our first trip to CA  and Disneyland and we wanted it to be a memorable one.  The Grand Californian has everything - soaring lobby, fantastic service, easy check-in and nice, spacious rooms with a King bed, oh my!  The most fabulous part of all?  Walking with ease over to the parks; needing no transportation wait to shuttle things back to the hotel; and the walk out right to Downtown Disney and the other resort hotels.  We will stay here again - I promise!  Thank you, Disney management for creating this wonderful experience.  This is the only place that blows WDW away in the CA resort system.

We had a great time at the Grand! Exceptional service, friendly staff! The room, 5424, was premium and faced DCA. At first the room I wanted wasn't available but they found a way and we got our theme park view! Thank you! We had our 5 year old grand son with us and he loved the hotel! The pool was great for kids and he enjoyed the slides. Character breakfast at Storyteller was exceptional and he loved all the characters. Everything about this hotel was five star and a great place for kids and adults. We had a problem with our shuttle back to the airport and the Grand Califonian helped us with their Disney Magic and we got off to our flight no problem! Thank you to everyone at the Disney Grand Califonian for making our first disney trip with pur grandson so special!

We stayed her for 5 nights and it was great.  The rooms are a little smaller then the Disneyland Hotel and it does not have the Disney motif like Disneyland Hotel, but it was nice.  The rooms were always clean and it was spotless.  Everyone there was extremely friendly and professional.  The only issue we had with our room was the faucet in the bathroom leaked when you turned on the water.  I told Bell services and they said they would have someone fix it right away.  The last day there, the faucet still leaked, not sure if anyone showed up to repair it.  Some of the pools close at 8:00 PM and in the morning some of the pools don't open until later.  When we were there, they were conducting training in the pools.  Food service around the pool does not start until 12:15 PM, so if

The lobby is sooo grand and beautiful and clean and shiny. The sitting area for the kids is cozy w/ those rocking chairs and old cartoons. The fireplace is big and blazing. The bar is so nice. And I swear I smell pine in there. The location is super convenient w/ Downtown Disney a few steps away and the parks just a short walk. Another pricey Disney resort, but so perfect it's absolutely worth the money.

Moved to grand Californian after a bad experience at marriot, it was pretty pricey with our room being 300$ a night, but I would say very much worth it. Service was amazing, everyone was so friendly, located right in Disneyland which was so convenient as we got to constantly go in and out for afternoon naps and such, and no travel to a far hotel. Only downside was the washroom was a bit old and needed renovation. Would recommend for family vacations!

Summary Heading: Impressive front door is where it stops
Summary: Not very impressed.  Booked a "Deluxe View Room" at around AUD$450/night which sleeps 5 people (queen bed looks more like a double, bunk set and roll out bed).  The room measures roughly 30 x 14 feet which works out to be less about 55 square feet per person.  Surprised that even meets fire code.  The room was made up for 4 (4 towels, 4 glasses, 1 small shampoo and conditioner) despite 5 people being booked.  Sitting area is a small desk/table with 2 chairs (again.... there are 5 people living here).  Electrical kitchen appliances in the bathroom surely presents and electricity risk.  Living on the reputation of the brand and not delivering on the facilities.

I absolutely love this hotel. We normally stay at a good neighbor across the street, however we decided to splurge. We stayed 7 days which gave us plenty of time to enjoy the parks & the pools during the heat of the day. Such a great location & own private entrance & are able to use the early morning magic each day to a park. We went in late August while they transitioned into Fall but still was busy. Mariposa Pool was our favorite. Less small children, We were able to find chairs in the shade just fine & even rented a Cababa for an afternoon which was great!!! Own personal server & chairs with a fridge stocked with fruit & water. ceiling fan & TV. Definitely recommend to spurge if you can. This hotel (true Hotel, not motels across the street) would have been given a 5 star

Only hotel that has the parks on the doorstep although its still a fair walk to Disneyland (direct access to the Californian adventure park).  Grander than Sequoia lodge but the rooms still felt like they were built on the cheap.  This permeated throughout the hotel - pool OK but seen much better before, restaurant was expensive and seen better before - it was all just OK but at a very expensive price.  Frustratingly, we had to do some work there and everything in the business centre costs money from using the computers, logging onto wifi everything.  Again not what you would expect from a top hotel.

We had a nice suite  on level 3 with great views out over two of the hotel's three pools. A wonderful early morning sight, plus night views of the ferris wheel and roller coaster. The hotel is in a fabulous location, with shops and restaurants galore on the doorstep and a very short walk to the Parks. That meant we could visit in the morning, rest across the hottest part of the day and go back easily in the afternoon/evening. It is expensive, but you just have to weigh up the priorities. Ours had to be convenience at the end of a really busy itinerary. Staff are helpful and friendly.

Summary Heading: Great Location, Close To Everything Disney
Summary: We came in late August, early Sep. The hotel not only has its own entrance to California Adventure, but it's also the closest hotel on the property to both parks.  Would go have given this place a 5, but it's a bit pricey, and certain things didn't function properly. First, the cable went out, and didn't come back on. I didn't mind calling the front desk about it, but the button on the phone didn't work. Ok, I thought. I'll just open up the little book of hotel service for the phone number. The book listed a few numbers, but just said to press the front desk button on the phone. By the time I went through all of this, it was time to go to dinner anyway.  Kind of frustrating.  Alright, so nobody goes to Disneyland just to watch TV in the hotel room.  However, this is one of the

This is the most expensive hotel in the Disneyland Resort, but the second you walk in, you can see why.  We had fantastic service, an easy check in.  It is very easy to get lost in this hotel, but the cast members did a great job of pointing me in the right direction every time I was lost. I shared a room with a friend, we had two very comfortable queen size beds and double sinks! The entryway to California Adventure was just downstairs from our room.  We had a view of the monorail right outside our window! It was a corner room, but very quiet.  I occasionally could hear children screaming in the hall, but that was a rare occurrence. I recommend this hotel and can't wait to stay in it again next time! The location can't be beat and there is a military discount!

Summary Heading: What a wonderful place to stay at Disneyland!
Summary: We were spending two days at Disneyland while visiting my daughter in CA.  I had originally booked another hotel but my husband said to try to stay onsite with about two weeks to go--the only one was the Grand Californian so we booked it!  We spent two nights, and spent most of the first day and check out day at the parks, with some pool time on our full day.   We loved the pool!  The chairs are a BIG step up from Disney World.  My husband and I were in the hot tub and who walked by on his way out but Adam Sandler and his family!  Very shocking for these "rubes" from Ohio.  The lobby was very impressive and when we were there they had a huge cake in the shape of the DL castle for the upcoming 60th anniversary.  We asked for a bunk bed room as we had my 23 year old daughter and

We stayed for three nights in late August when the temperature was in the high 90s.  We paid for a room on the Concierge (Club) Level which came with lounge benefits - more on that below.  The room (one double and bunk beds) was of a fair size and came with a balcony.  There was a small balcony with two chairs and a small table.  The air-con was also good.  Overall a 3 star room in any other hotel.  But you're not here for the room of course!  The hotel itself sits right alongside the Californian Adventure park and staying at the hotel grants you entry to both parks one hour early.  We had a three day park hopper ticket (entry to both parks each day) and were therefore able to pop in and out of the parks and back to the hotel for naps and food.  If you're only staying one day

Summary Heading: Great location - tired rooms and service lacking.
Summary: Stayed at this hotel during the off peak end of summer time. Usually stay at Paradise Pier but decided to splurge on a $600 a night stay for 4 nights.   Check in was great - super friendly check in assistant (thanks Maggie) - she got us a room right away at 11am and in a great location where we could see the fireworks from our balcony. Unfortunately in the time it took her to find us a room (about 10minutes) bell services managed to break one of the items in our grocery bags. The bell services guy told us when he brought our bags to the room. He told us that they broke the quest dip - we didn't care - it's only quest dip however he promised to see what he could do about replacing. Upon further inspection, our bags were still covered in cheesy dip! We also discovered out chips

Like most other people have already stated, you stay here for the location.  I was traveling with my husband and 11 & 10 year old children.  Each morning I would awake before my family and walk the 5 minutes from my room to Starbucks (in Downtown Disney) and get coffee & breakfast then head to Jamba Juice to get the rest of my family's breakfast needs.  The hotel was clean, beautiful and I would absolutely stay here again.  Our room overlooked Downtown Disney and I was afraid the noise would keep us up, I am a light sleeper, but I didn't hear a thing.    My only complaint was the service at the pool.  We went to the pool on 3 different occasions and the service each time was terrible.  On one particular occasion the waiter asked if we would like to order, we said just need to

We brought our nephew who has never stayed at the hotel. Just to get away for the weekend was very nice. My kids loved the pools, the slides and the ambiance of the hotel. The pools are well manned with lifeguards and life vests and swimmers are provided to guests. We had breakfast at Storytellers caf√©. Food and service excellent. Very kid friendly. Rooms were very nice overlooking Ca Adventure park and monorail.

I love Disney and all it has to offer.  Having said that, at the end of a fun-filled day, I am DONE.  DGC offers the best of both worlds...I am steps away from both parks AND light years away all at the same time.    The subtle nuance of Mickey is obviously present, but DGC is peaceful, dimly lit, and quiet.  I requested a room with bunk beds for our little guy, and he loved them.
