I highly recommend this option if you have kiddos that are still too young for an adjoining room.  The bunk bed sleeps 3 little ones (top, bottom, and trundle).  The top bunk is safe for all ages.  Another benefit to one queen and the bunk bed is that the room feels larger.  We ordered the family Grand Magical Welcome in-room celebration.  If you are looking for an over-the-top experience, it

Summary Heading: Convenience is King. Long live the Grand Californian.
Summary: We had a really great stay at the Grand Californian Hotel. Despite giving it 4 stars, it is the only place we would stay in Disneyland with small children. Yes it is expensive and we did have a few glitches, but it is still a definite must, if you can afford it.  First, the positives: the proximity to the parks was a godsend with small kids. Being able to return for some downtime, being able to take a stroll in the evening through the park without it being a huge ordeal to get there...check.  The staff at the hotel were all terrific - couldn't have been nicer to a person (except for the lifeguards at the pool, but they've got a pretty tough gig). Check again.  The few meals we ate at the hotel were all surprisingly good.  The pool was GREAT. Perfect temperature, slides for

Being a Disney resort you expect the best, and they delivered.  We prefer to stay during non-peak times as the price is lower. Entrances to GCA, and Downtown Disney. There is a special balcony for hotel guests where you can watch the World of Color show. Great pool, even better service. If you want a no hassle hotel stay and are willing to pay then this is your hotel.

Summary Heading: Best Stay Yet, hard to beat the location
Summary: We have stayed here multiple times at different areas of the hotel and I have to say I like the east wing on this visit the best. These rooms are located along the Californian Adventure theme park side with one set of rooms facing the park and the other set facing the pools. There is a elevator located between the Storyteller Cafe & Napa Rose restaurants so there was easy access coming from the elevator to go to the park entrance. We stay here when grandma is in our party because it is easier for her to get to & from the parks because of the close location. We love the service and the quality of the resort but have to warn first time visitors to beware of sticker shock when you get the bill. On this visit we had a suite with an additional room. The connecting room had bunk beds

Location.  That is the one reason to stay here.  The easy access to the parks (including a dedicated access to DCA) as well as the convenience of walking out the door into Downtown Disney are the sole reasons to stay here.  We've stayed at the Disneyland Hotel in the past and this hotel is definitely in a much more convenient location.  Beyond that, the hotel itself was just mediocre.  Take away the location, and I would never stay here.  The public areas are very nice (and the Whitewater Cafe was very convenient), but the hotel is loud - especially the noise coming from the open great room which was noticeable within our room.  The staff were friendly.  The great room was nice, but always crowded and very loud.  The pool area was nice, but there are not enough chairs and the

First off love disneyland but for $700 a night i expected more from Disney's Grand  California resort this hotel is average at the most nothing to vome hone an talk about. I think the lobby is the nicest part of the hotel. Rooms had no type of disney theme besides one mickey head in the wall paper an carpet speaking of the carpet they need to be cleaned dont walk around without your shoes on. All in all i would stay here again if the rooms were in the $300 to $200 range they are way over priced

The hotel was superb.  The only thing I have bad to say is about the meals.  They are substandard and cafeteria style.  Just a step up from nursing home food.  Otherwise the staff was friendly and courteous.  The disney characters around for the children was great for them.

Just got back from 5 nights at the Grand Californian. This was our second time, but we have had several visits over the years to non-Disney hotels in the area, and persuaded ourselves having walked through the lobby many times that we should treat ourselves. I have to say after this trip that ( whilst the cleanliness, location, and service were excellent) I find it hard to justify the extra $$$.  Our main problem was lack of wi-Fi in the room - something that is a basic requirement these days. Although the staff showed concern, there was not really any solution forthcoming other than just agreeing with us that the wi-Fi is "not the best". I feel it should be at that price. ( we tried with several devices- Apple, Samsung, Nokia - which all worked perfectly well in our previous

Stayed at the GC in June this year; chose a Downtown Disney view since we had my 89 year old mom with us and wanted to cut down as much walking for her as possible. It's pricey but the room was nicely appointed and had a nice size balcony overlooking Downtown Disney and had a great view of the Disneyland fireworks. You could see the tip of the Matterhorn and top of Space Mtn. Room 423.  We had dinner at the Napa Rose which was really good; read some not so good reviews earlier but found it to be a nice dinner with good service. Tasty beers and a Moscow Mule which was delish.  Also went to the character breakfast buffet at the Storytellers cafe; the food was good and fresh; the service was quick and attentive for juice, coffee refills, etc. Chip and Dale and the others came often

Stayed club level for 2 nights for the Disneyland Diamond Celebration.  We were not greeted by club level staff upon arrival and were directed to find our way up to the concierge floor.  After that misstep, were we pampered and treated like royalty for the rest of our stay.  Even though the hotel was near capacity, the club lounge was never crowded.  I really enjoyed sitting on the club balcony, sipping a great latte' from their wonderful cap machine, reading the USA Today, and nibbling assorted fruits and pastries.  What a great way to start a usually tiring day at the parks. Afternoon Tea is served from 11am-4pm.  A much longer period than the Grand Floridian in Orlando.  The finger sandwiches were incredible, and the added time gives you plenty of opportunity to take a break

This hotel is right adjacent to Disney California Adventure and Downtown Disney.  Therefore, you can easily access everything.   My son even snuck out in the evening for the "Reflection'' show and came back all by himself right after the show finished.    Super convenient. However, while reserving back in April, I remember requesting to have a room with two queen beds and one day bed.  This request was not honored while we checked in on the night.  And the reply we got was: "all those rooms have been allocated out and those guests have already checked in".  Ok, we eventually got an accessible room with one King bed and a sofabed which was right next to the Laundry Room, Vending Machine/Ice Room, and Exit Door.   Great.  I squeezed in the King bed with my 13 year old son while my

Summary Heading: Premium Price for a Very Average Hotel
Summary: The only reason anyone stays at the Grand Californian Hotel is to visit the Disneyland Parks.  Its location inside the Disneyland Park and the convenience of being able to enter directly into California Adventures are very good selling points.   With the added incentive of the Magic Morning extra hour that residents have, Disney is able to charge whatever price the market will bear.  The hotel does have a very nice lobby area and a large contingent of very friendly, helpful and professional staff.  The hotel have few amenities other than a swimming pool and spa, since everything a tourist needs is right outside in Downtown Disney and the parks.  We had an enjoyable 2-night stay as our granddaughter and her friend spent most of their waking hours in the parks.  But I find hard to

We stayed here for four nights and we thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience.  Of course, it's a beautiful hotel, paying homage to California's Arts & Crafts style.  Everything from the exterior to the majestic lobby to the details in the rooms are wonderfully executed.  The service from all the staff was excellent and very helpful.  A couple things to be aware of; the check-in process is lengthy and we were told they charge for extra towels in the room.  The beds are very, very comfortable, possibly the best I've ever experienced.   An added bonus of staying in a Disney hotel is the "Magic Hour" where hotel guests gain entry to the parks an hour early.  One can get in a lot of rides in that extra hour.  Note that it alternates between parks and that some sections or rides are

Was disappointed that the cost of this hotel didn't meet my expectations.  When we checked in our room wasn't ready and they said they  would send us a text when it was.  That wasn't a problem since we were early.  When we received the text we went to the front desk and they told us the cards they had given to us previously would work.  It was quite a hike to our room.  and of course the cards didn't work.  We went back downstairs only to be told that it was our fault the cards didn't work.  they are sensitive cards.  I told the check in clerk that we kept the cards in the jacket that they gave us so I didn't see how it could be my fault.  I then asked if they could give us a room by an elevator.  He left to go to the back for about 5 minutes only to tell us no.  He printed us

The room, the staff, the amenities..... everything was just incredible!  Checked in on a Sunday and stayed until Wednesday.  The room was perfect.  The entire hotel is an architects dream; Craftsman style with  Frank Lloyd Wright influences throughout.  We were there during out anniversary and when we came back to the room that evening there were rose petals, chocolate and more covering out bed.  The staff is incredible; anticipating your every need and always pleasant.

The hotel staff and location are excellent.  Very convenient to both parks and Downtown Disney.  The staff was always helpful and friendly.  The grounds immaculate as you would expect from Disney.  As always everything is VERY expensive.  We dropped in to the Storyteller's Cafe for breakfast (I needed to eat to take some meds) and didn't realize it was buffet only.  Well, okay, no menu, so I grabbed some pre-scrambled eggs and bacon and a little bit of fruit.  Hubby about the same.  Cost per person?  $33!!!!!  Yikes, that was a little steep for breakfast....  but over all that was our only complaint.

Summary Heading: Direct Entrance to California Adventure Park
Summary: We stayed here for one night to go to Disneyland. We booked one suite and one room. I would say you pay a premium but the convenience of being in the park is worth it. The rooms are not exactly 5 star furnishings but being that Disney is right outside your door makes a difference. Check-in was fast and smooth. Our room wasn't ready but Disney has a system where they will text you when the room is ready with your room number.   -They have a grab and go type of restaurant that we used a lot. Burgers, sandwiches, breakfast, snacks, drinks. Great for saving time so we could enjoy the park more.  -Spacious rooms with darker craftsman decor.  -Nice outdoor pool area -one hour early entry to either California Adventure or Disneyland depending on the day -Walk right out to Downtown

The rooms were clean and nice. We rented a cabana at the pool for 2 days. It was so relaxing. We went into the park early and rode rides and came back to the pool to enjoy our cabana. It was just lovely and so very relaxing.

The Grand Californian Hotel at Disneyland is a deluxe hotel featuring views the Magic Kingdom Fireworks, or Downtown Disney, or Disney's California Adventure.  There is a special entrance for guests to get into Disney California Adventure.  You can also take a different path and enter Downtown Disney.   It is pricey and you are paying for the location and convenience.  Wonderful theming.  Dining options from upscale Napa Rose, to Storytellers Cafe (fun character buffet, solid lunch and dinner options), to White Water Snacks for quick serve.  Rooms are very nice and provided ample space.

My family was very excited to stay at the Grand California Hotel.  It was to celebrate our son's birthday and wanted to make it special.  We checked in early and had the day planned out.    We expected to have our room ready by 3pm and came back to the front desk at exactly 3pm.  It took about 30 minutes for the staff to find out what was happening to the room, only to find out it wasn't ready.  I was told it would be a few more minutes and I would get a text message when it was ready.  15 (few minutes) later, I check with the front desk, and the make another phone call.  Again a few more minutes and to wait for a text message.  Finally 15 minutes later (1 whole hour waiting in the lobby, waiting for an over priced room), I finally got the text message.    We got to the room,

The proximity to Disneyland and Disney California Adventure Park is ideal. The lobby downstairs is like Hogwarts - kids would love it. The rooms were around 3 star. DISNEYLAND WAS AMAZING. The evening parade and fireworks were magic.

Summary Heading: Best Disney hotel I ever stayed at
Summary: Great location.  Service was terrific and rooms were very nicely furnished with high end linens.  The lobby is spectacular and the pool area was well kept and not at all over crowded.  I've stayed at the Pirandello Floridian hotel, which is very nice, but this hotel is even better.  It's costly but well worth it.

This hotel is amazing.  We stay either here or at the Disneyland hotel every time we visit Disneyland.  It's worth the money.  The parks have the same magic as the parks do.  The private entrance to California Adventure is a plus too!  The last time we visited we upgraded to Club Level and it was worth it!  Downtown Disney is just outside the doors as well.  The hotel even has a really delicious buffet located on the grounds! Love this hotel!

Disney cast members always make Disney days amazing.  Our room overlooking Downtown Disney was a little noisy but worth it because it allowed us to see the fireworks from our room.  The breakfast critter brunch was a little underwhelming, but the chef and cast are amazing at accommodating food allergies and making sure the kids feel special.

Summary Heading: Great location, but hotel needs updating!
Summary: We requested a room with three beds.  When we arrived, we were given a room with a king size bed, a sofa and a sleeping bag.  At $600 a night?  A sleeping bag?  Really?  And the issue was not resolved.  The three stars I gave it is solely for the fantastic location, just at the entry to the parks in Downtown Disney.

Summary Heading: As if you need another awesome review
Summary: Perfect. Everything was perfect. From the moment we walked in until we checked out 4 days later. The hotel is beautiful. And while it's incredibly crowded, especially during the summer, it still felt quiet and peaceful. The hotel has the added bonus, of course, of early entry into the parks. This was a huge benefit for us. Our child loved ending the day in front of the little tv, rocking in the tiny rocking chairs and watching old Disney cartoons. Story time by the fireplace was a special retreat (as was the bar just down the hall for Mom and Dad).

This is the second time we visited this hotel while at Disney Parks. The first time, Aug 2014 was wonderful. We begged about it to our family and friends. This year we brought down my sister and niece with us. Upon arrival everything was pretty great until we got to our room. Outside our room was a pile of food that was spilled off a plate and stuck to the carpet, (took almost a full day to get it cleaned up) There was still residue on the floor even after it was picked up. There was a old half eaten piece of bread inside the drawer. We asked for it to be removed and to have an extra coffee cup and coffee because we had three adults who like to drink coffee. When my husband went downstairs the first time to speak to someone regarding the issues. They said they would get it fixed

Stayed here just one night while visiting the parks. We live local but have a young one and it was a bit day so we decided to get a room so we could rest when needed. We booked ahead of time by about 2 weeks and it was $615 per night!   Pros- large, well appointed room. Convenient to California adventure  Cons- price, check in (our room wasn't ready until almost 4pm which for us negated the whole reason we got the room in the first place- to hide in the heat during the hot parts of the day)  I would stay again but only if the price were lower that day. MUCH lower b

Summary Heading: Great location and overall nice hotel
Summary: I give this hotel a very good rating mainly because of it's location- you can't beat it if you are going to Disneyland.  Also, I do enjoy the lobby area and staying here over the Christmas holidays.  I do think that over the times I've stayed at this hotel, the staff during my most recent visit was not as friendly as in the past.  Front desk was great, the little cafe (at the end by the pool) was not up to par and the people I passed on the floors didn't smile or acknowledge us in the hallways- some of the staff looked quite unhappy in fact.  The hotel charges a lot because of it's location and the fact that it's a Disney property.  I do try to stay there though every time I'm in Disneyland because of it's incredible convenience to the park, and because my daughter loves it.

It's no four seasons, although you'll pay as much depending on time of year.  Rooms are ho hum, think clean basic small with. Proper dose of Disney theming.  Common areas are exceptional and best in all of Disneyland resort, as is the location.  It's awesome to walk out into California adventure park without the lengthy stroll you get from Disneyland hotel.  Pool is ok, Disneyland hotel is better.  Staff is terrific as is always the case with Disney.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel...but missing some of the magic
Summary: We recently stayed at this property for one week; we drove down from Los Angeles with family that were visiting from the East coast.  Our family members are Disney Vacation Club members so my impressions may be colored by the fact that we did not pay a nightly fee for the hotel (my family used their DVC points).   Here were the pros: - absolutely worth staying at the property for ease of access to the Disney parks.  We have a two year old and a four month old and I was SO thankful that the parks were so close by.  The backdoor entrance to CA Adventure Park is GREAT.   - pool area was overall nice although need to get there early to claim chairs. - service & housekeeping staff were friendly and very good.  I asked for help babyproofing the room and staff was very accommodating. -

This hotel is one of my absolute favorites. Great atmosphere great staff and exceptional location! Very useful when attending the parks because it has its own private entrance into the California adventure park!! No matter what the issue, disney staff happily fixes it and makes sure you never leave unhappy!! Best hotel Ive ever stayed at!

I stayed here with family for four nights, such a beautiful hotel with such friendly staff, the restaurants were brilliant, the pool facilities were brilliant and brilliant access to the park. Food offerings were enjoyable (particularly Napa Rose restaurant) and we shall return again!

Remember to try to get DVC (A.K.A Disney Vacation Club) because the DVC rooms are magnificent and you get everything your family wants in your room but you need to try to get room 3401 because it is so magnificent This is what each family wants... Easy access into the California Adventures Park among with a secret porch over by the monorail it also has easy access into Downtown Disney over by Anna and Elsa's boutique and Safora Makeup.

My girlfriend was nice enough to take me here for my birthday. She spent $750 for one night. We went to our room which was about a 5 minute walk from the elevator - opened the door and thought I was at a Howard johnsons. A dirty butter knife was on the floor and the downtown Disney view was of Hagen Daz. Room was dark snd sad. I immediately called downstairs and told them we were both tremendously underwhelmed. They switched out our room to a pool view which was much better and brighter. As far as food- if you eat healthy or are vegetarian or vegan- bring your own food- they will have nothing for you. Pool was ok and staff was nice - but for the money - not worth it. In my opinion

We recently stayed at the Grand Californian in Downtown Disney after visiting several times and dreaming of staying there. It was worth every penny. I have a family of 7 that includes 3 children under the age of 5. We loved the proximity of the park to the parks and the Disney Downtown district. The rooms at the Grand Californian are the closest of the 3 hotels located "in the park". You will have to pay for this convenience but if you have small children and can afford it, by all means go for it! Also, the pools alone are a fun activity if you want to spend a day away from the park.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay while visiting Disneyland!
Summary: My wife and I had been wanting to stay here ever since we took a trip to Disneyland in 2005.  We finally stayed here and it was awesome!  Beautiful accommodations!  It was great to have direct entrance to California Adventure. Downtown Disney was right there as well.  After all of the walking we did on this vacation, we loved the hotel's foot lotion!  It was so soothing after being on our feet all day in the parks!  The only thing that I did not like is that we did not have good phone service in the hotel, but that applied to the parks as well.  Maybe it was just our carriers?

Had an amazing celebration at The Storyteller's Cafe for Mom's 85th - complete with Meeko singing (dancing) along to "Happy Birthday" and a complimentary b-day cupcake!  Best birthday bash ever!  Lots of character visits: Chip, Dale, Bears; and can't beat the adorable mini Mickey waffles!

The hotel is beautiful.  Lots of attention to detail.  Lobby has small rocking chairs in front of a tv showing Disney cartoons. Signs with directions are posted by every door.  Rooms were good sized.  Beds were comfortable.  Every room comes with a fridge. A basket is provided for dirty laundry.  You can put the basket outside your door and in the morning the basket will be filled with clean linens.  When a member of our group lost her park pass, the front desk didn't know where to tell her to go to get a new one. They sent her to two different places until someone else helped her.  The WiFi did not work.  Our room was overlooking the Starbucks, so we tapped into their WiFi.

Our room was extremely clean. The view was amazing. I had a issue with my Disney park tickets they went out of there way to help me with them. Our plane didn't leave tell 8pm so they held our bags check us in for our flight and arranged our transportation to the airport. We just went to Disneyland and played and I didn't have to worry about anything. It's worth the extra money.

We have stayed at this hotel several times and every time I say you are really paying for location and to us it is worth it.  I do have say we were there Sun thru Thurs leading up to the Friday the actual 60th birthday of Disneyland.  The hotel was at capacity given that part of it was closed for renovation?  I just kept thinking how could they close almost one wing during probably the busiest week of the summer?   You could tell they were struggling to find available rooms and get rooms cleaned.  We arrived around 10 am and had to wait past 4pm to get our room.  We have arrived every other time and have gotten our room within a couple if hours.  No upgrades available.  Our room location was great as usual with the Monorail  running past our balcony.   The location is awesome

Summary Heading: Incredible mission decor, great service, the best of the Disneyland hotels.
Summary: We have visited the Grand Californian since it opened. From the moment you walk into the lobby you see this hotel is special, by far the best hotel at Disneyland and if it had a better pool it could be better than any WDW hotel. Great service, well kept and convenient. The Grand has it's own entrances into California Adventure and Downtown Disney, the Grand is the closest to Disneyland also. Great restaurants, Storytellers for families and Napa Rose for fine dining. The pool while not big is nice and a great retreat from the parks. Rooms have various views, our favorite was opening the balcony doors to Grizzly Peak. We have never had a bad experience with the Grand!

We have stayed at many of the neighboring hotels while visiting Disneyland and we have always been satisfied with our stay.  However, now that we have been "spoiled" we will always stay at the DGC.  The convenience of being able to go back to your room to get away from the crowds or just cool off at one of the many pools they have on the property is priceless!  Our kids enjoyed being able to go to downtown Disney to get away and shop.  Of course it's Disney so they take good care of you to make sure it's a memorable experience for your family.  The only complaint I have is their bell service.  They had a hard time coordinating my luggage and getting my car out of the valet.  Other than that we are looking forward to another stay at the Grand Californian!

Summary Heading: The Most Beautiful Thing In Anaheim
Summary: This hotel is modeled after the Ahwahnee in Yosemite, or at least I think it is.  It's beautifully detailed with Greene and Greene type design looks right down to the door hinges and handles. There is so much to explore both inside and out. The grounds are garden-like and it's adjacent to Downtown Disney if you want a completely different feel- which I doubt you will, since the ambiance here is the reason to go. Fine restaurants on the grounds also, both a family one, and a top tier chef gourmet one.  The rooms are elegant and provide you with a comfy robe to use. There is usually a grand piano "concert" going on in the lobby as well as the huge fire place with rockers  around it both inside and out on the patio.  This place simply must be seen if you go to Orange County.  For

The hotel staff were friendly, funny and always helpful when we had questions.  Rooms were beautiful, views are awesome, and loved the evening turn-down service.  Can't wait for our next stay.  If its your first time visiting, I would recommend letting the booking agent know as they will have special surprises for you and family members (like a signed picture of their favorite Disney character (:).  Great location in the middle of entry ways to Downtown Disney and California Adventure Park.  Oh and the pools are beautiful :)

Summary Heading: I don't want to stay anywhere else!
Summary: I've kept away from the Disney properties because of the cost, but believe me - it was WORTH IT!  The hotel is beautiful.  Beds were comfy.  Rooms were quiet and clean.  Room service was Fast!!  But what really sealed the deal for me was the convenience!  No driving and parking.  When it got too hot and crowded at the park, we left and came back to the hotel for a quick shower and a nice drink in the lounge.  Refreshed, back to the parks we went.  Our room had a view of the Disneyland fireworks, which we were able to watch twice from there (and once from the park).  All rooms have a pack-n-play in them, which was great for the grandbaby.  If you stay here, I highly recommend bringing your own stroller (rather than renting one at the park for $15/day).  It is just more convenient

Feels like a wilderness retreat. Great theming. The room was luxurious and roomy. The beds were very comfortable. Really liked the access to California adventure. Overall a nice stay. I recommend the quick serve restaurant located in the hotel for breakfast...quick and easy...then a few steps to the park.

Summary Heading: A great hotel but for the room service and front desk
Summary: We stayed in this hotel a year apart. First visit was in Jun 2014 and then again on Jun 2015. The hotel is beautiful. Housekeeping amazing. It has close proximity to downtown disney and the two theme parks. The lesser walk means a lot when you are coming back after a long day! The hotel provided a foot spa cream that was outstanding. We were park hopping for 3 days but were able to sustain thanks to the spa. The character breakfast at storyteller's cafe was nice. Kids loved it. Food was not bad either The pool with the slide is great fun for everyone.  There were movie nights and story telling that kids love and helped us to get some us time We didn't have time to try Pinocchio's workshop however, all the good feeling got marred by two incidents that happened while we were

Summary Heading: Attended an Institute class and stayed here.  Awesome!
Summary: The rooms are very clean and comfortable.  I am a very picky business traveler and this resort lived up to my highest expectations.   What did I like?  EVERYTHING!  -Room/desktop size for business electronics. -Decent balcony with interior view. -Room service menu. -Wicker basket in bathroom for wet towels. -Two telephone in room. -Nightly bedding turn down service with quality chocolates. -Well stocked and varied Disney-themed gift shop. -Expedited check-in with cast member assistance for the next available counter service. -Grand piano music in the lobby. -Movies in the lobby for children. -Storytelling in the lobby for children. -Very inviting grand atrium area (adjacent to lobby check in area) for seating clusters.  My Disney Institute class was awesome!  Fantastic

Summary Heading: Terrible time at The Grand California Hotel Disneyland
Summary: We had a terrible time at disney and didn't enjoy it at all. The beds were small. My 14 year old couldn't comfortably sleep, bed size was too small for him! We couldn't book through restaurant reservation for breakfast on which I think is un heard of, I was told guests book 60 days in advance.  The queue in the parks was 80-90 minutes long and fast passes were sold out by 11am. Having paid $900 for a two day park hopper Its unacceptable and a total disappointment. Even though it is Disneyland I wouldn't return to the hotel nor the park.

Summary Heading: Kids will enjoy Disneyland Hotel more!
Summary: While this is a nice hotel, it isn't worth the money. You aren't going to feel like you are at the Ritz, and your kids will wish they were in the pool at the Disneyland Hotel! Convenience and kids' club are nice...but not enough to outweigh the $ and lack of kid friendly atmosphere found at other surrounding hotels.

We are Disneyland annual pass members so we frequent this hotel often. The convenience factor alone is well worth the money. The ease of being able to enter the park is a huge perk. With a family of five carrying extra sweatshirts for the cooler evenings can be avoided with a quick run to the room. ( not to mention all the other things you accumulate throughout the day ;)  The rooms are cozy and spacious. The beds are great. There's nothing better then coming back after a long day at the parks and ordering room service and applying the complimentary foot relief cream.  It's a pricey stay but in my opinion well worth it.

Summary Heading: Way to spend the weekend at Disneyland
Summary: Did a little R and R weekend here. The hotel is very busy, and pools are very busy not enough chairs in my opinion. But we visited the spa which was a treat very nice and a great massage and facilities. Rooms were nice and beds very comfy.

Summary Heading: Beautiful but really not worth the price of the room
Summary: I have stayed at all 3 Disney properties in Anaheim & am a big Disneyland proponent. I go at least twice a year & am a native Southern Californian. However, although the lobby is beautiful, the room wasn't really worth the price. It was small & the bathroom was no big deal. The standard rooms at all 3 hotels seem about the same to me. I also thought the pool at the Disneyland Hotel was far more fun for kids than the Grand Californian. The grounds are nice & the staff is always amazing, but I say, save a little money & stay at the Disneyland Hotel or Paradise Pier instead.

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay to experience Disneyland
Summary: The Grand Californian had nice rooms with comfortable beds and flat screen TV (a regular size room with two queen beds, not paricularly large or small).  We had a lovely pool view and balcony.  As a Disney guest, early entry at 7am to the parks was provided and an absolute must with the Summer crowds! The hotel guest only entrance into California Adventure was very useful.  Plus quick walk to Downton Disney area. The two restuarants, Storyteller's Cafe and Napa Rose were great.  Napa Rose was unbelievably amazing food!  It is expensive but worth it!  Great soup, steak, wine!!!  Storyteller's Cafe had a delicious dinner buffet and a very fun character buffet breakfast.  The "Critters" were lots of fun.

Summary Heading: Magical experience in an average hotel
Summary: It's okay, it's well placed for getting to the Disney parks (residents only access point from hotel straight into the Adventure park)   The staff and service are well managed   But the hotel is just a very large basic hotel - with a grand lobby - which is fine in reality as you spend your time in the park or hotel pools

The hotel feels like home with a touch of Disney. The cast members were extremely helpful and friendly for our first visit to Disneyland. The location is perfect and the walk to downtown Disney and to the 2 theme parks was easy to get to (under 5 minutes) There is an entrance to Disney's California by the pool but make sure to have your room key available. Whitewater snacks had an affordable and tasty breakfast with plenty of room to sit in and relax. There were plenty of pools and hot tubs suitable for all guests. The rooms were just the right size and the balcony was cozy. If you do not want to stay in the park to watch World of Color, this hotel has a viewing deck on the 6th floor with a clear view of the water show

We traveled to Disneyland in April with a group of 6 people.  Since my inlaws are DVC members, we stayed in the Vacation Club's villas.  It was AMAZING!  We are from New England and usually visit Disney in Florida and stay at the timeshares there.  This was so much bigger than the units at the Boardwalk and Wilderness Lodge in Florida.  It was a two bedroom unit that had two separate entrances.  The rooms were so big!  On one side was a bedroom with two queens, bathroom and kitchenette.  The other side had a separate bedroom with a king sized bed, living room with trundle bed and pull out sofa,a full kitchen, and two additional bathrooms.  Three bathrooms for a group of six was crazy!  The place was bigger than our first apartment.  Oh, and DVC members have access to a rooftop

Great location and overall hard to argue that staying here is ultra convenient.   The hotel is nice, but in no way Grand or 4 star. The rooms were poor and very tired, bathroom was pretty awful but functional. We both looked forward to a decent shower in the next place !  Disney do need to look in the mirror and ask if this hotel lives up to the Disney ethos or image - the rooms are 3 star motel standard. 'Making a wish' will not do it Disney !  HOWEVER- good things , access of course is first rate straight out of the hotel into the park.   Food - good in parts, suggest you avoid the buffet areas and pay nearly the same price for the very nice al a carte restaurant - food was very very good and some excellent chefs in there turning out great food.  We did not breakfast in the

Exceptionally appointed the grand Californian stands up to its name. Spacious rooms with separate sink to bathroom, the hotel is excellently positioned to both Disneyland and Californian Disney (with direct access to the park). The pool is beautiful including a great slide for the kids. Room for improvement ? The storytellers buffet is certainly not worth the price tag ! Very sub par indeed in terms of selection (quality was reasonably ok). Bath was particularly small but fine for a child. The only other room for improvement was the lack of Disney in the rooms..if you didn't know it was a Disney hotel you certainly wouldn't know ! I know it sounds like we weren't impressed but we were and would very much recommend the experience

Summary Heading: Craftsman Style & Magic Feels Like Home
Summary: Disney's 60th anniversary celebration is a must see and experience.  We booked our reservations over a year ago in order to lock in the best rate through the Disney Travel Company.  What I love about booking through the Travel Company is you can make your deposit and pay on it monthly until all is paid in full before arrival.  So glad we did, because the rooms can be quite spend per night, but after you have walked and walked in the park, it is a welcomed escape back to your room for a cool down at the pool, before returning for the night time spectacular celebrations.  Our room bad two queen beds, with the soft sheets and pillows to lull you into dreams.  The balcony had a mini table and two chairs, perfect of that morning coffee to get you started for the day.   There are dual

In numerous trips before to the parks I'd daydreamed about staying here.  This trip I decided the price was going to be worth the access to the hotel in late-July to beat the heat and rest mid-day.  I went all out and stayed at the club level on the 6th floor.  The 3 day, 3 night stay was with my daughter and two grands, a 12 yr old boy and 10 yr old girl.  The experience was worth every penny spent! The clubhouse was comforting & inviting.  With hours to open early to fuel up and grab a coffee for Magic Morning entry and late until 10 pm for a sweet dessert after fireworks.  No waiting in line to eat at a park and the service and fresh items offered were so welcome. The weather turned particularly humid & it was easy to enter the hotel for a trip to the pool area and/or a short

This was a bucket list stay for me.  I have looked at this hotel for years and longed to stay here.  We booked 4 nights over the 60th Anniversary weekend and I was not disappointed!  The hotel was beautiful, staff - oops - cast members were very nice and helpful, rooms were very clean, and the view of the park was perfect.  I think there are many nice options for hotels in Anaheim, the closeness to the parks and the beautiful lobby and rooms made this stay just magical.  The room was very expensive, but, the rest of the things at the hotel were regular priced.  The pool area was beautiful and the water slide is fun.

We have stayed at several Disney properties at the "Deluxe Level" and this hotel simply shows the more you pay the better your stay. This hotel has it all, quick front desk, speedy bell services, great restaurants, good pools and clean and quite rooms. If you want the full California Disney experience this hotel is your best option. Disneyland Hotel is great, but DGCH submerges you into all things Disney. I highly recommend to all lovers of Disney a stay at this hotel. It will even give the veteran WDW guest a taste of California Disney Magic!!!

We have been to Disneyland at least a dozen times and have stayed at the Grand Californian the past 2 visits.  The location of this hotel makes a world of difference in how you spend your day!  I know it's expensive...and we are not rich....but if you want a great experience, save up your money and do it.  You don't need to upgrade to any kind of a room with a view... you really don't spend a lot of time in your room.  We just got the basic room and both times the view was of the Disneyland Hotel and Paradise Pier.  Basically overlooking the front of the hotel where the cars pull in to check in.  It was fine.  The first time we stayed, we had room 6239 and just around the corner was the observation deck that looks directly into the park!  It was great to just stand there and

Summary Heading: Great Stay at Disney Grand Californian
Summary: Outstanding location.  First classic every way.  You spend a little money but you get your money's worth.  Fun for grandkids.  We had 9 ages 2-11 and the different swimming pools were a big favorite after early morning trips to the theme parks.

We loved staying at this Disneyland onsite hotel...you're literally right next to the park! It was very convenient staying here, as you could easily return to the room to rest. It was great to be immersed in "Disney magic" the entire time we were here. Beautiful hotel...we all really enjoyed it!

Our family of 5 stayed here for 5 nights and we were thrilled with the room size!! Usually we feel crammed into a hotel room unless it is a suite, but our room had a queen bed and twin bunk beds with a trundle. All 5 of us were able to sleep comfortably and have room to move around the room. I wish more hotels had this option!! We stay in 15-20 hotels a year and this was one of our favorite rooms! The resort was very conveniently located. The staff was friendly and hotel was clean. We were very pleased with our stay!

We had 13 people in our family staying here for 3 nights. EVERYONE we encountered were friendly, fun, personable and awesome. The look of the hotel itself is GORGEOUS. The hotel has a ton to offer besides access to Disneyland and California Adventures. Right next to Downtown Disney, that was handy. The pool was very fun. rooms had plenty of beds and was clean and comfortable. The maid went above and beyond her "duty" and cried when my dad tipped her. My room faced California Adventures, which can be loud. But the door was dang near sound proof! I will definitely stay here again!!

Summary Heading: Fully immersed at the Grand Californian!
Summary: This past march we had an awesome stay at the Grand Californian! With over 20 trips to disney WORLD under our belt, we had high expectations for Disneyland and it's hotels. We chose Grand Californian for it's proximity to both parks, and were so happy with our decision. We loved feeling fully immersed in Disney. . . we stayed 4 days, never left, never saw a car or bus, and just walked everywhere from our hotel, to each park, and it was awesome. Our room had an amazing view of California Adventure, and our kids loved watching Goofy's flight coaster from our room.  My only con for this hotel (and I thought this was very un-disney) was the bell-services staff who all made it very clear that we should tip each and everyone of them that touches our bags. I thought that tipping was

We chose this hotel based on convenience and location to the park as well as how great the rooms looked online.  We stayed on property in Disney World and had a spectacular experience and expected the same in Disneyland.  This was not the case in the least.  The staff we encountered were uninformed,and not interested in our inquiries.  The room - Woods view with the bunkbeds - were tiny - considering we are a family of 3 kids and 2 adults, we travel with alot of stuff and for the cost of the room, one would expect a bit more breathing room. As for cleanilness...on the surface it looked ok - but then I put on a complimentary robe which was hanging neatly tied up in the closet and was thoroughly disgusted..in the pocket was a crushed kleenex and a used Q-Tip..seriously..as if they

My husband and I were able to snag a room within hours of check in. We continued to call reservations and we got lucky that someone cancelled and we got it. We were already planning on going to the park and hoping we could be able to get a room and we did. We were in a double bed room, right next to the monorail. But we didn't care. We were in the park most of the evening. We also purchased the World of Color finner package which was well worth it! Wow!! So only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was the bathroom. Everything else was beautiful. But the bathrooms were too dated. The lighting was old woth a green fluorescent hue to it. And the showers were too industrial looking with the handicap railing and were too tight in general. But maybe it was just our room... The bed

We've stayed at the Grand Californian and across the street from Disney at popular hotels/motels.  With 4 small children, we keep coming back to the Grand Californian for its location, comfortable, vacation-like atmosphere and Disney charm. You pay for the convenience and the experience but it's worth it.  When you/the kids hit a breaking point at naptime and bedtime this is a quick stroller ride back from the parks and a relaxing atmosphere to return to with the breathtaking lobby & resort-like pools. It is also nice to have a character breakfast on-site, a private entrance into California Adventure, and the ability to push your stroller right out the door into downtown Disney when fussy kids need a diversion.  Rooms are small but charming.

We visited for a weekend and had a nice stay. This is a fairly standard four-star hotel, by my standards. The rooms are typical size, quality and amenities for a U.S. hotel in this price range. Prices vary greatly depending on demand, of course. Service was "Disney normal" which is to say competent and friendly though a bit mass produced.   The best part of this hotel is its location. You are paying to stay here to maximize your value at the theme parks, though I also enjoy the aesthetic design. The lobby area is wonderful.   My one serious issue was the bed. It was saggy and seemed to amplify the motion of occupants, ensuring one restless sleeper would undermine the peaceful slumber of the other. A good night of sleep is not possible in these conditions.

The Grand Californian is Disney's flagship resort at the Anaheim parks. It is absolutely beautiful, built in the arts and crafts architectural style. Its location inside California Adventure park really cannot be beat, and you are just steps away from Downtown Disney as well.  Pros: --Location. Just can't be beat. Closer even than some of the motels on Harbor. --Ambiance and theming. It's just amazing. --Staying on Disney property gives you early access to one of the two parks each day of your stay, before they open to the public. Staying on property is the only way to get into California Adventure early. --Top-notch Disney service. --Pool is nice, though nothing spectacular. --Storytellers Cafe was a lot of fun. --Being able to run back up to the room to change after getting

We arrived early on a Saturday morning after flying all night. Although we could not get into our room right away, the staff was very helpful in storing our luggage and getting us room keys for pool access.  The entire staff was always friendly and professional during our stay. The housekeepers did a wonderful job every day and did a turn down service every evening.  The pool areas were always clean and the pool staff was great.  The restaurants, Napa Rose, Storytellers Cafe, and Whitewater Snacks were excellent and the service was outstanding.  This was our second stay at the Grand California and it will not be the last.

Summary Heading: WE HAVE STAYED IN MANY TYPES OVER THE YEARS
Summary: I have read many reviews about the Grand and do not understand some of them, maybe I am blind or too old to notice. I have stayed at many fancy places all over the world like Mandarin Oriental in DC on the bay and others that are $2000 plus a night and I just do not understand. We have stayed in DVC villas, DTD view, park view, Brisa Court View and last September in a standard view room. Are rooms have always been clean, standard wear and tear for an upper class rooms, very close to the parks, DVC entrance into the park for convenience, fast and on time room service with very good food, restaurants were always very good. We will be going there again this Sept for the Dapper Days celebration for a week and enjoying what the parks and the hotel has to offer. If you can afford to

We stayed in a Courtyard View room during a busy (summer holiday) week.  Pros: luxurious & beautiful decor, great Disney service, very convenient entrance to Disney California Adventure, Courtyard rooms are close to elevator (less walking), Courtyard rooms are well away from outside noise (pool & theme park), pools are great (esp. water slide for kids), Storytellers Cafe is very good  Cons: Courtyard rooms are close to lobby (noisy from indoors in the evening), wifi is poor, hotel gets very busy which can lead to rather slow service  Overall: you are paying a very high price, but will have the best experience for a Disneyland visit - recommended!

Ok, you only stay here if you want the closest hotel to the two parks, location is the only thing this hotel has going for it. I spent less money per night staying at the Ritz Carlton (ocean view room) at Laguna Beach then I paid here (for a basic room), and wow, what a difference!! Stayed in a room with a queen bed and bunk beds, which was great, since our two girls (12 and 14) didn't fight!  Wi-Fi was poor, cut out, and very slow when it did work. The room was dated, but overall it was good (I had low expectations based on the previous reviews, which are accurate). It was in the high 80's and they had at least one of the pools closed every day of our stay. So if you wanted to go to the pool you  didn't know if you'd be able to find a chair (we had to share one lounger for 4 of

The Disney Grand Californian provides one of the finest and most enjoyable hotel experiences available.  The rooms are beautiful, the California Craftsman theme of the hotel is carried throughout, and all of the materials used to construct this masterpiece are authentic timber, river rock, marble, and other highest quality materials.  The staff is top class, the friendliness and customer service is unbeatable (it's Disney, after all), and the views from the rooms are thrilling.

Summary Heading: Grand Stay at the Grand Californian!
Summary: With a "Deluxe Partial View" 5th floor room, we were positioned to look right over Downtown Disney from our balcony. What a surprise to find that this was also the perfect location to watch our own personal viewing of the park's fireworks after walking back from the World of Color show. Location was absolutely perfect to easily access Downtown Disney and California Adventure, the two places we had planned to visit during this short 2 night stay. The walk is farther for those who want to get to Disneyland. There are 3 different pools to choose from, none that had zero-depth entry. Our 4 year olds enjoyed the small waterslide and used the hotel-provided life jackets to make up for the fact they could not touch the bottoms of the pools with their feet. Ate at the Storytellers

Summary Heading: Terrific location, great lobby, painfully uncomfortable beds, crowded pool
Summary: We stayed here for three nights on a Disneyland trip, and did so for the location. We were not disappointed in that respect: it is the single best place to stay for visiting both Disneyland and California Adventure. You can walk directly into CA park and Disneyland is a very short pleasant walk away even in full summer heat.   The hotel lobby is spectacular and welcoming service is also great: even arriving at the peak check-in time we were still quickly and efficiently sorted out, and the cartoon watching area in the lobby kept our four year old very happy while I dealt with check-in. The clerk was also very helpful getting us tickets for which I'd gotten a prepaid voucher and had forgotten to print out the confirmation.   Room service is limited but reasonable. The citrus

Our mini family vacation was great, the hotel was not.  The staff was not overly friendly, or helpful. We booked and paid for our trip (two night stay) with AAA. It took over 40 minutes to get checked in, this was 40 minutes at the counter, not waiting in line.  They did not have the rooms we had booked, fine we are not that picky and took what they said they had available, even after making the reservations months before. I forgot to mention a supervisor was helping get us checked in and it still took 40 minutes. Never a sorry or thank you for your cooperation and patience for it taking so long, nothing. The rooms are basic, nothing special. Our A/C did not work properly, even after it was reported and told it was fixed. Turn down service was not what we were told it would be,

Expensive even at the reduced rates for convention. Nice ambience. Great pools. Good self service laundry. Good options ... Storytellers cafe was nice but the cafe snack place was awful... Good quality was poor and expensive!!! Main benefit is park entrance and proximity to Disney

Where do I begin. We booked through the Walt Disney Travel Company. Our agent, Roberta, was phenomenal and very excited for us, since it was our first time staying. Which made us very excited. We booked a Premium View Club Level room. The check in clerk, Maggie, was absolutely great. She was very friendly and went the extra mile to assist us. Then came Club Level. The Club Level was very formal and stunning. The breakfast included bagels, toast, hard boiled eggs, pastries, cereal, juice, and milk. For lunch we indulged in bite size sandwiches and chips. For dinner there was cordon Bleu, vegetable spring rolls, and vegetables. The only downside was parents would let their kids be by themselves and it got very noisy. Then came the accommodations. The room was absolutely small. The

Stayed 2 days here with my husband and kids (ages 10 & 14). We are annual passholders and have been for the last 11 years. We had never stayed here before because we've always thought it was too expensive. This year due to our heavy work schedules were can't take a vacation so decided take a stay-cation. Wow! I'm so glad we chose to stay here! There are so many benefits to stay here which I'm sure have already been detailed. We made the most of our stay and hardly visited the park (because we go often anyway). We did however, take advantage of the magic hour at California adventure. Sadly, Radiator Springs was taking long to get started (they were having test runs) and California screaming wouldn't open until the regular operating time. But we rode Tower of Terror twice (no

My wife and I have not been on a vacation since 2003 and we wanted to take a short trip for our anniversary so we decided on a trip to the Disneyland resort. I wanted us to stay at the best hotel within the resort so I did some research and found that The Grand Californian was the best place to stay. We decided to book through our local AAA Travel and they helped us book the hotel as well as purchase the tickets for the two parks ahead of time, we requested a good but quiet view and they took care of that as well. We payed in advance so that was one less worry for us when we got there. You get extra goodies for booking thru AAA, including a free picture, free lanyard and pin (collectors seem to want our lanyard and pin), getting in the park an hour before everyone else, and a

I have stayed at several Disney World hotels over the last 20 or so times we have been there. This was our 1st trip to Disneyland. We decided since a short trip we would splurge on the GC hotel.  I booked a "Standard room" but I am sure I got upgraded since our room looked out over Downtown Disney. Incredible view of the fireworks every night right outside our room. Location made every penny worth it for this hotel. Before you would get to the equivalent of a parking lot in other hotels- you are literally at either Disneyland or California Adventure park.  **Warning so this does not happen to you- Unlike Disney World, Disneyland does not have Magic Bands and the tickets they send you, are literally your park admission. I did not think this through and left the physical tickets

We stayed at the Grand Californian with a group of 43 families and found the service and accommodations excellent.  The staff were extremely helpful and friendly, always greeting us and our children wherever we came upon them.    The pools were a great way to cool off, and we appreciated the number of lifeguards on hand poolside.  There was also pool side food and beverages available making an afternoon of relaxing even easier.    The location allowed us early entry into Disneyland and California Adventure parks and being just steps away made our days easier travelling with young children.  There is no doubt we would stay again, and look forward to our next visit.

The location is great- very convenient to the parks. Check in is always good, and the lobby is rather impressive. The rooms are not huge- but you are paying for location- not size. Surprisingly, the quick food place by the pool has some great deals on breakfast- two people could eat one breakfast. We cannot wait to go back in 2016- my daughter loves this hotel.

Summary Heading: Staying on Disney property makes the trip!
Summary: We are DVC (Disney Vacation Club) members and this is our home resort, so I am a little biased. However, we bought the DVC membership because we love Disney and believe in the product that they can provide in vacations. We won't EVER go to Disneyland or Disneyworld without staying on property. I know having the DVC makes that easy, but we always stayed on property before we had DVC too. Being on Disney property for your hotel stay, just extends the magic to a 24/7 experience.   Our trip here was wonderful. We checked in very early in the morning so obviously our room wasn't ready. We went into the park for the morning and the front desk was able to text me when our room was ready. The text even said which room number was ours and we already had our keys, so we just went straight

No internet service for 2 days. Room carpet was wet and smells moldy. They blamed it on my invisible service dog. Hmm, I know this is magical, but my dog is with grandpa. Expensive rooms bad service and full of lies. Second manager magically found a similar room, different floor, but too far away from entrance which is not what i had before.  What upset me up the most os that they lied about a dog that does not exist, and lied about not having other rooms.

Summary Heading: POSSIBLE MOLD AND FILTHY TOILETS CAKED WITH OTHER PEOPLES URINE AND HAIR, was treated terrible after discovery.
Summary: Please look at photos. Possible mold in room . We went to Disneyland for my sons 9th birthday. From July 10 to July 14, 2015 Paid $776.88 plus $25 per night for 4 nights, for hotel only, does not include park tickets. First room had tons of what looks like mold in the bathroom, vanity area, shower, and even the entry into the room. On the 3rd night they switched our room for the last night there. Second room toilet was caked with other peoples urine build up, hair on sides and bottom of toilet. Someone elses urine dried in a steak mark down side of toilet (see pictures)  Upon checkout they presented me with a bill for the full amount of the rooms even though I showed them photos days before and complained. When I went to check out , I asked for a manager, they only supplied a

After staying here and the Grand Floridian in Walt Disney World , i would have to say that this one has the edge. Amazing staff, great hotel and made us feel very special. The most amazing thing is that you can fall out of your room and be in the park

Summary Heading: Better than expected, but not outstanding
Summary: My family (2 adults + 3 children, ages 1-12) stayed last week for five nights. We booked a standard view room but were upgraded and given a "fallsview' room, which ended up being on level 3 with a view of the hotel entrance to California Adventure, with trees and a hint of the Grizzly River Run ride. The room had a double bed plus bunk beds.  The location of the hotel was great. From our room it was a 5-7 minute walk to the front gates of Disneyland, but only 2 minutes to California Adventure.  The walk through Downtown Disney to the main gates felt easy, with shops along the way.  The public areas of the hotel are all very clean and in good order. I wouldn't rave about the beauty of the lobby in the way others do, but it was fine (and maybe I just don't understand why Disney

Summary Heading: Great service but lacking on some of the small stuff
Summary: The lobby is amazing when you walk in! The staff at check is very friendly and spends time explaining the hotel, early hours etc. Normally our family of five has a hard time sleeping, it was nice getting a room made for five! The beds were nice and they supplied lots of towels.  The pool really is not big enough for the number of guests and not anything special.  Finding a seat at the pool is a real challenge,there is not enough seating. I would suggest bringing your  own coffee or getting starbucks.  The in room coffee was terrible as was the coffee at the banquet breakfast. The free hotel WIFI is very slow. They have a laundry room where you can wash your own.  This was very handy and free while we were there. The best part of our stay was the special entrance to California

Summary Heading: Average hotel but best location for Disney
Summary: An average hotel by itself with nothing really stands out. The rooms perhaps also need some updating here and there. However, it is the most convenient hotel for visitng Disney. Can watch the fireworks from the balcony if you choose thr right room. You also get to see some Disney charactors moving around.

We stayed here for my daughters Dance the Magic performances at Disney which means we had very special rates.  It was a great Hotel your paying for Convenience mostly.  I would NOT stay here if I had to pay the regular price of $600.00 a night that's just crazy.  Overall service and staff very friendly and great.  Walking into Downtown Disney and CA Adventures was the greatest out the Hotel doors and your there.  Also the pools were nice I have seen better nothing compared to Florida Resorts but it is nice PRICEY but nice .  OOOO Almost forgot went to change card to where things should be charged to and front desk showed me long distance charges almost 70 dollars worth.  I boys being boys decided to start prank calling while I was not in the room.  The Hotel was nice enough to

My family and I have always dreamed of staying here, but we were always with big groups who were only interested in cheaper hotels for the amount of time you actually spend in the room.  So this time around we finally got to stay there, checking it off our bucket list.  Overall it was a very good hotel, the staff is all very accommodating and there is always someone around to help you.  The rooms were very clean, but on the smaller side.  We stayed in a room with two doubles and a single and felt it just wasn't big enough for something that is supposed to sleep five comfortably.  It would have been nice to have a little more open area to put suitcases and what not.  The room itself was also a little outdated and could use some upgrading.  Our room overlooked downtown disney

This hotel was absolutely gorgeous! The location is outstanding and cannot be beat. You are right in the center of it all. We stayed here for 5 nights and never wanted to leave. The beds were the most comfortable that I have had. The lobby was spectacular. The one slight issue that I had during the stay was that the wifi was not very good. Our room was located on the outer rim of the hotel and I was rarely able to have a wifi connection. The lobby was the only place I was able to connect. Other than that, this resort was fabulous. I would absolutely stay here again. The location is definitely worth the money.

We stay at this hotel always. We are Disney Vacation Club members and stay in the wing that houses the DVC villas. We have a one bedroom, 2 bath unit unit with full kitchen.  We have noticed a bit of wear on furniture over the years but for the most part it is in as good of condition as when we bought our membership.  We like the location and also the pool area especially.

Summary Heading: Do not hesitate to pay the extra $$$$
Summary: We visited in early April during Spring Break and wouldn't stay anywhere else while visiting Disneyland.  This was a splurge to say the least as we've never spent this much on a hotel, but we're glad we did.  We arrived at 8:00 AM, and were allowed to check in and, much to our surprise, our room was ready, so we were able to change and head to California Adventure Park right away.  We've stayed at WDW Animal Kingdom Lodge and Wilderness Lodge several times, and the GC was a mix of the two.    The room was spacious enough, although not huge.  We had a balcony overlooking the pool.  Beds were comfortable.   There are 2 pools, only one of which was open when we visited.  As always, pool chairs are hard to come by when arriving early afternoon - probably the only downside to our

Awesome place. Beautiful views, so convenient with its own entrance to disneys California adventure and to downtown Disney. Stayed 3 nights end of April 2015. Free upgrade to pool view room. Nightly turn down service. All Disney cast members were friendly and helpful. Well worth the money for convience and atmosphere!

Summary Heading: 21st Birthday Celebration for Daughter--Worth Every Penny
Summary: Ok---If you are a family looking for a budget hotel then this is not it.  But‚Ä¶.if it's a special occasion or you can afford luxury then... definitely stay here or at the Disneyland Hotel. It's worth every penny! From the moment you step up to the valet parking until you check out of your hotel room you are treated like royalty. You just can't beat the care and level of service Disney provides their guests. I loved the nightly turn-down service and chocolates on my pillow. Also we were able to wash our clothes for free in the big beautiful laundry room.The BIGGEST plus for me was the location.  I can't tell you how wonderful it is to wake up in Disneyland and California Adventure and have the monorail right outside our door. At the end of a long day at the park when everyone is

Summary Heading: We wouldn't stay anywhere else if visiting Disneyland.
Summary: This is a big, busy hotel but they are well organised to cater for lots of guests. We arrived early (around 10am) and were given clear directions of how to check in etc. Check in was efficient and our rooms were ready early which was a bonus. The hotel lobby is huge with and busy at certain times of the day with the many guests arriving and departing. The hotel has lots of exposed timber and has a really grand feel to it like a big country lodge. Our room was on the 4th floor, 2 double beds, TV, bathroom - everything we needed was there. Whilst the hotel is a bit older, it is well maintained and not showing signs of being run down or poorly maintained. The hotel has direct access into California Adventureland and Downtown Disney and a short walk to Disneyland. Location is

Summary Heading: The Only Place to Stay at DL
Summary: Okay, so every body tells you before you travel to DL that any hotel is good and staying close is no big deal. The someone tells you about the Grand Californian and you start to question your original beliefs.  So what do you do? Firstly look at your budget as well as the experience of staying "IN Disneyland" and not at some 70s hotel Km away. Secondly how important is time and the flexibility of coming an going during the day - especially if you have flown in from some OS location.  But you're still not sure, so read more reviews and make up your own mind.  For us however this was a great decision.  We loved the fact that  1. we were inside the Californian Adventure park (Disney's newest and best them park). 2. we gained early access to Dl before the crowds. 3. we could return

My company has out annual party here. The parties are always nice and I do recommend it for events. The food has been consistently good.  I have never stayed here but had friends stay here and they seem to have liked it.

Stayed 2 nights with the family for Halloween. Couldn't get an early check-in. Hotel is beautiful, and the convenient access to Downtown Disney and the theme parks is unparalleled. Room was basic, balcony overlooked hotel entrance and valet. Hotel provided a pack n play for our infant. Critter Character Breakfast at the hotel's Storytellers Cafe was decent, we still had about a 20min wait even though I had made the reservation 60 days in advance. Private theme park entrance was nice. Based on stays at the other hotels on property, this hotel is overpriced. I expected more from Disney's  luxury flagship hotel, especially front desk staff (could have been more friendly). Would stay again for the simple fact that we love Disney and for the location, but for cost and experience I

We love this hotel! We stay here everytime we go to Disneyland. It is so nice to enter/exit the park from the hotel lobby. We have small children and it made it convenient to make a quick trip back up to the room and rest, nap, eat, etc. We have stayed over Christmas and the tree, decorations, piano and carolers in the lobby are truly amazing.  It really made it a wonderful experience.   The hotel is clean, and beautiful designed.  Our Kids love the Bunkbeds and the chocolates that are delivered each night.  The staff is very helpful and housekeeping is top notch!  The pool and waterslides offer a nice break from the park.

Summary Heading: Stunning Architecture with great access to the Disneyland Parks
Summary: Certainly cannot beat the location or comment on how wonderful the staff are at this hotel.  I would have rather rated this hotel a 5 star but it came up short in a few areas.  First off the internet was not very good.  I was continually kicked off which always drives me a little crazy.  This is my second stay at this hotel in the last 6 months and I had the same issue.  I could use my own cell data but why when I am paying over $450 night right?  Also the interior of the guest rooms is definitely showing wear and tear.  The beds are so/so.  Linens are nice but I think my mattress was definitely in need of replacement!    If you are sensitive to noise I would not recommend rooms over the park because there is a lot of screaming from the rides.  This wasn't bothersome to me but I

Summary Heading: If staying in Disney great place to stay, forget the pool though
Summary: First you are in Disney so I am comparing this to a Disney resort hotel.  Rooms very clean and comfortable.  We were impressed on how they  were able to creat a high level of customer service in a very busy hotel.  We had a premier room facing downtown Disney, there really was not anything special about that view.  I'm not sure what non premier room views would be but I didn't find ours very impressive.  A double queen room also has a pull out bed in it so easy room for our family of four.  The early admission into the parks is worth it!  Plan right and you can get a lot in an hour.  The cars ride in Disney California can be a tough wait and fast passes sell out fast so if that's a ride you want to experience do it first.  We found the parks didn't get busy until an hour after

Summary Heading: Nice but needs upgraded rooms and more perks for price!
Summary: Stayed four nights at a park view room. The room is very outdated. Not dirty but outdated. The rooms are comparable to a 150 night hotel anywhere else. So you pay for the location. It's super convenient to have access to California adventure park. TiP: for Early hours at the park it's way better to go to main entrance. The line is ridiculous at the hotel at 7am. It'll take you half hour to get in. We got in in 5 minutes through main entrance. Did Cars ride four times in half hour. Ok so the check in was disappointing. They gave us a room. Got there. Room was not ready. Not even close to ready according to housekeeping staff. Had to drag my family down again and get a new room. This is not a 5 star service. The pools are nice. But not enough lounges. So many folks hv to wait for

Summary Heading: Certain rooms have a view of the fireworks - get into the park an hour early
Summary: We were in room 3343 facing California Adventure, and could see the fireworks really well off of our balcony.  We heard that there are very few rooms that offer a view of the fireworks so they don't advertise this.  This is a fabulous location within literally minutes of the Magic Kingdom entrances and steps of California Adventure.    By staying on property, you're able to enter the park one hour early (varies which park on which day - we had Magic Kingdom on Saturday and could have done California Adventure early on Sunday).  By getting into the park an hour early, we were able to beat the bigger crowds.  We literally walked right onto Pirates of the Carribean, It's a Small World, Buzz's Blaster, the Haunted Mansion, and only had a small wait at others.  Space Mountain wasn't

We came with our 22mo old. It was the perfect location to return to for nap time and to touch base when needed.  We didn't have enough time to take advantage of the pool or character dining but will come back to do so! The staff was very friendly and even upgraded our room at check-in! We will definitely be coming back.

Summary Heading: Motel feeling at luxury resort prices
Summary: You are definitely paying for location  at this hotel. And you certainly can't beat being at the heart of Downtown Disney.   However for close to $400 a night I would have expected a king sized bed, not two double beds with motel 6 style quilts on them and a plain basic cheap motel feel to the room.  We were put in a wheelchair accessible room which made it feel even more basic   The Wifi was poor throughout the hotel and I was trying to Get some work done whole I was waiting for my husband to Come back from his meetings. I ended up going to Starbucks in downtown Disney as it worked there.   So it really depends on your priority. If you want to be that close to Disney. It's great.  But if you want a nice hotel or have any business to do for the $$ it's not really up to par.   I

Summary Heading: DVC members at The Villas @ Disney's Grand Californian Hotel and Spa
Summary: When I saw a 2 bedroom villa availability at The Villas @ Disney's Grand Californian Hotel and Spa during the Father's day weekend, I instantly made the reservation since we've been wanting to stay at that hotel. As DVC members, we used our points so it was ok but if I have to pay 1200$-1500$ per night, I would have to think very hard if I would do it again.  We have stayed at the Grand Floridian and Bay Lake Tower in Disney World last year and I can't help but compare. The Grand Californian Hotel and Spa did not have an online check in system, no children's activity center where kids can do arts and crafts or play games and stuff and did not have many scheduled activities for the kids. The location is great because you are right next to the park so that was convenient. Downtown

Upon entering the hotel late in the evening, it felt very Beauty and The Beast like. It was a great way to start a trip to Disney. Overall the staff was extremely friendly. When I asked about postage stamps at the concierge, they offered me free postcards and delivery of my postcards. All the staffs are really well informed about everything going on at Disney. On the 6th floor at the Paradise View Terrace, which you can gain access to with your hotel room key.....you can get a great view of Disneyland and a relatively good show of Disneyland's World of Color show at specific times. (Just ask someone that works at the hotel)  At the business centre, they offer complimentary check ins and print outs of your boarding passes.   Overall, I enjoyed my stay there ...only thing I could

We visited this hotel for four days during early June. Our room overlooked Downtown Disney. We found the room to be lovely and the beds very comfortable. Some of the reviews had said the hotel was rundown, but I have no idea of where those people had stayed. It definitely was not at the Grand Californian!The staff was friendly and we felt pampered. The foyer of the hotel was absolutely gorgeous. It is definitely not the cheapest place to stay at Disneyland, but the convenience to both Disneyland and California Adventure makes it extra special. It was so nice to be able to easily go back to the room during the day. We really liked that there was a double sink area available outside the toilet/ shower area so that you could get ready if someone was in the shower. Our only

We LOVED our stay at this hotel!  The room was beautiful!  We forgot our daughter's favourite blankie and they have shipped it back to us at no charge!  We are so grateful!!!!  It was so convenient to be so close to the parks.  It was also great to have the magic hour each morning!

When I was going to book last year, there were plenty of negative reviews that were making me question whether to book or not.  I asked a few friends who had stayed there and all encouraged me to book and listen to them rather than the reviewers.  Thank goodness we did.  It was for my birthday celebration.  Typically, we will stay at Park Vue Inn, but we actually wanted to spend more time in the room, enjoy the ameneties, and have close proximity to the parks.  It was a fabulous stay and wonderful service throughout the hotel and restaurants.  I only rated it a 4 due to price/value.  You are definitely paying for proximity.  If the rooms were a bit nicer and bigger, I would go ahead and give it a 5.  With that being said, we will definitely come back on those special occasions.

Perfect place to stay after big days at the Disney Parks - A touch of Disney magic in this hotel without it being to much. Love the location and the dining options. The Atrium area is really amazing!!

I've stayed at the Disneyland hotel many times - pre and post renovations. And every time I'd walk by the Grand Californian and think, that place must be real nice. Well the lobby is - but otherwise, to me, it was just a hotel, and not nearly as nice as the updated Disneyland Hotel. The rooms are nothing great, felt Hampton Inn-ish to me. I like Hampton Inns, that's not an insult, just thought this property, with the high cost, would be nicer. Even the pools are second rate compared to the updated pools at the Disneyland Hotel. The one big perk is the proximity to the parks.  Maybe my expectations were too high...I can see that, but I will not be staying here again in the future. I'll walk the extra .25 mi to the parks for a better experience.

The Grand Californian is pretty grand (with prices to match).  However, the convenience when traveling with extended family, including two young kids, made it just about worth it.  The location right next to the park is perfect. We took advantage of the early admission each morning, and loved being able to go back and forth between hotel and park throughout the day.  The little kids really needed that break during the day to recharge (and swim) before hitting the rides again.  The pool is fabulous too!  Being so immersed in Disney can be a little much, but the convenience is really nice.

The Grand Californian puts you in the ideal location that gives you access to Downtown Disney, Disneyland, and California Adventure. But first, you have to check-in.
