A Cast Member escorts you to the registration desk. This is necessary because if this is your first visit to the Grand Californian, you are most likely gawking at the expansive lobby area that is inviting, restful, and reminiscent of a well appointed lodge. We drove there so we planned on arriving before check-in time of 4:00 p.m. so as to have lunch at Downtown Disney. The Cast Member who check us in was very helpful and explained that he was going to give us our room keys even though our room was not ready. But we would receive a text message let us know when our room was available along with the room number. He

This is a big grand Disney hotel. Expect it to be very family oriented, the customer service is excellent. The pool was nice but expect to wait for a lounge chair if you pop in in the afternoon. It is a two minute walk into Disney's Adventure land which was a great feature.  The kids loved the bunkbed and trundle room we were in, try to reserve that ahead of time.  The StoryTeller Cafe had a cute character breakfast that we went to almost every day, plan to spend a pretty penny on those Mickey Mouse waffles but when in Rome...

Just returned from Disney's Grand California hotel and love this place. The staff went out of their way to accomodate small requests that we had and then followed it up with a phone call to make sure our items arrived. The convience to Downtown Disney was wonderful. We were on the second floor which I was a little concerned but when we open our drapes we were facing the pool through a light forest of trees.  It was absolutely beautiful. My daily morning treck to Starbucks just two doors down from hotel exit was a highlight. My two teenage nieces thought they had died and gone to heaven. Highly recommend.

A very nice hotel and room.  Of course all the staff are friendly and professional and attentive to your needs.  A great location to get in and out of Disney California Adventure Park easily.  Hotel allows you to get into the park even 1 hour earlier.  Restaurants are good, but a little pricey--like most hotel restaurants are. Storyteller restaurant is good if you have kids.  Got lucky and had a wonderful waitress, Pao.

Disney's Grand Californian is nestled in between Downtown Disney and Disney's California Adventure park.  Make no mistake, you are paying for convenience with this hotel.  But for the price, you get:  A solid 4-star room with comfortable beds. Very good service. A private entrance to Disney's California Adventure park. A bunch of outdoor pools, and a decently-equipped fitness center.  We stayed with kids, and being hotel guests gave us "Magic Hour" access to both Disneyland and Disney's California Adventure parks on alternating days.  This magic hour let us experience the park ahead of the general public - most days we were able to experience all the major attractions before noon.  Dining at the hotel is cost-prohibitive.  Fortunately Downtown Disney is right next door, offering

Summary Heading: Worth the Extra Price, Take Advantage of All They Offer
Summary: We only had 1 night, and we soaked it for every hour: 6:00 AM-1:00 PM the next day.  The beds are very comfortable, the room very clean & the staff very helpful and eager to please.    The hotel is gorgeous, with a feel of being in the middle of the woods. The Lobby is second to none: a room remembered with it's thick wood, huge fireplace and tall ceiling.  There can be 100 people around and you still feel alone. Both parks are very close, which makes taking a mid-day nap very possible, even for 1 or more of your party, if they need to take a break.  With even 1 night, you get the Extra Magic Hour for 2 days in either Disneyland or California Adventure.  THIS is one of the reasons we didn't mind paying double to stay here.  By 11:30 AM, we had been on 15 rides.  We didn't have

I was there 5 years ago, I loved the room, service was excellent room amazing and the bed was out of this world so comfortable like a giant pillow, stayed for 4 days the room 4 day park hopper 1200.00 , bet than sticker shock can't believe how expensive it is now. I wanted to go back but I can't afford it anymore we booked at the carousel for 2 days and the cost is the same that we paid 5 years ago. So sad how can anyone afford to go to Disney. I loved that hotel wish I could stay again

This was my 3rd stay at The Grand Californian over the last 7 years. It is a typical Disney property with all the commercial influence you would expect. Conveniently located with direct access to downtown Disney and California adventure. The sleeping rooms need some updating. If you want to stay on Disney property it's  a good alternative to the Disneyland Hotel.

From the minute you enter the parking lot your experience begins. From the Valets to our Cast Members at Guest Services. They make you feel "Special".  Our room overlooked the Mickey Roller Coaster and gave us a good view of "Illuminatons". It was a precurser to our evening in the park.  The really Great part of staying at the Grand Californian is you have the opportunity for early entrance into the park. Always nice to get a jump on the crowds.  Did not have the opportunity to spend any time at the pool, however, my next visit I have allowed time for a visit.   The interior of the hotel is wonderful..Very Frank Lloyd Wright or Mission. My favorite types of architecture.  It's very warm and inviting.  I will be back in the hotel this fall. Can not wair for my next trip....

This was our second trip to this hotel and it has many wonderful things including a beautiful interior, and easy access to California Adventure Park . It was minutes to return to our hotel to pick up items and return to the park . The pools were fun and staff pleasant .  Our maid was excellent and left extra chocolate in our room at night . The rooms are standard Disney rooms but no microwave which would have been nice .  For some reason we were given a handicap room which meant waste all over the bathroom due to no door .  Here is a warning for people that purchased non expiring passes years ago. We purchased them at WDW 10 years ago and were able to use them at both Florida and California , until we tried to use them on this trip . They told us that they stopped accepting WDW

Summary Heading: Disney Vacation Club Member liked it a lot
Summary: We stayed in the Vacation Club Villas 2 bedroom unit.  They are quite big.  Access to the parks and Downtown Disney is fantastic.   The Lobby area is grand and beautiful.  The rooms were spacious.  The Second bedroom was quite nice.  Didn't care for the broken up balconies.  The main one was off the master bedroom.  The living area had a murphy bed that was convenient but lead to a messy living area.   The pool area had three pools and three hot tubs.  But there were so many kids in the hot tubs it wasn't worth the effort.  It would be nice if there was an adult only area.   The food options were only ok in the hotel, but Downtown Disney was next door.  Disney sure knows how to create wonderful spaces.    I think this resort ranks high among the Disney Vacation Club offerings.

We used our Disney Vacation Club points to stay here 2 nights in a 1 BR unit.  This unit could sleep 5, but there was just the 2 of us.  It was absolutely beautiful.  There was so much space.  The hotel is set in a setting that seems like you are at a beautiful inn in the Redwood Forest, not in the middle of Disneyland.  They have thought of every detail for comfort and quality in these villas.  We had 2 full baths, full kitchen and a king size bed.

We recently visited Anaheim's Disney Theme Parks along with our son, daughter and their families, a total of thirteen in our party.  It was our first stay at the Grand Californian Hotel.  There were many things I enjoyed and appreciated about the hotel, the very helpful staff, the direct entrance to California Adventureland ( saved a lot of walking), early admittance to both parks, on premise restaurants and coffee/ bakery shop for those early mornings.  But, I'm not sure it was worth the extra money.  We definitely prefer staying on the Disney premises but found Paradise Pier Hotel just as nice, staff as helpful but considerably more affordable.  I think the next time we return, we will probably rebook at Paradise Pier Hotel, a better value for the money.

We have been to Disney World many times but this was our first time at Disneyland. We opted to stay at the Grand Californian for ease and upscale accommodations. It was vary convenient to access the parks from there. It was clean and the staff was friendly. I would stay there again. Pricey for what you get.

I wanted to stay here for years and finally could justify the splurge. These rooms are very pricey. But it is a really nice experience.  Our room had a bunk bed and this was probably the hi light of the trip for my son. He loved sleeping on the top bunk. The room has a fridge which I appreciated but would have loved a microwave for the price. The balconies are lovely and the views really emphasize that you are at a resort. There was a movie playing on the lawn most nights. We left the balcony open to let our son hear the movie as he fell asleep. The special entry to DCA is pretty great. Near that access is a wonderful little food shop with lots of healthy choices and the most affordable prices we saw at Disney.  As much as I loved the hotel, I would have a hard time justifying

Clean well decorated rooms.  Killer location.  Kind staff.  Fun pool, luxurious comfy pool chairs and activities.  Food at the quickie restaurant was surprisingly yummy.  First time to DisneyLand instead of DisneyWorld and overall very pleased.

Just DO IT!  Stay here the room was immaculate, the staff was ever accommodating & super friendly. We could watch the nightly fireworks right from our balcony or Beds which were  very comfy Heavey glass doors made for a very quiet room..Downtown Disney was a simple walk outside our hotel and the hotel itself had everything we needed right on site.  This hotel has a private entrance  to the Disney Adventure land Park & Downtown Disney, no need to wait in entrance  lines.     Each room has a refrigerator so we had groceries delivered from a online service called Vonn's. Make sure you look up the coupon for  free delivery for first time shoppers I would SO stay here again

Only Disney could pull off such a magical stay.  From the time that you enter the hotel lobby, the scale of this hotel is grand with its enormous grand lobby to the beautiful rooms, perfectly outfitted for family vacations with dual master suites, family dining table and fully functional kitchen all combine to make this a dream vacation.  You are literally attached to a private entrance to the California Adventure Park.  You can see the park from the window in your room - how exciting!

Summary Heading: Only Place to Stay at Disneyland
Summary: We have stayed here a number of times. The ONLY hotel with direct and I mean DIRECT access to Califirnian Adventure, and 3 min walk to Disneyland via down town DISNEY.   Room could be said to be a bit old style (but NOT old). Dark wood, very basic small bathroom with shower over bath.   Beds were comfortable, lots of pillows, good TV's, room size was fine, room was clean. This time we paid for the Club Level which was great!! Previously we had thought it not worth it. It's worth it!!! Breakfast every morning was fruit, juices, cereal, cold meats, cheese, pastries, yoghurt, bagels!! Much cheaper than breakfast every morning for 3 adults and 3 kids.   Lunch was pretty good. Ribbon sandwiches, little cakes, drinks and more fruit. We would spend the morning in DISNEY, get a fast

Summary Heading: You will never want to leave this place.
Summary: This magnificent Hotel is worth ever cent. It's  onsite with direct entry to parks and an hour early. We knocked out all the oat popular rides early that later were hours and hours waiting periods. I walked in to be greeted by a huge majestic, warm and inviting setting. Kids everywhere and happy and families relaxing in the huge open areas in the foyer. I received a first timers badge and actually cried on arrival. I have been waiting 38 years for this moment and the hotel didn't disappoint. The rooms were spacious and had a balcony that looked straight over the beautiful immaculate grounds. There was not a smudge or piece of furniture out of place. The staff were amazing and it was safe, clean and friendly. It was expensive to stay but if this is your dream holiday and you can

Arrived with large group, check in was a breeze.  Everyone on staff was helpful, kind and courteous.  Had to leave our luggage with bellhop as room wasn't ready only because we arrived early morning.  Hotel is large, but isn't so big that it's a problem.  The room is very clean and again, the service was wonderful.  Some of the furniture is a little dated but nothing in bad shape. The pool area is a great place to relax.  Having direct access to all the parks from the hotel was the single biggest bonus going.  Really nothing not to like about the hotel.  Check out was just as easy and staff was very helpful.

Summary Heading: Large hotel; great service; very expensive
Summary: This is a lovely hotel but rooms are dated for the price.  The piano plays loud songs very early in the morning and having a room facing the pool it was extremely loud.  I was truly disappointed with the bathroom specifically it was dirty.  I also had a problem with the lights in the room and the food was VERY expensive and not quite good enough.

Summary Heading: The best Disneyland resort - for a price
Summary: This review is for the Villas at the Grand Californian - the Disney Vacation Club properties onsite, but all features included are available to the standard hotel rooms save for the kitchens in the villas.  Where do I start? Yes, the property is pricey. But for a family of Disney fans it's well-worth a little splurge. Easy check in and very attentive staff from the moment you pull up to the curb. Self-parking is included with our DVC membership and an easy walk across street. Drop your luggage with the valet, park and you'll be back onsite in five minutes.   Rooms are large and comfy. Very nice amenities, plush toiletries/linen, "Disney-fied" TV options kept kids entertained in the room. Many, many activities included for resort guests: fun hotel scavenger hunt, with a tasty

Summary Heading: Stayed to attend the Mickey-not-so-scary Halloween party.
Summary: From the very moment we checked in and received our Disneyland "first visit" button, to the amazing friendly customer service, we enjoyed every minute of our stay. The room was comfortable and had Disney themed decor, the view from our room was nice, we enjoyed the hotel  beautiful architectural designs.  We loved the magical hour and being able to have a whole extra hour to visit the parks. We also loved how close it was to the parks. Overall I would highly recomment to stay here.

Outstanding service.  Attention given to every little detail.  Close to both parks.  Downtown disney & California Adventure is right outside the door.  I was on the 5th floor and had a great view.  The room was large and easily accomondated my family.  Very clean and well appointed.  My birthday was made even more special because of the service that we received.

After a 15 hour flight from Australia we finally got out of our transport van at the Disneyland Grand California. We were greated at the kerb side by a Bell man and our bags disappeared, to reappear whenever we wanted them. We were greeted by John who was very helpful, arranged our room and organised to text us once our room was ready. He arranged our park entry tickets and was genuinely friendly, and helped us with every request.  Angel in Bell services was great and retrieved a parcel that I had had sent to us. Done with efficiency and a smile.  We managed to even check out the new parts of California Adventure land.  A great start to our holiday

Disney Grand Californian is a lovely property.  The rooms are average hotel size, but the convenience is great. It is very expensive, but you are paying for the location.  The pools are beautiful and the lobby area is amazing.

We stayed in a one bedroom villa on the first floor. It was clean and convenient. If we go back I would request a higher floor so I could see fireworks but theirs floor was fine and quickly accessible. Loved being able to enter California adventures from the back and made it nice to come and go from park to room several times. Everyone was very courteous. Beware...if you are self parking it is a long haul so make sure you have everything out of the car before you park.

The best place to stay.   Both parks are right outside your door. So clean. Everyone is so friendly and helpful. Love this place. I will be staying here again. Love the magic of Disney. The whole family had a blast.

Summary Heading: Great stay, clean rooms, bunk bed for kids, and unparalleled access....
Summary: This was our first visit to Disney, and through our nephew who is in the military, got a great rate at this hotel.  You drive up and are immediately greeted by several bellmen willing to lend a hand with your luggage. Tip #1, if you plan to explore the surrounding areas in your vehicle, opt for the valet service as its only $8 more than self-parking.  Also, the self-parking lot is across the street from the hotel and can become cumbersome if you frequently have to access your vehicle. Upon entering, you feel as though you entered an enormous log cabin. The lobby was clean and check-in was a breeze with little to no wait. The lady checking us in upgraded our rooms to a partial view of Disney California Adventure. Tip #2, the enormity of this property rivals that of Las Vegas'

Enjoyed our second stay at the GC. Third trip to Disneyland.   Had a 'premium' view room. Really? I mean thru the landscape we could kinda see the small pool. Not exactly premium in our opinion.   Beautiful hotel in the absolute best location! Access to the parks and Downtown was fabulous.   Check in staff was not good. Took forever. Charged us $300 more for our tickets than he should have. I had to explain it to him. Took forever for him to correct. Then he didn't return my room/charge key. Had to go to a different person and get new key.   But biggest drawback is the food situation. Nothing open when you come back from parks late at night. Seems at disneyworld, at the deluxe resorts, many of the fast food places stay open until the park closes. Not here!!! That was

We are Disney Vacation Club Members (DVC) and have stayed at several Disney Deluxe Resorts over the last several years. Disney's Grand in my opinion is just stunning and is now my #1 Disney resort. I could argue maybe the best 5-Star resort that I've ever stayed in.   Swimming pool area is beautiful, we were able to secure an umbrella sitting area every day by noon, one day as late as 1pm. No need to reserve a cabana unless you just really want the additional luxury and cost.  Ample dining options including Napa Rose, Hearthstone Lounge and Storytellers Cafe and don't forget that Downtown Disney is just a short walk outside of the resort with numerous dining options as well.   We loved the convenience of walking in and out of California Adventure and Downtown Disney; no need to

The hotel is located within a stone's throw from Disneyland and the Californian Adventure, with access from Downtown Disney. The entrance and lobby were pretty cool. High ceilings and a dark, cosy winter lodge sort of decor. There was a small t.v in the lobby showing Disney favourites with small chairs so the kids felt happy. Unfortunately, the rooms were a bit of a let down...a tad bit depressing and very dated..I guess not a big deal since most folks are here not for the rooms but for the proximity to the theme parks. The night we checked in, there was no water supply, so we were not able to freshen up, and room service only had cold dishes due to the lack of water.  On the upside, the room had a coffee maker and the staff were extremely helpful in retrieving an item which my

We just got back from five nights at the Grand Californian, which is where we always stay when we visit Disneyland. The hotel is visually stunning, with the usual Disney attention to detail. The first time you walk into the lobby you know your experience there will be something special.  It is true that the rooms themselves are pretty average for what you're paying, but the best part of the place, of course, is the access to the park, especially California Adventure. You get in right next to Grizzly River Run. You are only a couple minutes from Soaring over California. As for Disneyland proper, you enter via Downtown Disney. It takes just a few minutes to walk to the entrance. You just cannot beat the location. Period. It is easy to come and go from the park, which allows you to

Expectations were high for this place, and they were for the most part met. Normally, this place would been out of the price range to stay at for Disneyland since I live down the street, but they had a great deal for dapper day and the room was almost half off!!  The place is beautiful, you feel like you're walking through some old mountain hotel from years ago. They really outdid themselves architecturally, there is no mistaking that this is Disney! The layout is really strange because of the way they had to build the hotel in the location they had available, it is easy to get lost!  The room was great, it overlooked Disney California Adventure, you could literally see into the Condor Flats area. Pretty Cool view at night of the Hollywood Tower of Terror and the Bear Mountain,

I just returned from Disneyland, where we stayed at the Grand Californian. This hotel is designed to handle Disney going families, with direct access to both Downtown Disney & California Adventure. Disneyland itself is accessed from Downtown Disney.  First, the positives: 1. They are equipped to handle a full house. The service was exceptional in every way. I have stayed in many 5 star hotels around the world that have not had the level of service I received here. 2. Despite the hotel being filled with families with lots of children, it was quiet. They even have a great place for kids to watch Disney shows while the check in and check out process is going on. 3. Access to the parks...don't take this for granted. To be able to walk back to your hotel for a short break does

This place is a tradition for my extended family and I. We've been coming here since I was in high school, and we still love it! The location just can't be beat. You have your own entrance into California Adventure. Early entry (Magic Hour) into the parks and character wake-up calls are fun perks, at any Disney hotel. The pool here is wonderful, much nicer than the Disneyland hotel (in my opinion), and the convenient location of the pool makes it a great option as a break from the parks if they get crowded or the weather gets hot. The food options are pretty decent at the hotel, but you are also right in the middle of Downtown Disney!  The best parts of a stay at the Grand Californian are the views of the parks / Downtown Disney, and the fireplace! The most treasured part of our

This is a great hotel that is connected to the California Adventure and within walking distance of Disneyland.  The early morning entrance is worth the price, as we were able to get in, enjoy the park when no one was there and then relax in the afternoon back at the hotel before the night activities.  the staff is very friendly and cordial!

Summary Heading: Totally worth it - but understand what you're paying for
Summary: We had the pleasure of staying five nights at this gorgeous / enormous property. We have always wanted to stay at a Disney resort hotel but could never previously justify the added expense when several nearby hotels were nearly as well reviewed and cost about half as much. But having hear such great things about it, we decided to give it a try.  To start, a few negative thoughts to share: There was a very long line at check in, so be prepared to wait 15-20 mins to actually get checked in to your room. Our room had a very nice view and balcony for the basic room package, but the view also included a small section of the roof which had a bit more trash on it than what I would expect from a five star resort hotel. I understand this is due to inconsiderate guests rather than a

Stayed 4 nights starting on Memorial Day, club level with 5 people. We managed to receive a rare daybed room, perfect for our group of 5. It was our 4th time at the Grand Californian club level and we love it each time & will return when the budget allows. The rooms are small, we like the club because it gives us extra space for some to leave and go get snacks while others get ready. The club level continental breakfast in the morning is very light, but the appetizers at night are great. Wish the hours were longer, it doesn't open until 6:30am which does not provide much time when early entry is at 7am and it is a shame it closes at 10pm when parks are open until midnight. If you can afford it and return to the hotel every afternoon to take advantage of the amenities I highly

The check in process was a breeze, as I was intrigued by the Club Level service.   I had booked a King room, but received two queens, not a huge problem, but my child was expecting a bunk or trundle and was very excited about that.  The room was a bit outdated and small.  The beds were very uncomfortable, my back hurt every morning.  The club level offers continental breakfast, light sandwhich lunch and evening desserts.   I originally thought this would be a blessing because my child and husband are always hungry.  Unfortunately, this was a waste of our money. The food was exactly the same every day.  The concierge service on Club level was kind of a joke too.   You'd think for the extra money you pay the service would be impeccable and maybe have some better advantages.

I'd like to give this hotel a 5 rating but cannot because of a noise problem.  We stayed here in a villa room for 4 nights while visiting Disneyland.  Two of our nights were during "Grad Night" events when the California Adventure park stayed open until 2am for the graduates to celebrate and enjoy the park.  This is great unless your room is right next to that park and you hear screaming outside your hotel room window until 2am.  This made the stay here problematic and exhausting.  Other than that issue, the hotel and staff are terrific and we'd love to stay here again.  However, we'd request a room away from the park or would check to learn about any late night park events that would hinder our rest.  Disney certainly designed a very beautiful Grand Californian resort.  The

Summary Heading: Way overpriced for the quality of the rooms and service level, location is good though
Summary: I find it amazing that this place gets such great reviews. When you check in and see the lobby you feel like in a five star hotel, valet and bell desk is good too. But when you get to your room (after like a 5 minute walk as in our case) you will be more than disappointed. You end up in a room with dark decor, cheap furniture and a bathroom without a door, only a sliding door to the tub and toilet, but the sink is only separated from the room by a wall on one side. A/C was very loud too, so we had to turn it off at night. Not what you expect for 400 USD + tax per night, more like your standard 3star hotel room. Nothing special at all and no real disney decor, probably they are afraid that otherwise people would take home to many "souvenirs" from the room and would not be buying

I have stayed at both the Paradise Pier and Grand Californian.  I have to say that walking directly into the California Adventure Park is a great perk of the Grand Californian.  Other than that, I thought the hotels were basically the same in terms of room size and cleanliness. At the Grand California, we had a "Woods View," which is basically a view of nothing.  When I stayed at Paradise Pier we had a Park View and my kids really loved that.  Paradise Pier is also right Accross the street from the Grand California, so it is not a long walk to the parks either.  I liked both hotels just fine.  Neither was overly impressive, but both were efficient and clean.  The Grand California was considerably more expensive, but also more convenient to the parks.  Where you would prefer to

This hotel is not to be missed, if you can swing the money. My 2 sisters and I stayed on the 6th floor overlooking part of Disneys California adventure. The room was huge, we could have easily added 2 more people in our stay as we never used the hide a bed under the couch, Most unique feature i have never seen before was the revolving shower head, so cool thought i don't think i would have missed it, we hung by the pool untill the very last minute of the 4:00pm check in time.not a bad place to wait.The view of the park was really cool and my sisters loved every minute of it. We were there in late May and the weather was just fine for pool use. I love this hotel and can see myself staying for 5 days once my ship comes in It is very expensive but worth every cent for a special

My wife, our 7-year-old daughter, and I spent 4 nights at the Grand Californian. We had a room with two queen beds and a park view. Overall, we had no complaints about our stay. It was the Disney-quality we expected. My daughter loved the pool. She's still learning so swim, so the facility-provided life jackets we a plus. I would NOT pay for the view of the park. The view was neat as a novelty, but about the only time we saw it was in the morning while I was drinking coffee. The park was closed that early, so it actually had the effect of reducing the Disney magic a little.  I was happy to pay the premium to get the prime location for this trip.

Summary Heading: Amazing location, Great Studio, but better service at Disneyland Hotel.
Summary: I just came back from a 5 nights stay at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel. I am a member of Disney Vacation Club, so I rented a studio. The studio itself was amazing. It was everything I was expecting and even more. It was clean, the bed was very comfortable... and I had a theme park view! There is an entrance for guests of the hotel right in Disney's California Adventure!  Where I had problems is with the customer service of this hotel. I was told to get milk or breakfast items to call room service. I found that odd. So went to Downtown Disney every morning until 3 days later we went to White Water Snacks... and it was all there. So I wasted lots of precious time getting breakfast at Starbucks in Downtown Disney (milk and juice and breakfast items from room service was

We stayed for one night. We are Annual Passholders, and every time we go to the parks we walk through that hotel and say: "One day we will stay here for one night." Well, we had our one night. I booked a Premium View with the Concierge service. The view was gorgeous, we overlooked Soarin and Grizzly River Rapids. The Concierge service gets you breakfast/snacks/drinks/appetizers/desserts/liquor at a private club. The price was really expensive ($700 with Passholder discount), but I'm glad I did it once. The added food was nice; the day we only ate there for the time we were staying, so I could value the food that was included in the price saved us money by not buying food in the parks, but it was still a super pricey overnight stay.

Summary Heading: loved the room and the view, great location
Summary: We weren't sure which hotel to pick at Disneyland and were so happy with this one!  Just steps away through hotel and we were at California Adventure land.  Then the next day a ten minute walk thru Downtown and we were at the magic kingdom.  At night we saw the fireworks from the balcony of our room.  The kids loved the 3 pools. Every afternoon they would go there and rest up to go back at night time.  Plenty of room for all our luggage. The five year old loved the large closet and it was big enough to be her dressing room! :)

We stayed five nights and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves, the hotel is very large and very accommodating. The staff was kind, helpful and at all times, courteous. The location is amazing! Being able to walk into the theme parks is priceless. The location is fantastic. You can also walk right into Downtown Disney. The 2BR villa was clean and extremely spacious. I can't say enough about the convenience of walking to the attractions. I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Only bad point of the trip was we didn't receive the King sized bed room we requested.  This is not unique with Disney as they seen to not have perfected the science behind giving their guests the size bed they prefer as other chains have.  That being said everything else was above standard.  The staff, atmosphere and upkeep are top notch.  Breakfast buffet top notch.

Summary Heading: Staying here made Disney experience even better
Summary: We had 2 suites for a 3 generation group in Sept. 2014. One 1 bdrm suite, one 2 bdrm suite (12 ppl + 1 baby). Terribly $$$, but worth it for location, extra a.m. hrs., Disney "magic" & amenities.  Very clean & well kept; so nice to have full kitchen (you can go broke by eating out around here!). Kids loved the pool. I don't know if I'd call this property "romantic", but I guess it could be if you like the old-fashioned Californian park hotel look (we do).  Customer service outstanding.

My family and I checked in Sunday, May 31st at the Grand Californian Hotel, as we always do when we visit Disneyland. We spent the next day at Disney California and our kids (4,2 and 1) had a blast. We decided to stay as late as possible because we were with our parents who are seniors and were enjoying their visit to the park. When we arrived back at the hotel, there was NO WATER. Not even a drop or trickle. I called front desk and they said, sorry but water will be back at 5AM. SHOCK OF MY LIFE. the person also said that they have rooms available at paradise point if we want to freshen up or they will send up some water. (They did, send 5 small bottles for 7 adults and 3 kids to freshen up. What.) we got very angry and upset because there was absolutely no notice prior of

Summary Heading: Great location but is that worth the cost?
Summary: If you are undecided this may help  Stayed at the Grand Californian for 3 nights during the Tinkerbell Marathon and Mother‚Äôs day. Most reviews will tell you how beautiful the hotel is and I will not go into the details of the beauty as that is something anyone wandering around the resort can come and see at no charge. As a person considering this hotel you need to know about the rooms and what is like to stay in this hotel.  This was my first time staying at the Grand, but I have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel as well as most of the official hotels of WDW and the international parks. How does the Grand compare to the others - it is more expensive but closer to the parks than any other Disney hotel in the US. If proximity to the parks is your main priority, and you can afford the

This was our second time staying at the Grand Californian Hotel with our three-generation group. We wouldn't consider staying anywhere else. Especially enjoy having a little balcony off the room. Location is perfect. Housekeeping is great. Staff is helpful and considerate. Rooms are pricey, but that is to be expected.

We loved the convenience of staying at the Grand Californian, however there were just one or two  things that just weren't up to our expectations. First off our upgraded room was right next to a loud air conditioning unit for a shop in downtown Disney so we couldn't even keep our patio door open it enjoy being on our patio when the unit was running.   We had quite a few issues with the reservations- we ordered a gift basket to be delivered to our room and it went to our connecting room (where our parents were staying) and even after an hour after we asked for it to be switched nothing was fixed so we just waited until our parents arrived and retrieved the basket on our own.   All of the other issues with our reservations we had were taken care of promptly and professionally  The

Summary Heading: Convenient to California Adventure and Disneyland
Summary: The Grand Californian lobby is beautiful and reminiscent of an old lodge you might find in Yosemite. Our room worked well for us with a comfortable queen bed and a bunk bed. The bunk bed is great as it gave each of our children their own sleeping space. The bunk bed also frees up valuable floor space, making the room feel more spacious. Some of the bed covers were starting to show a little wear, as was the tile in the bathroom. The room was clean, and I do like Disney's bath products. It was great to have a balcony to sit and have a coffee. The pool area was a nice place to take a break from the park. The kids enoyed the slide and hot tub, the adults appreciated thepoolside service and happyhour appetizers. It was fun to be in the parks for the 60th Anniversary celebrations.

Summary Heading: Stayed here for 60th Anniversary and celebrate graduation
Summary: We stayed at the Grand Californian for 4 nights to celebrate our daughter's college graduation and partake in the kick off of the 60th anniversary.  We have stayed here many times in the past.  From the time we checked in until we left it was absolutely wonderful.  We ordered special cake pops for a surprise and they were very delicious and decorated exactly like we asked.  I also used the laundry facility this time and it also did not disappoint.  The washers and dryers were easy to use and clean.  We also went to the Spa for the very first time and had pedicures.  They did a wonderful job and were very friendly.  I would recommend using the Spa services if you have not done that yet.  If I had to pick one item to recommend an improvement on it would be the WIFI.  It was so

Summary Heading: Not up to my expectations of Disney.
Summary: It was great to be adjacent to the park and get in one hour early.  It would have been helpful to have a sheet of tips about the park, fast passes, etc at the concierge desk. I also think that the on site activities were not up to par with what I would have expected at a Disney resort. The pool party was boring and consequently not many kids participated.  Although the room was nice, we had no mini bar - even for sodas and waters as it was unplugged and empty. I expected more for the price we paid.  Spoke with one person who literally told me that my issue was not her problem.  The bell staff was extremely helpful though.

I stayed here for the MD&M medical show. It was a nice room. I had a veiw overlooking Downtown Disney, it did get a little bit noisy at night. The location is great for close acess to the Disney resort. The staff on the other hand seemed overstressed and under-paid. Just not what i know the Disney magic to be. I would recommend staying in the Disneyland Hotel if you want that feeling with great service! Overall if the price is right I may consider staying here agian though.

Summary Heading: Great central location, be prepared for crowds
Summary: Disneyland and CA Adventure are crowded these days - we went Sunday through Thursday at the beginning of May and had a 15 minute wait to talk to someone about checking in. Our room wasn't ready, and so we had another 15-20 minute wait to leave our bags with bellman. Our room was fine - nothing spectacular for the price, but the most practical part is the distance to the parks - they are right there.  The hotel is pretty... But I think our rooms weren't in the best spot. We were over parking lots and it was a long distance from the lobby. We have two young kids, so it was nice that we were close to the parks for nap time.  I don't know that we would stay here again just because for the price, you don't get a ton of extras besides being close to the parks.   The "Magic Hour" is a

We stayed at the Grand Californian for 3 nights to celebrate my son's 5th birthday.  It also happened to be the beginning of Disneyland's 60th anniversary celebration and the wackadoodle 24 hour party.  We were expecting crowds since it was Memorial Day weekend but the anniversary celebration brought the crowds to a whole other level.  We stayed in a Premium view room with a view of California Adventure, right above the hotel entrance to the park.  Most of our view was of trees and not so much the park, but it was still a great view and a great room.  We were given a queen bed (more like a full size) and a bunk bed for the little, which he absolutely loved.  He did sneak into our bed in the middle of the night but he loved that he had his own special bunk bed for his birthday.

Excellent venue, excellent location.  We stayed there for our 20th anniversary, having not been to Disneyland in 20 years.  Had dinner at the Napa Rose Restaurant, and the food and service were outstanding.

The Grand California hotel is incredible. From the moment that you drive into their lot you're welcome by name. When you arrive at the front desk there are plenty of cast members assisting with the check in process. You might even find goofy in the lobby taking pictures with the guest while you wait.   The rooms are all conveniently located around the pool with an awesome view for fireworks.  The rooms are spacious and decorated in a Disney manner in full detail. The pool service is wonderful they even provide water diapers. The business center is available to use with all you might need at no charge.  As you walk the luscious gardens all cast members greet you and are ready to answer any questions.  Upon departure the process is simple and the bell crew is happy to hold your

Summary Heading: Customer Service at the highest possible level
Summary: My wife and I stayed on the Concierge Level.  The staff met us at the cab door.  Welcomed us using our first and last names.  Took our baggage out of the car and took it to our room.  We did not have to wait for hours like everyone else for our room to get cleaned.  They had electric scooters for us at the cab doors.  They had specials meals prepared for my wife who is a diabetic delivered under silver domes.  Giant rose petal heart on bed.  Artistically prepared food available 24 seven.  All the food and drinks including alcoholic that we desired at no charge. Movies delivered to room.  Silver tray of diabetic cookies for my wife with chocolate designs around edge celebrating our anniversary.  I wanted special soft drinks that they usually did not have in the hotel.  They went

I was hesitant to spend the money on this place but it's worth it! From the moment you walk in you're treated so well! The hotel is beautiful and they put effort into every detail! The staff is courteous and very sweet. All the restaurants are great, the rooms are super clean, comfortable, and quiet. One small complaint is that I wish the pool would stay open late

You can't beat being right in Downtown Disney after a long day of walking in the park. It's a real luxury to be able to just fall into bed. The rooms are nice, but on the smaller side.  The service is great.  We left something in the room and they mailed it back to us, no charge.  The lobby is beautiful and our daughter make a beeline to the toddler size rocking chairs, which are strategically located near the front desk (and in front of a TV playing classic Mickey toons). Just a lovely place although I often feel that it's overpriced‚Ä¶And yet, I still come back.

Summary Heading: All in one package for Christmas
Summary: It's closeness to Disneyland, the decorations, the feeling in the place, just a wonder place to take the kids. The only down side is the price about $800 Aus per night for three of us. We stayed 4 nights and it was was well worth the treat.  The food eating restaurants there were pricey for what you got and it all seemed to be rushed. The staff were as always brilliant.

Summary Heading: Great location but not worth the money for the standard of room
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in May 2015. Positives: You can enter the California Adventure park from the hotel - but we did notice that people we entering/existing via this entrance and not staying at the hotel. We could see the fireworks from our rooms balcony. Rooms where regularly cleaned and cleaned to a good standard. Each night they would turn the sofa bed in to a bed for our daughter. Negatives: Very basic room, no water supplied, no kettle just coffee machine, when paying $400+ a night you would expect these items. Rooms are old and had seen better days. No breakfast included in the room price, we paid for a Disney character breakfast with the chipmonks, was $30 each for breakfast, the breakfast was average at best, they only had 3 characters walking around a

Love the Disneyland Hotel- but the Grand Californian's room are dark. Wood, dark wallpaper, curtains dark, the lighting is dark can't even brighten things that way.   just not a cheery place like DLand.  I get the theme thing - but you can have a balance of both.  Going DLand Hotel from now on. Worth the 30 - 50 extra steps with soar feet.   Advantage- seeing the park and getting into the park onsite.   Napa Rose Resturant is snobby-  I make good funds and dine big 5 star places but don't need snobby at DLand. Need friendly cheery happy peeps like me after seeing Mickey.

Summary Heading: Loved that it was connected to the park!
Summary: I came to this hotel for a business trip and didn't expect to have a good experience, but i was pleasantly surprised! My room was not OVERLY themed and was very relaxing! the fact that it was attached to the theme park was amazing also!

We stayed at the Grand Californian Hotel and in all our future trips we will stay here.  We've always stayed on the coast and driven in - for our two days at the Park and the Hotel we did not use the car.  The hotel is classy with a rustic air - in the end we just loved hanging out between our visits to the park!!

This is an amazing hotel. The views are great! The prices match the quality of the service and rooms with views all with the convenience of being "IN" Disneyland !!!   Best place to stay, ever. We are actually here right now again as I'm writing this review!

This is the 3rd time I have stayed at The Grand, last time I was quite dissapointed and vowed never to spend money here again, that was 2 years ago, recently we decided to take our son to Disneyland for 2 days before the madness and crowds of summer come. I went on the Disneyland website (we are AP holders) and The Grand Californian had a great deal we could'nt refuse, discounted rate, fastpass for each family member..We signed up!  Glad I did upon a very Disney (fun staff) arrival we were upgraded to a premium view (I paid for the standard) we overlooked Goofy's Flight School at CA.  Room was still the same as 2 years ago, but in great condition and clean.  Needless to say we had a blast at the parks in our 2 days, but all around our stay at this hotel was amazing, thanks to

This is a great hotel to stay in if you plan to spend a few days exploring Disbeyland. The rooms are kid-friendly and there is a great pool with a water slide. You are in the middle of everything and can walk to all the attractions.  The service at the hotel was amazing. You can tell that the staff work really hard to make your experience memorable. We forgot a costume in the room when we checked out. The next day we got a call from the hotel to let us know they found it, and the mailed it to our home address free of charge. We were surprised and amazed at this level of service!

Summary Heading: Definitely walk through once but carefully consider before booking.
Summary: For starters this hotel is amazing, it is probably my favorite Disney hotel of any of the disney hotels in the world I've been to. It is beautiful and has an entrance directly into California adventure theme park. (which for early access to the Cars ride is fairly essential). So here's why I probably won't stay here again. It is very expensive, and really for the price you can get a great room at a non theme park hotel opposed to this fairly average room (set in an amazing building). If you have the resources and go to Disneyland very rarely or only once, definitely stay in a Disney hotel, it is the best way to keep the magic going 24/7. This hotel is definitely worth walking through at least once, and totally worth eating at. It really is an amazing hotel and I do love it as a

Summary Heading: Can't beat the location, but expect to pay for it
Summary: Recently visited Disneyland for six nights; two with my husband at a neighbouring Best Western (Pavillions) and then bunked in with my mother and adult sister for four nights at the Grand Californian. We were there for the Tinkerbell Half Marathon Weekend which included Mother's Day.  You can't beat the location. Entry directly into California Adventure and Downtown Disney and less than 10 minute walk to Disneyland front entrance. Certainly no need for a car or any resort transportation.  Our room (two queens on the sixth floor facing the entry) was a snug fit for three women but well appointed. Beds, linens and towels were all of good quality as were the lotions. Evening turndown service was nice but totally unnecessary for us. We would shower once a day in the morning and head

Summary Heading: But you have to accept that it's Disney
Summary: Given the $400+ nightly room charge, my expectations were quite high, and mostly they were met. As a Disney property, the only reason to stay here is for Disney related activities. For that, this is THE most convenient spot. We stayed for the Tinkerbell Half Marathon, and found that it was a brief walk from the hotel to the starting corrals. There is a private entrance to California Adventures, and an onsite entrance to Downtown Disney, and from there, Disneyland. However, if you're only interested in the hotel as a place to stay, that money can by a nicer experience at a true resort.  Everything about it is huge, including the lobby which is decorated in a California Frontier sort of way. The lobby is enormous, the better to handle the high amount of foot traffic cutting

Summary Heading: What can I say but AWESOME
Summary: Close to everything. They have everything. To be able to be so close to the parks and come and go as I pleased was the best part. Room with a view of California Adventure park. Loved sitting on balcony and watching the light show. Definitely a fan.

We stayed at the Grand with our 2 and 4 year old. We loved it. Absolutely closest to the magic, being able to return anytime to our room made every cent worth it. The room is big enough for the 4 of us and the beds are so comfortable. The private entrance was great and near to all the cool things that California adventure has to offer. We never got to experience the turn down service because the kids slept their nap right during that time. If you take the kids you will love the pool, it has 2 slides, one for big kids and one for small children. It made it more fun. They have towels right there, and a great food location right in front of the pool. The service is all Disney and all I could complain about might be that there is no stop of the monorail right inside the hotel like

As expected, the hotel was very clean and nice. Immaculate even!  We had some minor trouble upon check in. The room we reserved months in advance was somehow changed in the system. We ended up with a room that felt like it was 10 blocks down a deserted back hallway. The counter attendant didnt seem to care too much about our little problem. So, to keep the spirit of vacation alive and well, we let it go, and trekked the extra 100 miles (so it seemed ;-)  )  A gorgeous hotel at nearly $500 per night.  Not something we'll do often, but it was fun :-)

This is THE hotel to stay at when planning on going to Disneyland!  It is completely geared towards families, but "does Disney" in a very tasteful, understated way.  The lobby is reminiscent of a grand national park lodge, and there are craftsman style rocking chairs for children to watch looping Disney cartoons - the kids LOVE it! (There is also plenty of comfortable seating for adults to "people watch" and relax. This hotel allows for a separate, private entry to and from Disney California Adventure, which is very convenient. It is also adjacent to Downtown Disney, which has many restaurants and shops to choose from. The pools (4 of them!) are beautiful and fun.  The StoryTeller's Cafe is a great place for an entertaining meal (i.e. character abound!). The hotel is pricey, but

Summary Heading: Location for Disneyland can't be surpassed
Summary: I have stayed here many times, almost from the opening. It is majestic and full of Disney charm and happiness. This hotel is always my number one choice when staying at Disneyland. The access can't be matched and proximity to the parks are more than convenient. It is expensive, so if choosing to stay closer or stay longer is a decision maker, your personal opinion should be considered. I would, however, choose to stay at the Grand Californian for fewer nights. It truly makes your trip more magical and part of the whole experience.

Summary Heading: Convenient, Friendly, and Safe..but basically just a basic hotel.
Summary: I cannot say a bad thing about our experience here.  From the valet to the front desk and the retail and restaurant servers to the bartenders, everyone was pleasant and helpful.  The rooms are just ok.  We had a clean, comfortable bed, the bathroom and vanity area were clean.  Housekeeping was in and out every day and turndown service at night was also a nice touch.  I just think the d√©cor was tired and basic looking for a hotel branded more in the luxury class than in the moderate class.

Summary Heading: Overpriced but the staff are friendly
Summary: We stayed here 5 days to be closer to Disneyland. And while the hotel is very nice and the staff are very friendly, there were a few things that needed attention especially for the price we paid. We had 2 rooms for 2 kids and 5 adults. Both rooms only came with 2 coffee cups, 2 glasses and 2 coffees. Every day, we were having to call and ask for more mugs, coffee, creamer etc.  In one of the rooms, the TV was only analog..really. It was a horrible picture. We called maintenance and they came up and looked at it, gave us the correct tv guide and said there was nothing they could do to get the reception better. It was an HD tv so we were pretty confused why that occurred but it did.  You also need to put the "clean my room" sign on the door if you want it cleaned. Something they

I read many mixed reviews and having stayed at the hotel, I can see why this is so. We had always wanted to stay at the Disney Grand Californian Hotel and torn between this and the other three Disney properties. For a one-off trip, I decided on the Grand for location and payed top-dollar for a premium view overlooking the park.The premium view was of buildings and a few trees and a 'glimpse' of the pool. The hotel is convenient and yes, the foyer is nice, but you don‚Äôt spend much time in the foyer, as it is crowded with anyone from the parks who wants to rest tired feet. I have to agree that this hotel is noisy! We were awake every night as the foyer is open to everyone. There is no secure swipe card needed to get to the accommodation floors, so people were ‚Äòwondering‚Äô around

This hotel is completely 5 stars for a family vacation to Disneyland, we will definitely be back. That said there were a couple things I will remember for next time: check-in took almost an hour and we got there just before 10pm on a Wednesday, from waiting for the valet and bellman to the explanations of everything included in our package at the registration desk. Also, bring water! Snacks and food were actually fairly reasonably priced and accessible, water was a minimum of $3.25. We were celebrating our son's third birthday and had a pool view room on the 4th floor with 2 queen beds. The room was small, but clean and well equipped. We stayed 3 nights and did the park 2 days, parkhopper. The extra hour you have to get into the park is worth it. We made good use of it going on

the Hotel is Stunning..park access is perfect..the pool chairs are so comfortable...and the little touches Disney does(my sons in the military) are touching...expensive yes..we stay on the concierge level..

Fast and friendly check in. Great room, clean! Quieter than the Paridise Pier.  Great access to the parks, we had the court yard view this was perfect.  Nice to be able to sit outside on the little porch. The only issue was the self parking was quite a distance from the hotel.  We have now stayed at all 3 hotels on property, we will diffiantly be staying at this resort on our future visits.  It is a little more money compared to the other two and doesn't have much of the traditional Disney atmosphere but it's worth it.

Fabulous hotel! We only stayed one night for Tinkerbell weekend and had a wonderful stay. The front desk agents were personable and helpful, even after we left our room keys in a locker at DL! The room service food was delicious and reasonably priced and arrived in less than 40 minutes. Check out and bag check ran seamlessly! Our bags were easily stored and retrieved quickly at valet. Will hopefully stay again soon!

Summary Heading: Great theming and direct access to the parks!  If you can afford it...
Summary: We started staying at the Grand Californian in 2006, a few years before they added an official DVC property there.  It's fantastic!  The rooms aren't terribly big (it's Anaheim), but the entire hotel is superbly themed - and Arts and Crafts is our thing!  The furnishings in the lobby blow us away - the couches are huge and the whole thing exudes ambience and unadorned luxury.  The scale is enormous!  Direct access to CA is a real benefit - making it much easier to return to the room for a nap or a swim.  There's also an entrance to Downtown Disney - again a convenience.    We dined at the Napa Rose and Storyteller's Cafe - both excellent venues.  Storyteller's is somewhat less expensive and formal.  Napa Rose has an extensive wine list and is a really fun place for the adults to

If you are taking young children to Disneyland, this is the place to stay!  Not only do you get to go in an hour before the public, but you can take the kids back for their naps without losing the whole day!  You walk right out onto Downtown Disney with the shops and restaurants.  And there is just not enough room here to tell you about all of the amenities for the kids!  But what else would you expect?  It's Disney!!

This is a nice hotel, obviously geared toward an adult clientele.  Not the best of the Disney on-property hotels for kids.   The lighting is very dim.  It does lend a certain ambiance, but for those who don't have the best vision, isn't really a selling point.   In addition, the room we were assigned was the farthest point from the elevator, down a half hallway, turn right, down another entire hallway, turn right, down another entire hallway.  Just walking to the elevator gave me a good portion of my daily workout! (J/K, I can walk more than just to the elevator, but really? Add another elevator!)  The gift shop is also better at the Disneyland hotel.  There is very basic stuff here, not really up to the level of Disneyland Hotel.  Also, I understand it is off season, but maybe

Summary Heading: Perfect family hotel for the Disney experience
Summary: The Grand Californian is a treat. We have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel several times and enjoyed it very much, but now we have been spoiled. Everything at the Grand Californian is meant to coddle and serve their guests. Our five-night family trip included nine people and three rooms, which we requested to have close together. They were, all within a four door range. The rooms were large and we each had a nice balcony that allowed us to look over a tree-studded pool area. Best of all, because I had signed up for Disney Destinations email offers, i received an offer for 20% off rooms for certain nights of our stay. We had already booked our room through an excellent travel agent; I emailed her the code, she called it in, and they honored it. It earned us the equivalent of a free

Summary Heading: if it wasnt on the disney plot no person in their right mind would stay here
Summary: we stayed  over mothers day  and they also ran the tinkerbelle  half maarthon races ...........the hotel is busy and they have the audacity to charge  full rates and yet are unable to deliver service when under pressure ................. so they charge more and offer less than normal   a mad scrum on arrival no help gettting to rooms  phone not working correctly........had to connect with oeprator all the time  buffet breakfast expensive and poor quality  room service just plain poor ............half food forgotten  appalling mess when departing.............no bell people available and 30 minute wait for car collection..............really disgraceful whining  noise in room apparent  battery flat on remote control for TV  nothing done to make the runners feel special nothing done

Summary Heading: The most central hotel on Disneyland property
Summary: We picked the GC because of its private gate into California Adventure, and also because of its similarity to both the Wilderness and Animal Kingdom lodges in Orlando. The hotel is huge, as befits the Disney brand, and the rooms are wonderfully appointed. The physical plant boasts three restaurants (of ascending price points), and a stunning main hall atrium where you check in. While not as classic as the DL Hotel across the street from Downtown Disney, this is certainly the classiest.

Summary Heading: Handy location, fast elevator, great room welcome options
Summary: Room was unimpressive, but the package we preordered to have in the room was VERY Impressive!  Great way to start a trip to have a gift basket waiting for my wife and daughter with personalized ears and cookies, etc...this alone is worth the location. It's handy to be right at the gates especially if you're going to California Adventure Park.  Great pools and certainly set up for kids..  We would stay here again even though the price is fairly high but it's good to be so close.  Had the Goofy Breakfast experience and would repeat that as well.

Summary Heading: Location to parks is the best thing about it!
Summary: We rented DVC points to get a bit of a discount on the rate and even though we rented 11 months in advance the price break was well worth the wait. The DVC rooms are average at best but we didn't expect much since these rooms are sold out all year long. You have to walk past the outdoor smoking area to get to the DVC building. The room was a bit dirty when we first arrived, gold fish crackers on the floor and then on the couch bed. The laundry basket had a pink liquid in the bottom and the comforter for the couch bed was nowhere to be found. We had a bottom floor studio and it was the right size for our family or four. Laundry is accessible and the machines are clean and clean well. The machines are HE so bring your own tabs, each cycle (wash/dry) cost $2 each. The quick service

The Disney experience here is great but well below the WDW vacation, no special registration desk, no advanced check in,   Room keys and tickets are still senate, cannot charge and no delivery to you hotel room.  They say and with great fanfare they are the "original " but they are behind the times with convenience and easy of use.  We love Disneyland and California Adventure for walking and close, and it is the best for under age 8 kids lots more for they to do and enjoy.

Summary Heading: Great service and location, less than par room.
Summary: I recently stayed here with 3 other adult guests. I asked if they had roll-away beds, when checking in and the lady's reponse was, "we don't have roll-aways at this hotel". She the. Said we could switch to a room with a 3rd bed already in it, plus it would have a view of the pool. We got to the room and the third bed was a twin bed with wheels on it...a roll-away. The pool could be viewed between tree branches and by leaning over the balcony. The room had no couch and we were dancinf around each other due to the lack of space. We turned the ac on before leaving the room so it would be nice and cool after. Long day at the park. One of my guests went back to the room and 30 minutes later the rest of us followed. Upon getting back to the room, it was hot and muggy. We checked the

Summary Heading: You're paying for convenience AND its worth it!
Summary: A frequent WDW visitor this hotel wrecked me because of the proximity to the parks, Disney World has nothing this convenient.  We rode Grizzly River Run and got moderately wet we were back at our room to change in 5 minutes.  Plus Early Morning was great though not as big of a perk as the pure lack of walking long distances with little kids.  No matter what anyone says I did not see any hotels that would be similar in walking distance.    My family of 5 rented at DVC villa at DGC so we were in a that section of the hotel. We wanted the kitchen for breakfast or dinners with the little kids (2,4 and 7) and separate bedroom for adults.  Our room was in good condition (not run down like  some users said) amenities were good, beds were fine.  Two bathrooms and the kitchen sold it for

Talk about Disney grown up fun, this hotel is gorgeous, and right next to California Adventures, and a 1/2 mile from Disneyland gates! Ask for a room with a view so you can enjoy the fireworks/ light show from California adventures. Its a lodge setting so you can stay put to enjoy the restaurant, stone fire place and pool. Or head out to downtown Disney where there is plenty of resturants, specialty shops and nightlife !

We stayed here for our honeymoon April 2015.  I was on the fence about it as it is a lot of money - however you absolutely get what you pay for.  From check-in to housekeeping the service level is high.  We were concerned about the noise level as our room view was of the pool area and the Grizzy/Tower of Terror at California Adventure.  Relieved to find that once we closed the sliding glass door we heard nothing.  The ease to enter/exit California Adventure was a huge plus.  Even hitting Starbucks early in the morning was a quick walk.  My concern regarding the number of elevators never became a reality - the elevators are efficient and nicely scattered throughout the hotel.  We only used the main bank of elevators once and had no crowd issue.  The Storytellers caf√© breakfast

Summary Heading: The DGC was a great choice with toddlers
Summary: The DGC's proximity to the parks, pools, and restaurants worked well with toddlers in tow.  I enjoyed a standard third floor two bed room with woodland view overlooking the California Adventure park entrance. The balcony was great for having breakfasts and the bar sized fridge accommodated our milk and snacks. The room was clean and the television provided Disney entertainment and appeared to have inputs should you bring your own device. The wifi worked well in the room once logged in (I found logging in to be finicky through my iphone and ipad - not a DGC issue per se but a heads up to those of you who aren't savvy to troubleshooting such things)  The front desk, bell hops, and room staff were friendly and helpful.   The one pool we used has a tiny water slide perfect for a two

I wasn't actually a guest, my sister and brother in law where. They stayed for a week. The room had easy access from the California Adventure Park. The room d√©cor was amazing. Wood carvings, spacious, woodsy overlook, and monorail track seen from balcony. The bathroom had a sliding door closing off the vanity area that included double sinks. I got a massage at the spa downstairs while waiting for dinner time. I was able to walk in and get an amazing massage. The reception was kind and helpful. The spa accommodated me with the tight schedule to squeeze in a massage after a long day walking around in the hot sun.  The hotel lobby is also nice with a fireplace, bar, gift shop, and more. Check it out to chill out.

The Grand Californian is a wonderful hotel! We choose the hotel for its location and early entry into the Disneyland park as we had our twin 2 year old grandsons on their first Disneyland trip. The hotel is the perfect location, early entry into the park if you are a guest but easy return to the hotel when the two year olds needed a nap... Perfect choice! The weather was very hot so we enjoyed the close proximity to the hotel to relax after a busy morning of Disneyland fun. Some reviews I read said the hotels needs updating but we did not experience that at all... Lobby is gorgeous and our part of the hotel was new! We were in the hotel wing near the Napa Rose restaurant. The reason I gave four stars rather than 5 stars is due  to the overall food experience at Disneland and

We had our family of 5 in one of the bunk bed rooms. It was nice to have a hotel that could accommodate 2 adults and 3 children in one room. The kids rotated through the bunk beds each night. The room is pretty much taken up by the beds, so there isn't a lot of extra space. The access to the park was super exciting for the entire family to walk to and from. Early-access is a treat. The pool is a great and my kids wished we had spent an entire day at the pool, but there's so much to do at the parks that we ran out of time. We never seem to plan a long-enough trip to Disney!

The nicest of the Disney properties and offers easy access to California Adventure. Nice pools and facilities.  Could be a long walk from hotel room to lobby if you have walking limitations ask for a room closer to the elevator

Hubby and I spent 4 nts at the Grand for a long weekend getaway. We normally go to Disney World, so this was a nice change.  The hotel is quite "grand" with a lovely reception area, rooms are spacious and well kept.   I gave 4 stars because in the snack bar restaurant I wanted a cookie and the ones on the bakery rack were dated March 2015 and we are in May!!  No excuse for stale food!!

I have to say I was a bit disappointed with this hotel. I was so looking forward to it. The rooms were fine... a bit worn. The cleanliness was very poor... different shades of many hair in the bathroom...on the floor and in the tub and on the toilet when we checked in. Dust on all of the drawers. It was one of the most dirty places I have stayed. The turn down service was poor. They showed up at 930pm one time (we were just getting into bed after a long day in Disney) and another time at 5pm when I got out of the shower, someone was in the room doing the turndown service! The wifi was good. The location is the best out of all of the Disney hotels. Good to have the early entry every day to Disney. They had one of the pools closed each day (we were there 5 days) which ment it was

I stayed here for four nights on business to attend a conference.  The rooms were clean, the bed was comfortable, the views were nice and the temperature was just right.  The fitness center was small, but fully functional and never crowded.  The restaurant prices were a little high, but the food was good.  The staff was very helpful and polite.  Bell services went above and beyond to make sure everything I needed was taken care of.  The hotel has a direct entrance to downtown Disney, and it was really close to a Starbucks, which was awesome.

Stayed 3 nights April 2015.  Pool view king bed room. Beautiful place, awesome location, friendly staff. Own entrance into disneys California adventure park very convenient!!  Loved it here- can't wait to go back! Many dining options within walking distance. Connected to downtown Disney and California adventure. Disneyland park short walk from hotel.

First time stay for 5 days.  Super convenient.  Spacious and beautifully themed.  We had a balcony overlooking Downtown Disney.  We are a youngish couple who don't mind a little bit of noise at night so some music and crowd noise didn't bother us.  If you are someone who sleeps lightly or are bothered by nighttime noise, then I'd recommended staying away from this type of room.  The resort overall is very tranquil and peaceful as far as Disney resorts and Disney in general goes.    It's the  most conveniently located of all the Disneyland resorts.  There is an entrance to California Adventure from the resort.  We frequently travel to Disney World where managing around the resort is like training for an Olympic event.  It was so nice to watch a nighttime show at Disneyland and

We stayed 4/22 & 4/23, midweek and very quiet with very low crowds in the parks! We were received a free upgrade to a Woods view room from a Standard Room so we were already excited; a little far from the lobby, but we loved the quiet area and more space with the Woods view room! Next time, we may visit in December so hopefully we can stay in a room in the main lobby to enjoy all that the hotel will offer for Holiday activities, entertainment and special Winter Treats! That saying the hotel was great and the only drawback was only staying overnight; not nearly enough time to explore both parks, Downtown Disney and our hotel but with both parks closed by or before 9pm, we shopped DTD stores and got treats to take back to our room. We took advantage of Extra Magic Hours for both

There were 5 of us staying on points in a 2 bedroom Villa on the 3rd floor overlooking California Adventure. We were VERY excited to be staying here as we had wanted to since it opened. We are all huge Disney fans.  The room was beautiful and well appointed BUT everything was sticky! The carpet had a few stains and there were some bumps and bruises here and there on the furniture and fixtures - for $1400 a night - that room should be perfect!  The view was good - there were several trees in the way and if you looked down there was a utility/break area - again - not good enough for $1400 a night!  The location to Downtown DIsney and the parks was amazing! The lobby and staff were phenomenal. The beds were comfortable and I loved having a washer/dryer and small kitchen. We never

We stayed here for the Star Wars convention and to visit the Disney parks and I have to say that while it wasn't terrible, it was not what I'd hoped for given the price.  Many of the things are noted in previous reviews but some of the details I didn't love were the temperature control that went from artic at 72 to the heater coming on at 73. It also blitzed one side of the room while leaving the other relatively untouched. We had three in our room and every day the cleaning crew took away three coffee mugs and left two new ones.  These are minor grievances but the one that really stood out for me was when two of our party got sick after eating at House of Blues in Downtown Disney. At 1 o'clock in the morning when one was riding waves of nausea and the other puking, there was

We've been to Disney's Grand Californian Hotel 3 years in a row; and this is the only place we would stay for Disneyland.  The location is super convenient to both parks and DownTown Disneyland.  You even have your own entrance to California Adventure inside the hotel.  However, if you don't get there early enough before the Park opens in the morning it can get super crowded.  If it's a really long line, then I would suggest going to the front entrance of California Adventure instead.  There's a viewing area for the World of Color Show on the 6th floor of the DVC Resort section.  However there are a lot of obstructions from that viewing deck.  My kids aged 11 & 8 really enjoyed the several pools, jacuzzi's and 1 water slide.  Also, our kids really liked the rooms with the bunk

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland and the rest of the magic
Summary: Our room was at the very very far end of the hotel so took us a LONG time to walk there because we were in town for the Inaugural Avengers Half Marathon and I'm sure every room was full. Other than that, we liked everything about the hotel, the private entrance to California Adventure, the character breakfast options, the ability to walk to Downtown Disney and both parks, and the theming of the room.

I usually do not stay here because of the crazy prices, but I got a great deal as part of the Anaheim Star Wars Convention (40% off).  Every cast member I came in contact with was friendly and helpful from the valet and bell staff, to the check in desk and housekeeping.  They were all a little chatty and informative, but not intrusive in any way.  The special convention price only includes a standard room, but I was upgraded to a Downtown Disney and Disneyland View which was nice.  The only issue is that the Downtown Disney area is pretty busy and has music playing all day and late into the night.  I requested some earplugs from the front desk which were quickly delivered.    The room was very clean, but of in the need of a little upgrade.  I love the craftsman furniture

Summary Heading: Up Close with Mickey and his friends
Summary: When you are going to the best theme park in the world stay at  their best hotel. Gives you the opportunity to be right next to both Disney parks. You have your own entrance to Disney California Adventure. You get early entrance to both parks. Breakfast with Disney characters right at hotel. All this with Disney flair.

My husband was attending the Disney Institute so I tagged along.  The hotel is lovely. I spent most of my time by the pool enjoying the sunshine that I hadn't seen in Ohio all winter!  The pool gets extremely congested mid to late afternoon.  Take advantage of the early morning hours if you want to relax!  They also offer free power walk and yoga mornings which were fun! I was disappointed in the gift shop.  It is small and lacking.

We won this trip to the hotel on a local radio station... So my review starts off amazingly as I had very little out of pocket expense for this trip. Even if I had paid for the rooms I would still give 5 stars. My only negative comment is that we only stayed 2 nights! The on site "convenience store" white water snacks was perfect for early morning snacks and drinks before the park.  We were upgraded to a room with a queen bed (with the most comfortable bedding we had ever been in) along with bunk beds includinga trundle bed underneath. The kids were in heaven! The view was amazing! As was EVERY cast member we came in contact with. Parking was across the main street in the downtown Disney parking area. It was a quick less than 5 minute walk to and from self parking. The private

Summary Heading: Proximity to Parks is Worth the Price
Summary: My family has stayed here a few times now.  If you are traveling with young children, it is absolutely worth it to stay here.  Being so close to the parks makes it easy to go back for a nap mid day or grab sweatshirts after dinner.  The entrance into California Adventure for hotel guests is great on Magic Mornings.   The common areas of this hotel are beautiful, the character breakfast at Storyteller's Caf√© is good and the pool area is very nice.  A hidden gem for a quick bite is Whitewater Snacks at the end of the property.    The rooms are nicely decorated, but they are starting to show their age.
