There is no resort fee, but parking is steep regardless if you valet or self park.  The staff has always been very nice.

My family (kids are 10 and 12) and I just returned from our fourth or fifth stay at the Grand Californian Hotel. We have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel just to compare and save a little money, but have decided that the location alone makes the Grand Californian worth the price. It is so convenient to be able to walk right out into California Adventure in the morning and pop right on the rides. Plus, it's so centrally located in Downtown Disney: right across from family friendly Mexican and Italian restaurants, and most importantly for us, really close to a Haagen Daaz (frozen yogurt at night by the hotel fire place) and the huge new Statbucks for a quick breakfast in the morning! Besides the amazing location, the Grand Californian has a beautiful ambiance, very warm and cozy,

I have made several trips here.  This hotel never has disappointed my wife and me.  In typical Disney fashion, room was clean.  Lobby was spectacular.  They continue to upgrade the facility.  This year we found they had moved the weight room to a new location and had made it better than it was before.  Plenty of things to do and walking distance to every kind of food you could imagine.

Summary Heading: Went for the standard room this time
Summary: We were in town for the Star Wars Convention and got an unbelievable rate on their standard room compared to a previous visit of getting a suite with a view. As always the staff was exceptionally courteous and helpful with our check in by informing us we never received our refund from our previous reservation (Non-Convention rate) deposit  at the Disneyland Hotel and applied the balance to our room, giving us an overall credit. Our standard room faced the valet & taxi stand but felt it was a lot quieter than our previous room that faced Downtown Disney. You also had a nice view of the Disneyland Hotel.  It was also close to the elevator so it was very convenient. We had a king with a sofa but the sofa seemed a bit worn out, comparable to everything else seeming well kept up.

As an annual passholder, my family and I visit the Disneyland Resort 3-4 times a year. We usually stay at more moderately priced properties to increase the number of visits we can make, but decided to spring for the Grand Californian this time.   It's widely acknowledged that the main draw of the Grand is the location. I can't stress enough how much of a positive effect the proximity to the parks brings to a family trip. Our stress, fatigue, and need for pre-planning was cut by at least 90% knowing that anything we forgot in our room could be quickly and easily retrieved. The other real positive aspect was the staff and customer service; it's what one would expect from a five-star property.   Although the interior common areas such as the lobby and bar are lovely, the rooms seem

This trip was our first to Disneyland and we wanted it to be great.  We've been on two Disney cruises and they are wonderful from the service to the food to the rooms.  We anticipated a similar experience staying on a Disney property and were overall disappointed.    Upon arrival, the check in line was very long and there were just three employees working to get everyone settled.  Eventually, it was our turn, and we were directed to our room.  We paid for a downtown Disney view and, if we craned our necks, that is what we had.  Our direct view was of a large green wall.  We did have an excellent view of the fireworks but those only happen once a day.  The room was dusty and clearly had not been thoroughly cleaned in some time.  The bathrooms should be renovated, the rest of the

The Grand Californian is a beautiful hotel.  The d√©cor is Californian Craftsman it is located at the doors of Disneyland and Disney's California Adventure.  Considering how close you are to a theme park you might think it would be decorated as such. It is not. We stayed for a week only visiting the parks 3 days.  We loved the relaxing pool area, restaurants and lounges.

There are lots of good reviews of the Grand Californian on this site, and I agree with lots of the opinions. I'm going to write a bit about our impressions, but to sum this review up: fantastic location, criminally expensive, absent service, uninspired decor.  The major issue with Disney parks is that there are a myriad of hassles between you and having a good time. Traveling from lodging to park is one of the major issues- and this hotel is in a fantastically great spot. There is an exit from the hotel directly to California Adventure, and another right into Downtown Disney. Within Downtown Disney, you walk a block and you are in Disneyland Park. For someone like myself, who is used to Florida's Disney World- this is absolutely amazing! The whole morning rush to get into the

Summary Heading: WAY overpriced for the quality, but nice stay!
Summary: This was my first stay at the Grand Californian. The lobby was very impressive, it made me think of what a luxury ski chalet would look like if constructed in the Arts and Crafts style. Of course I loved the Disney-themed details incorporated into the hotel! All in all it was a lovely stay. Our room was comfortable and clean and looked out onto the peaceful tree-filled courtyard.  Quite honestly, my only complaint was the price. The price ($600 a night???) is appalling for the one-step-above-Holiday-Inn quality of the rooms, but then 80% of what you're paying for is to be in downtown Disney. So, understandable, but I would definitely recommend splitting the cost with as many people as the room allows.

My children and I have stayed at the Grand Californian 3 times now for varying amounts of time, and we are going again this weekend.  I have nothing but compliments to give each time, the staff is very welcoming and the rooms are comfortable.  You may end up paying more than you could at a local hotel, but this facility is worth the money for the pure magic you feel by being there.  The access to the parks and shopping centers is phenomenal and the time you save in convenience is worth far more than the money spent.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone that can afford the stay.

Summary Heading: Nice but not worth the Money.
Summary: Stayed here for an anniversary trip. The hotel is gorgeous the lobby is stunning, the service is top notch, and with all that in mind the room was just another king bed hotel room. The lay out was no different than any other hotel room. Walk in the door closet/storage area on the left bathroom on the right and straight ahead was the bed dresser and TV. Yeah all the furniture was real wood. The bedding and linens were nothing to write home about. The bathroom wasn't any better than what I have at home standard tub and shower combo. Bed was comfy pillows were ok. That same room any other hotel off site would be a quarter of the price. So be advised what you are paying for is the location and the convenience. No thing is free. No complimentary breakfast. The breakfast buffet

Summary Heading: Overpriced for a hotel that can't guarantee room layout and too loud at night
Summary: This was probably my family's 5th trip to the Grand Californian, and by far the worst stay.  For starters, I find it crazy that the hotel cannot guarantee a specific room layout.  For a hotel with an unheard of 30 day cancellation policy, you would think that they could guarantee whether your room has 2 queen beds or one king bed for example.  We booked a one bedroom suite in February, confirmed that the suite would have two queen beds in early March (and were told it was "no problem"), and when we checked in to the hotel over 30 days later, we were told the room had only one king bed, and a (very uncomfortable and small) pull out sofa in the living area.  Suboptimal for a family of 4.  We explained that we needed the living area to be a living area so that my husband could work

Summary Heading: Beautiful Hotel!  Disney at its finest!
Summary: We have stayed at a couple other Disney properties in Florida and this one is much nicer.  The rooms are clean, updated, and modern.  The pools were large and the poolside service was a plus.  The proximity of this hotel to the two parks is what sets it apart from the others.  Pricey but nice!  Would probably come back if I were to visit Disneyland again.

20 + trip WDW veteran mostly staying at the Grand Floridian. Our first trip to Disneyland (which was awesome), a bit skeptical based upon reviews I had read here.  Arrived, at 300 check in our room was ready, cast member knowledgeable and genuinely pleasant at check in. Valet and bell service no issue. Booked a woods view, asked for top floor, received and got a nice view overlooking the pool and a glimpse of California Adventure ( cars land really cool, Aladdin show fun and Carthay Circle restaurant a really good in park eatery).  Rooms were well maintained, service twice daily fine. We had just arrived from 3 nights at the Hotel Bel Air. I think those expecting that level of luxury at a Disney hotel are unrealistic. Perhaps the bedding and towels could be a bit finer and sure

Summary Heading: perfect location for Disney and the service you'd expect
Summary: Its a disney hotel, so you know the service is going to be A1. We've stayed at many different Disney resorts in Orlando over the years and our expectations were well and truly met at the Grand Californian.  The location is perfect for the parks with its own entrance (we didn't venture off Disney property) and meant we could come back to the hotel for a rest within a few minutes when we felt like one.  We had a standard view room so weren't expecting much but we could see Downtown disney and the entrances to the parks (and the back end of Soarin') from our balcony and the Magic Kingdom fireworks at night so we were more than pleased with the view out the window!  No idea how price compares to other hotels in the area (its LA so you could get a non-Disney hotel a stones throw

I stayed here end of Feb-beginning March for Dapper days. Beforehand I requested a room near the elevator and  courtyard view. When I got there I got just a standard view and wasn't able to get the courtyard view, I think it was because of the special event and many guests had booked this hotel.  I was tired from my travels so I didn't put up a fuss about not getting my room I wanted. I was kinda disappointed this trip I didn't feel the disney magic like I did when I stayed here in 2009. The staff were not rude, I just feel like they didn't go out of their way to be as welcoming as they were years ago.  I mainly stayed here because of the convenience but really one area of the park was closed so it wasn't really all that easy to hop between the two parks like I had on previous

Summary Heading: Will not go bak to Disney Grand Californian!!
Summary: I stayed at the Grand Californian with my daughter two grandkids and my son. The hotel is run down and the rooms show lots of wear and tear and age. The customer service responses to problems were memorized lines with zero sincerity. They advertise wifi in the lobby and in rooms, but it did not work once our entire four night stay. At least five people in management came in our room to try and fix the problem. One manager even had the nerve to say they do not guarantee wifi in the room. It is in all of their printed materials. Bathrooms were dirty after they had been cleaned. Carpets in rooms are dirty. My white socks were dirty in less that ten minutes! The heating/cooling system must always run or the rooms are too hot. When it runs it is noisy! Requested turn down service and

If you want all the benefits of a motel for the price of a room at the Mandarin Oriental, this is the hotel for you.  Location and service is great (and rooms are clean), but the d√©cor and room/bathroom size feel just like a motel.  To get a bottle of water you have to go down the hall and pay $3 to a vending machine.  TV small and fuzzy, and phone did not work properly.  Food at Storytellers is abysmal ($30/person for buffet consisting of 4 soggy items).  No Chip at Chip & Dale breakfast, etc.

Summary Heading: Great space, restaurants and service. GREAT park access.
Summary: We went with kids and grandkids, eight people total. The lobby is lovely, Napa Rose is a very nice restaurant and the grandkids LOVED the pools and slides. Best of all, when our six year old granddaughter (and I) needed naps in the afternoon we were just a short walk away. Is it expensive? Yes. Is it worth the money? We thought so. You have to remember that you are in California AND at Disney. Neither come on the cheap.

You are definitely paying for your location here which is very convenient ! Great to be able to enter the park directly from the hotel! The hotel itself is nothing special but of a Better standard than the other Disney hotels. The rooms are very basic and old fashioned but clean and sufficient for the minimal time we spent in our rooms. We did stay in a suite at the Disneyland Hotel one year ago and thought at the time it was very basic for what you pay. But now would recommend the Californian over that. You really do just have to suck it up and expect to be ripped off at Disney honestly , it's all expensive but it's worth it for a few days.  The staff are mostly accomodating and helpful, food sometimes good sometimes atrocious!  The parks are so organised and the kids love it

It was everything I expected from a Disney resort. The bunk beds and pools where a huge hit with my boys. The restaurants where fantastic, especially the Napa Rose. The Extra Magic hour at the Disneyland and California Adventure was a nice touch. Lastly, the location made it very easy to enjoy the entire resort and take breaks when needed.

I stayed here with my family in mid March in a Premium View room.  The room was comfortable and clean although not huge. It was certainly fine for us.   The lobby and hotel grounds are beautiful and resemble a grand lodge. Staff were courteous and helpful and professional.  Breakfast with Chip and Dale and dinner at Storyteller's Cafe was terrific, the food and service all lovely.  The main advantage is the hotel's proximity to Downtown Disney and both parks. Just perfect for small children and tired parents. The private entrance to Californian Adventure is fantastic!   I would've given it 5 stars except my husbands ipad went missing on the first day. We think he put it down in the gift shop by accident to pick up some things to purchase and someone picked it up after we left,

Stayed here a few years ago, but would like to say, like any other Disney Resort, this was a great stay!  They definitely go out of their way to make you feel special.  Disney always does it right from the value resorts to the the 5 star resorts.  Would splurge again to stay here.  Great entrance to California Adventure, awesome lobby.

Summary Heading: Service is really suffering. I hope Disney can turn this around.
Summary: We go to Disney every year for a long weekend. Two adults, no kids. And we always stay in the Grand Californian, mostly because the location simply cannot be beat. I've reviewed the hotel before on Tripadvisor. The summary being: you pay for convenience and location, but the rest of the hotel is pretty mediocre. The rooms are shabby. The sound-proofing is abysmal. The pool area is too small and there is no 'quiet' area.   Normally, however, the food has been a highlight and so was the service. And then we attended the hotel last week.   Our park-going schedule is pretty normal: wake up at 6:30, leave the hotel early. Be in the parks until about 3pm and then go back to the hotel for two hours for a nap. Then back into the parks from 5 until 11 or so.  Despite being gone from our

I have stayed at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel many times, and have loved each stay! It is a beautiful hotel, the staff are fantastic, and the location can not be beat! Yes it is expensive, but location location location! It will save your feat a lot of extra walking! And the private hotel entrance into the California adventure park is nicely situated right next to the grizzly river run, so you can go back to your room and clean up if you get a little to soaked! We had a room looking over the pool this time, so relaxing to sit on our room balcony at night!

Staying at the Grand Californian is a bucket list must! Upscale, and extremely convenient, you'll love being steps from everything. Great rooms, great pool, and a great bar. We did not want for anything. Our room overlooked Downtown Disney and we could see the fireworks from our balcony...bonus!!

This is our family's third stay at the Grand Californian Hotel.  We've stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and Paradise Pier (once each) as well.  In terms of accommodations, the property itself is beautiful (especially the lobby), but the rooms are smallish and quite ordinary, especially for the price.  The Disneyland Hotel has nicer, more spacious rooms, and the kids generally prefer its more contemporary and themed design.  The Paradise Pier is inferior to both, but is a good value.  The kids like all three, but ultimately prefer the Grand Californian for its proximity and convenience.  Simply put, the convenience and location of this hotel cannot be beat.  With two good restaurants on property (Napa Rose and Storytellers), a private entrance into California Adventure, and its

My family and I also stayed here 4 years ago.  Not much has changed.  We requested the bunk beds and got them this time.  The bunk beds also have a trundle bed underneath them if you have 3 kids (or yours aren't old enough for the top bunk).  The rooms are not big, but there is a small refrigerator and our room was clean and tastefully decorated in the arts and crafts/Disney style.  You are paying for location here.  This hotel is right next to California Adventure (with its own private entrance) and less than a 5 minute walk to the Disneyland (aka Disneyworld's Magic Kingdom) entrance.  Downtown Disney is also right next to this hotel.  When you stay in a Disney owned hotel you can go into the parks an hour early (aka Magic Mornings).  It is definitely worth it because the

Summary Heading: THE Way to experience Disney Land Resort
Summary: Spent half my Spring Break here with family of four (10 year old and 6 year old).  Hotel is definitely a premium, but if this is within your budget, it is THE way to experience Disneyland.  Pros:  1.  Location.  You have direct access to California Adventureland, a very short walk to Disneyland and in the heart of Downtown Disney.  2.  Pools.  The pools provide a wonderful retreat from the amusement parks.  3.  Staff.  As you would expect from Disney, the staff was awesome.  4.  Decor.  I love the Arts and Crafts and this is Arts and Crafts on steroids.  Because this is Disney, it seems like fake Arts and Crafts, but I still loved it.  5.  Room.  Room was clean and comfortable.  Bathroom was very nice.  Cons:  1.  Can't think of any.    When you are staying at Disney, you should

We enjoyed our stay. The primary reason we stayed here was for the entrance into the park from the hotel....however that entrance had a HUGE line at opening. We ended up going through the front park entrances.  The hotel itself is great, however our regular 2 queen room was average. It would have been nice to be in a bigger space, but it was sold out unfortunately.  Overall, it would have been just as convenient to stay at the other disney properties...and probably a tad cheaper.

Summary Heading: Heard great things about this hotel, but the rooms are small for the high costs
Summary: It is a nice property and the location is outstanding. With that said, our room was very cramped for 2 adults and 2 small children. Stayed just 1 night before moving over to the Howard Johnson's for less then half the cost of the Californian and the rooms were significantly larger.

Summary Heading: Made A Great Trip Even Better
Summary: This place is fantastic and made our trip so much easier and enjoyable. We were only here one night, but even the kids felt it was some place special.   From the moment you drive on to the property the pampering begins. The lady at the front gate greeted us warmly and called us by name. When we arrived at the valet the bellman was there to open car doors and help us with bags.   The reception desk was a dream. Friendly and competent. They even drew our kids into the conversation. The man helping us took one look at our two boys and knew we needed those bunk beds that were pictured on the web and a room that was ready even though it was 6 am during Spring Break. We really appreciated the attention to details.   The lobby itself lives up to the hotel's grand name. Furnishings are

Summary Heading: Wonderful location but small rooms and avg. svc.
Summary: This is the second time we have visited the Grand Californian.  Hoping things would be better this time.  Not.  You really need to be drinking the "Disney Kool-Aid" to be able to stomach the cost of staying there, the small rooms and the "fake smile" service givers are just out of line.  I don't want to sound too bitter but enough is enough.  We made our reservation 3 mos. ago and specifically requested a King bed.  Upon our arrival, we were informed they didn't have any available.  We were also told the reason why is that. "Its a family oriented hotel and only 10% of the rooms were equipped with King beds.  Well that equates to almost 100 rooms with King beds!  You'd think they could figure out how to accommodate you while charging you almost $500 per night for the privilege of

Summary Heading: Beautiful property however, over priced for what it really is.
Summary: We have stayed here at least 3 different times and each time we always say to each other "that was way too expensive". However, if you want outstanding customer service, a clean nice room and entrance to the park this is for you. You will pay through the nose though so brace yourself when you receive the bill! One thing to note, on our last trip in Feb. 2015 the room needed some attention such as the "cold" label was missing from the sink faucet and the toilet looked like it needed to be replaced..ick. Also the view we had was of the courtyard and other building roofs so we saw a lot of trash on the roofs and in the gutters. In our opinion, this would be unacceptable by Walt's standards. I would think the room service cleaning crews would see this and notify building maintenance.

Great service, very helpful staff, stayed in the 2-queen room with balcony to the courtyard (though we were close to the monorail we didn't find it too noisy); hotel takes you right out to the Adventureland park, so very easily accessible to parks; food (buffet) was excellent at the Storytellers Caf√© and in  Disneyland Park at the Plaza Inn.

This hotel has by far the BEST customer service I have ever experienced.  From the moment you get there, it is 5 star service all the way.  The employees were excellent.  Everyone was very knowledgeable and eager to help.  I cannot say enough about the location.  You wake up and walk directly into California Adventure Park.  It is also in Downtown Disney.  Steps away from restaurants, shops, and Disneyland.  This is invaluable if you have small children who need naps in the middle of the day.  Location is so great we did not use our rental car for the entire trip, so think of saving the money on the rental car and just catch a shuttle.  Valet parking is $25 per night, self park is $17 but far away.  The rooms are ok, we paid for an upgrade to the Downtown Disney/Park view.  It

We booked a two night stay in a Double Queen standard room at the Grand Californian Hotel. We are So Cal locals and over the years have stayed overnight at the local Harbor Boulevard motels, the Disneyland Hotel and the Paradise Pier Hotel. This was our third stay in the hotel and while we prefer the Disney Vacation Club Villas, they were booked. The public areas of this hotel really make it feel like you are at a resort, even though you are in the heart of crowded Orange County.   The "standard" rooms are located in parts of the hotel that have uninteresting views out the balcony.  Our last visit was overlooking the interior courtyard where the monorail rushes through.  This most recent visit, our 6th floor view faced the Disneyland Hotel and overlooked the drive where the

We had a convention here in March 2015.  I was expecting the usual convention hotel but this greatly exceeded expectations.  The lobby is amazing.  I know it's Disney Magic, but to the untrained eye it does look like a lodge in a National Park.  Staff was incredibly friendly.  Room was decent sized and the bed was very comfortable.  The hotel is right next to Downtown Disney, which opened up a lot of dining options.  We ate at the Jazz Kitchen (New Orleans theme) and Catal; their Spanish restaurant.  Both were very good but pricey.    Convention facilities were fine for our size of group (~300).  Conference rooms were clean, noise from adjacent sessions was minimal, and the lunch catering was very good.  I would stay here again, whether on business or a family trip.

Summary Heading: Great visit to DL - cannot beat this location!
Summary: Hi - we recently stayed the the GC - we had a party of 10 and we had a 3 bedroom suite (really, just 3 adjoining bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, and a living room)...but it was great. We were not in the room very much - usually a afternoon rest/pool visit and to bed early after long days at the parks. While this hotel cost us a fortune, it was worth it with 4 young kids, magic morning access, access to Downtown Disney, and the proximity to the parks. I really don't know why people complain that it's dated - I thought it was fine and nothing stood out to me that said "wow, they have some work to do here". The lobby is very impressive as many have stated before, and the service was great. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were clean and we felt right at home.  If you want

Our room was basic but the hotel itself is beautiful. The service is excellent, we were able to check into our room fairly early in the day and the day that we checked out, they held our luggage so that we could spend the whole day in the park. The location is convenient with easy access to both parks and Downtown disney. We enjoyed the pool inspite of the fact that construction was going on. As a guest of the hotel we were allowed early entrance into the park which was nice but a bit early.

2nd time staying here. 1st the good. Great location, clean, helpful staff. Now the bad. 2 out of 3 pools closed during my stay. The "magic hour" early entry is NOT worth the extra money. Count on MAYBE 1 extra ride and the ride you want will not be open early. This has happened during all 4 of our early entries. This place is very expensive and NOT worth the extra cash. Rides closed during our 3 day visit. Soaring over California , tower of terror, the bear raft ride, bumper cars, Matterhorn , splash mountain, entire critter country, Indiana jones for part of 2 days,. You will go to Disneyland anyway no matter what I say. Don't pay the extra to stay here. Good news is that no sales or food stands were closed for renovation so you can spend your time in line here instead of the

The customer service is top notch, from checking in to getting help with your baggage, it was no exception this time. I've stayed in the hotel before so when the hotel clerk was checking me in and said I had an upgraded room I was happy but I've stayed in bigger, nicer rooms so this one was disappointing in that you except the same if not better. It wasn't bad, it was clean, had all the necessary items if not more like a baby crib, didn't need it thank god and a view of the matterhorn. It was very comfortable and quiet on the 3rd floor.

My husband and I thought it would be "grand" to stay in this resort with our 9 yr old as a surprise for her over spring break.  It wasn't.  It certainly was NOT worth the money spent.  It is a standard hotel room with a 5 Star price.   The lobby bar was packed and service was SLOW even though my husband sat AT the bar.  The one bartender was too swamped to care for all patrons in a timely manner. The bar-back did not have the authority to crack open a beer bottle nor did he have the inclination to inform the bartender that a patron had been waiting a very long time for service. I caught (and squished...GO ME) a spider the size of a nickel crawling up the side of my bed sheet as I lay reading before lights out.  GROSS.  I called the front desk to inform them and, while they did

This is a great hotel, especially if you are planning to spend time within the parks.  Housekeeping did a fantastic job on a slammed weekend (we unknowingly planned our trip on the same weekend as the Star Wars marathon).  There were a lot of nice touches that you would come to expect from a hotel at Disneyland... we arrived early and while the room was not ready, we were given keys and the option to store luggage, and received a text later with the room number.  It was nice to not have to return to the desk after roaming the parks all day.  I also found the foot lotion in the bathroom amenities both amusing and practical.  The rooms are very well appointed, and the front desk agent who checked us in was very sweet and tried to accommodate our bed type request.  Occupancy made

Expensive hotel, dated & small rooms, crappy Internet (kids sat out in foyer when needed), great location with access to cal advent land on-site, great check in staff.  Issue- this was our first stop in USA hotel & as Aussies were unsure about tipping procedure - when valet took our car, son was away from us smoking & saw guy chucking our suitcases & heard him saying uncomplimentary things about us. He didn't tell us this straight away as he would have been embarrassed about complaining- I wrote to Disney after & never got response.... Lesson learnt, tip valet when takes keys :)

Summary Heading: Nice enough hotel. Great location. Don't stay in 5022! Staff don't give a hoot.
Summary: Nice d√©cor. Small swimming pools. Excellent check-in. Amenities like the giant projector screen and small TV viewing area for the little ones are nice touches. I thought we lucked out to get a room on the 5th floor. BUT, above us was the Concierge level and the lounge. We were not informed of that when we checked in. First night, there was some noise at 10:40. Didn't disturb us much. But the second night, the furniture was being dragged across the floor, stuff was being thrown down. One bump was so hard that it rattled the night lights above my bed. At this point, we didn't know it was a lounge. We thought it was a rowdy guest. A quick call to Front Desk stopped that somewhat. But at 6:30, it started up again. Metal screeching on the floor as chairs are dragged across the room.

Summary Heading: Nice, clean and very close to everything!
Summary: Every cast member I came into contact with went above and beyond helpful. Friendly, funny, knowledgable. Large clean rooms, great water pressure in the shower, nice beds and a balcony. A tad pricey but with an exits directly into California Adventure and Downtown Disney, it's well worth it. Hotel will also store your luggage until midnight the day you check out. Will def recommend and hope to stay there again. Thanks for a great stay!

One of our princess' was a little car sick on the cae ride to the hotel. We arrived at hotel around noon. We asked Billy at front desk if he could get us into a room early so our princess could get cleaned up. He not only got us right into rooms, he upgraded  us. He must of seen the stress in our faces. Right then and there we new we made the best choice in hotel. The rooms were great! The kids loved the pool area. Everything within walking distance. We used the laundry service which also help save our day.  Loved the turn down service at night! It was a magical stay!

We enjoy this hotel so much that we return here on every trip to Disneyland. You can't beat the convenience/location to Disneyland, downtown Disney and the California adventure park.  Their rooms are nice but I think the decor needs to be updated/refreshed.

Summary Heading: Be Part of the California Adventure!
Summary: There are plenty of great places to stay on or near the Disneyland and California Adventure parks, but you just can't beat the Grand Californian if you want to be totally immersed in the Disney experience. Being able to walk right up to Grizzly River Run at 8 a.m. and beat the crowds to the other rides in the park helps justify the expense of the GC. The beautiful lodge and grounds do the rest. The GC is reminiscent of mountain lodges like Timberline at Mt. Hood in Oregon. The service is great. The rooms are nice, but not outstanding. The bunk beds with the trundle are a fun feature. The pool area is wonderful but can get crowded--stake out your lounge chairs early. All in all, the Grand Californian is part of the ideal Disneyland vacation.

Summary Heading: Beautiful and right in the heart of Disneyland
Summary: This was our fourth visit to Disneyland and we have stayed at some really nice off-property hotels so we knew this would be special. I must admit that after staying at the Disney World resorts, the Grand Californian seems a little worn and old. The hotel is however, beautiful and located in Disney's California Adventure park. It was great being able to go back to the hotel for a swim and then back to the parks so easily. We were a little disappointed with our room allocation though. We requested a Theme Park view which ended up being a view of the trees outside our room. My sister was on the 5th floor with a Theme Park view and it was amazing. After mentioning this to staff they moved us to the 6th floor 2 bedroom villa. This was the best room with the most amazing view of

Just stayed here for the first time with our children and grandkids for 4 nights. Stayed in more places than I can count over the years of visits so here's our impressions:  Upsides: CONVIENCE. No hazzle of getting to the park, returning to the room or pool for a break in the middle of the day, finding a variety of places to eat, etc. 100% FAMILY FRIENDLY for every member from baby to grandpa:  pak'n'plays in every room, full bar, spa, sound-proof rooms, room service,  life vests at pool, spacious & quiet seating areas available throughout property. STAFF: every single employee is knowledgable and eager to help meet your every need.   Downsides: EXPENSIVE. You pay more to stay here than anywhere in the area. Disneyland Hotel is a better value with just a tad more walking. FOOD

Summary Heading: Nice on the outside not so nice on the inside
Summary: We've been to Disneyland a few times now and everytime we pass the Grand Californian we think we should stay there one day. That's because it's so grand on the outside and in the lobby. And then we got to our room.  We wished we were back at the Holiday Inn where we've stayed before. It might not be on park but it was much better value for money and the quality of fittings were equal.  Yep. This will be the last time we pay the hefty rate to stay here, even if it is on site. So disappointing Disney.  Insert sad face.

We stayed at the Grand Californian for the first time for three nights.  It was outrageously expensive-about $650/night. The hotel was ok-rooms were nothing special. Cheap coffee in the rooms and small bathrooms.  As an avid traveler for work, any Hilton I've stayed at was definitely nicer. BUT...the convenience of the hotel was unmatched. We have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel multiple times, and although it is nicer than the GC, the walk to and from the parks is a lot, especially for little ones. I cannot say how easy it was to run back to the hotel to rest, get a sweater, etc.  No long entrance lines because the hotel has private entrance into California Adventure! Overall, I rated the hotel very good for the convenience. If the rating was soley based on the rooms and

first off I'm a Disney fan and this is not a Disney World hotel. That being said the Grand Californian is fantastic, outstanding customer service. Sure the price is high (average rate is $350) welcome to California, but between the location and exceptional service it is worth a stay. The spa is small but not crowded at all, I was the only one there for a short while. You have tons of choices for food since Downtown Disney is connected to the hotel. The lobby is beautiful, activities for the kids and a fun pool and staying here gets you early admission to the parks which is well worth it!

Summary Heading: Beautiful, Perfect location, but very expensive
Summary: We have stayed at all the Disneyland on-property hotels and this one is the most beautiful.  The lobby is breath-taking, the service is wonderful, and the amenities are very nice.  We love the pool & hot tubs, and the restaurants are great.  The best thing about it, though, is the location -- you are literally inside Disney's California Adventure and can walk everywhere without worrying about sore feet.  The only negative is that the rooms are average sized and super expensive.  For the price, you could stay in the lap of luxury elsewhere.  It all comes down to how much location and convenience are worth.

We have stayed at various Disney resorts and this would be our favourite so far.  The location is fantastic - both in terms of access to the parks and Downtown Disney.  The lobby is magnificent and the Disney 'cast members' as welcoming and warm as ever.  Our room was spacious and clean.  We had a king sized, comfortable bed and our daughter slept on the pull out sofa bed in the lounge area.  There was plenty of room and everything worked satisfactorily.  The rooms were serviced promptly and efficiently.  We did not use any of the hotel restaurants as we only had a 3 day stay and used that time in the parks.  We did use the self service laundry - easy to access and use.  And we did need to use the chargeback facilities from park to hotel.  The Internet access was quick.  My only

Summary Heading: Great location, great service, & beautiful hotel
Summary: We really enjoyed our time here. There is no shortage of events and thoughtful amenities for families. We found it is really worth it/best use of time & energy to not have to walk or ride a shuttle with two young children, when you do a tremendous amount of walking in the parks. Room service, buffet-style breakfast with Chip & Dale (no long wait for food), quick park access & exit, easy to stop back at hotel to rest or take a nap. Also found the decor of the hotel to be beautiful and iconic. We were there when the Christmas decorations were up and it was magical for the kids. Would absolutely return, hopefully soon!

Summary Heading: The Grand is like staying in a cabin, but more comfortable!
Summary: Love staying at the Grand. The staff is the best around, the rooms are always clean, the guest are even friendly when passing in the halls (must be the Disney magic). I also like that the rooms have balconies...a great place to relax.  The Grand is the closest of the Disney Resort Hotels to the parks. You can even enter Disney California Adventure from this hotel via an entrance on the east side of property.  Every room has a great view...from Downtown Disney, the monorail track, the pools, or the view of DCA, there is no bad room choice. There are two full service restaurants, a lounge, and take out food service. You also have all the food choices at Downtown Disney just a few steps away!  There is an in house lounge, The Hearthstone, two full service restaurants, and a

Just checked in and they placed us on a lower standard view room; if you like to sit outside and look at a fake wall with a playground behind the wall, go ahead and book the room.  If you want any type of semblance of relaxation go somewhere else for the price or points you will be using.

Breakfast with Chip & Dale was so much fun! Not sure if the kids or I enjoyed it more :). The hotel is great, location is great (back entrance into Adventure), food is great, service is great - it deserves a 5. Are there better hotels in the world - of course. But this one is very good and best in the area.

The location can't be beat!  On Disney property.  Great restaurants, great amenities.  My kids love the movies at night and the fireside stories with chocolate!  The only reason I did not give them 5 stars is because the mattresses are not a five star hotel experience.  Need to know --no roll-a-ways but they offer sleeping bags for the extra kids---so it's better to just get a big bed for mommy and daddy since the kids all want those sleeping bags!  Don't miss chip and Dale's breakfast.  Make reservations for Napa Rose as soon as you think about visiting Disney!  Child care is awesome.  My kids just loved the childcare center.  Worth every penny!

Summary Heading: Come for the convenience! Stay for the convenience!
Summary: First off, nothing beats the convenience of the hotel. Right on the Disney property, Downtown Disney for all your morning coffee and meals needs.   Also, the service from check in was probably some of the best I've ever seen in all my travels. Lots of people to greet you, show you where to go, how to get place, and all extremely friendly (in true Disney fashion).   What I didn't like about the hotel were the little things. Internet was spotty (keeps disconnecting), the hotel blasts the AC in the common areas, and the rooms are very dated (nice, but dated). For pricing on the high end of Anaheim, I would expect this type of stuff to be impeccable.   I'm in Anaheim every year and have stayed at the Hilton, Sheraton, Disneyland Hotel and this one, but the the price, convenience and

Summary Heading: Disneyland vs Disneyworld, both a great
Summary: Decided to mix up our annual family trek to Orlando by heading out West.  Of the 3 Disneyland hotels this was by far the nicest and most unique.  What a great job Disney did with huge lobby.  Think Wilderness Lodge in Orlando, but better.  The rooms were just as you'd expect if you've ever stayed in Disney accommodations.  We even had a bunk bed for the kids!  Unlike Orlando, Disneyland is literally wedged into Anaheim (not a complaint, merely factual observation).  Everything from the Magic Kingdom to Downtown Disney and California Adventure are "compact" and all right next to each other.  At first I was concerned we'd be bored after a week, but it was actually kind of nice to be able to walk everywhere and get from park to park in minutes.  The hotel has it's own private

Summary Heading: Beautiful Lodging, not for Budget Conscience
Summary: This place is obviously going to be beautiful and magical, its a Disney Hotel.  The staff does go out of their way to make your family feel special.  It is like a huge log cabin that you get to sleep in.  On certain days, you can get into the parks an hour earlier and if you had a long day, the hotel is only a short distance.  If your family is budget conscience AND plan to spend most of the days at the park then I would not recommend.  You don't get to enjoy the beauty of hotel if you aren't even there.  The rooms are very comfy too.  You would think it would be loud but it is surprisingly quiet.

Summary Heading: If feeling like you are getting ripped off bugs you, stay elsewhere
Summary: Sure, this is the closest you can stay to California Adventure.  Yes, the lobby is beautiful. Yes, you will have a comfortable room that is good for your family.  Uh huh,  being in Downtown Disney is fun.  But, if you don't like that nagging feeling that you are wasting your money, don't stay here.  My husband, boys (9 and 11), parents and myself stayed here and while we had a great trip, our experience in this hotel wasn't worth the cost. When forking out that much more money for a hotel room, I expect the service of the hotel to be great.  We didn't find that to be the case.  If you want to stay at a Disney property, The Disneyland Hotel is a better deal.  We found the service there to be average just like the GC, but the rooms are cheaper and the pool just as good.

Summary Heading: For half the money you can stay at the real Ahwahnee Hotel...
Summary: First time staying at this obvious ripoff (in more ways than one) of the Ahwahnee Hotel in Yosemite.  Having stayed at the Ahwahnee many times, this is not it.  Other than the overdone attempt to copy the great room and lobby the resemblance ends there.  We paid a premium for a park view room.  The view consisted of trees blocking any view of the park and the gangbanger smoking dope on balcony next door.  The room itself could have been in any Motel 6 with  15 year old technology,  offering nothing at all special. Then of course there were the jackhammers at 6 am, as most of the rides around the hotel were closed for renovation.  And as an added bonus,  when we tried to enjoy our balcony, we realized that directly below our room was where the park employees gathered for their

Our two favorite things about this hotel are the pool, which we spent the first afternoon and an afternoon break the following day to cool off from being in the park. Love it!! Second favorite was the easy private access into the California Adventure park!   Warning, for dinner walk out to Downtown Disney to find a great restaurant. The Hotel choices were poor, expensive and not very good!!  The Hotel price is expensive, but a great location to everything. Its a very nice and comfortable hotel.

I have been to Disneyland many times over the years. We have had good and bad experiences on our trips, usually attributed to the hotels. Disneyland and California Adventure have always been a good experience. Disney's Grand Californian was a disappointment for us. The hotels common areas were very nice, but when we got to our rooms, it was a whole different story. We found the rooms to be small and dirty. The carpets were stained. The furniture was very dusty. You could spell your name in the dust on furniture above 5 feet in height. One of the sinks in room #4114 was cracked from one end to the other, and looked like it had been that way for some time. The granite was stained and faded around the faucets. I accidently spilled a soda on the bed the first day we were there and

We stayed 3 nights at this hotel. It was beautiful! My 5 year old daughter loved the pool and water slide. The location to the parks and downtown Disney was a major bonus. Our room was very nice. Not one complaint.

The service and convenience was spectacular! Yes it is pricey, but we stayed in January when they had discounted rates, so awesome to experience at least once.  The pool was a blast for my kids, and my husband and I were able to lounge around at the pool relaxing.  Best thing is the friendliness of staff and the convenience. We used the valet parking and they held our bags at the bellhop on the day we checked out... after a LONG tiring day at both Disney parks and a 2+ hour drive home ahead of us - it only took one call to the hotel and by the time we walked from the park to the hotel our bags & car were ready at the front, then loaded for us and we were on our way! We LOVED staying here!

Great hotel and fantastic location. Many would say it is worth any price to be connected to the park. It's not luxurious. It's a family hotel and it does that job well. I mean we are in Disneyland! The character restaurant experience was fun and food was good. Great pool. The bed in our small room was a pull out and was extremely uncomfortable but I'm sure that's an exception to what most of the rooms offer.

I'm aware that the location is great. It's walking distance from any of the great Disney landmarks, and that's what really made the price worth it. We could stay as long as we wanted in Disneyland without worrying that the shuttles were going to leave without us, because guess what? Our hotel was right next door.  Nevertheless, excluding the location, I was a bit disappointed by the rooms. The lobby was beautiful, but personally, I believe that it set expectations up too high. I was expecting our rooms to have the same grandeur as the lobby did, but alas, it didn't. And I'd really like to say that it could all be forgiven because of the stellar location, but I can't, because this is quite possibly one of the most expensive hotels I've stayed at that haven't exceeded the "decent"

The initial impression is stunning as this hotel has a very grand entrance with a huge Great Hall. The decor in the common areas is tasteful and masculine without being overly so, or littered with animal carcases like so many other "lodge-inspired" locations go for.   We arrived at exactly 3 pm, which is check-in time and were told that our room was not yet ready and that we'd be sent a text when it was or we could check back in every so often if we preferred. We waited... and waited... and waited some more. We went back up to the front desk two additional times trying to get more information on what was taking so long or to get changed to a different room that was available and... nothing. There's a strange thing that we witnessed with all the front desk staff when they didn't

This is an excellent hotel, excellent service and very close proximity to the Disneyland and California Parks. Very kid-friendly, rent-a-car on site, clean, swimming pool towels in the halls for use, great on-time room service and very cordial and professional staff. The Great hall spectacular designed after Yosemite National Lodge. Very impressive. We had three children ages 6, 5 and 2 along with 2 grandparents, and three aunts and everyone said it was a perfect vacation and much of the credit should go to the hotel. We'll be back!

The Disney Grand Californian is designed to have the feel of an old, lamp-lit hunting lodge.  I disagree with some reviewers who say it is "dark" inside.  It it more "cabin cozy" than dark.  We did self-park which was adequate and extremely convenient.  I did wish, as have many other reviewers, that there was EV charging.  I even brought my charger from home, but they just couldn't manage it unless I did valet parking.  The room was very clean, and I had no complaints about the age of the carpet or any other such stuff.  True to form, the cast members were attentive and helpful and the "waiting to get late check out" experience was 5 minutes.  Even more than Disney normal, the staff was expedient and efficient and made me feel attended and not rushed through.  I especially liked

I stayed here during my first visit to Disneyland, so I wasn't in the room very much.  However, the room was beautiful, very clean, had a nice assortment of bath products, and has lovely pools.  The lobby is very nice, with dark wood and a cozy fireplace.  The one problem I had was finding my room every time I was only my way back from the park.  I found the layout a bit confusing.  A friend payed for my stay, so I'm unable to say how pricey the rooms are.

Summary Heading: You expect the "DISNEY" Experience... but its not in this hotel!
Summary: Went to this hotel on a business convention, however 80% of it was spent relaxing and enjoying the wonderful parks, Disney is known for.   You always hear people talk about the "Disney Experience" but really, that is truly in the parks, not in this hotel!!   The Good  The location was great for walking down town Disney and getting through the parks.  The pool was very nice and lively The beds are sooooo comfy!  THATS IT!  The Bad  This hotel was extremely dated!!! By dated I mean, old dirty looking rugs in the rooms, coaches that had 70's carpet upholstery, I wouldn't even lay my clothes on them!!  The room was small The bathroom, even smaller!! Right out of the 70's There wasn't a Mickey decoration or nothing to be found... Didn't even look like a Disney Hotel room.  The

Summary Heading: What are you paying for when you stay here?
Summary: As a group of 7 people, we wanted to ensure we had the best Disney experience possible - which for us meant "Magic Hour", the Storyteller's breakfast, along with a easy access throughout the day (in case we wanted to come back to the hotel).  Our advice?  SAVE YOUR MONEY.  Any of the hotels onsite offer Magic Hour - and what we learned is that the Disney staff walks the front gate crowds to meet up with the hotel crowds - so nobody gets an advantage.  This means that if you are staying at the Disneyland Hotel (paying half the price) - you will have the same early access as those guests in the Grand California.  The Storyteller's breakfast wasn't worth the money (over $240 for 5 adults and 2 children).  The line for the buffet took 20 minutes to snake through, the characters were

We spent the last week of February at Disneyland and stayed at the Grand Californian Hotel and Spa.  We love this hotel.  When you first walk in, you are welcomed into the Great Hall.  Tall ceilings, tables, couches and comfortable chairs dotting the hall, a cozy fireplace with rocking chairs and a TV with mini chairs for children to watch while the parents either register for their stay OR have a cocktail in the Great Hall.  Very welcoming.  Disney is subtle here in the piano songs being played in the Great Hall to the Mickey's found in the carpet.  But the Disney attention to detail is still strong.  Our room had a Premium View which overlooked Downtown Disney.  It can get a bit noisy at night, but if you're exhausted from a day at the parks, you won't even notice.  The room

Summary Heading: Best Part Of Our Disney Trip
Summary: We are Annual Passholders who visit Disneyland about 6 times a year. Any time we can stay at the Grand Californian is such a treat! It's a struggle to divide our time between the park and the hotel as the hotel offers so many awesome things to do. You are able to enjoy the hotel the full day you check in and out. Take full advantage of this and arrive first thing on your check in date. Enjoy the pool until your room is ready. Same thing when you check out. Stay and play at the hotel all day. Perfect for after you've had your fun in the parks. One of the pools has a slide that my family enjoyed for hours on end. If you're staying on a night with fireworks, make sure to request a firework view room. What an awesome show! We didn't want to leave and cannot wait to return!

From the minute you go in the staff makes you feel like family. We were selected family of the day and got a complimentary upgrade to the suite. If it's your birthday you get the badges at check-in and a signed photo from Mickey!Even the housekeeping was great and gave us a rose and and extra chocolates when we walked by.

Summary Heading: For the unbelievably high price, not the quality you would expect
Summary: The service is very pleasant so a definite thumbs-up to the staff and the lobby is definitely very lovely.  Also, the bath products are nice, and obviously, the location is terrific.  But other than that, they're simply overcharging.  The bathroom has a tiny tub and very little space.  The quality and decor of the rooms is average and basic. No pillow-top mattress or quality linens you'd normally get for those kind of room rates. The gym looked quite basic and small.  They put the next day's fresh bedding and towels in baskets outside every room in the morning.  While I'm sure it's a good time saver for the housekeeping staff, it looks rushed and is definitely NOT something you'd see in any other hotel charging 500 bucks a night.  The in-room TV's are small with limited channel

We recently stayed at the Grand Californian and we totally loved it. The stay was in 2 parts. Firstly 2 nights in the Disney Vacation Club part, using our points. We had a lovely room with a fantastic view on the Ferris wheel in California Adventures park. The second part was as a group tour with Adventures by Disney, staying in the main part of the hotel. Both rooms were perfect. The service was second to none from check-in to check-out both times. We had food at Napa Rose and it was simply superb. The pool scene is gorgeous and we loved to proximity of Downtown Disney. We had an absolute blast and will definitely come back !

Summary Heading: You pay for location - that's it!
Summary: The location can't be beat.  Hotel needs updating - showing wear and tear in rooms and common spaces.  Restaurants okay.  Pool area is nice with oversized chaises and plenty of towels.  Character breakfast with kids a joke - they are not interested in seeing bears and racoons.  They want to see Mickey and Donald!  Front desk staff is a little clueless. My huband had an unexpected meeting to attend so I extended my stay two nights (front desk couldn't help with this - had to call Disney vacation line directly) until he could return and continue with me onto another destination.  The first extended night, my son stayed with me and then I sent him off in the morning with my sister to Legoland so I could have a day at the "spa" to myself.  I booked a body scrub, massage and shellac

Had the pleasure of travelling to Disney last week with my son and we met up with my childhood best friend and her daughter.  I have been to Disneyland 13 times and this was the first time at the Grand Californian.  We arrived at 10am and for the first time ever our room was ready when we got there.  It was so nice to be able to check in before heading to the parks.  We had a bunk room, which gave us a queen, bunk set and a trundle -  and it was more than enough room.  Our balcony opened up to California Adventure. Our room was on the 5th floor directly above the special entrance for Disney hotel guests.  Sadly their was construction, but it was still very magical to us.  We could see the tower of terror, the large grizzly and in the distance the red rock of carsland.  We slept

The "Grand" Californian is supposed to be for families.  If you are lucky enough to be able to afford to stay at the Californian, you should be treated MUCH better than our stay.  This hotel, other than location (which is only 4 more minute walk than the Disneyland Hotel) was truly a disappointment.  We were shocked by the sticker price, but felt it was worth it as we had a 3 year old and a 5 year old and the location would be worth it and it was our first visit to Disneyland.  Upon arrival, we were "hurried' out of our shuttle, left in the front loading area with 2 kids and luggage and NO help and moving vehicles everywhere.  When finally getting to the lobby, there was a HUGE line, and not a very friendly greeting.  When getting to our room, it was not the room I had booked 3

While I just stayed 2 nights for a quick trip to Disneyland,  this hotel was perfect. We stayed as part of our honeymoon, and the cleaning staff had our bed all done up with flower petals, heart stickers and towel art. We ordered room service late one night, and it was very quick. The bar near the main room satisfied our need for a post park drink.  The best part is the location. Just steps away from both parks and Downtown Disney. Next time, I will have to stay longer to take advantage of the pool and more.

My family goes to Disneyland each year, and usually we stay close by at one of the hotels on Harbor Blvd.  This time, though, we decided to splurge and stay on-property at the Grand Californian.  Actually, we got a very good deal on the room, which made the decision a little easier. Yes, the location is very convenient.  Being able to walk right in to California Adventure is great, and it provides lots of flexibility to come and go as you want. The public areas of the hotel are quite grand, but once you get out of the lobby, the hotel is a bit worn and quite ordinary.  The room is no nicer than a Hampton Inn that's overdue for renovation.  carpets are worn and dingy.  The restaurant choices are limited and very overpriced.  Luckily, the restaurants of Downtown Disney are only a

My daughters and I came to California in 2011 (ages 14,11,8) as a girls trip (dad stayed home) and we stayed at the Disneyland Hotel (we are DVC members) and had such an awesome trip. This year we decided to up our game and stay at the Grand Californian (girls now 18, 15, 12). We were planning on staying here as a gateway to Disneyland, Hollywood, Newport Beach and then head up the coast to San Francisco as we did in 2011. Quite disappointed with Grand Californian (GC)!. Staff not nearly as friendly or helpful as any other destinations that we've been to (and we've been to them all, housekeeping excluded). Ex. inquired about wine in the general store, salesperson stated she doesn't know anything about wine. Walked up to DVC desk to chat with rep, felt like I was bothering him

Our family stayed in the Arroyo Suite for New Years Eve.  Its a one bedroom suite with living room and dining room.  Its a beautiful suite if your willing to pay 3K for the night.  (Once-in- life time event)  Its decorated in Arts and Craft style, from lighting, to flooring, to furniture and fireplace.  If you can get a tour consider yourself lucky.  The furnishings are by Greene & Greene.  Its my favorite room in the hotel. The only problem is NO view.   The 3 foot deep balcony's are for fresh air only.  The pine trees obstruct any park view.  There is no view what so ever, I can hear the rapids and see pedestrians on the walk way.  Fortunately, we came to play at Disney not the hotel room.  We took full advantage of the late check out and early admission to Disney California.

Well --- If you are going to Disneyland and trying to decide on a hotel, this is the place to stay.    Disney offers 3 hotels connected to the Disneyland / California Adventure property, The Disneyland Hotel, Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel and Disney's Grand Californian.  Of the three this is the premier property and of course the price reflects that title.   All the hotel offerings are wonderful I'm sure but my latest stay was at this location and I cannot say enough nice things about it.    Staying at the Grand Californian gives you private and early access to California Adventure, a nice touch when the park is crowded.  Also, you are right in the middle of Downtown Disney.  Handy for dining and shopping.  The entire staff at the hotel seem dedicated to the guest. Your needs,

We stayed for 4 days and nights! Great ambiance and decor, convenient location to parks. Negative aspects of the trip is that for the amount of the room they also charged us for parking each day. that was an additional $68. Front desk and phone service should be more knowledgeable of park times for each day.  TV and wifi was horrible!

Summary Heading: Nice room, nice furniture, but a pretty average experience.
Summary: For the price, we were expecting a lot more.  The room was clean, the furniture was nice, and everything worked.  But.... for the price, the room was average size, and the clientele is NOISY.  The halls are filled with kids running up and down, and it seems as though most of the guests assume that every other guest has no interest in sleeping past 7am.  The place was noisy until late and the noise resumed at 6am.  The grounds are nice, the pool is nice, the lobby is amazing, but in the end, you spend the most time in the room and it's just not that special.

The Grand Californian is unlike any other hotel most people have stayed at.   The sibling to the Grand Floridian in Orlando/Kissemee, this hotel celebrates the Craftsman style in every detail imaginable. The service is superb and the staff is friendly and helpful. They genuinely want you to have the best possible experience.   The pace here is a little slower than the bustle of the Disneyland Hotel, which is bursting with excited young children (we took the "happiest hotel on earth" tour). The lobby opens up to several floors, and it's positively gorgeous there at Christmas time.   We had a dual queen bed room overlooking Downtown Disney. We could step out on the balcony and watch the world go by, and then step back into our room to enjoy absolute silence. The sound deadening

Summary Heading: The magic lasts all day and night
Summary: When you walk in you feel like you are at a gorgeous lodge up at Yellowstone yet you are minutes from Disneyland. The Storytellers roasted corn chowder was a treat. It can be noisy if you are overlooking Downtown Disney but the service and location can not be beat. The giant fireplaces and pool area make a great spot to rest from the hustle and bustle of the parks.

Starting with the excellent guest experience checking in, this hotel is magnificent--and pricey.  The hotel lobby is rustic, the Disney cast members graceful, friendly, and accommodating.  My room was clean and beautiful, and my bed was turned down for me every night.  The food was delicious and plentiful, and the wi-fi reliable and fast.  I'd stay there again!

Amazing hotel and amazing experience! From the second you pull up to the hotel through check-out the staff is outstanding! The rooms are clean and nicely decorated. Highly recommend a Downtown Disney View! Makes a day at the parks a breeze being able to take breaks back at the hotel  and change if necessary. Would stay again in a heartbeat!

Amazing hotel and amazing location. The service and food quality was amazing. The rooms were pretty good as well. Best place to stay while visiting Disney land. Close to both Disneyland and disney California adventure.

First of all this hotel has the perfect location.  One door exits into downtown Disney and another door exits to disneys California adventure Park.  Disneyland is just a short walk through Downtown Disney.  The hotel is gorgeous and luxurious. We even bumped into Raney Rodriguez from one of the Disney shows and she took pictures and signed an autograph for my daughter.  This is the only Disney hotel I would stay in.

Summary Heading: Shame on Disney for not supporting EV charging.  No EV charger at this hotel!
Summary: All EV and PHEV drivers - STAY AWAY from this hotel!!  No EV charger at this hotel, despite 3 calls before our trip to confirm that they do in fact have an electric car charger.  Their website is LYING, they DO NOT HAVE ANY EV CHARGERS HERE at all!  They only have a 110 volt standard outlet (everyone has those).  We arrived from San Francisco late at night, and I was way too tired to deal with driving our Tesla Model S off-site to charge.  A silly 110-volt outlet would take about 5-6 days to charge up our 85 kWh battery pack (it has a big battery to give us 300 miles of range).  I would have given the hotel a 4 star rating if they had a real EV charger (like a Chargepoint or something similar) and a 5-star rating if they had a fast DC to DC car charger (from Tesla or others).

Requested a specific room 3009-- not honored. Was really disappointed with front desk staff at a Disney property--and the hotel is getting run down. You should see the grout in our bathroom 4124--amateurish and filthy. Also, the staff is uninformed about the differences in their rooms and will argue that they're all the same. They're not--3009 is larger and has a garden tub. Don't argue if you're uniformed!!!

I travelled to Disneyland with my family at the busiest time (NYE)! This hotel is huge, clean and decorated beautifully for Christmas, but it is the proximity to both parks that is the greatest positive regarding this hotel. The convenience of having a seperate entry to the Adventure Park, along with early entry and re entry was priceless on extremely busy days. The  downside is that it is looking dated but amazingly still has the WOW factor . It is expensive! So you definitely pay for the location, even wifi!!.

We chose the grand californian for it,s ease of entry into the park, and as it turned out thats all it had going for it. The hotel is quite dark and oppressive, nothing very disney about it. Our room had a nice view of the park ( Which we paid for of course ). Unfortunately our sleep was interupted repeatedly by the plumbing, at various times popping and gurgling was coming from the sink which we couln,t silence. We called for maintenance to come and fix it but when he arrived he said there was nothing he could do about, it was a problem with the plumbing that the hotel was well aware of !! When we complained to the front desk they addmitted they knew about it and just appologised. They didn,t mention it when they charged us full price for the room. We were also surprised to get

We had a one bedroom suite with a connecting room at the Grand Californian.  It was great to have a little extra space.  The room was clean and had modern furniture.  The bunk beds were extremely small anyone over 10 it would not be a comfortable option.  I enjoyed the location - so nice to be that close.  I loved that the housecleaners were dressed disney - with the wood laundry baskets.  Everyone we came across was friendly.   We ate at napa rose one night - food was great but kids option were a little too healthy for my kids (Ex brown rice).  We ordered room service one night - I didn't have high expectations but it was convenient as we were exhausted.  It filled the pit - lots of options.  Can't wait to stay here again.

We went to the GC for a quick two night stay while visiting the parks. Granted, found a very rare situation, but the front desk staff was borderline incompetent in their service. We arrived at 12:15am after driving from Las Vegas. Two couples and five kids. We had made reservations months before and double checked the accommodations to include bunk beds. When we arrived, the hotel is almost completely dark. Turns out a planned hotel maintenance required turning off electricity to most of the common areas, and to half of the hotel rooms, from 12am to 6am.  Still, we get the keys to our rooms, connecting rooms as requested. But when I ask what room arrangements they have, they tell us each room has two double beds. I told the front desk clerk that wasn't acceptable, but the reply

It's our third time staying here and like always, we love being able to walk to and from the park , from the hotel, not having to wait on shuttle's to take you back to hotel well worth the price for us, early entrance to California Adventure Park is always nice.

We booked a room for Christmas night in a 1 bedroom villa using our DVC Points.  The room was very nice and spacious with a view of the park.    After checking in we went down to the pool and ordered lunch at the quick service restaurant past the entrance to CA.  The food was good and they have a 100 flavor soda machine with was a plus in my book!  We took our food into the pool area.  The pool was great.  They have a few different pools for the kids and adults and the main pool have two water slides for the kids.  One for the older and one for toddlers.  The only thing they seemed to have neglected was a splash pad.    My only complaint with the property is the maids are very aggressive and if you don't put a DND card up on your door they will enter.  They walked in on us 5

We were meet at the valet by the concierge team and escorted to the club level check in. We then entered the amusement park and came back to our room over looking Paradise Pier in CA Adventure. We called the bell desk and our luggage was brought up very quickly. Our stay was well enjoyed due to the hotels location within walking distance of both parks and downtown disney. We entered Disneyland via the Monorail station, and CA Adventure through the convenient hotel guest gate. The club level refreshments were always enjoyed in a very relaxed environment, with all cast members very helpful and courteous. Upon our departure we were able to have our luggage held by the Bell Desk and ready at the valet pick up when we were ready to leave after a much enjoyed vacation from Sunday to

Rooms are nothing special. No Disney feel at all. Construction clouded the sound of peace and quiet. Hotel lobby was freezing. Employees expressed their frustrations of air quality. Our bell hop was sweating so bad. Valet parking men were likes sharks! My dad didn't know to tip the valet guy as we retrieved the car. The bell hop did all the work loading our car and he received a tip The valet guy walked in front of our car and gave a death look to my father. The guy never took his eyes off my dad as we drove away.He kept shaking his head. What a Physco!! Let it go as Elsa says! Several employees never smiled. What happen to the Disney face? Would not stay here again. I should have a taken the other reviews to heart.

Summary Heading: Close to where you want to be
Summary: This hotel as great for location, location, location.  As for the hotel it was very clean ... disappointing was the room charge for what you get ... the room was nothing special and really did not show any "Disney" feeling.  The room as no different than any hotel room and it was disappointing that in the evening they did not have a Disney show for the kids to watch ... as for the bedtime story they tell you that the kids can watch-  we stayed 3 nights and it was the same story all 3 nights and it needs improvement.  I did order gifts from the Disney floral and I am giving them a 10/10 for service and product - well done!   I think they can add touches as ... shampoo for kids ... etc.   I would stay there because of location but do not expect the Disney Experience.

Summary Heading: Busy hotel escape amid a busy theme park
Summary: Family busy hotel with lots of peak hours. Ideally located amidst the Disney theme parks with its own entrance to California adventure and literally a 4 min walk to Disneyland entrance. Comfy beds, beautiful Lobby. Nice pool! Great service constantly delivered.

As a DVC member from the UK this was our first visit to the Grand Californian in Anaheim and we were loving it.  A lot less busy than Florida but will all the fun and charm   The lobby is simply spectacular and Napa Rose had some very tasty food. Disney Grand Californian borders the Downtown Disney entrance to Californian Adventure and even has its own private entrance for an hour when the park opens. We can definitely recommend asking for a park view as you will back onto the UP Movie Wilderness trail. The hotel also has its own entrance into the Downtown Disney Area which is very helpful if you want to eat outside the hotel.   Unlike the Florida site there isnt any fastpass+ here and you still have the more useful paper legacy fastpass system which is much easier than trying

My husband and I (ages 66 and 70) chose to visit Disney's Grand Californian hotel and the parks as well, just by ourselves.  No kids, no grandkids.  Just a romantic holiday.  This hotel is fabulous.  As you would expect from Disney, the atmosphere was grand, the service was friendly and complete.  The location was unbelievable and, amazingly, when the sliding door was closed, even with Downtown Disney right outside our door, it was lovely and quiet inside the room.  What a great place.

Yes this place is expensive.  Yes it's Craftsman style pretty.   So why stay here than the other buzillion hotels near Disneyland??  LOCATION, LOCATION AND SERVICE!  SERVICE:   I made some requests from reservations before we arrived...all requests were fulfilled.  I ordered gifts from disney floral and gifts, and when we lost some items from the package in the park, it was quickly replaced.  I mentioned we were celebrating a birthday, and we were given birthday buttons and a signed Minnie Mouse photograph. LOCATION:  since traveling with a 2 year old, we knew we wanted to stay at a hotel where we can run to if our toddler had a meltdown and this place was pleasantly convenient.  Plus, by the time the park closed, it was a relief that we were a quick walk away from our room.

Summary Heading: Book a room category ‚Äì You just might not get it.
Summary: A review from a non-Disney fanatic: ‚Ä¢ This was my first Disney trip. Figured we‚Äôd do as we did in Aulani, and treat ourselves to a Disney hotel.  ‚Ä¢ This is NOT Aulani: We splurged and visit Aulani for our last vacation. The hotel was sublime, from detachable showerheads to better bathe your children, to provided footstools so the smallest of hands can get easily washed. Those amenities are not here, although we naively expected them. ‚Ä¢ Booked ‚ÄúTheme Park View‚Äù (says so right on our reservation). Oops, they were out! Gave us a partial view of the pool instead. Claimed it was still ‚Äúpremium.‚Äù All I know is that we were shoved at the end of the hall at the far end of the resort, nowhere near restaurants or theme park entrances. The man who was helping us seemed distracted as he was

Summary Heading: Distance Travellers with young Children this is a must :)
Summary: Location location, we recently Travel to America From Perth Australia with our two young children (3 & 5) and stayed here for 4nights 5days and really enjoyed our stay :) the hotel room was clean and bed were comfy and it had all the amenities we required. The true be told if you are staying here and going to Disneyland and or California Adventures don't expect to be in your room much at all :) The location is perfect, after a big day at the parks it is just a short stroll back to the hotel and this to us is worth every cent. The hotel staff were friendly and the interior design is amazing, there is always something going on at Disney Grand :)

Summary Heading: Great onsite property for Disneyland trip!
Summary: This was our second time to Disneyland with our 2 year old toddler. Last time we stayed at the Hilton and it was run down and not on site. So we elected to stay the next time onsite at the Disney's Grand California Hotel this past Jan 2015. Well worth the splurge and highly recommended to upgrade to the concierge level. We had a great corner room and the pools were well maintained. My only complaint would be the dining options - room service menu was extremely limited and lack of variety throughout. Try to bring a cooler if you are local or stock up on snacks before you arrive!

Summary Heading: AWESOME stay as always! All others should strive to be like this!
Summary: Love it as it is extremely CLEAN.  I couldn't find a thing wrong.  Quiet, luxurious, awesome!  COMFY beds, nice linens.  Come yearly and love knowing what to expect and it's always the same.  Love how we can enter the park there at the hotel.  Nice pool area, clean, spacious. Nice life ackets for smaler kids to use

Stayed here in January with my wife and 7 year old. The initial greeting and experience they gave my daughter was fantastic at reception. The hotel was nice without being outlandish. The true value is the locality being so close to the parks. You can go thru the side door to grand California which was nice. Being able to access the early pass also is a bonus. We were able to watch the fireworks from our balcony which was a bonus. A great experience without the tackiness.

In December of 2014, my family of five stayed at the Grand Californian for the second time.  And once again, it was a marvelous trip.  This time, we stayed during the Christmas season because I wanted to experience the resort all decked out for the holidays and it didn't disappoint.  In fact, the lobby Christmas tree was stunning just as I imagined it!  The Christmas carolers were a perfect seasonal touch as well.    We splurged a bit and paid for a premium view and we received a room that not only overlooked the pool, but we had a perfect view of the Mickey Mouse Ferris Wheel and California Screamin.
