And as a bonus, we could sit on our balcony and watch World of Colors at night from the comfort of our room instead of fighting the crowds.  I felt like our room was truly in the

We recently returned from a fabulous 4 night/5 day vacation at Disneyland -- our entire family participated in RunDisney's Star Wars themed 1/2 marathon weekend (5K, 10K, and 1/2 Marathon).  Here are my thoughts regarding the property and location:  1.  LOCATION - you can't beat the location - it's in Downtown Disney - a 3 to 5 minute walk to Disneyland's Main Gates and it has a private entrance to California Adventure.    2.  If you're going for a RunDisney weekend:  again, cannot beat this location.  The running corrals are right out the front entrance to the hotel (car entrance).  No super extra early wake up call like at Walt Disney World races (or if you're not staying that close).  The running expos are always at the Disneyland Hotel and it's a 5 minute walk to the

Summary Heading: A Grand experience, but questionable value
Summary: Let's get this out of the way: The Disney's Grand Californian is a beautiful property. IT has the polish and theme that you would expect from a Disney property (although maybe not quite as well done as one of the deluxe resorts in Florida). Service is also top-notch. We arrived at the property with more luggage than anybody in their right mind should have (long story) and the staff unloaded the truck like a moving crew - and took care of everything while we checked in. We arrived very early in the morning, but the reception prepared a room for us right away and got us on our way to the parks right away.  The problem with the Grand Californian is that you are definitely paying a premium on the experience. At some other Disney properties, I can see the advantage. The main selling

We just visited this wonderful hotel this month.  When we arrived they still had their huge beautiful Christmas tree up.  Breathtaking to say the least.  We had a 1 bedroom villa and all I can say is nice!!  Plenty of room, the kitchen was nice (even though we didn't really use it).  We were on the 2nd floor facing California Adventure.  We really couldn't see the park for the trees, so if you want a true view of the park you need to go higher than the 2nd floor.  The tub was huge and was so great to get into after a long day at the parks... comfy bed too!  What was super nice was having an entrance to the parks in our hotel.  The cast members would check for keys to make sure you weren't just trying to get in without staying there.  I thought that was great since we got an

We stayed at the hotel for a few days and were surprised by size of the hotel! The room was bigger than expected and all the staff were very friendly. Kids loved looking for all the hidden Mickey's! The Kids TV in lobby while the parents check in set the mood, kids all had rocking chairs while watching classic Disney cartoons. The whole hotel is well decorated and the pools & spa's were great.   We'll be back!

This hotel is unique in that it's Disney, it's modeled after the California Crafts movement, and it has a private entrance into California Adventure Park. It's a little hard to compare to other high-end hotels. Does it offer the same amenities or service as similarly priced hotels? Maybe not, but it doesn't need to. It's super convenient for accessing the Disney parks, and the lobby is simply stunning. Those two features make it more than worth the cost. The rest is very nice too. We were able to take a quick nap in the middle of a hot day at CAP, which totally saved us. Because of the private entrance, it took no time to get to the room and back into the park.

We thought we would splurge and stay 3 nights at this hotel as a treat. For the price we were really expecting something, and we were very disappointed. While the lobby is very grand, the rooms are average at best. We were at a Marriott the night before, and it was a much better hotel for 1/3 the price!  The heated pools were too cold for the children to go into, and one day we never received maid service despite being out of the room all day. The split bathroom was nice, but it has been years since I have seen such a tiny tub in a hotel room.  As we overlooked California Adventure the room was very noisy. I was surprised that they didn't use better quality windows to cut the noise.  Disney is definitely playing on their name, and in my opinion they failed to deliver any value

Summary Heading: Great location, service not good enough
Summary: Our family had a few nights at the grand Californian in late January 2015, and had a mixed experience. On the plus side breakfast at Storytellers Cafe was fantastic, and access to the parks is good. However, you can just book breakfast, and get the same park access if you stay at the other Disney hotels, albeit with a slightly longer walk.   Unfortunately the service is not good enough at this price point. We started in a cramped 'premium' room with a view of grizzly mountain... but were kept awake by chainsaws and trucks beeping, as the park was being renovated, and the power was also out from 12am to 5am. That was probably just unlucky, however the service we received when we tried to move was not up to scratch, and the room we subsequently moved to had a strange dripping

The only advantage to staying in this hotel is its location!  The rooms are dark, outdated and the furniture was worn and tired. The cleanliness left a lot to be desired with small bits of rubbish around the edges of furniture from previous guests and yet clearly visible - but not to house cleaning as they weren't removed in the 4 nights we stayed!  You pay a lot to stay at the Grand Californian which is on the door step of Disneyland and Californian Adventure Park and entitles you to a "Magic hour" before the general public are admitted to the parks.  If it weren't for these benefits we probably would not have stayed.  But having said that I am not entirely sure I wold stay again!

Summary Heading: Nice and Close, perfect for our Disney Adventure!
Summary: This was the only hotel on our trip where we chose a standard room, as the plan was to not really spend time in the room. The rooms are standard size, neat and clean. The location is perfect, a short walk away from the shops and restaurants... and most importantly Disneyland is right at your doorstep! Everything is so convenient. The staff were also the most helpful we encountered whilst in the US, talk about smiley :) Loved the pretty christmas decorations this time of year either as well. This hotel met my high disney expectations and would happily come back for another visit, highly recommend it.

Summary Heading: Not worth the money, hotel needs major improvements
Summary: I came here with my family and booked the one bedroom suite.  Well, it was not worth the price we paid.  There was no view to the room, furniture was really old, the bathroom is similar to a Motel 6, pillows had stains on it.  My daughter and nephew got some bug bites from the bunk beds.  We will not return to this hotel again. This place does not know how to run a hotel.

Disney's Grand Californian Hotel is a nice hotel. It is not a wonderful hotel.  It is in a great location for Disneyland and leads right into the parks and downtown Disney.   The lobby is terrific - lots of place to relax and it is beautiful. But the hotel rooms are hotel rooms - nothing special. And the bathroom is tiny and below average. In my opinion, the rooms are equivalent to a category 4 Marriott where you would pay between $150-$240 per night depending on the time of year. But at this hotel they will charge you double, triple or even 5 times what it is worth They love to charge for absolutely everything and they are not shy.  The spa is very average and underwhelming and not worth it.

The overall atmosphere was good; rooms are very small with a strange cheap-ish wooden theme. Extremely close to the parks (that's the hotel's biggest pro) but not even close to the Floridian counterpart, Disney's Grand Floridan Resort. Breakfast was awesome.

if for no other reason that location you need to stay here.  I mean don't even waste your time looking at other options.  the hotel is within Downtown Disney, has  private entrance to Adventure Park and is a 2 min stroll to Disneyland.  For that reason alone I think Disneyland is better than Disneyworld...   we have two small children that still nap and it was really easy to run them in and out of the park when necessary.  no long lines for a bus just a quick walk.  the rooms are ok, nothing special but the are clean and they have a fridge.  wifi is so slow it almost does not work

With its proximity to Disneyland I thought the staff would be more knowledgeable of park activities and prepared for peak hours. For example when I called to see if I could see the fireworks show from my room I was told no but that was incorrect. When I called for roomservice I waited on hold for over 10 minutes just to order.  The drain in the sink wouldn't drain which is simply gross and we had the worst time trying to control the temperature in the room.  If you like a rustic and older feel this is the hotel.  For the price I like the other Disney hotels and their more modern upgrades.  The only reason to stay here is its access to the park which is extremely convenient!!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, great location, questionable value
Summary: This was the first time I stayed here. The hotel is gorgeous, and staff are absolutely phenomenal. Unfortunately our room was not in top shape: the sliding door to the balcony would not lock because of a broken fitting, and all of the beautiful craftsman style light fixtures were askew, as if someone had been throwing a large ball around in the room. The decor also just seemed a bit tired. Normally I would say that this is just fine, but not for the prices that are charged here. Even though we got a steep discount because it was low season (our room worked out to about $300/nt), there are far better values that are close by to Disney. The convenience factor was great, but again, I'm really not sure it was worth it. Also, we tried to use one of the 2 hot tubs in the evening and

Summary Heading: Not worth the price you pay
Summary: At the end of the day what you are paying for at this hotel is location, and if that is all you care about, then go ahead and book it.   The problem comes when you want a little more than location for the price you are paying. I have stayed in 5 star luxury hotels for a lot less $$$ than this hotel, and the service here is no way up to that standard.   My two biggest gripes with this hotel are the quality of the bell services and the wifi. I stayed both in December 2014 and in January 2015 and on both occasions I had a lot of issues with bell services. They were more interested in talking to each other than helping guests with bags outside, and the line to store luggage was out of control (and the wait to have them come to your room can be as high as 45 minutes). I had to

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel with great park access!
Summary: This is a beautiful hotel decorated in the style of the grand days of California's past. The rooms are well appointed with comfortable beds and bedding, TV, DVD player and a small refrigerator. The bathrooms are large with the toilet and tub in a separate room from the double sinks. The balcony of ours had a beautiful pool view. The entrance to California Adventure is directly from the back of the hotel and for guests only! The only downside is that the entrance used to go to the front of California Adventure and to the Roaring Rapids, but with recent construction it only goes to Roaring Rapids. The entrance is convenient, but not so much if you want to go to the Hollywood studio area.  There is a snack bar on property that has a quick hot breakfast and is reasonably priced for

The room was very comfortable. I slept like a rock and didn't want to get up. The rooms are very clean. The bell hopes where a little rude. Make sure you have lots of money  to eat at the restaurants because they are not cheap. But you are close to other place to eat. My family and I had a good stay and will do it again.

We love this hotel. Everything from the Lobby, pool, rooms, atmosphere and especially at Christmas. We use the hotels private access next to 'Storytellers Cafe' for California Adventure for fast access to Cars Land. Breakfast at 'Storytellers' is a must. Hotel check-in is easy, with a welcome package with signed pictures from 4 characters as we were celebrating one of our children's birthdays. The hotel lobby was celebrating Christmas with gingerbread and hot chocolate, while you waited to have photos with Santa. If you sit on the floor above the lobby, it has lounges that are quiet and away from the main lobby, but enjoy the same atmosphere that can be very busy at times. The beds are extremely comfortable and quiet. Fabulous and highly recommended.

Nothing wrong with the property, but wish I had saved a ton of money staying elsewhere. At almost $600/ night they raised the expectation bar too high for any place to reach, I suppose. I wish we had stayed at a 4 star property and simply taken transportation to and from the park.

Summary Heading: Beware of MLK weekend and bunk beds
Summary: Stayed for 2 nights over MLK weekend, and paid the full price.  Got to our room after a very long day in the park to discover we had been given a room with a queen bed and bunk beds. There was no indication of a weight limit on the bunk bed.  Called the front desk to inquire about the weight limit on the top bunk, and was told it was 80 pounds.  I was traveling with 3 teenagers who all exceeded 80 lbs.  The front desk indicated that there were no rooms with 2 queen beds available.  As a result, one slept on the bottom bunk, and one slept on the floor in a trundle.  If I'm paying $400+/night, I expect everybody to sleep in a REAL bed. It is also very irresponsible for the hotel to put families in a room with a bunk bed without first advising them of the weight limitations.

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for a RunDisney race weekend
Summary: We were at the Grand Californian for the Star Wars Half Marathon. We are frequent Disney World guest but we didn't know what to expect for a Disneyland trip. If you are in a similar situation I would totally recommend the Grand Californian.  The hotel itself is very similar to the Wilderness Lodge, including the lobby and the resort layout. The room was spacious, well decorated to the theme and very clean. There are two sitdowns (make reservations), a quick service, and a coffee shop/bar. The gift shop was a little underwhelming. Not as stocked as the Disney World hotels so remember to bring your essentials. The lobby area was beautiful. There is plenty of seating and we really enjoyed the pianist in the evening and the story teller at the fireplace area. The location is

We absolutely loved this hotel and can't wait to stay again! The early entry to the park was brilliant and staying in the middle of Disneyland was fantastic after long days! The hotel keeps the Disney magic alive throughout. Lovely staff and service too. Highly recommend.

Summary Heading: The best hotel to stay at Disneyland
Summary: We were there for 5 nights for christmas 2014, the whole family, each member of the staff was so nice and friendly with all of our needs, sue rented a scooter for my mom, directly in customer services, and it was so helpful, the distance to the parks and downtown disney is fabulous. We have been to disneyland many many times before, but our experience was perfect for the convenient distance to all attractions and the special entrance to california adventure park, we could come back very fast to let my 1 year old baby sleep or eat or just have a rest, while the rest of the gang could continue having so much fun an  making memories! im sure we will be there soon again.

The Disney Grand Californian resort is a wonderful place to stay and play during your Disneyland vacation. It is the most convenient location to the park, and requires absolutely no transportation to get to the main gates. In fact, you will have your own private exit into the California Adventure Resort. The service is excellent, and you can expect great personalities to shine through from every employee, whether its the person taking your bags, sweeping the floors, or checking you in. They will all go out of their way to insure a perfect stay.   The rooms are beautifully appointed. Every detail is made to give you a  feeling of staying in a luxury cabin in the wilderness. Even the sofa bed is very comfortable with a special Disney signature sofa bed mattress that even an adult

Summary Heading: Convenience is the best thing about it
Summary: This hotel anywhere else would be rated just average. There is nothing special about the rooms. Mattresses are average. Maid service was very good. You pay Disney prices here, which means at least twice what it would cost anywhere else. Our room was on special at $298 per night, a $149 value anywhere else. But, you aren't just anywhere else. You are at Disneyland. The convenience and ease of getting to and from the park was worth the extra money. Expect to pay double for everything at Disneyland, inside the park and at Downtown Disney. Is it worth it? Yes, of course it is. It's Disneyland!

Summary Heading: BEST LOCATION BEST SERVICE QUAD ROOMS
Summary: The location of this hotel is second to none, it is very close to the Disneyland entrance and has a special private entrance to Californian Adventure. Yes, it is not cheap, but it is super convenient. Room service is superb and caters to special needs, rooms are large enough, fit 4 comfortably and are very well fitted out. During December there is a huge indoor Christmas tree and Santa Claus each night. After previously staying at the Disneyland Hotel which is quite a walk, this hotel was magic. The staff went out of their way to assist, Check-in was fast and friendly. Close your eyes to the price and enjoy being in the center of everything, yet it is quiet in the rooms.

Summary Heading: Rooms are beginning to show their age.
Summary: I last stayed here in Jan 2006 and there is no doubt, it's an excellent hotel (if overpriced) in the perfect location if you're visiting Disneyland with the grandchildren. The rooms spacious, clean and comfortable, but are in need of an upgrade.    If there was a negative comment, the housekeeping staff ignored the Do Not Disturb hanging on the door.

The hotel's title is largely a misnomer.  Our family of 4 (2 adults & 2 young children) stayed here for 5 nights the week before Christmas.  We booked a 1 bedroom suite.  The lobby is indeed grand and rather spectacular in it's festive season decor but the hotel rooms are far from impressive.  When we booked, we understood we had booked a suite that had a king/queen and a bunk bed.  What we ended up with was a king bed and a dodgy sofa bed in the sitting area.  Highly inconvenient and the sofa bed had seen better days.  We found the decor to be tired and in need of a makeover.  The bathroom area was quite bizarre - the bath & toilet were very small and the dual vanity basin area was in an open space outside the bedroom.  The bath had a shower curtain (do hotels still use

Welcome to the 22nd century where every hotel worth your dollar has wireless Internet.  What if they offer it but the signal is so weak your phone can barely function once connected?!!! Welcome to Disney's Grand Californian.. An expensive place to be foribly disconnected from the Internet!

My family and I stayed at the Grand Californian Hotel Resort and spa for three nights.  The hotel still had its Christmas decorations up - it was beautiful. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is easy walking distance to Disneyland and has direct access to California  Adventure. We would stay there again.

The service was excellent. The hotel beautifully decorated for the Holidays and it was very enchanting and cozy. We had a view overlooking CA Adventure park. Very beautiful place to stay with family!@

If you decide to celebrate your anniversary with a visit to Disneyland and California Adventure, stay here.  My husband and I are L.A. locals, but we decided that coming here to celebrate our twenty-ninth year together and our first year of marriage might be fun.  We were welcomed with enthusiastically open arms.    Of the hotel itself, everything the other reviewers write is accurate:  the hotel is beautifully designed but it needs some refreshing; the rooms are a bit small (if it's two of you, get a single king bed, and then there's room for a sofa and lounge chair, too); the spectacular lobby is where you'll want to relax; and yes, the hotel is really expensive.    The service we received was extraordinary, starting with the telephone reservation agent.  She asked if the

Summary Heading: Get your service in order, people!
Summary: You pay an exorbitant amount to stay close to the parks, but you tell yourself it's a special, memorable time for the kids, so suck it up.  But really, for $700 a night (concierge level) there is SOME expectation of a certain level of customer service.  We got there at 9am, to dump our bags and get to the character breakfast on the morning of our 8 year old sons birthday.  20 minutes waiting to see a receptionist, just to be told, oh, you are concierge level, you check in on the 6th floor.  Up we go, time is ticking on, we miss our reservation in the Park.  Back to the hotel at 4pm and they have put us in the darkest, dingiest room, right in the elbow of the corner of the building.  Park view = side of the building view.  We complained and they did move us eventually, to a room

Summary Heading: Great Location - but as a result they don't seem to care about the customer
Summary: This hotel is incredibly disappointing. Yes it is a great location but you are paying for this privilege. They got off to a bad start when we arrived and no one bothered to come and help with our bags despite numerous staff members standing in the drive way. We booked for 5 people and they did not have enough towels in the room. The icing on the cake was calling room service waiting for 15mins to order 3 bottles of water and being told it would take 45 mins to deliver!!!! What a joke. It's low season guys - I think you need to have a good hard look at your selves.

Summary Heading: Still the best place to stay at Disney!
Summary: This is our second stay at the Grand, and I'm just as happy as I was the first time.  The hotel is beautiful and the rooms, though a bit on the small side, are well appointed.  The pool area is stunning, it includes 3 pools (one is an adult pool I believe), lots of chaise lounges and umbrellas,  and one pool has a long waterslide and a couple of short ones for the smaller swimmers.  Life vests are available free of charge for those who are not strong swimmers and come in several sizes.  One pool had 3 lifeguards on staff at all times so it's a very safe environment.  The hotel has several restaurants at several price points, so you don't have to go far to get good quality food.  It is true that you do pay more than usual to stay at a Disney property, but the proximity to the

The hotel is very old and the rooms are small. The carpet looks completely rundown. The only thing that looks nice is the lobby.   The hote service is also substandard. I asked for a kettle for our baby but they said its only for villas. I explained that we had a baby who needed hot water for his milk they were absolutely adamant that they cannot make an exception.   The food in the restaurants are also quite unpleasant. It looks old and like no care was given in prearing it. The servers also looked bored and uninterested - completely the opposite of what you would expect in a disney hotel.   Would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Summary Heading: Your staying in the park, it's amazing!
Summary: We loved our stay.  The rooms are tiny but the decor is beautiful with great expense to every detail. The kids enjoyed watching the monorail run through the hotel. The nature sounds block out park noise. The pools are awesome with lifeguards on duty and life jackets provided and a water slide.  Room service was ok.  Our room was quite far and it would have been less walking to the park entrance if we stayed at a good neighbor hotel. We will definitely be back!

I'm torn on how to review this hotel balancing location, rooms and value for money. So I will start with the good. The hotel is beautiful from the ambience in the lobby complete with pianist performing all of your Disney favourites (Let it go, let it go......) to the pools and grounds in all it's woodsy/ outdoorsy luxury. The pools (I think there's 3) are great with a terrific waterslide in one and are a welcome respite from the heat of the day. The sun lounges are super comfy and we didn't have trouble most days finding one. Great pool service waiters too. Quite frequent which was nice. The location is PERFECT! So close to parks with its own entry to Disneys California Adventure as well as all of the Downtown Disney action.  Check in ( I love it when people review check in)

This was our first time staying at the Grand,  we have stayed at Disneyland Hotel before. Our stay was absolutely perfect. We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa with on other family. We had a 4th floor room with an AMAZING view of California Adventure, we could listen and watch World Of Color from our beds!! Magical! The staff was top notch, especially Steve the bell hop. He greeted us as we came in, then several hours later recognized us sitting in the lobby, he came over to speak with us and called us by name. Impressive. We also met and chatted with the General Manager, great guy, no wonder our stay was perfect. The food at Whitewater Snacks, wonderful. Breakfast burritos are yummy!! We also grilled, they have tools for you at the front desk. So comfortable to relax at such a

Really enjoyed our stay here.  We went here the whole family, 2 kids and 3 adults.  We had joint rooms.  Upgraded to concierge level.  Breakfast and access the lounge all day for pop/juice.  Very close to the park.  Room were amazing.  Great experience for the kids.  Only the price was little too high even with the discounted rate.

Summary Heading: Great visit but, one hit they need to take.
Summary: Disney's Grand Californian Hotel was fantastic, the villa #3500 was ready precisely on time and provided a beautiful view of California Adventure and the Mickey Ferris Wheel.  Staff was very attentive and helped in any way they could when asked.  However, if handicapped and using a wheeled vehicle be aware that there only two areas with self opening doors, in the front entrance and exiting the Lobby to the villas and at the entrance of the villas.  The side door leading out of the hotel to Downtown Disney is said if pushed will self open which is fine, you just can't get in that way for the door only self opens in one direction------out, not into the hotel. It also needs to be noted that no signs direct you towards ramps. Actually, overall both parks hit and miss on accessible

Summary Heading: Great except for $$$ and climate control
Summary: This is actually an excellent hotel overall, and its proximity to California Adventure and Disneyland makes it the perfect choice if you're going to the parks and can afford it.  But for $300 plus per night (during the LOW season), they should provide better heating and cooling control in the rooms.  Because they didn't do that, we slept badly two out of our three nights there.  So bottom line, if you're not sensitive about the temperature of your room, I recommend this hotel   It's very pretty in a Yosemite-ish way, has a really fun slide on one of its three pools, and it's just so convenient to be right next to both the theme parks and the Downtown Disney shopping area.  There's lots of decent to good food available both at the hotel and at Downtown Disney, though of course

My adult daughter, her roommate and I stayed at Grand Californian for two nights during Thanksgiving week. This was a treat for my birthday - they live in LA and go to Disneyland all the time, but I hadn't been in 40 years. It was comparatively expensive but our two double bed room was perfectly comfortable and did not at all appear run down as some other reviews have stated. Paid extra for "premium view" which in our case meant the pool -- not my favorite but we weren't spending a lot of time in the room anyway. Very smooth and friendly check-in, the valet parking was smooth, and though the hotel was full all that week, we found it much more quiet, especially at night when it mattered to us, than I expected. Schedules were such that we never ate at the hotel but always in the

I must agree with other posts that the room were not spacious.  That being said, it was worth every penny we paid.  The lobby, out our front door, was spectacular.  The tree was 3 stories high.  Out our great balcony, we could see the fire works ever night.  We had the handicapped room and it was big enough for the wheelchair throughout even the balcony with a ramp.  The best feature was it's proximity to the park and restaurants outside the park.  After a day in the crowds, coming back to our sanctuary was heaven.  The spa was also perfect for gearing back up for a second run at the parks.

Summary Heading: Uncomfortable, dingy mess.  Not worth the convenience.  Stay elsewhere!
Summary: We just checked in for a three night stay, and are already looking for other hotels in the area to move to tomorrow night.  First, the location is fantastic.  I expected a pretty basic room, even for the high price, solely because of the lication.  What I did not expect was sagging creaking beds, dirty bathrooms, and an overwhelming mildew smell.  Room 1-we checked in and were told we had been upgraded from a standard room to a woods room.  Went up (at 9pm, pregnant, with a 3 year old) and sat on the bed only to have it sink and make a loud rusty creeping noise.  Tried both beds-both terrible.  Called down to front desk and asked for any other room due to what we assumed was an isolated mattress problem.  They were very nice and switched us again, another "upgrade" (which we

Check-in and check-out is chaos - just horrendous. Although I had prepaid before arrival, on check-out the attendant wanted to charge me again! I explained I had already paid but she was doubtful & made me wait while she went off (forever!) to check...no apology when she finally came back & it was confirmed I had paid. Our room was out-dated, small & we had issues with the television. There was barely room to place our bags. Yes the location is perfect but I'm not sure it was worth so much money - over $800/night for a tiny pokey room.

If you think the Grand Californian Hotel is going to be the height of luxury, you'll be mistaken. It's a good hotel, well-kept, clean, and great if you don't want to walk after spending a day in the parks. Beyond that, it's nothing more than a hotel, and a ridiculously expensive one at that.  Both times I've stayed there (the first in 2012) I was unable to secure a king bed room for my wife and because you book a king/2-queen room, and they are issued on a first-come basis. We always arrive around 8-9pm. Fortunately, both times we were also free upgraded to a "premium view" room. The first time meant right behind Goofy's Flight School in DCA (PS, the windows are amazing and you can't hear the park at all with them closed, and you could obscurely see WoC from our balcony), the

Stayed at the Grand Californian over the holidays.  Reserved a 2 bedroom, 10 person,  "suite" for approximately $1,200 per night as a gift to my mom who is dying of cancer.  Instead of an actual suite, we got a couple of adjoining rooms and a small room with a couch, table and tv, and furnishings no better than a Budget or Holiday Inn.  You heard it right - they were just average adjoining rooms.  The furnishings were dated and average.  The room sizes were barely able to contain the queen beds.    For Disney's flagship hotel in Anaheim, one would reasonably have expected the suites to have been furnished and fitted with significantly more in quality and quantity than what was offered.  The Hyatt Orange County down Harbor Blvd has a 2 bedroom queen suite that is at least in one

I heard this was a gorgeous place to stay while at Disneyland.  Did not disappoint.   Decorations were gorgeous beyond beautiful.  Staff made all guests feel very special.  Rooms were decent size for a family of five.  Cannot speak about the restaurants as we did not eat there.  Grounds were gorgeous.  Easy access to Disney Parks and Downtown Disney.  Cannot speak to the cost as my daughter picked up the tab.  I'm sure 5 star pricey, especially at Christmas time.  Park your car and enjoy the parks.   Early entry to Parks an extra bonus.   Very clean, Very Nice.  Would definetely return.   Enjoy!

Summary Heading: Best Hotel Ever! Christmas time was perfect
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel many times, we decided to go over Christmas and had one of our best trips ever! This hotel is a HUGE part of what makes our trips so magical. The lobby was decorated beautifully with a massive tree, giant gingerbread house and Santa. We could hear the pianist, smell the gingerbread and hear the sounds of laughter from right outside our room. There are so many different views you can have, this time we were back over the back pool. It was fairly quiet and you could see the beautiful trees and pool area. My favorite view of the theme park wasn't available unfortunately, but truly all views will work as long as you are staying in this amazing hotel. I feel at home when we are here, and want to go back the minute we leave!

We always arrive early since we are locals. We were told our room would be ready at 3pm (when rooms become available). As is the norm, we checked in at the desk, leave our luggage and hit the parks. After 3pm we got no call or text, so it appeared that once again, our room was not ready (not the first time this has happened to us). We returned to the hotel lobby and waited around and waited and no call. The lobby was full of people waiting for their rooms, some angrier than others. Some people were even calling to find out the status of their rooms, and became more agitated by the rudeness of the people on the other end of the phone.  Room service is great, but does not operate on a set schedule. One day they come around 10am, the next anytime after 1pm. Never the same time

My family stayed here for 3 nights in spring of 2011.  We absolutely LOVED it!  The hotel is so lovely and the rooms are spacious.  Plenty of room for a family of four.  The price is rather expensive, but you get what you pay for.  Being able to walk out the door and walk to the park and Downtown Disney is definitely worth it for us.  We were able to walk back to the room in the afternoon and get in a nap, then head back out for the evening.  We loved everything about this beautiful hotel!

We stayed at the Grand Californian over the holidays and had a great time.  We expected very small rooms with only average furnishings, so when we got just that it was no great shock!  Our hotel dollars ($$$$!!!) stretched far beyond that average hotel room.  They paid for the gorgeous Grand Californian hotel and grounds decorated for Christmas, the spectacular but (brrrr) cold swimrming pools, the so so quick and easy walk to Disneyland and Disney's California Adventure gates, and especially the early entry for hotel guests, which during the busy holidays allowed us to enter either park an hour early every day.  You see more attractions in that hour than during the rest of the day!  We didn't rely on the hotel staff for any extras, because we planned to and did spend most of

The holiday season at the happiest (and busiest) place on earth is so magical.The decorations alone are worth the visit. This trip we decided to switch it up from the Disneyland Hotel to Disney's Grand Californian Hotel.   Check in was pretty good and fast-super friendly of course .We were upgraded to a premium room whatever that meant. Before I get to that let me wax poetic on the lobby.The lobby is a luxurious wooded lodge with high ceilings with an inner wrap around view from the second story rooms.It has a feel that it was decorated by the Seven Dwarfs themselves-bronzed woodland animal statues nibble on the front desk,forest scenes and rustic artwork lend to the national park vibe.Oversized comfortable furniture and beautiful light fixtures anchor this room to the true

Summary Heading: Stay here only for the location
Summary: The location of this hotel cannot be beat.  Quick and easy access to Downtown Disney and the parks.  The private entrance to DCA is wonderful.    The hotel lobby is large and impressive with a beautiful stone fireplace.  We were there in December.  The lobby had visits from Santa and very talented carolers by a huge Christmas tree.  It was fun and festive.  Lots of "Disney Magic."  That magic ends when you enter your hotel room.  The rooms are nothing special, in fact, they are very dated.  We have stayed in both rooms with a view and standard rooms.  If you do stay here, the price of the upgrade to the view rooms is not worth it.  The wifi does not work.  The wall mounted hair dryer in our room started smoking when it was turned on.  A call to the front desk simply brought us a

Summary Heading: Open your wallet to stay here.
Summary: We go to Disney in CA at least twice a year and usually stay on property at the Disneyland Hotel.  We have stayed at Grand California in the past so tried it again this trip.  Cost is excessive!!!  I can stay in a nice ocean front hotel room in Hawaii for less money....and Hawaii is expensive.  The place and location  are wonderful, but the price is way too high.  Also, for $600 plus a night you would expect a shower in which you could control the temperature, but sadly this was not the case.  You were either scalded or frozen out.  There was no happy medium and no real solution could be offered.  Completely unacceptable for this amount of money.  Never had this problem at the Disneyland Hotel.  The GC is newer, of course but the shower was not up to par at all.  Staff are all

Summary Heading: Sorry to say, it's just not worth the money
Summary: Stayed here over the Christmas break, family of 5 and 2 double Queen bed rooms. Old and tired. Seriously NOT worth the money. Lucky to be a 3 star hotel but at 7 star prices!!! Room service a shocker - waiting time consistently 2 hours. Good luck with having breakfast or other meals in the hotel.

We had one of the large guest rooms in the main lodge for a week.  It was a lovely room and the balcony offered excellent views of the Disneyland Fireworks.  Valet Parking was not as easy as I am used to.  Restaurants vary from "average quality" (Story Tellers Cafe) to 5-star (Napa Rose)  See separate reviews.  Housekeeping was very prompt.  Easy Access to both parks and Downtown Disney.  Even though this is a Disney property with lots of families staying there, it wasn't noisy and kid-crazy.   They offer additional activities for kids and families.  Pool was wonderful, though FULL.  I was still able to find a chaise and relax.  We plan to go back in March' 15

Summary Heading: One of our favorites; worth the price. Get the bunk beds!
Summary: We go here at least twice a year. It is ridiculously expensive, but dare I say worth it. I would say perhaps it's not worth it if you are there only for one night as then you are likely spending most of your time at the parks and not in your hotel room. but if you are at Disneyland for more than 2 nights, it is definitely worth it. A few highlights (from a family perspective): - We always request the room with bunk beds as this is a highlight for our kids.  - So is sitting in the child-size rocking chairs watching classic Mickey Mouse cartoons in the lobby. These are the old-school cartoons and I love watching our kids enjoying these so much. It is wonderful, after a long crazy day at Disneyland, to come back to the beautiful lobby, have a glass of wine on a comfortable couch

Summary Heading: Grand in name, Grand in nature
Summary: This hotel is huge with large open spaces, we had priority concierge checkin at the Craftsman Club Lounge. The hotel has it's own entry gate to California Adventure Park for easy access. If you have small children they have story time reading in the evening in the club Lounge.

Summary Heading: First time staying here and was worth it!
Summary: I have been coming to Disneyland now for many years and always enjoyed every trip. Normally my folks and I stay on the Good Neighbor Hotel side of the resort but this time we decided to stay on a Disney property resort and we choose this one. We arrived Friday and left this morning, honestly this was the best place we had ever stayed at. We were upgraded to a Downtown Disney View after our original weren't ready, Rose from Brea,CA was very helpful getting my mom and I checked in and showing us where to go since this was our first time at the Grand Californian. Plus, Manny our valet was very friendly and welcoming us to the resort. Finally, Mike our bell hop for unloading and reloading our bags. Our room was amazing and the view was incredible to watch the fireworks. Beds were

Stayed here for four nights over New Years - feeling ripped off is the best way to describe this experience! Yes, like others I accepted that you're paying for the convenience of the location and having stayed at another 'neighborhood' hotel on my last visit, I enjoyed being able to walk to the parks - but what you pay for and what you get are totally apart.  You pay for a seven star hotel (two rooms with carparks views cost us over $1000 per night) - you get no minibar, no nice toiletries (cheap toilet paper), taps that were missing pieces, dirty sideboards (had to wipe up a water mark and the towel was black!). Got a lovely turndown once over the four nights!!   Check-in was fine but the girl, seeing my family of five with teenage children elected to give us a room with bunk

My family first stayed at this hotel in 2006 and have not stayed anywhere else since while visiting Disneyland.  My family stayed Dec. 29-Jan. 1.  We checked in at 7;30am and our room was ready at 11;30am.  We were given a room on the first floor which turned out to be fine.  Our room had 2 queen beds and a daybed. Had a view of the pool and since it was freezing, we barely heard any noise from swimmers.  Room was clean.  It was nice to enter the park early and come back after lunch to take a nap before braving the crowds once more in the evening.  The parks were super busy but expected during the holidays.    Yes, it is expensive and yes, you are paying for the location.  For my family, we feel the convenience of the location alone is worth the expense.  We will be back next

Our room was very clean and ready on time. We checked in early (around 12:30) and received a text around 2:00 PM with our room number. We had a very nice view of the California Adventure Park. Our room was actually above the Napa Rose restaurant with a perfect view of the rapid ride and the Soaring over California ride. We used this visit for a 40th birthday party and it was perfect. With the lobby, bar and all of the seating area it was perfect for all of the adults to be able to sit down and just hang out without having to worry about children running around. We sat in the fireplace area with drinks and then moved into the main seating area in the lobby for about 4 hours that night with no issues. We were able to go back and fourth to the bar and just be able to hang out where

This hotel is simply cashing in because of its location - paying close to $700 s night for a below average room - The amount they are charging they need to make done renovations - Have been coming here for 15 plus years and no changes to the rooms ......nothing has been updated -

We stayed here in December with our 2 children and loved every minute. The whole property has a magical atmosphere. The lobby is stunning and a relaxing place to sit for a hot chocolate at the end of the night. We found a quiet courtyard perfect for testing out the remote control cars we'd bought at Downtown Disney. The rooms are large, with plenty of family channels available (something we were surprised to find many hotels do not offer). They were also quiet - so much so that we didn't hear the fireworks at all from the room. The proximity to Downtown Disney was very handy and we really felt as though we were living at Disney for the whole vacation. The entrance to DCA was also extremely handy, and we walked up to the monorail for entry to Disneyland. We're already planning

Summary Heading: Amazing Hotel (plus Magic Mornings are awesome)
Summary: I just stayed at this hotel December 19-21 2014. It was so beautiful and the Christmas decorations are so tasteful and lovely. Yes it is expensive. WE all  know Disney is expensive, but the value of being a guest of the Grand Californian far outweighs the financial cost. As a hotel guest you are allowed entrance into Disneyland 1 hour before the park opens to the masses. So I think you have to ask yourself is walking onto all your favorite attractions without a line worth the price of the Grand's nightly rate. I say yes it is. Also a cast member named Susana really made trip trip more special. She provided us with fast passes.

We have stayed at the Grand Californian several times and had always had a good experience.  We had decided to visit after Christmas and decided to splurge and book a room on the Concierge Floor.  When you arrive, you skip the regular registration queue and go directly to the 6th floor and check in with the staff there.  Surprisingly, the effusive greeting from the staff that we were used to from the regular check-in was completely missing.  The staff was polite, but did not ask if we were celebrating anything special, and did not make us feel especially welcome.  We were given a packet of information and told we could visit the Club room until we were texted on our cell when our room was ready.  We visited the Club room and it is a small room with a drinks station at one end

Summary Heading: Grand californian is not so grand
Summary: Visitors to disneyland need to understand that EVERYTHING costs twice as much as it is intrinsically worth, from bottled water to souvenirs to resort accommodations. Disneyland is a unique environment and accordingly charges all the traffic will bear. We could have bought a small car for the price of our recent trip for 12 people for park hopper tx and  three days at the GC.   Other reviewers have noted the primary benefit of the GC - its convenient location.  In addition, the public spaces -- pool area, landscaped walkways, and the iconic hotel lobby --- are lovely.  The rooms are quite ordinary and on the small side, and for every added perk such as a view of the parks there is a substantial extra charge per room per night. The one add-on that I felt was well worth it for a

I took my daughters to this fantastic hotel for Christmas Eve and Christmas day.  We had a full kitchen, two full bathrooms, a washer and dryer and patio for dining.  There were also two spas, three swimming pools and a fitness center.  All of this at Disneyland.  One side of the hotel opens to Disneyland and another side has the entrance to California Adventure Park.  Parking was very convenient across the street from the Hotel.

We have stayed at Disney's Grand Californian many times in the past as well as a few nights over Christmas 2014. Definitely not worth the money you spend...rooms are nothing special by any means. Room service is slow. On Christmas Day 2014 at about 11 pm the fire alarm went off. Since the elevators were not working, we were instructed by a pre-recorded message to use the stairs. When we ran out into the hallway, no staff was around so we took the nearest stairwell down. Well, the stairwell was filled with smoke....decided to go down anyway since we didn't see any flames or fire only smoke. Thought about going back up and finding another way down, but as I said there was no one around except for those of us trying to get out. By the time we got downstairs and outside we were all

We stayed here for 2 nights with a 14 month old baby. The staff is amazing and very friendly. Check in and out was extremely simple. The location can't be better!  The rooms were average. We will definately stay here again!

Stayed for two nights over Thanksgiving weekend and the location is fantastic!  We booked a courtyard/woods view room and were pleasantly surprised to find we were upgraded to what I'm guessing is technically a theme park view!  Our room was on the second floor overlooking the Grizzly River Rapids ride at California Adventure‚Ä¶it wasn't a clear view of the park due to the trees, but they did provide a sense of privacy.  While there really wasn't much of a view, the location of the room was what we really enjoyed.  The room was located above the Napa Rose restaurant and the hotel's 'private' entrance to California Adventure park - we could be in the park in less than 5 minutes from our room!  The room itself was pretty standard but well-maintained.  Service is what I've come to

The bottom line is this hotel is overpriced for what you get.  I stayed here last year with my family and we stayed here again due to the convenience of being close to the parks but I am going to have a hard time staying here again.  The location is very convenient with a private entrance to DCA as well as an entrance to Downtown Disney near Disneyland. Other than these feature, this is an overpriced 3 star hotel.  As has been mentioned in other reviews, the lobby is nice and they have a good pool area.  The rooms are ridiculous for what you pay. They are small, dated, and have subpar bathrooms. Essentially, you get room that you would find in any Ramada that would probably charge you $100 per night. If this was the price at the Grand Californian, I would not be complaining but

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, Great Staff, Memorable Stay for Christmas
Summary: Although we generally stay at one of the Disney Resorts, this was our first stay at the Grand Californian.  Due to our experiences staying at the Disneyland Hotel on seveal occassions, our expectation here started our pretty high, we only switched hotels this time due to the proximity to the parks and the restaurants we wanted to vist. We arrived about 3 hours before check-in tio find a lengthy line of cars waiting to be assisted.  The staff did an awesome job of getting everyone processed througn and we were out of the car and on our way to check-in in a matter of minutes (Thanks Ken).  The check-in process went relatively quickly and we were given our keys to a complimentary upgraded room right away.  Bags were delivered within 10 minutes of us getting to our room and we were

Easy to get to from the airport.  We had three adults and two kids in a room with two doubles and a day bed. Our room overlooked the parking lot which wasn't ideal, but we were so close to the parks that if we wanted to see happier stuff, we could just walk to the good stuff!  We appreciated the snacks offered on our level, especially traveling with children.  One member of our party was not happy about the inability to turn off the fan sound in the bathroom, but it didn't bother the rest of us.

We usually stay at the Disneyland hotel, but they were booked so we splurged and tried the Californian. First the good--service was great, the lobby looked amazing decorated for the holidays, and the kids loved the bunk beds in the room. Being so close to the park was great with two kids who needed naps in the afternoons. The walk to the park was so fast and easy. Also, staying at the Californian gets you into one of the parks each day an hour before opening. We used that hour to walk straight on most rides, so that perk was definitely a bonus.   I have to say that the rooms were just average at best. Typical hotel room, not worth the large price tag. I would have to recomend the Disneyland hotel over the Californian. The price is lower and the rooms over there are bigger. We

We stayed at the Grand Californian twice before when it was newer.  So after a horrible year at home, (house fire, lost everything, no home for Christmas) we decided to take our kids to Disneyland and of course stay at the Grand Californian.  We were horribly dissapointed this year.  This hotel is not being taken care of, our faucets leaked and soaked everything on the counter, outlets had broken prongs left exposed.  Housekeeping had to be asked for everything, daily.. Coffee and towels PLEASE?  Then to top it off Christmas night around 10:40 we are woken up to the fire alarms going off in our building... Telling us to evacuate.  So we get the kids out of bed, grab a jacket and go stand out in the cold with absolute no information as to whats going on.  After about 30 min the

from arrival to departure this is a class act.  We were greeted by a cast member at registration who stayed with us until a station opened.  Our registration was handled efficiently and we were able to check in everyone in our party even though only two of us were present.  Our park hopper tickets were issued there rather than having to wait until the first morning at a ticket booth.  The rooms were immaculate and very comfortable.  teh beds were turned down every night with chocolates placed one each bed and any towels used during the day after the rooms had already been cleaned were replaced.  Guest services always answered promptly.  They even printed out our boarding passes when we were ready to leave and had them waiting for us at the registration desk.  Checkout was

After booking months in advance to visit over the Christmas holidays for the first time and paying over $5200 for 7 of us to visit both parks over 2 days, it was very disappointing to find that the 2 bedroom suite we reserved was not the spacious family area we had hoped to have.  We had very small balconies and a view of the pools.  NOT ONE Christmas light was anywhere in sight, or any decoration of any sort whatsoever.  The rooms were advertised to sleep 10.  There is no way that would happen unless the floor was used.  We did have 3 closets and 3 TVs, but no microwave.  The ice machine was more than half the length of the hallway away - and it's a long hallway. The reason we were all so disappointed was because we had stayed here about 5 years ago and had a wonderful suite

Summary Heading: Horrible.   Save your money. Fire alarms in the middle of the night.
Summary: Where should I begin..we arrived Christmas eve. Lots of confusion. Horrible signage.  Could not find room.  Not enough restaurants. Fire alarm went off when my husband, 7 and 9 year old children and I were in a dead sleep.  We followed the crowd outside to the shopping area.  No one staff member in sight to see if we were ok.  My 7 year old son had a stomach virus and was outside in the freezing cold for over an hour.  Not one hotel personnel member in sight.  People shoeless, people in bathrobes.  My sick son in shorts and t-shirt freezing.  No one explained anything to us nor offered a blanket or sweater!! This was a terrifying experience!!  My children were petrified. Not one once of compassion shown by Walt Disney personnel.   Also, you cannot eat in the hotel without a

Disney prides themselves on customer service and quality. This was the first time I have stayed at any of the Disneyland property hotels. Disneyland really is magical during the holidays and my girlfriend and I wanted to experience it together. I did extensive research to see what the most appropriate hotel would be for us and I chose the Grand Californian.  We stayed in room 3237 and it was a handicapped accessible room. My girlfriend and I aren't handicapped. We got assigned the room because there was an overbooking and our room was given to someone else since we checked in late around 10pm.   There were a lot of people and the check in process was really scattered and guests were not sure as to where to check in. Once we got checked in, we noticed that there was a big, green,

We had 4 rooms for Christmas Party. Location is The Best for visiting Disney Park. Interior ugly and very very old. Restaurant Storyteller, we were trying to get lunch there, service was good, interior ugly, quality of food disaster. Room service December 24 2014 was not funny:( I place an order one and half hour prior just for 10 tea, 8 bottles of water and 2 French fries. They do not bring anything even in two hours. When we get chance to talk to manager it's became even worse, she start lying! We were sitting in our room with opened door, but she told us that somebody was bringing our order, knocking and we not open the door!!!! After all they bring our order, new version they confuse room number, service lady was very professional. Think twice before get your choice for this

Booked a two-night stay due to its proximity to Disneyland. And proximity is probably the only justification for the high rates.  Check-in was good - staff went the extra mile to get us a room with two twins and a daybed before stipulated check in time. She was also very friendly and knowledgeable.   After a long walk from the lift lobby, we arrived at our room. It was very small, decor was old and felt like a motor inn, and worst of all, it smelled moldy. We had stayed in other Disney resorts and this was by far the most disappointing. There was also no communication between front desk and bellhop to deliver our luggage to the room so we had to make a separate call to the bellhop.  We did not get fresh towels the next day despite reminding housekeeping.  Check-out was

Summary Heading: Lovely Vacation Club Villas and Hotel
Summary: We had the pleasure of staying at both the Grand Californian Disney Vacation Club Villas and the Grand California Hotel rooms last week.  Particularly the DVC rooms are spacious and comfortable.  We had a view of California Adventure, but with the doors closed you could hardly notice the noise.  It was also fun watching the goings on after hours as cast members check out the rides for safety issues.  I highly recommend staying at the Grand Californian.  The grounds are beautiful, and it's incredibly easy and close to get into either of the parks.

This is a beautiful hotel and it was so fun to stay on Disney Resort property.  We were able to walk right into California Adventure right around the corner from my favorite ride, California Soarin'.  It is nice to have the "Disney" experience at a hotel beside inside the parks.  Also, it was great when I got tired during the day, I could just walk back to the hotel and not have to drive anywhere.

We go to Disneyland a number of times of year, we decided to stay at the California Grand.   Its nice nothing bad but its very overated.   It gives you the lodge feel, but not alot more.   The service is not overwhelming compared to the Disneylandland Hotel.     From start to end it seemed to be nothing exciting, most the staff did not seem happy in there jobs.   It was new feeling for us, as when your on a break you want to be happy.   There appeared to be alot of staff but most of them provide not a deal of service.   Try the Disneyland hotel for that classic Disney Feeling.

I stayed here with friends for the Avengers Half Marathon. The convenience of this hotel can not be overstated. Private entrance into Downtown Disney, a short walk from the security leading into the plaza separating Disneyland and California Adventure, Private entrance into California Adventure, and a short walk to the other Disneyland hotels (great for getting to the Expo at the Disneyland Hotel). Our room was close to the lobby but far enough away to be quiet. The monorail track was outside our balcony. Spacious room, great bathroom vanity area. Pretty standard bathroom and I wasn't thrilled with the sliding door, but that was a small thing. I would love to stay here again!

Another stay at the Grand and another great experience.  Staying club level is the best with children.  No need to worry about breakfast, lunch, dinner, snacks--there is always something there for the little ones to eat.  Complimentary cookie decorating kits were a hit.  The fireworks from the balcony were great especially with the desserts and hot chocolate to keep us company.  The rooms are showing their age/use--maybe changes are on the way?  Gracious, magical, and professional are words to describe the great cast members from housekeeping-craftsman club-check-in/out.  Miss Sam was the best and so attentive.  If they read these reviews--then they know, "Buttons" is looking forward to coming back and so are we.  Club Level is the way to go.  We also enjoyed all of the

I'll be honest here. I'm an HHonors member, so staying 'off-site' was a challenge when planning our Disney vacation.   So why did I?  Location, location, location.   Okay, there are a few other reasons, but you can't beat the location of the Grand Californian. Plus the Extra Magic Hour (different from pass holder's Early Hour) gives you an essential head start to the day.   We'd head out into the park first thing in the morning, walk back to the hotel for an afternoon nap (thus beating the hottest/most crowded part of the day), maybe take a dip in the pool, then head back into the park.   Rooms are smaller than they should be for the resort, but nonetheless are nice, clean, and efficient.  Hotel staff was phenomenal. We experienced the exceptional service Disney is known for.

Summary Heading: Really terrible service.  Great location and lobby though.
Summary: Despite calling in twice before we arrived, there were no notes on file about any requests for room type or location.  Checkin is interminable.  We were told by the checkin clerk that if we applied for an Annual Pass while we were there, we could use it for the discount at checkout, but when we checked out, we were told that was impossible--the hotel had been booked as a "package" with park tickets and they didn't even know what "discount" we'd gotten from the "website".  Sorry, but the checkin clerk knew all of this as well.  Cost us a lot of money.  Still love the lobby and the bar.  Both are just crazy busy though, and they've made some bad choices, like the stupid gingerbread house that is using up seating space in the lobby for some unknown reason.  Given the price

Summary Heading: Most Convenient of the Disney Hotels
Summary: We stay here a couple times a year and consistently receive great service and leave feeling we got good value. The property is gorgeous and clean, and worth every penny.  Very convenient access to california adventure.  The hotel is not quite as luxurious as some of the premier hotels around the world, but with the number of kids running around (and considering it's attached to an amusement park) I can imagine you have to sacrifice some fluff for durability.

The location was great, the room was amazing, we got connecting rooms and one had the most  amazing bunk bed - the kids (ages 6, 5 and 2 1/2) were beyond thrilled.  The details in the rooms were beautiful, and the extra magic hour makes staying at a Disney hotel worth it.  Loved everything about it, and the Christmas decorations in the lobby were beautiful.  The kids got to visit Santa and loved the room almost as much as they loved Disneyland!

This is my favorite place to stay at Disney.  It always delivers on service, convenience, cheerfulness, and comfort.  We had 4 rooms on this trip, and one of us was using a rental scooter arranged by the hotel.  Everything went off splendidly and all ages from 3 to 70 were impressed.  Our room was 4230, with a view of pool and Grizzly.  2 floors up, accessed by room card, is a viewing platform for World of Color!  You can't quite make out the water screen for a ride in the way, but, you can be dry, warm (heaters) and hear (piped in) the show and be back to your room in moments!  If you don't like the crowds and waiting on the hard concrete forever for the show, this is a great alternative.  Our host at check in was Randy, assisted by Linda.   Randy was wonderfully engaging,

We recently stayed at the Grand Californian for the 4th time.  My wife and I both found that the hotel rooms are really getting ready for some remodeling.  The sheets and pillowcases looked worn.  There were cracks in the ceiling of our room.  We noticed many dents and torn wallpaper on the walls.  We do love this hotel, but are hopeful that some updates happen before we would consider another stay there.  Service is top notch, but you do pay for it.  The lobby, bell service, registration desk, etc. are all fantastic.  The location of this hotel with direct access into California Adventure Park is a major reason why we have stayed at the Grand Californian.

Our family of five (children are 16yr, 14yr & 9yrs) stayed at Disney's Grand Californian over the Thanksgiving Holiday. We've stayed at the hotel a few times over the year. The hotel is beautiful and the service is five star! However, they do need to make a few changes within the hotel and some much needed updates to the rooms. Here our my overall thoughts throughout the hotel and our experience.   Location-Doesn't get better. Closet hotel to the park. They even have their own interest entrance into California Adventure. Perfect for seniors or families with small children. The hotel is located next to the main gate at Disneyland and towards the end of Downtown Disney.   Check in-From the moment we arrived we were greeted by the concierge right when we got out of our car (we

I simply love this hotel and think it is worth every cent for ease of access into the park with children.  While several like the views of the Downtown District, we like the view of the courtyard view.   Our room was a good size and much to our children's delight featured a bunk bed for them with separate lights which were not so bright as to disturb those still sleeping.  The wireless is nice quick with VERY few hoops to jump thru for connecting - I had do some work which required VPN access and there was plenty of speed.  The staff was great... well expect for the host who greeted us (his name was Nic) who was less than personable.    My only complaint was we had placed the "please no service" and yet they had serviced the room regardless - we wrote it off as an honest

I have wanted to stay at this hotel for a very long time, and I'm glad I finally got the chance. If you are looking for a swish and fancy new hotel, save your money, this hotel isn't for you. It's set up to look and feel like a wilderness lodge, and they created that feel perfectly. There are little Disney touches everywhere and there are even Bambi and Thumper prints on the shower curtains. There is also an entrance that takes you right into California AdventureLand. The lobby is incredible... would I stay here again? Absolutely. It is a little expensive, but I personally think it's worth it as part of a Disney experience.

Summary Heading: Everything you want in a Hotel
Summary: You won't find a more convenient and lovely hotel near Disneyland.  The location can't be beat and the amenities of the Grand Californian are worth the extra money.  My son and I visited California Adventure on a very hot day in September.  It was so nice to be able to walk five minutes to our hotel and take a break in a cool hotel.  In the morning the hotel entrance into the park can get backed up but you can come and go all day and you won't find that back up later in the day.  The staff at the hotel is so great giving my son special buttons and a cookies.  The food is good and the main restaurant offers character dining.  The pools are amazing and the hotel offers many kid activities throughout the day if you need a break from the parks. You will not regret staying here.

Stayed at the Grand Californian for a few nights while visiting Disneyland, and I have to say it was probably the most magical hotel stay I have had. Convenient access to California Adventure, and Downtown Disney, and not far at all from Disneyland. Every cast member I encountered was wonderful, which is very important given the Disney standard. I would definitely return to this hotel again if I make it back to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Its like your home away from home!
Summary: Stayed in this hotel with my family of 5.  The Grand Villa where we stayed had three bedrooms with 2 queen size beds each.  The living rooms on each level had sofa beds too so i asked my sister, her hubby and daughter to stay and visit with us.  The kitchen was fully stocked so I was able to cook breakfast for everyone.  We had a full size washing machine and dryer which was an extra benefit to have.  We were able to watch the fireworks at night from our bedroom and living room terraces.  The rooms were just the perfect size with ultra comfortable beds with luxury bathrooms.   My whole family just love it whenever we stay at the Disney hotels!  Worth every penny...

I always wanted to stay at a Disney property but could never justify the price when there are so many cheaper options nearby that are nice properties. This year I decided to splurge and booked the Grand Californian for my husband and I to take our two young granddaughters on a quick Disneyland trip. While the rooms are basic standard hotel rooms the public areas and grounds are very nice. The lobby was beautiful- especially at Christmas time with the large Christmas tree, gingerbread house, and carolers every afternoon. Our granddaughters loved the fact that we could easily take a break each afternoon to let them swim in the pool complete with water slide while we relaxed on the comfy pool side lounges. We loved being so close to California Adventure and downtown Disney. The

Summary Heading: very expensive but convenient to Disneyland
Summary: The hotel lobby is beautiful and the location is the best for convenience of walking to both parks as well as downtown disney.  The rooms are beautifully detailed but a bit dark and worn.  this is also a very large hotel so the rooms are sprawled out in different areas.  The pool area was large and great for kids and adults alike.  We splurged on an upgraded room overlooking downtown disney and were shocked to discover (it wasn't mentioned by staff) that we could watch the nightly fireworks right from our balcony!  Getting back to our room #4421 in time to watch the fireworks was the best part of our hotel experience!

This hotel can't be beat for the location.  Easy access to both parks and downtown disney.  Easy check in, fantastic guest services, clean rooms, H2O bath products, refrigerator, flat screen tv, and many restaurants on site including White Water Snacks, quick service with affordable prices.

I haven't been to Disneyland in CA in about 30 years.  A lot has changed for the better in that time.  This hotel was great.  We just walked into the two theme parks.  As a matter of fact, the parks were so close that we could go back to the room during the day to change clothes or pick up/drop off things.  We were right in Downtown Disney which was great as well.  The room was clean and the bed was comfortable.  I enjoyed my stay here and hope to go back before another 30 years passes.

Spent two nights at the Grand California over the Thanksgiving holiday.  The lobby is quite grand.  As many have mentioned, the rooms are not fabulous, but they are nice.  We had a queen/bunk bed combo, premiere view on the 5th floor.  Loved the room and the balcony.  (see not-so-great nighttime pic).  We had the goofy roller coaster just off the balcony.  Couldn't hear it at all with the slider closed.  Was able to get an ok view of World of Color at night.  Couldn't see the projections too well, but still a nice perk after a long day in the park.  The staff was great.  Everyone we came in contact with was friendly and helpful.   You're paying a premium to have early and easy access to the parks, and easy access to downtown Disney.  We used the early entry to Disneyland on

Summary Heading: IS IT WORTH THE PRICE!? LET'S SEE...
Summary: Although this review is about 1 1/2 months too late (Mid - October trip), I still felt it worth sharing my experience. Let me preface my review by stating that my boyfriend and I stayed as DVC (Disney Vacation Club) guests which means the rooms are considered "villa's" versus "guest rooms". In order to stay on the DVC side of Grand Californian, we went through a rental broker who secured us the room for 5 days 7 months in advance. Therefore, if any of you are thinking of going this route, renting DVC points is not for impromptu trips but for trips scheduled @ least 7 - 8 months in advance especially for Grand Californian as they only have a very limited quantity of "villa's" available which range from studio's to 3 bedrooms.  My boyfriend and I secured a studio villa on the DVC

This is a nightmare of 4 room changes, lazy, lying Disney employees, overbooking and a comedy of deceit and incompetence.  My wife and I arrived at Disney's Grand Californian at 11:45a Friday December 5th for our semi-annual extended weekend stay that we have been doing now since the Grand Californian opened. She took half a day off to allow us more time in Downtown Disney for some Christmas shopping.  We were prepared to not be able to have an early check-in so when our room wasn't ready we were fine with it and went to shop around until it was. The Disney Front Desk Person told us they would text us when room 4222 was ready, gave us our keys and said we could go on up when we got the text.   We received this text @ 3:00p saying our room was ready. Upon entering the room, there

This place is magical. Disney does everything right. We stayed there only one night but during that one night a forty foot Christmas tree sprang up int the lobby. They were able to assemble and decorate a huge tree within a couple hours while everyone slept. We will definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: Hard to be disappointed at Disneyland but this hotel somehow did it
Summary: I've visited the Big D many many times and have never failed to have a good time. Since my significant other had never been, I decided to splash out and book the Grand Californian with a Premium View king bed room and dinner at the Carthay with the World Of Color package.  It just seemed like Disney Corp. did their darnedest at every turn to over-promise and under-perform. The little things often matter the most, and rather than making decisions to err on the side of luxury or comfort, they seemed to choose the path that maximized profit at the expense of guest comfort.  The first sign was when we checked into our "premier view" king bed room. Rather than the view of the park that we had expected, we found that we had a partially obstructed view of the pool. And rather than a

We arrived here for a 4 night stay and were very disappointed in our stay.  It was not great from the start.  We found the bar staff to be very rude and customer service was out the window.  The only two people we found who helped us was Sonja and Bob.  Sonja finally got us into our room and seemed to be the only one who cared and Bob the porter helped us as well.  The blankets in our room were full of old food and the rooms were so old the wallpaper was peeling off the walls. The walls were so thin - you can hear everything from next door! This hotel needs a make over and while they are saying they will do it in 2015 - perhaps the prices should reflect the state of the hotel now.  The breakfast we got was horrible. The muffins under the eggs were soaked in water and that

We stayed their for one night this past month on a last minute trip.  I just can't say enough if you can afford the convenience do it...it is worth every penny.  We had early entry at Disneyland since we stayed at a Disney Resort for the night and we took full advantage of it.  We got 5 rides done the first hour.  When the parks started to get busy we retreated the short walk back to the Grand Californian to take in the festivities in the lobby.  The Christmas tree was up and the gingerbread house was being completed (literally) over the 2 days we stayed there.  We had a standard view room at the very end of the building overlooking the entrance to Disneyland and Downtown Disney and the back of Soarin.'  Great view of the fireworks!  What more can you ask for?  We did get hot

We just returned from a 3 night stay at this wonderful hotel and we already want to go back.    Pro's:    The most comfortable beds and bedding I have ever experienced in hotel.  Soft sheets, down comforters, lots of pillows!  I actually hate my own bed now.      You are literally in California Adventure! It took about 5 minutes to get from my room to standing in line at Soarin' Over California.     The Christmas spirit here is seen and felt throughout the hotel.  Think Christmas carolers, Santa in the lobby,  a huge Christmas tree, the most gigantic gingerbread house!  Con's:    Slow check in.  It seems like it could be much more streamlined.  Very personalized check in experience.  However, when I am checking in I want to get the Disney show on the road.      The expense.

Summary Heading: Rm 5021 is beneath Concierge Club = Noisy, Old, Mediocre Hotel
Summary: We are avid Disney-goers and have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel 6x so far and love that hotel, but we decided to try something new for our most recent stay (Nov 2014) and stay at the Grand Californian for our 3rd annual Thanksgiving trip to Disneyland.  We hated it and wished we had saved our extra money and stayed at the Disneyland Hotel like we normally do!  The rooms are no bigger than the DLH, actually smaller in my opinion, they're older, not remodeled, and there's no cute light-up headboard that plays music like the DLH has.   We paid extra for a "courtyard" view (because the standard view was already booked so we had no choice) which no one tells you the MONORAIL RIDES THROUGH EVERY 10 MINUTES so that noise is right outside your window all day long!   The walls &

Summary Heading: Great hotel great location not cheap but worthwhile in my opinion.
Summary: Let's just say this is a first class hotel all around.   It's clean, staff is polite and helpful, rooms are great.  It's expensive but you know that going in.  My only complaint is they need to do a much better job staffing the 1st hour of early entry.  Given what we are paying for this benefit it shouldn't be 30 minute line to get in.  Pretty bad that we are paying for a private entrance but being advised to walk to the main gate as the lines are shorter.  Other than the 1st entry in the morning it's a great benefit.

Summary Heading: "Feels like you're actually staying INSIDE Disneyland at the Grand Californian Hotel"
Summary: This was our second time staying at the Disney Grand Californian Hotel and we had a fantastic time!  Staying here feels like you're actually staying INSIDE Disneyland because our room view was of the California Grand Adventure Park and when you walk out of the hotel you're inside the park - AMAZINGLY convenient!  Not to mention the accommodations were very good.  The entire hotel/lobby looks like a grand lodge with comfy areas to sit/relax and an oversized fireplace.
