The only downside was the restaurant choices inside the hotel itself - we weren't pleased - BUT we easily hailed our car via valet and went down the road to In N' Out Burger several times or simply walked out the side door with immediate access to several wonderful restaurants/shops/entertainment!    If you're

Summary Heading: Not such a good value, but has it's perks
Summary: This hotel is realistically a 3 or 4 star hotel, that charges the location premium, not surprisingly. Yes, it is great to have magic hour every day, and it's really great to have a separate entrance to California Adventure, but everything else is pretty mediocre. I've stayed at 3 star boutiques that had similar accommodations and finish. There aren't even very many Disney themes inside the hotel. I guess they were going for the California lodge theme, but I would have hoped for a few more perks to not feel like I was getting SO taken by Disney. The bar was a nice place to go at the end of the evening and downtown Disney was always packed full of people to keep the atmosphere going, but still not a very good value. I guess you really have to be a big Disney fan to appreciate this

This is the first time I have stayed at a Disneyland Hotel and I would do it again in a heartbeat! We stayed on the Concierge level, I wouldn't stay anywhere else. We had a park view room so we overlooked the pools and California Adventure, beautiful views! The room was a regular room, nothing to brag about, except the view of course, but the service on the concierge level is spectacular.  From the moment we arrived at valet and were escorted by our personal concierge to the 6th floor, bypassing the huge line of people checking in in the lobby, we were treated like "royalty". There were always snacks and drinks in the Craftsman Club. We were teated VERY well. The Craftsman Club had a fireworks viewing every night.  It was ok, I think you could see it better in the park but not

Summary Heading: Exceptional property. Not to be missed.
Summary: We stayed in a suite with a view of the park. The room was fabulous and of course the view was breathtaking . If you are going to Disneyland, this hotel is a must for any family. Everyone should spoil themselves once in their life with a stay at this hotel . It's family oriented, excellent restaurants and prime location for all the Disney fun. We've stayed here twice and I look forward to coming back.

Last week my family had the opportunity to stay at the Grand Californian Hotel.  We stayed in a Vacation Club Villa for 1 night.  The room was decent sized with a queen bed and a fold out couch for the kiddos.  The studio included a microwave, mini fridge and sink.    Since it was only a single night stay I was concerned that I wouldn't be able to explore the hotel/pools as much as I would of liked.  When I called to confirm check-n time I asked the hotel operator what my options were if I arrived earlier than published check-in time.  She said I was able to store my bags with the bell-desk and use the facilities as early as 6am.  We arrived around noon checked our bags and enjoyed ourselves in the pool area until I received a text with our room number.  The system was flawless.

Summary Heading: Stay here for a genuine Disney Experience!
Summary: I only stay here when I go to Disneyland.  Great architecture, unbelievably close to the park, wonderful service.  When you are here, you will not have to leave the Disney bubble whether you are at your hotel, at the parks, or in between.  Wifi was great too.  It's pricey though, but worth it IMO  Tip:  Ask for a room near the elevator so that you are not marooned in a far off corner of the hotel.

We recently spent 4 nights at the Grand Californian during our Thanksgiving trip to Disneyland!  We had stayed at Paradise Pier two years ago, and walking through the GC on our way to California Adventure made us want to stay at this gorgeous Disney property.  However, I think Paradise Pier is a better value for people who go "flat out" at Disney the way we do.  At PP, we had a 2-room suite with two queen beds in one room and a large pull-out in the other with 2 bathrooms.  We were on a suite floor with a free breakfast room (similar to a Hampton Inn breakfast, etc.)  With three kids, free breakfast (and fast) is awesome.  GC cost quite a bit more, and we were in a small room with a queen bed and a bunk bed with a trundle.  When I asked if there were larger rooms, the desk

Dates: Late October, Sunday through Thursday  Check in was crazy busy.  I highly recommend packing a bathing suit or other essentials in your back pack.  We checked in around noon, but the room wasn't ready until about 3pm.  We had to stand in another line to leave our luggage with the bell hop.  We wished we would have put some bathing suits in the back pack to eat lunch and swim until the room was ready.  Take advantage of the Magic Mornings and separate entrance from the Grand Californian.  Cars Land was fantastic with a head start.  Note: the FastPass machine for Radiator Springs Racers doesn't turn on until about 15 minutes before the regular park opening time (45 minutes after the start of the Magic Morning).  I recommend going to the Racers first and then cruising around

My family & I just finished up a 4-day long stay at this gorgeous hotel & have never been happier. We were in Disneyland to celebrate Thanksgiving, our 20th anniversary, & our youngest son's 13th birthday. We drove up & the valet immediately took care of us. We got the concierge level room so we were greeted by the concierge, who  checked us in & showed us to our room. The rooms were a bit smaller than I'd expected for the price we paid, but they were cozy, very clean, & the premium view was breathtaking. There were sweet little touches, such as a signed photo from a Disney character & 1st visit buttons given for each person. They also had an itinerary of all our dining reservations all ready to go for us, as well as anniversary buttons for my husband & myself & a birthday

What a beautiful hotel! The rooms were wonderful, the staff was amazing, and the location was worth every single penny - the room price is a bit stiff, but considering our trip was a driving one and travel costs were minimal, it was very much worth it.  We felt like celebrities entering the drop dead gorgeous foyer and being attended to by friendly, helpful staff.  The rooms were not nearly as nice as the foyer would suggest, but they were cozy, super clean, had every amenity, and smelled "fresh," not like some hotels can smell at times.  Overall, we really liked the hotel, the ease of parking and proximity to all.  We'll stay here again, for sure!

Summary Heading: Get the Disney reservation # when booking outside Disney
Summary: Disney.com had no rooms available.  Found one on Orbitz.  So I paid rack rate for 2 rooms.  Very Pricey but I was happy to be at the Grand Californian.  Our families VERY favorite hotels. On checking in, they couldn't find my reservation.  Called Orbitz and they talked to the clerk.  Took about 45 min. for them to square it away.  Seems Disney's computers were having issues with their wholesale purchasing system.  This wasn't an Orbitz issue.  I know this because I had the same issue with Expedia the next night when checking into the Disneyland Hotel.  The Clerk at the GC was Awesome.  Even though this was frustrating, she was sweet and plowed through the problem.  the clerk at the Disneyland hotel told us "we're full, so we can't help you".   Love Disney, but for the price they

Thank you Grand Californian Hotel we had a lovely stay. The foyer is so beautiful, the staff are very helpful, the rooms were lovely and clean and our children loved that they had a chocolate on their pillow every night when we arrived home.   The location is so convenient especially with its own entrance into California Adventure Park.   It was our daughters birthday while we were there and the staff made sure from the very start of our stay that she felt special and this carried on throughout the park for 4 days which was a wonderful experience for her.  On our last day we had a few hours to wait for our transfer to the airport so we spent time sitting in the foyer and enjoyed every minute with the story telling, cartoons for kids and the piano man. It was a wonderful end to a

While I admit the rooms are overpriced, we could not have been happier with our stay.  The room was clean, quiet and very comfortable.  The staff was polite and helpful and the location absolutely cannot be beat.

Summary Heading: Nothing closer to the parks but expensive for room quality
Summary: The recently renovated Disneyland Hotel has more attractive rooms but the advantages of a stay at the Grand Californian are immense: (1) walk directly into California Adventure, (2) closest hotel to Disneyland gate, and (3) easy car access to and from the park when you arrive and leav.  After that, the public spaces are fabulous but the rooms are typical moderate Disney.  Nothing fancy at all.  Would be a $79 room at La Quinta if it weren't located on and run by Disney.

Summary Heading: Second stay and so much beter than the first time, because of premiums view room
Summary: After a stay 2 years ago wich was ok, but more because of the hotels entrance to the park I choose this hotel back for that reason. But this time I payed extra for a premium view and that was what I got. From the balcony I looked on disney's california Adventure ( on grizzly run, tower of terror). My room had a king bed and a comfortable couch. There was a refrigirator, but no minibar. But you can buy cold drinks with a credit Card at the vending machines.  The room looked much fresher than the one from 2 years ago. Check in went very quick, I hooked it on the Disney website, and also bell service worked perfect. Had dinner at fantastic napa rose, dissapointing breakfast at storytellers caf√© and never-to-forget roomservice breakfast with waffles with banana foster. This time,

I've stayed at the Grand several times and each time gets better.   Customer Experience:   As you enter the gentleman who greets, walks you to the queue line, asks your name and about your trip, then identifies which cast member is readily available, walks you to that individual, introduces you to the person and tells them your last name so the process is already starting.    Rooms: Clean, amenities available, comfortable, the beds feel like a cloud, the shower was clean and overall the room was great to relax in after a long day.  Room Service:  Good food, quicker than expected.  Ambience: Love the lodge feel with the comfy furniture in the lobby, niches to sit comfortably and chat or sit by the large stone fireplace.  The resort offers everything you need.  Convenience: Love

We spent a week at this hotel in September this year, we have been to Disneyland several times before but always at area hotels.  This hotel is definitely convenient to California land but only so so for Disneyland it self.  It took 3 days of complaining to get a room with working AC which is dismal for a hotel that is this expensive to stay at.

We just spent five days at Disneyland and stayed at the Grand Californian at Disneyland.  I was really disappointed.  I have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel many times and thought I would try the Grand Californian.  Don't get me wrong it's nice but no nicer than the Disneyland Hotel.  I thought that this was going to be the cream of the crop but in my opinion it wasn't.  I didn't feel it had any more than the Disneyland Hotel (except the entrance to California Adventure).  We had the same size room we have had at the Disneyland Hotel, same conveniences, paid a lot more, and could not have the roll away that we normally have at the Disneyland Hotel.  I have two adult children who do not want to sleep in the same bed, thus the request for a roll away.  Everything else was top notch

Summary Heading: Location and early admission are all we liked about this hotel
Summary: We were really disappointed by this hotel.  The only thing we felt made this worth it was the location and an hour early admission.  In fairness, getting into Disneyland early is a huge benefit...we went on more rides early in the morning than we got into the entire rest of the day.  And it was very nice to be able to go back to the hotel and take a break in the middle of the day-- get a bite of lunch outside the park, take the grandchildren for a swim, have a nap-time and then be able to easily re-enter the park (although the re-entry stamp they put on our hands did not survive the swim and hand washings!)  But the hotel itself did not offer much to make us feel good about the high price we paid for this hotel...we've stayed in the real Ahwahnee hotel that this hotel was

This is a beautiful hotel however something's seem a little off.  I asked to have my room services by maid service and when I returned all they did was empty the trash and leave fresh towels,  they didn't even make the bed.  I called the front and they said if I wanted a full cleaning it would be $30 because I was "only" staying 7 nights.  I confirmed that without paying they wouldn't make the bed.  She said yes.  What?!?  I could stay within walking distance off property in a nice hotel and pay less than a 1/3 of what I paid here and they would make the bed.  Not being able to get maid service in a hotel like this is ridiculous.  I'm staying off property next time (if I renew my annual pass which in not sure about now).  Simply ridiculous Disney.

After checking in early in the morning we were able to leave our luggage and take our room keys.  We received a text later in the day with our room number letting us know we were ready to check in.  The room was always cleaned by the time we came back from Disneyland for our afternoon break.  The kids' stuffed animals were arranged artfully on the bed and they thought that was amazing.  There were many places to eat in the hotel from snacks to character breakfasts, and fine dining.  Something for everyone.  The waiting area in the lobby for the kids was perfect as well.  Small wooden rocking chairs in front of a screen playing classic Disney cartoons.  Will definitely stay here again.

As a Disney Vacation Club member I know the hotel is going to be above average. It wasn't a let down in fact in exceeded our expectations. Excellent guest service from the bellman to the front desk to the pool staff...every encounter was with a smile. Spacious rooms and comfortable beds. We loved the easy walk in to California Adventure and Downtown Disney. Loved the warm feeling of the expansive lobby. Wouldn't hesitate staying there again or highly recommending to friends.

we stayed with the kids and had a good time. the hotel is close by all the attractions and very nice in the rooms. my kids woke up every morning and ate toast and eggs at the restaurant close by, i had bagel and coffee

We stayed here with our two daughters for 5 nights. Immediately when you walk into the resort you feel like your at home. Its the coziest hotel on property. The rooms are very clean and spacious. I definitely recommend getting a view of the theme park. Its a little more expensive but worth every penny. We stayed on the concierge level so we could enjoy the late night fireworks in the lounge. They have a lot of activities for the kids and even gave us free milk and cookies. Definintely will come back to this resort!!!

Just enjoyed two nights at this hotel, along with daily visits to the two theme parks. Epic experiences shared with our 6 year old grandson and his family. The Disney search to pursue excellence in creating customer satisfaction continues..with a  minor exception.. Wi-fi  in the hotel is a disaster....difficult access....slow response... But most important.a frequent, total interruption of our internet connection..... Very frustrating... Customer service staff offered ineffective solutions, and i/t support simply acknowledged that it is an ongoing problem. Front desk staff nodded sympathetically when we voiced our frustrations about our wifi experience  on checking out... To Disney visitors.... Go and enjoy the Magical Experience, but be prepared for bad or noneexistent

Summary Heading: Welcome Home!  Had a Grand Time!
Summary: Nothing like hearing the words,"Welcome home, we've been expecting you!"    Coming to the Grand Californian, especially as a Disney Vacation Club member, is truly like going home.  Somehow as huge and palatial as this hotel is, it is still very warm and cozy.  The walk-in fireplace in the lobby definitely adds that extra cozy vibe!   Our room was fabulous to say the least.  Tons of space for our family of four.   Great view of the pools.  And, a very convenient kitchen area for those quick grab and go breakfasts.   Location, location, location!  Just walk out the door into the parks!  It doesn't get any better than that!  We thoroughly enjoyed every moment of our 7 night stay!

Summary Heading: A hotel which enhances the Disneyland experience
Summary: Here's a place that makes the Happiest Place on Earth even happier.  Disney's Grand Californian Hotel is right next to Disneyland. It couldn't be any closer without being inside the park. The hotel has its own gate leading into the park. With no queues, you could walk from your room to the log ride inside 5 minutes.  Yes, they don't miss you on price. Yes, it isn't one of those marble and glass-coated five-star hotels with chaise lounges, chill music, and cocktails and canap√©s on arrival.  But think about this. Less walking for you. For your kids. Less time wasted. Early access to the park as part of Magic Mornings (though you may have to queue a bit) ahead of those staying at the ring of hotels outside the complex.  Had enough at midday? Need to dry off? Nappy changes? Just

My husband and I stayed for 6 days for the very first time at this hotel. We usually stay at the Disney Land resort, but wanted a different experience. Let me say this, yes the hotel is a little pricey but that price comes with the most amazing convenience. Park entrance from the hotel as well as the down town Disney. This hotel has so much to do in itself. Most people do not know that there is a roof top area and you can watch the fireworks and see the water color show. The pool is fantastic, but you should stake out your claim early. The down side of having such an amazing pool would be the crowds. I think this hotel could do a little better at removing towels from the lounge chairs, so many people put down towels then leave them on the chairs when they leave. Thus creating

We stayed for 7 nights before and after Halloween. The only thing I was disappointed in was not being informed that the hotel has a certain number of Disney passes for Halloween night reserved just for hotel guests. They are available to purchase on the event day only - in this case, Halloween night. We didn't know and the tickets online were sold out and being scalped for $450/2 tickets. Because of this, we bought tickets at Universal Studios even though I would have much rather gone to Disneyland.   The hotel is "Grand" when you first walk in.  From the time you pull up to the front entrance through to the room attendants were all very attentive. Check in for us was very quick considering we had booked our trip under 2 back to back reservations. They gave us room keys for both

Summary Heading: Family-fun resort in the perfect Disneyland location.
Summary: Disney's Grand Californian Hotel  This resort has it all: nice rooms, great views, restaurants, pools, lounges and everything else Disney within walking distance. It has a great "mountain lodge" theme, which only adds to the comfort and getaway feel. Just another spot to show you this really is the Happiest Place on Earth!  I would definitely stay here again. ¬† Pros: Location- This resort is the closest in walking distance to the Disney parks, it has it's own entrance to Downtown Disney, so if you have a multi-day pass, it's very convenient to walk back & forth from the hotel to the mall, restaurants and parks.  Atmosphere- I loved the woodsy, lodge ambiance! The main lobby is definitely grand, and the lounge areas, restaurants and pools are wonderful- every sitting area is

We decided to visit Disneyland for Halloween festivities.  As a DVC member, we can stay in the Grand Californian Villa suites.  As expected, check in was easy and the staff were very helpful.  We requested a view of Disney California Adventure and was lucky to get a great view of Tower of Terror and Grizzly Run  We could even see the Disneyland fireworks at night.  Our two bedroom suite was spacious, clean and a perfect layout to give everyone both family time and their own space.  We ordered room service once and delivery was very quick.  On our last day, we were able to store all of our luggage downstairs and keep our car in the parking lot until we left in the evening.  Overall another great stay at the Grand!!

Lets face it, this hotel is GRAND as soon as you walk in.  The front of this hotel is on a very busy street and in the middle of a theme park but you would never know it.  The lobby is beautiful and you immediately feel transported.  The one HUGE drawback to this hotel is check-in.  I have no idea how a hotel of this size can take so long to check in one room.  It took me a good 30-40 minutes to check in when there was nobody there.  After all of that, the room wasn't even ready.  We waited until close to 3 until our room was available.  They do give you your room keys and text you the number to your room so there is no need to revisit the excruciatingly slow front desk.  Our room was on the 6th floor and had a standard view.  I have visited this hotel many times and sadly, the

This is the best hotel to stay at if your going to Disneyland. When you get to the hotel just park your car for the weekend everything is in walking distance through the hotel. Everyone is friendly and nice. Clean, spacious and great views. Highly recommend

Summary Heading: luxury Hotel and even better concierge service
Summary: When we arrived the luggage was removed from our car and whisked away and the car parked, although I was surprised that we had to pay for this, we had just come from the venetian in vegas and it was free.  We were taken upstairs and given personal booking in service, shown our room and the concierge lounge, which provided snacks all day long and free drinks, the snacks were quite repetitive and need to be varied every day, but it was a great place to be after a long day in the parks, we were also able to have continental breakfast, on our first night we were able to  watch the fireworks from this room with Julie Andrews narrating.    The hotel is huge and there is direct access to down town Disney with lots of shops and restaurants which then leads to the Disney gates, we smiled

Summary Heading: An oasis of calm in a hectic marathon weekend
Summary: We stayed at the Grand Californian Hotel for the Disneyland half marathon weekend (30th August to 1st September) and, to be honest, we were hoping to stay at the Disneyland Hotel but it had sold out.  Firstly an aside, if you are taking part in a Run Disney event do see what they offer through their partner travel agents.  We didn't get our hotel stay through "Get Travel" but did approach them for park tickets and found that there was a good discount (again, this was something that I hadn't tried before, but will the next time).  The hotel was easy to get to from the Long Beach area, even though we arrived just after the 10k run had departed.  It was easy to pull up and drop off the luggage, but the self park is across the major road from the hotel and it took another 15 mins

I have stayed at this hotel several times and hope my reviews and point of view can help others. I'll try to speak to things that have changed since my last few stays in hope you; the reader can learn from my experience and maximize your enjoyment.  First, This hotel is very expensive and offers great d√©cor, service, and the closest proximity to the parks. This is what you are paying for. As compared to any of the other Disney hotel's you get the same general size room, toiletries, parking, etc. You will see lot's of complaints about value for the money. No value exists here. I think many of the complaints are driven by folks who spend their life's savings to stay here and then are disappointed in the Motel 6 quality toiletries, rest stop quality toilet paper, and small room

Every cast member I came in contact with during my stay was top notch. They were always enthusiastic about making my stay comfortable. The room was spotless. The characters at the breakfast buffet were fun yet not intrusive. It was easy to see how Disney sets the bar in the service industry. The hotel is pricey but if it is within your budget I would recommend giving this place a try

Being on site at Disneyland was invaluable with a toddler in tow. I couldn't imagine staying anywhere else with nap times in mind and all the supplies you need with a young child. It was so refreshing to come back to the room midday and wash our faces and cool down from a warm summer day.  We reviewed the room at 4 because there is no door to separate the sink/bathroom outlets from the main portion of the room. How is a mom to shower and blowdry her hair after the babies are sleeping from a long disneyland day? ;)

Hotel lobby is spectacular with a pianist in the lobby playing Disney movie theme songs. There's a beautiful fireplace set in a rustic, woodsy layout. You can purchase coffee or wine right there. The Christmas tree is just beautiful. They offer 5 hours of babysitting if you want to explore downtown Disney's bars, restaurants or catch a movie while your little ones watch the fireworks with the Disney staff. Simply amazing!

what a better way to celebrate you birthday than spend it at Disneyland. We stayed in a 1 bedroom DVC villa.  OMG it blew me away.  the stainless steel kitchen and the master bathroom is huge!    the beds are comfortable.  the hide away bed is under the TV  my 17 year old slept on that ( he was too tall) but he said it was comfortable.  area was quiet, when the windows are closed but open them and its noisy.  we overlooked the California adventure park . definitely get higher than the 2nd floor.  I tried but nothing was available.  6th floor viewing area was great.  Pools, hot tub great.   The little store to buy milk and last min food for the room was close by and the food they served was good too.   I would definitely stay here again in a heart beat.

Summary Heading: You're paying for the Disney awesomeness!
Summary: We had an AWESOME time at the Disney Grand Californian!!  Ok, so let's start by saying that rooms are lovely, however they are not large nor extravagant. I read that they designed that in mind to get build more rooms per floor of the hotel... However, the Disney service is always top-notch! You get turn down service every night (with two fine chocolates per bed. (They even gave two for each bed on the bunk bed for our daughters!). Staying on site at a Disney resort you get early magic morning EVERY morning to both Disneyland and California Adventure (rotating days). Not to mention, the entrance to DCA is within STEPS!  So, yes, you're paying more. But I honestly have to say that we were taken aback by the attentiveness and details by Disney staff and the grounds.

Summary Heading: everything you'll need in one spot!
Summary: every year for Halloween, we stay in the Arcadia suite, it's insane....  3000 square foot suite overlooking the pools. on the same floor is the craftsman club. its an extra charge to use the club, but its stocked full of tasty snacks and free beer or wine! the wait staff is attentive and cool, they dont (cant) say anything but they will and do accept tips. i tipped, because they always had my beer when i wanted! worth it after a long day in California adventure or Disneyland. you can access California adventure through the hotel. we would run down to grizzly river run and do a few laps, and then run back to the pool! they make it to easy. the turn down service was always on point, story tellers restaurant buffet was awesome. we have been doing this for 10 years, and will

Both my husband and I are from Southern California but with young nephews we now find ourselves there several times a year.  We always stay at the Grand Californian for a couple of reasons.  It's convenient, amenities are wonderful, service is terrific and our latest reason....THE AMAZING CONCIERGE Level.  Last trip we had several friends meeting us for the day and the front desk was happy to accommodate our group for refreshments in the concierge lounge for snacks.  Great spot for tired grown ups to watch the fireworks and enjoy some wine and then go back to the park to close it down.  We are headed back with our family in a couple of months and have booked the Concierge level for our group....can't wait.  24 hour a day vacation.  Love it!  Thanks Disney...as always for the

Just stayed here the week before Halloween.  Beautiful hotel with all amentities.  The room was a bit small, but the bunk beds were a big hit with my kids.   The pool was great for a break from the parks, but a small and larger waterslide it was another huge hit with the kiddos.   We really enjoyed our stay.  The rooms are definitely expensive and over-priced, but you are paying for the location and the luxury of being so close to the parks.   This fact alone made it worth it.

Just stayed here over the Halloween period of 10-28 to 11-1-14.  The hotel itself is amazing an beautiful, huge six story high central lobby ceiling and very well appointed with nice couches and tables as well as a large fireplace tucked away with several chairs to sit and enjoy.  There's a tv set up in one corner near the guest service desk for the little children to congregate and watch a movie while the adults unwind on the couches.  The elevators are fast, never waited more then a minute to go to 5th floor.  Room was well appointed with comfortable queen bed and a bunk bed for the kids, small fridge, coffee pot and hair dryer.  View was nice, overlooking hotel pool and directly facing the Grizzly Peak area of California Adventure park.  We could also see the California

I stayed here in a while ago and it was incredible, I absolutly loved it. How enchanting and warm it was to stay here. Its very fun and very "adult" like environment and "richy" feel. Its incredible, I can't stop gushing over this place. Just beautiful! It will always bring those memories of shopping in the gift store, grabbing a drink from the bar, lying out near the pool, just enjoying the calypso vacation getaway. For the deal i grabbed it for was definetly worth it! Thank you Disney!

A very good hotel I stayed here a couple of months ago it was very good the beds were amazing the view was great but the staff were a little like when I lost my hat I rang up the lost and found and they could not have cared less like I said so you have a black baseball cap down there and they were like no and then I asked if one happens to show up could you call me and they were like sure in a really sarcastic was and they didn't  have the friendliness of a Disney person but I would definitely go back because you are not in your hotel that often

Summary Heading: Nice but quite a walk to DL
Summary: We reserved a standard Woodlands/Courtyard view, and it was just that-Standard.  You're really paying for early entry to parks throughout your stay and conveniences like having your purchases delivered to your hotel (not to your room, to the front desk where you will need to pick up next day) My husband and I visited with my parents and the bathroom situation was a little hard, it was two sinks but pretty small. We stayed at the Hyatt Regency in Feb 2014 for a visit with my niece and nephew and our room was much bigger. (For almost a quarter of the price) It's nice to stay on Disney property because you never leave the "magic" and the beds were very comfortable. Wifi is pretty slow though, but honestly, we didn't use it that much because we tried to disconnect and be in our

Perfect location. From the lobby you can walk out one door and you are in California Adventure. Go another direction from the lobby and you are entering Disneyland. Couldn't have planned it better. We stayed two nights which was just perfect. Very pleasant staff throughout the hotel.

The hotel was so convenient for long days at the parks. There is a special entrance from the hotel into California adventure which was perfect for an early morning or for a trip back to the room to decompress. I wasn't overly impressed with the decor. The lodge atmosphere was so cheesy and out of place in SoCal. I would expect that in taho, but not here. The staff was nice and always helpful with any questions or requests. A cool bonus is anything that you purchase while at the parks can be delivered to the hotel for you so you don't have to lug it around. I would stay here again purely for the convenience factor.

Summary Heading: Great but sorry to be picky
Summary: This is a fantastic hotel, a wonderful location and the staff are absolutely brilliant. The picky bit for a Disney hotel is not very Disney characters at breakfast and that's it. The rooms are a good size but for the price you would expect a bit more. Finally I know it's a Disney hotel ( kids) but there is no bar other than the pool bar ( daytime), so if you don't want to buy a wine or beer from the shop or have a drink with your meal or order room service it's dry so  it just lacks the adult relax feel. Fortunately there is a nice outdoor bar in Downtown Disney but it's down the road.

I've stayed at 7 of the Disney-partner motels and hotels during my many trips to Disneyland. This one is the very best of all of them!  My daughter, 8-year-old grandson and I arrived early, so the car valet had a bellman put our bags on a cart to secure them until we could check in. The only hitch with our reservation was that we were assigned to a king room instead of the two queens we had reserved. The discrepancy was quickly handled to our satisfaction. We were given room keys and told that we'd be texted with the room number as soon as our room was ready. We took advantage of the time to visit Downtown Disney (a mere hop, skip and jump away) and to have a bite to eat after our 8-hour car ride.  The room was a standard-sized room and very quiet all 3 nights. We had a view of

Summary Heading: Great trip for two older adults
Summary: This was a wonderful experience for a couple folks who had been there before.  The hotel is very modern yet comfortable.  The ambiance is beautiful and is everywhere.  The staff is warm and friendly.  And the two restaurants  are delicious!!!!!!!!!!!   We can't wait to go back.  The location is perfect for seeing the sites of both parks.

Summary Heading: Location Location Location. And a Wonderful Hotel
Summary: On out first trip last year to the Disneyland Resort, we promised ourselves next visit we would stay here. And boy, are we glad we did.  No, it isn't cheap. Is it worth it? So long as you don't have to make too may compromises on the rest of your holiday, absolutely.  Right from the moment we pulled up in the car to check in, we felt special. Plenty of counters were open when we arrived, and there was someone managing the line directing people to the next available counter. The cartoons for the kids on the mini rocking chairs was a nice touch.  Our room was 3353, overlooking DCA, not far from Grizzly River Rapids. It was great hearing the screams of people as they went down the big drop! With the doors closed, there was no noise at all. The room was nice, reasonable size, lovely

We stayed a week in October as Disney Vacation Club members. We arrived very early on our check in day and were very tired. The night front desk woman was very rude and made us feel like we were not welcome. We asked if we could just hang out in the lobby for awhile and they said "no". The security would kick us out. Also, the night manager (Kelli) was very rude and said that there are no rooms available as they are booked up! She told us we needed to call someplace else and get a room. It was ridiculous that we just needed to get another hotel room for about 3 hours till our check-in at the Grand Californian that day. Anyway, we called the Motel 6 down the road and ironically they were very accommodating and very nice and helpful. So we had to catch a taxi to the Motel 6 and

We stayed at the Grand Californian for 6 nights last week. We were a party of 9-7 adults and two children. As the reviews state, you are paying for location and more importantly convenience.  You are paying 5 star prices for an above average hotel but you cannot beat the location! The hotel staff was great and very accommodating and courteous. Guest services was always helpful, they will even print your boarding passes for your return flights. The lobby was grand and gorgeous. The pools were great and you had your choice of 3 pools, with pool bar service (though slow), towels, and a water slide. They also have a water station there. Housekeeping was OK, got the job done but nothing spectacular. We were greeted in our room with a previous guest‚Äôs dirty diaper still in the trash.

We stayed at the Disney Grand Californian October 15-19, 2014 and while the location and early access to the park was wonderful the hotel itself needs an overhaul.  When entering the hotel, the lobby is wonderful and of a grand scale.  Given the price my expectation was that the rooms would be wonderful as well.  Walking into the room was a big disappointment!  The rooms are very dated & ours was quite dirty (thick dust in areas that are not regularly used).  The beds (we had the bunks and a queen sized bed) were very comfortable but the furnishings are tired and out of date and the room needs new carpets and a coat of paint.  The bathrooms and amenities were not what I expected either for the price.    On the positive side....if you want proximity to Disney this is the place to

We stayed in the hotel for 1week .The hotel is perfect for attending the Disney parks only a short walk through Downtown Disney to Fantasyland and it has own entrance to California Adventure ,The lobby is nice but the rooms are plain .I have stayed in Disney hotels in Florida but the room held no magic for me the view was of trees and the monorail ran past the room .For a 5star hotel the wifi was very poor constantly cutting off no difference between the room and the lobby both areas were poor service .The room looks a bit dated .The pool area was nice and the loungers very comfortable ,As a Disney vacation club member we used our points to stay here . It was 4weeks points to stay here for 1week unfortunately I did not feel it was worth that .The staff were friendly and helpful

We stayed at the Grand Californian recently and really enjoyed it as we were travelling with a toddler and the easy access to both Downtown Disney and California Adventure made paying the extra to stay here so worth it! It's true when you read that the rooms and bathrooms could use an update but they are far from shabby.We had great housekeeping service during our 4 day stay with our adjoining rooms always cleaned before my little nephew needed his 1:00 pm nap. We splurged and rented a poolside cabana one day ($190.00) and it came fully equipped with our own food/drink staff; welcome fruit tray, t.v., overhead fan plus island with fridge-  I could plug in my ipod and speakers! Great breakfast buffet in the Character Restaurant with fresh food and visits by Chip and Dale and

Summary Heading: A nice bonus to your Disney trip. But get ready to pay.
Summary: Our family of four includes two toddlers. We stayed in a bunkbed room our first night then switched to a double queen the next because we spent the first night arguing about who should sleep up top. The hotel is beautiful in a Vegas casino sense. All wall surfaces, posts, and beams are made of fiberglass and plaster. But if you let go you feel exactly like your in a grand cabin resort in Yellowstone. The lobby has cool air conditioning, evening piano music, and a lovely fire place with plenty of rocking chairs. The hotel pools are perfect for kids and there is plenty of space for them to swim. Access to the Park is exceptional. Waking up and taking a short stroll to Disney G California Adventure is awesome. We boosted to the Concierge level service because we thought having

Summary Heading: Everything you hoped it would be!
Summary: I know you pay for it but you get Nordstom service without the pretentiousness. From the big "Welcome!" As you drive in to the Valets and Check In, this resort caters to all. Most everyone seems genuine and actually likes their jobs. The Hotel's design kept my eyes busy with admiration and the room (we had a standard 2 queens) was not only nicely appointed but quiet. They seemed to have actually insulated the rooms quite well. The thought to the toiletry tray was appreciated, foot cream and aloe Vera for sun burns! The location is prime as well and you get 1 hour early access to parks on certain days of the week. They show outdoor movies as well but we were too exhausted to participate. Unfortunately my Nephew was too young to attend the Children's programs as well, it would

We celebrated our wedding anniversary at the Grand Californian. Have been to Disneyland many times and have also stayed at the Disneyland Hotel. Have to say that the Grand Californian is our favourite. Yes, expensive but for us well worth the extra. We were there the second week of September and found an amazing price which made it even better. The staff went above and beyond to make our stay a special one - rose petals and chocolates on our bed were a nice touch! The pools were lovely and at this time of year not busy. Of course the location is perfect. The hotel restaurants and gift stores do close by 10pm but you are only steps away from Downtown Disney which is open until after 1am Maybe if we were there at peak season when the hotel and pools etc are much busier and room

Summary Heading: THE way to do a Disney stay.
Summary: Let me start by saying I LOVE Disneyland.  I grew up in SoCal but now live out of state.  I have stayed at other Disney hotels but the Grand Californian is the way to do it.  Especially with young kiddos. We were lucky enough to get a discounted rate which made this hotel affordable for us.  Most people, myself included, could not do the regular rates.    Pros The closest hotel to the parks.  You literally can go directly into CA Adventure from the hotel through a resort only guest gate the gates to Disney are really close too.  This is really nice with your younger kiddos that may get overstimulated in the park and/or need to nap.  It's so easy to get back to your room and then back into the park again.    Fabulous service- We had impeccable service.  The registration was so

I stayed at this hotel and it was traditional Disney themed so  you get what you pay for. you get the characters you get the breakfast shaped Disney waffles. you get the park access right outside the resort no car or shuttle needed you get the clean water the friendly service it's pricey but you're not staying at a hotel a regular hotel. You pay for the experience the service visuals the grand Californian lifestyle of the hotel you literally never have to leave and you probably shouldn't because traffic is a nightmare we just went to San Diego zoo went to the Hollywood walk of fame it's only about maybe less than an hour away but took us maybe to three hours. If you want to leave the resort make sure you have nothing else planned that day and leave lots of time to be stuck in

Summary Heading: One of my favorite Disney hotels
Summary: I am a more frequent visitor to Disney World in Florida than in Disneyland in California, but I've stayed in just about every deluxe Disney hotel in the U.S. and France.  (Haven't made it to Asia or Hawaii yet.)  The Grand Californian is one of Disney's best.  We love the theming and the location just can't be beat.  The resort-guest-only entrance into California Adventure is a terrific benefit, and the short walk to Disneyland and easy access to Downtown Disney really make this one worth the price for us.  The restaurants, pool, and concierge desk are all top notch, too.  The rooms are very comfortable, and the split bathroom design (sinks separate) is very convenient.  Our room was spotless and had a Downtown Disney view -- with the Main Street Train Station and Space Mountain

Summary Heading: Missing some details that I'm use to at a Disney resort
Summary: My daughter and I are Disney fanatics. We go to Disney World together at least once a year and she goes 2-3 times a year. This year we decided to go to disneyland for the first time. We stayed at the grand Californian expecting the best that Disney has to offer. Overall the hotel itself is great. It's big, clean and comfortable. What was missing was the ability to get something to eat and drink after 10 pm as well as some basic personal care items. When we stay at a Disney World resort the hotel counter service and gift shops are open until midnight. Here at the GC they closed at 10. Not only that but they are very small and have limited selections. So at 11:30 I wanted a soft drink and the only place to buy one was the vending machines. When I tried to do that they do not

Summary Heading: Good location, but $$$ for what you get.
Summary: This was my third time in Disneyland, stayed in the Grand Californian for a conference held in the hotel, so got a decent reduced rate...  Nice to be close to the park-- I had limited time after my conference to go to disneyland, so it was very nice to be so close to the park!! Not sure if it's worth the extra cost though if you have more time here- I've stayed at other places significantly less expensive across the street that are only a 10-15 minute walk to the park.  There is nothing really special or "disney themed" in this hotel. Just average in terms of rooms, decor, etc.

Summary Heading: Amazing Experience with the Disney Magic
Summary: I just realized I had never reviewed our stay at the Grand Californian, which was in April 2012. I had to put November 2013, since that was the earliest I could go back.  Our daughter was there because her dance company was selected to participate in Dance The Magic, which is an amazing experience culminating in the entire camp's own special parade down Main Street, USA!  From the moment we arrived, the experience was a whole other level. We arrived at valet parking and was directed towards the front desk. When we arrived, a cast member met us and asked us a couple of questions to make sure we were in the right place. After checking in, we went to our room. It was very clean, spacious and comfortable. Although partially obscured by trees, our balcony overlooked the pool area.

Summary Heading: Great stay at a very convenient Disneyland hotel.
Summary: We stayed overnight at this hotel because it was convenient.  We live in southern Calif., but we were participating in the CHOC Walk for children's hospital, and we wanted easy access to the park during a very crowded early morning hour.  From valet parking and check-in to our exit at 11 am, all was seamless!  The hotel is grand, decorated like a rustic log cabin, in the Disney fashion.  Staff was friendly and helpful, check-in was quick and easy (no lines, which was impressive considering they were booked to capacity).  The restaurants were nice, clean and had variety.  The food was average to good.  Very family friendly, of course being Disney and all.  Our room was clean and comfortable. The rooms were also rustic in decor. The bed was comfortable, with soft sheets (no smell

Summary Heading: Something for everyone, and great attention to detail.
Summary: The stunning craftsman lobby is warm and inviting, while being truly spectacular. Check-in is smooth, fast and efficient, and every member of the family gets their own key card--with their  name and spending limit--for the kids.   Strategically, placed just to off the front desk is a medium size TV that loops classic Disney cartoons from the 1960s and 70s. Around it sits about a dozen chairs for kids age 3-7. With a little Disney magic, kids sit themselves in front of that TV, which allows parents to get details sorted out. That type of detail, is emblematic of the entire experience. Small subtle amenities that make a big difference.   The rooms are awesome, food tasty, and pool is over the top fabulous with ample numbers of life guards who are attentive and engaged.         The

This was our 2nd stay at the Disney Californian and this time we had a 3 room suite which was a one bedroom suite with 2 connecting rooms. Our group consisted of 2 kids under 5, one pre-teen, one grandma and 4 adults. Grandma got the one bedroom suite with a king bed and the other 2 rooms had 2 queen size beds. The pre-teen slept on the pull out couch. We had stayed at the Disneyland hotel before and that suite was much larger. It seemed a little crammed as all 8 of us could not sit together in the living room space comfortably as we could at the Disneyland hotel. The Suite also had 4 small balconies with the biggest one right above Starbucks in Downtown Disney. When booking the room we inquired about the concierge services and they told us that we would have to wait until we

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for :-)
Summary: We booked this hotel as my husband had stayed at the Paradise Pier earlier in the year, and had to walk through the Grand Californian to get into the parks.  He was so impressed with the lobby he decided we should stay here.  Yes the hotel is expensive, but you get what you pay for.  People have commented that the rooms are small.  We had 3 of our children with us, and we found the size of the room fine.  I think the rooms with bunk beds may be smaller, we had 2 queens and a sofa bed.  The location is second to none.  The good thing is you get early entrance to the parks each morning and then you can nip back to your room any time for a nap or to go to the pools.  The pool was a great place to relax and have lunch and cocktails.  Very reasonably priced.  Love the location for

Summary Heading: Concierge suites here are top notch luxury service
Summary: We loved loved our stay here.  We were in the concierge level suites, on the 6th floor.  We were greeted at the car by a personal concierge who walked us straight to our room, no nasty line ups at check in.  We were shown the facilities, such as the club house, which saved us a ton of $$ because we had a light breakfast there everyday, snacks and drinks too.  The concierge assisted us with Disney tickets, or any other questions we had.  Pool was great, not too crowded.    Will definitely be back!

We had requested a bunk bed over 10 months in advance for one of the 3 rooms and for all three families to be near each other. We followed up 3 months out to confirm. Our one and a half hour check-in got us nothing. Only apologies. No manager would come to talk to us even after 3 requests.  Way overpriced for this hotel. Paying for location. Rooms are mediocre at best. Location to the park and pool areas were great.

Summary Heading: Nice Public Areas, Rooms can Vary
Summary: We enjoy going to the Grand Californian.  They have a nice beautiful and grand indoor sitting area.   Our favorite time to visit is during the Christmas holidays.  They have some stores inside the hotel,  but we have found that the quality and range of items offered have  gone from excellent to minimally good over the years.    We like their restaurants at the resort such as the superb Napa Rose and also for breakfast of lunch Storyteller Cafe.  The swimming pool areas are very nice.  The location by the parks and Downtown Disney is ideal.  While we like the swimming pool and public areas a lot, we found the rooms to be OK but not as special as one would think in such a luxury resort.  I have stayed at nicer rooms for lower price at the good neighbor Disney hotels.  For the

This was supposed to be a treat for our family as this is an expensive hotel. We were traveling with our 2 year old and 5 month old sons so we were very eager to get into our room so they could nap. Upon making our reservation over the phone, I was told that I would be able to get into the hotel room at 3 p.m.  Also, the representative organizing the reservation had difficulty communicating and was difficult to understand. When I told her that I was having a hard time because we did not have a good connection (trying to be polite) she would sigh out of annoyance. I had to call back and speak to a different representative to confirm our reservation only to find that the original representative had made the opposite requests in the computer than I had asked for. When we arrived at

My family and I stay here almost every September. We love the easy access to the Californian Adventure, Downtown Disney and Disneyland. Nothing beats the magical mornings! The staff and rooms are always wonderful. We were a little bit disappointed that the Napa Rose and White Water Cafe were closed for renovations, but enjoyed meals at Storytellers Cafe and restaurants in downtown Disney instead.

Summary Heading: Great base to do disney but it's going to cost you
Summary: Ok this was our second leg of our California trip and we had no dramas at all. We checked in and it was pretty busy but didn't take a great amount of time before we were all sorted and in our room. Staff were always pleasant and helpful,and hotel was always spotless. Room size was rather small for the cost for three adults and two kids, think there was a portable cot for our 7 yo ! But we made do with the two queen beds. The balcony overlooking downtown Disney was cool and at night the fireworks were right infront of us which the kids loved. I haven't stayed in any of the other hotels nearby so can't really coment on how convenient the hotel was to everything, but assume it made life easier ? All in all we had a great experience at the grand Californian but it cost a lot, the

We booked through Costco travel and got a great deal! We have stayed elsewhere before but nothing beats stay so close! We got to walk right into California Adventure from our hotel! Disneyland was just a short walk through Downtown Disney. The hotel its self is amazing! We ate at the Storyteller Caf√© for dinner one night. Then most of the other times we saved a bit by eating at the White Water Caf√© on the property. The girls (2 and 4) loved the Mickey waffles. The pool was nice. I love the fact that they have lifeguards on duty. Our encounters with the hotel staff were nothing but pleasant. Even the housekeepers made sure they said hello and always had a friendly smile.   I have 2 complaints but it will NOT keep me from staying again... 1) Self parking is $17 a night. The

We loved our stay at the Grand California.  We stayed for 3 nights and it was absolutely beautiful.  the pools were great and the lounge chairs at the pool were fabulous!  We had a downtown Disney view and at first I was concerned about the noise but you absolutely could not hear any noise when the slider doors were shut.  The staff was so pleasant.  Everything was wonderful and the beds were so very comfortable.  i will stay here again 100% and would chose this property over any of the other Disney properties at Disneyland.  I loved the private entrance to DCA which was very convenient!  Also loved having access to the parks for Magic Mornings.

Everything about this place was excellent.  Exceptional customer service, rooms clean, tidy and a good size for travelling families.  Location, well right in the middle of Disneyland - couldn't be any more perfect.  Plenty of food, bars and shopping options at Downtown Disney - perhaps a bit pricey but hey it's Disneyland.  Pool side was perfect for relaxation on our down days. Would thoroughly recommend.

Fantastic place to stay if you want to get on the rides early..we were able to get on all the kids rides before the gates opened....when one of the kids were tired it was easy to go back to the room ... while the others enjoyed...the shower heads revolve and are fantastic..the room was small but cozy.My great-grandson did  not want to leave the room....the staff were great and security made sure only guest were walking around the rooms.   I was surprised at the low cost of the drinks in the bar..and the bartender was really great..

Summary Heading: They can't manage their fire alarms
Summary: Don't plan on letting  your little owns take an afternoon nap. The management does not seem to have a handle on the fire alarms. Two days in a row now we have been startled from naps with Screaming and crying children all around being tossed out into 100 degree weather.  We are DVC members and are very disappointed that there is no explanation and no contrition from the staff and  management all of whom seemed to treat this as a n amusing joke of some kind.

For the shortest possible walk to the parks stay in this hotel.  Staff was super friendly and helpful.  Room and bath very clean and comfortable bed.  Enjoyed very much, would stay here again.  Had an upgraded woods view room on the 4th floor.  Not much for a view, but the location and room itself were very nice.

Summary Heading: all is right in the universe
Summary: When 1 of our travel companions walked into the lobby. his comment was "all is right with the universe". The lobby is truly impressive and the staff members were friendly and courteous which is not an easy feat given the large numbers of hotel guests they must process each day. The rooms are "smallish" for the price but the beds were comfortable, the rooms were quiet and the amenities were nice. Access the California Adventure and downtown Disney are the key selling points making it worth the extra cost. The hotel bar is very nice and you can make afforable meal out of the bar snack menu.

The lobby and property itself are spectacular. The craftsman style inspired lobby will almost take your breath away. However, the lobby is very misleading as to what you can expect when you arrive at your room. The room is for the lack of a better word "ordinary", it was not at all what we were expecting, and to be honest a little disappointing considering the amount you will pay to stay at the Grand Californian. If you are looking for a clean and comfortable place to stay then this will certainly meet that criteria, if you are looking for that core Disney DNA that makes staying at a Disneyland property "magical" then you might be some what disappointed. The entrance into California Adventure is a nice perk as well as the close proximity to the Downtown Disney District, but this

The Lobby creates a false impression of a five star hotel, which is at best 3 1/2. This hotel was conveniently located and that is what you are paying for.  But in saying that the staff are very helpful and friendly. Dont think i would stay here again...

Summary Heading: We will stay here every chance we get
Summary: We stayed here for Dapper Day, again, and had a perfectly wonderful experience.  Can't wait to return in the spring!  We were upgraded to a pool view room for free since it was our daughter's first visit to the resort.  Our room was quiet, clean, and spacious.

Summary Heading: All the blandness of a mega resort but with Disney prices
Summary: What we have here is an average hotel wrapped in a Disney package.  Huge and sprawling and seemingly convenient to the parks.  The lobby is gorgeously appointed in a craftsman stye and is huge and gives you a false idea of what staying here is going to be like.  It has a direct entrance into California Adventures which is what you are really paying for.  Dont get me wrong, that is a pretty awesome thing.  I just wish the service lived up to the style.  We are here right now for my partner's birthday weekend.  We have friends with us and a couple just flew in from London as a surprise.  We have dinner reservations for four which we tried to change to six only to have to be shuffled off to some phone reservation hub in another country.  No, they did not care about a birthday or

This hotel is so convenient to the parks.   It has some great views of the park.  You can just walk out from the hotel into California adventure.  This trip we asked for 6th floor with the hospitality room.  We could all meet for breakfast and if not too busy in the park, wine or other refreshments in the evening.  Love the Disneyland hotel also, but this is way more convenient.

Very nice, close to the Disney park and great staff. Very friendly and would most likely go back to that resort. They made a special birthday cake when I went for one of the members of the trip and we're very good at checking up on us to see if we were liking our stay.

The 3rd floor 2 bedroom corner suite worked out perfectly for the 5 adults and one child in our party. Each bedroom had it's own small fridge and the good size living room had a sofa bed. The balcony looked out onto the pools below and was a nice spot to just sit after walking around all day. The location of the hotel is what makes it perfect, just a short walk from Downtown Disney and Disneyland and California Adventure is literally right outside the door. This hotel is not inexpensive but then nothing in Disneyland is but at least it saved the inconvenience of having to drive or walk a long distance to the parks. The Storytellers Restaurant had an excellent breakfast buffet- again not cheap at about $27.50 per adult- but the characters in costume made it such fun for the child

Nice to have somewhere close to take the little kids but not worth the money. Hotel entry and lobby was super impressive but the rooms were just ok and dated. I would not spend the extra money unless the rooms were more up to date and nicer. Good location but rooms are not good.

Summary Heading: Probably worth a stay one time
Summary: A nice high end Disney Property with the location and extra hour worth the extra money (at least once). I will probably stay at which ever of the Disney properties is the cheapest next time as really, the kiddo's didn't care (as long as there was a pool) and i didnt really care as long as they were happy.  "Usual" great Disney service. Don't upgrade to a partial view room (either go the view room or save your money).  Still overall was a great experience.   For a "great hotel" experience go to Vegas. For a great park experience go to Disney.

We loved this hotel. We really are Disney's fans. But this was our first trip to Disneyland, in California. We went many times to Orlando, and always in Disney's hotels. The Grand Californian Hotel is beautiful, very elegant and cosy. And the best thing is its location, by the parks.

This hotel is the perfect place to stay at while visiting Disneyland and California Adventure. The convenience to both parks makes it ideal. We just returned from a 4 day stay with our daughter/son-in-law and 2 grandchildren. The staff was polite, friendly, and very helpful. They set us up with adjoining room which was perfect. The pool was the perfect way to spend the afternoon and "recharge our batteries" before returning to one of the parks in the evening. Having the ability to go back and forth between the hotel, Downtown Disney and the parks is ideal. Plan to return with even more grandchildren the next time!!!

Summary Heading: A Big Discount made it worthwhile
Summary: We had never stayed at the Grand Californian before because typically it's priced so high that it's not a good value, but right before Labor day we were able to get a room at almost half the usual price and so we were happy to try it out. You cannot beat the location. It is so close to the parks, that going back to the hotel for a break or change of clothes is an easy option, even when your feet are tired. And it's so close to both the Peet's coffee (in the Haagen Daz store) and the Jazz kitchen express that you can order your coffee, pick up beignets from the Jazz Kitchen, collect your coffee and be back on your balcony in 10 minutes or less.  The rooms are smaller than at the Disneyland Hotel, and there's not much pixie dust (but then the Disneyland Hotel doesn't have much

THE best hotel I've ever stayed in. Absolutely, hands-down, first class. Wonderful staff, engaging decor, you're right in the parks... just walk out straight into downtown Disney. If we were doing the Anaheim thing again, this would absolutely be the place we would head to for accommodation. I traveled with my daughter... we both had Disneyland on our bucket lists and I've got nothing but fantastic memories from our time at the hotel and visiting the parks.

If its all about the kids this is a place you should go to and which they will definitely enjoy. Especially younger children seen that there are many attractions that are accessible.  For the children It is like being in a wonderland and you can see how much they are enthralled and excited. therefore, it is a pleasure to see your child's face glow with joy.  So with this in mind, the other inconveniences are irrelevant (standard of rooms, food)

Summary Heading: I am lying in bed listening to the man in the next room snore.
Summary: Honestly, I don't have a set against Disney hotels, I am a Disney enthusiast but this hotel has only one thing going for it and that's the location.  Disney think they can create MagicalMoments for their guests with their syrupy platitudes but really this hotel is just too big to offer any kind of service continuity.  If you go to the pool and purchase a priceless cocktail (literally they don't list the prices) keep a close eye on it or it will be whisked away.  Mystery charges keep showing up on my credit card so I've been advised to call Disney billing in NYC at my own expense to sort out their mess.  I asked the doorman for a taxi and he looked at me blankly and asked me if I'd rung one myself when I suggested that most international travellers don't have a local phone or

We just spent 4 nights there during a major heat wave and were so happy to have a spot to rest and cool off, while still being so close to all of the action! This was our 4th or 5th stay, so obviously we love it. The rooms are nice basic hotel rooms but the resort is stunning. The decor in the common areas is beautiful and high quality. The special access to California Adventure park is really nice too.   What sets this place apart is the staff. They are there to please and do a fantastic job of it! From the time you arrive until you have to head home, they are present, pleasant, helpful, cheerful and make you feel that they care.   The beds are very comfortable, the rooms are clean, there is little outside noise, the patio was nice and ice was easy to get. The pool area was

We stayed here for four nights during a trip to Disneyland with my family. It is certainly pricey, but I figure that's the cost of a great location. The side entrance to California Adventure is particularly nice, especially with small kids in tow.  We were able to stay on the club lounge, and, while again an added cost, I did appreciate the dedicated concierge staff, quick check in, and food and snacks available throughout the day. The lounge was crowded at certain times, but the staff there was quick and attentive, cleaning tables, refilling the buffet, etc.  My husband and I had a traditional room, while my parents, brother, and his family shared a suite. All the rooms could use an update, but it was less noticeable in their suite. It had plenty of room for the 6 people that

Just returned from a three night stay at the Grand Californian with my wife and two of our adult friends. We had a blast at this super nice hotel that is steps away from everything we were there to do. Being able to come back to your room during the day for a nap or to just relax is definitely worth the extra money. That being said, prepare your expectations accordingly, you are paying for location and not a $350 per night hotel room. The rooms are what you would expect at a nice Hampton Inn or equivalent. The rest of the hotel, public areas, pool, restaurants etc. are definitely above average, not to mention a private entrance to California Adventure. As a group of adults we enjoyed the friendly staff and couldn't find any reason not have the Grand Californian as our first

We have been to Disneyland about a dozen times in the last 9 years. We usually priceline a 4* hotel in the area. I've always stared dreamy eyed at this hotel everytime I passed it in downtown disney or as I stood in line on Grizzly River Run.  I could never bring myself to fork over the $ required to stay here. As fate would have it, I won a disneyland trip from a local radio station and this is the hotel my family was put up in. The room itself is on par with other high end hotel rooms in the area. I've never slept in a more comfortable bed with more comfortable linens and pillows in my life. After a long day in the parks I felt like I melted into that bed. We were given a room with a queen and bunk+trundle bed. It fit our family of 5 perfectly. I loved that the vanity/sink was

It was great having early entry access to Disneyland/California Adventure. The hotel was beautiful. Rooms were basic. Loved being able to come back to the hotel to drop things off or take a break. Cast members at hotel were nice and helpful. There was a little caf√© that had decent breakfast that were fast and reasonable for Disney.

I stayed on the Grand Califorian for two days with three days at the park. This was my 5th stay and each time it gets worse.  The last 3 stays were as a DVC member. DVC members ar definitely second class citizens at Disney Resorts, no daily maid service or coffee unless you pay extra for both etc. The front desk and valet staff were quite good but housekeeping was nonexistant.  We check our bags upon arrival and I paid the extra $30 for maid service. The room wasn't  ready, this was expected, so I went to use the lobbey's rest room. It was filthy. There were no paper towels and the stalls had no lighting. When we got to our room that night I noticed the room service menu and been drawn on by previous guests and the pads of paper were also used. Remeber rooms at this hotel start

My first stay as a guest of DVC son. Loved the location and all pools and amenities. Closeness to parks was excellent. You can walk everywhere. If you run or walk for exercise you will find places to do that. Don't miss Calif Advnture Wonderful world of color. Downside was Disney way of handling crowds at entrance.. They used to do it way better

AS DVC members, we stayed four nights (Monday-Friday) following Labor Day weekend. The hotel is beautiful and as only Disney can do, they really immerse guests in the atmosphere of the hotel; in this case, the mountain forests of California. We also enjoyed the background music while sitting in the hot tub. The direct entrance to California Adventure was great and allowed us to dress for the rapids ride right there in the park and then come back and change. There is also a direct entrance to Downtown Disney which also serves as the most direct way to get to Disneyland. If you have been to Walt Disney World, it is very similar to the Wilderness Lodge.  The beds were comfortable and the kitchenette was exactly what we expect. It would have been nice to have a fan/vent in the

From the moment we stepped foot off of our car to check in the service was impeccable! There was a bellman ready to help with our luggage & a valet promptly parked our car. Plenty of cast members available to check guests in & out so I only waited 4 minutes to check in. We arrived early in the day so I did not expect our room to be ready .They offered to store our luggage so we could make our way to the park. The room & bathroom  was very nice & very clean. We had a great view from our balcony to DCA. Loved the turn down service & extra towels every night. You just can't beat the convenience of staying on the Disneyland property especially when as a guest we were allowed in the parks early before the general public. There are restaurants & shops all around you so u never have to

We booked 3 premium view rooms at this hotel for a special birthday celebration.  The lobby is great with a TV section for kids to view Disney movies, cute small rocking chairs provided.  A piano player keeps the mood going for adults with a lush seating area.  So far so good.  The first room I was given overlook a horrible looking roof with a peak at the pool area if you looked hard enough.  I complained and was moved to the second room "overlooking the theme park", I was told.  The room overlooked some unkempt trees with tarps below, a slight view of the tops of some rides, and construction going on adjacent to the room.  It was truly bad with constant hammering going on.  I complained.  This time they moved me to a room with a premium view, as I had booked and paid for.  The

Summary Heading: Not The Hotel It Used to Be
Summary: We have stayed here, at least, a dozen times over the last ten years. On this trip we had two rooms- connecting- for three nights. We paid top dollar for the "premium view". Disney has changed their description over the last few years from theme park view to premium, semi premium, downtown Disney and street view. We were on the 5th floor (hotel has 6 floors). The premium view for the two rooms was just OK. You could see parts of the park. The problem here is that the trees have grown so tall that even on the 5th floor the view is primarily of trees. They charge an awful lot of money for the premium view and there isn't much of a view.  The problems started from the very beginning. We had two rooms so we had two cars. We pulled into the hotel and the valet started unloading the

We just returned from another great stay at The Grand Californian. The service and the location are simply the best. The perks that come with a Disney Hotel are well worth the price. The Bar Menu and Drinks at the Hearthstone Lounge are a great way to end your evening after a day in the parks. The property is fabulous and we love Disney. Can't wait until we return!!

We have just spent 5 nights at the Grand California Hotel Disneyland with our 6 & 8 year olds. This is the best place to stay if you like to hop into both Disneyland Adventure park and Disneyland, and then take a quick stroll back to the pool from the parks. Character breakfast is a must, our children loved Storytellers Cafe at the Grand for this. Downtown disney is just at your door step for grabbing some non restaurant breakfast or a casual dinner. We think that Disney has set the bar high in terms of service and friendliness. We felt like we were guests rather than customers.  Great property, foyer is amazing and so are the pools. If you like a little people watching choose a Downtown disney view like we did.

There was that stood out that was wonderful but there was nothing that made it terrible.  The room was large, and had bunk beds for the kids (which they loved). The queen bed was comfortable.  The dvd  player worked but there were no instructions and we finally gave up and called downstairs to the front desk. The cable didn't always work, it would lose the signal and then just  fuzzy screen. We ordered room service that included 2 warm milks, and  appetizer which cost about $50.There is a cafe things at the far end near one of the 3 great pools. Where you can milk yogurt, boxed cereal etc.  The pools are wonderful one is equipped with a slide, and there are life jackets available for the kids. Of course the best thing about this hotel is the location. When you leave the hotel

As with all Disney Resorts, this one is a Great Place to Stay. Everyone is helpful from the Front desk, Valet and Bell Services. The only problem was the Napa Restaurant and Caf√© were closed for renovations. You can find other places to eat. We ate at the Cathay, great food, inattentive waitress. When booking a room keep in mind the Lobby is Busy and Loud. Our room was spacious and in a Courtyard Area where Monorail went through. We went in the middle of the week in September no crowds until Saturday...Look Out!!!

In terms of location you could not asked for anything more. Staying at a disney resort also gives you a chance to have early entry to the theme parks on each alternate day. Within 5 minutes you are in Disneyland and 2 minutes you are in California adventure land. The room was suffice as to be honest other than sleeping we were never there, too much action at the heme parks. There was no overly helpful staff member that we came across other than Julie at the information desk. Upon check in at midnight I might add as we were flying from Australia we didn't even get much assistance from the girl who checked us in, we asked for a bunk bed room as we were travelling with 3 children but the girl wouldn't even look on the computer system to see if one was available, it was like no this

We have visited Disneyland several times but this was our first stay at the Grand Californian.  What can I say...it lived up to our expectations.  From the moment we walked in we were treated with customer service at a level that only Disney can provide.  Our room was average size and nicely decorated.  There are several pools to choose from; one of the pools has a nice waterslide.    Keep in mind that this is a large hotel and some of the rooms can be a bit of a walk from the elevator.  The hotel has its own entrance into the California Disney Theme Park.

Summary Heading: Loved this hotel pity about the cake
Summary: We were lucky enough to have 3nights at this amazing hotel, it was the Disneyland half weekend. We had booked a premium view room and requested a grizzly peak view with bunk beds and we received both( I did check in at 8am) The girls loved their bunks and even tho the room was only small the bunks appeared to give it more room.  We LOVED being able to sit on the balcony and feel as if we were not missing out being in the park. Our room number was 4347, we could see Grizzly Peak and part of the rapids, down to Cars Land and around to where Soarin is and then across to Disneyland and Space Mountain and night we could some of the fireworks. We enjoyed the pool and slide and the kids used Pinocchio's Workshop which I can highly recommend, they were they only 2 there on the Friday

When we arrived from Aus with the usual long flight fatigue the reservations clerk was probably the best I have encountered. He didn't make us wait for the usual 2:00 pm checkin and found a room straight away and we didn't even ask him. 5 stars for him!  The Hotel is rated 4 1/2 stars.  It is right on the California Adventure Park entrance which is fantastic.  My room 3245 was dated, the carpet a bit worn and the bathroom tired.  The plug got stuck in the bath and we had to get maintenance to drill it out.  To their credit though the maintenance came immediately and fixed the problem.  The staff are the rating, everywhere smiles and welcomes.  The pool area was pretty popular with my 10 yr old and the abundance of life guards meant that the adults could just fully relax knowing

The only complaints I have are the Bell desk and Housekeeping. I stayed on the sixth floor - Concierge. My room was never cleaned until 3 or 4 P.M.
