They did a wonderful job, but it was hard to come back to the room to relax when you weren't sure when they would show up. If you were waiting for your luggage - forget it. They only have one person working the desk and quite the line. That really needs to be improved. Other that those few problems it was a great stay. Every one is very friendly and try and make your stay enjoyable.

Summary Heading: Great location but needs a facelift !
Summary: We love all that's Disney but we are disappointed by how old this place is looking ! It is also very expensive for what you get. I would try to stay at the other Disneyland hotels next time by looking at the other hotels . They charge Four Season/Ritz prices for the feel of an Embassy Suites.

No doubt Disney's Grand Californian is in the middle of the action. It also earns that "right" by returning the serve. We stayed in one of the DVC suites and it exceeds others by far. Well appointed, roomy, comfortable. Getting into the park (DCA) was less than spectacular. It should be a convenience or even a shortcut but the staff easily encouraged us to go through the main entrance as the linen from the hotel was longer and slower. Very inefficient (as are all methods of entry to both parks). A quick cup of coffee and Danish is easily gotten at the Hearthstone Lounge. There is reasonable room in the pool area. We took in a power walk one morning through the DCA and that was a fun time with our "guide and coach" Dave.

When you book to stay here, don't expect a 5 star hotel like four seasons. What you do get is exceptionally close proximity to Disneyland, in particular, California adventure park. There is a private entrance to California Adventure Park just for guests. That is cool and made for easy breaks from the heat for the kids.  You can't beat the location and the atmosphere is fantastic too. The rooms are a bit small and not flash, but they are comfortable and do have a refrigerator in them. At the end of the day, you spend most of your time in the parks.   We definitely don't regret staying here, not sure it's entirely worth the money, but it was a great experience, with great service and good facilities. We have stayed outside the resort before and had better rooms for much less cost,

The location of the Grand Californian is great and the pool is fun for kids but the rooms are overpriced and really need to be revamped .  For $500 plus a night you are really only paying for the location.

So we have been staying at the GCH since it opened in 2001. This is our prefereed hotel when coming to Disneyland. We have definitely seen the prices jump from our first visits.  You definitely pay for the location, I just wish the rooms were a little larger (as others have stated). They have changed their check-in policy (for the better). Previously you could not get your room until after 3pm, no execptions. They will now check if there are any rooms are available. We arrived at 10am and they found a room for us, this is a nice change.  On our checkout day we left our bags with bell services in the morning so we could go enjoy the park. We returned at noon to get our bags and goto the airport. There was a really long line to checkin bags and a shorter line to retrieve your

Wonderful staff - great food - proximity to the park a bonus for a disabled person - lovely atmosphere within the hotel - our king sized room was huge and when we ordered room service it was a fair price and great food and drink

It is convenient to stay here, that's for sure. However, I paid over $600 for one night in a club level room. I don't mind paying that at the Montage, Four Seasons, Mandarin Oriental, etc., but at the Grand Californian? I don't think so. You are just paying for the convenience of being close to Disneyland. Save your money and stay at the Disneyland Hotel.

Summary Heading: Enjoyed our stay....just one area of needed improvement
Summary: I enjoyed our stay very much. The staff was polite, and helpful. It was nice being able to take a park break and go back to out room. The only thing that could have been better is the pool area, there are not enough chairs in the pool area to accommodate the amount of guests and the pool staff are hard to flag down and a bit on the non-pleasant side, it was easier to go and get snacks and drinks myself than deal with the pool staff.

Surprised my Partner and Nephew and his wife by checking in for 2 nights on our Sun-Tues stay here last week.  We are not DVC members and seldom can afford to stay in Deluxe hotels so we are not expecting perfection, but the Hotel was amazing! The lobby was spectacular and I didn't see any dust anywhere! Our standard room was very nice sized with plenty of room for the four adults.  We thought the pocket door on the bathroom was a clever idea but recommend closing the bathroom door while you are using the bathroom if you don't want anyone to see you or see the TV! The 3 pools were clean, warm and the slide was a lot of fun! We took advantage of the Extra Magic Hour and the Hotel's private entrance into Calif. Adventure and were able to ride many attractions with almost no wait

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel, friendly employees, great amenities!
Summary: I loved the beauty and craftsmanship of this hotel.  As you would expect at Disneyland‚Äôs flagship hotel, the staff is top-notch.  The beauty and comfort of the hotel, plus the convenience of being literally steps away from California Adventure or Downtown Disney (and only a five minute walk to Disneyland) make it evident that the only downside  to the Grand Californian is simply that once you have stayed here it may end up being the only place you ever want to stay when you visit Disneyland!  Read my full review here: http://bit.ly/DL-GC

Summary Heading: If they could only get the check in down
Summary: I always stay on Disney Property when I visit Disneyland but I must say that the check in procedure at the Grand Californian is causing me to rethink. It literally is a huge waste of time and very frustrating. They have a rep who prescreens you (good but it doesn't do any good) clerks continue to walk away and disappear behind a door no matter how long the line is. Talk to each other, etc. management needs to step in. Once you get to the clerk it is friendly etc but getting there takes a ridiculous amount of time.  And if you dare to arrive early be prepared for countless waits in line when you attempt to followup later n the day. Maid svc is excellent as is the bell and valet svcs.

Just spent a week there.  And really the only good thing I can say is, location, location, location. The room was nicer then Disney's Ft. Wilderness Lodge, BUT two of their 3 restaurants were closed.  When I walked over to the quick service, the guard there said to check the lounge for coffee and pastries.  I don't drink coffee and there were three dried out looking pastries left at 9am.  Our room was nice, but there were little things we were surprised about. We had to ask for the laundry bag for our dry clean order,  then, they never replaced the one we used, so we just didn't do any more dry cleaning with them.  Loved the turn down service, but were surprised they don't do towel animals.  It is a lot of money for location.  If you can get a deal, it is totally worth it, if

We are DVC members and own two vacation club memberships. As members we have taken several cruises and have been totally satisfied and impressed. The only two resort stays have been sadly disappointing. Last year we went to the Aaulani and this year the Grand California. Our stay at the Grand Californian was a dream for my husband and I, only to be spoiled from the minute we checked in.  Our concierge Nick was waiting for us upon arrival and upon checkin we were informed that we were in a room at concierge level, when we fully expected to be in a villa. Nick attempted to help us and since their were no rooms available to move too, we were stuck in a standard class room just slightly bigger than my personal closet at home which would accommodate a kind sized bed in a pinch! Nick

Highlights: 1) Location 2) Kid friendly  Serious problems: 1) You have to chase down a server to get a drink at the pool 2) Bell service is slow and incompetent  After staying at the Disneyland Hotel in the Spring, we were so looking forward to the Grand California. What a let down. The rooms and services are so much better at the Disneyland Hotel. Grand California does have a nicer lobby, but the rooms are badly in need of a serious renovation. There are employees standing around in the lobby, but they're like Walmart greeters. They're completely useless unless you just like people smiling at you. Check in is great since they have a slew of registration desks. The bell desk - just horrible.   We brought a bunch of bags, a double stroller and two kids. We ended up just having to

Summary Heading: Expensive but worth it for location.
Summary: We booked this hotel months ago then just before going I read some of the reviews and was dreading it but all the bad stuff we certainly didn't see and am glad we booked it. Yes it's expensive for what you get. The rooms aren't massive and facilities in rooms basic but it was certainly clean and tidy and comfortable. We had four adults in one room and we weren't squashed. Yes for the price we could of got better further out but that wasn't what we wanted. It's on the doorstep of Disney. We had our car valet parked so left it at the door. We checked in early and our room was ready at 9.30 am so couldn't complain and we got a late checkout when we left. Staff were polite and friendly. Breakfast is expensive and not worth it but for the closeness to the parks and the strip and the

My husband, 2 year old son and I recently returned from a 5 night stay at the Grand Californian.  We choose this property for the location and we were so glad we did-with a 2 year old who needed an afternoon nap, it was nice that we could be back to our room in less than 10 minutes from just about anywhere in Disneyland.  We also loved the early entry that we received each day for staying on property.  We were traveling from WI with a 2 hour time change and loved to be able to get into the parks a little early.   In addition to location we loved the understated Disney theming (we appreciate a Disney vacation for a family, but are not "Disney people") and the pool.  We were there the week after labor day and it was very hot so having access to a beautiful pool in the afternoons

Loved staying here, from the moment we saw the "Welcome Home" sign, my excitement built for the trip ahead. They have awesome restaurants on property. Loved the rocking chairs fronting the TV for the kids in the main lobby. We utilized the pool on a relax day. Definitely recommend staying here. If you can, upgrade to the rooms with the California Adventure park views. Will stay at those on the next visit.

Summary Heading: Location Location Location AND Disney KNOWS IT!
Summary: We just spent 7 days at the hotel at a cost of over $400 per night(cheapest room). We checked in  but rooms are very tired. We could not get internet in our room do they moved us to a cheaper room and not only did it not have internet but the phone did not work. So... They moved us to a cheaper room and internet and phone worked. We tried to make the best of it and went to the pool and came back to room and we were locked out because key did not work!! I went to front desk to get new key and told front desk that we were not happy and to let management know. We were sent three fast passes to attempt to make us happy... Sorry- actually added to problem. And now back in room and Internet does not work. Disneyland is fantastic/ the grand Californian is a waste of good real estate.

It is steps away from the magic kingdom. It literally opens up into California adventure and that was very nice. The rooms were clean and we had a great view of the fireworks I would highly recommend it for families who can afford to stay at a nice hotel

I stayed here for business for one night. The hotel decor is really impressive - both from the outside and inside the lobby area.Unfortunately at the last moment my family were not able to join me - so I just worked more!. The location is obviously perfect for Disneyland with a back entrance into Downtown Disney. The room was pretty quiet considering how many kids were running around everywhere! I had a great breakfast - very quick and all the staff were helpful and friendly. One thing to note is that if you are not going to valet park your car then you will be parking it across the street in a lot. I'd recommend dropping off the family and bags at the hotel entrance rather than parking first.

Summary Heading: 3rd visit this year....Got to Love this Place!!
Summary: This is our third visit staying here this year (and we aren't even visiting the parks!) Forget the naysayers that complain about the decor and lack of Disney touches....this is a LODGE & SPA!!! You still have the amazing friendly cast members that greet and welcome you at every corner, and the closeness to the parks and downtown disney cannot be beat (my wife and I each have a bad knee so being located so close to everything is key). Now mind you this place is very pricey and honestly I don't think I would stay here if I had to pay full price (we came for Dapper Days, check it out, twice a year dapperdays.com and the discount rate for booking in advance is about 40-50% off, can't be beat!) Our first two visits we got upgraded views and this time unfortunately not because they

Although it'll be a year in October, it feels like it was yesterday. We went with another couple and shared a room. The other couple was the age of our oldest children. We had such a blast! From the exquisite rooms to the magic mornings where we could get into a park an hour early, Everything from start to finish was magical!  We enjoyed a lovely meal at the Storytellers cafe, and took advantage of a restaurant lost in time! This was accomplished with our visit the truly gorgeous Carthay Circle! What a magical restaurant, one that takes you back to an era of yesteryear! We truly felt like a member of the Disney family and already have reservations for Thanksgiving. Because if budgetary issues we've decided to stay at Paradise Pier and look forward to investigating what this

Con - We are DVC members who used points for villas that faced the worst absolute spot ever --Bottom level facing the wall. Rooms were very dark and felt more 70s style rather than that cabin feel. Coffee pot wasn't working and was clogged with calcification. Drain wasn't working. Used up half the vaction points to get the worst room. SMH Disney. The reservation desk attendant faked us by pretending to go back to see if we can change rooms.  Bottomline- DVC members should never be placed in the suckiest rooms ever!!! We invested in their timeshare because we wanted the best experience, service and location for our family.

Another wonderful week at the Grand. The staff, as always, was super helpful and greeted us with a smile every time.    The room was spotless upon check in and 'mousekeeping' kept it that way our entire stay.  They fulfilled all requests for extra coffee, toiletries, and towels.  3 females in the room, what can I say?  We went through towels and shampoo!  Best friend's daughter especially enjoyed the nightly turn down as the maid arranged her daily-acquired stuffed animals on the bed in cute ways to 'surprise' her each evening.    This was our first stay in August and we made good use of the pools as it was hot.  It can be hard to find loungers in the shade in the afternoon so get there early (no later than 11am) if you don't want to be in the sun.  People around us were always

I was prepared to pay the extra for the location and experience.  I had heard first hand how good it was and I now agree. We didn't need to really use many of the hotel services, but the service you don't necessarily see is clearly exceptional, the entire place is impeccable, people are constantly cleaning and preening the place from top to bottom.  All of the staff we encountered were always polite. Everyone you were anywhere near always said a greeting of some kind.  The kids LOVED the pool area, but unfortunately there is so much to do at the parks, we just didn't get enough time for much pool. We got a room with a view of the Californian park, which was nice, but I am not sure it was even necessary as we weren't in it much!  But it was almost totally soundproof. The resort

This was our third stay at the Grand Californian  and we enjoyed it just as much as the other times. It was even better because our room was close to the elevator and stairs which made  it easier to get to the parks sooner. While you do pay a considerable amount for a standard no frills room, the convenience to the parks makes it well worth it. Although we live on the east coast and visit Disneyworld often, Disneyland is preferred by our family as it is  smaller, intimate and more manageable to get around. It is wonderful not having to rely on bus transportation to get you  to the numerous parks. While I agree with another reviewer that service at Disney has stepped down a notch, you can still find very helpful cast members who are willing to go the extra step to make things

We have stayed here several times in the past.  This year was a little different for us so I thought I'd write another review.  Check In:   Arrived at 1pm.  We completed all the check-in paperwork, were given our keys and were told check in is 3pm, BUT we would receive a text if room was ready early.   We went into the park for a few hours, it was 90 degrees and we wanted to change into cooler clothes.  Since we didn't receive a text we went back at 3pm.    We were told housekeeping still had not cleaned our room for check in and it would be another 20 minutes and they would text us when ready.   We left and sat in the lobby.   It was almost 4pm (sigh), we still had not received a text and went to registration for a third time.   There is a staff member whose job it is to direct

Fantastic hotel. Easy access to both parks. Staff cannot do enough to help you. There were 8 in our party including 3 kids (who had a ball) and my parents who were celebrating their 50th wedding anniversary. We came back to our rooms 1 afternoon to find that their bed had been decorated with rose petals in a love heart for their anniversary, what a beautiful touch.highly recommend

Checked in today. The lady at the gate was ok. Real giddy and seem "happy". But yeah, it ended there. They can not accommodate our room request with a king bed; we paid for a theme park view which is mostly a view of a tree; they led us to believe that when you do valet parking it would be so much easier but then when we needed to get something from our car because we unfortunately forgot them when we checked in, it took them a while to get to it and you can tell they're not very happy to do their job. Only good thing is that it's very close to the park. And this is just day one. This will be a very long 5 days.  What a waste of money!!!

Wow! We were very impressed. We wanted to stay at a Disney hotel and decided to spend a little more for this hotel. Awesome. We had the first room on the left near the pool. Great little patio area. Hotel was gorgeous! Staff was great. Pool was nice and clean and the fires were relaxing. The only downside is I'd like to see a hotel guests only free buffet. You're paying a ton for the rooms. No reason we couldn't get free breakfast. And the walk to the cafe is long! Overall great hotel. Wish we could afford to stay here everytime we are in California

Summary Heading: LOCATION makes it worth it...sort of
Summary: The location makes it SO convenient.  It's incredibly nice to just walk into CA Adventure and be right in the midst of Downtown Disney.  Other than that...eh.  Hotel is showing it's age - I would NEVER pay that much for a room elsewhere, especially when the room is as Blah/dated as it is.    Service - and I can't believe I'm saying this b/c it's disney - is crappy.  Finding a server at the pool was a struggle and when I checked out the valet and 3 bellhops watched me struggle alone with 2 kids, a double stroller and suitcases.  No offer of help.  And I was holding a $5 bill in my hand so they knew they were getting a good tip!  Lazy, I guess.  We did the Character Breakfast Buffet - super expensive and the food was SO SO bad.  I'm going to review it separately because it sucked

We love staying at the Grand Californian, we go to Disney at least once a year and it is always our first choice‚Ä¶whether we go with our entire family or just a few of us this is the place to stay ‚Ä¶you have entrance to California adventure through private entrance and you can go to Disneyland through another and a short walk ‚Ä¶.if you have small kids its great you can go to hotel to let kids nap‚Ä¶has nice pool area and the restaurants are nice as well‚Ä¶they have a character breakfast if you have small kids...Downtown disney is just a few steps from hotel so you are centrally located to everything‚Ä¶Check in is always quick and easy as well as check out...you can not go wrong by staying here‚Ä¶.

Summary Heading: It was too short a stay
Summary: My wife and thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Grand Californian Villas (DVC). We were only able to book two nights and wished we could have stayed longer. The room was first class (one bedroom villa). The Hotel Staff were great and the location could not be better.   I especially enjoyed the fitness center. Very well equipped and easy to access.   One tip,  if you are buying water, larger sizes are available in the gift shop inside the lobby. Cheaper than in the counter service restaurant near the pool.

Even though I got a good deal for this hotel due to a wedding, I can't fathom why someone would pay full price for this hotel.  The only "special" thing is the fact that it is close to Disneyland and California Adventure.  Otherwise, you could stick with an off-site hotel or even Paradise Pier for a cheaper and similar experience.  Beds also need replacement.  Positive is that it is quiet, nice grounds, good pool and looks pretty.

The cast of 'Whose Line is It?" Was relaxing with me at the pool...so cool! The beauty and attention to detail of this resort is fantastic!  Ive stayed numerous times, since opening, and I always have a memorable time. Call and speak to concierge and ask to have a special picture balloon or cake delivered for your loved one or kids.

Summary Heading: Nice location, if your room is close...
Summary: We were here for my son's birthday and decided to go all out and book the Grand Californian.  Check-in for us took a while, we were never really told why.  However, there is a tv with little chairs in the lobby for kids to veg out while check-in is happening.  When they finally found us a room, it turns out it was REALLY, REALLY far away from the elevators, the pool, the entrance to Downtown Disney, and the entrance to California Adventure.  While it was nice having the hotel so close, our room was so far down the winding hall that we sometimes made the choice not to go back to the room if we forgot something in there.  Ask for a room closer to the elevators. The room was standard, 2 queen beds - overlooked Downtown Disney.  Great view of fireworks from balcony.  I was worried

We recently visited Disney for the 1st time and decided to stay at the Grand Californian Hotel. The rooms were very spacious and housekeeping was fantastic. The best part was its location! The hotel has its own entrance to California Adventure Park and is the closest hotel to Disneyland. After a day walking around the parks, it was nice to have our hotel so close.  When we go back to Disney, I wouldnt consider staying anywhere else!

Hotel is very convenient when traveling with elderly parents, Lots of activities for the kids and grand kids Pool centrally located Easy access to both parks, Disney land and California adventure parks.

We stayed in a section for Disney Vacation Club members, so it had a nice little kitchenette. I loved the whole hotel; took the guided tour and learned a lot.  The bellmen were quite gracious and friendly dealing with the daily storage and pickup of my electric chair.  On the whole I think the hotel is a bit overpriced but quite lovely.  Location adjacent to California Adventure is probably worth it.

Summary Heading: Great Location! After staying here I dont' think I can stay anwwhere else!
Summary: We stayed at the Villas at the Grand Californian Hotel (Disney Vacation Club timeshare side) in a 1 bedroom villa.  The location was simply fantastic.  Having come to Disney several times before and walking across the street from the hotels/motels on Harbor and even the Disneyland Hotel, After staying here, I don't know if I can stay anywhere else.    The rooms were fabulous but that's expected of Disney--we had a full kitchen, FULL sized washer and dryer and two full bathrooms.   The location though can't be beat. Having your own park entrance to the Grand California Adventure park, where guests of the disney resorts have exclusive use until 10 am or 11am (I can't remember the time) is such a timesaver.  Being able to go up to the room, rest, and walk downstairs and be in the

Just got back from a 7 night stay, there is nothing like a Disney hotel. Your disney experience starts from the moment you step inside. The detail in the property is fantastic, you can do an 'art of the craft tour' to learn more about the property and the imagineering that went into creating it. The private entrance into the Californian Adventure Park is fantastic, there is also a entrance straight into Downtown Disney, the location is the best. Great restaurants on site as well as whitewater snacks were you can grab some food and drinks. Many activities at the hotel to enjoy; movie nights, trivia activities, private build a bear sessions can be arranged for you, story telling by the fire. The lobby is like a big living-room where is can sit in comfy lounges or rocking chairs by

The hotel itself (room quality, restaurants, pool, amenities) is not 5-star but you don't stay here for the hotel per se, you stay here for the SERVICE and LOCATION! If you're used to Four Seasons and Ritz hotels, you'll be very disappointed but you cannot beat the location and service!  5 star reasons:  1. Every single staff person was helpful, fast, and seemed to love their job. The service was like the Bulgari hotels. From the valet to the late night room service waiter, it was honestly as good as the top hotels around the world. Period! They even found our lost toys in our room after we departed and sent them via mail at no charge!  2. The location is unbeatable. As you exit the hotel courtyard, you're 60 seconds from the Disneyland entry! And, on the way to the park, there

Summary Heading: Perfect spot for California Adventure Park entrance.
Summary: Very easy check in- bag storage- early arrival. Valet is available until midnight of your stay.  Easy access to CAP.  Breakfast with characters was substantial and fun.  Great service. My complaint is they offer a great deal to stay another day but you have to go back in person with the paper they left in in your room, wait in line for check-in AGAIN and then there is seems to be some long process to actually get the rate quoted. ALso, no guarantee you can stay in the same room. We weren't planning to stay the extra night but it worked out for us. Unfortunately, I wasted almost an hour while my family was in the park to get new keys for the same room.  Poor system.

Room is of normal size compared to any chain hotel. The sliding glass door helps keep the noise of downtown Disney out of the room.  The only real complaint I have is that for the three days I was there with the A/C set on 65 degrees, I slept on top of the covers because it was hot in the room.  House keeping was fast and efficient.  Room was clean.

Summary Heading: It will be hard to stay anywhere else when visiting Dland!
Summary: I absolutely LOVED our stay this past weekend at the Grand Californian Hotel for the Disneyland Half Marathon Weekend. My mom, sister and I arrived on a Friday late morning, had a short wait at registration. The cast member was very courteous at check in. She said they would store our luggage and we would receive a text message when the room was ready - they provide you the keys that are activated once the room is ready. No sooner had we stored our luggage and headed out the door to Downtown Disney, and I already received a text that our room was ready and the room number itself! When we went to our room, we discovered it was a handicap-accessible room - which normally wouldn't be a problem - but for three women needing lots of counter space, lots of bathroom time! (there is no

Summary Heading: Disney at it's best - Grand California
Summary: This hotel is fanominal.  Service is perfection, as usual on any Disney product.  There is no early check in because they are always full.  You can, however, leave your luggage with the valet and go into the park for the day.  We stayed in the villas and a one bedroom gives you a full kitchen, table for 10, living area with pull out couch and a single pull out bed.  The bedroom has king size bed, desk and sitting area with 2 full bathrooms including a jacuzzi tub.  Oh, and a washer and dryer.  You can get movies from the concierge. There is a place on top to watch the water show at night.

The hotel is great but there has been no poolside service in our section.  Supposedly someone named Christy is working our section.  Christy is nowhere in sight.  The two other servers just tell us we are not in their section and Christy will be right out.  It's been over an hour!!  Completely disappointed. (While I am typing this..A child just yelled out "did you order food yet?"  And the mom said "no she still has not come by!"  Make sure you eat before you go to the pool and bring your own drinks.  Service is not good.  Very unDisney

Summary Heading: Perfect Experience - Disneyland Half Marathon Weekend
Summary: What a wonderful experience! We traveled by car to the hotel with our tween and teen boys. We showed up early (about 10am) in hopes of leaving our luggage, parking our car and attending the expo for the race. We were greeted at the gate and they had a parking pass with our name ready to go. We temporarily parked in front and left our luggage, checked in and they gave us our pre-printed key cards with our names, and promised to text us when our room is ready. We chose to self-park which is a short drive and walk across the street to a guarded lot.   We attended the expo which is always great fun. Had lunch at Earl of Sandwich (it was ok) at Downtown Disney and got a text around 1:30 that our room was ready. We got room 4445 it had a queen with two bunk beds with a trundle and a

We recently completed a 3 night stay at this beautiful hotel.  Everything was fantastic, very clean rooms, attentive staff and great restaurants.  The only thing keeping this from getting 5's was the fire alarm test at 8am the last morning of our stay.  I realize the hotel only has so mush control over this but really? 8am?  Otherwise the hotel was fabulous and the entrance to California Adventure is an excellent perk.  If you go, be sure to check out White Water Snacks, great friendly staff and excellent for grabbing morning coffee and bagels before you hit the park.

2nd stay here and used DVC points for in their 3 bedroom villa #4513.  With 4 baths, 4 balconies, full kitchen (stocked with essentials) loft with a pool table plus a 2nd entrance to 5th floor, everything was perfect, clean and spacious.  The kitchen has everything you need and the dining room seats 8, plus a large living room area for more people.  The living room had a large TV with built-in speakers and a huge floor to ceiling window that overlooked the entire pool area.  The master bedroom was great with a separate tub and shower and the other bedrooms had their own attached full bathrooms.  Perfect large groups (we had 4 adults & 4 young adults).  There's a sleeper sofa in the loft & 2 more in the living room area so enough for 16 people.  Lots of closet space to store

Summary Heading: Well worth the visit, better than people said
Summary: Stayed as part of a 3 day visit with my family.  We arrived at about 12pm, so checked in early to get our park tickets and left the luggage with reception.  We had booked a room on the club level.  This gave us access to the lounge.  On booking we did not realise how often through the day the served food and drinks, all included in the price.  The room had 2 good sized double  beds and like most American hotels a small fridge. The Disney Park was a good 5 minute walk through downtown Disney, but there was an entrance to the California adventure park in the hotel.  We were disappointed to find the main hotel restaurant closed for a referb, but there were lots of places to eat in downtown Disney.  The lounge provided a continental breakfast in the morning which was really nice.

The hotel itself was ok, but josh at check in and front desk was amazing! So polite, friendly and helpful, he really made our vacation/stay worth it. I would go to this hotel just for josh, that's how amazing he made our stay there.

I have stayed at almost every Disney resort and this one takes the prize.  Nice furniture and gave you a feeling of luxury in the room.  We had a nice balcony that overlooked one of the three pools.   WiFi reception is poor or non-existent, so bring an alternative.  Location cannot be beat.  One side door of the hotel goes to Downtown Disney and the other goes to California Adventure park.  The back door opens to Grizzy River Run which is also next to the World of Color Fast Pass distribution.  Hotel guest get perks to get into the park early.   Note only certain "lands" are open in Disneyland, not the entire park.   Pull out sofa bed was comfortable. We had a squeaky bed, but it was comfortable.   Very clean bathroom.   Sink is separate in the studio rooms, so it make getting

Stayed for 4 nights.  Reserving through Disneyland is such a pain.  The room itself was nice, not outstanding, but the location can't be beat. Disneyland and California Adventure is a few minutes walk by going through Downtown Disney. We parked the car in the lot across the street and didn't use it again until we checked out 4 days later. Staff was very accommodating. We had a standard view, they were going to put us in a room far away from the main lobby, but requested a closer room and were given one overlooking the front of the hotel. We did swim in the pool once the first day of our stay, but didn't bother for the rest of the stay as it wasn't anything special.   Also the line for the pool slide was very long.  There is a laundry room which we used halfway through our trip.

Summary Heading: Overpriced yes but convenient. N.B poor WiFi
Summary: Is expensive when you consider what you actually get. Essentially you are paying for location which is hard to beat. Great for park access and for coming back for a break and recharge in the afternoon. An important inconvenience was the very poor WiFi. Couldn't actually get connected unless on our balcony (or in the lobby) and then the connection would keep dropping and reconnecting was not simple. Essentially I would have to load a web page I had never loaded before to force the connection page to open. Otherwise the web browser would load from cache and for some odd reason still be able to load new web pages but not email. So if you need to get any work done (as I did ) while staying here: bring a lap too and plug in (though I didn't actually get to try it and see if it was

really grand , walking distance to both the park, disneyland and california adventures.  where we stayed was overlooking the park, only it was way inside.  The lobby is nice and the restaurant was pretty good with i believe good price for their food. Around it are shops where you can take your family shopping,  eat , stuff a bear or build legos.. nice time if you are taking a breaks from the rides inside the park.

Summary Heading: Location is good but showing its age
Summary: We have stayed at the Grand Californian at least half a dozen times now.  It is really starting to show its age.  We just stayed at the Legoland hotel and that hotel was truly amazing and what an experience for the kids.  The rooms at the Grand Californian are just looking tired and dingy, especially the bathroom (yuck).  They really need to refresh esp. if you are charging around $500/night. The staff there is amazing and the location can't be beat.  But I have to say this trip was disappointing.

First up, let me say that this review is for the DVC villas at the Grand Californian, not the hotel side.  We are DVC members (Disney's timeshare) who live on the east coast so we usually go to the FL WDW resorts a couple of times a year.  This was our first stay at the VGC and we thought the resort was indeed grand.  We only stayed 3 nights as we were on our way to Disney's Aulani resort on Oahu and we thought we'd get our "Disney fix" while breaking up the jet lag.  I wish we'd had 1 more night to enjoy more of the facilities (ie pool & restaurants) but the resort is very points intensive (expensive as it goes for about $600 / night on cash) so 3 nights was all we could swing this trip even with using points.  I am not sure I would say it is worth all of the points it requires

Summary Heading: Finally concluded the convenience is worth the price
Summary: After trying "off-campus" hotel for our last visit, we were happy to be coming back to the Grand Californian.  Just the piece of mind that our family of 5 (younger kids) could go and regroup in our room and yet still be so close to the park, is worth the price.  The hotel is probably ready for a makeover but still nice amenities and very friendly staff.  Check-in was a bit of an inconvenient wait but handled relatively well.  The pool is well-supervised with diligent lifeguards.  Overall, I found it a good value for the convenience.  This was our fourth stay there and we will probably never stay anywhere else when we go to Disneyland, if we have the choice.

Stayed for the weekend with 3 young (6 & under) grand children in a premium concierge room. Upon arrival, we were escorted to our room - no need for check-in as it was done directly in our room by our friendly hotel concierge. Received exactly what I requested, including bunk beds and a view. Nice little extras for all 3 kids included plush Micky & Minnie's, autograph books and special photo treats. The bunk beds with trundle were really convenient and made it extra special for the kiddo's. Yes, the rooms are very small for the cost - but the location and level of service make up for it IMHO. The lounge offers a great breakfast, snacks to take into the parks and a really nice place to view the fireworks. The entire staff at the resort were helpful and friendly without being

We originally rented a local, walkable condo near Disneyland and immediately decided we couldn't stay there.  While the condo we rented was completely renovated inside, the complex was rundown and dark, we just didn't feel safe.  So we called the Disney Grand and were able to save our vacation and move there immediately.  The rooms are clean and nothing particularly fancy, but the whole experience it totally worth it.  While I had hoped to save here and there on our trip, we quickly realized its worth spending a little extra for the amazing customer service and perks that staying at this hotel allows its guests.  California Adventure and Downtown Disney are right there, many fantastic pools, a great gift shop and complimentary magic hour all were wonderful.

Summary Heading: reliable and makes the Disney experience much better
Summary: Disney is a great experience for all ages but the adults need the chance to unwind too.  THis hotel is full service, and we made use of most of them.  We used in room dining to catch the Magic mornings, and this put us all in better moods to explore on full stomachs!  The pool is inviting and easy access - very refreshing for a quick dip between Disney visits.  The Magic morning is only available for Disney hotel guests, and is a very efficient way to start the day, then relax after 3-4 hours of park time

We visited Disneyland in January 2014.  This hotel lived up to it's reputation and price.  Worth EVERY penny.  The location is fabulous...so easy to get to both parks and Downtown Disney.  The staff was impressive and so very pleasant.  Our room was ready when we arrived.  Clean and cool.  The bell staff brought up our luggage promptly and gave us some great tips on how to get around the resort.  The beauty of this hotel overwhelms you immediately.  You can't help but feel warm and welcomed the minute you walk through the door.  Our children were 12 and 10 at time of travel so going back to our room for a break wasn't an issue - but if you have small children (or a grumpy husband)....the location will save your vacation.  The pool was clean and lifeguards were very professional.

Wow, the atrium/lobby of this hotel has to be seen to be believed.  It is simply the most gorgeous and astounding I have seen.    It is pricey but almost worth it and if you stay out of season or are a Annual Passholder you can get some nice discounts.  It is nice as it's by far the closest hotel to the parks, with it's own secret entrance to California Adventure. Psst- dont tell anyone- if you stay at any of the three Disney hotels you can use the secret entrance!  Do note that the basic rooms arent a lot nicer than the other two Disney hotels, and you can save a lot by staying at one of them.... and still get the "Disney Magic"!

Read a lot of the reviews prior to booking this hotel.  Yes, it is a bit pricey but "you get what you pay for".  Found our 2 room suite very roomy with lots of storage.  Bedding and decor were upscale.   Staff was friendly and accommodating.  Received timely text message that our room was ready.   Had an electric stroller for rent and took delivery of our City Stroller, which we rented.  We have only good things to say about Disney's Grand Calorfornian Hotel; thus disagree with the negative reviews. Other features worth staying here: Magic Hour for each days stay Special entrance to California Adventure Park Close to Downtown Disney Each room has balcony - some with fireworks or World of Color views Great sound proofing

Summary Heading: Great fun for the kids, but a little tired for the price
Summary: Lets face it - you go to Disney for your kids and it has a real magic about it.  The "magic hour" (ie early entry to the park) if you stay in a Disney hotel is also a great benefit.  So our experience overall was great.  But this review is about the hotel as opposed to the overall experience/park.  The hotel is billed as top end (between 4 and 5 star).  The lodge style is great, but the accommodation and dining dont come close to this and are more at the 3 star level - room set up and facilities are very much like a travelodge.  That isnt a problem per se (it was clean and comfortable, so had no issues staying), but for the price point (one day in the park and one night stay well over USD1k for 2 adults, one kid and a toddler (free)) and expectations from the billing, you feel

While expensive, this hotel is a great place to stay. Beautiful architecture, lots of amenities and great park access and views. The room was comfortable and the balcony was a relaxing place to sit before the parks open. The extra hour in the parks is a great perk.

Summary Heading: A Disney Resort Right in the Middle of the Magic
Summary: What an amazing resort! I couldn't have been more pleased with the prime location of this resort which literally feels like it is inside Disney's California Adventure Park. This is a very large resort with various views. We were fortunate enough to have a theme park view where Soarin, Tower of Terror and Grizzly River Run were right outside or window. Noise was not an issue either considering the proximity to the park. The pools were great and the wait staff at the pool was fantastic. Although this resort has it's own entrance to DCA we found it better to walk through Downtown Marketplace to go the park in the morning for the extra magic hour as there are many more queues that get you in faster. It was great at the end of the night to avoid the major crowds heading to the main

This is my second stay at the Grand Californian Hotel at Disney's California Adventure Theme Park. I always check into the hotel early in the morning prior to the park being open. The valet takes our luggage on a cart and they store it until the room is ready. This allows us to take advantage of the early entry into the park not only the day we check in but the next day as well. So if you can only afford to stay one night, you can really take advantage of the early entry for more than one day. If you can afford to stay several nights, I recommend at least a 3 to 5 day stay here. Requesting a view of downtown disney gives you a display of the fireworks at night. This is a great hotel and I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Disney Vacation Club: Welcome Home in California
Summary: Note: my review is specifically for the Disney Vacation Club (time share) component of the resort: The Villas at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel & Spa  We checked in at the end of July for a short, two-night stay, in a Deluxe Studio. The check in process was a bit awkward for DVC; I'd blame that on that the facility is more hotel than time share. After a rough and awkward start with check-in, we received a text that our room was ready at 3:00 pm. Our keys worked and the room was comfortable and in good order. Plenty of room for three of us and it had a nice view of the main pool.  We stopped by the front desk with a few questions and after a short exchange, the cast member asked "Are a DVC member?" and "Did you receive a welcome kit?" Once I answered "yes and no" everything

Summary Heading: Great location, fun pool, fun mini vaca!
Summary: We have stayed at other Disney Hotels, including Aulani 3 times. I love how they are always thinking about the kids. From the small chairs in lobby next to a tv playing cartoons, to small sinks in bathrooms, the doors and peep holes the kids sizes so they can look out.... The pool with the water slide is great fun and a perfect mini getaway. I loved how after a long day at Disney we could just go back to the room and didn't have to worry and trolley, parking nor driving home. I wouldn't want to stay here longer then a few days but it's perfect for a night or two.

My wife and I thought we would do a special family vacation and take our six year old to Disney land for the weekend.  This will be a fairly short review as I am sure there are many more reviews out there that have a lot more information on the park and staying at Disney properties. This is my review on our room and the Grand Californian.   After sitting in traffic for 2 hours (Los Angeles to Disneyland, a 40 mile trip) we arrived at the front ‚Äúgate‚Äù of the Grand Californian.  At the gate you give them your name and then they place a card on your windshield. I am guessing this tells the parking people how long you are staying, etc.  After we got our bags out, on to check in. They have this down to an art; we got in line (visions of things to come?) and got checked, got all of

I had a great time at the hotel. I spent it with my brother and his family. My niece jumped up and down saying Mickey water, Mickey water when we saw the light show from our balcony. We are looking forward to going back next year with my parents and my husband.

Stayed here for 10 days in August and was really impressed. Fully part of the Disney experience. It's an old fashioned hotel around had an hour to central L.A. There are lots of bus tours to LA Universal and Sea World who do hotel pick ups from here or you can rent a car if you want to travel away from Disney. As for the primary reason to stay here, the location was great for Disney with both parks and Downtown Disney within 5 minute walk (and special entrance to Calafornia adventure theme park from within the hotel! ). The service was great and all staff very friendly. It's not cheap but you're paying for the Disney experience, which some will like,some won't. The breakfasts were amazing and the on site restaurant and shop were very good. The pools and gym were also very good

Summary Heading: Not worth the price. Not even for the location.
Summary: Long time user of trip advisor, travel enthusiast and former airline employee.  But after my recent stay at the Grand Californian, I felt compelled to sign-up and write my first ever review.  Before I start on why my stay here was so poor, I will say that I really appreciated the fact that you can drive up to the front of the hotel and they give you as much time as you need to load or unload your car and they don't hassle you at all.  Basically, people came up and said, if you need help, they are more than happy to help but if not, take your time.  This was appreciated when traveling with random items for the kids.  That being said, let me continue...  I chose this hotel because I have two kids under two and I wanted the closest place to Disneyland in case I had any baby

Summary Heading: Wish I could rate it higher than 5 stars :-)
Summary: This place exemplifies what Mr. Disney must have imagined when he 1st broke ground on his fun park way back when, as this place truly is magical.  From the period piece clothing the Valet drivers wear, (I loved their 20's era golf-looking attire,) to the Arts & Crafts style furnished lodge lobby, complete with generous wood work, beamed lofts, and real Tiffany lamps, (from the Modern current-day factory, but definitely fashioned in a retro look,) I was in love at first sight.  My family flew into town just for the Disney experience, and rented adjoining rooms on the ground floor for a family member with mobility issues.  We had a handicapped room, and then a regular room with connecting doors.  The rooms were quite roomy.  Our private little patios looked out on one of the

This hotel is literally 30 seconds away from Downtown Disney which was the best part! I thought the lobby was amazing but the rooms were basic. We stayed two nights and had no issues at all, everyone was nice, and we had an amazing time! I do wish I would have tried the food there but the food at Downtown Disney was amazing! Oh and you could send your purchases at Downtown Disney back to the hotel so you didnt have to haul it around! Great perks!

My family are big Disney-philes. We have been to Walt Disney World over 10 times. We have been to Disneyland twice. The best hotel we have stayed at in Orlando or Anaheim is by far the Grand Californian.  The rooms are designed perfectly for families. We are a family of five. However the Grand Californian had a perfect room for us. The room itself was designed very well with people like us in mind (place for the stroller, good bathroom, etc.).  The service was outstanding. In July we stayed at Meadowood in Napa and the Del Coronado. While the service is never going to reach Meadowood, this hotel trounced the Del in service. Service at Disneyland is not what it is in Orlando. However this hotel from the check in to the maids to the restaurants is top notch.  The craftsman style

Summary Heading: Brought a *live roach* to the front desk in a Ziploc bag
Summary: My partner and I returned yesterday evening from four nights at GCH and it was the worst hotel stay we've ever had in our lives. It was a three-day complimentary stay gifted to us totally by surprise (we never ever asked for it and didn't see it coming) by Disneyland Resort VIP services to make up for our annual passes not working correctly for several months last year, and we were paying for a fourth night out of pocket. We expected it would be an awesome experience as we had never stayed there before and after all it's GCH, and we were very grateful for the offer.   Unfortunately, almost from the moment we got there, our stay began to implode. (In hindsight, we wish we had read more of the negative reviews on here first--some of which were written while were there, too!)

My family of 5 had a great time in Disneyland, so let's start with that. Of course, you want to know about the Grand Californian specifically. As for as location goes, especially if you have younger kids, is worth the price you pay to be there. You can take breaks, get in and out of the park easily, etc. But the rooms badly need updating. If you're accustomed to paying for higher end hotels, you generally know what to expect in terms of decor and furnishing for a hotel that's $400-$500 a night. These rooms would be more at home in a $129 a night Ramada. Just remember, you're there for the location.

On our first family trip to Disneyland I decided to splurge and book the Grand Californian. Difficult to get info and not abler to book through travel agent - only direct. Heard a lot about executive club but couldn't find anything out online about it. Upon arrival was surprised at the beautiful lobby and after a few minutes wait was directed to a reception staff member. At this stage she gave us the opportunity to upgrade to the executive club at a not insignificant cost but in the end I think it was worthwhile. We were taken to the executive club and had a cold drink and explained about the facilities available. To get you our room was then a bit of a rabbit warren via hallways, down a couple of floors then more seemingly never ending hallways. I had booked a suite with an

We stayed her last October with our kids around Halloween. The rooms are very nice with warm touches. They provided nice amenities in the room and grey services throughout the hotel. The rooms are pricey so you are paying a premium for the comforts of this resort and the closeness to the parks. We had an evening where one of my daughter's want feeling well late into the night. I called down to see if the store was open and they notified that it was closed. They actually contacted a manger and had security open up the store so I could purchase some medicine for my daughter. They went above and beyond and we really appreciated it. Food selection was great on the site at the hotel as well.

We have stayed at all three of the Disneyland Resort hotels and I would rank it last.  Disneyland Hotel is by far superior in room amenities and architecture (love the Mouse hand wall lamps and light up headboards).  Paradise Pier is just plan fun and bright.  The Grand is medicre and overpriced.  Will not be staying here on our next trip.

The lobby and location are both good, but for $600 a night, you should get a room that's at least been properly cleaned. Our room was dusty, dirty and beat up, with garbage from previous guests left behind. The rooms are also small, and the kids could barely fit in the bunk bed and trundle bed. The best things about the hotel are the location, the lobby and the Napa Rose, but even the furniture in the lobby is old and worn out. Also, the battery inside the lock on our door died one night. Housekeeping should have made sure the battery was fully charged while they were cleaning the room before our stay. This hotel needs a serious renovation.

Summary Heading: Deserves 3 star however easy access to Disney venues gave a 4 star
Summary: In the hearth of the Disney Attraction, it is a perfect location to explore Disneyland. Easy access to any Disney activity. Rooms are old fashioned, dirty carpets, because of mass tourism service without soul. Factory style holiday. Everything over priced compared to services rendered. Highly recommend if you visit couple of days with children for Disney. Use the hotel just for sleeping.

We had a terrible experience with this hotel and will never stay here again.  I read the reviews and should have listened to the people who complained.  The staff is rude and not helpful, they switched room types on us and insisted that we accept a queen bed that was really a little larger than a twin with bunk beds.  The hotel is tired and desperately needs to be updated, even though the lobby is beautiful.  Food was some of the worst we've had anywhere.

As disney vets, we have high expectations and this did not disappoint.  We checked in late and had asked for room with daubed.  They were all booked but staff worked to get us one the next few nights of the stay.  Lobby is beautiful and the piano players in the afternoon evening are wonderful .  Separate entry to California adventure is very helpful.  All in all.... It's disney level !!!!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay while visiting Disneyland
Summary: We stayed for 4 days during August, with our 11 year old grand daughter. The hotel was excellent. The location is perfect with entrances to Downtown Disney and California Adventure. The concierge level is the place to stay with its club where you can get breakfast, snacks, late night desserts, water and wine. The staff is extremely helpful.  Anything you need they will get for you. You have the ability to charge meals and gifts purchased at Disneyland or the restaurants to your room. The concierge met us at the front door and escorted us upstairs where she explained where everything was in the resort and on the concierge level.  If we ever go back to Disneyland we will definite stay here again.

We spent a fantastic 4 days at Disneyland. Great location in the park with super easy access and ‚Äúmagic hour‚Äù. The Great Bits: It's Disney Disneyness, access to the park. The Good Bits: close to DowntownDisney (restaurants), pool. The Bad Bits: tiny dated room.  The hotel extends the Disney feel 24/7 which is great.  Your room is tiny and probably a stretched 3 star but you spend all day in the parks and the location is unbeatable.

Summary Heading: Once an avid fan of Disney for 14+ years but no more
Summary: I do not usually write reports before the end of a stay, but this is an exception due to the bad experience.   We usually go to Disney Florida and stay at the Grand Floridian and thought this would be the same standard of hotel. It could not be further away, and the only good thing is that my wife is no longer likely to be an avid Disney fan and want to visit each year. Cheaoer on the pocket and Disney's loss!  We arrived late evening (around 10pm) and had a 10 minute wait for check in, whilst reception staff finished typing on her terminal. I should say that at the Grand Floridian, someone has always been there to meet us, and show us around, in the lobby after passing through the security checkpoint. Not a good start.  We asked about food and told there was only bar or room

Planned a family vacation a few months ago to celebrate our 17 year old twin daughters birthday that also included our 21 year old son who is only home for one month before he leaves across country to go back to college.  We specified the ages and that we would have 5 people in the room. We have been told the only rooms available have two queen beds with our fifth person being given a sleeping bag to sleep on the floor. They assured us that our 6'6' son would find it to be an adventure. They told us that they were doing the best they can do and can't guarantee everyone gets beds when there are five people. The were surprised we found this unacceptable.  This has definitely diminished the joy my girls were feeling about their surprise trip and the special time we were hoping for

Disney's Grand Californian Hotel is beautiful hotel that seeks to capture the grandeur of National Parks hotels the most obvious of which is the Awhahanee Hotel in Yosemite N.P. The rooms are nice but the truly grand lobby is a sight to behold.  Huge to say the least and soaring comes to mind with massive wooden beams and windows high up casting rays of sunlight.  The lobby is full of comfortable chairs arranged in small groupings.  A grand piano sets the mood of elegance and peace despite the presence of children who have come to see Mickey.  The staff is pure Disney. trained to be gracious and helpful.  All this comes with a hefty price tag but we occasionally splurge especially when it comes to taking our grandchildren on vacation.  If you are thinking of self-parking, forget

We enjoyed are stay  at  grand Californian. This was our first stay here, and I would stay here again.  I looked at many hotel choices before choosing the Grand Californian, I chose it for its location. There are no streets to cross, no long walks,buses,shuttle etc...to return to your hotel after a long day in the park. It is very convenient to go back for lunch.  The decor is beautiful, similar I thought to Disneys Wilderness Lodge. Our room had a bunk bed with a trundle bed so everyone had a bed. Housekeeping was great. The room was large enough for all us, we even had a balcony.  The only issue we had was the television was hard to change channels. We only watched the World Cup final!

Summary Heading: A disappointing start, but Disney made it right
Summary: This hotel is my favourite disneyland property hotel. We have stayed here 3 times. We have had amazing stays each time except for this last time. We checked in at the front desk and as usual, we were greeted and taken care of by an amazing cast member.  We went to our room, which was outside of the main building that we normally stay at. Our room was the layout we had requested, two queen beds as we were traveling as a family of four. 2 adults and 2 kids. We were so happy that we were given a room with a view of DCA, it was amazing! As we walked around, the room to get our suitcases unpacked, and freshen up, we were disappointed to discover that previous guests had dropped something onto the carpet that made it sticky in several spots. One of the lights on the headboard was

This hotel has got to be in the best position for Disneyland and the California Adventure parks. both are accessible virtually from the hotel which makes it very easy to nip back to the room if so desired.    Disney seems geared to moving the most amount of people through efficiently and this hotel is no different.  Once you get used to this the hotel really is good.  I would not be staying here purely for the break but as a base to access to Disney it is great.  The rooms are absolutely fine, small balconies but the bedding is very comfortable.  We spent barely any time in the room anyway.    There is a good selection of snacks and water you can take to your room from the pool side cafe as the fridge/mini bar is empty, as well as nice restaurants on site.  You can get a drink

This was our first time staying at the Grand Hotel in Disneyland, to be honest our stay there really made our vacation seem complete!! We've gone to Disneyland countless times over the years but we've stayed at hotels near the park... this time we went for the whole experience and it delivered in spades!! It's actually hard to find words to describe the experience... the staff are incredible, the hotel is breath taking, I've always loved visiting Disneyland and had no idea what we were missing by not staying at one of the Disney hotels... everything seems to come full circle.. the downtown Disney experience makes more sense staying at a hotel because right out your front door are restaurants, shops, and entertainment... it's like you never leave Disneyland when you head to the

Summary Heading: In Decline For The Average Family's Needs?
Summary: This is a beautiful property in terms of architecture, landscaping and location. We traveled as a family of 4, including 2 teens, for a week. This was our third stay at this hotel in the last 6 years. From that fact alone you can see we have been happy with our stays here.  However, this visit was not as enjoyable as the others were. For the most par,t all employees through the hotel and resort were friendly, competent and eager to assist. We found housekeeping difficult when we requested our housekeeping time to be changed on one day. Thereafter, service became hit and miss.  We paid for the premium view this time around and had a nice room overlooking the pool area. We probably will not do so again if we come back to this hotel as the view we have had of downtown Disney was

Stayed for a week in June and just getting around to reviewing now. We spent a week at the Grand and found ourselves spending more and more time at the hotel each day. It was just just so relaxing and inviting. We thoroughly enjoyed the pools, all the onsite restaurants and the lounge for a nice bottle of wine in the evenings.  The room was pretty standard for Disney, but immaculately clean and with a great view of California Adventure. The staff were all over the top courteous and friendly. Excellent management at this hotel clearly. We will be back next summer as always.

It was incredibly special to stay at the Grand! The lobby is truly spectacular and we found it to be a very welcoming place. They have enough staff to handle the crowds checking in on a Friday and checking out on a Sunday. The room was fine - not huge (two queen beds took up a lot of the space. We looked over Downtown Disney, but the crowd noises weren't a problem. Nice pool. Super convenient to the parks and Downtown Disney.

Disney's Grand California was absolutely beautiful and the room was clean.  No complaints there.  However, we were quite disappointed with the pool area.  There are several pools and they were all beautiful but we were hard pressed to find a chair.  We visited the pool area twice during our stay, but we couldn't find any available chairs.  It was ridiculous!  Not only were there no available chairs, there is no pool bar in the pool area.  The bar is outside of the pool area and we would have needed to carry our room key to all areas of the hotel . . . even the pool.  Not at all impressed with the pool.  The entire area was fenced off and the gate was locked until 8:00 a.m.  Even then, we needed our room keep to open the gate.  It was definitely a weak spot for me.   On the flip

My father, my three sons and I spent two nights at the hotel. The pool area offers fun for the very young and old. Life jackets in several sizes are available for kids & people who cannot swim. The 2 water slides are awesome. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. Adam at the front desk was extremely helpful when we decided we wanted to stay another night. The food at the hotel restaurants was delicious and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. Very fun family trip!

I decided to treat me and my 8 year old to a 5 night stay at the Grand Californian. We try to stay at a different hotel each time we've visited Disneyland the last 9 times. The cost was $3000 for the 5 nights which was only a 1 notch upgrade. The ambience of the hotel is excellent and inviting...kinda reminded me of a gigantic lodge.  When we arrived in our initial room, we had a view of the monorail out our mini balcony as it passes through the hotel which was nice. The interior of the rooms are basically the same as far as I can tell. As with most reviews, rooms are 'fine' but not $600 a night fine but fine.  The difference comes with the balcony and the view. To my surprise our room had the stench of sewage emanating the sink. The same stench which you always smell in

okay, A lot of people may not go to Disneyland, but those of us that do, like to stay at a nice hotel. we stayed here for three days to visit the parks and have a good time. out stay was at the concierge level sometimes called club level.    we enjoy the fact that we can turn in our car at the hotel parking, and just enjoy walking around the parks. the extra hours for hotel guest are nice, as we can get to the park early and see the attractions we want to, or in some cases, stay late.

Summary Heading: Figured out the key to enjoying the Grand Californian
Summary: During several visits when the hotel first opened, my family was unable to sleep because of the stuffy air quality in the rooms at night.  We had stopped staying at the hotel for several years but returned this year because of the convenient location.  To my amazement, I finally realized that the air conditioner in each room is connected to a motion detector and therefore turns off after an hour or so when everyone has been sleeping!  The engineering staff was able to bypass the motion detector and we all had a great night's sleep.  Note to fellow travelers:  the bypass only works for 24 hours so you need to do it every night, but the engineering staff can show you how to do it.  I wish I had known this years ago, I would have stayed here much more often.

Yes it is expensive. But if you value convenience and are looking for a clean, comfy place to stay, you've found it. You can't beat the location, accessed right from California Adventure Park. To hot to wait in hour-long lines? Go to the hotel pool! Tired? Slip in a quick nap. Want to get into the park an hour early? Stay here! The customer service is amazing - everyone we encountered was friendly and helpful.  Despite visiting during the busy season, our room was quiet. It was clean, for which I have pretty high standards. Beds were very comfy. We will stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great location but that is about it
Summary: We enjoyed stay purely based on location; magic hour meant we could hammer the popular rides before the park got busy and the proximity to the park meant we could nip in and out as we pleased. The hotel seems to add arouns 20% to everything but the bellmen, servers etc still hold their hands out. We always feel for the little guy and are always happy to tip but when the valet deposits your car, leaves you to load up several heavy suitcases and holds on to your keys defiantly as if it will cost you to get them back, the tone is lost. Most staff were pretty unhelpful and do not seem to be happy. We also suspect we lost some jewellery in the room. All in all a pretty terrible hotel save by its location

The hotel is the closest you can get to the park..the convenience alone is worth the price! We are military so called and received a discount..decided to see if room was ready early..was checked in quickly around 11:00 am, room was not available, but was informed they had upgraded us to a one bedroom suite! The whole experience was amazing! Highly recommend this hotel, it has it's on entrance to California Adventure, never had to wait in line and the magic hour was super, got to go in an hour earlier then the general public...if your going to Disney this is the place to stay!

Summary Heading: Hey its Disney so don't go crazy
Summary: Hotel is well situated with easy access into amusement park.  The pools and restaurants were pretty good.  Room is small but bunk beds were perfect for our twin 4yo's.  The queen bed for us is smaller than we're used to and we wish they had a 1 bedroom setup so you can stay up after putting down your kids.  It's the best hotel on the Disney properties so you just have to go with it.  It's more up to date than the old Disney hotel we stayed at last year.

Summary Heading: No Better Place to Stay in Disneyland
Summary: The GC is centrally located right in Downtown Disney. Special entrance into California Adventure. Just wake up, eat a little and boom you are in the park. All the staff is very helpful. Beds were very comfortable. Little bit pricey, but i am not going there every week. If you have small children they have somethings for them to do in the hotel as well.

Sorry this review is from a few months ago, but I wanted to still review it based on my great experience. The room we had this trip was a garden view, with a partial view of Downtown Disney. This stay was prior to the new downtown disney starbucks, so we had a little bit of a construction view. However, given the low rate we received for staying at the hotel, I really can't complain. The convenience of our own entrance into California Adventure was great. Since it was a low season time, we never had a line.  The theme in the room is super cute with hints of snow white and bambi. Very earthy. You forget you are staying in a "Disney hotel".  The rooms are a bit small, significantly smaller than paradise pier and disneyland hotel. When I spoke with a bellmen at the DL hotel, he

First time staying the the Grand Californian for a recent trip to Diseyland with our 6 and 3 yr olds ... I have to tell you the direct access into Cali Adv --- the best....  as when one melted down it was off to the room, and no big deal ....  10 mins or so and there from inside the park .....    We spent 4 days and 3 in parks one in pool --- pool's were fantastic!!!!  Plenty of space (several pools and couple hot tubs ....    Pool side service --- and with soda for kids or adults!!!

Got a standard room because we were only sleeping here. Decor is old and dated. I can get over that. But our room was musty smelling, had a high pitch alarm noise off and on, patio door wouldn't open, air conditioning barely worked (set at 65 with fan and maybe only 70) and phone didn't work. After first night complained but they didn't have a room. I am sure other rooms are fine. Room 1529 needs to be shut down and redone.

Summary Heading: Expensive price to pay to be at park entrance
Summary: I have definitely had a love hate relationship with this hotel for many years now. The biggest problem we have had has been the inability to get the room we request. Whether we make the reservation months ahead of time and request the room then or call the night before and request it again or even arrive early for check in to make sure we get it.... there is, as they say "no guarantee we get the room we requested". That has always been annoying considering the considerable amount of money I am paying for this room! If you are paying over $600 a night (and this can be much more depending on the season) for a room, you should have the call on which one it is. We usually request a theme park view room and they always give us a pool view upon check-in, claiming it is equivalent.

Summary Heading: "Excellent Hotel with Disney California as your Backyard"
Summary: Me and my kids loved this hotel.  This was our first time in a Disney Hotel and it was trully magical.  Judy at the Guest Services was awesome she provided excellent customer service.  Loved it and would definitely come back!

Summary Heading: You can't beat being this close..
Summary: We definitely took advantage of the the 'magic gateway" between the Grand Californian and California Adventure Park right next door.. it is just great being so handy. I was a little disappointed that there wasn't a room available with a king bed on the Concierge floor, but we were at the parks for so many hours, it didn't matter in the end. We did make great use of the breakfast provided on the Concierge floor, but we never got back for afternoon tea!  Thoroughly enjoyed the convenience of this hotel, this is our third time staying there, and we would definitely return..

This was the fourth different Disney hotel we have stayed at and it certainly meets the normal high standard. Impressive architecture was matched by excellent service and an ideal location right next to the theme parks and Disney Village.

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel to be on the parks
Summary: We are DVC fo many years.  First time in the hotel.  It is an advantage to go to your room to take the shower or chnge you baby.  Some people could find it expensive, but tge convivience of the location is priceless.  The extra hour in the morning allow you to have the best spot for kcharacter atraction an the mos famous atraction.  If you really want to enjoy your stay in Anaheim you most stay here

Just back from California and Disneyland.  We stayed at the Grand Californian and it was just as expected.  The hotel and grounds were amazing.  Very similar in colors and style as Disneys wilderness lodge in Florida.  The location is amazing and service was top notch.   If we make it back to SoCal we will be staying here again.

Everyone was pretty friendly & helpful. Front desk girl definitely following the script (training?). Proximity to DD,DL & DCA was the best. Saw  World of Color from 6 floor balcony. Remembered my daughter's birthday upon arrival :)!!! Turn down service with chocolate ( thumbs up)! Room a little small for price. Pool should have been a touch warmer. Toilet too loud and seat loose. Water in shower hard to adjust. Room service good but expensive. TV never worked even after "repair" :(!  And we had a glitch that denied us our 4th day on a 4 day park hopper (issue was resolved fairly quickly). But I'll be back because we love to be in the middle of it all.

I've traveled  to 49 of the 50 states as well as two parts of south America and Europe. I have not experienced this high quality and superior class of amenity. In my five decades of travel I have never come across the level of service and sheer grandeur of a hotel than could hold a candle to the Grand.  Plus you have your own entrance to California Adventure park and Downtown Disney!!!!   One caveat-the kids of others. People that have the $$$ to stay at such an lush destination seem to forget that there are others that have paid just as much as they have paid and deserve the respect of peace and quiet between the hours of 11p-8a. Luckily, a call to the front desk staff usually solves the screaming/running/banging/bed jumping quite efficiently!!!  Disney staff are the best and

When you stay at Disney,  stay at the Grand Californian! Complete acces to the park, clean quiet and very comfortable. Wetook advantage of the consierge level,  and completely avoided the extra cost of food at the park. Magic mornings allowed early entrance into the park, and we could go back to our room and relax without taking a huge amount of time away from the parks themselves. Completely worth the cost especially if you are traveling with children or grandparents!  When staying here it is like it's own oasis between the parks to relax and rejuvinate. Also take advantage of the spa, amazing pedicure to heal aching feet! Will be back again soon.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay in when you have small kids!
Summary: We stayed here for 4 days and had a great time.  Service was excellent.  We initially were in a room with 2 queen beds but since we had 3 adults and 2 kids, we requested one with a daybed and they moved us to one within minutes.  The staff was very helpful.  We had 2 small kids with us during this trip, a 2 yr old and a 5 yr old.  They needed naps in the afternoon so we just walked back to the hotel to rest and nap.  This really helped us enjoy our trip since we did not have cranky kids in the evening.  We were able to watch the fireworks on one night and the World of Color on another night.  The hotel even gave us a deal on the park hopper tickets which are really the best thing to buy when you are visiting Disneyland on multiple days.  The pool was a bit full on the days we

Waitstaff at pool never ask if you need anything. They just chitchat with each other. Need to order food & drinks??forgetaboutit!!!! They should try to meet guest needs & sell rather than wait for us to try and find them. Reflected in tips
