We stayed here for a long weekend in July of 2014. The hotel is beautiful and well maintained. Our check-in went quickly and we were guided to our room. We were on the second floor with a pool view room. The room is well appointed with a refrigerator, 42" flat screen television and DVD player. The bed was very firm but comfortable. The bathroom area was divided into two parts; one with the bathtub/shower and toilet, the other, the sink/vanity area. It was nicely arranged and had accessories included that you would expect from a higher end hotel. The room was very quiet. We were not disturbed at all during our stay. Once we were in the hallway we could hear our neighbors but not while in the room. The staff is very courteous and the elevators were quickly available. The only

We stayed in a room on the 5th floor and were treated to a view of Grand California theme park.  We were able to watch the World of Color show from our room- there's even a channel to listen to the accompanying music.    The sofabed my son slept on was very comfortable.  Our bed was great.  I didn't care much for the comforter much, but that's my personal opinion.  The only fault I have is that if you don't do valet parking, you do not get assistance to your room with a cart. It felt a little subpar to carry luggage to your room after paying what we did for a room.

I love this place, my family stayed here Christmas a few years ago and it was a great experience. This time was as close to perfect as the last.   My only disappointment was our room location.   Our "premium view", it seems the roof of sephora in Downtown Disney is premium.   To be fair, they offered to move us in the middle of our stay but everything else was so nice, the view ended up being, not such a big deal.

Attending a conference held at the Disneyland Hotel I stayed at this resort because no rooms were available at the other property. There was a moderately long Iine encountered at check-in but this is Disney. Cast members were efficient. Check-in was smooth. The property is spectacular. Very much like the Wilderness Lodge in Disney World this has a beautiful atrium lobby. Rooms are spacious, clean and very efficient. My room was on the sixth floor with the balcony overlooking the Disneyland Hotel (and gorgeous sunsets). A private entrance allows resort guests entrance to the Disney California adventure theme park. Another entrance places you right in the middle of downtown Disney. The pool complex is well-kept, clean and inviting. I used the pool complex early in the morning when

Stayed here with our 2 & 6 year old, loved how close it was to the parks so if we needed to "divide and conquer" it was easy to do so.  I love Disneyland SO MUCH more than Disneyworld.  The people are nicer, the weather is nicer, and it's not so overwhelming.  Our room was comfortable, the food in the character meal downstairs was good. My only complaints were while we were there they had an event where the fire alarm went off at 1:30am and woke us up.  They were totally unprepared as to where to route all of the guests, no explanation was given as to what had happened, and they moved us twice before settling on having us stand in downtown Disney until the all clear.  Also the "spa" was nothing to write home about.  I had a pedicure and it was not great.  I'd not likely go back

This property is so well located we would definitely stay here again.    Reality is the property is very expensive, and quite dated and dark...certainly the guest rooms and bathrooms.  However the pool facilities are very good, the service great, and the location exceptional.  You can't beat walking back through those gates to escape the crowds and have a swim, and then being able to return an hour later.  Service from the reception and VIP services staff was attentive, quick and knowledgeable.  We did experience some delays with the food and beverage service at the pool.  A plug for the VIP guide offering at Disneyland.  This was an absolutely amazing service. Whilst not cheap the value was fantastic.  We were lucky enough to have Chris, who was passionate, knowledgable, and

We are DVC members, and our home resort is the Grand Californian. Let me just say, I love this hotel! Not only did we get munchies all the time from the club level lounge, we put our swimsuits on, ran to GRR, rode it, went back to our room and changed out of the wet clothes.   The location is simply unprecedented here, add that to the grand wilderness-y style and you've got a great place to return year after year.

From the minute we walked into the the Grand Californian we were greeted by a cast member that directed us to our cast member for the concierge floor. We were checked in directly in our room by the concierge cast member and she also gave us a tour. The food and beverages (including adult beverages) provided in the concierge lounge, free of charge was well worth the extra points we used to book our stay. We are DVC members. Our room had a private balcony was roomy and the double sinks made getting ready fast and easy. The extra touches of turning down the bed at night and the chocolates on the pillow put a smile on our faces at the end of a magical day. The pools were clean and chairs were very comfortable. The food and drinks served pool side made sitting by the pool easy. We

You couldn't be closer to California Adventure park! The room was large enough for our family of 5 (with three teenagers). There was a day bed for our youngest. The staff were all friendly and genuinely helpful. The room was mostly quiet for such a large hotel. The AC did not seem to cool while we were out of the room, so it was a bit stuffy until it got going. Plenty of towels and chocolates on the pillow with turndown each night.

Fortunately, Disneyland is not so spread out like Disney World in Florida.  However, after a long day at Disneyland, this is the perfect hotel to stay at because it is so close to the park!  This hotel is right on the property between Disneyland and California Adventure which is ideal. In addition, the d√©cor is like a mountain lodge, well kept and the staff are extremely attentive (of course, all Disney staff is this way - it must be one of their hiring criteria).

This summer we stayed at Grand Californian for the 4th time. It was by far the most expensive hotel we stayed at on our trip even though some of the other hotels was much nicer.  But would I pay the insane price again? Yes. I love the location and convenience. I love being able to run up to my run to grab a sweater. I love having my shopping at the parks delievered to the front desk. To me there is something special about walking straight in to one of the parks from the hotel and for that I pay the insane price for this hotel.

Summary Heading: Nice, great service and can't beat the location
Summary: Stayed here with kids (12 and 14) on a quick Disneyland/LA leg of a longer trip. Honestly, we could not have been more pleased with the location. At most, a 10-minute walk into Disneyland, and I think even closer to CA. And Downtown Disney is literally right outside the door! The service was excellent at every encounter, including an unexpected upgrade at check-in.  The hotel itself is a nice property with very nice pools. It is a near-replica of our favorite WDW hotel, Wilderness Lodge. My only knock would be that while the Grand Californian is touted and priced as a luxury hotel, I found it to be a bit downscale from that. In WDW parlance, I would call it an upper-end moderate resort.

Our family stayed at the Grand Californian for 4 nights in late June.  Yes, it is pricey but we will pay extra for the convenience factor.  Especially in the summer when the crowds are huge.  The location can‚Äôt be beat, it has its own entrance to California Adventure and is a short walk to Disneyland.  Downtown Disney is also right out the front door.  If you are tired and need a break, it is easy to walk back to your room for a rest.  I read some of the other reviews regarding the rooms being tired but our room was clean, comfortable, and in good condition.  The pool area is very nice and has drink service.  The lobby is beautiful.  The only negative is the hotel bar could use a remodel and better televisions.  I went there to watch a little bit of the World Cup and the

We live in San Diego and go to Disneyland frequently.  I have always wanted to stay at the Grand Californian but it is quite expensive.  We did a last minute trip over the weekend and the only Disney hotel that was not sold out was the Grand Californian so our decision was made for us.    All I can say is WOW!  The hotel is gorgeous and it is set up more like a Disney vacation Club (DVC) than just a hotel.  There is an entertainment schedule and activities for kids and families all day.  That was great for us given that we have a 3 and 1 year old.    It was fairly hot last weekend so the 3 pools on property were a great way to cool off in the afternoon and tire the kids out for a good nap before heading back to the park as it got cooler.  My only wish was that they had a zero

We have stayed so many times at the Grand Californian that I have lost count, but it has normally always been a good stay.  We were there to celebrate life -  my husband getting through his cancer surgery (which was supposed to be one day of surgery, with a five day hospital stay) -- It turned out to be a disastrous 2 1/2 month hospital stay, with five surgeries because the flap inside his face kept failing.  I don't want to digress, so let me stay on topic.  Disney's Grand California was the best for us, the location, considering the two have us have one disability or another, couldn't be beat.  I pleased with the reservationist to give us a room as close to the elevator as possible since the hallways there are a  We have stayed so many times at the Grand Californian that I

Summary Heading: Awesome Location and Style for Disneyland
Summary: Everything about this hotel was pretty much excellent.  The Storytime Restaurant buffet was really bad, but the rest of the hotel was excellent.  You can't beat the location; walk outside and you are near the gate to the park.  The hotel itself has a great pool and hoot tub area. (The robes that are there to use are a really classy touch)  The great room (lobby) is awesome with the "mountain cabin" style to it.  There was a story time place for the kids, big hearth, etc.  All in all, a great place to stay - we will stay there again next time we go to Disneyland.

After pouring through all the trip advisor reviews I knew to expect a tired hotel in a great location and that is exactly what we got.  For the money the rooms in particular are very overpriced and showing their age BUT you pay for the location and I would stay here again in a heartbeat if we visit Disneyland again due to easy park access and early entry.  We stayed in a room with a downtown Disney view high enough to view the fireworks at night, this was great with 2 young kids.  Yes it is a bit noisier but when the door is closed I couldn't hear any noise.  My kids loved the bunk beds and the towel animals left for us each night by the wonderful housekeeping team.  I also appreciated the lovely peppermint foot cream that the housekeeper gave me when I told her my feet hurt

It has always been on our Bucket List to stay at Disney's Grand California Hotel, and we finally decided to pay up and do it this year.  My wife and I usually go to Disneyland once in the winter by ourselves, and once in the summer with the kids. You could say we are a little fanatical about Disneyland in our research of facts, hidden secrets, and folklore.   When you enter the driveway from Disneyland Drive you are immediately immersed in the Disney experience. From the huge timbers used on the covered parking, to the perfectly manicured landscaping, guest are warmly greeted by Cast Member dressed in period appropriate attire.  We arrived early from our 8 hour drive so we could eat lunch before heading to the poolside cabana that we had rented for 4 hours. Check in was a

We stayed at the Disneyland Grand Californian mainly to get the early entrance into California Adventure to ride the Cars ride.  It was quite a bit more expensive than other hotels (including Disney hotels), but I decided to splurge for my niece's special trip and for friends we were meeting.  Let me say, it was well worth the splurge.  Disney is not ever cheap, but they do things well and the staff are attentive to your every need.  The attention to detail in creating the full experience of all that Disney is, makes the extra expense worth it.  Getting onto the Cars ride 35 minutes after the ride opened (you still have to get up very early to get in line once inside the park) was the cherry on the top of an already great experience.  The other Disney hotels are nice too, but

I really enjoyed my stay.  Hotel is a little different to most with its impressive lobby area and, best of all, it has easy access to California Adventure and Downtown Disney. Our twin room was comfortable and adequately sized for 2 adults and one child, but not large, especially when compared with similarly priced hotels. We would have needed 2 rooms or a studio if we'd taken the whole family.  The pool view was more a pool glimpse. The pools themselves were good although the pool area was generally a little crowded. Wifi was poor quality and dropped out. I was a little disappointed with the breakfast.  Plenty of food but not much variety, especially for international tastes.  True Disney service though, which we appreciated.

We stayed here some years ago and came back only because of the unmatched proximity to the Parks which was an important consideration for mobility reasons. You also feel as if you are immersed in the whole Disney experience. For that you pay a significant premium for a hotel that is well maintained and clean but showing its well past its prime. The rooms are small and dark and the bathrooms ageing. The pools are pleasant but nothing special and so crowded on a hot day that we ended up not bothering after the first experience. Worth it? Its a very subjective call. We knew what we were getting in for - grumbled about the cost, but still had a great time.

True Disney experience, from check in to checkout!  Greeted promptly, asked if we where celebrating, yes birthday, was given a birthday button (personalized with name) and given a signed 8 x 10 of fab 5 & signed!  Room upgraded to a pool view, beds super comfortable, easy access to park, a 3 pools to choose from!  Will definetly book again.

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel, but won't stay again
Summary: This really is a beautiful hotel, and most reviews - even the low-rated ones - seem to agree with this.  However, it truly is over-priced and in need of updating.  We rented DVC points to stay in a studio for 3 nights.  The room itself was OK - a queen bed with a queen sofa bed, kitchenette, and balcony.  As many have mentioned, it is relatively dark in the rooms.  The real disappointment was with the bathroom.  The toilet seat and shower fixtures were all loose (and I mean ALL), this was so obvious that I can't imagine that housekeeping wouldn't have noticed this during cleanings and informed maintenance.  If I was a DVC owner paying my annual dues, I would be very upset about the condition of this room.  As part of this trip we stayed in many hotels, with most charging

What a lovely place. Vaulting ceilings warm woods craftsman style. $$$$$ and I am worth it.  My daughter and boyfriend treated me to a wonderful time. A cheerful place.  Peeked into the spa. Meh.  Could be better ambiance just lacked the look of uber that makes a spa experience a spa experience. A little to sterile as in cold no personality. As a Dr. Hauschka esthetician I compare it to my private spa in Encinitas. But I have a rooftop so it's hard to beat a spa in the sky!!!  I look to be wowed and try spas all over the world. I have been wowed, but not here. Just an evaluation.  Hotel is great.

We stayed at this hotel the year it opened for an amazing rate of $150 for a concierge room. Fast forward to 2014 and although the rate was much, much higher it still has that same magic.  My husband and I are HUGE Disney fans and  are Annual Passholders. We managed to get a 25% discount which for June was amazing. It was still expensive but considering we were already staying at the Sheraton Anaheim for $178 which was disgusting, we were more than ready to take it. So we checked out the next day and were so glad we did. We were made to feel special from the moment we walked in. Check in was quick and efficient and super friendly.  The room was lovely, it was at the front of the hotel right next to the Monorail. It was nice to see it go by and we were amazed that we could not

Summary Heading: Third time not the charm....upsetting experience
Summary: Have stayed at the Grand Californian with family a couple of times in the past, and know that it looks better than it really is; it's a Sheraton-level place which charges 5-star prices because of it's location and image.  I also know that they tend to overpromise things, so I booked a concierge-level floor to try to avoid disappointments.  Showed up and basically the concierge service means a pretty basic lounge with continental breakfast and snacks, plus some dedicated check-in and booking agents.  However, the real disappointment was to find out our room didn't have a day bed for my son, even though I was promised during the booking that we would have one for our room.  Turns out there were no rooms available with day beds anywhere in the Disney resort (really?).  So they

After three trips to Disney World since our last visit to Disneyland Resort, we forgot how wonderfully close the Grand Californian is to EVERYTHING.  First, we could see several attractions within DCA from our balcony.  Want Starbucks, just step outside into downtown Disney and there it is.  Want to stop for a quick break between the two parks? No problem.  Use the DCA entrance/exit within the resort. At Disney World, you must hop on a bus or a monorail or a boat to get anywhere (or walk 10 to 20 minutes if it is "close").  At Disneyland you park your car and that is it. No need for any transportation, especially if you are staying at the Grand Californian. The resort is stunning.  The great hall/lobby area will take your breath away.  The theme is California craftsmanship.  It

This hotel is so close to the parks and Downtown Disney that you can totally separate yourself from the rest of the world and fully immerse yourself in Disney magic. The lobby is absolutely breathtaking and a comfortable, albeit busy, place to unwind after a long day in the parks. Service is impeccable, from the bellhops to those manning the front desks ...they even have someone to assist you in lining up for registration. The lodge feel of the lobby carries over into the rooms, with pine tree wallpaper and rustic furnishings. While not overly spacious nor excessively luxurious, the rooms are adequate for 2-4 persons and quite cozy. We were completely tickled with the rotating showerhead in the bathroom...a lavish touch.  (The room we had contained two queen size beds and a

I have just left the grand california after a 3 day stay with my family of 5. Boys 17,15 and 13 and was fairly underwhelmed with aspects of this hotel for the money I paid.  As previous reviewers have noted it is dark and does not have many indications that you are at Disney. Staff ranged from really friendly to very indifferent and the supposed magic of Disney was largely abscent!  our room has no view at all ( the trusses of the carport) and lots of noise from cars checking in. We also needed 2 tea bags one night as only coffee is supplied and the room service were happy to supply these but with a delivery charge of $4.86.  the hotel is superbly located and makes it possible to take breaks from the very busy park at leisure.  The room quality was more 3 star than 4 star and

Summary Heading: Very good service, but aging property
Summary: The service is very good especially at the hotel's dining facilities (Napa Rose).  The house keeping staff is a little less approachable than in most high priced properties.  The property needs some freshening up.  The pool area is not very upscale and some of the room furnishings are a bit tired.  That said the hotel is extremely convenient to the parks and offers a variety of activities throughout the day and night to make the price of entry worth it.  Try to secure a room overlooking Downtown Disney and you can see the Disneyland park fireworks.

Summary Heading: Way too expensive but you're so close
Summary: We wanted to be close to Disneyland. Well we were but at over $500 per night for a standard room I expected something special. The room was very average. Very average. No Disney theming in the room. No atmosphere. Nothing classy about it at all. All is has to offer is that it's close to Disneyland. It's in the resort and access to the park is a dream. But but but... For $500 a night for a very plain standard room is it worth it? If you don't think about the money it's ok but your credit card get hit so hard it really hurts.  Positives:  Hotel: Staff are very helpful. Access to Disneyland Access to Down Town Disney Pool area is nice. Waterslide is fun for kids but pool rules are too strict and a bit silly. No use of inflatable ball for a Dad and son to play with? Why?  Room:

Summary Heading: treat yourself for a special occasion
Summary: I've always said if your not going to stay in the room then look for a better priced hotel and save the money for other things.   However this time we decided to go against my reasoning and treat ourselves.  Its not about the actual room I have stayed in far more luxurious rooms, but its about the amenities the staff and everything this hotel has to offer.  For starters we decided to stay here because our flight would get in early in the morning, so we figured stay here play all day in the pool and then go into the park one hour earlier the next day,  well we checked in on july third, and when got there our room was ready that was a nice surprise.  the girl checking us in was training and she had someone next to her overseeing, well she was just great very professional and I

We stayed at this gorgeous hotel on several occasions with the last time being in December 2013.    Where do I start....   As soon as you walk in, your hit with this "magnificent view of a humongous tall redwood tree in the lobby!"  Kinda reminds me of "Bass Pro Shop."  The lobby itself is enormous with a huge fireplace where they tell stories at night. This being one of Disney's high end hotel is all that. The staff are attentive to your needs and assist you in every way.  They tend to the guests smaller children while parents check in and afterward deliver you bags to your room.  The rooms itself are clean and roomy but "your not here for the room, unless your on your honeymoon!" :-)  "Ahem", as I was saying, our room afforded us with a balcony view of Downtown Disney which

Recently returned from a trip to Disneyland, we usually stay at the Disneyland Hotel.  However, despite the fact that I love the new renovations at the Disneyland Hotel, our new favorite is Disney's Grand Californian Hotel.  You cannot beat the location (close to both parks including its own entrance to Disney California), the lobby of the hotel is a great meeting place for visitors (the kids loved watching Disney classics at their own special seating area), beautiful pool area, nice rooms with comfortable beds and bedding.  This is our go-to place from now on when we visit Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Great Location but no view from our room.
Summary: Disney's Grand has a great connected entrance to California Adventures and good access to Downtown Disney & the monorail to Disneyland but you do pay for the location. We didn't really know we were staying in a Disney hotel because there is no "Disney Magic" but on the shower curtains & some places in the room carpet. We were in a standard room on the 1st floor all the way down the hall towards the parking lot. Our view was of a blue building with white clouds painted on it. :( The view was disappointing. The hallways needed some updating and maybe more lighting. It was dark and sort of dingy, as my 8 year old pointed out. The rooms were small and dark. We did not use the balcony because of the no view and snaky look. The rooms really needed an updated look. The drain in our tub

Summary Heading: The best but get ready to pay for it
Summary: We have stayed here twice but both times someone else was paying for it. The location and overall feel of the hotel is what sets it apart from everything else. Every time I am walking through California Adventure, I look up at the Grand and say "someday". Last Christmas was that someday for me. We stayed in one the huge suites and loved it. We had two balconies that overlooked the park, which was so awesome and relaxing. We had a full kitchen and the living area was just immaculate. It was a glimpse into how the other half lives. The bathroom was huge complete with a jetted tub, which is nice when your feet hurt after walking all day. Even though someone else was paying for it, we did see the bill at the end and were shocked. I know it was more because we were there at

The location, the service, the best of everything! Highly recommend staying here. We had a room with the view of the pool, which was nice. Love the turn down service with chocolates on our pillows every night. Valet service was great, I had left some shoes in the car, called down to get them and they had them in my room in less than 10 minutes.

Despite large crowds, a million strollers (my grandson's included), and some hefty prices, Disneyland is great fun, even for my 73-year-old, addled self. In fact, I've loved Disneyland and WDW (and a Disney Christmas cruise) since my first visit to Disneyland in the 1960's. On our latest visit in June 2014, we stayed at the Grand Californian. Really a pleasant experience. We had connecting rooms: one for me and one for my daughter, son-in-law, and my three-year-old grandson. That worked great -- much better, I think, than a suite (I tend to talk too much and get on my son-in-law's nerves). The rooms were comfortable, clean, and expensive. But, the best part: The Grand Californian is very close to Disney's California Adventure. Incredibly convenient. Easy to enter the park, and

I was nervous about staying here because of the mixed reviews...This hotel is pricey for sure, I agree with other reviewers the bathrooms / showers are not quite up to expectation for this type of accomodation, but The Grand Californian has a character and an ambience, and I am not at all sorry we stayed there. Location was great, right next to the resorts. The beds were extremely comfortable.  The food on site could have been better. It has laundry facilities throughout the hotel. If they are renovating this will be unbeatable. It does need a bit of a tidy up...but we had an excellent stay ! Would be great with a heated pool..

Summary Heading: Run down, poor service, premium price
Summary: We have stayed here 3 times and this was our worst. The housekeeping has always been slow and done a poor job but that was actually slightly better this time although our carpet came pre-littered with someone else's bobby pins. When we arrived, we were told the room type we had requested (with bunkbeds) was not available because the last one was being given to a family with three children. Our two kids were not enough to warrant a bunkbed. I had called 2 months in advance to request that room and for $500/night, they should be able to accommodate that request. They told us they would move us on our third night and make sure our new room would be available as early as possible. We vacated our room at 10:00 in the morning on the day of the transfer and they did not have our new

We are a family that has included DisneyWorld and Disneyland as part of what we do when we want to share with our children and grandchildren, meaning that we have enjoyed their hospitality in California and Orlando. I can say that i speak with a bit of authority on the matter. The world of Disney does posses a certain magic and it is translated not only in the parks but also in their hotels. Saying this i believe that this property does need a bit more of the magic found in the resort of Orlando, Florida! Their swimming pool was cold and the grandkids had no where to swim

Summary Heading: BEWARE: BED BUGS AT GRAND CALIFORNIAN!!!
Summary: I wrote a review of GC that was nothing but praise.  See "Avid GC Stayer & Disney Enthusiast w/ Little Kids Review"  BUT...my mom and I stayed here in April and she even upgraded our room to a two bedroom suite which costs around 500+ a night.  Unfortunately, we weren't the only guests staying in that room...watch out for hitchhiking BED BUGS!!!  My son and mom were both bit.  When I contacted the hotel they act as if Disney is above a bed bug infestation.  I DID find it interesting a hotel staff member (or cast member I should say) informed me they would be closing the hotel in the next year and "renovating"  Hmm...you mean exterminating.

My family and I love this hotel. The location to Disneyland and the service the hotel staff provides is great. On this trip housekeeping was very consistent and the service was excellent. The bed's are very comfortable. The only reason why we give it four stars is this hotel uses poor quality toilet paper (literally feels like sandpaper in your hands) and the showerheads are very low pressure. With this hotel being the flagship on the property I expect better. I'm not here for value or to save money. Leave the cost cutting for Disneyland hotel or Paradise Pier..  The room service menu is quite limited however the food is excellent. There is a on site laundry facility with plenty of washers and dryers.  This hotel could easily be the best rated hotel in Anaheim if it weren't for

Summary Heading: Grand stay at the Grand Californian
Summary: My family truly enjoyed staying at the Grande Californian.  This was our first time visiting Disneyland (we have been to Disney World many times and usually stay at Disney's Beach Club resort).  We like to stay on property at a Disney resort when visiting Disney parks to get the true experience.  The Grand Californian was perfect.  The close proximity to the two Disneyland parks and Downtown Disney is amazing at this hotel and simply can not be beat (we stayed at the park until closing at midnight and were back in the room, teeth brushed and in bed by 12:15‚Ä¶this is how close the hotel is to the parks).  There is a small refrigerator in the room, but no microwave (you can use the micro at White Water Snacks Restaurant on-site). The resort was clean, all staff were encountered

Summary Heading: The only place to stay while visiting Disneyland
Summary: After dozens of family trips to DisneyWorld, we decided to make the trip to California. If you are planning a trip to the original House of Mouse,Disneyland, then there is no other place to stay than Disney's Grand Californian Resort. This hotel isn't located adjacent to the parks, but in the parks. Walk out one door and you are right in Downtown Disney, walk about 100 yards to your right and you are at the entrance to both Disneyland and California Adventure theme parks. You also have the choice to use the private entrance from the hotel directly into California Adventure.  Surprisingly, even though you are right there, the resort is quiet and peace full. Unlike Florida where everything requires you to ride there, bus, monorail, boat, etc. in California, everything is just a

Ok we know staying at a Disney Hotel is not cheap and to stay at one which is located with such easy access to the park (5min walk) is going to come at a premium but heres a few reasons why this is worth it for a few nights. The service is always going to be amazing, staff are very attentive and are willing to share tips that will make your stay more enjoyable. The hotel is really busy and it can seem overwhelming but the location makes up for that as you are only a few steps away from downtown disney where there are a plethora of shops and restaurant; may fav is House of Blues. A whole day at the theme park can be exhausting so its really nice to be able to come back to your room for a few hours, go to the pool, freshen up and go out again for the evening.  The rooms are okay,

Summary Heading: Best location to stay at Disneyland
Summary: Stayed in a premium view room on the 6th floor, room 6443.  Biggest negative is that I heard the mechanics of the elevator faintly all day and night, not too loud, but still a little annoying.  Given a 2 queen bed room.  Called to request a King, they said that they didn't make room guarantees regarding type of bed.  I remembered this at the time of booking as well.  No big deal.  View was of the pool.  Had to stand out on balcony and look left to see the park.  I think premium view means anything but the parking lot.  Room was very clean, a little dated and worn.  All in all, you should stay here for location.  That is what this hotel is all about.  Walk out your door and you are in the park!  Breakfast buffet at Storyteller's Cafe was average.  Recommend as location can't be

At the end of the day with very tired sore feet we all appreciated the short walk to our hotel, worth every cent. The hotel is very big and can be quite a walk in itself.  We were close to the California World adventure park and that was great for the magic mornings. So nice to be so close we could take a break during the day come back to the hotel for a snooze then head out again for more without the 15 min walk or more to the outside hotels. The rooms were lovely, beds bigs and comfortable. Service was excellent, staff very helpful and friendly. Appreciated the laundry facilities.

Summary Heading: Excellent location for Disney Parks & Downtown Disney
Summary: As kids, our family would drive to Disney early in the morning, spend for parking, navigate through the parking building/lot (don't forget where you parked!) then walk what felt like miles to our short legs, just to get to the shuttles for a quick ride, then line up with hordes of other kids at the gate till we were FINALLY inside the happiest place on earth.   What a difference from our last Disney experience in the Grand Californian Hotel!  Here, we woke up, had a leisurely breakfast, lounged around till the park opened, strolled through the hotel grounds and entered the park through our own private little entrance. After lunch, we even went back to the hotel for a short nap, before heading back out, well-rested for a second round of fun. Needless to say, going home after an

Went with our 5-year-old granddaughter, with focus on Disney,  so it was important to make getting there as easy as possible. This was where the hotel shone. Out the door and straight into the California Park, and a short walk to Disneyland, or alternatively a short walk through Downtown Disney to Disneyland. However, we ended up renting a stroller for the 5 days we were there as Disneyland was so hot and crowded. We rented, which was more expensive than buying, for what we thought would be convenience. What no one told us was that you could not take the stroller into Downtown Disney or the hotel, which meant a roundabout route through the parks to get back to the hotel, where you had to leave the stroller at the entrance and collect a new stroller at Disneyland the next day,

Upon check in I humbly suggest that  you check your CNN channel - if it's channel 38 you have a new TV and if it's Channel 57 and grainy you have an old TV in need of replacement.  I request a quiet room because I am up working at 5am for the next 2 days and sleep is kind of crucial. The request was for a quiet room away from ice machines and elevators where I checked into a guestroom room closest and directly next to the elevators. It surprisingly took another 30 more minutes to finally find another guestroom that was quiet and this while experiencing their VIP check in service where a staff member interrupts the check in process because they need access assistance.  Finally checked in and wanted to watch some CNN to get caught up on current affairs. CNN was on Channel 57 and

Great hotel. Wake up hit park no buses, no driving. Close to both parks and Downtown Disney. Stay here and enjoy the hotel.  Napa Rose is a great restaurant. If use to Florida you will not be "welcomed homed" as you are in Florida. Have three pools and pool near the Bar which is a plus. Have a couple of nice grills in back to grill a steak can't be best.

Over priced and the service is horrible.  I have never spent so much money for a bad experence. No breakfast service, that us an additonal charge. I will never stay at this hotel again.  People save your money do not go there!!!!

This place is amazing! After getting off a 14hr flight, the staff were very friendly and happy for us to check in early. Just a short walk into Downtown Disney, Disneyland and California Adventure Park. A little more expensive than other hotels around but your paying for location.   Having limited time (7n), we felt it was important to stay as close as possible to Disneyland.  Staying at the Grand, every morning we were able to get into a park early (magic morning). Doing our laundry here only cost us a few dollars. Pleasantly surprised! We would definitely recommend staying at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel.

Summary Heading: Great location, good hotel with excellent VIP service, poor valet service
Summary: The lobby is breathtaking. The location is superior. The rooms are acceptable although a bit dated. This is a rambling hotel with a lot of people everywhere. It seems they have overbuilt the infrastructure and built too many rooms in a bit of a rambling maze. The valet service stinks. We had to wait 20 minutes to obtain our car. The drive in was chaotic dodging Disney workers who did not seem to know what they were doing. The VIP service inside the hotel was superior and very helpful. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would return. We especially enjoyed the evening fireworks from our third story location overlooking Disneyland.

We stayed here for 5 nights recently for our family holiday to Disneyland. Yes this hotel is expensive there is no doubting that. We tossed up staying here versus saving a lot of money by staying outside Disneyland. Yes the hotel is tired and not the usual quality you would expect for the price. But here is my view - we used the hotel room mainly to sleep in as we were out all day having fun. The room was very clean, the beds were comfortable and the bathroom whilst it was small, was practical enough and vey clean. So it met our needs very well. We used the pool a few times and this was awesome - my 7 year old and husband both loved the water slide! Why is it worth the $$ - the Magic Hour! Yes the other Disney hotels have the Magic Hour too but there was nothing nicer than

The hotel is in a great location and we have been staying here since it first opened.  It is showing it's age and badly in need of a refurbishment.  The staff is very average and can't compare to the friendly Disney service at the hotels in Walt Disney World in Orlando.  The staff rarely says hello and some just look miserable being there.  Last two tines we stayed, our room wasn't ready until 5:30 pm.  Should have been ready at 4 pm as promised.  There is a new SpringHill Suites opening across the street - SpringHill is a better value and still within walking distance to the resort.

Summary Heading: A place to get away from it all
Summary: Had a wonderful time while we were there. Loved the location! Right smack int he middle of Down town Disney & Disney's California adventure. Be advised that rooms facing these location offer a Fantastic view and the sounds of Everything from early morning to late at night. We had a different view, but could still enjoy the Disneyland's fireworks from our balcony. Rooms are comfortable, but don't have a lot of the Disney touches that other hotels offer. This will please some and bother others. Pool lounge chair pads are Fantastic! Thick, soft and comfy (almost pillow top ). Be sure to get one and relax your day away. We had great service from the valet and the concierge servers. Always greeting you with a warm smile welcoming you back after a day of adventure!

We love this hotel and it's location in Disneyland.  It is very expensive but you are there for a good time, not a long time. :) We were disappointed that the main pool was closed while we were there. The rooms could be updated and don't have any Disney decor which our kids would have really loved. Breakfast brunch is too expensive, but again you aren't there for a long time. :) Looking forward to our next visit.

Summary Heading: Yosemite in the Heart of Disney
Summary: This was visit #5 at Grand Californian and while some places in the hotel are showing wear and tear, the accommodations are comfortable and it was quiet in the night which is hard to find close to Disney. We will be back due to the lovely staff and the service with a smile at all hours of the day and night. And the pool lounge chairs rock!

Summary Heading: by far the best stay at the disneyland area
Summary: stayed in feb 2014. The entrance and valet was very quick and friendly. Showed you were at a Disney hotel right away with it's magic!  Then checked in and was amazed by the "grandness" of the hotel.  It was midnight and had a six hour flight and then six hour drive in to anaheim BUT, the front desk agent greeted us with open arms.  He was very alert, attentive and quick.  He made small pleasant chit chat which was nice and very uplifting!  We then proceeded to our room and it was a little dark and dated BUT still amazing.  It was clean and the kids had a great time with sleeping on bunk beds and a pull out trundle.  It suited them perfectly!  the bathroom was great with the double sinks seperate and the toilet and shower in another room.  It allowed several people to get ready

This hotel is badly in need of refurbishment. The rooms are dated, worn, and aren't up to the standard you would expect from Disney. I would compare the room to a Hampton Inn.   Pros - Great location - Beautiful Lobby area - Early park admission  Cons - Rooms are old and in need of refurbishment.  - Their "green" initiatives are taken to the extreme. For example, the room stops controlling the temperature in the middle of the night since it uses motion sensors to determine occupancy. I know it seems preposterous ... feel free to call the hotel and confirm.  - Internet is so slow it is unusable.  - Pool area is too small for the number of guests.

Excellent customer service. Although rooms are very small. My stay was perfect. I stayed here before and rooms definitely need to be remodeled. It's getting outdated, but the customer services is excellent!  Employees at Gift store, front desk, the customer service at Valet parking is good, but it can be better.  Congrats!  Joab Flores

We have given this star rating due to the very helpful, caring, and courteous person who took our call at the hotel when we had to cancel our reservation 4 days beforehand due to a death in the family. They refunded the majority of the amount which was greatly appreciated, a big thank you. Hopefully we will get to visit your hotel under better circumstances in the future.

We stayed here for three nights.  After a long drive and some very  heavy traffic it's great to pull in and relax.  The valet parking and bell staff is great; all we did was get out of the vehicle and walk right in.  We never gave our van another thought until we left.  We checked in early and our room was ready.  One advantage of staying here is early entry to the parks.  We got to go in at 7am, way before the crowds come.  We brought cereal to eat in our room, but the hotel has a nice cafe where I got a coffee to go.  We had the "partial view" room which I didn't really want but that was what was available.  The room faced Downtown Disney and had a nice balcony.  It was noisy at night (I brought ear muffs for sleeping), and a long hike from the elevators.   All in all a very

Summary Heading: Loved the hotel however our room was So far away.
Summary: I stayed here for my 30th birthday. I was with my other half plus 3 other friends and we all came from Australia. I really loved the hotel and especially loved the fine dining restaurant (napa) based on California wine country. The only problem I had was that our room was So far away. They really need to find a way to not make it such a long walk. After walking all day it felt like once we hit the lobby we had another big walk to our room.  I would stay her again however I'd defiantly ask for a more convenient room.

We recently stayed at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel and I would rate the hotel Very Good.  I loved the convenience with the close proximity to the parks.  Everything was in walking distance which is in direct contrast to traveling within Disney World.  The hotel was beautiful and the rooms were very nice.  A nice selection of places to eat within the hotel and a quick snack store as well. Prices were a little on the high end but it is Disney and Disney prices are always inflated.  But as far as convenience, you can't beat it!!

Summary Heading: Stay somewhere else and save a lot of money !!!!!!!
Summary: Room not ready, Some other guest walk into our room, bath tub would not drain, room service brought up cold dinner, the safe would not work. All this added up to waiting for someone to show up and losing time at the parks. Also the room with the premium view of the park was looking out at a tree and nothing else!

We stayed here in October of 2013.  It was our first time in the Grand Californian and we absolutely loved it.  The location couldn't be beat.  It was so convenient to come and go as often and easily as we wanted.  The kids loved it.  And they loved the pool.  Everything was clean, and they always supplied us with more towels when we needed them.  Everyone was so nice, from the front desk to the often overlooked cleaning staff (truly wonderful and nice).  We would love to stay there again, as long as financials allow since it is pricey.  We even took the cheapest room and still felt that our view was great.  The only thing that I can think to mention is the bunk beds can rattle.  When my kids would bump the side it would be a little loud.  That aside, we loved it and want to

We stayed for two nights in a studio villa on 6/14-6/15. The room was very clean and the hotel and its staff are amazing. The room was on the first floor which would not have been my preference but there was nothing bad about the room at all. The only problem we had was the remote control for the TV wasn't working but we called and they arrived within 10 minutes with a replacement. Bell service and valet service was excellent. The staff all goes out of their way to make you feel welcome and we couldn't have been happier with the hotel. Another great Disney stay.

Summary Heading: Disney is always excellent...but prefer DisneyWorld
Summary: So...that was the question everyone asks us.  DisneyLAND or DisneyWORLD.  We're DVC members so we have a LOT of experience with DisneyWORLD as we live in NY and fly down to FL.  This was our first DisneyLAND.  I was told how small it would be, and with California Adventure it was easily two days at EACH park.  So four days comfortably...that being said the Californian is a small version of the Wilderness Lodge in FL.  Just like DisneyLAND is the small version of DisneyWORLD.  The staff is top notch.  You go right from the Hotel onto a Downtown Disney type strip...then you have to turn L for DizLand or R for CaliA.  I found the Grand Californian to be very pricey for everything from gift shops & spa to restaurants.  The rooms were Disney-spotless and the service Disney-perfect.

My husband and I stayed here January 2014.  We love the openess if this hotel.  After being in the parks with the crowds all day it is nice to come back to the quiet and openess.  We had the club level room and there was a mix up with the bed size.  We had to wait a little while for our room, but they upgraded us to a park veiw.  We had a great stay and the room and staff were fantastic.

Summary Heading: Excellent rooms and service, but you do pay for the location.
Summary: I have stayed in hotels around the world and I have to say that the service both in the lobby and with housekeeping rivaled those of some of the best hotels I have visited.  The room was appointed well with details similar to an upscale Westin.  The location really made a difference in hitting the park for a couple days and being able to unwind in the room when it got too hot or too hectic.  However, the price point rivaled that of one of the highest i have paid for a room that isnt a suite, either here or in Europe.  If one can afford it for a splurge, it is worth it for a nice break during a Disney stay.

This was my first stay at a Disney Resort in over 30 years - so the expectations were high!  The cast members hit the mark, they were superb.  The accomodations were beautiful and the linens gorgeous.  The Bambi shower curtain a nice touch.  The hot water temperature was not hot enough, it was difficult to soak in a tub with luke warm water.  All in all it was great to be back.

Summary Heading: Disney leaves no detail unnoticed or unattended!
Summary: We are Disney Vacation Club members which we always tell people is some of the best money we ever spent.  That being said, we were in a one bedroom villa in the Grand Californian and it was absolutely stunning with its wooden trim.  As with all one bedroom villas, we had a full kitchen, two bathrooms, a washer/dryer, two closets, a jacuzzi bath tub, a living room and a bedroom, plus a balcony.  We had a view of the Mickey ferris wheel at California Adventure from our balcony.  The villa itself was comfortably furnished, tastefully decorated and a welcome departure from having stayed in many hotel rooms.    The lobby of the hotel was typically Disney amazing!  There was a little room with a fireplace, tvs with cartoons running for the wee ones, big areas with chairs and couches

The hotel is beautiful but the staff is absolutely horrible. Our son who has ASD was having sensory overload and we went back to the room to let him rest but it was locked. The door would not open. We called the staff and they said it would be at least an hour and suggested we go buy ourselves some lunch. When we informed them that we were not hungry and really needed a quiet place to rest they told us the only place they had to offer was crowded lobby. After a half hour of waiting our son was really having a hard time. I informed the staff that we really really just needed a quiet place for our son because he was suffering they didn't care at all. The member of management who was assigned to deal with us said he had a child with downs syndrome yet showed no compassion in the

We stayed at the other 2 Disneyland hotels and finally stayed at the Disney California on a midweek, slow season deal. It is definitely closer to the parks and had a nice homey feel to retreat and relax in. The hotel is definetly more luxurious than the other hotels. We had the standard view room overlooking the check-in valet and felt it was fairly nice to step out into the balcony. We didn't have a view of the park but it was a nice view with trees and the Disneyland hotel. The pool area slide was fun but not as fun as the other 2 hotels. We really enjoyed the fact that there was a movie night that we checked out before we headed to bed. The Critter breakfast food was ok but the Chipmunks and Bears really kept my little one entertained and he enjoyed the little parade they did

Summary Heading: Oh so worth it ! A must with small children!
Summary: It is definetly a splurge and yet it made everything magical. Every moment was enjoyed and every encounter was positive. The cast members could not have been more helpful. I read all the reviews but the access to the parks and ease with which entrance was accessed made every penny worth it.  From the moment we arrived for my grandsons 5th birthday they catered to his every desire and wish. From a signed picture of Mickey to making him pancakes for lunch which really wasnt on the menu! A special balloon and a personal concierge made everything run smoothly.  We did stay on the Concierge Level and the added bonus of the Craftsman Club was pricesless. Staff there to get you a glass of milk  and cookies or chocolate covered strawberies and wine! The expresso maker was incredible!

We stayed here just one night in a three bedroomed villa as my daughter and son in law are Disney vacation members. This was very impressive, the lower floor had a full kitchen, dinning room, living room, and a master bedroom with bathroom and jacuzzi bath. This floor also had another bathroom with full shower, toilet. Upstairs was a seated area with pool table and two further en suite bedrooms. Each bedroom had TV, hairdryer, balcony. We wished we could have stayed longer

We have  stayed at this hotel a couple of times now. One of the times was during the holiday season and once when it was off peak. Both times were very busy. The staff is very helpful and friendly. Just be careful of what other events are going on at the time of your stay. Book any character meals well ahead of time to make sure there is availability. Pools are great and service there is wonderful with plenty of lounge chairs and towels.

We stayed at the Californian on the evenings of June 6th and 7th. There is absolutely nothing I can say bad about this hotel, It is beautiful and the help is cheerful and can't do enough to please you. It's great to be able to return to the room and rest in the course of the day especially if you are older and do not have the energy of the children. The hotel and dining is extremely expensive  and you have to realize that up front. For us it was a special occasion and knew that it would be expensive. As my children were growing we went to Disneyland every year and stayed off the property. If cost is a consideration I would suggest you investigate the hotels close to the entrance. If cost is not a factor, you will love this hotel.

It's rare to visit a hotel once every few years and walk away with an incredible experience each time.  On this most recent occasion, I booked a room at the Grand Californian to surprise my buddies with a weekend trip to Disneyland. We all enjoy hanging out in the parks, but we can't do 16 hour days any more, and we like to take our time and relax. The Grand Californian is perfect for this.  Upon check-in (at 10am!) the front desk staff was able to get me the exact room I wanted, and it was available right then. I know this is luck, but it was great luck to have. I was able to drop some things in the in-room mini fridge and set up my stuff before I came back with my friends later that night.  With five of us in the room, housekeeping happily provided pads and sleeping bags,

The hotel is the place to stay for convenience, with direct access to California Adventure and easy access to Disneyland and Downtown Disney. The hotel itself is average, and as other reviewers pointed out, getting tired. Rooms are small and basic. Staff is very attentive and friendly for the most part. If the family is all old enough to be walking all day, I would look at other nearby properties unless convenience is critical.

Great for families. Self park across street very convenient.  Food and beverage way to high.  Best to eat out on harbor blvd. food better and cheaper.  Pool was nice but hot tub was cold.  Great location to the park and downtown Disney.  Would stay again for the right price

Summary Heading: Rooms were nice but not worth 400+ a night.
Summary: This was our first time in a Disneyland hotel, one right inside the park. I guess I was expecting a little more for my 400$ a night. Rooms were nice and seemed up to date, They were clean so that was a plus. I paid an extra 200$ for a room with a view and was told we were going to be over looking the California Adventure park but we were over looking the pool area. Was pretty disappointed with that. Everyone that we encountered as for the staff there were very friendly and helpful. I honestly don't think we will be staying again in the park hotels because the price was way too expensive for what we got. I also don't look for us to attend Disneyland for a long time as we had to wait hours for rides that only lasted 45 seconds. I think they need to add more to the park like

This is our second time staying at the hotel in a Downtown Disney View room, coincidentally we were in the same room the as the last time (5143). This room is a perfect location, when you reach the end of the first hallway and make a right it's just a few doors down. It is also close to the vending room and the "escape" stairs should you choose to take the stairs (down only) rather than walk back to the elevator.  Our room had been well maintained, no carpet stains, peeling wallpaper, burned out lightbulbs and such.  The only thing that needed tweaking was the tub/shower diverter that was stuck in the shower position, not a big deal for us since we are shower people. We had people on both sides with children and could not hear our neighbors even through the adjoining door. The

very poor lighting in rooms - impossible for anyone trying to out on makeup. in fact whole hotel felt dark & dingy, meant to be like log cabins but bit inviting decor at all.  plus side  is that beds are very comfortable and Room seemed clean however the public restrooms only average clean.  we had 4 ppl in a room yet they only provided coffee for 2. towels rough and poor quality for the price you pay for a room.  being close to California adventure is only reason to stay here and very overpriced for dark very average rooms.

Club-level room w/exclusive Craftsman Club Lounge, priority check in, grizzly bear view, balcony in DCA, fireworks view, five stars. Cannot wait to bring my family next time. Spoiled and deserving mom

Summary Heading: Service makes up for OK rooms
Summary: Just returned from a two night stay at Grand Californian in Disneyland.  Starting at my arrival, I was impressed with the valet service.  I was greeted with a friendly smile and valet fees versus self-park were explained.  I chose to valet since there was only a small difference. Valet is $25 a day while self- park is $17 and it's in a lot across the street.   Check-in was quick but I felt the employee behind the check-in desk could have smiled a bit more and not been so mechanical. The person I had for check-in really should not have that job!  My room was  nothing special without any special touches and just your typical standard hotel room. Linens were very nice, bath towels were fluffy and new, view was looking over several roof tops towards Paradise Pier Hotel and Disney

I'm not going to complain about the price or compare the GCH to other $500 a night hotels.  There is no comparison for a lot of reasons.  I will say you shouldn't expect 5-star accommodations (though they have very nice suites...for an even higher price) here but the GCH is a nice hotel with a lot to offer.  It's the proximity to one of the best theme park resorts in the world that makes the GCH worth the money, not the luxuries.  I'll go in order.  Wife checked in before I arrived (she had flown down with my oldest son for a grad night celebration).  Check in was easy and fast for her.  The valet was right there to help us with our luggage and car.  I suggest paying the $25 a night for valet parking since regular is $17 a night anyway.  When my younger son and I found the room

First time staying at the Grand and so far the experience is so so.  The ease to the California Adventure park and Downtown Disney are the saving grace. Valet and Staff is great, clean modern rooms. Stayed at the Anaheim Marriott a few months ago and enjoyed a larger room for half the price.  If you plan to come and go to the parks this could be worth the added cost. Room service was very quick but breakfast was ridiculously tiny.  $20 for one little waffle was unbelievable.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay in Disneyland!
Summary: We love to stay at Grand California when we go to Disneyland.  The hotel is awesome and it's right in the middle of both parks so it's easy to come and go.  The pool area is great for the kids when you need to take a break from the park.  Also Downtown Disney is fun and you can walk to everything.  Staying here beats having to walk blocks and blocks to a nearby hotel.   The room are nice and the service is good.  If you have the option to stay, you should at least give it a shot. Sign up for their promotional emails.  Last time we stayed, we got 25% off our room for both nights.

Summary Heading: Good proximity, good sleep, big price.
Summary: The best thing going for it is the proximity to the Disney parks. If you weren't going to Disneyland or California Adventure, you probably wouldn't require this particular hotel.  I found the service to be great - quick bellhop response, turn down service (no request necessary), check in was easy. Also, I found the soundproofing of the room to be great - I'm a light sleeper so the less noise the better!  However, we arrived at 7:30am after an overseas flight and were told not to return to check in until 3pm. After getting some breakfast my mum and I went shopping, but my dad was exhausted so sat in the foyer. My dad drifted off and was woken by security and told he couldn't do that here so he had to move on. At 60 years of age, and a guest of the hotel, I think they could have

Our first stay at the Grand Californian didn't disappoint. The location to the parks is superior to all other hotels, and is obviously what you are paying for. Therefore, if a short walking distance to Disneyland-- and a private entrance and even shorter distance to the California Adventure park are your number one priority....stop looking, you've found the place.  If you are like my family, however, you like to take many other factors into consideration, especially with the price tag that a place like the Grand Californian comes with. So, it boils down to the question, "is it worth it?"   Location- Yes. Completely worth it. The private entrance to DCA is great, especially for that afternoon break to recharge and maybe chill at the pool. The early entry hour Disney guests get

I've been to Disneyland over 40 times and this is the 2nd time staying at the Grand California Hotel.  The lobby is beautiful and the staff very professional and helpful.  However, I think the next time I go to Disneyland, I will stay at the Disneyland Hotel or the Paradise Pier Hotel.  Rooms at the Grand California are over priced.  I've stayed at the Disneyland and Paradise Pier before and the rooms are brighter and of course, has the Disney theme.  Granted, the walk to Disneyland each morning was easy, but it's only a little further from the other Disney hotels.  Exercise is good for you!   A few negatives- the sink in our room "dripped" for a few hours after use, button on the phone for housekeeping did not work.  (Very surprised since this is a 4 Diamond property). We had

we stayed here on dvc points. The hotel is beautiful!  The first few days we stayed in 2 deluxe studios; they were nice and clean. Worst view first floor fence!  this was disturbing because we came from NJ and arrived 9:00 am told are rooms check in was 4:00pm but we would probably be in before that with a nice view...wrong... rooms were not near each other and we didi not check in until 5:00pm. We then checked out and had to check back in to a two bedroom villa which was huge and very nice however not a park view as lead to believe and even though we were out of studios by 10:00am we did not get into 2 bedroom until 4:30 pm.  spent day at pool but we were very aggravated.  we were given comps for dinner which was nice and very expensive.(steakhouse 55) in disneyland hotel.

This is a beautiful hotel with friendly, patient  staff.  They were incredibly accomadating (no pun intended) with us, especially in regard to helping us book our stay so it would be disability -accessible, even though we had to make reservations at the last minute.  The hotel itself is gorgeous-the lobby is incredible, and the rooms were also tasteful and clean (after watching Hotel Impossible, I now realize exactly how clean our room was).  The only issues we had with the room itself was that the sheets were sort of scratchy and caused an allergic reaction in both my Mother and I, and there weren't enough garbage cans in the room or the bathroom (and the tongs for the ice container were sort of useless, but complaining about that seems kind of stupid). And we also found out

Summary Heading: Great location for a family visit to Disneyland
Summary: We really enjoyed our stay here.  We had my whole family (grandparents, a family of four, and an aunt) so we stayed in a 3-bedroom suite.  Basically consisted of a 1-bedroom suite with two connecting rooms.  Rooms are a good size with a nice sized vanity and shower area.  Hotel staff are amazing.  We had everything that could go wrong, air conditioning that didn't work, not enough towels upon check in, and everything was fixed within minutes.  Even the AC. Much better service than at your standard hotel.  We had upgraded to the concierge floor to get access to the lounge for breakfast and snacks.  We tried to take advantage of that often.  We also had turn-down service every night, which I am not sure if that is part of the package. It was nice to get fresh towels in the evening

This hotel feels like a regular 3-star hotel, only overpriced - it gets its high ratings mostly from its superb location, but I am evaluating the hotel itself and not the location. We stayed in an upgraded room with the balcony right above a beautiful spot of Disneyland Downtown - it was great, but the hotel's interior has not been renovated for 12 years, and the room was not particularly pleasant. Unlike the Grand Californian Hotel, the Disneyland Hotel nearby has been renovated only 3 years ago and has a monorail nearby that can take you to the least busy entrance of the Disneyland Park - we are thinking to use the Disneyland Hotel next time.  Good things about the hotel: located at the heart of Disneyland Downtown, super comfortable beds and bedding, close to main entrances

Summary Heading: Proximity to the park is the key
Summary: The only big plus is the proximity to the park and the ability to get to your room as often as you feel like during the day. As for the rooms, they can definitely use an upgrade. Beds are super comfortable and linen is good too, but the bathroom and vanity can use some refurbishment.  The pool is not great- there are 3, but nothing very exciting and there is always a long line for the Mariposa tree slide. Also finding a chair near the pool is a challenge as they do not have any system where they fold towels or clear unoccupied chairs.  Wifi does not do good in the rooms- no wonder they say its free and included. It only works in the lobby. If you want a turn down service for the night, you have to ask for it. No additional charge, but you have to request it.  The coffee pot is

Everything else at the park or nearby is just not quite as good.  It is the closest both gates and it is the only one with an entrance right from the hotel into a park (California Adventure).  The feel of the place brought me back to those Sunday nights in front of the massive 19 inch TV when Walt would introduce one of those wildlife films narrated by Rex Allen.  Perfectly maintained in Disney style with very friendly staff.  The pool is a little small (but nice) and the restaurants aren't great but we didn't care.  The Disney characters appear in the buffet restaurant.  Lotsa fun for kids.  Hanging in the lobby (you can get a drink in the lounge then sit by the fireplace with the kids) in the evening was a great way to end the evening.  Often has a piano player tickling the

We stayed 2 nights in one of the Deluxe Studio Villas as members of the Disney Vacation Club. It was our first time at the resort. The room was nice enough and everything we expected. Queen sized bed with a queen sleeper sofa. Work desk, Mini-kitchen meaning Microwave, small fridge and sink with granite countertops. Full sized coffee maker and toaster. China coffee mugs and 4 glasses. Paper plated bowls and plastic silverware were also provided. Nice sized patio with 2 (very uncomfortable) chairs and a table. Large bathroom with a separate sink area. Bathrobes provided. Overall, very satisfied with the room. The gym was a decent size and well maintained with treadmills, elliptical, bikes, free weights and weight machines. The hearth Lounge is very nice, spacious with a nice bar

Summary Heading: The place to stay at Disneyland
Summary: Love this hotel - fabulous staff, gorgeous Arts and Crafts architecture with wonderful detailing.  Storytellers is a must for daily breakfast buffet with Chip and Dale and Brother Bear characters.  Convenient to parks.  Rooms are wonderful size with flexible configurations - bunks, multiple beds, etc.  Nice views from balconies.

Summary Heading: Awesome place but checking in takes forever!
Summary: I do love this place, but both times we've been here, the checkin process has been very time consuming.  They are extremely nice, and of course Disney is the happiest place in the world, but you just need to leave a lot of time. This is a huge hotel and there are so many people checking in and out at all times.  I used the self parking - definitely do this because it's right across the street and far far less expensive than valet.  Also we enjoyed the early opening of the parks - again, just realize that there are HUGE numbers of people at this hotel and literally thousands of them all take advantage of early opening, meaning there is a line hundreds of people long even before the early opening hours begin.   Also the Storytellers Cafe was wonderful - excellent food, everyone in

They know at this hotel that there really isnt another option for a "higher end" place to stay, and it shows. The rooms desperately need an upgrade, and so does the food. The poperty itself is nice and well kept, but once you dig deeper - yikes!   In the rooms, the towels were actually damp, and rough. The beds have a duvet, but no duvet cover! Just a sheet, duvet, and another sheet. What?! That's disgusting. If you are facing CA Adventure like we were, your room will be loud - especially during the World of Color performance. You can also hear the cleaning of the park in the early morning hours.    Everyone I know stays with their kids at this hotel (like I said about the options), and everyone feels the same. Why isn't something done to upgrade this hotel?  Pro tip - If you

This hotel has a very nice lobby; large with lots of nice comfortable chairs to relax in. Our room was nice, clean and in good shape overall. Although for $450per night isn't really represented in the room it's for the hotels convenience and location to the parks and restaurants. If you can afford it this is the way to do Disneyland and California Adventure (which you have a direct entrance.) Downtown Disney is right outside the hotel and Disneyland entrance is a short walk. The pool area is nice as is the fitness room. What we liked most is if you don't want to drive you pretty much have everything you need within short walking distance. We also liked the early entrance to the parks you get while staying there. FYI, as with almost everything Disney make sure to make

Location! Location! Location! We stayed at the hotel in June 2013. The check in at the front desk was very pleasant. The cast member was very friendly and helpful. Our Disney experience started right there.  We even received a Mickey balloon to entertain the little one with.  Our youngest was 14-month old at the time.  We were worry about the baby would get tired and cranky in the afternoon, but it was so easy to go back to our room to take a quick break. We asked for a room with bunk bed with pull out bed to accommodate a family of 5.  We loved the idea of the pull out bed underneath the bunk bed.  It was perfect for the baby!  I have to be honest, the room rate is very high but it is money well spent for the location.  We were so happy and we are going back again in Aug 2014.

Summary Heading: Yes It Is Pricey, But Is It Worth It?
Summary: We've been planning this trip for a while. It was my son's 10th birthday and he always wanted to stay here at the Grand Californian. I looked at some of the photos and read a lot of the reviews here in trip advisor just to get an idea of what people thought about this.  I read that the hotel was way too pricey for the room, not worth it. I could have probably paid half and gotten the same type of room just across the street from the park about a mile away. Some reviews said that the room is great, great experience, totally worth it. For me it was all about my son wanting to stay here.  We all are smart enough to know that when we stay at a place like this we are going to pay more for the exact same room a mile away. The extra $200 or so more you are going to pay is for the

I stayed here with my daughters for 3 nights.  We were in awe when we walked into the lobby.  Gorgeous.  Our room was on an upper floor with a view of the Mickey on the roller coaster and the pool.  Room service was delicious, though over priced.  Would love to return.

Summary Heading: You don't have to be a kid to enjoy this place!!
Summary: On a recent family trip to Disneyland, we decided to stay on property for the first time ever.  Although you can stay nearby for considerably less, there is something about walking out of your hotel room and entering straight into one of the parks that is super special and worth the extra cost.  The Grand Californian is a well run, HAPPY HAPPY place to stay at.  The staff is what you notice first.  Everyone is friendly and professional and if they do not actually LOVE LOVE their job, you will never know, because the feeling you walk away from is that everyone loves working here and they are very happy to see you.  The customer service here is a lost art and they could teach the rest of the industry much.  Even the gardeners will stop what they are doing to greet you warmly, you

We've been going to Disneyland for years, and have stayed at both Paradise Pier and the Disneyland Hotel.  Neither compare to the California Grand.  I took my wife for a simple Mother's Day treat, and she loved it.  This hotel isn't cheap, the rooms aren't large, and it seems to always be crowded, but it is so well done that we didn't mind any of the above.  If you are going to Disneyland/California Adventure this is a great place to stay due to it's location and layout.  The rooms were surprisingly quiet - even those overlooking the park.  The staff is there to make sure you are having a great time and to make parting with your hard earned dollars a little easier.  They were great - friendly, smiling and genuinely happy.   We didn't use the pool area, but it looked great and

We stayed in a suite that slept 5 adults. One of us had to sleep on a collapsible bed but it was all very comfortable and we had no problems.  The hotel itself looks great and the service is second to none.

Summary Heading: Reliable first choice hotel for visiting Disney Land parks
Summary: We've stayed here once before and came back because it works well for us. One room was enough for a family of 5 with bunk beds, a queen bed and a pullout bed. Water pressure in the shower was not great but otherwise the room was good. The hotel's gym is fine and the snack bar works well for a quick breakfast. Dinner buffet in the restaurant was fine; they made us fresh pizzas since we were vegetarians. The convenience of being able to walk outside the lobby directly into the California Adventure theme park is huge and having Downtown Disney right by you is also very useful. What is annoying here is that you get put on hold on the telephone to reach guest services so long that you might as well walk downstairs yourself, which is what I did, and whatever they promise to send to

We stayed just one night at this hotel (because at $450+ per night, one night was all we could afford!) and we were pleasantly surprised. It was a beautiful hotel with beautiful amenities. I would definitely like to come back and stay again, maybe in the Winter or early Spring, when the prices are more reasonable. Loved the additional magic hours!

The hotel is simply stunning!  It's like a giant log cabin with a massive lobby and fireplace, inviting you to just sit, read a book, people watch or relax.  I was there on a business conference with a group of about 50.  The room was very comfortable and clean.  The bed was also comfortable.  The pool is nice.  The restaurant was typical Disney amusement park food, but just outside the front entrance is Downtown Disney with many restaurants to choose from.  It is very convenient from the hotel to access Disney California Adventures from their own private entrance and a short walk to the entrance of Disneyland.  The hotel is very clean and well maintained.  The conference room and service we received there was good.  We had a suite for the group with was huge and overlooked

The best thing about this Hotel is the convenience to DCA and the hotel staff was very helpful and attentive but for the price we were told there would be 2 queens and a daybed and there were just two queens. The rooms were less impressive that other hotels for the price again just a regular room. They had a refrigerator but no microwave you have to go to common area to heat up food. we were on the first floor and the view was of a wall and some trees. I would suggest to ask for a room higer than first floor so you have a better view and make sure if you are paying for 2 queens and a daybed that is what you get. I will try the Disneyland hotel next time for the price or there are many hotels in the area that charge less for suites and have shuttles. Although I do have to say we

We are staying in room 4331 it would not be a 3 star back door broken tv don't work and the view we were promised we didn't get looking at dead weeds we will never do this again and will advise our freinds not to either

Adjacent to the Happiest Place on Earth is the Grand Californian Hotel.  The lobby area is beautiful and bustling with people.  I was treated to a massage and pedicure.  The massage was wonderful - Jackie was terrific.  I left the massage room feeling four inches taller and discovered I actually still had a neck.  She massaged out a lot of knots in my neck and shoulder area, and that wasn't an easy task.  While waiting for my pedicure, she noticed that I had been waiting for a while (there was a mix up in the pedicure time - not the spa's fault) and she graciously checked into the situation for me without being asked.  The pedicure was very nice and I was able to visit with friends during the appointment.  (There are two stations directly opposite each other.)  Overall, the
