Summary Heading: Not enough magic to get me to stay here again.
Summary: Being waken up at 5 am by construction was not my idea of how to wake up early for our extra magic hour in the morning. That, along with the mediocre hotel food & service and crowds just got me in a funk.  Yes, they did deduct a reasonable $ from my bill, but I was already tarnished.

I've stayed at nearly every Disney Resort property in California and Florida and have to say I'm rather disappointed with the level of service and lack of resolution with this stay. At $700 night, I would expect a bit more!!!  The property is immaculate, the lobby area is gorgeous and the restaurants are fair. Park entree to DCA is always convenient.    We were on a ground level room, which is convenient for the pools, though feature pool was closed and no option to pool share at the Disneyland pool so rather disappointed. The plants were fertilized as well during our stay and the smell was unbearable. Lastly nearly zero wifi connection in our room, connectivity was very poor and unusable.   We needed a set of sheets, blankets, pillows and extra soap for our pullout for the

this was our final stop on our honeymoon and it was so nice. decor, staff, food, closeness to the parks just perfect! We also took a trip to the spa and it was actually really nice! the breakfast restaurant is comfort food all the way!

I had previously stayed at this hotel with my family and loved the location however since last visit things have changed.  I think crowd levels in general are up a lot in Disneyland and this transferred to the hotel as well.  I don't think they had proper staffing to manage everyone. Cons: -No one to help our family with all of are luggage arriving or leaving, lots of bell man but no one even acknowledged us. -We waited to check in for over 15 min standing in a big line and the crib we requested was not available. -Rooms are not sound proof, we always had lobby noise and kids screaming from rooms around us. -Toilets were extremely loud!  If any of us used it at night or during naps someone would wake up.  All toilets from surrounding rooms could be heard as well.  The toilet

Summary Heading: Good if you want to say you have done it once
Summary: My wife and I stayed here for three nights in May.  Although we enjoyed the hotel, and it was very conveniently located to the parks, we‚Äôd recommend you stay at the Disneyland Hotel instead as the exorbitant cost of the Grand Californian could not be rationalized with our room experience.    The lobby area of the Grand Californian is stunning.  If you have stayed at the Wilderness Lodge at Disneyworld in Orlando it looks very similar.  Unfortunately, the rooms are pretty disappointing.  We stayed in a standard King room on the 4th floor.  There wasn‚Äôt anything overtly wrong with the room per se (outside of the wallpaper falling off one part of the wall), there just wasn‚Äôt anything about it that made the room stand out or made you feel like you were getting your money‚Äôs worth.

Yes this hotel is crazy expensive. BUT the location is great! You're practically staying in Disney California Adventure because you can get straight into Disney California Adventure from the hotel. Guests has a separate "VIP" entrance. if you don't want to go into the park, there's another exit where it takes you to the downtown disney.  if you're lucky enough, you can even get a view overlooking the park and you can even watch World of Colors!  They offer, what they call it, Magic Hours.. where you get to go into the park an hour before it opens to the public. So you get to ride as many rides as you can before other people go into the park.  And when you're tired during the day, you can just go back up to the room and take a quick nap or jump into the jacuzzi!  This is the

I can't stress enough how important convenience is when it comes to traveling with young children and older parents.  Each one of us had different energy levels and needed breaks at different times of the day.  There was only one hotel I considered booking for our stay - Disney's Grand Californian.  Not only is the hotel closest to both Disneyland parks (connected to downtown Disney and California's Adventure park), it was also a gorgeously maintained establishment and beautifully decorated.  The hotel only had 6 floors, and was built outward to give a cabin resort feel.  It was very cozy.  The service here is impeccable ‚Äì truly an experience to have when you‚Äôre on vacation.  In all honesty, I didn‚Äôt get a chance to explore the entire property, but nonetheless I had a great

The lobby of this hotel is beautiful. Being able to go into the park right from the hotel is a plus. While the rooms are nice they need a little lift. They are starting to appear gently used and ready for an update. One thing that was a little bothersome was the amount of noise that came in from the parkside and the lobby. We got a double whammy due to the location of our room but it did die down once the park closed.  I stayed at the Paradise Pier a couple of years ago and it cost much less then the California Grand. The room quality is very similar. Overall I very much enjoyed my stay at the California Grand but will probably go back to staying at the Paradise Pier on future visits.

We stayed at the Grand for four nights in a studio villa. The rooms and beds are very comfortable.  Our view was to die for overlooking the paradise pier area of California Adventure. The convenience of having your own park entrance to DCA can't be beet. Service is top notch. With every great review there is some down side. Food at the resort is very expensive,  but with that said food outside the resort is also expensive.  We found a hidden gem called white water snacks by the pool which had great food and priced right. During  our stay the main pool was closed for refurbishment. This was inconvenient but they did give you passed to use the other resort pools. Will definitely stay here again, I just need to save some more penny's.

Some hotels just get old and some hotels are like vintage cars that you can appreciate the quality of a by-gone era.  The California Grand at Disneyland is definitely starting to show it's age but it has been very well maintained and it's truly a classic.  The quality is evident everywhere as is the quality of service.  Yes, it's expensive but Disney delivers a great experience.  The attention to detail is what makes the difference.  All the staff, down to the cleaning people have been well trained to make sure you are noticed and welcome.  I'd been wondering about the benefits of doing the hotel in the park thing for years and now I'm completely sold.  If you want to do Disneyland right this is the way to do it.  Simply fabulous.

What's not to love about this hotel, first of all it's Disney and the service as usual is impeccable. The best thing of all for us though is that you can go from rollercoaster to sunbed in 3 minutes, or even better get soaked on the grizzly falls ride and dry out on the sun beds in the hotel. It is also a prime location for downtown Disney and all the restaurants and evening entertainment.

We booked Disney's Grand Californian at the last minute while in Anaheim for 2 nights. The entrance to this resort is just beautiful! Pine trees all around and lovely flowers everywhere. There is a 'gatekeeper' that you have to check with before you can even enter the parking area, which was nice for any safety concerns regarding your vehicle. They greet you as you pull in, and you have the option of valet or self park...we chose valet since we were wanting to get right in and go to the park!  Check in was a breeze, and you are treated very well....Disney makes you feel like someone important. ;)  We knew that check in was later in the day, but they allowed us early check-in at no additional fee! Booking last minute, we weren't sure what kind of 'view' we would have. We

Summary Heading: Disney's Grand Californian - Grand Gateway to Parks
Summary: Spending several days at a conference here in Anaheim. The GC is a beautiful property staffed by a "cast" of exemplary Disney folk who want to make your stay enjoyable. The rooms are pleasantly decorated and very comfortable. Haven't spent any time in any of the restaurants but the conference meals have been excellent. I am here during the peak of the blistering heat wave in California so the pools were packed. I do not hesitate to recommend this property - particularly for families who want to focus on the theme parks.

I have reviewed this hotel before, and basically reiterate that the hotel is worth it if you have infants/seniors/mobility issues. However, this trip, the main pool (Redwood Pool) and waterslides (big one, plus the toddler slide) are closed. The pool is scheduled to reopen May 15, but the pool is dry as of that date. The waterslides are supposed to reopen at some undetermined point past that, but no specifics are available. If water activities are important to your trip, be aware that there are only two smaller (and plain and ordinary) pools available, plus a 1ft deep wading pool.

Summary Heading: Disney level of service with very expensive, very average rooms
Summary: Disney's level of service is second to none.  All of the staff are friendly and knowledgeable about the property, Downtown Disney, and the theme parks.  The public areas are very nice, clean and create a great atmosphere.  Unfortunately the rooms are tired and undifferentiated from other hotels that are 50% of the price.  Location is convenient, but not worth $350/night (most inexpensive room) plus the local hotel taxes.  The rooms feel like the lower end properties of Starwood and Hilton, which is to say "clean" and "nice" but not on par with the pricing structure.

The Grand Californian does just what Disney wants it to do; transport you from a congested suburb of Orange County to a luxurious rustic lodge of a 1920's National Park.  The grand lobby alone makes it worth a visit even if you are not staying in the hotel.  Its pricey,  crazy pricey but for Disney magic without the hyperkinetic characters or soundtrack it is worth it once in awhile.

Summary Heading: Adequate lodging in the Magic Kingdom
Summary: It's fun staying on the Disneyland Resort property.  The Grand Californian has a beautiful lobby and check-in area.  The rooms, however, are beginning to show their age...sticky furniture, spots on the carpet, etc.  Don't get me wrong.  It's nice, just not great...especially for the price you pay.  The restaurants are grossly undersized.  If you want to eat there, make a reservation.  And, heaven help you if you want to get a drink at the bar during a televised s;porting event.

We're DVC members and have had nothing but great experiences with Disney properties - the Grand Californian was no exception. The quality of accommodation is great and the Disney theming works really well to immerse you in the Disney experience. Extra magic hours are an added bonus - be prepared to queue to get in even at the early entry time though. The choices for dining cover the full spectrum since you're less than a stone's throw from Downtown Disney.   Definitely worth consideration for your Disney vacation.

First time staying at Disneyland resort....save your money!  For over $300 a night you don't get much but staying close to park.  You still have to pay for parking.  Nothing special about hotel.  Waste of $$$

I went here several years ago with my family and really enjoyed it - although I did find the room a bit costly for its size and the pool a bit meh. To be fair, this really depends on why you are staying - The location is fantastic, and the decor is stunning.  I popped in a couple weeks ago again to see how things were. I popped into the bar with my husband and was met with a rather rude older female server. Once she realized I had out of country ID I felt like a criminal for having sat down to start with. If you are looking for a nice place to grab a drink, no other bar in the area we visited treated us poorly or asked for a passport as ID. I don't know about you, but I don't carry my passport around with me for fear of losing it - I also didn't require it at the bar on my

This was our first visit to Disneyland and our first time actually staying at a Disney Resort despite our many visits to Disney World.  The price tag is big but I must say the resort may have been worth it.  It was great being so close to both parks and not having to get on a bus or monorail to get to them.  We also had a great view of DCA and the area where world of color took place.  We watched the world of color early show and then went to our room and my wife and kids fell asleep to the music from the second showing as we laid in bed with the balcony door open. Everyone at the hotel was nice and helpful.  Rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable.  Getting the extra magic hours also made it possible to get more out of the parks.

We decided to book a day at the Grand Californian for a day for our anniversary. It is certainly convenient being able to walk right into California Adventure. It was super hot so it so nice to be able to take a break and relax in our room for a bit.  We arrived at about 11:30 a.m. and they were able to check us in right away which was great. We had to take a Downtown Disney view instead of a Park view but, that was fine for us. The view wasn't much to brag about.  The hotel is gorgeous but, the room was nothing special for the price.  It was clean and functional but, we stayed in nicer rooms for a lot less. We felt the room was pretty small. It did come with a fridge and free wifi. The in room coffee maker was ok but, leaked a lot which required some mopping up after making a

Overall Disney does it right every time.  We did have a small hiccup with the check in process but they took care of that promptly.  This is one of their best hotels and have stayed here a few times.  Look forward to staying there again soon.

From the moment you walk into this resort the experience is magical. We were warmly greeted in the lobby while the house pianist was softly playing a rendition of "Let it Go" from Frozen. The location of the resort is the best of the Disneyland Resorts because of the easy access into California Adventure. The rooms are wonderfully decorated with a lot of thought put into playing up the rustic Californian wilderness theme while paying close attention to Disney's heritage. The pool area is giant and accommodating for any group size.

My family and I stayed here for Mother's day and it was amazing.  It should be noted that I have always wanted to stay at this hotel so I had big expectations.  It met them all.  We loved being able to just walk through the hotel straight into DCA.  We spent a day by the pool relaxing.  The pool staff was very friendly and they have wait staff out at the pool for drinks and food.  We also took advantage of the evening movie out by the outdoor fireplace.  They have rocking chairs so I rocked our daughter while she watched the movie (6 months old).    The room was very spacious we had 4 adults and a child and we didn't feel like we were on top of each other.  There is a couch, desk & two beds.  The little patio was nice for sitting on in the evening with a glass of wine while our

staying here was not worth the money! the free wireless internet was extremely slow (I could not even facetime anyone,) and my father was sick so upon check out we asked for a late checkout from 11 until 2 and the agreed if we payed an extra 250.00 when we checked out at 2 the housekeeping staff were just getting to our floor. (very disappointing.) the only good thing about the hotel is that you can access California Adventure from the hotel and you dont have to walk any extra distance, but you are at 2 huge parks walking an extra 15 min to an off park hotel is not that big of a deal.

Summary Heading: Best that Disneyland Resort has to offer, but a lot of room for improvement
Summary: This was my second visit to this hotel.  I have also stayed at the Disneyland Hotel.  This is much more convenient than the Disneyland Hotel.  However, there are things you should be aware of.    For one, the idea of having bunk beds is great.  But they are first come first serve at the time of check-in.  They will not set aside a room with bunk beds when you make your reservation.    Next, get ready to wait for everything.  They don't have enough people helping with reservations so check-in takes at least 30 minutes.  Plus, not all employees read the notes in the system.  Make sure that if you've asked for anything or made special arrangements that they employee helping you reads all notes.  Third, the water slide closed down on Saturday afternoon during the hottest part of the

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for...amazing experience
Summary: This was out of this world good.  Really nothing like it.   The hotel is in the California park...and is easy access in and out of park. TAKE ADVANTAGE.  The face that we were able to use the facilities mid day...on our two night, three day trip...was top notch...literally a 1 minute walk and you are on soaring....from our room.   The pool facilities are great..3 options and a hot tub.   Heated and food service next to pool...which was excellent.  Service was great...everyday, they treated me like a rock star.  Disney does what Disney does...even when heckling out, at valet attendant, kept bags by car, and we were able to stay to midnight the last night....which is key to riding thunder mountain one last time.

We stayed here in december for Christmas time at Disneyland.  Worth every penny.  Come and go between park and hotel so easily.  If you have things to carry like jackets or bags or you want a little break or nap you can just take them back to your room.  So simple.  Beautifully decorated at Christmas too.  Fantastic.  Clean, friendly, gorgeous.

Was a Dream Come True to stay on Disney property. We were alone this time, no kids, celebrating our 36 wedding anniversary. The special touches like red roses on the bed were very sweet.  The only big over site and disappointment for us was when we went to soak in a hot tub after a long day at the park only to find it was warmish and then be told it was for the safety of the children. Walt meant the Park to be for the young at heart for ALL ages. Sometimes adults come without the kids and it would be Very Nice to have an Adult Only area for that purpose with a truly Hot... hot tub!  That would have made our trip perfect at the Grand Californian.

We are DVC members and were so excited to go to Disneyland in CA and stay at the Grand Californian....and it did not disappoint.  We had a great stay. First, the room was fantastic. Big, clean and perfect for the family. We love DVC because of the kitchen (so we can buy food and save money) and the washing machine/dryer (so we don't have to pack alot).  Only negative was our room was not ready until close to 5pm.  Another great thing is the proximity to the parks- one time we got soaked on the raft ride, walked back to our room (5 minutes), threw our clothes in the dryer, ate lunch in the room, got dressed again and headed back out.  We loved the early entry for hotel guests only. 7am and the park is yours until it opens up to the public.   Highly recommend this hotel...cannot

I was very impressed with all of the staff at this property. We were always greeted with a smile and some pleasantry form everyone we met in this hotel. The manager went above and beyond to accommodate our special request. Everyone made sure that the guest were well taken care of. If you needed something, all you needed to do was ask. Even though it's a little costly for some of us. I would not hesitate to stay their on my next visit. The star players were, House Keeping who always had a smile on their face and a nice pleasantry, The registration desk Manager who assisted us with our concerns that had nothing to do with the hotel, And Maverick, a registration desk employee who assisted us with our directions. Good job guys! We shall be back

My family just got back from a week-long visit to Disneyland.  Staying at the Grand Californian Villas was the highlight of the trip.  The service and attention to detail really are top-notch.  I loved the layout of the villa. We stayed in a 2-bedroom villa, which sleeps up to 9.  It had 3 full bathrooms, which was SO helpful when staying with family and young children.  The full-sized kitchen was fantastic, though I would recommend that Disney put a corkscrew in the drawer along with the other kitchen implements.  We bought groceries and cooked breakfast and a couple of dinners in that lovely granite-counter top kitchen for every breakfast, and it saved us hundreds of dollars.  I am a Disney convert, but their quality accommodations really keep me coming back.  LOVED THIS

We have a 4 year old and staying here is a MUST if you have young children!  First off the hotel is gorgeous and the staff is awesome!  You get quick service in all aspects of their services and they will bend over backwards to meet your request.  We even asked them for help in locating the Princesses and they made calls for us to locate them (our daughter is obsessed with them)!  Make reservations for the character breakfast at Storytellers Cafe - Chip and Dale are super cute and the kids love it!  The rooms are good size (we had a double queen) with comfy beds, drawers to store your clothing, fresh towels, and even a portable crib in the closet for those with smaller babies.  We over looked the Downtown Disney district from the 5th floor and had a full view of the fireworks

Summary Heading: Best of the Disneyland Hotel Properties
Summary: After this stay, I have stayed at all 3 of the Disney owned hotels. This is by far the best, but you do pay for it. However, I stayed at the Beverly Hills Wilshire the night before, and the service at the Grand Californian out did the Beverly Hills Wilshire hands down. The service was friendly, and our room was actually ready BEFORE we were told it would be ready. They were even able to accomodate us when the room was booked as 1 King instead of 2 queens. We loved being able to access California Adventure from the park, and the Disneyland Park was a short jaunt. We never used the pool, but we overlooked it from our room and it looked fabulous. The room was nice and well kept, house keeping always did a great job on our rooms, and we liked the turn down service. Also, since there

On the plus side the rooms are spacious  The first impression is quite good but it goes down hill fast. The d√©cor is tired and the Internet speed (if you can connect at all) is atrocious. (The answer from the Internet help desk was ‚Äúthere are too many people trying to log-on‚Äù.)  Getting a car from valet can take 15 minutes or more and everything is geared towards making another dollar, which would be fine if it was accompanied by actual service.  It is simply not a hotel for business people or conferences. They have no concept of business needs.  And there is a wait for everything. Our dinner booking at Steakhouse 55 was for 7:45pm but we still had a 15-minute wait (when we were expected to buy a pre-dinner drink). The food was quite good but it was a $100 a head compared to an

This was our second stay in a one bedroom DVC room.  We didn't have a view of Paradise Pier this time, but our room was even larger and more comfortable than the last time.  I think it's excellent value for the points used.  We're east coast folks and go to Disney World often. It's always fun to visit Disneyland and California Adventure for a nice change.  Some things are just better there.  Fantasmic--I'm glad we splurged on the "Dessert Package" and had real seats--not just standing space.  The Wonderful World of Color--I can't describe it, you just need to see it.  An amazing combination of water, lights and music.  Too bad there isn't seating--you are standing a loooonnnngggg time--but it's worth it.  And then we came back after just a short walk to a lovely room.  The

Summary Heading: Way over priced for ho-hum, nothing spectacular rooms.
Summary: While the location is very convenient & the service is great, it is NOT worth $500 for no view, nothing spectacular, small room. There should be something for that price that makes me say "oh wow!" & I'm a Disney fanatic. Was very disappointed by all the hype received. Probably find nicer rooms or same at Howard Johnson across the street...

It's been said before, don't waste the money. They are very crafty with the allocation of view rooms and even after paying for a premium theme park view room, we nearly got stuck with a view of a concrete gully (empty Grizzly River Run).  Yes, the convenience of entering DCA is unique, but next time I would try Paradise Pier where half the rooms face the theme park and save 66% of the cost

This was our first visit to any Disney Hotel.  We've been annual passholders for years, but never stayed in the hotel.  We decided to treat ourselves and stay for a couple of nights.  Yes it is VERY expensive, but you get what you pay for.  The room was gorgeous and we had a balcony.  We got a room with a queen size bed and a bunk bed which my son LOVED.  There are rooms with 2 queen beds, but I requested a room with the bunk bed.  The room had a small fridge which was very convenient to store our water and drinks.    Staying at the resort you get a magic morning pass to enter the park an hour before everyone else which is great if you want to get on those really popular rides.  The guest service was EXCELLENT.  I can't say enough about how friendly all the people are at the

My family and I are huge Disney fans and wanted to stay here at least once.  We splurged and booked an annual passholder "partial theme park view" room for ~$500 per night for two nights in April 2014 which included 2 fastpasses for each family member (not per day).    Pros: - Best location period if visiting Disneyland.  Connected to California Adventure and very easy to walk to Disneyland.  We had a car on site which we valet parked and never used.  We left the parks several times to come back and rest, and then went back.  It is extremely convenient.      - Beautiful lobby.  Disney knows how to get themes and architecture right.  The lobby is simply breathtaking and the huge fireplace was amazing to sit in front of.    - Outstanding service.  Our check-in agent named Jerry

This hotel is by far the best hotel that my family and I have ever stayed at. I love the fact that it is so close to both Disneyland and California Adventure, because all of that walking gets tiring, and by the end of the night the last thing you want to do is walk a far distance to get to the hotel. The staff is incredible and so friendly! They greeted us with happy smiles and warm hearts. Our bellhop was one of the nicest most friendliest people I have ever had the pleasure of meeting! The rooms are a bit small but they're always clean and really nice. Definitely recommend this hotel over the other two. Absolutely amazing!

We have stayed at all the Disneyland Hotels but chose this one for our recent visit for my sons 10th birthday. We took one of his friends with us so I thought the proximity to the parks and the pools would justify the additional cost. The other reason was that my son has always wanted to sleep in a bunk bed. I know they won't guarantee the room type, but I asked at booking and also called again the week of our trip, it was his birthday and Disney make dreams come true right? Wrong, we didn't get a room with bunk beds which left us with a room with two queen beds. This is a disapointment to me that the most expensive of the hotels can't guarantee room type and the rooms are very small. At least at Paradise Pier we would have had 2 queens and a sofa bed, so my son and his friend

Summary Heading: Grand Location, Grand Amenities, Grand Staff!!!
Summary: Our first stay to Disney's Grand Californian Hotel and Spa was‚Ä¶.well‚Ä¶..GRAND! As Annual Passholders, we often take our time getting to the theme parks when we visit Anaheim. The Grand Californian is located so near to the parks, that we felt no rush at all while we were there. Upon entering the lobby, we were greeted by the super-friendly staff and directed toward the check-in desk (the looks of which I would liken to a dimly lit, yet fanciful-looking bank) where we were promptly taken care of and given access to our room.  The room decor is not as whimsical as the Disneyland Hotel, and the Disney theming is more subdued (which I was told was the intentional design idea). It reminded me of an upscale mountain lodge. The rooms were immaculate. I always do a thorough check (under

Summary Heading: Disney Vacation Club Villas at the Grand Californian
Summary: This is a top notch resort with a lot to do for a four or five day trip. Lots of restaurants within walking distance including downtown disney and the two theme parks.   We flew into LAX and took the Disneyland Express shuttle service. The shuttle service which is run by Greyline and has nothing to do with the resort was disappointing despite good reviews. We waited at the proper place at the airport until the shuttle drove right by us without stopping at terminal 4. We called them and they informed us that the shuttle had filled up at terminal 2 and we would have to wait another hour before the next scheduled bus came through. There was no apology and no sympathy, the lady on the other end of the phone was very abrupt. Well we had pre-paid for the shuttle so we waited. An hour

We choose to stay at this hotel over the others simply because of the proximity to the two parks and downtown disney. We choose concierge service because you get a simple breakfast (nothing too fancy) and various snacks and fingers foods that you can take with you to the park. Free bottles of water, soda, and juice boxes as we'll. for the adults they also have complimentary beer and wine. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left everybody was kind and courteous. This hotel is a bit on the pricey side, but the look on my kids face as he saw disneyland for the first time was very well worth it. I would definitely recommend this hotel over the other two and will be coming back to this one in the near future.

We checked in during the evening after our flight to a wonderful deluxe studio.  Our room was facing California Adventure park. At floor 3 we were listed as regular view but could see much of the park.  Very helpful and friendly staff!   The pool could use a better slide but I am comparing it to their Florida resorts.

We are a family of three and recently stayed at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel over the Easter Weekend.  The advantage of staying at this hotel is obvious, Location.  That be said here is some feedback.  1.  Service:  The service was excellent.  Valet parking, bell staff, check-in, etc. were all excellent.  My 13 year old even commented on the quality of service and how the staff made him feel.    I would like to specifically thank Ryan who was working the front desk/lobby area.  Ryan spoke to us daily and greeted us with a genuine hello.  We shared an interest in hockey, specifically the San Jose Sharks, and he made a point to discuss the previous days game, etc with us.  He was outstanding and really went out of his way.  2.  The rooms:  We payed extra for the Downtown

So, first I'll say a few things - I'm a premium annual passholder, I know a cast member and I'm extremely polite and thankful.  These things made for a GREAT weekend getaway the Grand Californian, and I felt every penny I spent was worth it.  Cast member hotel rates are wonderful, so we decided to book.  Now anyone who's had the Disney experience know that the staff are (for the most part) very polite and helpful.  The folks at the Grand Californian are a step above.  You're greeted by name upon entrance to the property, which I loved.  Check-in was smooth and efficient - no matter what hotel I'm staying in, or what kind of room I have, I ALWAYS politely ask if any upgrades are available.  I've never not received one (either higher floor, better view, better room, suites on

Summary Heading: too expensive & sad to say very poor customer service this year :(
Summary: This was my second visit to Disney's Grand Californian Hotel and I am sorry to say that my first visit a few years ago which was outstanding as compared to my recent visit a few weeks ago which was just OK made me sad as this hotel is VERY EXPENSIVE.  When i made my reservation on a Friday, (approximately 2 weeks before our arrival) I didn't receive an email confirmation so when I called them on Saturday morning, they said they couldn't find anything. I called back again on Monday to speak with a supervisor (who was really nice & helpful) she said she could not find my reservation either, and unfortunately, the price was going to be about $800 more..needless to say I was upset so she gave us a 10% discount.  I appreciated that but also asked her to let someone know that it's not

My wife surprised me for my birthday and splurged on a room for a few nights.  Everything was great as it should be.  The main thing besides the beauty of the place was the ease of access to both parks.  Probably won't do it again soon, but one can dream.  It is definitely better than the old Disneyland hotel!  We'll be at the Candy Cane Inn with the grandkids this summer...a favorite for over 25 years.

Summary Heading: It is all about the location
Summary: We stayed three nights (M-W) and the hotel was fine.  We had a room with a queen and two bunk beds.  I usually stay in 4-5 star hotels when traveling for business such as the Marriott Hotels, and the rooms here were on par.  They were functionally fine, the bed was comfortable, the TV service was good, and WiFi was included.  I thought room services were excellent as the room got cleaned each day and there was bed turn down service each night which included chocolates.  I had an issue with a TV and the hotel tech was at the room in five minutes.  Overall, I found the staff to be very courteous and responsive.  For $500+ per night, I think charging for parking is a bit tacky, however, the $22/night valet or $15/self-park rates were reasonable.  We didn't eat at the hotel

You are basically paying for the convenience of being able to walk to the Disney parks.  I have stayed in far better 4 star hotels and this is not one of them.  Since I was traveling with just my son, it was perfect for us to be able to walk to the parks.  Our stay also allowed us to enter 1 hour earlier than normal which I liked a lot.  The first time we went to Disneyland we stayed at Hyatt off site and I liked that much better than Grand Californian and it was probably half the price!

Stayed at the Disneyland hotel last year.  Friends recommended we try California Grand primarily for the proximity to the park.  Both spouse and kids agree that it was NOT worth the price.  Problems started when we got to the hotel.  Had booked with a LIVE representative and specifically reserved a room with a bunk bed.  When we got there we were told that we were getting a standard NON-bunk bed room.  Based on travel books, I politely told the front desk man that we had reserved a bunk bed and kindly asked to check.  He told me none were available.  Luckily we got a GREAT bell man who (pre-tip) was able to use his connections and get us one of those "non-existent" bunk beds.  The "close" proximity really applies to CA Grand Park.  Walk to Disneyland park still long and we

Summary Heading: Not as good as the hype
Summary: We stayed in the Grand Californian with 3 kids.  Room was decent size with bunk beds and a bed that was on the floor.  The bunk beds are not meant for any kid over 12,  The bathroom was small and the carpet was old.  Not too bad, but not up to the price.  You could walk a long way to get to your room from the elevator. We looked out over downtown Disney, not too loud with a partial view of the park from our little balcony which wasn't bad.  We just went hard while we were there, so we didn't use the spa which would have been nice for a day off.  The pools were fine and the life guards were very attentive for kids.  My recollection is the pool was better at Disneyland Hotel.  There was a little snack restaurant not many people know about toward the California land side near the

for a hotel this PRICEY, i expected more.  the room is small.  the carpet is old.  the bathroom is small.  feels like a motel.  the furniture is old.  we're on the 2nd floor.  room has a queen and bunk bed which is nice as we have 2 kids.  but like i say, the room is small and furniture/carpet is old.  i enquired at the front desk if this was their typical room for the price.  lady at the front desk went to check with her manager if there's something they could do about it.  she came back with, she could upgrade us "for a small charge".  the upgrade means a room with a view of the park but the room is same size!  lol.  i humbly declined.   moreover, the pool area is... well... typical.    if you're going to stay at downtown disney (which i highly recommend for convenience to the

Summary Heading: Comfort and Convenience Well Worth the Price
Summary: We spent 4 nights the first week of April with extended family and grandkids.  Staff was excellent, room was comfortable, and the location was perfect.  Not too far for the 3 YO to walk to either park.  About the only thing that could have been improved is the in-room coffee service.  Was this goofy (Disney pun) 1 cup per pod thing that refused to brew a full cup of coffee.

We just had an amazing stay at this awesome hotel.  Upon checking we were offered a free upgrade or an upgrade to concierge for a small fee (which we accepted).  The location is right inside theme park but without the noise or bustle.  The room was very clean and the staff were exceptionally friendly.  Highly recommend!

Summary Heading: Great location, a bit high priced
Summary: Stayed here for  7 nights while visiting Southern Cali for a wedding. Although the price was higher than I normally would spend for a room of this size, 2 queen beds and a small bathroom, we still enjoyed the hotel with its high Disney standards of cleanliness, friendliness and quality. Plus the location was terrific, walking right into Downtown Disney to get to the parks or being able to walk right into California Adventure Park. I didn't think the lines were to bad entering thru the hotel, actually seemed shorter than the other entrance. Entering into the hotel property we knew it was Disney as we were greeted by valets and a grand entrance into the hotel. The service here and the location are probably why the higher price. Overall no disappointments in staying here. Our last

For the price that you pay, this hotel itself is not that fancy. It is well appointed, the lobby is impressive, and the staff are very helpful. The rooms are standard, nicely furnished, and we had a view over the pool. There is double glazing that is very effective and very useful when having a mid afternoon nap between theme park action.  Being the closest hotel to the parks, with its own entry into California Adventure, and the benefit of magic mornings, I would not stay anywhere else. Our 2 young kids LOVED the Disney Parks but when starting at 7 or 8am and going through to 10 or 11pm, being close to bed is invaluable.  The Hearthstone Lounge is charming for an evening drink and meeting other guests. We were a little frustrated by the lack of breakfast options, only being

My mother, my two sister and I stayed at the Grand Californian for 3 nights. We were visiting from the Cayman Islands and Ireland to celebrate my 18th Birthday.  When we all arrived (exhausted) we were automatically greeted with a smile and were being checked in within 2 minutes. I have never had such prompt service.  The Hotel makes a point to make their guests feel like family, I was presented with a birthday badge and a signed photograph from Minnie Mouse. ( The hotel only has 6 floors but they are massive, we were initially placed on floor 5 but requested to be moved to 2 in order to be closer to the elevator. If you have issues walking I would recommend doing the same. HOWEVER I must say if you have the right room, you will be able to see the fireworks clearly from floor 5

Summary Heading: Disney Grand California 1BR Villa - About as good as it gets
Summary: We stayed two nights in the Disney Grand Californian One Bedroom Villa‚Äôs in Mid-April during the week of our 13 year old son and 11 year old daughters‚Äô Spring Break. The combination of booking mid-week and a very late Spring Break in our school district combined for very moderate traffic and so an easy time in both parks.  We had stayed at The Grand Californian Hotel a couple of times, but were booked in The Villa‚Äôs for the first time. We tend to stay slightly high-end whenever we vacation and this was easily one of the best experiences we have had anywhere.  We were given room 6502, a sixth ( of six ) floor location with an absolutely phenomenal view of the California Adventure theme park adjacent to the Ferris Wheel. The Villa‚Äôs are tacked on to the end of the existing Grand

Summary Heading: Ummmm where is the luxury to match the price?
Summary: Ok so as with every other reviewer, I am going to say it is all about the location.  While it is nice to sort of have your own gate to the park, it is not the end all.  Picture an entire hotel trying to get through only one lane at 7a.  Its ok but not great.  Unfortunatly the rush for early hour in California Adventure is Radio Springs (Cars) which the Grand California entrance is far from.  We were in at seven with the rest of the herd and the wait was already over an hour.  So that was not super.   We paid just under $600 for a "standard view" room which was located on the second floor and looked directly on to the roof of the courtyard entrance.  When I say directly, I mean the roof was even with our "balcony" which was 2 feet wide.  Not awesome.    My expectations were low

My wife and I spent four nights at the Grand Californian.   As other reviews have mentioned, staying here is not cheap and this is why: Location, location, location.   That's right, above all else, you're paying for the sheer convenience of being able to easily go to and from the resort property to both Disneyland and California Adventure. At first, we didn't see the benefit. By the end of day two, we were so happy we didn't have to bother with trams and other transit options to take us to a 'somewhat' cheaper hotel further away.   Secondly, "Magic Hour." This is when everyday you're allowed to access either Disneyland or California an hour before the general public. That in itself was amazing.   We were upgraded to a Disney Town view room on the 5th floor which had a fantastic

Perhaps my expectations were a bit too high, but for nearly $500/night for a standard room, I expected something that would approach Fairmont or Four Seasons in terms of quality and finishes, but I guess the money is mostly about location, which is hard to beat.  The rooms are a bit outdated in their finishes.  The electronics are out of date and they don't have modern plugs and charging areas that I've come to expect from high end hotels.  Maybe an iphone/pod dock to play music?   The bed was just ok.  Pillows were not good.  All overstuffed foam/polyester. I should have requested feather but didn't think about it until too late each night.  Bathroom finishes are old and outdated.

While expensive, this hotel is a visual treat and in a great location. Next time, I would not opt for the concierge level room.  The price difference between concierge level and standard theme park view is fairly large and I didn't find that the concierge level service (food, drink, etc.) warranted the price difference for a party of two.  However, were I traveling with a larger party, the convenience of the morning breakfast and drinks/snacks all day might be worth it.    The hotel has a nice gym, three pools, good food options, beautiful design, great art work.  The standard rooms are comfortable, but not large.

Summary Heading: Disney Destination Hotel, Hardly a Resort
Summary: Convenient for a Wedding at the Disney Rose Garden, reception at the Grand Californian. Average appointed rooms (for the price I would've imagined much, much more), clean, comfortable beds, but about double the price you would pay at 5star hotel. I suppose the idea of craftsman style is too utilitarian for my taste, and I had anticipated much more, again for the price.  Pool area was ok, clean with plenty of chairs available, really only 1 selection for meals (other than Downtown Disney), good places to lounge in the lobby. View from balcony was of roller coaster at Ca Adventure, which was ok, but for the price I guess not much to see in Anaheim. Check-in was fast, but no help offered for luggage etc. Despite room being down long hall on the 3rd floor, still heard neighbors

I stayed here with my family in March, in two different rooms within a week.  Both were one-bedroom units (we are DVC) and overlooked the California Adventure Park.  The first room was on the 5th floor and had a much better view  - definitely request a higher floor!  Our second room (we checked out for one night in between) was on the 2nd floor and looked at a fence, so not nearly as pleasant as being higher up,  Both were fairly loud when the balcony door was open - lots of screaming from Goofy's Sky School - but very quiet when the door was shut.  We have stayed in almost every WDW resort so we had a hard time not comparing, but overall this resort was good.   I can't imagine shelling out the $ if you are not DVC, but that's just me... Here are a few things that are really

We just returned from a 5 night stay at the GCH, and I read hundreds of TA reviews before making my choice. As we were traveling during our Spring Break (albeit before many CA schools take break) with 3 boys- ages 9, 7 and 2- we were really looking for convenience. We elected to bring Grandma along and booked 2 rooms with a request for adjoining if possible. I debated about booking a suite to guarantee that we would all share the same space, but the 2 rooms were actually cheaper and provided us with a 2nd bathroom, as well. Much to my delight, they were able to honor the adjoining request and booked us in 4020/4021 on the 4th floor, edge of the lobby area with garden/monorail view. I was a little concerned re: noise due to proximity of room to lobby, but the only time we really

The hotel lobby was AMAZING and staff at the front counter were nice.  Having direct entrance to California Adventure was very convenient and also enjoyed the two restaurants within the hotel grounds.  However, our room was quite disappointing.  For the price we paid for the room, it was an average looking room at best.  Shower pressure was terrible, shower head was broken, the sinks backed up.  I would expect that room quality at a hotel 1/4 of the price we paid.  In our experience, it was absolutely not worth it.  We will definitely not be staying at this hotel again and will be trying the other Disney hotels.

We have always been fans of Marriott but we decided to break down and go with a Disney property for this stay. Stayed for 4-nights over Spring Break. Great time. Honestly, our room what not amazing, it was a standard hotel room. The property however, is hard to beat in terms of convenience and a true Disney experience. Tons of things for kids; movies in the lobby, movies on a big screen at night, great pool, free life jackets, activities, etc. And being able to walk to/from the parks without having to park and drive is awesome. That is what you pay for at Disney, convenience and the experience.  Negatives - daughter didn't love the Critter Breakfast Character Experience at the hotel and food overall on property is extremely expensive. It is cheaper to eat in the park, believe it

On arrival the registration was a pleasure for us and the 12 year old grand daughter as all the information and services were made readily available. The room was and comfortable and welcoming with nightly  chocolates and turned down beds. The restaurants were were handy for all meals if needed with activities available for family with kids at different locations and times. It had very easy access to both Disney Parks within walking distance without using a shuttle service. Tours for other attractions were readily available with pick up at the entrance. It had 2 swimming pools to relax when weary from Disneyland  activities. Unfortunately we did not get a room with a view facing Disneyland Parks to see the Fireworks at night on the weekend we were there. Overall a great stay

This hotel is a beautiful and authentic northern Californian craftsman. It's location is key-- the accessibility to both park entrances helps families make early start times and mid-day breaks (aka., nap time) easy to do. We loved staying here and would stay again. Some down-sides: $22/day parking fee and it's near to Disney's expensive restaurants. Plan on $100+/night dinner for a family of four. We also noticed the water was pretty bad-- not sure if that's controllable by the resort or if it's a state problem due to their recent drought. Buy bottled water.

The Grand Californian Hotel and Spa is the only way to do  disneyland.  They make it so easy to do and see everything Disney.  We could plan our day and get in so much in Disneyland and California Adventure.  Then take a little break and sit around the pool and rest, eat, have a refreshment etc...  The rooms are beautiful and we had a great balcony over looking what looked like a forest.  It made our week there seem like a dream and a truly magical week.  The only way to do Disneyland.  I can't wait to return.  Wow!  We did not have to worry about a thing.  They took care of everything.  A must stay.

It's all about the location here, and with small kids that's high on the list for us. It meant that we could go into the Parks first thing in the morning, come back to the hotel after lunch for a nap and then go back for the afternoon and also the night shows.  The hotel itself is great (it's beautiful!), especially the lobby but it's large so it was soooo busy when we stayed there.   The rooms are functional (have to say that I loved the bunk for our kids) and the pools were good.   But what I love about Disney is the customer service and the magic behind everything and while the customer service was good, I have come to expect magical and it lacked that.  Overall, it was a great stay as there was nothing wrong with it at all, but it lacked the magic I come to expect from

Stayed as a Disney Vacation Club member end of April. Upon driving into resort was greeted and then kind of forgotten about. We were not sure where to park and what the procedure was for valet. A guest services member handed us a ticket and said it was valet and we grabbed our bags and headed in. No line to check in and Lauren, a very friendly cast member, checked us in. She gave us a room with a view of California Adventure Park which was nice, but neglected to tell us as vacation club members the self parking was free. We ended up moving the car out of valet so we did not pay the $22/day for the service. She was able to charge our phones since we neglected to bring our chargers from home. That is a nice service to have! The lobby and gardens of the hotel are lovely. Every

Summary Heading: A Great Disney Experience, but not Perfect
Summary: Just returned from a family trip to Disneyland and the Grand Californian. This is the place to stay for ultimate convenience getting in and around the two parks. A must in experiencing as much as possible with a 3-day park hopper which honestly I think is all the human body can take before your feet become nothing but painful bloody stumps. Although you will obviously pay a hefty premium for staying here. The hotel lobby and d√©cor is absolutely amazing and breathtaking. The rooms are showing their age slightly and are comparable to a higher end Marriott hotel. The difference being the level of service from the hotel staff is obviously above and beyond with nightly turn down service with chocolates and personalized cards adorned with Disney characters. Pretty much everything has

Summary Heading: Happiest Place On Earth will be just an elevator ride away.
Summary: So you kids out there if mommy and daddy asked you where you want to stay when you go to Disneyland, you say Disney's Grand Californian Hotel!!! Don't worry mom & dad can afford it, you just have to get a job and get yourself through college. At least that's what I tell my kids while we stay in this nice room overlooking Downtown Disney and comes with a bunk-bed with a pull out mattress that's perfect for my kids.  All kidding aside, I love Grand Californian Hotel, it is so much better than Disneyland Hotel with just the same benefits. From the gorgeous lobby with Chip & Dale greeting you as you come in to the awesome hospitality of the oh so friendly staff.  Backlash, yes I know it's expensive and you can probably get a room for a fourth of the price ten minutes from here, but

My husband and I decided to celebrate activating our annual passes and his birthday by staying at the Grand Californian. We had a wonderful time! Since we were annual passholders, we found a promo where they gave us each four fast passes to use. That was the best thing we got! Unfortunately it really spoiled us and we will probably never get to do that again but we are sure glad we got to experience that VIP feeling of just walking onto some great rides!  We loved the piano players! That was really a highlight for us to be able to enjoy that entertainment.  Dinner at Napa Rose was FABULOUS! We had been there before but it was so nice to have such a great dinner and just walk back to our room instead of having to drive home!  We got to enjoy the pool area (we got into the jacuzzi

I'll start with the bad and end on the good note.  What you need to decide is f the convenience is worth $500 per night.  While the other two Disney hotels  are across the street and give you the same Disney experience. For at least $150 less.  The bedding in our room seemed old and wearing out and there was no safe in the room.  This place is huge so f you're not in the right building you could be walking around forever.  The services we experienced upon arrival was outstanding.  From the valet to the bell to the registration check in process was extremely personable.  loved that!  The pool area was great and we loved the slides.  The convenience to the park was great and the Magic hour is great.  They had kid activities scheduled throughout the day and story time at night.

This was our third visit to the Grand Californian and we were delighted to return.  We love the location and easy access to the California Adventure Park and the monorail service from Downtown Disney to Disneyland.  It was a busy time with lots of families visiting during spring break but check-in was quick, all our tickets, etc. were ready and we were able to leave our luggage with the bell man so we could get right to the park.  Our double room overlooked the hotel entrance and we were a little concerned about traffic noise.  No noise problems though and we slept well, got up early for a great breakfast at the Storyteller Cafe and early entrance to the park.  While this is the most expensive hotel at Disneyland, we still think it is worth the extra $$ to have such close and

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay with a baby or toddler!
Summary: We just got back from a trip to Disneyland to celebrate my daughters first birthday. We chose to splurge on rooms at the Grand Californian for the convenience of staying in the park. The hotel lobby is beautiful and the rooms spacious and comfortable. We chose adjoining rooms with my in-laws, which made it extra easy to have help with the baby. We tried all the restaurants and they were great! Even Napa Rose offered a kids menu so we could splurge on a nice meal. The best part about staying in the hotel is the magic hour, which let's you into the park early. We also loved the pool and signed up for a character breakfast across the street at the PCH grill. The hotel is also right next to downtown Disney.

Summary Heading: Can't beat the location of this classy hotel
Summary: Loved the bunk bed, easy access to parks and restaurants, responsive yet pricey valet and luggage service. Wished front desk staff had more services, needed a Walt Disney travel company on property. During our 2010 visit, the hotel provided free, basic helium balloons to guests. Disappointing to see that perq discontinued. Bathroom small.

We visited the Disneyland Resort as part of a spring break trip to California and decided to purchase a package at the Grand Californian.  The hotel was beautiful, and the location was perfect as we were able to walk to both parks.  Since we spent more time at California Adventure, we used the direct entrance to the park every day.  We enjoyed relaxing in the lobby and by the pool.  Especially if you are coming in from the east coast, stay here and enjoy not dealing with the Orange County traffic.  The only significant drawbacks from the hotel was that the hotel wireless Internet service was not consistent and that Disneyland does not use the MagicBands that have been a hit at Walt Disney World.

After months and months of researching on where to stay for our inaugural Disneyland vacation, we took the plunge and stayed at the Grand Californian.  The question most people ask is "is it worth the additional cost to stay here?"  I can definitely say with confidence, a definite.... maybe.  Here's the thing, for us it was worth the extra cost.  I had my three children aged 9, 7 and 4 and the convenience of just popping into our hotel for lunch or a rest was extremely beneficial.  We swam in the pool basically everyday near lunch time and it was a good break from the busyness of Disneyland.  Yes, hotels outside of Disneyland are very close, but not Grand Californian close.  For our first visit and with the age of our kids, it was worth the extra cost.  But really, the only

I love all things Disney, and when it comes to vacation planning, I often chose a Disney related one. I grew up in Southern California and did my fair share of Disneyland visits. These were day trips for the most part as we lived less than 1 hour away. Now that I live out of state, I have to think about where to stay if I am visiting Disneyland. I've always opted for nearby "Good Neighbor" hotels as the Disney properties are, for the most part, out of my reach for price. This time I was lucky enough to go with a large group and swing a group discount! I have always wanted to stay at Disney's Grand Californian but thought that I never would. I've stayed at many of Walt Disney World properties and loved them all. This time I got my wish in Anaheim. The Grand Californian is

Summary Heading: I would rate this as excellent if it wasn't so expensive
Summary: This hotel was beautiful and the location was perfect for visiting Disneyland. Such a short walk to get to the theme park. We stayed only one night because of the price. We were unexpectedly upgraded to the 6th floor which has its own concierges and rooms to watch the fireworks. The room was large and clean with a balcony big enough for a table and 2 chairs. We overlooked the pool and Adventureland. The bathroom was spacious with 2 sinks, making getting ready in the morning easier. I would love to have stayed here longer but it was cost prohibitive for us.

Summary Heading: Great location, nice fireplace in the lobby, but so so rooms
Summary: If you want complete convenience to the amusement parks this is the place to stay.  With this hotel and the atmosphere in a good portion of the new California park Disney has taken the feel of the northern part of the state and transplanted it down here to a SoCal version.  The in the woods, lodge feel is what they were seeking and achieved somewhat.  The let down is in the rooms.  Considering the least expensive accommodations are over $400 a night they could have made the rooms a little more spacious and had a little more of the Disney "magic" in the decor.  The hotel's check in and staff are ernest in their efforts to make you feel welcome and be helpful.  We had breakfast in the hotel's Storybook Cafe and it was wonderful food with Chip and Dale coming to the table to pose

Summary Heading: Overall great resort, convenient location and wonderful spa
Summary: If you are looking into one of the three onsite hotels at Disneyland, I take it you have kids and don't expect a relaxing or romantic trip by any means and it is convenience with a tad bit of bonus quiet time that you are seeking.  If that's the case, Grand Californian Hotel is the best out of the three that will offer you that chance of bonus adult/quiet time.  We have stayed at all three (Paradise Pier, Disneyland Hotel and Grand Californian) and Grand Californian has by far the  most kids programs on hotel property and most amenities to keep the children busy and content!  On top of that, there is a spacious, tranquil full service spa that will allow you to get away for an hour or two while your children are participating in the kids programs or if they are lining up at Cars

Summary Heading: Not as good as I remembered, but service and location win out
Summary: We stayed at the Grand Californian one time before in 2002 when our first born was only 8 months old. At that time, I remember being absolutely in love, as the location could not be beat. It was so convenient when having an infant, when I frequently needed to go back to let her rest, nurse, etc. I also remember it being worth the money we splurged to stay there back then. 12 years later, we finally returned with our now 11 year old and 4 year old daughters. We had a free night from a contest we won and we paid for another night to extend the trip. We got in to the hotel early in the morning at about 9:30 and did not expect our room to be ready, but it was, so that was fantastic. The guest service was phenomenal for our entire stay. I cannot complain about anything there. From

Summary Heading: Best hotel for stay and going to Disneyland
Summary: The hotel is beautiful the grounds are so well kept, just like the park.  We are Vacation Club members so we stayed in the Villas.  The amount of room and the accommodations in the villas is very nice.  The only issue is the fold out sofa.  It is a little hard and my daughter chose just to take the cushions  off the sofa and sleep on the unfolded bed, it was more comfortable that way.  We were able to make our own breakfast and lunch which is a much cheaper for anyone who has bought food in the park.  Did not use the pool this time but have in the past and it is very enjoyable area.  The location is second to none and the fact you don't have to "see the real world" while you're staying there is great.

Summary Heading: Only worth it for the location
Summary: We stayed here in early March with our 3 kids and my sister from LA met us with her family and 3 kids. It is  worth staying on property because of the proximity to disney/downtown disney and ability to do magic mornings and return to rest in the middle of the day. I was hoping that we would enjoy the pool area but we were disappointed. None of the kids swam more than an hour and they only used the slide once. My 10 year old had to push himself down and the other kids didn't like it either (ages 4-14). There is a food outlet near the pool area where you pick up snacks and a few grill items but both categories are limited and disappointing. There is also little to no early morning, quick breakfast/coffee options if you do magic morning. We had to wait till other outlets opened in

We loved how close the hotel was to the parks. It's a beautiful hotel and has a great staff. It's a very busy hotel and we thought the pools were a bit disappointing...we expected them to be more "kid-friendly".

Summary Heading: You can't beat the location and hospitality!
Summary: When we first walked into the place, we were AMAZED!!  The lobby is phenomenal!!  the amenities and the staff are absolutely exceptional.  We bought an "upgraded" room, but were a bit disappointed.  It was small, dingy, and looked like your typical $100 a night hotel room.  The breakfast with characters cost just as much for us patrons as it did for everyone else too, which was a downer.  Who wants to pay $100 bucks for a kids breakfast after spending $300 plus for a so so room?  However, the location CANNOT be beat!!  You are right there for both parks and the "Magic hour" really is Magical in helping get on a bunch of rides with minimal wait and get a short wait to meet those princesses.  If we go back, we will defly stay there again.

Location is the best part of this hotel.  Stayed here March 2nd through the 6th and was overall pleased with our stay.    Check-in was busy, our taxi driver commented how busy this hotel was for a Sunday at 3pm.  Boy, he was right long line to check in but went fairly quick.  My husband was not feeling well and our room wasn‚Äôt ready, I had requested a room with a bunk and I upgraded to a courtyard view so I assume they were trying to accommodate me.  The lady checking us in said it would be about 15-20 minutes so we opted to wait for the text since I needed to get organized before heading to the parks.  After about a half hour I told them my husband wasn‚Äôt feeling well and we needed to get into our room right away.  They promptly gave us a room but no bunks and no view.  Oh

We loved our 4-night stay at the Grand Californian. The common areas are beautiful and we unexpectedly had a nice view of California Adventure from our standard view room (room 5260). We ordered room service breakfasts using the door hang tag system (hang the tag with your order on your door before midnight the night before) to get an early start and take advantage of the extra magic hours, and the service was prompt and food excellent (we just got oatmeal and croissants which came with fresh fruit, juice, coffee, etc). The hotel location is so convenient - it was a very quick walk to the monorail and since this is restricted to hotel guests during the extra magic hour we were in Disneyland very quickly. Entry to California Adventure through the hotel entrance was a brief wait

As with previous reviews, our experience at the Disney Grand was a BIG disappointment.  Not only was the room somewhat run down with several maintenance issues, we paid an upgrade (in addition to the already ridiculous pricing) so that our small children would be able to see the fireworks from the room being that they are so late in the evening.  Conveniently Disney cancelled the firework show all 3 nights that we were there and had absolutely no interest in even discussing any sort of compensation for a future visit.  Extremely disappointing customer service!

We just spent 4 nights at the Grand Californian and it does not disappoint!  This is our 3rd visit in 3 years.  The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful, we called the front desk several times to ask questions about dining reservations and they were always so pleasant.  A few of our family members got the stomach flu during our stay (talk about a nightmare) and the housekeeping staff came to our room at midnight to help us w/fresh linens etc. and a smile on their face.  They also were so caring and reminded us there was a hotel doctor we could call if we needed help w/the kids.  The proximity to both parks is KEY to staying here as well.  At the end of the night, you do not want to walk an extra 5+ minutes (seems like a mile) across Downtown Disney to the Disneyland

Summary Heading: We are Disney people but this was a dissappointment
Summary: We are a Disney family and have enjoyed WDW in Florida and Paris and Adventures by Disney trip etc. so we thought we knew what we would be getting when we booked a 2 bedroom suite in the Grand Californian for a night. The public spaces of the hotel are lovely and impressive. OUr very expensive suite was decorated with all the finesse of a college dorm room. The furniture was drab and didn't even fit in the layout of the room. It was a big disappointment. It is convenient to get to the parks is about the only nice thing I can say about it. The park closed at 10pm the night we were there and by the time we walked back to the hotel, every option to get some food was shut tight. Even Downtown Disney on the way out of the park back to the hotel was only open for retail not food. Our

We have stayed at many Disneyland and Disneyworld hotels throughout the years, including a previous stay here, and this stay was rather disappointing. First off, the location can't be beat. So close to the parks and Downtown Disney but after that I felt quite let down. Our room was in the far corner of the hotel on the first floor which even the person checking us in said was odd. I asked why and he said that it was just sort of far from the desk but very quiet which for us was more than a great trade. However, it was anything but quiet. Every morning around 6 AM when people started waking up the pipes would shake and make enough noise to wake you up. Although we were usually already awake due to the incessant clanging noises, no idea what they were except maybe housekeeping

I've been going to this hotel for years. Last September I became ill in the park. I  was taken to the first aid station where I stayed for an hour. I tried walking back to the hotel, but only got a few feet before having to return. They called the hotel and explained my condition. The hotel sent a call into the park to pick me up. They had a wheelchair waiting for me and took me to my room. Now if that isn't service way above and beyond I don't know what is - I love this hotel - the location can't be beat. The rooms are small, but who spends a lot of time in the room. I know it's expensive, but if you can afford it it's worth a try.

Summary Heading: Great location to enter California Adventure Park
Summary: We chose to take the shuttle from the airport to the hotel because the size of our group - 9 of us. It took an extra 1/2 hour of our time waiting for the bus to leave. You may want to consider a shuttle van, faster and less money.  Check in lengthy but efficient. We had three adjoining rooms with a large patio, and a single room close, all over looking the pool. Very quite area at the end of hall. The beds were nice, bathroom area in the single room smaller. Rooms were very clean. Overall staff very friendly. Coffee and refrigerator in rooms, 24/7 room service. Never had to wait for the elevator. We were able to enter the parks one hour early since staying at the hotel. Enjoyed our hotel.

Amenities are plentiful. Pools are wonderful, with really comfortable lounge chairs. Jacuzzi was the perfect temperature. Hotel appointments and theming were excellent. We stayed in a villa studio. Room furnishings and amenities were excellent. Can not beat the convenient location of the resort. Just a few minutes walk to two theme parks.  Had dinner at Storytellers Cafe inside the hotel. Service was excellent. Portions were large. Had 2small problems-frozen daiquiri was very bland, yet very expensive (even for Disney prices), and the place was freezing cold!!! Our food cooled off very quickly because it was so cold in the restaurant. Would stay there again without hesitation.

We recently spent 5 days at Disneyland with our family and stayed at the Grand Californian. We enjoyed the friendly staff and excellent accommodations. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel if you are going to Disneyland. It has a convenient entrance to the parks with an early entry pass with if worth it. Extra nice hotel and super clean.

Lobby, location and restaurants are all this has going.  You can stay at other nicer hotels and still get the benefits for a lot less money and a lot nicer room. Our room was small, old and worst of all - we checked in late after a long day driving and flying to find out there was no water! They were doing some maintainance and had the water shut off from 11 pm - 5:30 am.  They offered no apologies and left us with only 4, 12 oz bottles of water to wash our hands with and drink. We couldn't have a shower after a long day, had no hot water to wash with after being in airports etc., and couldn't even flush the toilette.  On top of this, the room is small, there is just a sliding pocket door to get to the toilette and shower (and there was a bad smell in the little bathroom), the

Don't get me wrong this is a very nice hotel but it lacks that Disney feel you get when you are at a deluxe resort in Disney World.  The rooms were on the small side and did not provide much to them.  The location of this hotel is great for access to the parks and Downtown Disney but other than access the hotel doesn't offer much for the price it charges.

Summary Heading: 5 star for location, you can't beat it.
Summary: We have stayed at the Paradise Pier and the Disneyland hotel in the past, this was the first time we had stayed at the Grand Californian Hotel.  Valet was quick and easy.  Bag storage until check in was great (in fact, we had to get back into our luggage at one point and the bellman was quick and friendly in helping us).  Check in was a breeze, the gentleman helping us couldn't have been nicer.    We arrived around 10am and used the texting service for our room.  We received a text around 2pm that our room was ready.  We already had our keys and we simply went to our room and called the bell desk to have our luggage delivered, which maybe took 10 minutes but I think it was less.    The rooms were nice, but not large.  Rather small but not bad...we didn't spend much time there

Summary Heading: Very good but a bit more is expected of Disney
Summary: We love Disney in all its variations. We've cruised with them, we've been to Disney World twice in the last two years. We've seen the movies, bought the DVD's and watched the TV channels. But of all the Disney things we've seen and done since our seven year old twins were born, this resort is the most lacking. That doesn't mean it's substandard or not recommended; I just expect more from Disney. At these prices they are expected to deliver a premium product. This hotel comes up a little short. It's a bit dated and the rooms need freshening, especially the carpet. Even the Disney Cruise Line ships have two bathrooms with both a tub and a shower. Why not here? The pool area is a zoo on a hot afternoon, and when one of the three pools was forced to close due to a child's illness it

It's the nicest hotel on property and we read the reviews. Disney doesn't cater to the upper so this is the best you can get. We did the club floor and it's average too. Waters, fruit, muffins,etc, but not worth the extra $250 a day. I didn't feel the value for the "cast" member access. We were told our room was ready when we arrived, so we went to check in at the club level.  Once we were at the 6th floor, we were informed our room wasn't ready. AJ gave us  2 fast passes to compensate. This is Disney's attempt to make it right. It was a nice gesture. On day 3, the water in our room stopped working. We were trying to shower for the extra magic hour and we missed it. Disney gave us 3 fast passes again to compensate. Our room is much better than the Grand Floridian by stretches(

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but concierge level not worth it.
Summary: We have stayed in a few hotels using the concierge level.  This hotel disappoints in that area.  Hotel staff mostly outstanding.  It was nice not to have to wait in another disney line for check in and check out but not worth the money.  Lounge on the sixth floor was fine but food not special.  Wine and beer available as well as sodas and fruit punch for the kids.  Great staff lunch time, surly food staff at appetizer time.  Rooms were just like any other hotel.  Great beds and pillows but no other room amenities you would expect from a concierge level.  Save money and stay in a regular room and bring your own breakfast.  Great location for visiting the parks and they have a wonderfully staffed pool area.

When you first walk into the lobby you get this feeling that you expect luxury and then you walk in room and they are average. When we arrived there was a food on floor and waste in the trash can. Towels had stains on them. Total waste of money. We paid over $900 for one night. The only thing that is nice is that you can walk right into Downtown Disney or California Adventure but hardly worth the high price. We are annual pass holders and thought would be a nice weekend away and it very disappointing stay.  Will never stay here again.

My husband and I took our 11 year old granddaughter to Disneyland, CA for March Break, 2014.  We stayed at the Disney Grand California Hotel.  We had an excellent time and would not hesitate to return.  The room was average but for the amount of time spent in the room it was plenty enough.  This hotel has it's own entrance to the California Adventure Park and is definitely a bonus although there is still a line up to enter in the mornings but the line up is not as bad as at the main gates.  Everything is within walking distance.  We did not rent a car and took a shuttle to and from the airport/hotel.  The walk to Downtown Disney is approximately 5 minutes and the walk to the main gate entrance for both parks is about another 5 minutes.  Going from park to park on a park-hopper

We live locally but stay at "The Grand" during the runDisney race weekends.  This hotel is in the middle of everything.  It's great for families, our two kids love the bunk bed rooms.  There is a trundle bed to accommodate a third child.  We like the rooms facing Grizzly River Run.   Upgrading to the Concierge level will gain you access to the Craftsman Lounge which serves breakfast, afternoon snacks, and evening canapes and desserts.  Also available are libations and cordials in the evening.  The fireworks are fun to watch from the lounge.  Another treat for the kids is story time.  That happens around 8:30pm (check for seasonal times).  Blankets and pillows are spread out for the kids to sit down, and a cast member read Disney stories to the kids.   In high season, pool lounge

Just got back from a stay at the Grand Californian Hotel at Disneyland.  Hotel is still lovely, but in sore need of a good cleaning.  When looked at from above, the carpet in main lobby shows lots of stains and there is dust, quite thick on beams, (could be easily reached with dusters).  Our room was clean but worn, both sinks had huge multiple cracks.  There was a tine sticking out of one of the outlets, from where someone had obviously unplugged something that was stuck.   Pretty sure that is dangerous to little ones.  Tub did not drain properly, Gross!!! Housekeeping did a good job, and let me just say that every staff member we came across was very helpful, friendly and knowledgeable.  If it's this dirty now, what will it be like in the busy summer months?  We were looking

Summary Heading: A nice stay but not sure it's worth the price...
