Summary: We are three time annual passholders with Disney and we have NEVER stayed on property due to the ridiculous costs, but we decided to splurge this time for two nights since it was spring break and we wanted to experience the extra hour and try out the convenience of staying right no property.  We travel often and I rarely would splurge for such an expensive hotel as the cost is crazy high ($450/night with the "sale" price).    We showed up for check-in around 12:30 and we were hoping our room would be ready but it was not.  This was fine and we had planned for that possibility and headed into the park.  After you book your room on-line, you get frequent little e-mails about your upcoming visit and each one mentioned the "magic hour."  We looked forward to entering early the next

Summary Heading: Showing its age... and for goodness sake, fix your HVAC!
Summary: This was our second stay at the GC, and it is a very nice property, and also very, very expensive.  The lobby and common areas are very well decorated.  The employees are very personable and polite.  But with the cost, I have higher expectations.  Unfortunately, it's typical Disney value -- lots of cost for lots of fluff and little actual value.  The rooms are nice, but they are starting to show their age.  The grout on the bathroom walls (tub) and on the floor the bathrooms is discoloring/dirty.  The shower heads don't work like they were designed to, and the grout in the spa area has large chunks of missing grout.  The ventilation system is downright awful.  I like to sleep with the ventilation on when staying at hotels, so I just set the temp and set the fan to manual (low)

I wouldn't stay at any other Hotel if I go to Disneyland again.  It is in the perfect position close to Downtown Disney and the Parks.  The Hotel itself is wonderful, everything about it.  We arrived early in the morning and they let us check in straight away and our rooms were ready.  Big spacious rooms and very comfortable beds.  The staff are extremely friendly and helpful everywhere you go.  Disneyland itself was just amazing and we can not wait to come back and visit it again.  It was just the best experience and we will stay in their Hotel without a doubt.

Summary Heading: You pay for the best, you expect the best
Summary: We were originally planned to stay at the Paradise Pier hotel but decided to "splurge" and instead spend our one night at Disneyland at their top-notch Grand Californian Hotel. However, upon arrival, we were greeted with the news that the hotel would be turning off our water for several hours during our one night stay. Not acceptable. The hallway also smelled of dirty diapers (yeah, we know, it's Disney) but still, that isn't what you would expect from their top of the line resort. The bathroom door was also broken and refused to lock.   Good things to note: The park is within a 5 minute walking distance from the hotel (Disneyland). There is a store/cafeteria on site to buy late night snacks. Their maids/turn down service providers were extremely helpful and kind.

We got an awesome deal with WestJet Vacations (Canadian Airline‚Äîthank you WestJet) and stayed at the Disneyland Grand California Hotel and Spa for six nights.  Wow‚Äîwhat an spectacular hotel! The main lobby had a piano player and a large fireplace.  There was also a place for little children to sit and watch a movie while the parents checked in.  We were not traveling with children but that is a nice bonus. All the staff were cheerful,helpful and just really nice people. Our room overlooked California Adventure and we had a balcony to enjoy the California sunshine. Our room was spotless and the turn down service at night was a nice touch. The turn down staff would also take out used towels and empty the garbage‚Äîawesome! We bought a five day park hopper and were able to enjoy five

Summary Heading: Mediocre hotel especially for the price
Summary: The best things about the Grand Californian is its location - right next to California Adventure, and the staff who are excellent.  Unfortunately the hotel is showing its age and is not what you will expect for an absolute minimum of $300 per night (not counting taxes or parking, which added $70/night).  The hotel is not "bad", but here is a list of the issues we had that made for a less than pleasant experience: 1) The TV system is antiquated and impossible to use.  It is a hybrid analog and digital system, so ABC for example is channel 3-3 (try and figure that one out - NBC was 3-33 if I remember right).  This is not documented anywhere.  2) Our refrigerator didn't work, 3) Our thermostat went out, 4) The sinks barely drained, 5) the water was out in the whole hotel 1 night,

I really liked the location of this hotel you are literally attached to downtown Disney and Grand California Adventure park.  The club level is nice and had okay options (chef needs to learn how to boil eggs though).  The room are average and I expected more for the price.  I would stay again although the staff was friendly and helpful.

This hotel is fairly reasonable if you go off season.  There were 4 of us and the room accommodated us beautifully.  There was a bunk bed with a trundle and a queen bed.  The bathroom was nice because the toilet/shower were separate from the double sink area.  We had a park view and from our balcony we could actually see the fireworks (granted, through the trees) from Disneyland.  The ease of access to the park was amazing.  The staff made you feel like you were royalty.  I will stay here again!

Summary Heading: Not the best for an adult on business...
Summary: I would have given this 3 1/2 stars if I could have - the pool looked really nice so that and the location are great pluses for those visiting Disney.  This is a Disney resort, designed for a family experience.  I was there on business, however so I come from a different perspective.  Would I come here with my husband for vacation?No.  First let me say I love Arts and Crafts style architecture, and there are amazing details in the interior design.  However the overall effect is to make the hotel seem extremely dark.  You don't feel like you are in Cali. - it feels like the Adirondacks.  The rooms are average except for the architectural details on the bed.  My room was on the second floor which overlooked the lobby and the player piano so it was pretty noisy.  If you want a

Although the cost is pricey but it was worth the stay. All the staff that we dealt with in the duration of our stay were awesome from the valet staff to the housekeeper. I love the fact that as a guest of the hotel, we get to experience the park one hour before the general public. I wish it can be two hours early, but one hour is good enough. Storyteller cafe had great food with great service.

Summary Heading: With the exception of the rooms, it's all good
Summary: Lets get the bad out of the way first.  I agree w/ others who have stated that this is just a 2-3 star resort if we were only grading the rooms.  The d√©cor is pretty cheap right from the hallways, to the wallpaper.  There are clear signs of age from the scrapes, gouges and bumps in the elevators to the chips and wear marks in the rooms.  If you measure what you pay for what you get for in-room experience, this resort is a rip-off...BUT this resort has two things that make-up for the poor room quality. 1.  LOCATION:  You have backdoor access into California adventure and downtown Disney and you're only a meander away from the entrance to Disneyland...something both the Pier and the DL Hotel can't boast. 2. SERVICE:  The staff is over the top helpful.  From the waiters, bell-boys

Summary Heading: Spare No Expense for a Great Family Trip
Summary: Great place to stay in order to be close to the parks.  Since the Disney experience is very exhausting on the kids it made all the difference to be close to the hotel.  Kid has a tantrum or is tired or hungry, mom or dad can walk 5 minutes to take them back to the hotel.  It is a nice clean hotel with great friendly service as well.  Hotel is huge.  Pool is nice, lifeguards are like the secret service watching the kids like hawks.  Very uptight but wouldn't have it any other way.  Only reason not to give it 5 stars is they closed the direct entrance from the hotel to Cali. Adventure the whole week we were there!?  Main reason we stayed there was for that convenience.

Summary Heading: How is the Grand Cali Concierge?
Summary: We previously stayed at DLH concierge floor and decided to try the Grand Cali concierge floor on our most recent trip. I love it as I am an early riser and am gluten free. So I get up early, grab a paper and coffee and order something off the gluten free menu such as waffles, bagels or pancakes. They also have a good selection of yogurt and fresh fruit. My 15 year old son told me that he needed "real breakfast" which is a massive stack of pancakes and bacon. They don't serve that at the concierge breakfast so we had to go out one morning. Most days we would have a quick snack in the am, get in the park early entry, then come back for lunch and sometimes we made it for drinks and dinner. The gluten free menu is quite substantial and I could have eaten every meal at the concierge.

We came here for dapper days event, but I also surprised my wife for our 20th Anniversary and booked a room at this resort. Upon check in, we were upgraded to a king bed, premium pool view, which had a view of Grizzly River Run and part of Tower of Terror. Room has king bed, sofa bed, double vanity sink, small table and chairs, fridge, flat screen TV with many Disney and other channels and balcony overlooking the resort. Everyone walking by, from housekeeping, security, room service, any cast member, greets you and asks if you need anything. Having direct access to California Adventure park (be cautioned that first thing of park opening has about a 20-30 minute wait just to get in) allowed us to have breakfast in the morning and then leisurely enter the park a little later in

Summary Heading: Expensive, average room, but worth the experience
Summary: Have stayed at this resort a few times. It costs more than the 2 other Disney hotels in the area, but it is worth it. Beautiful design and grounds. You are as close the the 2 parks as you can get. Has it's own seperate entrance to California Adventure for hotel guests and an entrance to Downtown Disney as well. LOVE being so close. Basic rooms but some have amazing views of California Adventure.  Stayed on the Craftsman Club floor for the 2nd time. Have decided that to almost double the basic room price for the little bit of food and snacks available, is not something we will do again. (The rooms are the same as in all other parts of the hotel, and there is no way we ate $350 of food, so never again.) Everyone should stay here once just to experience it. :)

I was attending a convention at the adjacent Anaheim Convention Center. The rooms are completely filled up by two queen-sized beds so there is no space for a desk. There is a little table but my room had no power outlet or wired Internet at the table so there was no way to plug in a laptop and work. The WiFi was not functional. I couldn't use my Verizon 4G due to poor reception in this concrete palace. I moved to another room, which had the same little table but this time with a CAT5 wire and power outlet. Speakeasy measured Internet download speed at between 250 kbps and 900 kbps. This makes it painful to use even text-based applications such as Gmail.  The lobby is beautiful but the rest of the hotel is below what you'd expect from a Hampton Inn.

We stayed in a one bedroom DVC unit in early February to celebrate my husband's birthday. The pool view room was extremely clean and very spacious.  We loved the ease of leaving our room and being in the parks or downtown Disney within minutes. Everyone that we encountered was very friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again if we were in the Anaheim area.

Summary Heading: High quality hotel, next door to the parks
Summary: Stayed in the Grand Californian, just after the peak season. Yes, you pay a premium when booking a Disney Hotel and the Grand Californian is at the top of the price range. But what do you get in return for that: - We arrived around 11:00 and the room was already available, and we were allowed a check in! - The room was spacious, clean, comfortable and easily fitted my family of five. - Nice pools with plenty of available seats and free towels. - Free Wifi!!! (In 2011 they did not have this in Disneyworld (Orlando) so was not expecting this) - Our room (3301) had a nice view towards California adventure park and pools. - Easy walk in/out in California adventure park trough dedicated hotel entrance. - Magic Hours (note that for California Adventure the cue at our hotel was very

Summary Heading: Such easy access and beautiful hotel
Summary: This was my first stay at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel.  We stayed with friends who were DVC members in a 2 bedroom villa. Very clean and lots of room in our villa.  Everything was amazing.  So wonderful to walk out of the hotel through a special entrance that takes you right into California Adventure Park !!!  Also a special entrance into Downtown Disney!  This really spoils a person to wake up and just leave your room and be in the middle of The Happiest Place on earth!  I have checked room rates for a return visit and I must say it is very pricey if you want to rent a room and are not a DVC member.  I would recommend if you want to be able to get into park easily and be able to park your car and not do any driving.  It was GREAT!!  Just be prepared to "pay" for this or be

Summary Heading: Great place for 1st visit or with young ones
Summary: Hotel theme: rustic and lodge-like, NOT modern  Lobby: welcoming but dark  Cleanliness (overall): clean with all in-room amenities you would expect  Room size: small for the price.  We booked a standard room on-line (not knowing because of the price we paid) and ended up switching to a suite.  They were kind enough to show us 3 suites to choose from and they were all very comfortable.  Concierge suggested to call to book a specific type of room, instead of booking on line in future.  Swimming pool: good size but have to walk outdoor to gain access to it  Service: Good and friendly mostly  Dinning: Good character restaurants nearby.  Next to Disney DT and Disneyland Hotel where there are many more restaurants to choose from if you and your family are not into Disney Characters.

Summary Heading: Great Stay at a Nice Hotel
Summary: Hotel is beautiful but not as magical as Disneyland Hotel.  That said,  the location cannot be beat.    Hotel was clean and having turn down service nightly was a plus.  Overall nice hotel and great for location.  Overpriced in my opinion but worth trying at least once.

We have stayed at the Grand Californian about 20 times.  We love it.  Get the concierge or club service.  This is $150 per night per room.  It allows you access to the club room which has food and drinks available all day.  If you have 5 people in your room this is a heck of a deal.  They also have soft drinks and water that you can take into the park.  At night they have beer and wine during dinner and snack/story time.  Also the club balcony is perfect for watching the fireworks.

Summary Heading: Beautiful Disney Resort - Very Expensive - Great Disney Service
Summary: We stayed at this resort for 2 nights in early February 2013.  The hotel is beautiful with great lodge theming and craftsman architecture and decor.  It fits in very well with the Grizzly Peak section of DCA.  The 6 story atrium lobby is an impressive site and a joy to walk though each morning and relax in each evening.  Arrival was great, even though it was busy at about 10-11AM.  The security, valet, reception, and registration employees were all very helpful and made us feel welcome.  Our room wasn't ready (expected since it was still morning), but they issued us our room keys and sent us a text message with our room number when the room was ready.  This is a great system and we found it very convenient!  Parking is across the street in an open lot.  Not too far, but feels

The Grand Californian is the best of the three Disneyland hotels and is closest in proximity to both theme parks and Downtown Disney but it is also the most expensive. I would also like to mention that we received a discount on our room rate (less than half of the published rack rate). If we had paid full price, this review would have been one star less based on value. The standard rooms are exactly that, average with very little Disney theme added to the decor (some Mickeys on the carpeting and a Bambi shower curtain. However the common areas, lobby and exterior are beautiful. Service was also top notch. Everyone we interacted with went out of their way to make our stay memorable. We would definitely stay here again as long as we received the same room rate special.

Summary Heading: Great location but a very expensive dated hotel
Summary: We arrived at the hotel in and around a very busy period. The front of house staff were very helpful and we got to our room within 10 minutes of checking in.  The room itself was very dark and very very dated. Even with all the lights on it was still very dull. The room had the smallest bath (I believe the americans refer to as tubs) Ive ever seen. Good view over the pool though. but, when you consider that our room cost us $550 plus per night, that does not represent value for money  Breakfast, shocking !! A real poor standard. A family of four, not much change out of $100, yes $100. When you factor in that kind of cost per day for a family of four, per meal, that will give you some idea why this hotel is so expensive. I can stay at The Savoy in London cheaper. Maybe we should

We stayed in February 2014, which is off-season and did not want a room with any special views.  We paid $250 a night for a king with pull out couch and a view of trees towards the entrance driveway.  I had no plan to spend much time in the room, so I didn't care what we could see outside.  I think the price is about right for a decent hotel in So Cal.  I think people who complain about the price of rooms are from parts of the country where hotels are considerably less expensive.  Room was fine.  Our kids are 3 & 5, and we were a little crowded, but again, not a lot of time in the room.   Walls are a little thin.  You can hear housekeeping vacuuming & moving carts & furniture very easily.  If someone is in room next door, you hear each others voices.  But I feel more sympathy

Summary Heading: Worth the splurge if you don't come often
Summary: We have visited Disneyland many times but this was our first time staying at the Grand Californian. If you're flying in be prepared to pay for transportation to the hotel (no shuttle is provided). We used the Disneyland Express ($35 per adult, Kids under 11 free round trip). After arriving, the concierge shared that there is an agreement with some taxi companies for $35 one way per family. Wish we had known this sooner.  The lobby of the hotel is fantastic. We were greeted by employees at every turn. There was no wait time for registration and our room was prepared for us on arrival (4pm on a Friday).  Our family had the courtyard view room. The room looks very much like most hotel rooms do. The decor was lovely with hints of Disney and hidden Mickeys on the carpet. I was

We stayed here for a Disney symposium and it was a fabulous experience!    The hotel and rooms were beautiful, service was impeccable and the location can't be beat.....  After our meetings, it was an easy walk right into the Park!

Simply stunning lobby and grounds, --  easy access to all attractions ... EXCELLENT service. Unfortunately, one glitch.  A huge one, -- for us.  The smoking policy!  The "Smoking Allowed Areas" are in the absolute worst places.  One is the entrance to the pool area.  The stench from the smoke is overwhelming.  Just walking from the Lobby to the pool, you need to take a deep breath and HOLD until you get into the pool area.  At any given time there are at least 10 smokers puffing away. (Including cigars.)  There are so many more remote areas where they could allow smoking.  We had a room above the smoking allowed area ... FIVE stories above ... yet the smell of smoke permeated our balcony and room. ~ Put quite a damper on the ambiance of our incredible room and view.    When this

We stayed 3 nights at this property and it was well worth it. The interior decor was beautiful. The Craftsman style decor was stunning. Staying here you can access the California Adventures park from the hotel and you can also take advantage of the "Magic Hours". This was worth it alone. We were able to come back to the hotel very quickly from the park in order for our toddler to take a nap and she fell right to sleep on the comfy beds. Each room comes equipped with a pack n' play crib so you don't even need to ask for it. The property has an entrance to Downt Town Disney where there are many places to eat. You should call ahead and make reservations because they are always booked. The restaurants in DTD were the Rainforest Cafe, The House of Blues, The Jazz Kitchen and the ESPN

Location is absolutely great .... extremely easy access into Disneyland parks - no waitin in Q's. The Magic Mornings were totally worth it. The location is so handy that we came back to the room often for kids to rest, change etc

We stayed at a different hotel on Disney property and sure wished we had stayed here instead. Absolutely stunning Craftsman interior. We had breakfast two mornings sitting by the fireplace in the main lobby.

We are  DVC members, so we consider ourselves Disney experts. But that's Disney World in Florida. So this was only our 2nd trip to California.  We stayed in a 1br villa. It was beautiful. The decor was very craftsman style, which I love.  The bedroom has a king sized bed. The living room has a pull out couch, but also has a bed that folds down from the entertainment center. My son loved the bed from the entertainment center. It was just right for a 6yr old boy. We faced the pool area, and could see some of the fireworks at night.  The hotel staff were great. Our room was not ready at 5pm when we checked in, so we were given vouchers for a free dinner.  Over the course of the week we ate at Napa Rose, Storytellers Cafe and used room service. We enjoyed all of them and I will

We took our 5 year old son to Disneyland and CA Adventure for the first time and, as recommended by friends, stayed at the Grand Californian. (We got a great package deal through Costco Travel!!) I'm so glad we chose to stay on property, as the hotel is beautiful and the location and access to the park make your life so much easier!   We had a room on the 5th floor, with a view of the CA Adventure park, which was very cool.  It was quiet because we were at the end near Soaring Over CA, but we were still right by the park!  The other side of the hotel, overlooking the Disney promenade, would have been very noisy and I'm so glad we did not choose that side.  Our room was extremely clean, the beds were comfortable, the pillows were comfortable, and the sheets were clean, thick and

Summary Heading: Worth the convenience of being so near to the park!
Summary: We spent a week for our first trip to Disneyland after staying at several Disney World hotels in Orlando. The building is older (compared to Disney World hotels) but they are well maintained and the facilities in the room are most definitely modern with a luxurious touch. The cast members were for the most part accommodating and welcoming.  The rooms were clean, beautifully decorated and the beds were very comfortable  We were able to enjoy the nighttime fireworks from our balcony. Our room was quite far from the lobby but after the lobby it was just a few minutes walk to Downtown Disney and hotel entrance to the Parks. Traveling with two children ages 3 and 1 this was a great plus as we were able to walk back to the hotel room in the afternoon, get a brief rest, freshen up and

We actually stayed in a motel across from Disneyland for a week and treated ourselves to one night at the Grand Californian so we paid for two motel/hotel rooms for one night because we didn't want to move everything!  The Grand Californian was SUCH a fun hotel to explore.  We loved seeing the observation decks, pools, California Adventures right outside our sliding glass door from the fourth floor.  And those sliding glass doors must have been part of the Disney magic because open it sounded like you were IN the park with screaming kids.  Closed? Quiet as a church on Thursday. Just fantastic.  The room was clean but tight for four adults as it was rather smallish.  We had two queen beds.  Our motel across the street was quite a bit bigger at only $100 a night.  This was over

There is a lot that is completely awesome about the Grand Californian, and I love the place--so much attention to fine detail and a lovely experience. However, I was visiting last month to run in the Tinker Bell Half Marathon, and could not believe the noise coming from the next room! As I was trying to fall asleep, the ladies next door were having what sounded like a normal conversation, and I could hear every word! For more the steep price of the accommodations I would expect to be able to have a great night's sleep without overhearing every little sound from my neighbors. For all of the great things about the hotel, I can enjoy most of them without staying overnight. The idea of an overnight stay is to SLEEP, and I will think very carefully about booking with them again.

Summary Heading: BIG HOTEL WITH ABOVE AVERAGE SERVICE
Summary: We stayed 5 nights with 2 adults and 4 kids so had a 3 bedroom room which was 3 interconnecting rooms on 5th floor  5451 I think it was.   The room was a long way from the lobby. But the rooms were pretty good , clean and tidy.  The Hotel itself was pretty cool with very dark D√©cor. The staff were friendly but not perfect , as there is so  many people at this place they must get sick of so many of them. The food wasn't fantastic with it difficult to get healthy options so 5 nights was plenty. It was great for Disneyland as you are in the park with your own access but even then you still had to line up to get in. Pools were very good , the lobby was cool.  It really is a kids place as you would expect so from that point of view it was very good

The best thing in this hotel is the localization, almost inside California Adventure Park. But, the room's is very old, they need a reformulation. The size is good, but could be better since almost rooms are with families of 3 or more. The price is the worst is very expensive for a old room...

Summary Heading: 5-star pricing for 2-3 star accommodations, dining and service
Summary: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone because it charges 5-star prices for 2-3 star service, and it is not a nice or desirable place to stay for many reasons.  I see from the numerous negative reviews already posted that I am not alone in this opinion.  I agree with nearly everything these reviewers say and I strongly encourage people to avoid this hotel.  We had a two bedroom suite that was priced like a suite at the Ritz Carlton or the Four Seasons, but looked like something out of the local Best Western or similar 2-3 star hotel.  The suite consisted of nothing more than two small bedrooms connected by a parlor area containing minimal furniture, all of which was very basic and uncomfortable.  Most of the parlor was empty and therefore unusable (unless you need space for

This is an extremely beautiful hotel and the location is fantastic. The back of the hotel ends inside Disney¬¥s "Adventure Park" so you can overlook the rides, and the people walking by. It is also very convinient as you are so close to Downtown Disney and it¬¥s nice restaurants like the "Rainforest Cafe" for instance. Although it is an expensive hotel, the experience is amazing.

This was our 16th time back to Disneyland and DCA and this was our 1st time staying here.  Keep in mind you will pay up to 6x more than a motel/hotel nearby.  I choose to splurge this time as it was my daughter's 10th birthday.  Our usual hotel of choice is the Candy Cane Inn on Harbor Blvd.    We stayed on a Thursday night which was quite reasonable compared to their regular rates which I've seen during the summer as high as $600 a night for a standard room.  We paid $320 including tax.  First off, you cannot beat the convenience and location of this hotel!!!  There is a separate entrance for guest of the Disney property hotels into DCA.  It was well worth it for this alone.  When we wanted to go to the pool or back to the room to relax it was just a 5 min walk back to the

We just spent 5 days at Disneyland and the Grand Californian. It is a stunning, massive hotel that is an homage to Craftsman style. We stayed in a spacious, well-appointed 2-bedroom condo through my father's membership in the Disney Vacation Club. We had an incredible view of California Adventure and could even see the lights/ fountains from World of Color. The location can't be beat. The parks and downtown disney are literally just outside the entrance. There is even a special entrance for hotel guests to California Adventure. We were disappointed that the special entrance was closed for refurbishment while we were there. We shared our frustration with the staff and they were very understanding and accommodating giving us special fast passes to use for the attractions at the

Summary Heading: Rooms dissapointing but common areas in hotel very nice
Summary: stayed at the hotel while visiting disneyland for the whole disney experience.  while the common areas of the hotel were beautiful we found for the price you paid the rooms were dissapointing. the rooms were very basic with a very small bathroom. def worth being inside disney so you dont have to rely on shuttles or taxi's each day which comes in handy especially after night time shows when cues for these were exceptionally long. Only other problem we had was that bell boy who helped us with our bags was fairly rude.  other staff were lovely however but i think i would stay elsewhere on our next trip.

Summary Heading: Amazing DVC stay at the Grand Californian!
Summary: We returned yesterday from our first stay at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel. We became Disney Vacation Club members last year and this was our first time using our points for a 3 - day, 2 - night trip in a one - bedroom DVC suite. This was our daughter's first time on an overnight trip as well, and we could not have been more pleased (she is 2).  We arrived on a Wednesday afternoon and we're welcomed with their signature "Welcome Home." After getting our car valet parked we were checked in.  This was a very easy process. The front desk was helpful, courteous, and inviting. The manager Ken Haines made everything even better with special requests for our room to have brand new sheets and comforters, as well as an exceptional view of Disney's California Adventure Park.   Our room

Summary Heading: Grand Califonia is not a 4 star hotel.....
Summary: Don't be fooled, what once was a great family experience(we have stayed there six different years) is not a money extracting machine, from the lack of real coffee in the room, to staff with their palms out at every turn, to poor customer service at coffee bar and character's caf√©.   great location but the management has changed and don't expect much extra "resort" courtesy from anyone, it is a money machine and for 700 a nite you could be in any 4 or 5 star hotel just about anywhere in the world, think twice and pack wisely.

Summary Heading: Still the best place to stay.
Summary: I reviewed this hotel three years ago when we stayed here for my birthday and I raved about. We enjoyed it so much that we didn't even think to stay anywhere else when we planned our current trip. Helpful hint: if you stay here between January and April the room rates are not outrageous and worth every penny.  This hotel is still excellent in our book! From the moment you walk in the door to the turn down service at night...it's perfection. The staff is courteous, friendly and very attentive. The grounds are spotless. The lobby is gorgeous with a roaring fire (it is gas, which is a bummer) where we enjoyed a glass of wine serenaded by live piano (Disney) music. If I could critique I would say that the rooms could use some sound buffering.  Other than that we still don't have any

I was expecting to be a bit disappointed in the room after reading some reviews but I was very pleasantly surprised. The room was big, had a sofa, desk, two sinks, good water pressure/heat and a comfortable bed. We booked a standard room, the view was nice (5th floor entrance facing) but a bit hard to get too as the halls are quite extensive. Staff was pleasant and easy to work with, parking was convenient quick and inexpensive. Sun-Thursday rates are quite reasonable for the location and room, the experience was well worth $275.

This hotel is beautiful and conveniently located. I loved that they had lifeguards in their year-round heated pools. Their rooms have mini fridges, which their web site didn't mention (I would have packed more food to keep costs down) Some rooms have beautiful bunk beds with chocolates on the pillows every night (my kids found that exciting) The first night we had a Downtown Disney view room. They play ambient music until after midnight! The jazz music had bass so loud it kept us awake. This wasn't live music either- it was the music they play through the speakers in front of the stores. They moved us to a quiet, poolside room the next day. I can't believe anyone paying that kind of money would find the music to be acceptable. I'm happy they moved us. I would absolutely stay

Grand service, ideal location for teens, adults and Grandparents.  We loved getting into the California Adventure early and able to take in the sights.  Central location easy for cooling off in the pool in the afternoon and the wait staff at pool were wonderful, attentive, and joyful.  We spent four days there and enjoyed our trip.  We have stayed here before and the hotel gave us the same room again for ease and quiet peaceful rest.   Cars Land was our new favorite and we always find new places to visit that makes our trips feel new to Disneyland - Ariel's Grotto the cove bar is a perfect spot to order drinks and appetizers to watch world of color... As is the roof of the Grand Californian.  Big Thunder BBQ is tucked away behind the rail road and is a cool place to take the men

Summary Heading: Amazing location, great lobby, average rooms and can be noisy.
Summary: I ran the Tinkerbell Half Marathon in January. The location and convenience of this hotel CANNOT BE BEAT. You are paying a huge premium for the location of this hotel, but it is worth it. I have a 20 month old son and the ability to go to the park and then come back for nap time in about 5 minutes really made it easy.   In typical Disney fashion they made everything seamless from check in, check out, and the ability to buy something in the park and have it sent back to your room.  The hotel is overpriced for the "hotel services", but it was clean and spacious enough to get the job done.  The lobby is fantastic for just relaxing and the kinds rocking chairs are adorable and the children actually stay seated for more than 5 minutes.  Finally, the location cannot be beat for the

Best Disney hotel in Anaheim.  Its the newest one. The lobby it's amazing, u can sit there after u come back from Disneyland and relax with drinks and appetizers,  there is a tv with Disney movies for kids with kids rocking chairs. Best location ever, in downtown disney and California adventure. Love this hotel. Pricey, but it's totally worth it

I guess it depends on the value you receive for your stay.  We were able to get a special deal for two nights at the Grand Californian, making it a worthwhile stay.  We loved our stay. Rooms were spacious, quiet and nicely decorated.  The bathrooms accommodated families well with a large double sink area and a separate toilet/shower.   Adjoining rooms are a great option for families traveling in groups or with several children.  A plus was we arrived early and were able to  have our luggage held and gain early entry into the parks.   They texted us when our room was ready.  Easy access to Downtown Disney and California Adventure which we loved!  Excellent pool facilities enjoyed half a day by the pool before flying out!  All around good restaurant onsight - something for

Summary Heading: The Grand is for location, the rest is average
Summary: Why do I stay here, because it sits inside the Disney California Adventure.  Super easy to get into the park, relatively easy to Disneyland.  Great for getting soaked on the water ride and heading in to change clothes.  Wonderful if the kids need a break.  Certainly better than the other two Disneyland hotels.  The room is comfortable but not well appointed.  The bathroom will remind you of the Holiday Inn.  The service is average.  Waited for help on my last trip with my bags unloading and no one came to help.  Waited in long line to get my bags out of storage at the end of my trip.  The bar is great for drinks, very short on great food options and unless you have reservations you are not going to simply pop into the hotel restaurants and grab some dinner. As this is Disney you

With a room that is equal to any fine hotel and a spa, as well as fine dining. This hotel isn't just for the children. Come with your kids sure, but enjoy a spa treatment & a fine meal to boot. It has something for everyone. The concierge level has something for everyone too.

Summary Heading: You're paying for the easy access to the parks.
Summary: Decent but overpriced Disney hotel. Rooms and service were adequate, nothing special or exceptional. The highlight is the easy access to both parks. You can be in DL or CA in less than 5 minutes from your room. But is that worth the high price?  Probably not.

With the price paid for the hotel, you would think we could at least have access to continental breakfast and shuttle service. But instead, everything is MASSIVELY expensive. As if over spending on the room isn't enough, you have to pay $30+ per person for a meal on the hotel grounds that is horrible and not worth eating. I'd rather spending the extra time and save tons of money to stay at an off site hotel with more amenities. Vacations are supposed to be enjoyable and the over inflated, unnecessary charges and fees shouldn't have to be burden on your trip. The parks are amazing and the rooms were great but nothing you can't get down the road with more options like free breakfast and shuttle services. Unfortunately we will not waste our money to come back to this hotel

this is our second trip to this hotel and what a change for the worse. the staff seemed to have left on vacations and the leftovers are incompetent. the tv didnt work and the staff had to fix it everyday. the excuse was that they had a new provider. went to the front desk to ask about shipping something and they said they would call the business center in the hotel. but oops the business center changed the no and they didnt have the new one. finally at check out i was told the computers were down and i couldnt get a print out of the bill. all of this is secondary to the fact that the staff seemed to feel that they were the paying customers and we were bothering them. nothing like bad service to reduce a good hotel to mediocre

Summary Heading: Blind booking, average room and service, easy access to Disneyland parks.
Summary: I have planned and booked a 3-bedroom suite at this hotel since the beginning of November 2013 (2 months ahead) of my daughter special 21st birthday in January 2014. I have to say the booking experience was horrible, you cannot book a suite from anywhere but Disney website and for a group of 6 or more persons, you have to call in and talk with Disney travel agent to book. The Disney website for the hotel section is totally unfriendly, and so "yesterday". It does not provide you with all the detail descriptions of the rooms they have, no plan layouts or at least good photos so you can pick and choose. You very much rely on what the agent tell you and you do not get to choose room location or view. My opinion is that if I am willing to pay premium $$$$ at least I let me see and

Summary Heading: More like half a grand, but who's counting?
Summary: It's just so Chip and Dale -- I mean, so Ying and Yang.   This place is ridiculously expensive and doesn't do much to earn it other than -- yup -- location, location, location.   We stayed here for four nights over the 2013 Christmas holiday and, frankly, it really made the whole vacation.   But it's just so totally over the top expensive for a hotel room that wouldn't cost $200 anyplace else.  Service?  Pretty much nonexistent, particularly for this dollar level.  But they don't have to have service or fancy rooms, do they?  They have a backdoor into California Adventure that has a line at it at 6:45am and gets you onto Radiator Springs Raceway before the line becomes two hours long.   The convenience is so worth it, I'd recommend -- as long as you are dishing out the dough --

On the outside it is beautiful and is truly grand. We had a king room with a pool view. The room did have a balcony, but really was not that special. We have stayed in Holliday Inn Express and Hampton Inn that were every bit as nice. The Direct TV was out for our entire stay. We were told every day that it would be up around noon. They never got it working. The bed was just okay. It was not worth the $500 a night we paid. There is a Holiday Inn Express close by I would recommend. I can not recommend this Disney Hotel.

Summary Heading: The worse service ever, does not worth your money
Summary: We stayed 2 free nights at the Grand Californian. Other then good location they worth nothing. We got the 2 night due to previous incident in the hotel and you would think that they would do anything to make us happy. It was far from that. We asked for an early check in a day before, they told us that we are welcome to check in starting at 7 am and get the room keys. when we came at 2pm and our room was not ready, they explained to me that getting the room key does not mean getting the room!!!! Cody from the hotel tried to find an alternative room for us that was much smaller and you could see that he was only trying to get rid of us, had a poker face and was not helpful at all. The shower was the most horrible thing I have ever tried ( and I was in the army), super low water

Summary Heading: This hotel saved our vacation.  Worth every penny.
Summary: If the rooms at the Grand are in your budget, then don't waste anymore time looking.  Just book it.   If the price is a way to steep for you, then don't bother.  Nothing they do will satisfy you enough to justify spending the most you've ever spent on a hotel. And the $500 you'll save booking the best western will go a long way in the park. But if you're thinking about wether staying here is worth the extra hit to your vacation budget then read on!   I looked at a dozen hotels in the area in planning my family trip to Disney.  This hotel saved the vacation and it will be my only choice next time I come.  Some people may expect the high cost of the place to be reflected in over the top service and comps when you walk in the door.  The value is created by its location.  A hotel

This is supposed to be Disney's premier hotel, well it's anything but "Grand". Maybe only in terms of size. Do not stay here unless you must have direct access to the Californian Adventure Park. The rooms are spartan with absolutely no provisions in the minibar, I should just call it a fridge because that what it is, not a minibar. Our television didn't even work nor was fixed during our three night stay despite several calls to the front desk. Disneyland itself was very crowded, as you'd expect, but this was not assisted by the fact that no less than 8 attractions/rides were not operating the whole time we were there with no discernible reason given other than telling you to enjoy your stay! Don't fall for the "Magic Hour" thing either. Sure there's less people as its only the

We just returned from a month long holiday in the United States and of all of the places we stayed this was the second most expensive place (Waldorf Astoria, New York being first). It is very expensive to stay here, but I suppose like anything Disney related it comes at a cost. The hotel itself is spectacular and how you envisage it will be from the photos on the web. The rooms though are a different story, very tired and in need of attention. While being large enough it is time for a makeover. Old carpets, old bedding, old bathroom setup with an old shower curtain. Little soap bars that belong more in a 2 star hotel than what you would expect from here.  We also paid for a premium view which we feel did not eventuate and were sold a less spectacular view at Disney's

Summary Heading: Grand Style, Grand Manner, Grand Prize!
Summary: First, most everyone who works for Disney is polite, well-mannered and knows their stuff. Not all, but most. I think we experienced great assistance on all levels, from check in, to baggage, to room service, to in-house dinning. Second, the style of this hotel is Mission, even to the smallest detail of little mission-style rockers for the wee ones to sit and watch Disney movies (of course) in a corner of the lobby. Third, convenience is their most precious asset.  Just down the corridor and past the turn style right into California Adventure.  No need to worry about the young ladies walking several city blocks to the hotel. They can go from park to hotel, from hotel to park without leaving the compound. This took worry from me. Paid for it in terms of location and cost, but

We stayed in a 1 bedroom villa (DVC Member) and it was great!  We had a great 5th floor view overlooking California Adventure (and watched World of Color from our chairs in the balcony!).  With the doors open it was noisy, but if they were closed, you couldn't hear anything!!!  The room itself was large, spacious and clean.  The hotel was in a great location, and castmembers there were great-especially Ernie from bell services!  You can't beat staying on property at any Disney resort and this is no exception.  We did lose TV staions the last day (apparently  changing providers) but otherwise it was a great stay!  The proximity to the parks as well as Downtown can't be beat!

Summary Heading: convenient location, great customer service, but.....
Summary: We chose this hotel for its convenient location. We are here with a two and seven year old. Although not really in our price range, we made an exception for the convenience of literally being in the park for quick trips back to the room for naps, etc. That part is is great! And as promised at Disneyland, the staff is amazing. However, after paying the high end price, we are bummed about a few things... the internet connection sucks! You get kicked off every few minutes. Also, apparently they are in the process of changing satellite companies and we only get 5 channels- 3 Disney channels, a sport channel and a weather channel! No news! Also major construction going on. We understand that improvements have to happen sometime, but it is very noisy during the day for kiddo naps

Summary Heading: Old but great location giving you great Disney experience
Summary: The location is fantastic! Downtown disney with its shops/restaurants etc at your doorstep and a 10 minutes walk to the park. Love, love the location especially when you have kids that need a break from the park in the middle of the day. The staff are friendly and helpful! Excellent Napa Rose restaurant on site (dined there twice). Excellent character breakfast! Great pools but does not appear clean. The room is probably the worst part of the hotel - old furnishing and bathroom and does not appear clean even though housekeeping does a reasonable job. Would stay again because of the location and service but not a fan of the rooms - Disney needs to refurnish the rooms.

Summary Heading: It is about the experience since very pricey
Summary: My rating incorporates the value that this property provides in relationship to the cost.   The best thing about this hotel is that is so close to the parks. The hotel still requires a brisk walk to get into either park in the morning. Yes, it has its own entrance to Disney California, but this is useless when the park opens as the line is so long (this is a big hotel) and there are only 4 turnstiles. We resorted to going in through the main gates each morning unless you want to get up 1 hour to 45 minutes earlier to hold a spot. So, the entrance to Disney California is convenient, but only later in the day.  The other great thing is the extra magic hour for everyday of your ticket. However, this has drawbacks as you want to stay up late at the park and then have very little

This hotel seems like an extension of the park due to the location and seamless operation of Disney and Royal Caribbean. If you stay here, your memories will not be limited experiences inside the park; your entire stay will contain the charm found in California Adventure Land.  Adults and parents are more likely to appreciate the detail in the lobby and rooms. Only a few woodland related Disney characters (Bambi, Snow White, etc) can be found in the decor. The hotel theme is a blend of craftsman style and Disney playfulness that is reminiscent of original lodges in National Parks. Rooms are clean and top-notch. The standard room features granite counter tops, craftsman furniture, and a balcony. Service is exceptional and exponentially magnified on the concierge level (6th

This is a lovely hotel with rich, dark wood d√©cor.  The rooms are average in size and very accommodating for families, with pull out couches, bunk beds or portable cribs.  Rooms have a balcony with table and chairs for relaxing.  Although it can be very expensive for a family, it is a hotel that should be experienced at least once for a trip to the Disney Parks.  It even has a private entrance into California Adventure.  The cast are all very nice and attentive.   Ask about rooftop viewing of shows at CA.

Summary Heading: It's the what if's that make the difference
Summary: My friend and I had the opportunity to stay at the Disney Grand Californian for the second time and I can't say enough about the place.  From the front desk, to bell service, to housekeeping, to about just everyone worker we encounter at the hotel treated us so well.  What we liked was the easy access to the California Adventure park and quick access to Downtown Disney.  We have read reviews where people complained about the staff, but either they were super critical or at best expected everything to be perfect and without fault.    Again this being our second visit to the hotel could not find anyone to be anything less than helpful.  But as the title implies you pay for the what if's.  On the second night of our trip I had an accident right outside our hotel room door.  We

We stayed 5 nights at the Grand Californian Hotel and every night was lovely. The rooms are perfect with comfortable beds, good size tv, table, chairs, mini fridge, bench for putting shoes on at front door, bathroom and always clean! My only complaint in regards to the room was the shower was very hard to adjust and get the right temp.  Our downtown Disney view room had amazing views of the fireworks! Which was great because they are on so late each night. I recommend booking your meals in advance if you choose to eat at the hotel. We never ate there due to this but downtown Disney has a lot of different places to choose from if you miss out on a reservation.  We loved the extra hour in Disneyland each day. Make sure you get there early to avoid the long line or go via downtown

Summary Heading: Best way to visit Disney with a toddler
Summary: From the time of arrival at the airport we realized we made the right the decision to stay at a Disney resort. It was our first time to visit Disneyland and it was our first vacation as a family with our toddler (2 years old) so we were not sure what to expect. Once we arrived we had to wait for a bus to take us to the resort, the waiting was a bit of an annoyance but was worth it because we decided not haul a car seat around (we bought an airplane harness for our child's airplane seat). We arrived early to the hotel and our room was not ready, we were able to leave our luggage with the bellman and secure valuables in a safe deposit box provided by the hotel. We ate at a restaurant in the hotel and toured the grounds. Our room ended up being ready an hour after check in time,

This is an expensive hotel. We paid ¬£1250 for me, my husband and my daughter to stay for 3 nights 1-4 Jan, this included park tickets. I am a DVC owner and disney fan, I've stayed at the Hong Kong Disneyland Hotel, the Disneyland hotel in Paris as well as the Boardwalk in Orlando as well as several lower star Disney properties. So I was interested to see what it was like here.   I was disappointed. Having recently stayed at the HK flagship Disney hotel, I was expecting a similar experinece. Not so. The hotel theme is national parks so it's brown and green, but it felt really gloomy. It also feels a bit scruffy. The room was ok. Very little Disney theming. The beds were ok, nothing special, although linens nice. There is no mini bar. The pool wasn't that warm, and there is no

We had a standard view room which was clean and large enough. The walk from the elevator was long though, and room service trays were in the hallway for three days. The hotel cannot be beat for its location, but it's a busy place that's not really for children.

Summary Heading: Ho hum. Must be a disney. Overpriced, Ho Hum, Average.
Summary: Check in. Room that we requested...not going to happen.  $1426 a night. So what. Do you want the room we have or not?  Lol  This is Disney. Or should I say, don't give a damn disney.  Guys here it is. Wanna stay on property. You have no options. Just suck it up and try to enjoy a c class hotel at triple a prices.  That's all I have to say about that.

This is by Far our Favorite Resort Hotel!  This is quality. The Staff are always Disney to the Max!  Helpful friendly what Disney Castmembers should be! The extras you get are great  as well.  We have never had a bad stay here and have stayed numerous times.  If you can afford it do it; yes this is higher end, but its worth it for location,  No it is not over the top Disney but the nuances  are everywhere if a you take the time to look.  It is a great relaxing place after a Wild and busy day in the parks maybe best suited for those with very  small children uninterested in Disney  as much  or teens who think they are too cool. ;)  They do have much available at the resort for children like storytime etc.. but do the research.  The only con I have is it would be nice to have an

We went the hotel for the new year week and had a fantastic stay. WE were on the Club floor which made the stay even better.  The check in process was smooth and efficient.  We also had wonderful help in making reservations for dinner from the club staff. In comparing California and Florida parks California wins hands down. The quality of food was much better and so was the staff both in the parks and hotel.  We would come back and stay here again hands down

Summary Heading: An average un-Disney hotel in a 5+ star location
Summary: While I have been to Disneyland more times than I can count, this was the first time I stayed in a Disney resort hotel.  If I could give a half star I'd say my rating for this property would be 3.5 stars at best, especially given the price of the room. I have stayed in 4+ star properties in major cities like New York and Hong Kong so it's only fitting to compare this hotel to those experiences.  The foyer of this hotel is grand like the name.  It's impressive with huge vaulted ceilings and you feel like you've walked into a fancy lodge in Yosemite.  During the Christmas season they have a big Christmas tree that is a popular photo stop.  Unfortunately the rest of the experience was less than stellar.  The negatives: 1) Check-in/registration - what is going on here?  It is

Summary Heading: The only way to see Disney!
Summary: Location location location!  This hotel was the perfect base for visiting Disneyland.  When the kids got tired it was a short walk back to the room to rest up before heading back to the park.  There was so much fun in the restaurant at breakfast time with the characters and dancing etc, I think the kids could have stayed there all day.  The rooms was lovely and clean and our family of four were very comfortable there.  The kids had bunk beds which they loved.  There was a lovely big open fire on the lobby with rocking chairs and a kids tv close by showing Disney cartoons with kiddy sized rocking chairs for relaxing. It is on the pricey side but i would definitely recommend it.

Summary Heading: I thought we were staying at a Disney hotel
Summary: We arrived mid evening from a flight ex London for a 3 night stay.  First impression was it was rather dark in the main public areas but with people coming in from the parks having had a great day.  The corridors and rooms were even darker and our "park view room" certainly was not!  Not a Mickey Mouse shampoo or Donald Duck soap or motifs of "any" disney characters anywhere in stark contrast to the Disney hotels in Hong Kong.  One main reason for choosing this property is its direct access into one of the Disney parks and the "Happy Hour" of extra admission.  Well on Tues it was Disneyland Park that opened 1 hour earlier and on Wed that Disney California Adventure park opened an hour earlier.  On both days I reckon we queued for the best part of 30 minutes AFTER opening time

We arrived at this hotel at 8.30am after a 14 hour flight & half an hour sleep with 3 children under 6. When we first went to check-in they did not have our room we paid for even listed so they said one would be cleaned & to check back. We did at 10.30am & it was not ready, we went back at 12pm & still not ready & i was told that it would not be made available until after 5pm. I was told that they couldn't contact housekeeping to clean the room as it would ruin their system and that most people who have such long flights book the room for the night before so that they can access the room straight away. Meanwhile my husband & children were asleep in the foyer as their was no room to sit. I was offered a smaller room with a sleeping bag for our 21/2 year old & said that our room

Summary Heading: Good location but needs a little up dating
Summary: We are in the final day of a 3 day visit here. We had major issues at check in with no one to help us with bags and being giving keys to a room that was already occupied! It was solved in  the next hour  by staff and we appreciated our dinner voucher. The room provided us with a view of the fireworks each night and the room was of a good size. It did look a little tired along with the bathroom and towels. We did find the staff welcoming although a few more staff at guest services was needed on a couple of times.

Summary Heading: Very tired, overpriced and simply not what is promised.
Summary: The foyer at this hotel is spectacular and entirely unique.  The service is also pretty good although some staff look visibly 'over it' and no one ever seemed to know where our bags were when we checked in and when we checked out.  We were told to look in lost property.  Once outside the foyer however, the hallways and rooms were extremely tired and banged up.  There were also always numerous trays of food in the hallways.  You'd be disappointed with the standard of room if you booked a 4 star anywhere else but pretty happy if it was a 3.5 star.  It was absolutely nowhere near 5 star standard and we booked a suite.  But the real disappointed was that the promises made by the hotel were simply not met.  The most significant is park access.  There is no hotel access at all to

Summary Heading: You are paying for the location
Summary: If this hotel was located anywhere else it would not get any guests at the rates they charge. The rooms are small with very limited facilities and the bathrooms are tiny with the hand basins in the main room. One positive is the bunk beds for the kids because who does not come to Disney without kids. We stayed pre Christmas and it was horrendously busy......but it is in the Disney park grounds and gives you early entry and you can escape the crowds in the middle of the day. All the staff were very friendly but service can be a bit slow..it is also a shame that the cafe and restaurants do not offer many healthy choice eating......but again it is Disney and America

I only gave it a two because it does have a very convenient access to one of the parks, but what a mess this hotel is! Called customer service to let them know that the bag was arriving from the airport, they put us on hold for 30 minutes.  The staff is either unhelpful or not knowledgable.  The overall feel is very impersonal.  Also, they keep on asking me if I'm a guest at the hotel and then check it just to give me some information about the area, meanwhile, it does not look like anybody knows who is coming in or out of the hotel.  With so many children it is simply unsafe!  We travel a lot and at this price range this hotel/vacation is simply disappointing.  WIll not be returning to this hotel

We stayed here in early-December for the second time.  Yes, it is expensive but the convenience is more than worth it.  My grandson got sick and we were able to immediately return to our room while the rest of the family could continue enjoying Disneyland.  Had we been staying at a hotel outside the grounds, this would not have been possible and the entire family would have  missed out.  The hotel also has a nurse on duty 24/7 and sent her to check on our grandson.  We really appreciated their care and concern and we were not charged one dime for this service!  It was also necessary to change the linens a number of times and Housekeeping was always right there to take care of it without complaint or additional charge.  I don't believe we would have had this level of service at

Summary Heading: Very nice stay...everything as advertised...room a little dated.
Summary: Just spent Christmas in this hotel with family and required five rooms for six days. Very expensive, but Christmas!...at Disneyland!..about what we expected. The hotel did a very good job and we were pleased with the stay. The rooms are a little dated, especially the bathrooms, but they were clean, well supplied, and very functional. Very good beds. Good internet service. The benefit for the family of being steps away from the parks is outstanding! The magic morning hour where you have exclusive use of the parks is extremely beneficial. The staff were very friendly and accommodating at a very hectic time of year. They managed to have all our rooms on the same floor, within steps of each other. Having one suite provided us with a living room for group get-togethers...that worked

This was the first hotel of my family's American holiday and was the ideal place to stay to truly experience Disneyland in full flight. We were greeted with a "welcome home" from Jennifer at the front desk and relaxed in the beautiful Lobby as our room was being cleaned.   Although the rooms were reasonably small and expensive, they were perfect for our family (the type who liked to spend all of the day in the park). The various restaurants and cafes were also handy. I loved the easy access to California Adventure Park, which is not guaranteed with all of the Disneyland hotels.   I certainly recommend this Hotel, providing that you spend most of your time exploring, rather than relaxing...

Summary Heading: BIG WASTE OF MONEY ROOMS LOW GRADE
Summary: I don't mind paying the price if the service and rooms were up to par but the rooms are a joke. I find it absolutely rude to put a family in a box for 700.00 a night. Rooms are drab and feel like you're staying in a Marriott, yes the foyer nice but its a facade once you enter the room you'll be extremely disappointed. Walt Disney would turn over in his grave that this hotel is charging 5x more than it cost to enter his gate calling themselves Disney and taking complete advantage of families all based on location.There is nothing magical about this hotel except for the entry way.  Don't stay here its a sham. There are many nice hotels in the area with rooms much nicer and larger for half the price. Furthermore the reviews are paid writers of the hotel, its so very obvious.  I

Summary Heading: The best place next to Disneyland
Summary: Of all the hotels next to Disneyland with early access to the park and within walking distance, this is the best. Rooms were clean and comfortable and the kids loved the bunkbed. The pool area however is extremely crowded and it is tough to get a seat at certain times of the day.

Summary Heading: Incredible stay - glad we made this last minute decision
Summary: We had originally booked a non-Disney hotel near Disneyland but when we arrived we realized that transportation to/from the park would be more of a hassle than we had expected.  So, at dinner in Downtown Disney - we decided to see if we could get into the Grand Californian - oh, and did I mention our stay included Christmas Day.  Well, our incredible experience started as we were checking if they had a last minute availability.  Will at the front desk was incredibly friendly and helpful.  He found us a good room with minimum hassle and also made a special Happy Birthday button for my wife (it was her birthday the next day).  The room - just a standard 2 queen bed - was very nice.  The entire hotel, including the room, was decorated with a mountain lodge feel - just like it was

Stayed 3 nights while we enjoyed a park-hopper vacation with our grandchildren, ages 5 & 7. The Grand Californian did not disappoint. It was clean with great service, very friendly staff. I left my cap there, they called to be sure it was mine and they sent it to me free of charge. The hotel is beautiful anytime of year but the Christmas decorations made it even more so.

Great place to stay, convenience to Disneyland was awesome.  Everything was special, the staff and location, just what we were looking for.  Kids really enjoyed it, we plan to return next year.  By the way, balconies are big and very safe for the kids too!

Summary Heading: Service in the Main was Poor
Summary: Checkin was a challenge, staff need to smile, Bell Service area, I asked Angel for assistance, I was better off talking to a brick wall, ignored me then told me to join the queue at checkin & make my enquiry there. So whilst Im waiting in the queue, Angel is standing with 2 other staff members talking away whilst I, along with another guest who like me had a simple question which i'm sure could have been answered by the bell staff.  After waiting 8 minutes in the queue, i returned to the bell area & asked Angel the simple question, she turned to another staff member & said "do you want to help him".   Fridge in room needs replacing, compressor cutting in & out kept waking me. This is NOT 5star, its flat out 3star.

Summary Heading: So convenient! Ok room, but worth the money.
Summary: We agonized over where to stay for a recent family vacation. There were 10 of us, and we needed 3 rooms, and at just over $400 per room (that's with 20% discount) we struggled with our decision to stay here. It's something all of us had wanted to do for many years, do we finally decided we would splurge. We were all glad we did. The staff was great, and accommodated our request for rooms close to lobby, (which saved on extra walking after a long day at the park). The rooms were truly just a standard hotel room. The beds were fine. The water pressure in two of the three rooms was very poor. But the two things that made this hotel wonderful for us was the lobby (it's gorgeous) and the fast easy access to Disneyland and California Adventures. It felt like CA was our own private

Summary Heading: Pay for the location, not the room
Summary: We stayed at the Grand Californian hotel for our first trip to Disneyland.  The entrance was magical and the service at check in was excellent.    The room was nice.  it is small for $500/nt but comfortable with a king size bed and a couch.  My toddler loves running in and to the balcony.  Our room faces the entrance so we see a lot of cabs and cars.  The balcony is completely solid so there are no bars for my son to stick his head or limbs out which was good.  It is also tall and at 5 foot 4, i kind of have to tippy toe to see out.  The bathroom was not impressive.  I agree that they should upgrade this.  It reminds me of any 3 star hotel bathroom.  I could not bathe my son in there as the plug for the drain does not plug it completely.  He even pull it out and look at the soft

Summary Heading: 3 Star Room, 4 Star Experience, 5 Star Prices
Summary: I just stayed here for four nights with spouse and two five-year old kids.  To summarize, I would stay here again given the hotel's proximity to Disneyland and DCA and the fact that I think it is the nicest hotel in the area.  That being said, there certainly were things left to be desired.  The rooms are quite small for the price you pay ($500/night for premiere view room) and the service is spotty.  Our room on the fourth floor did not have much of a view despite paying extra for a "premiere" view.  The bathroom was small and dated.  It was quite shocking to be honest. I would have expected at least a proper tub but instead there was a tiny, shallow tub you might find in a Ramada.  The water pressure was horrible.  The room itself was decent but certainly not worth the price.

We stayed at Disney's Grand California Hotel very early into the year and i would definitely recommend it for you to stay at. You couldn't get a better location so close to both the Disneyland theme parks which were very easily accessible.The service was exceptional and the quality of our room was of a very high standard. The Hotel offered a range of different eateries and activities and it provided a magical experience for my family and I. We visited the hotel just after christmas this year so the lobby was filled with christmas decorations and the in the lobby was a beautiful big christmas tree. The staff are also very helpful, there was a problem with one of our tour bookings and when notified they immediately helped us to fix it. Disney's Grand California Hotel truly is an

Pro: location  Cons: The hotel is benefiting from superficial appearances and a reliance on the notion that if it costs a lot it must be good.  Below the surface: The grounds entrance is too small.  There is at least 20 minute wait on surface streets for vehicles (including buses) to get in line for the guard gate.    One elevator for the entire hotel.  Takes forever to get to a room for those of us who are not wealthy or have celebrity status.  Once in our room, the armoire had a broken door, the frig wobbled and would not stay closed.  Don't look too closely in the bathroom area, dust and soap residue on the edges of the sink   One of beds had wads of hair on the duvet. Almost nauseating!!  The phones were sticky and dirty.  Had to clean them.  Little or no soundproofing, had

My wife and I stayed for 3 nights at the Grand Californian Hotel as a Christmas getaway. The hotel is of course costly, but the benefits were worth the splurge. We had a standard room, which was quite sufficient and nice for the two of us. I noticed kitchenettes in other rooms. Access to Disneyland and California Adventure Land is better than ever. Leave the lobby through one door and you're in California Adventure Land. Leave through another door and you're in Downtown Disney for a 5 minute walk to Disneyland. So convenient. No car needed, no parking, just a nice stroll. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. During Christmas weeks all the decorations are up, kids are bountiful and happy and this adds to the festive atmosphere. Santa was center stage during the evenings in the

The Grand Californian Hotel offers a great deal of experience. While it is impossible to take advantage of all of them. The few that we did were excellent. Rooms are very nice, we had a king room on the 6th floor with a great view of Adventure Land. The mail lobby is very grand with a Christmas tree that must be 25 feet tall and Santa entertaining young and old for photos, they were take you own of have the concessionaire do it. Staff, as always at Disney were very helpful and courteous. It is a hotel worth staying in and enjoying a nice experience.

Love the place, this is our second time there in the DVC Villas. This time we had five nights in a two bedroom and then splurged and tried the Grand daddy of them all a Three Bedroom Grand Villas. Great but could have been fantastic, it seems like in both the two bedroom and the three bedroom the Disney repair staff are getting a bit lazy! The cleaning lady that I report the problems too said she had noticed them and reported them and they should have been fixed. Wasn't an issue for us but when you pay the dollars or the points, like us you'd expect Disney quality but it's been slipping. None the less, I am sure they'll fix it if people report the issues.   Even at that, these places rate a five star. The view was fantastic, our folks are elderly and have a hard time getting

If you want to walk right into California adventure park this is very convenient, but as grand as the lobby is don't expect this to be a 4 or 5 star hotel. The steak I had at the restaurant was tough & the service was below average. One morning of our 4 day stay there was only warm water to shower in. The early am lines for park entrance went up & down stairs & around sharp corners so don't attempt this with large strollers or wheelchairs. There is free wi fi but dont expect to catch up on any work while your here as you lose connection every couple of minutes which is extremely frustrating. For the price of staying here I expected more but I guess the location outweighs quality of food, staff & amenities for them.

It is a great hotel and does have a majestic feel to it but it is probably a 4 star hotel asking 6 star prices...on everything!  The basic room we had was spacious enough. Beds were comfortable but need to be queen size not double. The shower part of the bathroom is too small to get changed in but they don't provide addiional curtaining in the vanity area. (Florida does this). It has coffee facilities, ironing facilities and 2 robes. The 6th floor viewing area of California Adventure at night is amazing (and heated).  The services (valet parking is $22 per day) seemed punctual when we used them. Check-in was quick. Check out was even quicker.  Access to the parks and downtown were great.

Summary Heading: Perfect!  Beautiful place with great service.
Summary: Made a last minute reservation to do something special for my kids.  Visit to the hotel did turn out to be a very special experience for us all.  Room wasn't anything exceptional, but was tastefully decorated, clean and had a great view.  The lobby was decorated beautifully for the holidays, complete one evening with a very realistic Santa next to the Christmas tree for the kids the talk to and get pictures with. All the staff was friendly, helpful and professional. Bell service and valet folks were so quick and helpful. Pool has water slide that the kids really enjoyed.  They also had fun in the arcade. Magic hour to DCA was soooooo valuable!  We were able to ride the Radiator Springs Racers 2 times and do the rest of Carsland before the park was open to the public.  We have

Summary Heading: Awesome but bad service, too expensive
Summary: This is an absolutely amazing property.  We went in December before Christmas and spent a lot of time in the lobby hanging out listening to the choirs singing carols.  Our daughter took pictures with Santa Claus.  We got drinks from the nearby bar and relaxed after a tiring day at Disneyland.  Its the closest hotel to either of the Disneyland attractions, and of course early entry is always nice.  BUT... its just crazy expensive.  We paid nearly $600 a night.  Seriously, this is crazy territory for a hotel like this.    AND service is mediocre at best.  You'll spend a long time on hold if you need anything at all.  It took an hour and a half to get room service.  We waited over an hour for a bellman to pick up our bags.  I had to wait in a line 15 people long and over a half

Stayed here with family in December 2013. This hotel has an amazing ambiance especially in winter with roaring fires in main reception area, festive music and even christmas carollers entertaining guests in main guest area.We had two connecting rooms with bunks for the kids. The rooms were clean, spacious and ours had views of the fire works at night. Highlights- -within very close walking distance to Disney land park - private entrance into California adventure park - down town Disney right at your  door step -quick check in -character breakfast downstairs at storytellers cafe -knowledgable staff  -comfortable bedding  We loved this hotel and would recommend it to any one who wants to be in the heart of it all with a touch of class.

You‚Äôre at Disneyland, and yes it's expensive.  The Grand Californian Hotel is probably the best location for all of Disney, and you'll pay for it.  They do a great job and you'll get to enter the park 1 hour before the general public.  Is it worth it?  I don't know.  I guess you do it for the kids, but it was difficult considering the cost.  However, I'm a sucker and we‚Äôll go back.  Quick notes: - If you are there for a weekend, don't bother getting a car.  Take a taxi or arrange for a driver. - Make the most out of the day and especially the 1 hour you are given before the wave is let in. - Early entrance to the park is at 7:00 AM; however, the Fast Pass lanes are not opened till 8:00 AM.  We let the kids ride while a parent waited in a preferred attraction in order to get a

Summary Heading: The location makes it worth it
Summary: The best thing about this hotel is truly the location. You're so close to Downtown Disney, California Adventure and Disneyland. The hotel, especially the lobby and grounds are beautiful, especially around Christmas time. The rooms are nice, but nothing terribly special. They are clean. Lots of people have been disappointed by how dark and small the rooms are, but I found the room to be adequate sized for my husband and I. We had two queen beds (they don't have many kings). The hotel/rooms are done in the Craftsmen style, and is a lot like a national park lodge. There's very little Disneyland touches in the hotel/rooms. Everyone was very nice and helpful. We had a view of the Bressa Courtyard with the monorail outside the window. It was very nice. Very quiet too, considering the
