We just got back from an awesome stay. From check in to check out there is not one thing I would complain about other than we had to leave and come home. Christmas time at the Grand Californian is like no other place. In the lobby the tree was beautiful, the decorations classy and the live music wonderful (both piano and carolers). Our room was fantastic, maybe a little bit smaller than our last visit, but cozy, clean and very comfortable. The location of this hotel is by far the best of all the properties of DLR. And the cast members are all outstanding everyone from reservations to bell service to security guards, everywhere you went it was smiles and hellos. I cannot wait to go back again!!!

This was our family of 5's (3 boys ages 18, 15, and 12) second stay at a Disneyland property during the Thanksgiving Holiday.  Our first stay was at the Paradise Pier back in 2004 I think it was.  We had walked through the Grand Californian to go to California Adventure, and ate at one of the restaurants and thought it was beautiful.  This trip we wanted to stay in the Grand Californian to be closer to the parks and just see what Disney's "top of the line" hotel was like to stay at.  We checked in at about 1:30 p.m. on Saturday.  Timing was good, because there was nobody in line when we walked up, and then suddenly a large line formed right behind us. The person helping us check in was efficient and helpful.  I knew from when I had made the reservations that the hotel did not

We had a double queen room although small nicely and subtly furnished in craftsmen style, the location is key if your near meltdown in the park stop by take a quick swim or soak in the hot tub and recharge! The staff are very accommodating to each and every guest I recommend getting the club concierge snacks all day long wine and beer well worth the cost for this family. I can't wait to stay here again.

Overall, this hotel is great for location.  It is by far the closest hotel to the entrance of Disneyland and has its own entrance for California Adventure.  This is our second time staying at the hotel.  The hotel is indeed expensive and your room is not one you find in the The Four Seasons...it is rather average.  It has a fridge, coffee maker, and hair dryer, but no microwave.  We had a standard room. The cheapest we could get (2 queen beds).  However, we did not pay to be in our room but rather to spend as much time as we could in the parks, so the room itself did not bother us.  Since you are staying on property, you have the benefit of entering the park earlier than the general public.  Hands down a great perk!  We could leave our room and quickly walk to the entrance of

Great location, enormous expectations and very disappointing rooms. I had such high hopes for Disneyland's luxury offering and was prepared to pay for something special on my honeymoon. Unfortunately the room was more like a Travelodge than a Hyatt with not a trace of Disney in the rooms. The early entry to the park was great and of course the convenience of staying right on site was wonderful but I won't be staying here next time.

Summary Heading: Perfect experience in a great location
Summary: We used this hotel as our Los Angeles base for twelve days. The location is superb just a few minutes from both parks and easy eating and service options at Downtown Disney. We chose a standard view room because of the bedding configuration, the park view rooms do not have day beds. The room also came with a balcony which could not be guaranteed until we checked in. The hotel was expensive but worth every penny for the convenience and quality. We purchased annual passes as this was a much cheaper option that other multi day passes, the added benefit was a discount on the accommodation which was a huge saving.  Alamo car rentals made day trips into LA or San Diego very easy.  We would definitely return to this hotel.

Summary Heading: Close to the Park, but that's it.
Summary: They will not deliver your luggage unless you are IN THE ROOM, the TV remote did not work and the TV volume went out all the time.  Why am I watching TV anyway, you ask?  Two exhausted kids from being in California whatever since 7 a.m.  Thank God for the cold beers in the mini fridge.  ALL the employees are awesome.

Summary Heading: Amazing design everywhere you look.  Have kids?... get the roon with bunk-beds
Summary: From the moment you walk in the lobby you will be looking around and amazed at the design of this hotel.   You will not see a hotel like this anywhere in California. You must stay here at least 1 night when you come to Disneyland. I live 15 minutes away from Disneyland and still stay in the hotel every year for my daughters birthdays.   It is that amazing. Relax and enjoy the hotel.   Walk straight into California adventure... (the hotel is inside the park).  Or walk out the side and be inside Downtown Disney.  Another amazing lace to enjoy at night. If you have children, ask for room with bunk-bed.  The children will love this. This is why my daughters want to come every year... and they are now 19 and 21 years old. Excellent service.  A True 5 star hotel.  Impeccably clean. I

Great hotel, close to all the attractions. Staff very helpful and spotless rooms. 24 hour room service can't be beat especially coming in very very late from Disney. Nice that they bring much extra coffee pods even late at night without batting an eye!

We stayed here for a couple nights and LOVED the location. With two little ones under three, being that close was fabulous! The special entrances were really helpful for tuckered out kids and parents. We were going for our daughter's birthday, and I was a little disappointed it wasn't as magical as when we stayed at the Disneyland Hotel. She still got a birthday button, but no autographed photo.     It was lovely, and the architecture was great, but that was lost on the kids.  Like so many have said, it's very Aspen-y so I just kind of associate it with more of an adult hotel than one great for kids.     I was looking forward to the bunk beds since our kids love them, but we didn't get any. We used our vacation club points so maybe that is why we didn't get that specification.

We stayed at the Disney Grand Californian Hotel from 17 Nov - 24 Nov 2013. One can best judge a hotel by its actions rather than words. Our 17yr old son became very sick and needed to see a doctor. We are from Australia and quite unfamiliar with  U.S medical system and were at quite a loss. We rang guest Services and explained the situation to them. Within an hour a doctor arrived at our room. This was an astounding response the hotel had organised. We have travelled extensively and NEVER seen such an expeditious response to a medical condition.  Thank you to Management for their proactive systems in place for these events.  We found the Whitewater Cafe the perfect place for snacks and meals throughout the day. The meals are ordered and delivered within 5 mins of ordering. I

The hotel is in a wonderful location and the staff were wonderful.  I agree with some of the comments regarding looking like a ski lodge, (which isn't necessarily bad), just expected more in terms of ambiance.  The rooms weren't anything special considering the hefty nightly rates.  We had a group of 8 and unfortunately could not get adjoining rooms due to popularity of resort.  I remember spending time at Disneyland hotel years ago and the grounds were some inviting, I was expecting the same.  I guess being surrounded by stores and restaurants in Disneytown, helps to make up for it.  We did enjoy the balcony and being able to people watch and enjoy the music.

For convenience and comfort, I recommend Disney's Grand Californian Hotel while visiting Disneyland and Disney's California Adventure. Yes it's expensive, but if you are going with little kids you can't beat the convenience of staying there. Very easy to return to hotel for naps, forgotten items etc. This hotel in California, is much more convenient than any of the Florida hotels at Disney World to the parks there. The service was great, the atmosphere is nice, we had a pool view. Would stay here again!

Summary Heading: Great stay at a great Disney hotel
Summary: Our experience did not start off well at the Grand Californian.  We are DVC members and were celebrating a birthday and happy to be back at Disney after 3 years without a park visit.  We had a bad check-in experience and even though we booked early, we were given a low room with a poor view.  After talking to a manager, we were given, what is probably the best room in the hotel.  A 6th floor villa over looking California Adventure.  You can see the Ferris Wheel among many other rides and from our balcony, you can watch the World of Color show.  The balcony door closes tight enough where you don't hear all the goings on at the park nearby.  The room was great with a fridge, toaster, microwave and comfy beds.  It is a close walk to Disneyland with a special entrance to California

Summary Heading: Shocked by the great reviews of this hotel!
Summary: This hotel had so many great reviews, I thought that it is bound to be at least acceptable.  Boy was I wrong.  First off, it is dark, dark, dark.  You go to Disneyland and its surrounding properties expecting happy, light, airy, basically fantasyland type stuff.  This hotel is exactly the opposite.  It looks like an old skiing lodge that is dark and dank.    Our room was similarly so dark it was depressing.  None of us could bear being in the room at all. It was also quite small.  Just an overall depressing, small cubicle. The window to the room was directly behind one of the rides at California Adventure.  I mean when we opened our window, you could see the faces of each and every rider on the rides.  That's how close it was.  They had done a good job with sound proofing but it

There were 5 of us and we had a 2 bedroom suite . The rooms are spacious ,the balcony had a  round table that we all were able to eat dinner at. We faced the Ferris wheel in California Adventure and we loved seeing it turn colors all evening long. We were on the concierge floor which provided to be a benefit as 5 people doing breakfast each day gets costly,it's included on this floor along with snacks all day long and a wonderful dessert at 8:pm, along with free pop,beer and wine. If your a family,this is so perfect.  Your also only a short walk to the monorail to get to the park,and the hotel is actually part of the Downtown Disney area. So you can shop,get tired and go right back to your room. For convenience , this is a great place to stay. Yes,it's pricy. But people your in

I stayed at the Grand Californian as part of a work conference.   Everything from the moment I arrived to the moment I left was superb.   The front desk person was very friendly and helpful.  The rooms are amazing and big.  And the hotel is literally next to the park's entrance.   The only suggestion I have for improvement is to expand the hours of the workout room.   It opened at 6am and there was a line to get in every morning.   But overall the experience of this hotel was amazing at it showed Disney at its best.

We celebrated our daughter‚Äôs 21st birthday at Disneyland. The last time we were at Disneyland was when she was only 5 years old. We decided to stay at this hotel, because it was new and we also wanted to experience the convenience of being in the park. The hotel itself was beautiful. It resembled a huge mountain lodge with dark timber beams, lots of windows, and comfortable sofas everywhere. The hotel staff was helpful and friendly. Our rooms were on the third floor that faced the parking lot. The beds were super comfortable and I was amazed by how quiet it was even though there were kids and families everywhere. A short walk to great restaurants and shops was convenient, not to mention how easy and quick it was to get in and out of the park. (Tip: I would pass on the early park

We've stayed here 3 times over the last couple of years and it's always so wonderful.  My only complaint would be that check in takes forever.  You're so ready to throw your stuff in the room and head to Disneyland and you always have to wait in a long line.  But the rooms are great and each room we've stayed in has been quiet and clean.  You just can't beat the convenience either.  It's just right in the middle of everything.  Can't wait to go back!

So glad we spent the $ to stay at the California Grand during our Disneyland trip Nov. 8-11. The hotel is huge, beautiful and very clean. It meant all of our expectations and most of all, location, location, location. It was wonderful to be right there among all the shops and restaurants and just a short walk to the parks. Early admittance is another plus.

Upon check-in, I did not have a clean room until 4:30 in the afternoon.  The maid who came to clean told me she was told to clean another room first.  Check-in is at 3:00.  These rooms are VERY expensive.  The room was very dark and small.  there is only 1 elevator bank in the hotel and you have to walk around the whole hotel to get to your room.  the hotel reminded me of somewhere I would want to stay if I was at the Grand Canyon, not Disney.  We moved to the Disneyland Hotel which has way bigger and nicer rooms and is cheaper.  The demeanor of the cast members was not what I expected from Disney.  Pool was dirty.

This hotel definitely lives up to the Disney standard. We stayed part of our honeymoon in this hotel and received complimentary room upgrade with a balcony and view of downtown Disney, as well as complimentary valet parking. We also had a very nice view of the fireworks that night. The room was exceptional and the hotel is beautiful. Live musician playing piano on the first floor. The adjoining restaurant was great. They definitely made us feel special and i would highly recommend the hotel to anyone.

The Grand Californian is in a fantastic location for visiting Disneyland.  We stayed three nights and enjoyed having quick access to the parks and Downtown Disney.  The hotel itself is gorgeous with a beautiful lobby and grounds.  Our room was very clean and had a decent view of the pools.  Since the hotel caters to families, it is very difficult to get a room with a king size bed.  Despite the fact that our room had dual queen size beds, we still enjoyed our stay.  The Grand Californian is probably very expensive.  We stayed here has part of a group travel package and did not directly pay for the room.  There are cheaper options in Anaheim, but if the cost isn't an issue, the Grand Californian is a great hotel.

First lets starts by saying the bed was comfortable. That was the good.  We stayed in the concierges level. The cast members there were all very nice.   The room, we did not expect paint peeling off the bathroom molding near the door handle, nor did we expect to see mold the size of a small dinner plate on the ceiling. We mentioned this to the front desk and showed them pictures and were given a hundred twenty five refund. Nothing was done to correct this situation. The clock did not work and after three calls to get it fixed it finally was resolved on the third day probably because we were leaving on the fourth day and they didn't want us to leave late. The club consisted of the same exact food everyday, they could switch it up just a little bit. But overall it was convenient

Everything was great. From the minute you check in they are there to accommodate the kids. We had 2 little ones with us. In the lobby by the front desk there are little chairs and a tv with old Mickey cartoons playing so the kids don't get bored during this process. Rooms are fine. They are just the right size like any other hotel room. We faced the park and right outside our balcony we could see the water show in the evening. (SIDE NOTE...Facing the park you will hear rides and people talking on loud speakers til late hours. Also, we heard people singing and found out later they were practicing for xmas show in the middle of the night. LITERALLY AT 4AM, Tis the season I guess. We were there weekend of 10/26/13). Everyone is very friendly. Bathroom had 2 sinks which was great. 1

Summary Heading: Great being near parks, not as much bang for your buck though.
Summary: We had the idea of staying at the Grand Californian hotel because this was our first vacation together as a couple. It was really lovely being near the parks and being able to have early access to parks (although we never used this because we tend to like to sleep) The restaurants and all the amenities are also worth staying here. And we even had a semi-relaxing day at the pool. It's hard to call it relaxing when you are two adults staying at Disneyland hotel for families and children. Which we were not expecting it to be quiet. The staff were all friendly of course- it's Disney after all!   I just think it's a little over priced for what you get. However, the prices for the food in the hotel restaurants were not too pricey in my opinion. I would stay here again, but only if

Summary Heading: Great location, love the Disney magic
Summary: We take an annual trip to Disneyland every October and we have stayed at the Grand Californian for the past several years.  My family just loves the atmosphere in the hotel, the Disney magic that starts the minute you enter the lobby, and most of all, the proximity to the parks.  I keep saying we should try out the renovated Disneyland Hotel but my family does not want to give up the location of the GCH. However, that said, I will say that at the prices they charge, there should be a few things that are provided that are not.  The beds should be queens, not doubles.  The rooms should be bigger (obviously not easy to change at this point) and more (a lot more) rooms should have daybed options.  My family consists of 2 teenagers of different genders.  They are not going to sleep

From the moment we arrived, the service was WONDERFUL, easy access to the theme parks, great that we got early access to the parks. The restarants were great and easy access to downtown. the rooms were clean and large..

I spent almost a week here and it was fantastic. The rooms were very pretty and had a great view. Also, there are great restaurants and it's right next to the park! Plus, there is early entry for hotel guests, you get to go in 1 hour before the park opens! The only down is that there internet connect/box is iffy. Since alot of people don't bring computers there, like actual big ones, it's not a problem. But, we did and it took a while for them to fix it. But everything else was fantastic.

Summary Heading: Not exactly the happiest place on earth....
Summary: I have to start by saying that my better half and I are not exactly new to the Disney experience. I have been a passport holder for over 4 years and recently stayed at the wonderful Disneyland Hotel. Our dream had always been to stay at the Grand Californian Hotel and that dream was made a reality this weekend. My boyfriend reserved us a Premium View room to be able to watch World of Color from our balcony and have direct access to the park in the morning. When we arrived to the Hotel we entered the resort with very high expectations. We were helped at the check in desk very quickly and this is were the nightmare began. The very friendly girl at the front desk advised us that our "Pool" view room was ready. My bf told her our reservation was for a premium view and she changed it

I stayed here for 3 nights in October 2013 with my husband and daughter (who is 3.5 years old).  It was fantastic,  You can't help but smile the second you are greeted by the doorman.  We stayed in the a Concierge Room and it was worth every penny.  The room was large (1 x Queen and bunk beds) and it had a fabulous view of the pool.  It also aloud us to use the Club Guest Room which was fantastic, it was open from 7.00am - 10.00pm and offered complimentary breakfast, lunch, snacks, desserts, soft drink, alcohol and amazing views for the nightly fireworks.    Also, they had nightly book reading time for children.  The only hotel to stay in Disneyland, LA.

While the location is nice and you are as close to the park as you can get, the price is not worth the average hotel room. Very small rooms, we were located very far away from the only elevators available. Very hard to communicate with the housekeeping staff although they were very nice(did not speak english very well). I could get the same room at many other hotels for 1/4 of the price.

After spending the past weekend at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel, I can't imagine staying at another hotel when visiting Disneyland.  It was SO convenient. The hotel was beautiful.  The rooms were just the right size.  The kids had a great time at the pool.  All the cast members from valet, bell desk, front desk, and at the restaurants were great--especially Lauren at the front desk and Deondre at The Story Teller's Caf√©.  I highly recommend spending the money to stay here and if you can, request a room with a pool and park view.  This won't be my last time staying at this property!

We have stayed at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel 3 times and we are overwhelmed each time by the staff and always look forward to our next trip. The hotel is perfectly located for families and park entrance.

Really cannot beat the location of this hotel. It isn't anything over-the-top, rooms are just average, but the convenience is superb!  Traveled with 10 people (6 adults, 4 children). Stayed in three bedroom suite (it really an one bedroom suite with 2 connecting rooms). Rooms are spacious. Each room has a refrigerator and coffee machine (so 3 total). Once again, nothing fabulous but we weren't there to be in pour room, we were there to be in Disneyland!  I am embarrassed by the amount we paid but I must say, it was worth every penny! If you are traveling with small children, staying here is the only way to go.

This Disney property is literally in the middle of both Disney parks. It  is beautiful and perfect. It is very pricey. But, you do get what you paid for with this property. We had two rooms and decided to go for it with the price since we had a short stay and did not want to spend time driving to the park. You get to go early to the park if you stay here which is nice for the crowds. This hotel has it all. You walk outside to multiple pools that are very family friendly and beautifully maintained. Downtown Disney is literally out the door so you can dine and hang out in the evening. We loved the wood, rustic decor. My only suggestions would be to have soda/ice machines closer to the long set of rooms. We had to walk quite a ways and when you are tired that is annoying. Also,

I stayed at the Grand Californian for a 2 day business trip.  The staff on site was amazing.  Check in was a lot easier than I expected, and every time I had a question, the staff had the answer.  I had to use the Bell Service for my luggage, and they were very friendly and made things go smoothly.  My only complaint was on my final night when I found a fairly large bug on one of my pillows.  Needless to say, I used the other bed in my room, but it definitely but a damper on my experience.

Summary Heading: Best of the best in Disneyland resorts
Summary: My family and I go every year to Disneyworld in Florida. This year we wanted to try sonething new. We were not disappointed. We hada two bedroom suite with a wonderful view every night of the farris wheel at California Adventure park. Everything about this hotel is wonderful. So close to both parks and diwntown disney you will not believe it. we had the conciere floor so free breakfast, snacks, beer and wine and desserts, wonderful food and service. The rooms were clean and quiet and the pool was heated and very nice seats to watch your kids from or just relax. I hace no complaints and plan to return next year. the extra magic hours are great and both parks were empty so we rode rides many times durring the week. We did the character breakfast too. It was ok cute for the kids

Summary Heading: Worth the price just for the location
Summary: Stayed at the disneygrand early march 2013 for 3 nights at over $600PN with park view ( sort of ) hotel had lots of charm and very friendly staff ,rooms very clean had a pool view not really park view ,which is what we paid for, although we could see the hollywood hotel,but would only ever stay here for location to downtown disney and parks,otherwise stay across the road for much less and spend more within the parks ,but overall grand hotel nonetheless

Very convenient location within walking distance of both Disneyland & California Adventure. Stayed on the concierge level with breakfast & snacks for the kids. Staff was vey helpful. 2 very large swimming pools to relax after long days at the park. Restaurants geared for children.

We choose this hotel because of its proximity to the park gates and also for the magic mornings and this hotel definitely delivered. The hotel itself is grand and rich with craftsman architecture and the little children nook was a cute touch.  We rolled in around eleven pm and check-in was smooth and quick. The registration clerk took our IDs and issued our room keys immediately so that my husband could get the sleepy DDs(darling daughters) to the room and into bed. She even printed our park tickets at the desk so we won't have to pick them out in line the next morning. When I mentioned that this was a surprise birthday trip for my DDs, she found a few princess pictures and birthday buttons for them too. Our room was littered with little touches of Disney, with a Snow White

This is our fourth visit to Disneyland during the past six years.  We are huge Disney fans!  We have previously stayed at the Disneyland Hotel, Paradise Pier, the Howard Johnson Anaheim and the Ramada Maingate.  They were all great.  But staying so close to the Disneyland and California Adventure entrances made the trip extra special for us. My husband was attending a conference at the Grand Californian Hotel, so we our room was a great price.  Our room was close (but not to close) to the lobby on the third floor.  The room had a day bed for our third child, which was greatly appreciated as we stayed 8 nights. The room was a good size for the five of us.  The double sink outside the bathroom, made getting dressed in the mornings quicker, especially with two teenage daughters.

We stay here as DVC members often. love the spa & pools ,so relaxing  cast members are great in helping you.  When you stay here it's direct access to downtown Disney and the parks.  Before becoming DVC stayed in regular rooms, they are luxurious with bunk beds for kids and the restaurants are tasty but expensive.  Definitely a once in lifetime place to treat yourself and family.

Summary Heading: Sometimes You Should Pay More To Get Something of Better Quality
Summary: One pays a premium for the privilege of staying at a Disney resort, but if you can spare the extra cash, it is recommended if for no other reason than the theming (although other perks such as early entry certainly are valuable).  The GC echoes the style of the Wilderness Lodge at Disney World, but with a less rustic and more arts-and-crafts style.  None of the other California Disney hotels - and few worldwide - are so immersive.  During my prior stay at the GC in 2011, I experienced some hiccups in the service, but this time it was almost perfect (the minor exception being that the front desk on October 18 was unaware that the California Adventure park had added a second showing of World of Color).

Summary Heading: Comfortable luxury, Disney spirit, convenience and pricey!
Summary: First of all, I'm a huge Disney fan and I love staying "on resort" when visiting Disneyland. The Walt Disney Company actually runs this property, so operations are generally smooth. PROS - Has a direct entrance to Disney's California Adventure park. It's the nicest property in the resort. A lot of rooms overlook Downtown Disney (which have fireworks views) or California Adventure, which keeps one in the Disney spirit for the full vacation. Nice huge lobby with live music, live fire, and a well stocked bar. CONS - If going during a busy time, the check-in line can average 5-20 minutes. The valets seemed to get backed up when retrieving vehicles, and there sometimes is a shortage of bell staff to handle bags. I believe that management governs with a "make sure it's covered"

We had not stayed here before, so although expensive we were looking forward to staying somewhere with direct access to the park. Check in was so professional, valet parking, the bellman was polite, explained the check in process, and the registration clerk ‚ÄúChristine‚Äù was the best I have ever encountered. Took her time, explained everything, and treated us like family she went way beyond great. Rooms were good, not huge but sufficient; we overlooked California Adventure, and had a great view of the evening light display from our balcony.

Once we found out that that my DH's yearly medical conference was being held in San Diego, I started planning our first family trip to Disneyland!!  We live in Central PA, and there are 4 of us:  DH (50), DW (Me-45), DD (16) and DS (11). We are huge Disney fans....we are DVC Members, owning at Saratoga Springs in Disney World, FL.  This trip would be my kids' first trip to Disneyland, and DH & My first trip in 21 years!!  We had booked the concierge level at the Grand Californian.  All I can say is...WOW!!  We drove up to the check-in booth, gave them our name, and by the time we drove up to the valet parking....Abbie was waiting for us.  She took us up to the 6th floor, to our room...essentially bypassing the front desk.  We called the bell desk, and they brought our luggage

We stayed 4 nights here last month. It was very clean and you'll never beat the location, it's like staying in the park. The rooms are very clean but sadly not very Grand. The lobby and landscaping are beautiful! This place is a bit too fancy for my taste:valets, turn down service, etc. Overall it was worth staying at least once but my preference is still the Disneyland Hotel.

Summary Heading: Second time to stay here...most likely the last
Summary: This was our second time visiting Disneyland and staying at the Grand Californian.  We love the location...especially with the easy entrance to California Adventure, but the cost is becoming too high to stay here.  Also, this last visit was kind of disappointing.   First off, as expected, our room wasn't ready when we arrived and was told by 3:00pm it would be ready (this is pretty common at Disney hotels).  We checked back a couple of times before 3:00pm, but there was no hope of getting the room early.  However, by 3:40, the room still was not ready, so we went to the front desk and they had to get another (clean) room.  We arrived in the room around 3:45 and opened the curtains to find the sun was brutal...the windows were too hot to touch.  We left the curtains open for

There is nothing better when visiting Disneyland and California Adventure than to stay at a Disney property and Disney's Grand Californian Hotel and Spa is simply the best.  I highly recommend it for three reasons: the staff, the location, and the luxury of the hotel.  Every part of your visit in reference to the staff is five star:  from arriving at valet parking(hopefully you will have the pleasure of meeting Jeremy), to the wonderful people working the registration desk, to the bellmen, to housekeeping, to the staff at guest services, and the entire restaurant crew.  Everyone at the resort knows how to give quailty customer service.  The staff is what sets The Grand Californian apart from everything else around Disneyland.  The second reason for staying here is the location,

Beautiful, spotless, relaxing resort.  However, it's location is it's biggest asset, in my opinion.  Steps away from Disney's Grand Californian park as well as awesome shopping at Down Town Disney.  We had a two bedroom in the Disney Vacation Club building overlooking the park and were able to watch the water show "World of Color" from our balcony.  Yes, I said balcony!  :-). Disney pipes the music in on your television so you get the total experience.  These units can be rented by anyone on a cash basis.  Our unit had two bedrooms and three full baths.  There is one dedicated store located just to the left in the lobby and a small grocery section located in the quick serve restaurant.  I found the selection in both stores to be very limited but you can get by.  We ate breakfast

The Great Disney Grand Californian!  Disneyland and California Adventure Park is always top notch as I am passing down the enjoyment that I experienced as a kid to my two children.  The location of the hotel itself, you cannot beat.  For those traveling with young kids, the location with an entrance to the park is the best option hands down.  Add in the magic hour (get into park 1 hour before opening, for guests of the hotel only), it is a dream situation.  We stayed for only 3 days this trip and scheduled to enter the park at the magic morning opening time (tip: start lining up 1/2 hour before start time as line gets LONG) at 7am.  We would ride, and see the attractions until around 2pm where we returned to the room for a nap break.  After a 3 hour nap, we returned to the park

We just returned from spending 5 days at the Disney Grand Californian and had a wonderful experience. All of the Cast members were fabulous from the front desk, to the bell men, housekeepers, staff at the Hearthstone Lounge and Storytellers Cafe. They were all 5 Star. The location of course can't be beat!  The rooms were spotless. They really don't rate a 5 star because of a few minor things such as water pressure in the shower and a little updating that is needed for the high prices that are charged, but these things didn't detract at all from the overall great experience. I would definitely stay at the Grand again!

Summary Heading: Premium Price, Mediocre Experience - Very UnDisney
Summary: My Sister-in-law was celebrating her 60th B-day at Disneyland so several family members all met up to spend a long weekend at the resort. We choose a Disney property to get early access to the park. We chose the Grand Californian for its awesome, spectacular lobby and its easy access to California adventure - there is a park gate right out the back of the hotel.    At check in we noticed that the lobby was curtained off - and there was a lot of loud activity going on. It turns out they were replacing the carpet! We assumed it would be done in the morning and we would get the lobby back - but no - it went on ALL weekend.   The next morning we went to use the "easy access" gate to California adventure - BIG mistake - there is only one person manning the gate so it took 30 minutes

OK...this from a major Disney junkie...I've stayed in almost every Florida Disney hotel over the years with tons of great stays. Disney properties have always met or exceeded all my expectations, but...My new favorite without a doubt is the GC! This was my second trip to the California parks and the first stay in one of the CA Disney hotels.  Hotel design is incredible...staff outstanding, location to the parks could not be better!  This was a quick two night stay on our way to Maui.  As it turned out, this short stay could have been the main entree.  We upgraded to the concierge level room and were treated like celebrities.  From the personal check-in on the Club level floor to the the Club room with all-day parade of goodies (cont bkfst/snacks/wine-beer-cheese/desserts), to

First trip to Disney. Stayed 3 nights with 3 young boys. The check in was tedious, thank goodness for the TV and chairs for the children to sit , while we waited. The lady at the check in was fantastic, and we appreciated her advise and calm demeanour . The room was small, but we were honestly never there for more than a few hours sleep. Having the direct entry was definitely the big bonus of staying here. We wanted to stay a day longer ,but were told they were full. We transferred to the Disney Hotel, for a night which my 3 boys & Husband  all preferred . See separate review.

What a beautiful hotel. Everyone was so helpful and friendly. Checking in was fast and easy. A small problem with our room request was straightened out immediately and with a smile. The bellman who took our luggage up to the room gave us some very helpful tips about getting around the hotel and parks more quickly. Our room was clean, the beds were comfortable. Each room has a Pack n Play in the closet. That's a nice thing to know if you have a small child.  The main reason we chose this hotel was for the location. It was fantastic to be so close to the parks and Downtown Disney. It was very easy to run back to the room if necessary.  The extra Magic hour each morning was so worth it. We were able to get in lots of extra riding and avoid the giant lines for the most popular

My wife and I stayed here for the first time. We have stayed at The Disneyland Hotel for many years prior. The Grand Californian is over the top in ambiance, service, attention to details. The rooms, while slightly on the smaller size, are still big enough for two people to be comfortable. We had a room on the fifth floor overlooking Downtown Disney. It was not noisy, and with the sliding glass doors shut, we could hear nothing.  Beds were just right for a great nights sleep. If you consider the entire experience, it was well worth the price.

Overall it was a great hotel but I was disappointed with the bathroom space (looks like it could use a remodel or facelift; rotating shower head was kind of weird) and the sorry excuse for a coffee maker.  For the price, I expected a little bit more.  I'm sure the perks of being "front and center" to the California Adventure Park makes up for these little details.  The rooms were adequate but I've stayed in better.  The hotel lobby on the other hand was comfortable and inviting, with lots of room to lounge and sit by the fire.  The staff, as expected, were friendly and very helpful.  We had a very pleasant experience at the parks and Downtown Disney and would stay here again.  But mainly for the location and accommodating staff.

Overall a fantastic stay.  It was expensive but worth the money.  The front desk cast member was very professional and allowed us to check in early.  We had a beautiful room with a balcony overlooking California Adventure.  The hotel has an entrance directly into California Adventure.  We mostly used this for returning to our hotel.  I would recommend going to the main entrance in the AM as they have more staff and the AM rush can be busy.

Summary Heading: Very convenient. Great place to stay.
Summary: I was lucky enough to win a 3-day, 2-night stay at the Grand Californian. The convenience is wonderful and great for families needing a break during the day. The rooms are not overly luxurious, but still very nice. I had a pool facing view which was nice too. I really enjoyed my stay, but I am not sure I could justify spending $400+ a night to stay there on my own dollar.

Hotel very nice, and customer service outstanding,  room could use a much bigger tv, too small for room right now ,  we were upgraded for free to a pool view and an end room, dont get pool room if you want quiet, we asked for something like ballons and or cookies to help celebrate our anniversary, never got anything , not even a pic of pic of mickey and minnie!  Would stay here again if we could get a different kind of free upgrade!

What can I say! This was worth every dollar! Disney should teach everyone about customer service and cleanliness! The room was perfect! Clean, large, quiet at night, easily accessible and comfortable!  The bathroom was big with 2 sinks and a separate commode area. We loved the turndown service. We we able to store our luggage for early check in and late check out. Most of all, all the cast members make you feel like your vacation matters! Thank you Disneyland!

Summary Heading: Most convenient location to California Adventure
Summary: Priciest of the Disneyland hotels, but the only one with direct access to the California Adventure park.  We had a five year old in tow, and this hotel made it so easy to get in. Right from the lobby, down a short hallway, and we were at the entrance made available only to hotel guests. We had breakfast at the Storybook Cafe each morning. I was able to get a table within 15 minutes of checking in with the hostess shortly after the restaurant opened, and once seated I called for the others to come down from the room. Storybook characters made each breakfast a fun start to the day. The rooms are small, but well arranged with two vanity sinks with a separate toilet/shower. We asked for a child's sleeping bag during registration which arrived before we even got to the room, with a

Very nice hotel, but expensive as you might expect.  Self-Parking is across the street next to the Disney Paradise Hotel which is not too far, but still somewhat inconvenient.  We arrived about 1:00pm and check-in is after 3:00pm, so our rooms were not ready, however they still allowed us to check in and they gave us our room keys.  They sent us a text when the room was ready.  We received our first text about 3:15pm and our second room about an hour later.  We enjoyed walking around Downtown Disney until our rooms were ready, then went swimming until dinner.  The pool water was comfortable.  This hotel is probably the most convenient of the three Disney hotels to both parks and very close to California Adventure with only a few steps from the hotel lobby to the park entrance.

Summary Heading: Ok let's be honest, you're paying for location
Summary: I'd love to write a glowing review - because I am definitely a Disney fan - we've taken our kids to Disneyworld numerous times, last year went on a Disney cruise, and now this time we tried Disneyland.  But I have to say the hotel wasn't great.  The location - TOP SHELF - walk right into Downtown Disney and also the separate entrance into California Adventure.  But the service not great, the room was tired, and the coffee was down right BAD. The service - we took the Disney shuttle from LAX.  Outside the front of the hotel is 3-4 lanes of car traffic/valet and then a median, and then the Disney bus stop.  We got off and I see the backs of 5-6 valets, as my husband and I try to get 2 suitcases, 2 car seats, and 2 kids (3 and 5) across to the front of the hotel.  How about some

Summary Heading: Great location but on the expensive side
Summary: This is a lovely hotel, clean and high quality service.  Best of all is the location, on the doorstep of both parks, with a private entrance to one of them.  The pools were great and perfect for a rest and relax to break up a morning and evening session in the parks.  However the price tag really reflects this.  $500 + taxes per night is really rich.  It's very nice, but not sure that nice.

This hotel, beyond a doubt, is expensive.  Look online for deals, coupons, AAA discounts, etc., to reduce your rate.   We were staying here due to our 4-year-old grandson, so all of us could enjoy both the Disneyland and California Adventure theme parks, walk back to our room, rest and regroup, and then go back to the park in the evening.    That plan was awesome.    We took advantage of the extra magic hour, grabbed fast passes for the rides we might want to do later in the day (DO THAT, BY THE WAY....GET YOUR FAST PASSES right away for the popular rides, like the Radiator Springs car races).  We rode the rides with little or no waiting.  That is a nice benefit of staying at the hotel, not to mention walking distance.    The rooms are very nice.  Request a refrigerator....they

Summary Heading: The location is the BEST part!
Summary: We recently visited Disneyland with our 4 yr old and newborn (3mos). Although this hotel was more expensive than staying outside of the park, it was well worth every cent! It was always easy access from any part of the parks and offered 1 day with an early entry. This was the BEST part as it gave everyone in my family a chance to ride Radiator Springs Racers before the park even opened!  Enjoy!

Summary Heading: Fantastic location and serive, but rooms need a bit of TLC
Summary: We spent 5 days at this hotel as part of a family vacation.  The location is absolutely brilliant, especially with younger kids as its proximity to the parks makes it very easy to whip back for a rest.  The weather was reasonably hot while we were there, so we spent a few hours every afternoon by the pool.  The pool is good, but not great.  The table service is uneven - great some days and non existent the next - but the selection is good and once you actually flag down a server everything arrives quickly.  The rooms are a good size, all with balconies, but are a little tired - we had stayed here almost five years ago, and those five years have shown on the wood work - lots of dents and scratches.  There aren't nearly enough power points, the televisions are dated and you have

Disney doesn't let you down. Nice room, mini fridge, over the top service. I have come back from our trip completely satisfied. The bad reviewers need to remember that they are not staying in a castle, they don't have a personal butler, and Mom probably doesn't cook the meals here. Every employee I talked to was more than willing to be helpful.

Summary Heading: Great location and extra magic hour a bonus
Summary: Good hotel and the best thing about this hotel is its location. There is an access point the California Adventure park directly from the hotel and only a short walk to Disneyland entrance. The hotel has a lodge look and feel. The rooms were clean but not overly big. The hotel has extra magic hours so you get to go to one of the two parks an hour early. The park with the extra magic hour changes each day. If you go on a water ride and need to get changed the hotel is close by that you can come in and out of the park. You need to consider whether the location is worth the cost. I can't fault the hotel but it was pricey.

My family and I have stayed at the Grand Californian several times over the last years, and it has always been a treat. It's one of my favorite Disney themed hotels in California or Florida. I love the craftsman style, the open lobby, and, most of all, the location. This is a Disney resort, and so has Disney prices, but also had a great location to the Disney parks and Disney service. But my experience this last weekend left me feeling like I didn't get my money's worth.   Being a fan of Disney parks, you get used to lines - but not in the hotels. I feel that perhaps they have cut back on staff, and it really shows. There was a huge back up at valet to start, they were organized and nice, but had to wait in line for awhile to pull up in front of the hotel and leave my keys with

Summary Heading: Expected more for the cost . . . location must be your #1 priority
Summary: I am a very frequent business traveler - when I booked this hotel for a short vacation break, the cost and pictures reminded me of a Ritz or W hotel room.  While the lobby is beautiful, and the rooms are nice, you are definitely paying for location.   The rooms are comfortable and clean - and similar to a Hilton or Marriott.  I hoped for amenities like real cream for my coffee in the morning vs. the powder stuff or complimentary coffee downstairs in the AM; bed/pillows more like a "heavenly bed"; more insulation between the rooms (yes, we could hear the upset children next to and above us); and a balcony that was at least twelve inches wider than the small table and chairs - not joking on that one - really couldn't use the balcony it was so tiny.  Both nights that we stayed the

Summary Heading: You cannot beat the convenience and location
Summary: I recently took my two teens to celebrate joint birthdays.  Decided to splurge on the Grand Californian Hotel.  I was able to get slight discount with the Annual Passholder rate but it's still pricey.  However, the location is so fantastic for getting to the parks.  There's nothing worse than after long day at  the park having to wait for a shuttle or shuffle to the car in the humungous parking garage.  Spent an afternoon at pool, they really could upgrade the ambiance, and the pool cocktail servers were nonexistent.  Room is average, nothing spectacular, two queen beds, nice linens.  Housekeeping was prompt.  We were located in a Woods view room, near the lobby.  Monorail went right by our window, but you can barely hear.  Overall, it was worth the extra $$ to stay onsite.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but not worthy of the regular rate
Summary: First I have to say we got this room at a convention rate which was very fair. However I would not pay the regular rate for this room. The property is perfectly situated a short walk from Disneyland and California's Adventure but how much extra are we willing to pay for that convenience. My guess is not what their regular room rate is. Other than that the property is maintained well but starting to show signs of a needed remodel. Exceptional customer service from most staff members while I was a guest.

Summary Heading: Sets a standard by which all others should be judged!
Summary: Last year we entered the lobby; held our breath and were totally blown away!  12 months later, here we are again, entering the lobby and being totally blown away again!  I love everything about this grand hotel -- the soaring ceilings, dark wood beams, tiffany-style lamps, cosy fireplaces and scattered lounges, but then I said the same thing last year.   On arrival, the check-in girl was a bit abrupt ‚Ä¶ not like the fantastic guy we checked in with last year.  I‚Äôd booked and paid for a King Bed, Paradise Pier view room overlooking the World of Color at California Adventure Park, and requested one of about 10 room numbers on the 5th floor or similar rooms on the 4th floor (from a downloaded map of the hotel).   Abrupt Girl almost cracked a smile while key-boarding frantically,

We had been wanting to stay at this resort for the last few years but it never seemed to fit into our budget.  Finally, for our fall 2012 trip we bit the bullet and booked our stay for 3 nights.  We stayed in a basic room that had two queen sized beds and a pack n' play crib for our 1 year old. The room was clean and well kept.  I can't say enough good things about this place, honestly you just feel so happy being there. The customer service is superb, the food is excellent and the atmosphere is warm and friends...priceless.  It really is almost like an extension of the park itself.  We took full advantage of separate guest only entrance into CA Land to pack in as much time at the parks.  We did not get to use the pool (which is breathtaking) by choice since both our our

Stayed in a 3 bedroom unit, 3 separate bedrooms with a living room center. Had fridge and sink. Had a pack n play in one bedroom and bunk beds in the other bedroom. Was so perfect!! Had ordered in some groceries for the kids snacks. Loved the location!! If anyone needed to go to room it was right there! The kids loved all the characters. Should tell you, traveled with a 6, 4,2 and 8 month. Very nice hotel., would recommended it to everyone the could.

Third time we've stayed here with our kids, combining 2 days of Park with a night of relaxation.  Rooms, considering the use they get, are beginning to show their age-scrapes on all the furniture, worn carpeting, etc.  Hotel employees, usually friendly and outgoing, for the most part had a "I don't care...I"m making minimum wage" attitude.  We hunted 25 minutes at the pool for a server to no avail.  Finally had to go into the hotel to order drinks and food.  The girl said there were three servers out there but I saw no one.  And it wasn't even that busy at the pool!  Ate at Storytellers Restaurant for dinner.  The buffet was sorry looking, with two choices of salad (fruit or greens) ,greasy potatoes, mac and cheese and a few meat selections. Desserts were sub-par for a $27

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for his first visit to the House of Mouse. The location is excellent- right on Disney's doorstep. For that alone it is worth the 5 star price (especially I imagine with small kids). That's where the value stops I'm afraid. The decor is very tired, the halls and rooms themselves are dark and super-basic (almost budget hotel quality I would say). But really, who spends any time in their room! The food in the hotel was also pretty standard although the service was excellent. Book this hotel with the most basic room at the cheapest rate you can get. The service was friendly and efficient (as you would expect), especially regarding valet parking. Again, yes it's over-priced for the hotel standard but the location and convenience can't be beat.

We have stayed at this hotel several times.  We live locally to Disneyland and have gone for birthday weekends - something special.  This hotel is beautiful, the service has always been great, however, I do find it to be a little over-priced.  And yet, I wouldn't stay anywhere else near Disneyland.   Also, hotels at Disney World could take some courses in cleaning and customer service from our original Disneyland!  I love that they actually offer bunk beds in some of their rooms for families with kids.  This is a great feature if you are lucky enough to get one of those rooms.  With a son and daughter, they don't necessarily want to sleep together so the bunk beds are wonderful!!!  The pool area is clean and they provide towels at the pool.  I also like that they have a small

We stayed in a one bedroom suite at the Grand Californian for 3 nights.  It was a very spacious suite with two bathrooms and a view overlooking the monorail.  The room was very well maintained, clean and very quiet.  We ordered room service one night and that was delivered efficiently and was delicious.  We ate breakfast on site in the Storytellers Cafe and at Whitewater snacks and those were both good.  The staff were helpful and efficient, although getting our bags out from the bell desk on departure took a long time.  The best part of this hotel is the location and the direct entrance into Disney Californian Adventure, which is unbeatable.

As you would expect, Disney has a real winner of a hotel with the Grand Californian.  Storytellers restaurant is a great choice will a killer corn chowder. If you can get up early on a vacation, hotel guests can get into one of the parks an hour before the general public.  The lobby bar does a good coffee business in the morning yet Starbucks is being built in downtown Disney.   Only a couple of suggestions: The wait staff around the pool need more staff or maybe an iPad device to order from rather than the long walk back and forth.  Secondly, the equipment in the gym is visibly rusting apart.   You will love the hotel regardless of my negative comments!

The front desk was very accommodating found us a room with 2 queens. The location is amazing for spending time in both parts and downtown Disney. Lots to do in the area. No car needed. Lobby is quite impressive. Rooms are clean but not updated.

Many of the positive reviews I would confirm.  Great location, thought the room was well-appointed, and the location was ideal.  As an infrequent visitor to Disneyland, thought the location and quality balanced with the price.  Everything else being equal (see below), I'd stay here again, although I'd strongly consider paying for a suite if more than 2 people in the room - the room seemed to shrink over time.  HOWEVER  Others should be aware of what I experienced.  Two issues that made this stay far from "magical".    1)  Room Type.  Specifically reserved (and paid for) a parkview room with what I thought was a king bed / sofa pull out.  When I was checking in, the intro was "we have your pool view room ready".  Yeah, right.  Had to pull up the res on my i-phone, clerk went

Summary Heading: Stay at the Disneyland Hotel Instead
Summary: Location to Disneyland and California Adventure is Excellent. Every single other aspect of this hotel is Terrible. Food = very poor, apart from Napa Rose. Lobby is impressive if you like a "lodge looking hotel" however, the hallways, walls, rooms, bathrooms - basically every other part of this hotel looks terribly old and dark. It feels as though the entire hotel has a dark cloud over it - and this was the comment that one of the staff members behind the front counter made. For the price that you pay at this hotel, it is not worth even half the amount.   Do yourself a favour and stay at the Disneyland Hotel. Yes it is older and is the original Disneyland Hotel, however, it looks a Million Times younger and Brighter and a Much Happier place to stay. As an Alternative, the Hilton

Summary Heading: Rooms need a facelift but you're paying for location
Summary: This is definitely a 4-star quality property at 5-star prices, but you are paying for the amazing location and with little kids who hate to walk, it was worth it for us.  ROOMS- Basic basic basic and decor is tired.  I knew that going in from reading reviews here, so wasn't surprised or disappointed as I knew the rooms were not dazzling.  We had the room overlooking the parking lot which was fine because we paid for that category.  Bathroom is small and functional.  LOBBY- Big and convention-space like.  POOL- 3 spacious clean pools, good chairs, good service by the pool. While we were there they were shooting a commerical on the pool with the slide so that area was closed most of the day.  Hate that!  CONVENIENCE TO THE MOUSE- Couldn't be better!!!  So great to be so close to

Summary Heading: ...upgraded to a room with a bunk bed for my 4 yr. Old grandson!
Summary: ...first time staying at a Disneyland Resort property.  The Grand Californian was perfect for us.  We were there from Sept. 23-25th and enjoyed each day.  This was a trip planned by my daughter for her 4 yr old son...I stowed away with them and basically took photos of their time together.  The hotel was beautiful, clean, and so convenient to entrances at both Disneyland and California Adventure.  Our room was on the third floor and looked out to Downtown Disney's lush green landscape and beautiful water features.  It was refreshing to look out to natural landscape and not another building or rooftop!  The storyteller Cafe was an enjoyable, affordable place for dinner and the small cafe near the  pool area was perfect for a quick breakfast complete with bacon, eggs, and Mickey

We stayed at the Grand California to celebrate my wife's birthday and take part of the Disneyland Halloween Party.  The check in was simple, but my mother in law was given the run around. She registered under the Disney visa package, which came with some fun Disney extras, but the front desk did not know what she was talking about, nor where to send her to get more info. (Sadly, she didn't get the "extras" until the last day of our trip, she had to call Visa again.) Our room wasn't anything fancy, and to top it off, had dirty fingernails left on one of the beds. Ewwww. My mother in law went back down stairs and they offered us a free breakfast at any of the breakfast locations, which was nice.  The room was forgettable. Lots of scratches on the walls and our front door was full

This hotel is a perfect base for your Disney visit. The room was a bit small for a family and it was very expensive but being right on-site makes it worth it. We didn't really do much in the actual hotel but it was great being right next to Downtown Disney and a great choice of places to eat. I think that you have to accept that if you want to stay in a Disney hotel then you do have to pay a premium, I just wish there was a bit more space in the rooms for your cases and clothes etc.

Summary Heading: Concierge Level--The Grand and Not-So Grand
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel before but not on the concierge level--6th floor.  Decided to try it to see if it was worth the money.  The room was a basic bunk-bed room with queen bed overlooking the Disneyland Hotel and parts of Downtown Disney.  It was quiet and located close to the Craftsman Club.  The room was somewhat clean (dried food in the fridge/water spots in bathroom)--the room was worn and needs renovation (carpets, drapes, bedding, tiles in shower).  Upon arrival we did our own "cleaning" with Lysol wipes on all surfaces/remote/phones etc.  The walls are very thin and we could hear "everything" in the next room.  The Craftsman Club was a wonderful place to relax.  We enjoyed breakfast, afternoon tea, evening appetizers, and sweet endings (desserts)...plus all the

Summary Heading: Love the location! Hotel was nice but probably not again.
Summary: We vacation at Disney every few years and always stay at the Disneyland Hotel.  This year we thought we would try the Grand Californian as the location always looks so appealing.  And we were right, the location is fantastic!  Private entrance into the California park and 2 minutes to the front door of Disneyland.  However the walk from the Disneyland Hotel to the monorail is about 4-5 minutes and to the entrance of Disneyland about 8-10 minutes.  The hotel is nice, the pools are nice, the restaurants are nice.  But the rooms are dated compared with the renovations of the Disneyland Hotel.  In addition the staff at Disneyland Hotel is unmatched!  Although you can't go wrong with the Grand Californian Hotel, next time we will be back to our old standard (with the upgraded room!)

Spent 4 nights here after an issue with another hotel, (see my review on the Hyatt Regency Orange County).  Registration is busy but they get you sorted ASAP and with a smile. Kids are entertained with their own TV and small chairs in the lobby area. The girl that checked us in suggested we switch from a 2 queen bed room to a Queen bed with bunks, which suited us much better. And with no increase in prioce!!! The staff fussed about my daughter who was celebrating her birthday which she really liked.  Cafe/resturant options in the hotel are good.  Food and room prices are at Disneyland rates so if you look at things that way they are okay.  Room was large clean, and comfortable. We all slept well and enjoyed our stay.  Hotel location is great and the pool was a welocome break

We recently stayed at the Grand Californian on a visit to Disneyland Resort. It was a beautiful hotel! I loved all the detail and the close proximity to everything Disney, (Disneyland, Downtown Disney and Disney's California Adventures) is amazing! We are Disney Vacation Club members so we stayed there on points. But if we hadn't, I would have gladly paid for it for everything they offered.  The DVC rooms have a great view of the California Adventure park. We could see and hear the World of Color from our balcony, but when the door is closed you did not hear anything. The room was very spacious and beautiful. We enjoyed the Heathstone Lounge in the hotel as a place to unwind at the end of the day.

My wife, grandson and I just got back from three nights at the Grand Californian in Anaheim. We had a great trip but I found the disney atmosphere to be very lacking from when I had taken my children some time ago. To me, the Disney name always stood for excellence in service and while some of the employees at the hotel were what you'd expect the general feel was not what it once was. Staying at other hotels with a similar price commanded by the Disney company the service was far superior to what we experienced. As I had read in other reviews prior to our deciding to stay on the grounds and we decided convenience would definitely be a major factor.  To do it over again we would probably stay again but the title says it all.

We just stayed at the Grand Californian in Anaheim and absolutely LOVED IT!!  Honestly, the rooms are very expensive (by our middle-class standards) but so worth it.   My husband and I were celebrating our wedding anniversary and purchased Annual Passes and then made the reservations and got 15% and 20% off the room rate as passholders.  The room was well-appointed and the bed (king-size) was MASSIVE.  Bigger than my California King at home!  The bed was always freshly made up and chocolates put on our bed when they came for the turn-down service.  Our bathroom fan wasn't working and when we finally noticed it, they sent out a mechanic right away.  He was unable to get it working and the next day we received $150 credit towards our 3 night stay and the offer of moving rooms.  We

This was our first time staying at a Disneyland Hotel.  Normally we stay across the street.  It was a lot more money, but well worth it.    Check in was a breeze.  Nice young man that welcomed us and had a little treat for each one of us. The lobby is amazing as are all of the stores, activities and staff.  Valet parking was amazing and worked well.  Movies for the kids in the lobby, a child care centre, great stores and restaurants.   Our room had a view of California Adventure Park with a balcony and table and chairs.  We had a queen bed,  a bunk bed for our boys, table and 2 chairs and a large dresser.  The beds were very comfortable! What I loved about the room was the amount of space we had.  I was able to fully unpack 3 large suitcases and store them out of sight.  There

This hotel is all about LOCATION  You cannot get surpass the location of this hotel. Has direct access into California Adventure Park and Downtown Disney.   Rooms are clean but dated. A bit on the small side.   The price tag put on this hotel is for the location which can't be beaten

I will start by saying that The lobby is absolutely beautiful, and they have some great pools.  The decor does carry to the rooms, but the rooms are just nicely decorated ordinary rooms.  We got a good deal and still spent $350 for our one night stay.  When we arrived we were not welcomed in a Disney manner, however they did take our luggage early so we could go ahead into the parks and then texted us when our rooms were ready.  We then had to pay $6 to print out our Disneyland passes that we had bought online.  When I suggested that this was silly when I was spending over $300 for less than 24 hours in a room the concierge rolled his eyes at me and told me this was standard hotel procedure.  The next week we returned to Disneyland with our kids, stayed just down the street for

At first I was really nervous about our 6 night stay in Disney's Grand Californian in a family room at the end of our recent 3 week holiday to California.  Up until that point on our holiday we had always selected 5 star properties and had 2 interconnecting rooms to give us some adult time away from our 3 small children.  But, we were really pleased with our family room and our decision to stay right in Disneyland.    The room was large and very clean.  The bunk beds/trundle suited the ages of our children - 7, 9 and 3.  The staff in the hotel were fantastic - always happy to assist and answer questions.  Likewise, the location was perfect - after big days at the parks there was no way I could have faced a commute to another hotel.    We would highly recommend this choice to all

Just stayed at this amazing hotel for a few days for Grandson's 4th birthday!! The hotel is lovely, cozy and amazingly authentic to the Craftsman style.  The staff was so helpful and nice, the room was outstanding with a view of Downtown Disney. Which is a lot of fun to sit outside on the veranda at night and listen to music and watch the goings on. The room is very comfortable, clean and cozy. A nice flat screen and a comfortable bed. It was very quiet for sleeping, but if you go to be early the music can be heard from down below if you choose that side of the Hotel. Room was a bit far from the elevator but worth it.  Easy access to Disneyland and California Adventure!!! Very Pleasant stay, I highly recommend this hotel!!  They made the birthday boy feel very special!

We more than enjoyed our stay at Disney's Grand California hotel.  It provided us easy access to everything around Disneyland and California Adventure.  The rooms where nice, but we would have preferred a rollaway bed which is not an option.  They did upgrade us to a room with bunk beds and a trundle but only a queen size bed for us.  We prefer a king for more space.  Housekeeping was great and there was also turn down service at night.    The resort offers evening activities for children, but from the ages of 5 - 12.  I understand potting training issues but make that a stipulation of admission.  My husband and I would have liked to try Napa Rose for date night, but we had a nice dinner at Naples in downtown Disney.    After a long day it was great to come back to the hotel and

We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of a 3 week holiday from the UK. From the moment we arrived at the hotel we found the service to be excellent - from the porters, valets, reception and house keeping. Everyone was extremely helpful when we checked in (which was quick and easy). The receptionist noticed it was my husbands birthday, he gave him a small gift and made a fuss. Later that evening the turn down service had made a birthday display on our bed and left  a towel in the shape of a birthday cake.  These are all very small gestures but having stayed at other Disney hotels in Florida and Paris where we have been celebrating and not had the same service, it was certainly appreciated. All the staff always had time for us and no request was a problem. Our room was very good,

I can not express how great this resort is! The check in process was quick and our daughter got a little gift upon arrival. Our room was great, super clean and set out perfect, our beds and pillows have been the best I have ever slept in. Every staff member we came across was super friendly and nothing was ever a drama. Clothed washing facilities were excellent (and cheap!). Location of the resort to both parks is EXCELLENT! We stayed for 6 nights and used everything the resort has to offer. We never left the resorts/downtown Disney/parks area at all during our stay. Check out was so fast   aswell! This resort is worth every cent and I am more than happy we stayed there, we will definitely be back to stay.

Summary Heading: Our Hotel of Choice For Disneyland Vacations
Summary: This hotel is great all around.  The location is prefect for tired little feet.  The 1920's Craftsman theme is stunning, from the outside, to the lobby, to the guest rooms!  There are multiple dinning choices on property, one of them boasting a character dinning experience and the food is wonderful.  It's very pricey to stay here, making it a true splurge for my family, and something we cannot do very often.  However, it is so worth it!  I've stayed in a guest room with two queen beds, and also the guest room with one queen and a bunk bed with trundle.  Both types of room felt spacious and high end with the d√©cor and furnishings.  I have always found the beds to be comfortable, with one exception, and that was when I had to sleep on the bottom bunk of the bunk bed.  Not made for

Hospitality was phenomenal. Which it should be, since it was Disney. The room was kind of normal, but for the price, I expected more. Only a 2 cup coffee maker, no microwave. Robes were available after showers. Still for the price I was not impressed, by the room, or the offerings. This is a high priced room, located directly on the Disney Grand Adventure property. The building was Grand, in all of its decor, with a fireplace, a pianist, and the people, (cast members), were the best. The hotel was set up quite well for handicapped people, which I needed for my wife. The pool had a chair that would place a handicapped person into the pool. Out of the wheelchair, into the simply operated lift, with a seat belt, and place the person, right into the pool, or spa. All areas were

Stayed here 8 nights, leaving today, sad to be going, we had a two bedroom villa in the hotel (room 2506 )  with  three bathrooms ( 2 ensuite' s  ) master one  being huge, 2 large bedrooms, one with two double beds in,  master with kingsize bed and more drawers than you new what to do with, large open plan lounge /kitchen/ dinner with full oven microwave and dishwasher. Had double pull down bed in the lounge for extra guest. TV'S in all rooms, washer & dryer, ironing board & iron. Two balconies and a fantastic view overlooking the disney park, we could see world of colour show from our balcony's. clean rooms, comfortable beds, good AC, easy access to both parks, fantastic swimming pools, Downtown disney on you doorstep with lots of restaurants and shops, ( could do with a bigger

We just stayed for 2 nights last weekend, and are so glad we did. We always swallow a bit at the price, but as passholders we get a bit of a discount.  This time, we asked to be moved to a room overlooking the monorail, if possible, and someone actually came up to the room we'd been assigned, met us, and walked us over to the new room with a perfect view of the monorail.  The rooms are spotless; the mattresses look new; the linens are lovely. We enjoyed the balcony (the monorail! the monorail!) and peeking down on the bride and groom who'd gotten married in the afternoon in the courtyard below.  Sometimes we stay elsewhere, but probably won't do that again. The experience at the GC is multitudes better than anywhere else in Anaheim.  It's a quiet, peaceful respite, with a lovely

Summary Heading: So Happy I chose the Grand Californian
Summary: Great hotel  -  met all my expectations.  Nice and clean.  We had a back facing view which was a bit disappointing.  Would have been nice to be able to see the parks instead of looking over a parking lot.  The hotel is wonderfully done out and very comfortable.    Private entrance into Californian Adventure park which was great.  The Disneyland entrance is a leisurely stroll through downtown Disney.    We loved our stay here and would definitely return to the Grand Cali if we came back to Disneyland.

I probably never would have stayed at this hotel but Disneyland was running a military special and I am retired military and so the savings allowed me to stay here with my wife, son and daughter in law and their family.  The first thing I noticed when I entered the large entry area was that it was quite dark.  I remember as a child hotels being like this but I think they were saving money on electricity or trying to create an ambiance. There were fireplaces in the lobby area which brightened things a little bit.  The check in process took much longer than was needful with the desk clerk asking everything from shoe size to political affiliation.  OK that was an exaggeration but it seemed the questions were meant to increase their knowledge of you in the Disney database, second

We stayed here for the fall Dapper Day event, so we qualified for a group discount which makes the stay much more affordable.  We checked in very early, around 8am, to take advantage of Magic Morning entry.  We were surprised to be given a room that early in the morning!  Service was fantastic - housekeeping even stopped me on my way out the door to give me extra chocolate and a little cake made of washclothes when she spotted our "Happy Anniversary" buttons!  It's touches like that that remind you you're on Disney property.

Summary Heading: Avid GC Stayer & Disney Enthusiast w/ Little Kids Review
Summary: The Grand Californian (GC) gets you hooked upon entry because its...grand...quite literally.  It's a blend of comfy cabin meets secluded harvesty fall feel and it makes you want to cozy up near the fire (which they have) with a book and doze off to never never land.    What you pay for is the location, the atmosphere, and the cleanliness ... The rooms are tiny.  We recently splurged for a three bedroom suite which was really three corner connecting rooms they opened the doors to... I mean for nearly 1200 a night that's it?  It wasn't awful but it was no suite.  Still... It is clean which goes a long way for this OCD mama and the location to the park is amazing ... So if you have the doe you won't regret it but don't hold your breath for "grandiose" rooms because they aren't ...

I have stayed at nearby hotels within walking distance of Disneyland, but this was my first time staying in the park. What a difference! The Grand is very easy access to Calif Adventure side so for a quick trip in for one ride or two it was a short walk from our room. Also convenient for night shows (World of Color) also in Calif Adventure when you're tired and don't want to walk far.  The hotel is beautiful and very spacious. The pools were not crowded when we were there and the guards made it easy to leave the kids to do their thing for a short time. The room with partial downtown disney views was great for us, gave us a pulse of the activity and noise was not a problem at all. Room service was used once and was great.  More than anything, all of us agreed these were the most

Summary Heading: Turn of the 19th century elegance with modern amenities and style
Summary: Disneyland has really outdone itself with this hotel, which really should be called a lodge. The building is beautifully crafted and decorated in an Arts and Crafts motif, making you feel like you've walked back in time as soon as you enter. Large wooden beams abound, and a giant rock fireplace adds warmth. Although we were not traveling with children, one of my favorite parts of the lobby was the child's TV area with mini Adirondack and rocking chairs - too cute!! The staff (or cast members as they are called) are incredible. At every turn, we were greeted with a smile and asked if we needed anything. Check in was very quick and parking was a breeze.  If there was anything bad to say about this hotel it is that it is very large - and can be somewhat easy to get lost. We

The location for this hotel is great but you will pay extra to have that convenience. The staff is very friendly. The rooms are nice, clean and comfortable. The swimming pool is big. This hotel is located in Downtown Disney which is close to a lot of the restaurants and shops. It also has a private entrance into California Adventure. I've stayed here twice and will stay here again.

First off, I want to say I'm not going to discuss the price of this hotel as that topic has been covered in great detail, it's a matter of personal choice and I think it's pretty obvious why they are able to charge so much.  Overall this is a beautiful property with a very attentive and friendly staff.  The only area where I would deduct stars is the registration desk as it appears to be understaffed.  During the day there almost always seemed to be a line, when we checked in we were fortunate that the line was short as it was midweek however we still waited about 5 to 10 minutes.  I must say that the lady who "worked the line" was extremely pleasant and cheerful, her interaction made us feel very welcome.  They simply need a few more people working the windows to resolve this

Stayed one night at this hotel and had a great experience.  Was able to spend some time in the afternoon poolside, which was great.  The waiter was very attentive and the skinny coconut mojito was very good.    Had an appetizer and drink in the lounge area before heading into the park for the evening.  Was disappointed that the restaurant closed so early (10:00pm) which meant that we had to order room service.
