Room service was fine, they were slow because of the number of people they were attending to, but I didn't find it to be any more expensive than any other hotel I've stayed at.    The bed was very comfortable.    A great stay, though I wasn't paying the full rate thanks to my cast member companion, I'm not sure I would have felt it was worth the full rate.

I really cannot recommend this hotel.  Our reservation was for concierge level and we were placed two floors down.  We did have concierge service but had to go up to the 6th floor each time.  They were not apologetic about it either.  The rooms are very small and the bathrooms are too small.  Part of our room was flooded from the room above one night.  We were not moved only given a free meal.  This was really inexcusable especially for Disney.  I have stayed in Disneyland Hotel in the past and it is much better.  One big draw they use for advertisement for this hotel is that you can go directly into the park.  There is normally only one or two people working and the line is extremely long.  It was quicker to walk all the way around and go in through the main entrance.  It

This is a great hotel, borderline luxury in nature if it wasn't overrun with children (mine included).  Rooms are very nice and clean and with the proximity to the Disney Parks it gives you a leg-up on the hoards of fellow park-goers.  Plan on dropping a little coin... everything about this property is expensive.

My wife and I stayed at the Grand Californian on a Friday & Saturday night during the Disneyland Half Marathon Weekend. The main reason we chose this resort was proximity to the race start/finish and just to finally experience "The Best Disney Hotel In California".  We got a special rate through the official race travel company, GET Travel, $816, including taxes, fees etc (2 nights). Paid 8 months in advance but that was our choice.  Could have paid balance in July.  We have stayed at other Disney properties.  The Paradise Pier and The Disneyland Hotel in Anaheim, The Grand Floridian, the Yacht & Beach Club and the Port Orleans in Florida, and this hotel was the biggest disappointment.  Granted, our expectations were high it being "The Crown Jewel" of Disney Resorts.  What we

The location of the Grand is ideal if you have children and will be going back to the room in the middle of the day. However, rooms are small and the hotel lacks they magical feel of the other hotels. If you have older children that don't mind walking a little further I would recommend the Disneyland Hotel. It has magical light up headboards, great pool, large rooms and characters roaming the property.  The Grand lacks all of these.

I was so excited to be staying at Disney's Grand Californian and had very high expectations.  The rooms were a bit on the small side, but they were clean and comfortable.  The hotel itself is beautiful.  I was blown away by the lobby which has a large fireplace, vaulted ceilings, and a piano player to set a happy mood.  Absolutely "grand."  The hotel hosts guest activities each day such as early morning power walks, scavenger hunts, outdoor movies...enough to make a trip to the parks unnecessary.  Speaking of parks, the distance to both parks is great.  There is even a special entrance into Disney's California Adventure through the hotel.  Very convenient.    The reason I did not give this hotel an excellent review is, surprisingly, because of the employees or, cast members, as

This was my sixth consecutive trip to Disneyland and the last three trips we stayed at the Grand Californian. We love it! We don't want to stay anywhere else! The location is amazing! The service is great! The hotel is clean and the staff is friendly and helpful!

We stay in Anaheim quite often and really prefer to stay in disneyland hotels but price plays a part when your paying top dollar for mediocre üòû Rooms are clean and convenience to dland parks is perfect!!! But...how about A/C shuts off with no movement in room. So, if you're sleeping, you will not have A/c bcuz no movement in room. Had to call maintenance to fix 2x in middle of night üòûüòûüòû Save ur $ and stay at dland hotel or paradise pier.

Summary Heading: Great location and Disney service is worth the splurge.
Summary: Great hotel in the heart of the Disneyland Resort.  Beautifully decorated decor and outstanding Disney service. Clean.  Friendly staff. Awesome to have access from the hotel right into the California Adventure theme park. Their Napa Rose restaurant is worth every penny for a world class meal.    I only have two complaints. One - their AC/Heat system is not intuitive.  Two - they seem to have a problem with their fire alert system.  On previous occasions I have been staying at other Disneyland Resort hotels when the alarm was going off at the Grand Californian.  On my recent stay there was no full alarm, but before 8 AM there was a siren and an announcement (that cycled through in three different languages) that wouldn't stop saying that there wasn't an emergency and it was a

Summary Heading: Make the most of your Disneyland experience
Summary: The Grand Californian is one of the three hotels in the park itself. There benefits of being a guest at these hotels.  You can enter the park one hour before the general public.  If you have family (especially young ones) the day is easily split.  We had three young children and my youngest was able to go back to the room for a nap while the other two could stay at the park or have a swim in the amazing pool with waterslide. Then we could head back to the park for the cooler hours in the afternoon.. I recommend the story tellers cafe for breakfast once. It was so much fun, the food was great and the kids got half their autograph book signed by the characters. The hotel is lovely and the children enjoyed the Disney chocolate left on their pillow at turn down each night.

We stayed for 4 nights and enjoyed our entire stay!  We arrived at 9am thinking we would have to store our belongings, but lucked out!  They had a room ready and only steps from the elevator. We soon headed straight for the parks. The location was great since we had several character meals reserved and a 3 year old that needed a daily nap.  We are a family of 5 and had plenty of room.  I would highly recommend staying here if it's a one time trip, as was ours.

Summary Heading: Fantastic hotel close to all the Action
Summary: Went for a stay with our grandson...first visit for him and my wife to the DLR. beautiful lobby, rooms are Californian Craftsmen Style furnishings...great location for families traveling with preschoolers going to Disneyland or California Adventure.  We found getting around very easy as everything is within walking distance...both parks and Downtown Disney.  Character breakfast every morning....meals a little pricey but its California.  Private viewing deck for World of Color show was quite nice.  Recommend the Disneyland Resort for a first trip to Disney Parks if you're traveling with pre-schoolers. You can go back to room in the afternoon for naps or a break from the crowds.  Our grandson loved listening to fireside story teller and sitting with his "friends" in the lobby

Summary Heading: THE place to stay in Disneyland
Summary: A beautiful hotel and the location cannot be beat.  It's worth the price for the ability to walk into Disney's California Adventure and for the benefit of the Extra Magic Hours.  The hotel was lovely, the rooms have been updated since our last stay in 2010.  We had a room with two double beds and a daybed, which was perfecct for our family of four.  Service was very good, concierge was helpful and the lines to check in and check out were quick.  The pool is very popular and can get crowded, we were there after 4pm so the crowd was thinning out.    Because both parks are so close, we were able to park hop and stop back to the room whenever we needed to with little interruption to our busy day of touring.  It is very convenient.  We also enjoyed White Water Snacks.  Mickey Waffles

Last year we stayed at Candy Cane Inn because of the great reviews & we weren't disappointed, but the walk to & from the hotel (or even using the shuttle) takes time and a lot of energy.  If you have the money, stay at the Grand Californian.  It just makes life so much easier.   Every step of the way, we were satisfied - from check in to check out.  Room service was efficient, and if they were busy, their time estimate was accurate.  Pools were great, servers & lifeguards were attentive but not intrusive.  Room was clean, linens were good.  Next time I would request a room near the pool and closer to an elevator.  We had a long walk to our room.   Funny story now, but not then:  Not all stairwells lead to an exterior exit!!! We found one set of stairs that took us just behind

Great location, good-size rooms, mostly clean, layout can be a little confusing without map.  Our club-level concierge was great.  Forgot her name, unfortunately. Club level had some serious issues:   They had no record of my tickets, thought I was holding a print-out of my purchase and reservation from their system, so we didn't get the souvenir tickets we had purchased.  When the lounge door opened, people from other floors would sneaking in to take the "free" food and alcoholic beverages. One night there was a group of 5 people waiting to get in when the door opened and the two Disney employees at the desks did nothing because they were playing on their computers.  Also, a group of parents moved the furniture in the already-small lounge and laid blankets on the floor so their

Excellent service. People really went out of their way to help and were happy. Bags from valet 4 minutes, early check in to room 5 minutes, dinner room service 22 minutes. Rooms are very comfortable and quite. Beds very comfortable.  Perfect location to the park. My three year old walked entire park and back to hotel. We really enjoyed it. My only suggestion Is for the pool employees to monitor rude people that just throwdown towels then go to the park trying to reserve their chair all day at the swimming pool because there's not very chairs considering the size of hotel. Other than that it was fantastic.

We've stayed at the Grand Californian for several days over Labor Day weekend for 6 of the last 7 years for the Disney Half Marathon weekend. The stays in 2007, 2008 and 2009 were exceptional. 2010 and 2012 were very disappointing considering the cost of the room.  2013 was a return to exceptional.    In 2010 and 2012, we were given rooms were very far away from the elevators overlooking the parking lot. The rooms were noisy, far from the lobby, in disrepair (shabby carpet, chipped tiles in bathroom) and not very clean. The hallways were never vacuumed during our stay and room service trays sat outside doors for hours before they were picked up. Not what you would expect for a cost of more than $300/night. Both years we made calls to the front desk for air conditioning issues,

My boyfriend and I have stayed at the Grand Californian twice in the span of 5 months. We stayed there for Christmas in 2012 then again for my 30th birthday in April 2013. The first visit, we had a premium view room of California Adventure. From our balcony, we were able to watch World of Color each night. We were a little worried about sound from the park either keeping us up or waking us up in the morning. We actually had no problems with this at all. Obviously Disney thought this one out and the rooms have ultra thick windows to cut out park noise in the rooms. My boyfriend actually had no idea we were staying at the Grand Californian for Christmas. It was his Christmas present. The staff helped make the surprise that much better with having our room decorated and not

Spent a couple of nights here as part of our California honeymoon (couldn't travel down without visiting Disneyland) and stayed for two nights. On checking in after a dreadful Friday rush hour drive from Pismo Beach, all stress was immediately extinguished by the smile and welcome of the front desk staff.  On learning it was our honeymoon, we were given a host of goodies (badges etc.) that whilst of low value, meant the world to us!  The room itself was quite basic, but clearly aimed at families which the hard wearing implications this imposes on decor.  But to be honest, you are not at Disneyland to relax in your room - with the location, early access privileges and general feel of never leaving the magic unparalleled.  We felt like kids for two days and loved it.

Summary Heading: Glad we went for the splurge
Summary: After debating on if we were even going to to go Disneyland this year, my husband and I opted to not only splurge for the Grand Californian Hotel, but to splurge for a park view room and boy did it no disappoint.  We checked in early but our room was not yet ready.  We were able to get our keys, store our luggage and they would text us our room number as soon as it was ready.  Now, i was hoping to get some type of view but when we got our text right around 3pm, we looked at the map and saw it overlooked Paradie Pier.... couldn't have been more thrilled.  Others have ocmplained that the rooms are small and dark, and it was dark but for just two of us the room seemed quite spacious.  Everything seemed to be in really good condition, the room was clean and crisp.  The bed which was

This was our family's first trip to Disney. I've been before, but only before kids. Before the trip, I was somewhat dreading the whole thing. I love the idea of Disney, the fantasy, the theme, the magic, but as I've gotten older, I dread the crowds The idea of sitting in lines forever under a hot Californian sun was not terribly appealing. Well, the vacation turned out to be wonderful and booking this hotel was one major reason why. Yes, it's expensive but what do you get for it? Location and one extra "magic hour" per day that allows early entry. One extra hour may not sound like much, but it makes a huge difference. Although not every ride is open, all the major rides are during this time. This allowed us to hit California Screaming twice and Soaring over California once and

Summary Heading: Great for the Half Marathon Weekend
Summary: I really enjoyed my stay at the Grand Californian. There were 7 of us running in the Disneyland Half Marathon events (3 in the 10k, and all 7 of us in the half), and you really couldn't beat the location of this hotel to both the start and finish lines. It's right in the heart of Downtown Disney, and everything was a leisurely walk away. The only qualms I had was that our room was located right next to the swimming pool restrooms, and if you were trying to nap during the day, you could hear the banging of the stall doors; also, sometimes the A/C was really turned up and it was extremely cold walking through the lobby. Despite either, it was a great stay!

We always stay at this hotel when we visit Disneyland. We also always stay on the sixth floor which is the concierge level. They have a lounge on the concierge level where you can watch the nightly fireworks (they even pipe in the music from the park) from, while having complementary glasses of wine or after dinner aperitifs and snacking on home made cookies and other goodies. They also have soft drinks and juices for the little ones. It's pricey but worth it to us.

We decided to splurge once and stayed here. I will never stay anywhere else when visiting Disneyland.  This is the best hotel, the best service and you cant beat the location.  Im disabled and cant walk a great distance at one time. Disneyland is no problem as you walk to a ride, stand and repeat. But when your done in the park about the last thing I want to do is walk a mile or more to the hotel. Or even worse walk to the bus pick up and wait half an hour in the heat to get on a bus full of tired cranky people. I want to take a quick walk to my hotel and get right to relaxing.   Beautiful rooms and if you can afford it go for the concierge floor do it! Great food several times a day and as many drinks as you can get down. Well soda water etc. They do have a wine and beer

As a kid, I was a frequent visitor of Disneyland, so I knew that taking my 6 year-old and husband needed to be special. Neither had ever been, and I wanted them to feel every bit of the magic. I chose the Grand Californian, because I didn't want my husband overwhelmed. (We are a quiet family.) It was a great choice. The location was perfect. We walked everywhere, and were able to play the entire vacation "by ear", which is important when bringing kids. Whenever we got tired, we went to the hotel for a swim. There was a bedtime story every night by the giant fireplace in the lobby, and my daughter loved that. The character breakfast at Storyteller's was highly overpriced. We spent $80 for the 3 of us, for average buffet food and Chip and Dale signatures. We ended up seeing them

Summary Heading: Best Concierge Club Lounge Service among all that I've tried
Summary: Loved the location - attached to Disney's California Adventure Park and Downtown Disney, and only a short stroll to Disneyland. Makes you feel like you're in the center of it all without feeling overly crowded.  The lobby was amazing - the most comfortable, relaxing and well-used of all the Disney resort properties. The rocking chairs in front of the huge fireplace attracted people of all ages, and made them reluctant to leave.  Food was outstanding, no matter what type of restaurant you visited.

The hotel check-in staff were exceptionally friendly and what a lovely way to start the stay. The hotel is like a large wooden lodge and you have to pinch yourself to remind yourself you are not in the Rocky Mountains. The room was nice, beds were really comfortable, clean and well appointed. But remember, you didn't come here for the room...you came to play in the park and that is what you will do ..with ease and convenience. It takes no time at all to walk to the park entrance from this hotel. The restaurants are good, not overly pricey for this kind of a place. You are also right on Downtown Disney street and there is a lot of shopping and lots of eating places too. There is a bar fridge in the room and you can get fresh milk and snacks eg bagels and bread at the little store

We stayed at the Grand for 3 nights.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.  The rooms are quite nice.  We had read other reviews saying the rooms were showing their age.  Our room was great with a bunkbed for the kids and a trundle bed for an extra person(must be a small one!).  We requested an upper floor, got 4th of 5(the 6th is concierge level).  We also requested a room away from the elevators, not a problem and a theme park view (only available with 2 queen beds).  We had a great view of the fireworks at Disney, although they can never guarantee it(we ended up with a great view from our deck)! The rooms are spacious, and the refrigerators (or ours was)are back! We lined up for early entry at 7:30 for California Adventure and the line moved quickly.    The only con was

I will start by saying that this hotel is beautiful. It is like the twin of the Wilderness Lodge at Disneyworld. The staff at the front desk was exceptionally friendly and helpful. The ladies in the coffee shop could not have been nicer. We were looking for something they didn't have and they went to another on of the restaurants to get it for us.  The room was very nice and comfortable. As with all things Disney it is a bit expensive. The problem we experienced was after check out. My husband mistakenly left very expensive medication in the refrigerator. Realizing this about an hour after check out he called immediately only to be told someone would call back. The person who returned his call told him they could not find it, he asked for a supervisor who told him they probably

We are avid Disneyworld travelers but this was our first time trying out Disneyland in California.  The park itself was great, but the hotel was very disappointing.  First of all, I am a Disney Premier Passport Holder - which is basically the highest type of pass you can purchase (it is even higher than a Premium Pass) - and the "extra magic service" I received was non-existent.  So we were quite disappointed to have spent all that money and have received very little in return.  For example, when we checked in, we were given no upgrades whatsoever - the front desk agent was very nice and even tried with her manager, but no help.  The room was far away from the entrances to both parks and had no view whatsoever.  The size of the room was adequate for 4 people and the room was

Summary Heading: clean quiet but a bit pricey
Summary: We had connecting rooms which was nice but they were pricey at 500, more like a 200 room at best. However, this location connects to the parks and there are other amenities if you stay here. The pools were small and crowded, a few days we couldn't get a chair.  Rooms were immaculate and quiet which was a worry given the kids running in the halls. We had no view but a little balcony and could see the fireworks at night. I don't see the attraction of a pool view or view of the park and they are I believe an upcharge. Didn't try room service but food is kind of lacking early and you need to get in line around 6:30 to take advantage of "extra magic hour). That feature was great but it was tough to think about doing a roller coaster at 7 am.....

Summary Heading: Great place to stay while at Disneyland
Summary: Stayed here for two nights while we visited Disneyland. It's a beautiful hotel and the lobby is amazing and fantastic pools. It's perfect that you can enter Disneyland from your hotel. Rooms where clean and staff where exceptionally helpfull best service in America so far.

First off, let me say that we love all things Disney.  We come to the park every year, have stayed at every property throughout the years including taking all of our grown children to Disneyworld last year for a week.  I wanted to do something different for our 30th anniversary and thought the location and grandeur of the Grand Californian would be romantic and special. What a disappointment. The benefits to me did not come close to the negatives given what have to lay down for this property.  Let me start with the few positives:  location.  We paid the extra monies to have a room overlooking the California Adventure park.  It offered beautiful views all day and a whole new perspective at night.  It is truly all about location getting in a hour early through the gate adjacent to

Summary Heading: Hard to Beat Disney Experience and Quality
Summary: My 6 year old son and I spent four nights at the Grand Californian.  The location was fantastic to both Disney parks and Downtown Disney. The California Adventure park is conveniently connected to the hotel.  We thoroughly enjoyed Napa Rose and Storyteller's Cafe (esp the Brother Bear characters)!  We even found the pool bar/cafe quite nice and ordered by the pool several times.  Room service was also quite reliable and high quality.  The room was very clean and even though we did not pay extra for a view of the park, it was still a nice view of the entrance to the hotel.  The lobby was cozy with different seating areas.  One area was specifically for children with little chairs and a television constantly playing a Disney movie.  All the children including my son would stop to

My husband and daughter (13) went to LA for a long weekend.  I chose the Grand California because of its location.  It is a bit pricey but the location is perfect - easy to walk to both parks and downtown Disney - worth the extra dollars for the convenience.  Hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. We ate at the snack bar and at the buffet - food was excellent at both - expensive though.  I have eaten at the main restaurant Napa Rose and it is very good - upscale. The only downside is the room size- they are small- not what I was expecting and no Disney decorations or theme to the room - to my daughters disappointment!  We didn't have a great view but we didn't spend much time in the room- I'm sure the rooms with a view of the park are very cool.

Everytime we have stayed at the Grand Californian has been a magical experience for us as well as the kids. We always sleep with the curtains open because we get a park view room where we can see the big Mickey roller coaster (California Screamin') lit up outside our window all night long. We also make sure to do concierge service when we stay here because it includes drinks and wonderful little snacks (including evening wine or cocktails for the adults) all day long and the kids also get to go in at the end of the night and have a Disney story read to them in the concierge lounge. If you watch the fireworks from the concierge lounge, they also play the music that is playing in the park at the same time. You get the full experience, just without the crowds. If you go during

I was at this hotel because I was speaking at a conference being held there.  The hotel was beautiful and you feel transported.  The lobby is fabulous (although a bit noisy since there is always Disney music being played on the piano.  Even though I was working, I felt like I was on a mini-vacation. I love the fact that the hotel is part of Downtown Disney and you can just walk out the side door and enjoy all the shops and restaurants without having to get in a car.   The room had a mini-fridge, bedding, pillows, towels, and amenities that were all very nice.  I was fortunate to get upgraded to a room with a balcony that overlooked Downtown Disney, and at night I could sit on the balcony, turn my TV to the Disney Fireworks Music channel and watch the fireworks at 9:30 PM.

My husband and I recently stayed as part of our Adventures by Disney tour.  The hotel has a lodge like feel to it which is not everyone's taste, however, the rooms are lovely.  The bed was super comfortable, and there was ample room.  We found that the staff were pleasant and helpful as well.  Since it was my husband's 50th birthday trip, I had arranged ahead of time to get the room decorated.  At first I thought it was a bit pricey but when I saw what we was done, well it was worth every penny.  Granted the decorations were more for kids than grownups - but isn't everyone a kid at Disneyland?!!  We did eat in the restaurant and found the buffet to be very good.  At lunch one day we also stopped in.  I was not that hungry so asked if I could order from the children's menu.

Summary Heading: Great hotel and location, concierge level rooms and service are excellent.
Summary: Excellent hotel within walking distance to both Disney parks and downtown Disney. This is a great plus over Florida as you can leave a park and back back in your hotel room within 15 minutes without having to catch any mode of transport.  What set this hotel apart for us was the club/concierge level rooms. The rooms themselves were fine  and spacious and the private lounge was excellent. Here you could get a drink any time of the day, breakfast, light lunch and evening snacks. You could also get complimentary alcoholic drinks from lunchtime onwards. The lounge was quiet and the service inside terrific. All in all well worth the cost of an upgrade

Summary Heading: Great hotel, great location, Disney prices
Summary: We had a 2 week holiday in California with 2 teenagers and stayed here for 2 nights while visiting the Disney parks.  THE GOOD: Great location with an entrance into Downtown Disney and a private entrance into the California Adventure park.  Staff friendly and couldn‚Äôt be more helpful.  We were able to check in several hours early at no extra cost.  Rooms clean and tidy but nothing special.  Nice swimming pools.     THE BAD: Expensive but you‚Äôre paying for the location.  Self parking is off site across a busy road so worth paying the extra few dollars for valet parking which is on site. The wifi in the rooms is a bit hit and miss.  THE UGLY:  Nothing.

Nice and handy to the new park of Disney- California park- entry from the hotel. But super dated. Poor to no toiletries. Lots of random hair around bathroom & hanging from hair dryer when i checked in. Had to wait 45mins for a laundry bag to be delivered to my room late one night as none left in my room. (?) Coffee packs not updated each day - same with fridge drinks- not sure i would stay here if I had a choice. Not sure of price as travelling for work but it would have to be cheap from what I saw.  Fire alarm set off early one morning I stayed. No one to inform us of what to do on the top floor. Happy and helpful staff. very slow service throughout hotels including bar and restaurants. Oh and the kids complained That only  Same characters at the breakfast everyday( and then

Summary Heading: Oh it's Good to be Grand!
Summary: We LOVE staying here year after year.  Great location...beautiful atmosphere and exceptional service make this hotel worth the pricey room rate.  Our son had special needs and the staff is always able to accommodate us and make sure that we have a wonderful stay.

If you want the full Disney experience in California, you can't beat this hotel for the location. It has a separate entrance for both Downtown Disney & California Adventure Park. You can be back in your room in minutes from both locations. For this reason alone it is worth the cost of staying here. On the downside, the crowds that this place pulls is amazing. The pool was always packed & lounges are difficult to obtain after 2pm. The hotel entrance was a traffic queue from 10am & the lobby is always busy. Staff were very friendly & always ready to assist with your needs.

We just got back from a great 3 week trip around Southwest USA. The only place we had to pay in full beforehand was the Dinseyland Grand Californian - with 3 day passes I paid around $2800. This included a courtyard view, so was quite surprised when I opened the curtains to find out that all we look out to was a big lump of concrete - see attached photos. I went downstairs and was told by the front office that they thought they had given us a room with a view. I waited for about 30 min (holding up our bags being delivered to the room) to be told that they had sold all the rooms with a view. I told them that I thought that was the whole point of paying up front, to ensure we get what we want!! They kept me waiting some more whilst they went again back to their supervisor, but

Disneyland in July is crowded and hot, but this hotel is the perfect location for starting the day early, no parking, just get out of bed and walk to the parks.  Great for coming back in the afternoon and laying by the pools, and then going back to the park in the evenings.  Two connecting double Queen rooms perfect for a family.  Rooms/bathrooms were clean, nothing special.  Nice balcony overlooking the California park, great for sitting and relaxing or eating breakfast.  Expensive for the room type, but that is not what your are paying for, location seems worth it.  Lobby is huge, staff efficient and friendly.  Recommend

Disney itself is one of the best places to go because of their detail & imagination that is put into everything they do. You will not regret staying here for many different reasons. The proximity of Disneyland & Disney California Adventure (DCA) is very convenient. Disneyland can be accessed though their private entrance through Downtown Disney (shortcut) to the asplenade. DCA has it's own private entrance for guests staying at this hotel. The pools are a hit with the water slide & activites. The grounds are immaculate. Dining is exquisite. Other hotels are very close walking distance to tour or dine at. We loved it for our "Once in a Longtime" trip to California. You won't regret staying here!

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a birthday celebration
Summary: This hotel has to be the best located for California Adventure. The Craftsman hotel design is beautiful and even though the hotel is very large the check-in area and lounge especially by the fireplace is very cozy. Storytelling by the fireplace is really great for kids of all ages. The rooms are of average size with a small balcony to enjoy coffee in the early morning to the sounds of California Adventure awakening or the beautiful pool area coming alive. Each room has a small refrigerator that you might want to stock with water and drinks that you purchase on your way to the hotel.( water is very expensive to purchase in the parks) This was a big birthday for my husband and we had a two bedroom suite overlooking Soaring Over California, Grizzly Mountain and the Monorail. We had

If you are looking for the best location to Disneyland, this is the hotel to stay at.  The price is a little expensive.  The Bed's were great and we had a room with a view of the pool.  the little balcony was nice.  The pool was a nice place to relax in between trips to Disneyland.  The entrance into California Adventure saved a lot of walking.  Hotel lobby was nice.

This hotel is huge and pretty impressive. I love the Arts & Crafts style, so we thought the decor was awesome. My husband came here for a conference and my 8 1/2 year old nephew and I tagged along, otherwise we wouldn't have stayed here. It's too expensive and even though its very nice, we would have spent our money in Florida at Disneyworld if we were going to splurge. We were entitled to discounted park tickets too, and that made a huge difference.   We've eaten at the Storyteller's Cafe a few times.  It's good, but again, expensive to the point of being overpriced. We wouldn't have eaten there more than once except that we wanted to take my nephew to the character breakfast and its also so convenient. Downtown Disneynis steps away, but it's no bargain either and somewhat

Stayed there for our honeymoon. Paid great money, but received memorable romance. The hotel is indeed a top-notch one in the region. The staff members are always welcoming. The hotel room is quite large, and it is a real king-bed. The room has a view of the pools and the Adverture park. We got the honeymoon bedding, and received a very cute picture of Mickey and Minnie in wedding dresses, and some honeymoon buttons at the front dest. The Napa Rose is indeed a flagship restaurant of the hotel. Great food, and great service. It is not a hotel you can stay 20 times a year. But when you do, you'll get what you pay for.

after the valet crashed my car and tried to hide it I was concerned. Then they refuse to pay. Dont trust valet or disney staff. The room was average. Location was great but the 2500 in vehicle damage made my trip experience the worst. Stay at marriott or embassy suites for better experience

Summary Heading: Close to the park, but way too expensive!
Summary: Of course everything at Disneyland is expensive so that's no surprise, but this was just a bit too much for what they offer. My husband and I stayed here for 8 nights on our honeymoon and we reserved a park view room, and paid extra for it since we knew we would likely be in the room more due to the length of stay. When we arrived they had us in a pool view room and we corrected the front desk to let her know we paid for a park view. She went in the back office and when she returned she notified us she had corrected it and got us in a park view room. When we got to the room we discovered the park was no where to be seen. Our room was directly over the monorail track and we could see the very corner of the building for Soaring over California and then just lots of trees. The

The hotel is great. The staff is mostly very nice, in keeping with the location as I have found Disney employees and other companies in LA area quite variable. The pool was cold for me at 74 degrees F. High price, but good quality and location.

Though seemingly over priced, this hotel is the best value of the three Disney resort hotels. The service is outstanding and it is just steps from the parks. The pools are beautiful, clean and relaxing, the dining is great and the hotel architecture is an attraction itself. The rooms are very clean and comfy and well maintained. The key to making your resort stay pencil out is to use your annual pass for discounts on rooms, meals, merchandise, etc., and for special deals on entertainment packages. Then relax and enjoy the fun!

Summary Heading: Great location but not worth the price
Summary: As the "premier" Disney hotel, I was expecting much more. Checked in on Friday and the valet and check in processes were quick. Rooms are clean but very small and basic, even with our upgraded CA Adventure view room. For the price, I was expecting something wonderful, magically Disney but that was not the case. We instead got something expensively average.  One other big disappointment is that the smoking area was right outside the access doors to our room so every trip through the hotel required us to walk with our 3year old through a cancer cloud. Disney!! Please fix this and move the smoking spot far away from rooms and children!  The pools are nice but rather small and it is impossible to find seating. I noticed that people were saving chairs and then going into the parks.

This is a 3-star hotel at best - the only 5-star element of this establishment is the pricing, which is very expensive in relation to what is actually provided. Presumably Disney can only get away this due the proximity of Disneyland itself and the theme park packages available. The service is friendly enough, but the Grand Californian just looks drab, tired and lacking style and imagination - which is in complete contrast the theme parks.

Summary Heading: Great location but you can get better rooms for less money elsewhere
Summary: I simply don't understand how this hotel gets a 5 star rating. The location is the best thing about this hotel - it cannot be beat - but that's the only 5 star feature and I don't think that even counts towards the rating. The service is very good and there are lots of happy Disney people to help you out.  The villas are very nice and if the hotel rooms lived up to the same standard then yes ... it would be a 5 star hotel. Demand warrants the price - everyone wants to stay there, but what you get for your money dulls the experience.

We were sharing a celebration of our 55th wedding anniversary with our children, grandchildren and three great grandchildren.  This hotel was perfect for our group of eighteen.  Courteous, helpful staff; excellent accommodations and very convenient for our food and entertainment.  A truly memorable experience!

When we first thought about staying at the Grand the price set us back.  Then we regrouped and said we are going to spend this amount of money for 4 days in Disneyland and by putting a certain amount of money away for this trip we let go the cost of the room and made our own package.  This was so worth it.  You won't regret it.

Probably the best hotel (and most expensive one) to visit the two Disney parks. Very nicely designed as an old mansion with nice swimming pools. On the other hands, huge hotel working like a factory and rooms are in need of refreshing.   Worth noticing that Disney offers to its hotel guests a one-hour early opening opportunity (i.e. starts at 0700 instead of 0800 for normal visitor), which allows visitors to avoid queuing and visit two to three ‚Äúhighly‚Äù frequented attractions.  Kids loved it.

My family and I stayed here August 8th for 4 nights and what an awesome time we had.  The customer service and attention to detail at this hotel is top notch.  We usually visit the Florida resort, but decided to change it up a bit.  We had a reservation every morning at Storyteller's Cafe for their character breakfast and I must say it is the absolute best from any other we have been too (and we have done probably 10 different ones including Chef Mickey's).  Besides the characters coming to the table, they also sing songs with the kids and dance and play follow-the-leader which my kids did every single time : )  The rooms were very nice and most importantly the beds were extremely comfortable.  The lobby is absolutely stunning, and the best past was the private entrance into

This hotel truly sets some high standards and meets all your expectations. It is truly a great place to stay if yow want to have a wonderful Disney experience. Every cast member greats you with a smile and they even welcome you home when returning back for the day.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but very expensive room for what your get
Summary: We stayed here from Aug 10-14. I have mixed feeling about this hotel. The hotel lobby is "Grand"and beautiful.  It's  a very expensive hotel . I was surprised when I asked for a two queen beds and a day bed, the check in lady  told me that  it will be a downgrade (no view) for the one I paid .We were assigned to a room with s a queen and a bunkbed as we were told. I asked  if the bunkbed could fit my three tall teenagers, she said," everyone will have their won bed." :(  She has no idea about the bunkbeds specifications, I asked if she has seen it, she couldn't even answer me  Then she left, came back and told me her supervisor said, the bunkbed will only accommodate a kid that weighs  up to 80lbs.  Also said,  she can't do anything about crediting me for the difference. I have

The building Itself is a bit dark and outdated but the location is absolutely grand, it was amazing to get out of the hotel and be at the park at the same time!! The exit is even close to the most popular rides in the California park. OMG super convenient!! After the first night my girls were disappointed  they selected this hotel instead of the disneyland hotel because of the bunk beds they saw in the pictures and our room did not have them, so my husband called and explained that he was not going to have peace unless we had the room with the bunk beds,they were wonderful!! We got moved to the concierge level and the girls had their bunk bedsüòç I loved the  customer service Beyond excellent.

Summary Heading: Wonderful way to experience Disneyland and The California Adventureland!
Summary: Disneyland is actually made up of two separate theme parks...Disneyland and The California Adventure. And if you can manage the cost of staying on the grounds, I have no doubt that you will be thrilled with your experience of staying at the Grand Californian Hotel. The sheer convenience of walking through a private entrance and right onto the grounds of The California Adventure is a real luxury in itself. Guests can also made good use of the concierge desks that are located on each of the hotel room floors where you can get help with everything from directions within the parks to printing off your boarding passes for your flight home. There are several restaurants available too, but if you want to venture outside to eat or shop, just head out the north door and you'll find

Stayed in Room 3036 during a convention from 21st July - 24th July 2013. Let me summarize the pros and cons  Pros: 1. Excellent Location. Right next to disneyland and californian adventure. 2. Spacious rooms. The one I was in could sleep a couple and two kids. 3. Beautiful lounge and friendly, smiling people everywhere you look. 4. Close to Downtown Disney, a very active neighborhood with lots of things to do. 5. Shuttle service from LAX (at additional cost). 6. Free swimming pool (accessible with your room key).  Cons: 1. Rooms too expensive (About $500/night) 2. Wifi coverage is weak. The coverage was VERY poor. 3. The facilities were very basic and not really something you expect for this price.  In one line: If you are going with a family and need an accomodation close to

I was very excited to stay here in April this year, and it met and exceeded my expectations. I hope to return to this hotel very soon, as it was very inviting, comfortable, clean, and just a general pleasure to stay.  The proximity to the parks and downtown Disney can't be beat.

This is our 3rd time staying at this resort and I have to say they have not disappointed.  Again, we checked in extremely early (like 6am) and they had a room ready.  They also, upgraded us for a fee to concierge level.  I was a little skeptical of the extra charge on already really expensive room rates!  I have to say the concierge level did not disappoint.  I just hope I don't get let down if next time we can't afford the upgrade.  The two ladies (Linda and ?) at the front desk were just wonderful...very informative, happy and helpful.  The concierge (Craftsmen Club) is located on the 6th level.  Our room faced the courtyard that the monorail runs  through.  The concierge level had unlimited snacks, breakfast (continental) items, sodas, beer, wine, an awesome coffee maker to

Traveling with our four- and five-year-olds for their first Disney trip, we could not have been happier with our choice to really splurge and stay at the Grand Californian.  PROS: Flexible check-in allowed kids to take a rest after our early morning flights instead of needing to go straight to activities.   Also KIND and flexible check-out time plus availability to hold luggage when our flight home was canceled and the new flight was six hours later. It was so helpful to be able to focus on fixing the flight problems and know we didn't have to worry about checking out right away.  Early park entrance each day allowed us to avoid biggest crowds and heat. That, combined with ease of returning to the hotel for a mid-day nap and swim before returning to park in evening made our trip

As a big surprise to my family, we booked a 3 bd/3bath suite at the Grand Californian for 2 nights. It is very pricey esp since we stayed during NYE and New Year's, but definitely well worth it to ring in the New Year. The layout of our suite:  Master bedroom which has 1 king bed, 2nd bedroom has 2 doubles, 3rd bedroom was a connecting room with a king bed and a sofa bed.  It also has a parlor with a sofa/sofabed and it opens up to a huge balcony. The balcony is bigger than what you would usually get in a standard room. I also loved the front entrance, the wide foyer and the double doors to enter the main room. The other 2 rooms had their own entrance as well. Our suite overlooked the pool, but you can see the facade of the Cars Land Mountain. During the holidays, the Grand

I am a huge critic of service and quality.  This resort is amazing!  I was extremely impressed throughout our entire stay.  The check in experience was great- very friendly and efficient.  She greeted my children and talked to them about their stay.  The entry to the property and the lobby area are beautiful!!!!!  I did not see any maintenance issues as another person wrote about- I thought it was very well maintained.  Our room was located right above the entrance to California Adventure.  I loved this location!  I had a view of the park and partial view of nightly fireworks.  It was very convenient to both park entrances, the pool and the restaurants.  I would request this side of the property again.  I read a few comments about noise on the park side.  I did hear noise from

Recently stayed at the Grand California hotel, room was spacious, clean and our two queen beds were very comfortable.  Hotel is great and we especially enjoyed access to the parks at 7 am, an hour before the public.  Its great being able to retreat back to the hotel on site for a rest during the day before returning through our own entrance.  I left clothing in my room on check out and they mailed it to me in London free of charge, exceptional service.  Staff are so helpful and very friendly.  We arranged a late check out which was no hassle at all and they only charged us half of the rate that we were on.  The hotel foyer is lovely and a great place to relax.  Definitely hope to return one day.

We were quite disappointed with this hotel. First, the building really show its age. The furniture and the carpet in the room were dated. But our main complaint is that we really didn't feel the disney's atmosphere there. Not so magical... On the other side, the location and the swimming pool are really nice.  Next time we will try the disneyland hotel...  Stay in 2011

Welcome Home! You here this when stepping up to the counter to check in. The  rooms are immaculate, the room service is the best I've ever experienced. The nightly fireworks from the room is a life time memory. The beds are so comfortable and the pillows are amazing. The hotel has its own private entrance into California Park. They have mulitple pools and jacuzzis. Our Grandchildren love the two water slides. The hotel also has two signature restaurants, Storytellers Cafe which offer a buffet and menu for breakfast, lunch and dinner. And Napa Rose with an extensive wine list and bar. Also there is live piano music in the lobby next to the largest stone fireplace we have ever seen. During Christmas there is a three story tree in the center of the lobby. If you look carefully you

So impressed with how beautiful the hotel is, the lobby is stunning, it takes your breath away. So comfortable and relaxing, with fire places.  The bedroom was great, we had a king bed and a pull-out sofa bed.  Very spacious.  It was great that we could walk to both park and to the shopping area.

We stayed July 24-28. The room was clean. We were in room 3447. We had a great view of the nightly fireworks. Because of my disability, the hotel waived the parking fee. The employees were very friendly. Will stay again.

The hotel itself is beautiful, but our room was no different than a standard room at an average Marriott Courtyard or Hampton Inn--and it was $500 per night. We were supposed to have a larger room with bunk beds for the kids, but we ended up with a small room with two queen beds.  The Grand Californian did comp us a breakfast for the mix up.  The pool area is nice, but they enforce oppressive pool rules that take the fun out of it.  For instance, I was told that my 4 year old son was not allowed to sit on my shoulders in the pool. Also, they are very strict about who can use the large water slide, and do not let parents wait at the end to the slide to meet their children.  The hotel is adjacent to Downtown Disney, but the convenience to the park is heavily out weighed by the

Summary Heading: Awesome Resort - Most Convenient in Disneyland
Summary: Stayed at the Grand Californian Resort for 3 Nights; and this is by far my favorite Disney Resort (Including FL).  The property is super close to California Adventure, Downtown Disney and Disneyland; and it has its own entrance into California Adventure.  Downtown Disney (which is adjacent to this resort) has many dining options.  The Pool area is very nice, the staff is very accommodating; and the extra magic hour works out great, especially for Cars Land at California Adventure.  If you have young children, I would recommend asking for a room with the bunk beds.  Believe it or not that was a highlight for my children's (9 & 6 years old) stay at this resort.  Finally, the only negative that I have pertaining to the Grand Californian is that it's very expensive.  However, you

Summary Heading: DVC Member, Part regular hotel, part villa
Summary: We actually stayed last May, 2012 right before Cars Land Opened! I loved the look of the Grand Californian and the location. It was great having private access to the park and an easy walk to Downtown Disney and the monorail. I thought the staff walking around, the DVC staff and the bell staff were very friendly.  Enjoyed the restaurant twice.  Once for the buffet dinner and Character Breakfast on our last morning. Didn't care much for the front desk staff.  We had to make 3 separate reservations.  We started in a regular hotel room, then moved to a one-bedroom villa and then to a 2-bedroom villa.  The 2-bedroom villa was amazing! The staff did not try to work with us at all while we were there as far as trying to keep us in one room.  I felt they were almost rude and felt like

This is my second time here and I'm planning a third. I am a Disney Vacation Club member and the value is great here. The pools are lovely, staff pleasant and location convenient to all.  Downtown Disney is fun, as are the parks, but take a ride over to see the Angels play. They give first time visitors special treatment.

Summary Heading: Over-hyped and did not meet expectations
Summary: My family and i are Disney Vacation Club members, which we love as we get to enjoy the Disney facilities at great prices. We usually stay at the Disneyland hotel (4 stays) but decided to try the Grand Californian after hearing rave reviews from friends and online forums. This might be a case of mismatched expectations. I was expecting a great experience and frankly it has been blah blah blah.   The lobby which everyone raves about it ok but usually filled with people. Oh and before you get there, the entrance is quite unimpressive. When you drive up, there is a small stained glass door that you walk through. What happened to the 'grand' part of the Grand California?  It was a long walk to our room and i was willing to change my perceptions of the hotel for a nice sanctuary but

Our first trip to Disneyland and the Grand Californian.  We are DVC members so expectations were high.  Excellent location to access Disney's California Adventure and Downtown Disney.  Breakfast at Storyteller's was a fun with characters with excellent service.  Staff was helpful when checking in but otherwise staff didn't provide the usual Disney experience.

Summary Heading: Brilliant even though you are knee deep in kids.
Summary: What can you do ... as great as a kid free Disneyland would be that is never gonna happen but you can tune them out pretty quickly when staying at the Grand Californian. A beautiful hotel both inside and out, staff from the doormen, to bellhop to maintenance go out of their way to provide excellent service.  Our room overlooked the hotel guest entrance to DCA and the entrance to Grizzly River Run and aside from the nightly fireworks it was relatively quiet being right on the park. Room was clean, beautiful and well appointed.  Room service menu could be a little broader and all room service took a little bit longer to be delivered then normal but other then that it was near perfect.  It is a little pricey but if you can afford the splurge it is well worth it.

I have stayed here several times, most recently last month. The lobby is beautiful and the rooms are really lovely, with amazingly comfortable beds. The location is the star, though! I have stayed at other Disney and non-Disney hotels in the area and the difference with the GCH's location is incredible - my feet love it and it's so nice to be able to go back and have a break in the middle of the day. Coming right out into Downtown Disney is great also. The service has always been excellent and if you have any problems, just call and ask - they will be taken care of!   The worst part is it can be a very long walk down those hallways - next time I travel with my parents I will ask for a room closer to the lifts. You do enough walking at Disneyland without needing the extra miles

Summary Heading: Great hotel, you're paying for convenience & atmosphere, not room decor.
Summary: Hotel is stunning.  Staff & service superbly done.  Location can't be beat.  But remembered, when you close your door, your room is typical of any 3 star.  I still highly recommend this hotel. We go back. 2-3 times each year and wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Before I stayed at this hotel, I read the reviews trying to decide if I should spend the money. My parents hadn't been to Disney in 15 years and my husband and parents have never stayed at a Disney hotel. We were coming here after Thanksgiving to see the Christmas decorations so I wanted it to be really nice. When I got there, there were about 5 people behind the desk, 2 assisting customers,  3 talking to each other, and another who appeared to be directing people, but looked at me about 4 times before finally asking if I needed assistance. I booked a partial view of the park, well by partial...I guess that meant just a view of trees, hmmm. We kept the door open on the balcony because it was very nice, well the music for the Grizzly Run came on every morning at about 5:00 and

The Grand Californian lived up to all our expectations -   the lobby is very grand,  the check in was easy and the staff was knowledgeable and friendly.  The location was perfect to get to either Disneyland or the California Adventure Park.  The pool was well maintained, it was easy to get service for food or drinks,  and the lifeguards were very professional and very well trained.  We had a great storyteller  breakfast with several Disney critters and the food was good,  expensive, but good - over $100 for two adults and two children. The rooms and bathrooms are nothing special,  but we were able to see the fire works every night from our balcony when we were not in the park. In the lobby there is an area of small leather chairs and rockers so the children can watch videos -

We held a family reunion - 8 adults and 2 teenagers - and shared a two bedroom villa and had plenty of room! We were pleasantly surprised at the space. Granted, we had to share the 3 bathrooms but we made it just fine. The full kitchen, kitchen table, and living room were ample space.  There is a sofa sleeper and a Murphy bed that sleep three. A king size bed in one bedroom and two queen size beds in opposite bedroom. We had pads brought in and sleeping bag for the last bed. Snorers aside, all slept well. The service from the Front Desk, Bellmen, Concierge, and Story Teller Cafe were excellent. There's a private entrance to California Adventure and a short walk through Downtown Disney to Disneyland. I'd return without any hesitation. An absolutely fantastic place to stay while

Summary Heading: The service was over the top.  Location was in the middle of it all.  BUT ..  the room was nothing special when you factor the $
Summary: This was our first attempt at a Disney property and with exception of the room everything was really nice.  The rooms are a poor value with nothing to write home about.  I can safely say this will be our last Disney hotel stay.  I would rather spend the 200/nt difference on more  activities and less turn down services and tiny pillow chocolates.

Summary Heading: Who's the Grandest of them All?
Summary: Having spent at least a week at this and Disney's Grand Floridian Hotel, I am at a loss to decide which offers the most quintessential Disney experience. Both are flagships of a legendary hotel brand, both use extensive theming to bring the magic home. I am probably partial to the heavy-hewn rough beauty of the Arts and Crafts movement that is the basis of the Californian's beauty. The lobby is magnificent, and our room, which overlooked Paradise Pier, was exquisite. Details like subway tile bathrooms adorned with granite accents, heavy solid oak entry doors, oiled bronze hardware, were all pitch-perfect to the era. Although the room had a balcony right over the park and we could watch World of Color without even needing to use the simulcast TV channel, when you closed the

I booked this room for part of our honeymoon and I could not have been happier!  I set my expectations low because we were booked in at the lowest room tiers and I read quite a few reviews that said that the room was not worth the money.  Not true in our case!  I worked with the Disney cast before arriving to set up a surprise for my husband when we checked in.  I had paid for a dessert tower and a basket of "Just Married" goodies to be delivered to the room before we checked in.  My hubby did not see what would be special about staying at a DLR hotel, but the moment that we walked in the room and he saw the basket and an additional fruit and cheese basket set up in the room he was delighted!  I was a bit disappointed because I did not see the treat stand that I had ordered, but

Summary Heading: Best Place to Stay at Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here in Sept of 2012 for my first trip to Disneyland since 1994 and my partner's first ever.     I had always dreamed of staying at this hotel and it lived up to my dreams.    The room was very spacious, comfortable and clean.     We had great service from the time we checked in until the time we sadly had to leave.       This hotel is very close to both parks and we certainly took advantage of the special entrance to DCA.     The price was high but it was worth being right on property for us.   I hope to visit again in the future and this is where I would stay.

Summary Heading: They should treat their guest better..after all we paid more
Summary: its my daughter and husband celebration birthday and what i got is Mickeys pictures and a Birthday badge..oh well..nothings free from Disney, otherwise love the hotel,the location, the architecture ,the service, they let us check in around noon.standard room is a bit small (basicly the same size as the room from nextdoor hotel that cost 2/3 cheaper ). swimming pool definitely need an improvement.lining up early morning for DCA just to find out there are also hundred's Disney Passport member got early entry to the park..( no special treatment or whatsoever ) bummer about this.

The best thing about the hotel is the location.  We stayed for a convention otherwise I would never pay the rate they charge for the room.  It was a great vacation and doing all the Disney stuff.  I'll share a secret for viewing the evening show at DCA.  Take your room key, go to the 6th floor, walk down the 6200 hallway to the end.  You will find an outdoor terrace that is right above the Goofy rollercoaster.  You need the room key for access to the terrace.  There are not a lot of people that watch it from there.

This was our family's second stay at the Grand. Our room was on the 4th floor and overlooked the wood area with a view of the grizzly river run and a small balcony. We arrived at 8:30 a.m. and even though check in is not until 3 we were allowed to pre-register. The man working registration was kind enough to check to see if a room was ready right then, even though I told him I knew we couldn't check in early.  He was very kind and went out of his way. We left our luggage with the bell desk and went to the park. At 10:30 a.m. I received a text saying our room was ready. Such a surprise!!!! Although the rooms are starting to show their age we are all about the location. We used our magic morning every morning. Here is a tip. Don't use the hotels entrance on the California

The Grand Californian location is one of the best benefits of this hotel. After full days at either park, it is really a treat to only have to walk back through the lobby of this beautiful hotel and head to your room. The lobby of the hotel is one of the best features and we've enjoyed strolling through it before, but had never stayed in one of the rooms. The room was decent size - two queen beds for 3 of us was fine. Some rooms offer a queen with bunk beds - if you are looking for an alternative. The staff is welcoming and very friendly - in Disney tradition. The hotel floors and rooms are surprisingly quite given the number of people that go through the lobby every day. We would stay again if the rate was in the right range.

DIsney does magic like NO. ONE. ELSE. The key is the staff who makes service their first and only priority.  From the moment you enter this hotel, they make you feel like the royal family checking in for the weekend. Children are immediately acknowledged and attended to, with special areas of the majestic lobby set aside just for their enjoyment. Adults are greeted with courtesy and curiosity. The sole focus of the Disney staff is to determine can they do for the family to make their stay the most enjoyable trip of a lifetime.   Checking in, our family of 5 had some unique issues, all of which were easily handled by our most charming and professional reservation assistant, Carissa. We were staying for a week, but we were on a very strict budget. Yet Carissa made sure that all of

We stayed July 16 to 19, 2013, with our two kids.  When we booked I was somewhat taken aback  at the pricing on the rooms. We stayed this month at spectacular hotels in both London (Soho Hotel) and Los Angeles (Fairmont Miramar in Santa Monica). It seemed  that the Disney prices were comparable if not more. I assumed (wrongly) that we would get a similarly great hotel and that the premium was being applied because of the proximity to the park. Wrong   assumption.  Knowing what I know now I would have stayed in a great hotel in Los Angeles and hired a driver to take us to the park for a day and return to L.A.  that night. The drive to Santa Monica is only about an hour. The experience at the Dismal California is so lacking in value and so overpriced for the accommodation and food

I had to give this 4 stars because it is a very high dollar hotel!  But if you can afford it, it is great!  From the minute you arrive at the stained glass floor to ceiling entry doors, you are overwhelmed by the architecture of the lobby and foyer area.  While you are checking in the children can sit in small wooden rocking chairs and watch the old Disney cartoons on TV!  It is a cute set up and keeps them busy til you get the keys to your room.  Everything is spotless.  Pools are fantastic, and are equipped with handicapped accessibility lifts.

Summary Heading: Wonderful service, but hotel needs repair, overpriced
Summary: My family and I stayed at the Grand Californian in May 2013 and June 2013. The lobby and furnishings are beautiful. Both times we were in a 3rd floor room that overlooked the end of Downtown Disney; noise level was not bad.  Negatives:  1. Both times we stayed at the hotel, the ice machine by our room did not work.  2. The refrigerator in our room did not work as well; the hotel had left a note that all the refrigerators in the rooms had some sort of problem, which was why they were unplugged. (This was a bit inconvenient as we have toddlers, and we'd usually just throw their drinks in the fridge. However, this was remedied by filling up a bucket with ice and chilling the drinks in there.)  3. In June, when we returned to our room, there were fans all over the hallway, like

My wife and i were very dissapointed. this is an hotel that charges 5* prices but delivers nothing like 5* services or amentites. We previously stayed in the equivalent hotel in Disneyland, Paris and were Wow'd with the place, the room and the service. There was nothing to WOW about in this hotel. The room was small, dark and had a tiny balcony. At a $1000 room rate the product delivered was underwhelming. we paid a discounted rate but it was still overpriced. We are happy to pay for fine hotels and frequently enjoy all that they have to offer without ever questioning the price or value. This hotel was very dissapointing!!!!! I woud niot ever recommend it and certainly would not return.

This hotel was absolutely perfect for our family. The magic hour was great and so was the special entrance was very convenient. At night when our kids were tired it was great to use the special entrance.     The storybook cafe was AMAZING. I absolutely recommend it. Their character breakfast was delicious. Make sure to ask for the Mickey waffles:). Our waiter was very friendly and ready to help.    Our visit  was in February so we didn't get much use of the pool, but it is very nice and it is heated.    All the cast members were very friendly and ready to carry on a conversation.    Our room was a great size for our four member family  we had a nice view of the pool and monorail.   Altogether it was a fabulous experience. We will definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Disney's Grand Californian LOUNGE / BAR Review
Summary: DH and I stopped in on a child-free evening.  The atmosphere of the hotel lobby and lounge were wonderful - HUGE, oversized, rustic, warm... We dou d a table near the windows to the pool (would have loved to have landed a cozy table with the overstuffed chairs, but none were available).  Our waitress was helpful and attentive, and she made good recommendations.  My husband's first choice of beer was unavailable (which we were told about 10 minutes after he ordered it).  We shared the Wagyu sliders with garlic, shoestring fries - great! Our seet in the corner, against the window, left us isolated and not able to soak in the atmosphere, but was fine.  The one (BIG) complaint was that there were fruit flies all over the place!  :-( Not very Disney....

I traveled to this hotel for business and stayed one week. I have absolutely no complaints. They really did well to spread the Disney magic. I would definitely stay there again. The spa is amazing. Their conference rooms are very big and comfortable. Meals were great. It's a hop, skip and a jump away from both parks and downtown Disney. There is a fireplace in the lobby and the ambience was soothing. Food is great and service was exactly what you would expect at Disney...perfect.

Summary Heading: Disappointing service for a Disney Resort.
Summary: Myself, two kids (4 and 8) and mom came to celebrate my son's birthday.  The hotel is great as far as location to parks.  The hotel staff is very helpful.  The restaurants are to be desired.  White Water Snacks outside of the pool is disgusting.  We tried the food twice and thought both times were bad.  Storyteller Cafe makes you wait forever even though 50 tables were empty.  The pool has one slide and is absolutely freezing in mid July.  The kids didn't want to spend much time there.  The room is nice with a queen bed, bunk beds and nice porch overlooking Grand Californian.  I think the cost for the hotel is  certainly worth the convenience.    Although the hotel could use a major face lift I would stay here again.

My family of 5 spent one night at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel.  We were pressed for time, so we figured that it made sense to stay close to the parks and maximize our time.  So glad we did!  The hotel lobby area is fantastic!  The room is fine.  It accommodates a family of 5 well.  That is a problem with most hotels.  Each of us had a bed.  My husband and I shared the king bed.  The kids each had a twin (bunks with a pull out trundle).  We really enjoyed the extra magic hour and the proximity to the parks.  Would stay there again and recommend to others!

We went during the "24 hours of Disney" Memorial Day weekend and stayed at the Grand Californian. It was...as always.....a FABULOUS stay. It was mostly a turnaround stay for us and they provided us with some of the BEST service ever. From the moment we arrived...the friendly valets were fast to assist getting luggage, strollers...one even distracted an over-excited 4 yr old while we grabbed our things and headed to check in. The bell man basically took over with a great smile and a "I've got this...I'll meet you in the lobby". Our check in was fast, professional....we got our buttons for the weekend celebration and they even told us what special events were going on around the property.  Also....when we checked in we were given a card that said "Congratulations! You have won an

Summary Heading: Great service, accommodates family of 5, makes the experience special
Summary: We have stayed here many times and it never disappoints. We are a family of 5. Kids are 15, 11, and 9. They all sleep comfortably in the bunk bed room.  It's wonderful to take advantage of the magic hours. We did most of the park, came back for a swim and dinner, and finished the park in the evening.  The pool is great for kids, and relaxing for the adults. They had a great package for my nieces birthday. It's not cheap, but it made her trip so special. Being able to use the gust entrance to the park was an added bonus. All employs are extremely courteous and kind. Disney at its best.

This is a lovely hotel in a great location. However, given the price and the fact that it is the No 1 Disney hotel in Anaheim,  we expected more Disney fun.  We did not see any characters in the hotel apart from at the Critters Breakfast.  The breakfast was expensive and did not have the range of food I expected.  Also whilst the Critters were fun, I missed Mickey and the gang.  Next time we'll probably stay at a cheaper hotel.

The location is so nice. It is only like Minute walk to California Adventure. But it is still not that far away from Disneyland, the exit to Disneyland drops you off right in the middle of Downtown Disney, so that isn't that far of a walk. A standard room is decent sized, and the beds are super comfortable. The hotel complex is very nice and luxurious, it makes you feel like your in a 1920's Californian grand lodge. So over all if your going too Disneyland I think this is the best hotel. Oh and if you stay at on of the three Disney hotels ( Disneyland Hotel, Paradise Pier, or the Grand Californian) you get Early Morning Magic which is we're you get to enter 1 of the parks an hour before it opens to the public.

The Grand Californian was fantastic. The location couldn't have been more perfect.  We were in the park every morning by 7:00 a.m. - it's amazing how close the hotel is to both parks.   Pros: great location, comfortable room, clean, great restaurants, wonderful pools Cons: There really weren't any for us - just a great place to stay if you are going to Disneyland.

This was a very nice hotel and we loved staying here! We are so pleased with Disney and the level they keep their hotels at. We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa and it was exceptionally clean. The room had everything we could have possibly needed to make our stay extra comfortable and convenient! It had its very own entrance to the California Adventure Park. There was an issue regarding the park with early entry through the hotel entrance that the hotel actually called and addressed it for us. We went ahead and went through the main entrance because we didn't want to wait but they called us back and went the extra mile to clear things up. We had also lost my daughters back pack upon check-in and baggage hold and we didn't realize it until we left, we were thinking we might have not

Great hotel similar to the Wilderness Lodge in Florida. My Son loved his stay here. The Restaurant is a tad expensive, however, we enjoyed the trip as always. The pool is gated nd there re plenty of beds. We had a room with a view of the Park. I recommend Soarin :) The character lunches in the hotel are great fun.

we stayed at the Grand for 10 days and every day was aewsome. The resort is clean and very friendly. The restaurants were all pretty good but need at least 2 more with more selection. The pools were very clean and the service at the pool was great. ate 3 lunches there. Nice being able to relax and be pampered too. Not to expensive for poolside service. Will stay here again. We had a regular room for 2 nights and a 1 bedroom villa for 8 nights. Was perfect for us and our daughter and grand daughter.

I'm a DVC member and my home base is the California Grand Hotel.  We stay in the 2 bedroom villas normally which accommodates up to 8.  This time we stood in a deluxe studio.  The view was at the park, which was a treat.  However, I thinks it's time the rooms get a make over.  The bedding and rugs are so old looking and the mattress is a little too lumpy.  There was a smell in the room that only went away with the door kept open or the ac on.  Otherwise, the staff is great and they try so hard to make you and your stay comfortable and because of the magical surroundings you are able to forget about the little stuff.

I love this hotel, my husband and I we stayed at all the times when we going to Disney, is pretty and fancy hotel, this last time we stayed in the room with view to the park, and was amazing every morning to see which ride was working or which one not, I know is kind of expensive, but I thinking on this way if I go to Disneyland  I don't need to pay parking, walk or take the mini bus to get in to my car, get up pretty early to get in to the park, no no no, I stayed in this hotel, simple because is commodity, and comfortable, to walk and get in to the room, relax, and go back to the park, or go to downtown Disney, and have a drink, and go back to the room. This hotel is perfect for us.

The Disney Grand Californian is a visually stunning and spectacular hotel.  The lobby, beginning with sliding glass entry doors, is truly a feast for the eyes.  It is Grand in every sense of the word.  It is unfortunate that our experience inside the building did not live up to the surroundings.    Check-in was a bit slow, as the front desk was understaffed given the demand.  Check-in involved about a 15 minute wait.  This was not unique to the arrival night, as we had problems with our room, and we waited for about 15 minutes to report them each night.    Housekeeping lacked attention to detail, and each of our five nights, we needed to get towels replaced and/or have toiletries delivered that were not stocked when the room was serviced.  Maintenance was also problematic.  We

Summary Heading: Terrific...a toss-up with the Disneyland for which is better
Summary: Every May I am compelled to spend a weekend at Disney and have to decide Disneyland v. Grand Californian.  This year we were at the Grand Californian.  I tried to dislike it - I really tried - and I loved this hotel.  It was comfortable, gracious, wonderfully staffed, incredibly convenient, and had a perfect balance of value for amenities.  I guess I would give it an eensy tiny edge over the Disneyland for access to Downtown Disney, a small but extremely welcome outdoor balcony space, and access to a few more food options, but it doesn't have those super cool light-up musical headboards.  A special shout-out to the valet parking and front desk staff for their Chaos Management Skills - they rock.

I've stayed at this hotel twice and it's always such a treat.  The front desk service is always courteous and prompt.  Bell service could not be more helpful.  If you come in early and need to store your luggage until your room is ready, no problem.  If you're checking but want another stroll down Downtown Disney (or even take a last ride on the Pirates of the Carribean), no problem.  They will store your luggage for you until you're ready to leave.  The two times we've been here, our rooms have been to the adjacent wings so it can be quite a walk to Downtown Disney or the theme parks so if you would like to closer to the action, make sure to request for rooms in the main hotel.  One of the other things I love about this place is that as guests you can go in to the theme parks

Summary Heading: National Competition for son at Anaheim Convention Center
Summary: We traveled to Anaheim for our son's national competition at the Convention Center. While there we stayed 3 nights at Disney's Grand. The hotel is a bit pricey, but it is very new and very nice. Rooms were decent size and everything was very clean. The convenience to the parks and Downtown Disney was extremely nice. Nothing was more than a 5 to 6 minute walk. The service at the hotel was very good and there was nothing to really complain about.

This stunning hotel offers premium accommodations and rich dining experiences in American Craftsman style and elegance. With its world-class spa (Mandara), an impressive array of amenities and impeccable Disney service, Disney's Grand Californian Hotel & Spa defines grandeur in every way.
