Located in the heart of the Downtown Disney District, this hotel is just steps away from exceptional dining and entertainment. And with your park ticket, enjoy an exclusive entrance to Disney California Adventure Park.

We stayed two nights for our 20th anniversary.  All I can say is that this hotel far exceeded our expectations.  We are both "Craftsman" style fans and wow did Disney get this perfect.  Every detail of the hotel screams "Craftsman" from the carpet to each piece of furniture.  We loved it!  It is expensive and was the most we have ever paid for a hotel but for this special occassion it was worth it.  The easy access to the park was very nice too.

For a first time travelling family this was the perfect destinitation to base ourselves for a Disney adventure. The room hough slighly dated was clean and tidy. The view from the balcony was of both Dineyland and Cal Adventure Park which was a nice feature. Service great, people very freindly and helpful. Loction and the additional hour to the parks...fantastic. Private access ensured a smaller line-up time in the parks. Also with two young kids (7 & 4) it also avoided any long walks or public transport issues a real life saver. We where close to downtown Disney which allowed for extra shopping and dining. It was perhaps 3 minutes from the resort. Both I and my wife felt safe walking around Downtown Disney and to both the parks at any time. a top notch set-up all the way.

My family and I stayed at the Grand Californian over the July 4th weekend.  We property is nice: spectacular architecture (although a recreation, it's still impressive), pleasant staff, prompt service, and clean rooms.  The four pools and two hot tubs -- located in the courtyard -- are a pleasant place to place to hang out for a quick break away from the parks.  Our 7 year old really enjoyed the water slide in the Redwood Pool.  Daytime wait staff bring food and drinks from the pool bar until 6pm.  You cannot beat the location.  There is a private entrance to Disney's California Adventure (DCA) park from within the hotel.  (Must show a room key to use this gate).  In addition, Disney offers hotel guests a "Magic Hour" -- early entry into the theme parks -- one hour before the

Summary Heading: Absolutely the best Disney hotel in California
Summary: This place was breathtaking. The lobby alone is incredible. The rooms are great - very large and clean. I missed having a balcony, but that's not a deal breaker for me. The dining options are amazing. But the best part about staying at this hotel is the location. Private entrance to Disney's California Adventure park allowed us to get in early and ride lots of rides with literally no wait. And the other entrance is to Downtown Disney, about a 2 minute walk to the Disneyland Park gates. I loved staying here, and I can't wait to stay here again!   I have very little to say, because there are no complaints! I recommend this hotel 100%

I love lobbies and the lobby here is amazing! Gorgeous, quick exit into Downtown Disney and the park is right down the way. Napa rose was quite delicious, and it was overall a great experience unfortunately we only were able to stay one night because they were packed the rest of the weekend. This place is a little costly, but its worth it if you want the whole Disney experience.

On arrival you definitely realise that you have entered the world of Disney - from the huge doors that slide back to reveal the cavernous reception and lobby area this place impresses.  The bar is a wonderful place to relax after a day in the park (if your kids will let you), the pool area is a great place to spend an afternoon away from the park (if your kids will let you - this one being an easier sell due to the slides in the one pool!).  The rooms are clean and spacious  - the bathroom facilities could probably do an update but are perfectly adequate (much like the hotel in the park in Paris actually).  The entrance procedure for Disneyland is smooth but be advised that it isn't straight into the park.  The entrance from the hotel into the California Adventure park is direct

Summary Heading: First Family Vacation in Years So We Splurged
Summary: We made a three day, two night trip to the Disneyland resort this June and had a wonderful time!  We booked a Concierge level room at the Grand Californian Hotel and it was worth the splurge!  We arrived around 9:30 a.m. and we were greeted at the entrance by a cast member who escorted us to the concierge lounge where we were able to enjoy the end of the Continental Breakfast being served while we were checking in.  Fruit, pastries, cereal, bagels, fruit, etc. were available and replenished constantly by a helpful staff.  Check-in was a wonderful experience as we were able to store our luggage, confirm a dinner reservation, obtain a wheelchair, and get our room keys (our roos weren't ready until the afternoon, and we were texted when it was available) all while drinking coffee

Summary Heading: Location and pools make this great, rooms are average
Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights for the location.  When we arrived the man that checked us in was completely rude as we asked for any upgrade available.  He basically refused to check and left us with a bad impression.  Not a smile upon him.  Is this Disneyland?? Got to the room which overlooked a parking lot (okay it's what we paid for) and it is fine. The rooms need major updating.  The room was dirty with food on the walls and under the trundle mattress.  Refrigerator didn't work. Location and pools make this hotel worth it to us since my mom can't walk long distances.  Also used the gym once and it is horrible and needs completely redone. All the equipment is rusting and looked awful.   Overall, you are paying for location and we knew that.  Hotel needs redone with major

Summary Heading: Pricey, pricey, pricey‚Ä¶location, location, location‚Ä¶pools, pools, pools!
Summary: This hotel is indeed grand (if a bit imposing‚Äîthe property is massive), but from the very first greeting (at the kiosk as we first drove in), it felt warm and welcoming (though not entirely personal). The bell staff was kind, and self parking was a breeze (but don‚Äôt forget your room key!) and just across the street (bring a dashboard sunshade‚Äîit‚Äôs entirely exposed out there! But the lot seems very secure and well monitored). The lobby is quite nice (but lines at reception and concierge can be ridiculously long and slow moving), the feel is upscale woodsy ‚Äúlodge‚Äù (I hadn‚Äôt seen pictures and was somehow expecting something more marble-and-chandeliered, in keeping with California Adventure‚Äôs gracious Hollywood vibe), and the gift shop is cute.   Rooms are surprisingly average‚Äînot

Obviously, this hotel is pricey! But being a hardcore Disney lover, it was surprisingly worth it. I loved early access to the park and they were a very short walk away! No need to deal with parking or shuttles. Perfect location, very nice people. Comfy beds and a great view from the rooms that face the park. The location is what makes this hotel the BEST. The only bad thing is that since it is Disney, everything is overpriced, including food and drink.

My husband and I stayed in this Hotel In June 2013 and was very pleased with everything.  The staff were ever so helpful and friendly and the hotel itself was very inviting. Would recommend staying here as it was close to both Disneyland and California Disneyland.

Summary Heading: It really IS about the location!
Summary: We just returned from a four night stay at the Grand Californian. I had been getting concerned, as I had read several scathing reviews on this website. I have never gotten bad advice on Trip Advisor.  I was so happy to have stayed here. The location is amazing. The weather was SO hot, and by noon we could walk back in a matter of minutes and be by the pool or air conditioning. We saw so many people with little ones, pushing strollers, walking to the further away hotels in the baking hot sun. I felt for them.  The beds were very comfortable, and the bathroom was large and clean. We found the staff very helpful and polite. At Guest services they printed out our boarding passes for the following morning, which was great.  The Disney shuttle to and from the airport was always right

Summary Heading: Great hotel to stay at when visiting disney land
Summary: Great hotel to stay at due to location of disneyland and disney California adventure park, service was great and they would take care of any problems you have with your stay right away put shopping is right outside of the hotel and also restraurants

Let me start this by saying that I'm not really one to make a vacation of going to a Disney resort. We stayed here when friends came in from out of town because all of the kids wanted to go to Disneyland/California Adventure. We stayed one night and we stayed on the concierge floor.   The best part of the hotel is the private entrance directly into California Adventure and early access (I think they call it the Magic Hour). The other positive is that the pool area wasn't too crowded and the lunch food at the pool was surprisingly good (I had low expectations). The staff is earnest and efficient.   One gets the impression that they are EXTREMELY concerned about people sneaking onto the concierge floor and there is a hint of paranoia that comes across from many of the staff with

Summary Heading: Get in early but main rides not open?
Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights. Main lure was location, which is the best if going to Disneyland. Get to go in 1 hour early, BUT, 1/2 an hour wait in line to get in the park, get to the new cars ride, which does not open until after normal opening time, so waited in line for an hour and a half anyway for this ride. The extra hour early entry is smoke and mirrors and not a reason to stay here. The easy access to and from the parks during the day is.  The rooms are clean the staff is nice. This is an expensive place and it is very nice. Don't count on more than maybe 1 extra ride because of early entry. You may not even get that. The I cannot emphasize enough the lack of value of the early hour entry. If you have the money however, this is the place to stay if going to Disneyland for

Summary Heading: Pricey but location is worth it
Summary: My daughters and I loved this place.  Its location, right next to one of the entrances to California Adventure park, makes it worth the hefty price we paid for the average two queen beds/one bath room that we got (nothing fancy, not even a microwave in the room. ) The hotel has several pools and hot tubs as well as a wonderful day spa where I got the best massage I've had in years.  It is also minutes from Downtown Disney where the choice of shopping and restaurants were an additional pleasant surprise.  I'd stay there again without a doubt.

My husband and I really wanted to stay in this hotel because it has a direct entrance to CA Adventure...and because it it enormous. We enjoyed the wood cabin feeling it gave off and the forest theme throughout the whole hotel. On this stay we had one small bad experience with our luggage; we called the front desk when we received our room so they could bring our luggage up and over an hour later, our luggage had still not been delivered. We had to call again (to remind them, I guess) and finally our stuff was brought up. Other than that, which is what REALLY bugged us, my husband's breakfast potatoes were not cooked all the way through. That's really inconvenient considering how much you pay for room service. There was way too much people traffic through the main lobby at all

I've been in large hotels before but wow!  This one goes on and on, you'd think it was Vegas.  That being said to manage a property of this size and keep everyone happy, well that's darn near impossible.  Within those parameters they do an outstanding job here, and we greatly appreciated it.  The beds are extremely comfortable, rooms are reasonably quiet, balconies have nice views (well ours did anyway), just an overall good wxperience.  A couple of tips:  1.  If you stay at a Disney property get up early for the extra magic hour (park is 1 hr   guests only).  Stay out til it gets hot (11-ish) then go back to room, pool, etc til it's cooler (around 4).  Then hit park again.  The extra hour is huge!!  Also, if you're not sure wether to go to calif or Florida I'd take Florida.  2

Our 2-night stay at the Grand Californian was wonderful.  The location was, in a word, perfect.  You can go straight from the hotel INTO California Adventure.  The other end of the hotel goes to Downtown Disney.  It is SOOOO convenient to roll into your rooms after a long day in the hot sun and tired kids.  The room itself is pretty small (for what you are paying).  Our room had a queen bed, with a bunk bed, and a pull-out trundle.  Our 1-year old slept on the trundle, our daring 4 year old the top bunk.  Any sleeping problems we anticipated were completely overridden by their sheer exhaustion from the park.  :)  There were some minor problems preventing me from giving this hotel a 5-star.  First, the hotel policy is VERY strict.  They are inflexible!!! to a fault!  When we were

Just returned from a June stay at the Grand Californian. Our family's frequent Disney travelers and have stayed at several properties. This was our first time as guests at the Grand Californian. It was definitely worth the cost and we will only stay here for all of our future visits. There is a flat fee of $35 to John Wayne Airport by taxi or just  $15 a day for self parking if you drive yourself. The pool is lovely with terrific poolside service for an afternoon cocktail which is so welcoming after a busy day in the park. We had the 1 hour early privilege and with the DCA entrance near Grizzly Rapids you just can't beat it. The other entrance puts you right downtown Disney which is super convenient for dining options. We are never a fan of the food in DLand and try to eat at

We really enjoyed our stay here. We had a standard lodge style room with a balcony overlooking the park. It was a little dark but very clean. It was great having direct access to the park. Its so nice being able to pop back in the afternoon for a rest and a swim.The pool area was very relaxing with a great slide for the kids. We found the service generally at the hotel was friendly and helpful. The only negative was the Storytellers cafe. Dinner was just about ok but breakfast was dire. The service was poor. The fast food cafe( White Water Snacks) was also overpriced and not very good. We found that the restaurants at The Disneyland Hotel were much better. Goofy's kitchen at The Disneyland Hotel for breakfast was fantastic and you get to see many more characters. Also preferred

Summary Heading: Expensive? Yes  Worth the splurge? YES!
Summary: Okay, I will first start off by saying we took advantage of the military discount to stay at the Disney Grand Californian Hotel (DGCH) which helped tremendously on pricing.  I am not sure we would have stayed without that discount, however, we decided to splurge this time.  The biggest benefit, as others have mentioned, is the fact it is attached to Disney California Adventure (DCA) and Downtown Disney (DTD).  Having been to Disney World (DW) several times, being able to TRULY park hop at this hotel was really, really cool. *I always found myself giggling when we did that...*  (By the way, we always bought park hoppers at DW, but never really used them.  However, when staying here, I highly recommend it.)  As far as the room- as always with Disney, it was very clean.  We had a

Summary Heading: Totally destroy's your belief in Disney's reputation
Summary: This hotel is very very dated, the staff couldn't care less and almost you can sense they wish the guests would just all go away.   It took us 5 hours to finally check in. We arrived jet lagged from a 15 hour flight from Sydney and got given a dreadful room, were treated like muck and had to call a manager. Only then did we get another room, yes it was OK, but for a booking "with a view" it overlooked the car park.   The staff are simply un-interested. It basically destroys anything you have heard about "Disney = Good Customer Service".   We tried to order room service and were told it is always a minimum wait of 60 minutes plus. All we wanted was some hot milk for our child.   The 3 day meal plan we booked, wasn't 3 meals, it was breakfast, a snack and a $15 voucher for dinner

My wife and I stayed at the Grand Californian with another couple. We booked at the same time for the lowest tier of standard room. To our surprise they gave us adjoining rooms next to each other on the 4th floor. I walked out to the balcony, and to my surprise it was overlooking downtown Disney. Score! I thought we had to pay extra for that. The room was quiet at night. I am a light sleeper and I didn't hear anything around us. Sometimes a screaming kid blazing down the hallway but that was short lived.   The room itself was nice. Very small and they only had rooms available with (2) queen beds instead of 1 king. I already knew what to expect in regards to the room size. You are paying for the location. Staying in the Disney themed resort is a magical experience even to a

For my first time at this hotel I was really impressed! My best friend is a member of the DVC so we didn't have to pay for our room otherwise I would have stated it was VERY much overpriced at the regular going rate. Our room was spacious and very clean. Also, our view was very nice for just the standard room. The service/hospitality at this hotel was amazing as we didn't have to wait til 3p to check in. I loved the convenient location in Downtown Disney and DLAND.

Ideal location for the Disneyland as you walk out of the hotel and onto downtown Disney.  The hotel itself is very dark and showing its age but is kept very clean.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.

Celebrated our 2nd Wedding Anniversary by spending the day at Disneyland, having a fabulous dinner at the Napa Rose and ending with a wonderful night stay at the Grand Californian. From the moment you pull up in your car, you are greeted with smiles and that excellent Disney customer service. We felt so special and just loved our stay! I think we may just make this an annual anniversary tradition!! Once again, Disney does it right!!

You cannot beat the location for Disneyland and California Adventure but you pay a premium for the convenience. The ability to simply walk out of the hotel directly into Downtown Disney or into California Adventure is wonderful. Getting the extra magic hour to CA was the only way we could've ridden Radiator Springs Racers twice without having to wait in the crazy long lines. The service was very good from everyone we encountered including valet, bellman, front desk and maids. The rooms are well-decorated and clean but not huge.  The bunk beds were a cool feature. With the trundle under bunk beds, we were able to sleep 5 comfortably. We arrived late on a Saturday night and were able to view the World of Color show from the 6th floor terrace. You can find hotel rooms in the area

My family stayed in The Grand Californian for 2 nights. The hotel itself was nice but way over priced. I only stayed because it was a treat from my sister. I just don't get how the average family can afford to stay here. As it is we had a 40% discount. I listed it as average because its as nice as the embassy suites down the road and for the $$ its nothing fancy. They had early admission to CA Adventure when we stayed but it took a half hour to get into the park, which doesn't really help much. I don't think I will stay at this hotel again.

From the moment you arrive, the family is in for a treat.  They check over everything at regestration...leaving nothing out.  Birthday, anniversary, any event is noted.  Maps and folders are given out.  With your room map in hand (could be long trup to the room) you will find a very nice appointed room for your stay...many with a great view.  You will love your stay, as we did. Being able to go into the parks right from your hotel is a BIG plus.  VERY, VERY NICE.  You also go right into Downtown Disney, another big plus.  Only thing to add is - "please take us with you."

We thought we would treat ourselves to one night's accommodation at the Grand Californian Hotel.  Wow....how lucky were we.  This is a beautiful hotel and was greeted with "Welcome Home".  I wish this was home!  We were able to check in early as well.  Loved the fact that you have direct access to California Adventure. We also took advantage of the early hour where we could access the park, and when we needed a rest we could easily make it back to our room.  Nice choice of restaurants as well on site.  Definitely will be staying here again, keep up the great work!

We've stayed in this hotel the last three times we were at Disneyland. The hotel isn't quite as nice as it was during our first two stays. The in room amenities aren't quite as good as they once were and the prices keeping creeping up. The hotel still has many pluses- close to the parks, central location in Downyown Disney, and the hotel staff is still very good, friendly, and efficient.

I have been a passholder for the last 10 years! I have a 9 year old with a brain disorder. You would never know to look at her however she is very sensitive and sweet.  If you want to go camping many of the surrounding hotels will do. Remember many of these properties have existed since Walt built the park! Enough said...about that. After many years I have to say that staying at the Grand is the only way to do Disney! If you truely want to have a Magical time then this is the way to go... During the heat of the afternoon you can dip in the pool or stroll Downtown Disney... They are trained to have a very nice demeanor. If you have children and can save up and go all in for a few nights nothing comes close. Especially with the early entrance to the park and extra's only Disney

Summary Heading: Read Before Staying at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel!
Summary: Make sure you read before staying at Disney's Grand Hotel,  I really would give the Disney's Grand Californian Hotel a 1.5!  The only thing I liked Disney's Grand Californian Hotel  was the pool set up and the breakfast.  The service  Disney's Grand Californian Hotel  was very rude and incompetent.  I could me most assured that the management of the Disney's Grand Californian Hotel stunk very badly.    We drove 20 hours to get to the Disney's Grand Californian Hotel and after finally arriving and conveying very appropriately that we wanted to hurry and get to a room.  The incompetent person at the front desk proceeded to take 86 minutes to check us in!! I am not joking because i sent a facebook post when we walked in so i knew how long it was till I got to the room  86 minutes!!

It was my turn to pick the destination for our wedding anniversary so I picked this hotel because I love Disneyland.  When we checked in we got an autograph picture from Mickey and Minnie congratulating our anniversary. The front desk was really nice and answered our questions and made us feel welcomed.Our room wasn't ready so the front desk stored our luggage while we had fun at Disneyland. The hotel lobby was huge and reminds me of a big log cabin up in the woods. Our room was also nice with a fridge and double bathroom sinks. The only thing I wasn't too crazy about was the small bathroom. A good thing staying at the Disney hotels is you could use any of the pools at the 3 Disney hotels and depending on the day you could go into one of the two parks an hour before it opens to

In the afternoon of Day 2, strolling through California Adventure, my high energy husband said "I feel so relaxed."  Wow!  I knew I had planned and executed the perfect family trip.   Here's what helped us have 3 perfect days ay Disneyland.   We all wanted the most flexibility, quality time together and value for our hard earned dollars, and we got it at the Grand CA.  We booked 2 nights, and bought 3 days of park hopper passes through Disney Travel (and got fun lanyards, pins, luggage tags, and a free ride photo of our choice).  We didn't want to feel rushed each day, so the 3 day hopper passes were the answer.    Next, we purchased Walkee app that allows you to track wait times of rides, read all about rides, shows, parades and attractions.  This was so worthwhile.  It allowed

Summary Heading: Nice Disney Hotel, Location makes the hotel
Summary: Hotel itself was OK. Gets by because of its great location and ability to enter directly into California Adventure. Maid Service was very good and staff was polite and attentive. Rooms are OK. Nothing special. Went over to a friend at Disneyland Hotel and rooms were nicer and more space. Pool area was nice. Service in pool area OK. This is Disney, they have poolside drinks but keep it under control. Bottom line. Would stay again but would give a look at Disneyland hotel and compare pricing.

Loved the California Arts & Crafts-style architecture and lighting and the staff service was at its Disney best. The beds were super comfortable and it's the only place where you can roll out of bed at 7 am and be in Cars Land in less than five minutes (thanks to the Extra Magic Hour benefit). Hotel is adjacent to California Adventure and is a stone's throw from Disneyland (closer than the Disneyland or Paradise Pier Hotels). Character breakfast at Storytellers Cafe was good. Cost is a factor, but if it fits in your budget, stay at the Grand!

The lobby is tremendously impressive in terms of architecture, and the staff is trained to a "T" to be helpful and welcoming.  The rooms are actually quite ordinary in terms of space, bathrooms, etc., but the reason to stay here is to take advantage of the proximity to the parks, get the "Magic Morning" feature, and be able to  make an easy retreat back  to your room midday when the parks are really crowded and you need a break.  We ordered room service our last morning so we could get packed up and the breakfast came very quickly.  We did not eat at the Storyteller's Cafe on this trip as we have on previous trips and the food was mediocre, especially the buffet, for the price.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for multigenerational family vacation
Summary: My family usually stays at the Disneyland Hotel when we visit Anaheim but since the grandparents were with us for this trip, we decided to try the Grand Californian since it seemed geared towards a more mature clients.  There aren't as many Disney character displays throughout the lobby and hotel rooms as there are at the Disneyland Hotel.  It has the ambience of being at a lodge in the wilderness. Check in was a breeze and the front desk lady was really friendly. She made sure we had a nice room with a pool view for our 1st stay there.  The rooms are smaller than the Disneyland Hotel but it was nicely appointed and a great balcony overlooking the gorgeous pool area where we watched the fireworks each night.  My kids loved the pool and slide after our days at the parks.  The

We stayed last week for the second time in 3 years at the Grand Californian. The stay started out late due to United Airlines having yet another delayed flight (my 11th in the last year. Boo on United), but quickly got better when Randy at the front desk warmly greeted us and made us feel so welcomed. We had a wonderful 5th floor room overlooking the expansive pool area. I love not only the Arts and Crafts style of the Grand Californian but also its proximity to the Disneyland, Downtown Disney, and California Adventure Parks--especially considering that you can get into the parks one hour early when you stay there, a huge advantage when considering the lines for rides. On our last day of three, United canceled our flight back to San Francisco, so we had to scramble for a

This is the third time we have stayed at this hotel since it first opened. The location is very good since you are literally right next to the parks but the hotel has started to show it's age. When the hotel had first opened it was, of course, new and clean.  However, the rooms are not as clean as they used to be. The hotel staff didn't change the sheets once during our long stay and the sofa bed they gave us for our kids had old sheets in it from someone else's stay as well. When we opened the sofa bed the first night, there were reciepts from someone else mixed in the sheets. The housekeeping staff made the bed using the old sheets and didn't realise the recipts had been left in the bed inside the sheets.  The tile in the bathroom around the tub had signs of mildew and there

Our stay at the Grand Californian Villas was a DVC stay which is a smaller portion of the hotel, containing only 50 rooms including the grand villas. For anyone who is a DVC member and is thinking of staying here I highly recommend it. This was our 2nd stay in a one bedroom villa and it so far is our favorite DVC room. The layout is quite nice and roomy with a small hallway leading to the master bedroom. The d√©cor is lovely and the rooms are very well kept. The two bathrooms can't be beat. The kids have a shower/area to get ready and we had the master bath that has the whirlpool tub. We don't use the full kitchen, but is so nice to have the extra space. We order food from Vons and have it delivered to the room. So we have a full array of cereal, bagels, fruit for the morning and

This was our third time staying at GC. We have stayed at other hotels close to the park but have decided to stay at GC from now on. While the rooms at other hotels may be nicer and bigger, the convenient location is priceless. The first time staying here for us was in 2004 and we definitely noticed a little more wear and tear in the rooms this time around. We enjoyed taking a break at the pool from the afternoon park crowds.

It's all about location! My families been staying here since they opened. This hotel does not have lots of "Mickey" items in the rooms but the hotel is absolutely beautiful. We tend to request the rooms in the 300 block of the hotel with theme park views. Those rooms give you the best view of the River Rapids and Grizzly Peak. The 5th floor rooms are harder for kids to see people in the park because it's just above a short roof line. Floors 2, 3 and 4 are the better option. If there is ever a problem with your stay hotel management is always very accommodating. The hotel has a private entrance to California Adventure for it's guests. I highly recommend this hotel. Great service. We stay once a year and always check out BEFORE "Grad Nights" start. Please do your homework and find

Summary Heading: You can't beat the location, BUT....the carpets in the room were FILTHY!
Summary: This was our third stay at Disney's Grand Californian since 2011.  The hotel is impressive, but at the prices they charge to stay there, it should be, lol. And you absolutely cannot beat the proximity to the theme parks of the Disneyland Resort.  If you want convenience and can afford upwards of $400 a night, this is the place to be.  We spend a great deal of time in Disney's California Adventure, and we could be walking in that park within 5 minutes of leaving our room.  And we find the rooms spacious enough for our needs (a family of four including two teens).   But on our two most recent stays (January 2013 and May 2013), I was absolutely disgusted at the condition of the carpeting in our room.  The bottom of my feet were BLACK from walking on that carpet within 30 minutes of

Summary Heading: Pricey but worth it for the convenience
Summary: We stayed on the Wednesday and Thursday before the Memorial Day weekend in May. The staff treated us with consideration and friendliness. How could they not? It's Disneyland and you expect the 'characters,' as all Disney employees are called, to always be top drawer. We had a courtyard room on the fourth floor. Quiet. The rooms aren't large but the small balcony was a nice touch. We added a third guest last minute and housekeeping quickly responded to several phone call requests. No charge for the 3rd guest and we easily switched from a Kingsize bed to two Queens during registration.  With 2-day Park Hopper tickets we strolled through the hotel right into California Adventure Park.  What a joy avoiding the parking lots, trams, etc., though I wouldn't consider this expensive a

Summary Heading: I will never be able to stay off-property again!
Summary: It's my 40th birthday so we decided to do this trip to Disneyland the best way we could and stay on property for the first time ever (just got home today). We chose the GC since it had direct access into the park and I always walked by their hotel entrance with envy. I paid $1100 for 2 nights including tax -- I have NEVER done that in my life and it was a hard pill to swallow but hey, you only turn 40 once right?? We arrive around 11am on a Thursday morning and upon check-in I asked if they had any benefits for an IATA member (travel agent membership) - the front desk agent said she'd ask but came back and said unfortunately not. No problem, my bad for not calling in the reservation to let them know, instead of just booking online. I asked if we could have a park view but she

Summary Heading: Misleading room sales - but great location.
Summary: My sister and I decided to bring both of our families to Disneyland - we thought it would be great to stay all together.  We called the hotel and booked a 2 bedroom suite fit to accommodate 9 people. When we arrived, we were told they didn't actually have 2 bedroom suites, and were given a one bedroom w/parlor and an adjoining regular room with 2 beds. After repeatedly being told on the phone that we were booking the 2 bedroom suite so we could all hang out together in one big room with 2 bedrooms we were VERY disappointed with the switch. We could've just booked 2 rooms and saved a TON of money - we explained that to the hotel staff - they did nothing for us.     In this "suite + room" there were only 4 towels (to accommodate 9 people) and 2 tiny shampoos/conditioners, etc. We

Found the hotel was beautiful, loved the stay, close walking distance to attractions including Downtown Disney. Everything was excellent. The property is well maintained. The view from our room was spectacular. I would stay there again

Would recommend staying at the Grand Californian if you're planning to visit Disneyland and California Adventure for 2-3 days.  Location, location, location. You're walking distance to the parks, downtown disney, and the hotel amenities. Everything is convenient which makes for a great experience. Some of the rooms allow you to view fireworks and light show.  Relax at the pool. Three main pools, two hot tubs, and a slide. Great place to relax and rest your feet. We were there over a crowded Memorial Day weekend and were still able to find space to ourselves.  Nice rooms. We stayed in the Villas. Bathrooms were really nice. Beds comfortable. Full kitchen to prepare lunch and dinner. Couldn't ask for more.

Summary Heading: Location is great, but the overall stay was not Fantasmic!
Summary: Our party of four recently stayed at this hotel from August 31- September 3. I am giving the hotel 4 stars primarily because of convenience and magic hour!  The hotel rooms are just okay! Nothing spectacular, the furniture and decor is getting worn out. We stayed in a one bedroom suite, it was nice to have two bathrooms and two refrigerators. Other than that the rest of the room was just okay.  Negatives: We really disliked the fact that the showers can't keep a steady stream of the same temperature water. The temperature really fluctuates! You are either on the verge of getting scalded or freezing your butt off! The other issue that we had was with the valet. It takes forever to get your car. A good 15-20 minutes.  Back to the positives: You can't beat the location of the Grand

There is not a better hotel in all of Anaheim to stay at while experiencing Disneyland Resort ‚Äì that being said, Disney‚Äôs Grand Californian should be a better hotel.  While the public areas are SPECTACULAR, the average-at-best rooms are glorified motel rooms with open plan sinks, a depressing shower toilet room with bad lighting, and not a single feather pillow in the entire hotel. For upwards of $500 a night this self-billed luxury hotel should offer a better guest room product and experience. The checkout is early at 11AM and check in is rather later at 3PM so plan your day accordingly.  The food offerings at the hotel run the gamut, from thoughtfully prepared California-sourced cuisine at Napa Rose to below average, bordering on dorm food at Storyteller‚Äôs Caf√©. It‚Äôs a shame

We spent a little more than we normally would to get a great location and boy did we! It was so centrally located for both parks and Downtown Disney shopping.  We booked a standard view with hopes to get an upgrade. Although we didn't get an upgraded view they did give us a high floor. The room was great with a balcony overlooking the two other Disney hotels.  We would stay here again and recommend this hotel 100%!

Having stayed at both other Disney properties in Anaheim, I was ready to try "the big one". We had booked a standard view rrom, and upon our quick and easy check in, were upgraded free of charge to a premium pool view room on the 3rd floor. It was just the 2 of us, but the room was spacious enough for 4, easily. I loved the layout of the bathroom, shower and toilet were behind closed doors, and the double sink was not. Nice when people need to get ready if the bathroom is occupied.   The hotel itself is long, which can make for a long walk, even with close proximity to the parks, tiring after a long day.   We only explored the pool area one night, so we didn't use it much. 1 small jacuzzi was closed at that time, but another, quite large one was open. My boyfriend tested out the

Summary Heading: Concierge is Not What It's Cracked Up to Be
Summary: We (my wife and I) decided to spend 3 nights at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel and since we couldn't get one standard room for this time, we decided to book a Concierge room. It was about $500 more during the stay than a regular room.   Our stay began with a personal greeting when we left the car with the valet (not included in the price). We were then shown to the standard line for check-in and waited for an available Cast Member (CM). Once we started check-in, the CM noticed that we were Concierge guests and left the desk to have a Concierge CM escort us to the 6th floor for a separate check-in. The only difference in the check-in process was that we got to sit during it.  There is a snack area (Craftsman Club) that is open from 6am to 10pm with snacks of various types

Summary Heading: wonderful experience...still, a ton of money
Summary: We had stayed here two years ago (great experience).  We were NOT going to stay this trip simply due to the cost.  At the last minute we decided to stay again.  We were not disappointed.  Check in was a slow but we had a very attentive cast member when it was our turn.  Lobby is beautiful.  Service in the bar and at the pool were great.  Room is on the smaller side as many have noted BUT I think there is plenty of space between the closet, space on the floor and the dresser drawers.  I LOVE the little (and yes, it is little) balcony but it was lovely to sit outside in the evenings and have a glass of wine while the kids slept.  My kids were encouraged to write a letter to their favorite Disney character and we were thrilled with a personal meet/greet with one of the characters

We only stayed one night but it was enough to impress. The room was a nice size with two comfortable queen size beds. The lights over the beds could be dimmed to night lite status. The vanity had two sinks. There was also a daybed/couch. They even have turn down service, which few hotels have anymore and you do not have to ask for it. There was a playpen in the closet that could be used for small children. The only knock on the room was that the toilet was too low. The lobby is huge with an area with child size seats where cartoons are shown. It is not cheap but you get your money's worth.

We chose to stay here after years of staying at the Paradise Pier, as a special treat, and agreed to splurge.  HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT.  We were there to celebrate my son's 9th birthday and Mother's Day weekend and got there early with the intention to drop our bags and get "checked in" so that we could hit the park.  I had forgotten our vouchers at home and the front desk clerk scolded me good and then told me that without them, I would have to pay for the whole package all over again.  ($2800!!!)  I could feel all the blood drain from my face and start to panic.  He told me that I would have to figure it out with the travel desk and told me to go walk down there and they were next to the sandwhich shop (???? - not great directions).  He left and then came back about 10 minutes

For what you pay for a premiun, top-notch Disney experience this hotel completely missed the mark.   The rooms were well-appointed and clean. The decor was elegant Disney. Compared to some of the other DVC resorts, though, the rooms were smaller.   The pool was area was okay. It was a bit spread out with not as many tables as needed. Lounge chairs were nice and clean, but there were not enough to handle the capacity of guests during a busy spring break week.   My service experience was definitely NOT up to what I expect from a Disney resort. My only positive experience was at check in, where Michael was warm, friendly and very helpful. He answered all my questions, fave me great information and was supremely helpful. After that every cast member interaction went downhill. They

Kinda pricey and the towels were scratchy, however the staff go above and beyond to make every interaction great. The location is perfect for a Disney location. I didn't like the music playing at the pool at midnight but my earplugs took care of that. Everyone was very pleasant and friendly. Staying there was a dream come true for me and I would go back again. Highly recommended!

It took forever to check in...almost 1/2 hour and even then our room wasn't ready.  We had to store our luggage and go back later.  Our room was very ordinary and I couldn't have a shower on the last day we were there because the water was cold. A few of the staff were rude and unnecssarily difficult to deal with.  Totally inefficient! The Mandara Spa was one of the most expensive I have been too AND they added on a 30% gratuity themselves.

The Grand Californian is a grand place to stay if you are willing to pay the price for convenience and service.  I am.  I made reservation 5 nights at the Grand Californian, and currently am staying on property as I write this review.  This is just the first night, so let me  explain why they already deserve five stars.  This review is based on a 5 night stay on the premier theme park view concierge level, and I am staying in room 6226, a double queen room on the sixth floor that overlooks the pools and grizzly river mountain (with Tower of Terror in the background).    1. I was provided a pre-registration number, as all guests of any level are, and used it this morning to check in before I even arrived.  This service is something other hotels do not provide, which I am happy to

Summary Heading: A nice splurge for a special occassion
Summary: We are not DVC members, but instead rented points through a broker which made staying at the Grand Californian much more budget friendly. We stayed in a studio on the fifth floor with a view of the swimming pool. The entry straight into California Adventure was a great way to hop to and from the park after wet rides on the river rapids ride which is very close to the hotel. Downtown Disney is right outside the door as well, adding to the dining and snacking choices the hotel already offers. Disneyland park is also a very short walk away. We found ourselves going back to the hotel for breaks at least once a day, something we almost never do when fighting the buses in WDW. The studio was very large and great for two. Two more guests can sleep on a sleeper-sofa, but in my opinion

There were two good things that I can say about this hotel: 1) It is right on the Disney complex; and 2) The upgraded view room, with king bed, was a nice room. We spent two nights at this hotel, with the first being in a very ordinary 2 queen bed room.   In every other way, this hotel is completely overrated. The first and last impression comes from the reception and bell desk. The inefficiency of those areas is beyond belief. Because checkout is at 11:00, practically everyone must store luggage. Thus, this is a bottleneck area...and is poorly managed.  There are plenty of nice hotels in the immediate vicinity of Disneyland. Save your money for the Disneyland park.

We have stayed at the Grand Californian several times with our kids and grandkids.  Each stay has been terrific from start to finish.  The hotel is designed in the American Craftsman style on a grand scale.  The largest family usually gets a room with bunk beds and a trundle as well as a big bed for the parents.  Very popular with the kids.  There is a pack and play in every room for the babies.  Every room has a refrigerator and you can even have food delivered from Von's!  The hotel is actually in the park with its own entrance to California Adventure.  It is such a luxury to go in and out of Disneyland, California Adventure, and Downtown Disney with an absolute minimum of walking.  You can even have your purchases delivered to your room.  Another treat for the adults is the

If I could afford to stay here every time I visit Disneyland, I would!  My husband and kids feel the same way.  We love that the registration area is so large that you never feel like you have to wait.  The huge open lobby manages to be both warm and cool, and always relaxing!  Even when we aren't staying there we manage to make our way in to relax and recharge.  The kids especially love the pianist who has been there for years playing all the Disney Classics.  Love the access directly into CA Adventure, which we use even when we're at Paradise Pier and the Disneyland Hotel.  We have yet to use the pool because we are having just so much darn fun in the parks!  When the kids were younger they loved the storyteller in the fireplace area with the rocking chairs.  We have yet to

Summary Heading: Not what it used to be
Summary: We last stayed in October 2012 but have stayed there about 4 additional times from the time it opened.  The old girl needs some cleaning up (see photo).  For what we payed (around $700/nt.) we expected a clean room that has been maintained.  One of our children isn't walking yet, so I was really grossed out by the thought of letting her crawl on the carpet.  I had to call housekeeping to clear random debris from our room upon checking in (old food, camera lens cap, etc.)  The biggest bummer though, was that they bill this as the hotel w/ direct access to California Adventure, and lead you to believe that that's only available as a paying guest.  However, the morning we wanted to go to DCA, we went down for breakfast in the quick service to find that the queue was already wound

We spent 4 nights at the Grand Californian, electing to spend top dollar for the Craftsman Club access.  The cost for this hotel and service is top-shelf, but what you receive is anything but. Craftsman Club access is supposed to come with personalized concierge service - which we did receive, though they were repeatedly snotty and incredibly unhelpful. Julia/Julie was blatantly rude to our party, declined to get off her butt to assist a lost family member, and started off the entire trip with a snotty attitude that had one of our family members fuming.  The concierge 'service' also managed to bungle our attempts at arranging an airport shuttle. First they assured us advance notice wouldn't be necessary, so we were later chastised by the bellman for not making 48 hour notice.

The #1 reason to stay is that you have your own private entrance to the park, right out the back of the lobby! No waiting in lines and very easy to go back home for an hour or two if you travel with little ones or just need a break from the no-stop crazy fun! Would recommend adding the balcony that overlooks the park to add to the experience :)

The value for this hotel is not good as one would expect from both the Disney brand and the price charged. The guest assistance desk (concierge ) didnt have any real desire to assist in making dinner reservations, even though it was at their own top end 'Napa Rose" restaurant (we ended up having to take our chance and walk in). We stayed an additional night that required us to go back into the check in line for another 40 minutes, even though a letter in our room indicated if we wish to stay an additional night all we needed to do was call (we did and had to waste more time). We travel a lot and have had great Disney experiences on their cruise line as well as other Disney hotels including this one.  Keep in mind that its an average room, so your experience needs to be over the

My husband and I are DVC members and we stayed in a studio of the Disney Vacation Club part of the hotel from 4/29 - 5/10.  Wow.  What a beautiful place.  The Cast Members were all so friendly and helpful.  The lobby is awesome - lots of places to sit and relax, there's a piano player and an alcove with a large fireplace.  There are also balcony sitting areas looking down to the lobby.  There are 2 restaurants and a quick service meal area, all the amenities you could want and expect at a Disney Resort.  Our studio was clean and well appointed.  It was very nicely decorated and the bed was so very very comfy.  The balcony was a nice size and had nice furniture out there.  The studio has a kitchen area and a sitting area and is a very nice size.  I would absolutely recommend this

Summary Heading: Save your money - stay somewhere else
Summary: I have stayed in many Hotels over the years, 4 star and lower.  I feel I have a great base to compare this Hotel. Ok I'll start with the good stuff:  The staff was friendly, the location was great. They gave us a complimentary character breakfast at Ariel's Grotto with our room.  Now here is the bad stuff:  SOOOOOO overpriced, even for Disney!  The food in the Hotel was bad, and I mean bad. The wine pours were a quarter glass, gone within 3 sips. One night we ordered room service, for 2 appetizer Quesidillas, 1 glass of wine and one Entree a whopping $150.00.  And again, its CoCo's quality.    The Lobby of the Hotel is huge and kind of dark, beautiful atmosphere if you are lodging in the mountains to go skiing somewhere.  Not a single Disney character in sight at this Hotel, of

Thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Average size rooms. Can see how a family with strollers would be crowded. We had a deluxe view room with a king. Perfect for us with a nice view of the Grizzly River Run and Hoolywood Tower. Food at the resort was the best and the healthiest; not so in the park. Would recommend.

We had just come from Santa Monica, where we were renting an entire apartment, so I was a little concerned about being cooped up in a small room with our 3 year old for 4 days. Not to worry. Our room was beautifully outfitted. We got a room with a queen bed and a set of bunk beds, so we had extra floor space to put our luggage and for our son to play.  It had a nice 2-person table where our son could sit to eat his breakfast, an empty mini-fridge where we could store our milk, soft drinks, water and snacks that we picked up at the grocery store. The beds were ultra comfortable (so much that I want to find out what type they are so I can buy one!). Overall, everything was top notch.  The service was impeccable. Every single person was ready, willing & able to help with any

me and my family including two grand-daughters stayed at the disney grand californian  about ten days ago...we enjoyed the resort...over the top pricey ..as expected.....best location and access to  the park...food very mediorce except for goofys kitchen which we found to be very good for a buffet....however there were NO lifeguards in the mid sized pool...my grand daughters  6 and 8 were in the pool with 21 other children....the sign said ..no guards on duty..thats great for three year olds...they also said this was not peak season even thou they were 91 and 100% occupied..this is unacceptable for a family resort...its needs to be corrected ASAP..i tried to contact mgt.  with no reply???..

What a wonderful vacation we had!  The beds are the best I've ever slept in (the best sheets & mattresses) and everything is immaculate.  The lobby is absolutely beautiful...just like the Ahwahnee Hotel in Yosemite, Arts & Craft style.  I wish I could afford to stay here every year when we visit Disneyland!!  You will love it.

This hotel of all the hotels surrounding Disneyland Resort has the best location.  You can walk through one gate to enter Downtown Disney and another gate goes right into California Adventure Theme Park.  If you have trouble walking or just don't like to do it, this is the hotel for you.  Plus, it has the best restaurant Napa Rose inside.  The lobby is very impressive with its massive ceiling and "woodland" d√©cor.  They have nice fireplaces to sit and relax.  One night a "story teller" stopped by (unexpected to us) and told everyone a funny story.  You gotta love Disney.  They take a theme down to the tiniest detail.  The d√©cor is very woodland, and not very Disney.  Inside our room was a shower curtain with Bambi and a picture of Snow White.  That was the extent of the Disney

Summary Heading: Very busy - Very Quiet Room - Worth the expense
Summary: I Stayed as a DVC (Vacation Club) member. Normally you will pay 250/night for a room like we had. A suite with a kitchen.  The rooms are very nice with 2 extra pull-out beds and a 2 portable cribs. All the 4-star amenities.  Recomendation: If you stay for more than a few days- you can shop for groceries on-line through VONS and they will deliver for free or a decent charge. The suites are well equipped and you can save a ton on soft drinks or Water - and snacks. In our case- it was needed as we have special dietary concerns.  One thing you will notice about Disney Resorts - attention to detail.  Downers: The Video reception in the room was poor. snowy channels on the TV. Several guests used room service. The plates left outside the room tended to stay there for longer than I

You don't pay the big bucks for nothing! With its own private entrance into DCA Park, Monorail access, and its own entrance into Downtown Disney, this hotel is prime for getting to the places you want to be without walking too much.   We stayed during the end of Jan 2013 which was a great time to visit. The check-in process was easy although a night the lines can be a little long. Plus they were training new Castmembers and that can make thins a little bit slower. However, once we were with someone, it went pretty fast.   The only negative thing about this hotel is that the lobby is so nice that you'd expect the rooms to be as great or better. False. The room is a standard room. They really didn't go out of their way to make anything in it super nice. Basically for rooms, you

We have always wanted to stay at the Grand.  The service from the front desk staff to the valets was fantastic.  The grounds impeccable and the ease of entering DCA was very convenient, but like others you will pay the price!  Our two night stay was $1200.00, ordinary room with a view of DCA.  The one thing that didn't work, was the wireless Internet the entire time of our stay.  Even calling the dedicated Disney IT support staff about the problem, never got the issue resolved....very frustrating and we had to use our cell phones everyday with the 4g.  We will try the Disneyland hotel on our next weekend trip!

Just returned from a 6 night stay with the family including a 5 year old and 7 month old..  Was a little nervous about the hotel after reading some reviews but it was great.  We had a bunk room which my 5 year old was thrilled with and it also gave us plenty of room for the cot.  The room was NOT looking worn (as I had read ), it was very clean and serviced very well.    I thought the bathroom lay out was good, with a low bath, which was great for bathing the kids and a seperate double basin sink outside of the bathroom, so others could brush teeth etc.  Really can not beat this hotel for convenience, especially with little ones to take advantage of the magic hours and get on the Cars ride.    Other great thing (well we thought so) was no mini bar and an empty fridge.  Was great

Our favorite place to stay with tiny grandchildren, the Grand Californian had no flaws once again.  Yes, it's quite expensive, but it's worth the ease of having quiet down-time when you have cranky people, big or little!  All the staff, from the young lady in the gift shop to the front desk to the concierge desk were wonderful.  We tried White Water snacks for the first time, as well as the pool.  All were lovely.  Three generations traveling, and it makes the occasion special every time.   Standard rooms are not large, but suites are.  This is the hotel for those seeking tranquility.

We are just finishing up a three day stay here after several day drive down the coast from washington. We have a two bedroom villa booked with DVC points.  It took a lot of points and I would not have booked the two bedroom if there was a one bedroom available. Lots of room for three people with three bathrooms. As others have mentioned the rooms are a little dark but the suite was very clean. We had to wait until 4 30 to check in but once we did the bags arrived within 10 minutes.  The fitness center is very nice as is the pool where we spent the day today. Great slide.  It is nice to be able to walk  out into Downtown Disney right from the hotel. The area had good restaurants, shops and movie theater so there is no reason to use the car. Parking is 15 a day but DVC members

I stayed there it is truly magical the rooms are great and very clean in your room you get a big flat screen hd tv and a IMHO,e dock for your iPod and they have a outdoor water park witch has a lifeguard. The staff was very firendly and nice.

The hotel rooms are well appointed and comfortable but the real beauty is the location, service and amenities. Here are my ratings:  Gym  9 Pool 10 Service 10 plus Food 10 Location 10 plus Amenities 10  The hotel is right on Disneyland, and downtown Disneys doorsteps. The experience is a once in a lifetime experience and my kids have as much memories of the hotel as thye do of Disneyland. That says a lot.

We celebrated our son's 5th birthday in Disneyland in March, and stayed at Grand Californian. While I was planning, hubby was concerned about the cost of the accommodations, but after the trip, we both agreed it was well worth it. I agree with the other reviewers, we paid premium for the location and convenience of the hotel.  The hotel was beautiful and clean. The great hall (lobby) was beautiful, airy and felt tranquil. The staff was discreet and very helpful. We like that it was not overflowing with Disney decor. It was a good break from the parks.  Our room had enough space. It was clean and kept out most of the noise. One of my pet peeves is hearing the next door bathroom. It did not happen here! Our bed was comfortable. Housekeeping was quick in making our beds. Our son

Summary Heading: So Close You Can Almost Touch It, But Do You Want To Hear It?
Summary: Used our DVC points for our first visit here. We had a two bed suite, which was immaculate and very well laid out. We appreciated the closeness of all the amenities being able to walk to both parks and Downtown in less than ten minutes from our room...However...we would have chosen a room overlooking the pool rather than ours which overlooked the funfair Pacific Pier at Californian Adventure. Down time during the day had to be spent with balcony doors closed, to shut out 'rollercoaster screaming'. Pool area was clean, with three pools and one with a slide for the children. Food is good, but to get best value for money, if you are travelling from the UK, as we were, try to get a 'meal package' with your Disney tickets.

The only decent thing that we found about the hotel was the proximity to the parks. The first room we received was completely filthy with cobwebs and all the dust above the room. When we complained they sent a housekeeping supervisor to see the room and try to convince us to stay in it after they deep cleaned it. We refused to stay and they gave us another one. When we got to the other one they had were still in the middle of cleaning it when we arrived. We thought that since they had so many people in the room cleaning that it would be clean, but we were wrong. The pictures of the mirror and bunk bed were from the second room. We called once again to complain and they sent a crew up to deep clean the room as they called it. My family went down to the pool while I waited for the

I have stayed at this hotel several times and am never disappointed.  Very pricey, but also really worth the money.  I try to watch for specials whenever possible.  My kids have made drawings in the lobby & "mailed" them to Mickey, only to wake-up to their own "mail" of autographed photos delivered to their rooms.  They have done the scavenger hunt around the hotel property and received fresh cookies as prizes.  I enjoy the "campfire" songs that happen nightly, as well as the really comfortable and friendly atmosphere.  The staff is super nice and we've never had a complaint!

Summary Heading: Great to be close to the parks, but can be a little pricey!
Summary: This property is beautiful and soooo convenient! It truly doesn't get any better. Certain rooms have bunk beds with a trundle bed as well. Our family of five slept wonderfully. The pool area is great for kids with the slides and multiple pools. So great on a hot day in Anaheim. With all of these pros, the only con is the price. You basically pay a mortgage to stay for 3 days! But, it wouldn't be Disney if it wasn't expensive, right?!

We were led to believe this was the best at disneyland. Certainly it was the most expensive. We were there at the end of april for 3 nights and had expected a nice hotel, off season. When we checked in the lady had to go see her supervisor three times so it told almost 30 minutes to check in. The hotel is tired and the rooms looked and felt dank and dirty. The next day we asked to move to a different type of room which was ok (again after visits to the supervisor). We were told they would call us when the room was ready which didn't happen. When we finally got new room cards they didn't work so another trip down stairs. We tried to get a drink at the bar twice and while a lot of staff busy stacking napkins etc only one serving and so very slow. This place is a factory with the

The Grand Californian is the perfect place to stay when visiting the Disney parks. The lobby is beautiful with an area set aside for little ones to sit in kid size rocking chairs and watch Disney movies. The staff was very friendly and super helpful. The rooms are nice, but the beds were not the most comfortable. Disneyland is a short walk away through Downtown Disney or you can pick up the monorail there. We were not able to use the direct entrance to California Adventure because there were too many people (on a Monday?) I would highly recommend this hotel, but know that you will pay for the location. Very pricey!

We stay in our Disney Vacation Club unit which is located in this hotel (1 bedroom, 2 baths, full kitchen). You can't beat the location if you are going to Disneyland. We have also found it convenient to Amtrak and Angels Stadium. The pool area is terrific and has 3 pools (one more for kids). The restaurants are terrific as well. Service is great and staff are friendly. The hotel is serviced by buses to LAX and John Wayne. The Grey Line site is nearby so it is easy to go on day trips. We have never had a car when we visit - easy enough to get around in other ways.

Stayed for 3 nights at the Grand Californian in a 1 bedroom suite overlooking the pool.  It was pricey!  The suite was very comfortable if not that luxurious.  The proximity to California Adventure is a big bonus, however the Grand Californian entrance to the park that they advertise is a joke.  There is only 1 or 2 attendants and the line is awful.  Go to the main entrance where there are more attendants and get into the park quicker.  At check in we decided to go with the upgrade to the concierge lounge.  It was nice to be able to go have appetizers and snacks all day plus "free" drinks, but I don't think it was worth $250 a day.  You could easily go buy $100 worth of snacks and drinks a day and get much more for your money.  If you can get it included in the room price -

The hotel was premium location, spotless and so convenient.  The location made the Disneyland experience so much more special and the resort itself was fabulous - the pool area was fun in itself :)  The staff were all super friendly and helpful at all times.    A once in a lifetime stay to top off the once in a lifetime visit to the Disney theme parks.

Clearly the location at this hotel is the highlight.  I believe you are paying the premium for the location, but it is worth it.   It is so nice to walk through the lobby and then either directly into Downtown Disney or California Adventureland.  This is a typical Disney Hotel, in that there are a lot of rooms and you typically have to walk pretty far from the lobby to get to the room.  The rooms are also nice. In my view, they are probably a 3 1/2 to 4 star room style.    We had a room with one Queen and two bunk beds. The kids (ages 11 and 10) loved the bunk beds.  We had a "garden view", however when we looked out from our balcony, we could see the Bear Mountain at California Adventureland- it was fantastic. I really do not think there is a bad view from anyroom at the hotel.

I would only stay in this hotel again if:  - I was going to California Adventure with kids (being able to go back to the hotel quickly is a huge bonus - in my opinion the only reason to stay here) and - I was able to get a reasonable rate on a room   Good Location. Service, cleanliness, decor, and room space does not live up to the cost and what I believe to be customary for Disney. I was in room 3424, which is over, out, around, back in, up and around again- no joke. I did change to another room, but not until I had to plea and beg for something. I was told that they were fully booked, I asked to upgrade and I'd pay extra‚Ä¶"we are fully booked in all of our room categories" hmmm strange because I found rooms online after we talked, yes pricy ‚Äì but she didn‚Äôt even give me an

The hotel is expensive to stay but its the place to stay.  Conveniantly located at Disneys California Adventure with direct access and only a 4 minute walk to Disneyland, you really do feel part of the Disney Adventure.  The rooms are nice, the hotel is great, the staff at checkin were fantastic and very helpful, friendly and happy.  Wehad breakfast at the Whitewater Cafe which is a far cheaper place to eat with you normal and basic breakfast type food, for America that is.  Not sure about that sweet cooked or fried food they eat.  If you can afford it, stay here.  You will love it.

Check-in was fast and smooth though we didn't get any offer from bell service upon arrival. Our room had a queen bed and a double-decker bed for our two kids. I felt that the price was too expensive but due to its location and access to California Adventure and Downtown Disney (which links to Disneyland as well), I didn't regret spending more here. Bathroom has two sinks which really help. Tried room service and everything tasted great. Napa Rose restaurant was extremely good!

Summary Heading: Can't Beat the location but is that enough to justify the cost?
Summary: My family of 4 (2 adults, 2 teens - boy/girl) stayed at the Grand for 5 nights, arriving April 8th.  We are huge Disney fans and go about 1x a year and usually stay off property at one of the hotels across the street on Harbor.  Before we arrived I read many of the reviews and was expecting smallish rooms and not best accommodations for our 4 adult sized family members and I was not (or was depending on your perspective) disappointed.  The rooms with park views do not have sofa bed options and my teens won‚Äôt fit in the bunk beds comfortably so we squeezed into the 2 queens . They do offer a sleeping bag if you desire (uh, no ‚Äì not for over $500. night).  Everything you read on TI regarding Four Seasons prices for Homestead Inn accommodations is correct - except, you have more

If you want to make your life easy getting in and out of Disneyland or California Adventure, staying at the Grand Californian is worth the money.  There is a entrance from the hotel directly into California Adventure.  Also, you can see the California Adventure water show from the deck on the sixth floor of the hotel.  Being so close to the parks and right in Downtown Disney takes the hastle out of staying and playing!  But it will cost you and arm and a leg to stay at the hotel.  Our room was nice, but it was odd that the room only had one nightstand.  Nonetheless, the room was quiet and had everything we needed.  The lobby of the hotel is outstanding and the restaurants weren't too bad.  When there was a wait of over an hour in Downtown Disney for a table, the wait at the

Summary Heading: If you splurge, this is the place to do it!
Summary: So its not a four seasons experience, but as far as theme and proximity it takes the cake. You just can not get closer to any Disney park than this place. The customer service was nothing to rave about, in fact the valet was extremely rude and obnoxious however it really is about location, amenities, and ambiance. This place delivers! We stayed at Disneyland hotel the second half of our trip and much prefer Grand California.

We stayed at Grand Californian in June of 2012.  We had never stayed on site at a Disney property, but it was worth the extra money.  We loved being able to walk straight into the California park and Downtown Disney.  We enjoyed the craftsman style architecture and the calm feeling the hotel conveyed.  My kids enjoyed the Disney QUEST scavenger hunt throughout the hotel.  We attended a character breakfast, I recommend ordering from the menu and not buying the buffet.  We swam one afternoon and the pool and water slide were fun.  We will definitley stay here again.  We may have not been able to get a fast pass to ride Cars if we had not had our early access privilege into California, it was the best ride we went on between the two parks.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, location is really what you pay for
Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights (2 adults and 2 kids) and loved the fact this hotel is so close to California Adventure Park, Disneyland and Downtown Disney. It is very convenient to be able to access your room during the day, have a break, then go back out into the parks. (Especially considering both parks are open until late).   In terms of the room, this hotel is just average. It's an OK size room, decent size bathroom, comfortable beds and it's clean. The lobby is lovely - the kids chairs with old Disney movies playing is a great touch.   Room service dinner was average - much better places to eat in the area. Also, if you are planning on ordering room service for breakfast, be sure to pre-order the night before as there is a long wait in the morning.   The early access to both

Hotel itself nothing to rave about but the location is unbeatable. The staff are so lovely and friendly but it is crazy busy so most things we had to wait for. Eg .having landed at LAX after a 16hr flight from Australia we had to wait until 3.45 before they could give us our room...not so fun. The location is its selling point - it has a direct entry gate into California Adventureland which means tired children are close to their beds and if you forget something you are only a moment away. Well worth the expense.

Summary Heading: A nice hotel at Disney Land California
Summary: I've stayed at this hotel for two nights in September 2009, I was visiting disney land with family and friends, the hotel was very nice and the rooms were big, clean, and nice. toilet was big and had spa toiletries. the lobby was huge and you could feel its a happy place!  I would definitely recommend a stay at this hotel.

Our family has visited Disneyland 3 times over the past 8 years and each time we have stayed at this Hotel.  Unfortunately, there have been no changes in this hotel over that time.  The rooms remain the same, same fittings and furnishings - only additions are the flat screen TV's.  But why spend any money on renovations when people are going to continue to stay here simply because of the convenience of the location to the Parks?  As for the quality of the staff and their service - I think that it is worse, if that is at all possible.  Do you know the UK comedy series, Little Britain?  There is a very dowdy looking character who sits behind a computer who is initially very friendly to the customer, but when the customer asks a question or requires some service, she taps the

Summary Heading: Ideal access to California adventure park and downtown Disney
Summary: Expensive accommodation room small for family of five . Staff extremely friendly and helpful. early access into theme park as part of our stay only way to go if you want to get on some rides. Pool area looked nice but sadly weather did not permit use. Handy access also to downtown Disney. Lobby area of hotel looks amazing.

Reading reviews before making reservations, it was clear to me that just because you are spending $500 per night, you should not expect a luxurious room or amazing service. We decided to stay here ONLY to be close to the parks because we were taking our 2 year old for her first visit. What I was not expecting was a filthy room exhibiting a complete lack of maintenance. I will upload pics from room 3113 - filthy air vents in the bathroom and sleeping area as well as a broken sink and the sink plunger's missing cap. I did get a massage one afternoon while Daddy and baby took a nap... the service itself was ok but the locker room/lounge left a lot to be desired. There is no pool or whirlpool only a sauna and steam room. The locker area is tiny so you have to wait your turn to

Summary Heading: They hit all the right notes
Summary: Disney's Grand Californian Hotel is wonderful. The staff is fantastic, and they are really focused on service. The location is perfect for both parks and Downtown Disney. All of their restaurants are fantastic. The pool is nice. Bar staff is very friendly and the food at the bar is really good. I've stayed here three times, and everytime, the staff has gone above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable. Yes, you definetly pay a premium to stay here and it is well worth it. You can stay in less expensive hotels, your experience will be very different.

We recently spent one night at the Grand Californian Hotel and it was a great night!!  They said check in was at 3pm but you can tell them you're coming earlier and if they have a room available they will check you in early.  I had requested a king room but at the time of check in they just had two queens, which was fine.  We actually didn't realize how big the hotel was until we had to walk to our room. lol  There were so many turns and twists!!  I suggest if you do stay and are not wanting to walk, request a room that's closer to the lobby.  Our room was really nice and it had a nice TV and a DVD player in it. (So if you're coming with kids you have the option of bringing Disney movies along) Anyway, we had a view of Downtown Disney and could see Space Mountain and the train

Summary Heading: Unique experience, but very poor value
Summary: You will pay a very hefty premium what is really a very average room in this hotel. Yes, they have "Grand" appointments all around you to make you feel "Grand", but for the price of one night here you could have a night AND your park admission across the street at any number of hotels (plus free breakfast for your family). The room appointments are the same as any hotel (okay, some of the light switches are sliders....wow), and you cannot sit and see anything off the balcony because of the height of the railing...you have to stand up.   If you are a Disney fanatic who cries when they step on the grounds, then this place is for you. If you want a sensible hotel value there are better options.

The resort hotel is first class in terms of staff. The structure itself is a sight to behold inside. Also highly recommend its flagship restaurant the Napa Rose. Wonderful meal! The only drawback are the rooms which are fairly simply and "motel-like" in appearance. Love the easy access to Downtown Disney which allowed our teenage sons ease with coming and going.

Summary Heading: HORRID BAR SERVICE, OTHERWISE PRETTY GOOD
Summary: We stayed at the Grand Californian six nights in February as part of a Disney package. It's a decent hotel in a fantastic location. But it has abysmal service in the bar. One of the bar tenders had to come out herself to save us from being ignored by the wait staff. Otherwise, our high expectations were met. Ease of Park access made the room price a decent value for us to celebrate my wife's birthday treat.

To start off, let me say that I am a BIG fan of Disney, and though not every experience is perfect Disney almost always meets or exceeds my expectations.   To start, the hotel is absolutely beautiful- well built and maintained. The lobby is spacious and very well appointed with plenty of helpful staff to assist you with your needs. Our room had more than enough space with a nice view and balcony. Also, each floor has multiple ice stations, so it's always convenient when you need it. Though, I didn't have the opportunity to take advantage of it, the main pool always seemed to have more than enough room for everyone who wished to take advantage of it. Also, the fitness center was small, but had more than enough for you to get by with during your stay- there are also plenty of

Summary Heading: Still Great Location - Time for A Sprucing Up
Summary: We come to Disney's Grand Californian almost every April, and we typically stay in a Craftsman's Club Conciege room.  I doubt we'll do so again.  First, the good.  The location is unbeatable.  The pools are pleasant, well staffed and clean.  Storytellers Restaurant is a gem.  Napa Rose is at the tops of all hotel restaurants and should not be missed.  Valet and bell staff are very helpful.  The lobby still looks beautiful after all these years.  And the views from the rooms are quite pretty.  Next, the not so good.  The Craftsman's Club service is indifferent and the quality of food/wine pretty poor.  For the price, the conciege service should be gold standard, and this falls well short.  Also, the quality of the GC's rooms is becoming worse by the year.  I think a major upgrade

Due to the rates offered with the Disney salute to the military, we decided to stay at a Disney property for our visit to the parks and the surrounding area.
