Of the three property hotels, the GC is obviously the closest to the parks ‚Äì basically bordering California Adventures ‚Äì and also commands the highest rack rates for their rooms.  Make no bones about it; if you stay here, you‚Äôre paying a premium price for the walking convenience.  It‚Äôs a beautiful hotel with a nice wilderness lodge theme, but if you look at a hotel as a place to sleep and shower between an early rise and a late return, there are certainly more wallet-friendly choices.  As with the other Disney resorts, your room keycard allows for Disney purchases, early entry into the parks and access to the special guest

Summary Heading: Mandara Spa at the Disneys Grand Californian Hotel
Summary: My best friend and I had a discount voucher for this spa. We live in OC and visit Spas frequently.the spa validates your Disney Hotel parking which was great. My friend thought her facial was great and I liked my Swedish massage. The treatments were wonderful, some of the best. The spa environment it's self could be improved. The locker room was tiny. We didn't use the showers but they looked uninviting. We are both familiar with a "relax" room/ waiting area before treatments and the waiting area was small and had 2 benches, felt like a hallway. I would have preferred some soft chairs and maybe an ottoman. Again, the treatments were great, so if you want a good treatment and don't mind missing the relaxing, comfy ambiance you will be more than satisfied.

Stayed at the Disney Grand Californian for a 5 day stay.  It is more than we usually pay for hotels, but what a great experience.  We had room that overlooked the park and Disney Village view.  Lots of fun! The 1 hour early entry to the park is a huge benefit.  I took the family with me when I had a business trip I took several days vacation while there.

My family of 5 stayed at the Disney Grand Californian Hotel for five days during the 2nd week of April (Spring Break). It was our 3rd time staying at this hotel in 4 years, so we are definitely repeat visitors. I've read the other reviews here where people complain about the price, stating that the hotel is old with worn furniture, dark hallways, etc., and comparing it to a Motel 6. Let me first start by saying that I've stayed at many, many different hotels during my 20 years of business travel throughout the US. Although I've never stayed at a "5-Star" hotel like the Four Seasons or have been pampered like a King, I do believe I've stayed at some very nice hotels in my travels. I would also put the Grand Californian at the top of my list of hotels which I definitely like to

Summary Heading: You're paying for convenience to park
Summary: We were there over the holidays and the hotel's decorations were lovely.  The hotel, it's amenities, and it's restaurants were very nice and clean but at super-duper prices.  You're obviously paying for the direct entrance to California Adventures.  If being able to roll out of bed and into the park is not important, stay elsewhere and save your money for something special.

We had to try staying in the Disney property once.  Our stay was great!  Nice and comfy room with responsive service.  The storyteller cafe made for some good tasting meals.  And you simply cannot express how nice it was to leave the park utterly exhausted and be in our room within minutes!  Downside?  Very, very expensive.  Probably won't stay there again in favor of a more economical place.

Girlfriend Booked A Room @ The Grand Californian For 2 Days & 1 Night.  Excellent Way To Do Disneyland! Staff Is Very Accommodating, Friendly, & Seem Genuinely Happy.  They Truly Know What Customer Service Is All About!

I've stayed at this hotel many, many times.  However, it's really not worth the money.  The Disneyland Hotel has better service, larger and quieter rooms.  This hotel does have it's own entrance into California Adventures but that really is the only reason to stay here.  It's clean and of course safe but there are many hotels in the area for way less money...ie The Candy Cane Inn

Nice interior and great location, but the rooms are old.  We originally thought there had been smokers in our room when we realized that our entire side of the fourth floor had the same musky smell, which was so strong that it smelled like smoke.  The bathroom is very basic.  For the price, the hotel rooms needed to be upgraded.  Service is also very service.  I think the problem is insufficient number of staff.

Summary Heading: Good hotel in a great location
Summary: We stayed at the Grand Californian for six nights in late March 2013.  The whole experience was great  - from check-in to departure.  Sure it is expensive but the rooms were clean and well equipped, the beds were comfortable, and we had no noise issues.  The lobby is a bit dark but the open fire was nice and the TV for the kids is a nice addition.  The food and service at the restaurants were also fine, although not outstanding.  The staff were all very friendly and helpful.  The queue to get into the park from the hotel in the mornings was always very long and you lost most of the extra hour standing in the queue.  Overall, it was a good experience and we will probably stay there again.

The Grand Californian is not only great because of its location (middle of downtown disney)  But also because of the great service provided.  I stayed for conference in April, and was delighted by the friendliness of the staff, As well as the cleanliness of the hotel.  I really do recommend this hotel to any family wishing to stay close to Disneyland.    The only negatives were:  expensive Casual eateries within the hotel,  & Expensive room service ($16 for a latte!?).  Thats it.

We stayed in this hotel April 4-72013 and had a wonderful time. 5 adults, 1 teenage, 2 young girls in a three bedroom suite. There was a balcony off of each bedroom. The best part is the location, super close to all the attractions. The downside - as a previous visitor to DisneyWorld hotels, it wasn't as "Disney" as I expected. No towel animals, no special "Disney" behavior. This was more of an adult hotel vs a child oriented hotel. There is a waterslide in the pool. Georgeous pool area - three hot tubs, three pools, drink service. But it overall wasn't super child oriented. Which, depending on the guests was a good thing. The kids got plenty of "Disney" magic while they were in the parks, just not what I expected as a previous guest of a Disneyworld hotel. This is a large hotel

Very accommodating.  Love that there is a TV on all the time with cartoons in the lobby for kids to watch while mom and dad browse the gift shop or check in, complete with child sized rocking chairs.  The hotel is beautiful and "grand".  We loved going through the back entrance directly into CA Adventure.  Its so nice to bypass the crowds going through the main gate and the main security check.  The hotel is pricey of course, but you get outstanding service, a beautiful room, and special perks for staying at a Disney hotel.  Also, there is an upper balacony open to guests for a view of the World of Color show.  Its not a perfect view and no chairs, but its still nice to see.  NOW, if you are looking for a really "Disney" feeling hotel (especially for kids, but not sickly

Summary Heading: Middle of the Road for Top price...
Summary: The room was above average, and at times somewhat noisy. I have to say the best part is the Hotel gate into the park and ease of getting back into the hotel for taking an afternoon nap. The service is pretty good if you are not a picky person. The price per night is about 300 to much a night....Its just to expensive for what you recieve...

To arrive at a property with high expectations but leave it after being underwhelmed is disappointing. While the facility is still charming enough (although still very strangely organized in a dizzying and seemingly irrational floor plan), the staff in nearly every department appeared to have lost it's luster. For the three days I was there (every department except bell services/valet) seemed to be staffed with sad, down-trodden, sometimes surly & borderline rude employees in positions that require a genuine spirit of gracious hospitality. Unfortunately, graciousness and smiles and anticipatory service were not to be found. There seemed to be a morose spirit in abundance at the hotel. I watched and observed with genuine disappointment. Because of its excellent location, I'd

I expected a hotel room and experience similar to the Fairmont or Ritz.  Although there were flashes of top tier hotel, we had too many episodes of the LOWEST tier hotel.  I had to change rooms FOUR times.  The first room wasn't ready.  The second room was noisy.  The third room had a huge wet spot/puddle on the carpet (don't ask me what).  The fourth room was fine (except the WIFI went out and there was gum on the balcony railing).    No bottled water in the rooms even though the tap tastes like the pool.    The towels were thin and grey.  One thin robe was provided the first night.  No robe the following night.  The kids complained that their eyes stung badly after swimming in the pool  The PH is probably off.  The staff was friendly and tried to help.  Disney gave us

Summary Heading: Great Place if you have the money
Summary: This is our second time staying here. We stayed at Spring Break two years ago, and again for spring break this year. I wondered if we would enjoy our stay as much, and we definitely did. The service is top notch! Staff is pleasant and helpful, rooms were clean, and the beds are very comfortable. I'm now looking for a new mattress, as the week in Disney was the first without back pain in a while ;). I always request a standard room in the vicinity of the pool, so we have a good location. Even without a "view room" we could see the pool, the Ferris wheel, and Redwood Creek Challenge from our deck. Beautiful when lit up at night! I agree with others though, that the room is not quite up to par for the price. It's nice, it's clean, and there are little Disney touches (look for the

It all started when the family decided to take a vacation together after 20 years...  Booked our favourite Place on earth "The Disneyland Hotel" & soon after were steered to stay @ the 5 star "grand Californian"   The family Arrives after a long flight & Greeted by Typical Disney Staff after 15min waiting in Driveway   Then Walked through the Automatic doors into the Lobby & the Shocked began...   At first glance this property was an Overpriced Scout camp with staff   Friendly staff greeting & Room keys in hand... off to the room we go  Arrived at the room and the shock began??? is this Room worth $700 a night??? Not a chance in hell : at first glance this room looked like a crappy motel off a highway across America    No View, No Luxury, Nothing that could possibly motivate

There are far better and far cheaper rooms nearby.  But, Disney fills this place for two reasons and only two reasons: the location and the early entry to the parks.  There are no other reasons to stay here, in what is basically an oversized motel with small rooms, mediocre food and long lines.  But, like so many others, being able to get your kid back to the room for a nap (or an emergency diaper change) 4 minutes after stepping off a ride, and getting that golden one hour of early entry every day of your stay, will cause you to quickly hand over the highway robbery rates Disney charges.  It does have good beds, too.  Concierge level gives you a room on a higher floor and access to a private room with snacks and some kids activities.  Don't believe anyone who says the higher

Summary Heading: Great location but room itself is not worth the money
Summary: Ok, The location is the best you can get in Disneyland Anaheim. The hotel has is own entrance to Disney Grand Californian. That's good during the day, but in the morning the normal entrance was even quiker!  When I arrived there where some troubles with checking in. I booked this room through an travelagency. I took them something like 20 minutes before they had everything arranged. So I went off to the entrance, luckely realizing that something was not ok, they didn't gave me tickets for the parks. So back to the reception, and another 20 minuters before they found out that it was really inclusive to what I payed in Belgium. Room wasn't ready yet. When I came back in the afternoon for my room, it wasn't the room with park view I payes for, but one with a view at the swimming

Summary Heading: Expensive. Very expensive for very average room.
Summary: We took my son to this hotel on 26th march. Even he was disappointed. It's close to Disneyland and the pools are excellent. Other than this, I can think of no reason to book it. Rooms are average. No safe in the room. Dark and Un-inviting rooms with ageing upholstery and furnishings. Nothing like I expected for $600 a night! No breakfast, thats extra. No parking, that's extra. Next time we will stay outside and drive in for sure. Anything else in that area is better value.

We just got home from there and I'm already wishing we were back!  Service was excellent and our room was perfect!  We ordered breakfast off the menu that was left in our room the night before and it was delivered on time and was delicious.  The price might seem high but you get so much food we couldn't even finish it all!  You also can't beat the location.  The only thing I was disappointed about was when we went to the park an hour early and Mickey's Toon Town wasn't even open.  That's the only reason I woke my small children up that early because I thought we'd be guaranteed to meet the characters and ride those rides.  Some other rides weren't open until 8 am either, so it was kind of pointless.

Summary Heading: Location and service can't be beat
Summary: This was our second visit to the Grand Cailfornian.  We decided to pay the higher price to stay here because it is so very convenient to be able to walk from the hotel right into the California Adventure Park.  It's especially great if you have younger children who need a break during the day or before the evening entertainment begins or if you are older (like us) and need to put your feet up between adventures.  We checked in quite early and were really pleased that our room was ready AND that the DIsney upgrade fairies found us a fabulous room overlooking the pool.  The king-sized bed and lovely linens were very comfortable for an afternoon respite between visits to the parks.  Despite it being a very busy time of year at the park, there was very little noise from the hall,

Summary Heading: Excellent First Time Experience at Disneyland!
Summary: My husband, two year old and myself had a WONDERFUL first Disneyland, California vacation.  The Grand Californian Resort and Spa was one of the many reasons this trip was a success.   We had a theme park view room.  Room views aren't a deal breaker for us but it was wonderful waking up every morning with the view of California Adventure theme park.  The rooms were spacious, clean, up-to-date and very comfortable.    One of the best resort features is that the resort has the perfect location.  We are Disney Vacation Club members and travel to Disney World in Florida regularly.  It was so nice having a change of pace at Disneyland where you walked right out of our hotel to Downtown Disney, Disneyland as well as enjoying our resort's private entrance to California Adventure.  It

In terms of location and convenience, you can‚Äôt beat the Disney's Grand Californian Resort and Spa.  As you drive up, the massive Arts & Crafts Style fascade is impressive, and the valet and bell staff will get both you and your luggage out of the car very quickly.  The hotel staffs the front desk well during the busiest times of the day, and check in was smooth, quick, and efficient.  Tickets to the resorts can be purchased directly from the front desk, and your room key doubles as a resort charge card at all the on-site restaurants and shops (but make sure you always have your Driver‚Äôs License on you as they ask for verification of ID).  If available, ask for an even numbered 240-250 room on a higher floor of the hotel facing Paradise Pier.  These are apparently the newest

It's still all about the location. My most recent stay however had a few significant hiccups-the first Room I occupied had a damp mildewy smell that seemed to be coming from the Bathroom vanity area. It's carpeted so I chalked it up to a closed up room and bathroom carpet that might not ever get much fresh air or opportunity to thoroughly dry out. I woke up my first day with a raging headache and sore throat-the man had similar symptoms and sneezy too. We went down to breakfast at the Hotel and the symptoms magically disappeared. Then when we returned to the room we realized we both felt overwhelmed with the return of the headache etc. We went to front desk-explained the smell, headache, allergy symptoms and asked to be moved. Front desk was accommodating and said they might not

From the crisp mountain air as you walk into the lobby to the sound of owls and foxes in the courtyard at night, this place was amazing. Great kids activities in the lobby for non Disney days. Supervision in the pool was unbelievable... if anything maybe a but too stringent, but who doesn't want that fir their kids around water. Great comfy beds to help you get a good nights rest and own access to California adventure which is handy esp for those with little ones.

perfect location - the back of the property is inside California Adventure, and the Grand Californian has its own entrance into the park.  a lot of the Park View rooms have really good views, but it's hit-or-miss - some of the views are obscured or not very good. if you do get a good view it's really fun to sit out on the balcony and experience the park.  the rooms are a little on the small side with tiny bathrooms  definetely way over priced

Overall a good to better than good experience at Disney. We stayed one night and did the one day hopper pass. Limited chances to get on rides unless you are there first thing in morning for fast passes. So that was not good. But more irksome was the 2 rooms we got, connected for the 4 of us, for approx $600 per night per room. I was expecting something amazing for that price per room but it could have been a base Holiday Inn. Pretty basic rooms, with one of the oldest bathrooms I've seen in a while. Aside from that, great location for hotel, great lobby. We signed up for character breakfast, Chip and Dale, and we really enjoyed that. So, overall good to better experience but for feeling taken on the room rates.

Choosing hotels when traveling with a family of 5 can be difficult, especially if you have to squish into standard rooms.   This is why I loved that our room had bunks and a pull out bed for our 3 kids, plus a massive bed for the parents. With us, luggage, toys etc - we weren't at all cramped for space in the sleeping area nor the bathroom area. It was relaxing and comfortable!  The pools were great for all ages, a good temperature and plenty of space to sit in the loungers.   Check-in was a breeze and the service was great. Plus, it had easy access to the parks plus the perks of getting bonus hours at the parks when staying here as well.   With gorgeous grounds as well as the building itself, pleasant staff and the overall 'disney magic' that is in the air, we loved our stay

We stayed in one of the DVC grand villas for a lovely four-day family vacation. It was absolutely perfect! We had more than ample space, and loved the kitchen, dining room, and washer/dryer. The beds were amazing, all our rooms were quiet, and we very much enjoyed the view. Add to that the legendary Disney customer service, and you have an excellent hotel.   But the very best thing about the Grand Californian is the location; we could easily make it to either park in five to ten minutes, which makes trips (especially with small children) so much more relaxing. I highly recommend the Grand Californian.

We stayed in a 2 bedroom, and there was a bad smell of mold when entering the room.  We complained and they sent maintenance up to spray something down the drains.  It didn't help.  After 4 nights and our children having cold-like symptoms we insisted on moving to a new room.  We received 3 fast passes for 3 rides and a day room to keep our luggage in for our trouble.  Not what i would consider compensation.  Will not stay here again.

Disney‚Äôs Grand Californian Hotel really is grand, with wonderful attention to Arts & Crafts details in every corner of this massive resort.  Additionally the hotel enjoys a privileged and convenient position in the middle of Downtown Disney, Disneyland, and the California Adventure.  There is even a direct entry from the hotel straight into the California Adventure in an area adjacent to the Grizzly River Run ride (although the entrance is not clearly shown on the property map you‚Äôre given at check-in, and you must pass through one of those ubiquitous bag check lines to enter).  Additionally on the plus side, there are some really nice not-typical-of Disney amenities in each room ‚Äì tv with substantial offerings beyond Disney channels, a double vanity, a coffee maker (pod type),

Summary Heading: OMG.. Every employee of this hotel really goes out of there way to make you feel like you own the place.
Summary: EVERYTHING ABOUT THIS PLACE WAS AWSOME.  Every time we called for service were greater with our name.  Food service was amazingly fast. Everything was oriented for the kids: ).  The parks employees where friendly and helpful. BEST way to stay at any Disney Hotel is book thru Disney. Com so you can get all the perks( free stuff...worth over $$ and one hour early in each park.) one hour early for everyday your booked in the resort.  WON'T GET THAT IF YOU BOOK THRU ANYONE ELSE.  Buy your tickets when you book it's the same price but don't have to stay in line.  Just pickup and go.  Our kids best comment was when he said, " I have a great life."   Disney does it best. YOU CAN CHECK-IN AT 7am and they hold your luggage.  YOU CAN RENT A WHEELCHAIR AT THE HOTEL TO USE AT PARKS AND

Forget the price because everyone knows it is EXPENSIVE but it is the location that you are paying for ... really!!! Stayed here for the first time and the building and the design and all didn't impress me too well and not much activites for kids to participate w/in the hotel compared to Disney hotel in Florida where they had small shows inside the lobby where kids can hang out and do arts and crafts. Nevertheless, folks gave them rave review for the location and it is true..... walking distance to Disneyland and Cal Adventure.  Customer service was fine, didn't get to chance to check out their pool, no time! Very clean, furnitures are still in good shape though old.  They make every effort to check your room in the afternoon and see if there is anything else they can straighten

We were excited to be taking our granddaughter to Disneyland and decided to splurge on the Disney Grand Californian Hotel for two nights. Our room cost was $450 per night for a basic room. The hotel is beautiful, well maintained, clean was employees offer great service. But, everything is an extra cost. Our parking charge wa $66 for just over 48 hours. To use a computer the fee was $6 for 10 minutes. I was told that the business suite was not part of Disney. Disney didn't offer free computer use. We enjoyed our time in the park but I wouldn't return to the Grand Californian because it just isn't worth the price.

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel without the "grand" Disney service
Summary: My husband and I are Disney Vacation Club Members (our home resort is at WDW) so we spent quite a large amount of our timeshare points to stay here in a 2 bedroom villa as a treat for my mother-in-law's birthday.  We were super excited to actually book a room here on our points because they are typically hard to get.  First, the check-in procedures are very confusing.  There was no queue to organize the line, one tiny sign telling you where to line up, and a single staff member armed with an iPad to try to expedite the process.  Keep in mind, we stopped in early (around 1pm and check-in is officially 3pm) to get all of our paperwork done and get a credit card on file so we could get back to the parks  We were offered self parking for free (they neglected to tell us at first that

As a frequent Disney park guest and big Disney fan, I was excited to stay at the Grand Californian.  I really wanted to be thrilled with the experience but instead I was left feeling it was just an average experience. Here's why: We had just finished a 6 day Disney Cruise and arrived in Anaheim directly from the ship at approximately 11am. I had hoped potentially for an early check in, but was told that the earliest they might have the room ready was 4pm.  When 4pm finally came we went to our room. We were staying in a Villa ( Disney Vacation Club ) room.  The room was quite large, but sadly was on the ground floor facing a wall  -  we were just on the opposite side of Goofys Sky school.  There was a path right outside our room and if someone was walking along there, they would

Summary Heading: Location and convenince to downtown and parks is unmatched
Summary: My husband and I decided to go all out and stay at the top of the line hotel while visiting Disneyland.  The Grand Californian Hotel was nothing less than you'd expect for a Disney property.  There was absolutely nothing wrong at this hotel, just probably not our style in the "Lodge" type setting.  Overall the hotel is a bit dark because of all the dark wood and lodge-like atmosphere.  If you're into that type of nature setting, I'm sure you would love it.  Service and cleanliness were top notch.  The location is great with an entrance from the hotel to Downtown Disney and a direct entrance to California Adventure Park.

We stayed here as part of a Disney vacation package.  They did their best to make everything easy for us.  When we arrived the valet took our van and we didn't think of it again until we left.  The room was nice.  There were two queen beds so we had one and gave the other to our son.  There was a small balcony, but you have to pay extra for a view.  It might be worth it to get the view of Disneyland if you think you will be too tired to stay for the fireworks (we were).  We did not take advantage of the pools, but they looked nice.   The extra magic hour alternates by parks and we only went to Disneyland, so we had one extra hour.  It was worth it!  Only tomorrowland and one other "land" was open for the extra hour, but you can't beat walking right up to Space Mountain at 8 am

Summary Heading: Best way to experience Disney - if you can afford it
Summary: We really love this hotel because, - early morning access to the park every day (but there is usually a 15 to 20 minute line up each morning) - easy access to park - one entrance brings you right into California Adventure park, next to Grizzly River Run which is where the Fast Pass distribution is for the World of Colour.  Get one first thing as they run out quickly.  The best place to view World of Colour is the bridge but its a "Blue" viewing area. We found easy access to park (and exit) very very nice as we went in and out of park to access pool, room, naps etc.  exclusive access for hotel guests to this entrance until 11 am daily. - beautiful, beautiful hotel. From page boy parking attendants, to stained glass doors, Lobby is spectacular, dark wood accents and vaulted

Summary Heading: Love this little piece of the Awahnee in Anaheim
Summary: Disney pulled out all the stops when they designed this hotel. It has the feel of the Awahnee (Yosemite National Park) but with all the modern amenities a traveling family would need. I especially like the easy park access to the California Adventure.

Love this hotel.  I'm middle-aged, and I felt like a little kid at each turn around the hotel grounds.  There were Disney characters at the Storyteller's Cafe during the breakfast brunch.  Easy in and out of the California Disney, and Downtown Disney is only a few steps away.    I loved all of the sitting areas around the grounds as well.  Or grab a drink at the Lounge and sit next to the fireplace.  We were on the 4th floor, with a nice view of the pool grounds.  Would definitely go back, hopefully with the husband the next time around.  We valet'd for $15 I think.  If you don't plan to use your car the entire time, I would recommend, instead of having to cross the street to the self-park, which is only a few bucks less.  You do need to give yourself time, since it took a while

Great location helps break up long days/evenings at Disneyland!  We had a pool view room and it was very comfortable.  Kids loved the breakfast, too!  We've stayed at other hotels on Harbor Blvd in the past and it is worth paying a little extra to stay right in the park.

Beautiful!  Our first stay in a DVC villa at the Grand Californian.  Our room overlooked Paradise Pier and we could watch The Wonderful World of Color from our living room and balcony.  Furnishings were lovely and used the compact space efficiently.  The bookcase/Murphy bed was a great solution and surprisingly comfortable.  Very handy to have 2 bathrooms in a one bedroom villa.  Bonus--you enter directly into California Adventure from the hotel and you have early morning access to both parks.  This let us do all of Carsland before 1030 each morning.  One day we were the only people on our pod in Soaring!!  Delightful!  Can't wait to visit again, just wish it wasn't 3000 miles from home.  Only complaint is that the staff at reception and guest service really don't seem at all

We had a great experiance with our family's stay at the grand californian. The rooms were very nice and the staff was exceptional. The location of the hotel in the the hearty of Downtown Disney and at the entrance of the two parks is the best! We would go to the park, back to the room then eat somewhre in Downtown Disney and then repeat:) I recommend Naples, The Story teller, The Rain Forest, The Hagendaus Ice cream, House of Blues, Ariel's Grotto to eat. I was able to leave the family and make some meetings while there.

Summary Heading: A little worn but great service and perfect location!
Summary: The Grand Californian has a lovely lobby and great service.  The room was decent sized and clean, but a bit worn about the edges.  Still, you don't stay here for glamour, you stay for the location.  The convenience of the location cannot be overstated!  Particularly if you have small children, and want to be able to take a break in the middle of an exhausting park day.  The breakfast buffet is great, although expensive like everything associated with the park.  Again, for us it was worth it for the convenience.  You get early entrance to the parks when you stay the Disney hotels, but only on certain days.  Plan ahead so you can take advantage of this!

Summary Heading: A Magical Stay at the 'Grand Calfornian'
Summary: We stayed for five nights.  It seemed as if every employee at the hotel was determined to show us extra special attention.  My daughter was in a 'Dance the Magic' parade at Disneyland on this trip. We loved our room, and the hotel is so beautiful.  At night, we went out to one of the patio's where the outdoor fireplace was, and it was so beautiful out there, and the landscaping was perfect.  Even when I had a craving for tomatoes late at night, the staff was more than eager to find some in the kitchen and prepare a nice little plate of sliced tomatoes for me, with a garnishment on top!  They treated me like a queen, more than eager to do my bidding, they even bowed to me (I don't think I've ever been bowed to before)!  When the five nights were over, we were very sad to leave.

So we had a wonderful family vacay when we stayed at this hotel.  So convient and close to the park with our kids made life so easy.  The staff were very friendly and everything was very cleaned and maintained.  The only thing was that I thought we booked the 3 bedroom villa and we only got a room with 3 adjoining rooms and a small living room.  don't think I would have paid the amount I did if I knew we weren't getting a kitchenette and 2 stories!  Hotel didn't do anything because they said it was our mistake at booking:(  Only bad part of the experience.  Ran into lots of celebs too at this hotel which was kind of fun for us grown ups:)

Summary Heading: Waited Over 4 Hours for Room and Had Megaphone next door kept us up all night
Summary: The manager could not be ruder if he tried. Got in a little early and went to check in, they said it would be about 30 minutes. Came back and room still not ready and that started the mantra "We have till 4 pm" that I would hear for the next 3 hours. Finally at 4:30 we were going to another hotel down the street and Magically our room was ready. After being promised the room would have great views and we would love it, we got to look at the fence by the Jelly Fish Ride. I asked the Manager to move us, but he said rudely no other rooms. About midnight started the work outside our room about 20 feet away with a Megaphone yelling every hour or so "Come the Jelly Fish ride","Mr Brown to the Jelly Fish ride" all the way until 7am. After no sleep we went to the park and it took 45

Our family loved staying at the Grand Cal.  It was very clean and well appointed.  Service and staff were great but could get a little "teste" if you did not accept there first response to a question or issue you may have.  Some almost "growl" right through their smile! Honestly, the best thing about the hotel is the location.  Directly adjacent to the California Adventure resort!  Just walk out of the hotel and literally right into the park next to the Grizzly Mt. Rapids ride!  No parking issues, (other than the $22 per day for valet), just walk right in.

Disney's Grand Californian is extremely over priced for what you get. Save your money and stay at Paradise Peir. The rooms at Paradise Pier are equally as nice as the Grand Californian and cost hundreds of dollars a night less. We (mom, dad and four kids) have been going to Disneyland for the last 20 years at least once a year. I have always wanted to stay at the Grand Calif. and finally saved enough for all of us to stay there. I figured it was something extraordinary for the price of $545.00 a night for the average room. What a disappointment!!!! Our room was smaller than both of the rooms at the Disneyland Hotel and Paradise Pier. The service was average. They tried to over charge me at check out. I will never stay at The Grand Calif. again.

We are big Disneyworld fans, so for our fist trip to Disneyland we thought we would splurge on this hotel.  The staff was pleasant, the decor was in keeping with the theme, and all was clean.  But, the room was small, we looked out over a roof into the courtyard area, and all for a hefty nightly fee.  The one huge plus to this hotel is the ability to walk to both parks with ease.

This is just the best hotel, clean, comfy, the room has everything we need in perfect order. You just cannot beat the ease and conscience. Love the view of the park. Try to get a high floor. Also great to have a fridge in the room.

Let me preface by saying I LOVE Disney... seriously love Disney. Like well up in tears as soon as we pass through the DL Park or MK gates LOVE Disney. Honeymooned at, wrote a master's thesis on, LOVE Disney. So when I get to Disney, I'm ready to be swept off my feet in magic, cast member love, all of that. The first time we stayed in Anaheim, we stayed off property. Wasn't prepared to pay the prices with just a 2 yr. old. This time we went for the full banana, Grand Californian, dining experiences, magic morning, etc.   This hotel is beautiful... I compare it with Wilderness Lodge, Great Wolf, Big Cedar in Branson... But I just couldn't get too excited about it with the prices. I know it's Disney, I'm prepared for that, but it's a just a little ridiculous for what you get. Don't

Positives:  extremely friendly staff, loved that they store bags for you before check in and after check out, early entrance to the parks, private entrance to the park, right on the park property, great view of the world of color show from the upper deck , very convienent to be able to use hotel key card as payment in the park at shops and restraunts,  really liked that they offered a room with bunk beds, and bed turn down service (my kids loved the surprise mint on their bed every night.. The gym was above average for a hotel.   cons: the rooms themselves were basic. For what we paid I would have liked to have had a microwave, (There is a fridge) And we would have like to have a had a garden tub or something we could have soaked in, the standard hotel tub isn't exactly adult

The Grand Californian is very impressive and very convenient to the Disney Parks in Anaheim. It has it's own entrance into California Adventure. Steps away from both parks and the Downtown Disney area.   Beautiful but the rooms are starting to show their age. The walls need better sound proofing. Getting to your room can be a nice little hike but hey you're in Disney's Flagship Hotel. Don't get me wrong, it's a nice place to stay but I remembered it when it was brand spanking new.  I was there for a convention so the rates were extremely good for a Disney property. Lot's places to eat. If you're in the hiking mood, you can even walk in between the park entrances to Katella Ave. and dine at non-Disney restaurants.  Definitely a place to try out and emerse yourself in the Disney

4 night stay in late February for 2 ladies on a 'girls only' trip to the Disneyland Resort.  What can I say, our hubbies just aren't into Disney!    This was my 3rd stay at the Grand, and like the 2 before it, once again Disney worked its magic!  The CMs are friendly and accommodating, from check-in to check-out.  Our room was spotlessly cleaned, the bell staff was quick to respond to any needs, and the staff at the restaurants are always friendly and accommodating (I have food allergies, Disney is wonderful!).  We were upgraded to a Courtyard View (my favorite, love the monorail).  The rooms at the Grand are 'typical' size.  But they are spotlessly clean, the furnishings look fresh, and those beds are heavenly!!    You are paying for the location and the Disney Magic.  To be

Only stayed one night but loved the hotel.  It was beautiful with fully appointed rooms.  Very accomodating staff - typical Disney hospitality.  Staying at the hotel allowed you to have early access to the parks and enter California Adventure from the hotel.  Very convenient.

Wife and I stayed here this past weekend. The early admission and private entrance to DCA was a major advantage for our short stay. We were able to take advantage to get a head start on the new Radiator Springs ride and Toy Story Arcade before the park got too crowded. Also location made it very easy to drop off purchases and not have to carry all day. There is a very nice bar where adults can relax and enjoy peace and quiet along with a cold drink. Bartenders were very friendly and efficient. The snack shop is near the main pool and has a variety of selections. Downtown Disney is a short walk for more dining and shopping. If you are flying you can get boarding passes from concierge or use business center at no cost to print your own. The Disneyland Express bus goes to LAX and

This hotel has comfortable rooms that are tastefully decorated. My room was a pool view with a nice big sliding glass door. It was a short walk to the convention center which is what brought me to the area. I enjoyed the Storeyteller's Cafe for breakfast and the easy access to Downtown Disney for dinner and shopping in the evening. The hotel is quite expansive. My room was very close to the lobby but a few colleagues had rooms that were a long hike. Overall, it was a great stay.

Stayed 3 nights at the hotel last month.  At check-in we were instantly upgraded to a pool view room.  The room was nicely appointed.  The bathroom (and tub) were on the small side.  Loved that the double sink was separate from the toilet/tub.   The proximity to the park was amazing.  It was extremely convenient to come back to the hotel to rest in the afternoon.   Decent snacks at white water snacks.  The pools and hot tubs were awesome.   Ate at Storytellers cafe a few times.  It was so convenient and had just enough variety.  The princess character breakfast at Ariel's Grotto was worth it for the princesses (not for the food). Don't recommend getting the meal vouchers as it's easier to just use a credit card.

I am a DVC member so I booked a 2 bedroom Villa months in advance (you have to with the Grand Californian) and my plans changed slightly where I came in a day early so I also booked a Club Level room for our first evening.  The Club level room was spacious 2 beds and a small trundle bed/couch and of course having access to the Club Level room where you can watch the fireworks and have snacks available is always a big plus. Then I moved to the 2 bedroom Villa and since this was my first experience at Disneyland Villas I wasn't sure what to expect.  What a room!  It was well laid out with a master bedroom with king bed and large jet tub and shower. The second room had two double beds and a large bathroom with a shower.  There was also another bathroom in the kitchen/dining area

Booked a room here back in June 2012 (excited for Cars Land!!)  Decided to splurge on our last trip to DLR as our annual pass was going to expire soon.  In the past we have stayed at Paradise Pier, and walked through the Grand's inviting lobby many times to access the private entrance into CAD.  We're not early risers so we never made use of the hotel or AP early entry, but was told it gets pretty crowded.  Valet and room check in was smooth.  Stayed in a standard room with courtyard view.  The room was pretty small but comfortable for our family of four.  My kids enjoyed watching the monorail pass through the hotel every 10 min.  I happened to notice there were even Mickey ears sewn in throughout the carpet!  On our floor, there was access to an outside patio area that had a

Summary Heading: If you are going to "do disney" stay here!
Summary: There are cheaper hotels to stay when at Disney. There may even be better hotels.   Make no mistake however if you are desiring "the full Disney Experience" this is THE place to stay.  The early "magic hours" - the private entrance to California Adventure - and the proximity to Downtown Disney make the Grand Californian almost worth the money.   It is expensive, the rooms are small, and the dining options limited and costly.  All negatives. But the property itself is beautiful. They did a nice job extending the Disney Magic into this hotel which simply isn't the case for the other two Disney properties.  The caveat here is if you are planning to go ALL OUT - not looking to save money - you simply can't beat the experience offered by the Grand Californian.

We booked this hotel at more than half off due to a group event, so please take into account that my review is based on the value at THAT price.  I would have a much different opinion at the usual price.  We checked into the hotel very early, around 7am, and were given a room right away.  Every employee we came across was very friendly.  It seemed housekeeping came by several times throughout the day, as every time we came back to the room the beds were freshly made with a nice note (have a great night, etc) and chocolates on the comforters.  The location can't be beat, especially if you will be changing clothes during your park outings (as we did).  The room itself was nothing spectacular, but it was more than enough for us and absolutely every inch was spotless.  If we ever

The reason to stay at the Grand Californian begins an ends a three word cliche...location, location, location.  The phrase has been around so long because it's true. You can't put a price on ease of access to the parks, views and convenience.  Well, you might not be able to, but Disney sure can...and the price is substantial. While you do pay more to stay at the Grand Californian, on balance you get solid value for the dollar.  The perks?  Easy, friendly check-in, a sophisticated and subtle Disney environment, but most of all...quick access to the parks of Disneyland. The dedicated entrance to California Adventure, especially now that it hosts Toy Story Midway Mania and the Cars experience, the two most popular attractions in either park, makes staying here worth the cost.  But

Summary Heading: Best place to stay in Disneyland
Summary: If you are willing to splurge, this hotel is the best choice in Disneyland.  Check-in was easy and the staff was extremely helpful; we were given tips on how to spend our time at the parks wisely (the tips really did help!). We put in a request for a king bed and upon check-in were told they couldn't accommodate our request and had upgraded our room. When booking at Disneyland hotels you do not get bed size options, and they told us there was no guarantee; upgrading our room was a nice surprise and gesture. They checked one last time before giving us our room and housekeeping ended up putting together a king size room for us, keeping the upgrade! The room was beautiful and spacious. Our balcony faced Downtown Disney so we were able to sit, drink wine, and listen to the live

Summary Heading: Grand! But not the best for Disney Experience
Summary: I love all things Disney!!! And this is a gorgeous hotel and the private entry into DCA is the best feature.  But if you want the true Disney experience.  Stick with the original! I am also not a fan of the layout of the hotel.. The common areas are fine but navigating the halls to your rooms is a nightmare.

If you're a mouseketeer anyway, you'll probably love the Grand Californian. If you're not, and you're only at Disneyland because the kids wore you down, staying here might help ease the pain. My family has stayed here several times (full disclosure: I like Disneyland), and the rooms are always nice -- clean with no signs of wear (problems I've started to notice more and more in other hotels). True, the rooms are not big, and it's not cheap, but it's a nice property in its own right, and of course its location is a big plus for any Disneyland visit. On our most recent visit we had a room overlooking the pool area and, beyond, the Ferris wheel and roller coaster in the California Adventure Park -- a great view at night, when they're lit up. Our fifth floor room had no problems

We stayed two nights and had two adjoining rooms.  We were not in the hotel much but service there was as good as expected.  All questions were answered quickly and staff were very friendly.  Our room was very clean and spacious.  Hotel is not the Four Seasons, don't go expecting 5-star accommodation.  The price is for the location and proximity to the park and magic hour. We did miss seeing the fireworks from our room but the positives far outweighed this one negative. Getting into to the park an hour early can not be under valued; especially with a 2, 4 and 5 year old who have little patience for waiting in lines.  We were able to stay ahead of the crowds, all three days and avoid almost all lines except for 5-15 minutes here and there. CA Adventure Park entrance at hotel is

We initially were booked at the Disneyland Hotel and then realized that it was a further walk then we wanted to the parks with our 2 and 8 year olds so we changed to the Californian.  I know the Disneyland Hotel has been renovated and is more 'disney' but we had the Theme Park view that was awesome becuase when the kids were tired they could watch the firework from the balcony.  Walking into adventurleand was taking an elevator down to the first floor and walking 50 feet to the turnstyles and there we were....in the park.  Disneyland was just the opposite way but like a 4-5 minute walk through downtown disney.  The location of this resort is what you pay for...and yes it is worth going and getting themepark view and being at the Californian.  We really did not venture too much

We decided to go all-out on our trip to Disneyland to celebrate our 50th anniversary, and stay at the Grand Californian. We are not sorry. Our room overlooked Disney's California Adventure Park and we could see the World of Color show from our balcony. The service was exceptional by the entire staff (cast members), and we were treated exceptionaly well. The Grand Californian has its own entrance to DCA, and is in the middle of the Downtown Disney shopping/dining area. Very convenient. Park the car and leave it parked until ready to leave. All the Disney hotels are more expensive than many families can afford, but in many ways they are worth the extra cost. The hotel is somewhat on the order of the National Park hotels at Yosemite, Grand Canyon and Yellowstone. Lots of wood, old

The Grand Californian is starting to look "not so grand". The hotel has really lost its sparkle. It is now showing a lot of wear and tear. The check in process was long and difficult. The room was very ordinary for the price and it was possibly the worst shower I have had in a hotel in the last 10 years, with very poor water pressure. It was definately a dissapointment, and we would probably not stay here again. I suppose you are paying for the location, being so close to the parks is a bonus and the direct entrance to California is nice.

Summary Heading: A Lot to Pay for private entrance to California theme park
Summary: I paid Four Seasons prices to stay in Anaheim where I was in line to park, check-in and dine.  The room was tiny with a small bathtub.  Nothing luxurious.  We even got upgraded but still not impressed.  We do get a one-hour head start at a park every morning.  Kids didn't want to nap due to all the excitement at the park so not much advantage to staying close-by considering you get to line up with everyone else as people stampede out of the park after the parade.

This was our second stay here at the Grand Californian, and it remains a visually stunning property.  Additionally, the convenience of the location is beyond debate.  The extra Disney magic hours are fantastic - I don't think we ever would have been able to ride the new Radiator Springs Racers ride without the extra hour!  The service is very good, just not 5 star good.  We will stay here again, absolutely, in the future.  For us, DisneyLand and DisneyWorld, is about emersion - full emersion into that wonderful world that Walt created, and staying on property is a crucial part of that formula to us.

Summary Heading: 3 Star Hotel, value is in location and magic hour
Summary: The room, linens, towels are of the same quality as a Best Western or Homewood Suites.   What you are paying for is the location and magic hour. Our first time to Disneyland and we found the lineups became unbearable from 11 am onwards. But from the start of magic hour to 11 you get the equivalent of a full day if you started your day at say 10. Then you can head back to the hotel to use their pool which I would rate as a 4 star amenity.  Food was average and everything was overpriced down to the $8.00 can of Heineken in the hotel mini-mart.  If you have toddlers and want to do rides, desoute the cost it is the ace to be. But if you have older kids then may be better to stau at a 4 star off resort and save yourself at least $250/night.  If I go with any kid under say age 6

We were walking in DT Disney and stumbled on to this hotel. Needless to say, after lunch we ended up at the front desk inquiring about a room for the remainder of our trip. We ended up getting a room overlooking the pool for the last 3 days. We were happy about the move as our previous hotel was FAR away and the wait for the ART transit was ridiculous. This is the ideal location...yes that is what you are paying for...rooms are pretty standard, but all the amenities including the pool are worth it. The magic hour and entrance to California Adventure is right in the hotel....soooo convenient. The restaurants are all great and character breakfast was a nice surprise. This is esthetically a beautiful hotel and the service was pretty good. The bell service could use some work-when

The location is awesome. Great place to be so close to the park. Love the early entrance. The room was mediocre. Towels were not fully stocked, had to call for robes. Our kindle was "lost" from our car to our  room... Bell service was responsible for our baggage but they claimed they never saw it even tho, my son put it in one of the bags. The service is terrible, not sure if the have turn down, if they do, you would not know. The exercise room is great for a resort. They need to work more on their customer service. Their prices are on same level as a Four Seasons but the service cannot compare. Aside for the convenience of the location, this is not worth the stay.

Summary Heading: Pluses and minuses but overall a stunning resort
Summary: This hotel really puts the Disney attention to detail on display. A beautiful Arts and Crafts themed design with lots of dark wood beamed ceilings and wall paneling, but it wasn't too dark inside with plenty of large windows that let light inside. We had a room overlooking the pool area which was not too much of a noise problem and at night my husband kept the balcony door cracked to listen to the cricket recording they turned on at night. Charming touch. The bad was waiting for check in and since we were with a returning group, we got the in room check in. Only problem was it took about 20 minutes waiting at the desk for them to find someone (who turned out to be none too knowledgeable about the resort) to check us in. Also we realized after a couple of days that our room door

The location of the hotel is of course awesome...very convenient to get into the park. The big thing about staying in the hotel is the extra perks; like early access and direct access to parks or late night extra hour in the park to get on rides.  Now speaking about the accommodation its nothing out of the ordinary; in fact I would say that for the price its not all that. I think its an ok hotel but nothing WOW about it.

Summary Heading: Pleased at the end of the trip, but experienced hicups
Summary: We just spent 4 nights at the Disneyland Grand California over president's day weekend. We booked a 1 bedroom suite and stayed in it with our toddler and 6 year old.  Upon arrival via a shuttle, there were at least 15 "cast members" in the entrance area but no one helped us with our bags. I found that a bit odd. When you see a family of 4 with luggage and strollers spill out of a van the logical thing to do is to assist them. No one bothered.  We went straight inside and the kids camped out in the TV viewing area which made a 10 minute checkin work. Nice touch. We were upsold on concierge service for $250/night which seemed like a lot based on what they described we'd get so we passed. We then proceeded to the rooms.  The elevators are fast with 4 zooming up and down at all

We have stayed here twice with our family. Each time, we had to wait in a looooong line at check in (about 45 minutes last time) with our luggage and two tired kids in tow. Both times, we have checked in after the "check in" time, but our rooms have not yet been ready, despite our reservations being made months in advance. This last time, our room wasn't ready until about 7 pm. This resulted in a tired toddler needing an afternoon nap having a meltdown. Each day we have stayed at the Grand Californian, our room has never been serviced before late afternoon (despite our leaving the "please make up our room" sign out). Because of this, we have had to choose between our trash being emptied and our kids being able to take naps in the afternoon. Even at a discount, we paid over

Summary Heading: The Magic is gone at the Grand Californian
Summary: I am a DVC member, and this is my first negative review at one of their resorts. I have a huge tolerance for things, but this was amazingly bad. We were unable to get one room for our length of stay, so we had to move. We checked out on time (11am), but at check in time (4pm) our room was not ready (5 hours we waited)!!! Upon going to complain and talk to a manager, we were treated with blank stares and platitudes with no real solution to our problems other than a couple of fastpass's. As we are from the east coast we usually confine ourselves to Disney World. After this trip, I can honestly say it will be a long time before we come back to the west coast and even longer before I stay in the Grand Californian again!!!

We stayed here for 3 nights and it was wonderful...as Disney always is in my experience!   When we arrived I really was taken aback as the lobby/reception is simply stunning...so beautiful! We were greeted and checked in in classic disney style (very enthusiastic and friendly reception staff!)   The room was clean, spacious and comfy. It was nicely decorated and had a nice feeling of warmth to it. There were lots of lovely little touches such as a framed picture of Micky and a Bambi shower curtain. The bathroom was also very nice. One teeny tiny complaint...I had a bath and it was seriously the shallowest bath I have ever been in! To me this was a very minor inconvenience but if you're the type of person who can't live without a long hot soak before you go to bed, you may want

Summary Heading: THIRD STAY AND SADLY OUR LAST
Summary: I really hate to have to write a negative review on this hotel, as it was our third stay and we were so looking forward to it,  but our next trip to Disneyland I will find another hotel.  we only stay at Disneyland resorts but this time it truly showed how you are just $$$$$ and not a valued customer.  Don't get me wrong we chose to spend a lot on our room and a lot on our view (park view)..we had a view of CA right behind Goofy's Flight School. We love this hotel because it is close to everything and very convenient,  but the whole vibe of the place now is "cold"  you actually get scared to ask for anything because a lot of the staff make you feel like you are pushing your luck or something.  Our other 2 visits were fine, but it has gone down hill, in service and that friendly

Summary Heading: 2 Nights at the Grand Californian with Costco Package
Summary: Just back from 2 nights and three days at Disney's Grand Californian.  Loved the hotel almost as much as much as the Ahwahnee in Yosemite.  Much to our surprise, it is not a knock off.  Rather a very beautiful representation.  We especially liked the fact that it was not just more disney fun.  It was a bit of a relief to escape to the Grand Californian in the afternoon.  We really enjoyed the pools and staff was excellent.  We checked in about 4:30 on a Sunday afternoon.  We asked nicely and were upgraded to a view room.  We were in Room 4322, 4th floor with a view of the pool and an adequate sized balcony. We could also see the ferris wheel in California Adventures, which was so pretty to watch change colors at night.   Plus a bit of the World of Colors show.  This room was

Summary Heading: The place to stay if you're here for the parks
Summary: The staff was exceptionally friendly here, and because we checked in midweek in early February, there were no delays at all getting registered and in our rooms. In fact, since there was no line behind us, the gentleman at the reservation desk spent a lot of time with us giving us tips about getting around the parks, he dug out some first time visitor souvenirs for us, and pointed us to a 4 o'clock kiddie scavenger hunt (where cookies for all were the prize).  The location to the parks can't be beat, and the morning in-hotel California Adventure line was no more than a 15 min wait. Food was a bit pricey at Storytellers, and you can get some of the same things for cheaper at the neighboring snack shop.  The pools were fantastic, heated enough to even be enjoyable in February.  The

Our room was a 3 minute walk to California Adventure and a 5 minute walk to Disneyland.  This is a very nice, though pricey, property.  Very clean and well laid out.  The only negative impressions were with the actual check in process.....it took 25 minutes to get to the front of the line (only two employees working); and with the staff in general.  No one was very friendly and they were more concerned with talking to each other than the guests.  Though it wasn't enough to negatively impact my stay it was obvious the staff isn't very happy with their jobs. Stay here for the convenience, location and the quality of the facilities at a Disney property.

We checked in after waiting in line for sometime. We were very tired. We got to the room, which was a disaster. The noise level from Downtown Disney was awful. We asked to change rooms. Someone came and gave us a new room assignment. Meanwhile, our luggage from the bellhop was lost. We ordered room service in the new room. Our waiter went to find our luggage. But my boyfriend's hat was gone! We waited 2 hours for our luggage and without the waiter's help, he probably would have been worse.  The breakfast at the restaurant on property was cold. We could not get reservations for dinner. We had to eat at Disneyland.

Summary Heading: You are paying for location and convenience
Summary: We usually stay at a neighboring hotel and shuttle to the parks.  But this time, we decided to splurge on this last minute 2-night trip.  I was grateful for the convenient location as my son and husband were not feeling well.  They would make quick trips back to the room when feeling tired and rejoin the rest of the group when rested.  No shuttles or long walks!  For this trip, the hotel's location was a lifesaver!  We reserved the lowest end room and had a quiet view of the parking lot :)  Not a huge concern to us as we were seldom in the room and awake.  The room was an average size and we asked for bunk beds, thinking that this would be better for my kids.  However, my son is 6'3" and really didn't fit.  He said after that he'd prefer sharing a bed rather than being hunched

Summary Heading: Best stay at any Disney property so far.
Summary: Stayed at the Grand Californian for the Holidays.  They did an amazing job with the decorations and all the Holiday events in the lobby.  Checked in a bit early but was still able to get a room.   We were celebrating quite a few special family occasions and got an upgrade to a room with a wonderful view of the pools. We had a few special gifts for our first turndown service as well.  The cast members were all extremely gracious, helpful, and generous with our requests.  I highly recommend anyone stay at this Hotel.

Loved it!  Exceptional hotel, everything was just world-class. The spa was my favorite as well as the hotel lobby which was very relaxing.  So convenient to be right there in Disney.  Disney is great for the kiddos, but this gave us an opportunity to take our time and enjoy it, rest, and get back out there without feeling rushed since we were actually staying onsite.  It's wonderful architecture.  The lobby is the place to just lay around.  We had a big group of friends and a party in the evening outdoors and it was perfect.

The Grand Californian Hotel has the best location in Disneyland, it is next to the California Adventure park. We were with our 3 year old, and it was quick and easy to access the park directly from the private entry through the hotel, and come back to the hotel quickly.  The lobby is grand with a nature-based theme, not tacky at all. Front desk staff was very efficient for check in and check out. We had pre-paid our stay through the Airline travel agency and it was smooth.  The rooms are nice, but not spectacular. They have nice views and quiet in general. A small problem is that it‚Äôs a long walk to get down from your room as the hotel is very long with not enough lifts.  I just would not rate this highest value because it is the most expensive of the Disney hotels in Disneyland

Yes, it costs a bundle, but if you're old and tired, just being able to walk back to your room instead of catching a shuttle or two saves a lot of time and energy. We would go back to take a nap without killing most of the day, and come back refreshed in the afternoon to keep doing stuff. I was leery of the cost when my wife booked it, but this has been our most enjoyable trip to D land in years, just because were not as tired as we have been in the past. ThThe

Summary Heading: Good but the prices not so great.
Summary: Great location but the prices get higher and higher every year for not much extra. I remember when rice krispie treats were free each visit. Now you pay. Yet the price has gone WAY up for a room....lame

Summary Heading: Not the happiest place on earth!
Summary: We (family of 5) were enticed to stay at the Grand by it's 5 star rating and access to Disneyland and California adventure park.  Does it deserve the 5 stars? In my opinion no.  I realise star rating relates to facilities but give me a break decor and service is a HUGE part of why you spend the money to stay at a 5 star rated hotel and this place has neither!! I hate to sound so negative as it is true access to Disneyland is excellent which is vital when you have young children who need a rest during the day.  The management need to have a good look at their staff or even better go to Disneyland hotels in Hong Kong and see how it is done !  I would expect smiling service at the "Happiest place on earth"

Summary Heading: Cant beat staying on Disney property.
Summary: Spent three nights in January using Disney Vacation Club points, mid-week. Even for points, it was expensive. Not sure what it costs in dollar value but I am sure it must be over $300 per night. For the price, you get a very well appointed standard sized room with two sinks, mini-refrigerator, and a very comfortable bed. Evening turn down service adds a nice touch. Guest self service laundry had plenty of machines. But the reason we stayed here was not the room. It's the location. This property is attached to Downtown Disney and California Adventure (with it's own entrance). The two other Disney properties are equally nice. But the location of this hotel makes it the prime location to stay at. Getting to Disneyland is simple as walking 5 minutes to the monorail located in

I have been to Disneyland 3 times in the past 2 1/2 years.  I thought I would 'splurge'.  Not worth the money!!!!  I would rather of stayed on Harbor Street at the Carousel Inn,  Much nicer rooms. The rooms here were starting to look run down.  They were small.  The dresser drawer wouldn't stay shut....the lights by the bed wouldn't turn off.  I spent 6 days.  Other than getting in early to the park everyday, the Grand Californian Hotel was a HUGE disappointment.  Save your money and stay on Harbor Street.  Its not that long of a walk into the parks.

We just returned from a 5 day holiday in Disney, Anaheim. We stayed at Grand Califronia Hotel, which is supposed to be a 5 star resort, but it's not really up to this standard. Rooms were dark and small, and the hotel safes were the size of the envelope, couldn't get my Cannon camera in, not enough width. Location was great, the reason we booked in, but with our next visit we are looking elsewhere, so many options just accross the street.  Marya R, Cananda

Summary Heading: Gave it try, Definately not worth it.
Summary: We stayed here since we had toyed with the idea of doing it for so long but were always put off by the price. The location was necessary for me considering that we were there for the half marathon and I wanted to be as close as possible. We got to the hotel around 11:00am, room wasn't ready but I didn't expect to be so we dropped our bags with the bell desk and went to the park since I was told I would receive a text when the room was ready. Well check in time came and went with no text so we made our was back to the hotel to inquire. She told me it was still not ready but they could give us another room. I asked if it would be on the 5th floor, like the one we were waiting for. She said it was on the 3rd which annoyed me because I wanted a room on the 5th floor but at this

The property and it's location / amenities is really top notch. If the room was as nice as the rest of the hotel this would be a flawless place to stay despite the dear price tag. We had no issues with the front desk personnel, even given some communication snafu between their computer and my bank's caused a rather long check in delay. They were even gave us a "family fast pass" to use at the park to say sorry without us even asking. The Valet service was great and the bell hops very friendly quick and efficient. The room had several issues, some of which I'd have overlooked in a room that was under $100 but we were at $280 in the off season. Things like despite having beds for 5 only having seating for 2, only a 32" TV and verily limited storage space if we were to have 5 in

What a nice facility - grand in every respect, from the physical plant to the superior training of the staff. Pricey, but unparalleled access to Disney - which is what you are here for. Comfortable rooms, tremendous service. Heated pools (3) with a waterslide for the kids ....... even the big ones ;) Good connections to airports, and you can print your boarding passes. Did I mention the free WiFi??

Summary Heading: Good location but wouldn't stay again.
Summary: We were a family of four staying for 4 days, our first visit to Disneyland.  Check in took a while due to the volume of guests but staff were friendly.  The room was disappointing.  We had a two bedroom suite as they would not provide a cot/rollaway for the one bedroom suite - given the vast size of the living room this lack of a rollaway makes no sense.  A crib is fine but not a cot?  VERY dark rooms and dated furniture.  Jam all over the table in the living room!  Glad to have the empty bar fridge though.   We were facing Grand California resort which was an interesting view but we were also over top of Napa Rose. Two nights in a row VERY loud music was playing very late into the night.  Hard to sleep when you have to listen to this coming through the closed windows.  Really

We have stay here three times now and always enjoy the hotel, staff and rooms. Great Location right by the water run so when the kids got wet we could run in and change.  Concierge is well worth the extra.

I stayed in this hotel with my two boys and stayed for the proximity/access to theme parks, but for the price there are other options that work fine.  The property is beautiful, we had a balcony overlooking CA Adventure...but there was quite a long walk through hallways to get to the room, which was not spectacular.  This was my most expensive trip to Disneyland and I would probably not stay again.

Yes, this hotel is expensive but the cost is worth it due to the proximity to the parks.  We were able to do so much more due to the close location.  Direct access to California Adventure doesn't get any better! The rooms are surprisingly quiet even with the constant in and out of rooms. We stayed January 20-24 and absolutely loved our stay.  If returning to Disneyland we would only stay here again.

We spent Christmas here with our 2 daughters who are 19 & 22.  It was our second visit for a reason.  The on site Disneyland property is gorgeous!  Walking distance to the parks & downtown Disney.  All the staff we came in contact with were friendly & sincere.  Hotel is a little pricey, but worth the fact that you can literally walk to the parks.  If I can't stay here, I won't fly across the country to go to Disneyland...other on site hotels are NO COMPARISON whatsoever!

We spent a wonderful 3 nights here for a no-kids 40th Birthday celebration. We had a lovely room overlooking the pool and found the proximity of the hotel to the parks to be fantastic. We loved being able to buy dinner or lunch at Downtown Disney and take it back to our balcony to enjoy. Sure, the hotel is expensive but it definitely a lovely splurge if you can afford it.

My wife, daughter and I just returned from a 3 night stay at the Disney Grand California Hotel at Disneyland January 17-21, 2013.  We were extremely disappointed with the attitudes, room amd service at this hotel.  We made 4 calls to try and get issues resolved with the telephone and bathroom in our room.  Each time I explained our problems to a different person every time we called and everytime they were going to get someone to make repairs "right away", but they never did.  The location is the only thing that would keep this kind of service from putting them out of business.  We have stayed at many Disney properties including this one in the past, but something seems to have changed here as they just don't seem to care!

Summary Heading: Paid for proximity, did not get value
Summary: Being my first Disney adventure my friend and I chose the hotel closest to the parks. we happily paid a premium rate for the convenience.  What we got was the room in the furtherest corner of the hotel down a maze of corridors several minutes walk just to get back to the foyer. Frustrating as during our stay other better located rooms sat vacant.   The room itself was quite dated, the fittings ok but not great. The staff always pleasant but but overall this hotel was not worth the extra cost compared with other local Anaheim hotels. Parking was confusing and expensive.   Doubt that I would recommend to friends despite the grand foyer area and lovely pools.

As most other reviewes have mentioned, you are paying for location. The grounds and rooms are nice although not quite as fancy as one might expect for these rates. The big adavantage is that you don't have to mess with the hassle taking a shuttle to the parks from the nearby hotles and you do have Downtown Disneyland right outside the hotel to enjoy when not in the parks. We have stayed here with our familes four times and have yet to be disappointed. The staff is always polite and food prices are out of control expensive. One complaint; fifteen dollars a day for self parking. I get that in areas where space is at a premium(Chicago, New York City), but as a native of spacious California it would be nice to see Disney eliminate that.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel in a perfect location, but too expensive
Summary: First let me start by saying I am a huge Disneyland fan. I have been here multiple times.  I have wanted to stay here with my family for some time but the price kept us away.  Since we were here for a short trip we decided to splurge.  Overall I am happy with our experience but I just don't think the price made it 100% worth it.   One of the best things about the Grand is that it's the closest hotel to the entrance of Disneyland & California Adventure.  Super convenient when you are tired or if you want to run back to the room for awhile.  The hotel lobby is spectacular and customer service was on top of everything.  The room (as others have said) is a bit tired.  For the price paid I would expect a room with a "wow" factor.  That really wasn't there.  Just a basic room with

Summary Heading: Very Pricey, Rooms are Mediocre, Location is What Makes Up It
Summary: We stayed at the Grand Californian for five nights and paid $1800 for our stay which we booked through GET Travel. We were there for the Tinkerbell Half Marathon and other races. The lobby is beautiful as is the pool area. But the housekeeping service was not what it should be, almost daily they would forget coffee or the cups. The rooms are also just mediocre, nothing what they should be for the price! We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel in August/September and the renovated rooms are so much nicer. We also had a room overlooking the cabs that were running constantly so we couldn't even have our window open without having exhaust fumes in our room. We loved how close the hotel was to the parks and the Magic Mornings (which is included in all 3 Disneyland hotels), during that 1

It is expensive to stay here and the rooms themselves are nothing amazing but the location makes it worth it. Especially travelling with little kids it was so nice to just have a short walk back to the room with no need to struggle to get on a tram or bus.  It was also nice to have white water snacks to pick up basic groceries such as sandwich stuff and breakfast items. There was a fridge in the room to store everything.  I also love that all the restaurants can accommodate  a gluten free diet so easily.  It will be hard to ever stay anywhere else on future trips.  Everything was so close we did not even rent a car.

We stayed for 4 nights with a party of 10 in 2 rooms. The rooms are small to average in size but you don't spend much time in them. This hotel is close to everything that Disneyland has to offer. It was very cold when we were there but we enjoyed the hot tub every night. You can use your room key for anything in the park so you don't have to carry money. We had children with us: 11,10, 7, 4,3 and 1 and with those ages you simply cannot beat the ease of staying at this location.

Summary Heading: Splurge and stay here with your kids!
Summary: We went here for one night with our 2-year-old girl for her birthday since we live in Southern California.  We requested a balcony with a view of the pool/courtyard/park (magical!) and queen bed for us and a bunk bed for her.  She LOVED the bed, insisted on sleeping on the TOP which was lovingly made safe with high wood rails, loved the picture of Snow White in room,the GORGEOUS lobby that reminds me of the Ahwahnee Hotel in Yosemite with little Craftsman rocking chairs around a TV playing Disney classics, the HUGE fireplace in the lobby -- the whole hotel is an amazing mix of warm and cozy -- Craftsman BEAUTIFUL while still being very child-friendly.  It's a splurge but worth it, especially because of the EASY access to both parks early in the morning and at night (the hotel is

This hotel is worth every penny. The cast members are all extremely friendly and helpful. You can literally exit the hotel and enter California Adventure or Downtown Disney. We were able to enjoy the magic morning hour which made riding the new Carsland rides so much easier. the rooms are clean and well maintained. We ate at the Storytellers caf√© one morning for the Character breakfast and it was a bit overpriced but my kids got to meet several characters up close and personal which was well worth the overpriced food.

Summary Heading: This hotel goes the extra mile!
Summary: Our family traditionally stays for 3 nights at the Grand Californian in mid-January.  We stay here for the easy and quick entrance into both parks, and the Magic (it really is worth it!!!!) Morning Hour.  This hotel's accommodations are clean and adequate, but you are really paying for the service and perks you get for staying at a Disney hotel.  We recently stayed our usual 3 nights and had a wonderful time.  We have a 3-year-old and the close proximity is priceless!!  I have never written a review of anything before in my life, but I must comment on a situation that occurred.  On the day of our departure, we had reservations at the Storytellers Cafe for brunch.  (Wonderful place to eat; we always enjoy it several times during our visit.) In our packing haste to get our luggage
