The location, everyone say that, you can¬¥t beat. It is wonderful to be near Downtown Disney and walking distance from the 2 parks. You can leave your room and go see the fireworks and the World of Color and return to your room after ten minutes. You can go to the AMC Cinema that there is in Downtown. The rooms are great, very big. The decoration has little or few things of the eorld of Disney, which is not bad. There is a refrigerator in every room, which is also a good news. I strongly recommend this place.

There is no denying that the convenience of the location was good and if you were at a conference with family it certainly would be handy but there are some improvements required with this hotel.  Firstly, we found nobody offering to help take our bags all the way to our room.  It was somewhat confusing.  Check in was fine.  The rooms are clean but dark.  The whole decor feels sooo dated, and particularly more like something I would expect in the ski fields.  The shower is hiddeous and hardly works.  The air vent in the bathroom is so loud we tried to play music to drown out the noise.  The phone was broken and the rooms are really dark.  On the positive side, the staff were friendly, the room was clean but for the price, I think you kind of miss the Disney experience and it

The park view villas look over Disney's Californa Adventure - it's expecially lovely at night. The views of World of Color are from the side, so it's better to see the show from the regular viewing area inside the park.  It's a large resort (as are most Disney hotels) so it's a long walk to anywhere.The dining establishments were very good. The gift shop is OK. We didn't use the pool this time because the weather was very cold. If you are staying at the resort, you can enter DCA from a special side entrance by Grizzly River Run, but there is a line in the morning full of strollers - the line moved pretty fast, but I suggest walking around to the front entrance with no wait. You can get your Fastpasses for seating at World of Color right there as you walk in the special side

We just returned from a 3 day weekend at the Grand Californian. The hotel is perched between Disneyland and California Adventure Park and was a perfect location for getting us in early, for occassional breaks, and for avoiding shuttles to and from. The hotel itself is beautiful, but obviously family focussed, so decor is lush but durable. There are handy restaurants, notably those on Main Street that runs between the properties (a couple of minute walk). Probably our favorite was Naples, a pizza/pasta joint. People make reservations well in advance, so expect a wait if you want to eat during core meal hours. We slipped away to Outlets at Orange to do some shopping one afternoon. There are better outlets but they`re too far away on a short visit. We found the deals worthy. It was

Stayed here with my daughter for two nights on the way home from a ski holiday in Aspen. She absolutely loved the easy access to the parks. An unexpected benefit was that on one of the days it poured with rain for a large part of the day and we were able to slip back to the hotel and change shoes etc.  Having been to Disneyland several times now I must say that winter is the time to visit - no queues whatsoever!!

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel and the location can't be beat.
Summary: The Grand Californian is a gorgeous property and with the location being next to (and partly inside) Disney's California Adventure park it's hard to complain.  We arrived a bit early and our room was not ready, but the staff sent me a text message when it was which was about 30 minutes. We left our bags at the bell desk and headed to the park. The hotel has a great lobby reminiscent of a grand lodge. There is a fireplace that you can warm up next to, and televisions playing Disney movies for the kids.  The staff is so awesome here! Disney service can't be beat and the hotel staff at the Grand Californian represent the best of Disney customer service. They are all so friendly and accommodating. The rooms are just average. They are very quiet though. I didn't hear kids running up

Let me start by saying that I have stayed here over 40 times with my family since the hotel opened. I think I have a pretty good idea of how the resort operates.  Not once, in 40+ stays, did a hotel employee at the front desk acknowledge that we had EVER stayed there. Every single time we checked in, they asked "Is this your first time visiting us?" This is customer service 101. Every other resort that I have ever visited acknowledges that you are a returning customer.  Is this crazy? I even wrote it on the survey about 30 times. Never heard back from Disney.  The rooms are clean, but extremely cheap for what they charge. Awful pillows and sheets, Motel 6 bathrooms for four star prices. The single worst shower head ever created.  If this resort charged a decent rate, I would not

Having stayed at the Grand multiple times over the last few years and almost always experiencing fantastic service, it takes a lot to wow me at this point but the staff at the Grand Californian most definitely did it this time. Because of an unfortunate incident in the lobby during my last stay involving someone throwing a beverage off a balcony and nearly hitting me, the staff made sure that my stay this time was completely perfect. From the moment we checked in - which was late in the evening, due to a significant plane delay (thanks again, United!) - everything was taken care of and nothing left to chance. I wasn't feeling well after a nearly 12-hour trip across the country so one of the staff members escorted us to our room (which was an upgrade to a theme-park view) and

Pack the kids and watch how Disney employees lay on the sparkle. We traveled with our 2 infants and some friends and stayed for 5 nights.   Resort is clean, staff spectacular and location perfect. If you have the money to do Disney, this is the way to do it. You are allowed to enter the parks before anyone else and get all your photos, great added feature.   This is the best of Disney, so be prepared to spend. This is not a place for bargain hunters. We loved every bit. The rooms are as large as any hotel, pending you have a suite somewhere. The pool is phenomenal. Huge and plenty of space to splash and relax.   Get to the pool early to get you a seat, it gets busy.   I would say, the pool needed more servers taking orders or a better menu. I get that it is kid friendly but

My two sons, age 11 and 7, my mom and myself stayed here for three days and we all thoroughly enjoyed this spectacular hotel. The attention to detail is breathtaking, from the carpets honouring Arts and Crafts guru William Morris (look for the hidden "W" "M" monograms) to the soaring lobby with cabinets filled with original Roycrofter, Stickely and Newcomb pottery examples. Amazing. We received the best check-in ever - after completing everything two lovely cast members walked us around the lobby and pool area pointing out the artistry. Their passion for the architecture and craft of the Grand Californian showed. For art lovers there is a free "Art of the Craft" tour offered most days and it was thrilling to get to peek into all the restaurants and "behind-the-scene" areas. My

We went to Disneyland for a week in August. We stayed for 7 nights at the Grand Californian. After reading many reviews I wanted to try out the hotel and liked the idea of the proximity. I had been to Disneyland several times, have stayed at off site locations, Disneyland hotel too.  We booked through AAA which I always find helpful.   The lobby is very fantastic. It is gorgeous to sit in there and look at the artwork. I had read reviews about the difference between downtown Disney side versus CA Adventure side. However, our room was neither, more of a weird courtyard view. It was fine, but it wasn't much of a view.   Our room was terribly small. The room had a queen bed and a double bed with a pull out trundle for a 5th person. First of all, the bunk bed isn't pushed against

My guest and I stayed at the Grand Californian for three nights and went to the parks for!  days.  This hotel had fantastic restaurants and room service, the staff was friendly, and the location was perfect.  I really appreciated how quiet the room was and how luxurious the bedding was.  My number one concern is always getting a restful nights sleep and I was able to do just that and get good naps in too.  The view was fantastic and we were able to see the fireworks from the balcony.  I will definitely be staying at this hotel again.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, but had some issues
Summary: We won a vacation that gave us 2 nights at the Disney Grand Californian Hotel.  It is well over our normal budget so we had high expectations.  When we arrived (after a 13 hour drive with a 2 year old and 4 month old) we ran into our first hiccup at the parking check-in.  They had our reservation starting on the following day.  That immediately started to worry me that they weren't going to let us checkin.  After waiting 30 minutes in their check-in line, the desk clerk said the reservation was made for the following day.  Good thing I had my email confirmation stating the day we arrived was the day we reserved so they were able to make changes on their end to get us in. We arrived around 11AM and checkin time wasn't until after 3 so they said they'd text us if the room was

Nov 17, 18, 19, 2012  Room 5443 We have stayed at many of the Disney properties: Disneyland Hotel, Grand Floridian, Boardwalk Inn, Caribbean Beach Resort, Contemporary Resort, and Wilderness Lodge Resort. In comparison, I‚Äôm sorry to say, I was disappointed in the Grand Californian. The rooms are just too small for the amount of money Disney is asking you to pay. I wrote a very favorable review of Grand Floridian, so my dissatisfaction with GC is not solely the rate.  Our room was on the top floor overlooking Downtown Disney. We loved the location and the view of the nightly fireworks was perfect. We had a standard room with two queen beds; with luggage, baby stroller, and purchased souvenirs there was hardly enough room to move.  (I found ample room in all of the above-mentioned

Arriving in LAX 7 am, with a four year old and traveling to Disney's Grand Californian Hotel, was much anticipated having been a visitor to the parks many years before without a child in tow.  The shuttle arrived on time and we shared this with one other family, and it was unlike most others in that this was door to door. As expected check in was scheduled until 2 pm however the staff offered to take our cell no and call us when / if rooms became available. We then explored our surroundings only to be interrupted to learn that not only was a room available but an upgrade was on the menu. The room overlooked the pools and it was greatly appreciated being able to check in early. Well done to Disney Staff. For those not familiar with this resort, you have access to the park by the

Summary Heading: Worth it for the privelage of being close
Summary: Flew in from Australia & arrived just after 9am after a 14 hour flight. Check in was efficient & staff helpful & very polite but (and this would be my only grumble) they did not accomodate early arrival well especially after such along flight!! There was no suite or similar for a freshen up & to change & we were forced to shuffle through our suitcases in the lobby to get organised. This is unnaceptable for a hotel which caters for international travelers arriving at all hours of the day!!! This aside our stay was more than pleasant and as others have said, take full advantage of the Magic Morning's as the queues are at a minimum & the flexibility of the pass hopper & proximity to the hotel allowed us to have a couple of hours to recharge in the afternoons. We had a wonderful 4

Summary Heading: Wonderful Hotel but you pay for the privledge!
Summary: My sister & I started going to Disneyland as adults w/o husbands, children & grandchildren 4 years ago. While we love our families, it's a nice time to get together as Sisters and catch up with each other. Each time we stay @ the Grand California! It's always nice! Excellent service throughout our stay! Convenient to everything! A plus is if you get really wet on the Grizzly River Run , you can just run back to your room and change. This I know from personal experience! Lol! The only complaint that I have is that the laundry room is not real convenient but everything else works great! The cast members (staff) have always been great . My sister & I have eaten in the Napa Rose & the StoryTellers restaurants . They're $$$ but have always had good food & wonderful service !! When

Summary Heading: Use the Grand Californian to your Advantage
Summary: When you stay at the Grand Californian, you have high expectations and the hotel delivers.  What you get from staying at the hotel where a park hopper pass is included is the following:  *one hour early access into the parks on designated days, either Disneyland or California Adventure. Entry at 8am which is one hour before the park opens. *take advantage of the close proximity. Rest/refresh in your room as needed; thisnisnespecially nice if you have small children. *we decided to fly to Anaheim and not rent a car; we could do this easily and not worry about parking because we stayed here.

How much are you willing to pay for an extra hour in the Disneyland Resorts and the convince of hotel room proximity to the parks?   The Arts and Crafts style of the hotel, including the entrance and lobby, are just gorgeous, the rooms clean and well maintained.  The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful.  And the onsite restaurant food is very good.   I was impressed by some of the little things in the room that were aimed at families with small children.  For example, the porta-crib in our closet, and the linen hamper (for your own dirty clothes, or to put dirty towels so they wouldn't make a mess on the floor), and a quiet pocket door to the bathroom (so not to wake the rest of the family when one has to take a visit in the wee hours of the night).  The amenities in the

This was my fourth stay at the Grand Californian, and every time has been excellent in all respects. Staff is friendly and helpful every time, every person. Hotel decor is my very favorite style... craftsman... every little thing you notice in the rooms, restaurants, lobby is just right. We always go in winter and there's a HUGE fireplace in the lobby with lots of chairs and rockers (even kid-sized ones) which is my favorite place in my favorite hotel lobby ever -- make sure you take at least a few minutes to sit by the fire and just relax. During the holidays they have a gigantic xmas tree in the lobby that's just as beautiful as the ones in the parks, and last year we saw carolers performing as well. There's also a piano with a real tuxedo'ed person playing in the evening. I

We stayed at the Floridian a few years back and expected the same fantastic experience when we visited the Californian.  Obviously it is an older resort, so it wasn't quite the same- our room was smaller, the hotel not as fancy.  Service wasn't quite as good either, nothing offensive at all, just not the over-the -top service we'd received at the Floridian.  Disney is still heads above most hotels for service, so it may not be a fair criticism, but if the Floridian was a 5, Californian would have to be a 4.

You can't beat the location and the side entrance into the California adventure park. We were able to get in there at 7:30am and beat the thundering hordes. We finished the park by 1pm.  That alone justifies the cost of staying there and makes it make sense overall. Downtown Disney nearby is a good thing. Dinner buffet at Stories was adequate; best to call ahead for reservations instead of arriving at dinner time and waiting an hour to be seated. For breakfast we just ate quickly in the fast food outlet in the hotel. Gym was fair; the biggest beef we had was that the water pressure in the shower in the bathroom was not much above a trickle. They upgraded us on the room so that we had a view over to the park which is a nice touch. The building is huge; expect to walk at least 5

The hotel is awesome especially if you get a view of Paradise Pier in Disney California Adventure.  You can view Wonderful World of Color Show from your room.  Very comfortable beds.  Housekeeping does a great job and if you need extra pillows they are delivered promptly.  I also loved the fact that the hotel is connected to the California Adventure park.  You just walk out of your room and into the park.  It was really wonderful.  The only drawback is if you are familiar with Walt Disney World transportation and the Magical Express that is one thing this hotel should connect to is free transportation to the airport like WDW does.

There isn't much I could say bad about this hotel. We've stayed there only once but someday, would love to stay again. If possible, make the stay worth the money and make it as long as possible. One night is awesome if it's just a couple or a few friends. However, if you are traveling with children and you have it in your vacation budget, stay four days or longer. With the cost what it is, you want to be able to experience the hotel itself, right? Yes! We stayed for three nights and it still wasn't long enough. So lovely, romantic, children friendly, adult friendly. Fun but not too childish. I would definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Stay at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel
Summary: We stay two nights at the hotel. Honestly, it was an average stay. Nothing too magical. It still has some of its formal grandeur. A bit tired. We stay on the 26-29 Dec 2012. I must say it does not worth what we paid for. The bathrooms need to be updated to match the modern 4-5** hotel. I supposed they want to retain its californian style ...may be. I must say it is very convenient to and fro disneyland. Just steps away..would be good for families with young children. The beds are very clean and comfy. We Dine in one of the fine dining Napa Rose restaurant. Service was good. Lighting was very 'dim'..we still not quite sure what the food look like , they did taste good.  They quite expensive..We went there because all the other hotel restaurants were fully booked and we tried

Summary Heading: Great in every way except-rooms too small-midnight rumblings
Summary: You pay more knowing it's the experience of Disney.  The park view room we had had a fantastic view and a nice small balcony to sit out on and watch the park as a whole.  The rooms were clean, kept up well and service from all staff was fantastic.  With all that said, the rooms are just too small for the price, and it'd be nice it there was a king bed in place of the queen in the family room.  The bunk beds were nice for the kids. My other issue was that the folks in the next room keep trying the adjoining door to our room at midnight, and called up staff about the lock on their side.  Al this while we are trying to sleep, and then the banging continues while staff tries to fix (in total about 30 mins of this stuff).  I finally had to go into the hallway and beg them to stop.

Summary Heading: The  perks make it worth the price
Summary: There is no way around it - it is expensive to stay at this hotel.  The rooms themselves are o.k - they don't justify the costs but the added benefits of staying at this hotel do make it worthwhile.  Being so close to the parks you can easily run back to change or rest during the day.  Over the Christmas holiday season anyone staying at a Disneyland resort hotel could go into either Disneyland or California Adventure an hour early which meant an almost guarantee to get onto the new Cars ride in Calif. Adventure.  This meant avoiding the 3 hour wait time during the holiday season.  Whatever your question, the front desk and hotel staff went out of their way to help also.  The gym look nice and never busy and the pools, we didn't use, but looked nice also and must have been fairly

We were very pleased we chose the Grand Californian Hotel. The proximity to both parks made a huge difference to our levels of sore feet & energy. The early starts available also gave us a edge, although we still started those days at 6.30am queuing at the hotel entrance to the parks!The level of service was excellent all over the hotel. Our room on level 2 was handy to the guest laundry..also shiny & clean. We had a couple of room service meals which were good, & saved having to go back out after a long day.  Our grandchildren ( 10 yr old twins) loved the pools,which we used each afternoon after a long day out & about.     Happy to recommend the  Grand Californian Hotel.

The amenities are great, however the food was disappointing. I expected much more from the on-site restaurants, especially the very expensive ones. The hotel food was also pretty poor. The hotel staff were wonderful. The access to the Disney parks is a big plus. Overall, the experience is definitely worth the price.

This is our second time staying here.  Wish we could afford it everytime as it seems to make the trip so much nicer.  You can not beat the location. I have had nothing but excellent service from the front desk.  The first time they upgraded us and this time the front desk clerk gave us our room at 6am for a 3pm check in because a room was available.  WOW!  We were not expecting that.  We just wanted to pre-check in and let them hold our bags but we were pleasantly surprised.  Judy the front desk clerk even let us choose our room in our category.  Knowing a little about the logistics I picked the room facing Disneyland so we could watch the fireworks from our room.  We had a courtyard room on the 5th floor.  The monorail whizzed by our room...our 6 yr old would run to the balcony

I'm writing this review after staying a week in the Vice Presidential Suite. I loved staying in the suite.  The suite was spacious.  The Christmas tree was a nice added touch.  My only complaint was the food in the Craftsman lounge concierge level.  The free food and drinks are nice but everyday it is the exact same thing.  You would think they could change it up just a little bit.  After the second day we just used the area for drinks only.  Such a disappointment.

My family loves this hotel for all the right reasons.  It's festive, fun, energetic, simply fantastic service, etc.  The best aspects are the service and the location.  For Disney, it's a huge difference even from the other Disney properties.  You can walk into CA Adventure in seconds and breaks are so much easier.  I could go on and on re the positives. The cons are the rooms are just boxes like any other $200 a night hotel.  Sure they do them up a bit and the small touches are nice but it's still just a room.  The fact they don't have pay for view movies still annoys me so be aware and bring any down time entertainment.  The real issue is price.  Granted we paid holiday rates but to pay $700 per night for a box is rather remarkable.  That's before food, beverage and Disney

Summary Heading: Treat yourself to a night or two
Summary: Our family of four stayed at the Grand Californian the nights of Dec. 30th and 31st for the New Year's holiday.  It is a beautiful hotel and the staff we encountered were polite and helpful.  Our room was exceptionally clean and comfortable.  We had a normal sized hotel room with two queen beds, 6th/top floor facing a quiet courtyard.  Being on the top floor made our room light and bright during the day.  I emphasize that it was a quiet location because we wanted to get a good night's rest the first night we arrived so we could take advantage of the 7am early entry into the parks.  I grew up in Orange County but this was the first time I have ever stayed at a Disney hotel.  I have always wanted to try it.  It was a real treat to enter the park early and start the day without the

I wasn't going to bother writing a review for our second stay at GCH but after just returning from their spa and having a most excellent treatment I felt I should. The spa itself is nice enough...clean pleasant atmosphere. If they ever do a reno they need to put in some changing rooms specifically for changing clothing.  The only place to change is either the toilet stalls or the showers.  Anyway on to my reason for posting.  I had their "Bundle Treatment" The girl for the facial was very good, very knowledgable about products but at the same time did not push them aggressively.  Cecilia did my massage and oh my goodness was she fantastic! Such a nice person and her technique was by far the best massage I have ever had. I had strained my back with the luggage and the Disney

Our stay was disappointing for one reason alone. The staff, and not just one or two of them, were indifferent or surly. I have stayed in many different 5 star hotels worldwide for business and pleasure and this one ranks the poorest for service bar none! I will not be staying there again.

Summary Heading: Save your money and shop for more reasonable accomodations
Summary: The initial impression of the hotel is that of those hotels built in national parks by the railroads back in the 1920's and 30's. The exterior fits the image as does the lobby area. Unfortunately, that's as "GRAND" as it gets. There is nothing special otherwse except the price, which is way too pricey, even for Disneyland, which is now too pricey to visit except on a very special occaison. If you are comming to Disneyland and plan on staying in one of their hotels look for a package deal to save $. I give the hotel and both parks a poor rating because of price and because Disneylands upkeep, appearance, and maintenance standards have visibly dropped. I would also say the hiring standards of the castmembers/staff have also dropped.unless I just happened to be there for 2 days

We stayed for four nights in late October, 2012.  Check in was quick and impersonal.  Communal areas were noisy, uncomfortable and busy.  Room was dead average.  Beds were fine but we had to get two queens rather than one king.  Nice that it is a non-smoking property.  We did not go to the pool but it must have been fun because there were so many people there throughout all four days.  Restaurants are way too expensive for the quality of food and service.  So nice to walk out of the hotel and be in Adventure Land or close to the entry to Disneyland.  Really like the restaurants in the area I think is called Disneytown.

We just completed a 4 night stay at the Grand Californian staying in room 2259. The room was small and we really wanted to get a room with 1 queen and 1 bunk bed but that was not available even though we asked for it a month prior. After deducting the cost of the park hopper passes and character meal at the Storytellers Cafe the room cost $600 per day. The bathtub drain was partially clogged and a puddle of water always appeared. The view was poor and the arch on the facade partially blocked the view which really wans't much unless you like looking at cars driving into the hotel grounds.  Room 2259 was the farthest from the lobby too. Staying here gives you the "privilege" of getting into the park an hour earlier than the general public but the wait to get in resulted in an 30

Aside from location, the Grand Californian is not grand except in its pricing structure.  The staff gives the impression that the magic is missing.  The rooms, two queen beds and an average bathroom, are as tired as Tink.  The room rate is expensive.  I can not speak to the other Disney hotel, Paradise Pier, but look at your other options before you book this hotel.

Summary Heading: Great location, not practical for families with 5 people.
Summary: We have had many enjoyable stays at this hotel, but they advertise their rooms are for 5 people and they aren't. If you have small children you may be able to make it work. We are forced to pay for 3 adults and 2 children, however no accommodation is made for the ages in the room. They always want to give us a room with 2 queens which is obviously not appropriate for three adults and two teenagers. And then we have to fight for the few rooms they have available with 2 queens and a day bed. This visit we didn't win and are stuck with 2 queens. One would think there would be a filter for people who really need this room, oh they also offer a sleeping bag- my 17 year old was not amused. For the price we pay, based on their ages, we feel ripped off. We will never stay here again. It

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel but service can be spotty....
Summary: The beauty of this hotel is truly outstanding, and it adds an indispensible ingredient of ambience to the Disneyland / California Adventure experience.  Having said this, I found it odd to discover some unevenness with respect to service.  For example, I thought that the check-in process was one of the worst that I‚Äôve had.  One pulls into the hotel into some sort of grand stage of an entry area and you‚Äôre virtually left with no clear choices with respect to getting your luggage to the room.  I asked about getting a cart for our bags and was told that I could get one if I wanted to put our bags into storage‚Ä¶this certainly wasn‚Äôt where I thought that my bags needed to go at that point in time.   I eventually figured out later that I could have put my bags into ‚Äústorage‚Äù and then

Summary Heading: Oh the great things could have done with $800
Summary: $800 PER NIGHT for an outdated small room. We just stayed here at Christmas and though the lobby was decorated beautifuly it stopped there. All the things I could have done with this money, I'm emarrassed.  Yes, location is great but I've stayed at Disney Pier and it was a few hundred feet farther from Downtown Disney and had character dining, etc.  My advise is to save your hard earned money and stay one of the ohter disney hotels to get the early access and other disney amenities.  There is absolutley nothing here worth that kind of money.

I took my granddaughters to this hotel for one of their birthday getaways. The hotel itself is beautiful. Wonderful, relaxing lobby area. Valet parking was great, but there is a fee of 25.00 a night to use this service. It was worth the money, as you would have to park across the street to find parking yourself and walk back across a busy street with all your luggage to go into the hotel. The check-in was fast and courteous and we got a special treat for our granddaughter because she was celebrating her birthday. But this is where our good experience ended. The rooms were very small, and not up to the standards of a 400.00 a night room. The bathroom was "TINY" and no extra towels were provided. It overlooked California Adventure park and had some noise level heard inside the

The hotel room was stunning and kept immaculate clean, staff were friendly. Would have been nice for sml milk for coffee, was a little disappointed in the greeting, arrived 6am no sleep and was handed a map to find my room and in such a large hotel I kept getting lost :(  Other than that it was a great place to stay

This hotel is all about location. PLEASE don't expect anything special, it doesn't match the 4* standard at all. The rooms are a little worn, service is nonexistant, the food (had roomservice several times) is overpriced but ok. I would never ever accept such a lousy value/buck-ratio in any other hotel. BUT: this is Disneyland and the hotel has an unbelievable location. You drop out of the hotel right into all the hustle and bustle of the park and vice versa. No need for long walks, exhausting fights at shuttle busses etc.; the kids love it. You can save all your precious time for the park itself. So: even if it does hurt to pay more than 500 USD/nite for a nothing more than average motel-level-hotel-room, you will be spoiled for a lifetime with this location. Once you have

Summary:  Don't stay here, save your money and stay somewhere else.  Carsland Racers is either broken (a cast member says it happens daily) or there is a 3 hour wait.  The service is terrible unless they are somebody who expects a tip.  The 1 hr early entry is not worth the price of this hotel.  My family has gone to Disneyland for three years in a row.  December of 2010 was by far the best trip we have had.  We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and they brought a towel folded into a birthday cake to my son on his birthday.  On October 2011 we stayed at the Embassy Suites, about 10 minutes north of Disneyland, and saved money.    This trip was supposed to be special as we will be moving this spring and decided to "do it big" for our last visit.  Disney started our trip by charging

I am not sure why this hotel is a 4-star.  Rooms very small and so dark it is difficult to function.  Soap for our party of five was a round "bar" not much larger than a quarter, to last 6 days!  Fortunately, I had bars of soap in my overnight bag.  Also one towel per person for the week, while maybe "saving the earth" does not make for a comfortable stay.  For this kind of money, I would like a clean towel.  Obviously, the location is what you are paying for as all 1,000+ rooms were sold out when we were there.

Summary Heading: Great stay although rooms a bit small for the price
Summary: The major plus for this hotel is the proximity to the California Adventure Park, it has it's own entrance to the park.  The room was a good size although we were a bit cramped with 5 people in one room (2 adults, 3 kids).  We had the combo of a queen bed and a bunk bed with a trundle that pulled out from the bottom to make a third bed.  The third bed is definitely for a smaller child, couldn't get my 14 year old in that bed comfortably.  There is a refrigerator and a coffee maker in the room.  The coffee and supplies were really sub-par as were the other items provided (shampoos, conditioners, etc.).  These bottles were very small and they were not replenished sufficiently by housekeeping.  Another plus was the small balcony, good to get some fresh air and sit outside with a cup

This hotel is absolutely fabulous and worth the extra few bucks! When you walk in, you get the impression that you walked into a luxurious, art deco-themed hotel rather than a Disneyland resort. There is a huge attention to detail in every corner of this hotel and, unlike the other Disney resort hotels, you have to look closely to find any kitschy Disney references. Although this hotel is the most expensive of the Disneyland resorts, the quality of the hotel, level of service and convenient location make it the best choice if you're going to do a Disney vacation package. There is a fitness center, 2 dining options, espresso and spa on site. In the evenings there are story times by the giant fireplace for the kiddos and a live piano player near the bar for the adults. The best

We stay at the grand once a year for a work event. My family loves it however the rooms are way over priced, it's a hit or miss on room location & view. It would be great (especially with our struggling economy) to lower the room rate & parking cost.  The customer service isnt what the "Disney" way use to be. This too is a hit or miss and for the price we pay for the high pricey rooms, guests deserve and expect the "above and beyond" treatment. Overall truly enjoy the resort and hope the Mouse will encourage the cast members to return to the Magical Disney way.

Summary Heading: Very nice trip with large family.
Summary: Great trip back to one of my favorite Disney Hotels. We had a large family gathering and the staff did a great job with all the details. Christmas time is a great time to visit and the hotel is all decked out. Great location for getting to both parks.

Summary Heading: Pleasant Service, Small Rooms, Beware of Noise from Downtown Disney
Summary: We stayed here at the beginning of Dec while taking our grandkids, ages 4 and 5, to Disneyland for 4 days.  We had two adjoining rooms.  Fortunately, I had read reviews and was not shocked at the size of the rooms, which are very small.  Having a refrigerator in the room was helpful (in fact, we've gotten to the point that we we won't stay anywhere without one) and lighting in the bathroom was adequate, with magnifying mirror available for putting on make-up.  We had requested a pool view room but we ended up overlooking Downtown Disney (near the World of Disney store).  Although fun to see all the people coming and going, be advised that music plays most of the day at DD.  Loud music.  Music with lots of bass.  Even with our patio doors shut tight, the thump of bass was

Summary Heading: As Always, An Exceptional Resort Hotel
Summary: This was our fourth visit in six years. Staying at the DVC villa will full condo style amenities this 5-star hotel has been an incredible choice each time. This time it paid dividents in LOCATION. The location of this resort hotel allowing early and immediate access to California Adventure allowed us to be the first people on the Radiator Racers ride at Carsland, which typically has 3-4 hour waits. The benefits of this resort hotel is endless and well described at prasadandassociates.com but I must admit one of the most memorable joys was the late night hot tub after a long day at the park with the kids.

We stayed for two nights as a family of four, inclusive of disney park passes for 2 days at a cost of $1770.00   On arrival we were welcomed by lovely staff who gave us details of the hotel and parks.  We went straight to the restaurant bar as we'd had a very long journey.  The cocktails and food were good so we thought we were onto a winner.  (very impressive foyer at the entrance to the bar)   On arrival of our room we were really disappointed.  Rooms are very dark and the bathroom is tiny and believe it or not they still use a waterproof shower curtain over the bath. (For the money they charge you would expect a seperate shower enclosure)  On attending the spa I was told they were closing the ladies area that night due to maintenance.  (I spoke with the reception at checkout

What's HOT?? Location, Service, early Disneyland access, Napa Rose... What's sorta not? Concierge Floor and Rooms probably not what I expected but certainly comfortable and convenient but basic. I'm not going to complain about prices because this is a great facility and dining at Napa Rose is reason enough to stay here. Concierge lounge supplies a basic continental, Coffee/Tea/Cocoa, snacks, beer and wine, afternoon tea, PM desserts. Nothing to write home about but it's just down the hall. Everyone is super friendly. Room had a nice view of the pool etc. bed was super comf, bathroom small double sink and tub-nothing wow but serviceable.

We stayed a few weeks prior to Christmas,  but the hotel was decked out in Christmas!  So beautiful!!  There are a ton of activities at the hotel which is great when you need a break from the crowds of Disneyland.   The pool is heated and there is a cafe that sells yummy hot chocolate right outside of the back pool entrance.  Hotel staff was very friendly.  We splurged and had the room decorated for Christmas as a surprise for the kids!  Definitely worth it! We don't get to Disneyland often, maybe once every three years.  This is the only place we want to stay!

Summary Heading: Noisy air cond in room,but worth the money due to private entrance to Disneyland
Summary: Hotel foyer was very impressive, loved te seasonal cheer with the tree, Santa & carol singers. But the room was a let down. The air con was so noisy you had to turn it off at night, it as a major issue. Apart from that the standard room was fine, you don't spend a lot of time there. Character breakfast is a must great for children & adults (keeps the kids amused).

My daughter and I were lucky enough to have the experience of a lifetime during our stay at this hotel. Staying at this hotel made our Disneyland experience complete. The Christmas ambience was surreal and at the age of 60 I felt like a child again. Every day of our stay I thanked Walt for having his vision to provide people with such a happy escape from the real world.

My husband & I stayed 3 nights here with our 2 daughters (5yrs & 8yrs) & we loved it!! I highly recommend that you catch the Monorail straight into Tomorrowland on Early Entry days to Disneyland & that you go to the Main Gate Entrance of California Adventure Park (as opposed to the Hotels Private Entrance) for Early Entry days....as the que was WAY too long for Hotel Guests & there was only two staff members & hundreds of Guests. For us this was the only disappointment. You strictly MUST have your Room Keys for each member of your party (including children) on Early Entry mornings & photo ID & tickets. We didn't get a chance to use the Hotels Facilities (Pool & Restaurants etc) as we were having too much FUN in the Parks. We dined at Downtown Disney.....Rainforest Cafe is a MUST

We stayed here just for the weekend and enjoyed easy access to the parks.  You can walk in and out thru an entrance only used for guests of the hotel.  You can see California Adventure from your room and the pool area makes you feel like you are in the mountains.  The rooms are very comfortable.

Summary Heading: So convenient! Would never stay anyplace else while visiting Disneyland
Summary: Had a one night stay in the middle of a week of business meetings. It was a pleasant escape. The hotel is large but easy to navigate. The lobby is warm and inviting with fireplaces and lots of seating.We loved the easy access into Downtown Disney and California Adventure directly from the hotel lobby. This was a HUGE plus and made it very easy to run back to our rooms when needed. The staff was friendly and helpful, as one would expect from Disney.  My only regret is that we did not book a room with a park view. I would have enjoyed watching the fireworks at night since I was too tired to stay out late enough to see them from inside the park. Otherwise it was a great stay and we look forward to returning.

Summary Heading: Excellent stay but be prepared to spend $
Summary: With convenience comes a price. A nice but aging hotel that allows you access to the park early, steps away from the shops and good service. Ate a breakfast buffet at the hotel that was $60.00 for 2 adults not including gratuity. I was there with my wife for one week on a business trip. If you have little ones, they will cater to them but again, you will hear a lot Ching, Ching and Ching. Be cautious if you're on a budget, enjoy it to the fullest if you're not.

Summary Heading: Nice Exterior, Beautiful Lobby, OK Rooms
Summary: This hotel is very expensive and outside almost being inside of DCA, this is where it stops.  I found the rooms to be nothing special, the mattress was hard as a rock and the ammenities were right up there with Best Western (not that BW is bad) but when you are paying top dollar you expect something else.  The Lobby is beautiful and if the rooms looked like that; they would have a winner.  I would stay at other hotels around the area and pay about 1/4th the rate.

Summary Heading: Wouldn't stay anywhere else for Disneyland/DCA convenience
Summary: Just returned from a great stay at Disney's Grand Californian. We had a great stay, and my two friends and I all agree -- we just wouldn't be able to stay anywhere else for Disneyland and California Adventure convenience. My group was three adults with no children.  The location: There is no better hotel for location. You have your own entrance to California Adventure and another entrance about halfway through Downtown Disney. Picture it: You're sloshing back from a midnight run on Splash Mountain. You're cold, you're chafing, maybe you have kids in tow. You don't want to walk through the concrete jungle that is Anaheim. Instead, a three-minute walk through Downtown Disney and you're at your hotel. Two minutes later, you're in your room. I'll never stay "right across the street"

i stayed here on business otherwise i would have run screaming.  olive green, brown, dated, very depressing.  i can't believe families are spending this much on such a mediocre hotel.  save your money.  i can only assume that because it's inside the park, anything goes.  the hotels on site in orlando are much nicer, this property is in serious need of an extensive remodel.

My boyfriend surprised me for our anniversary with a stay at this hotel. It was amazing from beginning to end. we were greeted with happy anniversary pins and everyone was very nice. The location is obviously great. I do think it's very pricey, however it is Disneyland and you are staying inside the park, so what do you expect.   The room was a bit small, I would expect it to be bigger for what was paid, but it was clean and nice. We ordered room service and it was delicious and one of the staff members even gave us a some chocolates and a "sleep well" card! it was really nice. The beds are sooo comfortable. Really great sleep!!! I wish check out was later though, after a long day at Disneyland all I wanted to do was sleep in a little bit. haha, but overall it was an amazing

Got up earlier than folks I was staying with. Didn't want to disturb everyone sleeping. Went to the lobby for coffee, well you have to buy it. Even motel 6 has free coffee in the lobby. The tv the kids watch in the main lobby is a whopping 32 inches. Restaurants are not good and expensive. Wish we would have stayed down the street at a motel. Could have had better food and free coffee in the morning. Disney in general is a giant rip off. Havnt been here for some 20 plus years and boy did it lose its splendor. Very sad.

Summary Heading: Absolutely spectacular in almost every way!
Summary: Absolutely spectacular in almost every way? I could not rate this property higher. We stayed at the Grand Californian Villas in a studio room using rented points from a Disney Vacation Club member. This wing of the hotel seemed much quieter than the main hotel areas with a lot fewer people around.  "Welcome Home!" the front desk cast member said, smiling as we checked in. (That's a nice greeting for DVC members... wish I was one!)  At 8am we were checked in at Grand Californian and given our room keys to use for early entry at California Adventure. The front desk staff told us that they would text my cell phone when the room was ready, we left our bags with the bell staff and reminded them that we had ordered groceries from Von's (free delivery!) - Since we don't drink, they

After a wonderful day at Disneyland Park with four friends, they went home, and I walked around Downtown Disney and then went to dinner at Napa Rose for dinner.   Prior to being seated, I stopped at the concierge desk, and asked the young lady working there if I could get an escort back to my vehicle after dinner.  I was a woman alone, parked at the end of a 1/4 mile long parking garage, and it was night. I explained that I would feel safer if I was walked to my vehicle by security.  Alphonso (?) from security asked to speak with me, and despite the concierge explaining it to him, wanted to know why I asked for someone to walk me to my car. I explained again - night-time, alone, at the end of a very long parking lot, i would feel safer.  He dodged my request, and told me there

We liked the "Yosemite lodge-like atmosphere of the craftsmen style hotel, but it's interior was "tired" and in need of renovation; the rooms, at the prevailing price, were small, dark, and claustrophobic. The staff was very friendly and service oriented and the hotel is efficiently run. We had two rooms on the 4th floor near the elevators with a good view of the pool, but the hotel is huge, so expect to walk a lot if you get a room in the wings. The food venues, a cafeteria and an upscale dinning room were not good values - high prices with very medium food quality. Maybe we expected too much for over $300/nite.

We just got back from our family trip to Disneyland and stayed at the Grand Californian Hotel for the first time. The hotel is pricey, but worth the splurge. Probably won't stay here for a while since it is expensive, but would highly recommend this place if you want to go all out. First off there are 5 members in my family that include a 2 year old and 7 month old twins. The rooms were spacious, we had two queen beds and a sofa/day bed  Each room has a graco pack n play which came in handy for my two infants, I used ours and borrowed my parents which were staying in the room next to us with connecting rooms.  With the two pack n plays set up the room was still spacious. Loved the extra hour in the morning in the them parks, we were able to do a lot in fantasyland before it was

We've been to Disneyland many times and stayed at more reasonably priced nearby hotels. We've enjoyed Napa Rose previously and were impressed with the hotel‚Äôs d√©cor. We decided to treat ourselves for Thanksgiving weekend for Disney‚Äôs Grand‚Äôs great location. The stay was very enjoyable. We had a view of the fireworks. The staff were all very courteous‚Ä¶. except the valet attendant upon departure.   No offer to help with the one piece of luggage we had while we were dealing with a sleeping child in the stroller even after I handed him the valet ticket with a tip. And maybe he didn‚Äôt notice my husband limping with a swollen ankle. This prompted me to write my first review.

We stayed at the Grand for five nights the week of Thanksgiving.  This was our second stay at the hotel and once again we had a great time (my husband, and our two daughters, four years old and seven months old)!  I am very picky about hotels and I do not see how some people have given this hotel poor reviews, must be some negative people.   Arrived right around 11:30am on Sunday.  We were greeted by a very friendly valet attendant.  We chose to do self parking.  Walked into the lobby and walked right up to the counter to check in, no line.  We were hoping a room would be ready and to our surprise one was!  We had a standard room, two queen beds, on the fourth floor.  We were not facing either park, but at night could look off to the right and had a perfect view of the

Yes, this is billed as the top hotel out of the three disney properties, however, each time i stay, i remind myself not to do it again.      Dont get me wrong, the hotel is amazing, the decor, the ability to walk into CA Adventure from the hotel, but there are also things that it is lacking.    I am a Disney Vacation Club (DVC) member (this is not my home resort) and i have stayed in the regular rooms as well as my first stay in the DVC room this past weekend.   Im going to give a 2 part review for this,   1- for non DVC members and a second for DVC members.  Non DVC members - The pros - you are literally in the heart of CA Advuenture, especially if you have a theme park view room.   It couldnt get any better, and depending on where you room is located, you could luck out with a

Summary Heading: Great hotel and location, but pricey
Summary: I've stayed here a couple of times (most recently Thanksgiving 2012).  You can't beat this location; it's attached to CA Adventure and also really close to Disneyland.  The hotel itself has an impressive lobby, and the food is pretty good (try the appetizers in the Hearthstone lounge).  The rooms are on the smallish side, but the service is superb.  Pricey though, but you are paying for proximity to the park.  Great location if you go visit the park in the morning, rest in the afternoon (hottest part of the day), and then return for the evening.

Such a great location and overall good experience!  The hotel is pricey for what you get- small room, few amenities.  However, it is clean and you get all the basics, including a small fridge.  Our room was overlooking California Adventure and that was a nice.  Great pool area.  Staff was very accommodating and friendly.  We have previously stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and had found most of the staff there to be pretty bad, especially the bell desk.  We had a completely different experience here.  The registration desk was always busy but the wait was not long and everyone was always smiling.  The convenient location with regard to proximity to both parks and Downtown Disney can't be beaten.  The monorail entrance or the maingate for Disneyland is a very short walk away and

Summary Heading: Best place to stay for Disneyland and California Adventure
Summary: This was by far the best place to stay and the closest of the 3 Disney Hotels but also the priciest.  It was so worth it.  The entrance to California Adventure was maximum 100 yards (about 300 feet).  You could roll out of bed, do the early access for staying one of the 3 Disney hotels, and get in line for fast passes before the park was open to the public.  The beds in the rooms were very comfortable and they change the sheets each night.  If you want the towels changed make sure you dump them in the wicker bin under the sink.  We were unaware of this the first night.  They did turn down service 2 of the 3 nights and left Disney chocolates on the pillows.  My mom, my dad and I (auntie) stayed in one room while my sister, brother in law and my 5 year old and 3 year old nephews

Hotel is very nice, but way overpriced.  We stayed on the 6th floor which is the concierge level so it includes snacks and drinks till 10pm.  Concierge loungs was always full of people stocking up on taking 6 sodas, 20 cookies and all the snadwiches they could fit into their purses.  Seemd like these people had never eaten before the way they stocked up to take back to their room.  Maid comes 3 times a day to tidy your room.  Room service carts litter the hallways so you cant ge thru.  Rooms have a balcony and are dimly lit.  Wifi is quick.  Beds are soft and the pillows are about an inch thick after you lye your head on it.  Bose radio in room, and the TV only gets Disney channels and ABC and NBC.  The location is right at the gate to Adventureland which is handy.  For $375 a

enjoyed our stay at the Grand California.  the place is beautiful and the service is impressive, from check in to bell service to valet. the only problem was after 12 hours or so in either  disneyland or California Land, we were just to tired to really enjoy the total ambious of the Grand Californian lobby and fire. room was comfortable with flat screen tv with a good choice of channels. we had adjoining rooms so our grandsons had fun running back and forth between the rooms. loved the double sink vanity outside the bath, toilet area, made getting ready easy.  the  grand Californian is a nice place to stay, convenient to the two parks and downtown disney but it is pricey.

It's really pretty. Love the lobby. We have been annual pass holders at DL for several seasons, and have loved Disneyland for much longer. From when this hotel was built, we would use the lobby as a place to hang out and relax between riding the rides and shopping with the throngs of people in the parks, but we never had an opportunity to stay here. Over a year ago, we joined friends for a trip to the park - they stayed at GCH and we stayed at a nearby hotel. It was fun, but we kicked ourselves when we saw how convenient it was for them to just go to DCA or Downtown Disney and hop back to their room when needed.  This time around we decided to take the plunge and stay here. We booked a partial view room and requested a queen + bunk bed room for us and our 3yo. When we arrived we

Summary Heading: Sometimes you just have to pay the big bucks
Summary: This place is fabulous!!  It's a little upscale & totally overpriced. But not in comparison to other hotels in the area. We actually moved to this hotel from another one that just was not up to par and no where near the caliber of the Grand - yet it was over half the price per night - and was basically one step up from a motel.  The Grand is a Luxury Hotel and has it's own entrance in to the California Adventure Park.  This saves a huge amount of time and hassle which for me with two young boys is totally worth the the extra price. I can't afford to stay there every time i visit Disneyland, which is 2or 3 times a year, but every once in a while you just gotta pay the big bucks for the convenience . However they totally dropped the ball at the end of our trip. We had extended our

Hotel is lovely, the service was splendid, lobby is stunning. The room was comfortable but nothing exceptional for the price. Loved the bath products, but have had them at a 2 star motel before (I still love the Spa H2O brand). However, no matter the time of day or the amount of adjusting attempted the shower would run hot & cold alternately & never would stay at the set temperature...not so comfy after a long day running through the parks! Could hear holiday music being played outdoors late into the night through the closed sliding glass door. The location can't be beat--walk right into California Adventure or Downtown Disney. Took the architectural tour of the hotel which was excellent & really made all the details & hidden Mickeys even more special. Overall very nice, with a

As usual our stay at Disney property didn't disappoint us at all, although a little annoyed by the delay in getting into the room, checkin was supposed to be 4pm but were told not to go back until 4.30 pm. Stayed in a one-bedroom villa overlooking Disney Californian Adventure Park. All furniture and fittings superb, kitchen facilities, large shower cubicle, jetted bath tub. The pool area is very nice and the lobby of the hotel stunning. Easy access to both parks, Downtown Disney and the outer perimeter of the hotel. Realise what a bonus being DVC members really is when you have access to such beautiful properties.

This was our first and last trip to the Grand Californian. If you want to pay top dollar for proximity to the park, this is the place for you, location, location, location was what we paid for. My family decided to stay here because it was my husband's birthday, there was NO mention of the celebration by the "cast members". I requested a room with a view of the park, which didn't happen.  The water pressure in the shower was horrible. I'm sorry but when I'm paying top dollar for a hotel room, I want better water pressure. The toilet flush was so loud!! It scared my son each time. We've stayed at the other Disney hotels and we return again to Disneyland Hotel but not to the Grand Californian.

Summary Heading: Feels like you are "away from it all"
Summary: This hotel is beautiful.  The lobby is stunning.  The rooms very comfortable.  We were amazed at how sound proof the sliding glass door was despite the fact that California Adventure park was just outside--with the door closed you'd have never guessed that there was a theme park just a few feet away!  The location can't be beat--walk right into California Adventure or Downtown Disney.  My family would stay here again in a heartbeat.

A little pricy but a great experience for the family.  Great location, early entry perks into Disneyland, family friendly swimming pools, proximity to "Downtown Disney" (appreciated this more than I expected) all made the stay very fun.  I might ding it a little for value and a below average workout room but I will definitely stay here again the next time we go to Disney.

Summary Heading: No better location to maximize Disney time
Summary: We've previously stayed at the Disneyland hotel, and splurged on the closer to entrance location and arts and crafts styling of the Grand Californian. The location and early access to The parks can't be beat. The lobby and restaurants are gorgeous. The room itself is very standard...very clean but slightly worn. We loved the pool area, and the fireplace area. Went to Target ($13 round-trip from the hotel) and got milk, salads, cereal etc) and probably saved the additional cost of the hotel in breakfasts/lunches we came back to our room for.

Again, our stay at the Grand Californian was a pleasant and restful one.  I didn't hear one door slam, loud talking, kids screaming and running in the hallway!  The beds/linens are the best, the room was larger than a regular "motel" nicely decorated, with two sinks in the dressing area.  A sliding door opens for fresh air, a lovely garden with a bit of Disney California in the background.  Service, if needed, is impecable, staff right there for your needs/wants.  The huge lobby reminded me of the Ahwanee in Yosemite, large, comfortable and welcoming.  We later went to sit by the fire in comfortable chairs and couch and listened to the piano being played.  It IS pricey, there is no getting around that, but allows easy access into Disneyland/Downtown Disney & Disney's California.

Summary Heading: classy place so convenient to Disney parks
Summary: First of all the room: we had a double queen bed room with balcony that overlooked the pool area. Really nice craftsman decor in rooms and throughout the hotel. Robes to borrow in closet, really comfortable beds and nice sheets. Many lights throughout room, turndown service to make the beds nice and cozy before bedtime. They give you a few tiny freebies for the kiddos too like a postcard, chocolate coins on the pillows, a tree planting kit. There's a little store inside, free wifi, nice lobby and common areas, and three pools, including one with a slide. They close about 10pm so you won't have much time after your DIsney parks visits to get a swim or hot tub time in.  Now for its Disney connections: The hotel is connected to an entrance to California Adventure. Be sure to take

Summary Heading: What a location!  In the park!
Summary: It was a super location - in California Adventure as it turned out.  I had no idea that we could walk out a door and be in the park!  Wow.  The hotel is beautiful and you would have no idea you were literally next door to Disneyland and had California Adventure in the backyard.  The room was very comfortable and quiet - and the free guest wireless worked wonderfully for us.  I hope to go back and stay longer!

When I booked this hotel I imagined I would be leaving a 5 star review, so am disappointed that this review has only 4 stars. To be honest I wanted to rate it 3.5, but gave them the extra half star as its Disney! I have never stayed in a Disney hotel before so was super excited. We booked for two nights over halloween, and there were 3 adults and 2 children in our party. We had requested two rooms. We arrived at 8am and were greeted with lots of smiles and hellos. The lobby area is beautiful, but slightly disappointing that there was no real sign of anything Disney. We were able to check in to our rooms straight away which was a plus, and they had given us adjoining rooms which was nice. For the price we paid I was not impressed with the rooms, but hey its Disney - you pay $$$.

We had 6 in our party and used 2 rooms. This hotel cannot give you a better experience for everything Disney.  The rooms were clean and quiet.  The service was great.  It is one of the Disney Resort hotels and has a guest only entrance to California Adventure.   The hotel is also just steps from the entrance to Disneyland. We rented two poolside caba√±as and had excellent food and drink service there.  We spent 7 nights at the hotel and came back to our rooms with turn-down service and chocolates. There was only one glitch.  We we got home we found that someone had used a Kindle to access Facebook and chatted with their friend in Mexico.  After calling the hotel costumer service desk to advise this was happening they graciously apologized And extended 2 of our Disneyland Annual

Summary Heading: Great very close to both the parks
Summary: The Grand Californian was a very cool hotel. When you walk in there is a huge fireplace inside of a massive room, so your enterance is grand. Disney did a very good job with this hotel because it is so close to both parks. If you go down one hall way you are in California adventure and down another is downtown Disney. The hotel has a few resteraunts one of which has a character breakfast with chip and dale. The rooms were very nice and pretty luxurious. This hotel is not chosen for its luxury but more for its closeness to the parks even though it is a very nice hotel. I highly reccomend the hotel                                                         -RMV123

I paid quite a bit more for a "premium room, with a park view", but I was "upgraded" to a pool view.  I had a pool view last year and paid much less.  I called the front desk to ask them about this and they said that "premium" ment pool or park.  I told them I had a pool view last year for much less money, but they had no answer for me.  The room was not very clean and had declined from last years stay.  When we checked out of the hotel, they took the bags from the room and said they would be waiting at valet with our car.  When we got there, our car came out, but no bags.  I asked if they would get my bags and they said they would.  35 minutes later, my wife went to the Bell desk to ask where our bags were and they said wait here.  15 minutes later, they still had not gotten

Disney does it again , what a wonderful place, The rooms are superior and the staff is not to be believed, Its an tad pricey but well worth it. The pool area is large with the most comfey lounge chairs, the restaurants are fantastic with a relaxed atmosphere, Its a great place not only for families,but for we adults that love the whole disney experience.My sister and I go each year usually in sept. when the kids are back in school.

Stayed at this hotel last weekend. Loved the location. My children, 4 and 7 year olds, loved the two hours they spent at Pinocchio's Workshop (aka daycare). The staff was wonderful. My only complaint is the strange smell the bed sheets had and the curtain. It reminded me of vinegar. I didn't call to complain because after having had a very busy day I was too tired to do so. The room size is standard and I wouldn't put it in the 5-star category.

Summary Heading: This is a truly magical place.
Summary: My family and I have been staying here for years. This time we were there for family vacation, as well as to celebrate my daughters birthday. She really liked the warm welcome upon check in. The staff presented her with an autographed photo of Mini Mouse, along with special buttons for everyone in our party. We love the convenient location, within minutes of either park and private entrances to both California Adventure and Downtown Disney.

I was there with my daughter on our own, hubby had to fly out to Hong Kong prior to our arrival. The hotel was wonderful, the staff looked after us so well and the concierge lounge was a huge benefit- Somewhere to rest to get a drink and be a little bit social without the huge numbers of people. As per usual Disney does make everything special. My daughter still talks about how wonderful the room attendants were (leaving chocolates every night on the pillows). Outstanding!

Summary Heading: My favorite hotel in one of my favorite places!
Summary: This was our second stay at this hotel, we are completely spoiled to stay at other hotels on our trips to Disneyland. The hotel is so beautiful, and it is a nice retreat from the hectic pace of the parks. Staff was friendly, we even received an upgrade to a theme park view room! Location can't be beat. We were at the furthest point from the Downtown Disney entrance and could still be at Disneyland gate in 5-7 minutes. Entrance to California Adventure is right in hotel, made it easy if we had to run back to room. Pool area was very nice and White Water Snacks is a hidden gem for a quick meal. It is an expensive hotel but we feel it is worth it!

the Location cannot be beat, walk out the back you are in the park the side and you are on the Disney Boulevard. We had a one bedroom, very spacious, clean and updated. it is pretty unbelievable the price however...unless you can get a Scream'en deal or money is no object. the Condo and park admission for 2 adults and 2 children set us back over $1000 for 24 hours.. it was cool ONCE.

If you have been to the Wilderness Lodge in WDW you get a sense of it here but on a much smaller scale. It feels like a hotel not a resort. The location and no need for a car makes life simple and easy but also gives you an uneasy, unsafe feeling at the same time. Being the location of the hotel is truly in Disneyland it is a very public city feeling. You don't get the relaxed away from it all sense. People seem to incorporate time at the hotel just as they do in the park. It is used as just another attraction. I highly recommend that security be put by the elevators and room keys shown.  Will not be going back.

Summary Heading: Our First Time to Disney's Grand Californian!
Summary: We're recurring visitors to the Disneyland Hotel but felt it was time to take advantage of the Grand Californian and its offerings/proximity to California Adventure and the useful point-of-entry. The staff at the hotel was consistently approachable and engaging. The room (requested an upgrade upon our Sunday arrival) was adequate for our family of four (could have accomodated 5 with the bunk/trundle bed). Take advantage of the pools!

The staff at the Grand really knows how to treat you right. Love the convenience to the park. The food is top notch. Rooms are comfortable but starting to show a little wear. Love the lobby area and the beautiful fireplace. Lots of activities for the kids

Summary Heading: Just felt like another average hotel!
Summary: I was shocked on how this hotel charges for parking especially the room rate you have to pay!  Ive stayed at plenty of hotels and this to me was just an average hotel! With the prices you think it would be all inclusive but it's not!  I didn't get the Disney feel what so ever!  It was nice to be walking distance from everything but that was the only nice thing about it!  I guess I just expected it to be more plush for the amount you spend a night! I was really disappointed!!

It is a absolutely beautiful hotel. Check in went smooth. The woman who checked us in might of been having a bad day. It appeared that her "Disney" attitude was in need of repair. All the other staff were wonderful. We were here for the Disneyland half marathon so it was packed. The best part was how close it was to the park. The room was too dark for my liking but we weren't in it much during the day. It was quite at night and we were able to sleep well. For me this hotel was all about location, location, location! Next time I would probably stay at the Disneyland hotel. The decor there is more to my liking. It reminded me of Disney's Aulani Resort.

This hotel was super convenient and quite nice. As an adult, I appreciated the rich tones of the decorations as well as the arts & crafts styling. (My kids, 6 & 8, felt it was a little "dark and creepy" but I really disagree with that statement). The parent in me appreciated the proximity to the Disney Parks, with a hotel guest exclusive entrance to Disney Land, Disney's California Adventure, and Downtown Disney. Since I was there for a Trade Show, the proximity to the Convention Center was also key. It is walkable, but I took a cab since I was running late and there is considerable construction going on right now (October, 2012). The folks working at the hotel were very responsive to all our needs as a family and went above and beyond for our work needs as well.

When in the Anaheim, CA area a stay at the Disney's Grand Californian Resort Hotel is one NOT to miss. This Resort is unbelievable, handcrafted design and all the comforts of home. The CM's (Staff) are surper friendly and go out of their way to make your stay one you will remember forever.

Summary Heading: Need To Refill The Pixie Dust
Summary: My family and I have stayed at this hotel five times since 2009. The first three visits were outstanding and the last two is when we started to notice the deterioration in service and amenities. Each time we stay it is usually for six to seven nights. We stay in the standard rooms with a courtyard view.  Don't get me wrong, the location is outstanding, especially if you have small children, but I feel Disney is starting to take advantage of this and reduce the quality for profits. For starters, the toiletries shrunk in size (shampoos, conditioners) from two to one ounce bottles and they used to give you an almost full size bar of soap and that now has been reduced to a small glycerine bar the size of most discount chains. They also used to provide a high quality toilet paper and

Summary Heading: Very central location makes this the play to stay at Disneyland.
Summary: The hotel itself is clean and well maintained.  It is a very nice hotel, not. 5 star, but definitely a 3 1/2 to 4 star hotel.  Rooms are a little on the small side considering the price.  We had 5 people stay in ge room, 3 of which were kids aged 4,2 and 1.  The room size made this a tight squeeze.  The bathroom is also a little cramped.    The room though small is kept very well.  What made this hotel worthwhile is the location.  It has a direct entrance to the Disney California Adventure Park, and Cars land.  It is also connected to downtown Disney and literally steps away from Disneyland park.  This is very helpful especially having little kids/ strollers/ diaper bags around.    Overall good hotel, great location but expensive!

This property is absolutely wonderful.  I love the theme of the hotel, which is designed after the Arts and Crafts Movement in the 1900s.  The lobby is magnificent (especially during Christmas) - incredibly high ceilings, live music (someone plays on their grand piano everyday), and lots of seating available.  I especially like how we get easy access to California Adventure, which helped out a lot when we wanted to get our fast passes in the morning for Radiator Springs.  And of course, Disney's guest service is quite exceptional.  We are of course, greeted everyday, with a smile and someone is always ready to help.  My family and I have stayed on all three Disney properties in Anaheim, and the Grand Cal, is by far, the best of them all.  We stay here all the time.

I've now stayed here on my last two visits to Disneyland, and both times were very good. It's not the best hotel I've stayed at in the past several years, either in terms of service or the hotel itself, but the location can't be beat. In addition to all that other reviewers have mentioned, let me add the following: --hooray for free wi-fi, which should be standard at all hotels, but unfortunately is not. The signal was strong and very easy to connect to. --another hooray for quiet rooms. I was in room 4260, which was at the very end of a hall. A bit of a walk, but if you are looking for quiet, ask for this room or any similarly situated rooms.  The room overlooked California Adventure and some Goofy ride, but we didn't ever hear a thing.  --boo for high self-parking fees ($15 a

First trip to Disneyland.  Arranged a Concierge floor (6th floor) suite.    It was nice having access to the Concierge Room for little snacks, drinks and so forth.  Complimentary Wine and Beer were available and coolers full of beverages to take back to your room, as well as finger foods, fruits, and just about anything you asked for they would provide.    Checking in was a breeze, there was a young man outside waiting for us to arrive and he took us directly to our room, wished our 3 year old a happy birthday, gave us our keys and explained how the hotel worked.  There were always personal Concierge people available at the desk with no wait.    Our room was nice, I had arranged a bunk bed for my kids in the BR and they thought that was just fantastic.    We used the laundry

I have read all the reviews and all the points are relevant and valid. We decided to stay here purely for the location and ease of getting into the park and paying the extra for the Magic morning which really sets the day up and gets you right to the front of the queues. All the crowds are heading for Carsland and it is worth it.   In our once-in-a-lifetime 5 night stay - 4 day pass we could get around quickly and at lunchtime escape to Downtown Disney and the hotel. One day was the really hot day in October (100 deg ) and it was just too hot so we went to the hotel pool and cooled off and then came back to the park in the late afternoon. It is really important who you talk to you on the Disney staff and the advice they give - sometimes you can get the wrong information about

You can't go to Disneyland without staying at the Grand Californian. From the minute you step into the beautiful lobby your Disney experience begins. Great service, nice clean rooms and the convenience of walking either direction from the lobby to enter Downtown Disney or the California Adventure Park. With your own private entrance, you don't wait in line and being a Disney Hotel guest you get the bonus of early entry to the parks. We go to Disneyland several times a year and have stayed in all 3 Disney hotels. The Grand Californian is by far the best. The price may be higher, but when you sit on your balcony and watch the nightly fireworks the cost is justified. The Storyteller cafe has great food and the service is always outstanding. No need to pay for breakfast with the

As many have said, the location of this hotel cannot be beat.  This was our first time at Disneyland after being a loyal Disney World fan (10+ visits), and we were amazed at how much more convenient this hotel was being right on property.  Not monorail or bus, just walk right into the park with now lines.   It's truly amazing.  The hotel itself stacks up well against any of the Disney Deluxe resort properties.   The lobby is amazing.  The pool area is great with different pools and plenty of space.  We got bunk beds in our room which is a great option that my kids absolutely loved.  The restaurants are all OK.  The only thing about Disney hotels is they come at a cost.  Nothing is cheap, but for us it is worth it.  Disneyland and California Adventure are great too.  Again, we

Summary Heading: Beautiful. Disney Luxury. Pricey. I Miss It.
Summary: Where to begin? Walking into the hotel is like a grand entrance. It is more beautiful than I can explain. The customer service was Disney quality. Check-in was easy and it was my husband's homecoming from Afghanistan. Learning this, the gentleman checking us in disappeared for a few minutes and came back with a "welcome back" picture signed by Mickey Mouse and some of the celebrating buttons and balloons. It was nice to be recognized. The room was small in size, but very comfortable and romantic to us. We could see part of Downtown Disney out our window. It was very quiet for such a large and busy hotel. No noise to complain about. Very comfortable beds...like sleeping on a cloud! The hotel offers a lot (spa, room service, entertainment, and exclusive entrances to California

Stayed at this hotel. Lobby and guest relations were wonderful.  The extra we paid to stay on the concierge was well worth it but the guest room was clan but minimal and very small.  Not worth the hype. This year will try Disney Hotel instead. It's great if you want to be close to park but such a ordinary room.

Sorry to have to write this about a Disneyland hotel, because my wife and I love Disneyland and California Adventure. For our 16 year anniversary I asked my wife what she would like to do.
