To my amazement, she said let's go to Disneyland. We are Season pass holders and go there often. I decided to surprise my wife by booking a three night stay at the California Grand Hotel. Which I was informed is Disneyland nicest hotel in Anaheim. I paid for a deluxe view room.  After parking and taxes the room was about $600.00 a night.  We were supposed to have a view of the park; instead they gave me a room with a pool view. When I ask to talk with a manager, he told me there was nothing they could do.  WOW, this does not sound like Disneyland. The room was so small that they couldn't even

Summary Heading: Missing some Disney Magic, but impeccable customer service
Summary: We stayed at the Grand Californian on a weekend trip to Disneyland and California Adventure.   The front gate staff, valet, and front desk staff were amazing. It can be confusing where to go when you enter the grand (and I do mean GRAND) lobby, but there was a ton of staff around that lead us where to go and the concierge was prompt with bringing our bags to our room.  The rooms DID lack a lot of that common "Disney magic". They are nice rooms, they have comfortable beds, they are pretty darn sound proof, but its a prettty standard room.   We had 2 adjoining rooms, my 11, 10 and 8 year old stayed in one, and me, my husband and 5 month old stayed in the other. We had bunk beds (that sleep 3) and queen beds in each room, and conveniently  there was a Pack N' Play in the closet.

This our second stay at the Grand Californian within 2 years. Our first stay was a very positive memorable experience. This stay not so much. We purchased a package from Southwest flying from Oakland, CA to LAX. The dates were 10-9-2012 through 10-12-2012.   Needless to say the big attraction was the new Cars Land in California Adventure. In addition we chose to attend the Halloween party one night that we were there.. More on that later. Cars Land has great eye appeal, as long as you understand the landscape portrayed is not to be found anywhere in California. However it is a wonderful representation of the Arizona and New Mexico deserts.   The majority of the area is covered with shops and eateries as would be found on Route 66. These are fairly representative. I remember

you knew it was coming...the but.  This was our second trip to the Grand and it was comical from beginning to near end.  We were to be put in adjoining rooms with our party who was checking in the following day.  Didn't happen.  We were supposed to have a view of the park...got downtown instead.  Thought the hallway would be dry, but was wet and squishy our entire stay (burst pipe I assume).  The poor people who had rooms right there had to endure fans throughout their stay right outside the door.  The room we had seemed smaller than the last time we stayed there, but we were in another wing of the hotel.  Appointments were fine, though it seems like it was time to change the linens and wallpaper---just looked a little worn for Disney and at that price point.  To be fair, though

We stayed at this hotel in February of 2011.  It has all you need from a Disney perspective, great rooms with little Disney flourishes.  Beds were large and comfy, room temperature was easily maintained, size of room was perfect for our family of four.  The access to the California Adventure Park makes returning from theWorld of Color show easy and quick.  Plus the early entry makes hitting certain rides that are popular so much easier.  My son and I rode the California Screamin' coaster three times in a row because of the lack of lines.  Breakfast (all meals) quite pricey and maybe 2.5 star out of 4 for quality but the cool thing is that there are characters there all the time, no need for a special breakfast.  We were there during the week so reservations weren't a problem.

We decided to book the Grand Californian Hotel for our first visit to Disneyland due to its proximity to the parks.  We paid in full for the accommodation before leaving Australia - over $1800.00 for three nights accommodation in a standard room.  The lobby is lovely and check in was reasonably fast.  The location of our room from Reception was an enormously long walk through a maze of corridors and lifts.  We never thought we were getting there and we had to take our own luggage.  The rooms were quite disappointing and very old and tired looking.  The beds were lovely and comfortable but quite sad older bathrooms and fixtures.  I really did expect more for over $600 per night for the two of us for the room only.  We ordered room service each night, and the food was fine, but it

Summary Heading: The hotel you want....just not this suite
Summary: If you are going to Disneyland the Grand Californian is the place to stay. Closest to the parks, with an excellent restaurant, Napa Rose, as well as a character restaurant, Storyteller, it also offers a lovely bar, an excellent spa as well as pools and game arcades......fun for the whole family..  So,in the happiest place on earth what should you avoid?  We stayed in suite 4452, a two bedroom suite with an additional pull out bed in the living room couch. Everything about it was fine EXCEPT the fact that the king bedroom is not for light or moderate sleepers. Each morning at 4:30 the parade of delivery trucks begins an hour long convoy restocking the parks right behind this suite. Most annoying was the beeping sound of trucks backing up. Now we aren't light sleepers but we were

This is the only place to stay in Disneyland for us now.  What a difference it makes to be so close to the parks.  We could come up to take a break and have a quiet lunch in the room.  We also could come up to change after wet rides.  The extra hour was so great for those hard to get on rides (Cars Land!).  I also used their Laundry facilities which were more than adequate.  Only 50 cents for a load (washer or dryer).  We were able to get a bunk bed room which the kids loved (they don't have to share a bed!).

Summary Heading: Hotel is beautiful - several service issues
Summary: Just got back from Grand Californian. Location and beauty of hotel is amazing. That being said our stay was a comedy of service issues that I have little confidence they are working on. Also, our bed had sheets with holes in it. Last, there appeared to be many staff having conversations with each other (did not appear to be work related) that would just keep chatting away rather than stop and ask what you needed while you waited their (in anger).   1) Met at the valet by an amazing staff - was thinking this will be great!!!! 2) I had reserved 2 cribs for my twin infant girls - was told they will be in the room (they weren't) 3) Had to wait with my 4 y.o. until the cribs arrived (mom had volunteered first watch with babies). Kept getting pushed to use a pack and play - NO we need

From beginning to end it was remarkable. We book a room on the club level through the disney vacation clud which cost us extra points. Worth every penny or point. The room was good, the view spectacular and the staff extraordinary. Entrance to the california adventure is right from the hotel and guests get early admission. After many hotel nights from motels to 5star resorts the staff here suprised me with all their extra efforts to make everything perfect. Bravo

Summary Heading: It's all about the extra hour
Summary: We stayed here last week for 5 nights and we are glad we did. The parks were packed and the hotel booked at 100% capacity. It's location is awesome and we would stay again just for the extra morning hour.  The room was OK, very nice but nothing special. We had a queen bed and two bunk beds, which also had a rollaway trundle underneath it. Service was OK, again pretty good, nothing special like you would expect at Disney, just at another hotel. Housekeeping were very efficient and I liked how they left extra towels out if you needed them in the hallway.  We swam, but even though the pools were heated they were freezing. The children like it but I had to get out.  Valet service were great. The rooms were very quiet for a Disney hotel. We would stay again primarily for the location

Summary Heading: Lobby under construction, water turned off for a night.  Sky high prices for low return!
Summary: We are frequent visitors to Disneyland.  This time it was for a birthday celebration with 18 family members.  We booked a block of three rooms at the Grand Californian, three rooms at The Disneyland Hotel and one at Paradise Pier.  We stayed at the Grand Californian.  What a DISAPPOINTMENT!    One reason we chose The Grand Californian was for its beautiful lobby which we intended to use as a family gathering place during our trip.  Without warning, the day we arrived a huge black curtain went up surrounding the entire lobby.  We were told by bewildered staff that  in new carpet was being put in.   The staff told us they had "no idea that this was happening."  I find this lack of information surprising as it is a specialized carpet and this had to be ordered and planned for.

Ok. Stayed at Grand California this week with wife and kids.  The good:  Hotel is beautiful. Staying there gives you access one hour earlier to the parks.  California adventure has a private entrance to/from the hotel..very nice!  Pools are great, staff is attentive and pros.  We stayed on the concierge level which offered coffee, snacks, beer wine and nightly storytellers for the kids.  Out of everything at Disney my kids rushed back to catch these guys every night.  Very nice touch Disney!.  The ..well average...Rooms are nice but not exceptional.  Not complaining but for the money I was expecting a larger room.  Guess it doesn't really matter as you are not there most of the day.   Overall, as most of the reviews say..you pay for the convenience..which is exceptional.  Spend

My family and I spent a long weekend at the Grand Californian recently.  We have annual passes and have stayed at various hotels off-site, but within walking distance.  Staying at the Grand Californian was a rare treat.  It's very expensive, but worth it if you need something close by and if you take advantage of the Magic Morning hour (7-8am special entry to one of the parks for Disney property hotel guests).  There is a special entrance to California Adventure from the hotel located near the Grizzly Run ride.  After reading other TA reviews, we decided to finally try Grizzly Run but first returning to the room to put on our swim suits (we had never wanted to walk around the parks totally soaked).  My son stood at the bottom of the ride for an additional hour to watch the rafts

Summary Heading: Another excellent stay at the Grand Californian
Summary: I've stayed at all three of the Disneyland resorts, and the Grand Californian is my favorite. Why stay here?  Let me list the reasons: 1. Location. It doesn't get easier than this. You are literally located in the California Adventure Park, and steps from Disneyland 2.  You have a private entrance to the Cali Adventure Park, which can be used for early admission - which is helpful to explore the new Cars Land. In fact Fast Passes for Radiator Springs were gone within an hour of the official park opening. This ride's wait time is typically 80 minutes. We were able to ride early with the Magic Morning, get a Fastpass and ride again - with a minimal wait time 3.  Ambiance - I LOVE the Craftsman beauty of this hotel. Staff is very helpful also.  4.  The Grand Californian enhances

Summary Heading: Best Hotel if you want to be in the Heart of Disneyland
Summary: Hands down, this is the best option of all of the Disney hotels if you want a true Disney experience.   Hotel has private entrance into Grand Californian.   Its not inexpensive -- remember that you are paying a premium for the experience and location.   The rooms are standard rooms.

Our family of four stayed in a 2 queen room on the concierge level. We decided to spend the extra to take advantage of the early morning entry to both parks on alternate days, we have been to Disneyland before and loved the look of this hotel. We were not disappointed. The added benefit of concierge level was a great luxury - just being able to wander into the lounge and get something to eat or drink was a great convenience.  The room itself was larger had I had expected, was very clean and tastefully decorated. There were little Disney touches such as Bambi and Thumper on the shower curtains and hidden Mickeys on the carpet. The beds were heavenly, especially after 12 hour days in the parks. Housekeeping was of a high standard, they even return later in the early evening and do

We just came back from a weekend at Disney and overall we had a really good time.  We had two standard rooms adjoining which gave us lots of space for a family of four and my mother who joined us.  I would call the rooms, nice and clean but pretty basic.  At almost $500 a night per room, I have stayed at hotels which much nicer rooms,  but really you aren't in the room that much.    Staying at this resort gives you a private entrance into the park which is great.  Take advantage of the early entry, we were able to ride the cars ride three times before the park opened.  In fact most people rushed over there right away but if you go around 7:15 the initial crowd has moved on and there has hardly a line up.    The pool area was great but I have to say the service was terrible. I

We have stayed at the Grand Californian before on trips to Disneyland and we like the Disney hotels for the early entrance into the parks and the great location.  Because of this we overlook the overpricing of the rooms and the small size of the rooms.  Check in was a pain and took a very long time.  We checked in on a Sunday around noon.  The experience was not pleasant.  Our room was okay and we had a great view from out balcony of the fireworks display over Disneyland without having to fight the crowds in the park.  The biggest disappointment was the shower!!  It was one of the worst showers we have ever experienced.  The water leaked and the shower had no pressure at all.  You would think that for the price of the rooms at this hotel that the housekeeping staff would have

Service was outstanding. They have the Disney service everywhere in this hotel. It is a very large place and has shops to look in. A very big lobby area where we never had any problem finding a seat. Room was average size. Clean, kept up and cute decorations.

This property is simply gorgeous.  The rooms resemble the same layout as in Paradise Pier hotel, but the grounds and hotel common areas are beautifully decorated.  The main floor area reminded me of a Great Lodge up in the Montana mountains. There is a beautiful stained glass of the Sierra Redwoods at the entrance that is very stunning when the sunshine peeks through.  The main floor common area is also an excellent place to relax, enjoy the piano music or visit with friends in the lobby.  There is also a children's area for them to watch Disney cartoons and still be within their parent's view.  Lots of gorgeous tile work on floors, just an overall great visit.

Room had a bad view, gravel roof , not exceptable!!!! we went to check in, said our room was avail went to it, it had not been cleaned after this long walk to the end of the hall, pizza box on the bed, dirty towels on the floor, bed not made!!!!!! went back again to the front desk was a very long walk, there halls are LONG, i mean VERY LONG!!!!!!!!  my hubby is handicap i specially asked for a quiet room but not at the end of the halls, but they gave us one at end of hall anyways, we were too worn out to go back to front desk again to get request closer room, employee at front desk was not the nicest! we were there for our anniversary, never a mention or anything for our special visit. furniture tv stand worn and broken, no microwave avail. Front desk could use nicer  employees.

Before we went to the Disney Grand Californian, I took the advice of another post here that I would like to endorse. Upgrade to the Concierge level if you can. We travelled with two kids and this made a small but significant difference to our stay. The level has its own serviced lounge that has food available all day long. It was great for having breakfast on the fly, stocking up with water, and making the most of the early entry into the parks. We also liked being able to have a 'timeout' from the park (and the heat) and have some healthy options. We'd also take a dip in the pool to cool off before heading back to the rides.   We also highly recommend the World of Colour show at Disney's California Adventure. We wouldn't have seen the show if it wasn't for the generosity and

Summary Heading: You cannot go wrong with Disney
Summary: My husband and I stayed 4 nights at the Grand Californian as part of our 8 day trip to California.  I have to say the hotel lobby is so impressive.  Upon check in we were greeted by the most friendly and accommodating Disney cast member we have ever met.  His name was Rudy.  I cannot tell you how absolutely great he was.  We are Dvc members so we have been to Disney world in Orlando many many times as well as Disneyland 3 times.  Rudy has to be the most outstanding ever!  The first night we stayed in a studio because a one bedroom villa was not available.  The studio was nice but it was on the bottom floor so it felt a little closed in.  The 3 nights we were in a one bedroom on the 5th floor that was fantastic!!  access to the park is easy as it is attached to the hotel as is

We did extensive research before our Disneyland vacation.  Many reviews we read about the Grand Californian Hotel were great, and many said it was over priced for what you get. I can say in all honesty that if we had chosen a different hotel to stay in, our trip would have been so much more stressful and definitely not as relaxing.  The location of the hotel is incredible and makes visiting the parks as simple as walking out your back door.  We have a 3 and 5 year old and just being able to go back to your room to get a sweater or camera or a quick nap or dip in the pool was so perfect since we stayed here.  Our room was very clean, and very nice.  The beds and linens were lovely and soft.  The bathroom shower was large and there were robes to lounge and get ready for the day

A trip of a lifetime,from the moment we checked in to the time we checked out the service was excellent. The staff were friendly and helpful. Easy access to the parks The only downside is the place is so big you can easily get lost inside

We are Disney Vacation Club owners and up until this trip we had only stayed in Disney World vacation club villas and loved all of them. And I have to say we were not disappointed with the Grand Calif. The room was awesome, looking out at Disney Calif Adventure, and the service was excellent. The lodge was beautiful and the pool had the most comfortable, cushiony lounge chairs I've ever sat in. And being able to walk right out of the hotel into DCA or Downtown Disney was so convenient. When we were there the temps were over 100 and the water rides at the parks were cranked up to get the most water. But after getting drenched we simply walked back to our room and changed. It's possible that our love of all things Disney skews our perception a little, but for us, the week we

Enter the lobby; hold your breath and exhale very slowly‚Ä¶ you‚Äôll be blown away!   First impressions really do count ‚Äì- soaring ceilings, dark wood beams, tiffany-style lamps, cosy fireplaces and scattered lounges, made this very grand entrance feel intimate and welcoming as well.   On arrival, the check-in guy was fantastic and took us personally to view the room our travel agent had booked (overlooking Grizzly Park) and also to another vacant room overlooking the World of Color at California Adventure Park (obviously we chose this one!)   Our room wasn‚Äôt large but high quality throughout with free Wi-Fi and fantastic theme park views. Customer service was excellent -- from check-in, room service and housekeeping, dining and shopping, to check-out.   Private access into

Summary Heading: Their way or the highway, no other way.
Summary: The hotel is nice. Service is pretentious. For this money I expected more. Spent the day poolside and was highly disappointed in pool attendant's sour attitude. Room is average, which is fine. Free wifi is a very nice perk. Overall a great location if you are headed to Disneyland or California Adventure.

Summary Heading: A great room and an excellent stay!
Summary: We are DVC members and used our points to book our stay. I booked 7 months in advance to guarantee getting a room. There is just the 2 of us and so we had a studio for our 4 night stay.   We arrived about 9 am as we had stayed at another hotel locally. We knew that we wouldn't be able to get a room so early and so we dropped our bags off and checked in to save time later. As DVC members self parking is free so we chose to do this - the parking lot is across the street but we weren't planning on using the car for a few days anyway.  We asked at check-in if there were any theme park views available (DVC bookings are by room type only) and the cast member said they would take a look. They said they would text us when our room was ready...but we have a UK cell phone and find that

Three years ago my husband and I fell in love with Disneyland and then started going 3 to 4 times per year. We usually stay at Good Neighbor Hotels, but after doing the Disney Vacation Club tour decided this would be a good investment for us.  We stayed at th Disney's Grand Californian in the Villa's for the first time as DVC memebers. We had a very late check in, so our room was ready. The check in was quick and easy. Our room was room 2516, on the second floor. The room was spacious and clean. The view however was not very exciting for us. We had a wooded view of the back side of the Redwood Creek Challenge. It was vey quiet, but we had hoped for a view that was a little more magical.   The rooms are well appointed and the bed and couch were very comfortable. The private entry

We have stayed at the hotel 2x now. First time it was amazing. This time just ok.  The room we where put in was so far from everything. We paid extra for a park view. What a disappointment. We had a view of the back of one of the rides. The floor was so filthy dirty that when we took our shoes off our feet/sock turned black in minutes. Sheets had stains. Service was pretty good. Though we had a waitress at the lounge that acted as though we were wasting her time.  I'm hoping this was all just a fluke because our first experience was wonderful that's why we chose to go back.

Summary Heading: Fun place to stay and convenient
Summary: Not the cheapest in the area but the staff are so happy and the rooms are great.  We stayed 3 nights and had a view of the Disneyland fireworks from our room.  It is very convenient for if you want to head in and out of the parks to get a break.  You also get early entry to the park and it has its own entry to Disney California.  Has a variety of places to eat and downtown Disney is next door with more eating places and shops.

Recently stayed here with family, and had a fabulous time. Our main goal for the trip was to spend time in both Disney parks and this hotel was absolutely perfect for that.   A special entrance for hotel guests into California Adventure made it very easy to get to the new Cars Land on our early morning visits. The front desk were very accommodating, we had a fabulous park view room.   As always with Disney, the food was expensive as was the room, but you are paying for top service and location. Highly recommend staying here if you are going to the Disney parks.

Summary Heading: Convenient Location, Excellent Service, Fair Rooms
Summary: We've stayed at the Grand Californian four times in the last seven years.  The service is what you'd expect from Disney.  You pay a premium for the location as the rooms are small for the price, but capable of sleeping five.  The benefits of the location are direct access to California Adventures, Downtown Disney and early entry privileges in Disneyland Park or California Adventures (alternating days).  These benefits are important if you are entertaining out-of-town visitors who rarely make it to California.    If you want larger rooms, don't want to pay a premium for the location benefits and don't mind being offsite, the DoubleTree Suites Anaheim Resort is an excellent alternative.  It is located 15 mins away by foot on Harbor Boulevard (there's also a regular shuttle).

The Disney Grand Californian is a beautiful monstrosity - when we arrived we were overwhelmed by the sheer size of the hotel and its grounds. However, we were greeted by an ultimately well honed Disney machine.  Our arrival was expected - we received our tags when we drove through the gates and we breezed through check-in. Within the hour, we were ready and headed right into Disneyland! (Our package included an early start and a 3 day pass). The front desk was also great - telling us all about the special events available and where to get the tickets. In addition, one great thing about this hotel is the private access into California Adventure. All in all, staying here made entering the theme parks easy and quick. In addition, you get the ability to charge all your purchases in

First off, yes this hotel is pricey and only through a deal were we able to enjoy our first trip there.  The hotel is phenomenal.  With ornateness throughout, you get everything you would expect from a Disney resort.  We were lucky enough to have a room facing California Adventure and even with the noise from World of Color, we couldn't hear it at night.  The bed was very comfortable.  The kids loved the turn down service complete with choloclates and scene settings for their toys.  Of the few minor inconveniences, the smoking section near the pool was in a poor location because all that did was waft through toward any of us who were walking to the lobby, restruants or just out in the lower level.  Yuck.  Kind of broke up the serenity.  I sort of expected the pool to be heated

I almost changed to a cheaper hotel at the last minute to save some money but am so thankful that I didn't.  The convenience and the extra little touches made this place so great.  My husband and I took a chance and went on our own to Disneyland with our 4 young kids and took a shuttle from the airport to the hotel, we didn't rent a car.  I had called in advance about an early check-in since we would be arriving there by noon however, I was told that 3pm was the earliest time but they would put in a request.  The front desk person looked for a long time but said there wasn't a room yet but then went to a back office and came out and told us that she found one, hooray!  Our luggage was taken right away and brought to our room.  Our kids were given Disney buttons to wear and

Summary Heading: DVC Villas at the GCH - Wonderful stay! I love this place!
Summary: My husband and I spent 5 nights in a studio villa overlooking Paradise Pier. It was as I remembered from our last stay a couple years ago, simply wonderful.   The room was in clean and in good condition. The bed comfortable with nice linens. The towels fluffy. Our rooms was facing Paradise Pier, but on the 2nd floor, so we were looking just over the treetops. The pool area is large with super comfy loungers that just beg for you to relax and take a nap in them. If you can tear yourself away from the loungers, make sure to check out some of the activities offered at the hotel, especially the Art of the Craft tour.   The staff from pulling up to the hotel, to checking in, to guest services were all friendly and helpful. We spent a couple nights in the Hearthstone Lounge and had

Our cast member who checked us in lacked not only in Disney magic but personality. Found him totally useless and borderline rude. Our room was Downtown Disney view center which is a great location. Alot going on outside to watch from the balcony but once you shut the balcony doors totally silent. Maids and maintenance are so friendly and  such hard workers and keep the place spotless. Pools are amazing and lounge chairs so comfortable. You cannot beat the location of this hotel to the 2 parks as well as Downtown Disney and all of its great shops and restaurants. Howard the manager on duty is an asset to hotel, bell hops,  staff at food court, and in restaurants all top notch . Hotel is amazing and just sitting in the lobby is a treat. Glad that jerk at check in did not define

Just returned from Disneyland staying at the grand Californian Hotel, such a great place, so convenient for Disneyland and California adventure. The rooms are spacious and have everything you need, expensive but a very special place. Downtown Disney right there for you to enjoy too, but take lots of spending money!!!!

Summary Heading: Plan to spend a lot of money for very little
Summary: Ok so the 4 of us arrived on Tuesday for a 4 night stay. Let's start at the beginning.  The greeter at the main gate where you drive into the resort was great. Very friendly.  Next stop was parking. Was greeted by a valet to take my luggage and asked if I wanted to do self parking or valet. Took valet and asked him to try and park my truck so the doors would not get dinged. He said "well it's only a truck". I proceeded to explain to him that yes it was, but it still cost me in excess of $35k and to please be careful and he then said that perhaps I should park it. Say what?  Next check in. How to explain and not write a book???? Ok so it was bad and I made the reservation several months ago. Spoke to the manager and he could have cared less. To show his concern he gave me 2 Fast

Hotel staff is super friendly and professional.  The hotel is very clean with great black-out curtains for naps.  The proximity to both parks is great.  Don't be intimidated by entry lines in the morning - magic early hour or not - the lines move fast.  Character dining breakfast at the Storeyteller restaurant was a huge hit - worth the money even when your child only has grapes and ham at the buffet.  :-)  The pool has great safety vests for all children sizes and a towel service - don't bring either.   Accept the automatic "bed time turn down" service - that's when you get the cute chocolates!  Spa was really expensive so I didn't go.

Summary Heading: Not as amazing as I imagined but still good!
Summary: My review of the Disney Grand Californian is based on me being a travel agent AND a DVC member.  So our room was in the villas section.  We had reserved a studio room for 4 nights.  When we arrived I knew to expect our room to not be ready.  We were greeted by a very friendly cast member who had an IPAD in her hand and took my info along with my CC and then took me to a check in agent.  The girl at check in was pleasant but really the only information I got from her was the room wasnt ready but they would text me when it was.  She didnt go over the add ons I had put on the room (ie Character Breakfast and Dinner at the Carthey Circle Restaurant ) all of which I had made sure were tied in to my room reservation. She didnt go over the fact that as resort guests we could go in to

This is such an amazing place to say if you're visiting Disney! The bathroom is a bit small for the price, but everything else makes up for it. It's so close to the park and the staff and level of service are awesome. The pool is enjoyable and the piano player inside the hotel makes for an enjoyable time just sitting in the lobby. The restaurants are also very delicious!

I think this was our 5th stay at this hotel.  The reason we return?  Location, location, location.   With the September promotion we got a good price on the room and early entry each morning.   With early morning entry we were able to get on the Radiator Springs Racers at Cars Land three times during our stay in a fairly fast line.     We didn't realize with a 5pm flight arrival to the airport the Disneyland Express only runs every hour.  We missed it by a few minutes so we had to wait about 50 minutes for the next to arrive.  Got to the Hotel and were greeted by bellman waiting to assist us with our luggage.  Check in was a breeze, we were upgraded to a room overlooking the rides at California Adventure.   Great view from our balcony of the World of Color show, unfortunately

We just got back from a 4 day 3 night stay at the Disney Grand California Lodge.  Let me start by saying this is the most we have ever spent on a hotel stay and that includes the luxury 2 bedroom condo we rent in Hawaii.  Upon arrival we were awed at the lobby and the service by the check-in staff and valet staff.  Then we arrived in our room!  I went into this reading all of the reviews and knew the rooms were nothing to brag home about but seriously they are a huge disappointment.  We had a nicer room at the Best Western Meridian down the street for around $100 a night as opposed to the nearly $400 a night spent here.  I think what I was most disappointed with was the missed opportunity by Disney to make this room truly kid friendly and memorable.  Give me a real portable

We arrived at the Grand Californian the week after Labor Day with high expectations. The room prices was signicantly higher than other good hotels around the Disneyland Resort, but we really wanted to stay "on campus" so we were ready to pay the price. In fact, we spent an extra $300 for our four night stay to have a room looking out over the California Adventure Park. Well, ithe hotel and the entire experience actually exceeded our expectations. The hotel's public areas are spacious and beautiful. The lobby is especially nice. There are multiple pools and some lovely grounds around them. Our room was comfortable for our family of four, including two college age children.  We had two queen beds, a couple of chairs, a small refrigerator, and a balcony with two seats and a small

This was our first time at The Grand Californian, and it was absolutely fantastic. Disney is all about customer service. From check in, to bell service, and housekeeping. We were truly impressed. We would definately stay again.

It was my grandaughters birthday and we decided to take her to Disneyland. We also decided that we wanted to make this a "trip to remember" for her. We opted to stay at the Disney Grand California hotel in Anaheim, Ca. Wthen we arrived at the paking lot entrance we were greeted and treated well. The attendant at the gate acknowledged us and even though when we made the reservations letting them know it was her birthday, she greeted my grandaughter by name. That made a lasting impression on her, That, and that Mickey wanted to see her at his place in the park. The hotel staff was excellent and everything was as described. The room was fantastic as was the service. Although very expensive, it was one of those "once in a life time" trips that truly left an impression.

Summary Heading: Great location but definately has some drawbacks
Summary: This is my third stay. The bell service is nonexistent when you arrive via Disneyland express. They stand and watch you struggle with bags and kids across the driveway to the entrance. This has happened every visit.   Check in takes a very long time and is not until 3. We were early and our room was not ready so they said they would text but my phone was dead (they did take and charge my phone). I was told to come back after 3. So we checked our bags at the bell desk and went to the park. We came back at 4 hoping to shower before our 5:30 dinner reservation. It was very hot and we were sweaty. At 4:10 only 1 room was ready (we had 2). They said they would call and text when second room was done. They never did we just tried key and found it ready. With 5 people traveling we did

Right in the heart of Downtown Disney, just a short walk to the park from the hotel.  This had always been a "dream destination" for us. We spent a weekend here with our two teenaged boys for graduations and Father's Day.   We are actually from the Yosemite area, and this hotel reminded us very much of the Ahwahnee Hotel in Yosemite valley.  Very grand lobby area.  Huge fireplace and lots of cozy areas to settle in.  I almost wished it would snow.   Our room was kind of a disappointment however.  It was small and really dark.  There was an enclosed balcony which overlooked nothing in particular, just the rooms across the courtyard.  The monorail ran past us which was kind of cool, but you couldn't sit out and enjoy the patio because the balcony wall was too high.   Getting to

Summary Heading: Outstanding for families with young kids
Summary: This was our family's first visit to Disney. The hotel was all that we wanted it to be - best possible location (especially for California Adventure), very nice pool with a kiddie slide that gave our four-year-old hours of fun, decent food and fun characters at the Storytellers Cafe, and the absolute best pedicure ever at the on-premises Mandara Spa. Yes, it's pricey - that's a given. But it was more than worth it in terms of the time we saved by being so close to the parks, and the fun we had with the hotel's amenities. (Bonus points for the kid-sized rockers and the TV showing classic Disney cartoons in the lobby. The perfect distraction for the kiddos when you're checking in or out.)

Well, my daughter and I finally did it.  We saved up for months, watched the prices and booked a room at Grand Californian for the first time.  We had her three children, 6 yr old, 4 yr old and a 4 month old and felt this would be the most practical time to stay on Disneyland Resort property. And it was the best decision! The service was wonderful. Our room was close to the entrance to California Adventure and close to the pools.  We used the pools (mostly the one with the slide-even the four yr old could use it with a life vest, provided by the hotel) everyday as a break in the afternoons.  We ordered from the White Water Cafe and everything we had was good (except the prices). I wish it was in our budget for every time we come as now we are spoiled.

Awesome luxury hotel right in Disneyland! Impeccable service made the vacation so fun! The rooms are so clean and great views. The pool area was huge and provided many hours of fun. We loved very little Disney touch

My Daughter was there on Business trip, she arranged to have her husband and daughter join her there and also asked me and my wife to join up her there as well, celebrated my Birthday everything was over the top really enjoyed myself theme park visit, downtown disney visit, was a really wonderful place to celebrate a birthday, DanD

Summary Heading: Our Happy Place :) Can't wait to go back
Summary: It's the overall package of the Grand Californian Hotel that makes it a must stay!!  The architecture, the grounds, the staff, the views, the convenience of being literally inside the park, make this our Happy Place, we can't wait to go back!! But we always say that because I've been staying here since 2004 and we have the time of our lives in the park, but coming back to this hotel, takes it up another level. Stay on the Concierge Level if you have the chance, LOVE the Craftsman's Club and the smiling faces that greet you as soon as you walk off the elevator. Stay in a 2 Bedroom Suite with either the Theme Park View or Downtown Disney View. We've done both and the best was a huge patio overlooking the main entrance to Disneyland! I could lay in the bed and see the train

Summary Heading: great location not so great room
Summary: First visit with daughter and grandsons.  Room  very standard for amount of money paid out.  Great location as far as the parks are concerned, within walking distance.  Room service quick.  Staff friendly and helpful.  The pool was ok, need to have more slides for little ones who can't go down the big slide due to height requirements and the pavement around pool really hot, isn't there something you can put on pool deck to make the pavement not so hot? Wear your shoes!  Overall the highlite staying here was the location and that clearly is what you are paying for and it works out if you have little ones who need a break from the parks.

Absolutely FANTASTIC!  Awesome pool area.  The White Water Cafe is a life saver.  This place just rocks!!! Of course it is Disney.  On this trip I didn't go to the parks, but I did spend a great deal of time at DownTown Disney.  Just a fun place to be.  The hotel had perfect rooms, outstanding service, cleanliness is off the charts & the decor~atmosphere is amazing.  I almost felt like I was at a lodge in the Redwoods National Forest!    If I can say that anything coul use improent, it would be the lighting in the walkways between the hotel & the park gates.  It is very dark even during the day & when in a new envioent, lots of other people also unsure and then kids running about, it can be confusing in such a dark walkway, that feels like a passage way.  Aside from that,

Summary Heading: Loud over priced but can't beat location
Summary: We just got back from our first family vacation to Disneyland. We got the courtyard view and had we known about the loud annoying music from downtown Disney we wouldn't have stayed in that area. Kids even complained that they couldn't sleep well from the noise and we all hated the beds and pillows. The first day we went swimming and just tried to relax~pool takes getting use to because its freezing! Beds were small and waaaaay to soft (some people like that~we are somewhere in the middle not too soft not too firm). My back was killing me after the first night and hurt the whole time due to the bed. Staff was pleasent and nice, check in and out was easy, and location was fabulous being so close to the parks. The fridge in our room kept everything cool but not cold. The "heavy"

I had booked a standard room-3 night stay in Sept 2012! This hotel has it all. Im sure of it...even though I didnt have nearly enough time to explore everything! I had a studio room with 2 queen beds located right above the Sunglass store in Downtown Disney. It was a long walk down the corridor to the end but it was well worth it! They allowed me to check in with the room being already available at 730AM! This allowed us to use the early entry into the parks this first day we were there...through the direct entrance to California Adventure Park. Had the Critter breakfast at the Storybook Cafe. Buffet food was very good with a large variety. Pools were fun and the pool lounge chairs are so comfy. I liked relaxing in the lobby, listening to the piano. My only regret is that I

We recently stayed in a Grand Californian 2 bedroom Villa!  We have stayed at several hotels in the surrounding area of Disneyland but this is by far our favorite!  You just cannot beat this location to get into the resorts.  We traveled with 3 very small children and it was so convenient to stay there!  The staff at the hotel was always very kind and helpful!  The rooms are very nice and have great decor.  We requested a room overlooking Paradise Bay and our request was given!  Being a huge Disney fan, we also enjoyed all of the little Disney touches throughout the room!  It is always nice to stay on Disney property.  You can have any items purchased delivered to your room.  There are also lots of little perks - like a powerwalk through the park before it opens.  Little hotel

We stayed at the Grand Californian Disney Vacation Club for 5 nights of our vacation. We had 2 bedroom which perfect for 3-4 adults and 4-5 grand kids. The biggest perks was having the pool only a minute away and resort entry into Disney's California Adventure. We also used the BBQ there and had a great cookout for grand parents day. Our theme park view was incredible.  I love the theme of this resort and the location can't be beat. This was our second stay here. I would have given our stay a rating of 5 had it not been parking. On our second day, they decided to close the self parking lot and my daughter was forced to park on the top level of the Paradise Pier hotel on her return. She had a baby and little kids with her and no one could tell her why it was closed or offer to

We chose the Grand Californian for it's location. This was a family trip with a total of 14 people, 8 adults and 6 children ranging in age from 3 months to 6 years. After a 14 hour drive through the night we arrived at the GC at noon but were allowed early check in. The service was great, from the valet to the bellhop to the front desk. We had a total of 4 rooms and they were able to juggle the rooms to get two adjoining with one directly across the hall and the other just down the hallway. Two rooms overlooked the courtyard where the monorail travelled through and the kids just loved it. The other two rooms had views of Downtown Disney with a great view of the fireworks. The rooms were a little worn and the TV was in an odd location due to the bunk beds which made it difficult

This is our first visit. Check in was very quick hotel lobby grand and impressive. Rooms are average size bathrooms small hotel restaurant food good quality and reasonable price for buffet or families.hotel has great pools with waterslides for the kids. it's the location that you stay here for and excellent for easy access to disneyland parks and downtown disney. Best advice for parks - get yourself a fast pass ticket, saves hours off queues for rides!

We are just back from our second stay at the Grand Californian Hotel.  My husband and I visited with our 2 children almost 5 & 8 from 3rd Sep - 14th Sep.  Thanks to our annual passes we were able to secure a room rate of $300 on average per night and at this price it was worth every penny.     We arrived around 9am and on arrival we were able to check in and gain access to our room straight away which was a big bonus after a 14 hour flight from Australia, so we were able to unpack, have a shower to refresh and head to the parks straight away.    Our room was a lot further away from the lobby this year, and the view faced the main hotel entry/drive way.  However, some advantages were that we could watch the fireworks from our balcony, we had closer access to pool (which we took

Have been staying at Disney resort  for 40 years now. 10+ times in last few years with young kids of my own. Really like the Disneyland Hotel but went for the Grand California hotel last weekend. Upon check in we were greeted by cast member Linda, She was wonderful . Put my family in a great room with pool & park view. This was a really clean well run establishment. After reading some poor reviews about hotel with run down rooms, dirty carpets , peeling wallpaper . It made me wonder what hotel these guests stayed ? Not the same place we did. And the location cant be beat. A little expensive yes, but when you look at the perks ,its well worth it. If you stay outside the park to save money you will be short changing yourself for sure.Good clean fun for you and yours.

After a long day (and lots of walking) at the Disney Parks, It is great to have a short walk back to your room.  The location of this hotel makes it worth the extra money. The rooms are OK, nothing spectacular.  Each room has a balcony, which is very nice. All three times I stayed, I got a room with an upgraded view at no additional charge. Each room also has a mini-fridge.

Summary Heading: Hoped to have a Grand time....
Summary: We stayed from Sept 9th - Sept 13th and when we arrived around 1:00 & I had read some reviews on here talking about how long they had to wait in line to check in. Well to my relief there were only 3 groups ahead of us & it went pretty fast. Rachel was the cast member that helped us & she was wonderful. Upon check in I asked her if we could have a higher room, so she checked to see what she could come up with & she gave us an up graded room which had a view of the pool & also DCA & we could see the World of Color from our balcony, Which was amazing. My 1 complaint for staying here was just trying to get into DCA at opening. I felt like the cast members have no clue as to what is going on, you ask 1 person about early entry & they tell you 1 thing, yet another cast memeber tells

Our room was very nice and we stayed on the "conceirge floor" so the club room was a nice amenity and we got a high level of service.  It was very hot while we were there so it was nice to be able to come back and go to the pool and cool off, without wasting too much time going back and forth.  It was very expensive though....you are clearly paying mostly for the convenience, which with small children is worth a lot.  We had a great vacation, but I think we could have all gone to Hawaii for 10 days or more for what it cost to do Disneyland for 4 days and stay at the Grand Californian.

This was our second visit to this particular Disney hotel. The best part of this hotel is its location and pool area. The furniture and carpet in the room was pretty worn. We did have a refrigerator in our room, but it was not cooling. It was replaced immediately.  When staying at a DL hotel you do get Magic Morning Hours to the park which is great! This hotel does have an entrance to DCA which is awesome especially when you have just gotten off the Raging Waters ride dripping and want to change clothes quickly. This is a great hotel offering lots of things for the kiddos with a wonderful staff as well. My husband was attending a meeting at the hotel and he said that the facilities were great as well as the food that was provided.

Summary Heading: Dated but comfortable and great service
Summary: We stayed here for five nights at the end of August on the Craftsmen Club on the 6th floor.  You have access to a lounge where you can have breakfast with no lines, constant access to drinks and snacks, alcohol and desserts in the evening and great views of the nightly firework display.  We also rented DVDs (for free) every day when our kids crashed after a day at the parks.  We had a room with a queen bed and bunk beds with a further pull out bed.  We had a view of Paradise Pier from our room.  The rooms are pretty basic and in serious need of an update, but our room was clean and the bed was really comfortable. The service in the Craftsmen Club, the Storytellers Cafe and the bar by the lobby was fantastic and the staff in the shop were helpful, friendly and courteous.  The

Summary Heading: Expensive, worn and location is the only thing that commands the crazy price
Summary: Currently staying in this over priced hotel. It's not the price that bothers me so much as it is convenient for both the resorts, but surely the price includes some level of quality and complimentary tea and coffee facilities in the room. Some second rate and 1970's coffee sachets with no milk and no tea (apparently no one drinks tea who visits here). Excuse given for no milk is that 'it may go off'....seriously. Maybe they could put it in the fridge...that would be the fridge that has nothing in it...or maybe UHT milk might be a solution! The hotel is in need of a serious facelift....but again, as many others have pointed out, it's the location you pay the crazy price for. Let's not start on the toiletries.

Summary Heading: Five night L.A and Disneyland break.
Summary: Booked two rooms for give nights for our family trip to LA. As the Disney "flagship" hotel for Disneyland, we were anticipating an exceptional experience, however were somewhat disappointed. Our rooms had the feeling of being"worn-out" and tired disappearance, with two of the beds"sagging". Disappointing view of the front of hotel, with such a lot of commotion from constant busses and delivery vehicles, that it was mot possible yo sit-out on the verranda or opening window. The only advantage of paying the extra price for staying here-is that theme park is tight next door. Yes, the entrance lobby and dining rooms are vast and interesting, but this does not justify price. Pool is average for hotel this size and has two/three spa .pools, however these were not monitored by the

Summary Heading: Nice facility terrible service "Don't waste your Money"
Summary: At first glance the hotel is physically beautiful.  The front desk and reception was great. BUT .... once we arrived we recieved poor service from the food servers.  We were overlooked at the pool by an older lady named "Donna".  She chided us for not having the proper ID to sign things to our room.  Telling us we should have read the policy and it is written down, Somewhere????   We decided to go to the room to get the ID, only to discover that we had pissed Donna off so she decided to ignore us while cheerfully serving other patrons on either side of us.  When we did flag down another server (Tiffany) she stated that we were not in her section and that "we must be the people Donna sent to their room to get there ID".  After forcing forcing Tiffany to take our order, we waited

My family of four stayed five nights and everything was great. Staff were very friendly and helpful - rooms are made up daily then they have a turn down service every evening and empty bins and generally tidy and replace towels again if needed. The location is perfect for both parks and even though this hotel is family friendly it is very quiet. Would recommend this hotel !

I stayed at the Grand Californian from 8/29 until 9/4 with my husband and 3 kids (ages 12, 10 and 6). This was my 2nd time staying at this beautiful hotel and I was not disappointed. We arrived by car and chose to valet the car. There is self-parking, but as we found out last time, it is not close. It was worth the extra few dollars a day for the valet convenience, especially since our car was always ready when we needed it.   We arrived at 10:45am and our room was not ready yet. We had bell services hold our bags and we went right to California Adventure. Check in was 3pm and we received a text at 2:55pm that our room was ready. Our bags were delivered a few minutes after we got to our room.   Our room was on the 5th floor. We had a queen bed with bunk beds. The top bunk of the

Summary Heading: Good location and service but feels a bit cramped
Summary: There is no doubt this is a beautiful hotel and feels 'grand'. The lobby is just amazing and the hotel is tastefully decorated throughout. Stayed with family of 5 in concierge room and it just was a little too small. Storage space particularly was lacking. If you are a US family visiting for a short break it will be fine. We are visiting California on a longer trip and found we did not have room to unpack our cases. The service was professional but apart from Anthony in the concierge lounge I did not find anyone particularly overwhelming. If you make use of the lounge for breakfast, stock up on park water and snacks and have a few evening drinks then it is worth it in my opinion. Also great not to have to go to far at the end of a long day. Would I stay again. Probably not. I

Summary Heading: Military rate increase 300% -- made us cancel
Summary: We had our vacation booked 6 months ago, but Disney reduced the valid time window for military passes, which tripled the daily price for us and made a group of us all cancel.  Impossible to reach anyone with authority or intelligence.  The Disney reps just laughed at us when we asked to have them honor our reservation, and said they'd be glad to have us cancel and get someone with more money.  Greedy jerks.  This is what we're going to teach our kids about how not to act, and how we can avoid Disney in the future.

Summary Heading: Doesn't get much better than this!
Summary: I have had the pleasure of staying at this property on multiple occasions and it has blown me away each time. The Disney standard should be the standard for all hotels. Every detail of this hotel and property is spot on.   The front desk check-in and check-out was a breeze, the lobby is magnificent and the rooms are equally gorgeous. I went off-peak, and never had a problem finding a chair or room in the pool. The daily musicians in the lobby are a nice touch as was the lounge chairs in front of the fire place.   Yes the price is pretty steep, but for Disney quality service and location, it was worth every penny. I will definitely return!

Summary Heading: Location is great and that is what you are paying for
Summary: we were disappointed by this hotel. We had expected (given prices) something on par with the Polynesian or Boardwalk at Disneyworld. But it is lacking the magic of those places. Pools were just ok -- rather bland. Customer service was average, attention to detail poor (for example, they got the name of the birthday girl wrong on the special "button"; no apologies, just rewrote the name). Overall, we were underwhelmed by the property. We enjoyed the concierge level and the best part of the room (which was smallish) was the balcony.   Location is great; for those of used to Disneyworld with its shuttles, trams, etc, to be able to pop back to the hotel in minutes was great.   If we came back, i think we would try the Disneyland Hotel instead. Pool looked more interesting plus it

Summary Heading: Best trip I have ever had
Summary: We went to the Grand California Hotel in March of 2012 and it was amazing.  It is now how I judge all other hotels.  Everyone was so helpful, professional, courteous, went above and beyond.  Our guest services person found out that my grand daughter loved Princess Tiana and so he went over and found her an autographed picture of her and the Prince.  My grand daughter felt so special.  All I can say is thank you, thank you, thank you.

Summary Heading: Right in the heart of things
Summary: We just returned from a 3 night stay.  We had a court yard view.  We could see the monorail pass by from our room.  The hotels location was perfect for my family.  Close to both parks and just a few steps from our two favorite downtown Disney places - Jamba Juice (peanut butter moo' and great oatmeal - yum and Naples pizza- awesome!)    The only thing that I didn't like about my stay was that when we left, I forgot my cross necklace in the room.  I remembered once we were in the car driving to the airport.  I looked up their number and called them the next day when I returned home and Lost and Found said they had nothing turned in.  I asked him if that meant that house keeping kept it then and he said "no".  Well, it was definitely there when I left.  I guess someone in house

My family had a great stay the week of July 4th! This hotel location is PERFECT for visitors with small children. When the park gets busy and the temperature gets hotter, your are literally a few steps away from the hotel to change clothes or take a dip in the pool for a break from the action.  The Grand Californian is very clean and accomodating....which it should be for the price.

I won a trip to Disneyland. We stayed at this hotel. Everything in the hotel was expensive. I really enjoyed my stay though. Liked sitting by the outdoor fireplace. It was a bit cold and rainy when we went. The fireplace helped.

Just got back from a week at the Grand California Villas at Disneyland.  The Lobby was amazing the rooms were nice, most of the employees were pleasant but some were so rude I couldn't believe I was at a Disney resort.

This was our fifth stay at the Grand Californian and we really enjoyed it. Our room was clean and comfortable and the wheelchair access was very good. The staff were friendly and helpful. It was great to be so close to the park and the hotel services were very nice as well. It really does feel so nice to return to the hotel after a busy day. Whitewater Snacks is great for a quick (and inexpensive) breakfast.

Previous reviewers got it right: location, location, location.  I laugh when I read about people suggesting that every last aspect of their stay should be perfection because the room cost $400 a night.  Let's get this straight.  You are paying for the location.  Yes, the rooms are a little on the smallish side, and no, it's not a light, bright, modern hotel. (That's not the theme!)  But it's perfectly fine, housekeeping is fantastic, we have found the service to be mostly excellent (even over Labor Day weekend), the pools are great (yes, you might get splashed by a child in a pool - it is Disneyland, after all), and again, it is NINETY SECONDS from room to California Adventure.  You don't need to bring a car here because everything you need is in one of the hotels, theme parks,

We visited Disneyland for my daughter's birthday in June and decided to stay at Disney's Grand Californian.  The hotel's lobby reminds me so much of Disney World's Wilderness Lodge, which is just stunning as you enter. Much care is placed in the common areas, but I think the rooms need some sprucing up too.  The location could not be more perfect - the hotel has it's own entrance to California Adventure and the entrance to Disneyland is either a short walk through Downtown Disney or you can catch the monorail from the other side of Downtown Disney.  You actually do your bag check and park entrance check here and the monorail deposits you into Tomorrowland.....loved that.  We had a Concierge Double room, which was like all the other rooms size-wise, but we also had access to the

We stayed for the last few days in August to see the new Car's Land attraction.  From the start as we checked in till we checked out the service was exceptional!   Asked for a room near the elelvator and that is what we got - right off the elevator and surprisingly not noisy at all even though the hotel was FULL of guests!   Housekeeping staff was exceptional in caring for our room and needs daily.  Turndown service is always nice with the chocolates.  Our room was cared for by women that took the time to go out of their way to service us, making this a truly outstanding stay! Love being close to parks so after a few HOT hours in the sun at the parks we can walk back - refresh ourselves and head back out again.  Cannot say enough for the ease of park entry.

Disney's Grand Californian is a clean, spacious hotel with all the amenities you could want. However, the service during Labor Day weekend was just questionable enough to make me not want to return. We stayed for the Disneyland Half Marathon, and yes, the race starts right outside on Disneyland Drive. It's super quick to get to the start and to return from the finish. However, the neighbor hotels on Katella and Harbor are also convenient, and I think you get a much better deal!   When we arrived, the valet told me if I left my car outside longer than 10 minutes he would valet it, even though I just wanted to check in, toss my stuff in the room and then self-park. Ummm, forcible valet? Very Disney-service oriented!   The room was immaculate. The housekeeping staff does an

Let's face it, if you are staying at this hotel, it's because you know the first three rules of real estate -- location, location, location! After a long day of walking through the parks, it's such a pleasure to be back at the Grand in no time at all. You forgot your hat? No problem, you can run back and get it. You got wet on Grizzly River Run? No big deal, you can change in your room and be back in a flash. Your baby needs a nap? Just stroll on back to your room, then hit the parks again. You get the idea. The lobby is fantastic, and the rooms are nice yet on the smallish side. But we had 3 people in our room, and we did just fine for a night. If we were staying a week, I might think differently.   The only big fault on this trip was that the check in process was miserably,

Great hotel, nice enough rooms, kids love the bunk beds.  Very good service.  Not our our first trip and won't be our last.  Very nice to be so close to Disneyland and right into California Adventure.  rooms are not fancy but are kid proof and clean.  It is expensive, but gets you access as close as you can get to the parks.  We consider it money well spent, as we tend to go for shorter periods, so every hour counts.  This time we were running the Half Marathon, and staying so close optimized our time.

Last time I stayed there was when it just opened so it was wonderful and would have rated it a 5.  It's still wonderful and you can't beat the convenience, and, from far it still looks great.  But, as you get closer I noticed small things that weren't there the last time like the carpets look worn and the room has a slight musty smell. Many things that are touched like sofas and pillows are showing wear and tear.  Prices haven't gone up in 10 years so that's a plus.

Summary Heading: Location is great, perfect for families.
Summary: The service is great. Cant beat that Disney customer service. Poolside is the best place to be in the summer. Hotel staff are friendly and accommodating. The location is perfect, right next to California Adventure and Downtown Disney. My only peeve is that it is a monstrous hotel and gets super crowded during the summer and holidays.

Nice being able to escape Disney park to the room for a cool down . Also try story tellers for breakfast with the kids. Pools are nice and view is cool .we go here every year . And we'll do it again next year

We stayed at the Disney's Grand Californian over Labor Day weekend.  Our room (4429) was nice and the hotel itself is beautiful.  But the room was above Downtown Disney, which is very loud and noisy until well past midnight.  The worst part of the stay was we ordered room service for dinner one night.  We were told it would be an hour, so my wife took the kids to the pool to kill some time while we waited.  When it got to be 90 minutes, we called and were told it would be another 10 minutes.  Well, it ended up being two and a half hours and when the finally DID arrive, they had the order wrong.  I complained and no one seemed to care.  For the ransom that they charge to stay there, this type of service should NEVER happen.  Overall, it was not worth it at all, and I would NOT

Stayed in 2 bedroom DVC room at the Grand Californian.  Everything at hotel exceeded our expectations.  Room and Hotel were immaculate.  Location was great.  You walk out the door and you are at Downtown Disney, and both parks within minutes.  We enjoyed everything about this hotel.  Can't wait to go back!

Used 260 DVC points to stay here end of summer with 2 adults and 2 children in a one bedroom suite for 5 nights.  Can't beat the location; connected to one park and a 5 minute walk to the other park. Just like everything else with Disney can't beat the service - the hotel did everything well.   We were on the first floor and had no view, but that didn't impact us at all. Couldn't hear anybody else when we were in the room. Very comfortable beds.  Good AC temp control.  Used self parking every night across the street.  Food was highly priced all around, as expected. Found it more cost effective to stop and grab groceries nearby and eat breakfast in room, and drove out to eat at nearby places a couple of times.  Kids liked the pool but unlike other Disney resorts at which we've

Let me start this by saying this is my first time commenting but i felt it was worth the effort as I felt you should know the goods before you spend the money....I wish we did.  My husband and our two boys of 7 and 9 have done quite a bit of traveling and have stayed in many great hotels allowing us to draw from our experience. First we expected way more given what the hotel charges.  the only thing I loved was the hotel location ... This hotel offers a great location allowing you to take breaks inbetween visits to both parks. Especially, if you just got soaked in the water ride located at the hotel's California Adventure park entrance. You are able to return to your room to get changed within a very short period of time. It was also nice to catch the monorail to the park if you

We very much enjoyed our stay at the DVC portion of Disney's flagship Disneyland hotel. As mentioned so many times on so many reviews, you simply cannot match the location for enjoying all that the Resort has to offer. How many other major theme park hotels have room balconies literally looking over the park attractions.   Space is the double edged sword for DGCH though. It doesn't have a great deal of it which shows in the facilities and the pool which was a disappointment. Costs for the hotel rooms are high too and if we had not stayed on DVC points, we would not have paid the asking price at the time we were looking to go.   The Disneyland is still our favourite onsite resort and is slightly cheaper, but take nothing away from the Grand, its a lovely hotel.

Summary Heading: Enjoyed our first stay at the Grand
Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Californian last month for a kidless trip to Disneyland/DCA to check out Carsland. We have now stayed at all three Disney properties and we were very much looking forward to staying at the Grand and being so close to the parks. We had initially booked for just one night but at the last minute decided to add a second night.  We had booked a "courtyard view room". When we checked in we were given a view upgrade for free. We were moved to room 5400 if I recall correctly, this room was very near the DVC villa portion of the hotel. From the balcony you could see the top of Grizzly River Run and had a lovely view of the pool area. There wasn't any view of fireworks (not really) or World of Color.   We were in a King bed room. The rooms with king

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel, Not Great, But the Location Can't Be Beat
Summary: We stayed at the Grand Californian for our 5 year wedding anniversary. The room was very nice and clean, although I would not say that it was as nice as the price would lead you to think.  We had a couples massage at the spa, which was wonderful. The only negative thing about the spa is that the hotel allows all guests to use the locker room and sauna. So, a whole group came in from the pool and used the sauna, all of the showers and were hanging out in the locker area. This would not be an issue, except that the locker area was a small nook. I just wanted to rinse off the message oil and get on my way, but had to wait for this group in order to do so. They were very loud too, so not the relaxing spa experience I was hoping for.  The location can't be beat, as you are right in

Summary Heading: How much is location worth to you
Summary: As I'm sure many other reviewers have shared this property is all about location.  I loved walking directly into DCA.  There was never a line and during our stay the main entrance to DCA was under construction which made this extra convenient.  It was also nice to walk directly out into the Downtown Disney area.  Location is by far the best feature of the hotel.  The ambiance of the common areas is also great and we found the service to be very good.  The porters where very efficient with the movement and storage of baggage and the valet staff had the very busy main entrance running smoothly.  Check in was smooth and our room was made up and turned down to a perfect T every day.  We used the pool area and it definitely has a resort feel to it and would say it would be a big draw

First time staying at DGCH. Members of Disney Vacation Club so used points for a two bedroom dedicated villa. We've stayed in many of the varied DVC villas over the years but this had a more spacious and elegant feel to it...we couldn't have asked for "Muir"! We had balconies and views of California Adventure which was lit up through the night and early morning. This was exciting but never affected the quiet of our unit. The public areas of the hotel were truly "grand". There were areas for meals as well as snacks. A special entrance to the CA park made life easier on our feet! Staying on property carries many benefits and to my way of thinking is always worth it. Yes, we have superlatives and cliches to describe Disney Parks but that's how I feel toward the company that taught

Spent two wonderful nights at the Grand Californian and it was 5 star all the way. From the check in through every interaction with staff we experienced the highest professionalism. The Critter Breakfast is a great treat, even for adults ( especially if you are, as I am, a Chip 'n Dale fan.) Granted the place is pricey, but well worth the money. We had a room on the inner courtyard which was leafy and quiet. We enjoyed having morning coffee on the balcony and we really enjoyed coming back to a cool, super clean room after a long day of park going.

Summary Heading: Amazing -don't believe what you have previously read
Summary: We have just checked out after an amazing 10 nights at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel.   After reading so many negative reviews before we arrived I as a bit nervous about what we were going to get. What we got exceeded every expectation. We arrived at 11am after a 15hr flight and the welcoming cast members were more than happy to check us straight in. At check in we were advised what rooms were available right now or what rooms we could wait a few hours for. My priority (after reading previous reviews) was to have a room near the lobby. We were in room 3216 and had a lovely view of the pool, could see Hollywood Tower of Terror and were very close to lobby making it easy to get to California Adventure, Disneyland or Downtown Disney.  The room was not "tired" as reported by

Summary Heading: Fantastic, but prepare to pay the big bucks!
Summary: This hotel is nothing short of amazing, but it is very very pricy for what you actually get.   The property is gorgeous and perfectly manicured, like Disneyland itself. Attention to detail is everywhere, from the grand lobby (complete with huge wood burning fireplace and rocking chairs) to the night time "cricket" soundtrack they pipe in to make you feel like you are in a wilderness lodge (Side note: My PF and I debated for about an hour whether they were real crickets or a soundtrack. The valet the next morning confirmed they are as fake as a Canal Street Coach purse).   The location is nothing short of amazing. Leave through one exit and you are in Downtown Disneyland. Leave through another exit and you are right inside Disney California. Downtown Disney provides tons of

We have stayed at the Grand twice now and God willing it won't be our last. Disney's attention to detail is perfect. Our first visit, we arrived by the Disneyland express after a long flight from Australia. We were gob smacked by the vast foyer, its ambience (music), its height and beautiful craftsmanship of the woodwork in the foyer. Because we were concierge level guests (that Level 6), we were checked in immediately but even so there were lounges for the children to sit in to watch...you guessed it Disney. They were old Mickey cartoons we used to watch on TV years ago. We were shown up to the craftsman's room which is a lovely large room set aside for guests on this level. Breakfast was nearly closing but the children were able to get cereal of many selections, toast and jams

Happiest stay on earth, truly magical location, unforgettable ambiance, did I miss any Disney cliche's?  We have stayed at the Disneyland hotel and several on Harbor and Katella and we decided to drop the coin and experience the best Disney had to offer, and it didn't disappoint.  Besides the check-in taking a few minutes longer than we would have liked (probably wasn't that long but we were very anxious to get in the park for some evening rides!) the rest of the experience was as about as perfect as it could have been.  I was surprised at how fun of a view we had even though we didn't have a "premium view" room, which are mostly are the East side facing calfornia adventure park.  I think most rooms have a fun view that entice to spend more time outside of your room than in it.

Our visit, from August 15 - 21, 2012, to Disney's Grand was nothng short of spectacular!! Room was clean and roomy...love that the 2 sinks were not in the same room as the shower and toilet.  All staff were extremely helpfull and polite.  They helped to make our vacation very comfortable and a ton of fun!! We are allready planning our next trip back and we will definitely be staying at the Grand! Hats off to all the employees at the hotel :-)

Summary Heading: Beautiful public spaces, ok rooms, very expensive
Summary: You are paying here for early access to Disneyland, and the convenience of being able to pop back from the park to your room if you forgot something. Public spaces are grand and beautiful and luxurious. Room was much simpler than I expected, not as nice as a Holiday Inn. Dingy bathroom lighting, etc.  Beautiful pools, though, and great view of the patio.  Was frustrating that we booked a day and a half (to stay til 6 pm), but the system acted like we were supposed to be gone at 12, so we had to keep getting our room key reactivated, housekeepers kept wanting to clean the room while we were napping, etc.  Would stay here again, but know that the reason for the high price is convenience, not great rooms.

Summary Heading: Luxurious Hotel in the Center of Everything
Summary: If you want to experience Disneyland at its best and are okay with spending a lot of money, then this is the place to stay. Yes, it's very expensive and they make you pay a lot for parking too, but that's to be expected at a hotel like this. The staff (and there are a lot) were all very pleasant including the ones who were on our floor by the elevators just in case we needed anything. They even had pin trading.   The lobby is quite stunning and the rooms are very nice too. We had a standard room that overlooked the parking lot, but you don't stay there to look out your window. The beds are very comfortable, which is a big plus after a long day in the park.   The pool area was also very nice and they have life vests for kids, which is great if you have younger children. They have

We stayed at in a standard king room with a pull out sofa. The room was nice and very clean. The set up of the room was very nice, although not a huge room, enough space for the 4 of us. Our view was of the parking lot, I suggest requesting a view on the pool side or of downtown Disney or California adventure park. That way even if you aren't in the parks you can still view the fireworks. You are paying for the location, so go the extra for the view. We had our 2yr old grandson, so the location was great! Very easy and quick access from the parks to the room, which was great when he needed a nap. Also the White water "cafe" next to the pool was a life saver at times. It had everything from quick sandwiches, drinks, cereal, bagels and anything a 7-11 would have. Checking in was

The rooms are just OK but the location makes up for it. We were able to get in on the weekdays at 7 AM through the hotel's direct entrance and it made a huge difference. For instance, we were able to get in rides in Cars Land with a wait of only 30 minutes vs 4 to 5 hours of wait for the Cars Land rides  without early entrance. Another big plus is Napa Rose, the best restaurant that I have eaten at, This restaurant should be on everybody's bucket list, amazing.

Summary Heading: You pay for the parks upkeep
Summary: What a horrible deal. I found nothing to recommend this hotel over Embassy Suites. In fact, you can stay for a week at the Embassy Suites for less than you would pay for the same type of room here. Prices range from $425.00 to $945.00 per night: the MGM Grands brand new rooms in Las Vegas only came to $735.00 for three nights; a Friday Saturday and Sunday at that.
