At least in Las Vegas you get free drinks and all-you-can-eat buffets. These people won't see business from me again. Zero stars.

We have stayed here on other occasions and have found service to be quite excellent and quite consistent.  Check-in is really my only complaint.  There is often a fairly long line of people waiting to check in and it is always somewhat frustrating to see a dozen check-in stations and less than half that many staff manning the stations.  Once this hurdle is cleared, however, it is pure Disney magic.  Rooms are exceptionally nice, quiet and comfortable.  All of the "cast members" are knowledgeable, friendly, helpful and just a joy to talk to and deal with.  This hotel also has its own entrance into the California Disney Park and this was a real benefit since the new Cars Land had just opened up.  We were able to get into the park an hour early and ride the Cars Land rides that can

This is our favoritie hotel in Anaheim, however it is pricey. We always stay here on the concierge level, but on our most recent trip we were on a budget and decided to stay elsewhere. After one day at the "other" hotel I realized why we pay extra to stay at the Grand Californian and we moved and stayed the rest of our trip here.  Standing around for a shuttle (that may or may not show up) and that stops at every hotel along the way just wasn't the way I wanted to spend my vacation. The Grand Californian has it's own entrance right into the California Adventure Park, so no shuttles! A quick two minute walk through Downtown Disney gets you to the Disneyland Park. The hotel is beautifully decorated in the Craftsman style, right down to details. Be sure to take the free guided tour

We had a terrific visit at the Grand Californian. The rooms were not huge but spacious enough for the four of us. The hotel lobby is stunning and the pianist at the baby grand added to the ambience. The best part for us was the direct entry to the park from the hotel. It was SUCH a nice treat...no mono-rail, no bus rides....it was all right there! We would definitely stay there again.....

Having never been to Disneyland only to Disneyworld I decided on the Grand Californian because I liked the idea of easy Park access so I booked a Standard View room. It is a stunning hotel for a Disney property in the Craftsman style and reminiscent of a grand lodge! The attention to detail is amazing from lamps to fixtures which carry over in to the rooms! Melissa at the front desk was lovely and helpful (yes, we know that's their job) BUT when she found out it was our first Disneyland visit she she upgraded our room to a Park View !! We wound up with very close access to CA Adventure and we had a view of Grizzly Peak! The 2 queen bed room was spacious, clean and quiet with a nice balcony where you could sit! We happened to be there during a heatwave so to be able to go back to

Just had a relaxing weekend with friends at the Grand Californian. Disneyland = Relaxing??? Yes, it can be done. I love this place with the rustic cabin feel. The rooms are nice, not extravagant but they are clean and do not feel run down or too fussy. You can't beat the location, right next to California Adventure and a short walk to Disneyland.  The pool is great with a clear view to the water slide and pool area. Parents can sit back and relax as they watch their kids go down the water slide and swim. We just stayed at the Disneyland Hotel (July) and this is not the case there. The water slide at Disneyland Hotel is in a completely separate area then the pools so you have to follow your kids around. Way too much work! As with all Disney parks and hotels, they are not cheap!

We are Disney Vacation Club members, and used our points to book two one-bedroom villas.  The first villa was for my two brother in laws, my son, and his girlfriend.  The second for myself, husband and daughter.   Each one bedroom villa will sleep five.  On arriving at the resort, we were allowed to park our car under the porte cochiere so that we could go check in and get a parking pass.   Check in took about five minutes.  It seems we had just missed a very long line, so it was good timing.  Our villas were not ready yet, so we decided to lounge by the pool, grab a few drinks, and swim.  Parking is by self park or concierge.  Self parking is free for DVC members, for all others it was $15 per day.  Concierge is $22 per day.  The self park lot is right across the street from

We stayed with another familiy in a 2 bedroom suite and it was very nice.  The room could have slept 8 or 9 easy.  There were 3 full bathrooms so there were no waits for showering after a long day at Disneyland or CA.  Our 2nd floor room was clean and there was a full kitchen.  Beds were comfortable and clean.  The kids enjoyed the pool area and the big hot tub.  The staff was very friendly and the hotel is conveniently located to shopping and various dining options.  One night we bought pizzas from downtown Disney and had dinner in our room, very relaxing.  If there is a down side to this hotel is its expensive room rates.  You may be able to get a special somewhere but dont count on it.

I loved the hotel as did the rest of my family. We had two adults and three children in our party and stayed in one of the rooms with a bunkbed. The beds were comfortable and there was plenty of space to stowe our luggage and all our junk. We didn't spend that much time in the room but it was comfortable and I have to say all of the staff was amazing! The prices are crazy expensive for everything, which is the only drawback. The location made it worth it though.

Summary Heading: Had the Disney Magic for Us
Summary: We stayed in a 1-bed villa on the DVC side of the hotel.    On arrival the valets were very helpful and explained valet and self-park options.  We were checked in very quickly even though we were early and the receptionist was very efficient and friendly.  The room was a bit dark but I think that is the Arts and Crafts style.  Unfortunately the lounge area contains a double sofa bed and then the extra bed is a pull-down from a wall cupboard which wasnt really long enough for my teenage daughter who is only 5'4" tall.  Our room had no saucepans or frying pan and when I phoned housekeeping they told me to look in the cupboards, what did they think I had been doing?!  The pans never did arrive throughout our stay.  The only issue we had was that the walls seem very thin and we had

the rooms suck.  really suck.  refrigerators don't work, small, old, smelly, musty, etc.  The prices are simply for the nice looking lobby, and the fact that it is a great location within the disney property.  That is really the only upside to it at all.  staff is rude, unhelpful, and simply knows that you will stay there because of the location.  Think of this as a hotel operating as an airline.  They tolerate your existence only because they need your money, but they know that if it is not your money they get it will be that of the next sucker willing to pay for the convenience of the location and the perk of getting into the park an hour early to avoid the insane line.

Just wanted to say that my family and I love this place.  Have to agree with the other reviewers who said the only thing they can think they'd like better is a lower price.  We just got back from our 3rd trip to the Grand Wailea in Maui and everyone agree'd we'd prefer to do this again any time over that.  The back entrance to the park is very help, and everything about this place is classy.  Also, the offerings aren't cheap, but they don't strike you as nearly outrageous as a lot of these 5-star-wannabe resorts.

Summary Heading: Couldn't ask for more...perhaps a better price?
Summary: We just stayed 2 nights at the Grand Californian hotel.  We had a 2 bedroom suite with concierge service.  Yes we went all out, even rented a poolside cabana.  With concierge service we didn't have to wait in line to check in, a nice lady Jennifer came out to my car and led me to sixth floor where I sat down to check in.  Well, the suite sleeps 10 so some relatives who live nearby but never been to the hotel came to stay with us.  Our suite had a pool view plus part of the theme park.  The concierge service was well worth the money as there were 10 of us.  The first night we pretty much ate dinner there, veggies, fruits, bread, chicken screwers, and pot stickers.  Beer and wine were complimentary too.  The suite was spacious for 10, it was clean and beds were comfortable.  We

Summary Heading: Nothing exceptional about this hotel other than its location
Summary: Let's be clear... the expense of this hotel is not supported by the rooms, the service, the public spaces, nor (certainly not) the food.  Except for the poor quality food, everything about the hotel was acceptable but not great.  These are Ritz prices for Ramada quality.  But it is in the middle of the Disney action, and that's a huge amenity.    There are acceptable alternative hotels a relatively short walk away.  It is certainly possible to stay 'off property' in a non-Disney hotel and still leave in the middle of the day for naps for kids, etc...  That isn't really possible at Disney World, but is certainly possible here at Disneyland.   Especially if you plan to be in the park all day, I don't see the logic of paying these prices.  But if you are not sensitive to price, at

We are Disney Vacation Club members and stayed in a two bedroom villa.  Wow, what a beautiful unit with beautiful woodwork and bathrooms.  From reading other reviews, I gather that the standard rooms here are not so grand, but I can vouch that the villas are luxurious and beautiful.  The hotel itself is very elegant, beautiful lobby, restaurants and pools.  Nice shops in lobby Outdoor fireplace.  Huge laundry room for guests.  Friendly staff and easy check in/check out. The Grand Californian seems more posh and reserved than the Disney resorts we have stayed at in Floriida. Restaurants seemed outrageously expensive.  We ate only the quick service restaurant, Whitewater snacks.  Very good breakfast there.  Downside is that although this is supposed to be the pool's snack bar, it

We stayed 4 nights mid-week recently with our 3 and 5 year olds. Although we had requested a bunk bed room at time of reservation they don't guarantee anything, and upon arrival we were told there were no more standard bunk bed rooms. We asked nicely, and they were able to "upgrade" us to a higher tier bunk room.  The bunks were perfect for our kids, and the room size was fine. The adult bed was frankly awful. Very springy and soft, like you might find in a highway motel, not somewhere as expensive as this.  One other small pet peeve; there is only one bedside stand. I'm not sure where they expect the other parent to put their glasses, etc at night, but seems pretty dumb to not have two.  We did have a nice patio with two chairs overlooking the pool.  Speaking of the pool, it is

We spent 7 nights at the Grand Californian Hotel in July 2012.  We are a family of 5 with children 14,10 and 8. They could not guarantee bedding in one room or interconnecting rooms so we had to stay in a 2 bedroom suite. At $1600 per night this was soooooo expensive. We were on the 4th floor with a view of Cars Land and the pool. We did not have to walk far to our room. Can I just say that the rooms and service are not worth the money but I would not stay anywhere else. Upon our arrival after 26 hours of travelling we were left to lug our 6 suitcases into the reception area and up to our rooms. At check in we were not offered first time badges and I had to ask for them. This was our once and only experience with reception. The location is everything. Being able to go in and out

We were so excited to go stay at this hotel. Unfortunately when we got there to check in, on time, we found that they did not have the room we'd requested. And we weren't the only ones this happened to that day. Later I read the notes on the reservation confirmation, that even though they took our deposit for the room/view we requested, they didn't promise we'd get it. This was an issue because we have kids and needed a specific room set-up. We travel quite a bit and understand that this kind of thing can happen, but usually when a hotel makes a mistake, they offer an upgrade. That didn't happen. Instead we were offered a room with a view of the parking lot or a similar room at the Disneyland Hotel. They told us that was all we could have as the hotels were completely booked.

Overall the hotel had the feel of the Wilderness Lodge (WDW) but was more compact.  Our room was on the second floor and faced the pool, but was in a good location for access to California Adventure park and Downtown Disney. Direct Access to California Adventure was great during the day and the evening, but not that good for opening the park.  They only have 2 turnstiles and you are farther from Carsland then the people entering the main gate. So if you care about being first to the rides then I would walk down to the Main Entrance for California Adventure in the morning.  The room was big with 2 queens, table/chairs, double sinks (outside bathroom area), fridge, lots of drawers and a large closet. The main lobby was large and spacious.  All of the workers were very friendly and

I am in our room at the Grand Californian as I type, in their special chloride scented guest room, gagging at the smell, waving at other guests passing by the pool/our room.  A new definition for "open concept".  If you ever stay at the Grand Californian, be VERY specific to avoid ground floor pool view, or else it's your own fault apparently.  We paid top dollars for 7 nights so I could gag all week.  Truly a first rated hotel.

My 4 yr old granddaughter and I stayed at the Disney's Calif Grand during Halloween and had an absolute wonderful time. From the moment I drove up to the hotel I knew I had made the right decision. Walking into the amazing hotel felt so exciting, checking  was a breeze and our room was beautiful and spacious with a gorgeous marble bathroom and double sinks.  Walking into Disneyland's Downtown Disney was so unbelievably convenient and worth the extra cost. The staff were helpful and made our stay very special. I am so looking forward to returning with both granddaughters.

I am a long admirer of the Disney hotels having visited numerous since childhood, so take my review with a pinch of biased salt. However, trying to remain as neutral as possible, I believe this is a fantastic hotel! The lobby was vast yet cosy with beautiful log fire areas and helpful staff who welcome you to the hotel with balloons - starting off in such a way is the type of touch I appreciate. The rooms were fantastic; always clean and comfortable with all modern needs including a kitchenette in even the smallest rooms. Our room had a view right on to the theme park which was incredible, especially as with the doors closed and curtains drawn you can't hear a thing or feel intruded by the light - you could be on a spa retreat in the woods for all you'd know. The pool area is of

Spent the last leg of our trip at this hotel. The hotel itself is right next to California Adventure so very convenient. Check in was a breeze. We opted to valet our car as self parking is across the street & way too much walking with 2 young kids. The rooms are large and comfy. I was surprised about all the people smoking!! Oh well not the hotel's issue. We had breakfast at Strorytellers Cafe in the hotel. The buffet is amazing and a few Disney characters are always on hand. It's a relaxed atmosphere & great with kids. The pools were great too. But this hotel is getting outdated as well. There's nothing magical or luxurious about it. The 2 bathroom sinks were plugged from day 1. Day 2 they started to smell. They were unplugged & things were ok after that

We just finished seven nights at the GC, ending 8-4-12. The location was fantastic, the hotel was very nice, housekeeping and bell staff were wonderful, and the pools great. We loved everything about the place (it's pricey, but generally worth it) except the food service in the White Water Snacks and the drink service at the pool bar. Both of those things were horrible, but the pool bar was the worst pool bar we've experienced anywhere. White Water Snacks claims its service is slow because everything is cooked to order. But just buying a muffin and coffee takes 5 minutes because the cashiers are so slow. They take forever to examine every photo I.D. with room cards, annual passes, and credit cards. (Because we all know that the first place a credit card thief goes to with a

Summary Heading: Okay hotel, good location for Disney, thats about it
Summary: Good hotel altogether but nothing out of the ordinary. Everything is decently overpriced leaving you little options for eating without spending a major amount of money. Pools close at 10pm which was a little bit of a letdown because we didnt get back in until late and it was usually too late to use pools or hot tubs. The fireplace beside the pool was nice for nighttime to warm up. Staff very friendly, no problems there at all. Make you feel welcome to be there but in general, everything is way overpriced for what it is. Has an entrance to Disney which is handy if you are visiting Disneyland. It was also neat to sit on balcony in evenings and watch the roller coaster riding which went right by our window.

Summary Heading: fantastic place to stay right on disney property
Summary: this hotel is a fantastic arts and crafts style large hotel.  great pools with a slide and nice chairs.  we got into disneyland and california adventure park one hour before the official doors open.  this is a huge bonus to get the popular rides done before the park really opens.  the cars ride is great but the line is long regardless of what you do.  fast passes were out by 9am for this ride.  getting in at 7am we still had to wait 40 minutes.  but, the day before, we went to disneyland at 7am and rode a lot of the biggest rides before 8 or 9am!  walk from your room to either park- nice if you like the water rides but want to change after.  easy snack bar and good storyteller place to eat in hotel.  we were going to try the nice restaurant but ran out of time.  hotel guest get

The Grand Californian was a wonderful place to stay during our trip to Disneyland. We loved staying there for our four night stay. We have visited Disneyland before, but this was by far our best visit. Our room was very nice, clean, and comfortable, but the best part was the proximity to Disneyland and California Adventure. By using the early hour entry to the parks given to people staying in the Disney hotels we walked right on the most popular rides before the parks opened for the rest of the day.  The Grand Californian has a gate directly into California Adventure which is awesome for going into and out of the park. My only suggestion is to not use this gate for the early entry in the morning. There are only two lines to get in this way and it moves slowly.  Instead go to the

Summary Heading: If you are going to be trapped in a hotel at Disney, this is the place.
Summary: My daughter and I just had our annual "just us" summer vacation and stayed at the Grand Californian. We have been to Disneyland before, but this was our first splurge on their signature hotel.  I must say, we had a unique experience, so apologies if my review is a bit odd.  You see, my daughter contracted food poisoning at the airport on the way to the hotel. We arrived late on a Tuesday evening, only to have her wake the next morning, for what was supposed to be our big day at the park, to instead becoming violently ill.   We never made it into the park.  Fast forward two days later, she is so ill, we can't leave the room.  I was climbing the walls, struggling between wanting to make her feel better, while listening to the screams of joy coming from the park.  It was a less

Summary Heading: Location can't be beat. The rest is pretty average.
Summary: When you stay at this hotel, you're doing it because it is unbelievably conveniently located to the parks. Thanks to the private entrance into DCA, we were the first people on Radiator Springs in the morning. Going back for a nap in the afternoon is so convenient and easy.   This is probably our fourth time staying at GCH, so we know what to expect by now. The rooms aren't really lavish, but are clean and spacious. Unfortunately, this time, we were put in a 2nd floor 'pool view' room that was immediately above the piano in the lobby. We could hear every kid scream in the lobby and every piano solo. The noise was intense until about an hour after park closing (1am or so) and started up again around 6am as guests lined up.   My #1 tip for staying at this hotel: bring earplugs.

Summary Heading: Stepping back in time coupled with Disney service. A winner!
Summary: A lifelong a student of the Arts and Crafts period, I marvel at the public spaces in this hotel. Meticulous attention to detail have created a special experience. The lobby alone is worth a quiet half hour of rest and reflection.  You can't beat the location and getting into the park from inside the hotel is fantastic.  However the rooms are beginning to show their age and the price is crazy high.  That being said, I love the rooms overlooking Downtown Disney and the convenience of walking just a few steps back to my room each night.  With the recent renovations to the Disneyland hotel, it's going to be a tough decision next trip!

Stayed for 4 nights. Was initially told the bunk bed room was sold out upon reservation. Called a week before arrival to again mention my request. Upon check-in room requested was granted! Definitely a good start for my 2 kids (ages10& 8) who pestered me for the room just like the one on the website! Location of the hotel is worth the premium - in my opinion. Highly suggest you avail of the early entrance priviledge for Disney hotel guests. You can enter the parks an hour earlier than those not staying in Disney hotels. This hotel has its own entrance to Grand California and is a 4 minute walk to Disneyland entrance. The convenience of going back up to your room mid day to take a nap to re-charge kids makes it worth while. Rooms are clean and daily housekeeping is up to par.

Summary Heading: Do Not Take the Stairs at This Hotel!
Summary: In general, other reviewers have summed up this hotel quite well.  What guests do need to know is something my daughter and I learned the hard way on July 9, 2012.  We opted to take the stairs down from the 5th floor rather than wait for the elevators.  Big Mistake!  We got to the first floor and the only available door out was the imposing Emergency Exit (an alarm would sound if the door opened).  We walked up to the 2nd floor but that door was LOCKED.  We went to the 3rd floor . . . LOCKED.  We tried the 4th and 5th floors with the same results.  For 35 hot and claustrophobic minutes we were locked inside the stairway, banging on the door and calling for help.  We even had cell phones with us, but no one was answering.  Finally, a guest passed by the door and let us out.  We

We have stayed at Disney World in Florida before and this was our first visit to Disneyland in California. This hotel was a huge disappointment. The only thing that was great about it was the location. After a long day at the park, it was great to just walk to the hotel and go to your room. The lobby was lovely as well. But that's where it ended. The room was small and very outdated and the bathroom needs a major renovation as well as it wasn't clean. There were hairs on the floor when we arrived. The Disney rep at check in must have been having a bad day as she was miserable. We have never experienced a really unhappy Disney employee so this was quite surprising. The "premium" view room did not have a great view at all, definitely not worth paying for. Also, if you are hungry

Summary Heading: Location Great - The Rest?  Not so Much
Summary: Pros: Location - book this hotel if you want to be able to get back to your hotel room straight from the park. That's the best it has going for it. Cons: Hotel rooms are dated and have seen better days. Service lacked attention to detail. We had previously arranged to have a late checkout and when we got to our rooms, the key didn't work and we had to go back again to front desk (a hike from our rooms).. For the prices charged, this shouldn't happen.

We flew into Long Beach via Jet Blue. Flying Jet Blue was a great idea because it was not crowded at all, especially into Long Beach. It is probably not as pretty as LAX, but definitely less crowded. We took the ShuttleVan (the blue van) from the airport to the hotel and that was not a good idea at all because we had to wait for the driver. On our way home, we took the Shuttle Van to the airport and we had to pick up other passengers at other hotels. They weren't ready so we had to wait for them as well. Next time, I would opt for a taxi. It would be much cheaper and much faster. And, we won't have to wait for others. Once we got to the resort, the concierge staff came downstairs to greet us and we went up to the 6th floor to check in. There were no lines. This was awesome. And,

The only thing more impressive than the actual hotel and proximity to the park was the first class service we received during our 5 night stay.  We were treated so well, and staying on property really enhances the Disney experience.   Thank you to the saff for the amazing service, it really added to our vacation experience.

This is my favorite hotel to stay near the Disney Parks. The service is great and its close to the parks and even quick entry into California Adventure. The food is good too. The last time we were here,we stayed Club Level last time and it was great. Our room was past the Club Level room so it was great to be close to it to get snacks and desserts. The people working the Club Level were really nice too and helpful. Our room was clean and nice. We had a theme park view of California Adventure. Great place to stay and no problems with neighbors next door or anything. Always fun to visit!

Summary Heading: Totally Convenient but not worth over $600...
Summary: Let's begin with driving into the facility. Driving into the hotel is a great experience. Everything is personalized. They know who are automatically by driving into the valet service. Upon checking in..huge doors open to a spacious lobby... The Lobby is cute & very frontier like.. Checking in wasnt a hastle but paying for self service parking & valet is a $7 difference per day. We decided to take the valet service especially since the self park is across the street near Paradise Pier. Remind you its like 90 degrees out.  The room is average & nothing special. The soaps werent even the shape of Mickey Mouse. I have had better soaps, shampoos, and conditioners in a cheap hotel. However, our balcony is the backyard of California Disney Park. That was awesome. But seriously how

Beautiful hotel conveniently located within easy walking distance to both Disneyland theme parks.  Has private entrance to Disney's California Adventure however this entryway quickly becomes a long line on Extra Magic Hour mornings.  It is easier to enter California Adventure on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays by leaving the hotel, walking through the Marketplace and through the public entrance which has more turnstyles open.  Our rooms were spotless, plenty of towels.  Price is expensive but the location makes up for time spent driving and parking.  Staff members were attentive and efficient.  Breakfast is hard to time early in the morning around 6:30 a.m.--just coffee, tea and muffins.  Coffee makers are in the rooms.

You can't beat the location.  Disney during the day, quick dip in the pool, back to the park at night.  Rooms were clean, please was perfect. Early entry into California Land was perfect for getting fast pass tickets to the water show (a don't miss event).  Can't wait to go back and check our the news Car's land.

How amazing to be in a hotel that is directly linked to the theme park. We had 5 in our room and although it wasn't huge we definately had enough room. It was nice to have us all together actually - much more convenient than being seperated. You don't need to eat at the hotel, there is easy access to many other restaurants. We found the rooms to be clean, the beds comfortable and it was very quiet. We really enjoyed the bonus of the early morning passes to the parks. Staying here just made the whole disneyland experience so easy and enjoyable.

We have stayed at the grand California 2 times and this last time was not as good as previous times. The housekeeping was horrible! We had to call to have them come back. The rooms are starting to show their age. Next year we will stat somewhere else.

Great location, good service, but room was small & needed updating and better cleaning. I emphasize better cleaning, because there was a layer of dust in all the nooks and crannies of the furniture.  Our room location was over the main entrance and it was noisy as cars pulled in and out and could not sit on "patio" because it was a 4 foot high concrete wall so could not see over it while seated. No view whatsoever. Sofa had an odor and coffee table had gouges and scratches. Spa was not luxurious, but, service was very good. Lovely lobby and fixtures, and comfortable fireplace area. The restaurant Napa Rose is certainly not intended for children...the menu contained no real options for them, and way overpriced, in my opinion. In general, accommodations were overpriced for the

We stayed at the Grand Californian with 30 family members for a family reunion.  It is the perfect spot for a Disney vacation!  The location cannot be beat.  We loved that we could just get in and out of the park and back to the hotel in a few minutes.  The pool area was perfect for the kids.  I would suggest, however, that you eat breakfast around the corner in Downtown Disney at the Jamba Juice.  Storyteller Cafe was very expensive, although the buffet was delicious.  Our room was good sized, although a few more drawers would have been helpful.  Room service is great.  Try the warm chocolate brownie with ice cream and homemade chocolate sauce!  Overall, definitely a five star and worth the price.

There is very little that has been said about this particular Disney hotel property that hasn't been mentioned already.  The hotel is absolutely gorgeous, the food is delicious (no matter WHAT your room and food budget is), the Cast Members are all super friendly and helpful (at least all the ones that my family interacted with), and best of all the direct views and hotel access into California Adventure are beyond comparison (seriously - NO other Disney property in the US offers either of these things!!!).  Sure the prices are sky high for just a room, but if you do your research or sign up for emails from Disney Travel (yep, they can take care of ALL of your travel issues) you can snag a decent room rate during the "off season".  This is also the only Disney-Anaheim property

Not a 4-5 star, solid 3   Valet and porter rushed and unwelcoming ‚Äì missed an opportunity to set the tone for a positive experience  Best feature was craftsman beauty of the lobby, designed to look like Awahnee Lodge of Yosemite. Cute kid chairs with movies playing in one corner, piano, fireplace. Good surprise to get 2 instant fast passes per person as well as balloons for birthday and Mickey photo. Close location to the park entrances.   Reserved room with 2 queens and day bed. Upon check-in, not available so moved to ‚Äúupgraded room with pool view.‚Äù This room consisted of one queen, wide bunk bed with trundle pull out took up large foot print ‚Äì made small room feel smaller ‚Äì only 1 night stand. Management made the assumption that 2 adults and up to 3 kids would be fine in this

This was our first trip to Disneyland and we decided to splurge for two nights. We were able to take advantage of the reduced resort rates found on the Disneyland website... our two nights were the last two of the promotion. It was well worth it to park our car and have three days of a short walk to everything.  As frequent WDW visitors the comparisons are -- it's similar to staying at the Wilderness Lodge or Animal Kingdom lodge (same architect). Each resort has its own unique theme but the guest room layout is the same. If you like the ability to walk into EPCOT from the Yacht or Beach Club you'll be able to do the same into Disneyland and California Adventure.   We requested a king room when we made the reservation and we were given a king room, which was great. We were on

Summary Heading: I think its okay, location is everything
Summary: I have stayed here several times as a single business person without children so please consider my review as not being the norm.  The hotel is okay the rooms are not anything special everything is super expensive and it seems my room is always as far out as you can go.  I used my GPS app and logged my room round trip stroll at .67 miles from the lobby.  Now I know I can use the exercise but that is a trek.  The location cannot be beat and their restaurant Napa Rose is superb but you pay for what you get be prepared to mortgage the house.  I have stayed at the Paradise Pier and actually like their beds better, just my opinion.  There are a ton of hotels in the direct area for half the cost with on par amenities.  I would never choose to stay here personally only for business.

Summary Heading: great choice for Disney park access
Summary: Loved my stay here. If you come all the way to Disney - you don't want to spend the whole day and take a long shuttle back to your room exhausted. What better than to stay on the doorstep of the park? There are also some awesome restaurants right there, mostly notably Napa Rose.  Pros: Walk right into the park from your front door Comfortable but not stuffy hotel Well appointed Extremely clean Lobby is grand and impressive - social place to hang out Quick check-in and attentive staff  Cons: Style of hotel can be a bit noisy with rooms around center lobby area

Summary Heading: Great location, sketchy service, average rooms
Summary: It goes without saying that you can't beat the location if you plan to go to Disneyland.  However, for the price and because this is a Disney property, better service is expected.  While the overall staff experience was average (not quite Disneyesque), the experience at checking was horrible.  The front desk staff could not be more indifferent or dismissive.  What a terrible introduction to this resort.  As for the rest, we never quite got the feeling the staff was interested in truly assisting guests.  Regarding the rooms, a bit worn and the housekeeping leaves a bit to be desired.  Disney should take a good look at this operation, they can do better.

We just finished a two night stay here July 5-7.  My husbands parents are DVC members since 1994 in WDW. We have stayed at a few WDW properties as well as a trip to DVC Hilton head last month. This property is great!!!! Check-in: it was quick. Our room was not ready so they gave us our keys and text us hike we were at the park with our suite number. They stored our bags and brought them to our unit very quickly! The resort: the lobby was gorgeous . Lots of people hanging out talking and the kids of course watching videos on the television . The mission style decor was beautiful. Very representative of Cali. Room keys got you into the pool areas. The resort surround the pool area so it makes it more private. Nice pool lounges and a slide in one.   I loved that you could walk

We stayed here last year and it was so-so.  This year while nothing changed about the rooms the staff seemed friendlier and did what they could to make you happy.  We had a view of the park and were surprised at how quiet the room was when the doors were closed to the patio.  The location was great, especially after a long day at the park.  It's alot closer to your room than having to walk all the way to the parking lot.  We would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Exceptionally well located to Disneyland, clean, great hospitality
Summary: Fantastic property within Disney's California Adventure I highly recommend. Comfortable, clean, great hospitality and well appointed. Staff were exceptionally helpful and authentic and as someone with 3 kids agres 14, 12 and 6 who were keen to explore both parks and "hop" between them all day, it couldnt have been a better located hotel. It was also great value as we stayed in 1 room (tight, but doable in a queen, 1 bunk and one pull out) compared to the 2 rooms we normally need to purchase. We'll be back!

We absolutely LOVED staying at the Grand Californian Hotel.  We were celebrating a birthday and they made it a wonderful experience.  Although he was turning 43, he it was like he was 6.  Everyone greeted him with a happy birthday when they saw him.  The cake we got from room service was amazing.  As for the hotel, great attention to detail.  We had a second floor room, without a view, but it was still wonderful.  We couldn't hear anything from the people around us.  We were able to enter California Adventure early when we were there and that was a great advantage because we got to ride cars within the first hour of the park being open.  The line after the park opened was 3 hours long.  It was a bit expensive, but for a celebration, it was well worth the money.  We highly

Our first impression was "Where is the door to get in?" The entrance door is painted over with a forest scene and we didn't know it was the entrance until someone came outside to leave. We were there for 6 nights for a convention and were told we were upgraded. It looked like an average room to me with double beds which I am not fond of. Blaring music outside our windows until 11pm and then back on at 7am. Another couple had jackhammers outside their window. I guess we had the better noisy room.   Leave breadcrumbs when you go out for the day, this hotel is huge. Without a rental car, your dining choices and shopping choices are extremely limited to Disney venues.  We also had screaming children next door. I guess that is to be expected here, but not want you want for a

This was our first experience stating at a Disney hotel and we loved it!  The staff was very friendly and gave us balloons, signed Character pictures and celebration buttons for my daughters' birthday.  I was in a wheelchair from a recent surgery and prior to arrival a hotel employee recommended an outside source (Deckert) for my rental.  Not only was it cheaper than renting from Disneyland, but they were faster machines and they delivered it to the hotel and picked it up!  My kids loved the pools, chocolates delivered to the room with the nightly turn down service and being so close to Downtown Disney.  For me, the best part was being so close to California Adventure.  No pricey, overcrowded shuttles to take when your already tired at the end of the day.  We were able to just

Disney Vacation Club members so the cost to us is not an issue, but this is a beautiful, well maintained hotel. One of a kind and an experience in itself. We had a great view of World of Color and California Adventure, but you shut the balcony doors and there was no noise in the room at all. The power walk in the morning and hotel tour were both wonderful. The detail in the hotel, like all of Disney, is amazing. The staff are fantastic. Stay here if you can.

You can't beat the convenience and access to the parks from the Grand Californian.  While staying at this property, you must take advantage of the Magic Mornings, where you get access to the parks at 7 a.m.  The days vary, so certain days you get in early to Disneyland and others you get access to CA Adventure.  From 7 to 10 a.m., we did as many rides as the rest of the latecomers will do in a 10 hour time period.  We took long breaks near the pool on their very comfy lounge chairs. Following our afternoon break, we had energy to stay until the end of the day and the parks' closure.    I was blown away by the comfort of the pull-out bed.  The bed said it was custom-made for Disney and I've never slept on such a great pull-out.  My 7 yr old loved the Murphy-style bed. We fit 4

Summary Heading: Price is more for location. Not accommodations.
Summary: We took our two year old to Disneyland for the first time, and wanted to go all out. We stayed two nights at the Grand Californian, and enjoyed our stay. The hotel is a short walk to Disneyland, and is ON the California Adventure park.  When you enter the lobby, the hotel is quiet impressive. The staff is AMAZING. Very friendly and helpful. Once you get to your room, you will realize that you are paying for location, and not a fancy room. You have to remember KIDS stay here, so there's a good chance you'll have some pen drawings on the bathroom wall, or a stain on the carpet. Room service is OK. And the hotel restaurant is fun and cute, but you'll need a reservation. A great feature is the hotel pool area. Once the park gets crowded, it's nice to go back to the hotel, and play

We just loved everything about this hotel.  The decor, rooms, food in the fine dining restaurant.  The early entry to the park makes it worth the stay alone.  Only low point was the buffet breakfast - the hash browns were disgusting and choice poor.  Certainly not worth the $29 each.

Summary Heading: As close as you can get, but at a super pricey cost.
Summary: Our first trip to Disney and we decided to go all out. This is the most expensive hotel on and off the Disney property. It is grand like its name, however I feel it does need a little updating. The rooms(at least the standard) are a little small. We have 5 in my family. We requested bunk beds and they were great! Our oldest slept on top, our middle child on the bottom and (much to our delight), there was a trundle for our 3 child! We thought she was going to have to sleep with my husband and I. As far as location, you do walk right out to downtown Disney. The maps that they send you, make it look much closer, but it is still quite a little walk. If you have strollers or older kids, it's not bad. We paid for the basic character dining experience at storytellers cafe. The buffet

For the convenience of walking 5 minutes to get to the park and Downtown Disney, then this is the place to stay. The kids loved the waterslide/pool and I thought the guest laundry was an excellent facility. The advantage of accessing the park an hour before everyone else is a bonus, if you don't want to line up for hours for the new CARS ride. Breakfast very very average. Rooms expensive and nothing flash but I think worth it for the convenience of being able to come back for an hour or two during the day and then go back for the fireworks etc. If you are travelling with little kids, this is the place to stay.

We hosted our married son, wife and 2 children in two rooms, adjacent and connected (like a 2 bedroom suite with a gathering/mustering/gaming room in between the 2.  Noisy.  No help from the front desk or management!  In fact they told us we were confabulating it all!  I would recommend you never go here.

Summary Heading: Very Good, but not the St Regis
Summary: Billed as a  luxury property by Disney corporate is grossly an overstatment.  I dished out $411 including tax for a Saturday night & another 21 for parking.  As world-traveler visiting some of the top tier hotels I'm aware first hand of a luxury property (aka- Four Seasons Paris, Ritz Rome, South Beach Ritz, Copa Palace Rio de Janario, Luxury Collection, Orient Express Collection world-wide). Once we arrived we received first class service from the car drop off, front desk and explanation of daily activities we had planned. The whole luxury stops, when you walk into the room.  Just horrible and embarrassing to say the least for Disney officials.  The rooms are small, lack any detail, the furniture looks like it was just picked up by employees at the local flea market.  And the

Summary Heading: Most convenient location if you are visiting the Disney/California Adventure parks.
Summary: As soon as you arrive you are created in true Disney fashion.  Kids of all ages can enjoy the grand lobby area. Weather it is listening to a pianist, watching  A classic cartoon on the tv or just enjoying the sights the lobby is welcoming as are the "cast " members. The rooms are not as spacious as I thought they would be but were adequate. The linnens were comfortable but the beds have defenitely seen better days.  I also did not enjoy the towels.  They were coarse and rough.  However having he opportunity for our party of 7 (4 adults and 3 kids) to go in and out of the hotel and park conveniently and tale a brakes or enjoy the pools( one of them with a large slide) and refresh yourself is defenitely worth it.  The advantage of having the "magical hour " where the park is open

Yes - this is the most expensive of the resort hotels but it is well worth it for the convenience, beauty and quality.  This is a beautiful hotel and it has a private entrance to California Adventure.  it also opens up to Downtown Disney.  We have stayed both in the hotel and in the DVC Villas.  It really depends on your needs and the size of your group.  Be aware that the DVC Villas are limited as to availability.

We stayed at the Grand Californian for 4 nights.  Price is high for the room and amenities but it's all about the location!  Private entrance into California Adventure makes it so easy to go back and forth between the Parks, room, and pool.  (The same cannot be said of Paradise Pier or the Disneyland Hotel which require an approx 10 minute walk into the Parks.) The kids really wanted a bunk bed room but we booked through Expedia and the hotel would not guarantee this.  So I called the hotel four times the morning of our arrival and finally got a sympathetic staffer who magically found us a room with bunk beds!  It was a Standard room but the balcony looked out over the Grizzly River Run entrance (so don't fret that Standard = No View!)  I worried that the kids wouldn't enjoy the

I love the convienance of the Hotel, and the look of the of the lobby, and outside. As usual (for Disney) the service was impeccable. I would have to say that both times I have stayed there, I was pretty dissappointed with the size of the rooms for the price we payed per night, though. I guess the best part about it for me was how close it is to Downtown Disney, and that it has its own entrance to California Adventure. If you are vacationing with little ones, that is a great bonus!

I really enjoyed our stay.  We had a villa that slept 9. The accommodations were great however housekeeping only comes every 4th day for Disney Vacation Club members.  There was a nice kitchen with everything that you needed for your stay and three bathrooms which was great when traveling with a group of 7.  They hotel has its own entrance to California Adventure and is very easy to access from the main gate if you wish to use that entrance.  The three pools were always clean and chairs were always available.  The staff was very friendly and informative.  I would stay here again in a heart beat!

We loved the Grand Californian it was our first trip to Disneyland and we thought we would do it in style. After a 16 hour flight from Australia the reception and check in was quick & smooth. Our room was very clean and in a great location overlooking Downtown Disney and we could watch the fireworks from our balcony. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would love to come and visit again!

We took our grandson (6yrs old) for a birthday trip in December 2011.  Stayed on Concierge Level and had a gorgeous room with a view overlooking the beautiful pool and in the distance, the California Adventure Mickey Wheel!  We could actually see the World of Color lights changing through the trees.  Everything was perfect EXCEPT our check-in process.  (The concierge met us in the lobby right off the bus, and took us upstairs with my husband lugging ALL our bags!  AFTER we got up to the 4th floor, they found out our room wasn't ready and made HIM lug them by himself all the way back down to the lobby to "check" them into storage!!  I was HORRIFIED!)   However, after we finally did get our room - the rest of the trip was a pure delight!  In the future - for the price of the

Summary Heading: Pricey it is, but if you can, do it
Summary: Just back from weekend at Disneyland and California Disney with grand children.  Enjoyed beautiful lodge style hotel but particularly access to both parks.  We took advantage of wheelchair availability and proximity to parks.  Easy to return to room for quick rest or to change clothes if you are, as this grandma was, a water magnet on two of the rides.  Guests at Disney hotels also have access to Disneyland at 7:00 a.m.; kids went on all the Fantasyland rides in just over an hour -- no lines at all.  At 11 and 9, I thought they'd not be interested in those rides, but, delightfully, they still are.

We spent 5 days in a DVC studio.  Had an issue (cooking smell from next room) and they bent over backwards to fix the problem.  We were moved to a beautiful room as soon as it was cleaned.  Comfy beds and very clean.  It was so great to be able to do early entry into the park.  We did miss the opening of Carsland by a few days.    Beautiful room Friendly and helpful staff Convenient to parks Food good but pricey  Overall a perfect vacation.  We will be back

We have stayed at the Grand several times before and have loved it.  We decided to splurge for our annual family trip.  There were 10 of us this year (4 adults and 6 teens) and my mother was in a wheelchair so we figured this was the best option for us.  I booked the trip 3 months ahead of time and requested that 2 of the rooms be adjoining and the other could be apart if necessary.  I explained it was my daughters 14th birthday and gave all the ages of the kids (17, 16, 16, 14, 13 and 11). We arrived at 9am and were prepared to not have the rooms ready since it was early.  The CM who was checking was in training so we were patient but the whole process took over an hour and a half.  We were assured that we would have 2 rooms adjoining and the other room was close by which was a

Summary Heading: Fantastic hotel that enhances the Disney experience
Summary: Yes, there's no doubt that it's an expensive hotel. And if you are expecting a Four Seasons/St Regis experience, you will be disappointed. But if you are a big fan of the "Happiest Place on Earth," you should definitely consider staying here at least once. The lodge-like feel actually sets a great ambiance. The rooms are nothing to rave about per se, but they are well-kept and nobody does customer service better than the Walt Disney Company.  The one obvious advantage though it the convenience of its location. It's so close that the hotel backdrop actually makes it look like it's part of the California Adventure Park.  Plus the private entrance to the California Adventure Park actually feels pretty cool and now with the new Cars Land, it gives you the ideal path to Disney's

I am a harsh judge of hotels because they are, to me, a major part of any trip. While this hotel is expensive vs. luxury hotels such as the Fairmonst, Kimptons and the like, it offers a lot of value. We particularly prized staying on the 6th floor and having the concierge food all day long. The fruit and vegetables were especially plentiful, and service was lovely.  The obvious "best" quality - location - is more of a necessity for a great Disney vacation than a mere convenience. It allows a family to go in and out of both the Disneyland and California Adventure parks quickly and easily, all day and evening long. It's especially helpful to be able to take a "break" in the later afternoon (before dinner and the CA water show and Disney fireworks.  The downside (aside from cost)

Our third stay at the Grand Californian.  Our first at the concierge level 6th floor room.  All of the negatives spoken about by other guests are true -- the craftsman look just looks dingy here as opposed to the ahwanee in yosemite for e.g. where it looks warm and is the real deal.  But there is nothing as nice as this location if you are doing a few days in the park with young kids.  We have a 11 year old and two 3 yr olds.  Being in the park makes it simple for one of us to come back to the room for a nap with the twins after a long morning.  And nothing could be simpler than walking out the door and  straight into the California Adventures Park or a couple minutes through bustling disney downtown to catch the monorail into Disneyland.  I like that they have a little dorm

I don't typically play close attention to hotel properties close to home, but I was lucky enough to attend the recent CarsLand opener.    If you don't valet, parking is across the street from the hotel.  If you don't have a room key at the time you park, it's a bit confusing because the nearest lot to the hotel has card key access.  Upon arrival, we were immediately greeted by someone with an iPad that verified our stay and directed us to the person that could process our check-in.    I like the fact that the rooms have thick walls and are well insulated.  During our entire time, I didn't hear a peep from the people in adjoining rooms.  Beds were very comfy.  Everything worked as expected.    While we didn't dine at any restaurants on this property, we did dine at Napa Rose

We just returned from a 3 night Disneyland trip to kick of my son's summer vacation.  I wanted to stay at the Disneyland Hotel (less expensive than Grand) but it was not available.  Knowing myself and my desire to stay on the property - I chose the Grand.  It is a very impressive property with the expected Disney magic and service.  Our room was a "woods view" (least expensive category) and it was perfectly adequate - especially considering that we were only in our room to sleep or get ready to go to the parks.  After I made the reservation Disney notified me that we would be there during the Carsland grand opening - which I did not plan.  Disney communicated park closures and expected crowds/wait times very well to us as hotel guests, which I appreciated.  We have some specific

Summary Heading: Very disappointing-stay elsewhere and save your money for the park
Summary: After many visits to Disney we finally decided to splash out and stay 4 nights at this hotel. We read the reviews about how expensive it was but decided that it's location would be worth the expense. How wrong we were. Yes-you have your own private entrance to one of the parks but we still had to queue over half an hour in the morning to get in with the other guests. We paid extra for a room with a park view which turned out to be the back entrance to the park. The room was small, dark and dingy with a tiny bathroom. In fact the whole hotel was dark and dingy. Don't mind paying extortionate prices for good food but buffet dinner was the worst I've ever had. Good points - nice pool, beautiful lobby and bar and arcade to amuse the children but we'll NEVER stay there again.

Summary Heading: Magical Disney experience at the Grand!
Summary: This is our second time to stay at the GC. We have stayed at all three Disney hotels. We received a discount through the Walt Disney Travel Co. and that's why we elected to stay here again as the price is very high. The benefits of booking through WDW. We received a coupon book with reserved seats for some of the show and a free pin/lanyard. The benefits I wish they would add would be a fastpass to World of Color and/or other fast passes. Inside the hotel, you find other people like you who have traveled from a distance to enjoy the Disney experience. We came from Texas and usually travel to Florida but come to CA every few years. I believe Disney should reward hotel guests more with extras such as fast passes or special passes for characters, as the days we were there it was 1)

We've stayed at Disney's Grand Californian several times and have loved it every time! We live in Southern California and usually arrive before noon and have never had to wait until a 3pm check-in to get into our room.  You are greeted at the entrance gate and by the time you reach the valet, the staff know your name! We were celebrating my daughter's high school graduation and my sister and her family were visiting. I booked a package through Disney for 7 people and it was very expensive-don't think that was worth the $, so I would book everything separately. We had 2 rooms, which were connecting-a King bedded room with a pull out sofa and a double Queen bedded room. The rooms are large and spacious, but the bathrooms were rather small (especially for 4 girls sharing). There is

Arrived at lax and headed to baggage claim. Grabbed bags and went to bus stop, buses run every half hour to Disneyland hotels. We lucked out, one arrived in about ten. Ride to hotel went quickly, driver announced since we had vouchers and were going to the grand Californian ¬†he would drop us off first! Awesome :) Arrived in lobby, no one to help with bags, initial check in downstairs, they sent someone to take us up to concierge level, still no help with bags! Women at concierge check in was brisk and fairly rude, seemed to only give memorized info, no smile. Luckily everyone else we've met has been very nice and helpful. Other Concierge staff always say hello, can we help you? Lounge concierges always suggesting and helping. This am one helped me make a latte and another ran

Summary Heading: Location and customer service can't be beat
Summary: Nothing beats Disney customer service and that's what you get from the moment you pull up to this place.  We've stayed here before and every time it's a great experience.  It's pricey, but what you are paying for is the famous Disney service and above all, the proximity to the action. If you are thinking you will get a amazingly huge room for the price, reset your expectations.  You are paying for service and location.  When you pull up to the hotel, they immediately greet you by name and welcome you with a spirited and fun personality.  They are quick to unload your luggage and bring it up to your room while they park your car.  They do charge $22 a day for valet and $17 for self park I believe.  At the front desk, they are warm and welcoming.  They treat the kids like stars

I was somewhat conflicted about spending the money to stay at the Grand Californian as reviews weren't consistent. The only disappointment was our room view. However, there were trees and we could hear the excitement from the park on the balcony- something we enjoyed that others may not. No noise, tho, after the door was closed. All of the services were excellent and we appreciated the easy access to the parks. We enjoyed the turn down service and having a pretty basket for used towels - something I hadn't seen before. Of course the lobby was truly grand and my husband liked spending his time there while waiting for the rest of us to get going. I'm glad that we stayed at this property. Expensive, but a good experience.

We stayed here for six nights. The hotel is very impressive and well appointed and maintained. The grand hall is very spectacular.  Rooms are on the small side and are very clean with good quality linen and comfortable beds. We slept very well in this hotel.  This hotel is very popular and the price reflects this popularity more so than what you are literally buying for your dollar i.e. the hotel is very expensive when compared to what you can get at other holiday locations but as in all things this is a supply and demand situation - there is only one top quality hotel near Disneyland and so a premium price must be paid.  The hotel provides convenient access to Disneyland and California Adventure. As hotel guests we were able to get preview access to Carsland before it publicly

Summary Heading: Disney Treatment in the Most Prime Location
Summary: I've read a few reviews here about Disney's Grand Californian and I'm confused by the ones that claim service is bad. I can understand people who think the hotel rooms aren't luxurious enough for the money spent, but I'm simply shocked that anyone would have bad service here. I mean...that's what Disney is all about, isn't it? THAT'S what they do: They Aims to Please.   For example, my daughter lost her 2nd tooth on this trip. We called the front desk on a whim to see if they would do anything fun for her. We figured we may get a button or an autograph picture out if it. Instead, we got ridiculously wonderful service from Teresa who readied balloons, a Minnie Mouse Tinker bell stuffed toy, a Tinker Bell autographed picture, light up wings and light up wand for a late night

The Grand California has the best location for a trip to Disneyland, California Adventure, & Downtown Disney. You can walk to any of them in a couple minutes. If you need a break, forget something in the room, want to go get a drink from the frig, no problem you can be back at your room in a few minutes. You can get back to your room in less time it would take you to get to your car in the parking lot! You get a private entrance to California Adventure, you get in early, we rode the 3 best rides, got are early fast pass to World of Color in less the 45 min. with no waiting! and we took are time. It‚Äôs as close to staying in the park, without staying in the park. Pools, spas, chairs, towels, & staff are fantastic. Outstanding kids pool. Lots of activities for families are just the

Summary Heading: average room, amazing location and service
Summary: We went stayed here for my son's birthday, and from the moment we checked in the staff was amazing!!  Parking was a bit out of the way (we didn't use vallet) and the room was not that impressive for $200+ a night.  Worth it for a special occasion but not for every trip.

My husband and I stayed at Paradise Pier for a week in May and decided to splurge for the couples massage at Mandara. Yes the spa is small but it had everything that we needed. The facilites were very clean and the staff was extremely nice.  We both had the balinese massage and decided that next time we would get the deep tissue as you feel more relaxed afterwards. We did add on an additional treatment for our lower legs and feet and it was definitely worth it.  We received a 20% discount since we are annual passholders for Disneyland-this was a nice surprise as the spa was a little pricey. We would definitely return  as the overall experience of the spa was great1

As annual passholders who only live 30 minutes away from Disneyland we were hesitant to stay at the Disneyland Grand Californian Hotel but we decided we'd do it for our son's 5th birthday since that's what he really wanted.   The hotel, just like everything else Dineyland related is short on quality and high on price.The room I found to be no nicer than a best western.   Do yourself a favor and stay at one of the many other hotels or motels in the Disneyland area that are not owned and operated by Disney and are about $250 cheaper per night.  There is nothing special at all about the Grand California.

We surprised our kids (6&9) with a trip to Disneyland, and picking the GCH was the right choice, for sure.    Upon checkin I requested a bunk room (queen + bunk beds), ideally with a DCA view.  The nice lady found one available that early (noon), and we went right in.  The room was in the very farthest wing of the hotel from the lobby, which had a plus and minus.  The minus is that it's about a 1/4 mile walk from the entrance to Downtown Disney, so trips back from Disneyland took about 20 minutes to get from gate to room with 2 kids in tow.  The plus is that as I read somewhere here, we could go down to the end of our hallway (5 or 6 rooms down), take the stair (I think it was "S-4") down to the first floor, go through some plain stairway exit hallways, and emerge at a one-way

We have gone to disney many times (10+) since I was a little girl.  My family and I have always loved the happy times and memories.  We have stayed at the Grand Californian for the past several visits.  We have also stayed at the Disneyland Hotel years ealier.  I havent been impressed for many reason of both.  The location is wonderful, the staff has always been pleasant but not always helpful.  We stayed last year in October 2011 and they gave our room away.....When bookin I had asked for a room that sleeps three adults and  two teens.  They said that all of us would have a bed to sleep in.  This was also true at the Disneyland Hotel.  We did have a room that slept 5 many years earlier.  Atter checking in and getting to our room it only had two beds.  I called down to the desk

Summary Heading: Simply the best for location. Glad we chose this over Paradise Pier and Disneyland Hotel
Summary: This was my first time in LA's Disneyland and I had my wife and 2 kids (5 & 1) traveling. We knew we wanted to be close to the parks and despite attempts by friends to convince us to stay at hotels close but not on premise (ie non Disney hotel), we felt we would be going to the room for naps or other emergencies (as expected with kids).  We made the right choice - the proximity of the hotel is fantastic and substantially better than the others (which I was surprised at - we knew GCH was closest but the other hotels looked quite a distance away). We now know to always stay at GCH if choosing a Disney hotel. The convenience ended up being not just for the kids but for the whole family. As we were staying for a few nights, it was easy to go to the parks, then pop out of Disneyland

My husband, daugther (2 1/2 at the time) and myself stayed at the Grand Californian the week of Thanksgiving back in 2010.  We booked our trip through AAA.  We paid for a standard room but were able to get a room with an obstructed view of California Adventure (better than looking at parking lot we figured).  Our room was very nice. We liked how the toilet/shower area was separated from the sink/vanity area with a sliding door.  We had a room with two double beds.  There was a pack n' play in the closet for those who travel with litlte ones (we didn't need to use it though).  We loved the entrance right into California Adventure from our hotel.  We ate breakfast one morning at the 'snack bar' by the pool.  On our last day we ate breakfast at Storytellers Cafe and had a great

Summary Heading: Elegance, spleandour, comfort.... Just don't look at the price!
Summary: We stayed at the Grand Californian for three nights in late May 2011. Upon arrival we were slightly disappointed at the parking charges, $22 valet or $15 self-park. The self-park option is only two minutes walk across the road and we were planning to spend three days in Disneyland anyway, so it seemed a waste to use the valet park.   The check in was very rapid, and they had a room for us even though we arrived about noon. We were pleased to have been upgraded. Our twin queen room looked out onto a central garden with views of the monorail. A balcony had views out onto Downtown Disney. If you have small children who will go to bed early, you might ask for a room with a different aspect as there is loud music until 10pm although with the door closed our 4 year old was able to

Summary Heading: after 8 years, the feeling is lost
Summary: My wife and I have been staying at this property going on 8 years now. We have noticed that over time, and as the resort got bigger and more popular, the experience at the hotel has gone downhill. Last time we were here the valet damaged her vehicle. Since we did not walk around the vehicle prior to handing the keys over and inspect it with the rude, obnoxious valets, they denied our claim. Being huge fans of the resort and what was once high caliber customer service, we chalked this up as a anamoly and booked a return trip. Mistake. We got a great room, but the performers outside in the Disney district were incredibly loud as we tried to sleep at 10pm. It took an hour of my wife and I on the phone to get the issue resolved. For as much as they charge here, its ridiculous they

We stayed here for a week in October 2010 on our second visit to Disneyland. As a special treat for our seven year old we also purchased a Disney gift basket.  From the moment we arrived until the day we left we can only praise the staff for their helpfullness and "happiness".   When we entered our room it was full of disney presents and halloween treats which certainly brought a smile to our faces, even after a long flight from Australia. The location is perfect for access to both parks and downtown disney. If you want to maximise your visit to Disneyland and reduce traveling time to the parks, this is the place to stay, although you do have to pay a extra for the experience.

Stayed in a Downtown Disney view room which had a view of shops in Downtown Disney like Haagen Daz and Build a Bear.  Not a view of the Park and not terribly exciting (but to be fair exactly as advertised just not for some reason quite what I expected).  These rooms are also a little noisy with music from rather bland street performers (playing the sort of muzak you hear in supermarkets).  Relative to the parks the location is great and the hotel does offer some advantages in park entry but it is overpriced charging 5 star prices for 4 star accommodation. The overall look of the hotel is rather cliche and the pool area needs an upgrade..  I guess the extra $'s are for the Disney brand rather than real amenities. I wouldn't stay here again, much better value can be found in

Loved the location (you can't get any closer to the park), the Craftsman theme and style, but was sorely disappointed with the check on/ out process. Husband spent 2 hrs at the front desk during the 20 hrs we stayed here. We were charged for the room twice, just to name one of the many incidents that came from the front desk. The lobby was gorgeous and our room was wonderful, comfortable and clean. All in all, we would stay here again.

This is the best location for the Disneyland Resort.  You are within walking distance to both theme parks.  The hotel is so close to the parks, you can go back during the day and enjoy the pools.  There is a private park entrance to Disney's California Adventure from this hotel.  Also, as a hotel guest you have early entrance to California Adventure.  The lobby is very impressive and is a nice place to relax and people watch.  We stayed in a newer section of the hotel and had a view of some of the rides in California Adventure.  Our room was clean and the beds were very comfortable.  I liked how the sinks were separated from the shower and toilet but I did not like the pocket door.  Ate at Storytellers for breakfast, which was a character dining experience.  The buffet was great
Everything was top notch! form the room, to the housekeeper dressed like Cinderella!

The staff is rude as could be, parking was supposed to be free; however we were charged in arm and a leg for it. You will get better treatment if you stay at the cheapest, scummiest flea bag of a motel rather than staying at the grand Californian hotel. And that is being 110% truthful. The Storytellers caf√© is not much better the staff looks down upon you as if you do not matter. Save yourself as much money as you can and do not stay there. Seriously stay at a neighboring hotel or some dive they will treat you so much better. All the Staff at the Grand Californian care about is lining their own pockets they do not give rats @$$ about you, you are just a number to them. The do not honor their commitments to you they give you false and BS promises and say they really want to make

Summary Heading: Best place to stay at Disneyland.
Summary: Everything about this hotel shouts COMFORT!  First there are the beds, so comfy and restful whenever taking a break from the park.  My daughter and I (adults) make this our central location for every trip to Disney and so much enjoy the early entry from the hotel, the location (we always get a room overlooking Downtown Disney) so she can see everything going on, coffee bar in the morning, it is EASILY accessible from the freeway, and I love the valet parking service.  We will go back again in September as my daughter's only request upon returning from her deployment to Afghanistan.  This will nark our 5 stay in 3 years!

Summary Heading: Beautiful Lobby, easy access to Park
Summary: As a big fan of Disney I am always excited to stay at the beautiful Grand Californian, this will be my 2nd stay here.  Coming for my 2nd wedding anniversary I was greeted by a free upgrade, balloons and Mickeys autograph.  That is what is best about Disney, best in service!!  We checked into our rooms, which I will get into later.  Changed, got a drink at the bar and headed to the park.  Reasons I love this hotel:  1- The feel of the rustic lobby. 2- Side access to Grand Californian Park.  If you don't like to walk a lot this is the quickest way in. 3-Service 4- Downtown Disney Location, easy to find some places to eat besides the park. 5- Not just for kids, this hotel is a nice place for couples as well. 6- Nice pool area to take a break in.  On a small downside, I believe this

Summary Heading: Excellent with small kids or seniors
Summary: The resort was really well kept, and perks like having three pools to swim in was great. Also, we found the service was really good, but you get out what you put in- don't expect great service if you aren't respectful and friendly. Same as anywhere. Enough of that! If you have small kids that can't do a full day in the park, or are traveling with seniors or anyone that needs to go back to the hotel for a nap/rest, this is THE location. During the two hour afternoon nap, it was lovely to sit on the balcony and have a glass of wine and read a book.  I would also recommend Whitewater Snacks for the kids. They were always super fast and had good choices. If you are looking for a full sit down breakfast but not interested in the standard park fare, I recommend Catal in downtown

We've stayed at the Grand Californian several times and are never dissapointed. The hotel is beautiful, rooms spotless and the "cast members" (staff) always helpful and friendly. The hotel has it's own private entrance to California Adventure, which at times allows hotel guests to enter CA 30 minutes before other park guests. There is a lovely gift shop, spa, and the restaraunts on site are great. Whenever we visit Disneyland, this is and will always be where we stay.

Worst experience ever. 30 minute check in, A/C in room did not work, now 10:36 pm we are exhausted, my four year old is delirious we need sleep, and the staff could care less. I asked for an upgrade, I got another room, same size but a better view. Darrrin the "supervisor" refused to comp a night he was extremely proud of the fact that the better view was the upgrade. He could not grasp the concept that I could care less about the better view, I am upset about the entire experience, it's the horrible service they needed to fix not the view. Trying to make good with a free meal is a slap in the face for what we endured. Try waiting around with a sleep deprived four year old for a technician to come up and tell me what I already knew, that the air conditioning did not work. The

UPDATE: The GM's office contacted us on the afternoon of the 24th and made amends.  I feel that they listened to our concerns and I hope they will make some changes as a result  TIP: Save some money and stay at Paradise Pier instead  We had a wonderful experience at the Paradise Pier in September 2010 and were very excited to have a chance to stay at the GCH. We expected the same level of quality and service, but were very disappointed. It may be the fact that there seemed to be a large number of new employees in the hotel and around the parks, but we never experienced problems anywhere else.  Here is a list of the specific problems we experienced: - Check-in took 30-40 minutes - Housekeeping is appalling. The walls, doors and phone were filthy from previous guests. Even after I

This was our second trip to Disneyland and since my youngest DD was only 21/2 yrs, we decided that location trumps everything else and DGC delivered that with even better perks. The room was a little dated and it was to be expected when compared to the newly remodelled rooms at the Disneyland Hotel. However, it was very clean and it held a sort of charm. We had two queen beds with a view of the main entrance and the monorail but it was surprisingly quiet given the amount of tour busses that drove through the main entrance in the morning. The balcony was a little small but it was sufficient for DDs to have their little siesta. The bathroom had a tub with a laundry line which was great for drying swimsuits on. The rotating shower was kinda interesting but water pressure was great.

We really enjoyed our time here at the Grand Californian hotel. Your room key can double as a credit card around the park, have your shopping bags sent to the hotel so you don't have to carry them around the park all day, you also get in early to the parks for Magic Morning hours on select days, this hotel has a private entrance into the California park, and on the 6th floor your room key will open the door to a private patio overlooking California park for a balcony view of the World of Color show. Vallet parking is available for a reasonable cost. Can't wait to return.

Summary Heading: Excellent but trumped by the new Disney Hotel Remodel
Summary: Excellent hotel for Disney trip and of course the location is the best.  However, I stayed a few months ago at the newly remodeled Disney hotel with the kids and I prefer the rooms there now and they are less expensive.  The spa was nice but very small.  Great bar area for those that want that at the end of the day with a cozy fireplace.  Pool area was very nice and comfortable lounge chairs!

Summary Heading: Great Location, Great Service, Conceirge Access a Big Plus
Summary: We are just waiting in the airport to fly home after spending 5 night at the Disney Grand Californian Hotel.  Overall our stay was great and I would recommend this hotel.  We were in room 1605, which was on the concierge floor and was made up of two queens (we are two adults and two kids).  The beds were very comfortable and all four of us commented how well we slept.  By the end of the day we were always exhausted which I am sure helped the sleep, but the mattresses were really nice.  The bedding was soft as well.  We had a two sink configuration in the bathroom area with  the shower and toilet closed off with a separate door. Nice as a couple of us could use the sinks while one of us showered in privacy.  Water pressure was good (a make or break it for us!). In the shower with
