We stayed at the GCH from May 20th to May 24th and it was expensive,but it was very worth it...staff was helpful and friendly(as usual)it was clean and very busy,whats wonderful is you can enter DCA thru the hotel special entry which steps and time...(note the parks were very busy..think I heard someone say the grad nights are moving to days with many grad days during May and June)I highly recommend the GCH,its very close to downtown disney and the Disneyland main gate,has great pools and a wonderful lobby and the atmosphere is wonderful...its pricey but worth it..will never stay anywhere else on our return trips.

Revisiting Disneyland as an adult after 14 years and GC certainly did not disappoint. Greeted by an impressive and expansive lobby, check in was effortless. Booked into a twin room, room decor is a bit tired but it was very clean and pleasant nonetheless. Location is absolutely the best. Nestled within the vicinity of Disneyland, Cali Adventure and Downtown Disney. Enjoyed the walk from the hotel through Downtown Disney and to the parks everyday. The hotel is a welcome sanctuary after an adventurous day of sightseeing and theme-parking. Downtown Disney comes to life when the sun goes down, with lots of eateries, shops and a Sephora. Don't forget to go for the Character Breakfast at Storybook Cafe.  Pricey but hey, isn't everything in Disney?

Took the niece for a quick trip and stayed here for the location and convenience to California Adventure and dining option at Downtown DIsney.  Beautiful property and nice pool area but room are getting a little tired (we have stayed here multiple times - first visit when they originally opened).  As other have said, expensive, poor food choices but you are paying for location, location, location. We are heading back in November for fall break - too easy to stay here and the girl loves being able to ride the rapids over and over and then pop into the pool.

We splurged for our annual visit to the Disneyland parks with a two-night get-away at Disney's Grand Californian. Our flight arrived before hotel check-in time, but there was a room available; the check-in host, Richard, was cheerful and pleasant. Our king room on the third floor was very clean and the bed comfortable. We appreciated the large closet, double sink vanity and in-room frig. The tiny balcony had a courtyard view, but the roof overhang for the floor below was so wide that it blocked most of the view. It was a nice start to the morning to open the sliding door and listen to the music playing outside. Our room was conveniently located close to the entrance of DCA. However, it was a long walk to Disneyland through the entrance to Downtown Disney by the Sephora cosmetics

What a great family hotel.  We stayed with our 7 month old son.  It was so convenient to be able to walk into Disneyland without any fuss with organising transportation to & from a hotel.  The hotel was beautiful, grand indeed.  The hotel catered for our baby well.  Outstanding service, great experience.  We relaxed despite the crowds and normal fuss with amusement parks and travelling with an infant.  We loved it! Book it!

We just came back from a 5 night stay at Disney‚Äôs Grand Californian Resort.  The hotel itself was beautiful, very grand.   We had a courtyard view, standard room (two queen beds).  The room was a typical hotel room, nothing spectacular, but clean and comfortable.  I liked the fact the vanity is separate from the shower and toilet.  There were three of us and we found the room to be a good size.  I didn‚Äôt think our room looked worn or dated, as some other guests noticed.  Our room was a ways away from the elevator though so there was a bit of a hike to get there.  We did find stairs at the other end of the hallway, however, that took us almost directly to the entrance to Downtown Disney.  Make sure you explore for other options besides the elevator as it may save you some time.

We were a group of 6 adults staying in a two bedroom villa.  The villa had 3 bathrooms, a fully equiped kitchen, 2 balconies and a fold out couch in the livingroom.  I have slept on many fold out couches over the years and none compared to this one.  It was just like sleeping on a regular good quality mattress.  The villa used every bit of space efficiently and the decore was beautiful.  The pools and out door furnishings were top quality.  The access to the parks was right out a side entrance to the hotel.  The activities at the hotel included a morning walk in California Adventure prior to it's opening which was fabulous!  I highly recommend this hotel to all travellers!

We came on a family vacation for last Christmas with my parents, myself and my husband. The hotel itself is absolutely beautiful. The lobby, the pool area, even the smokers outdoor fireplace (I don‚Äôt smoke but I spent a lot of time out there with my mom, but I think I would have gone even with out her).   The rooms are very standard. My mom was very disappointed with the price of the stay, that the rooms were so.. standard. You have your bed with nice linens, and a basic bathroom. Nothing fancy. You don‚Äôt receive any extra perks for staying on property other than early entry to California Adventure.   Customer service though, nothing standard there. They go out of your way to make sure you have everything you could possibly need and to ensure you have an amazing stay. True

There are some things you just expect from Disney: like magic.  And I guess the Grand Californian is just on the edge of the Magic Kingdom, so it's reasonable to expect that it's not quite as magical as the rest of the Disney resort.  Sure, it's good.  But Grand?  Meh.  If you take Grand to mean 'big' and 'impersonal', then sure, Grand it is.  We stayed, probably as most people do, because of the proximity to the parks: this was worth every cent, and to be up front, I would stay here again just for that reason.  Location, location, location.  But the place is kind of dark and a wee bit morbid.  The theme - well done, as usual - isn't particularly exuberant or celebratory, like you kind of want Disney to be.  It's staid.  Dull, even.  Think Disney-meets-Twin Peaks (though you're

Summary Heading: For the couple or the family
Summary: We have stayed here a few times, and we love it. Even if it is in Disneyland, it is so elegant that you forget that you are at a theme park. The bed is so comfortable, and they  use H20 as toiletries. The restaurant, Napa Rose, is wonderful. Even our 3 year old son loves it there. The hotel also has an entrance that leads you straight into California Adventure so you don't have to go to the front entrance and wait in even longer lines. We will come back here again, when we feel like doing a Disneyland splurge.

Ok - as and hotel the GrandCalifornian lacks in a few points as rooms are very tiny and dated - its huge and a bit impersonal and its expensive but you are there to experience Disneyland and for that you could not ask for a better place to stay at ! You hardly need to walk to get to the park as it has its own exit to California Land and it is next door to main gates of Disneyland. We went when they had a deal that hotel guests could enter Disneyland two hours before it opened to the public and it completely changed our entire experience as we practically had the place to our selfs and NO QUEUS !!!! The hotel also has a lot of activities for the kids and some of the restaurants have some of the Disney caracters coming to visit ... Check in can be a bit annoying as they take ages

This place is so grandiose, it is just amazing!  We were here in December to celebrate the Holidays at Disneyland and decided to splurge and try out The Grand Californian.  We stayed in a room that was able to accomodate 4 adults and a child, the room was very clean and just awesome.  We had a 2 seated baclcony with table and could leave the Arcadia (large) door wide open and enjoy the great weather.  We called the front desk and they even brought up a sleeping bag with a pad in case our child wanted to camp out instead of sleep on the bed and get the whole outdoors feeling.  Our bags were taken from our car and delivered promptly to our room. There was plenty of room for the entire family without being on top of eachother.  The enormous Christmas tree with free picture with

I stayed one night at the Disney Grand Californian as a DVC member and felt welcomed immediately! The 2 bedroom Master Suite was GRAND with a jacuzzi tub and huge shower and the other two full baths were also great! Really spacious! I especially like that it was only a 5 minute walk to Disneyland. I wasnt able to utilize the services of the hotel, but everything was clean and I cant wait to go back again. The pool area also looks wonderful. Oh and the BED...I havent slept that great in a hotel room in a long time!

we had the cahnce to stay in a villa at the Grand Californian. WOW!!!!! Our villa was a two bedroom, master bedroom had a king size bed and ensuite, second bedroom had two queen beds and an ensuite and the kitchen (yes full kitchen) had a bathroom as well. There is a washer and dryer, three TV's and a dishwasher, queen sofa bed and a double wall bed.  There was only three of us but using the villa was a god send, wash your clothes have coffee from a full size coffe pot use the microwave to thaw bacon to cook on the fully supplied kitchen, dishes and pots and pans.  At the end of the day sitting in the jacuzzi tub was the way to end the day after   watching the fireworks from our room.  the only thing that was wrong with the room, we had to leave.  May is great at Disney no line

Summary Heading: Great base for days at Disney
Summary: We switched our reservation to this hotel for easier access to the parks and were glad we did. I was recovering from a foot injury, and this hotel is adjacent to California Adventure and quite close to Disneyland. Our room was on the second floor and was a bit loud from the lobby. My kids were not impressed with the pool area (hot tub wasn't hot). The room was small, but very clean and nicely furnished. We spent very little time there, so that was no problem. Disney had a sale on rooms, so it was definitely worth the cost.

This hotel is in a great location, but at this price point the rooms should be a few steps above what you find in a Hampton Inn.  Check-in was seamless and we were upgraded to a Downtown Disney view room. During the week the loud music stopped at 10PM, so if you (or your kids) go to bed before that time ask for a room on the other side of the hotel.  The rooms are OK, nothing special. Except for a few Disney touches here and there it reminded me of a Hampton Inn room.   The overall hotel was very nice and the special hotel guest entrance to California Adventure was great. Soaring Over California opens a half hour early for hotel guests, but you will find a line to go into the park before 9AM at the entrance.  Only one breakfast option at the hotel - Storytellers Cafe - which was

I stayed at the Grand Californian Hotel for a week on business. The staff was professional, courteous and friendly. The Craftsman decor was a delightful change from typical hotel interiors. Attention to detail was evident from the greeting at registration down to the craftsman chairs for children in the  the TV corner of the lobby. Catered food for our functions was excellent - all fresh and vegetables steamed to perfection. The Cherry cheese tarts served as appetizers at our reception were delicious. You could not eat just one. My room was a double with two queen size beds located in the newer wing of the hotel complete with a balcony.  Wi-Fi worked great. The only down side was the minimal number of TV channels and I do understand that most people come to a Disney property to

We stayed at the Disney's Grand Californian for five night sstarting May 3rd. This was our third visit to the hotel in three years and to be blunt we were less than impressed on our previous visit. We decided to give the hotel another shot, primarily due to it's convenient location and are we happy that we did!  The hotel itself is beautiful. We arrived around 3 pm and check in was a breeze. Our room was ready when we got there, but in the days that followed we did notice a lot new guests waiting in the lobby after 3 pm (as we have on our previous visits). The rooms themselves are basic, but very comfortable. House keeping missed our room for the turndown service 3 out of the 5 nights. Fortunately/unfortunately they turned down our room on the first night and left a helping of

My wife and I spent our anniversary here on the 7th of may 2012. When checking in....after 30 plus minutes in line waiting, we were told the system was down, and that only cash and credit were going to be accepted.....this seemed OK at the time. We were given a temporary room key and told to check in to registration every "once and a while" to see if the system was up so we could get our real room keys (which we never received) even after checking back in 4 times throughout the night because my wife wanted the souvenir room key. When we got to our room there was loud construction going on, we asked the front desk what was going on and were told it was unexpected construction. When we asked to change rooms we were told we cannot and the construction will end this evening around

Stayed in two bedroom suite in October of 2011 and loved every moment in this gorgeous hotel. We've walked through the lobby of the Grand Californian on our way to Disneyland from an off site hotel many times over the years and have always wanted to stay here. So last fall we finally got the time and money saved up and splurged on a lovely stay.  Our room faced Downtown Disney so we saw the fireworks from the balcony (we had a corner suite so it wrapped around and we had views of Downtown Disney, the front of Disneyland and then parts of California Adventure.)  The room was huge. Not just the one bedroom suite but the other room that added to it. We hung out as a family and watched moves or had meals in the evenings. This was absolutely possible because the Grand Californian is

Summary Heading: Perfect placeto enjoy a vacation at Disney.
Summary: We spent a weekend and really enjoyed this hotel especially due to the proximity to both parks. The pools - especially the kids water slides were lots of fun. We even went into California adventure park to ride grizzly rapids after being at the pool so we didn't mind getting wet. It's so close we could just run back to our room afterward and change. There were a few missteps for a Disney hotel which usually has the best service. For example the bell service was very slow but they were also pretty rude about it. The chip and dale character breakfast was disappointing for the kids. Again lax service but then  also no other characters. I'd suggest the Minnie and Friends breakfast in Disneyland park instead. Other than that we are definitely looking forward to coming again!

From the moment you enter the main atrium, the hotel dazzles. Fantastic architecture. Rooms are well appointed and clean. Hallways are narrow and cluttered with baskets containing towels. They should get rid of baskets of towels. Hotel layout has very long halls where you will be hiking to your room.  Since it is Disney, there are lots of kids. So understand that.  Hotel is short walk to Disneyland. Definitely worth staying at for that alone. Napa Rose food was excellent though pricey. There are rooms that face towards Disney and if you are on upper floor you might see night shows in park.

We had a relatively short trip to LA with our 10 year old and felt that in staying at the Grand Californian, we could really make the use of our time. The hotel itself is very nice, the beds extremely comfortable (better than home!) and the choice of restaurants good. We had one "critter " themed breakfast which, although expensive, was great fun. Dinner at Napa Rose was excellent but very bustly and busy . You could also get cheap eats on site. Our room overlooked Downtown Disney and it was very entertaining watching the hoardes arrive each morning for a day in Disneyland. But THE best thing about this hotel is its proximity to Disneyland and Disney's Californian Adventure. You can pop back to the hotel for a rest and even a swim in the pool (which had the most comfortable sun

The hotel is very impressive in the lobby, pools, restaurants, etc. The weak aspects are the rooms, which reminds me of the old Las Vegas hotels where the management wanted you to spend time outside the room. The rooms are small, and we don't even have a family with kids. Fortunately, Disney did design the bathroom separated the toilet and shower/tub area from the sink area, but the toilet and shower/tub area really can hold only one person at a time. Unlike another reviewer, though, I've never had thin towels in the bathroom in any of the 4 stays I've had at the hotel.  Be careful of rooms that face the lobby, as well as those that face onto Downtown Disney. While the windows do cut down on the noise, there is still more than what you'd get from the interior courtyard or

Summary Heading: Nice....but FAR from a four star hotel
Summary: This hotel tries to bill itself as a four star hotel, but anyone who knows anything about hotels knows nothing about this place is four star except its location, the lobby and the people working there.  Once you get into the rooms you see they are no better than you would find at the Best Western located across the street from the park.    There are some very nice things about this place, the lobby is amazing and the people at the front desk checking us in were VERY friendly, albeit a little slow (couldn't imagine checking-in during a busy time of the year) and every other employee working here was friendly and helpful and of course the location of the property cannot be beat being so close to both parks and Downtown Disney (although get there early for dinner as most

Summary Heading: Couldnt have been a better experience!
Summary: Although we only stayed for 4 days, its a vacation we'll never forget.  Im a DVC member and my sister and i stayed in a studio.  The guy who checked us in was so great, i had mentioned to the reservationist when i booked our stay that we'd be there celebrating my sister's birthday and man! did they make it special.  Upon checkin they gave her, balloons, 2 pins (1 first timer and 1 Birthday pin) and an autographed 8X10 of Mickey! what a way to start a vacation! unfortunately our room wasnt ready but he took my cell number and texted me as soon as it was, he had given us our room keys already so all we would have to do is go to it.  The room ended up being ready in less then an hour.  It was so spacious, nice closet with LOTS of hangers, we had a great kitchenette, stocked with

This is a beautiful location and the location can't be better for those visiting Disneyland and California Adventure.  The accommodations are beautiful, spacious, and inviting.   Pools: There are many pools and hot-tubs plus a slide (and little slide) for the kids. The pools are not heated (as far as I can tell).  There are enough seats and the private villas are great.   Location: There is an entrance to Downtown Disney and California Adventure.  It takes 6 minutes to get to Disneyland.  The entry to California Adventure is right in the middle which is great.  Adults: The bars are close to the pool and the lobby. There is a movie playing constantly for kids which means you can hang out in the lobby and have a drink if you want. It also means that when you are seriously done at

We stayed recently for spring break at the GCR at Disney.  its pricey compared to staying off property but we think it is worth every penny. Our kids are little still (6 and 7) and cant walk that far and love the break time for the afternoon swim.  There was hardly a crowd when we went in mid/late april.  We stayed on the consierge/ club level this time and it was well worth the splurge.  they have extensive snack / breakfast food out at all times during the day, juice boxes, snacks to take in to the park, and viewing for the fireworks from the club room.  We had a great view towards the pool on the 6th floor but could see world of color (sort of) and the pier area of the park.  SO COOL.  We had a bunk bed and girls loved it.  The staff at the club room / level were wonderful,

The worst part of California is the dirty, city look... This hotel makes you feel like you're tucked up in the woods completely away from all the dirty stinky city. Seriously I could never have anything bad to say about this hotel. The quiet lodge with the massive fireplace is the perfect place to wind down after a crazy disney day, I could sit in those rocking chairs in front of the fire for hours! I've been in a lot of 5 star, $500 a night hotels and this one is absolutely unmatched.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a disneyland stay
Summary: We usually stay at the grand californian when we go to Disneyland in LA> It has an own access without waiting too long and you can actually see the nightly fireworks from your room in summer, which is very nice. The rooms are not really exceptional, quite on the small side and very tiny bath, however comfy and good beds and very good service. we upgraded to the lounge and the free food throughout the day and the special service is worth the extra money. The buffets were sometimes very crowded. The swimming pool area was very nice with excellent lounge chairs, very very clean and very supportive staff. HIghly to recommend for children as well and it was very nice to have a swimming catch up during lunch and then head out to the parks again later.  All the hotels are really close
room is always perfect. feels like home. view rooms are perfect. shampoo is sweet. i even catch myself taking the bar of soap home . kids love the pools

This hotel is wonderfully convenient to the California Adventure Park (it is great to be able to pop in to change if you get wet in the park, or to take a break for a swim during the day).  It is also comfortable and the service, as with everywhere in Disney, is excellent.  But you do pay for what you get, and it is quite steep.    I have only given four out of five because for me, the two most important aspects of a hotel like this (ie attached to an adventure park), is the quality of rest, and how well you can clean yourself after a long day in the park.  I have no quibble with the bed, I had a great rest, and the children slept well too.  However, the water pressure is so pathetic that I found the getting clean part difficult, and the whole shower/bath experience far from

Summary Heading: Feels like you're staying right in the park
Summary: Location! Location! Location! This is the main reason we keep going back and paying at least twice as much as comp. hotels around. The minute you drive through the gates, you're in a new world, a Disney world where you can let go and fully enjoy the experience.  The decor is rustic, feels like a National Park Lodge and it's great, they carry he theme in the rooms and public spaces. Various activities available , my kids loved story time help twice a day in the lobby, while we enjoyed a drink and the resident pianist a few feet away. Love the private entrance, the convenience of having a room right next to the river rapids, as it is colder in CA than FL, and you will get wet! The rooms are adequate, service is up to par. I tried the buffet once and really did not like it, but we

Disney's Grand Californian Hotel has always been one of my dream places to stay.  I finally got the opportunity to stay here for a few nights in December 2011.  The cost is outrageous, let's get that out of the way right now.  It's VERY pricey to stay in even the most basic room at this hotel (particularly during the last week of December when we were there).  However, there is really no substitute for the amazing level of theming and the incredibly convenient location.  I am a Walt Disney World veteran so to have the ability to walk back to your hotel room from a theme park in a matter of minutes is a dream come true.  Especially when compared to what can be a major hassle in WDW if you're relying on Disney transportation.    We arrived hours before check in time but the cast
Lovely hotel!  No complaints except I wished it included breakfast.

Summary Heading: Great Service - Great Location - OK rooms
Summary: First, the positive, I cannot say enough great things about the service here.  We stayed in the concierge rooms, and the service from the concierge staff, housekeeping and hotel staff in general was consistently excellent.  Also, you cannot beat the location of the hotel - right next to California Adventure Park - easy access to Downtown Disney - right in the center of the action.  The ambiance of the hotel was also really great, lovely atrium, nice public spaces.  And the pools are really nice - and the pool furniture is very comfy.  The negative - the room - in need of new furniture and upgrades all around.  Deck furniture is not comfortable and carpeting and tables could stand a refresh.  The bathroom is small and plain.  Given the price for this hotel (especially the

Summary Heading: The best Disney has to offer!
Summary: We recently stayed two nights in a two-bedroom DVC property at Disney's Grand Californian.  First of all, not long enough to enjoy all of the amenities!  It is one of the most beautiful of all of the Disney resorts.  The rooms are very large, and two key room features are the extra bathroom in the living room (for a total of 3!) and the pull-down murphy bed, also in the living room.  5 of us stayed here and there was plenty of space.  We had a beautiful view of the pool, but be forewarned that the "Disney music" starts playing poolside at least a half-hour before park opening (that was 6:30am for us).

Summary Heading: Sitting back at home with my memories!
Summary: I am sitting back at home with my memories of this fabulous hotel.  Sitting in the awe inspiring lobby, listening to the piano being played and soaking up the atmosphere, thinking about the wonderful day we had just had at Disneyland, is one of my favourite memories.  One tip: there is a great little cafe for take away food which is sort of around the corner... have meals from here rather than sit in the (pricy) restaurants if you have small children. If you are Australian and used to the sort of food we have here you will be disappointed with the restaurants.  But otherwise, FANTASTIC. Great to find a hotel that caters for families of 5!

Summary Heading: Convenient, comfortable, beautiful, great location, expensive.
Summary: Arrival was a breeze.  Opted for the self parking instead of valet as I knew the car wouldn't move while we were there.  The self parking is close and you can walk in/out from downtown disney too (behind movie theater).  They prefer to deliver your bags and pick them up when you leave (tip$).  This is not like staying at an 'on property' resort in Orlando...this is really walk out of the hotel and you are in Downtown Disney or California Adventure and couple minutes from disneyland gate.  so close we went to the room to put swimsuits on for Grizzly run, then walked back to change after getting wet.  Like all things Disney, expensive and you are hardly there to enjoy the expense of the hotel.  Storytellers Cafe was great for breakfast, but expensive of course.  Ate at 3
obviously a great location if visit the park, the facilities are good, but everything is old, the rooms, the bathrooms, the beds everything needs a refit, to justify the $500 a night.

We had a room looking over Californian Adventure. When the sliding doors were closed you could not hear the park at all. Pool and hot tub were awesome. Bed was extremely comfortable. Everything was clean, new and tidy. The only issue with this resort is the price. If you can get over the price tag, you will just love this place. It has its own entrance to the park and they let you in early to Californian Adventure! This hotel is right next to Downtown Disney, which was very convenient.

Summary Heading: Beautiful "California Craftsman" style hotel located in Disneyland's California Adventure
Summary: The hotel is enormous, but has a very intimate and welcoming atmosphere due to the attention to design and detail to replicate the unique Craftsman style. The staff is helpful and efficient in making your check-in and out painless.     Staying on the grounds made it so much easier and had the benefit of early entrance before the gates open to the general public. Be sure and check the date, location and times that apply, because it is not available daily. For our children, who had very specific rides they didn't want to miss; they were able to avoid the long lines of the popular rides during the early entry.     The Character breakfast was a nice surprise in the restaurant. It was a great fun for the children who loved having the Disney characters visit our table. The brunch is

What can I say about this place? Everyone has said pretty much all what I had to say.  The best part of this place was that we could enjoy the park in the morning and head back to the hotel for a midday nap and then go right back to the parks for more fun!  You can't beat the convenience and location of this hotel  I loved the decor, food at Napa Rose!! and the hospitality of the hotel crew.  If I ever go back to Disneyland, I would want to be in this hotel and no other!!  Hands down, the best place to have Disney dreams come true!!

Summary Heading: Not up to Disneyworld standards but okay for California
Summary: Right up front the front desk tried to put us in a lesser room than we had paid for.  When I pointed out the "error" it was quickly remedied.  The desk clerk was polite and friendly at all times as was everyone else at the hotel.  The character breakfast was exceptional.  In short this hotel was much closer to the old "Disney" experience.  A huge departure from the rudeness and disorganization which is rampant throughout the Disneyland and California theme parks.  Even if you live in L.A. do yourself a favor and hop a plane to Orlando.

We've stayed at this resort a few times.  When we are in the mood to drive down to Disney and stay, this is the only hotel we'll use.  The service from Valet to Housekeeping and all inbetween is impeccable.  This time we had a view of the pools with California Adventure in the background.  We could see the riders in the Tower of Terror when the doors opened during the ride.    Our room was a 2 bed queen with a small balcony. The room was clean and ready when we arrive, right at 3pm.  The amenities that Disney provides in this resort of some of the best I've ever used.  In fact the day we got home, my husband found the company on-line and placed an order for their products.  We spent time in the lobby area, where we sipped our drinks and listened to the Piano player. The lobby

Summary Heading: Expensive and in need of refurbishment, this hotel does not compare well with competition.
Summary: Whilst the service overall was good, the hotel itself is in much need of a revamp. The cost is based on 5 star accommodation, but the shabby room with its tired decor and well worn bathroom fittings would struggle to pass as a 3 star. Having thoroughly enjoyed Disney in Paris and Hong Kong, we had high expectations for the all-original mother of them all, but it was a real let down. It didn't help that we had just come from a stunning stay at the World-class Mandarin Oriental Hotel in Las Vegas, with it's impeccable decor, high tech fittings and unrivalled service. Having travelled from Australia, this was to be the highlight of our holiday, and in fact the hotel was a low point. If we ever come back, we will stay in one of the more modern hotels surrounding the parks.

This was our first trip to DL (3 adults and a 6 year old).  We chose to stay at the GCH Concierge and loved it, in fact not sure we could stay any other way now as we felt like we were part of the magic and treated like royalty.    The hotel is well maintained, the staff are fantastic and the location is great.  Only one complaint and that is our room was 65?? and it was a LONG walk one you were out of the elevator.   Our room was a double queen with a courtyard view.  We found it to be very spacious, no complaints about noise at all.    We had purchased a "Grand Mickeys Welcome" so even though we checked into the hotel at 10:30am our room wasn't ready until 4pm.  (they tell you this may happen as they have to set the room up after it's been cleaned).    The pools were adequate,

Disney's Grand Californian is a stunning showpiece in the Arts & Crafts / Craftsman style, and is similar to some of the grand old National Parks lodges. It's situated right in the middle of the Disneyland Resort, with convenient access to Downtown Disney (the Monorail to Disneyland is a short stroll away), and a special entrance gate to California Adventure.  There are two restaurants in the hotel - the Storyteller's Cafe, great for the family; and the Napa Rose, very high-end and amazing.  I've stayed here 4 times so far, and I still love it. It's far nicer than the Disneyworld equivalent, the Grand Floridian.

We always stay at Disney resorts when going to any of the parks.  So far this is the only  hotel/park where I don't know that it's necessary to do so.  Since the parks are right across from each other there is no need for transportation between them and the hotel.  This was our first trip to DL & DCA, so we weren't sure what to expect.   That being said it is a beautiful and relaxing place to stay.  Our girls loved the swimming pools, even though it was cool out when we were there.  We all enjoyed the outdoor fireplace, although we didn't spend a lot of time resting there.  The gardens were wonderful - lots of bright & cheerful colors.  The architecture is also very well done, as expected when staying on Disney property.    The girls also loved that we got chocolate each night

Summary Heading: Villa's at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel
Summary: So happy that we bought into the Magic and have this as our home resort. The property is well maintained as expected since it is a Disney property. We stay here at least twice a year and we have never been disappointed.

This property is truly wonderful from concept to up-keep. Beautiful, well kept, friendly staff and access to everything needed. The proximity to the park makes it easy to come and go several times a day. Not just for kids!  A great couples retreat, complete with spa and great restaurants. It is very overpriced, however. If money is no object, that won't bother you, but it bothered me. The quality is Disney's "best of the best," but the price kind of ruins that experience.  In other words, it's too much even given all of it's charms and benefits. If you can afford it, staying a night or two for a special child's birthday (I would make sure they were at least 7-10) or as a couple's Disney vacation, will be something you will really enjoy. But, if you don't want to feel awful about

I can't stay anywhere else when I visit DL & DCA. I compare all other DL hotels around the area, and even the legendary Disneyland Hotel up the block. Nope, not gonna do it. Gotta break the bank because this hotel has spoiled me and therefore ruined any chance any other hotel has to gain my business. It Stinks that the cost keeps going up though. I love this place. I love the location, the amenities, the park entrance, the pool and the little secrets I know about. I could complain about little annoyances here and there, but who cares? ST cafe is a bit pricey but it's a great character bkfst. Oh- ahhh, Napa Rose ~ You have GOT to eat there. Marvelous! I wish I could bring all of my family here from all over the US to experience this hotel together.

Summary Heading: The Perfect Place to Stay at Disneyland
Summary: The proximity to the parks makes it easy to come and go into the parks several times a day. The rooms are lovely, all of the the staff are extremely friendly and helpful in every way and the variety of restaurants in the hotel is great. Don't miss "White Water Snacks" for a tasty, quick and reasonably priced meal.  The proximity to Downtown Disney is great also.

Summary Heading: Amazing Disney Hotel with a park entrance for guests.
Summary: This was my first time staying in this resort and was very impressed.  The service was excellent, but then again what would you expect from Disney.  It has several restaurants to choose from and a wonderful spa.  You have an entrance that brings you right into Downtown Disney or they have a special guest only entrance to California Adventure Park.   It is a little pricey, but I think it is well worth the amenities.

Yes, this is an expensive hotel but for us, it was worth every penny.  We splurged for a concierge level room and what a difference.  Quiet floor (6th), private check-in, friendly staff, comfortable room (albiet small), and the craftsman lounge's food (continental breakfast, afternoon tean, and evening desserts was good).    Looking forward to our next stay!

Summary Heading: The Perfect Place to Stay at Disneyland
Summary: We recently took our 3-year-old to Disneyland + California Adventure and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Grand Californian. With the little ones who nap during afternoons, being so close to the Parks makes this location ideal. My wife did not enjoy the parks so much so the resort hotel with spa worked out well. The service was top-notch and we were exceedingly well cared for. To save money on food, call out for Pizza-local places will deliver right into the lobby! If your on the fence about spending the money for the GC, go for it, you will not regret it! Can't wait to stay there again soon.

Summary Heading: Concierge Not as great as before.....
Summary: First kudos to the Valet that helped us figure out why our battery had drained down while at the Paradise Pier Hotel (next time remember to unplug our little refrigerator). We checked in and the first day on the Concierge level was nice. We had a nice room with a king bed and bunkbeds for the kids. Also we had a nice balcony with a view of the courtyard. Brent was a great concierge and Tatum in the Club was soo helpful. Sam and Jarod have a lot to learn about being concierges. Sam especially was not friendly nor did she ever acknowledge us. We have stayed here before and I do not think that we were given as great of service as we have had in the past and for the money you pay to stay here it was disappointing!!! I got better concierge service at the Paradise Pier for less money.

We have been visiting Disney's Florida Hotels for years if not decades... and we found the Disney Grand Californian to be just as deligtful.  One of the best features is the entrance directly into the the California Adventures park.  The Spa, restaraunts and pools are all amazing as well!  A really great hotel if you can afford it!

We‚Äôve stayed at this hotel many times over the last 10 year so.  If I could afford it, I stay every time I went to the park. Even off-season, it does cost about three times what the non-Disney hotels do across the street.  We go to Disneyland a few times a year, and staying here each time is out of my budget.  I‚Äôve always liked the ‚ÄúArts and Crafts‚Äù look so I consider this hotel to be very attractive inside and out.  The lobby is amazing.  The rooms are not as spacious as one might expect for these prices, but they are acceptable.  The rooms are well appointed, beds comfortable, and cleanly. This is the only Disney hotel at the park that has a functional balcony that you can actually sit on.  Being in a hotel that is attached to Californian Adventure park is a real plus.  If you

I am a picky guy but this is the best run hotel I have stayed at in a long time.  We are Disney Vacation Club members and had a two bedroom villa.  From the memory foam on the pull out sofa bed, to the quick lighting compact fluorescent bulbs to the piano player in the lobby, what a place to stay.  Quiet, secure extraordinarily clean, everywhere.

We are Disney Vacation Club owners, but had never stayed here. We were in a one-bedroom villa. I was very impressed by the entire stay. We asked for a high floor and were given a top floor villa, with a perfect view of the California Adventure water show. The villas are exquisite, with beautiful craftsman styling, full kitchen, 2 full baths, flat screen TVs and DVRs. The balcony, while not large, is large enough and is completely covered (it rained most of the afternoon and night). The water show was still held and from our vantage was pretty cool. All in all, a great experience.

Summary Heading: 25th Anniversary Stay At Grand Californian Hotel
Summary: Our 25th Anniversary stay at Grand Californian Hotel at California Adventures Park and Disneyland in Anaheim, California was excellent. Wil be back for our 26th anniversary December 20th, 2012 you can count on it. Save us some Monte Christos at the Blue Bayou Room Restaraunt in the French Quarter next to Pirates of the Carribean ride. Bye for now. Always and forever,  Bob and Nancy Lavelle

Disney's Grand Californian is a nice hotel with great charm. Standard rooms with bunk beds are a decent size and ideal for families with young children. Character breakfasts/dinner at the different Disney hotels is a must for those who have kids who enjoy meeting some of the Disney characters and do not want to wait in the long lines at the parks. Also, one of the best benefits of this hotel is that Downtown Disney and Disneyland Park are a short walk away and California Adventure Park has a private entrance right from the hotel. The only down side of staying at this nice and very conveniently located hotel is that even standard rooms are pricey, but when in Disney nothing is inexpensive. Overall, great hotel, with a perfect location especially if you will not have a vechile

Summary Heading: Nice, but expected a little more for the money...
Summary: Stayed here while my husband was doing business, being that it was my daughter's first disneyland trip and it was so close to disneyland and a lot of hotels were booked we decided to stay here. We had another part of our company with us, so we got the suites where it's two rooms shared by a common living room. The space was nice and there were a lot people coming in and out of the room based on the convention so we liked being able to shut off the bedrooms, but coming from staying at the Del Coronado with five star service and knowing disney can give that type of service, we were left a little disappointed. So many things are for "an additional fee" and it seemed as if those things are part of four star hotel services. The pools are beautiful and the Napa Rose restaurant is to

Summary Heading: Grand Californian a Great Disneyland hotel.
Summary: The Grand Californian is a great hotel with a superb location. It is walking distance to everything Disney. Downtown Disney, Magic Kingdom, and Disneyland. It is a little pricey for what you get room-wise but the amenities and location make up for it!

Of course when you stay on property at Disney you pay for it.  But the Grand Californian is definately worth the price.    Customer service is is excellent and the convenience of your own park enterance, the ability to easily return to the room for naps, and the ability to purchase the Disney meal plan is worth the extra expense.  One of my favorite features of staying at the Grand California is the abilty to send things back to your room.  Should you purchase anything in the park, the store will package it up and send it back to your room.  It is so nice to not have to lug around that new sweatshirt or have the new disney hat get squished at the bottom of your bag.  They will even send back purchases from the candy store or any store... so very convenient.  Also- I have

I'm a huge Disney fan and for Christmas, my daughter wanted to go to Disneyland.  Since we normally stay at the Disney Hotel, I thought we would try something different, the Grand Californian.  As they typically say, "if it ain't broke, don't fix it."  I should have stuck to that.  When we arrived, we were directed to a particular spot to unload and wait for valet.  After sitting there for a while and not being helped, while others were being helped around us, I decided to ask someone what the protocol is.  One person told me that it was not their duty and they were a concierge, the next person said they would get to us and just wait, and the third person, well, he said the same thing, to just wait.  By that time, after a long 6 hour drive, I've had it and was frustrated, but we

My family spent the whole week at Grand Californian in  Apr. After traveling +15 hours from Europe we had high expectations. I considered the pricing of accommodation heavy compared to other Disney resorts visited. Well, how did it go? The 1st sight was a cosy lobby with  friendly staff warmly welcoming us to Disneyland. The room  was practical, big enough for adults and 2 kids. we found the small terrace wonderful, perfect for chilling. My boy loved the big pool area, there was something for everyone. White Water Snacks was propably the best kept secret, easy-to-pick-up food & cold beverages - handy & practical. Character dining in the morning was propably the highlight of the visit, meeting Chip n' Dale will never be forgotten. We also highly appreciated the location of

Summary Heading: Fantastic Location - Otherwise Average to Slightly Above
Summary: To be fair - you cannot beat the location of this hotel.  Literally out one door to the hotel is the California Adventures Theme Park.  Out another door is Downtown Disney, which has a monorail on one end that takes you to Disneyland and walking the other direction is the main entrances to the theme parks.  The facility has been updated in the "Greene & Greene" funituremakers theme.  I'm not sure of the connection to these folks - I might have picked another style as the facility, while clean, is awfully dark.  Aside from that, I found most things to be average or slightly above.  We stayed on the Concierge-Level, just as we do at all the properties in Florida.  I'd rank this experience as lower than any of the similar experiences in FL.  The hotel has an odd configuration,

I stayed here two years ago in August and was totally unimpressed by this hotel. I found it overpriced, corporate, and too crowded. Two weeks ago we revisited the hotel (not my idea!) and I found a new degree of appreciation for the property. We were upgraded to a room with a lovely park view (we could stand on our balcony and see people walking through the park, hear the music, and experience a bit of that Disney magic from the comfort of our room). Our room also had bunk beds, which were great for our two children. The hotel and park are so much quieter on a Monday in March than they are in August that our overall experience was worlds better. My husband and son went into the park the evening we arrived, while my daughter and I walked around Downtown Disney, hung out in the

We're were pleased with our two-night stay at the Grand Californian.  The positives‚Ä¶  Location.  Location.  Location.  It's the closest to the parks, and we enjoyed the private entrance into the California Adventure Park.  The regular entrance into the Magic Kingdom is a short walk away, or you can move from the Adventure Park after using the private entrance.  Every staff member (cast member) was fabulous.  Check-in was efficient, and we secured a room prior to the normal check-in time.  Classy lobby with piano music at times.  The large pool was a great relief from the hectic park in the middle of the day.  They have water vests in various sizes for the young ones.  It was a resort, but did not charge a "resort fee".  Terrific!  Internet access was free and worked well.

My two 7 year old daughters and I took a girls trip in January and stayed here.  Upon arrival the front desk wasn't sure how to proceed with my Alaska Airlines Disney Package. After much conversation with another staff member they found our park tickets. We weren't offered any help with our bags to our room, which was quite a long distance away. The room itself was very comfortable although a loooong way from the elevator! Since it was late and my kids were hungry and ready for bed, I ordered pizza from a local restaurant. The Bell desk called me when it arrived, I went down to get it and by the time I got there. the driver had left with our pizza. The woman at the Bell desk told me she called me 4 times. I was on my way from our room and my kids dod not answer the phone. She

We've visited Disneyland many times over the years but this is the first time we've stayed at the Grand Californian. When you're tired after a long day at the park it's so nice to have such a short walk back to your hotel.  Not only did we like the conveniece of being so close to the park, but the room was spacious and comfortable as well.  We've stayed at the other two Disney properties over the years and this one is definitely worth the extra money you pay for convenience.

A beautiful hotel with stunning scenery. The room size is average, the amenities great, and the staff attentive. We loved it, "BUT", I have stayed at some of the worlds premier properties. The Royal Hawaiian, Fairmont's all over the world, and have never paid the prices they charge here. Really? $20 for a drink at the bar? Affording it is one thing. Paying prices that exceed the absurd is another.

Look no further!  Location is perfect!  Walking distance to both parks.  Downtown Disney right there with shopping and eatiers.  Worth the extra money to stay on property when traveling with kids.  You wear yourselves out walking the theme parks during the day - it's a treat to have a short walk back to your room instead of fighting for a shuttle, etc.  We were even able to walk back to our room during the day to take a break then return to the park later. Clean room and extremely comfy beds!  If you are considering splurging on the Concierge Level Room - do it!  Worth every penny!  My husband is military so we aren't rolling in dough but we are SO glad we paid the extra $100 a night for the concierge service. Personal check in, access to Craftman Club Lounge where you can get

Summary Heading: Annual family reunion here for ten years
Summary: My family has been meeting up at this hotel every February for the past ten years.  The hotel itself is a work of art.  Arts and craft inspired, industrially built, but well disguised.  The lobby is not just a place to meet up, it is a destination in and of itself.  Be sure to take a look at the collectibles in the glass cases, have a drink, and enjoy the pianist who plays nightly.  The rooms are fantastic.  The bed is better than the one I have at home.  The furniture is a definite step up from the usual hotel furnishings.  And of course, all in the craftsman style.  It is a pricey hotel, but it it worth it.  The pool, to be frank, is lame.  I think they forgot that kids would be coming to the pool.  Its just not "fun".   If you are planning on entertaining kids with a pool,

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel but review based on exorbitant price as well.
Summary: I stayed here for three days in March.  The reason I stayed here was because a friend is a cast member and we got a *very* good deal.    I had always wanted to stay here and I'm glad I got the chance.  The rooms were nice, the main lobby was really quite warm and inviting and the location couldn't be beat. I really loved how you could walk out a set of doors directly into downtown Disney for a very quick walk to the Disneyland entrance.  Another set of doors puts you right into California Adventure which works for later in the day (California Adventure opens a few hours later than Disneyland so the entrance doesn't work early in the morning for the parks).  For the price we paid, I felt it was really quite nice.  HOWEVER. I would never EVER stay there for the posted nightly

Summary Heading: Conveneince Worth Every Dollar with a Toddler
Summary: We just got back from 3 nights at the Grand Californian with our three year old. As the reviewers have noted, we paid over $300 a night for a basic, two queen bed room. Check in was easy and the front desk was well staffed at check-in time, the best I have ever seen at a hotel which made our check in super quick. The rooms are immaculate and even the most basic rooms come with a mini refrigerator, making it great for storing drinks and snacks (tip: the Vons grocery chain delivers to the hotel and the hotel will accept deliveries on your behalf so you don't need to be there when you groceries arrive). The convenience of the hotel cannot be beat especially with young kids, as we could walk back to the hotel for a mid day nap and head back to the park. That made it worth every

Summary Heading: Quality upscale resort in Disneyland's backyard
Summary: We stay here about 4-5 times a year.  This is the closest you can stay to the Disneyland parks yet it feels like an upscale 5 star resort.  Everything is immaculate, the staff is very friendly and helpful.  Regardless of the type of room you book, they are all fresh and upscale.

Summary Heading: Disney Grand Californian not worth the stay
Summary: We booked a room at the Disney Grand Californian Hotel for two nights for 4 people, myself, my husband, our daughter and our grandson.  The hotel looks nice enough, and we were glad to be walking distance to the entrance of Disneyland.  On the plus side, the staff is pleasant and helpful, as Disney employees are trained to be.  That's where the plus side ended.  At over $400 per night for the spring special,  we expected better service than we received.  When we entered our room, my first thought was how small it was for the price.  There was a tiny table with two chairs, and two beds.  For the four of us, two had to sit on the bed while two sat at the table.  The bathroom was seriously the size of a handicapped bathroom, but with a tub/shower in addition to the toilet.  Very

Summary Heading: Great Location, Great Service = Great Time
Summary: Family is fresh back from 4 days in a concierge level room at the Grand Californian.  The hotel is centrally located which is totally worth it unless you enjoy fighting crowds and grumpy kids!  The concierge level was excellent - really a savior when your kids are really hungry after tromping around Disneyland/California Adventure and you want a quick decent snack.  They never had full meals in the club room but lots of fruit, PB sandwiches & muffins as well as espresso & coffee etc.  Breakfast was the most fulsome with cereals, bagels, meat/cheese plate and fruit etc.  Overall very good value in my opinion.  We also had a greeter and separate check in as concierge level guests so less waiting around.  The service from all staff in the hotel was top notch and really adds to the

Our family just spent 4 great nights at this hotel/resort.  The convenience to the parks and the beautiful furnishings made the cost of the rooms worthwhile.  We had early entrance to Disney and after a quick breakfast at the Whitewater Cafe (recommend for just the right foods...breakfast burritos, oatmeal, pancakes, yogurts, juices at reasonable prices) on the grounds of the hotel, we headed in to find short lines and easy access to the rides.    The housekeeping staff was very friendly and efficient...chocolate treats greeted us, nice amenities in the bathrooms, robes in the closet.  Check in and out was smooth and helpful.  Finally, the availability of adjoining rooms with bunk beds (and a pull out bottom trundle) made for perfect sleeping arrangements for parents,

I've been to this hotel twice but not as a hotel guest....just for their amenities.  The food is excellent, service is great and it's a beautiful resort.  I went to the Mandara spa and had a great massage/body polish but I was surprised about the facilities.  They bathroom and steam room in the ladies room could definitely use an upgrade.  The shower was a bit gross - mildew on the walls and there isn't a nice sitting area.  The employees and services are great but I expected more of the facility especially for prices you pay and it's in such a nice resort!!  Won't go back unless there's a special.

While we have visited the park many times, this was out first time staying on property and it was TERRIFIC!  On arrival, the check in went well. They had not placed us in a room with 3 beds but we were early and when we told them we would wait, they made the change and took my cell# to send a text. My husband is handicapped and we were able to have a scooter delivered to the hotel and had an accessible room. We left our luggage and headed off with the scooter to a great lunch at the Storyteller's Cafe'. Then we headed to California Adventure - easily accessible from the hotel's private entrance.  When the text came, we went back to the hotel, picked up the keys and the desk sent our luggage up for us. I can't tell you how easy they made it for us - with a handicapped person! The

We wanted the ultimate Disney experience, and that is why we stayed here.  It is right there in the middle of all of the action, and you have perfect access to everything that you could possibly want.  We stayed for 4 nights and knew that it would be expensive, and left feeling like we got our money's worth.    The Room:  Beautiful paintings on the walls, a comfortable room with a balcony and the most comfortable bed that I have ever slept on.  The Staff:  Not overbearing, extremely polite and attentive, very happy to help with any need that you might have.  I cannot understate how great every staff member was from check-in to gift shop to cleaning staff.    The Hotel Itself: Has great ambiance!  I mean it is so warm and inviting from the moment that you step foot on the

My wife and I stayed for our wedding anniversary.  The hotel staff gave us an upgrade to a suite that was larger than our first apartment we lived in.  We were given priority seating for The World of Color as a guest of the hotel.  They decorated our room with balloons and such for our anniversary as well!! Thanks Disney!!

Summary Heading: ONE OF THE BEST HOTELS EVER!!
Summary: This hotel is one of the best hotels ever. We checked in early and they were not rude at all. Most of the hotels we have stayed at will not even have the room ready even if you check in late. We checked in early morning and they were great. Everything was phenomenal.  Ten Stars.  Great service, great room, great view and we cant stress enough how wonderful everyone is.     Verrrry kid friendly. They left us the best cookies ever with extremely cold milk for the whole family.  Thank you Disney Grand California staff for the best experience we have ever had at Disneyland.   Thank you to Danny who works as a bellman. Management please give him praise.

Summary Heading: Was very impressed with the Grand Californian...
Summary: Thought that while pricey, this was a great choice for us and our stay at Disneyland.  Was very impressed with the services from the valet, bellman, registration, and in general had a very pleasant stay.  The proximity to the theme parks is simply awesome too.    Enjoy!

Summary Heading: This place is awesome, and its the best Disneyland location.
Summary: We have stayed in lots of Disney hotels, but have never experienced anything like this as far as overall value. The hotel is literally in the heart of all the action. There is a private entrance and exit directly into the Disney California Adventure Park, as well as an entrance/exit directly into the center of Downtown Disney. You honestly could not get closer if you tried. Even the Disneyland hotel in Paris which is at the entrance to the park, does not give you the immediate access to the park and downtown disney in one hotel (although its also as close as you can get to the action without being in that park). But lets not talk about Paris.   The Grand California Hotel was beautiful with a log cabin feel. The rooms were nicely appointed although the bed was surprisingly not

Summary Heading: Perfect place for a Disneyland stay!!!!!
Summary: I stayed here with my family and loved every minute of it. The hotel is everything you'd expect from Disney. Clean, quite, fun!!! Stay here, you'll love it.

Summary Heading: Fun Family Trip to Disneyland/California Adventure
Summary: We love staying at the Grand Californian it is so easy to get to both parks and also to Downtown Disney. I would not eat at their restaurant for dinner, better choices at Downtown Disney.

We stayed in the villas at the Grand Californian. We actually had 2 rooms, switching from a studio to a 1 bedroom suite halfway through the week. Both rooms were well appointed and very clean. The 1 bedroom was amazing! We had a full kitchen and invited our local CA friends up for a pizza dinner one night. Proximity to the parks and DTD is perfect. Hotel staff was amazing as well!

Summary Heading: Nice if your a California Adventure girl
Summary: Stayed at Grand Californian for the first time on 2/12, it was nice but not great.  For the price we paid, I would have expected chocolates on the pillows! hahaha  We have always wanted to stay here, we've been annual passholders since 1996 and now we can say "we stayed there".  Overall, I prefered the Disneyland Hotel's convenience that they offer.  We prefer Disneyland and you can't beat walking to the Monorail and entering the park.  Plus, the rooms at the Disneyland hotel were almost the same as Grand Californian.  Also, after paying 300+ for one night's stay they added 22. for parking.  The one plus to staying at the Grand Californian was the entrance to California Adventure, no waiting!!

Stayed Feb 23-29/ 2012,  Room 5224  Ricky rocked it at the front desk when he upgraded us to premium view room when we requested bunk beds and there weren't any available. The rooms were spotless and well appointed, the beds were the most comfortable we've ever slept in at a hotel, amazing pillow top mattresses! We called the service desk twice requesting an extra towel and a corkscrew. Both were delivered in under 5 min.  You can't beat the location, so worth the extra cost. Nothing bad to say at all. Excellent stay.

Summary Heading: The nice and not so nice.
Summary: I've stayed here 3 other times. This trip we booked months ahead with out annual pass. When reserving a room you can only make requests for the type of room. I requested a room with a day bed. They couldn't accomodate that when we arrived. I requested a room near the lobby. They said not available on arrival and wanted to put us in the furthest room in the hotel. When checking in the man was nice but made no eye contact just rattled off his speech while looking the other way.  Room was average,outdated and just ok. Nothing special at all.  The thing that makes this hotel is the location and the lobby. We will only stay here  around the holidays so we can use the lovely fireplace and lobby. For 1400. 00 for only 3 nights I really expect a little better service.

Best location by far of the 3 Disney hotels, with its own entrance to California adventure and just a 5 minute walk to the Disneyland entrance.  We were able to check in at 9am and drop off our bags, which was a nice perk.  We were also given 2 instant fast passes per person to use, which was great.  The room was more than big enough for the 4 of us (2 adults, 2 kids in 2 queen beds) and bathroom plenty big.  Also, it was nice to have the fridge in the room.  Really, though, we just used the room for sleeping and showers.  The Hearthstone bar downstairs was great as well.  We skipped the long lines and hefty prices for breakfast at Storytellers Cafe and just walked down to the little cafe by the pool--much quicker and far more reasonable.

Regular rooms are somewhat spacious, especially if you ask for the bunk-bed configuration. Suites are pricey and hard to reserve but are very well appointment for a larger family or extended stay. I agree with previous contributors that the advantage to this hotel is the location. And of the 3 resort hotels, I bet this one is the nicest! We found limited advantages to the Magic Mornings as there were no rides open, but the proximity to the park shortened our day and gave us afternoons by the pools during peak Disney hours. We also received a few instant Fast Pass tickets which was nice to shorten lines.  I did appreciate that the hotel would take delivery of grocery orders from Vons.com so we could prepare breakfast and healthy day snacks in our room (cereal, milk, yogurt, etc.)

Summary Heading: Average Hotel, Good Park Admission Perks
Summary: If you‚Äôre used to nice resorts, Grand California‚Äôs not going to be the most amazing place you‚Äôve ever stayed, but the perks are worth the extra cost.  The main reason we stayed (and would stay again) at Grand Californian, is the ‚ÄúMagic Mornings‚Äù at Disneyland. The ability to enter the park ahead of the general public is a huge advantage and made our visit much more pleasant. We‚Äôd hit almost every major ride on my husband‚Äôs list of ‚Äúmust-see‚Äôs‚Äù before 9am We made it from the entrance of Space Mountain to the ride itself in 5 minutes.  For the rides we couldn‚Äôt make it to before the lines started, we obtained Fast Passes early. In addition to being able to use the regular Fast Pass system, the hotel gave us 2 special Fast Passes that we could apply any time to any ride that

Was expecting campy, theme park type appeal, but found a woodland retreat that was cozy, warm, classy, mission/Adirondack inspired and SO comfortable. The lobby was big enough to be its own theme park, the desk staff helpful, courteous and enthusiastic, the bedding down-filled and restful, the pools and jacuzzis heavenly and the access to Disney and California theme parks was WONDERFUL. You don't need to be a Disney person to enjoy all that this hotel has to offer.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for,,,
Summary: Yes, as many other viewers noted, this place is expensive - you pay for conveniences and amenities.  To be so close to both parks to grab a sweater, a change of clothes, take a quick break etc. Lobby and overall decor of the place have an outstanding arts & crafts feel. Try and get a room with a bunkbed if you have little ones! We had a queen and a bunkbed with a pull out trundle (rm 3308) with a nice view of the pool and California Adventure.  Staff is very warm and efficient and the grounds, pool etc are immaculate.  To bypass the breakfast rush at Storytellers, grab a bagel, cereal, coffee juice etc at White Water Grill. Excellent lattes, cappucinos in the morning at the lounge. At night, they are well versed in serving Mommy and Daddy juice! A splurge to stay here but worth

We stayed in a 1 bedroom villa, it was spacious and the view was spectacular.  The staff were all very eager to help us with all our needs.  The only issue was waiting for our room on the Sunday we arrived, it is frustrating to have to wait (past the posted check-in time) after flying with 2 small children across the country.

Summary Heading: Don't get the room upgrade. Besides that, great location.
Summary: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary.. Great location. You can walk to the parks and head back to your room in 5 minutes. That alone is worth the price... The staff were great. Very friendly even if it was part of the schtick and they had to be. They did a good job playing that role so good on them as I could never smile that much. Only downsized, don't bother upgrading your room cause you're not there. So close walking distance to the parks there's no need. We got the forest upgrade and it was basically trees in the courtyard. You just sleep here. Overall, I'll come back.

There's nothing I can say in this review that hasn't already been said:  the ability to walk directly into California Adventure (and to be able to easily run back to your room if you need jackets or forgot something), the gorgeous architecture, over and above staff, and true feel of Disney makes this hotel well worth spending the extra money.  During our last stay, we utilized the onsite childcare so that my husband and I could go out for a nice "adult" dinner; when we came back to pick up the kids they didn't want to leave!  The pools are beautifully kept and the water slides are super fun for the kids.  The gym is small, but the equipment is well maintained and current.  Every year we make a trip to Disneyland, and every year we consider paying less at various hotels down the

WE stayed one night for our annual trip to Disneyland from San Diego. We booked the room with a queen bed and bunk beds. My girls loved the room. They were so excited to stay at this hotel. We spent the first day at the pool and the next at Disneyland.  The rooms are small but comfortable. Upon check-in the hotel hits all the bells and whistles for children and young at heart adults. The location is great. We will be staying here form now on!!

Summary Heading: Great location, great staff, great service!!
Summary: We enjoyed the convenient location and friendly knowledgeable staff.  It made our park visits fun since we could come back to our hotel with parcels & to freshen up.

I just love this hotel!  I must caveat though....I grade all Disney experiences on a different scale from my other hotel trips.  Disney is Disney...you can't try and compare staying here to staying at a Four Seasons.  It has it's own criteria measured against other Disney properties.  That said....  The amazing over the top ridiculousness of California crafstman style on steroids always makes me smile when I walk into the lobby.  Every little detail is designed to reinforce the overall effect, and I love it. Even the mini craftsman style rockers for toddlers!  My 11 month old daugher loved it....  Rooms: normal nice hotel room in keeping with the overall theme...we had adjoining rooms so we could watch TV at night without waking up baby, and so grandma could come down for a few

It is hard to beat the location, with a private entrance into Disney's California Adventure (although guests of any of the Disney hotels are able to enter through this private entrance, it is built into the Grand Californian Hotel, so it is closer for guests of the Grand Californian). But aside from the location, the style and quality of the Grand Californian are terrific as well. With just enough of a Disney touch, but not too much, the hotel features very nice arts and crafts style architecture.

We stayed at the Disneyland Californian at the beginning of February. Although we live in LA, we were bringing our 19 month old to Disneyland and Disney's California Adventure on a two-day pass and wanted a place to relax, take naps and regroup while there.  The hotel is beautiful. The lobby, as other reviewers have pointed out, is quite magnificent. There were a lot of nice touches, like the fireplace, piano player in the evenings, the kid-size rocking chairs, etc.  The staff was extremely friendly and welcoming. The person who checked us in helped us get into a room close to the California Adventure entrance and also celebrated our daughter's first visit to the parks by presenting her with balloons and a signed picture of the princesses. She generally seemed excited for us and

We love the Disney Grand Californian Hotel.  It's is great to have quick access to California Adventure and Downtown Disney.  Ask for a room that overlooks Downtown Disney or one that allows you to view the fireworks from your balcony.  Schedule your vacation time when kids are in school to get the best price.

Summary Heading: Excellent stay during a slow time
Summary: I have always wanted to stay at the Grand Californian, but I could never justify the price.  I then discovered that I could get a pretty good mid-week rate from February 14-17.  Our room had two queens and was large enough for two adults and two teenage children.  The beds were very comfortable as were the pillows.  I could not hear any noises from the hallway or lobby which was pretty amazing considering the hotel is filled with many children of all ages.  I liked the double sinks being outside of the toilet/tub/shower area.  There was a lot of storage room in the vanity and in the room itself.  The hotel location is very convenient to both parks and Downtown Disney.  I found the Hearthstone Lounge right off the lobby to be a great place to get good espresso drinks or

Summary Heading: Convenience at a very expensive price.
Summary: I always wanted to stay at The Grand Californian Hotel in Disneyland. Finally one time my family, along with 10 other families, decided to stay here for our annual Halloween weekend vacation. My expectations were very high. In some areas they exceeded my expectations, but in others they greatly lacked. 	There are a lot of pros to staying here. If you are a guest at the hotel, you can enter the park two hours before everyone else. Also, when you enter the park, you don‚Äôt have to wait at the entrance with the general public. You have your own entrance straight into the park. The entrance is conveniently located by the Grizzly Bear Rapids ride which you are guaranteed to get soaked on. No one wants to walk around in soggy clothes all day. But if you are a guest at the hotel you can

A beautiful retreat, even though you will share it with hundreds of people.  Upon our arrival we were made to feel welcome, wished a happy birthday, and off we went through the doors and into California Adventure Land!  If you choose to invest in a stay at this wonderful hotel, you will not be sorry.  Just know before you go that it is expensive, and get over the cost, because it is well worth it.  What do you expect for something as gorgeous and fabulously built as Disney's Grand Californian Hotel?  A beautiful piece of architectural history re-enacted, you can spend hours here enjoying the glory of the old days when hotels were built with grace, beauty, and character.  Go ahead, splurge!

We just loved the grand . This hotel is awesome. Not only is it beautiful, but the rooms are so nice and the beds are very comfy. We were there celebrating our sons birthday and at check-in they presented him with balloons and a birthday pin. We had a great view of the park. It truely was a magical stay.

I had an opportunity to visit the Disney Institute and have a new appreciation for the core values that Disney has. I was able to stay at the hotel and was soo impressed with the customer service, the amenities available and of course the food! I was truly impressed.

Summary Heading: Hotel is nice but way too expensive
Summary: We have stayed at the Disney's Grand Californian Hotel several times throughout the years. The hotel is very nice, I especially like the mountain chalet feeling.  The rooms are good size and very clean.  The beds are not exactly the most comfortable and the pillows need some improvement.  The nightly turn down service was always a welcome surprise.  The kids love the chocolates the staff members leave on the pillows.  Last summer we were on a budget; therefore, we were forced to stay off site at the Fairfield Inn.  We were very surprised at how nice the Fairfield Inn was and how much money we saved by not staying at a Disney resort hotel.  Don't get me wrong, I still adore the atmosphere of Disney; however, after we saw the price difference, my family will stay off site from now

My husband and I, along with our 13 yr old son, treated ourselves to a stay at this hotel as an early Christmas present and we were not disappointed!  Beautiful at any time, it is especially pretty during the holidays.  Save your pennies and treat yourself to the great decor, location and comfort this hotel offers!  We've stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and other partner hotels and have never been so comfortable or enjoyed such convenience.  The hotel is beautiful and our 2 queen bed room was extremely comfortable.  The bathroom was very nice and the room had a large closet.  My son wanted to bring his laptop and I called ahead and was told the room safe would not accommodate it...wrong!!!...the safe is deep enough to hold a small laptop, plus wallets, keys, etc.  Money saving

This hotel is stunning. The architectural design is truly amazing and the staff was extremely warm, helpful, and friendly. This is a great property for so many reasons. I would say first and foremost you just can't beat the location. The hotel is literally inside the CA. Adventure Park, which is also steps away from Disneyland so the location is fantastic. We had a 2 queen bed room with a park view and it was so beautiful at night. We took my fiances 2 children with us and they just loved staying at this property. It wasn't hardly warm enough to swim but the kids were dying to test out the pool and spa so my fiance and I lounged around a bit outside while the kids enjoyed swimming a bit. All in all I would recommend at least one stay at this property. Its is very pricey but

Great Hotel.  Beautiful decor.  Staff bent over backwards to be helpful.  The location couldn't be beat.  We had a three room suite and 6 people.  We requested a room with a balcony facing Disneyland so we could see the fireworks.  They put us right out front so we could see everything.  It was so nice to be close to the parks so we could go back and nap or rest when we wanted to.

Summary Heading: Got to love the access to the parks.
Summary: Beautiful 5 star hotel , 4 star service with 3 star rooms.  What can we say? Quick walks to Downtown Disney, the parks, magic mornings, but essentially stuck there unless you have or arrange transportation. The food just about every place we ate was mediocre at best and triple cost compared to better restaurants in town. But it's convenient. Plenty stock up at stores and that's smart. The grand hall is very pleasant, piano at night, fireplace, nice bar... Overall very appealing.

Summary Heading: Great Location but not worth the price
Summary: We stayed here 3 nights over Valentine's Day.  We stayed in a Courtyard view room as to avoid any park or Downtown Disney noise.  It had a pretty view and it was on the 3rd floor.  We were not on the conceirge floor but that was fine with us.  We had a Queen and Bunk Beds room for our daughter.  She loved the beds and the balcony.  The room"s have no Disney atmosphere but it was still a nice room.  The lobby and the Grounds are where all the beauty are at.  The Convenience of location is what you are paying for.  Being this close to both parks was great with our little one for nap time!  We ate at White Water Snacks and also at Storytellers and both were good.  I loved the early park time  and private entrance to DCA.  It is great!!!  The housekeeping did a good job and had turn

The location of this hotel, cannot be beat.  It was so relaxing to just stroll into the California Adventure Park just a few steps away from your room.  We stayed for 3 nights and requested a king bed near the lobby which was granted.  Our standard view was of the lovely pool area and we could see the grizzly river bear head as well as tower of terror in the background.  The rooms was very nice and cozy.  The room set up was the exact same as the Animal Kingdom Lodge at WDW, just a little larger.  The bed was super comfy and we had no problems with noise at all.
