Housekeeping was excellent and super friendly. IThe turn down service with chocolates was a nice touch. We loved dinner at Storytellers, we had the buffet there twice, not too bad on price and the food quality was

Summary Heading: Just OK, Certainly not Worth the Price
Summary: We have stayed at the Disney Grand Californian over the past few years. We always stay on the "Concierge Floor" which is the 6th floor. There is a nice room where you can get beer and wine along with coffee and snacks from 6:30 am to well into the evening. The concierge's on this floor are not real concierge's. They are pretty much just front desk employees. They are pretty slow to do anything out of their desk area and certainly never return a phone call. The rooms are small, dark, and don't have a bar. The bedding is just OK, and the TV is fine. Lots of Disney stuff to watch. The employees are pretty much complacent and put little effort out other than the Faux smile that goes along with all the Faux at Disneyland. Disney seems o do such a great job of rides and entertainment

We got a decent deal on the hotel and had a resort view room which was basically overlooking the pool. The rooms are a good size, we had two adults and two preschoolers (4&2). Didn't eat in the hotel except the white water snacks and it was nice and good value.  The location to the parks is what we wanted most from this hotel and it didn't disappoint. Its own entrance into California Adventure was great and convenient for going back during the day.  Overall a great place to stay, and we would consider a return to this hotel. It is pricey but worth it for the location.

Summary Heading: Stunning Hotel but less than stellar food
Summary: We stayed here for our anniversary and enjoyed the hotel, but will likely not stay here again. The other Disney properties were half the price and though not as convenient, offered a better value. The good, the hotel is beautiful with a grand lobby, very reminiscent of the Old Faithful Lodge in Yellowstone Park. Our room was very comfortable, with a great view from our balcony of the monorail and California Adventure park and offered a private entrance to the park, which made it very convenient. We would enjoy the park in the morning, drop by the hotel for a rest for a half hour or so and back to the park very easily. The staff was very attentive and friendly as one would expect from a Disney Property. The Not So Good, food at this hotel was some of the worst we've had at Disney

Summary Heading: Gorgeous lobby, nice rooms, just don't pay retail!
Summary: If you pay under $200 per night for the room, go for the bargain.  You may feel cheated, however, if you spend top dollar ($300+ per night!) as the rooms are nice but nothing spectacular.  The location, however, and the lobby ambiance is really beautiful. Can't beat the convenience to California Adventure theme park, downtown Disney, and of course Disneyland.

After reading some negative reviews I was a little concerned especially as I am a Travel Agent however my stay was exceptional. I was in a standard room which was exactly as I expected. It was clean (and I am fussy) I had a view of the pool and the Adventure Park. The Air Conditioning worked really well. The beds were great but like all hotels take your own pillow.The reception staff at check in all provided excellent service. I arrived at 10am and they checking me straight in. I went the end of Jan which is low season so it wasn't so busy. The best thing was having direct access to the Park and Down Town Disney shopping street filled with places to eat and shopping. They also have a self service cafe where you could get meals all day long, breakfast was just $6.99 per person.

Summary Heading: Best ambiance and location of the CA Disney Hotels
Summary: But very expensive.  It is, however, awesome to be able to be in the park in a matter of minutes from the room.  Plus, if you stay in the hotel, you can get in Disneyland an hour early (at 7:00am) by taking the monorail near the hotel in the Disney Village straight to Tomorrowland and so jump right on Space Mountain or the Nemo Submarine or Peter Pan before the crowds are let in.   We got a room facing the California Adventures directly behind Goofy's Flight School.  With the balcony door closed we couldn't hear the screaming, although we could hear a little of the World of Color show as that volume is high.  You can also see that show from the balcony if you are facing the park.  We were celebrating a birthday and the staff was nice enough to give us balloons and streamers to

The Hotel was great.  Great people working there.  The only thing I wished would be to have the rooms better lit and more storage for your clothes.  Yes we would stay there again.  Best location for both parks.

I had occasion to stay at this hotel for nearly 2 weeks, from January 20 through February 3. My original stay was only for a week but I had to extend it as I was visiting a sick friend and needed to stay longer. Every single person I encountered was extraordinarily helpful in every possible way.   My first few nights were spent in the Disney Vacation Club 2-bedroom villa, complete with 3 full bathrooms. We had a view of the pool, extremely comfortable surroundings and could easily have slept 8 in this room. The weekend of January 27-29 was extremely busy at Disney with the Princess Half-Marathon being run in and around the Disney properties but I never saw a customer who wasn't being attended to in a timely and courteous fashion. It seemed to me that extra staff was available to

I booked 3 rooms at the Grand California--Disneys most luxurious hotel--and was so disgusted with Disneyland and their rates and lack of service that I had to share my experience. I have only written a TripAdvisor comment 1 prior time and it was glowing--about another Hotel. I do not complain much.  Disneyland over-charges to an obscene degree and doesn't even let you use an 800 number to call them. You pay up the ying yang for everything, but have to call on your own dime to make a reservation. It takes about 45 minutes and then if you want to make dinner reservations, they will not help you. Instead they give you another long distance # to call. Then they got all 3 rooms wrong and I had the pleasure of calling back on my own dime and spending 1 hour to get them to fix the

Summary Heading: What else to say, convenience trumps all.
Summary: Pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Yes, expensive. Yes, the rooms look like a Marriott inside. But the convenience overrides everything else. My breakdown: Rooms - clean and quiet, sound proof like windows facing the pool areas, great room service, turndown service!!, great bath products. Pools - large, well kept and clean. Excellent. Towel service was iffy. Food - Only ate at Story Tellers Cafe, but both dinner and breakfast buffett were excellent, 4 star quality. Again, expensive (25 bucks/ adult), but would rather eat here than other places in Disneyland. Convenience - best ever. made the whole weekend better. Easy to get in and out of parks, can come back and rest.  Staff - very friendly in the Disney way.  If the rooms were of a higher quality, I would have almost given

Summary Heading: Your vacation starts the minute you walk through the door!!
Summary: I'm finally submitting a review for the Grand Californian after my third stay in the hotel in as many years.  Since bringing my 2 girls here in February of 2009 for the first time it really is the only place I know around Disneyland.  To be quite honest, I really don't want to risk taking a chance with somewhere new when I know a great thing when I have one!  When doing Disneyland with young kids (mine are now 8 and 5 years old), the convenience of both parks is soooo worth it!!  One year, we had a room facing Disneyland right over the World of Disney store.  I had just gotten my girls down to sleep and was enjoying a nice adult beverage on the balcony.  My view towards the ground was the chaos of people waiting for the tram to get to the parking lot.  I knew right then and

We stayed at the hotel Dec. 12-15 to celebrate my daughter's 7th birthday. We are passholders and often visit Disneyland although it is about an hour and half commute. We have the Disneyland parking pass but that makes no difference - the hotel charges $15 per night regardless. We arrived early and were happy to check-in early. The front desk person was not very verbal so most of the details about the hotel, I learned from his co-worker checking in another family next to us. I asked for bunk beds for the kids (and requested them at hotel booking) but they stated there were none available. The hotel was clean and there was huge Christmas tree in the middle of the hotel which made for great pics. The room was clean - a little dated. I love the convienence of being able to visit

Summary Heading: The way to go at Disneyland!
Summary: Definitely trhe way to go if you are staying multiple days at Disneyland! A private entrance to both parks, and Downtown Disney. Nice restaurants on site.  Child Care available.  Modern, clean facilities. Helpful Staff.  What more could you want!

Summary Heading: The only place I will stay at Disneyland!
Summary: Our family stayed for four nights in late January 2012.  The Grand Californian is excellent, and I would not stay anywhere else on a return trip.  You simply cannot beat this location.  You are in very easy walking distance to both parks, as well as right in the middle of Downtown Disney.  The separate entrance to the California Adventure Park is a huge plus-- you can avoid the long lines at the main entrance.  Even better, the private entrance is just a few steps away from the Grizzly River Run, so when you get soaked on this ride (and you will!), you can head straight to your room to change and get back to the park(s).  It was also great to be able to enjoy the pools and hot tubs and take a break from the parks one afternoon.  The hotel itself is lovely, and does a great job

Summary Heading: Wow, spectacular lobby.  Good rooms, great access to Disneyland
Summary: It is certainly more expensive than other hotels near Disneyland, but what a treat.  Spectacular lobby, walk right in to California Adventure.  Room keys and Park Passes not on same card (unlike Disneyworld but that was minor).

Summary Heading: Over-priced, but decent except for the cheap pillows and beds
Summary: This is a place to be Near The Disneyland Park - if that's what you want and don't mind the steep price. No one who lives in California would pay this price for this class of hotel, when you can stay in much better places for less in real resort areas Newport Beach or Irvine - just 15 miles away (about 20 minutes south by Freeway). They rely on tourists who insist on being so close to the Parking Lots where the noise keeps them awake all night despite a decent room and nice room service, and an in house Cafe (The Story Teller's Cafe) which has very decent food for its price.   The beds however leave much to be desired if you are not apparently the same weight as the one who must have authorized their purchase - say about 140 lbs max - as they are cheap and uncomfortable if you a

We stayed January 25, 26, 27.  The five of us drove all night and arrived at 8 am.  Although we didn't use valet parking, the jauntily-attired valet guys graciously let us park in the front as we unloaded the car.  We straggled inside the gorgeous lobby, looking all the world like refugees, feeling very grubby indeed.  I was feeling especially self-conscious because I had won the trip during a contest.  I figured I would get the "contest winner treatment".  The lobby took our breath away!  Simply stunning.  We were welcomed at the little waiting place by an older gentleman who looked us square in the eyes and said, "Welcome home."  *sigh*  Judy, castmember from Kona Hawaii, checked us in.  I had been unclear with the number in our party.  The hotel was expecting four of us; we

Our family from Oz stayed 5 nights at the Resort in early January with family relatives who live in the USA and can only say what an excellent stay. There is organisation the minute you turn into the driveway, collect your family name acrd at the gate office and then directed into a driveway location to unload you car, assistance provided for every vehicle. The foyer / lobby of the hotel is grand, with timber finishes and a grand open fire place, a very warm welcome.  The room just suited our teenage children as it was really a bunk for smaller kids and a pullout from the bottom bunk for the third bed.  Room maintained well. Easy access to the Disney Parks and Downtown Disney.  Great pool / jacuzzi area after a tiring day at the Parks. Did not eat at the hotel as we ate at the

you can't beat the location, but the hotel is over-rated.  small rooms, bouncy/cheap mattresses, and sponge pillows that you'd find in a Motel6.  Seriously bad.  Bring your own pillow.  Also, get used to waiting--I guess this is Disneyland, so lines and waiting are part of the experience.  Grand Californian continues the tradition.  The check in took us 45 minutes--and there was only 1 person ahead of us in line.  Check out--same thing.    Food--think Hampton Inn.  That said, if you have young children, this is the place to stay.  Over 5 years old--consider Newport Beach.  Much, much nicer hotels. And, cheaper.  Just a 15-20 minute drive.  We stayed 3 nights at Grand Californian--no sleep, bad pillows, little sleep, bad food, etc.  Then, actually relaxed (and slept) at the

Summary Heading: Beautiful property & so convenient for the parks
Summary: We stayed here for a few nights because my sister & brother-in-law participated in the Tinkerbell 1/2 marathon.  The location was awesome, so close to the start & finish of the race & so convenient for the visiting the parks as well.  It is connected to the Disney California Adventure park and right in Downtown Disney so restaurants  & shopping are close as well.   This hotel is beautiful.  I loved all the dark wood & the decor has a soothing nature feel to it.  It was very clean and comfortable.  We had a little kitchenette w/ a sink, microwave, & fridge which was nice for snacks & breakfast.  My fiancee & I slept on the pullout couch & I was surprised at how comfortable it was.  We were also dead tired from all the walking in the parks so that probably helped.

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel, but you pay for the luxury
Summary: Disney's Grand Californian hotel is a beautiful place to stay while visiting the Disneyland Resort in Anaheim.  I cannot express how good the service is.  From the moment you drive up, the valets wish you "a Grand Day", and the bellmen and front desk people are eager to welcome you.  The maids in the hallways smile and say hello as you pass by.  Everyone I encountered had a "Disney smile", and they always seemed sincere.    The room is pleasant, with a woodsy, lodge-style vibe.  I thought the bathroom was a bit small for such an upscale hotel.  There was an old-fashioned shower/bathtub combo, which seems dated now that most of the newer hotels have a separate bath and shower.  The water pressure left a lot to be desired, so my hopes of having a nice, long shower were dashed.

The hotel had a wow factor when you first walk in.  The beautiful grand lobby with inviting fireplace and log cabin feel were more than what we expected.  There were a lot of visitors during the holiday season. I would strongly suggest the meal vouchers. It was easy to use.  The hotel is also the closest to both Disney park and the adventure park and the downtown Disney shops and restaurants.   We stayed at the other hotel on site a few years ago, but it was so far to walk to the parks. The hotel rooms are pretty good, but still thought it was a little pricey.  Overall, a great stay and would definitely stay there again!
The main rationale for staying here was the location - easy access to the park everyday was worth it for sure. A beautiful spot and a typical Disney treatment - well done!

We stayed at the Grand Californian for one night (January 24-25, 2012, a Tuesday through Wednesday) to celebrate an anniversary. Everything about our experience was really nice so this might be a fairly boring review. We arrived at around 11AM and the front desk was accommodating enough to let us check in immediately (hours before their official check-in). Of course, it was probably easier for them to do something like this on a relatively-quiet Tuesday, but it was a nice touch nonetheless. Our 6th floor room, which overlooked the pools, was clean and quiet. The bed was really comfortable and the bathroom was in full working order. No hotel staff/cast member we encountered was rude or unpleasant; we were constantly greeted warmly by everyone. We grabbed a bite to eat late
Location, Location. The easy acccess to the parks, and attention to detail at the hotel make this the best place to stay.

I choose this hotel for its quality and location to California Adventure park. With its own access to this park, there simply simply is no better place to stay. I'm happy to report that at the time of this stay internet access was free in the room, however, the speed is the slowest I have witnessed in any hotel I've stayed at; both wired and wireless. Also, the low flow shower heads make it difficult for washing hair and the water seemed to cycle in temperature. These are issues I would attribute to lower quality hotels. None the less, these were worked around. The bar fridge was noisy on check in, and they replaced it immediately for me. I'll be looking to stay here again next trip to Disneyland/California Adventure.

We decided to stay at a Disneyland park hotel because we have two small children.  The location of the hotel is key.  It has access to both California Adventure and downtown Disney.  It's also very close to the monorail.  All of these really helped with our experience in Disneyland.  Dragging two small children around on shuttles up and down the street is really hard on them after being in the park all day.  Especially, because one of them still naps and it was great to have a short stroll back to the hotel for our child to rest.  When we arrived at the hotel the service was great.  We were immediately welcomed and asked our name.  We were then called by our name by all of the cast members while they helped us out of the car and into the lobby.  That was great.  The lobby was

We stayed at the Grand Californian for three nights, primarily because we were travelling with a 15 month old and wanted it to be easy for one of our party to take her back to the hotel for naps. It was well worth paying the extra money for the convenience. For the price I was expecting more luxurious rooms (they had a dated feel to them). The buffet breakfast at the Storybook Cafe was everything you would expect of a top hotel. Dinner there was very average. It was a pleasant surprise that there was a snack bar/general store on site which made it easy to buy milk and the basics we needed for our little one. They do not supply microwaves, but you can use the one in the snack bar. Really though you are paying for the location and the proximity to the parks. It is well worth it in

Summary Heading: Really nice lobby, below standard rooms
Summary: Really impressive lobby,  Great location.  Rooms are reminiscent of an average to below average mid-priced hotel chain.  Old bathrooms.

The hotel is not really the focus of a trip to Disneyland. We last stayed at Paradise Pier and this was a definite improvement.  The only issue here is that the hotel is a little tired and yet everything works so very well. There is nothing in the way of your trip but not truly a boost to the Disney experience, hence the 3 stars.

Summary Heading: Incredible location!  Great location!  Disney magic!
Summary: Step inside the lobby of the Disney Grand Californian Hotel and you are overcome by Disney magic.  The lobby is exactly what it should be - grand.   This was our second visit, but it was no less magical.   Luckily the wait to check in was short, not always the case.  Our room overlooked the pool and had a very small balcony.  Fine to stand on and admire the pool, but not big enough to sit an enjoy.  The rooms are typical Disney - small, but well designed, but we don't spend much time in the room when we are visiting Disney so that is fine.    We pay the expensive Disney rates for the location and the magic.  The hotel has a private entrance to California Adventure and easy access to Downtown Disney.   The Magic Kingdom is an easy walk, if you don't have little ones or you can

Summary Heading: Beautiful Hotel with Spectacular views of California Adventure
Summary: I was in awe the moment I stepped into this hotel. The lobby is quite large with a great fireplace and wooden features. We stayed in a studio suite and the room was just as nice. The bed was extremely comfortable and I love the fact that is quiet and there are darkening shades. You are in walking distance of the parks and Downtown Disney. There is a cute bar downstairs with a fairly nice wine menu and an outdoor patio. The only downside to the hotel is that most of the restaurants are quite expensive. We wound up eating in the surrounding area or downtown Disney.  We had a great view of the ferris wheel in California Adventures. The pool is beautiful and there is a hot tub.

Summary Heading: Good Hotel , could be great ,overall would recommend
Summary: Stayed for 1 week in a premium Downtown view room.  This is not a 5 star hotel , its a solid 4 star , nothing wrong with 4 star but please set your expectations when you book.  Positives: Great staff always helpful smiling and considerate. Location unbeatable for the parks and downtown disney. Pools lots of fun and warm enough in Jan to swim, very suitable for children swimming lifeguards on duty and swim vests on hand. Parking is closeby for self parkers.  OKs:  room , a bit small but functional , dark , a bit dated, probably not to my taste. Bathroom very old and bath small not separate from shower. Beds comfortable , fridge big enough for use.  Negatives:constant music from downtown disney only stops 10pm which is a problem if your kids need to sleep , restarts 9am. Food, I

We stayed in the villas for a week through our RCI timeshare points. What a surprise when we entered the villa (2 bedroom that sleeps 9) It was elegant and well planned. The main room had a full kitchen, hugh table for all of us, a 1/2-bathroom, and living room area with sofa bed and a hidden Murphy bed. (We wouldn't have found the Murphy bed if the bellman hadn't shown us.) One bedroom had two queen size beds and a full bath. They didn't skimp on the size of that second bedroom. The master bedroom had a very comfortable king size bed and a full bathroom with a big separate shower and spa tub. All was done with rich dark wood and as expected Disney was subtly evident throughout in the carpeting, shower curtain, trim pieces.  We had trouble with both the microwave and dishwasher,

My dream was to go to Disneyland and stay in the Disneyland hotel. So we decided to go the best and booked the grand Californian. We were not dissapointed by its Grandness! The foyer/sitting area is amazing. The rooms were lovely and the pools were a great way to chill out in between visits to the park. I loved every minute at this hotel and so did the kids as it was only a short walk to the parks and downtown Disney. Breakfast with the characters and the other Disney hotel next door is a must!!! Love love love this hotel and if I ever come back I'm sure to book again.

Summary Heading: LOVE this hotel--Can't wait to go back!
Summary: So this summer we wanted to give our children (ages 1, 2, & 11) the ultimate Disney vacation.  We typically book our hotel stay at one of the "disney neighbor" hotels.  However, this year we decided to stay at one of the Disney hotels.    We are  SPOILED rotten and can't and will NOT stay anywhere else except at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel.  This hotel is amazing!!  I highly recommend booking a room on the concierge level as you will have full access to the club's private room which offers snacks, milk, juice, and even wine and beer for Mom and Dad.  There is plenty of activities in the hotel--game rooms, movie area for the kiddies.  Easy access to both parks (California and Disneyland)  You also have a wonderful view of the fireworks from the clubhouse balcony.   The staff

Summary Heading: If you want location, this is it.
Summary: We stayed @ the GC right after Christmas.  Overall, our stay was great!  A few minor glitches.  Prior to our stay, right after I booked it, (2 months in advance) I called and asked for a room with bunk beds, I found out our son was too tall for the bunk beds and the operator suggested a room with 2 queens and a couch.  That was great, she told me to be sure to call the day before to make sure they had my request.  I called and confirmed my request about 3 weeks prior then called the day prior.  That operator told me they did not have a layout like that at the hotel and apoligized.  All took good notes on my calls.  When we went to check in, (where I found them to be wonderful and helpful) they had me booked for 2 queens, the person checking us in, seen my notes and said they did

Summary Heading: If you go to disneyland there is no better choice
Summary: If you go to disneyland there is no better choice. This is the best hotel to stay. You will have fast access to california adventure park because you have a special entrance. Also the rooms are very nice. Everything at the hotel is great you will not regret it. You will pay more than other hotels but you will save time to access to disneyland because this hotel is the nearest to disney and california adventure park. Your kids will thank you for staying in this hotel because everything is great including the pools.

Stayed here two nights.  Standard room was clean, beds were comfortable.  Not enough light overall, but ok.  Bathroom was only as wide as the tub and toilet.  Double sink vanity outside of bathroom was not as well lit as I would like.  Had a small balcony with view of a couple of trees and the windows of other rooms.  Not a lot of outside noise even though the lobby was bustling.  Reminiscent of a huge hunting lodge.  Staff was friendly and helpful although the valet staff was a bit pushy - just trying to get everyone through.   Room service prices were over inflated. $18 for a three egg omelette?!?! Pool area was clean (although it was dark when we went so hard to really tell).  Water temp could have been a bit warmer for January. Only used the entrance to California Adventure

The Disney land, adventure was a wonderful experience with amazing attractions like the Jungle Cruise, The Temple of the Forbidden Eye on the Indiana Jones Adventure Tarzan's Treehouse and you‚Äôd then enjoy the tropics in the Enchanted Tiki Room. Coming at the start of the day is probably the best option if you‚Äôd like to complete the whole entire adventure at hand. If your up for the adventure that is, or you can go straight away to the Grand Californian Hotel and Spa which was the choice chosen between our family, and it was an absolutely unbelievable experience with the nicest and most homely rooms they could make! The staff, were very friendly, showing us which way to our room and offering to carry our bags. It was just as I expected with great service and quality, including
Great to be so close to so much fun, yet so close to the room if needed. Great for small children that need a nap and or make your own lunch.

I am currently staying at this resort and the location is wonderful. I will provide a simple summary. Lobby: It was quite grand...reminded me of the titanic for some reason.  Reception: Wonderful, quick, friendly and efficient!  Parking: I self parked, but the parking is pricey. $22 for valet and $15 for self parking and if you are DVC member it is complimentary.  Room: I have 6504 which is a single villa and it provided a great view of the world of colors. The room decor is ok and reminds me of a good standard timeshare. It meets your basic needs and was comfortable for a family of three. Pools: Looked well maintained, safe and inviting but did not enter. Food: We had a dinner buffet at the Storyteller and it was decent. The buffet was 26.99 for adults and 11.99 for kids. I

Just walking into the cavernous lobby was jaw-dropping.  My 9-year old son couldn't believe we were going to stay in such a cool place.  Check in went well, if not maybe a little long.  The room was perfect......clean and spacious.  The immediate access to California Adventure provided the perfect gateway to the park.  Having a concierge on every floor is perfect, and my wife used their services for a number of issues, primarily arranging for transportation for other venues we were going to.  It is expensive, but well worth it.

Summary Heading: Ever stayed in a $29 room at Circus Circus?  Then "Welcome Home"
Summary: This place has really run down since I was last here.  The front desk folks go out of their way to ignore you.  They take your credit card and ID and then walk away without a word to a back office somewhere.  When this happened to me I approached another clerk and she rudely told me that the other person probably went to "prepare" my room.    Upon entering the suite I was knocked over by an acrid stench of old smoke and chemical spray used to cover it up.  Having just had a wonderfully rude experience with the front desk, I chose not to request a different room since I figured it would only get worse and worse.  After being in the room for one hour I had a headache and burning eyes that returned every time I returned to the room.  If you have ever stayed in a $29 room at Circus

We stayed here for a few days to end our vacation.  It's not cheap, by any means, but being able to see your room from the Disneyland gate, at the end of a long day, does have a lot of value.  A little light on theming for a top teir Disney hotel.  The main atrium is great, but that's really about it.  Storyteller's Cafe and the snack bar both had excellent food.  And watching the monorail go by while having coffee in my Disney bathrobe was quite nice.

We are DVC members and booked a 10 day stay at the Grand Californian.  We had a 1 bedroom unit.  It was spacious, granite counter tops, bench dining area.  There was a fold away bed in the TV cabinet, so it slept 5 people total.  Full kitchen, the pairing knive was dull, so I called and got a replacement.  The bathrooms were spacious. Love the sunken jacuzzi tub.  Our view was of the pool area.  There are 2 large pools, one with a slide, 2 jacuzzi's, lots of deck space and comfortable cushioned deck chairs. The staff are friendly, the main lobby is massive and very impressive.  The access into both Disneyland and California Adventure make it a great place to stay for convience.

1st thing out of my wife's mouth was. WOW! I've never seen a bath this clean in any hotel before (and she's seen quite a few).  Having the sinks outside the bath and toilet area is good also because the area is usable and the mirrors aren't all steamed up. We got a special rate on this hotel due to a convention. At 200+ per night after taxes it might seem pricey but the location, being able to walk right into the Disney Park, walk out the door to Downtown Disney, access to food (and good food too!), the pools, being able to come back easily to the room all make it worth the price as opposed to having to take shuttles to and from another hotel. But we've earned it. We've stayed at less expensive hotels for years. I'm spoiled though now. At regular rates depending on your budget

Summary Heading: A Most Excellent Place to BE!
Summary: We were able to Check in Early as we have a special needs child. They accomodated us beyond belief. The hotel is a beautiful place, you honestly could enjoy the hotel as a destination all on its own. However, it opens up directly to Disneyland's Downtown Disney And California Adventure. They have their own 5 star restaurants‚Äô and shops within the hotel, not to mention a grand pool and spa. The rooms are very nice - we were able to see the fireworks from our balcony every night so our little one could watch them from her bed and not be too afraid of the noise.

Obviously, this hotel is in a great location. You have quick walking access to Downtown Disney and CA Adventure Park. You have a short walk to Disneyland. We enjoyed not having to rely on the buses to transport us around, and enjoyed the perk of having early entry days to Disneyland Park. The hotel is beautiful and clean. The staff is very nice. We got room service 3 or 4 times, and the food was good. We ate at the restaurants at the hotel and enjoyed them. We took advantage of the hotel's activities for kids: scavenger hunt, movies, storytelling, etc., and the kids enjoyed that. Staying at the hotel is very pricey, but I appreciated having our hotel close by for when the kids were done with the parks. It was also nice to just pop in and out of the parks for Fast Pass rides or

I have been to Disneyland more times than I can count on all my fingers and toes, but I had never yet stayed at the Grand Californian Hotel (because of the price).  While it is more expensive than any of the other places, it was the best overall experience I have had than any of my other trips to other places in the area.    I have come to the realization that it is worth it to pay a little extra for the convenience.  The proximity to the park is so close, your feet will thank you immensely when you come crawling in after a long day of walking (or several days).  You don't have to wait for any tram to come get you and it's a short hike through Downtown Disney to the side entrance by Sephora. You can run back to drop off a pile of souvineers, get a jacket, or take a nap without a

Summary Heading: Great location, lovely atmosphere, worth the splurge!
Summary: **About us: We are a family of three (2 adults and one 8 year old girl) on our first trip to Disneyland!  **Location: Having never been to Disneyland I had a difficult time deciding on whether to stay on or off property.  Ultimately, I decided that I value a convenient and appealing location over the cost savings of staying off property.  I absolutely LOVED being able to walk to both parks (never having to leave the 'magic' of Disney) and now can‚Äôt imagine doing it any other way.  For me, this is the number one reason to book this hotel, but fortunately it has other positive qualities‚Ä¶.  **Customer Service: Surprisingly good and personal for such a large hotel.  Check-in was speedy and cheerful. Every single person we dealt with was helpful and efficient.  **Room: We booked a

I thought that the GCH was all around a great experience. I tend to stay fewer times at better hotels, and although this is not the Four Seasons, for the type of hotel this is, it is excellent. The rooms are of adequate size (we had four people), the beds and pillows were truly excellent, and the people were wonderful. From the moment we checked in early, every single person we spoke with, from cleaning staff to the concierge, went out of their way to be friendly and helpful to any request we made. The only downside is that it is slightly noisy, but that is to be expected at this type of hotel the week after New Year's when there are a lot of children at the hotel visiting the parks.  For food, you cannot beat Napa Rose for an adult meal, an with the kids, Whitewater snacks is

On a recent family vacation to Palm Springs, my boyfriend and I decided to break off from the family to go spend one night and two days at Disney. We decided to splurge on the Grand Californian because we were only staying one night, and the Disneyland Hotel was undergoing renos that seemed to bother reviewers. Our decision to stay at the GC was the best one we've ever made. Right from our arrival at the front gate "Welcome home!", we experienced the best customer service I could ever imagine. Valet parking was easy to use. We arrived at 8am so that we could get our bags stored and such before early entry into California Adventure. We went to the check-in desk and our attendant, Rudy, spent 15 minutes with us, answering all of our questions and explaining things about the

I'm an experienced traveller and I know to hide or lock away my valuables, but these are things that I didn't realize people would be looking for.  I left my headphones (standard earbuds) and gift cards in the room. My headphones on the bed and my gift cards (in an otherwise empty) purse. In the first day of housekeeping my headphones were gone and my purse was rummage though going through at least 2 zippered compartments to take about $200 worth in gift cards.  Of course I reported it, but it still is a circle of transferred and I know I will probably not be seeing those items or reimbursement ever again.  HIDE EVERYTHING!

We usually stay at the Disneyland  Hotel but it was under renovation during our stay so we decided to stay here. We stayed in a room overlooking California Adventure. It was so worth it. There was a private entrace to that park minutes from our door step, which came in handy with kids ranging in age from 8 months to 9 years old. We got to see the fireworks from our porch. The pool was clean and relaxing. This place is very, very pricey so you have to be ready to fork over some serious cash. It was a splurge for sure so next time we'll probably head back to the Disneyland hotel.

Summary Heading: This might be the biggest take ever
Summary: The Disney GC hotel costs around $400 for a family room per night for one queen sized bed and two bunks and a dimly lit teeny tiny bathroom. The decor is 1970s motel. There is no mini bar, no in room movies and poor ammenities. We tried calling room service twice at 9:30pm but there was no answer. The position is incredible but its time they stop ripping tourists off.

I was reluctant to stay at the Grand based on all the negative reviews, however our recent stay (20-23 Dec) dispelled our fears. My only real gripe is the inability to reserve a specific room type. Not sure why that is so difficult for them, I've reserved specific rooms at other hotels. Checkin process was good, we were upgraded to a pool view.  Bunkbeds do rattle if you have a squirmy child. Other than that the room was incredibly quiet.  Corridors were properly heated.  Water presure was fine for all in our party. White Water Snacks - quick, great value and variety for kids. Valet parking was great. Obviously, location is everything. The ability to go back to your room for a break is priceless, especially if you've taken advantage of a Magic Morning.

The hotel is excellent if you are a Disney fan- direct entrance to California Adventure Park, early entry to both parks etc.are some of the perks of staying here. The rooms are very very disappointing, though. The toilet is extremely small especially for family rooms. Service is below average, and the staff are hungry for tips every where. Considering this is the best hotel in Disneyland, it is so far behind its counterparts in Hong Kong and Japan.

Everyone we encountered at the hotel was pleasant and helpful.  On two separate occasions, an employee overheard us and offered advice.  In line waiting for the front desk, I mentioned we were celebrating a birthday to an attendant.  When I got up to the counter, I was told we were upgraded.  The lobby and common areas are beautiful yet homey.  A huge fireplace with 2 dozen rocking adirondack chairs make a large but cozy gathering area.  The Christmas tree was enormous in the lobby, where we sat in the evening enjoying the ambience and listening to an exceptional pianist playing music from The Phantom of the Opera.  The 5th floor upgraded view was of California Adventure, the ferris wheel and much of the park. It was like watching a show at nighttime.  The hotel is pricey --

The Grand Californian Hotel is so beautiful and worth the extra dollars to stay there. You are literally right in the center of all the action. We had a Park View Room and the view was incredible. We could watch all the action of California Adventure park right from our balcony. The special entrance from the hotel into California Adventure was great! The staff at this resort were wonderful and very friendly.  The rooms were nice and clean. There is only one issue with this resort, the shower has absolutely no water pressure. I read reviews before we went to this resort and that is the one complaint I kept reading about. I figured how bad could it be?....well it is bad.  I would not let this little issue keep me from returning to this incredible resort. Everything else at this

Expensive splurge for Christmas. Wouldn't do it every time, but once in your life it was such a treat! We loved having our room right off the beautiful lobby. Had a courtyard view-was hoping for a view of the pool,but it was fine. Monorail noise is not a problem, quiet room.  so nice to be able to come back, hang by the pool for a while and take a break! We took a late afternoon jacuzzi break each day-so nice! Still can't figure out why Disneyland Resort can't make a decent meal in any restaraunt, except we found Tangaroa Terrace to be good-kind of far.  Room was nice-fit 5 ok, bed was fine, not as nice as WEstin, but heck you are so tired!  You have to ask for the chocoates which is dumb.  The lifeguard was a jerk when he closed the slide at 4:59 as we were walking up the

treat yourself, this is well worth the extra dollars. You can find deals at the right time always check the web, and check timeshares they may want to dump their stay.  no extra walking around, rest part way through the day give the wife a break and the kids can swim. save money by walking down the road to eat or rent a car and head to norms or pizza hut everything is 10 minutes away.  early park access, gym for workouts, laundry down the hall, wine bar:-)

My husband, two daughters (age 2 and 4) and I stayed at The Grand Californian for new years Eve! It's a beautiful hotel right in between Disneyland and Disney's Californian Adventure. Although you can get the Californian Adventure straight from the hotel. It was great for us as my 2 year old and I went for a nap during the day and didn't have far to walk to get to the hotel.  No monorails or trains needed. This was our first time at Disneyland, California. We had been to Euro Disney and Disneyworld, Florida 4 times. We rate them all very high and loved Disneyland, Ca too!  The rooms were nice, clean and the evening turn down service was great. Coming back to chocolates on the pillow was nice.  I would recommend making restaurant reservations at the hotel and other restaurants in

We stayed for a week in October in a two-bedroom villa room. What can I say? Nothing bad that's for sure. The apartment was spacious and equipped excellently. The only thing we didn't seem to have was a kettle - and as a Brit, we do like our tea, but this was easily fixed after a call to house-keeping and a few minutes later we had our all important kettle.  Our party was made up of 4 adults and 4 kids varying in ages from 10 to 16, but this was no problem in this apartment. The kids shared one bedroom with 2 large double beds and it's own bathroom. We had the Master-suite, again with it's own bathroom and the other adults had the bed settee in the lounge, again with it's own bathroom and they said it was extremely comfortable.  Our room also featured two good sized balconies

We stayed at the GCH for 5 nights from Dec 26-31 2011.  We stayed in a room with bunk beds, a queen bed, and a trundle.  The room itself was ok, but certainly not special.  It was clean enough.  It was large enough.  It was appointed well enough.  But frankly, the service part of our experience was horrible, so I'd recommend that friends/family stay elsewhere.  I realize we stayed at the busiest time of year.  I get that.  But 30 minutes in a huge line to check in, mainly because their system is archaic is ridiculous. Yes, 30 full minutes standing in a lineup.    The attendant helping me said "the system says your credit card requires an authorization, what would you like me to do?" and stands there staring at me.  Um, get it authorized.  It's not near limit, it's an out of

Besides the beauty of the lobby, the best thing is the location. The room was so-so in it's decor but very quiet and the beds are very comfy. We didn't pay extra for concierge service or a special view as we had no plans to be at the hotel much, so without expectations - no disappointments! We had a view of the back of DCA and a partial view of the World of Color. The food on the room service menu and the Storyteller Cafe was very pricey ($20 for an omelet??!), just like food in the park, but the White Water Snack Bar was reasonable and good. The few staff members we had contact with were nice and a real treat was a 2-mile power walk through DCA before it opens! It's so peaceful and Dave, the guide, is full of facts and tips about Disney.  I walked two mornings and wish I had

It's true that the steep prices of this hotel deterred me for a long time. But when I received a special offer for 40% off, I jumped at the chance to stay at this hotel. We were impressed from start to finish. Not one single flaw. And after this trip, I would pay full price to stay here any day.  My husband said that if there was an "easy" button for a theme park hotel, it would be the Grand Californian.  They catered to our every need and made our two days at the park as easy and enjoyable as possible!  We got the valet parking for $22 dollars/day. It was totally worth it! We drove up to the hotel, they unloaded our bags, and told us to have a great day at the theme park.  We walked into the hotel, through the lobby and out to the entrance of the park. As easy as that! No maze

We stayed between Christmas and New Year's Eve. Everything was average, staff was very attentive and nice, the location and park access was great. We didn't spend much time in the hotel. The price is high for this type of hotel but justified for the location. At over 50,000 visitors a day during our stay, it certainly was a convenience to be able to take breaks frequently.

Summary Heading: Return trip to this hotel just as good as first time!
Summary: My family stayed at the Disney Grand Californian Hotel about 18 months ago, and we decided to surprise out 7 year-old son on another trip there right after Christmas (gift from Santa). It was just the three of us who flew from Seattle into John Wayne Airport in Santa Ana on Dec 27th, 2011. We initially were going to take the Disneyland Express Bus from the airport to our hotel, but instead opted to take a Taxi cab as the price wasn't much different. I'm glad we did, as it took us directly to the hotel with no additional stop offs (at a cost of $40).  Once we arrived, everything went very smoothly at the GCH Check-in was a breeze, and we were able to get a room early at 10 am (normally, check-in is at 3 pm). So we stowed our luggage in our room and headed out to the California

We loved this hotel. Fun for families. It's fun to walk around, as there is so much to see! The HUGE fireplace with story telling every night (and music) was a plus! The proximity to shops and the park was nice. We enjoyed every second.

My husband and I stayed in a Deluxe Studio in the Villas at the Grand Californian for four nights in January. This stay was nothing short of spectacular! The lobby is breathtaking, with an airy sitting area, complete with a piano player, cartoons and sitting chairs for the little ones (and my husband) and a cozy fireplace. Having multiple pools and hot tubs allowed for a feeling of spaciousness, while enjoying the amentities. We enjoyed a dinner at Storyteller's Cafe, which was one of the best meals we had during our entire stay! The corn bread muffins were our favorite!  Our room was very large, clean, and had a great view of the California Adventure park, and even a partial view of the hotel's pool area. The only complaint I have about the room is the thin walls. At times we

Full-service hotel, but their room-service food selections are not excellent.  Has free Internet including Wi-Fi, onsite pool, restaurants including character dining, business center, and good bell services.  The hotel is huge and the construction with the wood and giant log-feel is very home-like, and if you go in Christmas they have a 6 story tall Christmas tree inside the lobby.  Also, when visiting Disneyland it's a huge part of the experience to stay in a resort hotel (nothing closer, and can make purchasing souvenirs easier because they can deliver from the store to your room) and this is the best of the resort hotels.

Beware-if you stay in this hotel once, you'll have trouble considering staying anywhere else.  I am writing this review 18 months after staying at the DGC but I'm doing so as we have booked another DL trip for the summer and of course we are staying here.  This hotel is incredible.  The lobby is breathtaking and while the rooms aren't jaw dropping, they are nice. The only drawback we found with this hotel was the low water pressure in the shower.  Other than that, everything was great.  The self park across the street was close and easy, but for another 5.00/day you could do valet.  They stored our luggage for us until our room was ready.  We loved the food at the Storytellers Cafe.  You cannot beat how close this hotel is to DCA.  You literally walk out the door and you are

Summary Heading: Hard to top! (But, there was this ONE really bad thing...)
Summary: The lobby is spectactular!  High, beamed ceilings and immense attention to detail everywhere.  Yet, as grand as the place genuinely is, there are many cozy, intimate-feeling spaces to have a quiet break and even put your feet up.  The leather craftsman rockers by the stone fireplace are an inviting spot to have a glass of wine or beer at the end of a day at DCA/Disneyland - and there are ottomans (oh how one's feet appreciate those after a day at the parks)!  The tiny versions of these great seats in front of a little tv showing Disney cartoons is pretty adorable for the small ones, too.  The service was great, minus one REAL SERIOUS DOWNER experience we had.  My daughter had a reaction to the water in California that made her eyes puffy and itchy.  (I had the same problem - I

Stayed in a 2 bedroom villa in the Disney Vacation Club part of the hotel for three nights the weekend before Christmas.  We have stayed here multiple time since we are DVC members and have always enjoyed the hotel.  The villa is very spacious with one bedroom having one king bed and the other bedroom having 2 queen beds.  There are three bathrooms, one with a shower and the other two having a shower and bathtub.  We were on the third floor overlooking the pool and had a great view of the fireworks at Disneyland, especially nice since they play the fireworks music on one of the TV channels as well.  Nice toiletries, comfortable beds, no complaints at all on the room.  The service was good as usually.  Valet parkers are very quick to assist and very friendly.  The front desk

We stayed at the hotel 13-16 Dec, our third stay since Sep '09.  We paid extra for Downtown Disney view on this visit.  Loved the view.  However immediately discovered that the ice machine nearest our room was out of order.  Despite numerous calls to report it, it remained out of order our entire visit, requiring a long walk to get ice.  Additionally, our wifi did not work the first two days of our stay, again initial calls to report this were largely ignored.  When we did finally get wifi it was very slow.  Love this hotel but service has gone down hill dramatically.

Summary Heading: Worst hotel I have ever stayed in.
Summary: This is the worst hotel we have ever stayed in, we travelled to Disneyland 3 years ago as well but didn't stay in Disneyland.  They cancelled our room before we arrived, they had no rooms to offer, they didn't care that we had two children with us and the rooms are so overpriced and pokey.  We waited for an hour and they eventually offered two queen beds for five of us and when I refused they suggested a sleeping bag for the youngest child!  It was not a magical experience for us at this hotel that is, so expensive, and because of queues we had to walk outside Disneyland and go to our favourite restaurant Mimis every night.  I think Disney Group need to refurbish these hotels and why should you have to pay six weeks in advance upfront, no other hotel has you do that.  I would

We just returned from another 5 night stay at the Grand Californian with our two kids (5 and 2.5). Little has changed from our previous stay in November 2010, except they now charge $15 for self-park in the lot across the street.   Of the three on property hotels, this is the most upscale and most convenient in terms of location and walking distance to get to the parks. You also can't beat direct entrance to Californian adventure and avoiding the longer security and ticketing lines through the main entrance. While this entrance is supposedly for hotel guests, they don't seem to enforce this except at park opening time. In addition to shorter lines at park opening time, you have a head start to get to the Fast-pass ticketing for the World of Color preferential seating. Otherwise,

We booked a three night stay at the Military rate which I discovered was the same as the rate they were charging everyone else for this time period. Oh well, still a great property. We upgraded to the Concierge level but it's not as great as our last stay. One of the reasons I booked this was they used to reserve seats for you at most shows like Aladdin. No longer. The food was great but selection was slim and a little eclectic. Lots of non-traditional fare which makes for a difficult time with a picky 5 yr old. Additionally I think there should be a separate, lower rate for non-alcohol drinkers. I know the soft drinks and juices we enjoyed cost Disney a lot less than the large number of alcoholic beverages we saw them hand out while we were there. I felt like we were

Summary Heading: The absolute best Disney has to offer, on either coast!
Summary: We are total Disney nuts, we love Disney parks, movies, characters, and Disney Cruise Line - we love Disney! Having said that, fans are often times the most critical. On our southern California trip this past summer we stayed at all three Disneyland Resort Hotels. The Grand Californian is without a doubt the nicest, most luxurious, and the most upscale of the three hotels. From the convenience of being IN Disney's California Adventure, to the grand scale and beauty of the architecture, design of furnishings, and the caliber of staff.  The rooms are beautiful, clean, well appointed, and well maintained.  The quality of the furnishings from the rooms, to the lobby, to the loungers by the pool - everything is absolutely top notch. The pool loungers are without a doubt the nicest I

Summary Heading: Holiday weekend getaway to the Grand Californian!
Summary: We just spent 2 nights in a deluxe studio DVC room. The hotel was beautifully decorated for Christmas. Check-in was swift and as it was 8pm, our room was available. The room was very clean and quite nice, the studio has a queen bed and sofa sleeper. The sofa bed was soft, but we wish they would put 2 beds in the studio.We enjoyed the pool and watching the World of Color show from the DVC viewing deck. There was a lot of hotel security on staff which is nice since many use the hotel as a pass through to the parks from other hotels. Overall it was a great stay and we really enjoyed being so close to Disneyland and California Adventure. We wanted to book a 3rd night at the Grand, however the DVC rooms were all booked at the 7 month booking window. So we spend the 3rd night of our

This is a great place to stay. We had a deluxe room facing downtown disney. Watched the fireworks for two nites it was great. Love the Private entrance to California adventure park from hotel.  No crowds at entrance only guests allow to enter this way. Christmas tree beautiful in lobby. Its not cheap to stay there. Rest storybook rest for breakfast 60.00 for two buffet. Its better to order buffet then regular breakfast only about 7 to 8 dollars more for buffet. Don't miss the World of Color. Get a fast pass the cal.entrance to park different color passes to where you stand for show get into park early to get good color pass. We had the Fire Alarm go off 5 am they were very organized getting us out of hotel to a rest in cal adv park. Ended up only pipes broke in basement better

We stayed here for three days, and overall, we had a nice experience. The lobby is beautiful, especially when it is decorated for Christmas. The rooms are small, but since we weren't in them much anyway, it didn't matter. The reason to stay here is the location. There is simply no better place to go after a long day at Disneyland. We requested a room with a courtyard view, and we had a perfect view of the fireworks every evening. It was also very quiet, and the beds were reasonably comfortable. There was a mix-up with our bags at the bell station, and after going downstairs and standing in front of someone, they miraculously found our luggage in minutes. My two biggest complaints about the hotel are 1) the water pressure in the shower is ridiculously low. I think it would have

Traveled Dec. 5-9th.  Location is perfect.  Bell Service is prompt and quick.  Hotel was decorated with a beautiful tree and had some nice carolers.  We've stayed here before and always found the service to be great and at times awesome.  We must have caught someone on a "not so magical day" this time.  Check-in was a few quick key strokes, package handed over, and a finger pointing where we could stow our bags until the room was ready.  Nothing magical, just a check-in.  No kid delighting balloons, signed pictures, or any other little treats that were available in the past visits.  Housekeeping was okay but missed one day.  Room was quiet with no view.  While we were granted a bunk-bed request, they could not honor our request for a theme-park view.  Just wish Disney could

First off, I love this hotel.  I love the craftsman style, and the trees, the perfectly maintained grounds and the attention to detail.  The castmembers are friendly. The pools are wonderful, the kids and I go on the waterslides literally hundreds of times whenever we stay here.  The hotel and rooms are very clean.  The rooms are good but nothing special.  You can get adjoining rooms for large parties.  The location is amazing, smack right in the middle of downtown disney. You have your own entrance to CA Adventure.  You can get all kinds of food on premise or easy walking distance.  If the prices were dramatically cheaper, as in near half, i would not stay at any other hotel on my many trips to DL(Annual Passholder).  However, I dont really think the price is justified, as I

This expensive hotel is not worth its price at all, why use several hundreds of dollars each night for a hotel like this? Don't do it! This shows the real spirit of what a monster Disney has become! Daylight robbery! My stay was at least horrible! I never cried because of a hotel before, but Disney decided to ruin this vacation.   I paid 300 dollar to get a "Theme Park View", but my view was horrible and definitely not a theme park view. I was 1 person, and got a room for 5 people, with bunk beds and a view of a roof and a pool behind a big tree. The TV was mounted on the shelf/wall and was placed in front of the bunk beds, so I couldn't really watch it. I went down to the lobby and complained, because when you mark that you want a "Theme Park View", then I expect to get a theme

Summary Heading: The Way to Do Disneyland - XMAS TIME added bonus!
Summary: Beautiful great room and grounds overall, but inside and out.  The bar is warm and coxy as well.  There are two fireplaces on property, one in the actual bar and another in an alcove by the main lobby.  XMAS is a magical time to see both the parks and this hotel does it right.  They have classy holiday decor and we really enjoyed the "Caroling" in the lobby one of the nights we were there.  Great location, which you VALUE greatly after a full day at either park.  Everytime I am walking back to the hotel, I am thanking my lucky stars that I am not going to have to fight the crowds to wait for the shuttle to take me to my hotel outside the park.  By that time, it just seems you are so ready to get to your bed!  Which speaking of brings me to the negative aspects of the hotel that

Just returned from my third stay at the Grand Californian with my boyfriend. We love this place! Nothing beats staying right in the middle of the park, especially when we were running late to World of Color and got there in less than ten minutes from our hotel room. And at the end of the night, when we were exhausted and freezing, it was the best to just go up to our room! It was extra special to experience the Grand at Christmas, with the amazing tree in the lobby and all the garlands and wreaths everywhere.  Check-in staff are great and always seem eager to please. We arrived at 9:30 in the morning, so we stored our suitcase and went off to play in the parks. Love how they send a text message alerting us when our room is ready. We had a standard-view king bed room, which is

Location = A+, Room = A, Shower = D-, Value = C, Pool = A, Dining = A, Staff = A, Atmosphere = A, Extras = A, Spa = ?  We're a husband & Wife plus three kids ages 6-10. We prefer true one+ bedroom suites but they're far/few between depending on where you go and how close you want to be and then price.  We chose the Grand first for location and because the room offered a bunkbed with a trundle which sounded good to us.  Location:  Okay, you just can not beat this Hotel, period. It has a hotel guest only entrance into California Adventure as well as one into Downtown Disney. It's also very close to the entry to Disneyland itself. Because of the location to Downtown Disney, you have many more options for dining, snacks, shoping and entertainment.  Room: We stayed in room 3439 with

Summary Heading: Not a value but very good
Summary: First thing that may come to your mind-"Is this hotel worth the money?" Answer-"If you have to ask that question, stay elsewhere."  This hotel costs twice what you pay for any other Disney partner hotel-if you get it at a discount. Pay full price and it is three times what those places cost. For that extra money you get....pretty much nothing that matters. You pay for every single meal and you pay $15 a day for parking if you park it yourself, $22 a day, if they park it for you and take up your bags. Well, you do get a free copy of USA Today at your door every weekday morning and you do get free wireless internet. AND you do get the Magical Morning access to the park every day it is available, instead of once if you do a normal package. Which could mean once to three times if

Summary Heading: Not quite that Grand but a great location
Summary: My wife and I were doing a side-by-side comparison of the Disney Grand Californian with the California pioneer - the Ahwahnee at Yosemite.  Of course the Grand is about 80 years newer, great freeway access and, well, there's Disney!  So its got a lot going for it save for anything related to nature.  We stayed in a standard room (4405) that overlooked the courtyard and the monorail.  The room was nicely sized with enough room to relax and move about without tripping over each other.  The beds were comfortable with lots of pillows although the drapes and bedspread were, unfortunately, not quite up to the room price (but this is Disney!).  Our room also had a small balcony with a table and two chairs so, on a nice day, you could step outside and watch the monorails go by.  The

Summary Heading: What you are really paying for...
Summary: Ok so it is over-priced - everything Disney fits that mold. But what we paid for (in my mind) was the expectation. We knew that our car would be safe, our things would be safe, the people would be friendly, the place would be immaculate - I wanted no variables that were apt to ruin my vacation - and that is what I got. The Disney contrivances are what we were looking for for this trip! The rooms are lovely, the staff more than helpful and the best part (for those if us traveling with a 6 yr old) was having the parks right outside. Disneyland is across the "street" and California Adventure right outside the hotel. It is a great feeling knowing that if anyone suddenly got tired, we could return to the room, have a rest and then head out again.  Also, if you go during the

Staying at the Grand Californian is so convenient for a Disneyland/California Adventure visit. We traveled with our grandchildren so it was so nice to be able to just walk into the parks from the hotel. Granted the room quality left a lot to be desired...very over-priced for what you get. The staff was very attentive and helpful and the lobby was beautifully decorated for the holidays. Santa was greeting children when we arrived. .

We decided to splurge and take advantage of the off season specials Disney offers to stay here.  As previous reviewers have stated, the location can't be beat--down the elevator and around the corner to CA Adventure and a short walk through half of Downtown Disney to Disneyland.  The hotel lobby is beautifully decorated--stunning at Christmas time.  The staff is beyond friendly and helpful.  BUT, we won't be returning because the hotel failed its primary purpose--SLEEP!  The room is fine--had to ask for robes, found a dirty sock in the corner, asked every night for bunkbeds to be pushed against walls only to have them returned again the next afternoon (and this was for 5 nights!).  All of that I can overlook or let go, but, seriously, my husband and I slept so poorly it nearly

Summary Heading: Loved our stay at this hotel!
Summary: The best part about this hotel has got to be the distance from the hotel to Disneyland/California Adventure. It's just a quick walk from Downtown Disney to the parks and when you have little kids, it's well worth the extra cost.  It makes it so much easier to not have to board the tram, pack and unpack belongings, and drive to a nearby hotel.  It's beautiful inside the hotel.  Staff is extremely nice and courteous, especially since they acknowledge when you're there celebrating a birthday or special occasion.  We were welcomed throughout the hotel with friendly smiles and well wishes.  They make sure the special guest receives a birthday button, balloon, and autographed photo from your favorite Disney characters.  Our room was comfortable, clean, and equipped with a pack and

We stayed here November 28 to December 2.  Our room was on the second floor and overlooked the pool.  The negatives are that in the hall we could smell the gas from the fireplace below and the TV channels were disappointing.  The TV was almost totally Disney owned (ABC, ESPN, etc.), and Disney Vacation Club advertising.  We weren't there to watch TV, but it would have been nice to have had other options.  The positives are the friendly staff and service.  But the extras were great, too.  We loved the carolers in the lobby, Santa, and the absolutely gorgeous Christmas tree.  If anyone had told me that I would find a tree in such muted colors pretty, I would have thought them crazy, but I fell in love with it.   Of course the best part is the location.  Go out one set of doors and

Summary Heading: It's just closer. Nothing else‚Ä¶ anymore.
Summary: I 've been coming to Disneyland every year for the last ten years or so and have stayed at different hotels almost every time. When they built the GC I was so envious of the people who could afford to stay there with the private park entrance and that beautiful lobby. I thought staying there would be like a dream. Now that i can finally afford it, it feels strange to be laying here in room 5306 writing that it really isn't a dream. It's a major bummer.   Bad front counter service to begin with being ignored and generally bad additudes from the front counter employees. I wrote that off as everyone has a bad day right?  Next , we get to our room and there's an orange slice in the middle of the floor. Kinda gross but oh well stuff happens. The lobby is beautiful right? Now look

We loved staying here with our 2 year old. The service was amazing (we had just stayed at the St Regis Monarch Beach and both my husband and I agreed hands down that the DGC staff was more attentive and provided better service!). There is a fridge in the room.  The shower pressure is "green" i.e. plan on doubling your showering time due to the slow flow nature.  We were on the 6th floor and faced the entrance and it was a quiet room. There is a window by the elevator on the 6th floor that you can see fireworks from. Also there is a terrace on the 6th floor as well, where you can see the World of Color.    I would make reservations (preferred dining) in advance for character breakfasts.  We ended up going to Minnies (at the Plaza Inn) as well as the Critter breakfast at the

We spent Nov 5-11 at the Grand Californian and loved it.  We had a room with a view of the park, I though our room was very nice and clean, we had 2 queen beds and I'm sure our room had updates linens and carpet.  The free wi-fi was very slow.  Our 7yr old loved the turn down service, always excited to see what chocolates were left.  All staff we encountered were friendly and helpful.  The hotel itself is stunning, we loved the feel of it.  We thought the food at the breakfast buffet at Storytellers Cafe was good, it was expensive - but the food was hot and tasty (we went to the buffet at Goofy's Kitchen - not impressed - cold food and way too many unhealthy food choices).  The location of the hotel was great.  We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

We finished our 30th anniversary trip in Disneyland, staying on the concierge level (top floor) of the Grand Californian Hotel. The staff were VERY helpful (as my hubby had ordered a scooter for his new hip replacement comfort) and our room was very large, facing the Mickey wheel in DCA (yes, the outside deck also overlooked the pool area)! Able to plug in scooter outside room in hallway only. Direct entrance to DCA and Downtown Disney were wonderful. The food available from 0630 - 2200 h in the common room by the elevators (inclued in your room price) was an added bonus that was plentiful and tasty. Dine inside or outside on the deck overlooking the Monorail track.  Many services available for booking dining and shows in both of the parks was appreciated ... we'll stay here

Our annual stay at this hotel is a family tradition we truly enjoy.  Easy access to the Disney parks and Downtown Disney district are worth the expense for this first class property.  The rooms are well appointed and comfortable, with nice amenities for the bath.  The small terrace balconies allow you to relax for a few minutes and take in the view of the parks or the pools.  Check-in is easy and all employees are friendly and helpful.  The hotel's lobby is also a nice place to sit and relax, with many places to sit, including rocking chairs facing the large fireplace.

The hotel lobby makes a wonderful first impression and the room didn't let us down.  We found the room spacious, clean, and comfortable.  The only downside was how long the trek was from the elevator the room -- it felt like a maze that went on forever, but well worth it once inside.  The bed was super comfortable with nice linens. The products supplied (shampoos & such) were high quality.  Even though we didn't pay extra for a view room we looked onto the back of Calif Adventure -- which was super because we could hear the charming music -- but thankfully only when we chose to crack the slider door. When the door was closed it was silent.  The staff lived up to reviews too.  Only area we had slightly slow service was in the Hearthside Lounge.  We would go back soon. HIghly

We've been staying at the Grand at least once a year since it opened years ago!  The Concierge lounge is perfect----great service and fantastic selection of food throughout the day.  Worth the price because we end up not spending money on food at the park unless we are celebrating a special occasion.  The rooms are small but works for a family of five like mine.  Excellent location---always a pleasure to stay here!
Best hotel we have ever stayed at.  Great for families of course. View of California Adventure was awesome.  Location to Downtown Disney was great and the pools were terrific!

The rooms are tiny, over priced, dark and a bit run down. The food at the restaurants were very below average and very expensive. I cannot confirm it but I am 95% sure I received food poisoning from the Napa Restaurant. The location, lobby and staff are excellent but I will not be returning to the Grand Californian unless they complete a major overhaul and bring in some better chefs. The food was just horrible at the lounge, storytellers cafe and napa. The hotel feels really over crowded as well not a 4-star experience by any stretch.

Summary Heading: Terrific location to Theme Parks & Downtown Disney
Summary: Perfect location if you have young children & want to visit Disneyland primarily.  You have a chance to eat with the characters in the morning at Storyteller's Cafe & you can go to Disneyland @ 7am on certain days to avoid the crowds.  Downtown disney is right outside the hotel where there is a good variety of restaurants.  One drawback is everything is higher priced so you pay for this convenience.  We also walked to Coco's Bakery Cafe a short distance from the hotel for a reasonably priced place to eat.  Don't need a car while there and we rode the Disneyland Express to & from LAX and also took a bus to Universal Studios...picked up right at the hotel..very convenient.  Very pleasant personnel encountered.

I was scheduled for two treatments. A 50 minute massage and a hair and scalp treatment. From start to finish my two treatments were only 40 minutes long. I thought it felt short but didn't realize just how short it was until I went and got my phone to see what time it was. My massage was at 11am and I was back in the lounge area at 11:40. Unacceptable when you are spending that kind of money and expect a certain level of service. Also, the front desk ladies were extremely rude when I told them about my experience. I was very kind about it and just wanted someone to be aware about what happened.  The spa itself is nice but is extremely small. There is one waiting area and it's for both men and women. It only has two benches for waiting. The woman's area is extremely small with a

I paid a FORTUNE for our room because I wanted my nephew to have the same Disney experience that my niece had.  It is a lovely hotel, but there were no Disney "touches".  There was one picture of Snow White in our room and that was it.  Parking was $15/day, and across the street at that.  Disneyland and Downtown Disney were a bit of a walk (not bad), but the one super-plus was that California Adventure was literally next door to our room.  And we could even see the ferris wheel from the balcony!  We were in room 5344.  ZERO water pressure in the shower - forget washing out the conditioner.  :(

Summary Heading: WOW is all we can say
Summary: What a hotel - if you want the best whilst staying at Disneyland this is the place. From the time we arrived we could not have asked anymore from the friendly staff members that we dealt with.  There was five of us travelling and we were upgraded to a suite which interlink our three rooms which was greta - our room was huge with a lounge , kitchen area , bathroom , bedroom and large balcony - it was the best.   We only had to walk out of our room , down the elevator and walked straight down to Disneyland which was only a five minute - PERFECT.   Best position , best staff , amazing to look at on a grand scale - we cannot wait to take our grandson there in two years time as we will definitely be staying here the whole time it is worth paying that little bit more.

We didn't know what to expect after reading previous reviews but we were pleasantly surprised. The staff were friendly and made us feel welcome. Our accommodation was clean and spacious and had everything we needed. The coffee bar is great with a nice homely feeling and we experienced no service problems. The location is excellent, close enough to the parks and great for downtown disney. The pool area was lovely and the sunbeds were so comfortable I didn't want to move.

Summary Heading: A fabulous place that really yells wow!
Summary: We were first not sure if this hotel would be value for money. We were greated upon arrival with personal service. We walked in the foyer and wow! We were with two children aged 9 and 11. They loved it. The staff were professional, helpful and we have just recievef post cards from the pinochio club. The pool was fabulous and the life guards were very switched on. Would not hesitate to stay again. If you are traveling from Australia. Do it. Perfect location, wonderful staff and plenty of choices for dining. Not to mention a hop into down town disney. We were worried from some reviews but they must have had there eyes shut. Excellent stay!

Once again, the Grand Californian did not disappoint. Although it is quite pricey, if you can afford it-- it's worth every penny.   Perfectly located in the heart of Downtown Disney, you can walk to everything.   The Story Teller's Cafe is a great place to eat. The menu is great with many healthy choices for children and adults. Reasonably priced.  Our kids loved the pools. I think there were 3. One had slides that the kids loved.  The Napa Rose is an amazing upscale restaurant with beautiful ambiance and the food and drinks are fantastic. Pricey, but good. Dress is a bit more formal than other restaurants.  Terrific cocktails in the downstairs bar.  Great customer service.   My only complaint is that the lobby is about 60 degrees and freezing. It would be lovely to have a

Summary Heading: Have stayed many times - they are improving!
Summary: We stay here about 5 - 8 times a year.  I have given them poor reviews in the past for cleanliness and service issues, but this time, I must say that they have improved!  Granted, we stayed on a less-than-busy Sunday/Monday, but things are looking up here!  While check-in was slow (waited about 10 minutes with 5 people working and only three of us in line) I sort of expect that from them now.  They have a lot of people seemingly standing around doing very little!  Also, upon check-out I wanted to switch my form of payment.  The front desk girl went to the back and was gone for (I kid you not) 8 minutes!!!  When she came back she told me she just needed to fill out some paperwork, which was taking even longer.  I told her "never mind" and went on my way!    We had booked a

I stayed here last week with my 3 yr old daughter-we arrived Tues night and left Thurs-I had booked a premium park view room-our view was basically the tree tops-nothing to see in the park except the glow of some lights-needless to say disappointing.  The room was your average hotel room-a queen size bed with a bunk bed and a trundle-you could easily sleep a family of 5.
