It is a bit expensive for what you get but you are paying for the location-we had direct access into Disney adventure park.  Dinner at Napa Rose with friends was very good--the lobby had story time in the evening which was nice.  It's Disney-nothing more nothing less.

Just arrived back from four nights at the Grand Californian Hotel. We returned to this property after such a positive experience last year. We booked our family vacation (2 adults, 1 10 year old) at this beautiful hotel. Cast members go out of their way to ensure your stay is a happy one: pin trading, great breakfast in the Storytellers cafe, early entry into California Adventure and special attention for those special occasions like birthday celebrations. Clean, convenient and fun for the whole family. Great pool and hot tub!

We take family trips to Disneyland every year or two and decided to do a split stay between Embassy Suite and the Grand Californian on or last trip.  On the positive side, the Grand Californian is an absolutely goregeous hotel. The pools are fantastic and the private entrance to California Adventure is a wonderful benefit. We took regular advantage of the proximity to Downtown Disney, as well as the on-site food locations.  The downsides, especially when comparing it to Embassy Suites (which we obviously did staying at both places on the same trip) are quite obvious: the room itself, the lack of the included hot breakfast and the price.  As Disney lovers, at the right price, we would absolutely stay at the GC again. But that said, our upcoming trip will be at the Embassy Suites.

If you can stay here while at Disney do it.  You won't be disappointed.  The lobby is absolutely stunning!  The staff did a great job giving us a room with a fantastic view when we requested it at check in.   We didn't get to enjoy the pool, however, this place is conveniently located for Downtown Disney and both Disney Parks.  We only stayed three days and wished we could have stayed a few more to enjoy the hotel.

My husband, 4 year old daughter and I stayed here for 5 nights at the end of our 5 week USA holiday.  It was suppose to be the icing on the cake after a wonderful holiday.  We paid more than $3,000 and I will honestly say that it was one of the worst places (the other was in Tuscon) we stayed on our holiday (we drove over 3,500 miles around the west coast).   We booked & prepaid from Australia for a premium view room and were looking forward to seeing the park from our balcony.  Upon entering our room on level 3 we were very disappointed to say the least.  Rooms are small, well worn and drab -certainly don‚Äôt warrant the price paid.  You are paying for location.  There was still rubbish in the bathroom bin, crumbs on the desk and most importantly I paid all that money for a room

Stickley furniture in the lobbies, piano, great bar, balconies, lovely toiletries, comfortable beds? Yes, PLEASE. Disney gets it right with this hotel with a private entrance into California Adventure! The service is impeccable, the pool is a blast. It's Disney for grownups and it's *fantastic*.

Summary Heading: Grand Cal: great service, great food, great location
Summary: Stayed here 3.5 days for business conference.   received VIP check in, which means no waiting in lines to check in. You have a personal attendant take you to your room, answer questions and then they just take your info in the room and give you a VIP concierge 24 hour number. Nice touch after traveling.   ROOM:  5th floor room (5012) seemed like a long-ish trip from elevator to room, but learned a shorter way later. (This part of hotel is a big square, so you can walk all the way around it.) Good size room: 2 queen beds, dresser/ tv area, small desk w/ two chairs, table btw the beds.   Room was very clean, usually high traffic hotels have spots on the carpet, dust, etc. This was impeccable. everything was clean & smelled clean. Slightly older feel matched with the Frank Lloyd

Stayed here for two nights in a view room on the concierge level(extra $150 or so a night). Flat out, this is more than I would ever pay for a room like this (about $700 a night), but...it's Disneyland and none of the usual rules apply. We kind of just lumped the room cost in with the whole trip and didn't get hung up over it.   Now, the good. First, the location is unbeatable. Second, service is perfect--especially with the extra cost of the concierge lounge/level/treatment. We did make good use of it: snacks, evening desserts, evening drinks...and pretty much all we wanted. Was it worth the extra cost? For two adults and three kids, yeah probably, but I'm sure others would say different. It's really relative to each family. Third, it really was nice staying there. There are

Best place on Earth during the holiday season and everyday... Disney Resort in Anaheim, CA. It has fantastic hotels -our favorite is Grand Californian- and the prices are NOT much different from ordinary hotels in the area. It is in the heart of all the fun: Disneyland & California Adventure. Its restaurants are splendid in all aspects. Their wine place is a bit expensive but for very valid reasons (exquisite wines). Just a few steps away is Downtown Disney for those night-lifers and those big on shopping, eclectic dining, and lively shows/dancing!

Summary Heading: Loved it, can't wait to come back!!
Summary: I loved this place. In terms of location and service, it doesn't get any better. Yes it is pricey, but aside from that, it is perfect. And to be so close to it all is so worth it. I can't count how many times my husband and I said to each other how happy we were that we were close by. No back packs needed, just nip back to the hotel when jackets needed etc. My kids loved the cartoons in the lobby, and the chocolates each night! When we come back to Disneyland, this is where we will stay!!

We had room 5447 in the Grand Californian - which was what they called Downtown Disney view - but they should have called it Disneyland View.  We could not see anything of the park but trees and the top of the Matterhorn but it was amazing to watch the fireworks from the balcony.  The only 'bad' experience we had was one day when 'security' was doing something to the door card readers and then we were locked out of our room.  We went to the front desk and got brand news cards but they still did not work and we were still locked out.  Someone from the front desk came up and gave us each one fast pass for any ride except Star Tours.  They made us feel like they cared whether we were satisfied with what they tried to do to make us happy.  If you are going to try to eat at the

After many trips to Disneyland and staying at various hotels on Harbor Blvd, we decided to "splurge" and stay a few nights at the Grand.  After reading other reviews, I tried to keep my expectations of the room itself reasonable and I must say I was still disappointed. This was by far the smallest hotel room my family has ever stayed in. We had a standard view room (parking lot view) with 1 queen and bunk beds. I can't imagine how little space there would be if we had 2 queens!  There's very little Disney magic inside the room; a Snow White picture on the wall, hidden Mickeys in the carpet, and a Bambi shower curtain.  Other reviews try to justify the lackluster room by making statements like, "You don't come to Disneyland to stay in the hotel room".  I agree but at $350 a

The Good: Disney's Grand Californian Hotel & Spa is a beautiful old hotel within walking distance of Disneyland and has an exclusive entrance to Disney California Adventure Park.  We received excellent customer service from the valet and room service personnel.  Our 3 year old daughter is at the age where Disney princesses and fairies are all she talks about so we wanted her first visit to Disneyland to be memorable. We called a month in advance of our stay and made reservations for a room with two queen beds and the Concierge Service upgrade because we thought we would need someone who knows the ins and outs of Disneyland to guide us to the most appropriate attractions and sights for a 3 year old. Robert, the sales rep, assured us this would be a memorable experience and

Putting aside the spectacular rooms, views, restaurants, staff and ambiance, the best feature of the Grand Californian is definitely the location.  The hotel abuts California Adventure and Downtown Disney and boasts a very brief walk into Disneyland.    Within the hotel, guests will find a full service spa, a myriad of pools and a gym.  The decor cannot be beat.    While all the rooms are outstanding, it is absolutely worth throwing down a little extra cash to secure a park view or Downtown Disney view (which may provide views of the fireworks in Disneyland park).
Great hotel to stay in if you want to go to Disney Land or CA adventure. Very convenient; little old style but kids loved it.  Should try it for sure.

Summary Heading: Worst service I have ever experienced better of going to Hawaii, its clear they just want your money not interested in making yo
Summary: Worst service Disney is like Christmas Just all merchandise and marketing employees could care less about your stay, go to Hawaii where service is still a word people recognize

If you're going to do Disneyland you have to stay here!  The location on it's own is worth the money - going to the parks is very tiring and if you can crawl back to the hotel within minutes then that'll do for me!  From arrival to departure it was perfect.  The staff were extremely helpful and the only downside was that we were only here for 3 nights.  One of the best things was the luxurious loungers by the pool.... very difficult to leave them and go to those parks!!!

My family of four went to Disneyland to celebrate my youngest daughter's 5th birthday in February 2011.  We were looking for a nice hotel with a great location, and this is the best location one can get.  The lobby is breathtaking and dramatic - great first impression.  We arrived a little early for check in, so the front desk gave us a pager and they said they would page us when our room was ready.  30 minutes later we were paged and we were on our way.  Very impressed with the check in experience.  We booked a standard room with two double beds with a view of the parking lot.  If you keep your expectations in check, you will not be disappointed.  The point of Disneyland is not to sit in your room, but to get out and do things.  The room was a bit small, in need of a

Summary Heading: Good,  but not the happiest place on earth!
Summary: My family of four stayed at the Grand California Hotel for my daughter and husband's birthday. We have stayed at the hotel in the past and it would be hard to stay anywhere else due to the perfect proximity to the theme parks and Downtown Disney. We used the pool facilities which we enjoyed very much. We ordered room service for breakfast and thought it was a reasonable price and delicious. The only reason I wouldn't give this hotel a 5 pt. rating is because when we first arrived in our room the bathroom smelled of mold. It was very strong and unpleasant. We figured out it was the shower curtain liner and it appeared that the bathroom fan was not operating. The next day requested that housekeeping replace it. This did not happen so my husband called the front desk and requested

As you can tell, this hotel is the best for its Disney parks location,  after a long day or if you get soaked on one of the rides the conveniance of this hotel is well worth the cost.  This is our second stay here,  friendly staff,  great housekeeping (very clean & organised), no lines for the lifts to the rooms, right there for all the Downtown Disney shopping and food too. My one and only complaint of this hotel is the dinner buffett at the Storytellers Cafe......Warning do not waste your money,  there is absolutly no variety, the salad was greens only, not one tomato or onion in sight,  they had mac n cheese, some lame meatballs and carved turkey YUK... we complained to the manager and he rolled his eyes at us, he had not one thing to say.  The staff are really unhappy there,

I recently travelled from Australia and stayed at the Grand Californian with just mysellf and two sons (aged 7 and 6). I was extremely impressed with the hotel. The hotel was very modern. You couldn't ask for a better position....perfectly located between the two parks and Downtown Disney. The pools were great, if not a little cool out of the water in September. We had breakfast twice at Storytellers Cafe, which provided the character experience for the kids. The food there was ok, without being great. The parks themselves were fantastiic. My only complaint was that Pirattes Of The Caribbean and the big rollercoaster at California Adventure were closed for maintenance (one visit was on a Saturday). My only word of caution to potential visitors would be to think very hard about

Summary Heading: Great place to visit, but not to stay...
Summary: This is a fabulous hotel, located right on Disney Walk and with a back entrance directly into California Adventure.  The Grand Californian is a must-stop on any of our family's many trips to Disneyland (usually in Fall or Winter as we are Southern Californian.  Who wants to stand in endless lines in August's triple digit weather?)  The lobby is spectacular with a large fireplace (again a great place to sit and relax in Fall or Winter) and the Storyteller's Cafe for dinner is a family tradition.  BUT the only time we stayed overnight we were surprised at the tiny rooms.  The pool is nice, but seriously--are you going to Disneyland to use the pool?  By all means, enjoy the ambiance of the Grand Californian...but stay a block away at any of the non-Disney hotels where you can get

Summary Heading: Not the Best for the Money
Summary: My husband and I spent a few days at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel.  This trip was to be a short and fun get-a-way without children.  As other reviewers have stated the lobby is nice, pool is nice, close proximity to Disney Parks is nice, the room was clean, good bed, and when we arrived at the hotel at 11:00 a.m., we fully expected to just check-in our baggage and return for the 3:00 p.m. check-in.  But we were pleasantly surprised that the hotel had a room available for immediate check-in which was great.    Our negatives were, for the high price and expense, the room had extremely low shower pressure; our room was an end unit located over Downtown Disney and therefore the people, street bands, etc., were loud until at least 10:00-12:00 p.m.  One night there was some sort

We stayed here a few nights to celebrate our grandsons 4th birthday. The best location for a visit to Disneyland.  We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel last year & liked this hotel more. The large pool has a water-slide that  was enjoyed by us all. A respite from the heat & crowds. The restaurants were better than what you'll find in the park, of course. Don't try to find a really good cup of coffee in the park but you can get one here (& the New Orleans benyay place in Disneys shopping strip). Ask for a room close to the elevators other wise your room could be a very long way a-w-a-y!  Beautiful lobby, reminiscent of Ahwanee Hotel in Yosemite, cute little rockers for small ones to watch Disney cartoons while adults check in.

Summary Heading: Perfect location for visiting Disney parks
Summary: This hotel is in the best location of any hotel near the Disney parks. There is a short pathway right out the hotel into California Adventure, and only a short walk to Disneyland. With Downtown Disney right outside your door, there is so much to do and many dining options. It was expensive but worth the cost if you are spending a couple days at Disney so you can come back and take breaks, and would be especially key if you had kids.  My husband and I had reserved a king size bed but when we arrived all they had left was a queen with a bunk bed. If we had family with us it would have been perfect but instead we had to squeeze into a smaller bed than we are used to for two nights. It was comfortable and we were so tired from being at the parks all day but it was a bit of a pain

As expected, customer service is top notch and there's easy access to California Adventure and downtown Disney (restaurants and shopping), Disneyland is within easy walking distance. If you're willing to pay top dollar for location and service, then the cost is worth it. It's not as impressive or as magical as the parks or even the cruise lines. Where the cruiselines offer bigger rooms and there is the exclusive  Disney island that makes the Disney cruise line more expensive, there's nothing aside from location and the name that makes California Grand extraordinary to pay $400 a night for a standard room (at least in my opinion) compared to the other Disney hotels that are cheaper (Disney Hotel and Paradise Pier). The lobby is rustic and grand. The rooms are adequate and well

I have been a passholder for about 4 years. I have passed by and through this hotel countless times, often for their back door into CA Adv or perhaps for their restrooms. Just walking past it in DT Disney has always made want to stay here. Unfortunately, their rates have always kept me away (I only live about 20 miles away). So when they offered 40% off for a special event, I decided to take the plunge.  The location simply cannot be beat. You are literally on top of CA Adventure, and a very short walk to the monorail (which also opens early for the Magic Morning you get as a hotel guest). And the service and decor is very good. Perhaps the most shocking thing is that they even have free wi-fi.  The also have a very nice and large pool complex, with multiple pools and a large

Summary Heading: Best Disney Hotel We have Visited
Summary: I dont have a lot of comparison among Disney hotels but have stayed at 3 properties in Disney World and Disney's Grand Californian. A Californian at heart who loves the rich heritage of this state I must say I am a sucker for the Arts & Crafts style Grand Californian.   My family has stayed here 4 times over the past 8 years and each stay was better than the last. From the valet service, to the personal greeters who escort you through the lobby and check-in process to the bell service and beyond.   Beautiful lobby, nice bar, great pool and a good night's sleep.   Planning on enjoying the chaos of a Disney weekend? Treat yourself and your family to a stay at the Grand Californian.

We stayed here for two nights on  our recent Disneyland trip.  The hotel is beautiful and the magic starts when you pull up.  Your car doors are opened and you are welcomed by name, you step out and a representative is waiting to take you to the registration to check in.  The front deck CM was happy to help out with our requests and when I asked what type of view we had, he explained we had been upgraded to a California Adventure theme park view.  That was great.  The kids had the bunk beds and didn't fight about where to sleep.  We could watch World of Color from our balcony and you get a special admittance into California Adventure.  The only problem was that when you are in your room with the balcony door open, it is so loud.  The kids loved the rotating showerhead too.  We

We've stayed for a couple of nights at GC, and loved every moment!!! From the friendly check in, quiet and  spacious room. Great amenities! The pool had a good slide, and some recluse ones where you can relax too! The back entrance to California Adventure park make it easy to go to and from the park, so we could enjoy the pool before returning to the park to night fireworks!

Disney is known for it's world class service and the Grand Californian doesn't disappoint.  We live in So Cal and have annual passes for Disneyland so we spend quite a bit of time at the Disneyland resort throughout the year.  As parents of a 3 year old and 14 month old, we love the convenience that the Grand Californian offers.  The lobby is beautiful and the pool area is great.  We especially like the room with the bunk beds.  The only reason that I wouldn't rate this hotel a 5, is the price.  It's hard to stomach the high price sometimes, but in the end, we are willing to pay for two reasons - the service and the location.

My family and I stay at the Grand Californian every September. This our third year and we definitely will return next year. The lobby is very welcoming with large fireplace, rocking chairs, Mission Style furniture and warm arts & crafts style Tiffany lamps.   The guest rooms are large, well appointed with newer carpet, nice furnishings, triple sheeted bedding. Families might enjoy a room with two double beds or one double bed and a bunk bed. There are also connecting rooms available. The rooms are equipped with very good black out curtains, and are very quiet, which made for an effective nap time.   My family really enjoyed the pool area. There are three main pools, a kiddie pool, two hot tubs and also two water slides. Beverages and snacks are served in the pool area by wait

Summary Heading: Can't say enough great things about this hotel!
Summary: I have stayed at the GCH twice (September 2010 and May 2011) and both experiences were EXCELLENT! We will definitely be staying here on our next trip to Disneyland! We typically frequent Walt Disney World, Florida and feel that GCH is hands-down a better resort (in every aspect) compared to any of the Florida resorts. It is very well kept, staff are friendlier and more knowledgeable, and it has an amazing location to everything Disney...Disneyland, California Adventure, and Downtown Disney! We flew out to California specifically for the Disney "experience" and were not disappointed in our decision. (We loved it so much that we had to return in May of this year to do it again!) The hotel is large but I find that most Disney resorts can be a little confusing the first time around.

Summary Heading: We had a fantastic view watching The Wonderful World of Color!!
Summary: My BFF is a Disney Vacation Club member so when we were planning to spend two days at Disneyland, she wanted to stay at the Grand Californian Villas.   She got a two bedroom suite which was just fantastic.  It was on the fifth floor and we had the best view of California Adventure and both evenings watched The Wonderful World of Color.  Besides each bedroom having a shower, there was also a full bathroom next to the kitchen.  That made it so easy when the four of us were getting ready in the morning.   Being so close to both parks and Downtown Disney was a big plus.  Lots of choices for eating.   The suite had a full kitchen, dining area and living room.  Each bedroom had a private balcony which was great for viewing.   When we arrived at the hotel, I noticed the lobby area

Summary Heading: Fun Trip But You'll need Funds Too
Summary: We decided to splurge and stay at the Grand because we had both a toddler (age 3) and an infant (age 7 months) with us.  Knowing full well that it would be very convenient for naps and getting to and from the two parks we stayed here during the first week in October, 2011.  The cost was about 2 to 4 times what you would pay for a hotel on the outskirts.  We did get a 30% discount and a 10% AAA discount so that helped some.  They accommodated our request to update our reservations when the discount rates (came out only a month before our trip) were announced.  You have to keep looking to see if these specials are available at the Disneyland web site.  There‚Äôs not many ways to get a discount it seems at the resort hotels except for these specials in off season.  We were a party of

Summary Heading: Plan extra time for a shower
Summary: Overall we were impressed with this hotel. The rooms were clean, the interior of the hotel itself was impressive, but I wouldn't say I was 'wowed' by anything. My biggest complaint was the water pressure. Good grief. I felt like my 7 minute shower turned into a 18 minute shower. I don't know if this was in the whole hotel, or if it was just our room, but it was not a great way to start my day. The turndown service with chocolates was wonderful for the kids, they were impressed. There were no staff members who went out of their way or were overly friendly, I was kind of shocked by this after all I had heard about Disneyland. The location was key I think. If someone was paying the big bucks because they wanted to be so close to the parks, then I'd stay here, but if you're thinking

Very convenient. Spacious clean rooms. Friendly cast members. I used my military discount. Its 40% off. The only minus was the cost of parking. $22.00 for valet and $15.00 for self parking a day. I don't know if this is average for the area? Seemed high to me. My daughter who is 23 months old liked playing in the room more then the parks. I would definitely stay here again with the discount.

We stayed three nights at the Grand and it lived up to its name.We were on the fifth floor.The room was very nice turn down every night with chocolates. A nice touch.The hotel itself speaks for itself.Starting with a beautiful lobby the  great pools.It rained for two days that we stayed there but no problem as the hotel was so nice you didnt mind spending time at the hotel.We ate at the hotel two times had the smorg once and ordered off the menu once both times were very good.The pool loungers were the best we ever sat on.Pure comfort.So in closing it is a pricey hotel but worth it.

We stayed here for a total of 5 days and everyday was awesome! We were a group of 5 and when we booked we were told they would try to get us a premium park or pool view and with bunk beds. That didn't happen and we were never promised that. So we didn't have those expectations in our mind and thus were not let down or angry. Our room overlooked the front of the hotel and we had some very nice sunsets. It was 2 queen beds and a comfy sleeper. We choose to have concierge service, it was worth every penny. On our 1st day we pulled up and valet was so helpful and explained everything to us, we didn't have our kids with us as we were trying to surprise them. So we knew we might not get our room right away. Surprise!! At 11:30am when we arrived our room was ready!! We walked right up

I just got back from a short 3 night stay with my mom and my 10 year old daughter. Our room was clean, updated, and a decent size. I ordered room service for breakfast one morning, and they gave so much food (I had ordered 2 fruit plates with carrot bread), that we ate the second half of the food the next day. The pools and hot tubs were clean, and I loved that there were 3 lifeguards at the waterslide pool. I had a small issue with being given a pool view room vs the premium park view room I had paid for through Disneyland travel. The guest services supervisor told me she would sort it out with Disneyland travel and call me back, and surprisingly she did within 5 minutes, and I was very happy with their solution. The direct park and Downtown Disney access made the big price tag

Summary Heading: Great location, but good old Disneyland Hotel a better choice
Summary: Stayed at Grand Californian for a change of pace with two kids and high expectations, thinking that it would be a level above the Disneyland Hotel experience (and because the DH is having serious construction).  Overall the GC is more expensive, harder to navigate, more limited food choices (why can't there be a Coffee House like the DH?), and haughty staff.  The promised bunk beds weren't available, a big disappointment but somehow a cheery "sorry!" should make up for it on a 3 nite stay...  This is a hotel with an identity crisis, really strange for a Disney property.

It was a very nice hotel! It was right where you wanted to be to get to Disneyland. Our room very clean and the kids had bunk beds. It was beautiful on the outside and the lobby was amazing! The staff were kind and and it was a very pleasant experience! Our family loved it and I would recommend it to anyone wanting to visit Disneyland. (the pool is really good,the kids enjoyed it!)

Summary Heading: Lovely hotel but unable to accomodate the crowd well
Summary: Lovely lobby area and room.  Mattress was comfy and the bathroom was very clean.  We had almost no water pressure in the shower on the first day.  I couldn't get the soap out of my hair without rinsing in the sink.  After a call to the front desk, it seemed better the next day but was still not what I would expect when spending so much money for a room.  The crowds were horrible at check-in (very very slow) and valet parking was a disaster when we attempted to get the car at checkout.  It took about 30 minutes and then when the car finally arrived it was parked in what ended up being the part of the driveway blocked by other valet cars and the Disney bus.  We waited another 15 -20 minutes just to get out of the driveway.  When paying $22/day for parking, I expected better

Summary Heading: Best Hotel in Anaheim & Disney - Direct access to the park
Summary: Although the GC is Disney‚Äôs most upscale Anaheim hotel, it is the hotel‚Äôs direct and early pre-general admission access to the park that makes it most worth the additional price.  Done in the theme and design of the great WPA National Park lodges, the hotel has grand public spaces, great guest rooms, and attentive service.  The wonderful swimming pools offer the perfect mid-day respite from the worst crowds the Parks attract.  Many rooms overlook the fireworks.

We had never been to Disneyland. This is the only Hotel I would stay at if on a return trip .  You are at the Park. There is a special entrance from the hotel to the park. You go out the door and are in the park. Nothing could be easier.  The only thing I would say negative is there is no "Disney feeling in the hotel." It has a beautiful loby, the room are a nice size and very clean. The hotel staff is excellent.

While this is a very pricey hotel, worth every penny! The rooms are clean, excellent customer service, best location for a Disney vacation! You may pay more staying here but your getting prime location, early park entrance, private entrance to California Adventure park, and saving on time. When your staying this close to the parks you don't waste any time taking buses to the parks. If you get a chance to stay here I highly recommend it! It's a full experience from beginning to end and we were extremely pleased with our stay here!

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel right in the parks
Summary: My family had three rooms, one being a handicap room. We had adjoining rooms for one room to the handicap room and the third room right next door. We were on the main floor with large patio doors in all 3 rooms. Staff are friendly, service oriented and efficient to Disney standards. The pool area is beautiful with two pools and two hot tubs. This is great as the one pool is set up for kids with water slides and the other one with cabanas to rent on the sides is more adult focus. We had a lovely outside area right by our rooms with patio furniture and big bar b ques to use. On site gust laundry is clean and the machines all in good working order. Being right in the park allowed us to return to our rooms throughout the day to rest and relax when the parks were too busy or it got

Summary Heading: In need of an update, but still very nice
Summary: We have stayed at the Grand Californian many times over the past 7 years, and have always thoroughly enjoy our stay.  We had five guests in our room and they provided us with an oversize room with a daybed which was very convenient.  The staff are always very accommodating, and the public spaces are remarkable as always.     I would usually rate this hotel a 5 star experience, however not much has changed in terms of updating the rooms since we first started visiting this hotel.   My only negatives this stay were the shower pressure and the slightly rundown appearance of the room. It took twice as long to shower, a combination of a water conserving shower head and dismal water pressure.  Also the room, decor and furniture are starting to appear a little dated.  The beds and

I enjoyed staying at this hotel with my husband and two kids (5 and 7) for three nights. The lobby and pool are fantastic.  The pool is so warm that you can swim in it at night time which was a great way to end our days.  The rooms are a bit dated but are overall clean and the staff were all helpful and friendly.  Yes, the shower does not have good water pressure but so do most hotels that I have stayed at in America (it is supposed to help the environment).  I had no problem with the hair dryer.  My hair looked great after using it. You can always bring your own hairdryer if that is a problem.  The food at the Storytellers Cafe is the best at Disney and after going there once the staff knew what we liked to drink and gave us those cute Mickey waffles to eat.  It is really the

My husband and I followed my daughter's family down to Disneyland and could not stay at their hotel as it was booked.  Decided to splurge at the Grand Californian Hotel and we could not have been happier.  We booked a premium room and they upgraded us to a premium view overlooking the pool.  We are glad we chose that side as it was peaceful and relaxing.  The music played from the pool was soothing and relaxing too.  We got a queen with a bunk bed because we wanted to have the grandkids come to our room to take naps.  Loved the room the bunk room provided as another bed would have not given us the floor space this room did.  The amenities and service of this hotel were 4 star as far as I would rate it.  Loved being able to have a private entrance for hotel guests to the

Summary Heading: Poor water pressure, hair dryer with no power
Summary: I stayed here for a work conference, and I was less than impressed. The common areas are beautiful, but I don't use the common areas. I care about bed quality, water pressure, hair dryer power, and seating in the room. The water pressure was horrible. The chairs in the room were maybe 18" wide. The hair dryer had hardly any power. The bed was not bad. The location is good if you like to shop. For the disabled, there is a third party who offers scooters for $40 per day. Service is extraordinary.

My family stayed here a couple of nights before switching over to the Paradise Pier.  I wish we could have spent our whole vacation here!  The hotel is beautiful and reminds me a lot of Wilderness Lodge in Disney World.  It has an adult feel while still maintaining the Disney family appeal.  The grounds are beautiful and well maintained.  The pool area is so inviting and relaxing.  It has a private entrance to the California Adventure Park and backs up to Downtown Disney.  One night we were craving ice cream, and in 2 minutes, we were at the ice cream shop. It was very convenient.  The room was wonderful! We had a 1 bedroom to fit everyone.  It was spacious and had everything I have come to expect from Disney.  There was a full kitchen complete with dishes and appliances.  There

This really is a quite a unique hotel experience. Aspects are either fantastic or terrible, there is very little in-between except in the end you end up with average. The hotel is in a fantastic location v the room size and furnishings are terrible. The service is fantastic v the food quality is terrible. The pool area is fantastic v the pool service and food Terrible. The Kids Club and general staff attitude is fantastic v the cost of everything is terrible. Thus overall you end up with average.   As our family (me, wife 9yo & 5yo) had traveled from Sydney Australia for a California holiday Disneyland was always going to be on our agenda. We wanted to stay at the best Disney property thus selected the DGCH, as a one off this hotel is a good choice. If you need more room for

We were expecting a world class experience. When we arrived our rooms had black mold in them. Because they were not able to move us into similar rooms because of being sold out, they came with bleach. It took them 2 days to clear the mold. The front desk was not helpful, nor was their senior management. Though this location is close to the park, the conditions of the hotel outweigh the short distance. We will use other accommodations in the future.

Summary Heading: Was prepared to expect the worst but pleasantly surprised.
Summary: So we decided to do to Disneyland for Memorial Day weekend and I was really stressed out because have of the reviews for the surrounding hotels were bad and half were good. I will say, if you can afford to stay at the Grand Californian then (for me) it's worth the money. Now be prepared, there are a lot of people running crazy but I would classify it as organized chaos. I was a bit irratated that I arrived at the allotted time and had to wait and hour for my room but the room was wonderful. I chose the king bed-premium view with a park view. (I wouldnt classify the view as premium..lol) but the room was lovely. I think the highlight of my time was the morning and midday cleaning service and the chocolates left on my bed.....not to mention the amazing room service. I ordered

Though the decorating is lovely and the location ideal, this hotel leaves a lot to be desired.  First, you can't reserve a room by its beds, only by the view.  If you call ahead and someone guarantees you two queens, you'll probably still end up with bunkbeds.  Which leads me to the next problem:  though the mattresses and pillows were brand new, they were poor quality and hideously uncomfortable.  Even my husband, who happily sleeps on pull-out couches, tossed and turned all night.  Next, the very expensive food is poor quality with one notable exception:  the hot chocolate is wonderful.  Despite that delicious beverage, I'll be looking for a different hotel next time we visit Disneyland.
The hotel is first rate, with great rooms and amenities.  The cost of course is very high, but then you expect that with a Disney property.

We just got back from 9 nights at the Grand Californian and we loved it.  The location can't be beat, our 2 children are almost 4 and 7, so it was great for us to be able to head back to the room of an afternoon for a rest, before heading back to the parks of an evening.  Our room was very clean, had views of the pool and theme park and came with bunk beds which our kids loved.  The staff were very friendly and helpful, whether it was check-in, room service or the gift shop.  Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

We have stayed previously at the Old Key West resort in Disney World and booked one of the Villas in Disney's Grand Californian for 9 nights without hesitation. The location of the resort is fantastic as both of the theme parks and Downtown Disney are within an easy walk and there are a number of resturants (including the Cheesecake Factory and a Bubba Gump's) within a 1 mile walk (on sidewalks/pavements). All of the staff have been really friendly and the quality of the hotel room is absolutely what you would expect from Disney.

I am an annual passholder to Disneyland and have always wanted to stay at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel. I have stayed at both of the other Disney hotels at the Disneyland Resort and quite a few of the other close hotels. We saved up and for our anniversary stayed here and were very excited to experience it. Unfortunately, we were disappointed.  Likes--A trip to the Disneyland Resort is not complete without a look at the lobby of the Grand Californian. Everything from the pianist, to the fireplace, to the cartoons playing for children, it is beautiful Disney magic. The entrance to California Adventure is convenient, and the little cafe is a good value with yummy food.  Dislikes--It is not nearly worth what it costs. With it being over $500/room for peak season, we were

Summary Heading: Rooms are good, great property, expensive but worth it
Summary: Stayed here with the family for 3 nights, had one queen plus a bunkbed for the children.  The room was nice, nothing spectacular, but it was clean and adequate, and we really only used it as a place to sleep, since we were out all day, everyday!  They turned downed the beds and left chocolates in the evening, which was a nice touch.  The grand lobby is really nice, and I especially like the fireplace with all the rocking chairs.  You can even go to the bar and grab a cocktail, then sit by the fireplace and unwind after a long day of mousecapades!  Sure, it's expensive, but being so close to the room after a long day, and feeling special when you stay here makes it worthwile to me...Yeah, you could stay off property in a nicer place for less money, but if you can afford it, I

This was our first time at the Grand California Hotel and we will most likely return.  It was great being able to easily return to our room if we needed something, or take a break at the pool when it got hot out.   My daughter and I arrived on a Sunday and it seemed very busy in the valet area where we parked while checking in. There was quite a long line to check in, but it seemed to move fairly quickly. Once checked in we went back to the car to get our luggage. We were not offered any assistance despite the fact that I had my suitcase, my daughter's suitcase and I was pushing her in a stroller.  We were able to easily locate our room with the help of the map we received from the front desk at check in. Our room was clean and there was more than enough space in the room. We

Summary Heading: Location Location Location - and town car service tip.
Summary: After reading many of the reviews we stayed here (adult and child) for 6 nights after staying at Good Neighbour hotels in the past. It's all about location being so close to both parks with private entry to California Adv. Park.  I would agree with most reviews about the quality and amenities of  guest rooms being of a moderate standard rather than superior.  The service is good, housekeeping thorough, with special mention of the front desk supervisor (Lynn??) who helped with an enquiry after check in and a long international flight, she was outstanding.  We were not given any assistance with our luggage both on arrival and departure - a small point and interesting given I was travelling with a child.   Also the staff member responsible for dropping of the linen baskets outside

We started off with a Good Neighbour hotel for a few days which was directly opposite the Disney entrance which was great.  the last 3 nights we splurged and stayed here.  Let me tell you I wished we stayed here the whole time.  Sure it is expensive but WOW!  So close to the park, private entry to the Californian Park and talk Bout service.  If you get one of the park view rooms way way away, use the stairs next to room 448 on any floor and you come out right near the bakery and Disney entry, saves a lot of walking.  Can only use it leaving though, as there is no room card entry.

we always stay at this hotel, it is very beautiful and convienient for familys to go in and out of the parks. This time we stayed in a 3 bdrm suite it was on the 3rd floor and overlooked the three pools. I think this suite is very expensive but there is so much room you could probably split it up with 3 familys. This is the first time we have slept on a king here at this hotel it was so comfy. The staff is very friendly at this hotel unlike the disneyland hotel. I just think they are very overpriced.

This was my first ever trip to Disneyland and I absolutely loved the Grand Californian.  My parents are Disney Vacation Club (DVC) members so my mom booked a one bedroom villa for me and my boyfriend.  My room was beautiful and huge.  We had an awesome view of the California Adventure Park and could see World of Color from our balcony.  It had a fully equipped kitchen, two bathrooms, and a Murphy bed.  The room was extremely clean.  It wasn't outdated at all.  Not sure if it was recently renovated or how that compares to the regular rooms.  Check in was really easy.  I loved that there were employees guiding you where to go and to answer questions.  The desk clerk gave us balloons and first time buttons.  Luckily our room was ready right away so we ran our bags up to the room

yes, its expensive but the convenience and service more than makes up for it. And if you have children it will save you a lot of steps and gives you a chance to take an afternoon nap or just to sit down in airconditioned comfort. Best of all you get that guest entrance to Calfornia Adventure cutting down the security line to one or two people. A friend of my daughter's used it for a character breakfast bridal shower for our daughter and future son in law. Now there's true Disney magic..

We booked two adjoining park facing rooms. Upon entering our room there was a very bad smell in both rooms; a mix between damp and stale cigarette smoke and there was no park view. It was unbearable and requested to be moved, the staff were happy to move us. Our next rooms smelt much better however there was still no park view (only ferris wheel) and once I settled in and went to use the bathroom I found several 'brown' removable marks on the toilet seat!! We spent the night on the internet looking for somewhere else to stay while using the baby wipes and disinfectant to clean the remote and other areas. Yes Disneyland is wonderfully central however not even this advantage was enough to keep us there. The rooms are old and dated. The toilet situation was enough to have me

We originally booked at an off-property location but then switched the week before arriving to the Disney hotel.  We are so glad we did!  The resort and park layouts are so different from Orlando... everything is just steps away.  If you stay at the Disney hotels.. you really feel like you are staying ON property.  No shuttles, monorail, etc. to take you anywhere - we walked to everything (1st year we didn't have to rent a stroller too).  We were concerned about room size being too small for our family of 5, however, kids slept in bunk beds and trundle which was attached.  They loved it!  We thought it would be nice for the adults to have a separate room to be able to stay up once kids went to sleep, however, we were all so exhausted after our full days that we all crashed into

I stayed for 2 days with 5 adults, 2 toddlers and 1 infant. It accommodated perfectly. Great locations, friendly staffs and perfect for kids. The kids loved it, i loved it too. Would definitely stay for longer next time!

My daughter and I spent four nights at the Disney's Grand Californian Hotel in February 2011.  We are DVC members and this is our "home" resort.  Although this was our first trip to the west coast, we have stayed on WDW property many times - so the hotel floor plan and room layout were quite familiar to us.  Our balcony had a terrific view of California Adventure, and we were able to watch "World of Color" from our room (the soundtrack is also broadcast on the television).  The restaurant selection at the hotel is nice, although we didn't dine at Napa Rose.  The dining options in the parks and Downtown Disney are abundant and convenient, there's no need to travel outside the property unless you want to.  The check-in line seemed long when we arrived, but the front desk was well

stayed for 5 nights from the end of August. Location wise it's perfect for the Disney parks. The lobby was freezing though as we discovered whilst waiting for our room on our arrival day. Free parking for guests and staff are extremely helpful. Obviously with Disney you expect above average prices in the bar / shops etc so no real complaints there. The only downside to where we stayed was we had a view of the California Adventure park - which when we first arrived we thought WOW - however - of a night / early morning it was quite noisy, so would rather have had a pool view or something. We was going to self cater one night with some home cooked pasta but very weirdly the room had a huge fridge / freezer, microwave, oven, hobs but no kettle or pots and pans. Loads of cutlery but

My wife and I stayed at this hotel for her 4oth birthday and what a great experience. The staff were very friendly from the first moment we arrived, the rooms were clean with a great view of the park and of course your at Disneyland. We enjoyed taking a dip in the pool during the day and soaked in the jacuzzi after a day at the park. The lobby is an incredible experience on it's own. All in all, it was a great time. Thanks Disney.

You are paying for location, period.  We had a premium view - if that's what you want to call our view of trees and the monorail tracks.  TV audio kept shorting out.  Room was smaller than I expected based on the pictures online.  It also wasn't as clean as I would have liked - wad of hair stuck in the blow dryer, stained grout in the bathroom.    BUT, you have a private entrance to the CA Adventure Park, you step out into the middle of Downtown Disney and you are only 200 yards from the main entrance of both Disneyland and the CA Adventure Parks.    Don't use room service for breakfast - go to the Whitewater Snack Bar they have the exact same food.  The American Breakfast (eggs, bacon, potatoes, toast) was $7 versus $20 + tip + delivery fee (plus at the restaurant it will be

We stayed for 3 nights in a single room with 2 queen beds on the 6th floor ( concierge floor). Our stay was just fantastic. To begin with, the minute we stepped out of our car, we were greeted by our last name. We were able to skip check-in at the front desk and were immediately wisked up to the 6th floor concierge desk were we were quickly checked in to our nearby room. The 6th floor has its own private room( entered with your key card) where food is served 4 times a day for free! While they aren't true meals, they are certainly generous enough to stand in for them. For instance, the breakfast consisted of bagels, spreads, fruit platter, hard boiled eggs, cereals, chocolate croisants ( to die for!) and any drink you night want. Then they served an afternoon tea, dinnertime

Summary Heading: A piece of heaven among chaos.
Summary: This hotel is breathtaking to say the least. The lobby is such a great place to hang out after the parks close and just relax. The pools are amazing, the attention to detail is unbelievable, the cast members are friendly and helpful. It's expensive but definitely worth it. It costs a bit more to have a "park view" room but you can't beat it.

I'm a Disney freak, so there's my bias up front. I'd always wanted to stay here, and we finally did when we took advantage of their winter 30% sale. I think our room was roughly $270/night, and we stayed two nights. My wallet whimpered a little because we could've gotten Candy Cane Inn for $120/night! But somehow I can't regret it.   Disney staff, amazing and friendly. The only eh part was the long line to get our bags checked before we could flounce off to the park immediately without having to wait for our room. Other than that, this hotel was perfection. Wonderful, clean rooms and the atmosphere was so--well, grand. My friend and I loved the private entrance to California Adventure for its convenience--in our opinion, that is the best reason for staying here! We've been

Summary Heading: Loved this hotel!  Awesome location for kids and parents!
Summary: What a beautiful hotel!  We had a great experience there!  Disney is just great a making you feel pampered in general.  We loved our room which was just a basic room with no view upgrades.  But, we did request a room with bunkbeds for the kids on check-in and were very pleased with it.  Neat woodsy decor...with little Disney animals subtly pictured on the shower curtain!  The kids were so excited about the chocolate Disney coins we found in the room each night!  Every staff person we had was very helpful.  It was nice that we could check-in early and leave our luggage with the valet past check-out so we could spend a little more time in Downtown Disney.  What an awesome location!  I can't imagine a better one.  We LOVED the private entrance into California Adventure which made

Summary Heading: Great Location, things could be improved though
Summary: We stayed for 7 nights in a two bedroom apartment with 2 Adults, 2 Children.  We chose this hotel because of the location, which I must admit was fantastic, and our room overlooked downtown disney, great waking up to the smell of churros.  We never ate in the restaurant downstairs, so I cannot comment there.  We did get in room breakfast and that was fine.  I guess my one disappointment was the inroom services.  We arrived at our room, which must have been at the furthest point away, the walk to our room made us feel like we were in 'The Shining', and there's not anything offered for refreshments.  For a hotel with this star rating I would've thought there'd at least be a bottle of water?????  If they read this, perhaps it's something they may consider adding, considering what I

Summary Heading: Lovely hotel, scary Stepford wives staff, poor service
Summary: It's beautiful. It's location is prime. The attention to detail in the lobby and grounds is exceptional, and very Disney (we love Disney's attention to detail in the parks, rides, etc). We appreciated that we could check in early upon our arrival. We really appreciated the cleverness of the rooms designed for families: there was a bunk bed with a trundle bed, and a queen bed for the parents. You could comfortably sleep a family of five in one room, with no shared beds among kids, and plenty of room.  But there is something off about this lovely hotel. For starters, we began our check in process feeling so well-taken care of--cheerful staff, efficient managing of a long line, etc. But when we asked about some extra Fastpasses that the reservation clerk had promised on the phone,

The Grand Californian Hotel is one of my all-time favorite hotels in the world.  True, I'm jaded because I'm a Disney nut, but this hotel just makes me feel at home (not that my actual home is anything like the hotel, but I can wish, can't I?)  It's a big hotel, but it's the little things that make the difference.  It's the hidden Mickey's in the carpeting, the authentic Tiffany lamps in the lobby, the huge stone-faced fireplace in the lobby, the attention to detail in the stonework on the elevators, and the very real ability to forget that you're in the middle of one of the most populated places on earth.   A few tips:  1) Contrary to some other reviews, I have found the staff to be polite, and many have gone out of their ways to create a special experience for me and my

I've stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and Paradise Pier and finally at the the Grand California at my last visit.  I have to say that I love it, purely because it's attached to the California Adventure theme park.  It's a roomy hotel, I feel like the room was larger than the ones I've had at the Disneyland hotel and I like how the set up of the bathroom is.  Plus you can see the fireworks show (part of it) and there was a little balcony.  You're definitely paying for the location more than anything else though.  All three hotels are great and very comparable.

Summary Heading: Understated, classy and a fantastic location
Summary: We stayed here for four nights as part of our California road-trip vacation. We looked at various hotels in and surrounding the Disney area and in the end although the Grand Californian was the most expensive we opted to stay here due to the fantastic location right next door to the parks! The main selling point of the hotel is it's wonderful location. You can step out of the lobby into Dowtown Disney and there's also a residents only entrance into the heart of Disney California Adventure. This makes it so convenient to hop between parks as you wish, and then return to cool off in the pool (one thing to note here- the pool does get busy in the afternoon and you may have to wait for a sun-lounger) The hotel itself has a rustic design and a hugely impressive five-story high lobby

We stayed at this hotel from September 9-11th with our 2 kids, ages 11 and 16. We had always wanted to stay here as we passed the entrance inside California Adventure because of the convenience to the park. We normally stay at Embassy Suites because it is convenient with kids.  We arrived on Friday evening and the staff is super helpful and friendly.  Walking into the lobby was pretty impressive - soaring celings, a roaring fire and the wood beams makes it feel like you are in a large country cabin. We got checked in pretty quickly and went to our room.    The rooms are nice, but nothing impressive. We had a full bed and bunkbeds. Unfortunately, the bunkbeds are made for 3 years olds and my 16 year old did not have much room with the wood frame that is outside the mattress.  It

Summary Heading: 5 Star looks -- 3.5 Star Operation. But Still the Best Choice in Anaheim when Money isn't an Issue.
Summary: Hands down, this is the best hotel in Anaheim. Best architecture. Best pool area. Best Spa. Best fine restaurant. Best Guest Areas. Best Lobby. But‚Ä¶  That being said, the rooms could be much more luxurious for the top price; the TVs could be larger; the linens finer; the bathrooms brighter and the service could be MUCH BETTER.   There is also a terrible, over-priced and sub-standard restaurant that should be very good, but as it stands, serves some of the worst fare of any Disney-run restaurant. The restaurant is Storyteller's Cafe, a beautifully decorated mid-level restaurant that has bad service and even worse food. The dinners we've had there over the past year have been so bad that we've vowed never to eat there again.  There is also a lack of great service. Some of the cast

Summary Heading: Perfect for a family with teens
Summary: The kids can stay late at Disneyland, while parents go back to hotel for gourmet dinner and laid back evening. Staying in a hotel that is right in the park so you can wander back and forth makes everything so much easier!  And the hotel is beautiful and comfortable.

We looked at all the hotels around the area and decided on the Grand Cali because of the construction going on at the disneyland hotel. The room was clean, service was nice, although we did get 2 queens, instead of the king we would have preferred (was not given the preference at booking, but not asked at check in)  The room was clean, TV was a little budget, but all in all it was a good stay. You can't beat the proximity to the parks, and if we have more time, the pool looked quite nice, albeit a bit crowded. Not 2 stars, because I feel like it was marketed properly and we enjoyed ourselves. Not 4 stars, as for 350/night, I expect more from a hotel.

Our family loves Disneyland and we were all able to go together because of this wonderful hotel being so close to the park and so accommodating.  My 91 year old father is the reason why all of us love the park because he took us every year when we were kids, so why not take him?  The hotel had a wheelchair available for him immediately upon exiting the taxi from the airport.  My 84 year old mother need an electronic vehicle that was also available for rental right there at the hotel and she was able to keep it the entire three days of our visit and able to take it anywhere she wanted to go!   It did require plugging in overnight and some maneuvering around in the regular size hotel room so you could walk to the bathroom. My parents had a room with a view of the World of Color

Summary Heading: The Best Choice When Visiting The Disneyland Resort Area
Summary: My spouse and I stayed at the Grand Californian Hote & Spa for three nights at the end of August / beginning of September.  This was our second stay here and it was just as great as the first.    We checked in at 12:00pm, which was 3 hours early, but our room was ready.  I had requested a park view room with a view of Paradise Bay, which is part of Disney's California Adventure Park.  This kind of view is tough to get because most of the rooms on that side of the hotel are Disney Vacation Club suites.  Unfortunately, there was nothing available, so we were given a pool view room, which was excellent.  The front desk staff were efficient and friendly.    Our room was quite a bit bigger than our previous stay.  It was clean and had very nice beddings and a comfortable king sized

Summary Heading: Wish I had more time to spend in the hotel.
Summary: Rooms are great, wonderful resturants, lovely grounds, and the best thing is that it's a short walk to the parks!   I stayed in the Disneyland hotel which I also love, but that walk back at night can be long. LOL.

Fantastic outdoor space, 3 pools and 2 hot tubs, lots of lounge chairs and poolside drink service available.  We only ate in the fast service "white waters" venue, they had a great breakfast deal for around $6.  This hotel also directly allows entrance into the California Adventure Park, and also right into the heart of Downtown Disney.  We would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great stay we will be back!
Summary: My wife and I stayed at the Grand Californian Hotel for the labor day weekend. We checked in a little early, our room wasn't ready yet. so we gave our bags to the bell desk and off to the park we went. About a hour later got a text msg. that our room was ready telling me what room we were in. No need to go back to the desk our room keys we were given earlier were already programed for our room. When we went to our room it was very clean. The bell desk then brought up our bags within 5 minutes of calling them. I only had two problems with the room first is the door that joins the two rooms together must be paper thin because all i could hear in the room was the neighbors conversation word for word. The second problem is the price. I can get a very similar room across the street

My son and I stayed during  Half Marathon weekend (September 1 - September 5) and found some of their typical above-par service to be lacking. A broken iron and missing coffee pot when I checked in. (Iron replaced, never got the coffee pot). Trouble with reception on the television - reported it - no resolution. And a broken refrigerator that never worked the whole time we were there - reported it 3 times on the phone and finally went to the front desk to speak to a manager and she promised it would be replaced but wasn't before we left. Also, there was an incident Friday night when soda bottles were thrown from the third-floor balcony on to the lobby floor, narrowly missing guests sitting near the piano. I know the hotel has no control over that incident and I'm not suggesting

We received good reviews from friends and decided to try a 1-night stay.  The woman at check-in wasn't helpful and the room was one of the problem rooms.  We didn't notice one of the two beds was broken, and that the A/C didn't work.  The valet parking is squeezed into the entrance and is dangerous with the yellow cabs receiving priority movement.  There is no covered self-park.  Room directions are spotty and it took 10 minutes to find our room - the front desk is little to no help and are annoyed if asked questions.
One of the best hotels I've ever stayed at. If you can swing it, stay on the concierge level. It's a hotel within a hotel with many nice extras.

Summary Heading: Worth it if you get a decent rate
Summary: My family stayed at the Grand Californian from 29 Aug thouth Sept 3rd.  Check in was done quickly and they accomadated our requests, and our room was available at 8AM.  We had a room with bunk beds overlooking a wooded courtyard with monorail passing through.  The room itself was standard, clean but not emaculate.  Service was great, magic mornings were great, entrance to DCA was wonderful.  We were close to the main elevators so we were just about as close to the private entrance as you can get. The walk from hotel to Disneyland itself  is comparable to the closest hotels on Harbor at the pedestrian crosswalk.  So if money is an issue, stay at one of those.     The pool area was very tranquil and a great place to relax, Whitewater snacks was never crowded and a little cheaper

Summary Heading: No More than a Holiday Inn
Summary: Other than the close proximity to Downtown Disney and the parks, there is no reason to stay here over any of the other chain hotels in the area.   This resort is huge, but there is not enough staff to handle the size.  Service is fair at best, while prices are high.    The pool areas are way too small for the size of the hotel and the amount of guests.   Forget getting a pool chair without hunting and hunting.   No one cleans up the used towels in the pool area so that makes it worse.   The rooms are plain and simple, and although clean the bathroom is old and basic, and in need of an upgrade.   It would be a 5* Holiday Inn, or even a 4* Marriott, but the prices are at a much higher level and not worth it.    Unless you are totally against driving or a bit of a longer walk from

My family & I had the opportunity to stay here on the 2nd & 3rd of September. All I have to say is wow. The level of service is outstanding. The location as is so often mentioned, unbeatable. I paid extra for the concierge level. It is definitely worth it if you fully intend to use this for your meals. We had all three of our meals here on Saturday. There is no rush so typical at a majority of continental meals. You can eat at your leisure & the Canoe Club is casual & comfortable. The nightly fireworks show can also be seen here comfortably.   I can't see anyone complaining about the service unless your a spoiled primadonna. If you are nice to the staff, they will treat you like royalty. If your a snob, you are going to complain about everything anyway.   The room was clean &

Summary Heading: Nice, but not worth the money
Summary: This is our second time staying here. We originally booked a room at the Disneyland Hotel. We were coming to celebrate our oldest daughters graduation from 5th grade. The plan was 3 days at the Candy Cane Inn and 2 days at the Disneyland Hotel. A few days before our vacation started I received a call from a Disney customer service agent informing me that the hotel was overbooked and we could receive a comparable room at the Grand Californian for the rate we were paying for The Disneyland Hotel. We were offered a Downtown Disney view room we which accepted. We checked out of the Candy Cane Inn at 2 pm. Check in for the Grand is 4pm. We drove around and did some shopping to kill time. Arriving at 3:30 we passed through the guard station to the valet parking. Hauling our bags in I

Summary Heading: The ONLY Way to do Disneyland Resort
Summary: After reading a whole bunch of reviews here regarding the Grand Californian, I was a bit hesitant about booking a stay here.  After our family experience here though, I have no regrets whatsoever.  This was our first time at the GC, and although we had always stayed at Good Neighbor places, like the Embassy, Hilton, etc., the whole family (myself, wife, three kids) are convinced that this is the only way to do the Disneyland Resort.  CONVENIENCE being the biggest factor along with GREAT staff, made our three night stay unforgettable. We arrived at approximately 1PM, and pulled up to the unloading zone and the hotel entrance.  We waited in the registration line for about 5 mins. before speaking with a front desk clerk.  Upon noting that we had opted for the Concierge Package, she

I think I was expecting more from this hotel. I have stayed at numerous Disney World hotels over the years and have become accustomed to a certain level of service/design at Disney Properties. The Grand is quite large but the rooms are rather plain. It reminds me stylistically of the Animal Kingdom Lodge or perhaps the Wilderness Lodge. The Lobby is pretty and it has a huge fireplace and couches everywhere to relax on. Our room had 2 beds and the pillows were quite comfy. Lots of linens, but it never got cold enough to use all of them. H20 spa products were a nice touch.   The hotel is VERY close to the parks though. You literally walk out and are in the California Adventure and it's a short walk down to Disneyland via Downtown Disney. Now one thing I hated was if I bought a

The Grand Californian Hotel was one of the top ten hotels we have stayed in. Not only is the hotel beautiful, the convenience of being able to walk right into Disneyland, California Adventure or Downtown Disney is just so amazing!!! We decided to stay in one of their standard rooms since we were there for a short stay and even though our view out of our balcony was a roof top, we were very surprised to learn we could look to the right of our balcony and had an unbelievable view of the fireworks form Disneyland. We did not have to fight the crowds because we had our own private view. The staff is incredibly friendly and accommodating. We loved it!!!!

What a fun hotel...the pool is great for kids and if you eat at the storytellers cafe you'll get to meet the critter characters. We live in So Cal and took our son to Disneyland for his birthday so we decided to stay over at the hotel for convinience.  It's was very pricey and the rooms are not worth $400+ a night. The bathrooms are not terribly clean...the grout in the tile were black and we found strands of hair in the bathtub.  You're definitley paying for convinience and NOT for the quality of the room.  Overall it was fun and would not stay here again.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay at Disney
Summary: The perfect place to stay at Disneyland.  We could easily come back to our hotel if we wanted a break.  Clean, nice lobby, helpful staff and great pool.  This is the only place we will stay from now on.

Summary Heading: Very Nice. The way to go.
Summary: We stayed 2 nights and loved every minute. They make you feel wanted and welcome from the moment you get off your car. We were greeted by 4 staff members before we got to reception to check in. Getting upgraded made all the difference. Our view of the pool and theme park was amazing. We had fun just standing on our balcony.  Our kids 6 and 8 slept on bunks next to our queen bed.  This is a true 4 star. I loved the turn down service, robes and nice bath products with tasteful Disney decor all around.  There is also a mini fridge in place of a mini bar for snacks that we brought from home.  The pools were great. The lounge chairs were the most comfortable ones I have ever relaxed on.  Room service food was just ok and pricey. We ate in the room because we wanted to be up and ready

Summary Heading: There is no better place to stay!
Summary: With three swimming pools, babysitting services, a store where you can buy milk and other essentials for little kids, PLUS direct access to the Disney Adventure Park, this is the best place to stay in all of Anaheim! It's pricey, yes, but you get what you pay for: Great service, great amenities and a wonderful park experience.

I stayed at the hotel with my daughter in Aug/11.  This was our 3rd stay at this hotel in less than a year.  This time was the best.  We had a standard view room, which was not the greatest view - of the front entry.  The first time we had a std view it was of the treed inner courtyard - that was much better.  We've also had a downtown Disney view, - if you can afford it I would recommend paying for a better view.  The convenient entry to the park is the best feature .. we would go from the hotel pool to the Grizzly river ride & back, very convenient!   Check in is a breeze, with staff there to help.  Both of the last 2 times we checked in early & there were rooms available.  The first time, we arrived at 4:00 (after check in) but didn't have a room until after 5:00.  Also the
My family and I stayed for 6 nights in July.  I actually cannot pick a fault with this hotel. Staff, location, room, pools, restaurants etc were all first class.   Well it is Disney after all!!

Summary Heading: Pricey but Nice. Some comments about Character Breakfasts too.
Summary: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel.  We have stayed at many hotels in the area and I would rate this one the nicest (maybe not best value, but the nicest). The lobby and other common areas are all very nice and well kept and the pool area is excellent.   It has a small waterslide for toddlers and a bigger one (but still quite small) for other kids. Three separate pools are all close together and many nicely cushioned loungers around them. Pool service was ok with a fairly limited food menu and prices weren‚Äôt too bad for a place like this (eg $10 for nachos).  The room itself was nice but certainly not overly special for the price paid. We faced California Adventure Park and while it was noisy when the patio door was open, it was very quiet with the door closed. It was nice having

Summary Heading: Over Priced but knew that when I booked
Summary: I am rating the room average because that was what it was but I would definitely stay there again based on the other conveniences mentioned.  Stayed at the Disneyland hotel in 1990.  Loved the close proximity to the park.  Saw they were doing major renovations so did not chose again.  When there for a little visit -  so glad I did not chose this time because the the renos.  The Grand was my choice and Grand it was - almost too big.  Fortunately we were on the second floor and close the the elevator.   This hotel is huge.  Because of this it lacks intimacy but I guess you don't go to Disney for that!  The very close ( hotel's has its own entrance for the Disney California Adventure theme park for hotel guests) as well as downtown Disney and Disneyland made it worth the extra

After reading "many" reviews of the top 40 hotels to stay during a visit to Disneyland I chose Disney's Grand Californian Hotel (DGCH) to be the hotel of choice. Granted that other hotels near the park offered "many" more amenities and a better dollar value; it was the location and my family's comfort level that dictated the stay at DGCH.  I would say from the moment we arrived, Disney's Cast Members go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable and comfortable. Upon arrival with our vehicle, a cast member greets you at a security gate. I mentioned that I had reservations under the name of...and the next thing the cast member places a color coded marker underneath your windshield wiper and mentioned to us to enjoy our stay.  I decided to do the valet parking route; again this

Summary Heading: Lovely Hotel - rooms a little tired.
Summary: Our overall stay at this hotel was very good and would recommend.  The location is amazing and the facilities top notch.  The staff were great and very helpful.  My only negative would be the rooms, there were a little dated and could do with brightening up a bit.  The bathroom however was great.

We booked this hotel as it was our children‚Äôs first visit to Disneyland.  I have been to Disneyland many times and have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel as well as other ‚ÄúGood Neighbor‚Äù hotels.  I‚Äôll get right to the matter; the Grand Californian Hotel (GCH) is a wonderful hotel to stay at.  The staff was very helpful, courteous, and knowledgeable.  The entrance, lobby, front desk, elevators, hallways, and rooms were all well maintained, very welcoming, and very clean. Our room had a view of the pool area.  We did go swimming one afternoon and their pools are very nice.  They have some great life vests for children that are available free of charge that our children loved.  It gave them the confidence to go down the water slide on their own.   We were on the 2nd floor and the roof

Summary Heading: When you check in and they say "Welcome Home" they are right on!
Summary: Our Family is from WA and we go to Disney twice a year, up until about a year ago we always stayed at The Disneyland Hotel, but do to the construction we decided to pay the extra and stay at the Grand CA..What a wonderful decision we made!  We have stayed 9/2010, 3/2011 and are going back next month 9/2011.  We always request the same room and so far we are always accommodated.  The pool is wonderful, the housekeeping is great, the lobby is grand and smells wonderful (true disney lovers know how important the "Disney" smell is) and we never have a problem finding a cast member to take our "checking in!" photo,  we just love everything about it...I have 15 and 12 yr old boys and they love the Grand CA!!  Counting the days until I hear "Welcome Home"!!!

Summary Heading: We liked it but won't be back
Summary: Nice Hotel, Great location but, don't forget anything in the room after you check out because you will not get it back!!!

Summary Heading: Very nice facility providing convenience for families
Summary: I recently stayed here with my wife and two children for 3 nights on a Disneyland.com package.  We purchased the package that included the room and a 4-day park hopper pass.  The cost of the package was almost exactly $800 more than had we chosen to stay at one of the hotels in Garden Grove (e.g. Hilton Garden Inn, Residence Inn by Marriott).  I have been to Disneyland about a dozen times in the past fifteen years.  This was our first stay at the Grand Californian.  I have previously stayed at The Paradise Pier Hotel, Disneyland Hotel, Candy Cane Inn, Fairfield Inn, Hampton Inn and Suites (Garden Grove), Residence Inn by Marriott (Garden Grove), Anaheim Marriott, and the Sheraton Suites (Garden Grove).  I enjoyed the Grand Californian more than any other prior stay simply

Summary Heading: Location is top notch; rooms are just adequate. Would stay again!
Summary: We just returned from 5 nights at the Grand Californian Hotel, and had a wonderful trip. It was our children's first trip to Disneyland (they are ages 6 and 3) and we opted to splurge and stay at the GCH so we could be close by if rests were needed.  Check in was super quick and easy - we arrived right around 4:00 pm and were expecting chaos, but it was well organized. We parked in the valet ($22 a night versus $15 self-parking) and they took our bags from us while we checked in. Once we got to the room we called to have the bags delivered and they were with us in minutes. Our room was on the second floor (2347) overlooking the GCH entrance to California Adventure. It was near the elevators, near the entrance to CA and pretty close to the corridor to Downtown Disney. One very

This was our second stay at the Grand Californian, and we had a great time! When we first walked into our room, I remembered all the not so great things from the last stay Honestly, it's time for a room refurb! The rooms are getting pretty old and tired looking.  They are pretty clean (my socks did not get filthy from the carpet as they do in many hotels - ew), but in need of updating.   The rooms are a decent size - this time we had a queen and bunk beds for our family of 4 (kids ages 5 and 6).  There is also a trundle bed under the bottom bunk but we did not need it.  This configuration actually gave us much more space than the two queens we had last time around.  The kids loved the bunk bed! The beds are only sort of comfortable.  Not bad but not great.  My main peeve with

We have stayed at the Grand California twice and will most definitely be back.  In fact, my husband and I both feel this is our new standard for visiting Disneyland.    We have four young children and the proximity to the parks simply can't be beat.  The price per room is definitely a splurge for us, but the convenience makes it well worth it.
