When one child was ready for a nap/break, it was simple to go back to the room without the hassle of waiting for a shuttle while the rest of the family remained in the park.  The magic morning entry was fantastic and we were able to divide the day up by going early, taking a break back at the hotel mid-day, and then easily returned to the park in the afternoon/evening.  Another perk we enjoyed were the Fast Pass tickets to World of Color.

We arrived at the hotel after getting off our flight from New Zealand.  The check in was efficient and friendly.  We had booked everything ourselves through the internet and directly with the Disney Travel Company, and there were no problems at all when we arrived.  Our room slept 5 - 2 adults, 3 children (12yr, 9yrs,8yrs) so we had a queen bed, a set of bunks and a pull out bed.  The only issue with the beds was the length for our 12yr old as she is tall and they were a bit short for her, but that was fixed by taking the mattress off the pull out and adding a pillow at the end.  The staff were very helpful, especially on the last day when our daughter hurt her back on a ride at Disneyland.  She was in excrutiating pain, and we had to get a wheelchair to get her back to the

The hotel was awesome, the pool was great fun. If you're going to Disney with kids- it's worth spending the extra money to stay at one of the Disney Hotels. You can't beat the convenience of boarding the monorail steps away from your hotel and entering the California Adventure park through the resorts "guest only" private entrance. The Redwood Pool has a nice waterslide and there were plenty of tables and places to park your junk. My only complaint about the pool are is, as with many hotels, pool side food and beverage service is ridiculously slow. Once they finally notice you it's not too bad, but it took an hour to have an order taken the first time. The hotel offers pre-registration. You should DEFINETLY take advantage of that. Once you arrive you will breeze past the line at

I have nothing but great things to say about this place.  I booked at this place because my fiance at the time loved disneyland and wanted to stay here.  I ended up getting engaged here.  The staff was nothing but helpful.  So much going on and so close to the park.  Very worth it to stay here once to get the experience.  It is expensive but it is also disneyland.  If you can afford it then do it!  They have great bars, lots to do for the kids, and being inside downtown disney is pretty awesome!  Hotel is up to date and had great rooms.  No complaints about the staff or anything.  The only thing that scares people is the price, but like I said, if you can afford it you wont regret it!

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel, convenient but TERRIBLE service!
Summary: Beautiful hotel, convenient for going to Disneyland. We loved the pool. I came on a medical conference and had my family stay with me to enjoy a trip to Disney. The worst thing was that items including my bathing suit, lingerie and my daughter's puddle jumper's floating device were stolen from my room.  I filed a report with security at the hotel but did not get any resolution. A log of who entered my room showed that housekeeping had entered our room at 5 pm that day -- the last entry before we discovered items were taken from the room.  The management at Guest Claims stated that "because we could not prove housekeeping had taken the items" we could not get compensated.  I am very disappointed with how the whole matter was handled and will not be returning.
Beautiful resort which allows you to walk right into Downtown Disney.  Staff at the hotel excellent!  24 hr room service.  3 wonderful pools with poolside menu and drinks!

I‚Äôd like to put in a plug for the California Grand Hotel, after staying there for two nights recently.  As many have pointed out, the standard rooms are just that ‚Äì standard.  Spending $400 a night at a Hyatt or Hilton may get you a very exceptional room.  Spending $400 a night at the California Grand is really more about the overall Disney experience.  The hotel is the closest to the park, and situated right in the middle of the Downtown Disney shopping center.  I am a bit surprised at how much I enjoyed our stay here since I was not a huge fan of Disneyland until I had children.  The vacation and exceptional service begins the moment that you pull up in front of the hotel.  The children (and myself) were in awe of the Grand lobby, the hotel grounds and the pools.  Our check in

Summary Heading: As long as you understand what you are paying for, it's fine
Summary: Don't expect a highly personal, intimate travel experience at this hotel. It's not going to happen. You are one of 1000s of people who pass through the hotel every week, and no one knows your name or really cares. It worked out fine for us, since we didn't have any problems with service or room, but I can see that if you had issues, it could escalate into a bad experience pretty quickly. Check-in at around 1pm was strangely chaotic- don't they do this every single day? It was almost as if it was opening week. But we managed to get checked in and never had to interact with the front desk again. Gym is pretty good-fair (compared to some of the dreadful gyms I've seen on business trips). I guess they figure people aren't going to use it much, due to all the walking they are going

I stayed here for a conference and the location is awesome. You are right outside of downtown disney eith all the shopping and live music. My room was nice but facing the rollercoaster. Although I couldn't here much noise there wasn't much of a view because it was blocked. So my view was the wall . I would suggest a higher floor if facing Disneyland. The staff was great, service was prompt even the maid helped me get my dry cleaning dropped off.  There

Summary Heading: Had to see if it was worth staying at the Grand Californian.
Summary: We looked into staying at the Grand Californian a number of times but couldn't bring ourselves to pay the price.  This summer we decided to splurge and book a two night stay.  We were pleasantly surprised to learn that we had been upgraded to a park view room upon check in.  Our room was ready when we arrived before noon .  It was a nice bonus to be able to check in early.  The room was nice with a view of the Grizzly to the right and the monorail right beneath us.  The windows are well insulated.  We did not hear the monorail at all.  We had a room with 2 double beds.  The bathroom was on the small side.  There were dual sinks and robes provided in the closet.  The best thing about the hotel is the location.  It is so convenient and close to Downtown Disney and the parks.  But

Summary Heading: Worth it for magic, warmth, fun...and convenience
Summary: After hearing on TA that some people think the Grand California is either overpriced or not as good as Disney Hotel, I was prepared not to like it.  In fact, I could have stayed at the hotel for the entire 24 hour period and skipped the parks and been happy.    We loved our room and took many pictures to remember the interior decor (unfortunately on a computer that has disintegrated - I'll try to find them).  But, the California Craftsman meets Good Hotel Decor theme worked for us.  Fast, ample elevators, never had to share with others - a sense of quiet that is so rare at Disneyland.  Great carpet, great and prompt room service (no more expensive than regular Disney fare).    We had a view of California Adventure and redwood trees, it was so relaxing - all park noise was

Stayed at the Grand Californian for two nights, enjoyed Disneyland and Caifornia Adventure Park immensely. The hotel lobby is enormous and certainly lives up to the "grand" name.  However, the rooms are small and pretty standard.  What you're really paying for is the special access to the parks and the ability to roll into your room after fireworks and light show.  The restaurants are nice but very overpriced.  The service is good, but nothing special.

This was our third stay at The Grand Californian Hotel. We had a great room on the 2nd floor this time just near the stairs which got us towards Downtown Disney in mere minutes.   Pros: 1. Great location to getting into both parks and Downtown Disney (has quite a few restaurants and stores). 2. Attractive decor; comfortable beds with nice bedding. 3. Double sink area, in the double rooms, separate from the shower/toilet making getting more than on person ready at a time easier.  4. Free wireless. 5. Love eating at the "Storyteller Cafe" for breakfast although it is VERY expensive. 6. Staff at the hotel are very nice and helpful.  7. They gave my son's friend a "1st Time at Disneyland" button, balloons, and autographed picture of Mickey Mouse to "celebrate" his first trip to the

Summary Heading: You pay for the magic...  But It's SO worth it!
Summary: My family usually stays at one of the Good Neighbor hotels around the park.  They are much cheaper, which is important when a family of 5 goes to Disneyland.  But this time we decided to splurge.  And I'm not sure we'll ever be able to stay anywhere else.  We have been spoiled!   The staff was incredibly friendly, check in was a breeze and the magic began instantly.  The rooms were small but clean, and other than sleeping, why would you be spending time in your room??  You're in DISNEYLAND!!  Our kids loved the bunkbed.  I won't complain about the cost of everything because if you've been to Disneyland you are aware of the fact that nothing is cheap.  All I know is that it was the best experience we've had in our 15 years of Disney Family vacations!

We stayed here for 4 nights. It was located in a extremely convenient location. Just a short walk to DisneyLand and hotel is connected to Adventure Land.  It was well organized and all the staff was friendly.  We loved the pools. We ate only breakfast ( because we were at the parks for the remainder of the days)at the restaurants located at the hotel, and again were pleased with their convenience.

Summary Heading: Partial to it for location, rooms are just ok for price
Summary: It is my hotel of choice for our Disneyland trips.  I love the Grand because of it's lobby, the feel and the location can't be beat for an amazing Disney experience.  The bunk beds with trundle are perfect for 3 kids, but I can imagine the older ones outgrowing them soon since they are on the small side.  The rooms are ok, slightly "tired."  Not what you'd expect for the price you pay, but no matter we keep returning because of the experience of staying there.  The downtown Disney view is fun and so beautiful to look at in the evening.  Definitely recommend off season stays so you feel a little better about the cost.  Really hope the rooms can an uplift in the near future as is Disney custom to keep everything beautiful.

Summary Heading: Must Stay Here at Least Once
Summary: My husband and I live a few hours from Disneyland so it is possible for us to drive to and from the park in one day. However, staying at this hotel brings a whole new level of awesomeness to a day at Disneyland. I highly recommend splurging to experience the perks of this hotel at least once if you live more than an hour away from Anaheim.  The hotel overall is good. The check-in line took about 15 minutes, parking was conveniently across the street, and the staff was nice. The lobby has a fun treehouse feel to it and our room was comfortable and clean. However, it's the location that  truly makes it worth the price. (I should add that a rate of about $400/night is not worth the price to me, but if you can get a deal closer to $250/night, go for it!)  We stayed at the hotel

We've stayed at the Grand Californian 4-5 times.  Mostly, we've been in the fall or spring months.  It is always fabulous.  The beds are comfortable, the staff is incredibly friendly, and you always feel that Disney magic.  Since it was warm during our 4 day stay (82 for a high) we decided to take advantage of the pools.  The waterslide was so  much fun!  There are 3 pools, plus a baby pool and 2 hot tubs.  There are a lot of lifeguards, plus pool side service.  It really helped to take the edge off for two moms and 5 kids who needed to escape the park crowds and heat.  Room service was delicious.  Generally we eat at Downtown Disney when we stay there, but we used room service twice for dinner.  It was delicious!  They also have a large selection of wines by the bottle with

Summary Heading: You can't get closer to Disneyland than this.
Summary: Nice hotel, incredibly friendly staff (known for this given proximity to Disney), clean, well-appointed, great bar, good restaurants and nice gift shop.  If you're going to Disneyland, this is the place to stay in my opinion. The hotel feels like a grand lodge, it's cozy and chic all in one. It's a hop, skip and a jump to the gates of Disney and you can get anywhere in the park within minutes.  It's not an inexpensive experience, but worth it if you like quality at the end of a long day of roller coasters.

This hotel is very beautiful in the common areas.  The standard no view room was not plush at all, and the walk from the elevator was the longest I have ever experienced in any hotel ever.  I was a little put off when I arrived and there were several people behind the counter and no offers to check us in I had to ask to be helped after standing at the designated line area with no one else in line (at over $365 per night are you kidding me?) on our third night there they just skipped us for turndown service and complimentary chocolates. The only thing you are getting special at this hotel is the convenient entries to California Adventure and downtown Disney, will not be staying again. Way overpriced, I expected a beautiful room and it definitely was not.

I have stayed at this hotel 3 times that tells you I like it alot.  It is the only hotel I consider when going to disneyland area.  Friendly staff and very helpful.  All kinds of extras for kids.  The only draw back is the cost, but if you want to do disneyland and california disney and downtown disney and have dinner at the disneyland hotel with goofy it is the only place to stay.  You can do all these thing walking from the hotel.  You never need your car.  It is a great place for that once in a lifetime vacation.

I took a group of 13 foster children (teens) to Disneyland, Anaheim for three days in January, 2011 as part of a Police Activities League Program.  Having stayed at the Grand Californian before, I was familiar with the service and hotel "extras".  While it's certainly a beautiful and comfortable hotel, there are others nearby with equally excellent service and comfort at a much lower cost.   The selling point for this hotel is the location.  Location, location, location!  The rooms are not overly luxiorious or spaciouis and the service, because it's a very busy hotel, is actually below average for hotels in it's price range....BUT....if you are traveling with young children, teens or even elderly parents, this is the place to stay.   You will feel like you never really leave the

I've stayed at disney's hotels before, but this was by far the best of all the disney properties. the hotel is beautiful. the lobby is like looking at a grand lodge from another era....the fireplace is always lit  and there are  comfortable chairs to chat with family or just enjoy  a cocktail by the fire.  The hotel staff is always working to keep the place clean and polished. we enjoyed room service every morning for breakfast, it was served in 10 minutes and perfect. I just can't say enough positive things about this hotel.....its also right by downtown disney, and the parks.  loved it.

Stayed here the past few years for the kids' birthdays. Convenient location as it adjoins the California Adventure park and Downtown Disney and you pay for it.  Disneyland is a short walk away. If you get tired walking the park, it's easy to go back to the room to recover. Rooms that face Downtown Disney will get some noise, but it usually dies down around midnight. Have had a couple of incidences regarding the fire alarm going off in the middle of the night and having to evacuate. Carpet is starting to show age.  Never eaten at Napa Rose as I'm not into high prices and small portions, but don't miss the corn chowder at Storyteller's Cafe.  We eventually bought into their timeshare program. which was unusual because there was no hardsell. Timeshare rooms are close to California

Having stayed at the Hilton, Universal City, just prior, I found our room in the Grand Californian dark, drab and dated. It was a standard room with a poor view. The walk to the elevator was extremely long and there were rooms still further away! The hotel is enormous! The location was excellent with direct hotel access to Downtown Disney and California Adventure park, which gives you a chance to explore the parks in the morning, enjoy a refreshing swim in the afternoon and return for another round of the Parks in the evening. Not sure if I'd return. Location - the best! Hotel itself, so-so!

This was the trip that we splurged on, stayed at the fancy hotel, had 2 of the charcter breakfasts, let the kids (and Mom and Dad) build card at Ride Makerz and what ever else we felt like.  After staying at the Grand I cannot see staying anywhere else.  The hotel was beautiful, the staff was very friendly and so helpful and you can not beat the convience of being so close to Downtown Disney and California Adventure.  My son and husband went on the Grizzly River Run about 4 or 5 times one evening and since our room was right there they did not have to be cold and wet for to long.  Sure it is a little spendy but we are talking about Disney here everything is a little spendy.  It was great after a long day at the park having just a short walk back to your hotel and not having to

Background:  Fifth time to Disneyland with children,  usually stay at Embassy Suites (for the extra room) but this time opted to stay at DGC so the kids could go back to the park after dinner without having to ride a shuttle.  Also, I got husband to go on another trip in December that he did not want to do, so this is his payback.    Now I wish we had stayed here each visit. This review is long, but I did try to break it up in paragraphs for easier reading.  We drove down (from Central California) during the last day of ‚ÄúCarmageddon‚Äù so we opted for a loop around the ‚Äúmess‚Äù and still arrived at the hotel at 11:00 am.  I had read about  the high parking fees (never did ask the hotel though) but after leaving so early and being in the car so long there was no way we were going to

The kids really loved this resort.  We have annual passes to Disneyland already so a majority of our time was spent at the pool and waterslide.  It made it nice to see the firework show them return immediately to our room to sleep.  You definitely need to plan your stay around a Magic Morning.  Hotel guests get to enter the park at 7:00am and the first two hours are empty.  You also get two free fast passes to ride on once the park starts to get crowded.  We left the park at 12:30 and had been on every ride the kids wanted to go on.  Then back to the pool....  A little pricey but well worth it!

The Grand Californian Hotel is a beautiful property--at least in the common areas.  The rooms are adequate, but nothing remarkable, and the room prices border on outrageous.  We had a two-room suite (one king bed, another room with two queen beds, and a fold-out couch) for six adults and two teenagers.  The suite had two bathrooms and three refrigerators, a lovely balcony, and a view of California Adventureland as well as Downtown Disney. Two of us slept on the fold-out couch, which was surprisingly comfortable, and the beds were very comfortable, too. The suite was roomy, and the bathrooms were spacious, very clean, and nicely lit.  One of the refrigerators in the room was broken, and apparently could not be repaired, but the staff was responsive and courteous.  Also, the staff

Summary Heading: $37 for valet parking for the day?
Summary: My title says it all. I attended a one-day seminar at the Grand Californian and was running late so I valet parked. When I picked up my car 7 hours later, the bill for valet was $37. I consider that excessive and would have socked Mickey in the nose if he were around.  Not a huge Disney fan anyway. Btw, since I was a day visitor to the hotel and not a registered guest, they charged me $15 for self-parking and another $22 for valet. How can you charge me for self-parking when you parked my car for me? The hotel lobby is spectacular, btw. The staff treated me well except for the attendant at the valet parking window who obviously hears alot of negative reaction to the valet price.

Summary Heading: Worth the extra money for location and service
Summary: This is our second stay at the Grand Californian.  It is worth the extra money as the proximity to Disneyland and California Adventure allows you so much flexibility to do more things in the parks.  The staff was always courteous and helpful.  We ate at the Storyteller's Cafe, by the poolside, and the Napa Rose.  All the meals were great.  I had just injured my ankle before our trip.  The hotel staff made arrangements with a private company they contract with for a motorized scooter and had it waiting for me upon arrival.  The price was more reasonable than renting it from Disneyland.  I highly recommend the hotel and all it has to offer.

Summary Heading: One of the best family hotels I've stayed in
Summary: Stayed here just for two nights, while visiting the Disneyland resort. We had rented Disney Vacation Club points from an owner to stay in a one-bedroom suite.  We arrived at 1:30 and was told the room was not yet ready, not unexpectedly. But by 2:30 pm we got a text message that our villa was ready.  The decor of the hotel is beautiful. The lobby is open to all the floors above it, and the room/villa fixtures, faucets etc. where all high-end.  There were both quick-service as well as sit-down eating options.  We ate at both Storyteller's and Napa Rose and were impressed with both, although Napa Rose was a bit pricey.  As is the case with all Disney hotels, it is very family friendly.  All the pools were in one area, with two hot tubs and what looked to be good pool service for

Summary Heading: Super Fantastic.  No one can compare!
Summary: First time staying here and I had high expectations.  Checked in early, 7:30 am and I would recommend people doing this.  We never had to wait and they found us a room that was available.  So our bags were brought up and we were ready to go and start our day by 8:30.  Hotel is super clean, service is top notch.  This is a large hotel, so you do have to walk a bit to get to your room.  We had a view of the bear mountain, we could see fireworks from our room.  Room is very spacious.  Robes in the rooms, turn down service.  Food at the hotel is great.  White water snacks is the best deal.  They serve so much you can even share.   Easy access to California Adventure, easy access to downtown dismey, easy acces to parking.  We self parked and it wasn't a big deal at all.   When

-special fastpasses issued as part of our westjet vacation package that are valid IMMEDIATELY, no need to return later, for any fastpass ride (except world of colour) -direct access into cali adventure park, saving steps -ultimate location ‚Äì allowed us to do WAY more than we otherwise would have. Perfect for this age group (35, 34, 5, 3, 3) (and expecting) -great pools, nicely done, 2 hot tubs, very well kept, looked clean. Tonnes of high quality life jackets and lifeguards all day until 8pm and they were doing an excellent job (closed at 10pm, too early which is my only complaint). Fun big water slide, fun small one, kids must have done it 100 times!    -Big complaint ‚Äì wet areas in pool area were more slippery than expected. Poor choice of floor material (some kind of rock)

Received exactly what I expected when staying here!  We loved the location as it is right next to Downtown Disney and has it's own private entrance to Grand California Adventure.  Part of what made it so great, is with two kids, one still needed a nap in the afternoon.  I could walk back for the afternoon nap and my older child could stay out with my husband.    The hotel service was exceptional and friendly.  We could even see the fireworks from the window at the end of the hallway.  Kids loved finding the pictures of the Disney characters on their beds at night left by the staff.  Recommend not spending extra money on a "view room" because you really are not in the room much.  The rooms were nice, up to date and had a little refrigerator.

This was a holiday with my husband and two children aged 6&8 and my Mother-In-Law. We stayed at this hotel from February 11-18th. The name is fitting as this hotel is absolutely "Grand" in every aspect. Every detail seemed to be oversized and the well thought out. From the minute we arrived we were treated very well. The lobby itself is so impressive. We got there in the evening and there was a fellow dressed as a ranger sitting at the oversized beautiful fire telling stories to guests who sat comfortably in rocking chairs. So cute! There was also a smaller group of rocking chairs where kids sat watching cartoons. In the evening hosts hand out Disney Balloons to all the young kids. Just one of the little examples of the attention to detail. As for rooms we got two joining rooms

Summary Heading: What a great place to stay
Summary: Spent 4 days and 3 wonderful nights.  All I can say is I'm not sure if I can ever stay some place else in Disneyland area after staying here.  Rooms were large and very comfortable.  We had a connecting room as we traveled with another family.  We had two large wonderful beds in our room.  After walking all day it felt so good to slip into these beds with premium bedding.  Flat screen TV, nice size refrigerator, great adjustable lighting, turn down service, deck with view of disneyland fireworks at night, toilet/ shower seperate from dressing/sink area, coffee maker.  Two small complaints-water pressure in shower very low and bath products were only so-so for a first class hotel.    The swimming pool was fabulous!  one with a slide for little ones and a big slide for kids and

Summary Heading: Wish we could stayed here longer
Summary: We used our DVC points to stay in a 1 bedroom villa... Amazing! We were only able to book 2 nights and had been on the waitlist for 3 additional nights since February, but nothing opened up. We spent the 3 additional nights at the Disneyland Hotel. Next time I will be sure to book far enough in advance.   The villa that we stayed in was fully equipped with a king bed in the bedroom, a pullout sofa and a Murphy bed in the living room, and a pack n play. We had a full kitchen, washer/dryer, and 2 bathrooms. There was plenty of room for our family to relax from the park.   Hotel service was great. They even couriered our baggage to the Disneyland Hotel upon check out so that we could enjoy the day at the parks. The pool was nice and we were able to grab a quick bite to eat at

We stayed here during the Christmas season 2010.  The location is perfect, right between the two parks.  We had a newborn with us and staying that close to the park made it perfect to run back to our room at any time to feed, nap, change diapers, etc.  The rooms aren't amazing but you're really not paying for the furnishings, you're paying for the location.  We had a room with bunk beds that my daughter loved.  The lobby is breathtaking and at Christmas it was filled with an enormous tree.  We were even able to get our photo with Santa in the lobby.  Pools were great, and very empty in December.

Summary Heading: Best Disneyland Hotel we've stayed at!!!!
Summary: We checked in on concierge level from 6/29/2011-7/2/2011. Loved the personalized greeting from the moment we stepped out of our car.  Walked right up to the 6th floor for check in with no wait in line. I contacted by concierge the day before and they were aware that we would be checking in early, they said no problem if my room wasn't ready we could go to the park and they would page us once it was clean.  I was a little disappointed when we never received the page and it was already after 3 p.m. which should've been regular check in time. I finally had to ask if someone can check, when they did, they found that our room was ready.   The room was 2 double queen beds and a day bed, nice roomy room! I had read a few complaints on room size, I didn't see the problem.  The decor is

I came here with my husband, his brother, and my sons 5 year and 1 year old.  The staff are super friendly.  Once we entered the hotel, it felt so calm or warm and welcoming.  It is huge inside.  We waited about 15 minutes for check it and it was about 11am and our room was ready.  What a nice surprise!  The room was little small.  They upgraded us with a room with bunk beds.  To our surprise, the bunk bed had really 3 beds.  There was already a graco pack n play in the closet.  The room was sooo cute and rustic.  Our balcony was facing the parks and Downtown Disney.   It was probably a 3 minute walk to disneyland.  Downtown Disney is maybe a 2 minute walk.   The pools were awesome.  I think they had 3 or 4 pools.  One pool had waterslides.   This place is so worth the money.  I

Summary Heading: Only real alternative for the park, but not a great hotel in itself
Summary: Location, location, location as they say and this hotel has that of course.  Rooms dark, food average quality and expensive, however, service is OK.  Some of the park visit package seemed beneficial however, early entry is only on certain days and other things were a bit pointless.

Summary Heading: Excellent customer service-would love to go back!
Summary: We brought our daughter, son in law, 2 young grandsons and our adult son met us there for 3 nights in two very comfortable adjoining rooms. We were celebrating both grandsons birthdays and our daughter & son-in-law's 10th wedding anniversary. The hotel was very helpful in recognizing those special events with balloons, birthday cake & even rolled bath towels into a birthday cake like they do on a cruise ship! Beds were luxiously comfortable, room service food delicious, and for the first time ever my husband & I actually sat down in the lobby relaxing while listening to a pianist on the grand piano. The lobby is beautiful and comfortable with little conversation areas of couches , love seats, and club chairs. The grandsons loved the waterslide into the pool, and I loved ordering

We just got back from the Grand Californian and LOVED it.  The location was great, you just have to walk out of the hotel and into the back of the California Adventure park near the Grizzly Peak River Rapids.  We got to enter the park early and ride the new Little Mermaid ride , we were also handed Fast Passes to the World of Color show.  There was also an entrance to Downtown Disney from the hotel.  The room was clean and spacious, fine for a family of five.  The pool was great too.  The kids really had fun on the water slides. Not too thrilled with parking fee but I guess it is to be expected.  Would definitely stay here again.

We booked this trip a week before we left and picked this hotel based on a recommendation for the location.  When we went to check in, they were  supposed to have our park passes and all other needed documentation waiting for us.  It was not there, and it was mailed to us.  The front desk employee was great, and got Disney travel on the phone immediately.  They issued us new tickets, and had them sent to our room.  I was upset at first, but must say they made it right immediately.  This hotel is huge.  It is right in the park, and you have your own entrance to California Adventure.  You really can't find a better hotel for the location.  The rooms were older and not that large.  The bathrooms were not updated much.  You would expect a much nicer hotel for the price you pay.

Summary Heading: Not worth the money. Will not be back.
Summary: This hotel had several things wrong with it. We were promised gift bags and balloons for my kids because of there b-day. When we checked in they had nothing for them. They said because they had a latex allergy child staying there they could not give out the balloons. I could buy one at the park and bring it back though. At 10:00 pm the 1st night we were woken up by something below us and it vibrated the bed and the walls, so we had to switch rooms the next day. With 3 kids that is a big pain. They did comp our dinner but when the waiter found out he never came back to the table. The next 3 night in our new room we were woken up from partyers and people running back and forth upstairs. Also someone was smoking next to us and that is not allowed. Not to mention my kids have bad

My friend and I stayed at Grand Californian with 3 kids at the end of October 2010 for 4 days. I hesitated about the cost but since we split the room, it ended up being less painful. I was very pleasantly surprised how spacious the room was. I was prepared to be crammed but it was not bad. 2 queen beds, one sofa and still room for all of us to move around :) If you can stretch financially , I would strongly suggest this hotel, especiallyy if you have young kids. I stayed at the good neighbor hotel before trying to save and can now compare. I would hoestly say that staying at Grand Californian made a huge difference in the quality of experience we were able to have.  Pros:  Location, location, location! Extremely convenient being so close to the park. You walk out of your room,

You simply cannot beat this hotel for convinience to Disneyland.  It is expensive, but very much worth it.  We learned how valuable their service was when we got home from our vacation and realized we had left our camera somewhere.  When we called the hotel they were very prompt, efficient and helpful.  Not only did they find our camera, but they immediately shipped it back home to us.  They not only gave us great service while we were there, they literally saved our memories!  We will never stay anywhere else when visiting Disney!

I spent 5 days (6/26-6/30) at this hotel and I have to say it was the nicest Disney property I've stayed at yet (we've done the Disneyland Hotel and are planning Paradise Pier for next year). From the moment you drive onto the property it is fantastic.  The cast member at the gate greeted us by name and congratulated my daughter on her graduation (apparently their computer system is awesome and up-to-date) and the valet was extremely helpful getting us unloaded and directed to the registration area.  The lobby of this hotel is awesome...in both design and scale - I love Arts and Crafts and the designers knocked this one out of the park - it's simply fantastic. They have a little area for the little kids with these heavy chairs all surrounding a TV playing Disney cartoons and

We stayed at the DIsney's Grand California Hotel, but in the Vacation Club section. We had a 2-bedroom unit that accommodated 9 travelers and included a full kitchen, 3 bathrooms and a great view of California Adventure park and especially the World of Color show at night.  I suggest reaching out the actual Grand California Vacation Club owners and see if you can rent out their points - they have access to book before any other DVC members and regular hotel guests, so you'll get the dates you want and need.  We were able to utilize the easy access to the park to come & go as we please (especially nice once you are soaked on Grizzly Rapids) as well as popping in for a bite to eat to help keep the costs down. The pools were fun & heated including a slide for big & little kids

Summary Heading: Top location can't make up for terrible service and inhabitable rooms
Summary: This is such a difficult review to write, because it's hard to separate the enjoyment of our holiday from the enjoyment (or lack) of the hotel.  But the truth is the hotel knows its location is prime, and that you'll put up with things you'd never put up with at another hotel just to take advantage of the location.    We arrived and received the room type requested.  It's very handy to get bunk beds for the kids, and that's something we wish we could find at more hotels.  Otherwise, the room was dark, a bit drab, and a bit worn; the bed was only barely comfortable enough.  The rooms are a bit below the standards of a Four Points by Sheraton.  (To calibrate your tastes with mine: I spend about 30 nights/year in hotels; I love Four Seasons but find them a bit much; Westins and

Summary Heading: Expensive yes but I didn't mind
Summary: OK please keep in mind that what you are paying for is not necessarily the room, but the Disney experience and Location. It's all the little things they do that me and my family (wife and a 6 and 4 year old) enjoyed. I will break it down from check in to check out.  Upon arrival the Valet and Bell crew were very friendly and helpful.   Check in took approximately 25 minutes from the time I waited in line to the time I got my room keys. The girl who helped me (Maggie I think) was very helpful and very nice. Not only did I get a room at 10:30 am but she was kind enough to give me an upgrade to a room with a view of the park. NO ONE lets you check in early this day and age and certainly not before check out. Room keys double as charge cards (like a cruise your room will be charged)

Had the pleasure of staying 5 nights at this hotel in June, 2011.  The staff promptly greeted us as soon as we pulled up the drive.  I encountered many workers at the Grand Californian and they were all friendly and helpful.  From the front desk to housekeeping, any needs we had were met.  The atmosphere of this hotel is relaxing and laid back.  It's the perfect place to unwind after a busy day in the Disney parks.  My favorite spot was in front of the fireplace listening to the piano player.  There are 3 pools at this resort and plenty of comfortable lounges to sunbathe on.  The pool staff would go around removing unused towels from the lounges, assuring that everyone who wanted a lounge chair could have one.  Of course, the most amazing thing about this resort is the LOCATION!

Summary Heading: NOt overly impressed, kids too young to appreciate, but ok to splurge once?
Summary: I guess I had my hopes a little too high and so my expectations were not met.  The trip was business and pleasure as my husband had to work half of the trip. So my mom came to help me with our dd 7, and ds 4.   Cons-The hotel is really spread out so when we got in late we were not thrilled to walk 10min.to our room.  When we openned the door, I was shocked! And not in a good way. The room was going to be supr tight for the 5 of us. The kids loves the bunkbeds, but that night we found out everytime my dd moved ontop the bed squeeked! Ugh. And neighbors toilet flushed all night. Next morning I complained about location and bed squeeking so they moved us but same problems but bettr location. Another con, since the pool was to cool there were kids with their parents splashing in the

Our whole family loved the hotel, the lobby is beautiful and special mention must be made of the fireside story time. The kids loved it. The in-hotel service was great and our room was lovely, right down to the pretty shower curtains.  My mum had poor poolside service but all other was great. The location was amazing for experiencing Disneyland. It absolutely served its purpose, we could come in and out of the park for toddler naps and go back with ease.   The only let down was we left our passports in the room safe after we left - our VERY stupid mistake. Trying to get these back to us was a tense and slow process that took well over a week for something that should have been straightforward. Lost and Found were great when you could get hold of them but getting hold of them was

The rooms are not worth the price.  For us it was the location.  We had a young child we needed to return for naps so proximity to the park was key.  If you are going to spend a full day at the park, stay offsite.  White Water Snacks had reasonable prices for quick foods and the pools were fantastic for the kids.  I'm not sure why adults without children stay here, but we did get security called to our room at 615am for two toddlers making noise on a day the park opened at 7am.  That was off putting to say the least.  Perhaps Disney should put the childless freaks experiencing the "magic" in their own wing of the hotel.  Be sure to follow up with your room requests right before arrival as our two month request wasn't available and we had to wait 20 minutes at check in with

Summary Heading: Service was great, But! bed bugs? and missing medications
Summary: The hotel had our reservations and was very quick on check in. The rooms appeared to be very clean (extremely low water pressure in the showers, heard this from other guests as well), food was very good in the restaurants, and the bartender served some mean drinks. Access to the park just can't be beat, and somehow the employees at the Hotel still have "Old Fashioned Disney land Customer service" something the park itself lost along time ago.  Careful on the internet, you have to lower your security to use it, and we could easily see the hard drives and all contents of other guests.   The Bad News, even though the bed sheets looked very clean, getting under the covers got you bitten by something, no evidence of bed bugs on the mattress but little black specs (maybe baby fleas)

Though the hotel is lovely, the service was poor.  Though we paid an extra $150/night for the concierge service, we received no value from this service.  Our call for restaurant reservations was not successful.  Our call for clean sheets (due to a potty training accident) was not successful.  Our call for bell service to take our bags to the lobby was not successful (my husband had to carry 5 large bags across the hotel himself). These were basic service request I would expect from any hotel concierge, let alone one that costs an extra $150/night.

You can't beat the location especially if you have kids. It will save you time and energy from wasting time traveling to and from the parks. Easy access right into California Adventure makes it even more of a treat. The pools are great and the kids will love the water slide. Down side, it is really large hence the name "Grand" and it is easy to get a bit turned around. Some of the staff can be not so helpful or even testy. Housekeeping cleansed our room and then forgot to hive us new towels . They were quick to send some up. Valet service was quick on check out however, it seems everyone is waiting around for a tip. You drain your wallet in the parks and then the hotel staff seems to try their best to do the same. That was a bit too much. Overall, kids will love it, your pocket

Paid $100 to reserve a "themepark view".  First room in the 400 building overlooked a roof and trees.  Second room assigned overlooked more trees and the monorail ran right under our room.  No theme park view was to be had.  Said that's the only rooms available.  What a scam!

Summary Heading: Great time and lots of Disney Magic
Summary: We just stayed at the Grand Cali for 8 nights and absolutely loved it and the entire Disneyland Resort area. After travelling to "The World" for the last 20 years and seeing how it's become so commercialized, it was refreshing to experience that Disney magic once again.

My daughter and I stayed at the Grand Californian for just one night on our recent trip to Disneyland and California Adventure.  This was our first stay here and it is definitely a beautiful property.    We were greeted when we drove up and escorted to the front desk at check in.  We were early (which is what I would suggest, considering the crowds at check in I saw later in the day), so we checked in, stored our luggage, and provided our cell number to the hotel so that they could contact me once our room was ready.  Just a couple hours later (around 11am) we were contacted and came back to guest services to get our room keys.    The hotel is fairly large and unfortunately a little like navigating a maze when it comes to finding your room.  We had to walk down four very long

Worth the rate as the attention to detail and hospitality in this property is amazing and palatable.  The team has the time to go the extra mile, by cheerfully giving you directions and taking the time to genuinely smile at you.  The food is just so-so, and I see many people leaving the property, which is easy as Downtown Disney is right outside.  Take the time to enjoy the lounge, and have the Pear Martini.

Stayed at Grand Californian June 2011 and was baffled at how good of reviews  this place got?? I stay at hotels several times a month and except for location this was a 2.5 star hotel at a 5 star price. You will wait 45 minutes to check in and i went back 3x and my room was never ready although they promised me each time to give them another hour. The first night there after a day at Disneyland we all took spit showers because the pressure was gone. The next morning (and last) my daughter screamed in the shower and said the water went for boiling to freezing and back and forth and so i took one next and she was correct,(more like hot to cold, she wasnt hurt in any way) it was horrible, i felt like i was staying at an old motel 6. The room was small, it overlooked the valet area

stayed there last week with my 2 kids and had a great experience.  the service staff were attentive - greeting us when we walked in, helping with luggage, giving the kids badges, balloons, showing us the way to the lifts etc.   We also received 2 free fast passes per guest which was an excellent bonus, which enabled us to catch the new Star Tours without a long wait.  Magic mornings are great too - i found that the best time to tour Disneyland was between 7am  - 12 noon.  usually too crowded after that.  The rooms are clean and of a reasonable size.  No complaints there.  To me, the best thing about the hotel is it's location! It's less than a 5 min walk to Disneyland and it has its own private entrance to Disney California Adventure! thank goodness for that because we were

This was our second time staying at the California Grand.  Checking in was a breeze even though it was quite busy. Elizabeth at the front counter upgraded us to a bigger room that had 2 queen beds and a sofa bed which worked out perfectly. Everything about this hotel is wonderful. The 2 free fast passes offered to each guest and the World of Color fast passes were icing on the cake and made our trips to the parks more exciting. We always feel like we are getting the V.I.P. treatment and it makes our Disney trips very special.  The cost is more than worth what you get in beauty, convenience and luxury. It can be described best by what my 15 year old grandaughter said "We haven't had to go out into the "real" world at all"  Thank you California Grand and we have all decided there

Summary Heading: If I'm going to stay in the park, there really is only one choice
Summary: There's no getting around the obvious complaint, Disneyland is expensive and when you stay on site it adds up... Food, parking, everything but the tradeoff is being right in the middle of it all.  For the times you choose location above all else this hotel is something else. One minute you're inside the park, crowds, noise and the next there's a big fire, hot drink... Or maybe a cold one come summer, and you're chatting like you were in a lodge.  Ok, so it's clearly Disney and not some mountain resort but it comes close.  Ambiance aside, the rooms aren't huge but their modern, clean, well done with some nice views. I don't spend much time inside at the hotel but when you need to get some work done, it's all hooked up and ready to go.  Food options are good with a cafe, formal

Summary Heading: LOVED IT!!!!!! You've gotta stay here!!
Summary: We stayed here from for a few days at the end of May so we could get Disney in before we went to San Diego.  This place is amazing.  Check in was quick and the lady that checked us in was wonderful.  Our room had a a beautiful view of Grand Californian park and my daughter would spend all night out there on the balcony if she could looking at the lights late at night.  At check our son and daughter were each given 3 balloons each and signed pic of Mickey and the gang and the princesses.  The room was comfortable and must have been updated because we had no issues with cleanliness at all.  The A/C worked perfectly, the shower was great and there was no noise.   The pool area was fantastic and the waitstaff at the pool are awesome.  The food and drinks were great and no more

We stayed at the  Disney's Grand Californian June 11-15, 2011.  This is the first time we splurged and stayed at Disney Resort.  We've been to Disneyland many times before, but normally at nearby offsite hotels.    Checkin was no problem, though there was a quite a line when we were checking out though staffers seemed to be handling pretty well.  We bypassed the valet parking and DH parked the car at the parking lot near Paradise Pier and left it for the next 3 days.  We stayed in room 6107 which was a handicapped accessible room.   Pros:  extra large room with 2 queens and a daybed.  Cons:  no views (faced front of hotel looking down at entrance), 1 big bathroom (no separation between sink and toilet/shower), no microwave.  It worked for us.  There were five of us and we

Summary Heading: We loved it and we'll be back!
Summary: My family and I stayed at the Disney Grand California for my daughter's 12th Birthday and we loved it.  It is so convenient to be adjacent to Downtown Disney, Disneyland and California Adventure.  You can enter California Adventure through the Hotel.  We really enjoyed the pool and the Storyteller Cafe Character breakfast.

I really enjoyed our stay at the Grand Californian.  We had a deluxe room with a view of Downtown Disney.  We could see the fireworks from our balcony each evening.  I agree with the other reviewers that the best part of the hotel is its location.  It was great to be able to leave Disneyland or California Adventure and be back at the hotel so quickly.  The pool area was great.  Lots of lifeguards around to help supervise and my son loved the water slide.  Our room was clean and comfortable and housekeeping made it up early each day.  We will be back!
the staff was great ,stayed in concierge room,it was worth the money but the selection is not that great Room was great loved view ask for room 6304 theme park view

Summary Heading: Very nice but a bit pricey
Summary: We stayed for 4 nights between April 20th - 24th, it was very busy at that time as Spring Break and Easter.  We didn't have to wait long to check in and no problems with our booking.  The room was a standard room with a view of the monorail and a roof ( by the way the Monorail doesn't stop at the hotel)   It was a  very nice room and we loved the yummy chocs left each day the room was made up.  It was expensive but you really are paying for the location and the private entrance to Disneyland California Park. We had some snacks from the cafe near the pool and they were reasonably priced. The pool was great, my son loved the slide and they have plenty of towels and lounges. We went to the Storyteller Cafe for breakfast it was a bit expensive but good to meet Chip and Dale and a

My wife & I as well as our 2 boys (aged 9 and 4) traveled from Toronto to spend 5 amazing nights at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel over 2011 March break. It was our first visit to Disneyland with our boys, we have been to WDW in Florida on many occassions. Check in was a bit rough, our travel agent accidently cancelled our reservation when she made an alteration to add an extra night onto our stay. The Manager eventually came out and explained/fixed it, but it was a frustrating ordeal after being in transit with kids for over 8 hours. They threw in a bunch of "use anywhere" FastPasses as an apology, which at the time didn't seem like much, but later on when we saw the lines for rides, was fantastic to have in hand.  Our room was quite spacious and clean, suited us wonderfully

Summary Heading: Even more than we expected it to be.
Summary: It was time for a short vacation and also to renew our Disney annual passes. So we decided to stay at the Grand Californian. We have been through the hotel several times and eat at Storytellers whenever we get the chance. Check in was super easy. We arrived early, they held our bags. We went into the park for a few hours, came back to a very swift check in, and a very nice room. Great view over a courtyard. (Sat on the balcony one morning with coffee and a book and it was so peaceful.) Maid service was impeccable, and the room was very clean. Bed was super comfortable. We ate at Storytellers and loved it as always. We also found that they serve meals in the lounge area by the bar. Great options, good prices. While we were there, (in addition to the parks) we wanted to enjoy the

Summary Heading: The Best Experience I've Ever Had at Disney!!!
Summary: The Grand Californian Hotel has spoiled me forever for future Disney trips.  We decided to splurge and spend the extra money due to the proximity to the parks (literally steps to either park) since we were doing the Disney thing with our small children for the first time.  The service at this hotel is unparalleled - they make up your room in the mid-morning, and then come back at night to turn down your bed, leave Disney-themed candy on your pillow, and tidy up and check your towel supply.  The pool area is amazing, there are either 3 or 4 different pools and a large hot tub, and one of the pools has a waterslide.  The chaise lounges are incredibly comfortable and plentiful.  Most pools are patrolled by lifeguards as well.  The lobby is absolutely gorgeous, and the staff is

The location of this Hotel is excellent.  The room was nice but nothing spectacular.  The lobby is spectacular with lots of comfortable seats to enjoy a morning coffee, people watching or just relax with a book.  This hotel is all about family and the Disney experience.  It's a short walk to the monorail that drops in inside Disneyland or it has a "guests only" entrance into California Adventure.  It located in middle of Downtown Disney so enjoying a great meal or just grabbing a bottles of water is just a few steps away.

Our family prefers the Grand when we go to Disneyland. We love having access thru the guest entrance to California Adventure. Coming home after a long day at the park and seeing the roaring fire in the great room is marvelous! We each grab chairs and just chill by the fire before heading to our beautiful room to rest up for our next adventure. The bathroom is huge! Big enough for a family with three females to easily get their beauty on at the same time! The front desk goes out of their way to accommodate your needs. We have a special needs child, and having a wheelchair available without having to go to the park entrance was wonderful. The general store downstairs carries everything you might have left at home.

Summary Heading: Excellent service and very convenient location
Summary: This was our first visit to Disneyland and we are glad we chose the Grand Californian. The service is excellent, the location is convenient to all of Disneyland Resort and the ambiance is delightful.  It was very easy and quick to leave a park and go back to the room for a short break.  We stayed off-season in early May and received a rate of about $300 per night with all the taxes and resort fees. Expensive but worth the convenience and services.   My only complaint is that the hotel is starting to show wear in some areas. It is still very clean, just a bit worn in the elevators, the sofa in our room, woodwork in some areas, etc. Some updates and refreshes are due.  Our room did not have a view but we did have a balcony with two chairs and a table. We overlooked the roof of the

We have been to Disneyland 3 times now and stayed in the good neighbor hotels but the last time we stayed at the Grand Californian Hotel.  The convenience cannot be beat!  With this great location you never leave the magic!  You get easy access to monorail, early entry to the park, direct/early access to the California Adventure Park, Etc.  Great way to beat the crowd!  You can easly go back to your room and change after the Griszly river run or get a jacket if it gets colder.  The hotel is nice and has a very impressive lobby.  On the down side, it is very expensive at regular price.  We had a Fall Sale at almost 70% off it is well worth it.

Summary Heading: Convenience cannot be beat, my favorite Disney hotel period.
Summary: I've read many of the reviews here and think that most of the negative ones are missing the point. Yes the Grand Californian is expensive. But you aren't paying for luxury. This isn't a AAA 5-diamond luxury resort for the elite. But it is rated 4 diamonds :)  It is most definitely expensive, especially when there are no deals going on. The value of the resort is in the eye of the beholder. I have stayed at Disney's Grand Floridian in Walt Disney World previously. Although the hotels are architecturally different they do share similarities. The rooms are pretty large, the staff is great, valet parking is there if you want it, they both have excellent spas, they both have turndown service, they both have excellent room service among many other amenities. They both cost similar in

Summary Heading: Great location and property, the best option for a Disneyland experience.
Summary: It was great being able to walk straight out of the hotel into downtown Disneyland. The hotel in true Disney form is larger than life and the facilities are fantastic. We weren't that impressed with our room given what we were paying per night, however, I suspoect you pay a fair chunk for just being where you are! We thought it was a little strange that there was no mini bar in our room?  Overall a great stay and lots of fun.

Me and my two 10 year olds just got back from a 6 day stay at the Grand Californian, and I have to say it was the best vacation of my life (and theirs) notwithstanding the crowds and lineups in the parks.  We were on the 5th floor overlooking the pool and California Adventure Park, and even though there were families with young kids on either side of us, the room was dead quiet and very comfortable.  The kids also loved the pool, and being so close to both parks allowed us to spend the morning in the park, hit the pool for the hotter part of the afternoon, and then go back to the park (other the other park) for the evening with ease.  While you pay extra for such a great location it was well worth it.  It took us about 3 minutes from our room door to the entrance for California

Summary Heading: Still the ONLY choice for me!
Summary: I was here on opening night 1998 and returned with my 20 year old daughter last week..  I was pleasantly surprised to find the property running smoothly with guest rooms and public rooms up to Disney standard.  Pricey yes but well worth it..........so nice to be able to WALK back to your hotel during long hours at the park. Enjoyed dining at "House of Blues" and "Catal"  (Joachim Spichal from Patina) in Downtown Disney.

Summary Heading: LOVED IT FOR THE FIFTH TIME in 10 years!!!
Summary: We love this hotel! Yes, its expensive, yes its noisy but its DISNEYLAND!!!  This hotel can not be beat. The convenience factor alone is worth the price!! Dad can return to the hotel for his nap and everyone can regroup for dinner! The rooms are clean and the staff pleasant. We always request a room in the "Great Room", there is nothing like opening your door and seeing that gigantic fireplace and beautiful architecture. Upon our arrival we found the room to not be quite ready...needed towels and used ones were still there...called guest services and spoke with Melissa K. We only needed towels but she made sure the room was recleaned and handed us fast passes for our inconvenience, which was not necessary but really appreciated! I want to live here!!

We returned to the Grand Californian for another visit and again we received exceptional customer service and enjoyed the resort tremendously.  We are Disney Vacation Club members so this time we stayed at the new 1 bedroom condos.  We were able to have meals in the room which was a great cost saver.  There is a convenient BBQ right outside of our condo, with outdoor seating.  Although we did not pay for the view, we received a beautiful view of the California Adventure Park.  At night we were able to hear and see most of the "World of Color" water, light, and fire show.  It was fabulous!  The best part of the hotel is its proximity to Disneyland and California Adventure parks.  You can actually walk out of the hotel into the park.  When you need a rest, it is easy to walk back

This hotel is all about location and that is worth every cent.  Rooms are average , bathrooms need to be renovated.  Service is excellent.  My only downside I would say is I paid extra money for a view of the park but all I could see was the side of the mono rail , trees and a bit of the rafts.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel and location, but a bit pricey
Summary: We stayed 3 nights here before we headed to Vegas and had a great time.  The hotel is very grand and the location can not be beaten.  It is virtually in the Disneys Calfornian Park.  The hotel rooms are very comfortable, although not overly grand.   The beds are incredibly comfortable and we slept really well.  Room service was good and very fast.    I had a great facial at the spa and my husband had a massage and was very impressed with the staff.  The price of the spa were very reasonable compared to other hotels we have stayed in.    We asked for a view of the park or the pool but they couldn't do this so we had a view of the car park, although the room had a balcony which was really nice.  If you could get a view of the park you would be able to see the World of Colour show

The Grand California Hotel and Spa is magnificent! The hotel has a luxurious craftsman style theme, perfect rooms, butler style service, phenomenal restaurants like the glorious Napa Rose and the comfortable Storytellers Cafe, a relaxing pool area, and a special entrance into California Adventure. The lobby is jaw dropping and so are the views of the rest of the Disneyland Resort from this hotel! This hotel is a work of art and my favorite hotel at the Disneyland Resort!

Summary Heading: Like staying in the Magic Kingdom.
Summary: We stayed in the Disney Vacation Club Villas section of the hotel in a one bedroom suite which overlooked the Paradise pier section of California Adventure. The suite was quite elegant and provided all the comforts of home including a full kitchen which allows one to eat some healthful meals in addition to enjoying restaurants in the theme parks. (A bonus is being able to bring leftovers back for warm ups later on.) It is also nice to be able to return to the room for a mid afternoon break.  while our suite looked into the theme park it was still very quiet while allowing us to view the "World of Color" show from the comfort of our living room.

We went for my sons 13th birthday and there was not a day that went by that the staff did not spoil him. The hotel is right in the park, and so each morning, the boys would line up half an hour earlier than anyone else and have the park to themselves along with other guests staying at the Grand California.  The food was very good across all the restaurants and in hindsight, I'm sorry that we did not base our 2 week stay here and then travel out on day trips to Las Vegas and San Diego.  A great time was had by all and the Hotel experience was simply memorable for my son

We decided to stay at the Grand Californian on our most recent visit due to traveling with our toddler son, as well as my in-laws. We wanted to be as close to the parks as we could, and we were not disappointed in that regard by staying at this property. The convenience of being so close to not only Disneyland but also having the private entrance into California Adventure was great! The room was extremely spacious for four adults plus one crib, and the beds were quite comfortable. You could see that the room was starting to show its wear, but there wasn't anything too bad. Housekeeping was great, even when we made special requests for more coffee or towels. The bar and fireplace in the lobby were nice to have on hand at the end of a long day in the parks so we could relax with a
Disney always seems to prove their proficiency in providing the perfect resort experience!

Summary Heading: Great location and Amenities, Average Rooms
Summary: I've stayed here before at this Hotel when it was newer, and cleaner, and now the Hotel rooms are starting to show their age. It reminds me of an $80 dollar hotel on the side of the freeway.  The hotel lobby is beautiful as you walk in, and wonderfully decorated with the Craftsman style charm.  However, once you get into the rooms, they are dingy, dark, and showing their age and imperfections.  The shower drips out watery very slowly, and the overall decor in the room is blah.  There's also a smell in the hallways reminiscent of a nursing home type smell with strong cleaners, and not enough airiness to it.  I would give it an A+ for the location and amenities, but a C- for the rooms.  This hotel needs a serious makeover to justify the high prices.

Summary Heading: 3 star hotel at best, five star price
Summary: As others have said, the only really good thing about this hotel is it's location in Disneyland.   We found all of the other things that were important to us were bad, and we would rate this hotel as a three star at best.  We have stayed in many four star hotels around the world, and this was by far the worst and doesn't come close to a good four star.  We decided to pay the $450 per night because of the location and because we thought we would be staying in a luxurious hotel.  However, the room was very disappointing.  Small, dark and decorated in dingy tones.  Furniture was cheap.  Also, you couldn't turn off the A/C fan which ran all night blasting cold air all night.   Called maintenance who said they could turn off the fan, but then you would have no A/C.  Whatever happened

Summary Heading: The convience is worth every penny!
Summary: Nice clean, comfy rooms.  Convient "snack shack" by the pool.  Long check in process.  Friendly house keeping staff.

We were at the Grand Californian 4/18 -4/20/11.  My husband, ten year old, 2 year old and myself checked into the hotel and ran off to the Disneyland.  We arrived back at our room about 11pm at which time we bathed the kids and put them in bed.  The next day was an exact repeat except we had an even earlier start.  On 4/20, I woke up to change my son's pull up at about 5:30 am.  He likes to sleep low in the bed, so I pulled the sheets down further than half the bed length on the queen size bed.  I was horrified to find what looked to obviously be multiple large blood stains on the sheets.  I immediately turned the lights on to check my children to see if they were bleeding from some unknown injury.  They were quite frightened along with my husband.  I was happy to find that the

Hi  I never write these things but feel obligated. This place is so expensive.  I agree with others, you are paying for the convenience and proximity to the parka which is nice   My first poor impression was yhe lobby. We arrived on 50 degree cold spell and the lobby felt colder. It never warmed up the whole time We stayed. They had a big beautiful fireplace but it was only a gas one and didn't give off much heat. I found put layer they keep it that cd for the mountain theme. Seems preposterous.  Our first day the Tv didn't work. I called everyday because it wasn't working. They said they would send someone and maybe they did but it still doesn't work. They lock on the bathroom door was broken so no privacy. One night we were leaving and the maids had not made up our room. We

Summary Heading: Unbelievable location! Should have been much, much cleaner.
Summary: This was a wonderful hotel. It was our daughter's 12th birthday while we were there and they treated her very well. She received autographed pictures of the Princesses and of Alice and the Mad Hatter! She also had a bouquet of balloons in our room when we finally got in. The concierge staff was out of this world! They had concierge on our floor who helped with changing reservations for restaurants and who suggested other places to go (WhiteWater Snacks- onsite have the most amazing steak nacho's for a great price). Everyone who works in the hotel are very friendly! The location couldn't have been better- being situated in downtown disney with an entrance to DCA and only steps from the monorail. The hotel is also extremely beautiful! The pools were great as well...not crowded,

Family four (2 kids 8yr/11yr).This a beautiful hotel with such amazing detail everywhere you look, if you look closely you see Disney themes everywhere, micky ears on carpet, bambi on shower curtins - but very tastefully done. Architecture is art deco/arts and craft - like a huge ski lodge. Easy access to Disneyland and its own entrance to Adventure park.  Kids loved the pools which they assured me were heated.  Laundry facilities were a godsend as we where travelling light. Food is pricey in hotel and outside in Downtown Disney which is expected.There is a shop at the hotel which you can buy cereal, bread, yoghurt, coffee etc which you can eat there are take back to room.  This helps offset the  food cost espcially for breakfast as we are not big waffle/pancake/cooked breakfast

I came here with my family and best friend during spring break. I had heard not so great things about the rooms, but they honestly weren't that bad. They were small for the price of the hotel, but we weren't in there besides to sleep, so it didn't matter that much. I have been to Walt Disney World around 15 times, but never DL and from my experience at staying at this hotel, Disneyland has to be my new favorite. My family absolutely adored being able to walk right in with our CA private entrance and ride the rides before it got too crowded. We took advantage of our magic morning hours and got up very early, but when we were tired around midday, we could just take a short walk and relax by the pool. My parents loved that. My friend and I also loved being able to go around the

For a place that is so big, you still felt a bit special just being there. All the staff (and there is alot of them) were all very polite and helpful. Totally capped of our Disneyland Experience. Be carefull getting the meal packages as they dont always cover the cost of the meals at the resturants

Summary Heading: Quality, Fabulous Location and Great Service....with a large price tag
Summary: We stayed at the Grand Californian for 5 days starting on April 10th.  Having a bunk bed room was a priority for us and I mentioned this when booking.  Upon check in at the Grand, they let me know that we were already slated to receive a bunk bed room, so we were pleased with that.  Our room overlooked the pool and was very quiet during the day and at night.  Based on previous reviews, I would be cautious when booking a park view or Downtown Disney view if you have small children, due to the noise.  We didn't have any of those issues.  While I was aware that the rooms are smaller than people expect, it doesn't hit you until you are standing in the room how small it actually is.   With 4 people in a room , we were tripping over each other.  The service we encountered while

Summary Heading: Reliable, Consistent, and good quality... at an expensive price
Summary: Our family stayed at the Disney Grand California Hotel for 8 days, March- early April 2011.  The rooms are nice and clean.  I would guess the maids have to complete a thorough checklist for each room.  We liked the consistency of the good quality.  It is worth the extra money.    The pros:  They have a turn-down service,  they leave chocolates each night.  The breakfast cafeteria was a good alternative in the mornings, not too expensive and quick.  The beds were comfortable.  Noise level between the rooms is muffled, not too loud.  The pools with the slide and two large hot tubs were nice, but a little crowded at times.  The ambiance and theme of the hotel and room were relaxing and fun.  It was really nice to be so close to the parks, it helped the achy feet- it made a huge

We stayed at Disney Grand Ca hotel from April 14 -17th 2011 with my daughters dance team of 20 + girls & families.  So far 7 girls and 1 family member have reported bed bug bites.  We contacted Disney Ca Grand directly to report the bites.   We were in no way rude or obnoxious about this, nor did we ask for any type of refund.  We asked that Disney own the problem and take care of the problem. We have been told they checked all the rooms. No bed bugs were found. We find it absolutely amazing that so many kids have been affected by this and they still refuse to accept responsibility. We understand this is not something they have control of.  It happens, but Disney needs to accept the problem and deal with it.  STOP denying it and be more diligent and proactive about it. We have

You'll see the same thing throughout the reviews here, so let's get it out of the way. Think of it this way: the hotel is $200 a night, and for that I think it does quite well. The other several hundred you are paying each night is for the convenience of being in the closest hotel to the two parks. There are similar charges at Disneyland--e.g., reserved seats for the shows--and so it's best to think of it that way.  At that rate, this hotel does well to excellent on several levels. The lobby is really very nice, and it's great that they have performers playing music, or telling stories in front of the fire. I'm a bit surprised to see complaints of dirty rooms--we had no such issues. The two things that are most important to me in a room are a comfortable bed and a high-pressure

Summary Heading: Not as convenient as you think....
Summary: We took our two grandkids, four and two, for their very first Disney experience last week, April 18-19 and chose to stay here.  We figured since it was right at Downtown Disney and backed up to California Adventure, it would be great.  My wife booked the vacation on line with a two day park hopper pass, dining plan and we figured we could rent a stroller and we would be set, right....WRONG!  First, you have to get to the room, which is a LONNNNG way from the front desk.  Second, you are not told the dining dollars you buy in set amounts, may or may not pay for everything.  Third, about the stroller...  You cannot rent a stroller from the hotel.  Nope, they told us that they used to, but they were being stolen so they don't.  Where can you rent one, in front of Disneyland.  BUT,

Of course everyone who stays here is sold on Disney and will cut them lots of slack, and I am no exception.  There was enough that was really nice to make this a very pleasant stay.  The staff was super nice, from registration to bell services to valet, just great.  Being able to leave the car and luggage in valet/storage for free all day after we checked out was very convenient.   Our connecting 4th floor rooms overlooked the majestic Grand Hall on one side and the pools on the other, very nice.  When my wife could not get to sleep by 2:30 because of all the noise, she woke me up and I figured out how to unplug the noisy refrigerator, and we called the front desk to turn off the Grand Hall theme music, which apparently plays at considerable volume all night... they did do this

As with most Disney hotels rooms are nothing special even small for family of 4 but location wins here, special entrance for calafornian park and monorail for Disney guests to disneyland park. Worth the extra if you want character breakfast too. Service all round excellent.

Summary Heading: there IS NO five star luxury for disneyland
Summary: after years of staying at outside hotels and other older, more run down disneyland resort hotels, we were greatly anticipating staying at the grand californian on our most recent trip to disneyland as we had read and heard that it was the best.  let's be perfectly frank here.  if you've only ever stayed at 3 star level hotels, then the grand californian is great, but it really charges 5 star prices for 3 star quality.   let's face it, for convenience and location, it is by far the best hotel you can stay at when visiting disneyland and california adventure.  unfortunately, it really is nothing special.  you are paying for convenience of location, nothing more.  you're paying to be able to walk out from the hotel straight into downtown disney or into california adventure.  the

My family of five stayed here to celebrate our 7 y.o. and 6 y.o. birthdays. We are annual passholders so we often come to Disneyland sometimes for the day, sometimes we stay with family who lives close by, sometimes we stay at the less expensive hotels in the surrounding area. But, since this was a special occasion and my daughter specifically requested to stay at the "hotel with the water slide," my dad splurged for us and booked us a room for two nights at the Grand Californian.  I am so grateful that he did! The lobby is gorgeous and a very calming atmosphere after the hustle and bustle of the theme parks. I love the comfortable leather rockers by the beautiful fireplace. I could've sat there for hours! The kids loved the child size rockers in front of the big TV that

This is our second time staying at the Grand Californian and we LOVE it!  I rate it a five star, but if you go with small children - do not get a room by the main lobby.  There was a lot of noise and music in the evening and my son couldn't go to sleep (I even had a hard time one evening because the noise level was so loud).  The previous stay, we were in another portion of the hotel and didn't have any issues with the noise.  Otherwise, FANTASTIC place to stay on your magical vacation!

This hotel is the closest to the two parks and you definitely pay for the location and nothing else. The rooms are really basic and quiet depressing in it's decor, not entirely sure how it get's its rating. It's extremely dated and the bathroom is really small.  The beds are not particularly comfortable but our girls (aged 10 and 8) do like the bunk beds in the room. It's actually a shame that this is Disney's best hotel because it is so expensive for what you get.  Like most travellers before us have said, it is really just the location you pay for. The only thing that is good here is the free wifi...

Summary Heading: We all loved the Grand Californian
Summary: I must admit to being a cynic and a hater of theme parks (and I have a unnerving fear of rollercoasters). And being in close proximity of soo many people makes my skin crawl. So I booked the Grand Californian hoping that it will give our holiday with two children (6 & 3) a fighting chance at a good time.  Perhaps because I went into the resort with such pessimism I was so much easier to impress.
