We were enthusiastically welcomed to the resort and given everything we needed to have magical time at Disneyland.  The staff were sincerely helpful and always smiling and asking if we were having a great time.  We booked bunk rooms and weren't able to have one, no problem we were given a double with a magical view over the pool and across to the Californian Adventure theme park.

Summary Heading: We will never stay anywhere else!
Summary: We stayed here over our spring break (from Vancouver Canada). We stayed at a different hotel last year, and decided to splurge. By the end of the first day, our "one time splurge" was now "the only place we'll stay". If you can afford the bill, this place is wonderful! We have a five year old son, and asked for a room near where the entrance to Disney California and Disneyland were. We paid for a standard room, but were upgraded to a room with a pool view (and one of thew Redwood Creek Challenge play area in DCA). The room was immaculate, and the beds were GREAT (this from someone with back problems). The Whitewater Cafe was great for quick breakfasts, and pretty cheap. The pools were awesome, and when we went each afternoon we were always able to find lounge chairs somewhere. A

Summary Heading: Beware if you have small children!
Summary: This is a beautiful hotel in a great location.  We had a premium view room overlooking downtown Disney, and the noise at night was HORRIBLE.  We have 2 small children, and there was essentially a live rock concert right underneath our window until after 10:00PM.  It was VERY loud and kept us all awake, causing major issues with 2 tired kids the next day.  It ruined our trip.  Hotel staff tried but failed to help us.  In general, service was very poor.  food is pretty good though, and the location is great.  Just be careful if you have small kids that need to sleep!

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel - not enough value for the price
Summary: Stayed at the Grand Californian for a week at the beginning of April.  We arrived at about 3pm and the check in line moved quickly despite having a few families ahead of us.  The guy at the counter managed to get us a bunkbed room after initially putting us a 2 queen room which was nice but I had requested bunkbeds during booking and that was obviously overlooked.  He gave my daughters each balloons and an autographed picture of the princesses as it was their birthdays. The room was nicely appointed but the safe is a style I would expect to see in an older hotel and couldn't hold very much, certainly not a laptop.  Dual sinks separate from the bathroom which was nice.  We had an amazing view of .... a roof, but not all rooms can have a nice view and I didn't book a park view.

Easy, very enjoyable tour of Disneyland! 1) Southwest Rapid Reward flight from NH to LAX 2) Hopped on a Grayline(Disneyland)Bus(very low rate! No need for rental car).  3) Dished luggage to friendly Bell Service at Hotel. 4) Assigned a very nice Courtyard-view room(efficient, professional check-in) 5) Quick bite to eat at Grand Californian's Whitewater Restaurant(basic, but good quality). 6) Walked a very short distance within the Hotel to Park entry. 7) Presented our Park-Hopper tickets, and we were off and running! Absoulutely love Disneyland!  The Grand Californian played a huge part in making this such an enjoyable place to visit.  Don't compromise...a great vacation experience is too important.

My family and I are DVC members and had not yet stayed at the Grand Cal Resort.  Oh my, my is all I have to say!  This resort was absolutley heavenly!  The decor is so warm and relaxing.  The side of our room faced the California Adventure park so we had great views of fireworks and the park lit up at night!.   There is not better location to the parks than the Grand Cal.  To have a resort that you can literally walk out of the resort and be in the parks is so convient and time saving.  The staff was super and extremely willing to help.  Our room was very clean and we just had an overall super stay!

This was actually my 5th time staying here and this was the first time I had a pool view. I enjoyed the pool view best because the weather was over 80 degrees when we were there, so there was something to look at when I was in the pool. Had the courtyard view--boring, had California Adventure park view, great, but the park closes early on most days. Had Downtown Disney view, nice, because it's stays open late and there is plenty to look and listen to. Like the different music performers, etc.   My most recent visit (April 1st) was actually the best night I ever had in a hotel. I literally thought I was at home! That's a good nights sleep! Because the weather was hot when we arrived at 11:00 a.m. I had the swimsuits in a separate bag ready to go because I knew the room would not

Great hotel if you are going to Dinsneyland with a family. This was our 6th trip and first time at this hotel, what a great location and fantastic ammenities. The restuarnts were overpriced and food a bit mediocre - but the location, pools, bunk beds were all worth the price. A short walk from the park allows you to go back and forth to swim & recharge before going back for the afternoon or evening. This is the only hotel I would come back to on our next trip to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel with a fabulous location
Summary: We recently spent 6 nights here in two adjoining standard rooms, one with a queen and bunks and the other with a king.  We were most concerned about getting our bed/room requests and they were fulfilled with no problem at all.  Our location was on the fifth floor overlooking the carpark, however we did not mind the view at all.  The walk to DL and Californian Adventure Park was really short and enabled us to come back to the hotel for rests as needed.  I enjoying walking through Downtown Disney as it felt like you never left the magic.  The pools were great, warm water, fun slide, plenty of towels, the only downside was lots of people hogging the lounges!   We ate a wonderful meal at the Napa Rose and can highly recommend this restaurant.   I have read other reviews of this
Worth every penny and more! The location, the staff, the service, the amenities, the beauty - I wish I could give it more than 5 stars! You can believe we'll be back!!!

My husband, two sons (8 and 5), and I stayed here for a week and we will return again.  Our room faced a courtyard/monorail and it was pretty quiet and private.  The hotel's location is excellent, but the rooms are average.  There is a small fridge in the room so I ordered from Von's on-line ahead of time (bottled water, drinks, snacks, sandwich stuff, and breakfast items).  There is a $15 delivery fee, but it's well worth it.  The hotel bellhop did a great job delivering all of our groceries and our 10 pieces of baggage to our room.  Housekeeping also did an excellent job.  The rooms are a little small and the pillows were way too thick for us (especially for the kids).  The registration desk was not very helpful or friendly, but we only waited 5 minutes to check in.  The kids

Summary Heading: Best place to stay at Disney for short term
Summary: Beautiful hotel. The pictures speak for themselves. Clean all around. Rooms have a small safe and fridge and a sizable closet. Flatscreen with DVD player.  We had noise similar to moving furniture above us early in the morning both days but was not a big deal. The staff were excellent and very helpful. The breakfast buffet was excellent but very expensive. Disney characters were around and took pix with kids in the restaurant and we did not even have to buy any packages ahead of time. Save $. There is also a good size pool area with pools of different types and a slide.The biggest sell of the hotel is its location. One door opens into Adventure Park. One other entrance into Disney Downtown area which is a 5minute walk to the main Disney Gate. The advantage is that you can come

Summary Heading: You pay for the location - not the rooms or the amenities
Summary: Overall - a good place to stay if you're touring the disney parks.  But...don't expect the hotel quality to match the prices.    Check-in - efficient.  Room - medium quality - similar to a standard urban hilton/marriott/westin.  Pools - perfectly nice, but nothing sensational.  Restaurants - did not eat there.  Service - very good - the hotel got us our boarding passes for the trip home, efficient bell desk, and attentive to questions.  Location - best in the area.  California theme park entry was under 3min walk from our room.  Disneyland and California park are essentially very small - its easy to bring young kids back to the hotel room to rest and recharge.  Its a minor hassle walking the length of the large hotel, to get to downtown disney, to then walk back to the gates of
Enjoyed our stay. It was a great experience for us. Service was good. Would definitely come back.

Summary Heading: Loved it, will never forget it
Summary: Grand Californian is the "creme de la creme" of hotels in the Disneyland area.  Steps from both parks, monorail and downtown Disney, is the best location and most convenient place to stay.  It was very expensive; but worth it.  Pools were fabulous, saltwater, heated to above 85f and two large hot tubs.  The Storyteller's Cafe is awesome and great for breakfast, characters come to table and visit with kids.  Buffet was perfect, loads of choice and fast and hot.  Rooms are spacious and comforable, quiet and clean.  Our room had queen sized bed and bunk beds with extra murphy bed...could easily sleep 2 adults and 3 kids.  You can skip the other two hotels, this is the best one.

I‚Äôm writing this well after the fact, but I had to post how the staff at the Disney's Grand Californian saved our vacation. We got to Hotel early in the morning. It was our boys,  at the time were 2 and 3 years old, first trip to Disneyland. I think we were more excited then them. I knew our room wouldn‚Äôt be ready, so we checked our bags and went to Disneyland. After a morning of pure fun; we started to notice that our 3 year old was not looking good and seemed to be ill. We went back to the hotel before we got the text message saying our room was ready. We hoped we could get a room now, so our son could get some meds and rest. They immediately gave us a room when they saw how bad he was starting to look. We got him in the room and gave him some medicine to try to help his fever

Summary Heading: The best place to stay if going to Disneyland with young kids
Summary: With young children and only 2 days in the parks, it was nice to be able to get in and out of the park so easily.  The older kids could stay out with mom, and I brought back the baby for a nap.  Priceless.  The pools here are amazing.  Some of the rooms take a while to walk to, but it is a big hotel so that is expected.  Some of the rooms have bunk beds for the kids, it was a hit!!!   We won't stay anywhere else again.

Our family travelled to Disneyland to celebrate my 60th birthday.  We decided to stay at the Grand Californian as my grandchildren are 3 and 5 yrs old and we wanted to be close to the parks. We had two adjoining rooms which were decorated with balloons and pictures of Mickey when we arrived to celebrate my birthday and my grandchildren's first visit.  I was also given a button which read Today is my birthday and my name.  The cast members at the parks and the hotel staff all noticed my button and all wished me a happy birthday which was actually quite special! The rooms were comfortable and clean.  I would prefer the sink in the bathroom rather than beside it but that is just my preference.  We ate at Storytellers and ordered room service and found the food very good.  We did

We stay at this hotel at least once a year or more. We have a 3yr old and a 4 yr old so it is worth every penny in convenience. We drive in from the San Antonio Texas area so nothing feels better that arriving at the hotel and having the valet take your vehicle away($17 a day for this service or you can park across the street for free and play frogger with your luggage) and the bell will take and check your luggage while you check in. The service at this hotel is excellent and you do get a lot more that if you stay at Disneyland Hotel or Paradise Pier. This is a busy hotel and all the staff works really hard to be sure you are tended to in a timely manner. One thing I need to point out is that this hotel is priced high for the size of room you get, but you need to remember that

Stayed here for Valentine's Day .  Arrived at the hotel right at 3 PM - ended up with 2 queen beds as opposed to the king I'd requested, but the room was ready so we took it and went to the pool.  Our two year old loved them, especially the hot tub.  The rooms are small, but have a fridge, as well as a separate sink area from the shower/toilet.   Beds were comfortable, rooms were quiet, except for occasional noise from passing guests.   We paid extra for a room with a theme park view - totally not worth it.  We had a view of the Grand Californian entrance to California Adventure.  Couldn't really see any of the park, and definitely none of the World of Color.  I didn't ask for a room change, as we were only there one night and room availability seemed limited when we checked in

Yes, you pay for location here, and that is really all you get.  Yes the storytellers is great for the characters, the food is barely average.  I guess I expected too much, I had thought it would be a bit more like a luxury hotel.  It is a middle of the line hotel in Disneyland.  Saying that, the distance to Disneyland and the private entrance to California Adventure is great!!!    The Service is good, not great.  We had called down the get a shoe my daughter had dropped retrieved and were given a very rude response and then after waiting 1 hour and hearing nothing we called down to cancel and retrieved it ourselves.  Some hotel staff are great, some not so great.  Typical of any mainstream middle class hotel.  There is an issue with the smell of cigarette smoke at the back

This hotel is very nice. Yes the price is high for the hotel stay but the treatment we received was just above and beyond! The staff is amazing and will do anything to ensure your stay is one to remember. The rooms were very nice and the beds were comfortable. The location is perfect if you plan on visiting Disney. Food is okay but we just went to the regular dining area and they do accomodate for allergies, very nice. I would stay again if the price is right, it was a treat for us to stay there during this trip! The children enjoyed the pool!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel with THE best location!
Summary: The Grand Californian and Disneyland was a fun trip.  The hotel lobby is very big and grand.  It's Frank Lloyd Wright inspired design, Art & Crafts.  They keep the lobby very! cold so it feels like you're in the mountains.  Our room was ok, right on the Downtown Disney side.  It was very clean, compact and typical.  Luckily they shut it down around 10 pm because you could hear the noise.  However, it was fun to look out on the action and view the Disneyland fireworks at night.  Like many hotels, you can definitely hear the noise around the halls and other rooms.  Typical for a big hotel.  Minus the 2 a.m.  fire alarm the first night, it was fine.  Not great, but fine.  It would have been better if we had been given a credit for that, but I didn't ask and they didn't offer.  The

Summary Heading: Beware! Dirty room at check in.
Summary: While the convenience of the hotel location can't be beat, I must say that I was quite disappointed with the lack of attention to detail when it came to room cleanliness.  When we checked into our hotel room, we found that there was still a little bit of trash in one of the garbage cans and the shampoo bottle provided was half used!  Okay, no big deal, we find a maid in the hallway and she gives us a new shampoo bottle.  It was not until the next morning that we noticed there were crumbs under the pillow of one of the beds!! We had not even eaten in the hotel room, so this could only mean that we slept on sheets occupied by the previous hotel room guest!  Very disgusting. For a 5 star hotel, I expect MUCH more.    I noticed other reviews with similar complaints and have written

My husband and I were booked to stay at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel and Spa for 3 nights at the end of our trip to the USA from Australia. We planned to spend one day at Disneyland and the other days exploring LA. Firstly on check in despite indicating that we wanted a KING bed in our room we were told there were none available so were placed in a room with two small queen size beds. The reception area was SO crowded and we were offered no help with any luggage and directions to our room. Our room unfortunately was on a lower level so the minute we opened our door we were greeted with the screaming children in the hotel foyer. The supposed 'relaxing' fireplace area was anything but. I understand we were in Disneyland but our room could have been right next to a

Stayed here with daughter and family. (3 rooms) Check in was a breeze even though the bus just dropped of several families. The total price for the package was a little pricey for just me.  The staff graciously up-graded us to a room overlooking the courtyard and pools so our family could be close. I would have loved to been able afford and to participate in the 6th floor concierge service! Grandparents, this is a neat secret! The convenience of the entrance to DCA was awesome!  I want to return of course, but I will have to save more money. Even though I read everything I could, I still missed some of the benefits because of the times or prices.  Wish I had more time to explore the whole hotel.  The lobby is truly grand in the Craftsman style.  Perhaps the dining plan would

Summary Heading: Excellent experience, a bit of a splurge
Summary: We loved staying at the Grand Californian. They went out of their way to make sure 3 rooms were together (2 separate bookings). We bought a package, which made it a great value. Beds were comfortable, rooms were very clean, nice layout. Felt a bit small with all four of us in one room, but we sent one kid to Grandma's room, which worked out better. We had rainy weather and tired kids, but were able to see peek-a-boo version of "World of Color" from our balconies. Showers were like a slow drizzle, but that was my ONLY complaint. Staff were uniformley excellent. How does Disney do that? Would definitely do it again if I could. Also loved private entrance to California Adventure. In our group were myself (mom), my husband, two boys (ages 7 and 9), my mom, my mother-in-law and my

We frequent Disneyland at least once year.  We have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and Paradise Pier, but this was our first stay at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel.  We had always wanted to stay here in the past, but couldn't afford the insane rates of $400 + per night for a standard room.  Then one night, it happened!  Magic!  They were advertising a rate of $200 per night.  Still VERY expensive, but it was a short trip and and eh...  You only live once.  Checking in was total CHAOS!  At one point I wondered if we were in line for an attraction.  We waited almost 45 minutes to check in!  Our room was nice, faced a courtyard and you could see a portion of the monorail passing by.  The room was smaller than expected for the price, buy hey - it's Disney!  They charge what they

We stayed at the Grand Californian at the start of our month long US trip.  What a place to start.  Firstly the theme of the hotel is superb and the lobby is awe inspiring.    As expected the Disney Staff were wonderful and very attentive to details.  We were advised on checkin that some electrical work would be done overnight so the power may go off during the night.  That night the TV came on without warning but the next day maintenance staff came around to check the TV.  Because they came to fix the Tv and "disturbed me" they gave us fast passes to use on any rides.  The restaurants at the htoel are amazing expecially Napa Rose.  The food is the best in Anaheim.  Again the service is great.  Although the mixed up our order a little which delayed our meals they were so

This hotel is great fun and a wonderful location, but be sure you don't need anything and pay close attention to your valuables! Our iPad was stolen from the room and I was incredibly disappointed with the service I received. Nobody was willing to help. The attitude was just, too bad.

We stayed for 4 days and 3 nights.  From the moment we drove onto the property, we were impressed.   We opted for the concierge level.  It is very worth the extra cost.  We were greeted as we drove up to the front.  I was very thankful to be taken straight to the 6th floor to register.  The cast members were wonderful to my kids giving them buttons and autographed pictures.  Check in was such a breeze. The Craftsman Club is a life saver.  My 3 year old could only make it till about 2 everyday.  He loved going to "the club" to color and play games.  I also appreciated the to go containers of snacks.  Also, liked the complimentary wine and beer in the evening! The room, with bunk beds, was spacious and comfortable.  The only negative was the lack of water pressure in the shower.

We stayed at the concierge level, which was probably the best decision we ever made!  When we arrived at the hotel, a cast member was waiting for us at the door along with a bellhop. As a concierge guest, we had priority check-in; the cast member took us directly to our room to check us in! It was great to be able to head straight to our room after a long flight.  The concierge lounge was fabulous! For breakfast there were fresh fruits, pastries, bagels & cream cheese, assorted cereals and oatmeal. For beverages, there were assorted teas, coffee with flavored syrups, milk, orange juice and cranberry juice (the fridge is always stocked with pop)  During the afternoon, they served delicious little sandwiches, chocolate covered strawberries and tea cookies, along with more fresh

Summary Heading: Really Really nice but the life guards....not so much
Summary: We stayed there the week after Thanksgiving and really enjoyed our stay. There was an issue with the tub and maintenance was up in a matter of minutes to fix it. The lobby was beautiful, and our children did get a picture with Santa by the huge tree.  The staff even had a scavanger hunt for the family which was a lot of fun. Part of the family even went to a towel folding class they held and made little towel animals. Bell services was really good.  Our only issue was with the life guard at one of the pools, one of our kids was in a little distress after swiming too much and the life guard just watched him struggle. There was an adult swimming with his kids and he swam over to help him and bring him over to us.

Summary Heading: You pay for the location and that's it.
Summary: Cleanliness The hotel is clean and comfortable.  They do a good job of making sure everything is polished and looking good.  Two complaints- the restroom in the lobby could be paid more attention to and it takes until late afternoon to have your room cleaned.  Location This is what you are paying $300 per night for.  California Adventure is right out the back door and Disneyland is about a 7 minute walk with children in tow.  Numerous shops and restaurants within minutes.  Rooms I was in a standard room with one full size bed and a bunk-bed for the kids.  I was unaware that when you request a room with a bunk-bed that the main bed would be a full size rather than a queen, kind of disappointed.  The room was a basic hotel room with a coffee maker, refrigerator and TV.  My only

Summary Heading: Perfect location, if you can get it for a discount.
Summary: Stayed at the Grand Californian as a special treat for my friend's 50th birthday. Usually we stay at the much less expensive places on Harbor Drive, like Carousel.  But it was a special occasion, and they had 40% off rates for the low season.  We loved how lodge-y it was, like at Yosemite.  Staff and service were Disney-excellent.  Place was clean, quiet, and well-kept.  We were three 49 year olds, a 63 year old, and a 15 year old, and we had a great time at the Chip-n-Dale character breakfast there too.  I don't think I could convince myself to pay $350 a night, but would love to stay there again at a discount.  WAY better than Paradise Pier or Disneyland Hotel.

Normally I could not afford to stay here, but Disney had a nice discount during the off season to make the stay possible.  It was still very expensive, but I could balance that out with convenience.  First, you can walk out of the hotel right into California Adventures or straight into Downtown Disney.  Second, there are several food choices within a few minutes walking distance.  Third, the service is second to none.  The rooms are very comfortable and cozy.  There was a fridge, coffee maker and a nice balcony outside our room.  The craftsman style hotel has a very warm inviting feel, just like going to a lodge in the mountains.  Would I stay here again?, in a heartbeat!  But, a family on a budget can save $$$$ by staying at a non-Disney property and still be within 6 minutes

Summary Heading: The Best Disney has to offer
Summary: When I booked this hotel I kept saying maybe I should cancel and go for a more economical room.  I am so glad I kept the reservation. I have stayed at all three of the Disney hotels and this one is the best. ( I do love them all)  When you pull your car up to the valet you feel like you have stepped into a different world and you do.  The lobby is beautiful.  The rooms were very clean and no mold or anything in the bathroom SPOTLESS. The view was pretty from our balcony.  The service was so fantastic.  The location was great. Downtown Disney was steps away. Getting into California Adventure was easy and no wait.   The pool and grounds were beautiful.  I will stay there again.  If you can get a deal at this hotel.  I highly recommend you  to splurge.
This is a GREAT hotel. They treat you very well at the hotel. I go at least once a year!

Summary Heading: Stunning resort hotel, impeccable, spotless, friendly, Worth every cent and more.
Summary: From the moment we walked inside the doors and they closed behind us, we were transported to a truly amazing Disney experience.  The staff are so friendly and helpful, they can not do enough for you. The lobby and foyer were truly amazing and breathtaking.  This would have to be one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at.  The restaurants were fantastic, the location to Disneyland was brilliant and so was the early entry into the theme parks.  The swimming pools were brilliant, we went night swimming with my teenage children and the warm spa pool was fantastic (especially seeing as we were there in winter).  The downtown Disney was amazing and such a great experience, we couldn't get enough of the place.  Our room was kept clean and the beds were made beautifully every single

Summary Heading: FIRST CLASS HOTEL, BUT IT WILL COST YOU!!!!
Summary: I now have officially stayed at all 3 Disney Hotels in Anaheim,  I love the Disneyland Hotel, but the Grand Californian was just spectacular.  Everyone talks about the lobby and it is amazing my son just loved sitting at the childrens tv on the little kids chairs and watching the classic disney shows, while my husband and I would sit on the gorgeeous leather couches and have our morning coffee.  The staff are all amazing, I cant fault any area,  the hotel is clean and friendly,  just a short walk to both parks and Disney downtown.  Our room (pool view) was small, but kept very clean, the only thing I didnt like was the sink was outside the bathroom in the hallway, so you had to come out of the shower and into an open hallway to complete your bathroom routine in front of the

Summary Heading: Relying on their location for business
Summary: We picked the Disney Grand California hotel for our first night getaway on our honeymoon.  We arrived at 11:30 PM and the first room we were given had not been made at all - lights on, beds unmade, but mistakes happen, so we phoned down to ask them to get us another room.  They sent someone with keys to a different room that was a lower teir (non view) room.  When we talked to the desk they denied that it was an interior view room and claimed they didn't know the different room prices, but finally gave us a discount as the appropriate view room wasn't available. When we got to the new room we found that it had only been partially cleaned.  The beds were made, the towels were changed, but there were used soaps and shampoo in the bathroom and shower, the robe in the closet had

Summary Heading: The best Disney has to offer
Summary: My wife and I just spent two nights at The Grand Californian on a bit of a whim.  We've stayed at hotels near DLR and at the Disneyland Hotel.  This was by far our favorite place to stay.  Today was my first day back to work and the experience keeps playing through my head so much I felt compelled to write a review.   We had initially meant to stay for just one evening. We got there late on the first night, about 9pm.  The vallets were very welcoming to us and offered to assist with all of our needs.  I opted for vallet parking and use of the bell service even though we had just a small amount of luggage.  We walked through the beautiful automatic rolling stained glass window door and into the most welcoming lobby I've had the fortune of walking into.  The check in was a breeze.

The magic of Disneyland started at the Grand.  We have stayed here before and will continue to make this our hotel when we come to Disneyland.  Olivia (at reception) went above and beyond to make sure our stay was perfect.  We traveled with relatives (also had young children) who were experiencing Disneyland for the first time.  We wanted to make it special for them.  Olivia arranged for complimentary balloons, buttons, autographed pictures, and special Mickey cookies/milk night delivery.  Our room requests were honored.  The Character Breakfast at Storytellers was a nice experience.  Cast Members provided us with Fast Passes to World of Color in the Hotel.  We enjoyed Magic Mornings and early entry.  You stay at this hotel for convenience and service....and we'll be there again.

We've been annual passholders since 2008. To celebrate my son and my birthday, we decided to stop wondering what the hotel is like. Because we're APs, we got a discounted rate.   We stayed in a standard view room. The room itself is clean and roomy enough for a family of 5. Three kids under 10 years old. The room has mini fridge. I suggest you bring a cooler filled with drinks and snacks. A few guests saw us wheeling a cooler and commented that they should have done the same thing. One guest said he paid way too much for bottled water at the hotel's snack bar.  Self and valet parking is offered. We opt for the valet for convenience, even though I wasn't thrilled paying $22 for it. We enjoyed the pool area with two slides; one for big kids and one for toddlers. There are life

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel, expensive but made the Disney trip so much easier, with little kids
Summary: This hotel had a great location, we had the concierge package which was brilliant, access to the Craftsmans Club with food and drinks all day long for no extra charge. The concierge staff were FABULOUS!!!

We just visited Disneyland in Decmeber 2010, staying at a nearby hotel and left wanting more. So we spent extra to have the convience of staying onsite since we were traveling with a toddler who requries naps and such. I booked the room through a third party booking site at a slightly better price than the resort site. When i arrived at the hotel, my reservation was no where to be found AND the hotel was completely full. After over an hour of trying to figure things out with management and the third party bookers, we were finally able to get a room and settle in. We were even slightly upgraded to a better view room and compted for beverages, which was nice, but would have rather not gone through the emotional rollercoaster.  We ended up with a room with a queen bed and bunk. I

Entry through Downtown Disney ruined my 3-day trip. Twice a day my family & other guests walked through a cigarette smoke filled passage way-not the bestr way to start or end the day at the "Happiest Place on Earth."  When I notified hotel staff, they shared that there were cigarette trys placed in the corridor for guests-um not a practical place! Given that I paid full price and this was a very pricey stay (budget extra $20-30 per day to park), rooms were nice but will not return to this hotel and share this with you to BE AWARE.

Title probably explains it all! I freaking love this hotel! It is decorated beautifully and there were bunkbeds for my 2 kids. I love the fact that the hotel is located in a spot where you can just walk out of your room and into Disney's Californian Adventure Park! That was awesome because we are true Disney fans. It was also a great way to come back through Disney's Grand Californian entrance after the busy crowd formed after the 1st show of World Of Color. I love White Water Snacks, probably the best little Disney cafe! The pool, awesome for my kids and overall, my favorite Disneyland resort vacation. I've stayed here before a lot with my family and I plan to go again soon!
Everything was great. Room had a double bed, as well as a bunk bed with a trundle. Glad to find a great hotel that caters for families with 3 children.

Summary Heading: Awesome, excellent & fantastic; Only if you can afford it.
Summary: I stayed there with my wife for our honeymoon.  Just for 3 days and 2 nights, i had to spend nearly 2 grand for the premium room.  However, there is no such thing as premium room, except it is an ordinary room with premium view, that is, looking at the still under construction Paradise Pier.   I would've thought there would be some Disney cartoon decorations in the room but unfortunately no. The room we stayed in is old and certainly need upgrading. You can hardly find these hotel qualities in developed Asian countries.   But, location is grand & most convenient.  It suits the tourists best.  In conclusion, I would love to go back again.

Title says it all - 5 stars for location.  We chose this hotel specifically for its location as both of our little munchkins still require naps.  We got a good deal through Expedia, but regardless this hotel is worth every penny if location is critical to your enjoyment of Disneyland.  My son and I got soaked riding the Grizzly River Run (9 times in a row!), but were able to change in a flash by using the Grand's private entrance to the Disney California Adventure park.  Now for the hotel itself: fabulous lobby as it is truly "Grand".  The rooms though are just average at best - small and not overly clean!?!  Reminded us of staying at a Marriott Courtyard or a Doubletree.  I would highly recommend readers use Von's (Safeway) for their free grocery delivery.  The rooms all have a

If you want the most convenient and upscale hotel/resort in Disneyland and have the means to afford it, this is your place.  We've stayed at the Grand Californian 4 out of the 5 times we've taken the family to Disneyland, with the most recent stay right before Christmas 2010.  The rooms  are nice, beds fantastic, location unbeatable but the price reflects it's monopoly location.    We found the service on our most recent trip to be a highlight.  It's really improved over time and the staff was simply outstanding...everyone we dealt with at the hotel was simply over the top.

Summary Heading: The price is worth it for the plush accomadations and the incredible staff and convenience
Summary: From the moment we arrived I was in heaven, the staff took incredible good care of us, loved the nightly turndown and the seperate entrance to California Adventure.

Summary Heading: Super convenient. Great after a long day at the parks!
Summary: Quick check in. Were upgraded to a pool view with bunk beds which the kids like.   Had breakfast with the characters but disappointed that there were no main Disney characters at this particular hotel.   Very convenient with a short walk to downtown Disney to shop and eat. And with a side entrance to California Adventure Park. Especially after a long day with tiring kids.   Booked if you are able to get good rates.

Summary Heading: Rooms are tired and rather dark, but you cannot beat the location.  Service was also excellent.
Summary: The rooms and common areas were rather dark, and the rooms in particular (or at least our, standard room) are really ready for some sprucing up given the pricing and the fact that this is Disneyland's most luxurious hotel.  It did not feel like a luxurious property.  That being said, we were extremely impressed by the level of service at the hotel.  Given that things were so busy (we stayed over the xmas/new year's period) and hectic, the staff was very responsive, organized, and polite, and they really kept things like check-in and check-out moving along.  Our room was cleaned twice daily while we were out, and we had a few service issues in our room, but they were attended to very quickly.  Although we were very disapppointed in the quality of the room and the overall feel of

We booked an extended family vacation with our grandmother, sister and her 2 children (4 y/o boy & 8 y/o girl). Grandma has some mobility issues so we choose the Grand Californian for the easy quick access to the parks. Arriving Easter Sunday for 6 days, check-in was smooth and the clerk very knowledgeable on the hours and options our package included. The only hiccup experienced was the hotel initially placed our 3 rooms on 3 separate floors. The front desk quickly reassigned our rooms so we had 2 adjoining rooms and the third was only a few doors down the hall. The building is very impressive with it's high ceilings, wood accents, stone fireplace, and tasteful appointments.  The hotel is connect to Downtown Disney and a very short walk (less than a 1/4 mile) to Disneyland's

We stayed here for my 30th birthday with our 18 month old.  The staff went above and beyond to make our stay special and we were treated like royalty.  We loved that they had pack n play cribs in the room and that we were just a short elevator ride to the entrance to California Adventure.  We loved the character breakfasts in the morning and the rooms were contemporary, clean, well decorated, and had a nice lanai.  The disney touches are subtle and fun.    Having an exclusive entrance to the park was really nice considering we were there just before spring break.  We waited less than 3 minutes to enter the park at any time and it was so convenient to head back to the room for nap time or just to rest without having to hop on a shuttle.  Speaking of sleeping, the beds were

Summary Heading: Fantastic Location.. Mixed Review of Service
Summary: My family and I love Disney and thought this was the best Disney Hotel in the area. Our experience was unfortunate.  The Good: Great Location. We were thrilled at the convenience of being so close to the parks. The lobby is gorgeous and as we checked in we were amazed at the service we received from the concierge greeter. The price is high, but we felt we were paying for service and location not value.  The Bad: The service after check-in was spotty. The room was dirty and noisy. The "concierge" service was not all it was cracked up to be. I brought my concerns to management, but got a lot of excuses. I would expect the service I got at a bargain chain hotel, not a Disney Hotel while paying for Concierge service.  After reading some other reviews, it seems like our experience

I knew this was outrageously priced to begin with but it was highly recemmended by friends.  This hotel had the best service perhaps I've experienced in some time as well as the best location imaginable.  It is also very picturesque and all in all a great experience.  There were also several cons to consider.  First the price.  We paid top dollar unfortunately due to the timing but it came to $600 per night for a standard box size hotel room.  The room decor was less than a standard Marriott resort room and surprisingly they don't have pay per view movies.  After a long day at the park, it would have been nice to take a break and let the kids relax and watch a movie.  For the money, I expected most everything to be dialed in and it was with the exception of the room itself.  All

Summary Heading: Magical... Overpriced but worth every dollar
Summary: We decided to splurge on this hotel for our trip this Christmas.  Check-in was super quick; we were able to check in at 10am.  Our room was clean, quiet, and just charming.  Free self-parking conveniently located across the street.  Some of the perks include: magic morning hours (you can go to Disneyland an hour ahead of all the craziness, which is great for peak time like Christmas and summertime), private entrance to the California Adventure park (no line!), have all your shopping bags delivered to your room at the end of the day... and of course, top notch customer service.  The two restaurants we tried were, of course, overpriced, like everything else in Disneyland; but quality of food and service was excellent.  If you have some extra bucks to spend on your next Disneyland

Our 4th stay at the Grand...and our best, so far!  Just don't think you can beat the experience. Location is everything, sure, but the  hotel is much more than its address. From  our check-in to reluctant farewell, we were treated with courtesy by front desk, bell staff, and housekeeping. And the beds are terrific!  After a bone-weary day of trodding both parks, I was only too happy to climb into the best sleep in the 'Land. We have been visiting Disneyland during the holidays for the last 15 years. While it is true you DO pay for the experience of lodging here, you also pay dearly for a poor stay somewhere else.  This hotel will always be my first choice...if considering the Grand Californian, be sure and check out the Disney's website for promotions. Well worth it!

Summary Heading: A fabulous hotel to stay at to experience Disneyland. Don't miss Room 5250!
Summary: Welcome to my 200th review, everyone.  Today I will talk about how good Disney's Grand Californian Hotel in Disneyland is. Let's start with:  Parking   The valet at the front door is very convenient for parking, and I highly recommend that over self-parking. Why? Because the parking lot is across the street in the Paradise Pier hotel garage. Really, it doesn't seem like a big deal, but when your feet are hurting from walking all day, it can be a problem.  So, just take the valet. It's easy  Service   The staff at this hotel and all of Disneyland are exceptionally friendly. They definitely know what they are doing, and want to make sure you have a good experience in the resort.  Rooms   I had two rooms that were meant to have views of the California Adventure park. The first

A+ in every, single, way!  From the ambiance and service to the location, this hotel is simply perfection! My husband and our two children stayed here in October and were pleasantly surprised by the excellent customer service upon check in.   The rooms are beautiful and the hotel is centrally located right in the heart of Disneyland - perfect for those with small children.   I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this resort and we will most definitely be back!

We stayed at the Grand once before in 2006 and I am convinced that we won't be able to stay anywhere else.  The location is superb.  Guests of the Grand also get to enter the adventure park 1 hour earlier to get World of Color fast passes.    2 issues this time around:  1) when we checked in at 4pm, our room wasn't ready.  I was told that I would receive a text when the room was ready.  We went shopping and had dinner and at 8pm, still no text.  When I checked with the front desk, they apologized, my room had been ready, and they don't know why I didn't receive the text.   2) we returned from the parks one day at 4pm and the maid had not cleaned our room yet.  However, these incidents didn't upset me enough to not return!

Summary Heading: Location is great, but is it worth the price?
Summary: Having stayed at many other Disney properties over the years I must admit that my expectations were high for this property.  First, the positives.  1) It's the Grand Californian!  It is, quite simply, a beautiful property.  Once you have seen it, you will want to stay there just based on the decorating of the property. 2) Location - come on, if you love Disney, who doesn't want to stay at the closest property to the park? 3) Food - the dining at this resort is amazing.  I eat at the Napa Rose even when I stay at other resorts.   Did it live up to my expectations?  Unfortunately, no.  What was I surprised with?    1) The view.  We requested and paid for a theme park view.  I would never make this mistake again.  Having stayed at other resorts with theme park views, our family was

We started our holiday with 5 nights at the Grand Californian and we had a truly wonderful time. As many note the location cannot be beaten. There is nothing like being able to quickly return to your hotel for a well earnt break - or to take care of some washing and still maximise your time in the parks! The beds were really comfortable - although after walking all day we probably could have slept on a floor! The pool was great for the kids to revive and the deck chairs were very comfortable. We were lucky to get into our room early - we didn't have a view - but didn't care. Our room was cleaned early each day. We would stay here again....and again and again!

Summary Heading: Beautiful, wonderful hotel during the holiday season
Summary: We had a party of six (two adults, two teens, 9 yr old, 10 yr old), and we stayed in a 1-bedroom suite for 4 nights on the 4th floor.  The living room had a couch that folded out and made a bed - the teenage boys said it was comfortable.  The bedroom contained two queen beds which were just fine.  I have a Sleep Number bed at home so my husband and I find it difficult to find hotel beds that can match the comfort of our own bed.  Everything was clean and worked properly.  There was a small balcony outside the bedroom - our view was a tree-filled courtyard and partial view of the path that led from the hotel to the private entrance into the California Adventure park.  We could also see the monorail track but only heard the monorail if we happened to be in the room with the

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, but not a great value.....
Summary: This hotel is expensive and in my opinion not worth that expense. The location is great as are the employees, but at $400+ per night I expect a little more from a hotel.  We supposedly had a "park view" room - what a joke!  You could see the very tops of a few buildings in California Adventure park and that's it, so don't bother wasting your money on that upgrade.  The room was of moderate size and very clean, but the king bed was not the best considering this is a four diamond hotel.  We had dinner one night in the Napa Rose restaurant in the hotel and it was fabulous as was the waiter Rodney.  In this case it was worth every penney and the bar was also very pleasant with excellent service.  The hotel did not seem to be overly crowded even though there were a lot of people

We had a 2 night weekend stay while visiting LA.  Passed on going to the park because we've been to DisneyWorld many times, but fyi, the entrance to CA Adventure is incredibly close by and convenient.  We had a 2 bedroom unit with 2 separate balconies from which my son got to watch the water color show each night.  Rooms are very nice, new and spacious and it had a good-sized kitchen and living room area, plus 3 full bathrooms.   I'd say it could accommodate as many as 9 people (2-master bdrm, 4-spare bdrm, 1-foldout bed and 2-sofa bed) and room for all 9 at the large dining table.  There is a gym on site (perfect to work off some of the the yummy food I had been scarfing down) and 3 large pools (one with a waterslide) and Jacuzzis sprinked throughout as well.  While exploring

The service we experienced whilst at The Grand Californian at Disneyland was the close to faultless, the pool complex was fantastic and the location was brilliant. I couldn't recommend this hotel more highly for people with young children who want to be literally a stone's throw from Disneyland & California Adventure Park and who are looking for lovely pools (one even has a waterslide) and spas. However, I recommend you do your homework when booking. This hotel is expensive. After we booked (using a travel agent) we discovered we could have saved around 30% by booking through Expedia. Fortunately, we were able to cancel our booking through our travel agent and re-booked (for exactly the same period) using Expedia, saving ourselves several thousand US dollars!! Expedia was even

2 reasons to stay here: 1. Location can't be beat for access to the parks 2. Staff tries their best to be helpful  3.  Reasons to not stay here 1. "Subject to availability" We reserved a park view room with bunks beds. Fortunately we didn't mention this to the kids (who just can;t sleep the the same bed), as there were no rooms with bunk beds available except right next to the pool and no view rooms. After a very long process a view room was "found" which looked out into the forest. with 2 queens. I did ask for (and received) a refund for the difference paid for the view room.  So, don't count on getting the type of room you request no matter how far in advance. Don't pay the extra for a view room. There are very few of them and most are now blocked by trees. Disney considers

Summary Heading: Great location and a great time!
Summary: We stayed here for 5 nights.  We were upgraded for the full stay!  Very accomodating!  We had a queen with bunk beds!  Our 4 year old loved, loved the bunk beds!  The location was not to be competed with.  We have stayed several times at the Disneyland hotel and good other good neighborhood hotels.  This hotel has prime location, especially for DCA.  We could even watch WOC (not a great view but still some view) on the 6th floor viewing terrace with heated lamps and the piped music for the show.  By the way- recommend seeing WOC from the DCA viewing area- it was great!  All the staff was very friendly and very accomodating!  Very forthcoming with "inside" Disney information.  Despite other reviews- we had no problem with the wait time to check in and even to inquire a couple of

I enjoyed staying at this hotel except for a few exceptions.  The Service was excellent from the time we arrived.  The front staff was very nice and professinal. I liked that it has easy access to California Adventure and Downtown Disney and is so close to Disneyland.  It's nice not having to walk far at the end of the day when my feet were hurting.   I was disappointed that the hotet wasn't decorated yet for the holidays since the Disneyland advertisement stated from Nov. 12th.  O'well the Disney parks were all decorated and it was done beautiful. The weather was still warm while we were there and was able to spend some time at the pool.  Nice pool, great louge chairs, and an excellent place to grab lunch. We ate dinner one night at the Story Teller Cafe and got the Buffet

Disney prides itself on doing things with style, and the Grand Californian certainly has that.  But for all its cool features, I wouldn't call it a value pick. You're paying a lot of money for its location -- which, let's face it, may be enough for most travelers.  But as a hotel, it's very expensive for what you get. The downstairs area is very nice, with a large lobby area and a ceiling that goes all the way to the top of building.  It's themed very nicely -- evidently patterned after the Ahwahnee.  Cool, but you don't have to stay at the hotel to enjoy it. The rooms were regular size and nicely appointed, but not over-the-top by any means. I'm in the customer-service industry, so when I'm at a Disney property I always test their employees -- asking them simple questions.

Summary Heading: The best place to get rest when you leave the madness!
Summary: We have always stayed at the Disneyland Hotel but since its under a major renovation we decided to stay at the GCH and I can't believe what I've been missing.  Wow!  The proximity speaks volumes when you don't want to lug stuff around OR want to quickly drop things off or change into warmer clothing.  This is the place to go when you want to take a breather from the madness that is Disneyland.  We booked the 40% Fall rate and saved a pretty penny; then, when we got here we were hooked up with a room with the most fantastic view of DCA's Paradise Pier/Midway area.  Although we could hear and see the  World of Color  from our balcony it is distorted--you must watch from the designated area or it will be blurry.  The rooms come with a fridge, a flat screen tv with dvd player and

Summary Heading: Can beat the location and service
Summary: This is a great hotel and the location is really great. I don't think we could have had such a great experience if we stayed at another location. Traveling with young chidlren is tough enough - we did not want to have to endure shuttles and trams in and out of the park. The room was darling - a queen bed and a small bunk bed for the kids. They loved sleeping on the bunks and our bed was really comfy.  My only complaint was that the pullout chidlren's bed was unmade when we arrived with sleepy children - when we pulled it open the sheets were a mess and clearly dirty. They fixed the problem quickly though. All and all, I am sure we will be back.

Summary Heading: Location and service can't be beat!
Summary: We stayed here for the first time in December 2009.  We travelled with 2 young children (3 and 1) and their grandmother.  When we arrived, our children received Disneyland First Visit buttons at the front desk along with "autographed" pictures of Mickey Mouse (for my son) and all the princesses (for my daughter).  Even though my daughter was just 3, even she got her own room key with her name printed on it.  I don't know how they do it but the hotel is geared for adults and children so everyone enjoys it.    The location can't be beat.  We were steps away from Disneyland's front gates and we even had our own entrance to California Grand Adventure.  We were able to use our double stroller easily without worrying about how to collapse it onto the shuttle or onto the monorail.

Like other's have said, this hotel has the perfect location, but comes up lacking in other areas.  We got off on the wrong foot at check in.  Even getting through the entrance in a taxi was an issue.  They wanted our name to confirm that we were a guest at the hotel before they would let us through the gate.  We said, "Jim . . . " After checking the computer they asked for another name.  We said, "try James . . .". That worked, but then we had a hassle at the front desk - seemed like we were checking into Fort Knox (and maybe we should have to afford all the extras).  They add a $13/day resort fee and one breakfast from room service was $37 after all the extra fees.  Rooms were average, and we did not get a room with bunk beds for the grand kids.  Best part was dinner at Napa

Summary Heading: Really Great And Exceptional Hotel Highly Recommend the Extra Cost
Summary: We stayed at the californian grand hotel and spa from the 29th June til 09th July in 2010. When we arrived at the hotel, there was a little bit of a wait to check in, which we expected for this time. The check-in man was very nice he took care of everything as we were unable to check-in to our room straight away. We drop our bags of with concierge and bell hop guy. Once our room was ready they were going to call us. So my mother and I went to do some shopping at the block at Orange, by the way that place is really great to do shopping spent hours at that place. We recieved our phone call from the hotel to say our room was ready. When we go to our room it was so wonderful it was nothing I had ever imagined. Stepping out to the balcony we could watch the monorail go past with

Disney's Grand California is by far the most amazing hotel my  hubby and I have ever stayed at.  It is, simply, worth every penny.  The Arts & Crafts era style is gorgeous.  The lobby is breathtaking.   Please eat at Storytellers Cafe' and make sure to order the Nebraska Corn Chowder - it is to die for!

Summary Heading: You are paying for the location
Summary: As many reviewers have mentioned, you are paying for the location of the Disney Californian. With a 3 and 6 year old and a family suffering from jet lag this was worth the money ( at $216/night at 30% off).  At most times of the year you can get a discount of 20-40% at this hotel with a few exceptions (Xmas being one).    The good:  Very close to Disneyland, California Adventure, and Downtown Disney shops/restaurants    Excellent service from happy, long term employees (many have been there 20 years) Some cute perks (in hotel Halloween trick or treating and games, disney chocolates in room, bunk beds when available)   Nice pool facilities (but you pay a daily resort fee for this) The lobby is lovely.  Great for adults  (wine bar/piano player) but also nice for kids (custom
Great location, service & very nice overall. Would definitely stay here the next trip to Disneyland.

We have stayed both on-site (disney property) and off-site.  When staying at the Grand it is like we never leave the park.  The magic continues and it makes the Disney experience never end.  The rooms are very quiet.  The location is perfect.  My son's favorite ride is the Grizzly River and it works wonderfully - we can quickly go up to the room, change and continue on with the fun.  The rooms are very quiet - we have stayed here 3 times and have not heard our neighbors.  Another favorite of ours is the bedtime stories - it runs all day and late into the night - it is very relaxing and allows children and adults at heart to wind down and get to sleep much easier.  Also, the room service is fast, easy, good (especially the spaghetti) and allows you to get away from crowds/relax

Summary Heading: Best of the 3 hotels on property, but also most expensive
Summary: My wife and I frequently visit the Disneyland resort and we stay exclusively at the grand Californian because of its location and great service. Are the rooms worth what they charge a night for them? No. Your paying for the location and convenience of a private entrance to the Californian adventure park. Room service quality has gone downhill, we no longer use. You can hear people in other rooms through the walls, and people allow their brat kids to run up and down the halls. Not disneys fault, just something you should be aware of. Water pressure in the showers is dismal. Only reason to spend this much for a room here is the location.

After a Mexican Riviera cruise, my husband and I decided to book a room for two nights in one of the Disney hotels. This hotel was gorgeous and totally met our needs.  The bed was comfortable. You could walk right into California Adventures from the hotel.  The breakfast restaurant on site was a little pricey - probably worth it if you had little kids who wanted to see the characters.  Our joke was "4 eggs and toast for $54, breakfast with the characters - priceless."   So stay away if you don't care about the characters.  Loved the hotel lobby!  In the business center they charged you $1 a page to print your boarding passes!  I thought that was outrageous and said so.  The clerk was a little haughty about it.  Oh well, the price you have to pay to stay in a Disney Hotel!  I'd

Summary Heading: Beautiful, Relaxing, and in the middle of Disney!
Summary: I had the opportunity to stay at the Grand Californian in May 2010 for the Disneyland Food & Wine Festival. The room was clean, relaxing, and beautiful. Our balcany overlooked the California Adventure Park! It is just steps from Downtown Disney and the entrance to California Adventure is right out of the pool area of the hotel. I couldn't believe it! I'm used to DisneyWorld where you have to take buses and monorails to get places, but this hotel was so convenient! I could get up in the morning, get my 5 month old ready, and we would be in the park within 4 or 5 minutes. The staff was friendly and the whole hotel had a lodge feel. I want to go back immediately!

very close to disney,large clean room with great view of the theme park and pool. the service was good and the beds where very stiff and uncomderful.Sheets where clean and i thought it was nice.would retern

Summary Heading: Best location for a hotel in Disneyland
Summary: This is our 3rd trip to DL. First time at this hotel. We came for my son's 16th birthday. Stayed 4 nights. Yes the rooms are average, yes it is expensive but there is nothing else that will beat the location. We difinately will only stay at this hotel ever time we go. Everything about Disney is expensive but you go there for the Disney experience which in our minds it's worth it.  Not only is your own private entrance right at the Grizzly Rapids ride. The other side of the hotel opens onto downtown Disney. Great shopping and restaurants. We only ate at the hotel for breakfasts. Even then we bought yogurts and such at the cafe on site. We did have drinks and appys at the lounge a couple of times. It was great. If you are looking for location and far less line ups in and out of

In the Disney tradition, this hotel is magical.  My husband and I loved the theme of Northern California charm and the kids loved the pool, restaurants and the video game room.  The hotel room was big enough for our family of five, although tight.  Next year we plan on staying at the Villas, since we are DVC members.  One of the best features of this hotel is the early entrance into the Disney California theme park.  Imagine walking out of your hotel grounds and right into the park.  We like to go immediately to the Grizzly River Run ride.  It is right outside the entrance from the hotel.  Then, if we get soaked, we can go right back into our hotel and change into dry clothes.    The restaurant, the Storyteller Cafe, had a very nice buffet with great food.  My 9 year old boy is

Summary Heading: Very convenient location but very average hotel
Summary: Hotel is very expensive by Anaheim standards - $350 per night for what i would describe as a very small room with average finishes. For half that price you can get a large suite at any of the best hotels in the area. Air conditioning repeatedly malfunctioned throughout the stay - ranged from freezing cold to very hot -  took 6 sepearte repair jobs until it was actually fixed so it would stay at a temperature that was actually comfortable - my 5 year old ended up with a cold as a result. Staff are all very friendly but when you return to your room at 8.30pm with a tired child who you need to get to sleep & your room temperature reads 87 degrees after 4 days & 5 separte repair attempts hearing a bubbly happy person on the line of guest services wears thin. The bed had the worst

Summary Heading: Convenience rather than quality - but don't take the side trips.
Summary: The Grand Californian is the closest to the park and staying in a Disney Hotel gives some perks, but is it worth the premium price? There is nothing wrong with this hotel, though dining options are limited and expensive. If its a first visit to Disneyland with young kids the answer is probably yes it is worth it - all part of the overall (great) Disney experience. For a repeat visit - worth exploring other alternatives. However do not book side trips through Disney. We were picked up by Gray Lines in a big coach expecting an express trip to Universal Studios. Instead we were driven a few blocks away to a depot, made to line up to exchange our tickets and then line again in the rain while they filled the real coach. We were given poorly printed Universal tickets that could not be

Summary Heading: Went there for a meeting--pretty nice overall but pricey
Summary: Expensive rooms.  The hallways were not kept particularly clean.  The folks working there were amazingly friendly and helpful.  Very convenient to Disneyland and family friendly.

We stayed at the Grand Californian for two nights in October.  It is a very typical Disney deluxe hotel, which to me means okay rooms and hotel amenities but a great location.  The staff was very nice.  The pool area was large with nice lounge chairs.  My main complaint is that this hotel has switched over to the room categories used by WDW in Florida.  This would be fine if the hotel knew what they meant.  We booked a deluxe theme park view room.  My view was of a tree and the monorail track.  If you went out onto the balcony, walked to the far left side and then looked out to the right you could see the theme park.  In WDW this room would never be sold as a theme park view room.  I called and complained and they did credit me $100, but said that my reserved view could mean

Summary Heading: The best hotel stay I've had with the kids
Summary: You would'nt stay anywhere else if you planned a trip to Disneyland. We had 2 Adults & 3 kids in a room with a queen size bed & 3 bunks. It was the most comfy bed we have slept in. Down town Disney view. Housekeeping was perfect. Food was yummy. So close to the parks. The only fault I could find was the room service breakfast was cheap at $13.00 but when you get the bill you pay for delivery,tax,hotel fee so it turned out to be $27.00 having said that it was yummy and it was big enough to feed all of us 5.

Staff was fantastic.  Our bacony faced the fireworks on Main street which was an extra treat. Only complaint was no seal on the bottom of the door so we could hear people talking, running, yelling, in the hallway.  Super convenient; you could walk out one way and be in Downtown Disney and another exit drops you into California Adventure.  We loved it!

Summary Heading: Great for families with children aged 8-12
Summary: We travelled to Disneyland for 3 days with another family. In total 4 adults and 6 children. Second time for us, first time for the other family.  We had booked a Premium View room which we were not given. It was not until we request clarification the folowing day, that we were given a small credit back to compensate for the lower value room.  This was the only negative part of the trip. The hotel is in an excellent location with easy access to the theme parks and perfect for families not wanting to add an extra 30 mins travelling time in their daily routine. Of course you pay for the provilege, but the hotel is worth it.  Breakfast with the characters in both Grand Cailifornian (Forest characters) and Disneyland Hotel (Goofy's Kitchen) were worth it.   The laundry facility also

Summary Heading: Great lobby, ok rooms but close to theme parks
Summary: We arrived early from a 14 hour flight from Sydney. We checked in but rooms were not ready until 12, it was 10am. They suggested we go eat something and come back. Staff were really nice. We ate at a cafe on the property which served decent food. We got back at 12.30 and it was a different person at the front desk, who was really rude. She finally got us in a room, and it was ok. Bathroom area was really nice, there were 2 queen beds, which were really high . We had 5 people, but we managed. TV was an LCD, view was of the carpark and other Disney hotels. Housekeeping was excellent and rooms were very clean. The best thing about staying at this hotel is the convenience to the theme parks. It is about a 2 min walk from the lobby. They have a disney store on the property, and it is

Summary Heading: Hard to beat the great location
Summary: As others have noted often here, the Disney Grand Californian (DGC) is perfectly located to visit both DisneyLand (DL) and Disney California Adventure (DCA).  The hotel is practically inside DCA, and has its own private entrance.  We once ran out from the pool in bathing suits, rode a fast pass on the Grizzly River Run, and ran back to the hotel's hot tub!The walk to DL is less than 5 minutes.  The hotel would frankly have to be pretty lousy to overcome this enormous location advantage.  This is a VERY big hotel, over 1,100 rooms.  Despite that, the attention to detail at check in and on each floor was very good.  Housekeeping was inconsistent, but overall fine.  We had some plogged drains, but I never bothered to call, so you can't fault the hotel for that.  The common areas

We recently stayed at the Grand Californian for my son's birthday. On check-in he was given a 'Happy Birthday' badge and everyone kept wishing him over the 2 days which thrilled him no end!  The hotel is amazing with a grand lobby and the location in Downtown Disney is perfect with a very short walk to the entrance ot both parks.  We had a standard room with a theme park view (not much of a biew though - could see the grizzly river run if leaned out of the balcony). The room was spacious and clean and we had daily turndown with chocolates.  On the first day we had a late breakfast at the Story Tellers Cafe - the food was passable. For the next 3 mornings we walked to Jamba Juice to get some healthy breakfast prior to the walk into the parks.  Certainly a perfect place to stay

Summary Heading: You can't beat the location and outside perks, but the hotel isn't that new anymore.
Summary: Most people know the Californian is a beautiful hotel. You drive up and it's beautiful. You walk in and it's magnificent. But by the time you get to your room, the splendor has started to decrease. There were two main problems I had, although my husband discounts the first.  You might not think this is a major issue, but the best way for me to wake up in the morning is with a nice shower. I'm assuming it's because of the drought in Southern California, but that shower had the worst water pressure I have ever endured, and I certainly wasn't expecting it at a luxury hotel! Thank goodness I had my hair recently cut or I would probably STILL be there rinsing it in that awful rotating shower head. Is that really supposed to help? I don't know, but I am from California and I

Summary Heading: Great locale with a few blips
Summary: My family of four spent the first week of October 2010 at the hotel. We had a package deal that included six nights at the Grand Californian and (4) five day park hopper tickets.  Total package price was $2,500, about $625 per person for the entire week.  I was very happy with the package price.  The location cannot be beat.  Short walk to Disneyland and smack dab in the middle of Downtown Disney.  There is also direct access to California Adventure.  I cannot say enough nice things about the hotel staff.  Very friendly and helpful, especially Linda in Guest Services, who came to my rescue when I needed earplugs.  Those were for the park, not because the hotel was loud.  The pillows are down feathers and are tightly packed into the pillowcases.  This caused a big kink in my neck

We stayed at the Grand Californian on our last Disneyland trip in August 2010.  We were deciding between this hotel and a smaller establishment to save monies.  We're so glad that we decided to go with this hotel.  We were there for 6 days, worth every pennies.  The location is priceless.  We would go to the park in the morning, and return to the hotel when it gets a little too warm.  Our boys (5 & 6)  would go to the the pool and play.  Return to our room to rest, have dinner and go back to the park.  It was the best thing

I really wanted to like this hotel a lot. We were going to Disneyland and had booked a hotel offsite. I found out that Disney was offering 40% off hotel stays, so we decided to give the Grand Californian a try. I was mostly excited that some rooms have day beds. I have two teenage boys over six feet tall and sharing a bed for them is not a good experience.  I was disappointed when we checked in and were not given the room we requested. The guy at the front desk said he could upgrade me to a "Deluxe" theme park view. He went on and on how wonderful this room was and how lucky we were to get this room. You can see from the pictures that there is nothing deluxe about the view except trees. I felt tricked. Then we asked for a sleeping bag and we got a ratty sleeping bag and pad.  We

We stayed at The Grand Californian for 4 nights, had a total of 3 rooms and 11 people.  We were on a family trip to Disneyland and got to stay at this hotel.  If we did not get this hotel at the special price of 40% off regular room rates, it would not have been worth it.  At 40% off the normal room cost including tax and resort fees the price was $324 per night for each room.  While the hotel is beautiful, and staff is very friendly, accomodating, and helpful what you are really paying for is the location, which can not be beat.  The rooms themselves are nice, but a little on the small side.  The bathrooms are on the smaller side too.   You can get just as nice of rooms at a Hyatt, Hilton or Marriot, but you will not get the "experience" of being right in the heart of it all.

Summary Heading: Couldn't have stayed in a better place
Summary: I decided to upgrade to the Grand Californian.. best choice I could ever have done! The hotel is very beaufitul, and remind us greatly of the Wilderness Lodge at WDW. Since you arrive at the gorgeous entrance, you are received warmly. Valets and bellboys are there for you. Lobby is very spacious, and you can relax sitting there listening to the piano man. Or just near the fireplace! We also appreciated the pool area, there are 3 ot them (as far as I could see) along with a hot tub. I did laundry while the kids where at the pool, very convenient as well, not near the pool but in a different area. We had a standard room, the beds were very confy and the cleanliness was spotless. Turnover was welcome as well. Though our room was far from the Lobby, the bellboy indicated us an

This is the top of the line in the Disneyland hotels but it is worth every single penny.  The hotel is done in the Craftsman Bungalow style and is very beautiful.  The room was a good size for the two of us with two queen sized beds (not full but queen).  The dressing area is a good size as well.  The service at check-in was a bit slow but they had a representative stand in line with you to answer any questions you might have and assure us that it was only due to the shift change at our arrival.  Our room was very quiet and extremely comfortable.  In addition whenever we needed anything from room-service or housekeeping I was addressed by my name without having to tell them who I was and everything from breakfast to wash cloths arrived within minutes of a request.   During

We stayed at the Grand Californian from Septembe 12 - 17 for our Honeymoon. What a fantastic hotel!  I have previously stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and severl other properties near by and this was just amazing. We had a standard room with a pool view and it was fantastic. The room was spacious and clean and Housekeeping came twice a day. Each night our bed was turned down with chocolates on the pillow - so cute we kept them and bought them home!  On check-in we were given Just Married pins and I attached one of these to my swingpack and everyone kept congratulating us through the park.  The hotel was more amazing then I thought it would be. The location in Downtown Disney is fantastic and it is a really short walk to the entrance ot both parks. Each day we went to the park was

We traveled to Disneyland without kids and still had a blast.  Staying at the Grand Californian is a great location, in between Downtown Disney with quick access Disneyland Resort and  Disney's California Adventure Park.  We were able to leisurely stroll through the parks and return to our hotel room in the middle of the day to drop off shopping bags and take a siesta before heading back out.    The service at check in was very smooth, the staff is very attentive and made sure we understood our park passes, room keys and added a special magical touch by asking us what we were celebrating.  We also enjoyed Storytellers Cafe and Napa Rose which were excellent restaurants for just the two of us.     There is convenient access to California Adventure - check the magic morning

We chose this hotel after receiving an advertisement offering a discounted rate. It wasn't based on any review so I had no preconceived idea of what to expect. We usually stay nearby and utilize the shuttle service in order to save $$. This trip I elected to spend a few extra bucks and opt for the concierge service to treat the family to a "special" vacation. We were not disappointed! From the moment of arrival we were treated as special guests who mattered. I needed special assistance in order to obtain my Disney tickets before guest services opened to get a fast pass for the new light show.  Concierge staff member Terri bent over backward to see I received my tickets immediately. She arranged for a staff member to actually walk over and pick the tickets up for me as the

Sorry if I am repeated info. I read many reviews when I made my reservations but not all 750!  Since we always stay with the in-laws living on beautiful Balboa Island 25 minutes away, we have never been willing to splurge on a Disney hotel. However, as our annual passes are about to expire, and not having any plans to return any time soon, I wanted to give my kids an unforgettable "once in a lifetime" experience!  I try not to dwell on how hard I had to work to earn this one night...I booked a great (not cheap) 40% off AP rate of $303 total for Friday Oct 1. To try to "get our money's worth" out of  the room, we spent Friday in the parks and most of Saturday only at the hotel. Friday morning at 7am we checked in to the hotel. We were given room keys even though the room was not

Summary Heading: Wish I Could Have Stayed Longer!
Summary: Spent 2 nights at this hotel to celebrate my birthday.  Parked across the street in their lot, and walked with our carry-ons to the check in desk.  It was 2pm, and luckily our room was ready for us.  Elizabeth, the desk clerk, asked if we were celebrating a special occasion, and I told her about my birthday.  she disappeared for a moment, then returned with a balloon bouquet, a signed photo, and a Happy Birthday button.  Made me feel very special.  We had a corner room that was well appointed, and clean.  Really liked the 2 sinks in the bathroom, the fridge, and the view of the fireworks show from our small balcony.  We left money on the pillow every morning and night for the maid / turndown service.  Very nice to come back to our room whether  it was day or night, and it was

Summary Heading: SUPERB! LOVED OUR STAY! GREAT HOTEL!
Summary: We stayed at the Grand Californian from 16 - 21 September 2010 and all we can say is we loved the hotel. We travel a lot, as a family, this was our fourth visit overseas in the past 12 months and we know good hotels.   The reception and staff was prompt, quick and efficient and friendly. The lobby was organised, the bell service was quick and room service was superb.
