We stayed in a room overlooking Downtown Disneyland and although noisy, once the sliding doors were shut, it was noiseless.  Access to the parks was a short stroll and the hotel is perfectly located. I highly, highly recommend this hotel if you intend visiting Disneyland.

This hotel is great - my brother and I stayed the week of 4th of July and it was wonderful. The hotel is pricey, but worth it as the ambiance is beautiful, its very clean, friendly, and super convenient. This is the closest hotel to the parks, is a short 5 minute walk through Downtown Disney to parks' entrance gates in one direction, and a short 5 minutes the other direction to the downtown Disney monorail station - an easy way to get into Disneyland itself w/out having to go through the front entrance. Hotel guests also have a special entrance to California Adventures, exclusive to hotel guests only - you are in the park within minutes of leaving your room!  We had a Downtown Disney view which was great - lots of nightlife and music. We could see the fireworks from our balcony

We really enjoyed our stay at the Grand Californian in May. We chose the hotel because of its proximity to Disneyland - we only had three days to spend there, it was our daughter's first visit to Disneyland (she was only 3.5yo), and we were willing to splurge a little with a strong Aussie dollar. After booking, Disney Vacations was offering a more discounted rate a month or so later. I contacted them, and they honoured the new promotional rate with our existing booking, saving us over $AUD600. I was also keen to have a room with bunk beds - what a novelty!  We loved the pool area, and spent our first afternoon there, as we did not have entry into Disneyland on that day. By later afternoon, it was pretty cool and shady, so most people were in the spas/jacuzzis. The pillows on the

This hotel met and exceeded our expectations. When you arrive to check in the inside is beautiful, grand and cozy! We booked a standard room but when we checked in we asked if they had any free upgrades and we got an upgrade to a view of California Adventure. It was beautiful! The room was very sound proof and we were never bothered by any noise at the park. The beds were fairly comfy. The maids come in twice a day, once in the morning and once in the evening for a turndown service and they leave little chocolates on your pillow. One of the best things about staying at this hotel is your very own private entrance to California Adventure. We were just a short walk to Disneyland and with kids that is a huge perk! Makes it easy to come back, take naps and head back out. There are
Outstanding hotel.  Service, location, staff, restaurants, room, all A+.  Dinner at the Napa Rose was worth every penny!!

Summary Heading: Nice property, good hotel service but poor Reservations Process
Summary: We had the hardest time with reservations at this hotel. They were surprisingly unaccomodating regarding our requests for a high chair and baby bath in the room given this is a Disney property. Also, they were not helpful.    But once we got there, it was fine.  The manager who checked us in was very knowleageable and helpful and she was able to address all of our needs that Reservations just refused.  The location is great and the property is nicely themed throughout.  Housekeeping was great and so was the bell desk.   We stayed in a suite and had had a couple of other rooms for my family and nannies.  Just be aware that the suites are super far away fromt he elevators. It's a long walk with small kids.

Summary Heading: Loved the hotel's entrance to California Adventure
Summary: We loved our stay. The beds were comfortable, the views were great, of Downtown Disney and the monorail. The balconies were really nice. The pool was big and my five year old loved the slide. In fact, we stayed two nights when we only planned on one. We will be back, after we've saved the outrageous rate that is. Way too expensive. Service was excellent. Chip and Dale breakfast buffet was worth it and good food. No hot water at all, just tepid and worst water pressure of any shower I've ever taken in my life. Entrance into CA was wonderful- it comes out right in front of the water ride, rafting, and just great to pop in and out.

Summary Heading: You are paying for the convenience
Summary: After checking out of the Hilton Resort and Spa, we headed to the Disneyland Grand Californian. I had bought 3 day passes at the military base, so we were going to DL after checking in.  Upon check-in, my husband and son were given buttons and balloons for there first time at DL.  We were given a room on the 5th floor (called premium view) facing the pool.  I had requested a king bed but was given two Queens upon entering the room. I was going to change but the bellman had mentioned that King rooms are few and far between. He said most rooms are queen rooms.  I decided to keep the room, so that we could get going to DL.  The room was spotless, and was just a regular room to me. Nothing spectacular given the price. It did have a refrig, but I preferred the refrig at the Hilton

Summary Heading: No where else would I stay....
Summary: The Grand Californian Hotel at Disneyland maybe pricey but it is worth every extra penny. You are right at the gates to the parks and the atmosphere of the hotel is definitely grand. I adore the arts and crafts architecture, and the big roaring fire in the lobby even in the summertime. The rooms are nice, though they could be a tad larger. The beds are comfy which is always extremely important to me. There is a little take and go cafe by the pool that is wonderful for a quick breakfast. We usually stay at the Disneyland Hotel but the Grand Californian is the ultimate Disney experience.

I have stayed at this hotel before and it was great then.  It seems it has only gotten better with age.  The rooms are standard size but beautifully appointed.  Housekeeping comes twice a day and when you are in and out of disneyland all day that is a great treat.  The beds were very comfy.  The bathroom was a little small but still very nice.    Beyond all of that is the convenience and atmosphere.  Guests of this hotel have a park entrance that is just is just for them.  Believe me that is a great perk!  You get to avoid all the horrid morning lines at the main entrances.  Also, it means you can go on the Grizzly River run, get soaking wet, run straight up to your room and change.  The hotel definitely has a "grand" appearance, it is massive and very well done.  It is not

Summary Heading: Best hotel I've ever stayed in
Summary: I've stopped in some excellent hotels, including the Grand Floridian and the Disneyland Hotel in Paris and this was my second stay at the Grand Californian.  This is the best of a very good bunch.  Location - back door of the hotel opens directly into the theme park, side door straight into Downtown.  Only way it could be better was if it was in Main Street.  Rooms - big, clean, well furnished  Public areas of hotel - quiet, clean, beautifully themed.  Even the musak is harmonious with the hotel !  Hotel facilities - three pools, plus two jacuzzis.  Several restaurants including a snack bar for those in a hurry to get into the parks.  Gym, beauty salon ....  Value - can't deny it is expensive, but quality usually is.  Self parking and wireless internet were 'free', but only

We originally made reservations at the Disneyland Hotel, but upon arrival, they took the liberty of upgrading us to a family suite at the Grand Californian for my daughter's 6th birthday, free of charge. We were blown away when we saw the hotel. The room was amazing, the people were helpful, and everything at the hotel was so great. There are awesome restaurants, numerous pools, a great lounge/bar with outside seating next to a fireplace. The lobby had a man at a piano, and a cute little area for kids to watch movies on mini couches. Also, there is a  daycare facility there that will watch the kids in the evening, so the adults can go have dinner or a drink. The best part is how close it is to Downtown Disney and the parks. You can walk into California Adventure from the

Summary Heading: Don't be mislead on "theme park view" rooms
Summary: We have stayed here twice and like the place in general.  As others have said ... location, location location.  I will say this - unless you are lucky enough to get a "Paradise Pier" side view ... you don't see much of DCA from the "Grizzly Run" side view rooms.  Basically the trees have grown up obstructing the view of the theme park, though you can still hear the noise.  These rooms should be called "theme park SIDE" ... not VIEW.  And it is first come, first served for room requests .... we have asked for Paradise Pier view 2 years in a row with no luck.  Housekeeping is spotty ... considering the price of the room ... our bathroom floor had not been cleaned prior to us checking in, and the refrigerator had not been emptied.  I think next time, we will give the Disneyland

Summary Heading: Disney always gets it right--you must respect the Mouse
Summary: Even pulling up to the valet, I was struck by how well organized the folks were. They always get it right at Disney; such a relief. They took our bags, joked with the teenagers, wrote up the slip, parked the car--I knew everything was well in hand.  The front desk experience--also amazing. Apologized that the room wasn't ready (at 10 a.m. for a 3 pm checkin!) but said they would contact us as soon as it was available. Gave us a double upgrade. Answered questions before I could ask them.  Others have said enough about how lovely the hotel is--really a nice break from LA. It feels like you're in a rustic resort circa 1935 or so.  The one snag was that one of the hotel pools was out of service because someone had dropped broken glass in, the previous day. I'm not sure if that was a

Made the annual trip to DLR with my grown son.  We normally stay at the Disneyland Hotel but knew of the renovation/construction (and closed restaurants) and switched to the Grand Californian Hotel.  Thank Goodness We Did!  Yes, GCH is expensive but the special they were running (buy 3 nights get 2 free) made it affordable.  I did a LOT of research and booked a Downtown Disney view room, which I would highly recommend.  This is people watching at it's best!  Plus, you can watch the fireworks from the balcony while the soundtrack plays on the TV (of course you can't see Tink and Dumbo fly over the castle, so you really need to watch them from the park as well!).   Yes, the pool area is crowded (the hotel was 100% while we were there) but we never had a problem finding 2 lounge

We really enjoyed staying at the Grand Cali.  It was pricey but worth the convenience.  Only one thing bothered us and that was the ridiculously cold tempretures in the lobby area.  It was like a meat locker!  We could not enjoy the beautiful lobby seating areas because it was so freakin cold! Every guest was complaining and I'm not sure why the hotel management didn't address the issue.

Summary Heading: Great service, but not my idea of luxury
Summary: This isn't an easy hotel to review. The first thing that needs to be said is that it is shockingly expensive. Our room, which was just a normal room with a pleasant small balcony and no view, was over $300- and that was a discount rate. Breakfast for two adults and two children was $90 (storyteller's cafe). Room service was ridiculously expensive. But it's Disney so one can't be too shocked. The location is great- a five minute walk to the Disneyland gates, through Downtown Disney. The food at Napa Rose is incredible- just brilliant cuisine and worth every penny they charge. The service was absolutely brilliant from start to finish- it felt like there was a one-one guest/staff ratio at times. And the cleaning people did the best job cleaning and organizing our room that I have

This is a beautiful hotel.  The woodwork and ambience were relaxing despite the size.  The staff was overall efficient with a few snags, which were forgiveable.   1. Check in was at 3, we got there early and went to the pool.  They called our cell phone shortly before three to anounce that the rooms were ready, though the second of our two rooms was not quite done when we arrived, the housekeeper was just finishing up the vacuuming.   Brilliant touch was the TV showing old Disney cartoons by the check in line with lots of child size rocking chairs.  Had to drag the kids away to go to the pool. 2. Pools were very nice.  There was a large water slide for kids (and adults).  The chez lounges were the most comfortable that I have experienced, nicer than the four seasons.  Service at

I have always wanted to stay in a Disney hotel, right on site. I've stayed at many hotels on the strip, and can honestly say that I was correct, staying in a Disney hotel really amplifies your Disney experience.   We drove down from Vancouver for a 5 night stay.   Pros: Beautiful hotel, excellent front desk staff. My little guy was crying and they popped out of nowhere to grab him a balloon. Housekeeping always managed to clean up our messy room. The turn down service was nice, and the kids loved the chocolate on their beds.   Our room overlooked the path in front of Grizzly River Run, so I could hear the screaming from the people having fun all the time. I could see the fireworks from our balcony, and occasionally the monorail would come whizzing past. I LOVED it. It made me

My wife and I stayed at the Grand Californian on 8/27 for one night.  The location is great with only a few steps to the Grand Adventure park (Disneyland is perhaps 5 minutes walk).  While the spot is right, the price is not.  We paid $460 with taxes for a nice room but, as others mention, the expectations for a room rate like that is more than it just being "OK".  If this is a once in a lifetime trip, go for it but don't expect the a typical 5 star hotel that might charge similar rates. If you do go, don't miss their restaurant, Napa Rose.  Not inexpensive either but, in the case of the restaurant, worth every penny.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for visiting Disneyland and California Adventure Parks
Summary: This summer my family drove from Seattle to Anaheim for a 4-day adventure at Disneyland. We decided this would be a one-in-a-lifetime trip, so we splurged and stayed at the Disney Grand Californian Hotel. This hotel is located on the premises of Disneyland, which made it very convenient for visiting both the Disneyland and California Adventures parks.  When we arrive the valet and bellhop greeted us promptly and courteously, and helped us unload our many bags and suitcases. They then wisked our car off to the valet parking, where it stayed until we checked out. Checkin went very smoothly, with the desk clerk providing balloons to my 6-year old son for his first visit to Disneyland. It only took 20 minutes for the bellhops to bring up our bags to our room, which was very nice.

We stayed four nights at the Grand and it's all about the location. Even at 40 percent off it's very pricey, but we decided to stay on our first family trip to California. We have stayed at DisneyWorld in Florida several times, but there is really no hotel there that compares in terms of location. You can hop out of the pool during a midday break and use the private entrance to California Adventure to grab fastpasses and be back in less than 10 minutes. The walkway through Downtown Disney puts you in Disneyland park in just minutes. The hotel itself is very nice. The lobby is huge and there are three pools with real seat cushions on the lounge chairs. When we arrived for check-in at about noon, we were originally assigned a queen-queen room but were granted our request for a

Arrived on 8/13 for 5 nights.  2 nights were leisure with the family and 3 nights were for attendance at Disney Institute sessions.  An absolutely beautiful hotel and SO convenient for entry to both California Adventure and Disneyland.  Rooms was beautiful, pool area was beautiful and buffet at Storytellers Cafe was great.  Only complaint was the price.  Paid over $300/night for no amenities that were over and above a Hampton Inn.  Price was directly reflective of location, location, location!  Have stayed at both Paradise Pier and Disneyland Hotel in the past, and I actully prefer the fantasy theming of the Disneyland Hotel (both rooms and pool).  All in all, however, I would return, and liek a big dummy would pay $300/night again for the convenient location the Grand

Summary Heading: Avoid this hotel and save your money.
Summary: One of the worst experiences I‚Äôve ever experienced in what should be part of the ‚Äúhappiest place on earth.‚Äù  My family and I stayed at Disney‚Äôs Grand California hotel on 8/21/10 for 2 nights.  The hotel suggests that guests preregister over the phone in order to expedite the check-in process.  Having completed that process, the front desk person told me that the keys were printed and a package was ready for me to pick up when I arrived.  We arrived at the hotel at 10:45pm.  Upon arrival, there happened to be no one at the registration desk.  Then when someone finally appeared after 2-3 minutes of waiting, the clerk proceeded to go over the registration packet for 10 minutes.  Any reasonable person should have shortened the explanation knowing that a 2-year old was waiting to get

Beautiful hotel, one of the best I've stayed at.  Huge pool area, beautiful lobby, rooms were perfect, comfortable beds.  Best part - Magic Kingdom, California Experience, Downtown Disney right outside hotel.  Staff was terrific as well.  If you are going to Disneyland this is where you should stay; worth every penny (can be expensive but if you are going to spend all that money on a vacation go the extra mile and stay here).

Summary Heading: I can't give it an A+ but loved it nonetheless
Summary: Traveled to Disneyland with my husband and two kids (ages 4 and 6), and stayed at the Grand for 5 nights.  Overall we enjoyed our stay immensely!  The hotel is very nice, but the rooms do not compare to most hotels with similar room rates.  There is nothing terribly wrong with them, they're just not up to par for the price.  They are on the small side and there is very little space to unpack.  The bathroom is perfectly fine but nothing special - shower/tub combo, very poor water pressure, mediocre toiletries.  (Smelled great but shampoo left a residue in my hair.)  I was only really bothered by the layout - while the water closet is separate, it also houses the shower which can cause logistical issues.  The sink/vanity area is not at all closed off from the rest of the room

I have written prior reviews but this time we went with my brother and his family.  The only complaint was that my brothers room was not ready on time, other than that, everything, from the service to the pool areas were great.  Being that we stayed three nights, we were able to enjoy the three swimming pools and grounds more than usual.  Wi-fi throughout the resort was free, in rooms and around the pool.  We brought our ipads out to the pool.  Very relaxing. We love this hotel.  For me the closeness to the parks and the comfortable luxury make it easily worth the money. A resort fee is charged in addition to the room which covers self parking, internet use, daily newspaper and use of the gym.

Summary Heading: A whole lot better than I expected
Summary: This hotel is actually very nice, with excellent facilities, decent rooms and excellent service.  Disney is terrific at handling crowds, so the fact that your hotel as about 50 million other guests doesn't end up being a problem at all.  The rooms were comfortable, although the bathrooms were quite small.  Furnishings were nice, and room service breakfast exactly on time and decent price (in context, of course.)  The hotel does evoke the sense of one of the historic national park lodges, although on an enormous scale.  The Storyteller Cafe is fair, but again, remember where you are.  The Napa Rose Lounge is delightful, with a terrific wine list.  Everything from valet parking arrival to check out is handled with Disney's seemingly effortless efficiency.  I was not looking

Summary Heading: The only place to stay in Disneyland
Summary: It was our first visit to DL and we are very glad we chose the Grand Californian hotel.  Downtown Disney, Disneyland and California Adventure are all right outside your doorstep.  The hotel amenities are beautiful and the pools and lounging areas magnificant.   It was really nice to be able to spend a few hours in the park, walk down the hallway back to the hotel to chill by the pool, wander into downtown Disney to listen to the music and grab a bite to eat and then walk right back into the park to enjoy the rides and night shows.

Summary Heading: Great Resort to optimize your Disneyland time.....But value vs...$$$$
Summary: I have a mixed review. Our purpose here was to relax and enjoy quick access to the theme parks. You really have to be a DISNEY fan to give everything thumbs up.   Location : The resort has great access to theme parks: short and direct accees to California adventure through pool area plus 5 min walk to Disneyland. Downtown disney is located right below the hotel.   Parking: By far this is the worst.....unless you like to splurge on valet parking at additional $17/day +tips (on top of $12 resort fee which incudes parking).  Self parking is located across Disneyland Dr. And it is ALWAYS FULL. In short, other resorts have allocated parking but Grand californian is for those who LOVE valet. If you do not plan on leaving the resort, it would be good for you as well.   Guest services:

Summary Heading: The Adults way to enjoy Disneyland
Summary: Staying at this Hotel for your trip to Disneyland and California Disney is perhaps the best way to experience Disney as an adult.  Comfortable beds, friendly and accomodating staff, quiet relaxing pools, excellent restaurants, valet parking at the end of a exhausting day and even a 'Private' entrance to the park.   Does it get any better than this.   Check for discounts that can be substancial and order your park tickets when making your reservations so you can bypass the ticket booths and go straight to the parks.  Don't think I would do it any other way ever again.   Budget a few extra dollars for your trip and do it right, you WILL NOT be sorry.

Summary Heading: cool spot by the hot spot
Summary: definitely a hit with everyone.  Great place to break from the Disney magic with good food, upscale drinks, excellent pools.  Perfect location near the Disney village sites too ie car rental, movie theatres, shopping

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay to visit Disneyland
Summary: We just got back from a great trip for a weekend at Disneyland and had a great stay at the Grand Californian. The hotel's location with a private entrance to Disney's California Adventure Park, direct access to Downtown Disney, and walking distance to the Magic Kingdom made staying here a no-brainer. The room was large and comfy, our balcony with 2 chairs and a table looked down on the pools and hot tubs (3 of each, I think!), and we had a room service breakfast that arrived right on time and was hot and fresh. Being able to take a break mid-day to swim when it was hottest at the parks was awesome, and getting early entry because we stayed at a Disney hotel meant we managed to get in Space Mountain, the Matterhorn, Peter Pan, and It's a Small World before the park even opened to

Summary Heading: Fabulous vacation in a one-bedroom villa
Summary: We stayed in a 1 bedroom villa using our DVC points. From check in until check out, the Grand Californian exceeded our expectations. We arrived about 11:30am and were told our villa wouldn't be ready until 4, so we went to lunch in downtown Disney and walked around, and at 2:00 we got a text that said our villa was ready. As a family of 5 we found the villa to be very spacious with a great view of CA Adventure and the World of Color show. There was a full kitchen, a washer and dryer, and 2 bathrooms. ¬†It was great to be so close to the parks so we could take advantage of the Magic Morning hours and go back to the villa to eat, rest, swim, then return to the parks until it closed. The cast members were friendly and competent. We ate at Storytellers once for the character

Summary Heading: Great place to stay when visiting the happiest place on earth.
Summary: I cannot say enough how much I loved this hotel!  The location, staff and services were excellent and really can't be beat by anything else in the resort area.  This was my husband and children's (5, 9) first time at Disney and my third (my previous experiences were at Disney World including a stay at the Grand Floridian) - it was a wonderful place to call home for the four days that we were there as this was the start of our trip driving up the coast.  Being so close to the attractions was essential for us since my kids had to adjust to the time difference and my husband ended up having to carry back the little one almost every night.  It was also handy for taking a breather after busy mornings, i.e. taking a quick dip in the pool during the hottest and busiest times of the day

Summary Heading: Architecturally beautiful hotel in the happiest place on earth
Summary: Grand Californian is one of three hotel properties on the Disneyland campus.  It is also the more expensive hotel.  Even at a supposed 40% discount it was still about $300/nt (before taxes).  This is the second time I have stayed here.  The first time was within a year of its construction.  The rooms have improved.  The building is designed in the Arts and Crafts movement of the turn of the century.  It is supposedly modeled after the Awahnee hotel in Yosemite, which I have seen, but I do not see much of a resemblance except for the period architecture.  I love to travel and have been to most of our national parks.  I especially love to stay in the period lodges.  The Grand Californian was a bit of a mixed emotion.  It does evoke a feeling of being in a national park lodge.

Pricey but the location makes it worth the money we paid  especially when traveling with toddlers. We were able to just walk back into the hotel from the park with ease whenever the little ones needed a nap or  a change of clothes. The staff was friendly and rooms were small but clean. The hotel was beautiful, nice pool area and arcade. The market was also a plus offering snacks, breakfast items and sandwiches. We are looking forward to staying there again in the near future!

Summary Heading: SUPER LOCATION + AMAZING STAFF = RELAXING STAY
Summary: The terrific location allowing access into California Adventure and only steps away from entrance to Downtown Disney was great for us.  We travelled with two tween boys who were ready to hit the rides then head back to swim in the afternoon.  The three pools were great and the wait staff kept the cool drinks coming and we were able to order lunch and snacks to eat by the pool.   The hotel is beautiful and comfortable with the main reception area and reservation staff noted that we had stayed last year and we got our same room as last year!  With 2 queen beds and a couch/daybed was great for sleeping on and the hotel gave us sleeping bags for the boys, at no extra charge.   The brunch at The Storyteller Cafe was delicious, the cafe by the pool had good selection of sandwiches and

Just stayed in Grand Californian for 3 nights kicking off family Califormina Roadtrip.  The room was very nicely appointed, one queen and one BUNK BED.  Size was great for family of 4, including 13 and 10 yr. olds.  Everything was very nicely decorated, very comfortable, and very clean.  Can't beat the location, its technically within California Adventure since you have a special entry past the crowded main gate.  The location is even perfect in case you get soaked, like we did, on the Grizzly River Run ride.  Two, minor, negatives, and that's because I'm a hotel "snob" as my wife calls me, the towels and TP in the room were terrible, not the kind expected at a 4* hotel.  Disney should not be cutting corners with those two key bathrrom elements.  To leave on a good note, due use

Summary Heading: Top of the line for DVC villas
Summary: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Disney Vacation Club Villas at Disney's Grand Californian. Check-in was very quick, and the woman helping us went out of her way to provide great service (e.g., finding us discontinued "family reunion" buttons, telling us about the discounts for park passes for purchase by CA residents, etc.).   It is nice to stay at a place where the units are so clean and new. We had a 1-bedroom and a 2-bedroom. The addition of a bathroom in the living room (which older DVC resorts don't have) was great for having another adult in our unit. The murphy bed in addition to the sofabed was also a plus for children (although probably not comfortable enough for adults).    The location right next to the California Adventure themepark couldn't be beat. We watched

Summary Heading: Excellent service, very clean room.  Overlooked Disneyland, great view
Summary: Our experience   at Disney's  Grand California was outstanding. The staff was perfect in all ways; extremely helpful.   Room was clean and  comfortable.  Soft bed, Great shower! Being able to go into park early was such a nice feature,  and going back to our room for a rest period during the day was so convenient. Restaurants a bit pricey, if there are children that don't eat much.

We stayed 5 nights and had a wonderful experience. I have 3 children and we all slept in 2 queen beds. The room was standard sized and we were very comfortable. The beds were comfortable. The room was soundproof. I didn't hear anything and there were kids everywhere. We had a beautiful view of the pools and part of California Adventure park. We had easy access to both Disneyland and right into California Adventure Park. We came back to hotel to sleep and then went to Disneyland from 4pm to midnight and were able to ride many rides with short lines. Going to Disney from 10am to 4pm is a nightmare....too many people....so this hotel saved us from a stressful experience. Worth every penny. This hotel is also very clean. I love that about Disney.  The negative was the price of the

We decided to take out 5 year old daughter here for her birthday this year. We have stayed at Disney World in Florida multiple times but since we were living on the West coast for the summer this location was much closer. We booked the Grand Villa which has 3 full bedrooms and is part of the Disney Vacation Club timeshare. If you're not members, you get regular housekeeping just as you would with any of the rooms. These rooms are fairly new. The location is absolutely perfect. The California Adventure park is about a 5 minute walk and accessible directly from the hotel, as is Downtown Disney. It takes you a few extra minutes to get into Disneyland but it's nothing like the Florida experience. EVERYTHING was so close and convenient we were shocked. The room service was fast,

We spent 5 nights in a studio overlooking California Adventure.  The room was beautiful and had everything a person could need.  Wi-fi, fridge, mircrowave, coffee pot, silverware, dishes, dish detergent and sponge, vacuum, pack and play, ironing board and iron.  The bed was very comfortable, and our son had no complaints about the fold out couch.  The only thing I wished were different was that the area where the vanity is located had some sort of door/curtain to block the light/noise while others were sleeping and I was awake getting ready.  The hotel has an entrance to both California Adventure and Downtown Disney.  Super convenient.  We ate at White Water Snacks for breakfast and it was good!  Pool is nice, lounge chairs around the pool are very comfortable.  The staff is

This was our second trip to the Grand Californian and we were not disappointed at all. It met and exceeded our expectations.  The pool and water slide at the hotel are great, the room was quiet and clean and we were lucky enough to get an upgrade. In general it is quite expensive but if you search and are flexible you can get a good deal, which we did.  I really love the private entrance from the hotel directly to the park ( Calif. Adventure) I also must say that the early mornings that guests of the resort get to enter the park before others was well worth it.  Seeing a little girl with Mickey Mouse all to herself with no one else in sight is priceless.  It is a lovely place and service and staff are great, just save save save and look for deals.  I have never stayed at the

4 star service that fully met expectations in that magical Disney way.  We were an elevator ride away from California Adventure Park, and a very short walk from Disneyland. The room was bit small but you don't spend alot of your time in your room - you're in Disneyland!   Special privileges for hotel guests within the park such as early admission which allowed you to get to the front of the line (or near it) for those most popular attractions created some great memories for us.  3 swimming pools, a water slide, 2 hot tubs, and a wading pool - something for everyone.    My daughter lost a tooth while there but Guest Services made sure the tooth fairy's friend, Tinkerbell, left a gift for her.  Every service request we made was followed up with a phone call to ensure we were

Stayed here for our 15th anniversary for 3 nights as a treat. Paid a handsome sum for a ‚Äúpool or resort view room‚Äù. We called that morning to request a King and to reinforce that it was our anniversary. Called and preregistered 2 hours before arrival and our request for a king was honoured and they verified that it was our anniversary.  When we pulled up it was a zoo. The valet‚Äôs were less than enthused when I asked where the self parking was. They said it was across the street. I then asked if I could leave my bags with the other ¬Ω while I parked. They watched as I pulled 3 checked bags and 2 roll a boards out of the car with out asking if I needed any help with the bags. I then parked the car. Some one did eventually help with the bags.   I entered and was looking for a

We loved our stay at the grand californian. My partner and I went there for a single night visit and the staff were friendly, efficient and helpful. In fact the staff here were miles beyond the disneyland staff in terms of treating their clients well and with courtesy. The rooms were extremely comfortable, the beds ridiculously soft and cozy. They upgraded us to a park view although we couldnt really see much, but really when you want to be in disneyland for the evening festivities and fireworks and want to come back to a comfortable bed and amazing breakfast (really fast service in the storyteller cafe btw) then theres no place better. We couldnt have been happier and will definitely be staying here the next time we return to disney, and I hope that is soon! Its pricey for

We stayed in the new DVC Villas for 3 nights in July.  Our 1 bedroom Villa was on the 4th Floor and had a nice balcony that overlooked the Pool. The Villa amenities are very nice with the full size kitchen, Living room,2 full bathrooms and jacuzzi tub. The Villas are adjacent to the hotel, you can't even tell the difference from the outside.  We really enjoyed our stay a the Grand Californian. The hotel is beautiful and the location is amazing. If you go out one side you are in Downtown Disney and if you go out another side you are literally in the Grand California Adventure Park.  This alone makes it worth it.  The other perk was the reserved seating for Colors of the World. Each morning they let hotel guests go into the park to get a Fast Pass for Colors before the park opens.

We arrived at Grand Californian after spending 5 nights at the Disneyland hotel in a premium view newly renovated room. We had the bell desk transfer our bags over so we could enjoy the parks while we waited for check in. Check in line was long but there is a tv and little arm chairs set up for kids to watch movies while they wait. Lobby is luxurious, it makes you say WOW when you enter. But the fireplaces and welcoming staff give it a homely feel.  We only booked a standard room here (standard room at GC was roughly the same as Premium room at DLH). We received room 5443 on the fifth floor. Room was not as big as DLH (didn't have day bed). The room was a bit of a walk from the lobby, past the restaurant & pools but our elevator was right near the entrance to California

Summary Heading: Perfect Place for Adults and Kids
Summary: I have had the great fortune of being able to stay at Disney's Grand Californian twice and can't wait to go there again.  What I love most about it is that it provides a comfortable atmospere for both adults and children.  It is only in recent years that my family and I have been able to take "real" vacations, and it's important that my children have fun and equally important that my husband and I have fun, too. I want to come home from the vacation that we've saved all year for and feel like I've really had a spectacular  and memorable experience and that will keep me going until next year's vacation.  A stay at the Grand Californian fully fulfills that.     I love the fact that I can sit in the hotel's  relaxing, gorgeous, expansive lobby, listen to live paino music and drink

Summary Heading: Ideal location, great room, and kind-hearted service when we needed it
Summary: This was our 2d time at the GC.  I'd waited on going back, and pounced when we got a promo rate offer in the mail.  The room comfortably slept all five of us (kids in bunk bed and a kid in a trundle single).  Drawer space was almost a little tight, but it's not like we needed lots of room for formal wear.  Double sink is a huge help.  Water closet was fine, shower had good pressure, and the towels were pretty good (but could be better).  Everything was clean.  The location is such a treat.  Three minutes and you're in line for Worlds of Color Fastpasses.  Six minutes and you're walking into Disneyland.  The first time we stayed here, one of us came back to let the baby nap or to change the little girl into princess stuff.  We thought we had outgrown coming back to the room, but

Summary Heading: Great holiday! Would love to stay here again if we can afford it.
Summary: We read many reviews prior to going on our holiday for both the Disney Grand hotel and Disneyland park and were a little nervous from the negative feedback for both.  However, from the moment we arrived at the Disney Grand Hotel, our worries were gone.  We were greeted as we arrived in our shuttle bus outside the hotel and told our luggage would be brought to our room, we just needed to sign in.  The front staff were friendly and very interactive with our 2 girls, and made the arrival magical.  Off to our room, and we were nervous at to what type of view we'd have as didn't pay for a view room.  We loved the room, it had a balcony that overlooked the Downtown Disney and we could watch the fireworks from our room!  The staff turn down your bed each night and leave delicious

The location of this hotel is fantastic, with a direct entrance to California Adventure.  The Disneyland entrance is only a couple of hundred yards away through downtown Disney.  The hotel itself is beautiful, much like the Wilderness Lodge and Animal Kingdom.  We had two adjoining rooms, and they were fine.  One problem is that one of the rooms wasn't ready at 4:00 on the first day (one of  two rooms).  Because of this, the hotel staff gave us a dinner coupon for 5 people for dinner at StoryTellers cafe.  That coupon ended up being worth $160.  We had a great trip, and this was a fabulous hotel.

I have been to this hotel twice. This year and Feb 2009. It is a bit expensive for the quality of the rooms but the convenience to the parks is worth it. The rooms are standard and adequate. We had bunks bed for the kids which was fun. There was wireless internet. We had a view of the pool area. Sometimes the night life in the hotel was a bit noisy but not bad. The room service and restaurants were nice. The staff were awesome. The front desk staff could not have been nicer. They used their computer to print my flight passes for when we left.   We booked the pool cabana for the afternoon. What a great way to supervise your children, stay out of the heat and relax all afternoon. The cabanas were gorgious. Two full length lounges outside and two couches inside. There was a TV and

If you are taking the family to Disneyland and want to immerse yourself in the Disney experience then this is the hotel for you.  This was my family‚Äôs second trip to Disneyland and after having stayed at the Disneyland Hotel we decided to upgrade to the best.  The Grand Californian is in the perfect spot for getting to and from the parks as quickly as possible.  The main gate of Disneyland is approximately 100 yards away and the Hotel has it‚Äôs own private entrance to California Adventureland.   This feature alone was worth the extra cost for our family. The lobby area is beautifully decorated and has a nice log cabin lodge feel.  On the other hand, the beauty is somewhat ruined due to the high traffic the area receives at all hours of the day.  The rooms were of nice size and
Great location, nice staff, everything was very good.  Can't beat this hotel.

Summary Heading: Staying at the Disney Grand enhanced our Disney experience
Summary: Before we went, I was a little concerned from some of the reviews that we were paying a lot just to be close to the Disney Parks.  Having just returned from 3 nights with 3 small children, I think staying at the Disney Grand hugely enhanced our whole Disney experience.  The hotel has been absolutely beautifully designed.  It was unbelievably busy when we arrived for check in, but the children can sit in rocking chairs in front of cartoons while the adults check in and the process was so well managed that in spite of the seemingly huge numbers of people we were checked in very quickly.  My only criticism is that we had to wait 2.5 hours from the stated check in time of 3pm to actually getting our room and having our bags arrive, but the general atmosphere of the hotel is so happy

Summary Heading: 1st time at Disney Property -- Worth the money for convenience and luxury
Summary: I had never stayed at a DL property -- I was really feeling like, "Boy I did a dumb thing - I could have stayed at cheaper hotels!"   Well, I could have stayed at a cheaper hotel, but I'm sooo glad I didn't.  Pampered, Luxury, Special.... that's how I felt.  ARRIVAL- When you get there, you'll drive up to the front.  There are many, many people to greet you.  If you want to self park, it's free.  If you want VALET, it's $17.00 per day.  I am a single mom and I did self- park and felt safe!  It was 9:30 at night, and I still felt okay.  Lots of people around, well lit, parking lot signage was good.  In the parking lot, they have beautiful music to greet you... it was just an incredible feeling.  CHECK-IN From the minute you walk into the sliding front doors, you just feel like ,

I am a young college student with a very low income and I have to say, this place is worth the money! I saved for 8 months to come here with my boyfriend for two nights, and man was it worth it. I can honestly say it was the best weekend of my life. The service was fantastic, everyone including the maids treated you with such smiles and respect. The view from the standard room was great! My boyfriend and I really enjoyed watching everyone check in and the overall people watching aspect. Plus we were surrounded by beautiful trees. The room itself was GORGEOUS with the perfect classy amount of Disney; nothing gaudy. The king bed was SO comfortable. Also I adored the Bambi shower curtain and the rotating shower head.   Some people claim they had problems with check in being late. I

Summary Heading: WOW! Loved it and felt it was worth every penny!
Summary: My family and I spent 3 nights here when visiting Disneyland.  I was little concerned that I was throwing our money away after reading some of the reviews and wondered if I should get a different hotel, but after arriving at the resort I was so happy that I kept our reservations.   The place is immaculately clean, the staff is exceptionally helpful and friendly. There are 4 pools all clean and heated.  The lobby is beautiful and they have someone playing the piano most of the day-was very relaxing.  Check in was a breeze, no waiting at all since they have so many people working at registration and we received lots of helpful information and tips!  The rooms were very nice.  We got a free upgrade upon check in and had 2 queen beds and a flat screen TV, refrigerator and microwave.

Summary Heading: Amazing Classy Resort- still had the charm of Disney!
Summary: My Family and I stayed in The Grand Californian in Disneyland for a total of 7 days. When we first arrived, we noticed how nicely air conditioned it was in there, as we had just come from the hot hot airport, so it was very refreshing. The Decor in the hotel is very woods-y, with tons and tons of small details- you could already tell that the resort was a five star resort! Upon arriving at our room, we noticed that it was a little bit noisy(we overlooked the court yard, as we were told a room over Downtown Disney is very noisy at night) because of the Monorail traffic that passed by constantley, so we decided to swtich to a less noisier room at on the other side of the courtyard. This was really the only set back of our entire hotel experience. The rooms are very nice, but

Had a brilliant 5day stay at this marvellous hotel.  The room was large and the perfect size for a family of 5.  It was great to be so close to the park so we could come back in the afternoon for a swim.  The kids loved the character breaksfast - chip n dale and mickey mouse surfs up - worth the cost from the entertainment point of view.  The pinochio's workshop childminding was brilliant.  Napa Rose is worth a visit - had a great meal.  If return to disneyland this would be the notel I choose again.

Summary Heading: Knock out stay that blew my (MM) ears off!
Summary: I had a fab stay at the GCH - really lovely. I stayed here for 3 nights, on my own on holiday visiting DLR. I booked here using a Disneyland special of 40% off - so a good discount but I admit still more than double any non Disney hotel. But they worked hard to make up for the difference in price! the service started when I walked through their beautiful front stained glass door and was met by a CM who escorted me to a check in person. The Check in person was REALLY HELPFUL and very nice - she spent quite a while with me helping with all my questions, and she went out of her way to help me with a few items that saved me time and money in the end.  She spent a lot of time and went and spoke with the supervisors when I said can I have a King bed room - and they got me one! In the

Summary Heading: Had a great time. Once again the best place to stay if your there for a week.
Summary: Stayed here in May of 2010. We stayed for a week before a cruise with our kids. We have been to Disneyland many times and have stayed in all the Disney hotels and a lot of the off site hotels. We love the Californian because we actually feel like we are on vacation when we stay there. Its soo easy to go back and forth between this and the parks. Outside of that this is still an amazing hotel. Yes the rooms are small but the service is impeccable and the staff know how to spread the Disney spirit. Check in was a breeze and they showed us to our room. luggage was up within 5 minutes. We stayed in a room overlooking the lagoon of the California park. We were up  late at night enjoying the testing of the world of color. Cant wait to come back and see it in its entirety. I loved

The service was first class.   We were very satisfied with the room - clean and though it was not new, it was not old either.   The location was awesome and the price paid was worth it for the convenience (There was 40% discount when we reserved the hotel). It was only steps away from the Disneyland, Disney California Park and Downtown Disney.  Other positive points of our stay - Complementary Magic Morning pass even though we bought the 2-days park hopper only. Magic Morning pass is usually only available to those with 3-days park hopper. The Magic Morning pass allowed us to go to certain rides before the parks were opened to the public. The hotel also has its own entrance to the Disney California Park. We didn't have to queue with the public and also, as the parks were only

Summary Heading: awesome location and worth the extra
Summary: we got a great deal online to stay at 40% off which made the cost reasonable vs other nearby park hotels. the hotel however is out of this world. all the facilities are first class. story tellers cafe with chip n dale for the kids is wonderful. just a step away from downtown disnbey and its eating locations. also private entrance to DCA and a short walk to DL. having stayed at nearby hotel previous and enjoyed it except the shuttle bus to/from dl it was a great to just walk in/out and have rest from the parks, enjoy a swim at teh resort , and go back in the evenings to the parks again.

Summary Heading: Truly an amazing hotel.....worth the extra money!
Summary: My daughter...who is 19 years old and I decided to book a trip to Disneyland for 4 days. Just us girls this time. I wanted it to be special so I booked the Disney"s Grand Califorian Hotel. Why not.....I thought. It's worth the extra money and I was not wrong. It was everything I thought it would be. I read other peoples reviews and I even went thru the lobby last time we were at Disney. This hotel was fantastic. For me the hotel is part of the experience of the vacation no matter where I go.........I love a grand hotel and this one is lovely. Tjhe service was great. We ate at Story Tellers Cafe. Expensive for the buffet  but worth it because of the enterainment for the kids. My daughter is 19 and loved getting her picture with the characters bears. The location is sooooo

Wow! We are Disney World veterans but decided to head west and try the Disneyland Resort for a change.  We stayed in a Grand Californian studio villa and were very pleased.  We had a view of the pool, and the room was plenty big enough for two adults and two kids. I could not believe the location of this hotel.  You walk through one door and you are in California Adventure, walk through another and you are in Downtown Disney.  Disneyland is also just a short walk away.  The hotel staff was very kind and the lobby was absolutely breathtaking.  We cannot wait to return!

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel & Experience, Poor Disney Transportation at LAX
Summary: We love Disney, & have enjoyed visits to DLand & World many times.  This trip was an extra special celebration of our daughter's & son-in-law's college graduations, and to share the excitement of their children's first Disney park visit.  We were thrilled to provide our 3 yr-old granddaughter with her first experience, and thus begin a new generation of Disney enthusiasts.  It was also our dear son-in-law's first visit.   We purchased a package for the Grand Californian 2 bedroom suite, which included character lunch and transportation to and from LAX.  Schedules were tights, since we were only spending 2 days in Disneyland, then flying on early the next day to Hawaii with everyone. The hotel was in great shape, and we had a pleasurable time there. Clean, well-maintained, nice

Summary Heading: Grand is a understatement for this hotel!
Summary: I love this hotel! I have stayed in other hotels near by but every time I walked down  the down town Disney walk I would look up at the balconies of the Grand Californian hotel  and I would wish that I had booked there instead. So, one year I did and I'm hooked.... I have stayed there three times already and I would never dream of staying anywhere else. I would have to say that the Grand Californian is the nicest hotel in Anaheim. They have so many amenities, I wouldn't even know where to start. My favorite thing about this hotel would have to be its location it is the closest hotel to  the parks literally close to California Adventure its in it. You can walk out the side breeze way right into the park. That is most convenient for parents with small children. I know when my son

Summary Heading: Really first rate property, not worth the money though
Summary: Great Hotel, but not so great rooms. Very nice, but not worth the money. I travel a lot with work, and stay in pretty nice places, Hilton, Sheraton, Hyatt, and even the occasional Four Seasons. The Grand Californian was beautiful in every aspect until we got to our room. I asked for a 'view' room and yes we got a room with a view of what would have been the garden I suppose, except it was completely blocked by a very nice pine tree at the second floor. Do you know how wide a 40 foot pine tree is 10 feet from the base? Well, let's just say even with the drapes open at 3pm, it was very dark in the room. I asked to move and we got a another room with a view of Katella Ave, but at least it was on the 5th floor. Still the room was not worth the money. I would have felt fine if I had

I read all the reviews before going out to Disneyland and since this was our first visit I wanted a hotel that was safe, nice, and most importantly close to Disneyland and California Adventure since we were traveling with young children. I am very happy that we booked this hotel. The hotel is really nice and the grounds are very clean. The staff was very helpful and check-in was quick and painless. We had read that the hotel lacks the Disneyland theme which it does. I mean it's there but not in the "in your face" style that you may expect. This hotel struck me as being more for the grown-ups and older crowds. The lobby resembles something you would find in a country lodge with it's huge fireplace and dimmed out lighting. The rooms are nothing to really go goo-goo over but they

We stayed at the Grand Californian Hotel at Disneyland June 20-25, 2010. We paid extra for a theme park view room. We were given a room on the 5th floor that looked right out at Grizzley River Run (water ride). The Hotel has a gate that allows you right into Disney Caifornia Adventure Park (DCA) that is only accessed by Disney Hotel guests. This made it very convenient to come back and forth to our room to swim and at night. However, at night they close off the path that accesses the Hotel from DCA, so everytime you want to go back to your hotel at night you must tell the cast member from Disney where you are going. This was like being interrogated and a bit over the top, as if I was "breaking into" some restricted area, hopefully Disney will get that hotel guests don't need to

Summary Heading: Beautiful Hotel, but not worth the money.
Summary: We booked a room for our honeymoon at the Grand Californian hotel in March of this year.  I've taken a while to write this review because I really had to think about how I wanted to rate the trip.  We booked almost 6 months in advance for a Downtown Disney view room with a king bed.  We were told that they could not guarantee a king bed, which wasn't a huge deal but because it was our honeymoon I was assured that there would be a note on our file and that it should not be a problem.  I was also told there would be some wedding "extras" in the room which was exciting.  Upon our arrival at the hotel the staff were busy doing internal business.  It was about 11pm and there were no other guests in line but it took about half an hour for check in.  I found this odd, but not the end

We recently came back from a 4 day vacation in Disneyland to celebrate the birthday of my 4 year old daughter.  Disneyland was one of our trip highlights, and I wanted everything to be perfect, starting with a good hotel.  Since it has been almost 15 years since I last visited Disneyland, I spent a very long time choosing a hotel, which eventually narrowed down to either the Disneyland Hotel or the Grand Californian.  Did all the research and although the reviews of the Grand Californian were almost unanimously good, what i found lacking was the "Disney" experience of Mickey and friends in theme and decor which the Disneyland Hotel had.  In the end, the quality of accommodations won out and we decided on the Grand Californian.  I am so happy with my choice of the Grand

Summary Heading: Stayed here last year and will do so again next week
Summary: We are annual passholders and wanted another staycation since I'm expecting a baby in a few months and we have young children.  The thought of sitting on an airplane for 5 hours just wasn't appealing.  I know there are some very negative reviews on this site and some of the complaints are well justified.  Before you stay here, you really need to know the facts and what to expect.  I will start with all the negatives.  First:  If you are used to ritz carlton or four seasons service and accomodations, you will be gravely disappointed with GCH.  Disney caters to families, not to the wealthy or business folk.  Don't expect white glove cleanliness as these rooms get put through a lot of abuse by the mass amounts of children that stay here (mine included who have spilled their share

Summary Heading: Grand Californian not grand with families of 5 or more
Summary: We have 3 kids-young teens, so we hoped to book a room with a sofa bed and we booked directly with the hotel several months ago.  We told them that we needed either a roll away or a sofabed. Or, we needed to get 2 rooms.  We were told that they had a room with a sofabed that would accomodate us.  We got there on June 16th at around 4 pm went to the room, and discovered 2 beds and no sofabed.  We went back down to the lobby to show them our kids and they told us that they were 98% full and that there was nothing they could do but would give us sleeping bags.  We arrived too late.  Checkin was at 3:00.  My husband expressed, in polite words, that we wouldn't have booked the room if we knew someone would be sleeping on the floor.  They repeated their broken record that the sofabed

Summary Heading: We arrived at noon and miraculously our...
Summary: We arrived at noon and miraculously our room wasn't ready until exactly at the stroke of 3pm which was the case with everyone else waiting in the lobby.  So don't even think about checking in before 3.  One of our rooms reeked like a dirty diaper and the staff had to do a "deep cleaning" of our room but we were disappointed that someone felt that room was presentable in the first place.  The bedsheets were itchy that night and needed to be changed.  The critter breakfast is nothing like the character breakfasts at the other locations and we were led to believe that it was.  There were no special pictures taken and no special treats for the kids at the breakfast.  Room service wasn't great either.  We expected to have a somewhat luxurious experience since this should be Disney's

My goodness!!! we had loads and loads of fun at the Grand Californian Hotel.Earlier we had stayed at the paradise pier , because there were no rooms available at the GCH (Grand Californian Hotel) so we decided to saty at GCH this year. We got there and we couldn't check -in till 2:00 and it was 11:00 so they advised we had breakfast at the Story Tellers Cafe . It had the most amazing buffet the food was fabulous worth the price.My sister is allergic to gluten (wheat) so the chef was kind enough to come out and tell what to eat.Later we decided to go to the park which was like just a second away from the hotel .Later we got back at 3:00 but we had to wait a couple minutes more , we didn't mind we observed the most comforting beautiful lobby ever with a grand fireplace and a

Summary Heading: Grand time at the Grand Californian!
Summary: I stayed for 5 nights at the Grand Californian at the end of May, and had a wonderful time. It was my first time staying onsite at Disneyland, as it was the first time I had been there in 17 years, I have been going to Disney World practically every year for years, and had been wanting to go back to Disneyland, so the right time came up, and I decided to go all out and stay at the Grand Californian.   We (there were two of us) were greeted with "Welcome Home" by the friendly cast member upon arrival, and were checked in and in our room on the 5th floor within 10 mins. It was a two bed room, with a sitting area, TV, separate sinks outside the bathroom (two sinks) and a balcony. The view wasn't a theme park one, but rather one of the Disneyland Hotel and the Paradise Pier Hotel,

Wow.  The staff, the hotel, the location couldn't be any better.  I will not be making any more trips to Disneyland without staying at this hotel.  Disney really knows how to cater to its guests.  My only complaint is that the toilet paper is only single ply, and I really had to dig deep to come up with that nit to pick.
Great Hotel1 We travel there quite often and although it is pricey, we will always return! Im not sure If our kids have more fun than we do?

Summary Heading: Only place to stay if visiting Disneyland!
Summary: If you're travelling with an obsessed Disney fan (as I was), this is the only hotel to stay at when visiting Disneyland in Anaheim.  We stayed 3 nights & it was worth every penny.  We were able to get a discounted rate from Disneyland's website, so it was 40% off.  Service was friendly & upon arrival, they upgraded us to the Concierge level.  The restaurant is definitely worth visiting at least once (to see Chip & Dale), & the grand lobby is quite impressive.  Regarding the room itself, the beds are extremely comfortable, bathrooms are spotless, & the overall look of the room fits well with the overall theme of the hotel.

Summary Heading: Pleasant Surprise to this DVC Member
Summary: I can't really add much about this wonderful hotel that hasn't already been said, but I did want to comment on just the access to Disneyland and experience versus Walt Disney World.  As a DVC member, I have been to Disney World almost every year for about the last 10 years.  I love it there, but I was quite surprised how much I also enjoyed my stay at the Grand Californian and the Disneyland parks.  Disneyland, while not as big, did seem to have almost all of the rides you love from Disney World without as many long lines.  Over the course of two and a half days, we were able to ride all the rides, with many being ridden multiple times.  This was great for people will small children that sometimes get difficult when waiting in long lines.  If you love Disney World, I would

Summary Heading: DVC Villas at the Disney Grand Californian
Summary: We used a few of our Disney Vacation Club (DVC) points for a one night stay at in a one-bedroom Villa timeshare unit that is part of the recently completed expansion of the Disney Grand Californian Hotel and Spa. As owners of a DVC at Walt Disney World (WDW), we decided to use some of our point allotment to check out the Villas even though we live in locally in Southern California. We stayed at the hotel about 7 years ago as regular paying guests in a standard room and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Our stay in a DVC Villa was incredible and we wished we added an extra day or two to our Memorial Day getaway.   There are only 50 two-bedroom equivalent Villas in the entire hotel and our one bedroom Villa was located on the third floor, unit number 3514.  All the Villas are

Summary Heading: Great location & rude service from one employee
Summary: Disney prides itself from excellent customer service and this I find to be true except unfortunately during the last 5 minutes of our stay at Grand California over the Memorial Weekend when I brought our valet ticket to the window to pick up our car and the attendant ask me " Are you sure you are in the right hotel?" It's a very insulting question and attendant could have handled the situation better by asking the manager about old valet ticket which they issued to us at check in.  Anyways, the best way to describe this hotel is location, location, location, just like in real estate. Best part is you can walk to the park and avoid the hassles that come when staying at neighborhood hotels, such as parking at the main garage and lifting your sleeping child from stroller to ride

What a BEAUTIFULLY constructed hotel!  I had the great pleasure of spending a night here with my husband as a Christmas present in a Park View Suite, and a separate weekend here with my mom, brother, and sister in law in a Double Queen Standard room.  I'll show pictures of both rooms.  PARK VIEW ROOM REVIEW:  I would always walk past this hotel inside DCA and Downtown Disney and think about how I would LOVE to spend a night here!  And that came true!  My husband asked for the best room that was available the night we were going, and that happened to be a king-sized bed closest to the park entrance overlooking the park...$400.00/night including our annual pass discount!  Anyways, the lobby reminded me of the Animal Kingdom Lodge and the Wilderness Lodge at Disney World.  It was

Summary Heading: To Help You Better Understand (brief and makes sense I hope)
Summary: Reading TA reviews for the Grand, a lot of you are from out of the area.  Even being 'from the area', this was a learn-by-doing hotel that took us a year to understand.  Previously, the cost also kept us away and still does, depending on the time-of-year and day-of-week.  Our Sunday-Tuesday stay this week was to celebrate an anniversary after deciding to include family & friends; second stay at this hotel.  If you're considering the Grand, you are also going to Disneyland and/or The California Adventure Park (same property, different parks).  There are DVC members, AP holders, and the general public.  Disney Vacation Club members (only/usually) get the big Villas at the Grand, no one else.  We are annual pass holders (not DVC members), which gives room discounts at Disney hotels

This resort is absolutely beautiful. It is spotlessly clean and what makes it the BEST place to stay is that it is right in the park! You can walk to downtown Disney in a couple of minutes and a private entrance to the California theme park. Only minutes to Disneyland too! Very relaxing, you feel so free to not be rushed or stressed to get to the park! You can come and go as you please. We rented a studio so we could have breakfast there and splurge on dinner. Go to the Napa Rose restaurant, very expensive but it is more than dinner- it is an experience! The food is fabulous and totally worth the money. You only need to go once so go for it! Make sure you wander in Downtown Disney and watch the street performers. Eat at the Rainforest but remember the portions are HUGE so

Summary Heading: The good, the bad and the overpriced!
Summary: We just returned from a conference which included a 4 night stay at the Grand Californian.    The lobby is grand and the front desk staff were very friendly and organized.  Our room was nice with oak, mission/craftsman sort of style.  The shower appeared to have been newly tiled with a rain head.  There was also a small refrigerator, which came in handy.  The only downside of the room was, the pillows were fiber filled and way too large - I can't imagine a child (a large percentage in this hotel) using such a huge pillow!  Also, the bath towels were in desperate need of replacement - they were worn down to where they'd be car wash rags in our home.  The pool area was awesome - several pools and lots of comfortable chairs!  There was a staffing issue - the poolside servers were

I surprised my husband and took him to Disneyland for his birthday.  He had not been there for 26 years.  I have stayed at Disney's Californian Hotel before during Christmas about 4 years ago and I knew this recent trip we could not bear to stay any where else.  We arrived at OC airport early so that we could spend the first day of 3 at Disneyland.  We knew the hotel would store our bags so we checked in early.  I told the wonderful woman at the front desk how I surprised my husband for his birthday.  She was especially excited when I told her that the night before I had Goofy call my husband and wish him a happy birthday and welcome to the park (special disney service). All he could do was grin from ear to ear.   The front desk lady then began telling the other employees of how

We just got back from staying at the Grand Californian our stay was May 3-7,  all in all the hotel is very nice great food, location, pools nice staff decent room size and they gave us a free room upgrade to a room with a nice view of the pool and park.  Now to the negative part,  the shower went from ice cold to scalding hot in about 1mm of adjustment, after taking the first shower I called down to the front desk and complained about the shower the person I spoke to said that they would send up someone to fix it the next day.  The following day same ice cold and scalding shower and I called down to the front desk and they said the same thing that they would fix it.  So to make a long story short it never got fixed and I just got lip service throughout our stay.  Finally the

Summary Heading: Perfect for families with babies and/or toddlers
Summary: When we first walked into the lobby of the GC our jaws dropped in awe of this immense wooden structure and its shockingly high ceilings.  My wife and I were impressed with the friendly staff circulating in the lobby to help ensure that toddlers were enjoying themselves.  There were pictures of Disney characters for coloring and a kid-sized seating area where children watched cartoons together.    Our one-bedroom Artisan Suite was well appointed and had a patio overlooking the Grizzley River Run.  My wife and I enjoyed the warm afternoon breeze and the rumble of the waterfall, while our 17-month-old daughter slumbered to dreams of King Arthur's Carousel.   The aspect of the GC that we came to appreciate the most was its location.  With a 17-month-old, the last thing you need is a

Our family recently stayed at the Grand Calif. and had a wonderful time. Very convenient to the Park, Calif Adv.Land, and downtown Disney. With 3 young boys (twins aged 5 and 3 1/2), convenience and location were key as we cannot be bothered with waiting for a shuttle after a long day, nor hike 15 - 20mins in the dark with 3 cranky kids. Hotel was clean and comfortable, though housekeeping service needs improvement (forgot to empty trash can one day, and did not replenish coffee and toiletries). The free internet and free parking were a bonus.  Our 3 1/2 yr old has already requested that we go back to GC next time.  Overall, 5 star location and ambience.

Summary Heading: Nice, Great Views and Location, Hard Beds, Expensive for what you get
Summary: I stayed in a room overlooking the Mullholland Drive roller coaster and Back part of CA park. When you closed the sliding door all outside sound went away, poof! It was wonderful. Can't say I didn't hear the kids next door or in the halls yelling the next morning. Man those little guys have the lungs. bathroom was real nice, amenities were nice, lots'a of nice fluffy big towels. Iron and board, hair dryer and robes in room. Nice touch. Flat screen TV with remote. floor was sticky near bed, ewwww. bed was hard, changed beds in middle of night, pillows were hard and lumpy. Balcony was dark due to long overhang and was also small. The rooms overlooking the water ride are light airy and much larger. They had a large table and chairs, my room had a small side table and 2 small

Summary Heading: Great for families, but is on the spendier side
Summary: We have stayed at the Grand Californian three times now, and every time we have really enjoyed the excellent service from staff, convenience to the parks, and great poolside atmosphere that many other reviews have spoken of.  If there's one down side I can point out it's cost, not just of the rooms, but of everything.  I travel a lot for business so I'm used to getting fleeced at hotels, but Uncle Walt has 'em all beat.  If they turned down the volume on some of their costs just a little - especially food and drink - I would have zero complaints.    Okay, not zero.  The water pressure in the shower was kinda lousy.  But that didn't bother me.    Some other points:  If you have two younger kids (depending on their height) and you're shooting to all stay in the same room, I

Summary Heading: Pricey but convenient. special entrance to CA Adventure a plus!
Summary: My family of 4 stayed a weekend at the Grand Californian hotel for 2 nights. Accommodations were nice, but not exactly what I'd expect for the price--or have experienced in the past for the price range; however, I knew before going we were paying for location, location, location. We ate one night in the Storytellers cafe restaurant --food was good although the make your own pizza took a bit longer than we anticipated (my son rec'd it after the rest of us was served). We also ate breakfast and dinner in the White Water Snacks cafe which worked fine - we didn't have to wait in long lines - food was adequate and quick (decent breakfast burrito). My kids were not interested in the character meals - and one is a picky eater - so these quick meals were perfect for us--after all, we

Location is key with access to California Adventure right out of the hotel and downtown Disney out the other.  In the past we had a Theme Park View and could hear the piano playing until late, so we didn't rest well.   So when we came back in August 2009, we mentioned that to check-in and they gave us a quiet room, near the stairs - perfect rest!   We travel with in-laws and small children, so we had a sofa bed in the room and the room was ample for our needs.  While room price is premium, we book through Walt Disney Travel and can book a year in advance and make payments each month prior to our trip, its easier on the wallet.  We purchase  the meal plan and it works beautifully for us - the best value with eating at the Character buffet breakfasts and a beautiful dinner at Blue

Summary Heading: Convenience location VERY yes, Overall Value? Meh...
Summary: I like Grand Californian. Location wise it is very convenience. I go to Disneyland every year (except last year we went to Disney World for the first time), so I know exactly the experience to stay outside of the Disney hotels. Staying in GC is totally a difference experience. Whenever I'm tired or need to go back to the hotel, I can do it with ease. No need to wait for the bus or walk an extra mile(s) to the hotel. All I need to do is either go to Downtown Disney  or California Adventure and there's the entrance.   My room is located very near to CA, about 2-3 minutes walking distance. So it's awesome. I've been to Disneyland Hotel once, it's convenience but it's nothing compared to GC.  Having said that though, why 3 stars? First of all, it's $400 a night. For this kind of

Summary Heading: 1st time and it won't be the last
Summary: My husband and I took a last minute trip to DL in 1/10. We were going to stay offsite and then we changed our minds....I am so happy we did. We arrived at 10 in the morning and our room was ready. The hotel is in the perfect location. I loved the entrance to California Adventure right at the hotel. We plan on going back next year.

We have been going to Disneyland at least once a year for the past 10+ years. My family loves Disney!! Our most recent trips we always stay at the Grand Californian Hotel in one of their larger suites on the 6th floor because we travel with our parents and our significant others and children. It is always an amazing experience! The staff is so friendly and very helpful. They always go out of their way to make sure you have the best Disney experience.  Since we stay in a suite on the 6th floor, we get use of concierge lounge, which is open from like 6am-10pm. Very nice. They serve breakfast in the mornings, cookies and scones during the afternoon, different appetizers in the early evening and then a lovely assortment of desserts later in the evening. It is worth it to pay the

Summary Heading: The best way to do Disneyland
Summary: We throughly enjoyed our 3rd trip to Disney's Grand Californian Hotel. We love it primarily because of its close proximity to the parks, but we also find it to be a good break from the sensory overload that we find in the rest of the resort.  The visit, we had two standard view, adjoining rooms.  The hotel would not guarantee adjoining rooms, so we were on pins and needles until we checked in.  We had a view of Downtown Disney, which was nice.  I didn't miss the park view that we'd had in past visits.  We were actually able to see the fireworks from our balcony.  We noticed that they had made some upgrades to the rooms since our last visit in 2006 (new flat-screens, nicer bedding, rotating shower head). The water temperature of the showers continues to run between extremes,

OK, this hotel is rather expensive. But when staying at Disneyland what do you expect? It is an awesome place to stay. We spent 5 nights here and had a great time.  My only complaint was the distance our room was from the elevator. This is a huge hotel and we were as far from the elevators as you can get. At least we had no elevator noise.   Our room overlooked Downtown Disney and at night we could watch street performers and the fireworks form the balcony. The room was extremely comfortable and spacious.   One evening my wife and I went down to the bar to relax. We had a couple drinks and was a bit set back by the cost of the drinks. But again what do you expect from Disney? Drinks were about $13 each. By the time we left we spent about $70 for 4 drinks and tip.

Summary Heading: Location is what makes the Grand Californian my first choice of Disneyland hotels
Summary: Spring Break makes the Grand Californian Hotel very pricey, but we wouldn't have wanted to stay anywhere else, especially with small children. Being able to walk right into California Adventure and Downtown Disney, makes things so much easier with two young ones and two strollers. No need to take a tram or shuttle to get into the parks; what a time saver! We loved sitting in the lobby during breaks while our granddaughter chilled in front of the Disney cartoons on mini versions of Arts and Crafts chairs. We loved the pool area with three well-designed pools and plenty of towels. The rooms were very clean and staff extremely friendly and helpful. Access to food was also simple - ate at Storyteller's Cafe for dinner, White Water Snacks for a lunch and breakfast, and many

Summary Heading: I would live here if I could!!!!!!
Summary: Oh my goodness...where to start....From the moment we pulled in to the Valet parking area we were treated like Royalty!! This is the most FANTASTIC hotel I have ever stayed at!!!! When I made the reservations I had booked us on the Concierge or Craftsmans Club level and let me tell you you truly get what you pay for here!!!! It was worth every penny!!!! As soon as we pulled in we were greeted by name. Dawnell from the Craftsmans Club came down and entertained my boys while my husband and I dealt with the Valets and Bell Hops who were outstanding themselves!!
