Then Dawnell escorted us up to the 6th floor and while she was getting us checked in Scott another Craftsmans Club associate took my husband and boys in to the exclusive Craftsmans Club Lounge for juice and sodas. Dawnell

Summary Heading: If price is no object, this is the place to stay, great location!
Summary: Best feature is location, basically right in California Adventure park.  Lobby is impressive.  We have 3 kids and 2 adults in our family and the room was great for this (queen bed with bunk beds and trundle bed that pulled out from bunk bed, everyone had their own bed).  We had view of California Adventure which was nice but if I stayed again I would ask for view of Downtown Disney so we could see fireworks from our room.  For young kids pool area is amazing, has about 6 pools all different heights.  Our toddler could play in the kiddie pool and the older kids could swim in bigger pool.  Only place I ate at hotel was pool side, small menu but reasonable prices.  Loved the hotel, loved the location, loved our room but if possible get room close to the elevator.  We were at end of

Summary Heading: Got a steal of a deal from Costco
Summary: Well this was our first stay at any of the Disney Hotels and I had originally booked with Costco for the Disneyland hotel but a few days before my trip I decided to see if it was possible to switch hotels and I was able to for not that much more.  I really got an awesome deal through Costco travel services.  The hotel itself was beautiful and when we arrived we got a free upgrade to a room with a bunkbed.  The kids, ages 5 and 13, loved the bunk bed. The room was very spacious and we had a room on the downtown disney side which gave us a perfect fireworks view each night.  The only thing I would change is to be closer to the elevator.  We got lost several times by taking the wrong elevator but that is ok.  The hotel had activities for the kids and even a learn how to draw mickey

Summary Heading: Ultra Convenient With the WOW Factor
Summary: We visit DL or WDW each year and love this hotel. The atrium is amazing and the chairs and fire nook make it a real log cabin- like experience. The service is second to none, I have never met less than a 5 star employee. The location makes it so easy to visit the parks, you can walk straight into Californian Adventure park. this means if you get there at opening you can rush to the busy rides, getting on first and avoiding the queues. In DL this is priceless and saves you hours of queueing. Food here is pricey, but you can walk 5 mins through to the Downtown Disney strip and there is lots of choice for far less. We did not eat at the hotel, rather walked through and saved a fortune doing this.There are lots of other restaurants to choose from. We had a great room with a queen

O.K. right off the bat, this is one expensive vacation if you stay here but if you want the convenience of the "total" Disney experience this is the place to be, although we have stayed at "4 Seasons" hotels and ate at their 5 star restaurants for substantially cheaper than here with the one added meal at the "Napa Rose".  We booked on the phone and I think because of that, we were upgraded to a a 4th floor pool view on check-in (ie way less noise) because I was pleasantly insistent that I could not handle a noisy overnight room  (yep I do realize this is Disneyland nonetheless) so you might want to chance booking "standard room" and getting a free upgrade.  Also the day before we left, I checked prices again on-line and the on-line booking price was now $40 cheaper and a quick

i hope this is all right with everyone, including the editors of this site. normally i find that there are too much to write at the end of a family holiday so this is a running commentary with additions as days goes on definitely on first sight of the hotel it is GRAND in appearance. the lobby was everything people has mentioned. as we were conceirge club floor guest, we were met at the lobby and escorted up to the club floor. the attendant then made sure kids and wife were fed/watered and then with me checked in my reservations. she carefully went thru step by step every feature of hotel and disneyland etc. knowing that we just flew in from australia she went out the way and got us a room within 45mins of stepping in the hotel. in room by 12:30pm. we landed at LAX 09:45am. all

Summary Heading: Poor service and cleanliness for the price
Summary: We are frequent WDW visitors, but had not been to Disneyland for many years.  We are used to the outstanding service and cleanliness of the rooms at the WDW hotels, but we were very disappointed with what we experienced at the Grand Californian.  Although they don't guarentee the type of room you request, we had never had a problem with this before at WDW.  We needed 3 beds and requested in our reservation (and called to confirm on 2 occasions) a room with 2 Queen Beds and a Daybed on a high floor in a quiet location.  What we got when we arrived was a room with 2 Queen beds (no daybed) and a dusty old sleeping bag on the first floor in a very loud/public area.  After many go-rounds with the front desk staff, they agreed to give us our 2Q/Daybed room starting on our second

This was our second stay at the Grand Californian and it was just as magical as you would expect from a Disney property. The service was outstanding and the location is so convenient to Disney California Adventure, Downtown Disney and Disneyland that we were able to take mini-breaks during the day and go back to the hotel for short periods of time. We love the Grand Californian!!

Summary Heading: Worth the $$$ to be so close.
Summary: I gave 3 stars for value just because it may not be worth it for most people to be this close.  For us it is.  It is so nice to be able to come and go from the parks and downtown Disney woithout having to get a tram.  Room is fine.  Only complaint is the bathroom is very small; difficult to give a bath to a toddler.  If bathroom was a little bigger it would be perfect.  We plan on going back and staying again.

What a beautiful hotel !! Everyone was top of the line. We were so impressed. When we checked in, Rudy ( our front desk clerk) gave us a map and marked off different places of interest and what the hour were. He also gave my kids pictures of the princesses and charters. How Sweet !! The most breath-taking part of the hotel was the huge stained glass doors that entered into the HUGE lobby area. We eat at all the reatutants. The cheapest was White Water Snacks but it is a snack bar. Breakfast was crazy expencive, otherwise the prices were typical disney prices.  This was the BEST family vacation ever !!! They also had baby sitting services which my daughter loved and it wasnt too pricey.

We stayed at Disney's Grand Californian back in January and thought it was a great hotel.  We frequent Disney World about 2-3 times each year and have stayed in a variety of their hotels.  On our first trip to Disneyland, we wanted to stay in a hotel that matched the quality and decor of the Florida counterpart.  After hours of research, we decided on Grand California for the following reasons:  - LOCATION - Theme - Decor - Star Rating  You can't beat the location of this hotel in relation to the theme parks.  It is literally a 5 minute walk to the front gate of California Adventure and Disneyland.  In fact, there is a private entrance from the Grand Cali to Cali Adventure which was nice.  We felt the rooms were smaller than we were used to at WDW.  This is Disneyland's DELUXE

Our room looked out over Disneyland and Disney California. The room was great, the softest beds, must have been the pixi dust, cuz we all slept well. Room service was fast and the food was hot when it arrived. The cater to the youngest members of the family which is great, saves on the parent stress. It's all here, relax and enjoy the fun. Got a sticker shock when I ordered egg salad sandwiches for the family poolside, came up to $40.00 with sodas. When the gal saw my expression she said welcome to Disneyland!

We stayed at the GC for the Mickey's Halloween Party last, and have stayed here at least a 1/2 dozen times.  Yes it's pricey, but the convenience, comfort, and atmosphere are worth it.   The rooms are cosy, you can watch fireworks from the room with a Downtown Disney view, the beds are turned down at night  with Disney chocolates.  I always order coffee and continental breakfast for our morning before heading out to Magic Morning (early entrance to Disneyland for hotel guests!) and it's always there at the time I request.  The pool is great and so is the service-food and yummy cocktails!  White Water Rapids is a great place to get food and snacks and usually not too busy.  The hotel will also store your luggage (free) it you come early and also after you check out if you are

The best way to stay at Disneyland for sure. If you like the best of the best, stay here, hit the pool and order lunch there. Relax and forget how exhausted you would be if you were standing in line at 4pm. then after your nap, go back for time in the parks and fireworks. Eat at Napa Rose at the Chef's table.

The best time to go is durning the off season.  We paid for a std room with no view.  We got to the hotel very early, about 8 am.  Since the hotel wasn't full we got to check in right then.  We also got upgraded to a park view room with bunk beds.  The staff was great.  When we checked in, we told them it was our child's birthday.  The lady helping us went into the back and got him a signed picture of his favor charactor.  That evening the turn down service gave him a card with mickey with happy birthday.  He was so excited because he thought Mickey himself left it for him.  It was nice to be able to walk back to the hotel and change after riding Grizzly Rapids and not have to walk around wet for the next few hours.  Its going to be hard to stay anywhere else now.

This is our 3rd time to this hotel. I do love this place. I tried staying somewhere else this time and ended up checking out and coming back to the Grand. Its just so expensive and sometimes i feel like everything Disney is trying to suck the $$ out of everyone and that bugs me . Having said that the location cant be beat ! I cant believe people with small children walk all day in the 2 resorts and then have to walk a mile to their hotel room. This is perfect . Whenever your tired or need a break your only 10 minutes back . The rooms are small for the $$ you pay. One of the kids had to sleep on the floor in a sleeping bag ! Ask about the beds and room size before you book. We only stayed 2 nights but its ridiculous you pay that $ and your sleeping on the floor. They are clean

I've stayed at the Grand Californian at least 5 times.  I can honestly say I've had a great stay each time no matter what room.  I want to not like it because of the price but it is worth every penny.  Easy access to the parks and atmosphere help to make a relaxing vacation.  The only negative this trip was that we could hear a kid screaming and slamming doors into the late night.  Although, that was probably a parenting issue.

Summary Heading: I Could Live at the Grand Californian
Summary: Our family (2 adults, kids aged 12 and 8) had the pleasure of staying at the Grand Californian from February 14-19 (inclusive), 2010.  It was amazing.  The reservation process (which I did entirely on-line through the Disney website) was painless.  All of the materials we needed for our trip arrived 3 weeks before our departure and we got lots of perks (free pin-lanyards, free Toontown Madness, Preferred Seating, etc).!  The bus was there as promised at the airport and we arrived at the Grand within 1 hour of landing at LAX.  We arrived 2 hours before check-in time and our room was ready and waiting - no hassels.  The room itself was lovely.  We were upgraded to Theme-Park view and could almost chat with people riding on Mulhulland Madness!  Good news - the balcony doors were

I've stayed in some nice hotels, but the Grand Californian tops them all. The staff were amazingly friendly for such a large hotel - I felt as if I were the only guest staying there instead of being there during one of their busiest times of the year. Every time I came back to the hotel after visiting the parks I was greeted with a sincere "welcome home." The front desk staff were great to point out the best places to smoke in this non-smoking hotel, and really took their time to familiarize you with the layout of the hotel.  They even solved a problem I had at the parks that left park staff completely stumped. The rooms were nice with subtle Disney touches, the beds were comfortable, the complimentary toiletries: decadent - I use high end salon products usually and their

Summary Heading: Great Stay In the Heart of Disney
Summary: Full disclosure: I am a Disney Vacation Club (DVC) owner, and this was my first stay at a Disney Property.  I stayed January 24-28, 2010, in room 5509, a studio.  The room overlooked the pool and hot tub. The room was nicely furnished and clean.  The exceptions were food spilled in the microwave oven, and half a cashew under the sofa (along with the DVD remote control!). The room has a microwave oven, a small under counter refrigerator, toaster, coffee maker, and ice bucket.  The only utensils supplied were four ceramic coffee mugs and four glass drinking glasses.  Let me reiterate at this point that I was staying in a DVC room, so if you stay in the hotel this might vary.  Also provided were a scrubber sponge, a small bottle of Palmolive laundry detergent, and two small packets

Summary Heading: Beautiful Hotel but I think Walt would be disappointed.
Summary: We just got back from a birthday celebration trip to the Happiest Place On Earth. My wife and I went with my daughter, her husband and our gorgeous 4-year old granddaughter. We paid a premium because it was the Presidents/Valentines weekend. We got there on Wednesday ($305 per night per room and $382 for the Friday night stay) and departed on Saturday. While making reservations on their line the lady (who was wonderful) asked if we were celebrating any special occasions. Wow, I thought, how courteous to want to make her stay even more special. I wonder what they do for that special someone?   My wife and I took an earlier flight than the others and landed about noon. We took the Disney Bus which was quick efficient and $54 for two, round trip (you do the math). We got to the

Summary Heading: Fine, but they get you with the cost of the food.
Summary: Beautiful lobby.  Check in was a bit crowded and we never got the text that our room was ready.  The hotel is situated perfectly to go to Disney and CA Adventures and downtown Disney.  Rooms were fine.  Hotel is very large.  Nice,  but certainly not opulent.  Everything about Disney was created for masses of people to be passing through.  The biggest disappointment was the food choices in the hotel and in adjacent downtown Disney.  So expensive and not good.  The Storytellers Cafe (or whatever it is called) had Four Seasons breakfast prices and was not good.  It was very cute to have the characters come through at breakfast and do a parade around the restaurant with all the kids in tow.  Oh well, it was a great trip to Disney for the kids.  The hotel was clean, convenient and

We have stayed at all the disney hotels and this is definitely the best.  We had a room with a balcony and a view of Downtown Disney which was great for people watching.  There is music playing all day (both live and piped in) until midnight and the street is well lit.  Once the glass door to the balcony was closed and the black out curtains drawn, we did not notice any noise or light coming in.  However, we could hear our neighbours using the washroom and especially conversations in the hall.  Why do people let their young children scream in hotel hallways, anyways?  The rooms were nicely appointed with a good sized washroom and two sinks which is great when travelling with teenagers who need to do makeup etc.   Even with 4 adult sized people, we did not feel too squeezed.  The

Summary Heading: A fabulous winter holiday at the Villas at the Grand Californian
Summary: I will preface this review by stating that we are Disney Vacation Owners and only stay on Disney property when visiting Disney parks. Dec 4 - 10, 2009 we stayed in a 2 bedroom villa, room 3518, with a scenic view of the Redwood Creek Challenge play area of California Adventure. We arrived at 6am and were immediately assisted in unloading our car. Check-in was efficient and courteous, we knew our villa would not be ready until 4pm (villas take longer to clean than regular rooms) so the bell desk stored our bags and we were off to Disneyland. A major perk to staying on Disneyland property is early entry into Disneyland on Sun, Tues, Thurs and Sat. We got so many rides accomplished in that 1 extra hour, imagine riding everything in Tomorrowland and Fantasyland with no lines... it's

Summary Heading: A safe haven on a whirlwind trip.
Summary: The hotel simply put is gorgeous. If you have ever stayed on the old disney hotel, this place will knock your socks off in comparison. It has everything, a nice restaurant, as well as a more family friendly restaurant (still very nice). My daughter loved Pinochicco's workshop, a nighttime place where they watch the kids so that we could go explore the park late night. In fact she woke up the following day requesting to go back. The spa there is fantastic as well, and a perfect treat after spending all day walking around the parks.   But what really did it was this: my daughter threw up all over herself in the middle of the night. (A little too much birthday cake frosting for her). It was a huge mess. I took her into the shower to clean her off, while my boyfriend called the maid

Summary Heading: They aren't kidding when they say 'Full Service' at this hotel
Summary: I recently completed a weekend trip to Disneyland with my girlfriend and her daughter to celebrate her daughter‚Äôs fifth birthday. We stayed in Disney‚Äôs Grand Californian Hotel and Spa and they went above and beyond to ensure we had a good time the entire trip. Upon first arriving, the valet service was prompt and friendly and the greeters wouldn't let us enter without first giving balloons to the little one. While checking in to the hotel, their friendly staff talked with and entertained the little kids so the adults could complete any paperwork and get their rooms set up without any distraction. The hotel also has a TV in the lobby with an array of little kid‚Äôs chairs and it plays nothing but Disney cartoons 24 hours a day. Its powers were unknown to me but it‚Äôs a real kid

from the moment you arrive, you notice there is a hominess....a warm and inviting quietness. perhaps it is the absence of white paint and the presence of so much wood and natural stone look. very calm hotel.  then, the room: soothing natural colors, extremely fluffy bedding, throws on the ends of the beds....accent pillows. lighting: ADJUSTABLE dimmers on the headboard mounted lanterns! No kidding. Like a craftsman lodge scene! There are tree shapes in the headboards. The carpet...a sage green and tan muted floral pattern. clean clean clean.  the vanity: Double sink (spotless!)great mirrors on the wardrobe that will allow yu to see the rear view...amenities: fine shampoo, conditioner, lotion dn bath gel.  The silence: How do they do it???There is an amusement park outside! but

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, pity about the paper thin walls!
Summary: We spent two weeks at the Grand Californian and absolutely loved it.   Check in was very easy and we went straight up to our room.  We had booked a theme park view and were a little disappointed with the view on the 4th floor as we looked down a whole wing of the hotel with a small view of the theme park and monorail to the right.  The one major problem was the noise from the remodelling that was going on below.  When we would come back to the room for a rest in the middle of the day, we were driven crazy by the drilling and hammering that was coming through from below, however it was so loud with the walls vibrating we couldn't actually tell exactly wether it was coming from below, beside or above!  After the second day we called down to request a new room away from the

Christmas at Disneyland and California Adventure was our present to ourselves.  We thought to top it off was to stay at the Grand Californian.  What a mistake.  Having stayed many times at the Disneyland Hotel, we were expecting the "very best".  When we go back, it will be to the Disneyland Hotel.

Summary Heading: Not "Grand": 3 stars at best, definitely a rip-off
Summary: We just stayed here, for 4 nights. What a disappointment! We were repeatedly told by acquaintances "you have to stay at the Grand Californian ("GC") if you go to Disneyland ("DL"). Fine, so we splash out almost $600 per night for a peak season ordinary room. Now when I pay $600 a night, I expect the best - Wynn style. Not here. Disney's message: "Hi, I know we have you over a barrel: we are going to take your money and give you a crappy value back."  The (only) Pro: 1. Location, location, location... sort of. The GC has the best location in the whole DL area. Could it be better? Yes, for $600 /night, I expect premier access to DL, not just to the third rate Disney California theme park. In fact for $600 /night, I expect to be teleported anywhere I choose! Other hotels are

Took my husband for his birthday to Disneyland Dec. 14th.  We usually go every year and stay at one of the hotels across the street,  but this year I got an exceptional deal and we stayed at the Disney Grand Hotel. It was amazing.  Check in was extremely fast and well run. Upon telling the girl who checked us in, Billie, that it was my husband's birthday, she excused herself and went to the back. When she returned she had a "birthday button" with his name on it for him to wear, and an autographed picture of Mickey Mouse.  How fun.  Our room was on the 4th floor; 4137 to be exact.  We got two beds, would have preferred one, but they were very, very comfortable, so it was ok.  Very well decorated room, and a balcony with table and chair overlooking downtown Disney.  We found out

You will not find a hotel closer to the Disneyland parks!  Check in was a breeze, didn't take more than 5 minutes and that included getting our park hopper tickets for the parks.  The lobby in this hotel is beautifu and spacious!  If you are a fan of the early 20th century arts and crafts design you will love this lobby!    The room was nicely laid out, we had a standard room with 2 queen beds.  Nothing super special about the furnishings pretty standard.  The beds were very comfortable.  The bathroom was nicely appointed.  I will say the bath amenities were better than expected.  I love when you get an actual full size bar of soap.  The main draw of this hotel is that it is adjacent to the California Adventure park and can enter the park directly from the hotel.  This was super

Summary Heading: Nice Property, Good Location, Poor Service
Summary: We arrived at the Grand Californian at check-in time only to be told that they did not have our room ready.  We sat in the lobby for 4 hours waiting for our room.  Once we were given a room, we discovered that it had only been partially cleaned.  It was missing towels and soap and the previous occupant's clothes were hanging in the closet.    My polite request to remedy these problems resulted in us being visited by a very angry maid who treated my wife with hostility.  Then, for some inexplicable reason, a different maid entered our room without knocking at 9:30 PM after we had all gone to bed.  The hotel is nice but the service seems to reflect Disneyland's overall attitude towards its guests - we were treated like cattle with money.  Our relatives stayed at the Super 8 across

Summary Heading: Don't expect more than a convenient place to sleep
Summary: Possibly the most overpriced hotel I have ever stayed in.  However, it is by far the closest, most convenient hotel and is located practically inside the park  The room itself is VERY small.  We stayed in the brand new wing of the hotel (only 6 weeks old) and yet the style and condition of the room would lead one to believe that it was much older than this.  Furthermore, there were some mistakes with my reservation.  We had reserved a room with a King sized bed and a Parkview, but apparently had been assigned a room with 2 Queens and a Parking Lot view, which is still somehow $425 a night.  We ordered room service at around 9 PM on a Thursday night and we were literally on hold for 30 minutes (watched TV while we waited for call to go through).  When the food finally arrived,

We just returned from a week trip with my family - we traveled with our 8 year old twin boys and also my parents.  We had a 2 bedroom suite at the Grand Californian and the accommodations were wonderful.  There was more than enough room for the 6 of us.  We over looked the pools and Californian Adventure Park.  The room was extremely quiet and beds were comfortable.  We also had conceirge access.  The lounge was great with drinks and food throughout the day.  The boys loved the story time and sing along at night along with the great view of the fireworks from the balcony.  The conceirge was more than willing to accommodate our every request and booked us private transportation to the Queen Mary and Harbor Cruise and were more than willing to print our boarding passes for our

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, Great location, it made all the difference.
Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights the week before Thanksgiving and had a great time.  We have 4 kids so we got connecting rooms which worked out great.  The staff was wonderful, everywhere from check in to check out.  The location was perfect for going to both parks.  It was so nice not having to walk very far or take a tram.   The pool area was also very nice.  I would def. stay here again.  We book about a month before on expedia and got a GREAT rate.

We have always wanted to stay at this hotel because it is connected to the Califoria Adventure park.  We had originally made a reservation for the Disneyland hotel, but switched when I received an e-mail for a significant rate discount for the Grand Californian.  We have stayed at a couple of the Disney deluxe hotels in Florida, so had a general idea what to expect from this hotel.  Our stay was for 5 nights.  The lobby was impressive and welcoming.  Our room was on the third floor, close to the elevator.  Our view was of the main entrance with the Paradise Pier and Disneyland hotels int he background.  There was plenty of room for us to unpack and store our suitcases.  The room was not as clean as I expected upon check in.  The carpet looked like it needed to be vacuumed, and

Summary Heading: I loved it and hope to return someday.
Summary: The hotel is beautiful - it looks like an arts and crafts hotel. We loved the atmosphere and the location right in the Calif. Adventure Park.  My husband could easily return for naps, while I stayed in the parks. It was very quiet and didn't seem as though as many families with small children were staying there, as there are at other hotels Maybe it just has great soundproofing? The meals at the Napa Rose and the Story Teller cafe were very good and we also had a glass of wine in the lounge, which was nice. The Disney touch was subtle, but we still received a photo of Mickey and Minnie when we checked in and told them we were celebrating our anniversary. We didn't use the pool, so I can't comment on that. I would definately stay again, if the same low rate was available.

Not only was this hotel super convienently located, but the subtleness of Mickeys in our room was super cool!  It's wasn't overbearring MICKEY everywhere, just little things that made it so nice.  The beds were awesome.... down comforters...  friendly staff, great room service and super clean.  Everyone loved it, no complaints at all.  The parking wasnt super easy, but the 5 minute walk was definitely worth it.    They did bill me a deposit without letting me know, but they were fast to release the funds once i brought it to their attention.  Napa Rose is located on the bottom floor of this hotel and the food/wine is devine.  Even with being right in front of California Adventure, the sound proof patio doors were extremely effective.

My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights.  We wanted to make the most of our 2 night stay at Disneyland so we decided to stay right next to Disneyland.  The hotel is located right next to Disneyland and California Adventure.  In fact, it literally took us 5 minutes to walk back from California Adventure to our hotel room!  However, it seemed Disney was attempting to milk every single dollar from guests.  We asked for teabags for the room and they asked us to pay for them (normally they're complimentary).  There was also no minibar (even if you wanted to pay for them) and the restaurants were very expensive.  I had a massage at the Mandara Spa but I didn't think it was spectacular (I've had better massages at other Mandara Spas).  The massage was also very expensive.  I don't

This Grand Californian's location can't be beat.  Short walk into the CA adventure park, and maybe 5 minutes walk to Disneyland.  From our room we were able to watch the fireworks each night.  The room was very clean.  We had to call  housekeeping for lotion and kleenex  (which weren't replenished when our room was cleaned).  The products were delivered quickly and we received a phone call to make sure the items had been put in our room.  The food at the hotel isn't anything great, but it's a very short walk to downtown Disney, where there were several places to choose from.

We stayed at the Grand Californian for a Solar Symposium fromMonday, October 26 to Thursday, October 29th, 2009 .  My husband asked me to come accompany him and enjoy the area and spend time with friends we hadn't seen in some time.  As a surprise, our friends also booked into the hotel for 2 nights even though they only live 10 miles away from it.  They love this property that much!   This was one of the resorts recommended by the Symposium.  It turned out to be one of the best  resorts we've ever stayed in.  The customer service from the moment we got off our motorcycle to the moment we left the property was top notch.  Always a friendly "welcome back"  whenever we returned back to the hotel during our stay.  We stayed on the 6th floor which was the concierge level although we

Stayed 5 nights bec  of the promotion buy 3 nights, stay 5 nights.   Pros: As stated before, location is the BEST feature. Our room had a view of downtown disney and fireworks every night. It was really convenient to exit hotel thru side fire exit bec it minimized a lot of walking. Size was ok. We had room service several times and food was ok. Service is exemplary. I had no problems at all. Everyone was very helpful.  Cons For the price, I expected a bit more.  HK Disneyland Hotel and Hollwood Hotel have nicer rooms and toiletries. The room is ok. I think they should renovate soon because it's starting to show age. My daughter and mom are asthmatic. It was ok for awhile, but it didn't seem be very clean. I checked under the beds and there was a plastic wrapper left by previous

Summary Heading: Great location. Little Pricy.  Christmas wasn't up to Par.
Summary: I've stayed at the Grand Californian 3 times.  My first two visits were wonderful. However, my last trip I had booked a totally of 3 rooms for 4 nights.  All three of our rooms were suppose to be "Theme park views"  none were. Instead they placed us over the pool with a great view of the construction and noise.  Normally I am a huge fan of the hotel, but this stay was not up to par.  After realizing the errors in room locations, we promptly went to talk to the front desk.  Basically we were told, "Sorry". This wasn't acceptable to me or my husband, seeing as the only reason we chose to pay the higher price for this hotel was the park views.  My husband talked with management and our rooms were eventually moved later in the trip. None of the rooms conveniently located next to

Check in was quick as we arrived in the early afternoon on a weekday.  The cast member offered us a room that was ready for us in the new wing.  As I was celebrating a birthday she  gave us trio of ballons tied to look like Micky, a signed 8 x 10 photo of Minnie and a button to wear.  Don't forget to wear your button as it will get you a sweet after your meals, even at breakfast.  The room overlooked the pool and California with a nice balcony to hang out on.  The room was clean and well decorated. It is a split bath with the sinks and vanity outside of the shower/toilet room.  Housekeeping was spotty. No turn down chocolates one evening and no shampoo bottles replaced one morning.  Be aware the new wing is a walk to get to.  It takes several minutes to get to the lobby,

What a beautiful and serene hotel with unbeatable location so close to the parks.  It's difficult to stay anywhere else once you've stayed here.  We checked out hotels surrounding Disneyland for our next trip but couldn't imagine staying anywhere else.  Beds were very comfy with down comforters and pillows and nice linens.  Rooms are not large but have a mini fridge and coffeemaker.  We will be back!

We just returned from a four night stay at the Grand Californian.  The hotel exceeded our expectations.  Yes, it is expensive, but the attention to detail is amazing - from the light fixtures to the comfortable beds.  We had a fourth floor room overlooking the pool (4350) with a queen bed and bunk beds.  The resort is remarkably soundproof. The Storytellers cafe has good food and better service than I was expecting.  The pools are lovely, the staff very accommodating.  The location couldn't be better.  It is the closest hotel to both Disneyland and California Adventure.   This hotel is worth the extra $$, especially when travelling with young children. It's great to come back to the hotel for breaks from the theme parks and have a dip in the pool.  We will return to the Grand

Summary Heading: Great hotel with a few service hiccups
Summary: Five night stay at the GCH.  This was our third stay in the Grand, we've previously stayed in a Suite and once on the Concierge level. Based on the expensive and relatively little return for Concierge we went with a standard Downtown Disney view room this time.  Upon arriving the gentleman at the front desk told us he could get us a room with an "even better view" than we had reserved so of course we thanked him and took the room.  It turned out to be room with a pool view located on an inside corner, it was very dark and claustrophobic with a view of the room next door more than anything else.  We contacted the front desk within 10 minutes and after some convincing received the room we had originally reserved with the downtown view, which we love (the music doesn't bother us as

Summary Heading: Excellent Service and Support in trying time
Summary: For our latest trip to Disneyland we chose to stay at Disney's Grand Californian. This was our second time staying at this hotel. The hotel service was phenomenal! We arrived on a Friday and were immediately greeted at the check-in desk by a very friendly cast member. We were provided a room in the newly built wing (which we requested) and our "Celebration events" - my birthday and Canadian Thanksgiving were noted and recognized by the cast member. Probably the best check-in experience I have ever had. My friend and I took advantage of the early morning, pre-opening walk the hotel offers through DCA - this was a neat treat and a fun way to get a walk in during the vacation. The vacation was off to a great start! Unfortunately, by the end of the second day my 6y old son came down

This hotel was amazing. We stayred in one of the villas. They were beautiful and had a completely stocked kitchen and washer and dryer. The pool was nice and not to crowded. The kids had so much fun on the waterslide. It was amazing that a hotel was so quiet and relaxing at Disneyland. Ususally you have bunch of kids running around but this hotel wasn't that way. There were also fireplaces inside and outside to sit around. We were able to watch the fireworks from our room in our pajammas and then put the kids to bed at a decent time. It was a great stay.

Summary Heading: If you want to be close to Disneyland this is the place.
Summary: This was our second stay at the Grand Californian Hotel.  We took advantage of their latest promotion and we paid $259 a night for a Downtown Disney view.  The hotel is very large and reminds me of staying on one of the large Las Vegas hotels.  The rooms are nice, but you could find a much nicer room in Anaheim for less money.  When you stay here you pay a premium for staying very close to the park.    We like staying here with our young kids because it is a very short walk to the park and it is really easy to go back and forth from hotel to the park during the day.   Our kids also enjoyed some of the activities in the lobby, including the storytelling time.  The character breakfast at the Storyteller's cafe is expensive, though fun for the kids.  One comment about the Downtown

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel, expensive but worth it.
Summary: Normaly my son, husband and I stay at a Suite Hotel or the Paradise Pier when going to Disneyland.  However, celebrating our 3 year old only child about to become a big brother, me being 8 months pregnant and wanting to enjoy the Halloween decor was a reason to stay at the Grand Californian for the first time.  From the moment we drove up to check in, we knew it was worth the expense.  The hotel is obviously very grand and amazing, we walked in going wow, we actually get to stay here.  Every cast member who helped us, from the valet person to the check in lady, so very nice.  Our son, who had walked through the hotel before, was SO excited once he realized we were here to stay.  We got up to our room and it was exactly like the pictures we've seen - craftsman style, very clean,

Summary Heading: Best atmosphere! Clean rooms! Fun Place to be!
Summary: The room was clean and comfortable - the woodsy colors were a nice choice and feel comfortable. The bed was great and I am super picky about beds! I love the pool as did the kids - heated so you don't feel chilled at night. The lobby is a great place to hand out at the fireplace, or listen to the piano player when they are playing. I love being able to go on a wet ride and come in the private entrance to change and go back to the parks. Overall a great hotel and we look forward to coming again!

Our famiy of 4 stayed here last December in a room with bunk beds and a queen bed.  We had a view of the pool area.   Everything was fantasic - except for the fact that I thought it was outrageously expensive.  Prior to Disneyland, we stayed at the St. Regis Monarch Beach (a five star hotel) - I paid the same price for ONE room at the Grand Californian as TWO connecting rooms at the St. Regis.    Once I got over the price, the dingy bedspreads, the low light in the rooms, the carpeted bathroom and scratchy sheets, we really enjoyed the property.  My kids loved the pool, the story time and the breakfast buffet.  The proximity to the parks can't be beat.  My kids were 3.5 and 4.5 and they walked everywhere - no strollers necessary - it's THAT close!

Summary Heading: Great Place to stay with young children
Summary: I have 2yr and 4yr old girls - and staying at the Grand Californian was great. Not only could we walk back to our hotel from the parks for their nap time, but my wife and I enjoyed relaxing time in the room while they napped each day. Our room overlooked Downtown Disney which was great, but it could get a little noisy at night. The staff was very friendly and always had stickers for my kids. I would definitely recommend this hotel to families who's kids still need to take a nap.

Summary Heading: Paying for the location, but hotel is nice too
Summary: If you can get a good discounted rate for this hotel then definitely stay here when visiting Disneyland. It is by far the best of the Disneyland resort hotels in terms of location and is lovely inside as well. We had a few minor issues - even though the hotel has a pack n play in every room, there do not have any pack n play sheets for guests to use. If you ask for a sheet, they bring a bassinet sheet that is several inches too small. If you're going to use the in-room pack n play, bring your own sheets. Also, we were pleased to see that the bunk bed in  our room had a trundle for our 4-year old to sleep on because there were no guardrails on the lower mattress of the bed. We were told that housekeeping was ordering bed guard rails though, so hopefully that's not a problem in

We checked into the GC first thing in the a.m. in order to get into DL for the "magic morning hours".  This is a great feature of staying at the hotel.  You get into DL one hour before the gates open.  We got a nice room with a view of the new pool.  Did not have the view of the ferris wheel, which I do prefer.  Service at the hotel was friendly.  The rooms are nice, nothing exceptional but very comfortable for coming in and out after being in the parks during the day.  Surprisingly very quiet at night in the rooms.  Enjoyed dinner in Downtown Disney.  Love the location of the hotel, very convenient access to DD and GC theme park.  Have stayed twice in the past 2 months and am looking forward to going back in November.  My 2 year old loves the movie in the lobby and enjoyed the

Everything was awesome, anytime we had a question, it was answered directly, we had a downtown Disney view and we were right above "world of Disney" store. I was stoked we got to stay here for paying 3 nights and 2 nights free. It helped our budget. I loved the view, I loved the fireworks from our room view. I especially loved my Pina colava drinks. Very tasty. The pool was nice, though for the crowd, you really can't let that get to you.  You're there, enjoy it. It was all for pleasure time, we were on vacation away from the real world hehe Very nice hotel, I will be coming back to it as soon as I can ;-)

Traveled with young child and great-grandmother in wheelchair.  Asked for adjoining rooms with one room needing a roll-in shower.  Not only was this provided but also placed in rooms with pool and California Adventure views.  Ambrose was wonderful with check-in.  Balloons, buttons, signed pictures, and a big plate of cookies and milk (compliments of Mickey and gang) were delivered to our room....made the great-grandmother tear-up and our young son giggle with delight.  Our thanks to Rosa in housekeeping for her attentive attention.  We thank everyone for making our great-grandmother's first trip to Disneyland a wonderful memory we have to cherish.  TIPS:  Blue Bayou a must (surf/turf).  Halloween Fireworks cannot be missed.

My wife and I traveled with our two girls (3yr old & 14 yr old). We stayed at the Grand Californian Hotel for 6 days. My first thought was; 6 days? That's a long time for Disneyland. We absolutely love the hotel, I didn‚Äôt want to leave. We stayed on the west wing of the hotel (room 3454), we had a theme park view with the Grizzly Mountain view right from our balcony. Log Cabin style hotel, the room was spacious. We have a GrandBed by Temperpedic (bed & pillows). The bed was so comfortable and the pillows; my wife kept saying ‚ÄúI love this pillows‚Äù I don‚Äôt know why but they feel better than my Temperpedic pillows‚Äù. Lol Our little one love the turn down service with Chocolate.     A World of Convenience: There was a stair way right next to our room that would take you right down to

We love the Gand Californian Hotel we have stayed here on three occasions.  The convenience of staying right next to the Disney parks is a big plus.  The lobby and bar are great places to grab a few quiet moments away from the parks.  We got to stay in a brand new room, in the new wing, over looking the new pool.  You could even watch some of the Disneyland fireworks from our balcony.  We would go less often or stay less days if we had to just to stay here.  Great employees the front desk staff, bellmen, housekeeping and waitresses in the bar kept us very happy during our stay.  After three stays no complaints here.  They even have a child care center if mom and dad want to have a quiet dinner by themselves.  O.K. one small complaint the pilows are over stuffed no way to get

Summary Heading: loved the grand,cant wait to go back
Summary: beautiful arts and crafts style hotel,very comfy beds(didnt want to get up) and the best pillows ever!( i even brought my own but for the first time didnt use them!) housekeeping was very nice with a turn down service(complete with chocolates) staff was extremely polite and very helpful-always service with a smile. the in house resturants were a bit pricey but the food was very good. if you have special dietary needs(vegan etc)  and you give them notice they can get tofu or whatever you like.the chef is more than willing to prepare an off menu item for you( he even comes to your table to talk to you personally). easy access to parks.in room thermastats so if your hot you can crank down the air.coffee maker and fridge in room. large flat screen tv(though i thought it could of

Summary Heading: great place to stay, avoid the inhouse restaurants
Summary: great place to stay with good accommodation and convenient location. service levels were great across the hotel except the inhouse dining was terribble with bad food.

Summary Heading: Terrific hotel - but at a price
Summary: The hotel was very good - much better than many reviews had suggested - but it comes at a high price.  We booked via DVC, had a standard room (front of hotel carpark view).  It was a large room with good amenities, clean and in good condition.  Access to Disney is unbeatable - very close and easy to get to.  As a first timer I would have liked a bit more assistance in planning my time - we only had 2 days, had not been abot to conduct much research and wanted to maximise our time.  Guest services were unavailable on a couple of occasions when I tried in the lobby. Theme breakfast with Chip n Dale is expensive (but no more so than in a 5 star hotel anywhere in the world - I think we paid about $70 for 2 Ad, 1 Ch).  My sone ate nothiing but was very excited at seeing the

We are a family of 4 from Ireland and spent 5 nights here at the beginning of August. It was our first stay here as Disney had a great special that made it justifiable instead of the cheaper hotels across the street.  The hotel was nothing short of fantastic! But, while I understand it is a resort, I feel it's about 20% overpriced. The extra mile the staff go kind of justifies the extra costs.  Disney class a child age 9 or older as an adult which means you have to pay adult meal prices for your children over 9. This is wrong! As such, we did not have a single meal at the hotel. We ate in Downtown Disney or across the street at IHOP and Denny's.   The rooms are nice but a bit small. The room safe has got to be the smallest sized safe in the entire world! It was too small for my

Summary Heading: Great Stay, lovely hotel, poor housekeeping
Summary: Stayed 5 nights in September 2009 and had a fantastic trip. I was traveling with my 2 adult sisters, and we got a great annual passholder rate on the room. We had a Downtown Disney view room (more of a 'trees and tram' view, but still nice).  This may have been the most relaxing Disney vacation I have ever had. There were some problems with housekeeping here, but overall I would still recommend the hotel, due to the location, the pools, and the wonderful atmosphere.   Pros:  =Location! It was wonderful to be able to "live" in downtown Disney. Easy walk back to the room for time at the pool during the heat of the day, plenty of restaurants and bars nearby. The hotel has a private entrance into CA Adventure park which meant that after a long day we were never more than a short

Summary Heading: Grand Californian -- better than I expected
Summary: I was a little hesitant about leaving the "safety" of the Disneyland Hotel to stay at the Grand Californian, especially after reading some reviews.  My worries were unwarranted because the hotel was beautiful, clean and so convenient, especially for someone like me who has mobility issues.   We arrived around 1:30pm and much to my amazement, our room was ready. I had gotten a convention rate for this hotel, so I didn't expect any type of view. We were given a room on the second floor, which she said was a standard view, but it was facing the pool. Not bad at all considering we don't spend much time in the room.   I've heard complaints that the rooms were dark and small, I didn't find it so. We had a king bed, a couch with coffee table, armoire with a flat panel TV, small

Summary Heading: Not So Happy @ the Happiest Place on earth
Summary: The Mr's company holds an annual conference here, and this is our third year attending (I believe I reviewed this after our stay last year and rated the stay average). I downgraded the rating from 3 star to 2 star.   Check in took forever. No line what-so-ever, the reps who were helping us and our colleague who happened to arrived at the same time as us were just slow.   They didn't have any King room left when we checked in even though we checked in early, so we were assigned the two queens. No complaints there since a few of our colleagues ended up with rooms with bunk beds. The beds themselves were NOT comfortable at all. I alternated between the two beds during our three nights stay. They were both way too soft. The pillows were small, really small *see pic* for reference. I

My fiance and I stayed at the Grand Californian Hotel as part of the Haunted Mansion 40th Anniversary Event package.  It consisted of two nights in room 4005, overlooking the front entrance, Disneyland Drive, and the Disneyland Hotel beyond.  Though this particular room is meant for a family - it includes a queen bed and two bunk beds - it is quiet, without the noise coming from Downtown Disney or the constant hum of the generators from the Indiana Jones ride in Disneyland, and its balcony is situated in such a way that neighbors can't look down or across at you, offering a private, comfortable spot to stay in.    We checked into the hotel at 1:00 pm, and our room was ready at 1:45.  We did not have to return to the front desk, as we were already given our room keys at check-in,

Summary Heading: Great location, great service, great weather, but it was US that made OUR vacation, and it turned out to be FUN for ALL!
Summary: We arrived on August the 30th at 2:00 pm,our poolview/ parkview room was not ready. Registration gave us room cards and we were told to check back between 3:00 and 4:00. The boys went to the park and we went to the lounge.This was after Bell Services took our bags to store them until then.                                                                                                                                                                  It was after 4:30 when our room was finally ready so much for the 3:00 check in. The lounge took some of the sting away, we guess.  When we finally viewed our room (4414) it had a view of 2 big trees, the monorail, the top of Tower of Terror and between the trees you could kind of see a little of the Grizzly River Run. Oh yeh and also

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay at Disneyland. Expensive but Worth it for a Treat
Summary: It is location, location, location.  Absolutely less expensive hotels to stay that are convenient.  But we love the fast access to both parks.  I don't consider the hotel "dark", it is the decor chosen.  Some like it, some don't.  While my first time at DL, I have stayed many times at DW, and I think the GC experience in terms of value is comparable the the Yacht Club/Beach Club - but certainly with easier park access.  Rooms seem more "adult size" for me though, and might be tight with kids.  For two adults, just fine.  I know many rooms have bunks.  As for views ... we chese a Grizzly River Run View".  Many of the pictures people have posted though may have been taken before the trees got tall.  We are on the 4th floor, and while we can hear the sounds from the park, you

We made a quick trip to Anaheim and stayed at the Grand Californian hotel.  We had visited the impressive lobby many times, but had not actually stayed there.  This time we joined a long line to check in, and were given a bunk bed room a long way from the main lobby.  The check in clerk showed us that we were actually closer to another entrance, and pointed us to an outside entrance and elevator bank that would be much closer to our room.  We were grateful for that as it was really a long way from the lobby.    Our standard room was not super small, it‚Äôs 350 sq feet, but the dark wood and dark colours used in decorating make it seem smaller.  There was a tiny balcony that overlooked Grizzly River Run.    It has an enviable location that butts right against California Adventure

Stayed there for 3 nights in a room with 2 queen beds. I think it's pretty simple: For the money (and it's allota) you get the best location but not much more. Direct access to Downtown Disney and the parks is the only asset of the hotel. The rest you can forget. Its a surprisingly dark hotel (hey - where is the happiness!) with 20 year old room standards and a pool area which makes a rather filthy impression. Staff is friendly and when they charged us with room service expenses we haven't ordered they called immediately back and apologized for their mistake. We never went to one of the restaurants but rather went to downtown Disney where we can recommend the Italian restaurant for its great pizzas and pasta! Free parking close to the hotel was positive and that you could get

We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights & 4 days and truly enjoyed it.  We had 2 young children with us along with some family members so we occupied a total of 3 rooms.    Check In : was quick and efficient.  I asked for 2 downtown Disney view rooms to be connected and we got just that.  The lady that helped us was wonderful, I wish I got her name.  Although our room wasn't ready yet (it was about 1:30pm and check in's at 3pm), she gave us cards with a number to call to see when it's ready.    Room : was a bit on the small side but functional.  We had a nice view of Downtown Disney (literally above the World of Disney store) and parts of the park (Space Mountain and the Main Street train station).  Nothing was wrong with our room.  It was clean when we got in and everything

Our 3 children didn't care about the bunk beds and trundle bed but we parents were very unhappy with the small size of the room. The queen bed seemed small and was pushed next to the drapes -- no nightstand on that side. There was no chair or couch - just a small table with 2 chairs. Hook up for only one computer - which then monopolized that table. A small fridge, no freezer, 4 very small desk sized drawers for the whole families clothes. An open bathroom (toilet and bath behind a sliding door) so that the light, hair dryer, etc. woke everyone up in the morning when used. Yes, the proximity to Great Adventure is nice but the hotel is SO huge that no matter where we went, it was a trek to get there. I loved the vast retro lobby and had long wanted to stay in the hotel because of

Stayed 2 nights, and wish we had saved our money and stayed elsewhere. Nothing was terrible, it was just extremely overpriced for what seemed to be a standard motel room with a fancy lobby.  The location of course can't be beat, and we had a great view of the park from the room, but in hindsight (which is always 20/20), we could have stayed slightly further away and paid 1/4 price for the same type of room and been just as comfortable. This was a major splurge for us and in the end, it just wasn't worth it.

I will begin by saying that I am a DVC member and did not pay actual money for my rooms-until the vacation club rooms open in September, point values are very high for standard rooms.  We used many points for 2 adjoining rooms for 4 people.  The rooms were adequately sized with a view of Downtown Disney.  I have to agree with the recent reviewer that the noise from the live music reverberated through our rooms (on the 4th floor).  The fireworks display from the rooms were nice. The location from the hotel to the California Adventure park was great-especially being drenched by Grizzly River Rapids-we were able to go back up to change.  The room however was a great distance from the elevators (with my son who is in a wheelchair) and  also an inconvenience if you are a smoker

well...I dont get how anybody could possibly complain about this hotel, you would have to be very very nit picky! really...just somebody looking for something to complain about. we had the very best Anniversary ever. they upgraded our room without me having to ask to a very nice room with a great view of the park (at no extra cost), we could see the Fireworks from Disnyland from our balcony, we were treated like royalty because it was our 10th Anniversary and when we went to dinner we came back to a bed that was covered in rose pedals and some other treats....all as a surprise and at no cost to us. the staff was very helpful. I could go on and on but I wont. I just think you would have to be somewhat of a spoiled brat not to let yourself enjoy your stay at this hotel. there is

Summary Heading: Wonderful location, but very small rooms.
Summary: Tiny, below average room size & unfortunately guest rooms are not really clean.  Beds were nothing special, but the bedspreads in our room were updated since our last visit, (as was the TV to a modern flat-screen).  Pillows are a strange, uncomfortable small size.  Bathroom was residential sub-par, with one sink & a Disney-themed moldy shower curtain over the tub.  Dark rooms--not enough lighting fixtures.  Many, many of their rooms are a very long hike from the elevators.   Without upgrading to the Club/Concierge Level our family with 2 full grown teenagers would have gone nuts in such a small room with 2 queen beds.  We loved escaping to The Craftman's Club when other family members were napping, showering, etc.  The downside--we paid big $ for Club Level, even with a

I arrived Saturday, August 8th and left on August 13th.  We got the 5 nights with 6 day hopper passes for about $2129.  That is the only reason we are staying here. We would not pay the normal $500 or so a night they normally charge plus the cost of park tickets.  I will attempt to only review the hotel and not Disneyland.  When I arrived at 1:30 pm on Saturday, I was annoyed that my room wasn't ready. I have never had a hotel tell me that I actually had to wait until the 3 pm check in time to get my room.   I ended up getting in at 2:46 pm.  The room is your most basic rectangle with two queen beds, decently up to date furnishings and comfortable beds.  There is a small refrigerator and a small wall safe that is a few inches deep. The safe held my 15 inch laptop if I angle it

This hotel is WONDERFUL, and highly recommended.  Classy, clean, service oriented, gorgeous and Disney ALL THE WAY!!  This hotel is attached to Calfornia Adventure and offers quick access to downtown Disney as well.  The rooms are not large, and the price can be very steep (there is also a parking fee...) but the location with kids cannot be beat!  Kids LOVE this hotel.  There are great pools, great restaurants and very comfortable beds and of course, Disneyland and California Adventure at your doorstep.  In standard Disney syle, the staff are eager to please and willing to do almost anything to make your stay perfect.  A must try!

Summary Heading: The Downtown Disney view is noisy with bad LIVE music.
Summary: We paid extra for a Downtown Disney view, which was great for people watching and fireworks viewing.  We expected extra noise with the high foot traffic and piped-in music, but each day, all day, live musicians were camped out below our balcony--a violinist, a pianist, and for God's sake a DRUMMER, all amplified.  A closed door almost completely silenced the normal crowd sounds, but not the live stuff.  We loved the convenience of an afternoon nap break each day, but the live music was dreadful.  I wouldn't recommend this entire hotel based on the fact that Disney is thoughtless enough to station these guys right below the hotel rooms when they could be moved down the mall.

Summary Heading: Disgusting and Dirty - Bring Your Own Cleaning Supplies and Housekeeper!
Summary: I am writing this review while I am still here because I am so disgusted.   My children and I stay here about two times per year and we have had pleasant to average experiences each time. We have stayed in the largest suite at times (Acadia Suite), two bedroom suites and one bedroom suites. (I have three children under 5.) However, this time is dreadful!! We are so upset by our experience that we are considering driving home to L.A., but we know our son may be upset because it is his birthday.  To get to the point, we checked into our suite and it was not cleaned at all. There was hair in the shower and shaving creme mixed with hairs smeared on the shower walls. Old towels had been folded to look "clean" and hung back up. The old soap was still in the soap dish. Totally

Summary Heading: LOVED THIS HOTEL WORTH THE COST
Summary: We have 3 children aged 9, 5, and 2. We found that the location was worth the extra money due to our little son needing a day time nap. The staff were happy and helpful they even up graded our room to a down town disney view for free!!! Yes it is a little noisey but once you shut the door to the patio you could hardly hear it. Worth it to see the fire works at night from our room. Kids in their pj and ready for bed. I would love to stay here again! We stayed for seven nights and could have stayed for another seven we had such a good time.

We recently returned from a really fun 4 nights at the Grand Californian.  We celebrated my daughter's 10th Birthday while we were there, and the Disney folks really made it a wonderful and really special occasion.  We paid extra to have one of the birthday packages in the room when we arrived, and our daugher was so surprised and excited to find the balloons, signs, autographed photos, stuffed Mickey and gift from Mickey, personalized birthday "ears", etc... Totally worth the cost to add this!  As other reviews have mentioned, the Grand is really all about location.  Its a 5 minute walk through Downtown Disney to the front gate, and the handy back-door entrance to the California Adventure park is great.  Really nice to be close enough to come back and swim and relax in the

We arrived at the GCH early, 10:30am to pre-register, check our bags and get straight the CA Adventure to explore Disney's Food and Wine Festival. Upon arrival we were told that the room type that we requested was not available. I know, room types are not guaranteed. I expressed my disappointment but wasn't about to let it ruin my anniversary weekend. After the 90 minute drive I found it necessary to excuse myself to go to the restroom and left my hubby to finish the check in process. When I returned he told me that they had upgraded us to a suite. The room was WAY down the end of a very long hallway. I didn't mind, as it was very quiet in that location. The room was beautiful. It overlooked the courtyard and Downtown Disney. Our suite had a large 'L' shaped balcony. The room

Summary Heading: A lot of money for what you get.
Summary: I booked a 5 night 6 day trip through Costco Travel with food tickets ($3000 without travel).  We arrived to be told that our reservation was canceled due to insufficient funds despite having paid cash for the whole vacation.  Turns out, Costco screwed up the original reservation and  rather than delete it, voided it due to insufficient funds.  The clerk found our paid reservation but said that the bunk beds we requested were not in the computer and were already taken. We later found out that Triple A can beat Costco.   We paid extra to have a park view but it was obscured by trees.  The clerk only offered a "I'm sorry" for this but nothing else.  The Story Teller's restaurant has excellent food but expect to pay $100 for two adults, a child and an infant even for breakfast. The

This Hotel wa great. It was close to everything in the Resort. If it wasn't within walking distance the Resort provided free shuttles every 15 minutes to the parks and shopping. The service was great anything we needed we got it right away. The pool is great for children. Adults might find it loud on high travell times like early and late summer and spring break.

The Grand Californian has some similarities to the Grand Floridian. They are the top hotels at their respective parks. Service at the Grand Californian is superior to that of the Grand Floridian but this does not mean that service is excellent. Actually it is probably fair to say that service is not excellent anywhere at Disney, they try but in a very awkward, very particular Disney fashion that is far too phony. But this is a review of the GC and not of Disney so: rooms are small, a bit dark but well kept, good cable selection but no plasma TVs. Housekeeping does a fair job. Good restaurants in the property. By far the best feature is the very easy access to Disneyland which is really within walking distance and direct access to California Adventure and Downtown through a

After having this be our 5th time staying at The Grand Californian, we were some what disappointed.  We had booked this trip to have fun before our son's surgery on his feet and had purposely requested a room with two queen beds and a day bed.  When we were checking in we were given a room with a queen bed and two bunk beds, my son is 14 and about 5'5".  When I inquired about making an adjustment, there was really no interest in all with helping.  We decided to make the best of it.  Next we get to the room and the light that is above the bottom bunk bed has a bottle of water in it and the light bulb broken, I do not find this too safe.  We had to have the maintenance crew come to fix this.    Previous stays the employees were helpful, happy and made you feel like they really

Having stayed at various disney properties in both Orlando and Paris, the most noticeable fact in Anaheim was a lack of disney magic. The majority of the staff seemed downright miserable and whilst there was some 'theming' to the property, they still seemed to miss a lot of tricks. Often there was no music at all in the lobby, just a huge void with the noise of people checking in or talking - very odd. Construction around the pool was also off-putting and they were refurbishing the main entrance for a couple of days meaning an extended trek through the conference centre to get to the car.  Also, expect to be 'nickled & dimed' like you cannot believe. A can of beer from the hotel shop was $5.50 plus tax (about the same price as a 6-pack in a local 7-11). Single serving of

Disney's premier resort in California offers something that none of the other hotels in the area can - excellent location and a private entrance in to California Adventure.  Nothing is better than leaving your room and being in line for a ride in less than 10 minutes.  Of course, this convenience comes at a steep price.  The exterior architecture and public spaces of this hotel are amazing.  You really get the feel of being in a turn of the century arts and crafts resort.  Unfortunately, I found the rooms to be on the small side and nothing overly impressive.  Yes, the arts and crafts style was carried over in to the rooms, but it felt like an overlay masking the generic hotel room that it was.  But let's be honest, you're not paying for the room, you're paying for the

We have wanted to stay at this property for so long, and we finally got our wish. We stayed for 3 nights and were lucky enough to get the exact room we wanted. We payed for the theme park view room, but we requested a Grizzy River Run view. At first it didn't look like we would get that exact view, but with a little luck and a great check in person we did. We had the view and the bunk beds the kids wanted. We love everything about this hotel. We listened to Tim at night play guitar and sing at the beautiful fireplace. The pool areas are great the lounge chairs are wonderful. Whitewater snacks has great food and the prices are reasonable. We had dinner at Storytellers which is always good. Our maid service was well done. The kids love how they turn down the beds and leave the

we have now returned from a two week stay at the grand californian. we arrived after a 12 hour flight and checked in very quickly. my mum and brother were in a wheelchair accessible room over looking downtown disney which they were happy with. we had booked a park/pool view room at extra cost and had and awful view on the second floor over looking the monorail track we couldn't even see the park through the trees and the pool was on the other side of the hotel. i complained the next morning and they moved us to the 5th floor a better room but two days later..!!! they did however give us free valet parking as my mums blue disabled badge is not valid in the usa, but lets talk about the valet service.. they charge you $17 a day for the service the car is parked in the normal car

The DGC Hotel is a nice place to stay.  One can't beat the location as you're literally at the doorstep to both parks.  The staff was friendly.  The rooms were nice, we had a room with a double bed and bunk bed for the kids.  Our room overlooked the porto cochere toward the other Disney properties.  We were happy with our location.  I must agree with other TA members about the noise factor from Downtown Disney.  We would have been disappointed had we had to put up with the noise from DD.  Housekeeping service was good. We enjoyed swimming at the pool and used the kid's slide and big slide.  Price wise, the GC hotel is Disneyland's upscale property.  You pay a pretty penny however you can't beat the location from the park entrances ~ No hassles of parking the car and driving to

We were in the room when we got a 5.0 earthquake!  Gladly, the hotel was fine and we felt assured this would be one of the better places to be in this situation (a little rolling feeling, swaying, a bit scary but no damage)  We had a great time at the hotel overall.  My only complaint is that the lobby and public areas were freezing!  They must keep it under 60 degrees, and it was too uncomfortable to enjoy it for long.  The rooms were comfortable, all with DVD players (free DVDs can be borrowed from the concierge), coffee makers and balconies.  My 3 year old just loved to watch the monorail come by the hotel every 5-10 minutes, but luckily you could only hear it from the balcony.  Location did make it fairly easy to come back and forth.  We went early to the parks each day and

Summary Heading: Fabulous property, but worth the price?
Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights in May 2009 with our 2 kids (ages 4 and 9).  We had a room with a queen and bunkbeds which worked out well - no privacy for the parents but honestly, by the time we did Disney parks all day, swimming, dinner, and got back to our room around 10pm each night, we were so exhausted that we all happily fell asleep as soon as our heads hit the pillows.  The swimming pool and waterslides were really great - my son says he went down the big waterslide 131 times in 3 days!  I liked that they will deliver drinks to you poolside.   Water pressure in the shower was very strong, and we never heard a peep from neighboring rooms.  Despite surely being full of families with young kids, the hotel doesn't seem noisy. The hotel itself was lovely (I loved the tiny size

Summary Heading: Loved this hotel and its location
Summary: We stayed at the Grand Californian Hotel at the end of April and early May. Both times were great. We flew in from Australia and stayed here 3 nights then went to Las Vegas then came back to the Grand Californian for a few more days. The location to Disneyland is one of the best parts of this hotel. The parks  require lots of walking and to go back to your room for a quick swim or drop things off or get warm clothes for night-time was very handy. The price was high but I really wanted to stay here so I planned it into the budget and it was a very nice stay. The character breakfasts were fun and the kids really liked these. While staying here you get to go to all the magic mornings that are offered during your stay at Disneyland which was also really good.

This hotel is great for kids, the pool and the slide's great and it's right next to disney land. the buffet is great, all the disney characters are there and go around and get photos with the kids, it's just completely kid friendly.  We've stayed there a couple times, and never have burned out on it. If you're going to disney land, there are some other close hotels, but this is the closest, so defenitly stay there.  For things to do after a long day at the park, definetly go into disney town. They have great resuraunts, awsome stores, and is also kid freindly.  If you are going with out kids, i probobly wouldn't go, the pool was pretty chaotic, yet that ment that there were lots of kids, and our kids met lots of friends.

Simply put -- stay here because it will make your trip to Disneyland easier.  It's very nice to hit the park early in the morning, come back to the hotel when crowds hit their peak in the afternoon, and then re-enter the park at night.  The hotel also hosts fun activities for kids.  I would also suggest looking into the concierge level -- I can't remember what we paid for it, but it seemed worth it to get free drinks/snacks/etc. throughout the day.

We stayed 3 nights at the Disney Grand Californian Hotel. I knew prior to booking this hotel that the rooms were not of a high quality, considering the high price of the rooms. The rooms are very adequate, clean, not too small but the bathroom,while clean, is showing its age. The hotel is located inside Disney Californian Adventure park and has direct access to the park, Downtown Disney and just a short walk to Disneyland. We were lucky enough to have a room facing into the park which was great. All staff at this hotel are very friendly and professional. Check in staff were by far the most friendly and helpful of any hotel I have ever stayed at.  The lobby is huge and amazing, the pool area is great for kids with a water slide etc. I would have no problem recommending this hotel

Here's the reality of Disney accommodations:  you pay for proximity and, to some extent, amenities.  All Disney rooms are the same, essentially--in layout and space--but in "Deluxe Resorts" you'll have more elaborate theming, more elaborate room service and more on-site activities (i.e. fantasy pools, movies at night, fancier restaurant options).   The closer you are to the park entrances, the more you pay.  Disney is a family entertainment company, not a luxury travel company so, if you are accustomed to paying for white-glove service, you need to book outside the resorts at a Four Seasons or Ritz property.  The Deluxe Resorts are VERY expensive...but they don't pretend to be AmanResorts.    The Grand Californian is faux-Craftsman "gorgeous", and it's fun to watch the parades

Just got back from our third stay at the Grand Californian at Disneyland. On previous trips, the kids have enjoyed the rooms with a queen and a bunk bed with a trundle. So as usual I requested that room again. This time though, I forgot to take into account that my kids are getting bigger (a boy 13 and a girl 11). Last year they fit fine in the bunk beds. It made for a great night's sleep and everyone was happy. This year, my son's feet (he's about 5'6") were hanging off the edge of the bed (see photo). The first night he tossed and turned and kept us all up with a plastic rustling sound that must have been from a waterproof mattress cover. Only in the morning did he admit that he was too long for the top bunk. We could only get him to fit if he put his head at the top of the

Summary Heading: Location, lobby, park entrance and pools are the key
Summary: We have stayed here a number of times since this hotel opened. I think the best time of year to stay here is during the winter, ideally the holidays, when a gigantic Christmas tree stands in the lobby center, Santa drops by every evening, and Christmas carolers stroll in from time to time.  The closeness to the parks make the chilly winter nights and the huge fireplace more appreciated.  During our three night stay beginning Easter 2009 we got a rate of $309 a night and our view was facing the Disneyland hotel.  Not a bad rate for this hotel.  I have never done a Concierge room here as for my family, I don't believe it is a good value.  The hotel has a relatively inexpensive (for Disney) snack area where you can purchase meals, snacks and drinks.  The hotels entrance into

The hotel was very nice. The rooms were way over priced and small the beds were comfortable and the pillows were kinda hard. The bathroom was nice and there was plenty of shampoo and soap. The turn down service was nice and the chocolates were a plus. The lobby was large and comfortable and the hotel employees were very nice. The gift shop like the rooms was way over priced. The restaurants were good the storyteller cafe had a character breakfast and the Napa rose provides a good atmosphere for a nice dinner and the Whitewater snacks was nice due to how close it was to the pool good for a grab and go meal. The pools were very nice and good size one has a tree slide for kids. Something i was surprised i didnt find at this hotel was game room since its a disney property there was

Summary Heading: The VERY best option - if you can pay for it.
Summary: We love this hotel and have stayed on each of our trips to Disneyland in the past few years. We just spent four nights, checking out on Easter Sunday. The location is astoundingly good. And the location is great. Have I mentioned the location? You are right next to Disneyland and Downtown Disney and can actually walk into California Adventure from the hotel. The pools are nice, the restaurants are convenient and very good, the architecture is lovely (it is a slightly fake - in a Disney way - version of the Ahwahnee without any actual timber) and the castmembers are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are fine - not as motel-ish as some reviewers here suggest, nor are they worthy of the hotel's four stars. The wallpaper is cheap-looking, but the beds are comfortable and the

Summary Heading: You're paying for location, location, location if you stay here
Summary: If you can afford it, this is definitely THE place to stay during your visit to Disneyland.  It takes less than 10 minutes to walk from your room to Disneyland Park, 5 minutes from your room to California Adventure Park, and 2 minutes from your room to Disney Town with lots of shops and restaurants.  You are paying 4 season prices and getting Hyatt quality rooms, but you can't beat the location.
