Another con is it is a very large hotel and feels it (a bit impersonal and anonymous), but again, you can't beat the location for a visit to Disneyland.  Service was solid and courteous.  Really no complaints at all except for the price.  I recommend looking on Expedia for better rates.  We booked through the hotel directly and then found a less expensive rate for the same room on

I have stayed several times at this hotel, mostly because it's location and because it's simply gorgeous. That said I know I'm overpaying, a lot, a huge huge lot. The rooms are as bland as any found in an Embassy Suites or any other hotel next to the highway. Absolutely nothing to be impressed. The pillows are uncomfortable and the bed could be better.  This time stayed in a concierge suite (top floor) overlooking the resort. You can see in my pics that this actually means looking at the pool and in the far distance a little bit of California adventure. The Craftman's Club is very convenient though, sodas are free and the breakfast is excellent, the food at noon (11-3pm I believe) is always the same, some cookies and little sandwiches and scones, for dinner they can serve you

I decided to spend my 60th birthday at the Grand Californian and Disneyland.   The hotel was beautiful.  The suite was lovely and overlooked the courtyard.  The beds and linens were very luxurious. The flat screened tvs were great, as was the turndown service, the chocolates, and the over all experience. It was well worth the money.

Summary Heading: Magical week stay...Craftsman Club is worth the extra!!!!
Summary: We stayed at the Grand Californian for the first time with our 4 daughters.  Ages 6,7,9 and 15.  We stayed on the Concierge Level, The Craftsman Club 6th floor Room 6116.  It looked towards the fireworks every night.  We were there March 10th-17th and every day was magical.  The concierge desk was simply wonderful and catered to our every need!  The Craftsman Club was great for breakfast and lunch.  They always were stocked with food and drinks and in the evening they have story telling for the kiddo's.  Beer and wine for mom and dad, even late night Bailey's or Amaretto with coffee!  The kids loved it and so did we!  We paid a little extra, but we think we saved money by eating every breakfast in the Craftsman Club and we ate 2 lunches in there as well.  The housekeeping

Summary Heading: The location is worth every dollar
Summary: We have stayed at the Grand Californian several times. And each time we are so happy. The location alone is so worth the extra money. If you get tired or need to switch shoes or you get wet, its just so close to both the parks that you can make the most of your day.  The service is always excellent, they always try to make you as happy as possible.  I would recommend the park view if available. We stayed in the bunk bed with Trundle/Queen Bed room and it had enough room for our family of five.

We have always talked of staying at the GC on a Disney trip - and finally got our chance this week.  We just returned from a 3 night stay.  While the lobby is beautiful and the location is terrific -  that  is the end of the magic at this hotel.  Once you leave the fabulous lobby - the rooms are just average holiday inn looking rooms.  Nothing special about them at all.  In fact the aging shower curtain and the worn polyester bed spreads were quite a disappointment.  Also the fact that there was no honor bar - and no bottled water offered... and that the ice machine was out of ice.... left us a little upset.  The sundry store in the lobby is really just a Disney store with t shirts, hats etc.... one very small section of strickly Disney candies. No other snacks to be bought

I LOVED it here!  Clean hotel, nice staff.  I booked a downtown disney view and requested an upper level fireworks view room.  We stayed in 4157 and it was great!  We could see the fireworks at night and our tv had a fireworks station to where you could hear the music that went along with it.  (this was of course after our first night actually being in front of the castle to experience the fireworks).  The room was nice.  The beds were comfortable although I think they should update the comforters a bit.  The safe is very small in the room.  The refrigerator was great.  Note:  The downtown disney rooms are loud even with the sliding door shut but I had ear plugs and I was so exhausted by the end of each day I had no problems sleeping.  I ordered a fruit, cheese and wine basket

I stayed at the Grand Californian with my husband for just one night while we were on a southern California vacation celebrating our 10-year wedding anniversary. We arrived around 9:30am and were surprised to find that our room was already available. It was great to be able to check-in, before heading off to the theme parks. The room itself was spacious. We had a king size bed...and there was a pull-out couch in the room, as well as a coffe table and desk. The room also had a refrigerator in it. The bathroon was spacious and I loved the shower curtain, which had a traditional rustic-California look, with some Disney characters like Bambi and Thumper mixed in. The room also had a flat screen TV and DVD player in it. Check-out was easy. We called the valet 20 minutes ahead and our

I rated this hotel very good because there is nothing in trip advisor ratings between average and very good.  I would actually rate it "good" if that were an option.  The location of the hotel can't be beat.  If you get tired, or hot, or cold, or in my case wet from a badly positioned ride on splash mountain, you can run back to the hotel and be back in the park in 20 minutes.  The lobby is beautiful, and I really enjoyed the piano player in the early evenings, as well as the large fireplace (it was cold this week!)  The group areas, pool, etc... looked very nice.  It was too chilly to enjoy, but I am sure in good weather it would be great.  Rooms were nice, nothing too spectacular.  Spacious, with comfortable beds, servicable bathrooms, large flat screen.  Cleanliness... not so

Summary Heading: A wonderfully beautiful hotel with great staff
Summary: This is a wonderful hotel.  I love its proximity to the California Adventure Park.  It is great to be able to leave your hotel and get right into the park.  It has an elegant lobby and homey rooms.  The food is great and there are character meals as well.  I will be back.

Summary Heading: Thin walls between rooms, neighbor noise kept my child awake.
Summary: For $400 a night I don't expect to have to listen to my next door neighbor's conversations.   It wasn't even a party, just some happy people who'd had a good day, but the walls were so thin it was like they were in my room.  I had to find some white noise on the radio to drown it out so my son could finally get to sleep.  The hotel is beautiful, the staff were helpful, the pool was excellent for kids, and it was great getting into the park one hour before everyone else, which is a perk of staying at an official Disney hotel.  But an underslept, overtired child can wreck all that.  Come on, Disney.  You can do better than this.

The Grand Californian Hotel is the perfect location to visit the Disneyland & California Adventure parks. We valet the car, and did not have to use it the for our 4 day stay. We checked in at 3:00pm the appointed time. Our room was ready. The bell man was very nice, and pointed out the different areas of the hotel. The walk to the room was a bit long, but well worth the view of Downtown Disney. If staying there in the Summer it would be a perfect view of the fireworks. We had a room with bunkbeds, a trundle, and a queen bed. Even with the trundle pulled out there was plenty of room to walk around. The room was very clean, and kept nice the entire time we were there. There was a turn down service at night with disney chocolates that the kids enjoyed. The bedding is not the most

We stayed at the Grand Californian hotel during the third week of February. As in my experience with the Disney Resort the customer service was excellent, all interaction with the hotel and restaurant staff was positive and left me feeling like a valued customer. The room we stayed in was very average, our view was terrible (of the top of the roof!) but I doubt anyone spends too much time in their room when you are right next to the Disney park. There was a small balcony with two chairs and a table for sitting outside. The one strange aspect of our room was that the bathroom sinks were outside of the bathroom, the toliet and bathtub were in a small closet like room separated from the room by a pocket door. The bathtub had some mildew in the corners but all other aspects of the

Summary Heading: Gorgeous hotel, great location, excellent food
Summary: I got exactly what I expected for the price.  Incredible lobby, outstanding breakfast at Storyteller's Cafe, superb location.  I can't say enough about the hotel lobby with its incredible woodwork and attention to detail.  My room was as expected, clean, beautifully appointed.  You are really paying for the location and small attention to details and outstanding food selection (relative to other theme park hotels I have stayed at).  Disney delivers.

Summary Heading: Last minute decision to stay here...our second time.  Still the BEST
Summary: We were originally staying at the Disneyland Hotel but had already experienced the convenience of the Grand four years ago and were very reluctant to give up the location.  After mulling it over on the plane ride we made the call and switched our reservation the day we arrived.    We paid full price for their standard bunk bed room + queen bed.  In room fridge is awesome for yogurt, milk, snacks, etc.  Room is not exceptionally roomy but worked for our family of 4 (kids 5&9) and we were there 5 days.  We found the rooms to be quiet even with guests on either side of our room we did not hear any conversations from their rooms...  The hotel staff was impeccable during our stay. Everyone was very friendly and went out of their way to chat with our children while sitting in the

We stayed the Tue-Thur, Feb 10-12, and enjoyed it very much. Every year about this time there is a major expo at the anahiem convention center that I attend and this year I chose to actually stay, afterall I am a Prem pass holder, and have stayed here about 5+ times already (lost count). I even dragged my husband along, who only comes because it makes me happy. We arrived about mid day, shortly after checkout time. Thinking there would be along line..no way!.. we were greeted by a nice gal who was attentive and the front desk lady was very friendly and our room was ready (4009) Great! But...though my requests were met right on (king bed, close to main lobby,...), the room had some bad points. The frig rattled (left it off), the internet was flaky (both wifi and lan), the

Summary Heading: Interesting experience.. but will not be back. not worth it!
Summary: Checking in was a breeze.. asked for an upgrade and got a view of California Adv. park! Checked out the room, and realized there was hair in bathroom- called front desk and an hour later had someone come up and clean it. I recommend the room 5434 even though it's furthest from the lobby area, there is no rooms above you, and you won't hear anything! Great for light sleepers! The kids loved the bunkbeds BUT beware of the top bunk as the rails make noise if you have a kids who is a wrestless sleeper! Tip:the front desk has ear plus!    Getting into disney on Early Entry days made our stay worth it since we were able to ride all the rides we wanted in that 1 hour before park opens to the public! You don't have to purchase through disney packages... early entry comes with all on

Summary Heading: Worth the price at the off season rates
Summary: We got a deal for $220 a night and just stayed for 1 night (great So Cal only deals in winter for park as well). We checked in around 11am before the room was ready and just left our bags with the hotel until we came back from the park around 8pm.   Only Queen with Bunk Bed rooms were available. Since it was just my girlfriend and I with no kids we would have rather had the king room, but they upgraded us to a pool view which had a very nice balcony view.  Fake cricket sounds were a nice touch, it was raining and it felt like we were in Big Sur. BYOW (Bring your own wine) and have a romantic drink on the balcony. Very nice staff.  1st time in my experience a luggage porter actually showed up quickly with our bags.  Nice ambiance and contrary to other reviews, I loved the fact

This is a great addition to Disney. I loved the whole feel of the resort from the lodge type atmosphere of the lobby to the really simple but nice and clean rooms. We stayed here with my mom and my two brothers and we met friends here. The resort is right there in Disney and is a short walk to california adventure, disneyland and downtown disney. If you have kids go get the breakfast in the morning because all the characters show up!!! My little brother loved seeing Goofy!! Anyways, very family oriented place here, if you can't stand plastic cups, a little noise, and children everywhere then this isnt your place and you should stay somewhere in Irvine or Newport but if you want to be in a great friendly and family atmosphere...there is no place better in Anaheim, will come back

Summary Heading: We Truly Loved Our Stay Here!
Summary: We stayed here as a special birthday trip! We were a group of 4 adults and really enjoyed our stay!  We actually ended up getting a great price form travelocity last minute. What we ended up doing, was booking months before we went, and then about a week before, I checked travelocity and saw a great $222/night per room rate, so I cancelled our reservation and rebooked at that great rate!  We loved the hotel! Check in went super smoothly! And we ended up getting a room facing Downtown Disney! This was wonderful because we were able to see the fireworks right from our balcony! Yay! Plus it was fun to sit on the balcony and people watch down below. The only downside to it was that it was quite noisy in the evening. On Friday and Saturday night, even with the balcony doors closed,

I have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel, Sheraton Anaheim and Hilton when visiting Disneyland before. We stayed at the Grand Californian Hotel for three nights in January, The hotel was clean and pleasant. All the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. It was not the best hotel i have ever stayed in but none of the Hotels in or around disneyland seem to be that great. It is more expensive and so i suppose others may be expecting more. However it is the most convenient. It was nice to be able to go back to the room just quickly during the day to pick up a sweater or things like that. And being able to charge things in the park to your room is also great (although you would get that with any of the Disneyland resort hotels). We had a good time here and don't think that there is

Not worth the money. The hotel is ordinary and so are the rooms. I wish i would have saved the money i spent on this hotel and bought something nice for my daughter. No refrence at all to disney land in the hotel. the walls are thin and you can hear everything.

Stayed Jan 24-28, 2009.  Upon arrival check in was a little slow, but activities in fabulous lobby kept kids busy coloring and watching disney cartoons.  Because it was slow season our request to stay on the top floor was accommodated.   Rooms are on the normal to somewhat smaller than average square footage, but the details and amenities are high quality.  Mattress, sheets, shower, two sinks, toiletries are all excellent. We had a bunk bed room that worked perfect because we had three twin beds (there is a trundle bed under bunk beds) so each child got their own bed.  There was no night noise, hallways were quiet. There was a water leak in the ceiling outside our room on the last night.  The guest services staff went out of their way to help us move rooms and offer us breakfast

The Grand Californian must be seen to be believed.  If you like arts and crafts style with a dash of Disney, this place has it, and you will like it.  Our room was perfect with a nice balcony that looked out over Downtown Disney.  It was fun to sit on the patio and watch people make their way to and from DisneyLand.  The hotel staff was exceptionally nice.  Do not pass up having a drink in the bar.  If you want one of the best spa experiences ever, make a reservation at the Mandera Spa on the property.  You will not regret it.  When I requested a massage on Sunday Morning, they asked a therapist to come in early without hesitation.  Having stayed in another upscale resort down the street last year, I have to say the Grand Californian is in a whole different category.   If you're

Summary Heading: The place to stay- worth the money
Summary: By far the most convenient place to stay when visiting Disneyland.  A wonderful, oversized Craftsman style mega lodge is everything that Disney is...friendly, smiling service in an enchanted feeling property.  The guestrooms themselves are quite pleasant but need new bedding and don't have mini-bars.  But they have nice bath amenities and flat panel TVs.  The food at the hotel is its weakness, but so it is throughout the park.

This hotel, unfortunately, the Disney Corporation has opted not to invest in its facility to make it deserving of even 4 stars.   The rooms are nice but not premium or luxury level. Napa Rose was quite good with excellent staff  Hotel service/concierge was barely adequate and at times, a bit rude. Staff sighed and shrugged and didn't seem to want you to be there. Granted this was the holidays but for the price you pay it was unacceptable.  For the same price, you can stay at a Ritz Carlton in Marina Del Rey. If you are looking for 5 (or even 4) stars around Disneyland, this ain't it anymore. Sad.

We stayed in a Queen Artisan Suite (2 queen beds in one room, adjoining lounge room).  All up, including Concierge  Fee our nightly rate came to nearly $1000, and we were completely disappointed.    Rooms are extremely dark, poorly lit  amd furnished in very heavy wooden furniture.  Beds are very comfortable.  Housekeeping and maintenance were terrible.  On arrival, the lounge room smelt of urine.  I called housekeeping and two maids arrived.  Once declared she couldn't smell anything, the other clearly did smell it and arranged for our carpets to be immediately shampooed (which was good).    Other issues included faulty lightbulbs (4 different light fittings all of which required new bulbs), the phone didn't work in the lounge area, there were foodscraps left on the floor in

Summary Heading: Loved the Grand - It was Grand!
Summary: We have always wanted to stay at the Grand Californian and finally took the plunge last June.  It was VERY expensive, but worth every penny.  The absolute best thing about the Grand Californian is the convenience, no question, i.e., you're wet from the rapids ride, just stroll a few yards over to the hotel entrance and go to your room and change.  Unbelievable.  Or you're tired and need a rest; no need to waste an hour or longer shuttling to your off-site hotel, walking through the parking lot to your room and then back again.  What a waste of time that is.  No sirree.  It takes mere minutes to get to your room from wherever you are in either park and you can rest and then another few minutes and you're back in the parks.  That's the absolute best.  The rooms are nice, although

We stayed at the GCH in mid December for two nights as part of a one week stay in LA. Our primary reason for going to the GCH was  to celebrate our daughter's 11th birthday. We booked a room with Downtown Disney views and at the time of booking were advised that bunk accomodation would be available in the room for our three children. However on arrival we found that we had been given two double beds and a sleeping bag on a floor mat between the beds for the fifth person to sleep on!! Not something our youngest child ("the birthday girl") relished.  On complaining to management we were moved to a "non view " room that had two double beds and a day bed so in the end no one had to sleep on the floor.  As can be seen from other reviews the GCH does have a great foyer and its

Summary Heading: very nice, but not very disney
Summary: We stayed at the Grand California in mid december in order to get a "disney" holiday experience.  The lobby was beautiful as were our rooms.  The hotel is perfect for the holidays because of the lodge feel.  The only complaint that I had was the lack of disney touches.  It felt like a really nice hotel but not necessarily a really nice disney hotel.  Make sure to check out Story Teller's for the character breakfast and Napa Rose for dinner.  Both superb restaurants.

We stayed in room 3143 12/8 - 12/12 and it was fantastic!  Our room was situated over Downtown Disney right above the walkway into the hotel between Libby Lu and Sephora.   We had a terrific view of the fireworks from our balcony and were able to listen to the musicians who played just to the right of our room in the evenings.  Once we closed the door we could just barely hear the music.  Not loud enough to disturb our sleep.  The room and balcony were clean and comfy.  As this room is one of the farthest from the lobby, our bellhop told us of a shortcut to Downtown Disney through the service stairway just a couple of steps from our door.  We never had any problem with lost or misplace luggage as some of the reviews have indicated nor was the condition of our room less than

Summary Heading: If you have the cash, stay here!
Summary: Sooo expensive.  But our two day stay over Thanksgiving weekend was worth the extra money.  We travel a lot for business and fun.  These rooms are wonderful.  Nothing fancy or magical, but the beds are awesome.  Just what you need after a day at the park.  Feather pillows, comforters and firm matresses.  Our bad backs were in heaven.  We booked the Downtown Disney view and, based on this website, realized too late that it was loud.  I called in advance to negotiate a quieter room and they upgraded us to the pool view at no charge to accommodate our request for quiet.  Very nice.  Having gone to DLand over Thanksgiving, we knew that it would be crowded.  The location of this hotel allowed us to get into the park early one morning and at the opening of the park to ''everyone'' on

Summary Heading: OMG My New Favorite Disney Hotel!
Summary: I stayed at the Grand Californian from November 16 - 21 with my partner.  This was the best Disney Hotel we have ever stayed in.  Our room had a view of Downtown Disney and the Courtyard.  Our room featured a king bed and because we were in a corner room, there was more space.  The quality of the decor, toiletries, furniture and staff made our stay very relaxing and enjoyable.  We looked forward to coming back to the room after being in the parks.  Used the pool are and again made the entire stay a quality one.  If you can swing it, stay here.

We stayed at the Grand California for only $249 as our friend lives in So. Calif and was able to book the room using her Disney season pass. We ended up purchasing season passes and asked about rates for upcoming spring break, and they are well over $400, so we decided not to go back due to price.  The hotel is beautiful. Two large pools and a hottub with a ton of lounge chairs. The distance to downtown disney and the parks is crucial if you need to be close or have small children who cannot walk very far.   The rooms were nicely furnished but small. We had a double bed room, double vanity area, toilet/tub were separate. The shower curtain had bambi on it in a forest print. The toiletries were spa quality. We unfortunately had a downtown disney view (do NOT select if you want to

Very nice place. Everything is beautiful, the service is good, the rooms fine, etc.  We were however a bit disappointed that there just wasn't anything that really stood out as magical.  We stayed one night and will come back to really check things out as our stay was too short to decide to not come back. For the price and this being Disney we expected more, and have yet to get it.

We spent one night before Thanksgiving in a standard room. This hotel is beautiful and well kept. The room was of a good size in my opinion. The bathroom was spacious and the toiletries and linens were what I would expect of a luxury hotel. I can't complain about anything here save for the price of the room itself. That being said - being able to walk out of your hotel and into Disneyland in less than 2 minutes is worth it's weight in disney dollars! yes it's overpriced here - but the service is excellent and the staff bent over backwards to be accomodating. This was a truly memorable experience which I highly recommend  both to families and people wanting something special - the added expense was worth it.

I can't say enough about the excellent service at this hotel.  We decided to splurge at the last minute and stay overnight at the hotel to celebrate a birthday and I don't regret it.  The staff was friendly, professional, and very helpful.  In fact, we decided to enjoy the hotel and downtown Disney the first night and go to Disneyland the following morning and it worked out perfectly.  Of course in the real world this hotel is way to expensive for the average size room you get, but this is Disneyland, so they know we are willing to overpay for everything.    Of course the multi-story lobby is very beautiful (but it is a Disney version of an old grand hotel so don't look too closely) and I liked the overall impression of all the mission style design details from the beautiful

Had a wonderful stay at the Grand Californian.  Check in  was a little on the average side as she didn't give us much information about the property and the magic mornings but we soon found out what to do and where to go.  Ate at the Storytellers cafe first night staff their were excellent.  The rooms were very comfortable. had a safe and fridge and a nice bathroom.  The location was great close to everything.  I personally thnink it doesn't matter at which disney resort you pick they are all nice and all offer great things.  The pool at DC was great and the lounge chairs wre also comfey.  Ate at Disney Pier which was very nice and also at Disneyland Hotel at Goofy Kitchen which was a buffett dinner great.  Loved disney had a fantastic holiday.

I'd really like to give this 2 1/2 stars.  Three is too high, but two seems petty.  We stayed two nights (Mon - Tues) and this was a splurge for my boyfriend's birthday.  We usually stay at the Annabella Hotel, which is a terrific value for the money, but have always wanted to stay at the Grand Californian.  We were disappointed.    The Good:  Location, location, location.  So easy going back and forth from hotel room to Downtown Disney or California Adventure.  Got soaked on a ride?  Just dash up and change.  Feeling chilly?  Run up and get a jacket.  SO convenient.  Housekeeping was excellent.  Drinks at hotel lobby bar surprisingly strong!  The Bad:  Service outside of housekeeping.  No one seemed to smile anywhere.  Room was not ready at 3:00 pm check in time, we had to wait

Our family (a toddler and a baby) recently stayed at this hotel for four nights, during the first week of October.  We took advantage of a convention rate that was available to the general public, and paid $219 per night.  The hotel and its grounds are absolutely gorgeous, without a lot of the blatant Disney decor.  The lobby is stunning, and the three pools are really nice and well-kept.    The biggest negative for us was the check-in process.  We utilized the express check in and called the hotel when we were 2 hours away from the resort (around 1:30 p.m.).  However, when we arrived, well after the check in time, a room was not available for us.  With two tired young children in tow, this was not welcome news.  We were told to call the number again in 15 minutes, which we did.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel next to the Park
Summary: Nice lobby (but everything is kind of plastic and ersatz if you look closely) and decent rooms, although very average.   It's a big hotel, a little impersonal, and our rooms were a fairly long walk from the elevators.  One thing the Disney Hotels do (we've stayed at the Disneyland Hotel as well) really well:   customer service.   They have got it down, and the staff is always delightful here.   My husband left his Visa card at the Story Teller restaurant, and we called from home to see if they found it.   They had, and they mailed it to him the next day at no charge.  You'll pay a premium to stay at a Disney property, and so very close to both parks (Disneyland and California Adventure park).  We travelled as 2 adults with 4 teenaged girls, and we stayed here for 2 nights.   It

Summary Heading: Not as good as the original
Summary: Okay, I have stayed at all three Disney property hotels.  All have their positive and negative attributes.  Yes, the Grand Californian is a beautiful hotel-from the lobby.  When you get to your room, there is nothing noteworthy to sing praises about.  It is just an average hotel room.  Why pay the $400.00 a night for a standard room.  I just don't understand it unless you are trying to impress yourselves or your neighbors by knowing or saying that  you stayed in an overpriced Disney hotel room.  If I were to choose to have an all encompassing once-in-a-lifetime Disney experience, I would hands down choose the Disneyland Hotel.  Don't believe what other reviewers say about it being old and tired.  It is a clean hotel, has large rooms and there is always a touch of Disney magic.

This hotel is the best for location if visiting Disneyland. The service and hotel rooms were great. It was better than I had imagined. It is very expensive for an average room size but its the location and service that make it worth at least one in a life time visit.

We stayed at the Grand for 6 nights.  We expected great service from the disney workers at  the hotel and at the park.  We were very disappointed.  The hotel staff was mostly indifferent, sometimes rude.  The hotel room itself was nice, but nothing special.  The best part of the Grand hotel was the location.  Was it worth the money?  Probably not.  I would not stay again.

Summary Heading: Perfect for Families with Young Kids
Summary: In late September, We were going to take our children to Disneyland for the first time and wanted to do it right.  There were lots of reviews talking about how convenient it was to stay so close to the parks.  We made reservations for a regular room with a resort view, and we requested a room with bunk beds.  When we made the reservation, we knew it was expensive, but we have two children, 2 ¬Ω and 5 months, and the convenience of being on the resort itself made a lot of sense to us.  My wife and I have always liked the longer reviews on Tripadvisor that go into lots of details, and been really frustrated by the two sentence reviews, so we‚Äôll give you as much information as we can.  Sorry if we go a bit overboard.  GETTING THERE When you get there, you have to stop at a gate so

My family stayed here for four nights. Our room was on the fifth floor and we had a standard view. The room was large and the bunk beds were nice for the kids. However, the room was very dusty and I had to wipe down the dust from the beds before I could let my girls sleep there. The bathroom was clean and the double sink area was nice.The room did have a musty or mold smell to it near the door opening to the bathroom. The staff at the hotel was nice and helpful for the most part. Room service took 45 minutes just to get plates and cups when we ordered pizza. Overall the hotel is just a moderate resort. It could not even begin to compare to Disney Worlds resorts. I would not recommend spending this much money for the hotel it is not worth it. Save your money and spend it on the

In short - A fantastic Disney resort hotel.  Perfect for families visiting Disneyland.  In detail - We had five nights at this hotel in mid-September.  We stayed in a concierge level room with a view over Disney's California Adventure theme park.  Paying extra for the concierge level gave us access to a lounge with free breakfast, snacks and beer wine and soft drink.  Our room was very comfortably fitted out and had a queen size bed and a set of bunks.  Our boys loved the novelty of sleeping in bunk beds.  I also like that there were two sinks outside of the bathroom so that effectively two people could be getting ready at the same time as the access to the sinks wasn't restricted by someone being in the bathroom.  I understand that this is a relatively expensive hotel but it

The hotel and staff was amazing. We spent a full week there. Sunday to Sunday. We did so much. I recomend Discover the Magic tour with the family. But for our anniversary I had booked a couples massage at the spa. It was mediocre at best. It seemed as if they were both right out of school for massage. It was to be a 50 min massage an a 30 minute tea ceremony. I say it was closer to 35 minutes for massage then after they brought us tea in the room and told us to sit for a half hour. The chairs were not comfortable we changed and left. All that for $380.! Oh and the couples room shares a wall with the bathroom used for the pool. We could hear flushing and kids screaming the whole time.

My whole family decided to stay there for six nights, fully expecting to leave on the seventh day.  We had a suite facing the park.  While it is pricy, the service is well worth it.  We loved the concierge room (you have to pay for an upgrade)a nd the snacks etc... that it provided...trust me when I say that you'll get your money's worth if you upgrade-in food alone.  They have free sodas and water in the concierge room and at night they have beer and wine tasting as well.  It is easy to get in and out of the park...we ended up extending our stay for one more night...

Summary Heading: Great location but pricey and could be noisy
Summary: We stayed at GCH Sept 28-Oct 1.  Good: - Great location with respect to Disneyland parks. We can go from our room to Soaring California (great ride) in couple minutes. - Clean and comfortable room. We had the double room. The mattresses could be better so suggestion to Disney is to see/feel Westin Heavenly. - Napa Rose is great. We were not share if it is child friendly but like everything in Disney (except that one restaurant in GFH Disneyworld), it has child menu. Many tables have kids as well. BTW: the food is great. - The pools are great and a good break from the theme parks. Bad: - Our room is 4th floor facing downtown Disney, right on top of the Disney shop. It was noisy. One night (er morning) we had 5am leaf blower. Another night we had 2am heavy equipment outside. Music

We are frequent Disneyland visitors and had wanted to stay in the Grand Californian since it opened.  During this trip, we were in the hotel for three nights. On the first night, we were awakened by a misdirected phone call by a Disney staffer at about 3 AM.  Once we hung up, they promptly called again, and apologized for bothering us.  When we returned to the room the next day, there were 'cookies' (more like brownies) and milk waiting for us as an apology... even though we weren't fussy at all.   The location was great because not everyone wanted to spend the entire day in the park, and those who wanted to sleep in could do so easily.  The room seemed a little small for the price, but the hotel is absolutely beautiful, so no real complaints.  Check in was slow, but there was a

We stayed at the GCH Sept 18-21 and got a Downtown Disney view. The view was great, we were right across from Naples on the 5th floor. But the rooms dont have elevators near them. Its a long walk. Id say its like a U, and the elevators are at one end and your  at the other end. I would say though Downtown is noisy at night but when you close the slider you dont hear anything. If I ever stay there again, Id be happy with a standard room near the elevators.

My family stayed at the Grand Californian Hotel right before school started and thought it would be a good closure for Summer. The hotel itself is lovely, the lobby area (called a great hall) was amazing. It is opened for the public to walk through and has an enormous fireplace where there is usually a guitar player or storyteller each evening. It was great staying right near the theme parks but the best thing was the guest service! On our second day we were unsure of where to dine so we went to the Guest Services desk. Normally I am not good with names but the girl there was so friendly..her name was Kim. She was able to get us a reservation at  Ariels Grotto last minute which when I tried calling was told on the phone that "there was no way it was possible". Kim called for us

This was our first visit to Disneyland and you definitely can't beat the location of this hotel.  Great location to downtown disney, disneyland (including magic morning passes).  The room was very basic but clean.

The hotel is not at all over priced you get what you pay for and thats QUALITY! we ended up staying more days then originally planed just because everything was terrific room service was amazing! We are annual pass holders we spent most of our time in the hotel it was so cute and relaxing the pictures of snow white we're adorable this is a very very amazing hotel and worth every penny will do it again in a heart beat!

It's been a while since we stayed there, but I just started using this site while searching for a different hotel to stay on our next trip to Disneyland.  I suspect that the experience now is the same as when we went, though, and the price premium certainly is :).  We arrived a little before check-in time, but were told they would have a room for us.  However, it was uncharacteristically unorganized getting a room.  I forget what specific request we had at the time that they (eventually) met, but we kept having to wait around in the lobby in 15 minute chunks, until almost an hour had passed between the time we checked in and the time we got the room, changed, and headed out to the park.  It wouldn't have been that big a deal for us to just not go to the room (we didn't even

Summary Heading: Has location but bad food, service & is way overpriced
Summary: Check In:  We arrived at 3pm and only had to wait a few minutes to be seen at the desk.  From there it took more than a half hour until we had our keys because we were offered an upgrade and then the girl had no clue how to make the switch.  Any costs associated with our ‚Äúupgraded‚Äù room should have been waived due to her incompetence/Disney‚Äôs lack of proper training but of course, this was not done.  Not exactly ‚ÄúDisney‚Äù service from the start.  Room:  Two queen beds.  This is your basic hotel room and is a standard hotel room size.  It could have been a Hojo or Holiday Inn.  The balcony was very narrow (unless you are on the top floor, which we weren‚Äôt) so when sitting down the railing is directly in front of your face, which renders the balcony  pretty much useless aside from

Room 5322. The hotel was amazing.  We stayed for five nights 8/3/08 to 8/8/08.  Checkin was a breeze. We arrived at 11:00am and we did call ahead and preregister.  Our room was not ready so we toured the hotel and had some lunch.  We were able to store our bags with the bellhop which is a fantastic convenience.  After lunch our room was ready.  When we opened the door we were pleasantly surprised.  The room was very neat.   We stayed in the queen bed/ bunk bed room.  The first place we checked out was the balcony.  I did request a view of both the pool and paradise pier.  The balcony was not very big but perfect for the three of us. We changed and headed down to the pool.  Very nice pool and clean.  The redwood slide was great.  Biggest complaint is rude children who were not

Just returned from two nights three day stay.  Hotel stay was Thursday and Friday night.  Some aspects of the hotel are top notch and they provide services that no one else can.    Went with two teen daughters.  Front desk, bell staff very friendly and efficient.  Servers were also excellent and food was good.  Of course location can't be beat.  Have previously stayed at the Disneyland hotel and off property.  The Grand Ca had a more relaxing feel, I guess it was more peaceful and quiet.  Of course it's still Disneyland but there were pleanty of places to sit in quiet if you needed it, both inside and outside.    Check in - We arrived at 11am.  Did not expect our rooms to be ready.  Front desk staff said the hotel was not too full and so upgraded our room.  Checked our bags,

Yes, the Grand Californian is expensive, but the location is worth it.  We stayed here for three nights, and enjoyed the experience.    Check-in was quick and easy, and we were given a room overlooking Downtown Disney.  Worried at first about noise, we were really impressed with the quietness of the room when the balcony doors were shut. And the bonus - we were able to watch the fireworks from the balcony.  Not sure about the complaints about parking. The parking lot is just across the road from the hotel - a three minute walk.   Luggage services were excellent.   And, as you would expect at Disney, all staff were extremely friendly.     We didn't eat in the hotel itself, as there were so many options in Downtown Disney or in the parks themselves.   But the kids loved the pool

Summary Heading: Classy hotel, worth the $$$ if you have small children or teens
Summary: I stayed for 2 nights with a girlfriend and her two children (ages 4 and 6) and for the most part, we loved this hotel.  It was worth the extra money to be so close to the park if the kids got grumpy and we needed a fast break!  It's a very classy and adult hotel, but very kid and teen friendly.   The room, although not terribly large, was decorated tastefully with mission style furniture and had a flat-screen TV and DVD player that was great for the kids to watch movies on.  We noticed that there was a pack and play in the closet.  It also had double sinks and vanity in an area separated from the bath and toilet, which was nice when mutiple adults and children are getting ready at the same time.  We payed extra for a great view of the fireworks from Disney and a room overloking

We have visited Disneyland / Disneyworld before but never stayed in Disney accommodation so thought we would give it a shot.  The valet service was excellent, our luggage and car were whisked away (buy guys wearing ridiculous pedal pusher trousers and silly caps). Check in was a real experience, dont miss it!  We were seen by a lady called Linda - I dont recall ever remembering someone's name before.  She was a real character and kept referring to herself in the third person and calling it "her" hotel.  This is more than likely all Disney training.  She was absolutely hilarious in a freaky kind of way, but we will always laugh about it and never forget it.    Our room was pretty much what we expected - a double with bunks and a roll out bed for our third child.  It was robust

You can't beat this location. A private entrance to California Adventure and next door to DowntownDisnney. But that's it. You pay for a 5 star room and you get a 3 star room. Small, outdated, without enough number of lamps and the safe deposit box was the smallest I've ever seen.  Service is also average and not always efficient. We didn't have a chance to try the hotel's restaurants. California Adventure closes at 10pm and the hotel's restaurants close at 10pm - so unless you have a fast food dinner at the park, room service will be your only option.  Breakfast starts at 7am but hotel guests early admition to Disneyland is also at 7am (and you should take advantage of early admition if you want to avoid huge waiting lines in the best attractions).

While the Disneyland Hotel is definitely more "Disney-ish", you just can't beat the close location of the Grand Californian!  The lobby is really lovely and check-in was a snap.  We received the type of room we requested (theme park view) and while our room was quite a ways away from the main lobby, it was quite close to the California Adventure entrance, pools  and to the hotel restaurants.  We had a queen bed and a bunk bed with a pull-out trundle bed in our room.  I had expected to find our room to be very small because of reviews that I had read on-line, but really it was quite comfortable.  The only complaint I would make is that the amount of drawer space was lacking for five people.  The pools were crowded but there was always some space to spread out our stuff and the

Summary Heading: Full of Class, But it will cost you some cash!!
Summary: Being pass holders , we do receive a discount, just not enough to make it worth the price of staying here. Though after booking a room @ the org. Disneyland Hotel, we received a call a few days later. We were give a upgrade to the Grand. We had stayed her (childless) in the past. And this was our daughter's (4yr old) first stay @ a Disney Hotel. She was amazed by it's size & beauty. She loved the giant fireplace. And as always enjoyed the Story Tellers Breakfast. Though she thought it was odd that it wasn't more  "Mickey-ish". This is true  I have heard other kids state the same.  As far as the rooms go, I was impressed to see they now have large plasma tvs.The robes are wonderful, you will want to purchase one in the gift shop.The turn down service is wonderful. Front desk is

We recently stayed here due to the great reviews. The travel agent we booked through didn't have this hotel in their brochure, but we requested it and they were able to book as part of our package. We are so glad we made the request - on arrival we were told that we had been upgraded to a pool view, which was a lovely suprise. Our room was large, very clean and very comfortable. The bathroom and sink areas looked brand new and the decor was superb. We had a view of not only the pool, but some of the rides in the California Adventure Park.  The hotel lobby was 'larger than life' with an enormous fireplace. All of the staff were polite, helpful, friendly and smiled a lot. We really liked the way you walked straight into Downtown Disney for meals and could get directly into the

We stayed at the Grande Californian for 5 days.  This is our 4th visit to Disneyland and this is one of the nicer hotels that I've stayed at in the area.  Found the Foyey to be breathtaking and massive.  Being right at the California Adventure entrance was definitely a plus and it was a short walk to the Disneyland entrance.  I loved being right on the strip of all the neat stores and restaurants that Disneyland has to offer.  Beautiful at night.  My only complaint would be the price, the room decor.  and room size.  I would recommend booking the hotel directly as I'm sure it would be way cheaper.  It was really neat to see the lead singer for Blink 182 staying there!  My teens thought that was really sweet.  All in all I would recommend it!

We have stayed at the Grand Californian about 10 times since it opened in 2001. It definitely has it benefits., at a cost of course.  We have a 3 year old who needs a nap everyday. We have stayed offsite and had to use the Anaheim Rapid transit (ART) bus but the 20 minute schedule is not dependable. We have waited over an hour. This doesn't work with a 3 year old.  We have stayed at the Disneyland hotel and the distance from the park entrance or using the monorail can take a while. Also we had serious noise issues everynight at 1am from the DtD foot traffic.  Summary: We will continue staying the GCH and use the AP discounts (when they are available) until my daughter is older and then we might try Embassy suits south..

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel, nice stay, but one or two issues to consider
Summary: We stayed three nights at the Grand Californian with our two boys - one is 3 years old, the other is 5 months old.  Overall, we were impressed by the hotel; gorgeous lobby, quiet mezzanine areas, great pool area with kiddie pool, kiddie slide, and a big slide.  Room was good, and well appointed; two sinks in bathroom, cozy balcony with view of Downtown Disney (DD), beds were comfortable.  Downsides are nighttime noise from DD is pretty loud, long walk from elevator, and housekeeping didn't clean out the fridge from prior guest.  Key aspect of course is location of hotel, this can't be beat.  And the hotel isn't cheap.  More details below....  ROOM - Our room had 2 queen beds; I believe this is bigger than the bunk bed rooms, but we kind of wish we had one; I think our 3 year old

Summary Heading: Fantastic hotel and best time at Disneyland!!
Summary: We just got back from 5 days at Disneyland.  We took our little girl for her 5th birthday and our 6 month old son.  We stayed at the Disneyland Grand California Hotel and loved it!!  It is  a great hotel for families.  It is quiet, Very clean , an adult atmosphere but very kid friendly.  There is a baby swimming pool and a kid pool with waterslide.  There is also an adult pool and water slide as well ,with pool side bar.   The staff is very friendly and helpful.  The morning of our daughters birthday the hotel gave her balloons and a signed picture of the Disney Princesses.    My only complaint is that check in is slow, it took about 40 min to check in.  But the great thing about Disney is that even while you are waiting they keep you happy.  Check out, however was very fast and

We were use to the amazing experience at Disney World hotels in Florida and this was not at all at the same level.  Additionally, the easy location of surrounding (and CHEAPER) off-property hotels really made this expense unnecessary with little benefit.  Couldn't believe the Resort Charge added on at the end for the "FREE PARKING"?!?  Additionally we have also been use to outstanding food options at the Florida resort and in this particular area this hotel was most disappointing.   Pool was okay but nothing to write home about again for the cost.  Overall a disappointment!  Find a nice, friendly and reasonable off-property hotel instead.

We have annual passes, so we come to Disneyland pretty often. It can be quite tiring to tramp around the parks as adults, so we really don't like to come unless we can stay at a hotel close to the parks. The best by far is the Grand Californian. The staff is consistently helpful, the location couldn't be better, and although the rooms are small, they are pleasant. I love to sit in the rocking chairs by the fireplace in the morning while my daughters and husband sleep in. My teenage daughters love to shop at Sephora and go to the movies as well as the parks. We usually eat dinner at one of the multiple restaurants in Downtown Disney, but the food at the hotel is good. There are no in-room movies, but there are so many other things to do that it really doesn't matter. The only

Summary Heading: Can't compare to Disney World Resorts
Summary: Let me just say that when you compare this to a Disney World (DW) resort the Grand Californian is seriously lacking. It was hard for my family and me to not compare this trip to DW when we have been there so many times.  First off parking at this resort is sub-par unless you pay $17/day for valet you have to park your car across the street and cross a busy road to get to the resort. This is ridiculous IMO for a Disney property. There should be some sort of safe walk way. Check-In was fast and the front desk clerk was friendly and helpful. We arrived on a Wednesday at about 4pm.   The inside of the lobby is grand and beautiful with a huge stone fireplace that must be enjoyed at least one time during your visit....you might have to scope it out though to hit a time when all the

Summary Heading: For the Disney fanatic, but not for everyone
Summary: I have stayed at the Grand on 2 seperate occasions, one being my honeymoon.  My husband's first impression was that of mine when I first stayed as a guest... "this is it for $400 a night?".  But as a guest and Disney enthusiast you soon realize you are not paying for the room, but the location and direct entrance into DCA.  Those two things are priceless for someone needing quick and easy access to their room (i.e. I am disabled and need to rest from time to time).  The rooms with a view are worth it if you are really into Disneyland.  On our last trip I stayed up all night watching the crews try to fix the Tower of Terror sign.  The surroundings are gorgeous, business center helpful, and Napa Rose restaurant is an absolute must.  A tip for a discounted room:  Get one Annual

We stayed at the Disney Grand Californian for 8 nights in May 2008.  I can‚Äôt say enough about how great an experience you get when you stay here and visit Disneyland/DCA.  We have two children (7&9) and the rooms are just what a family needs. We requested one with bunch beds, which the kids loved (no more sharing) and the double sinks, separate from the shower toilet work very well for families. In fact the whole room design is brilliant and well thought out, as mentioned we were here 8 days and it was comfortable.  Disney channel on the TV is also great for the kids.    Even better than all of the benefits I mentioned is the proximity of the hotel to the entrance to Disneyland (less than 5 min walk) and it‚Äôs own entrance to DCA. This is worth $ when you are coming back from

Summary Heading: Fantastic location- worth the extra money
Summary: We stayed here for four nights from June 21-25, 2008.  We decided at the last minute to book one room at the Grand Californian rather than two rooms at a less expensive property (the Candy Cane Inn) given the Grand Californian's proximity to the parks and the fact we were travelling with a 3 and 5 year old who would be taking mid-day naps.  We could not have been happier with our decision.  First, we were pleased that staying in the park allowed us to take the Disneyland Express bus from LAX to the hotel, which was easier and cheaper than renting a car.  Check in was the least enjoyable part of our stay, as the hotel was mobbed when we arrived and our express check in paperwork could not be located.  But, we were given a nicer room than the one we booked, on the 5th floor with a

I do not think we have ever had a bad experience with Disney and this trip was no exception.  The hotel amenities and staff were excellent!  Our only disappointment was with the Room Service Manager, Jennifer.   Our singing and dance company had an impromptu meeting at the hotel and someone forgot cups.  Jennifer made it clear that the hotel could not accomodate us and that we needed to go to the local 7-eleven.  Thank goodness for our concierge, Kacy.  Kacy was the epitome of customer service and what Disney represents.  One simple phone call and she was able to accomodate us.  Thanks to you Kacy!

We just got back from a fun 4 days at the Disney Grand Californian Hotel. I went with low expectations after years ago staying at the Disneyland Hotel and being very disappointed. Even my cynical non-Disney loving husband was pleasantly surprised. Expensive yes but you can't you put a price on the location. I was really glad of the special entrance to California Adventure as we were travelling with our two young children and took frequent breaks from the theme parks and enjoyed the pool. We found  most of the staff to be extremely courteous and they went out of their way to accomodate special needs like meds that needed immediate refridgeration. Our quiet, clean room was on the 5th floor overlooking California Adventure - it wasn't the Ritz but was nice enough. Our bed was

If you are looking for large rooms and a great value, this hotel is not for you.  However, if you want the convenience of staying right in Disney's California Adventure park and the luxury of a nice resort and pool area, then the GCH may suit you. This was our third annual stay at this hotel, and we feel like we've been forever spoiled.  For us, we love being able to run to our room for quick breaks throughout the day.  We enjoy sitting out on the patio, watching the people and listening to the sounds below.  The kids love the pools, and we parents love the poolside drinks.   Our Disneyland vacations include a significant amount of time at our hotel, so we appreciate  the Disney Resort feel the GCH provides.   We have found that the Cast Members do their best to accomodate the

Disney's Grand Californian has, without a doubt, the worst $400+  rooms I have ever stayed at.  Of course it starts before you even check in.  Your room is preassigned so very little chance of getting one of the good views overlooking Paradise Pier.  Then, a resort fee is charged for 'use of the resort', a newspaper (which you don't get on the week-ends) and self parking.  If you choose valet parking you pay about double again with no credit for the self parking fee.   Also, 'included' is internet access which was not available in my room.    While you are preassigned a room, they won't tell you where it is until you check in, undoubtedly, to cut down on the inevitible complaining.   So we were assigned rooms overlooking the River Raft ride which is almost completely blocked by

We just returned from a 4 night stay at this wonderful hotel. We have stayed in all of the deluxe hotels at Walt Disney World, so we were expecting this hotel to be much like the Wilderness Lodge in Florida. We found this resort to be much more than we ever expected. We had two rooms, one with 2 queens and one with a king and sofa bed. The views were wonderful and the beds were quite comfy. The desk staff were so kind and when we first checked in, they told us that one of our rooms seemed to have been cancelled out. Needless to say, after flying over 1000 miles for this vacation, we did not want to hear this, but in a short time, Brendon and Caleb had the problem remedied and we were in our rooms. The maid service was good and the turn-down service happened every night without

Summary Heading: Beautiful Lobby; Excellent Service; OK View
Summary: We were lucky enough to stumble upon a great deal to fly to LA and stay at Disney's Grand California Hotel during December, 2007. The lobby was magnificent - nice craftsman-style woodwork and furniture. There were several fireplaces that a large group of people could have stood in, and the Christmas tree was huge! Santa was around for photos several times a day, too.  We checked in around 10:00 a.m., and they stored our luggage for us because our room was not ready. It's a great Disney perk!  In contrast to the lobby, we found the room to be "just" a room - nothing magnificent, although it was fine. The bathroom was nice, and the free soaps/shampoos were high-quality, from the on-site spa. They gave us turn-down service and left a disney chocolate coin on each of our pillows, so

enjoyed a two night break here with family,the hotel is breathtaking! rooms small but luxurious, the themed breakfasts are an amazing experience everyone will love, quality of food very high. The only place to stay in disney!

We enjoyed 4 nights at Disney's Grand Californian.  The room overlooked Downtown Disney and we could see the fireworks from our balcony.  The beds were comfy and housekeeping cutely arranged our daughter's stuffed animals during the turndown service.  We really loved the convenience of going back to the room to rest and have a snack.  The customer service was excellent.  As a guest, we were able to enter DL on two magic mornings, which is the only way to go.  We also entered DCA before the main gate opened.  The pools were not very crowded and it was a great way to cool off and rest our tired legs and feet.  Having poolside drink service was a special treat.  The highlight of this trip for our 15 year old son was meeting Travis Barker who was also staying at the hotel.  Travis

Summary Heading: Is this really the best hotel in Disneyland?
Summary: We just came back from a 2 night 3 day stay at the Disney Grand Californian and I have to say it met my relatively basic expectations after reading the various reviews on tripadvisor.  We were disappointed that this was supposedly the best hotel in Disneyland and for the amount they charge, you would expect better quality rooms.    We were travelling with our 2 young children (5 and 1 years) and their grandmother so had 2 interconnecting rooms. The bedrooms were quite basic but due to the dark bedspreads, curtains and carpet, the rooms themselves seemed quite dark.    The travel cot / "pack and play" they provided was very basic and came only with what seemed like a quilted crib mattress protector that did not even fit the travel cot mattress well and also had a stain on it -

Just a heads up for future travelers, i followed the advice on the Trip Advisor Forum (excellent  tips) to call the Disneyland Resorts directly to make my hotel reservation at the Grand Californian to get the best room rate--no, it's not the least expensive hotel but it's for a very special birthday.  Here's where we go off the rails: trying to put together a 2 day birthday event once you have used the phone reservation system is very, very difficult. You can't use the web site because  the confirmation number for phone reservations won't work on the web site to do anything lile "view your reservations" or "book birthday dinner" or "book priority seating"  - anything at all. All the pieces and parts of our stay are different phone numbers i have to call, no one knows anything

My husband, two young children and I just got back from a three night stay at the Grand Californian.  This was our second time staying there and it just keeps getting better. We arrived at the hotel on a day when they were extremely busy and were told we might have to wait a bit to check in to our room.  For our patience (we hung out at the wonderful pool area for two hours!) we were upgraded to a room with a magnificent view of the park and bunk beds (my kids thought they were in heaven!).  One of the main reasons we choose this albeit pricey hotel is the wonderful location to the parks, but it has so much more to offer if you have time to take advantage of it:  the pool area is so much fun (they have two water slides, one for independent swimmers, one for the little ones),

Our extended family of 9 stayed at the Grand Californian instead of Disneyland Hotel, as we had originally planned, due to some "renovations" issues. We went from a 3 bedroom suite at the Disneyland Hotel to a 2 bedroom suite and two rooms next door at the Grand Californian. We were on the third floor and had views of California Adventure Park as well as the monorail passing by.   The Artisan 2 bedroom suite was roomy and very nice. The bedroom that was part of the suite had floor to ceiling windows with plenty of room and the connecting room was also nice with a small balcony.   The hotel is definitely nice and classy but for the money the Disneyland Hotel (although their rooms need to be updated) has a more relaxing, Disney feel to it. It was a nice experience to try once but

This is a very expensive hotel, but worth every cent.  We found all of the staff lovely and were amazed by our view.  It was exactly like the travel brochure picture.  We saw the Disney roller Coaster and parts of the theme park, plus overlooked the pool below.  the convinience of being so close is worth every cent and I would definately stay here again.    Also because of the price we spent 3 days at the californian and then 2 days across the road at the Howard johnson which again I was most impressed by.  It was a third of the price and a very comfortable hotel with buses going back & forth to Disney so  it was still convinient.  But if you can afford it go the whole hog and stay half the time in Grand Californian or the whole time for a treat.

I was disappointed with the Disneyland Grand Californian.  For the price you pay, you'd think that your room would be nice with a friendly staff.    The room fit two queen beds and a small desk and two chairs.  The room also seemed very dark and in fact quite gloomy.    We had to call room service three times before an item was delivered, and the person delivering it was mumbling (most likely swearing) under their breath.  Can you say "Grumpy?". The Disney Magic was totally lost on us.

Summary Heading: My Friends Were Happy (but don't think they would have said otherwise)
Summary: This is what you get at the Grand Californian: 1) a really lovely lobby (free to anyone); 2) an overpriced breakfast (open to anyone); 3) an average hotel room at 4 times the price of a comparable room.   I was stunned at the mediocrity of the room. Very boring. The only advantage was the proximity to the parks, since we stayed in the parks till midnight, gave us a chance to change clothing.  Beware that the reservation you make is not necessarily the reservation you get. I reserved two non-adjoining rooms, one with king, one with queen/bunks. Didn't get the bunk room and the rooms were adjoining. Not the best for the couple in the king celebrating a special anniversary. Wound up with sleeping bags, which were NOT delivered as promised at check-in.  At check-in, two other groups

My family stayed at the Grand from 5/3-5/7. Our flight landed about 8:50am, we got the the resort around 11:00 room was not ready until 3:00pm(no rooms are available until 3:00 pm). The resort is beautiful and it is literally walking distance to the DisneyLand and Adventure Park.. The resort is also attached  to Downtown Disney. The restaurants are also great. My son loved the character breakfast. There are nice golf courses around the area try your lucky at: Coyotes Hills Golf Course... The hardest in the area. Walking distance to great restaurants.

I'm a bit of a Disney nut so for my anniversary my husband takes me to Disneyland for the weekend.  Check-in was great, they were able to honor our requests without a fuss.  I did have to return to the front desk to pick up our vacation planning itinerary and premium seating tickets which she forgot to give me but not a major problem.    The room wasn't ready at that time but I called around 1pm and it was ready.  I had arranged with Disney's Vacation Planning to set up a snacks/drinks, in the now empty fridge provided, prior to our arrival in the room.  I also purchased a surprise to be delivered while we were at dinner for my husband, "The Grande Finale" a chocolate box with truffles.  When we arrived at the room 4 waters were missing in the order but everything else was

Summary Heading: Great as long as you don't mind paying Disney prices
Summary: After talking to my agent at Small World Adventures (who I would highly recommend), we booked at the Grand Californian. As I was 8 months pregnant, we wanted something close by in case I had to waddle back to the hotel myself.  The hotel was very nice, clean, and had a lot of nice touches.  Nice cosmetics in the bathrooms and a fridge in every room as well as a flat screen tv.  I didn't experience the bad service that some of the other reviews mentioned and in fact, had the complete opposite experience from the front desk to guest services.  Downtown Disney however, is a complete nightmare and I don't recommend anyone eat at any of the restaurants on the street.  You'll be paying Disney prices for a non-Disney experience.  Save your money and feet and order room service which we

Summary Heading: Way overpriced and subpar to its WDW counterpart
Summary: As a big fan of WDW in Florida, our family decided to stop here for a few days during an extended vacation touring the Southwest National Parks.  I was expecting an experience similar to our vacation at the Wilderness Lodge.  However, "Disney Magic" seems to have a different meaning on the other side of the country.    Yes, the hotel is beautiful, but not as breathtaking as the WDW Wilderness Lodge.  However, the service is what truly distinguishes these two properties.  The employees at the Grand Californian were indifferent and, in some cases, clueless and uninformed.  We were routinely subjected to one Disney employee screw-up after another to the point where it became somewhat of a joke after a while.  I know it is not a regional thing, because we experienced exemplary

Our  three-day stay was part of a week-long celebration for my sister's 50th birthday.  I picked her up in Sacramento (she lives near Atlantic City) and we arrived at the Grand Californian after two days in Santa Barbara at the Harbor View Inn.  (HIghly recommended!) Compared to those accommodations the Grand was a disappointment--twice the price and not as nice.  I'm all for losing myself in the Magic that is Disneyland and when I hand over my credit card I expect to be wowed but truthfully, our room was nothing special. The beds were very comfortable but the tap water was awful and the nearest vending machine would not take any of my bills when I tried to get bottled water which, I must add, was outrageously priced at $2.75. I was able to find another machine down the long

We recently spent 5 nights at the Grand Californian; booked there through my husband's conference.  We are Disneyworld veterans, with our favorite WDW hotel being the Beach Club.  I found this hotel comparable in terms of comfort and amenities. Our room was  in the wing over Downtown Disney but was quite far from the elevator.  Our balcony faced a quiet courtyard that the monorail glided through every 15 minutes or so all day long.  Courtyard music started playing shortly after 6 each morning; even though it was Kenny G type music, it still was kind of jarring. Each morning we had a USA Today and a big basket of fresh laundry outside our door.  Each evening we had turndown service with chocolates and a sheet left for us that described the weather for the next two days as well as

Gorgeous details in the decoration and construction of this hotel.  Check in process was simple and quick, room was ready immediately.  I advise calling 2 days prior to your arrival-that is when they assign rooms-that way you can make sure your room choice is fulfilled before you are standing at the front desk.  Our room overlooked CA, was quiet and clean, and my kids loved the bunk beds.  My only complaint is that this whole place supposedly caters to kids, but there aren't any stools to enable them to reach the sink to wash their hands, brush teeth, etc.  There were a few lightbulbs burned out, but that did not affect our experience.   The Storytellers Cafe has an amazing breakfast buffet (this coming from a person who will not eat at a buffet).  Wonderful fresh fruit,

Summary Heading: Way overpriced but probably worth it
Summary: Having read some dire reviews I agonised about this booking, but as I'm partially disabled and needed to be close to the parks, I went for it. And booked the concierge floor. Good, but expensive, decision on balance.  The positives:  - The location. Can't be beat. This alone made the price worth it. - The concierge level. Very expensive and none too impressive to look at, but a good selection of quality snacks on tap all day and a calm place to relax was worth every cent. The fast-track check in was great. With the free wine and food we hadly had to buy any food in the parks. Our daughter loved the betime milk and cookies and the special balcony for watching the fireworks. And what you're really paying for is rare and priceless i.e a stress-free trip to Disneyland.   The

I stayed at the Grand Californian for the first time March 29 - April 4, 2008, with my family of four (including kids 10 & 9). We were reluctant so spend much on a hotel but realize now that Grand Californian is worth every penny.  The hotel itself is gorgeous, interesting and inviting. We arrived shortly after check-in time and there were no lines whatsoever.  Checked in without a hitch. The lobby itself is overwhelmingly beautiful. Nearly every morning we would look over the balcony into the lobby area and see something we hadn't seen before -- just fabulous. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Our room balcony had a peaceful view facing into a garden courtyard of sorts. Very calming after a day at the park (will choose this again).  I noticed another reviewer commented that

Summary Heading: Best Place To Stay When Going to Disneyland!
Summary: I will not stay any where else when going to Disneyland again.  I have been to Disneyland approx. 9 times and have stayed in various hotels.  Now that I have children 2 6yr olds and and 8 yr old I like to stay close (within short walking distance to disneyland) and have stayed at the Disneyland hotel as well.  You'll pay a bit more, but it is worth it.  The Grand Californian has always been very clean, and had very friendly staff ( we have stayed there 2 of the last 3 times we have been there).   Last year we decided to save a few bucks (try something new) and stay in the Disneyland hotel instead, I was a little dissapointed in the cleanliness, lots of dirt around door ways, bathroom and the shower wouldn't drain properly-it's overly out dated (I am not talking a little dirt

Summary Heading: Great Hotel; we stayed with a conference.  Well located.
Summary: Well located; not that crowded.  Wish they triple sheeted the beds.  We got free internet and free parking. Fireworks every night.

Summary Heading: The Best...with or without the kids
Summary: Stayed here four nights at the tail end of Spring break. Even though the theme parks were jammed this hotel offered a quiet place to rest by the pool away from the hoards of people. The staff was exceptional. This is the most expensive of the Disneyland Hotels but this was the third time we have stayed at the Grand Californian, and we will be back.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel - Perfect Location - Worth the $$
Summary: Having stayed at the Grand Floridian at WDW and never been to Cali, I wanted to stay at the nicer hotel at Disneyland. The Grand Californian was as good if not better than the Grand Flordian in many ways. If you have small children (I was traveling with 5yr old, 3 yr old, twins at 1 yr old) the GC is by far the best choice you can make. It is right on the grounds of both parks and Downtown Disney. The Disneyland Hotel looked nice too when we went for Dinner with Goofy but if you want an upscale hotel, the GC is the one. We stayed in a suite at $975/a nite.  Yes, is a little pricey but the suite was large and very well done.  Worth every penny. The rooms are clean, the service is outstanding, everyone is very friendly, and the convenience to the parks really makes a difference

I stayed here for five days during Spring Break (March 17-March 22) with my mother and 7-year old twins. It was my fourth stay at the GC and given the wide spectrum of reviews i was concerned something could go wrong but it never did.  I booked through Travelocity and thought not using Disney travel might relegate us to 'second-class' status, but it didn't. We arrived around 2pm Monday and I was bracing for long lines in the lobby but we did not wait and had a great check-in. Everyone was cheerful and gave the girls pins and post-cards. Best of all the room was ready. We were on the third floor right off the main area, which was great b/c it is close to the elevators. There was some noise from the lobby (piano) every night but it was not too bad and seemed to stop around 10 pm.

My family and I stayed here for 5 nights in November of 2007.  We found the hotel to be quite nice.  It was clean, comfortable beds, good linens, good service, etc.  No complaints, except that it is spendy.   We have also stayed at the Howard Johnson up the street, and now that we have something to compare HoJo to, we will not go back to an off-site property.  Having two seven year olds, we will always opt for a Disney property and pay the extra money.    (Since we are traveling from out of state, the convenience of being on-site and close is worth the money...)  One nice thing about being so close is that you can travel back and forth between the hotel and the parks.  We have already booked another Grand Californian stay for 2008!

Summary Heading: Great stay at the Grand Californian
Summary: This is our third stay at the Grand Californian and it has never disappointed us.  While the room is a little tight for a family of four it is clean and nicely decorated.  It is also very convenient to the two parks and the staff are all so very friendly and helpful!  We will definitely stay here again and will recommend that our family and friends stay here too!

We just got back from Disneyland last week and we stayed at the Grand Californian Hotel.  Everyone was SO friendly and the atmopshere was amazing.  You just cannot beat the location.  It was so nice to be able to walk to Downtown Disney for breakfast within 5 minutes and to walk into California Adventure park within 2 minutes of getting off of the elevator from our room.  We have a 3 year old and a 5 year old and it was so nice to be able to go back for a swim in the afternoon when the kids got tired of walking and to change our clothes at night into something warmer without really going out of our way.  As well, the night staff did an amazing job during their turn-down service at night. They took the bears that the girls had bought at the Build-A-Bear and displayed them on

Summary Heading: Nicer than we expected after reading these reviews...
Summary: The hotel itself is suprisingly stunning.  Our room was wonderful and very roomy.  The check-in process was horrible though, be prepared if you choose to stay at this hotel for a very unorganized and slow process of checking in.  Our room was not ready in time, but in return, they gave us a late check-out, but, we had to ask for it.  It is very expensive, but to be expected I guess considering they sell out and Disney has such a captive audience.  We obviously knew the price before booking, so how much can one complain about the price, when you choose to stay at this particular hotel and you know the price upfront...  We did it for the whole "Disney experience."  It was nice, no regrets.  I would do it again, but would probably stay an additional night as we really did not have

Summary Heading: Perfect for large family w/ lots of little ones
Summary: Loved this hotel, especially the concierge floor... Our family included grandparents, 2 sets of parents and 4 grandchildren (2-5 yrs old).  You just can't beat the amenities and location of this hotel.  There are a million reasons why you chose one property over another.  Bottom line, if you go to Disneyland you can't beat strolling right back to the hotel for a snack, nap and dip in the pool.  When our taxi arrived at the hotel, a guy comes out of nowhere identifying us by name and escorts us past the regular registration desk.  He shows us around a bit, then takes us up to the concierge floor.  Our kids and wives went into the concierge room for cookies and mickey mouse club, while we checked-in.  We utilized the concierge room, a lot.  I know if you break it down to the penny

We stayed at the Grand Californian March 7 to be with our granddaughter for her birthday.   The pros.The rooms are very attractive but not outstanding. The hotel has a charming, craftsman look.
