The meals at Napa Rose and the Chip & Dale breakfast were great. We didn't mind the price.  The cons. We booked a standard king room to be near my daughter's family. We pre-registered at 1 p.m. and arrived just before 3 p.m. Our room was not ready and to call after 3 p.m. Our room was still not ready at 4 p.m. and we were told it wouldn't be ready until after 5 p.m. Really! Check out is 11 a.m. - takes 6 hours to clean a room. Since we had a 6 p.m. dinner reservation this was a real inconvenience. We were offered a room with 2 queens and no sitting area. We took it. They need a larger

We have a 7yr old and a 4yr old, so we chose this hotel largely based on its location to the parks. The hotel was nice, but you're paying for the location and the overall Disney experience. We honestly didn't spend that much time in the hotel itself, so I'll simply provide a few brief comments: 1. The location is terrific. You have easy access to Downtown Disney and a short stroll to the entrance of Disneyland. You also have a private entrace into DCA directly from the hotel.  2. The Arts and Crafts theme throughout the hotel was very well done and quite impressive.  3. The pools were nice, and not terribly crowded (but this was March). 4. We had no problems storing our luggage on our arrival or departure days.  5. We originally received a room with 2 queen beds but I asked for

This place gets and extra star for the location.  The hotel was just fine.  Nice lobby, very friendly and efficient check-in, clean room (which I was not expecting based on reviews here).  We heard no noise through the walls until mid morning when we were already awake.  We got a room with a queen and bunk beds as we had our 4 year old and he thought the bunks were great.  It is not luxury but I found it to be reasonable at our $250 rate because of the location.  Had room service for late dinner and breakfast and would say it was OK.  Not terrible but not memorable but not having to face crowds of families in the restaurants was the goal.  But, the main wonderful perk of this hotel is the very short walk to get into the two parks.  No trams necessary.  This made our Disney

I tend to take other people's reviews with a grain of salt, so I had no preconceived notions about our stay.  I do not know what the other "reviewers" were whining about, because our experience far exceeded our expectations.  Disney has done it again...the Arts & Crafts style was amazingly represented from top to bottom.  Our visit to the Storyteller's Cafe was so much fun and theme cleverly carried throughout.  Expect to pay resort prices, but don't expect to be disappointed. My wife and I intend to return soon.  We had made dinner reservations at the Blue Bayou restaurant in Disneyland in order to celebrate our anniversary.  After taking the Arts & Crafts tour, we decided we will come back to dine at the Napa Rose; looking forward to that!

This is the second visit my family of four stayed at this hotel.  My children are 12 and 9. The decor of the hotel is really beautiful.  The only drawback was the lack of venues for breakfast before the parks.The Story Tellers Cafe was terrible.  The restaurant was very crowded and our waiteress too forever.  My daughter and I were finished with our meal before my husband was even served. The restaurants in Down Town Disney are much better.  The location is amazing. You cannot beat the short walk to both parks.  We are avid DisneyWorld travelers so we occasionally travel to California for a change of scenery.  This is a good choice.  It is a little pricey but worth it.  We did encounter a slight situation when the fire alarm went off at 1:00 in the morning.  We evacuated in our

Summary Heading: Terrible service, waste of money! DONT STAYHERE!
Summary: My family and I stayed here for 2 nights in the beginning of february. I knew our room wasnt going to be ready until 3pm so we checked in and left our luggage with bell service. We came back to get our rooms at 4pm and they were not ready. We tried to get our luggage...and they took forever to bring it out. We had to ask twice because the forgot or something. After asking for the manager, she came out with a huge attitude, and was no help. Finally they gave us our rooms. But then one of the rooms was wrong. We were supposed to have a bunk-bed room and it was just a regular room. The bell-hop guy was nice and he seemed upset that we had so many probelms already. He wanted to go down and tell them about our room, but i told him it would be a waste of time, and we just wanted to

Summary Heading: Comfortable Hotel; Easy Acess to Disneyland
Summary: We've just returned from a four-day stay at the Grand Californian over the President's Day holiday. After reading previous comments from Trip Advisees, we were expecting slow registration, rooms not ready, and large crowds. Happily, we experienced none of these.  Our standard room was on the third floor, relatively near the elevator, so we did not have a long walk to the room with our suitcases.  Our room faced the interior courtyard, which at first was disappointing (hotel too full for upgrades) but in retrospect, it was actually very peaceful and quiet.  The tall pines provided a nice respite from all the park noise and chaos. The only drawback was we had to leave the room and go to the park to see the fireworks.  Speaking of which, it would be nice if the hotel had a prime

We loved the service, the room, the location.  We stayed in the heart of Disneyland.  It was great!  We are going back there in two weeks.  I would rate it as good as the Monterey Plaza in Monterey, CA.  We booked it online at the disneyland website.

Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Disney Grand Californian. We attended a trade show so Disney was not our destination; however, we got cheaper rates and decided to check this hotel out for future trips. Check-in was a breeze-they were very accomidating at the front desk-did not have a king bed but gave us an upgrade with a park view. The room was spotless, but nothing special-I would say this is more like a 3 star hotel. The only complaints I have are that the rooms are too far from the elevators-which they only have 2 for this very large property, the keys did not work half the time and it is a pain to have to get to the front desk to re-make them! The major complaint is that the walls are paper thin and you can hear EVERYTHING next door and outside your room. Fabulous

We just returned from our trip to Disneyland.  We stayed at the Grand Californian after several friends suggested it.  I read the reviews before hand and was a little worried about the room but we have no complaints.  The room was very clean, nice furnishings including the flat screen tv.  We had 2 queen size beds which were very comfortable.  I prefer the vanity outside the shower area and that it how it was set up.  We had a nice balcony over looking their courtyard area and we could see the fireworks display on Friday and Saturday night.  We stayed in 3309, which is a standard room.  The check in process was very fast and everyone was very professional and courteous. We went to the Chip and Dale breakfast and the Brother Bear characters were there as well.  You will receive

I used to tell my kids that the rooms at this hotel belonged to the characters (Mickey, Goofy, Donald, Pluto, etc.) and we were just borrowing them.  Now, after all these years, I am beginning to think that mice, dogs and ducks actually DO stay in this hotel.  Cleanliness issues aside, the guests are treated like zoo animals.  No complaining allowed.  No extras.  And absolutely NO warm fuzzies at all!  Just be prepared and know, this is as good as it gets at a Disney property nowadays.  No, it isn't horrible and you will likely love it if it is your first time, but don't expect the Four Seasons or even the Hyatt, because Holiday Inn-ish is as good as it gets here!  Key cards often don't work, the rooms are never spotless, and the staff is likely trained to give the absolute

Summary Heading: Great time, as usual; little complaints
Summary: This was my 6th time at the Grand Californian.  January 27th through to 29th.  We were a foursome of two kids, 10 and 4 and two adults, mom and grandma.  Got the senior rate, which is 30 percent off the room rate so if you can find someone 60 or older to come along with you, it's worth it!  We opted to purchase the concierge services, which we utilize extensively.  We are always  there for breakfast, drag the kids back for afternoon tea from 11 to 4 and back again for cocktails  and appetizers at 5:00.  The kids loved the storytime  in the lounge both nights; first night with fabulous storytelling (forgive me but I don't remember the gentleman's name, but he was fantastic), and the second night with songs by Kim Olson.    The concierge staff is wonderful.  Scott checked us in

My partner and I stayed here for Thursday and Friday nights, January 24th and 25th.  Just us two adults, no children this time.  We had no problems and enjoyed our stay.  One major plus was that when we went to check in at 9:00 in the morning on Thursday, we assumed that they would be storing our luggage and we would have to stay in the parks until late in the afternoon, since check in is at 3:00pm.  To our delight, they gave us a room right away (room 4410, with a view of the Grizzly Rapids ride in California Adventure).  Two queen beds; nice room.  Was never awakened by noise, had no problems with housekeeping.  Granted, we were there during one of the slower months, so even the parks were not crowded.  Lucky us.  This hotel is so convenient to the two parks and Downtown

We live near by and just wanted to have an overnightstay with our daughter then hit Disneyland the next day.We arrived at 10AM and did not recieve our room  till 6pm.The next morning the fire alarm goes off so we had to evacuate for about 45min.Had our luggage held  while we went to Disneyland when we came back to leave could not find our luggage  for 25min..We called to complain and never heard back because when you call they ask what is this reguarding,you say  our stay and they ask what is the issue  and I guess when you say a complaint  your message  in my opinion is not passed on.WOULD NEVER RECOMMEND!!!!!!!!!!

Summary Heading: I have received warmer welcomes at a Funeral
Summary: My how things can change in two years.   We last stayed at this hotel in September 2005 and boy have the service levels deteriorated.  We arrived at 10.00 pm and our room was not ready!  The second week in January was not a busy time for the hotel.  We had been travelling much of the day from Vancouver.  Flight from Vancouver was delayed and bags coming off at LAX were delayed.  The hotel had been advised in our booking of our late arrival, but because of delays with flights we were later than what we had advised, so it was inexplicable that the room, a 1 bedroom suite could not have been ready.  The room was not clean - dust everywhere on lamps, coffee maker, glasses, bedside tables - it seemed that the room may not have been used for sometime - but it should have been prepared

I had moderate expectations for our stay at The Grand Californian after reading some negative reviews. However, I was pleasantly surprised time after time! The service is excellent. We got an early check-in with no problem, arriving at the hotel at 12:30 PM. Valet and Bell Services were prompt, courteous, and helpful.   Our courtyard view standard room was nicely sized and had a small balcony overlooking the monorail, which our toddler enjoyed. Everything was clean and in good working order. The tub/shower combo is pretty unremarkable, but it was sparkling clean, worked well and was just fine for family use. Having a fridge instead of a useless mini-bar is an added bonus. The beds are very comfortable, with luxury linens and down pillows. A plasma TV and DV player are easy to

We recently had a wonderful 3 night stay at the Grand Californian during the busy holiday week between Christmas and New Years. I'm only sorry I forgot to take any pictures of our room before we moved in to better show the beautifully designed rooms and amenities.  At this point it goes without saying that this is a magnificent property, ideally located close to the entrance to Disneyland as well as directly adjacent to California Adventure. The primary question about this hotel is, is it worth the money to stay here? So, I'll focus this review on a few things we learned and experienced that help someone decide if this hotel is a good choice for them.  1) As my children were growing up, we always stayed in inexpensive motels walking distance to the park. I'm still a proponent of

The rooms do not seem to be maintained.  I have stayed at three star hotels with better rooms.  The hotel is nicely located and the lobby, pool and resturants are exceptional.   Even with great facilities I cannot recommend this hotel becauseof the service we recieved.  The service was very poor and unprofessional.  They were not timely, friendly or adequate and did not live up to the expectations I had.    I am a frequent traveller who has had better service at many less expensive hotels. I would not recommend the Grand Californian Hotel.

We stayed at The GC for 5 nights in dec. Don¬¥t expect to find a 5 star Hotel, you pay the big bucks because of the location and that¬¥s it. The Hotel looks grand with a beautiful lobby, Staff OK  but the rooms are the bad part of the deal, size ok, looks in the need of an urgent renewal, worn rug, the bathroom looks like one of a cheap hotel, it does not have a door but a wood curtain and it is very small, I found a piece of cotton with some blood in it, the furniture worn and creaky(bunkbeds). The only good part of the room is the TV, it is HD brand new. You are paying a huge amount of money for a room the quality of a 100.00 a night hotel. Roomservice is expensive but portions are not as described in a previous post tiny, at least the ones we ordered. If you decide to pay for a

First let me say that I have done this trip on every budget you can imagine. Here is a trip where money was not the issue. It was all about convienence, comfort and avoiding the pitfalls of being at Disneyland at a very crowded part of the year.  I am writing this because I do not think that you need to spend the money I did to have the time of your life. Having said that I realize that each travelers needs are different so maybe some aspects of our trip will prove useful to you.  Family of 4 traveling by plane from No. Ca. Parents 38, daughter 15 and son 12. We flew into John Wayne and had a limo take us to the airport. When you get to this airport you must exit down stairs and the cab stand is right outside the doors. A cab will cost you about 40-45 dollars. The limo was a

Second time we have stayed here. Stayed 7 nights just before christmas.  Rooms now look a bit tired and dated.  First room felt like it was 1/2 mile from lifts! Also just below aircon/heating unit in the roof. This was really loud. Managed to change rooms to a quieter location.  There is construction currently going on which will add another 200 rooms. We were by the pool most days, but it was really noisy with the lorries coming and going and the banging and drilling.   I did complain about this as we were not warned when we booked. We would definately not booked had we known about the construction close to the pool. We were given free character breakfasts and $50 credit to the room. But I would have rather had a more pieceful time round the pool.

My sister, 14-year-old niece and I are Disneyland fanatics and were looking forward to our first stay at the GC. We arrived at 10:30 a.m. and our room was ready for us. The young woman who checked us in could not have been nicer. They had upgraded us to a park view room. We had a great view of the rides in California Adventure. The room was clean and well-appointed and the cleaning staff was terrific. The beds were comfortable, we were able to adjust the temperature of the room to just what we wanted and the ability to adjust the brightness of the lights over the beds was nice since we each liked reading for different amounts of time at night before we fell asleep.  The walk to the entrance of Disneyland was a breeze--especially nice at the end of a long day--and it was great

We arranged a four night stay at the Grand Californian during the Christmas holiday period, departing Jan 1. The hotel is beautiful and clean and the location is terrific for visiting Downtown Disney, Disneyland and California Adventure. That said, the regular-level rooms are not very large and barely provide adequate space for beds, dresser and small table with two chairs. Room value at Disney resorts is similar to food value - generally overpriced.  Dinner at the Napa Rose was well worth it and our group of 20 also enjoyed meals at Naples, House of Blues and a Brennan affiliated restaurant - all in the Downtown Disney area.

Summary Heading: There are more enjoyable ways to waste money
Summary: We paid waaaaay too much money for our room at the Grand Californian.  It's definitely the first time I've ever checked out from a high-end hotel feeling that we were totally ripped off.  The high points:  The room itself was standard in every sense of the word, but it was clean.  The hotel common areas are beautiful and worth a walk through if you're into the Arts & Crafts period.  If you are a guest, you have the 'priviledge' of getting in line for California Adventure (though not Disneyland) inside the hotel property instead of negotiating your way to the front of that park. We were also 'upgraded' to a 4th-floor view of the construction site next door...an interesting sales pitch which may have worked if our boys were still in the Bob the Builder stage of life, but since

We have stayed a week at this hotel every year for the past 6 years and always come away with great memories!  It is a beautiful facility with great customer service.  The rooms are really nothing extravagant, but they are clean and comfortable.  The nightly turn-down-chocolate-on-the-pillow service is a big hit with the kids!  Room service, although pricey, is delicious and servings are generous.  I highly recommend this hotel, especially at holiday time.

We've stayed at this hotel the last three years. Each year I'm surprised at the poor level of service. Every year we register in the am and go into the park. So..they know we've arrived right. We come back at 3 pm their posted check in time. Each time we told the room isn't ready but will be in 10 minutes. So we play call or walk to the front desk for 9 to 10 times. The only way to get the room is to ask for the manager and make a fuss. No apologies. In fact, they make it sound like its our problem. Too many guests etc. Don't know what to tell you other than this. Great location. Nice rooms but not 4 or 5 star quality. Clean yes. Small and lacking amenities - yes. Service and friendliness - intermittent at best. The GM should be fired and someone who understands how to manage a

I got a great deal with my annual passport, 279.00 a night and they bumped us up to conciege level! when we pulled up to the driveway they asked our name, they told us to go ahead and pull up front, we got out and our conciege was there to greet us! she took us to a private check in off to the side of the main check in desk after we checked in she took our whole family up to the 6th level showed us the the Craftman club (conceige room with food and drinks) after that our conciege gave us special pins to trade with others and one to keep for ourselves, which was very cool! They had snacks all day, treats, sandwitches, breakfast stuff and wine, baileys, beer in the evenings and cookies and milk for the kids. They aslo had nightly bedtime stories, where all the kids can come and

Summary Heading: Grand Californian Concierge - Good and Bad
Summary: We have stayed at all three of the Disneyland hotels, the Disneyland Hotel, Paradise Pier and Grand Californian. This trip we upgraded to the Concierge level of the Grand Californian. Being Annual Passholders we got a great price. Was it worth the upgrade? Not for us. But it could be for some. Read more!  You are suppose to get priority check in when you book a Concierge level room, but we didnt get that. No big deal, there was only one other family in line in front of us.   Concierge Experience: Nothing was even mentioned to us about any of the concierge benefits when we checked in, we had to ask about it. I had no idea where the lounge was, how we'd get access to it, or anything. The Cast Member who checked us in was friendly but not very helpful. So anyhow, we were too early

We took our daughter to the Disney Resorts for her 3rd birthday and at the last minute decided to bring our 3 month old along as well.  Bringing the baby was no problem because they have cribs in every room and the rooms (we just had a standard room) are large enough that we didn't feel cramped at all; even with the crib set up & a very active toddler bouncing about.  Yes it's pricey- but the beds are great, the sheets are soft & of high quality, the staff is friendly, and, most worth it of all, its so close to the parks.  I highly recommend it to anyone with small children, the convienence is worth the price.  The only thing I would do differently would be to arrange for a babysitter ahead of time on my own rather than using the service that the hotel recommends.  Because the

My wife and I live in Los Angeles and just took two of our four children on a mid-week, one-night mini-vacation to Disneyland.  We spent the night at the Grand Californian, sharing adjacent rooms (with a pass through door) with some friends, and I‚Äôm proud to say that we had an absolutely spectacular experience.  I read some of the other reviews prior to going and I was fully prepared for the worst.  Fortunately, with a few minor exceptions, I think the Grand Californian pulled it off wonderfully.  The Good 1. Any discussion of the Grand Californian has to note that the property itself is hands down one of the more impressive hotel venues anywhere in the country.  The Craftsman architecture, the attention to detail and the over the top interior spaces are truly remarkable.  The

I am writting this review from our room at the Grand Californian.  We have stayed at  the Disneyland Hotel, Paradise Pier and now the Grand.  The Grand Californian is our favorite of the three.  The convience of being right at the parks did it for us.  We liked having an entrance to Downtown Disney and California Adventure.  We even used  the Califonia Adventure entrance as a "shortcut" to Disneyland.    A plus was the annual pass holder special of $199 per night.  Even though we loved staying here I don't see us paying the regular rate of $350 a night (and up) to stay here.  That is too much money for what is basically location.  Our second choice is Paradise Pier.  We would rather spend a few extra bucks for a Disney Hotel than stay at one of the motels accross the street. We

Summary Heading: This is the best hotel and is worth every penny
Summary: We stayed at the Grand Californian 11/19 - 11/23/2007.  We always stay at the Disneyland Hotel and really wanted something different.  Boy did we get it.  We go to Disneyland all of the time and we wanted to be closer to the park.  Unbelievable convenience of staying at the Grand.  We wanted to book a Downtown Disney View but unfortunately they were sold out so asked for the Brisa Courtyard view, because it is soooo close to the entrance.  When we arrived there was not much of a wait and then we were told that we didn't get the Brisa Courtyard, instead they UPGRADED us to a pool/California Adventure View.  Our room would be ready at 4:00pm.  That is the standard for all of the hotels so please remember that and just check your luggage with the bellhop dept. and go and enjoy

Our room was booked months in advance. We arrived earlier than anticipated, we checked in our luggage and vehicle and notifed the front desk of our arrival. We were told our room would be ready by 3pm - it was not!  We encountered one uncaring employee after another who did little if anything to get us into our room. Housekeeping was to blame for the delay.. Perhaps they should hire more staff?  Close to 4:30pm we were in front of our assigned room but could not get in. None of the keycards worked. So back to the lobby we went to meet the unsympathetic employees once again.  We were not in but 10 minutes before room service arrived asking if we wanted the beds turned down. Uh. Its only 5pm!  Bottom line, the rates are too pricey, the rooms average, and you're still a good walk

Yes I read the reviews but so many were positive..that I thought I would give it a fair chance. First when booking the trip the Disney site would not let me calcualate a package deal so I ended up booking the tickets separately and found out that there was no discount for tickets when staying at the hotel.    When we arrived we valet parked and were not told it was a half hour wait to check our bags at bell service so we began our trip on an unfavorable foot.    Because we had to wait until 5 PM for check in we went on our merry way only to get back to our room that night and have the bell man bring the wrong bags!  Once the TV was turned off for the night we noticed an annoying sound coming from the celing ducts..kept me up most of the nite.   When I got up in the morning and

Summary Heading: Loved the hotel - some tips & comments
Summary: We stayed for 2 nights this December and were delighted with the hotel. It looks beautiful for the holidays and has a huge Christmas tree in the lobby! Be sure to ask when the carolers (dressed Dickens style and lovely to hear) will be around and check out when Santa will be available also. (It's free to take a picture with Santa and  talk to him, your child also receives a small candy cane, and a photopass photographer will be happy to use your camera).  We stayed concierge level which was great! When we arrived someone from the concierge service came out to meet us at our car and walked us up to the personal concierge check in. Took no more than 10 minutes. The kids received a coupon for free pins (redeem in the gift shop, 3 or 4 free christmas pins, very cute) and we were

We (two adults, two grandparents, 3 grandkids) recently enjoyed 3 (too short) nights at Disney's Grand Californian.  I selected the GC due to its close proximity to the Disney parks so my older parents could return to their room to rest whenever they pleased.  They also liked that!  We took advantage of their senior status to book a discounted senior citizen rate.  Still, this was probably the most expensive room rate we've ever paid. We loved the GC's private entrance to California Adventure--so convenient.  We often cut through CA to get to Disneyland. The rooms were roomy, clean, beautifully decorated and nicely appointed.  Beds were comfy!  We enjoyed lunch at Storyteller's Cafe and several breakfasts at the fast food place near the pool.   Parking was nearby and included in

Summary Heading: A fabulous stay until food poisening or flu not sure..
Summary: This was our 4th stay at the hotel this year. We are AP holders and used their special rates to enjoy this hotel. We stayed for 3 nights on the conierge level. This is a nice service with small kids. You get breakfast continental type items, but it is great because you go when you want and no waiting. Then sodas and water all day, lunch is these little tea sandwiches always the same, salmon, veggie and turkey and fruit. Very good, orderves at 4 pm pb sand, hot item and cheese and great snacks. And wine and beer. And then at night a special story time with cookies and milk my kids love that part oh and the choc covered strawberries are not to be missed. And they have kids activities that were fun. Cookie decorating. So for the AP rate of 279 it is sooooo worth it but for 600 the

Summary Heading: Torn...Can't Make up My Mind If It Was Worth The Price
Summary: This was our second trip to Disneyland; having previously stayed at Paradise Pier.  We decided to go all out for our Thanksgiving trip this year and stay at the Grand Californian - Double room with a view of Downtown Disney.  Housekeeping was totally erratic, coming at all different times of the day and once not at all.  Having a three year old that needs to nap, this was frustrating.  Also annoying that several times the housekeeper removed the bedrails to make the bed and did not replace them.  We enjoyed the turndown service - one evening the housekeeper arranged/posed our son's stuffed animals that had been strewn aroudn the room, which was cute.  A little creepy, but I guess a nice gesture that they take a picture of it for you to keep as a souvenier.  Paying for the

From the moment we arrived we were treated like VIP's. We arrived early and of course our room was not ready, we knew they would not be so this didn't bother us as we had reservations across the street @ Lilo's & Stitches Character Breakfast.            We were a party of 5 and the gal @ the front desk was aware that we celebrating our 6th wedding anniversary and 2 of the 3 children were experiencing Disneyland for the first time. She asked me to hold on a few minutes and she retreated to the back....When she came back she had 4  8x10 white envelopes, one addressed for each of us in beautiful writing. On the outside of each envelope was a button 2 happy anniversary buttons, 2 first time visit buttons, and for my daughter who had been before 2 collectible Tinkerbell trading pins.

I agree with most of what everyone is saying about it being very convenient, however, not really worth the money.  You're paying for convenience.  This hotel was not designed to get around very easily.  There's too much walking around inside the hotel, and it took us too long to get to our room.  As if we hadn't done enough walking at Disneyland!  :)  Also, it was a little chilly when were there, which made the hotel lobby extremely drafty, although it's very beautiful.  Our customer service happened to have been great.  They let us check in at noon since they had a room available...three hours early!  That made it nice since we got there when the park opened...we were ready to take a break.  Overall, don't expect anything other than a clean hotel close to the parks...

The hotel is quite beautiful....but the staff was luke warm. I got food poisening inside Disneyland and missed a whole nights activities. I reported this to the front desk at the hotel the next morning...and they seemed really not to care.    We were hoping for a four star treatment and really got a two star treatment from the staff. The rooms and hotel are beautiful....but the staff is not up to par. Very disappointing for a Disney hotel!

Summary Heading: Great Stay By a Seasoned Traveller
Summary: Best place to stay for a fun, no worries, Disney vacation.  Beautiful hotel, excellent location, great food, great staff, and oh ya, did I say location.  I rate this hotel very high, keeping in perspective what the hotel is and what the hotel is not. You are not going to get any better than this for an onsite Disney vacation. What bugs me are those reviews that can't seem to get past the fact that not every hotel is the Ritz, with gold embossed entrances and snobby concierge desks. I travel quite a bit to a wide range of destinations - camping to the Ritz, Vegas to business travel, I've seen a lot of hotels. The Grand Californian is a great hotel with all that you need for a high-end comfortable stay with some Disney flair. The staff were very helpful and the foods was very

Summary Heading: Way over rated and over priced
Summary: Stayed here for our teenagers 16th birthday.  And I would have to say that the problems started with the check in.  There was a delay (until 5 PM) on getting our room.  We wanted and paid for the concierge service.  When they checked us in we were told that it was an additional charge.  It seemed that the entire weekend was like this.  The place is beautiful - but doesnt seem that they want children there either.  We got rude looks from the staff as our cheer kids were hanging out by the fire with us.  The rooms were nice - but small.  We had a suite and it seemed that we were walking around things to get anywhere.  Compared to the Disney suites, I would say about 150 sq feet smaller.  Anyway - we will definately go to the Disneyland Hotel next time.

We visit Disneyland once a year and had been staying at Disney's Grand Californian, but no more.  Disney has been pushing this as a 4 star hotel, but lately the service has dropped to a 3 star hotel.  The rooms are beginning to show their age, the flat screen TVs are a nice addition, but the bathrooms are getting old and the furniture is becoming worn.  The rooms are noisy due to their location close to Downtown Disney and California Adventure.  The HVAC isn't loud enough to drown out even cars driving by.  Check in is still quick, but the "cast members' don't seem to refer you by your name anymore.  The turn down service at night is spotty.  The video quality of the Disney TV shows (the Disneyland Resort ones, not the "local cable") is poor.  Valet parking can be tricky.  If

We are Annual Passport holders, and have stayed at the Grand Californian Hotel perhaps a dozen times, always during Christmas, and other times during the year. On the positive side, reservation people are very helpful, and I have always been able to book the exact room number I ask for (the suite which overlooks Grizzly Mountain over the Napa Rose). The hotel is massive, and beautiful especially at Christmas, and the location can't be beat!. Speaking of the Napa Rose, it is fine dining at its best. Wonderful, and worth the $$$$. Be sure to reserve way in advance.When you walk past, it always looks empty, but you are looking at the small lobby area. Around the corner, the place is always full, mostly it seems, with locals.  We have always found maid service to be excellent, as

The location makes it worth the stay, but don't expect a four star experience....We booked the "luxury two bedroom suite", which turned out to be a one bedroom suite with access to the adjoining non-suite room.  We checked in at 2:30 and were advised that the room would be ready by 3:00.  We were given a number to call, and we did so regularly until 4:15, at which time we decided to check the bags with the bell stand and go to the Park.  We returned at 7:00 and were given our keys.  The hallway was lined with room service carts, mostly with that morning's breakfast remains..  We could not open the door between the rooms and could not get it serviced until about 9:00 p.m.  We were awakened the next morning by a gurgling sound in the bathroom and a horrible odor of sewage - the

Stayed her for one week in mid October.  On my last trip to Disneyland, I stayed at Paradise Pier but visited Grand Californian for dinner and fell in love.  I knew I had to stay there this time! It was pricier than Paradise Pier, but thanks to an alert travel agent, we got a "buy 3 nights get 1 free" deal that helped.   The hotel is absolutely gorgeous.  Stained glass doors greet you as you enter the cavernous lobby with a huge fireplace and plenty of comfortable seating.  We had to wait until 4pm for our room to be ready but the desk took my cell phone number and called me when it was ready.  We were on the 4th floor, near the elevators next to Napa Rose.  We were steps away from the special entrance to DCA, the pool, both restaurants and the snack bar. White Water Snacks is

We stayed just one night, a spontaneous trip down the coast with our kids.  We arrived at noon and were told that the room would not be ready before 3, which is what we expected, so we went to the park, came back right before 3 and were given a free upgrade for a suite on the 6th floor.  Very nice.  We then made several trips to the concierge lounge for the free snacks before finding out that that is only supposed to be for people who have paid more for concierge services.  Oops.  We found out when we asked - they don't ask for proof or a room number, so if you're walking by when the door opens, you're in.      The hotel is nice and, like everyone mentions, the best thing about it is the location.  The suite was great - not sure if it's worth the extra money, but the room was

Summary Heading: Can't wait to go back to the Grand
Summary: We recently had five days at Disneyland, and due to a mix-up in the initial booking, we stayed our first night at the Disneyland Hotel and the remaining 4 nights at the Grand Californian.On a previous trip we stayed at Paradise Pier, but I had always dreamt of spending time in the gorgeous Arts and Crafts styled Grand. Our room at the Disneyland Hotel was OK, (parking lot view) but nice to watch the fireworks while relaxing after a long day of travel. Really nothing special... Then we moved over to the Grand Californian, where a reservation problem (which turned out to have originated at the Disneyland Hotel check in, where the clerk ' married up' our reservations, but by doing this, put us on another families' account- which had the same last name!- Yikes, we were given room

This review is for our stay Oct 19-21, 2007.    From the moment we arrived I was pleased that valet service and check-in went so smoothly especially with the chaos of so many families arriving at the same time.    We had booked a standard room and got one that overlooked Downtown Disney and we were able to watch the fireworks from our balcony each night.  We arrived in the early afternoon on Friday and our room was ready for early check-in.  Valet service, check-in, nightly turn down service, housekeeping staff all excellent.    Guest Services was chaotic, and when we made it to the front of the line the young woman working the desk had a severe cold.  We were told there would be an activity sheet in our room (there was not) so we went to get one from her.  She said she only had

My husband and I decided to stay at this hotel when we began planning a Disneyland vacation with our two young sons, ages 3 and 1.  Realizing that a trip to Disney with young children would require frequent naps and bathroom breaks, we decided to splurge and stay at the Grand Californian for it's proximity to the park.  I was incredibly anxious about spending that kind of money on a hotel.  The minute we pulled up, I was glad we did.  The hotel staff were incredibly helpful and polite.  The interior of the hotel was beautiful and well maintained.  Every day on our way into the park we would see maids cleaning everything, from the baseboards in the hallways to the handrails on the stairs.  I commented to my husband that I would love to have maids like that everywhere in our home.

This was our 5th vacation to Disneyland with our children and everytime we go, we pass the Grand Californian and tell ourselves that we will save our money to stay here.  I booked this room and park hoppers through disneyland.com.  I always use this site as it doesn't require full payment up front and the prices are pretty comprable to other sites.  We stayed a total of 8 nights.  We usually catch a red-eye from Hawaii but we decided to catch an early morning flight and check in by dinner time.  That worked out really well.  In the past, hotel check-in time is between 1 and 3 and no rooms are available, we are exhausted and the park isn't open yet.  We checked-in  to this hotel with no problems at all.  Got a Asian woman at front desk and she was very pleasant.  I didn't lie,

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel, a few minor complaints
Summary: We visit Disneyland every fall and decided to splurge for the Grand Californian.  Like a lot of people, we had walked through the lobby, observed the balconies from the DCA park and said to ourselves "let's stay there sometime!"   Overall, the hotel lives up to expectations - rooms are nicely appointed and clean.  The bathroom is on the smaller side, but there is a large vanity with a double sink outside which is probably a better arrangment for families anyway.  We had a standard double and parents be warned that the beds are taller than typical.  We were concerned our toddler might fall off, but pushed the inside bed against the wall so he was protected on one side (and yes, the carpet was clean underneath - nicely done Disney!).  Another danger for young kids is the balcony -

Summary Heading: Hotel Employee Theft response told Disney Magic did not extend to us
Summary: This was our 2nd stay at the Grand Californian. The first stay our room was not ready at check in time. It was ready an hour late, NOT acceptable for a family with exhausted kids who needed a nap. We lost a lot of park time waiting around in the lobby for our room. But our room was fabulous, the hotel is gorgeous, location can't be beat. We got over it.   Decided to stay again this fall. Loved the pool, food court, location, UNTIL we came back to our room to discover an item of sentimental and monetary value (over $1000) had been taken from our luggage. This item did not fit in the ridculously small safe provided by the hotel, and was something many, many people would have with them on such a trip. Cops were called, hotel staff notified. The door locks are such that they can

We just returned from our Disney vacation and cannot wait to book our next.    Stayed at the Grand from Sat. Oct 4 until Wed., Oct 10th. At check in we were given an upgrade to park view and went to our room, which happened to be occupied by another family (...oops...)  Went back to check in and were given a Downtown Disney view and a $50 credit. Ok, not the best start, but everything went up from there.  Of course the price is high, but the convenience is unbeatable and the staff will bend over backwards to try and make your stay as pleasant as possible. The one tip that I HAVE to pass on is this:  the Grand offers an early morning power walk (7:30 am) that takes you into California Adventure (DCA) before it opens and you really should try to wake up for this unique opportunity

Our first stay at the Grand Californian was within a month of its opening and they were offering incredible rates to Disney fans.  Smart move. They hooked me. Now Disneyland just isn't the same without the Grand Cal...its part of the magic!  The lobby is amazing. Every small little touch, and there are amazing, will captivate both Disney fans and fans of the Arts and Crafts movement.  Take the hotel tour if you can, is well worth it.  Also, don't miss the stories by the fire. Get a glass of wine and listen to a story in the lovely lobby at 6pm when the parks might be crowded you will have a moment of serenity.  We stayed on the Concierge floor once. It was great but what I think is true best value is to book a room with a request of a view of Grizzly Peak. These have been my

Just returned from our second stay at the Grand Californian. Once again, a superb experience. Our room overlooked Downtown Disney - just above the World of Disney store. A "secret stairway" let us get to Disneyland's main gate in five minutes. Going the other direction, we could be at the hotel's entrance to California Adventure in about the same amount of time.  Location is this hotel's strongest suit, but not its only one. The common areas (lobby, pool) feel very five-starish. A tour called "Art of the Craft" that gave us an inside look into the Craftsman influence on the hotel made us appreciate the GCH even more. (The tour also included a brief visit to one of the presidential suites - amazing!)  We also dined at the Napa Rose - sat at the chef's table next to the pass and

Summary Heading: Expected a Little More...But Still Disney's Best!
Summary: Alright, check-in was amazing!  When we arrived (at 8:50 a.m.), our room was not ready, but that was expected.  However, we stepped out of the car where Jorge (pronounced George), greeted us and took us up to the concierge floor.  We went through the check-in process, and then we were welcomed to some breakfast before heading out to the park.  We were called promptly when our room was ready.  Pro's: -Room (large, luxurious, great bed, awesome TV, views). -Hotel Decor and Surroundings -Disneyland -Disney's California Adventure -Club 33 (we had connections, and had a spectacular evening at this exclusive club) -Disney Service (It's Legendary)  Con's: -Room Location (6417...Last Room, Farthest Away, Literally) -Club Lounge Selection (Read my review from: Portofino Bay Hotel,

Summary Heading: not the best of the three disney hotels.
Summary: I hate to have to write this review, but after my first bad experience at a Disney property hotel, I have to agree with some of the other tripadvisor members who have not had the best time at this "four star hotel".  I have previously stayed at the other two disney hotels , and always wanted to stay at the Grand Californian, but due to the price of the rooms, I thought I would never get a chance.  Well, for the first time that I know of,  Disney decided to include the Grand Californian in the annual pass discount rate that they do every  once in a while.  I was able to get a standard room for $219 a night, which is normally abut $380-480 depending on the time of year.  I decided to go for my Birthday, and I brought along my daughter(6yrs) my nephew(9yrs) , and my mom.   It

My 16 year old daughter and I, being big fans of disneyland ,decided to splurge and stay at the Grand Californian. At $400 plus, what a ripoff! The plumbing leaked, the in- room coffee was so stale I couldn't drink it. The room was at best average. I wrote the hotel a letter regarding my negative experience and they never even bothered to answer! Disneyland is out to soak us for as much as they can!   Signed- ex Disneyland fan from San Diego

Summary Heading: Great stay at the Grand Californina
Summary: At the end of a two week trip to LA we spent our last three nights in a one bedroom suite at the Grand Californian.  Having stayed the previous nights at the Beverly Hills Hotel  and the Four Seasons our expectations of the Grand Californian were not high but we ended up being extremely impressed with every aspect of the hotel.  Unlike the PPs experiences check-in was smooth and pleasant.  Our room was ready immediately upon arrival and we had a great theme park view.   We found pre-check in to be a huge help and would highly recommend that others take advantage of this service.  Bell service was fantastic and we found the food at the hotel (not in the parks) from restaurants to room service to be some of the best we had our entire holiday (I know shocking but true!).  Our room

Summary Heading: A Great Stay for a Good Price
Summary: We stayed at Disney's Grand Californian a few weeks ago (August 2007).  I'd read reviews here, and so did not hold high expectations for our stay.  However, we had a wonderful stay (3 nights) at the hotel, and the price (380/night) was reasonable for a California hotel in a tourist location and for both the amenities and the convenience that the hotel offered.  We've visited Disneyland and Disneyworld on many occasions and have stayed in a range of lodging types (private homes, rental homes, motels, cruise ship, Disney properties, off-site hotels).  Our Grand Californian stay was wonderful.  Our room was equipped with a queen bed and a bunk bed (requested in advance) with a pull-out trundle.  Our room was clean and quite large, and available at three pm. (Following the advice

We just returned from our stay at The Grand Californian for our Grandsons first birthday. What a great time we had. First off everyone at the hotel is extremely friendly and helpful. When we arrived they had balloons and an autographed disney photo for him. And on top of that they upgraded us to a suite. What more could you ask for. The Grand Califorian is close to everything which is great when you have small kids We will be returning in September and just changed our reservation to the Grand Californian from the Disneyland hotel. See you soon

Summary Heading: Our new place to stay at Disney
Summary: We usually stay at The Disneyland Hotel but wanted something different this time.  We arrived early and our room was not ready but that was okay since we wanted to hit the parks.  My kids loved the pool which was not that crowded and my husband and I enjoyed the pool bar.  The lobby is beautiful.  We loved our room which had a queen bed and bunk beds.  My kids loved the plasma tv and the turn down service.  The staff even took a digital picture of my daughter's stuffed animals and left it for her on her bed.  The fitness room was great.  The best part about staying there is the location.  After getting soaked at California Adventure we walked straight into a private entrance to the hotel.  Literally a two minute walk to Jamba Juice at Downtown Disney where we would get

Summary Heading: Great Experience at the Grand Californian Hotel
Summary: We stayed for five nights from July 23-29, and we were very impressed. Last year we stayed at the Paradise Pier, which, in our opinion, was worse than terrible, so it was a relief to know that not all Disney hotels operate under the same principles.  Registration: The registration staff appeared bored, but they were very professional. (It might be worth noting that although we checked in with no problem whatsoever, we did overhear 3 or 4 "mix-ups" with other peoples' reservations. We were glad that we had booked through a travel agent.)  Decor/Rooms: The hotel itself (especially the lobby) is amazing to look at, our room was very clean, larger than we expected, and soundproof (no sounds of doors slamming in the hall, etc.) Housekeeping: Our only problem with the housekeeping

Just got back.  The hotel is beautiful. The access to the parks and Downtown Disney made up for the cost. It was the perfect  location.  Hotel was clean and well kept.  Housekeeping and  room service were great.  Food was good & service was fast. The Storyteller's Cafe has a nice buffet breakfast.  The only downsides that I found were the location of our room.  It was a hike to the elevator.  Make sure you ask for a room close to the elevator.  It may not seem like that big of a deal until you get there and you see what I mean.  The only other draw back was self parking. It was across the street from the hotel, across a busy street, and a bit of a distance, but you could valet park for $14.00 per day.  Overall, great stay!

We stayed at the Grand Californian Hotel from July 19th through the 21st in a concierge room.   At check-in I came very close to changing my mind about staying at the Grand Californian, but because I had already paid in full on-line and my two teens would have been disappointed, I didn't.  The two desk clerks who were checking us in didn't seem to have a clue as to what they were doing.  I'm convinced that there was something seriously wrong with their cognitive abilities!  As they looked at the computer, I had to repeat information over and over again, even though I had given them a printed receipt showing all of my reservation details.  I'm not going to go into a lot of detail here, but it was the worst check-in experience I've ever had.    The icing on the cake was when the

Stayed 2 nights Sat/Sun 16/17 June. Arrived at 11.00 to early to check in, as I had expected. They put our bags in storage and told us to come back at 2.00, got back about 1.50, checked straight in, no queues or fuss.   \The room was beautiful with everything you could want, there is a small veranda where you can have a coffee and look over the park when you wake. At night they turn down your bed and leave a chocolate with woodland creatures on  The Napa Rose was closed for a private function the night I wanted to go this was a bit disappointing.   Staying at this hotel was one of those things my wife ‚Äúhad to do‚Äù is it really worth all that money, believe it or not, it is, the location and atmosphere make it worth every cent.

Guest services and check in are terrible.  This was the second time we stayed at the Grand Californian and the second time we got our room after check in.  The people you call on the phone after you do your pre check in are rude and not helpful at all!  The first time we didn't get our room until 4:30, this time we complained and asked who the supervisor was so we got our room by 3:30.  They are very reluctant about giving the supervisors name out, but ask and it seems you will get what you need then.  Unfortunately it is a nice hotel, one of the nicer ones and once your checked in if you don't need guest services you should be happy.  Just don't expect check in to be easy or on time and you will not be disappointed.

Summary Heading: Worst customer service experience of our lives
Summary: Unbelievably bad stay, with one problem after another: - Check-in: took the better part of an hour for 3 families + Mom, in spite of all rooms being pre-paid. - All rooms were STILL not ready at 4:15 PM, in spite of numerous requests, phone calls, showing up in person at the customer-no-service desk from noon till 3 PM. - Restaurant on premises: overcharged us by $70.00 by billing us for 13 iced teas instead of one - Character breakfast: we were refused admssion because we didn't bring our vouchers, in spite of bringing a receipt showing we had paid. The last straw: After we borrowed a wheelchair from the front desk for our Mom, Disney staff refused to let us back into our hotel from the park AT 11:30 PM, insisting that the wheelchair could not be brought into the hotel (note

I was a little bit leery of staying here after reading reviews that stated it being 'overpriced', but I have to say it was the very best of ANY Disney property I've ever stayed at! (And I've stayed at all the ones in Florida) I was amazed at how quiet the room was - especially when you consider that my room was facing the front of the hotel and was pretty near Downtown Disney! Their soundproofing is unbelievable! I was pretty impressed with everything I experienced here - from my room service breakfast to the turndown service to my airline boarding passes being printed out and held for me at guest services! The quality/freshness of furnishings and cleanliness far surpassed any of the Disney properties in Florida. Also, while there isn't really any 'travel time' here (as opposed

Summary Heading: Nice location, average rooms, APPALLING CUSTOMER SERVICE
Summary: So, here's my expereince at the Grand Californian...  I had a suitcase of extra clothes I wasn't going to wear while at Disneyland because they weren't weather appropriate. It was a suitcase I never went into during our time in the hotel.  The morning we were leaving, I opened the suitcase and took out the unused clothes to replace them with bags of dirty clothes. To my surprise, I discovered 5 hotel pillowcases and 2 sheets neatly folded at the BOTTOM on my suitcase. I was stunned to say the least. It then dawned on me that at one point during our stay, I had an eerie feeling that one of my other suitcases had been rifled through. But, since nothing appeared to me missing and we don't leave valuables in our room, I decided I was being paranoid and passed off the feeling.

me and my friend booked a room, park view room, for my birthday. when we arrived i was greeted at the entrance with a warm Happy Birthday. I was shocked how all the info is all over the place and they know imediately. well it took a while to get our room but the lady at the front desk was more than happy to entertain us until our room was expidited. she gave me a whole bunch of extra ballons and was told that they upgraded our room. When we got there we found out that they had upgraded our room to the concigner level. i was really surprised it was the best birthday yet. it really wasn't what i expected considering i read all of the negative responses. im sooooo glad i went.

Our first time there and it started Great. Staff was helpfull and friendly. The only problem we had is that we had to wait until after 4:00pm to get into our room. We asked them to hurry and we were nicely upgraded to a nicer room overlooking the backside of Disneyland where you could watch the fireworks from our balcony. The beds in the room were fantastic. In fact, I'm trying to search for them for my home.   We had one mixup and the staff helped us with a $50.00 room credit, which help resolve the missing items.  The room was smaller than I thought it might be and since the bathroom was half and half, you could hear "sink noise" when in the bedroom. The LCD TV was very nice and the service was fantastic.  The breakfast buffett was very good and since it was my Birthday, the

My family has been vacationing with Disney for over 20 years and we know when we recieve the true Disney Experience. Let me start off by mentioning that my family has owned in the Disney Vacation Club for 10 years and always make our reservations through DVC. We typically will vacation in Walt Disney World in Orlando but decided to try CA this time around and try out Disneyland & CA Adventure.     We stayed at Disney's Grand Californian. We walked in and the lobby area is beautiful and it has a really nice fireplace to get warm by at night but checking in was an absolute nightmare. We have never seen anything like it in any Disney resort we have stayed in. We had 2 different rooms in our reservation and they "gave away"(is what they told us) 1 of our rooms which we requested

Stayed for 4 nights as part of grand tour of California.   Upon arrival, valet and bell service readily available, so all good here.   Big wait at check in, followed by a lengthy process due to the inexperience of the girl on the desk - must have been her first day.   When we buying tickets for the park, I asked to purchase the "Southern California City Pass" which in addition to Disney, also includes Universal Studios plus Sea World San Diego and others.   The check in girl denied that it even existed, let alone was available from Disney.  When I insisted that she check with a colleague, she returned 10 minutes later and confirmed that yes we could of course buy this.  Unfortunately, the hotel completely ignored our request of a room with either a view of the parks, the pool,

We spent 6 wonderful nights at the GCH. The hotel is very grand as the name implies. The lobby is inviting  and warm. The staff was very helpful and courteous.   We were in a standard room facing the front of the hotel, but with the trees that were blocking the view of the road, it felt like we were in a secluded mountain hideaway, except for the monorail that would pass outside our room every 20 min or so. I loved that! We never noticed the sound from the monorail, unless we had the patio door open, so the room was well insulated. The room was well appointed. The shower head wasn't the best I had ever seen, but the water pressure was great and the temperature constant so we didn't get scalded or freeze if someone else was using any water while we were taking a shower. The flat

We booked the Grand Californian as we were travelling with 4 young kids and wanted to be as close to the parks as possible. The hotel was extremely convenient - footsteps from our room to the California Adventure Park and a leisurely 10-15 min stroll to Disneyland theme park.  When we checked in early at noon, not only were our rooms ready, we got upgraded! So the vacation got off to a great start.  The room were nice, not super luxurious or anything, but decent. The bathrooms could do with an upgrade, but it was not anything bad.  Being jetlagged, we hit the parks early, came back for naps in the afternoon when the parks got crowded and went back and stayed till closing. It worked out really well for us.  The service at this hotel was overall very good and we were very

We stay at Disneyland resort hotels quite frequently, but this was our first stay at the Grand Californian.  We were celebrating my sons 4th birthday and thought we would splurge and stay at what we thought was the best of the Resort hotels.  I was seriously disappointed.  We got to the hotel at 6:30 am and were told we would get early check-in approximately 12:00-1:00 pm‚Ä¶so we hit the park‚Ä¶our room was not even ready at 4:00 pm which is check-in and the front desk help did not care whatsoever‚Ä¶the service was not what we had expected.  We have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and the Paradise Pier and were much happier with how we were treated.  Once we got our room, it was ‚Äújust a room‚Äù nothing to write home about‚Ä¶we paid more for a ‚Äúpark view‚Äù which was the top of the Grizzly

The overall decor of the hotel is dark and uninviting - lots of dark wooden beams and not a lot of natural light which I personally didn't like. The light fixtures all have animal motives and would benefit from higher wattage bulbs throughout especially in the bathrooms.  It is very hard to put makeup on in dim lighting. The rooms are nice of average size with nice furniture and really, really comfortable beds.  The beds are great with nice linens and plush duvet!  The staff throughout the hotel were very friendly. The housekeeping staff derserve a special mention as not only did they do a good job,  I also enjoyed their sense of humour. As a single person staying in a two bedded room the housekeeping staff responsible for evening turn down service felt I should alternate beds

We were at the hotel for four days and had a room with bunkbeds.  From the previous reviews, I was not expecting much.  We chose the location because we knew that our 5 and 3 year old boys and myself would need to nap during the day and we wanted to be as close to the park as possible.  We had a nice room overlooking the front of the hotel.  The small water fountain helped to disguise some of the street noise.  The room's decor was average (but I'm not a big fan of Arts and Crafts).  We liked the fridge, robes, spa products, and flat screen tv.  Housekeeping staff was outstanding!   I requested that the room be cleaned every morning within a 2-3 hour time period and turndown within a 2 hour time period.  There was never a problem.  I also enjoyed the disney chocolates and daily

We stayed @ The Grand Californian May 15th-May 21st. Wow, what a beautiful hotel! We loved everything about it. The rooms were nice & very clean. The pools were nice, especially the one with the slide. The restaurants are very good! The staff was great! Housekeeping did a very good job-would come in to turn down the beds & would leave candy & nice little card! I have no complaints about the hotel I would stay there again in a heartbeat! It is a little pricy though, but well worth it! Now the Disneyland hotel on the other hand is awful & not worth the price!!

My wife and I stayed at The Grand Californian from May 7 - 10. We brought our 4 year old daughter for her first trip to Disneyland. The hotel has a fantastic lobby and the overall look is stylish and clean. Check in was prompt and they gave my daughter balloons and keepsakes that were a nice touch. Our room was nice, but certainly not the luxury room the price commands. The spa goodies, shampoo, soap etc were also a nice touch. The food was average and VERY expensive!. 17 bucks for pancakes and bacon at the Stroytellers Cafe. Room service was an hour wait but the woman who delivered the food was friendly and exemplary in her service. The main advantage to this hotel is the location, which is ideal! Walk out the back of the hotel and you're in the California Adventure park and

Summary Heading: Great service at the Grand California, Location priceless!
Summary: My wife and I have stayed here once before in 2005. This trip was for 4 nights mid May 2007. My wife and I have a 3 1/2 year old and 11 month old. The hotel staff could not have been better and top notch service. I am VERY PICKY regarding "service" everywhere I go. When we checked into our room, I was not excited about the "theme park" view from our room. I called down to the front desk and they got us into a room that was great! Right over the Grizzly water ride. Our 11 month old ended up waking up a few times during the night. We were concerned about the other guests hearing him, which we found out a few days into our trip that our neighbor did. I asked the hotel front desk about crying kids and hearing infants, her response to me was that "this is a hotel that caters to

The Grand Californian is a beautiful hotel. The service was excellent. The convienence of the parks can't be beat.  The food was good. We have  two children 2 and 5. Being able to go from the park to the hotel so easily was convenient and priceless for us. The pool was beautiful with great slides and comfortable lounge chairs.   The topper was when we were leaving. We had a reservation with Supper Shuttle to pick us up between 10:33 and 10:50. We were at the pick up site by 10:43 and Super Shuttle had left us. We called them and they would not come back. Jarod hooked us up with a cab right away. The hotel took care of the cab fare for us. Needless to say, I do not recommend Super Shuttle. It cost the same as a cab from Orange County airport to the hotel. From the airport to the

We stayed here last summer with my husband, and two boys aged (then) 7 and 9.   obviously, the location is fantastic. i especially liked that we had our own private entrance to the california adventure park (soaring over california was the best ride!) with no queuing to get in.  as soon as we arrived at the entrance, a valet parking guy took our car and we didn't need to pick it up until we left the hotel for good 3 days later.   our (standard) room was average, but with a balcony overlooking downtown disney. but fine. the kids shared a double bed and didn't seem to have too many problems! the bathroom was tiny, but as the sink was in a separate area, it wasn't too important.  btw, for anyone planning on going to disney during the crowded summer, i cannot recommend enough the

We were very happy to stay Disney's grand californian Hotel.  Don't expect great service.  The rooms were nice, and the location was wonderful. We especially enjoyed the pool grounds the most.  Next time I might try the Disneyland hotel.  It is too bad that the hotel is not closer to the Disneyland Park.  This hotel is very convenient for families, we have a 5 and 3 year old and our experience with the going back and forth was much better since the park was much closer.

We booked our trip online via Disney Travel in December 2006 for a March 2007 stay at the Grand Californian.  We needed a suite since we were traveling with a toddler and au pair.  We also wanted the Concierge service so we did not have to worry about amenities like drinks or snacks at the hotel.  After booking online, I contacted Disney travel by phone to confirm we had the Concierge service as part of our package and was told yes, it is part of the suite you booked.  Fine.  I had been planning to pay an extra fee, since I did not see it on the online booking.  But, I was told it was included.  Fine again.  Needless to say, we arrived checked in and no Concierge service.  The hotel was not responsive (unless I wanted to pay an extra $150/day) and Disney travel conveniently had

Summary Heading: This is the place to stay when visiting Disney
Summary: The Grand Californian is a luxurious oasis right in the middle of all the magic Disney has to offer.  The themeing here is reflective of the Pacific northwest, and the articheture is fantastic.    The cast members who will assist you throughout your stay are outstanding.  From the evening piano player in the grand lobby to the bell services staff,  nobody does customer service better than Disney! I loved the extra touches like turn down service with chocolates on your pillow, lighting dimmed, and a pine frangrance lightly enhancing the room before drifing off to sleep.  And the beds are wonderful!    The restaurants are extraordinary.....Don't miss dining at the Napa Rose.  One of the best restaurants I have ever dined at in my life!  Do not hesitate to book this luxurious and

Our family was there from March 27 to April 3. The first day we got a 2 queen beds room for the 5 of us. 3kids 2 adults.  The next day they were able to find a room with the bunk bed and a pull out.  That was better.  The only complain I have is that the room smelled terrible.  It smells like somebody had vomited. I call the front desk to see if they had some air freshener and I don't really know if they came to the room or not.  When we got back to the room @ 11:00 p.m. my daughter use the top bed and all the bedding smelled really bad.  I call again and they apologized and said they were going to send someone to come and change the sheets but almost an hour went by and nobody came.  Called back and ask them to forget about it and she slept with her sister.  Well the whole week

This is the second time i have stayed here, the first time was feb 05. This time i stayed for 4 nights, sun/mon/tue/wed. with my wife 7yrs old daughter and 4 yrs old son.  The hotel staff i felt were very helpful although we never had a problem with anything. The rooms are lovely and maid service every day. For breakfast you should book night before as there will be a long wait in the moring, if you book and are late getting there its not a problem as you will still be infront of the others that are in line.  The breakfasts here are with characters, chip, dale and brother bear and a few others depends on the day. The hotel is the best one placed for the parks and downtown disney. and you get early entry too. Try not to use the telephone in the room i found this to be really

Summary Heading: mickey and martinis - a wonderful combo
Summary: Just returned from a wonderful last minute trip to the Grand Californian.  As a stressed out mom of a 20 month old and a 4 year old this was exactly what I needed to leave behind the cares of the world.  I am a confirmed believer -There is no other place to stay when visiting the parks!  Convenience comes at a cost, but what a trip!  We stayed in room 3436, a spacious, and oversized room with two (very comfortable) queen beds, portable cribs come with all rooms and they will deliver sleeping bags and mats upon request. There was an empty refrigerator, (perfect for toddler foods and snacks) and dvd player hidden in the giant dresser.  TIPS:   If you exit the hotel and walk through downtown disney, you can pick up the monorail which delivers you into Disney's Tomorrowland,

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel.  Lots of fun.  Perfect for families.  Staff is VERY confused.
Summary: This hotel should not be confused withthe DISNEYLAND HOTEL.....    It was a great trip.  I am single and "allergic" to kids.  i was there for a business trip, yet I still enjoyed the hotel.  ONLY problem was that the staff is, or at least acted, NOT VERY SMART.  Getting the car valet was an ordeal.  Young kids are apparently the only ones working, and must be their first jobo  NO one wants to step up and take responsibility for anything.  I gave a bellman $20 to deliver a package to my boss' room--including his tickets to all events, and his schedule.  That was at 11 am.  At 7 pm they had just found the package.  My boss was upset, and I was late to my funtion due to having to spend 45 min. on the phone trying to get it.  Room service will answer after you let it ring for 40

Summary Heading: great location but average in every other way
Summary: Stayed 2 nights at Disney's Grand Californian with our 3 children. Had booked a room with bunks and a pull out trundle but at check in were told they couldn't accommodate as promised. Finally , after emphasizing that this was one of the biggest reasons we booked this hotel they "came up" with a bunk bed room. For the $400 per night you only get location. The room itself  is below average. The water pressure was awful and the water temperature was unpredictable. The carpets were filthy and their room service took over an hour on 2 occasions. The Storyteller's Cafe  (the hotel restaurant) was very average food and service. There are much better places to eat in Disney and this is not one of the ones I would recommend.  On a positive note, their bell hops at the front entrance are

My wife and I stayed at this hotel on the weekend of March 24th.  We are a young married couple expecting, so we decided to take as many trips that we possibly can before our baby is born.  My wife loves to go to Disneyland, especially for the fireworks.  Like many, I was expecting a little more than what I got.  We paid about 490/night and with tax etc we ended up paying about $1100 for 2 nights.  For $600/night we were defenitely expecting a little more upscale/luxurious hotel.  The "feel" of the hotel is like a cabin in the woods.  It almost feels like you are camping or at a retreat.  Most of the employees that were working during my stay looked like they were young high school students.  The lobby was full of "cheerleaders" due to some competition they were having.  When we

My Mom, 14 year old daughter, her friend and I headed over to the Grand Californian for a quick one night stay in Feburary.  We got a Downtown Disney view for a good Annual Passholder price, 199.00.  We arrived at 1:00 and our room was ready!  The last few times we've stayed on this property, the room wasn't ready until after 3:00, so this was a nice surprice.  We got our things up to the room and the girls headed over for Disneyland.  My mom and I went out to the balcony to have a diet Coke and enjoy the people watching.  We were right across from where the trams drop people off and it was fun to just relax there. We had dinner at the Storyteller's Cafe and it was better than I thought it would be.  The girls especially enjoyed the chocolate fondue for 2 for dessert. The room

This was our fourth stay in five years at the Grand Californian at the Disneyland Resort and it was as wonderful an experience as we've come to expect from this property.  The location of the hotel to Downtown Disney, Disneyland and California Adventure can not be beat. A couple of years ago we thought we would save some money and stay at a hotel off site, which was fine and we did save money, but you can not beat the convenience of Downtown Disney with its restaurants, ESPN Zone and live music every evening. Some friends joined us for this trip last year and decided to join us again this year but the hotel was booked. We were ready to resign ourselves to the fact that the GC was booked and we would have to stay somewhere else when our friends somehow called at the same time a

Although we paid half the rate, the hotel still was very expensive.  Reservations made for 3 A & 1 C, and towels only for 2.  Each day had to request additional.  I have stayed in top quality hotels before and this one is not one  Small rooms, small baths.    Also, my 3 year old grand-daughter got a huge sliver in her foot.  This occurred our first night around 8 pm in our room. I noticed our carpet did not appear very clean.  She screamed bloody murder for about 2 hrs. while we were trying to assist her.  We had absolutely nothing to remove sliver with.  My son is an EMT and after trying different techniques to remove the sliver, called the front desk for assistance.  They had no nurse and suggested calling paramedics. My son told them he is one himself.  But they were helpless

I have to say while I love Disney's Grand Californian, I lope that everyone realizes that what you are paying for is the location. While at other hotels with such a high price you get service to match, at DGC, I have never recognized a higher level of service than say a well run Hilton or Doubletree. So if you go in with that expectation, you will not be disappointed. I have often wondered why I consider DGC everytime we are vacationing to Disneyland, but have come to the realization that there are no luxury hotels very close to Disneyland. DGC is as close as it will come within walking distance. So i get to debate each 1-2 years if it is worth 2/3 more to stay their than at any of the hotels that are within 1/2 mile.  In the end, most years I end up choosing DGC because of

We had the most wonderful Valentine's Day ever!   As a last minute idea, I thought it would be fun to go to Disney for Valentine's Day.  To my surprise, my husband agreed...and an even bigger surprise was that they had availabilty. We went, checked in (which was wonderful) and got to our Downtown Disney view room.  It was awesome! The room was great, the service was awesome and the overall atmosphere is so positive. We ordered room service, which was wonderful for dinner AND breakfast. We went to the parks during the day and came back to our room to relax at night. Downtown Disney is a blast and so much fun. The next day was just as great, check out was a breeze and they are just so NICE! I loved my stay and I LOVED my Valentine's Day!!!

We (myself, husband, and 2 teen boys), stayed this last weekend at the Grand Californian for our annual Spring trip to Disneyland.       Even though we live only about a 1/2 hour away from the park, we enjoy playing tourists too!    Last year we stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and vowed it would be our last.   Disney may own both properties, but the service is not equal.  We figure the management at GC must be nice to work for, because the staff are actually friendly and helpful.  A far cry from the stressed out folks at Disneyland Hotel!      I'll just list the things we enjoyed and those we thought could use improvement:        Enjoyed:       The location is certainly one of the top reasons we chose this hotel the first time.  After a day of waiting in lines, the last thing you

We stayed at the GC during a few-week annual passholder discount period. We paid about $200 for a premium view room (of California Adventure--looking right at the Grizzly Rapids ride!).  We were there only 2 nights, and it was wonderful. We ate at Napa Rose one night (fantastic--they prepared a special vegetarian dish for me which was incredibly good).  The only bad experience we had was arriving for breakfast one morning at the Storyteller's Cafe 5 minutes before breakfast was supposed to stop serving, and they REFUSED to serve us breakfast. I was very disappointed at that; dying for some breakfast food!  Other than that one incident, we had a lovely time in every way.  It made it worth the cost of an AP!

Summary Heading: Parents' reward for taking kids to D-land
Summary: Our stay in November 2006 was great and I will not stay anywhere else for future trips to Disneyland. I'm not a big fan of Disneyland but the kids like it.  This hotel makes the trip to the Big D much more palatable for the parents.   *Convenience:  Private entrance to the park. No other hotel is closer, period. If you have little kids who need to go in and out of Disneyland during the course of the day, staying here will save you a lot of frustration and mental anguish.  *Cost:  Yes, it costs more than it should, and yes, there are lots of other places to stay that are a better buy, but if you're already spending the bucks on the plane fare and the 3-day passes for everybody, the extra bucks for this hotel won't be a significant part of the trip cost. For a big group with a lot

Summary Heading: Not worth the price of admission...
Summary: First off let me say that this is by far one of the most beautiful hotels I have ever stayed in or seen, but after my first stay there I came away very disappointed.
