As a very frequent guest and a Disney season pass holder I get a chance to go to the park 10 or so times a year. But because we live in Northern California we can‚Äôt afford to stay at the Disney properties. In previous visits, I‚Äôd hung out in the lobby and just enjoyed the architecture and the HUGE warm fire or the beautiful Christmas tree during the holidays. But man was I disappointed during this stay. First off we had booked a Concierge room; I was told this was the only way to go. I was told upon arrival you‚Äôll be greeted at the door and whisked away to the concierge room for personalized check in and tour of the

This hotel is not what it used to be, especially for the price you pay.  This was our fourth trip at this hotel.  Our family of 4 traveled with our friends a family of 5.  We booked online together and requested side by side rooms with a daybed and fridge.  We booked our 7 day Disney vacation directly through Disney.com.  I wanted to reserve the flights as soon as I could so I picked just a standard room (with daybed & fridge) thinking, I could upgrade later.  I paid for the vacation in full upfront (not cheap).  I called 3 weeks before arrival and was told we picked a great time to come because the Hotel was not at capacity and there should be no lines at the park.  I called again a week later to see if we could upgrade to a Concierge level room and was told I would have to

This was a fabulous hotel. Its lobby is breathtaking. With a hugh fireplace & they way its laid out you would think your in the Swiss Alps. The service is great. Lots of things we are not use to Bellhops, room service, they turn down your room at night with chocolates left behind, diming the lights for a romantic feel when you get back. It is definately the best! Very pricey but we used our vacation club. Your own entrance to Disney California Adventure & Downtown Disney. We had a room with a Downtown Disney view, it was not noisy at night. A long walk to our room but that was it everything else was awesome!! Would recommend to anyone who can afford it!

I am a Disneyland Annual Passholder and they were offering amazing rates through 2/15...I knew I would never be able to afford this place at regular rates so I decided to splurge and go for it...I stayed here on 2/9-2/11 and the place is fabulous...service is outstanding and mousekeeping impecible...beds were comfortable except I had to grab the other side of the tucked in bedding to pull myself up onto the bed lol...its very tall...we got a room on the 5th floor #5048 and it was a theme park view..candid pictures above are exactly as the rooms are...my room overlooked soarin, grizzly river run and Tower of Terror...funny thing was...people are very noisy in the hallways..much moreso than anywhere I ve ever seen...however, it didnt come into the room so no worries...if you can

This is a really nice place if you have a complete package plan and are staying a few days.  You are right where you need to be in terms of location.  There are nice touches for kids.  The woman who cleaned our room took a photo of herself with all my child's stuffed animals and left it for my daughter along with a belcap doll.  This was thoughtful.  They do everything to make you happy, such as make reservations at Blue Bayou when there are none available otherwise, give you cute buttons to celebrate things, pull your car up before you come downstairs, etc.  We take naps in the room in the middle of the day so we can stay up late and they have no problem cleaning our room twice for us.  I like it here a lot.  My one wish is the room were just a bit cleaner; but it is a hotel

My husband and I stayed here Feb. 4th - 9th. It's a beautiful hotel. I have nothing to complain about,except the price.For what we paid for the rooms we didn't stay in our room that much. It's not really a hotel for kids. It was a nice stay,We are going to try the Disneyland hotel next. Eat at the 55 on the grill at Disneyland hotel. The food was GREAT and at a good price.  columbus ohio

I love this hotel. It is so close to the parks, it's not an adventure at the end of the day scrambling to get on the tram or walk back to the hotel after being on our feet all day. That's really what you pay for here. The rooms are nothing spectacular, but nice enough. We had a standard room, which looked out into a courtyard full of trees, either pine or spruce or something. I've read that many people don't feel there is much of a Disney theme to this hotel, and I suppose that could be true, it is mostly a Bambi and forest theme. Check in was easy, took about 10 min, and all cast members were very friendly. We had them bring up our bags and extra pillows, towels, and robes, and they did it with a friendly smile. We utilized the guest services to make us reservations at Rain

We stayed at the Grand Californian from January 11-15th.  We really splurged on this one and it was a nice stay....but I'm not sure it is worth it money-wise.  We have nothing terrible to report other than one of the two sinks in the bathroom area was not usable as it did not drain properly.  We left a note for housekeeping but it was not taken care of.  The proximity of the hotel is fabulous and we were treated very well by all the staff.  The bell hops especially were so helpful and friendly.  Our room had a Downtown Disney view which I really enjoyed but it was a bit noisy at night with the music.  We participated in the hotel's scavenger hunt and had a blast..highly recommend it to families.  We were given great cookies at the end of the hunt and also were told that we had

Summary Heading: (Insert title for The Grand Californian Hotel experience here)
Summary: When we arrived for check in at the Grand Californian at 8:00am, our room was not ready. The hotel stored our luggage while we went off to the park.   Disneyland is filled with Christmas spirit right now. Holiday music is playing, the flowers are  in red and white, a huge tree greets filled with oversized presents, wreaths and sways hang everywhere. It was a little weird on the first day, however by the next day we were in full spirit of the season.   The Grand Californian has a beautiful lobby. There is a piano man playing Disney tunes and a giant Christmas tree all decorated in a more woodsey motif. The whole hotel has an early americana arts and crafts period elegance to it. I just loved the giant mosaic poppy designed flooring, the pattern is continued onto the carpeted

This hotel has the best location possible - what a difference it makes to walk out of your hotel and right into the park!!!  Plus - we enjoy Downtown Disney so that makes for easy nights when you can hang out at all the fun restaurants and go shopping and then a quick walk back to you room!  It's definitely expensive - but there is a reason why - location location location!   I could not find my cell phone charger and the valet guys searched my car twice for me which was super nice - but did not find - so every day of our 4 night visit the front desk charged my phone for me so I wasn't inconvenienced without my cell phone.  We had a very long wait to get checked in our room so that was a bit of a hassle - extremely long time with each new check in so that must just be how it is

Summary Heading: beautiful lobby great location very expensive for what you get
Summary: Stayed at the GC for three days after Christmas. Last time we were at DL we stayed at the Disneyland hotel. This property is new and very beautiful. The lobby is gorgeous- especially decorated for the holidays. The rooms are very clean and plush. We had a room with bunkbeds for our kids. Very cool! They have an entrance straight from the hotel into California adventure- which is very easy to use. It is a bit of a walk to the DL entrance or the monoral entrance. You may have a room that looks out into downtown disney- our room was a little loud when we had the doors open. However, you can see all the action.The staff is helpful although one of our family members had a problem with his room and the hotel did nothing to find another room for him- until the manager came out . We

Stayed two nights at the Grand Californian the first week of January. Our room was ready when we check in at 9:30 am. We did the valet parking. Bell service brought our luggage straight up, we walked through Downtown Disney and were in the park by 10:00am.   The location can't be beat.  I thought the room was good sized. We had two very comfortable queen beds and were upgraded from standard to a pool view. There was a little balcony and you could see part of California Adventure from it.  My son swam in the heated pool and enjoyed the water slide.   The housekeeping service was exceptional. Our room was very clean and we were never disturbed by them knocking early and one day we slept until 9:00. We had turndown service done both nights of our stay.  The valet service was nice.

We had a great stay at the Grand Californian. The best things about the hotel were the location and the service. We had an excellent mousekeeper (did cute things with my kids stuffed animals each day), always came on a timely basis, did turndown service, etc. We never had to wait for a bellman, they were always prompt. The location for the Disney parks cannot be beat. The hotel is very pricey and the rooms are small so you do feel that you are paying a lot for a little. But, if you look at the hotels positives of location and service, then you will not mind as much. If you feel that you need a large hotel room, then this is not the hotel for you. We, however, felt location and service were more important and we much preferred the GC to a previous stay that we had the Disneyland

We stayed three nights at the Grand Californian, including Christmas Eve and Christmas Day. It was everything we expected and hoped for and more! Our room was large, quiet, and well decorated in  an elegant manner. We had a resort view that was fabulous. The only leaning we had to do while viewing was to see the fireworks. The staff was enormously helpful and full of the Christmas spirit. We had purchased a Christmas tree amenity for our room and it was waiting for us when we entered the room. It was delightful and very Disney. (When we checked out we had a good laugh with the valet parking attendant trying to get that tree in the trunk of our daughter's VW! He did it, though, and didn't squash Minnie or Mickey.)  Christmas eve we dined at the Napa Rose and it was a wonderful

When the hotel first opened, we were really excited.  The first couple of years we went, we were very impressed.  But each time we went, it was just a little less magical.  Things like the room not being ready when we were told it would be, going to the room and the bed wasn't made and housekeeping had obviously not been there yet.  Cold showers in the morning....  And the rates just keep rising.  I suppose as long as people are willing to pay the high prices and the occupancy rate is equally high, it won't get any better.

As DVC member, we exchanged our points for the Concierge Level at the Grand Californian, with a park view.  It was wonderful.  The view was terrific, the food was great in the Concierge Club, plus it is the best place to watch the fireworks.  The lobby was wonderful.  They had a big fire in the fireplace on the one day that it rained and the characters came around.

The Grand Californian's location cannot be beat.  The rooms are average, but only for sleeping anyway.  With 2 children under the age of 3, this was the perfect hotel (come back to the hotel in the afternoon, and return after the kids had their nap).  There is no need for a car, although you will be paying big bucks for meals in the parks and Downtown Disney.  After being spoiled at this hotel, I cannot stay at any other Disneyland hotel again.

My wife, daughter, and I spent 4 nights at the Disney Grand Californian Hotel in conjunction with the inaugural Disneyland Half-Marathon run. This was our third visit to the property and had a great time. Lots of attention to detail in the architecture of the hotel and if you are a Disney buff, it is a treat. Our room was on the 3rd floor overlooking the California Adventure theme park. Room was nicely appointed with comfortable beds, big bathroom, and an excellent balcony. Worth the extra money to have the park view.   The proximity to Downtown Disney and the two parks is great - we just valet parked the car and forgot about it for the long weekend. Service is good, though the restaurants run pretty full on the property. Our best bet for a quick breakfast was to go to the White

Summary Heading: Toddler to Teenagers - all our boys loved it!
Summary: We stayed at the G.C. from the 20 - 29 of Oct. 2006.  We do not normally stay "on property" when we visit for just a few days, but because we were staying for 10 we wanted to be comfortable and closer.  I was nervous because of some of the reviews I have read, but our stay was amazing.  To start, they upgraded us to a pool/park view, so we could see the maliboomer and orange stinger from our balcony(which is also non-smoking - a nice touch), we had booked a downtown disney view via AAA. (big discount that way, lots of extras, including enhanced fastpass)  We had requested a refrigerator, which was there, and had called ahead to have the Disney vacation planners leave a welcome basket, which was also there when we checked in.  I had ordered baby supplies from babiestravellite,

Was quite disappointed with this hotel. Whist it's lobby area is impressive, the room ceratinlt wasn't. Booked a theme park view room. The view was as stated, but the room was very ordinary for the price we paid. Decent beds but ugly furnishings, no mod-cons, and an antiquated bathroom with some plumbing problems. For $325 a night + taxes, this simply is not worth it. Huge queues at check-in, young, smily staff who are helpful, but not very knowledgeable. The hotel works due to it's excellent location-right at Disneyland, Disney's California Adventure Park and Downtown Disney. Personally, I would not stay here again. I would pay half the price for a room with same amenities & style and get the regular shuttle to the parks. The Grand Californian Hotel is simply not worth the

Summary Heading: Nice but not the grandest of hotels
Summary: We recently spent 3 nights at the Grand Californian.  The location can't be beat.  The walk to Disneyland is closer than any other hotel by far and the private entrance into California Adventure was nice too.  Traveling with 2 toddlers it was so nice to be able to leave and re-enter both parks so easiy.  The room was very average in my opinion.  It had the nice looking arts and crafts style furniture like the lobby but the quality of the furniture was bad.  One of the doors on the TV cabinet was broken and the bunk beds made a very loud creaky sound when my son climbed the ladder to the top.  Not what you'd expect from a higher end hotel but not a deal breaker either.  We did have that same musty smell in the sink that others have complained about.  Maybe if you get a room with

Summary Heading: Best Disney vacation my family has ever had!!!
Summary: I looked at trip advisor before booking my trip, and I was worried about small room size and a host of other problems some people had experienced.  We had no problems.  The walls weren't too thin, the room wasn't too small, the beds were great, the room was clean (and everything still looks/smells new), the customer service was excellent, there was no strange smell in the bathroom, the maid service was great, and we simply couldn't have asked for a better experience.  It was a relaxing and stress-free experience.  I'll admit the room was not cheap, but I thought overall it was a great value and worth every penny.  The room was not huge, but my family of 5 (two adults and three kids) was quite comfortable all week long.  We had a resort (theme park) view room with two queen beds,

We split our vacation between the Grand and the Paradise pier. I was expecting a truly wonderful room after seeing how nice the Pier was. Unfortunately I just wasn't impressed with our room at the grand.  There was no real closet to hang clothes, just a small opening good for pants and some hooks on the wall next to it for longer clothes.   The only thing in the room that was at all Disney was a shower curtain with some Bambi animals on it.  The beds were comfortable and soft, but it seems that all of the hotels have gone to using pack and plays for small children so our son wasn't very comfy. They did give us what looked like a mattress pad to use in the pack and play but it didn't fit. The walls must be very thin, the first day we heard a unhappy family trying to handle a

We just got back from the Grand Californian and had a FABULOUS time!   We found the convenience of the location bar none the best part of the hotel.  The service was also outstanding, as every request we had for the hotel was answered immediately (in less than 5 minutes).  We had a slight problem with the iron in the room and our problem was addressed by housekeeping management promptly and appropriately.  The hotel is beautiful, as most of the reviews state.  We did not use the pools, but did notice kids swimming in them so we assumed they were heated (it was only in the low 70s while we were there, a bit chilly for swimming with a non-heated pool).  We ate at Storyteller's cafe for lunch one day and while it was good, it was pricey for what we got.  We also ate at White Water

We took our 2 and 4 year olds to Disneyland for 4 days.   Booked our room on the concierge level for the extras.  What a lifesaver!  Our room overlooked the California Adventure park and when kids are staring at that while in the room, they want to go.  Having that concierge room, with the food and drink all day and night was a blessing.  We could take the kids down the hall to breakfast immediately in the morning. Then take some waters and apples to the park.   At lunch, they had sandwiches. At dinner they had beer/wine/appetizers.  And the best thing was at 8:15 each night they had storytime.  One of the hotel's employees would set up pillows on the floor and all of the kids would sit for storytime.  And the adults got to watch and drink Baileys or Kahlua and eat cookies.

This hotel is very pricey but you can not beat the convenience of the location. 5 minute walk to Disneyland. Direct access to DCA. Direct access to Downtown Disney. This was by far the most relaxing trip we have had to Disneyland. (we've made the trip the last 5 years)  We have 3 small children (6, 5 and 5 months) so not having to deal with driving to the park or catching a shuttle from the hotel was a huge plus for us.  We had a park view room with bunk beds. Our 5 and 6 year olds LOVED the bunk beds. Our park view was overlooking DCA but the pool views are also very nice. (you can still see DCA over the pool area)  Hotel was fully booked but noise was not an issue for us. Some of the rooms are pretty far from elevators though so you might want to check a room map before

Summary Heading: Worst hotel on our two week trip
Summary: My first coment when we got to the room was how small it was for the money, this was the most expensive hotel I have ever stayed in.  The information packet in the room mentioned that the terry robes hanging in the closet were for us to use and not a gift ,and we would be charged if they were missing.  I called and said we did not have the robes and was told that they would be delivered that night. No robes, finally after several days of calling, I was promised that they would not be charged to us.     The water in the sink went down the drain up into the other sink with black nasty water. I called and that was fixed.  The drain stunk so bad of a moldey smell, how could the plumber or the maid miss it?   The chairs in the room were not clean. Something that looked like pancake

We atayed at the Grand Californian the end of September, 2006.  We had called several times in the weeks leading up to this trip to request a "view" room and were promised that we had one.  When we requested a king bed along with our view room, we were told that you either get a King Bed or a View room (not both).  When we arrived after a 7 hour drive from San Francisco at 11:30 p.m., the front desk staff was very cheerful and happy to assist.  When we got to our room, we found 2 queen beds and no view.  My husband called to complain and told that we could not be moved as they were full for the weekend (it was Thursday night).  The next day, they called and told us that they found us a room.  WE WERE MOVED TO A KING BED/VIEW ROOM.  WOW!  I thought that they didn't exist.  This

Summary Heading: An Excellent Place for a Honeymoon
Summary: My husband and I spent our honeymoon at Disney's Grand Californian and we had an absolutely wonderful time.  It was a true "Disney" experience.   A honeymoon at Disneyland and at the Grand Californian comes with many perks my husband and I were not expecting.  They happened right away too.  When we were checking in, the girl working the desk asked us if we were on our honeymoon and we told her yes.  She asked us to wait right there and she disappeared for a couple minutes.  We were a little confused at what was going on, but she arrived back shortly with a bouquet of balloons and a congratulatory picture of Donald and Daisy Duck, complete with their autographs.  We were given buttons to wear that said "Just Married" on it and the cast members were congratuating us the whole rest

Summary Heading: Expensive, but worth it if you want to live the dream
Summary: We stayed in the beautiful Disney property for two nights in August. Let's face it, for many of us - at least those coming all the way from Europe - you want to immerse yourself fully in the Disney experience. And this hotel did the trick.   Our boys 8 and 10 are old Disney hands now. We've been to Disneyland Paris several times and spent a week in Orlando three years ago. This proved to be a great stop at the start of our three week Californian road movie. You pay top dollar, but overall it is worth it for the atmosphere, the friendly-service and the convenient location and you know you won't be here every week of the year.   Getting the full experience was also the decisive factor in going for a park view room. The rooms are standard, good quality disney, large enough, Queen

My husband and I took our two children (2yrs. & 8mo) to Disneyland for just a quick getaway.  We decided with 2 small children, that proximity and convenience were the main issues that we were going to have to deal with.  Well, the Grand Californian took care of all that.  We reserved theme partk view w/ concierge service for 2 nights, and though it is quite pricey, it was well worth the money!  We checked in at 9am, the bell hop took our bags, and we headed out to Disneyland.  We recieved a call from the front desk to our cell phone that our room was ready (12:00).  It was just in time because the kids were getting hungry, and tired.  We went up to the room, and there was the concierge greeting us everytime we got off the elevator.  Once we went to the room, we would take turns

During our honeymoon road trip, we stopped here for 3 days and 2 nights from 9/20-9/22.  We did valet parking (self parking is across the street) and check in went smoothly.  We also bought our park tickets at the desk.  Our room had a view of the pool area with a balcony, and it was great!  You could see the California Adventure park, and we had no issues with noise even though the hotel was close to sold out.  Being able to walk right into the California Adventure park was a HUGE perk, in addition to also having an entrance into Downtown Disney.  We weren't staying for a long time, and having minimal transportation time really enabled us to enjoy our visit further.  We ordered room service for breakfast one morning (YUM) and dined at the Napa Rose another night.  We went on a

Summary Heading: Great hotel, will come back next year!
Summary: My husband, my parents, our 2-year-old son, and myself stayed at this hotel from 9/5-9/8.  We had a wonderful experience here, and we will definetely stay here again next year.  Here are some tips that we would like to share with everyone:  CHECK IN:  People are very friendly here.  Our room was ready when we arrived at around 3pm.  The total check in time was less than 10 minutes.  We got the kind of room we booked for which was with 2 queen beds and a portable crib.  THE BETHROOM:  The bethroom has 2 sinks, a dryer, and a coffee maker.  They proveded shampoo, conditioner, soap, lotion, and shoe mitt.  The shampoo, conditioner, and soap looked nice but the quality was kind of cheap.  It's a good idea to bring your own if you're picky on the quality of shampoo/conditioner.  We

We had the privilege of winning a trip to Disneyland which included our accomodations at the Grand Californian Hotel for 4 nights.  We were completely blown away by our experience there.  I can't talk about the value of the room for the dollar, because it was free!  But I know if I had the money, if we ever go back to Disneyland, I would love to stay there again.  I was travelling with DH, my parents in their 60's and 2 small children, ages 3 yr. and 5 mo.  We requested rooms next to each other and were given rooms that had an adjoining door.  That was great!  We also requested a fridge as we picked up food for breakfasts and it was no problem.  I took the advise of other people who had posted reviews and requested that our mini-fridge that was full of food and drinks to

Summary Heading: You know what to expect when you stay with Disney
Summary: Excellent Hotel, very comfortable. Typical Disney Hotel with friendly and obliging staff. Always feel a bit let down by Disney restaurants as healthy options and organic alternatives are not readily available.

My family (me, DH and 4 year old daughter) visited Disneyland with some friends at the end of August.  Though we live in So Cal, we decided to stay for a night to enjoy more time at the park.  We took advantage of the "Southern California Family" special that ran through August.  We got a Downtown Disney view room for $220.  This was a good deal.  We also pre-purchased our tickets when making our reservation.  The check in at Grand Californian was one of the most pleasant experiences I've ever had.  They had a steward greeting everyone in line and answering questions.  Linda checked us in and just made everything so fun and easy.   Though our room was not yet available, we had keys given to us.  We stored our baggage with the bell desk and went to the park.  You are given a

We stayed at the Grand Californian just before Thanksgiving 2005.  It was busy but we didn't feel like just another face in the crowd.  The room was immaculate and a perfect size for the four of us.  The vanity is separate from the bathroom facilities, which really helps when everyone is getting ready in the morning.  The turn down service with Disney chocolates on the pillows is a very nice touch.  We love rustic atmospheres and the Grand Californian didn't disappoint!  The ambiance is great.  The Storyteller Cafe has delicious food.  The only thing we would change is adding items to the menu.  We thought the menu was a little limited.  The bell service was great.  Since we went just before Christmas, we had lots of purchases.  Someone was at our room in no time to help us

Summary Heading: Location is the best part of this hotel
Summary: My family and I just returned from our 7-night Disneyland vacation and stayed at The Grand Californian.  Having stayed at the Disneyland Hotel in our previous visit, we were anxious to stay at The Grand Californian this time around.  The thing that stands out is the LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION.  It was very convenient to be able to walk right back into the hotel to change our clothes after getting soaked on the Grizzly River Run.  It was also nice to be able to walk right into the heart of the Downtown Disney District from the other side.  The lobby itself is beautiful and very rustic with large, overstuffed chairs and sofas, the grounds are immaculately landscaped and there are two pools, one of which has a slide.  The one thing I would warn guests about, though, is the

You have to remember when you stay at a Disney Hotel this is not your average 5 Star experience - you are paying for convenience, the Disney experience and convenience.  I just got back from a 2 day stay over the weekend of August 18-20.  The hotel was very similar to the Animal Kingdom Lodge in WDW - grand open area, a bit dark.  We had read that check in was slow, getting your car back from valet was slow, food was expensive and not good and views were not good from rooms.  We had none of those problems as check in was quick, with a nice young cast member waiting to escort us to the counter.  We tried to upgrade to a view room, but the hotel was sold out Friday night - but it didn't matter.  Our standard room had a view of Downtown Disney and was on the 6th floor.  The hotel

Summary Heading: Just Forget the Dough and Go!
Summary: My wife and I and our two kids (ages 2 & 4) just returned.  Just like so many other reviews for this property, the hotel was Fantasmic!  Seriously, a truly wonderful 'Disney' experience.    We stayed in a suite, although a bit more (about $900 with concierge lounge access), we felt it was well worth it.  The concierge lounge was wonderful, the treats were all excellent and the staff extremely friendly and helpful.  We have also done a first class Orlando trip and we thought that the Grand did a much better job than the Animal Lodge in Orlando.  The food, room, service, etc., were all much better.  Make reservations for everything you can well in advance, as the waiting can be a real bummer.  Forget the dough and just go......life is too short to pass on the truly terrific

Although the Grand Californian is Disney's nicest hotel, you may be disappointed, as we were, if you are expecting a truly luxurious hotel.  The outside decor and common areas are very nice and transport you to Northern California.  We were disappointed by the rooms (above average definitely, but not luxury level as Disney claims) and definitely by the customer service.  Probably a great option for out-of-towners who will appreciate the location, but not worth it if you live in town.  We thought we'd make a mini-vacation out of it (we're from Los Angeles).  But for $400+ a night, I would much rather stay at the Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons or any "true" luxury hotel.

I am a travel agency owner and have stayed in some of the nicest hotels in the world, but sometimes people equate price with quality and that is simply not the case. Some of the most pleasant experiences we have had were in moderate hotels or places where we simply had low expectations. I always tell my customers to stay in a hotel that is better than the one you stayed in last time. The reason is that our prior stays affect our expectations. We compare amenities, service, facilities even though we may not realize it.   That said, after several dozen trips to Anaheim over the years including on wonderful and another disappointing stay in the Disneyland Hotel, I caved and agreed to try the Grand Californian. In the area are true deluxe and luxury properties...those at Laguna

Summary Heading: The place to stay at Disney
Summary: Stayed here with family of 5.  Day bed is large enough for teenager.  Expensive but worth it because of short walk to both parks.  Parks were very crowded at this time of  year so it was nice to be able to come back to room for break during the day.

We just got back from our trip to Disneyland.  We stayed at the Grand Californian and except for a few glitches, the trip was great.  We stayed on the concierge level this time and it was definitely worth it....we did not have to wait in line to check in, our room was ready on our arrival, and we saved a ton of money on food and water by going to the lounge several times a day.   The one disappointment was that our room was not on the 6th floor.  They stated that all of the rooms were the same size, but I had read reviews on this site that led me to believe that was not the case.   We made the reservations in December 2005, so it is not clear to me why we could not have a room on the 6th floor.   Apparantly, they overbook the 6th floor and if you stay for a short time you have a

Summary Heading: The only way to see Disney is by staying here...
Summary: My daughter, mother, sister, and I just returned from a 2 night stay at the Grand California. What a wonderful experience. Upon check in I asked to purchase an upgrade and we were given one without charge. Everyone was very friendly and happy to help us with every request we had. We booked the conceirge level and it was well worth it-Breakfast, snacks, waters, beer/wine, hordourves and late night treats were offered complimentary every day, all of it done with the Disney touch and tailored to children as well. They even have late night story time for the little ones. Very easy walking distance to both parks from the hotel.  Staying over the weekend allowed us early entry into Disneyland, which was worth the heafty hotel price, especially with a 4 year old.  The room service

Having stayed at many deluxe resorts at Disney World, we were a little leary about whether this hotel in Disneyland would measure up!  We were not disappointed!  Not only does it offer all the amenities that you can think of, but the location is unbelievable!  It gives new meaning to the term "park hopping"! We had a room on the 6th floor because I had requested a room with a daybed!  This room accomodated our family of 5 very comfortably!  We even used "Pinnochio's Workshop" one evening for our littlest family member.  The turn down service was also a nice touch! Also, the proximity to Downtown Disney gave us many choices for meals!! This is a wonderful hotel in a magical location!!

First problem was a 20 min wait in line just to check into the hotel.  Not a good way to start in a 395.00 a night hotel. When we finally got to the room, it was not completely clean.  I found a large pill on the floor ( looked like a antibiatic), hair in the bathroom, crayons on the floor.  Either a poor maid job or a late late check out.  I ordered a steak sandwich for dinner, they sent up a chicken sandwich.  My wifes and boys order's were correct. Food was good.  Room was very small for three people. We checked out a day early and went to the Marriott Newport Beach, which was excellent at half the cost.

What a fantastic Disney Hotel!!!  We just got back from a 4 night stay with 2 adults & three children ages 5, 5, and 7.  We chose this hotel over the other 2 properties because it offered a bunkbed with one queen room (what's better than all 3 kids having their own real bed to sleep on)???  WOW, were we not disappointed.    The hotel has only 6 floors but is huge.  The Whitewater Cafe next to the pool is a great value and never had long lines.  We would spend 5 hours in the 90 heat at the parks in the a.m., go back to the hotel to eat at this Cafe & swim for 3 hours, and then back to the parks when it cooled off for another 4 hours.  Depending on which end of the hotel your room is at, will determine whether you are closer to CA Adventure or Disneyland.  We happened to be closer

Loved the Grand Californian. When we first walked in we all knew we would like it here at the GC. The lobby had many comfortable seating nooks for private conversations and a large fireplace many chairs in front of it. The check in was fast and quick for us, but it depends on the time you get there and the time of year. I believe that the morning is the best time to check in. The rooms were very nice, our room had a queen sized bed and a bunk bed with a trundle. Perfect for a family of 5! The location of the hotel is perfect, it is right near Grizzly River Rapids and Soarin' Over California. Also since we stayed in Jan. when one of the kids got wet, they were freezing. So we took them back up to the hotel and ordered some hot chocolate and took a hot shower. All in all, I loved

My husband and I stayed at the Grand Californian for 3 days and enjoyed every second!!!! The room is excquisite! Done in the Arts and Crafts style the room is large and beautifully decorated. Every night they have turn down service and place Disney chocolates on your pillow. The beds are luxurious and are on a platform that places them off the floor. Very ritzy!!!!  From housekeeping to the front desk to the staff at the shops and restaurants, everyone is so friendly and helpful!!  You have direct entrance to California Adventure and to Downtown Disney. Very convienent when you have packages to drop off or want to take a break from the park.  The Story Teller Cafe is fun and the food is great! But if you want a fantastic splurge, go to The Napa Rose. I have eaten at many fine

I have never in my life seen such a beautiful hotel. The service is magnificiant, and the pool is great. However the pools open at different times, resulting in waiting.The storytellers cafe is so good that my family has never eaten anywhere else. Although, the Character Breakfast is a bit pricy, so I wouldn't do it again. The park is also great and close to the hotel. Try to get a view of Downtown Disney or California Adventure. My family got a room once that viewed a flat wall. At the bottom, there was a blacket, garbage bag, and a water bottle. Of course... we moved to another room. The service is also great. Room service food is good, but more expensive than walking down to White Water Snacks, or the Storytellers Cafe.  Even though the room price is expensive, this hotel is

Summary Heading: Great hotel, but you better have money to stay at this place.
Summary: We checked into the hotel on June 25, 2006 for two nights.  When we got to the security gate; they checked our name to make sure we were guests of the hotel.  Mind you this was on a Sunday afternoon when we arrived and the car area in front of ‚Äúcheck in‚Äù was busy.  You had many people checking out while there were a number of people checking in. I got out of my car and checked in the hotel while my husband waited outside for a bellman to be available. The lobby of the hotel is HUGE. It was pleasant with a piano player playing Disney songs.  There was a HUGE fireplace where people were sitting and enjoying the ambiance.  The lobby was busy, but you can still relax there. The girl at the desk smiled the whole time while I was checking in.  She provided me with the notes for the

We have been to Disneyland numerous times but have never stayed onsite so this was the first time shelling out the big dollars for a Disney Hotel.  Staying at the Grand Californian was the best money we have ever spent and from now own we will not stay anywhere else.  We just loved everything and could not find any faults during our entire 9 day stay.  The staff, the location, the rooms,  the food - everything was perfect!!  We can't wait to visit again.

My son and I spent 6 nights at the Grand Californian Hotel and throroughly enjoyed it. The location was superb and we found it very easy to return to the hotel at various times during the day without having to sacrifice a lot of time. The room was a standard double queen and we didn't bother to upgrade to a view (we faced the Disneyland Hotel across the street). It was clean and comfortable and supposedly had a safe, although we never could find it! We ran into the  issue with the items in the refrigerator being on a sensor, but the hotel had no qualms about removing the items from our bill.   Although clean and well kept, the pool was just average. We ate at both the Storytellers Cafe and the Whitewater snack bar and found the food to be very good. We ordered room service one

My husband and my two kids (4 and 3) just returned from our two night trip at the Grand Californian.  Overall...we had a great time.  We stayed in their standard room with two queen beds.  Our veiw consisted of the other rooms as well as the monorail.  My son absolutely loved the view of the monorail that passed by our room every 10 mins or so...at first we were worried about the noise...but when the patio door was closed...we could not hear it at at.  The room comes with a refrigerator however it's stocked with stuff you need to purchase...and if you move it...they will charge you since it's on a sensor.  Because we had young kids...we needed a refrigerator so we just asked housekeeping...and they brought one up for us to use for free....great!  The hotel is very nice and

We added a night at the beginning of our trip after a bad stay that we shortened elsewhere.  They had us reserved for four nights (instead of three) in a minute.  We were able to upgrade our three day tickets to four day tickets for only an additional $20 per ticket.  We loved the Grand Californian.  It reminded us so much of the Wilderness Lodge at Walt Disney World in Orlando.  But it had it own special magic.  Being able to walk right into Calfornia Adventure from the hotel was a great perk.  And being right next to Downtown Disney was as pretty neat.  Walking over to Disneyland from the hotel was a breeze - either enter through the main gate or take the monorail over to Tomorrowland.  We had a wonderful dinner at the Storyteller Cafe - a great buffet for each of us.  We also

Friendly check in staff although the rooms weren't available when we got there. Had a pleasant lobby where you could sit in comfort and a small area off this with a fireplace.  Great location - the ability to just walk to Disney Marketplace and both theme parks was convenient - especially when you went on the water rides and didn't have to get back into a car all wet.  The rooms were a little dark but otherwise fine. Initially our tv didn't work but they got to us fast and fixed it.  Beds were comfortable - ours weren't too soft.  Room service was also very prompt - twenty minutes was twenty minutes.  I asked for a quiet room as I need a lot of sleep and it wasn't until the last day that we realised that a monorail went by - so soundproofing was not an issue.  The laundry room

It had always been my dream to stay here, always my dream to walk to the pool wearing one of those cool Grand Californian monogrammed robes. My dreams came true!!! And it was just as great as I expected. From check in to checkout, it was the little things that added up to a welcoming stay: the valet, the checkin procedure (room wasn't ready but we got our keys, room number and a phone number to call to check up on the availability), even the free Internet access in which the Disneyland logo comes on your laptop screen and then says "Have a magical day!" were such nice touches. I have a bad hip, and the location can't be beat for convenience and for letting the kiddos out on their own into the park for the first time. First thing we did was buy the Grand Californian mugs at

My wife myself and our 6 year old boy stayed at the Grand California to see how the other half live from May 22-27 2006.It was all we expected and more. We got to the hotel at about 2:25 pm and checked in no problems at all our room was ready, we had a standard room ,only problem was my wife noticed it was across from the ice machine, I said No problem it has a door on it(was I wrong as my wife reminded me at 11:30pm,when people were yelling down the hall to GET MORE ICE DUDE!! waking us all up UNTIL 12:30pm) It was ok though at 6:45am an excited 6 year old and mom and dad can make a lot of noise he he he.I went down to the front desk and asked to be move, they were very helpful within 15 minutes we had a new room, I asked for a fan to help keep the noise down( just in case).
Clean, comfortable and close to the park...but a freakin rip off...save your money for the rip off at the park and stay at the clarion...just as nice and a lot cheaper

Summary Heading: Love the Grand Californian, but some problems
Summary: We are locals and have stayed here 6 times in the past 2+ years for mini-vacations. Our kids are 5 and 2 and LOVE Disneyland. The Grand Californian is hard to beat. As everyone else has said, the location is ideal. The lobby is very nice with a large fireplace, and the restaurants are good, if a bit pricey.  We stayed here for 2 nights last week. They upgraded us to a view room, which was nice, and our room was ready at 3pm (the first time we stayed here we weren't able to get into a room until 4:30pm, so check-in time can be a problem). One of the other reviewers mentioned hearing strange noises at night. The first night we were there, we kept hearing strange noises from the room above us- it sounded like a marble was rolling around on a hardwood floor. Very strange. Needless

We stayed 8 nights at the Grand Californian from May 11-18.  My husband and I, our 5 yr old and 3 yr old.  We absolutly loved every minute of the stay.  Service was great, we arrived at 11:30 am check-in was quick and the room was ready for us.  We were so pleased!   We stayed and the Disneyland hotel two years ago and it doesn't even come close to the Grand.  Firstly, the Grand has so much more to offer... Many restaurants, the White Water Snack is awesome and quite reasonable.  The ambiance in the lobby is stunning, the rooms are much more cleaner, bigger and newer than the Disneyland Hotel.  Service is great and every request was done quickly.  The location is great especially if you have young children less walking to get to the parks and Disney District.  My son loved the

We splurged and booked a concierge suite.  We stayed Christmas Eve and Christmas night.  At check-in the concierge staff met us in the lobby and greeted us by name. We requested a resort view and were given a view overlooking both the pool and the resort.  Amazing!  Concierge was wonderful with plentiful food, activities for the kids and even  Christmas Eve visits by Christmas Carollers and storytelling by Santa.  I loved being on the balcony with music piped in for the fireworks.  Our overall experience was great.  The room was roomy and clean.  The proximity to the parks was unbeatable.  I am sold on the Grand Californian!

Summary Heading: Unbeatable Convenience! But hotel parking needs attention...
Summary: Just got back from a great trip to Disneyland. 6 of us total, 4 adults and 2 kids ages 3 and 12.  Stayed 3 nights at the Grand Californian.  Checked in 5/14.  Got there at about 2:30pm and both are rooms were ready.  2 adjoining rooms and 1 with a roll in shower as 1 in our party is disabled.  Rooms were very clean and goodsized.  decent bathrooms with a double sink.  I appreciated the balcony and our bed was extremely comfortable.  The hotel is really nice.  Great lobby and the atmosphere is very calming even though there are a lot of people going through the hotel.    Super location to downtown Disney and the parks.  The convenience of the proximity of the hotel itself is worth the $320 a night.  You should have seen the throngs of people at 10pm on Sunday night waiting in

We stayed in the Grand Californian for our 20th wedding anniversary. We stayed 4 nights, it was wonderful! Everything in the hotel was spotless, the staff was very friendly and the beds were very comfortable. The hotel itsellf is gorgeous! Everything I would expect from Disney.

Summary Heading: Great Location, Great Food, still pricey
Summary: We loved the Grand Californian Hotel.  We found the Nappa Rose to be of outstanding quality.  The Spa had just opened and was operating out of a suite, however, the serivce was outstanding as well.  The only glitch we had was the first room we were assigned had not been cleaned yet.  It appears to have been a glitch with their computer system.  We were relocated quickly and our bags moved for us.  The second room was very nice and clean.  The only thing about the hotel is the price seems to be a bit out of line with the quality of the rooms. However, I guess you pay for the outstanding location.

What a huge DISAPPOINTMENT!!!    First, check-in was at 3PM, but the room was not ready.  After more than a few calls and almost two hours later we got our room.... room #3417.  I was very disappointed with the size of the room, the amenties, and especially the cleanliness (the lack of)!  Hair on the bed sheets, "stuff" stuck to the under side of the comforter, bathroom not cleaned, etc.   You get the idea.  Secondly, I wake up at 4 in the morning, with my skin itching like crazy!   Can't be bedbugs at a 4 star hotel!!!  YEP, bedbugs!!!  BEDBUGS!  Called down to Guest Services, they said they have NEVER heard such things!   Oh, brother!   I am not looking for to sue or for anything.  I just wanted to inform them so they could do something about it for the next family getting the
Stayed for three nights.  Allowed early check-in.  Great room that was very big.  First class service.  This hotel rises above all other for a Disneyland stay.

I have stayed in both hight end and low end hotles.  Although priced as a premum hotel, the property falls short of "Disney" expectations.    Why?  Check-in was a nightmare, (overall lobby chaos, long lines that moved very slow, non-existent valet, we carried our bags (and infant car seats to the check in line, just to name a few issues))  Although we had asked for an early check in becase of nap times, we were able to get into out room at 4:30.    The rooms are adequate, but nothing special.  I am not knocking Holiday Inn, but that is what the room reminded me of when entering.    The best feature - You pay for location and like others have said, it's hard to beat.    Pool - disappointing.  It's Disneyland for gosh sakes.  Again, far from anything even above average let alone

I have not actually stayed at this hotel for a few years, but I payed this gem a visit just recently, and I can assure you that nothing has changed since I had stayed there. Let me begin by saying that, overall, this hotel is AMAZING.       The service couldn't have been better. From the concierge, to the front desk staff, to the waiters and waitresses at the restraunts, they were all kind, and gave a new meaning to the word 'accomadating'.      The rooms were comfortable, big, and clean. The hotel is also convienient.(it's in California Adventure)       This is one hotel that I won't forget, and would return to in a heartbeat. Grand Californian-I salute you!
i don't think that i will be able to stay anywhere else if i ever go back to disneyland again.  just to be able to walk right into the park is worth the room price.

stayed at the grand californian for a week beginning second week of september '05.  having had a few months to reflect here are my lasting impressions. got there about 1pm, went to the park and when we got back the rooms were ready. yes, the rooms were small, the food was expensive and nothing special in the family restaurant. i tipped the maid and asked her to leave a few more chocolates at the nightly turndown. she literally showered the room with chocolates. towels outside the room every morning with newspaper. all the plumbing worked just fine. beds comfortable. staff very nice. very helpful in planning our trip to seaworld in san diego. small deck off the room large enough for two people to sit and have coffee and read the paper in the morning and enjoy the california

We checked in with the hotel around 11am on Sunday the 9th around 11am. The told us our room would be ready after 3. The bell desk was very nice, and stored our luggage. On to California adventure. Easy. Our room was not ready until after 4 pm. Not a big deal, since we were in the park having fun. Service was great, rooms were spotless, beds were comfy. We have 2 girls 13, and 15 they loved it. They could hop down to downtown disney and shop, the walk to disneys front gates was very short, or you could take the secret entrance to California Adventure and scoot across to Disney. No problem. The whitewater snacks was very reasonable for a resort snack bar, under 50 dollars for 4 lunches, 2 beers and 2 sodas. Tables inside and out, very relaxing. Storytellers was okay, food was not

My husband and I try our best to go to Disneyland every fall after the kids are in school.  To best see the parks is to go 2 days.  The best way to stay over night is to stay in a Disney hotel.  I'm sure the other hotels are great, but if you really want to be "Wowwed" you MUST stay at Disney's Grand California.  It's amazing!  If you're a fan of Art Deco, the 1930's, or Cabin-meets-mansion, this hotel is for you!  The fireplaces are huge, chairs are welcoming, main lobby is amazing, staff is great, and the rooms are wonderful.  Plus you can get into California Adventure an hour early through the secret entrance.  You wont be let down.  Please book the Grand Californian!  If, for no other reason, it's to see the adorable valet employees in their outfits.

Check in time is 3:00pm We got into our room and 4:45 only after much calling and finally insisting on something being done.  We had two rooms reservered only one was finally ready at 4:45 the other was ready by about 5:30.  Housekeeping has a real problem.  We wanted the best view which is that of California Disney.  We could see part of the rock bear and if we leaned out our balcony we could see the Mickey rollercoaster. This to me was not the best view and not worth the $350.00 a night we paid.  On the up side the staff all over the hotel are great. We ate at the storytellers cafe and the snack bar and both had great food and service.    They need to fix check in and housekeeping problems and let you know that their best view may not be a total view of the park.  I probably

If you ever get a chance to stay at the Grand Californian, you have to do it. My family checked in early,went to Disneyland till 3pm, rested up and had dinner right there in town. We had our balcony on the town street and we could not hear a peep. You get tons of pillows and the beds are great. The next morning we ate and took the back way for geast only to California Adventure. Best time I have ever had at DL.

Recently stayed at the Grand Californian. Spring Break rates of $300-345 per night. As stated in other reviews, the convienence of this hotel can not be matched. Not in DisneyWorld and not at Disneyland. From anywhere in either park to your room in 5-10 minutes. No trams or monorails, No drive down the freeway. Walk out the gate and into the hotel. Hotel has a direct entrance to California Adventure park. The rooms are very well maintained and clean. Unfortunately, the rooms are simple motel rooms. King Bed or Queen bed w/ bunk beds. Limited space. Small bathroom with tub and shower curtain. Very similar in square footage to a Marriott Fairfield Inn or any major convention hotel. For these rates, I expected more. Nice touches are turn-down service and early entry on most

The location is unbeatable, and service is wonderful!  We arrived before check-in time so our room wasn't ready but we were able to leave our bags with the bell desk while we strolled around Downtown Disney.  When we got to our room, we had a nice view of Downtown Disney and the fireworks spectacular every night.  The turn down service was impeccable!  They left the chocolates and also a guest services itinerary for the next day. The Story Tellers Cafe is great for breakfast and for meeting Disney characters like Chip & Dale, Koda & Kenai, and Terk.  White Water Snacks is also great if you want something quick and for you "old schoolers", they have Ms. Pac Man, Galaga and Star Wars Trilogy arcade games.   I highly recommend this hotel if you want to stay close to the action and

if you are going to Disneyland for several days, and have young children like we do, you need this hotel! We have tried other alternatives, and you can not beat the location and convience of this hotel. The staff were most friendly (except for the snippy gal named Adena at the C/A park- hotel entrance... they assured us she would be reminded about guest courtesy.) It was wonderful to be so close to both parks. It allowed us to tag team with the kids- if one of us got tired, the other would take a child to the pool or to the room for a nap, with little effort. We saved alittle bit of $ bringing our own snacks and going to the local market for milk/juiceboxes/fresh fruit/lunchmeat. Getting the mini fridge was no problem. We did go to the Rainforest Cafe for dinner one evening, but

I was in town March 23-27 for a trade show and decided to give the Grand Californian a try on the companies tab.  On a normal trip to Disneyland I would have overlooked this hotel due to the extremely overpriced rooms.  I brought along a couple of huge Disney fans in my family and let them take advantage of the short walk to the parks while I was working.    Unfortunately I didn't get to spend much time at the parks but they did and loved the five minute walk and private entrance into Cal. Adventure.  We brought along plenty of snacks and lunch making stuff to cut down on food costs (the park is way too expensive).  It was really nice to be able to head up to the room for a quick bite to eat and then back to the park, five minutes away.    Check in was a breeze, they didn't ask

This is a wonderful hotel.  No doubt about it.  I really liked it.  But it is  really, really, really expensive.  If you want the general perks of staying on-property, you can pay less for them at Paradise Pier or the Disneyland Hotel.  GC is closest to DCA, as it flanks the park, and a short esplanade walk to Disneyland Park, but this by no means proves that the other on-property hotels are "too far" by comparison;  they're not.    I stayed with a friend in a DCA view room on the concierge level.  Our room was very nice - lovely large bathroom with marble floor tiles/hairdryers/the usual nice-hotel assortment of toiletries/&c., removable wooden clotheshangers, and a DVD player included in our TV armoire.  The concierge lounge was large and pleasant, and it was really cool to by

Of all the Disney hotels, this one was the best.  Checking in and out was great, room service was great and the location was great.  Yes, this hotel is pricey but well worth it.  We stayed on the 6th floor which provided concierge services.  If you can afford this service and you have very young children, then you should get it.  When we check in we went to the lounge and had lunch where they provided fruit, sandwiches, drinks, etc.  It gave us time to freshen up.  Then they called me on my cell phone while I was at California Adventure to tell me my room number.  We ate one night at the lounge for dinner and of course had breakfast there every morning.  It was great because our kids were able to walk around and did not have to be seated the whole time we were there.    Also, it

Summary Heading: Best hotel  but a few little bad things I have to tell you about.
Summary: Nice to get away from crowds and get treated like royalty.  The other Disney hotels have crowded lobby's, they seem understaffed and like to pass you off as a problem so someone else can deal with you.  This is not the case with The Grand. They are the type to say 'my pleasure'.    When a day is shadey or rainy they will entertain the children with colouring with Chip and Dale. They have babysitting at night for kids 5 - 12 yrs old.  My child LOVED it.  We dropped her off there 4 nights.  They have a great time, then at 9:25 pm they go to a special area and watch the fireworks.  I wouldn't have put my child in for so many days but she loved it SOOO much.  Now in the gym, there is a steam room with a shower in it.  So nice to get all hot then shower off with cold water right in

This hotel is awesome.  I work in the hotel industry and this place puts everthing else to shame.  The staff are amazing for customer service and the rooms are spotless.  Yes the location is fab but you could almost forget where you are when inside the hotel.  Yes it's not cheap but it's well worth every penny.  I'll be back just as soon as I can.  Oh! and next time they will have a new spa!! What more can a girl want.

Summary Heading: If you can splurge, this is the only way to go
Summary: We stayed three nights over Presidents' Day weekend with our 7, 5, and 1 year olds.  We were in a basic room, for which we paid $280 on a AAA web rate.  We get to Disneyland once or twice a year.  We've stayed at the Hyatt in Garden Grove (just down Harbor) two or three times, and the Residence Inn next to the Hyatt once.  We also stayed a night once in a really seedy Ramada.  Assuming we can keep the rate to around $300 on future trips, we're never staying anywhere but the Grand Californian.  Assuming a reader of these reviews is someone trying to decide whether to go to the GC for the first time, I'm going to try to hit the highlights, the needs improvement/that-was-kind-of-odd points, and address some of the points raised in various reviews that I think could give an

Summary Heading: GREAT Location!!  Why would you stay anywhere else???
Summary: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Grand with our 2 kids (ages 2 and 6 years).  This was such a treat!!  Our 2 previous visits were at 2 star motel at the Disney Maingate area (kind of icky to say the least) and at the Quality Inn.  The Quality Inn was okay but too far for my liking when you've got small kids.  Most of the time we ended up walking it because we'd either miss the shuttle or the wait was too long for the next one...  I didn't know if I had made the right choice after reading some of the reviews... but after our stay, I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else!  The hotel was a little pricey but worth it considering the location.  Everything was so close it was sooooooo convenient.  The monorail and maingate were a few minutes away, Downtown Disney and the

I gave this hotel a 3 out of 5 because you are basically paying for location. We got a "good deal" through AAA for $280/night, but after the resort fee & taxes it came to $325. The room was not at all worth that much - in fact it was just as nice as the room at the Marriott convention center where we stayed last time & paid $85! Our view was of the monorail.  We live in Seattle and wanted a mini-trip so we flew down for 2 nights so we figured we would splurge and stay here. It was nice being so close to Disneyland and Disney California; I especially liked Downtown Disney!  The pool is also really nice, they have very nice lawn chairs w/ cushions.  On Saturday night I called Disney Dining to see what the wait was like at Naples Pizza place and was told there was no wait at all so

I grew up near Disney World and have stayed at several of the Disney resorts there.  This was my first time to Disneyland and I was uncertain of where to stay, and how it would compare to the World Resort properties. I read many of the reviews on this website and narrowed it down to this Hotel and the Disneyland hotel.      We ended up choosing this hotel, and we were so impressed. The inside is beautiful!  Upon our arrival, the front desk was so friendly and super helpful.  We even got a few insider tips on where to go for the fireworks and the parade. I mentioned it was my birthday and the cast member came back with a bunch of balloons, a birthday pin, and a signed photo of Mickey and the gang.  (if you wear the pin in the park, cast members will tell you Happy Birthday all

We stayed at the Grand Californian for 5 days/4 nights in March 06. These are the things we liked:  GREAT LOCATION: Makes it nice to come back for afternoon naps for the kids. Access to California Adventure through the hotel. Downtown Disney has monorail for early morning access for the hotel guests. Make sure you bring your hotel charge card paper that shows your name on it and not just a hotel room key. They will not let you board without it. We didn't realize that you had to have that and they made us leave and go back to the hotel to retrieve it even though I had other verification that we were hotel guests. Once I brought it back, the woman at the front of the line hardly even looked at it. A little frustrating and time comsuming. So much for early access.  CLEAN ROOMS:

Summary Heading: Location great though expected much more quality for the price
Summary: Not sure it was worth the money.  For the proximity to the California Adventure and D-town Disney perhaps it was worth it.  The rooms were nice but the walls were paper thin.  Shampoo and other things like coffee were Motel 6 quality.  I could hear people setting their change down on the tables from the room above us.  Anyone that walked down the hall who spoke could be heard in our room.  Since most kids were up around 6:45am running and screaming down the halls this can be a problem.  Just expected more out this place.  Than again location location location.  We paid 1/3 the price for a room twice the size at the Marriott across from the Anaheim Convention center.  Very nice new hotel with a free shuttle.  May do that one next time.

I stayed at the Grand Californian with Disney Vacation Club members for three nights in February in a two-queen room. I am used to mid-level hotels. Therefore, I was wowed by the gorgeous lobby, pianist, and lovely fireplace with plush leather seating (nice at the end of a cold day). Stayed on the fifth floor- partial view of Downtown Disney and Monorail.     What did not impress me was the following.  Firstly, I ordered two (pricey) gift baskets to greet my friends upon their arrival. Although I was asked (twice) for their names and mine upon ordering (for gift tags), the baskets were delivered without either. Friends therefore thought gifts came with the room :( No big deal, really, but I expected better service from a four-star hotel. Not ordering gift baskets, you say? Well,

This was our first time staying at a Disneyland Hotel property.  What a great experience!  The Staff were so friendly and helpful.  We are a family of five and stayed in a room with a queen size bed and bunk beds.  My 11-year old son and five-year old daughter loved the bunk beds.  My one-year old slept in a pack and play which she is used to at her daycare.  We placed the pack and play between the bunk beds and queen bed...plenty of room.  One morning we ordered room service to save time going to a restaurant...the food was so good, it felt like we went to the restaurant.  Housekeeping responded quickly to our request for extra pillows.  It was Labor Day weekend and they were still quite busy.  The last morning, we went to a restaurant (can't remember the name)in the hotel by

Summary Heading: How Can You Stay Anywhere Else?
Summary: We always have just walked through this hotel as a short cut from our usual stay at Paradise Pier. We decided it was time to step up and stay here. We were so excited and were not disappointed in any way. Not one little thing! Everything was perfect! We most enjoyed the balcony and pools/jacuzzi/sauna so very much. We had a quiet and pretty view of a coutyard where the monorail would gilde by. Next time we will add a day to our trip to really enjoy the whole resort and maybe take a day off in the middle from the hustle of the parks to just relax. There is so much to do in the Downtown Disney area and it is right at your doorstep here. The food, service, cleanliness, atmosphere was more than we had hoped. We did not have a chance to use the spa or the child care but they both

Summary Heading: Unnerving resemblance to the Overlook, and just as grand
Summary: We stayed for 5 days and really enjoyed the hotel, with it grand fireplace and incredible attention to detail.  We could not help but notice the resemblance to the Overlook hotel in the Shining.  Rolling items over carpet tile sounded just like the little boy on his trike.  Grand rooms with enormous chandeliers, looking down on a grand piano.  The pianist himself looked ghostlike.  The rooms were roomy and nicely furnished, with wooden doors on the cabinets and closets, and headboards.  A little dusty around the hallways, but then such a huge hotel, it has to be expected.  Outside fireplace in an area that was reminecent of the hedge-maze.  Even another fireplace in an enormous bar area, you expect to "Jack" sitting quietly at the bar with a crazy grin on his face.  We searched

Although this hotel is pricey, it is worth it.  I have never been in a cleaner room with more comfortable beds.  The room was soundproof and all staff were very friendly and more importantly sincere people.  The pool is excellent with a fun slide for kids.  The convenience of getting into California Adventure and Disneyland is also worth staying here.  The Storytellers Restaurant is excellent.  Downtown Disney is great to shop and eat (Rainforest Cafe...don't miss) and is so easy to get to.  I have stayed in Good Neighbor Hotels before and never again...I am loving the Grand Californian.

Summary Heading: Location was worth the price nothing else seemed special
Summary: We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel one year ago so decided to splurge at the Grand Californian this year.  Upon arrival, our room was not ready so therefore we decided to eat lunch at the Story Teller's Cafe.  The Chicken Caesar Salad was excellent.  After lunch at about 3:15 PM we went to check on the room.  Again we were told the room was not ready & that we would have to relocate to another room after the first night.  There was no reason given other than blaming the Walt Disney Travel Company for a mix-up. Being tired & frustrated we were then offered a room a the Disney Hotel with adjustments made to the cost.  We refused & then was given three complimentary Character Breakfast tickets.  We then went shopping and returned an hour later at 4:30 PM to check our room.  Still

After reviewing the posts we decided to stay at the Grand for a family celebration.  We took two of five granddaughters for three days.  We arranged for the conceirge level which at the spur of the moment did cost us a hefty penny.    We drove from Northern California and arrived in the afternoon on Friday.  We were greeted by Cast Member Arnie who took us directly to the elevator and to the conceierge level on the 6th floor.  After a few key stokes and obtaining the necessary check-in information, we were shown the conceirge room and explained all the ammenities and then taken to our room.   We had a view of the inner courtyard...(recommended for quiet) The room as previously reported, was not as large as the DH but nice just the same.  Our oldest granddaughter is 17 and liked

Summary Heading: I would highly recommend this hotel!
Summary: The Grand Californian was the happiest hotel on earth!  I stayed with my mom and I and we had so much fun!  I would never stay anywhere else.  The cast members were so helpful and they made us feel very special.  I am a clean freek and the hotel was so clean.  The turndown service was awesome and the next time I stay there I want to stay on the concierge level.  Location was everything!  Before staying here we always stayed across the street and we hated that walk, but the GC was so convenient.  It is expensive but it is well worth it!  Everyone should get a chance to stay here!  It was beautiful!

Reservations failed to mention that a double room had one Queen and a set of BUNK BEDS and not two Queen beds, as reserved for a room with 2 doubles for 2 adults.  Just a little slip in sales!  Not too great for senior citizens!  At least inform us in advance, and then we can make our own decision if we should choose a bunk!  The problem was later corrected but did interfere with activities.

Summary Heading: Loved It! Won't stay anywhere else again!
Summary: The Grand Californian is gorgeous, but its best feature is the location - it is incredibly convenient to both parks and to Downtown Disney. We got a pretty good expedia rate for our rooms (less than $200/night). The rooms were comfortable and very nicely outfitted, and both were surprisingly quiet - even the one that overlooked Downtown Disney. Valet parking service was faultless, and we appreciated the convenience of being able to buy our park tickets from the front desk.  The hotel provided helpful services such as printing out our flight boarding passes for free.  We arrived at noon and the hotel was able to give us one of our rooms right away, which was an unexpected bonus, although they did not accommodate our request for rooms that were near to each other (our rooms were a

I am a big Disney Fan! Have now stayed at all three Disney Hotels in Anaheim. We stayed at the Grand California for Christmas. Our check in was fine, but no hide-a-bed asked for back in July. Got a Queen with bunk beds & my son loved it. Bathroom very small compared to the Disney Hotel. Room also bigger at D.H. Yes the lobby is Grand & walking to the elevator not a big deal. My room was always clean. We had 6217 very quiet area with outside balcony over looking the front of the hotel not bad. Do not pay for the view when your not in the room. Now that I have tried them all and some more then once. I like the Disneyland Hotel best. Also if you do not valet at the G.C. you will have to walk a long way. Also anyone can use the Disney California enterance! I will be back but will

Summary Heading: Another Great Visit to the Grand Californian
Summary: When we checked in, our room was ready (no one around us seemed to have the same luck though, unfortunately), but I had to wait over 10 min for the desk clerk to find our itinerary. Once in the room, it was all good :) We had ordered the Christmas tree and stockings and they were in the room within 10 min of our arrival. The view was fantastic... we couldn't have asked for better. We stayed on the 4th floor and had a view of DCA. We had appetizers in the lounge in the Napa Rose and they were wonderful. The Hearthstone Lounge was exceptional as well - though they said they had hot butter rum but they didn't. In fact, she said they haven't had it for some time. You'd think they'd take it off the menu then! The decorations in the lobby were breathtaking. As always, the character

The hotel lobby is simply beautiful...in fact - the hotel was built with great attention to detail everywhere.  We loved that aspect of it.  Rooms are basic - a bit high end in some features...some nice decor - too much money for what you get in reality...but it's Disney and it's the Grand so you pay.   You can't beat being on the park grounds...I've stayed off the grounds before and much prefer this.  If you have grand parents...or kids....there is no beating the convenience.  And thats what your paying for.  The staff is great - it was so crowded over the Thanksgiving holiday....but the staff always was nice.  Food was suprisingly good that the Storyteller cafe....and enjoyed it.  You are right in downtown Disney so everything is an option for you.  Our room was couryard

I‚Äôd like to preface this Disney‚Äôs Grand Californian review with the following: thanks to this web-site, I was able to gain multiple reviews before staying at the resort, and likewise my expectations were not that high.  Rule Number 2: Don‚Äôt run the 6 inch stop sign that stands so short next to the guard shack that even Dopey would miss it.  They will belittle you for it.  I booked a theme park view with two Queen Beds for 4 nights during early December 2005.  The hotel itself is very attractive, and very large.  We were fortunate enough to have a room next to the elevator, so getting around was very easy.  This in and of itself was worth the extra money we paid relative to other hotels.  However, had we not been near an elevator, I can see how inconveniencing this would be ‚Äì the
Best hotel stay ever, great staff, very helpful and courteous. Accommadations top notch!

We stayed in the Grand Californian for 3 nights.  After reading many bad reviews, we didn't have high expectations.  To our surprise, it was excellent.  When we arrived, the valet was quick and attentive.  We arrived at 9:00 a.m. so obviously our rooms weren't ready.  We requested a king size bed and they accomodated us.  We left our baggage at the bell desk.  They were also very quick and friendly.  They said to call around 3 to see if our room was ready and it was.  When we got to our room, we called the bell desk for our luggage and it was there in less than 10 minutes.  The room was clean and spacious.  Our rooms were cleaned everyday before 1 p.m. - we usually went back up to the room for a break around that time.  The location alone was worth the price and convenience.  As

Summary Heading: Beautiful Hotel But Dark . Bring some halogen bulbs along.
Summary: This is a great Disneyland Hotel...Beautiful and convenient. The rooms are nice and quiet. Even though our room overlooked California Adventure park you could not hear any noise. Only negative is the poor lighting in the rooms. If you are a business traveller bring along some lighting!

Summary Heading: I wish it were true, but the "magic" just isn't there!
Summary: In my opinion, the Disneyland Grand Hotel is basically overrated and their service isn't quite what you would expect from "Disney".  I have stayed at this hotel a total of four times over the past year and a half.   It is  nice because it is close to the park, but not worth the hundreds of dollars you pay for a small room.  Concerns that I have had with the Disney Grand conclude with the Valet Parking crew having difficulty finding my rental car, finding another woman's bra in the closet and room service knocking on our door at 10:30PM in error. At that time of night,with my three year old attempting to go to sleep after a long day at the park, she jumped out of bed, tripped over the corner a table and came home with a concussion on her forehead.  I am a service oriented

The Grand Californian is unlike a normal hotel in several ways.  I had an excellent stay, but partly because I didn‚Äôt have lofty expectations in certain areas.  On the morning we arrived 400 of the 700 plus rooms were turning over and the hotel was fully booked.  We had requested a standard room with bunkbeds, which are in limited supply.  At the front desk, our cast member told us that our assigned room was two queens.  I politely asked if another room might be available and after ten minutes of effort a bunkbed room was found.  Evidently, the hotel books the total number of rooms and not the particular type of  room (except concierge level).  Knowing this, I would always show up early in the morning when there are still rooms available to swap.  With their system, I would

Location, Location, Location, why does that 1 simple word, play a major factor in the Tourism industry?  Let me start off by saying that I am a Hilton Honors Silver VIP, and usually stay in Hilton Hotels 5-10 times a year, and other brands another 5-10 times a year.   Rate: $199 Annual Passholder Rate ($239 W/ Tax & Resort Fee) Themepark View room  Rooms: The rooms are fairly large, with a Couch, Coffee table, Desk w/ chairs, TV, "Refreshment Center", and closet. There was a well appointed Bathroom, with a large tub, and double sinks. The bed was comfortable, and the room was clean.  There is a balcony large enough for two chairs and a table.   Service: The service was just as you should expect from a Disney hotel; Friendly, Efficent, and fast. Every request was honored quickly,

I booked a vacation package 4 months in advance through an airlines and everything appeared to be in order according to my confirmation and final papers.
