We were to stay at the California Grand with a California Adventure Park view ( premium price - above a standard room, and Downtown Disney view )   I called twice before arrival to be sure everything was in order and to let them know we would be arriving in the evening.  Well, lo and behold when we did arrive, we were assigned a (standard ) pool view room with the park no where in sight.  I would not have minded *if* that was what I paid in advance for but it was not.  Upon calling the front desk to let them know this was not the room I reserved, I was told the view rooms were sold out for the whole weekend.  I was given the

My family of three (we have a toddler) stayed for one night on Halloween this year. I have stayed at several places Anaheim, but until this last visit, we hadn't stayed at the Gran Californian.   I originally wanted to stay two nights, but due to budget constraints, I had to trim back that idea as this hotel can be extremely expensive. I booked the first time directly through the operator listed on disneyland.com for the first two night during our Disneyland stay, but later found the same room for the same night through Expedia.com over $150.00 cheaper.  It is a five-star hotel with all the amenities. There are several large pools. It is a short hop to Downtown Disney and the California Adventure park. It is big, beautiful and all Disney, it is just too expensive.

I booked a 4-night vacation for my family through the Disney Travel Company. My family visits Disneyland at least once a year but we usually stay at one of the "Good Neighbor" hotels. Since this was the 50th Anniversary, I decided to splurge. In the end, I guess I have very mixed emotions about the value of this hotel. As far as the Cast Members (CMs) are concerned, there was never a negative interaction. The main issue was the state of our room. Five of us stayed in a Queen/Bunk combination (two adults, three children aged 3, 8, 11) with an "upgrade" from the Downtown View that we booked, to a Park view (very distant view). In the three nights we stayed (we left early) they only turned down my youngest's trundle bed once, and only left the treats for two of the five of us.

I've tried to stay at the Grand Californian several times, but they're always booked up. When I was finally able to get reservations for the dates I wanted, I was ecstatic. What a HUGE disappointment! Thinking that the high price of these rooms vs. the Disneyland Hotel, Paradise Pier, and all the surrounding hotels, plus the fact that it was a brand-new hotel, I thought that would mean it would be a luxurious stay -- up to par with the Westin, the W, etc. WRONG! It was a very small, very plain room. The carpet in the corner by the desk was sticky, the bottom of the toilet rubbed black, there was NOTHING special about the room to warrant such a huge price tag!  When we first got to the hotel, around 8PM, we were told that they were full and would we mind staying at the Disnlyland

Summary Heading: Not a good bargain in the end.
Summary: Having spent four nights at the Grand Californian I am not sure if I would stay there again unless certain things were different. I had made our reservations though Walt Disney Travel in March.  over the months while waiting I had made a few requests prior to our arrival to upgrade some aspects of our stay, but they didn't come to pass in the end.  I had asked for a fourth floor room with a King size bed.  Upon arrival at the front desk early on Oct. 12, I was told that we were scheduled to be in a third floor room with a queen and bunkbed.  This wasn't to my liking as it was only my wife and I staying.  We weren't allowed to check in at that time and had to wait until later in the day, but were told to check back later for the disposition of our request for a bed upgrade.  This

Summary Heading: Loved it, Would love to stay again.
Summary: We have previously stayed at hotels across the street from disneyland. But because this was a family reunion and everyone else was staying at the Grand Californian, we decided to suck it up and pay the money.  My husband whined and groaned about the cost  but now that we've stayed there, he can't see staying anywhere else ( mind you, we saved up for a year and half to afford thsi trip). I've never stayed on disney property before so I can't compare it to the other hotels. We have two kids, a 4 yo and a 7 yo. We loved the conveneince of the California Adventure private entrance as well as the downtown disney entrance. The staff was friendly and helpful. We checked in at 9 am and the bellhops held our lugagge til our room was ready. Our room was ready around 2 pm. We had a city

My grown daughter and I stayed on the concierge floor at the Grand Californian September 26th through the 29th.  As soon as we pulled up to the curb, we were met by a CM who took us up to the 6th floor (where we were checked in) then he gave us a tour of the concierge lounge.  It was barely 3:00 and our room was ready.  It wasn‚Äôt as small as I had anticipated after reading some reviews.  It was spotlessly clean.  Had asked for and received with no problems a room with 2 queen beds, not terribly far from the elevator, and with a fridge we could use.  All the CMs were friendly and the utmost professionals.  Every CM we passed made it a point to smile and offer some sort of greeting.  Any time we asked a question for which they didn‚Äôt have an answer, they were on the phone and

Stayed at the Grand from Sept 29 - Oct 3.  Got to the hotel before stated check in time of 3PM (I got there around 1:30PM) and did not have to wait for room.  I stayed in one of the one bedroom suites. The room was very nice. Clean and Comfortable. Housekeeping was really on the up and up! The only downside I found with the place is the room was literally at the end of the hallway(s). After walking around the parks all day, it's a bit daunting to make the walk all the way back to the room.  I really don't know what the designers were thinking when they designed the place. If you are going to have such incredibly long hallways, there should be more convient access to rooms more distant from the main lobby area.

My family, husband and 2 sons stayed at the Grand for 4 nights, starting Oct. 2. We come to Disneyland every year and usually stay at the embassy suites, or somewhere comprable to that. Every year I say I want to stay at the Grand so we finnaly did.  I booked in July and requested a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor. When we checked in at 3:30 they had no rooms on the 2nd floor, so we were booked on the 3rd floor in probably the worst location in the hotel. The room was at the end of 2 very long hallways, VERY LONG. I called down to the front lobby and was told this was all that was available for now. With 2 kids wanting to go in and out to the park, pool, lobby, etc.,, I did not want to stay at this location, so when we got back from downtown disney that night I spoke to someone at

Summary Heading: An insider look with hot tips
Summary: Here's a few tips so your stay can be a more pleasant one at this hotel and at any hotel you may stay at in the future. First of all, arrive early and never expect the room to be ready. By arriving early, you can check in and have more flexibility in getting a room exactly where you want and with the bedding type you desire. It still won't gaurantee you get everything you want, but your chances greatly improve because they will have more rooms to play with by moving people around who have not yet arrived. The bell services will hold your things and you should be prepared to go to the parks while the rooms are being cleaned. Arriving before 10am should be on your itinerary especially if you have 5 people or your one of those who demands a king bed. Are you going to get a larger

Summary Heading: Great Location, Great Service, Small Rooms-Would Stay again!
Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Californian over Labor Day weekend and had mixed emotions. While it is very conveniently located, you can walk right into California Adventure, the rooms were small for the price you pay. We were expecting the rooms to be small after reading various reviews, but we upgraded to a theme park view thinking that would make up the difference. Well, our theme park view was really just the top of the Rapids ride and a lot of trees. We had a much better theme park view at Paradise Pier and a larger room for much cheaper! (And just as convenient). But the staff there was wonderful, nice and accomodating. They brought us a fridge to our room right away, the room was immaculate and theming was brilliant. I enjoyed the turn down service. it was like

Just returned from the Grand Californian (stayed the night of Sept 14); our rooms were only $169 per night--so our stay was well worth it.  Granted, this was off-season ...  We actually found the best rate on the disneyland dot com website, same price as Expedia & Travelocity.  Be sure to check out several websites before booking; the AAA website was quoting more than $1,200 for two nights (including Park Hopper Passes)!!!  Even calling the Hotel directly, we got a quote of $400 per night--and they would not match the $169 per night even though that was the rate quoted on Disney's own website!  Booking aside, the hotel was wonderful.  I disagree with the poster who was bemoaning the lack of Disneyana--I found that refreshing.  Bambi appeared on the shower curtain, the room had a

My Husband and I decided to get away to Disneyland for a long weekend, and our choice of hotel was the Grand Californian - Disneyland's best.  I have been to Walt Disney World 20+ times, my Husband and I even married there, so I felt like it was finally time to see where it all started...  The hotel was like a nice ski lodge...cozy and warm.  The fireplace cove in the main lobby - a great touch!  However, our room was a different story.  While it was clean and kept up well, it lacked everywhere else.  I am a HUGE Disney fan, so I was very upset by the lact of the "Disney" feel.   *A sidebar if I may...our favorite WDW resort is the Grand Floridian...which is the most upscale resort on property, so we figured that the Californian would be the same.  The Floridian has Disney

GREAT hotel! We arrived on 9/9/05 in the am ( too early for checkin ) but they were able to store our luggage and gave us a number to call around 3Pm to check in. Our room was ready at 3:00pm and since we already had the pre-check in, all we had to do was take our card key they gave us and call to have the bell send our luggage up. The bell service was excellent. It only took less than 10 minutes from the time we called to the time our luggage was delivered.   Next we ate at the Storytellers cafe. The breakfast ( ala carte ) was well porportioned and reasonable priced for a resort hotel.  We did end up eat thing buffet breakfast the next day and it was rather dissapointing. The selection was very small ( No cereal ) and only had the basics. Pancakes and waffles were made to

We arrived on Monday, Labor Day with a little hesitation. I had read numerous bad reviews, but we went for it anyway.  I don't know where all these people who submitted bad reviews stayed, but it could NOT have been here!  First, let me tell you, I am a clean freak!  I clean a hotel room before I stay there.  This hotel room was SPOTLESS.  Everything was clean and fresh smelling and the room temperature was comfortable (not the usual hit of hot air because housekeeping shut the A/C).  I even saw them cleaning rooms from the hallway and they pick up the chairs and actually DO vacuum under the table and beds!  Patio had two nice chairs and a little table to sit out there - all clean!  Second, I am from Las Vegas.  I know good hotels and bad hotels first hand - this IS A GOOD ONE!

Summary Heading: Best Hotel Ever!  Attn Parents with Toddlers
Summary: We just returned from a glorious vacation over Labor Day weekend lasting through September 9th with our two toddlers (almost 4 and almost 2).  It was the height of Labor Day crowds when we arrived on Saturday and yet everything was smooth from beginning to end.  We actually stayed in a 1 bedroom suite at the Disneyland Hotel for the 1st 2 nights and then stayed the last 4 nights (4th night free due to promotion) at the Grand Californian.  Yes, the Disneyland Hotel is a bit dated, but the size of the 1 bedroom suite was huge.  We arrived early so I didn't expect the room to be ready, but it was, so we were able to go straight to it.  We stayed in the Bonita Tower.  Our suite had views of the Grand Californian and Fireworks at night with a nice large balcony.  Everyone prefers the

Just returned from Disneyland. We stayed at the Disneyland Grand Californian Hotel.  Let me just say that I was very worried about staying there when reading review from past guests. But I can say that my experience there was Great!   First of all I got great rooms rates for $169 for a standard room. We stayed two night because of that. When we arrived we were greeted by happy, friendly staff. At the Front Desk when we checked in without a wait. Without asking they automatically upgraded us to a Pool view. Also if you have a little one they have near the front dest they have an area for the littles ones to relax, in cute lil chairs & rocking chair with Disney cartoons playing.  It really helps if you have a lil one.   We unable to check in early but was able to store our bags

Summary Heading: The Grand is not so Grand in room size and comfort, but location can't be beat.
Summary: This hotel gets an A+ for convenience, but a C for comfort.  My biggest complaint is the management policy of not guaranteeing enough beds for the number of guests booked into a room.  In fact, their policy is to "guarantee a view not the number of beds."  Huh??  The explanation given was people don't come here to sleep, they come to go to the parks.    We were 3 adults and two 5 year olds, and one adult was forced to sleep on two sleeping bags between two queen beds on the floor.  No room for roll-away or cots.  No suites left, no bunk-bed rooms available.  For nearly $2000 for a 3-day stay (including our 3-day passes), this is really not a good marketing practice.  The room is about the same size as the average Marriott (which I like under the appropriate conditions).  This

Summary Heading: Try an see if Tiffany can help you at the front desk
Summary: Myself, my son, and my Grandson, just returned from Disneylands Grand Californian Hotel.  We were up and off to the airport at 5:00a.m. hard for a 3 year old, but even Antonio my 3 year old grandson was up that morning with a smile, he was going with uncle Chris and Nana, thats me, to Disneyland.  We arrived at the Hotel around 9:00 a.m.  and a little tried then, need to clean up and have a change of clothes.  Walked into the hotel lobby it was very nice and clean and their was only two other people checking in or out.  Was told at first that the room wasn't ready and wouldn't be till 3:00 p.m.  I wanted to change by clothes and my Grandsons, from colder weather in San Francisco, to warmer weather in Orange County.  We could after I asked check our bags at the desk, so without a

we just returned home from our stay aug 20-22 there were three of us myself,husband and 16yr old. when we travel I read everything so there are no surprises and no place is perfect,but this was pretty close. Arrived at 10:ooam we used valet (12.00 per day vs 8.00)worth it. We stored our luggage with bell service and went to the park, returned at 1:30 pre-registered and were given our keys and all information(no room number yet,but were given a number to call when ready) we sat in the beautiful lobby in comfy chairs had a snack roomwas ready at 2:15 no hassel. FYI resort fee is 11.50 per day. Room was great 4th floor room 4315 2 queens perfectly clean air conditioner quiet and cold. At 9.30 saw fireworks from our balcony. Mini fridge works on sensors if something is taken they

Summary Heading: Great experience - keep expectations in check
Summary: Given the mixed reviews of the hotel, we kept our expectations in check.  However, we are pleased to report that our overall experience was excellent.  We have stayed at both the Wilderness Lodge and Animal Kingdom Lodge at Disneyworld.  The Grand Californian is very similar, although less distinctive in overall theme and design.  The service was fine - no real complaints.  The convenience factor is huge - California Adventure and Downtown Disney are right outside the hotel, as is the monorail that goes directly into Disneyland.  Tips:   1.  Don't waste your money on an upscale room.  We stayed in a room without a view of the parks, and found it to be a pleasant and quiet change of pace after being in the parks all day.    2.  We thought it a little odd that, upon check in, we

Summary Heading: A couple years old and already worn out!
Summary: We make frequent trips to Disneyland and were some of the first guests to stay in this hotel. Our last visit however left us wondering what happened. The great Disney customer service is gone and although you are greated with a Disney smile they really are not willing to be accomodating at all. Our reservation request was for a courtyard view, upper-level room as we have learned that they tend to be the more peaceful rooms.  When we were assigned to a room overlooking the tram stop at Downtown Disney on the 3rd floor we asked for a change and they said no, that the hotel was booked. We would like this hotel to somehow reward frequent visitors that pay full rack rate with a better room assignment. Not only was the noise from Downtown Disney overwhelming (I ended up at the front

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay at the Grand California!!
Summary: This is a great place to stay.  We have no complaints.  Our check in went smoothly and quickly and we received exactly the kind of rooms that we had requested.  The rooms were clean, and the maid service was exceptional.  They even went out of their way to arrange our children's stuffed animals cutely on their bed each night.  The maid also found my son's lost stylus to his Gameboy Nintendo DS in the room and placed it on our nightstand.  We also requested extra linens which were quickly brought to our room, within 15 minutes.  The hotel is beautiful with a very inviting lobby that has tons of comfortable seats and a roaring fire.  The hotel is located in Downtown Disney, which has excellent shops and resturants--like The Rainforest Cafe', and Ralph Brennan Jazz Kitchen, and is

The GCH is very convenient and the most "sophisticated" of all the Disney hotels on the Disneyland property, but it really does not offer the quality you would expect elsewhere for the price.   They are almost always sold out, which makes it difficult to make any demands or expect any real customer service.  You get the feeling that they really couldn't care less if you dropped dead because there are hundreds chomping at the bit to take your place.  For example, we booked one night in August back in May and got a rate of 335 plus tax for a total of 385.  A couple of weeks ago we decided to add a night to our stay.  For the same room they charged us fifty bucks more because their availability had changed - seemed a bit petty to me, but again they just don't care.   That being

As regular visitors to Disney's Grand Floridian, we had high expectations for this hotel.  Unfortunately, this property is mediocre at best.  The layout and decor are laughably awful, the rooms are small with 50s era linoleum bathrooms (think "Psycho"), and our so-called "Theme Park" view consisted of trees and the monorail track.  The pools are nice (as are most at Disney hotels), and there is a convenient entrance to the California Adventure theme park.  Other than that, staying here is a major waste of $.  It was so bad, it offered our family a lot of laughs, and our kids a lesson about when a company is on the decline.

We didn't get a roll away - we got a sleeping bag! The toilet paper was very thin - not very comfortable. The towels were very rough on your skin. The location to Disneyland was great - they should just upgrade some things!

Stayed Jul 01 to Jul 06. Used getawaytoday.   Checked in at 1:30pm and received room within 1/2 hour. Had courtyard room (3317). Was able to see fireworks every night. Never hear anyone or racket from ajacent rooms.  The monural was right below our room but, could not hear it with slider closed. Elevators right there. Kids were free to come and go on their own.  Parks were busy but, we were in no hurry. Made time to visit VIP tour at Universal as well as Medeival Nights. Rooms were clean big enough for two adults and two teenage kids. Maid service great. (Left them a tip each day in room.) Whitewater snacks good food very convienent. Free parking no hassel. Short 2 min. walk back to hotel. Who said busy streets? Did you push the crosswalk button? Empoyees all very personable.

The service at the Grand Californian exceeded my expectations from the moment we pulled into the hotel. We got to the hotel early, about 10am, and before we were even completely out of the van a bellman was there to take our luggage and store it until we could check in. We came back to the hotel about 3:45 to check in and had no problem getting into our room at that time. The agent, Mandi, was great and gave us a complimentary upgrade to a room with a view of both the pool and California Adventure Park. I agree that the room itself was nothing special, but the vanity area was nice and I enjoyed the bath products provided.   We ate at the Napa Rose on our first night and had a really great meal. Like everything else it is very expensive, but this was by far this best meal we had

Summary Heading: 'Check in after 3 P.M.' means 5:45 P.M. availability
Summary: The Grand Californian is beautiful, the staff is friendly, but the front desk and housekeeping  do not have their act together. As others have reported, they actually say to guests, "Check in after 3  doesn't mean at 3, it means sometime after 3." They give you a room key and tell you to keep checking back to find out your room number when it is available.  Maybe they could give out beepers like when you have to wait for a table at a restaurant? I was considering lying down on a sofa in the lobby while waiting until almost 6 P.M. to get into my room.

Summary Heading: Small room, blood on the sheet, mold in the Tub...
Summary: I am truly disappointed in this supposely 4 star hotel.  It started with the reservation, I wanted a King size bed, they said we could request one, but they would not guarantee it. Why am I making a reservation then????  But the other half really wanted to stay there.  Check-in was just OK, took a long time, and then I find out that along with a 15% tax rate, Disney adds a "Resort" fee, as if their room rate wasn't high enough...  Got to the room, a bit of a walk, the lobby and grounds are nice looking...  The room itself, seems like it is more of a small Holiday Inn room, than a Hilton or Hyatt type room.    Then when we went to bed, we found blood on the sheets...  When I went to check out, they didn't care to hear any of my complaints...  I will NEVER stay here again!!!

I was a little apprehensive about staying at the Grand due to the number of negative reviews I have read about it, but I am SO glad I did!   From the moment we arrived, we were treated like royalty.  The registration clerk was an extremely pleasant lady who explained all about the resort when she learned that this was our first time staying at the hotel.  The bellman who brought our bags to our room was very helpful and polite.  Even the men who steam clean the carpets were very polite, turning the machines off and stepping aside with a friendly "good morning" when we walked by. Our room was very good sized--had one king size bed and also a couch and sitting area.  The rooms are very clean and tastefully decorated.  The crown jewel of the hotel is, of course, the lobby.  I just

Summary Heading: Loved it and will definitely be back!
Summary: We love this hotel and have stayed twice in 2 years - both times with our two pre-schooler/Kindergarden aged children.  We usually go in January-February and have been unable to swim due to weather so I can't comment on the pool area (although it looked nice!).  We've always had easy check-ins, decent, clean rooms with fun views of California Adventure Park or the pool, nightly turn-down service (and chocolates!)...  We love the valet parking and the gorgeous lobby and the access to California Adventure Park can't be beat - it's right out the back door of the hotel!  The access to Downtown Disney is great too - everything is convenient - within walking distance.   Their White Water Snacks is great for quick breakfasts and we *love* being able to purchase items throughout both

I have visited this hotel many times during other trips, just to take a break from the parks, but this is the first time I have ever stayed here. We had a theme park view room, overlooking the pool with an excellent view of Paradise Pier. I can see why some people may feel the rooms are on the smaller side, but it is not a big deal for just me and my boyfriend. I love the way the hotel is themed, and especially the Disney touches in our room: Snow White pictures and Bambi and Thumper on the shower curtain. I can't say enough about the bathroom...two sinks!! Not many hotels have two sinks, and it was a huge help getting ready in the morning. If it is helpful for two poeple, it must certainly be for a family of 4. The location is the best part of staying here. The walk to our room

Summary Heading: Been There Three Times and Would Go Back
Summary: My boyfriend and I have stayed at this resort 3 times in the last 4 years. I really enjoy the hotel.   Check-in: The first time we went in January 2002 and our room was ready at 11am. The next time we came back in June 2004 and we waited until 3:45 pm for our room. It just all depends on how busy they are. But the front desk is more than happy to hold your bags if you want to venture into the park or Downtown Disney while you wait.  Room: The rooms are about 450-550 square feet if I had to guess. We alway requested a King bed and have yet to receive one. They only have a few in the resort, so I guess it is luck of the draw. We have stayed with two queen beds and we are always very, very comfortable. We sometimes could hear people walking down the hall but it didn't bother us.

Our stay at the Disney Grand Californian was wonderful.  The room was great we had four adults‚Äô ages from 18 to 78.  Plenty of room we had a room with 2 queen size beds.  The service from check in to getting extra pillows to check out was wonderful.   They do have a couple of hidden secrets one is the White Water snack bar.  It has inexpensive breakfast, sandwiches and snacks.   The other is the Storytellers Caf√© which is where the have their Breakfast with Chip and Dale.  Besides the Buffets you can order off the menu.  They do not advertise this till you are seated.  Their dinners off the menu for start around $7.00 same as breakfast we did not have a lunch there.  They do this for all three meals.   The buffet does is very nice for adults with food for everyone.  The

What a rip off!  The room was too small especially for the price!  We could hear everthing in the other rooms - every sneeze, every cough!  There was no place to fit all of our luggage so we were constantly tripping over ourselves.  My four year old was extremely dissappointed in the lack of "disney" stuff.  It felt like a regular hotel.    The only good thing was the location!

Five days, four nights in paradise.  My husband, and 3 children- 5, 24 mos and 9 mos booked a concierge suite and were treated famously!!!  We were greeted promptly by two wonderful people who whisked us away to check-in.  It was too early to go in our room, but they cheerfully told us that we could go into the park while we waited and they would call us.    The park was full- with wait lines of two hours snaking past Sephora in downtown disney, yet we were allowed in past these people with their guest only entrances.  This was the BEST!!  Our room ,though not located on concierge level had a beautiful view of the park, and was decorated beautifully- even though it was not too 'disney' it was charming just the same.  It was very clean, very nice, smelled beautiful, was very safe

Summary Heading: dangerous and stinky and expensive-- appalling
Summary: a frank and honest review--please read  the room was tiny(seems to be a common review), smelled like vomit, had bunk beds and only a small double bed (reserved a king room with no bunks).  there was no recourse, no apology.  great location, though. best in the area, closest to both parks.  also nice lobby, Awahnee Hotel-like with new wood.  THE MAIN PROBLEM:  housekeeping left the hotel room door open after cleaning it--left open all day--extremely dangerous and shocking.  we reported it but only received lukewarm apologies and were NOT allowed to discuss the issue with hotel manager, only housekeeping.  they wanted to give wine to make up for it but don't drink, so instead they offered a ticket to a theme park, but because it was the last day of the trip it was useless.  we

This was our second trip to the Grand California.  Our first trip we had a great time and loved the location.  They have a nice pool and we would take a break from the park and spend time at the pool and then fast pass the River ride and go right in our swimming suits.   Disney has decided to cut costs at the park so you were not able to fast pass the River Ride all week.  There were no parades over the 5 days we were there and half of the concessions were closed.   The rooms are small and nothing special I have stayed at Hilton Garden Inns that were nicer.   The lobby is beautiful but the magic stays there.   We requested a refrigerator in our room and were told it was in the room and it wasn't.   We received it later...noproblem.  We called the conceirge about resturants in

We just returned from a trip to Disneyland. The Grand Californian is definietlya magical place to stay. The staff is ready to assist you in any way they can from the moment you arrive. They cater to families as well as couples. The incredible lobby and fireplace create a wonderful atmosphere to escape to after a long day in the park. They even have toddler size rocking chairs for the kids. The rooms are quite nice and they consider a family of 5 a standard occupancy.The kids loved the bunkbeds, we loved the balcony and view. The nightly turn down service was a wonderful touch.  The pool area is delightful with a small toddler pool, and two larger pools with a water slide.   The hotel and rooms were well maintained and beautiful. The location can not be beat. We used our special

My family recently stayed here for 4 nights and I can honestly say it was worth it. For a family with small children it was the best being able to return from the parks in the middle of day to take naps etc.  The service was excellent and every member of the staff we encountered was pleasant and helpful. We had a nice room, with a king bed, and sofa pull out...the room itself was very clean, a bit on the smaller side for us, but it worked. I would defintely stay here again.

Readers. Another VALKO REPORT Exclusive:   We (husband, wife, 3 daughters) stayed at the Grand Californian for seven nights in mid-April.  Valets were helpful and cheerful... Slightly above average.  Front desk check-in...15 to 25 minutes. Robotic motions, no personality...slightly below average.  Bellhop...Personable for a tip.  Room with two queen beds...Overall, small with average appeal. Desk with two chairs. Standard furnishings. What's the big deal about two Tiffany style lamps mounted on the headboard?  Small deck is not functional.   Bathroom is very small. Our fan did not work. Towells smelled like bleach. Bath products (soap, shampoo) standard. Vanity had very small coffee pot (2 cups). Formica countertop I believe. Sink did not drain well.  Overall, not impressed at

My wife and kids spent 5 nights at the Grand Californian and cant imagine having stayed anywhere else.  The proximity to the parks and downtown disney was a luxury we were happy to pay for.  The private entrance to the California Adventure park is very close to the grizzly river run making it handy for changing out of drenched clothes, definitely a plus.  Disneyland is actually a decent walk from the hotel, I recommend taking the Monorail from Downtown Disney, it drops you off in Tomorrowland saving alot of walking.     One of the finest elements of the hotel is the pool.  A destination in itself for the kids.  We were able to enjoy the parks, take a break at the pool and return later in the day.  The room was fine, no complaints.  We had bunk beds for the kids, they gave us a

We stayed at the Grand Californian for one night. They offered us turn down service and was very clean. After the 2 days that were spent in the park, we went to my cousins house, and then went back to Disneyland for a day before heading home. That day, a wheel came off my stroller, and I came ungluded. So I left my stroller, and rode the monorail to downtown disney, to look for super glue, to see if it would hold the stroller together for the last 4 hours. No one had any type of an idea to help, but someone said to check with the grand californian's giift shop, sh had seen some there. When I asked they called engeneering, and they totally fixed my stroller, even though I wasn't a guest there any more. Then they refused to take my tip. It was just a neat thing that happened, that

Summary Heading: The Grand Californian, I would stay there again.
Summary: My wife and I splurged and took our two boys (ages eight and 10) to Disneyland for three nights at the Grand Californian.  The location is the one thing that will bring me back.  We were able to maiximize our three day hopper and not have melt downs due to exhaustion by just walking back to our room and having a leisurely lunch and resting.  The rooms are not big by any means, the boys had bunk beds and we had a queen.  I upgraded and had a view of the pool and some of the park.  I live on a budget, and internally had a hard time justifying $370 a night.  However, the staff is first rate and quick to assist you.  The lounge is very nice, but I spent minimal time there.  Staying there is no doubt a splurge item, but when you're on vacation, what the heck. We had a refrigerator

We just spent two nights at this hotel with our one year old baby.  My impression of it was a very nice lobby and convenient location, but basically Motel 6-style rooms.  Our room was so tiny that I cannot imagine how larger families can fit into it.  The room was not terribly clean.  Service was not friendly at all.  The worst part of the stay was the 'crib' they provided for our baby.  Instead of using regular cribs, they keep a portable one in each closet.  This is understandable due to the sheer volume of babies that must come through this hotel.  However, the portable crib reeked to high heaven.  It smelled like an old tent and ended up making our baby smell like an old tent.  She slept with us the second night of our stay because it was so bad.  The pools were fine, but

Summary Heading: The good and the bad and next time...April 3rd, three nights.
Summary: The Good:  The exterior of this hotel is beautiful, and its location can't be beat.  Every person we had face to face contact with was friendly and did there best to accomodate our requests.  Having it's own location into DCA was very convenient, and the pool areas were ample and clean.  It was great to take a quick walk after a long day and be back at our hotel.  The lobby and public spaces were wonderful and well kept.  Upon check in, we were given most of our "wish" list.  Bunk beds, a courtyard view, and a higher floor (we'd requested 5th and got 4th.)  The Bad:  Upon entering our room we of course had to open the drapes and doors and go out onto the balcony, where our noses were assaulted with a very foul smell which we soon realized came from a bag full of dirty diapers.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for my birthday a few years back. I wanted to write a review because I absolutely loved this hotel. Our room faced Ca Adventure and we got to see California Screamin' and the sunwheel all lit up at night. It was so pretty. The lobby of the hotel is incredible - inlaid wood floor, giant fireplace, baby grand piano etc. It was so beautiful. There is also storytelling time by the giant fireplace at night for kids. If our daughter would have been with us she would have loved it.  We purchased a package with two day hopper passes etc. and it was very pricey. Our room was ready and very clean.     The front desk clerk was soooo incredibly nice and helpful I had to write about her. Her name is Linda and she was just so nice - I am not used to such

Summary Heading: Grand Californian is the way to do Disney!
Summary: We had a wonderful stay at the GC this week.  It was our second visit; our first on the club floor.  Before going, we wondered if it was worth the extra $$, for us the answer was "definately"  Our family of five enjoyed the daily breakfast, unlimited cold sodas and bottled water, tea time with sandwiches, fruit, wine/cheese and hot entree, and bedtime story time with milk, cookies, etc.  We only had to eat a few meals out (usually in downtown disney), but the convenience of being able to grab a bite to eat while changing clothes or putting our feet up was worth more than the food itself.  It was the first time we've not had to purchase one food item in the park - whew!  The concierge service was very helpful as well, they could get us preferred seating at shows and restaurants

We will definately stay here again.  We stayed during Easter March 26-March 30. We got a view upgrade without asking. We were given a view of the Adventure Park and the pool.  We asked for and got bunkbeds and a refigerator.  The ease of coming and going to the park was outstanding. We would tour until noon go back to hotel and swim, rest, get a bite to eat and then back to the parks. We cannot imagine having to get on a bus and go back and forth each day. Expensive, yes! Worth it, bigger yes! People need to remember that you are paying not only for a room in a hotel, but the whole atmosphere of Disney. When you have young children this is an affordable option when you look at how much time you save.

Summary Heading: Average hotel in a potentially great location
Summary: The phrase 'horses for courses' really does apply to this hotel. If you have kids and/or your visiting Disney for the first time then the locaton is great and the hotel satisfactory. However, in our case the extra price didn't justify the location and we felt we would have gotten better value for money by staying in the Hilton towers across the road.  The rooms are average, nothing more, and the hotel food is definitely overpriced (though downtown disney has some better alternatives).  So, if you have children who would like a character breakfast, or your going to spend most of your time in the park then this may be for you. Otherwise I'd recommend saving money by booking elsewhere and checking out the rest of Anaheim like Universal Studios and Hollywood.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, can't wait to stay there again
Summary: My family and I just returned from our stay at the Grand Californian Hotel.  We stayed four (4) nights 3/14--3/17.  I chose the hotel for the convenient access to the parks, so I was willing to pay a premium for the room.  I wasn't expecting some ultra highend 5-star rated place.  I just wanted something nice and it delivered.  Unlike some other reviewers, we were allowed to check in at 3:00 pm.  While I waited with the kids in the lobby, we were greeted by an employee who gave my kids some Pooh cards.  I wished our room faced the park, but we got one that faced the monorail track.  Monorail noise was NOT a problem.  Our room was clean with good maid service .  Nightly turndown was a nice touch and my sons loved the chocolate coins left behind by the maids.  One problem with the

I had read all the reviews of the Grand Californian after booking and I must admit was a little hesitant about what to expect. Having stayed at both the Disney Hotel and Paradise Pier several times and having had good to great service at both of those I was really thinking hard if the extra money to stay at the Grand would be worth it.  IT WAS!  At the time I made the reservation I had told the reservationist that it was my daughter's 14th birthday. Upon check in they presented her with a bouquet of balloons, card and special "happy birthday" button.  My daughter who is slightly punk, was absolutely thrilled. The staff at the hotel went out of their way to make her feel special our whole stay.  When we checked into our room, though it was the view I had requested, Downtown

My 12-year-old daughter and I drove up from San Diego, planning on checking in at 3:00 (check-in time), freshening up, and then on to the parks until closing.  Well, the room was not available at 3:00.  They told me to check my luggage, go to the Park, and return later.  When I complained to a different clerk, the lady told me that the stated check-in time was AFTER 3:00 pm.  I asked if that meant they could give me the room at 11:30 pm, since it was AFTER 3:00.  She told me again to check in the bags, go to the Park, etc.  We again explained we did not want to have to return later, etc.  I finally got a manager who told me he would see what he could do to get me a room earlier.  Finally, at 4:15 or so, after I again called them back (the manager never calle me as he said he

We just returned from a weekend at the Grand Califorian Hotel.  I had decided on this hotel after a rave review from my travel agent.  I had already planned on staying at one of the 3 Disney properties and so we went with the Californian because of it being newer and with an entrance to California Adventure. The hotel itself is lovely, the decor is beautiful and the huge ceilings and expansive lobby area are very impressive.  It would be a nice place to have a cocktail and hang out...if you have time away from the parks.  We had a cocktail in the main bar area.  I think it was the Hearthstone Bar and it was nice.  Not anymore expensive that in many of the nicer restaurants in my hometown.  The Storytellers Cafe was also a nice place  for lunch or the buffet breakfast with the

Summary Heading: Lovely hotel but the walls are thin!
Summary: After reading many of the reviews I was a little worried that the Grand wouldn't live up to my expectations. Happily, we found the hotel to be excellent. The rooms are very clean and nicely appointed in the arts and craft style, although the bathtub was one of the smallest that I had ever seen. I do agree that the walls are thin - at least they are when there is a headboard banging against them, however the hotel was more than willing to upgrade us to a view room. We found the hotel staff to be very friendly and professional.  As we have a 21 month old, the location of the hotel, and the private access to California Adventure, was excellent. I would highly recommend it for anyone who has small children who need naps in the middle of the day as it is so accessible. Incidentally,

I recently returned for a 4 night stay at this property.  I requested a room with bunk beds 3 months before arrival and was told at check in that this room type was unavail.  Check in was at 3:00 PM - They provided me with Keys to the room at 3:00 but would not provide the room numbers until the room was ready at 4:15 PM.  I requested a refrigerator and was told someone would bring it up, and it never arrived.  They compensated me with a fast pass for 3 attractions as I waited with a 9 month old  and a 5 yr old for 1 1/2 hours in the main lobby- and due to late check in and torrential rains we did not go to the park until the next day, where I was told the passes were expired.  I brought them home.  The rooms are small but I did not experience the noise others complain about.

As an annual passholder we got a great rate and decided to try this last of the three onsite properties.  We loved it.  The bunkbeds were fun, the bath rooms nicely appointed.  But the best part is the lodge feeling.  We went on one of the recent rainy weekends in So. Cal.  The resort has a fireplace with rockers for adults and kids.  Every time we went by the fire was roaring and happened to find a story teller there one evening.  The restauarants are far better than at the Paradise Pier and Disneyland Hotel.  You can get from California Adventure to your hotel room in less than 5 minutes.  That was a big plus when we got drenched by the rain.  I can't wait to stay there again - at the passholder rate!

Decent hotel. However, the Redwood pool was closed (one of the reasons we stayed here) 3 out of the 4 days we stayed here and they did not open the pool bar on the Saturday it was open. Hiked over to the Disneyland Hotel to use their pool. Thought this would be like the Wilderness Lodge at WDW but it is not as nice and more expensive. I did like the Napa Rose, but it just wasn't as good as the hype. The bar at the hotel had the worst gin and tonics I've ever had. Oh and when they say check in time is 3, they mean under no cicumstances will we let you check in before 3. This is Disney? I am so dissapointed!

This hotel is beautiful, no doubt about that, by far the most spectacular, visually, of all three hotels at the resort.  I had some major issues with the hotel though.  First of all, it is REALLY EXPENSIVE.  There were two of us staying there and upon checking in, we received a room with one queen or king bed (can't remember which) and bunk beds.  Not that having bunk beds was really inconvenient for us or anything, but I bet a family would have been very happy to have that room, as it would have been fun for children.  That wasn't the major issue though.....In the middle of the night, the fire alarm went off and everyone had to evacuate the hotel for no reason at all.  It was a false alarm, a mistake by an employee.  I am completely aware that it was an accident, and accidents

This hotel was beyound fabulous. We booked threw Get away today and later called the resort and requested a bunkbed suite. We were surprised that we got the suite at no extra charge. The room was large and had a king size bed and a pair of full size bunks. The entire hotel experience was superburb. The staff was unbelievable. It's like stepping into the world of "PERFECT". Negative was... not so close to disney itself. Connected to Cali. adv. but to get to Disney you either have to go through Cali. Adv. or come out in the middle of down town Disney. It seemed like the hotels at the main entrance was closes, I could be wrong.

I just returned from the Grand Californian Hotel. The hotel and staff were just great. And  being a smoker I was a bit leary of staying there as the hotel is Non-Smoking. But they have made accommodations for the percentage of smoking visitors that they have. And the smoking area has it's own fire place and rocking chairs. And it is not an out of the way area to get to. There is one wing of the hotel that is larger than the rest and it does take a bit to get back and forth to the room. But then with all of the wonderful food that is offered the walk did me good. So really no big deal. I would definately go back and would definately send my clients there. So convienent to the parks and Downtown Disney.

The family, Grammy, Mom, Dad and the three litttle ones,  packed up and all snuggled in one room which was very comfortable and roomy. With easy access to the park, we were able to close down the Grizzley Run at night during Oct and scoot up to the room and change in time for the parade in dry clothes, be first in line on the roller coaster, and take time to swim in the afternoon with a two year old still happy!  Beautiful lobby, great staff and we did ok with the budget on food.  Want to go back with my old cronies who are still young at heart for the Tower of Terror and Downtown Disney. A very happy grandmother.

This Hotel is great if you have small children! Its convenient location to both Disneyland and California Adventure, makes it worth the money as you can come back to the hotel to take a nap, and then walk right back when your child wakes up! I have stayed at other hotels and had to take the shuttle back and forth to the park and it becomes very time consuming, and very crowded. The hotel itself is beautiful and has a rustic historic charm.  The storytelling by the fireplace was a nice break in the evening for my 4 year old who loved it! The room service is excellent and the staff professional and very friendly! We also had to wait for our room to become available, but once we got to it we were very happy. It was clean and comfortable. I think they should have made the rooms a

Summary Heading: Grat Location for the parks, why cant Chip n Dale do babysitting though?!
Summary: My Wife, Daughter and I stayed for 4 nights at the Grand in December and couldnt really fault it. The Grand is a good choice when visiting Disney, it is probably worth 4 stars for the location and standard of amenities. The staff were ok, although we waited 1 hour to be checked in as our expedia booking couldnt be found and were made to feel like it was our fault - anyway it got sorted and we had a ball!   The rooms are nothing special but clean and spacious enough. The walk to the parks is 2 minutes / 5 minutes ofr the California / Disney parks respectively which is great and the Downtown Disney area has some good shops / restaurants and again is only 2 minutes away.  The pool is very nice and has 2 jacusis and a big slide for the kids. The Storytellers cafe is the best place

Terrible, terrible customer service!  What a surprise for me, my wife, and our 2 toddlers, expecting 4-star service and getting none of it.  Lip-service from hotel staff and management alike, none seemed empowered to make decisions regarding customer service needs.  From a used and discarded condom just outside our balcony to a burned out light bulb that was never replaced, to bed sheets that caused my 4-year old's skin to develop a rash, to waiting for luggage despite multiple bell staff doing nothing, to misinformation regarding Disney ticket prices... none of this was handled to our satisfaction.  I've written a formal letter of complaint to the general manager.  I willing to bet, for them, it doesn't even warrant a response or apology.  Spend your hard-earned dollars

Summary Heading: Where's the tram to my room?
Summary: 1/3 - 1/4/05  Like all the others say: 1) awesome location to parks 2) fabulous staff and service 3) great "woodsy lodge" decor 4) Graco pack 'n' play in every closet! 5) plenty of pillows/towels 6) very clean and quiet 7) enjoy the daily newsletter of events  HOWEVER We had to cross the LARGE lobby, exit the hotel, go down the restaurant row corridor, re-enter a wing of the hotel, take the elevator to 5th floor.  Then it's left, left, right, left, right, and nearly the end of that hallway.  After a long day at the park, it's a long walk to the room.  Next I'll ask for a room NEAR ELEVATOR!  p.s.  We had an 8am Character Breakfast downstairs in Storyteller's Cafe.  I set the alarm for 7am.  The fire alarm went off at 7:15am and we had to evac (hubby, me, 2 year old, 9 month old)

The Grand is not a 5 star hotel.   The service is good but not great.   We stayed 5 nights.   Would we stay here again and the answer is yes.   You simply cannot beat the convenience of its location, especially with small children.

We stayed at the hotel from Jan. 6 - 10, 2005 and had a wonderful time despite all of the rain. Everything was very clean and we loved the turn down service. We stayed in a room with park view. We had a side view of the park and next time will request a straight on view. I would recommend this over the view of Downtown Disney which seemed like it would be very noisy with the loud music blasting all day and evening. We spent so much time in the parks and shopping that we had no time to enjoy the hotel activities. I would have to agree that Storytellers Cafe was a little pricey with slow service and the White Water Snack shop was great for breakfast and lunch. Too bad we didn't even find it until the last day. They have packed lunches you could take into the park for later. Great

Summary Heading: Can you say convenient? Very practical!!
Summary: We stayed at the hotel on January 2, 2005.  It is grand in the lobby for sure with a beautiful fireplace. MAIN PROBLEM...late check in!  They kept telling us to come back in an hour and SEVERAL hours later our room was FINALLY ready.  I mean after 3:00 the promised check in time.  They did no upgrades or anything to make up for the hassle of leaving the park and then returning and leaving the park and then returning...only to find the room really was not ready.  Can you tell I am still irritated?  Anyhow, I really LIKE THE BAR where you could cozy up on leather chairs and enjoy the warmth of the fireplace while enjoying a drink to help you go another 8 hours into the "happiest place on earth".  The rooms were nice.  Nothing to write home about...smaller but very clean.  The

We just stayed at the Grand Californian 1-3-05 through 1-6-05.  All of the cast members that we encountered were friendly and cheerful.  Our room wasn't ready when we first arrived so we stored our luggage and headed out the quick entrance to California Adventure.  We called later and found that the room was ready and moved into it.  The kids loved the bunk beds and the turndown service with chocolate candy.  The only complaint that I would have about the room is not enough drawer space - I usually unpack into drawers, but could not this trip - so we lived out of the suitcases.  We loved the balcony and had a great veiw of Downtown Disney.  The kids brought their Playstation and used that at night - it hooked up easily into the tv.  We went to the washcloth animal class and

My husband and I spent our 10th anniversary (Dec 13-17,2004) at the  Grand Californian and our experience was wonderful!  We arrived early and our room was not only ready but we were upgraded.  They also gave us balloons and when the desk found out we left our four children at home, she brought out goodie bags for us to take home to them.  We loved the convience of having the private entrance to DCA.  I don't think you can get any closer the Disneyland's entrance, that was nice after a long day at the park.   Every night we had turn down service with candy and a copy of the next day's activities on our pillows.(very nice touch)  Whitewater Snacks is great.  We didn't have a chance to try out the other restuarants. Only thing to be aware about is the fridge, stocked with many

Summary Heading: Steps from the Parks and Downtown Disney
Summary: We stayed for 3 nights just to do the parks and it was an excellent choice. Just parked the car and forgot about it. Purchased the hopper tickets at reception and spent 2 days solid doing the parks. Location meant we could have an hour or two rest during the day and the kids could use the pool. Found a good deal on park view rooms and would definitely stay there again.

We stayed at the Grand Californian from Dec 15-19th.  The bellmen were very helpful and it only took a second to check in.  Our room wasn't ready so we headed over to California Adventure Park.  The Private entrance is so nice, we didn't have to wait at all.  Our room was ready before promised, it was larger than a normal hotel room and the bunk beds were a nice touch.  We were close to the elevator but noise wasn't a problem, we never heard our neighbors either.  The pool area was great with very good lifeguards, they even have free swim diapers for toddlers.  The food at the Storytellers Cafe and Whitewater snacks was great.  The turn down service was a nice touch, my girls loved the candy.  We would stay here again for sure!

My family and I stayed here last week and I was really not that impressed.    The rooms are just okay, nothing spectacular.  You are definitely paying for the location and the lobby (which is beautiful).  We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel in June and while we thought it was outdated, it was definitely better for children.  Room service was fantastic!  If you can get a room for around $200 a night, then it is worth it.  Otherwise, try the Disneyland hotel.

Summary Heading: Penny Pinching Management Eliminates Much Magic
Summary: One year ago I brought my family to the Grand Californian for a week. It was wonderful beyond our expectations. We were met in the driveway by a team of four enthusiastic bellmen who unloaded our car quickly. The children were invited to ride to the room on the specially designed luggage cart. As the bellman said, "The magic starts here."  There was no wait at the check in counter and the rest of the hotel just got better from there.   With last year's experience in mind I booked a three room suite for one week and invited another family to join us. I wanted to give both families a Christmas gift they would remember the rest of their lives.   The joke is on me. When we arrived this time we were met by one apathetic bellman. The hotel has eliminated the happy "welcome" crew.  I

This was the first time we have ever stayed at a Disneyland property. Many people cite the location as a plus but with so many hotels just a short walk away, I can't justify the price they charge for these rooms. We spent our last night at a hotel on Harbor Blvd. and yes, I did long to have back the bedding and decor of our room at the Californian. However, I still think you can get just as nice of a room right outside the Main Gates at half the price. Stay right outside the park and put the money saved to use on the outrageous food prices.  Someone earlier said they had the worst room in the hotel due to noise. Ours was probably the worst location as it felt like we walked a mile from the elevator to the room.

Summary Heading: Great resort location - Lot's of Noise!
Summary: This is our second time staying at the Grand Californian. This is a beautiful hotel, especially the lobby. We booked a room with a King bed and got stuck with a Queen, both stays our rooms were not ready upon check in, we had to call back several times and finally were able to check in after 4pm. Rooms are small but comfortable. Our daughter also loved the bunkbeds on our first stay, there is a trundle bed below the bunk which is great for a toddler who's outgrown the pack-n-play that the hotel provides. Room service menu is great, prices are resonable, real carved turkey breast in the Club sandwich, very good, large breakfast portions too! We had a room with a courtyard view very near the monorail track, regardless of what anyone says, you can hear the monorail everytime it

We were at Disneyland for a wedding last weekend and stayed at this hotel.  It was wonderful-modern conveniences coupled with last century nostalgia.  The Storybook Restaurant served plenty of nourishing food at reasonable prices along with morning visits with Chip and Dale.  Our room overlooked the Downtown Disney area but this made for interesting people watching plus we were able to see the evening fireworks from our balcony.  The beds were so comfortable, the bathtub large enough for a good long soak.  The bar, with its fireplace, serves some of the best bar snacks I've ever had!  The rates are high, although we got a little break because of the wedding, but staying at this hotel intensifies the magic of Disney.  An added bonus was that all the Christmas decorations were in

We spent 4 night at this hotel earlier this month and absolutely loved it.  We checked in at about 11am and our room became ready as we were checking in.  We had made quite a few requests for our room (connecting rooms, bunk beds and a fridge in the room) and they had already taken care of everything.  The rooms are a little smaller than than the Disneyland hotel, but our four year old absolutely loved the bunk beds and the turn down service is great, if you leave your stuffed animals on the bed, the maids prop them up on the pillow, it was a hit with our daughter.  It was nice to have the pack and play already in the room although we ended up putting our 1 1/2 year old on the trundle bed under the bunk, she rolls around and is getting a little big for the pack and play so this

We stayed here in October while visiting Disneyland with our kids. Yes, it is absolutely beautiful when you enter the lobby. In fact, its breathtaking. But don't expect that same "Wow" when you get to your room. The bunkbeds were a tad too small for our kids (ages 17, 15, 13). The bedding and bathroom decor was actually kind of tacky looking. And be careful of those honor bars! I don't understand why they put something like that in a room that they know will probably have  children. You can request at check-in that they lock the honor bar and bring you a regular mini fridge. Don't get me wrong, I LOVE staying on Disney property every time I go to Disneyland for the convenience factorand the "magic", but the Grand is just not worth the extra money. Next time, I'll be at the

The first and foremost thing about the Disney Grand Californian is its location. You cant ask for a better place to stay if you want an enjoyable time in Disneyland. When you stay at any Disneyland resort hotel...you can have anything you buy throughout the park sent back to your hotel so you dont have to carry it around with you all day. If you go on the river ride in California Adventure..you will want to be close to your hotel so you can go back and change if need be...I got soaked each time I went on it.   The hotel itself is very nice...clean and the rooms that dont have queen/bunk beds...have 2 queen beds, which is great if you have 4 in a room. They do an evening turndown service so if you use your towels up during the day, they will be replaced. Like everything in

This hotel is TOTALLY NOT WORTH THE $$$.  Way to expensive $400+ a night w/ view of the park.  They gave me a room with view which right infront of the bushes and big tree which I can barely see the park.  I request to change another room, and all they can give me is another room w/ not much better probably worse.  Room is small, definitely not worth w/ the $$$ paying for.  This is totally suck, not what I expected.

Don't get me wrong, this is a marvelous hotel for enjoying Disneyland, and California Adventure. Unquestionably the best. We took the grandkids last month and were able to walk to everything.The rooms and restaurants were outstanding. Now the not so outstanding part. The pool is much, much too small!! It was off season, and still the pool was totally packed. They had a pool bar, but it was closed! They had an OK snack bar, but it closed at 7PM, and, unbelievably for a hotel of this stature and price, they had no pool area waiter service. Overall, for kids there probably isn't a better place to stay, but for adults you might want to look further.

This review is for those thinking about using the Grand Californian for a family Disney trip. The bottom line question: Is this place worth the price?  Well, the answer is YES, based on four criteria:  Location, Service, Concierge, and Security.  The location is beyond wonderful.  Whether you are a first-timer or veteran, you know there is serious walking involved with a Disney trip.  From your room to rides at DCA is less than 3 minutes through a private entrance.  The location allows you the flexibility to come and go to enjoy breaks, swimming, and relaxing.  Your nerves will thank you about 1PM that you are so close to your Hotel. There is no better Hotel location than this one.   The service is clearly outstanding.  From check-in to check out the people here have been

We stayed at the Grand Californian for 2 nights this month. We really liked the lobby, it was really beautiful and huge! Very nice and I bet it looks even cooler to a little kid!  We had a suite, which was nice, the furniture and decor was obviously designed with the fact in mind that alot of children would stay in the rooms so everything is kind of un-breakable.. heavy lamps, furniture, but nice. Kind of a woodsy theme.   Very kid friendly! It was just me and my boyfriend stopping in for some fun during a business trip, but his kids would have really loved it.  We were a bit suprised there were no theme-rooms, maybe they will add some later.  We paid the additional 200 a night for the concierge, another service which I feel is best if you have younger kids. They have waters,

The Disney Grand Californian Resort was superb in every way.  The six-story lobby with Craftsman decor was breathtaking, and our room large and immaculate.  During our four day sojourn in Anaheim, my husband and I were impressed with the cheerful and eager-to-help "cast members" who worked in the hotel.  Every need was anticipated.  Our meals in the Storyteller Cafe were hearty and delicious.   The hotel is far from inexpensive, but we felt the value was high.  We can't wait to return for another stay at this idyllic destination, a few hundred feet from the gates of Disneyland.

After reading many of the bad reviews, I was on the lookout for problems with this hotel.  We stayed for 3 days and the only problem I found was that we had to leave.  Everyone was friendly and helpful.  Yes, it was very expensive for us, but that is what you get with a hotel like this in an atmosphere like this.  I will admit the hotel only had 4 star service for 5 star prices, but it was still worth it.  The location and atmosphere well outweighed everything else.  When we can afford it again, there is no doubt we will stay here in the future.  We had a standard room and were able to see the fireworks each night from our balcony.  Yes, we could also hear the music at times from Downtown Disney...we feel it just added to the atmosphere.  We have two small children and had no

We have just returned from a 4 day trip to Disneyland where we stayed at the Grand Californian Hotel and must say it was even better than expected.  Upon reading some reviews I went in thinking that negitive things would happen...nope  all good things.  We were able to check in early, very nice, and check in was very easy.  Parked in the free parking lot with no hassels, and it is very close.  Went up to the room, and WOW what a view, we were in a park view room, and even got  the swimming pools.  At the charactor breakfast they brought out a cute chocolate mousse mouse, and said Happy anniversay! and yes it was our anniversary, How they knew I don't know.  Made the reservations 4 months ago.  The whole stay was excellent, with the bed turn down, to the quick check out- took

The Grand Californian was Grand.  The staff were very courteous and friendly, the service was quick and efficient for room-service, maid service and anything else we wanted.   The room was a bit drab for being a Disney Hotel, but having a back-door directly into Disneyland far exceeded any decor disappointments we might have had!   The food at the hotel was excellent but a bit more expensive than I expected it to be.   The lobby was amazing; full of history, fun and surprises.  A fireplace with cozy rockers and seats, a movie niche for the kids, and a Grand Piano that "sang" every evening, and NOT just with Disney toons!   The view up from the lobby floor is amazing, gorgeous rafters, intricate carved woods, making the whole place seem like the quaint, rustic lodge it is trying

I just returned from 4 nights at Disney's Grand California Hotel and I was enormously pleased with my entire experience. Myself, my husband and two children stayed in a standard room concierge with bunk beds overlooking the Brisas Courtyard. After reading many varied reviews I wasn't sure what to expect. When we pulled in to the driveway a gentlemen in a booth checked our paperwork to verify we were hotel guests. As we pulled in front of the hotel my husband asked the valet where self parking was and  he most graciously pointed him in the right direction. A bellhop was immediately ushered over  to unload our luggage. I went inside to check us in as my husband parked the car across the street. As soon as the desk personnel saw that we were at the concierge level we recieved

My family of four just spend three days here.  The rooms, service and location can't be beat.  Stayed at the Disneyland hotel a couple of years ago and was not impressed by the age of the hotel. Every staff memeber that we came in contact with had a smile on their face. Sure you can get a bigger room for half the price, but it's the location you pay for.   Also I don't get the comments about valet parking... 12 dollars a day.  Get a grip people you just paid nearly 300 a night for a hotel room and several reviews have said 12.00 a night more is too much...  The one down side was the food at storytellers.  Just didn't think the quality was there.  Downtown Disney has a lot of places to eat that are  cheaper and better than anything in any of the parks or hotel.  You think Disney

Summary Heading: Good, but not up to par for a 4 star hotel
Summary: Recently we stayed at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel with my wife and 2 children.  We booked it through AAA and got a decent rate ($275/night) for a "city" view and a queen bed with bunk beds.  The check in process was OK, but in order to self park and avoid the outrageous valet parking fees, you have to leave your baggage curbside, get back in your car, park across the street and then hoof it back across that same busy street.  You would have thought that they could have improved on this route since the street you cross is fairly busy.  On to the room - it was good sized and the decor and fixtures were definitely upscale.  The down side is that there was nothing extraordinary about the room either.  The bathroom was a decent size and there was an oversized closet for clothes

My girlfriend and I just got back from the hotel today and were very dissapointed with our stay. We've stayed at the Disneyland Hotel many times before and decided to try the new flagship hotel. We paid quite a bit more money than the Disneyland Hotel for the same ammenities. The beds were very hard, there are no in-room movies, the staff was average, and the room decore is drab. Finally one last interesting thing was the mini bar, we took out some of their drinks to keep some of our our items in to chill. When we recieved our bill in the morning with a $36 charge for beverages. They did remove the charges from our bill but we where suprised to see that our mini bar was monitored by computer. All together I would not reccomend this hotel and suggest the less expensive classic

Let me keep it short and simple. I have visited Disneyland well over fifty times. Having stayed at this resort  I will never stay anywhere again. It truly made the experience that much better.  It was my 30th birthday and they really made me feel special!   Yes the rooms are a bit expensive and somewhat average but the overall experience cannot be described.   Do yourself a favor and spend the little extra. You will have the time of your life. While your there visit the Napa Rose for dinner and story tellers cafe for buffet breakfast. $19.95 but you won't be hungry until dinner.

Summary Heading: Quality does not match the expense
Summary: Having just stayed in the roomy lap of luxury in Hollywood (The Montrose Hotel) for less than half the price, we were very disappointed at the ordinariness of our room and especially the bathroom at the Californian when we were there last month. The lobby may be spectacular but it is not very inviting. The parks were great fun but didn't justify the non-experience of staying at the Californian.

Summary Heading: NY family travels to Disneyland/ July 31- Aug. 4 2004
Summary: Our family just returned from 2 weeks traveling California.  We stayed at the Grand Californian for the "LA/Disney" leg of our trip.  Our children (ages 9 thru 14) and my husband and I have stayed in many Disney resorts throughout Florida and the Grand Californian tops them all!  The service is first class in everything.  The beds and pillows are comfy, a waffle weaved robe in every room, etc.  The access to the parks is great.  The pools are great.  It was the nicest place we stayed on our trip even though the five of us stayed in one room.  The kids took turns sleeping on the floor on sleeping mats with bags and shared the queen bed. Have fun planning your trip!

8/03/04-8/05/04 My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary in a 4th floor standard view room ($248/night with AAA rates) and absolutely loved it! The room looked out over a courtyard and the monorail track. Didn't notice the monorail noise unless the patio door was open, and even then it wasn't bad. The most noise was during the fireworks, because the concierge lounge looked out over the the same courtyard and the music was blasting. Our room was lovely (1 King bed and a fold-out couch, a coffee table, desk, fridge--full of mini-bar stuff, though--coffee pot, iron, blowdryer, daily USA Today, late afternoon turndown service--beautifully done--with chocolates, and bathrobes.) The bathroom had two sinks, with plenty of storage underneath and a lovely dried flower arrangement

Just returned from the Disneyland Grand and LOVED every minute of it!  And believe me I can be picky!!  We were with some great friends who were also very impressed! (Also not easily done.)  The service was great from the minute we arrived at the hotel.  They picked up on the fact that we were celebrating my birthday and immediately brought out a balloon and birthday badge!  After that it is one continues birthday greeting.  Our rooms were very nice, not overly done but immaculate with nice toiletries and amenities.  We also noticed they were very quite!! A nice change!  We did ask for early check-in, which was not available but that seemed to be consistent with other guests, not a problem as they would store your luggage until your room was ready.  We had booked the concierge

We just got back from two nights at the Grand Californian.  This is the sixth year we've celebrated our son's birthday at the resort - three years at the Disneyland Hotel, and the last three at the Grand Californian.  This last trip just definitely wasn't worth the outrageous prices.   The bad:  Disney not enforcing their policy of 5 guests per room.  Our room was surrounded by other rooms being occupied by several families each.  This caused extra noise, extremely crowded pools, and constant running up and down the hallways.  The rooms are small - we had "fun" cleaning up the previous occupants coke bottles and tissues.  I passed on "turn-down" service our second night - they wanted to do it at 5:30 PM.  New bedspreads would be nice - ours were coming apart.  Pillows are

This hotel made our trip so much more enjoyable than staying offsite.  Yes, the rooms are expensive, but the comfort and convenience of being able to walk to the park, as well the the great atmsophere, was the highlight of our trip.  Be prepared not to have the room available until after 3pm on the day of check in, but you will probably be in the Park anyway. Would definitely stay here again.

Location is without peer.  But rooms were way overpriced, and overrated.  One of our children got bitten by insects quite badly whilst staying in the suite.  Service was efficient but perfunctory.  When asked at checkin how far the Parks are from the hotel, all they said was that it was not far but in fact there was a dedicated entrance for hotel guests to the California, which we only found out on the last day!  But for the promximity to the two parks, this is not the hotel to stay.

Summary Heading: Not worth it, except for the convenience
Summary: We expected more from this hotel.  First, the good: the public rooms are gorgeous (but who is hanging around there with the parks just outside) and the guest rooms are thoughtfully decorated with arts and crafts furnishings.  The not as good:  rooms are tiny and noisy, fixtures surprisingly poor for a brand new hotel (one faucet barely turned on, shower pressure was lacking, clothes line installed incorrectly so you could not use it), long walks to room from lobby, tiny balconies looking directly into other guests rooms, maid service delinquent.  The bottom line is I would stay here again only in the non-view room (we had a park view room this time, would not pay for it again as it barely faced the park), and only because of the fantastic access to parks.  You can't beat just

The Grand Californian is a beautiful, elegant and relaxed hotel where the staff is very friendly and the public rooms are gorgeous. The actual rooms are on the small side but they are beautifully appointed with the Arts & Crafts theme carried out. Do yourself a favor and have a glass of wine at the hotel bar, the wine list is incredible. We took our kids to the Napa Rose for dinner and although it is an elegant, 5-star type restaurant, the atmosphere is not stuffy and the staff was WONDERFUL, bringing toys and treats to the table while the adults enjoyed incredible California regional cooking. This hotel is a great place if you are in the mood to splurge a little. My children have been begging to go back.

Summary Heading: Hard Beds, Overpriced and limited room service menu!!
Summary: This was our third stay at the Disney Grand Californian.  Each time the hotel has lost some of it's quality.  We have loved this hotel in the past, but now will consider somewhere else to stay.  Our room was very cute, with bunk beds, a trundle bed and a queen bed.  However, the queen bed was AS HARD AS A ROCK.  If you like sleeping on a concrete slab, this will work for you.  My back was killing me the following morning.  My husband called downstairs to try and get another room, and of course, there were no other rooms available.  Management claimed that all of the rooms had the same beds.  (I think I would have remembered this from past visits).  I wound up sleeping on the bottom bunk, and had one of our sons sleep on the trundle.  Very disappointed for the cost.     Also, had

Bling...Bling... Blow a few grand in a few days but worth it.  Bring lots of money and a good attitude.  It's a beautiful hotel and every inch is delightful.  We were lucky to have a room that had easy access to the elevator, a great view of the monorail going by, fireworks at night and our room opened up to the lobby.  The overall feel of the hotel is dark and relaxed.  This is a beautiful place that makes you feel pampered.  It made all the difference to stay here and have my husband who is usually stressed at Disneyland all day relaxed and calm.  This is a good walking distance to all parts of the resort.  The hotel pools are terrific and hats off to the lifeguards.  My dh is a former lifeguard and he appreciated the very alert and numerous lifeguards.  You could feel safe

We stayed two nights  before 4th of July weekend.  The rooms are expensive, but worth it.  Don't expect a room that resemble the Ritz Carlton, but do expect clean rooms with nice amenitites.
