The convenience is worth every penny.  My son is two, so being so close made napping for him (and us) very convenient.  The pool is great and the service is awesome.  Upon arriving, we asked to self park. No dirty looks.  In fact they took our bags for us, so we didn't have to carry them across the street.  When our room was ready, which it was at 12:30, the bellman brought up our bags in under 5 minutes.  Whitewater Pool Bar had lunch and dinner at reasonable prices....alot less expensive than eating at the park.  There was never a line to enter California Adventure from the hotel and the

First off, this hotel is stunning. Its Arts and Crafts design is worthy of a tour (in fact, one is offered), and there are all sorts of beautiful little touches.  That said, it IS expensive. We paid a bit extra for a DCA "view" and got basically a view of the adjoining balcony and some trees. Not good, but aside from that, we would heartily recommend this hotel. You can't beat the location, the pools are nicely laid out and the staff was excellent.  I noticed one reviewer said that "self-parking" was frowned upon. We encountered no such attitude, and parking (basically) across the street was no great hardship, either.  We'd come back to stay at the Grand Californian any time.

This hotel made our trip to the theme parks an absolute dream. I would highly recommend this hotel for families with children of any age. Our 13 and 9 year old children had a complete and total blast. The proximity to the entrances, the monorail, Downtown Disney, shopping, dining, etc were so convenient. So fun to get off a ride at the theme parks and be swimming in the pool in the sun within 5 minutes! We were able to split up our days and swim in the fabulous pools, hang out at the spa, wander the property, etc. We paid $245/night and it was worth every single penny, in fact I would pay more for the convenience. We had a fridge in our room, wonderfully appointed accommodations and a great view of downtown disney from our room. The kids thought the bunkbeds were a hoot. You can

My wife and I just got back from staying at the Grand Californian for 7 nights. (6/22-6/29). I was very weary on what to expect because some of the reviews I had read, so I expected the worst. We had paid for a standard room. When we arrived at the hotel in the airport shuttle, you have to be a registered guest to get through security. (Yes, there is a security gate at the entrance). Wehn we got to the hotel we were just amazed at how great the hotel looked. We were early (12:30) but decided to check in anyway. Both desk clerks (one was training) welcomed us as if we were family. They gave us a free upgrade and we did not even ask for one. Then set us up for our disney hopper passes. Our rooms were not ready yet but they gave us a number we could call from any hotel phone to

Ok I must admit this is a beautiful hotel. But we are not rich people. But it was my daughters 5th  birthday and we wanted to have a big birthday for her because she almost did not make it to 5 years old. Well if you did not have the look or money they did not even look at you. We were shoved in a tiny room in by the world of disney. A $300.00  a night tiny room!!!! We asked if we could get a little closer they said yes another $210.00 a night. Oh and parking is a joke. If you do not let them park your car. DIRTY LOOKS FLY and we were asked to park across the street and get our belongings out there. {This is where you park if you do not valet your car}. Well we did nor time here and my daughter beged to stay another day. So we checked in to the Paridise Pier for $175.00 an night

Summary Heading: What you get for your money...
Summary: Its important to remember we came quite far so spending more for a better experience was ok. If we lived in the US, we probably wouldn't have stayed here....  + Atmosphere > Great for all ages and it felt welcoming  + Staff > Both friendly and responsive ( unlike the staff inside the park! )  + Location > Walking right into the park was a god send. It also allowed us to break our days up with a quick rest  + Hotel > The rooms were very nice well appointed, the lobby with fireplace was something special  - Value > We paid a very high premium for all the benefits and I wouldnt say this hotel is good value for money.  - Menu > Lack of vegetarian options. But it didnt matter cause we ate at Downtown Disney all the time.

It was great to take a short stroll to the Grand Californian after long days at both parks and escape the noise and crowds.  The boys loved the bunk bed and we loved the quiet.  The grounds are immaculate, the staff courteous and very helpful.  We have stayed at all three properties and this is the best.  Worth the extra dollars since you are so much closer to the parks, the rooms are brand new, the slide at the pool is better.  We didn't have time to enjoy the roaring fire and rocking chairs at night but we will next time.  At DL we didn't know that food service closed down two hours before the park closed; we were tired and hungry when we left at 9pm.  We found the storyteller cafe, which is beautifully decorated by the way, and  problem solved.  A good chicken sandwich,

As first time guests at Disney we didn't know what to expect and what a great surprise it was! the hotel was so kid friendly yet elegant enough for adults. the lobby was beautiful as was the pool. The entrance to disney was right in the hotel so you didn't have to wait in any line getting in. And, onw of the best parts was the fact that you are in downtown disney and there is so much activity and things to do - great for the tweeners! Our room was right over the action and we still didn't hear any noise when we wanted to go to sleep - what a fun place to stay and what a great trip!

Summary Heading: The Best Hotel at the Disneyland Resort: A Must Stay
Summary: To start off, I went down to Southern California, last June, and stayed 6 days at Disneyland, and stayed at the Grand Californian.  When we first drove up to the hotel, we were stopped at a booth to make sure that we were "real" guests, it also made the check-in faster for concierge guests.  When we parked in front of the hotel, we were greeted by the Valet people and the bell boy, who immediately parked our car and checked our lugage in, and led us to the concierge check-in, who checked our stuff in and led us up to our room.  On our way up, he told us about the actual resort, and hints about beating the crowds (really helpful)  When we arrived at our room it was magnificent.  We ended up getting a 1-bedroom suite with concierge service.  (If you have the money, get a suite

Summary Heading: Location Great!...Service and else...what a stuck up
Summary: Just came back from our Memorial day weekend stay 5/29-31.  I read the online review and thought this was the best.    $405/day for a 1king pool view room.   $8/day for health club and self parking access fee $12/day valet parking plus local tax and hotel tax  Here are the problems.  1) Tried to check in early, but room not available.  When we returned at after 3pm (check in time), still not ready.  Checkin clerk "Christopher" offered 2 fastpasses, yet mentioned to us "normally people come in late and 3pm check in is not an issue with our guest" ...well it was for us with 11mth old son.  2) Room was decorated in a redwood, yosemite style.  Nothing fancy.  Terrible quality bathroom tissue, no guide book in a room.  Room wasn't cleaned completely and still had magazines and papers

my boyfriend and i traveled california may 15-20th of 2004 and stopped for a night in disneyland. we came across this hotel and i liked it, (it looks very nice on the outside compared to must of the disneyland hotels) so we parked and went in. i will say however, you are paying mostly for the hotel amenities, and not the actual room. the lobby is gorgeous, the resturants are excellent, and the distance couldnt be better, this hotel is actually located inside the disney park! i was a little bit disappointed with the room, for the price of $350 a night, i did get an excellent view, but the room was kind of blah.....but overall, this is the ONLY place i would stay in disneyland, very clean and feels brand new!!

The hotel was wonderful. It was in a wonderful location and the rooms were spectacular. We paid about 70 extra dollars for a room overlooking the California Park and I must say it was worth the money. The view was incredible! The pools were wonderful, and the staff was very friendly. It was rather expensive but it was worth every bit.

I stayed at Grand Californian April 12 - April 16 2004 and found that overall it was a very nice place to stay. The staff was very pleasant, we were treated very well, and were always greeted with a smile. There were 6 of us in 2 rooms, I splurged on a room with what was suppose to be a view of California Adventure Park but what turned out to be more of a view blocked by trees. Next time I wont spend the xtra money for a view. The hotel was very nice and although for the price, you might expect Ritz Carlton luxury, dont expect it. You wont get 300 thread count sheets here. But you will get a very nice hotel with a beautiful lobby and clean, comfortable, tastefully decorated rooms (with the exception of the comforters)! Turn down service was a nice touch. It was also a plus being

My mother and I stayed at the Grand Californian Feb. 25-28, 2004. We had a wonderful time! It's a beautiful hotel, well worth the extra cost. It is defiantly a 4 to 5 star upscale hotel. Families with very young kids may want to save the extra money and stay at the other Disney hotels, but if you like staying at nicer establishments, this is for you! The check-in was painless with very friendly staff, we were able to purchase our park tickets right there, saving time at the park entrance ticket booths. We had booked a standard view room, but there was nothing standard about it. From our balcony, we could see the front part of Disney land, and Grisly Peak in CA Adventure. The room itself was just the right size, and the nightly turn-down service was a nice touch. The only thing

We made the sacrifice (financially) to stay at this beautiful hotel.  Immediately we were impressed with the entry doors! Small miscommunication with the valet (who told us valet parking was included in the room... it's not!) so we had to retrieve our car (another tip to the valet) and repark it in self parking. Check-in was very slow but our room met our expectations. We chose this hotel for many reasons including the "programs" offered to guests however our first choice was not offered during our stay (washcloth creations for the kids done by the housekeeping staff). We did do the "Learn to Draw Mickey" and exclusive early entry tour. The room was consistently well cleaned by smiling housekeeping staff. The pool was nicely heated but the slide area (another one of the reasons

Summary Heading: Fell in love with the hotel
Summary: My boyfriend took me to Disneyland for my birthday. We stayed at the Granda Californian Hotel. I LOVED IT. They had great room service and the bed were awsome. We had nightly turn down service and always had chocolate waiting on our pillows when we came back to snuggle. Being young and first time away from home we wanted to stay out all night but after 10:30 or 11:00 nothing is open and there is nothing to do. The hotel itself is huge and I would go back in back in a minute. Had the time of my life.

My dh and I decided to splurge a bit and stay at this beautiful hotel since this was our first trip to Disneyland with our 4 1/2 year old daughter. We stayed 2/27 to 3/3 and what a delightful time! Even the unusually cool and rainy weather couldn't dampen the "magic". The hotel was all that we'd hoped it would be, with only a couple of hiccups in service. The lobby is just breathtaking. The ceiling is SO high and the attention to detail obvious in the furniture and accents throughout.  The front desk staff was very helpful and quick to check us in (Hint: there is a "tv" corner right at the end of the check in desk with child rocking chairs so that if you did have a wait, your child is temporarily occupied w/ Disney short films). We were pleasantly surprised at check in to find

Summary Heading: My family and I will defiently stay there again!
Summary: I loved this Hotel! It was very nice and the rooms were great. The convience of the hotel was awesome . We could go back and forth (to our hotel and the parks) as much as we wanted. We went in March 2004 before spring break and on the weekdays we barely had to wait in any lines.  The only thing that was bad was Space Mountain and Indiana Jones were closed, but oh well. The hotel also has an entrance into Downtown Disney and i recommend eating at the rainforest Cafe just make sure to make a reservation like 3 hours before you want to eat. oops getting off subject. Anyway the price is defiantley worth it.

We just returned from a four night stay at the Grand Californian Hotel from 3/12-3/16/04.  The service was great right from the start. There was no wait at check in and the clerk was very friendly and helpful, giving balloons and stickers to the girls (2,9).  The bell hop brought up our bags and he was awesome. Really friendly with kids, setting up the bunk bed with rails and getting us a mini frig and sleeping bags for the girls for a "campout".  The hotel is a must with a toddler as you can just wak back to the room within minutes for afternoon naps. The hotel has entrances that lead either directly into California Adventure or into Downtown Disney. For those with kids the bunk beds work out great as they also have a low trundle bed underneath.  There are two good size pools,

We stayed at the Grand Californian for New Year's and it was a great way to usher in 2004. We'd first seen the lodge style mega-hotel while visiting Disney's California Adventure a couple of year's ago. We thought it would be a great place to stay while visiting the magic kingdom and we were right! The lobby is truly one of the most beautifully designed spaces I've seen in a hotel to date. It's reminiscent of a mountain hunting lodge. And appropriately, we had a room overlooking the rugged grizzly bear mountain of California Adventure. The rooms are nice, but a bit disappointing when compared to the lobby. They are comfortable, but pretty standard hotel issue designs. The hotel amenities, however, are first class. The spa was great and the pool and rock slide were a blast. You

Summary Heading: A great experience...  Recommend concierge level
Summary: We just got back from DL last week and we stayed at the Grand CA hotel.  We went last May and stayed at the Anabella. What a great treat! We decided for convenience purposes we would stay at the Disney hotel. We have a child that turned 2 while we were there and a 4 year old. We stayed 5 days and it was great. The crew members were all very nice and helpful! I has spend lots of time with both trips on trip advisor etc.  and was hesitant if this would be worth the money. It really was! It was so convenient and fun! We never even rented or bought a stroller until the second to the last day. The best part was staying on the concierge level! It is well worth the money. It pays for itself in food and water.!!! We were able to eat breakfast in the craftsman club (cereal, fruit, OJ,

We have been to Disneyland many times and have stayed at every price range of accomodations. Most of the time we have chosen not to stay at a Disney property because of the cost. But in December we decided to take an anniversary trip for a few days (early December, so still "value season") and stay at the Grand Californian. We are annual passholders and were able to travel on Sunday through Thursday so we got a good rate. We booked through the Disney Travel Company and the booking agent was very helpful and made some good recommendations... I told her that we wanted a quiet room and so she suggested a standard room that overlooked the courtyard. She was right on the mark.. the room was beautiful with one king size bed and yes, it was very quiet.  The room also had a small desk

Filthy! what else can I say about my room. My wife turned our beds down for the night and discovered our sheets were covered in PUBIC HAIR! crumbs and my three year old found broken eye glasses under the bed. We were horrified! Obviously the beds were not changed. Management was rude, and offered no apology. I'm surprised that Disneyland would allow this type of service, especially in a so called 5 star. If you buy your room online, with hotels or other, beware, Disneyland will not refund or be accountable for anything if you did'nt purchase directly through them. Shame on them...

We spent 4 nights at the Grand Calfornian in late September. I have traveled to Disneyland several times but never stayed at any of their hotels before. I always choose September or October because generally it is still warm and not too crowded. With our 2 1/2 year old we rarely had more then a 5 minute wait in any of the lines..A big bonus with a toddler! Anyway, I found the customer service to be excellent and up to Disney standards. The maid was incredible. She would neatly arrange my daughters coloring books and little toys for the turndown service as well as the morning room service. It really made us feel at home.  Everyone at the Grand Californian had a smile on and it was always spotless. We had a view of Disneys California Adventure and it was great to sit on the

If your're looking for a bargain hotel then this isn't the place for you. But if you're looking for first class accommodations then this is the place to stay. As with any hotel you'll find the good and the bad but with the California Grand you'll find mostly the good. Our arrival didn't start off very well as the employees in the outside arrival area were more interesting in standing around shooting the breeze rather than helping arrivals from the airport. After asking one of the employees where the front door was we took our own baggage to the reception desk where the positve aspects of our stay began. No lines, as our stay was the start of the off season in mid October. This is the only time to visit. Our receptionist was extremely helpful and took time to provide us with maps

We (my husband and I), just returned from a 4 night vacation at Disney Land. We stayed at the Grand Calicornian. The standard room did not have a king bed which we asked for. Since it was the two of us, the other bed was wasted when we could have been more comfortable in a King bed. When you pay so much, that is the least they could provide you.  Also the front desk personell were rude. They said no King bed and thatz it. So our first impressions were very bad. there was no breakfast on the house which most two star hotels provide. In face even internet browsing had a charge which two star hotels provide for free for hotel guests. The rooms were also below par of a 4 star hotel. The pillow was uncomfortable. All in all this hotel is aboslutely not worth the price you pay. The

The Grand Californian is a classy, attractive hotel which also makes you feel at home. It has an ideal location, with its own private entrance to the California Adventures theme park, and within easy walking distance of downtown disney shopping mall and Disneyland, as soon as you figure out which elevators (or secret staircases) are the quickest routes! My husband and I got a great price for a room at the Grand Californian in January, with a seasonal discount for annual passholders, so we decided to give this hotel a try to celebrate our 22nd wedding anniversary. What a pleasant surprise! Anybody who complains about this hotel must be spoiled and crabby. Our room on the third floor had a view of the park near the water raft ride, and the room was definitely above average. It

Summary Heading: HoRribLe! i ExpEcT bEtTeR fRoM diSnEyLaNd!
Summary: omg! me and my sister and my mom stayed at the grand californian and it was horrible! it cost too much 4 one thing so we couldn't really buy that much stuff, and 2 the staff wasn't very nice. and THEN in our room we found hair in the bathtub, and the room was smelled like cottage cheese! by the way... i hate cottage cheese so my stay was the worst ever! oh yeah and did i mention that it was my FIRST time at Disneyland.. and that was the last time i will ever stay at the californian. I DO NOT RECCOMEND THIS HOTEL 2 ANY1!!!!!
We have stayed at The Grand Californian twice and things were perfect.  Beautiful place to stay and very helpful and polite staff. Worth every penny.

We just visited the Grand Californian - it is SO awesome. We were treated wonderfully from the minute we drove up - everyone was very courteous and helpful. It was great being able to walk right into the park everyday. We had a balcony room facing downtown Disney and got to people watch and listen to musicians every night. They stop playing at 10pm so you can sleep. The rooms are very sound proof and very clean.  Thanks for a wonderful stay!

Just back from Grand Californian, it was a lovely hotel, the rooms were of a nice standard, very clean, but the decor and room size a little disappointing. As a couple we did frind (not surprisingly) disney very child orientated; which was fine, but after 10pm there really isn't anything for the adults to do! The food in the hotel is very good, but quite pricey, especially for breakfast! Much cheaper to eat in Downtown Disney. Overall we had a great stay, staff were very courteous and friendly and would definitely recommend it for anyone wanting to sample the Disney experience!

My hubby and I just spent five nights at the Grand Californian. We visited both parks, Disneyland and California Adventure. The hotel was awesome. The beds were comfy, the turndown service was surprisingly nice. Maids tidy the room when they turn down the bed, so if you've used coffee cups or towels, you get clean ones when they turn down the bed and leave chocolate coins on the nightstand. Our room overlooked the courtyard, which was nice and quiet. The monorail glides through every little while, but wasn't disturbing at all. The monorail stop at DTD straight to Tommorrowland was convenient, as was the private entrance to California Adventure from the hotel. We found food everywhere in the parks and hotels to be very costly, and the best deal was the White Water Snacks at the

We recently returned from a quick four day trip to the Grand Californian Hotel in Anaheim. My teenagers loved the hotel. We travel alot and the kids found the hotel safe, clean, and extremely convenient to Downtown Disney, Disneyland and the Californian Adventure. The price was steep but worth it. The room was nothing special but our room over the Downtown Disney provided lots of entertainment all day long. My 13 year old son (!!!) took advantage of the "Build A Bear" an hour before the store opened to the public. We discovered this option from a brochure that was on our bed. We enjoyed the piano player in the lounge. Finding a place to eat meals at regular times was a challenge as everything was full. We usually ran across to the take out pizza place in Downtown Disney.My son

We were quite pleasantly surprised to find that this hotel is well above all the others in the Disneyland area. We stayed one night in a concierge level suite at $750/night and it was quite lovely. The beds were comfortable with nice linens, the rooms were extremely spacious and overall, it shares many of the same carpeting, architectural features and design of the much more expensive Lodge at Torrey Pines.  The concierge level has free snacks all day for the kids and a lovely continental breakfast including. We watched the fireworks from our room deck and overall we had a magical evening! The dinner at Napa Rose was 5-star OUTSTANDING--as good as it gets in both food quality and service. I have never had such an outstanding waiter at any hotel. It is definitely the ONLY hotel

We stayed four nights at the grand california hotel and were very disappointed. The staff was not at all knowledgable about the area regarding restaurants or other activities besides disneyland. The rooms were very average, not at all up to par for a 4star hotel. The rooms were very dimmly lit so that it was difficult to see when getting dressed. The bedding was not that of a 4 star property, but more of a typical Marriott property. Our room was at the opposite end of the hotel and took several minutes to reach. We attended this meeting for a convention and everyone we spoke with had a negative comment about this property. Unfortunately I think that this is as good as it gets at Disneyland.

Our one night stay was wonderful. The atmosphere and surroundings were great. The room was great. The only flaw was when we arrived. It took the valet people at least 15 mins to even acknowledge us standing there by our car. We felt very slighted and unimportant. Even the Lincoln LS V8 didn't make a difference. Can you imagine if we had driven up in our restored '72 Monte Carlo! I even had to unload my own luggage and load it up when we left the next day. Service was not good at all for a 5 star hotel.

Summary Heading: Not quite the 'ELITE' of hotels but pretty darn cool
Summary: My husband and I just got back from the land of the mouse. We had a very fun stay at the Grand Californian from Oct 11th - 19th. We experienced both good and bad at the hotel but, overall, our experience was definitely positive. We had been reading all of the reviews for the past 8 months on this website and admit we were a tad bit anxious about our choice. A few of the comments made us almost change our minds about our location but I am glad that we didn't. Let me note some of the things that we found made it to be a great place to stay as well as note what made the experience lack.Lets start with the the few things that turned us off the hotel. so that we can finish this review off on a positive note. These were, rude front guest agents. Of course, I will say that it was only

Summary Heading: If you love disney this is the way to go!
Summary: The Grand Californian is a terrific hotel in the midst of all the Disney fun! We grew up in So. CA & HAVE to go back to Disneyland at least once a year to get our dose of Disney magic. We usually stayed at the Paradise Pier so that we could still be in a Disney hotel but not pay the big prices. Last year we splurged for the Grand Californian on the advise of friends & were we ever glad we did! The hotel is beautiful, the staff friendly & helpful, the rooms are decorated perfectly with great little amemities added & you are sooo close to all the Disney fun. Having 2 teenagers we usually get 2 rooms but decided since we are not in the rooms very much when at Disney we would go with just the one. It was a little tight at times but everyone agreed the one room was big enough to

We stayed here from 9/27-10/4. What a great experience! Convienence was wonderful, housekeeping was great, the atmosphere was heavenly. We stayed in a standard room overlooking the valet parking, but we didn't spend a lot of time in the room. We did have bunkbeds and they did squeek a little throughout the night. Beds were comfy, room was always clean, the staff was very friendly from check-in, valet and houskeeping to park entrance employees, servers and room service. Most everyone had a smile on their face and always said "Hi". White Rapid Snack Bar was GREAT! Something for everyone, not too over priced and good food! We will definately be staying here again and can hardly wait for our next trip! The price is worth every cent!

Summary Heading: Holiday Inn service at Ritz-Carlton prices
Summary: We stayed at the Grand just a few weeks before the summer season started. The lobby is gorgeous, and the hotel has some very nice touches with it's furnishings and architecture. But the staff and overall hospitality of the place leave a lot to be desired.  The employees were civil and occasionally friendly, but no one ever went out of their way to help us or impress us. The check-in process was sterile and charmless, as if we were checking in our car for an oil change at the dealership. It wasn't exactly the right way to start when you are shelling out Ritz-Carlton bucks (260 bucks per night, per room). The bartenders in the lobby bar always seemed to be bored and moved at a snails pace without a smile. Room service took forever, and on both occasions our orders were messed up

We just returned from a four-night stay at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel in Anaheim, California, and I really can't say enough. Our stay here made ALL the difference. Growing up, we usually stayed at motels just outside the park, and I always thought that the money we saved was surely worth avoiding the resort hotel(s). With respect to the Grand Californian, nothing could be further from the truth.  I've stayed at the Paradise Pier hotel too, and frankly, by comparison, I would rather have saved money by staying in a local motel, but the Grand Californian puts you in a whole world of its own. By staying here, we were able to immerse ourself in the "total Disney experience." We splurged and paid the hefty nightly rates, and I expected to find over-priced meals and merchandise,

I've been to the Disneyland resort many times in the past few years and had bad hotel experiences. This time I decided to splurge and get a room at the Grand Californian. From the moment my friends and I arrived at the hotel we were awestruck. The interior and exterior of the hotel was beautiful. the receptionist was very nice and helpful and we checked in very quickly. A hint to people talking about long check-ins, if you go in the summer, that won't be the first line you stand in that day. We went in February, and excellent time to go, California Adventure had just opened a week earlier and there were no lines. May I also recommend going in March and November (before Thanksgiving). After having gone at those times of year, I refuse to wait in a line for a ride more than 20

I am still trying to recover from our fantabulous vacation to the Disneyland Resort. We, my husband and two sons, 18 months and 3 years, embarked on a 7 days 6 night Disney vacation earlier this month. We opted to make the 6 hour drive from our home rather than fly for an hour-flying is an ordeal when dealing with carry-on luggage, a double stroller, snacks for the kids AND carseats! Since we left very early in the morning, the kids did rather well on the drive. They slept for most of the ride.  We arrived in the Anaheim area @ 11:30am on Sunday. We were able to check-in our luggage early BUT our room wouldn't be ready until 3pm.  Check-out is @ 11am while check-in is @ 3pm. At this point, one could pass the time at Downtown Disney or make the 15 minute drive to Costa Mesa's,

Recently stayed at the Grand Californian and everything lived up to what you expect from a Disney hotel. We decided to stay in a concierge room which was located on the 6th floor (exclusive lift access).  Concierge included use of the concierge lounge where there was a continental breakfast in the morning, afternoon cookies, wine and cheese early evening, unlimited drinks, turndown service. Brilliant location to watch the fireworks at Disneyland from. Whenever we stop at a Disney resort we always feel its like coming home and everyone makes you so welcome. Truly a wonderful experience.

Summary Heading: The Best DLR has to offer
Summary: We had never been to Disneyland before and chose The Grand Californian as our hotel, and hoped it was the right choice. It was! The location CANNOT be beat. It was a bit on the pricey side, but well worth the money. Our view of DCA was wonderful, our room was just above the Great Hall. Although we all thought the redwood pool could have had a better slide and more staff to wait on the entire pool area. There is no better place to stay in our opinion and will return there again for Disneyland's 50th in 2005.

We stayed at the Grand Califorian Resort Feb. 19-21 and had a wonderful  time. Our standard room overlooked Downtown Disney and we were able to  stand on our balcony at night and watch all the action below. The room  was very spacious and easily accommodated 2 adults and 3 children. The  only downside to the room was that we were located very far from the  elevators.  Our room was very clean and still had the new feel to it. There was nothing Disney in the room, but that didn't bother us because we quickly changed that. The furnishings were nicely done, with lots of wood accents and there was a full wet bar. We ordered room service one night and went into sticker shock when we received the bill.    We would definitely stay here again.

The Grand Californian is simply amazing. The hotel features some of the most stunning architecture I have ever seen. In addition, there are endless other details to enjoy. The rooms are beautifully decorated and elaborately detailed. The service is top notch. The restaurants and amenities can't be beaten. And the location puts you seconds from the parks and allows you to enjoy the best views imaginable.The only thing that felt lacking was the size of the pool. The pool is beautiful and features a waterslide, but it wasn't very big. Not to say it was sub-standard or anything, but it didn't seem to fit the grand scale of the rest of the hotel. (I should note that it still has one of the best pools in Anaheim. Most of the hotels don't have that wonderful of pools. I guess because

December of 2002 we stayed in a suite overlooking the California theme park. It was my granddaughters first trip and she was almost 2 at the time. She loved the lobbey and the ballon that was given to her, which she kept the 3 days we were there. We had breakfast at storytellers restaurant and Chip & Dale were a hugh hit. I would suggest getting a early reservation to avoid the crowd. It was such a treat to be able to return to the hotel for her afternoon nap. We are looking forward to another magicial visit in the future.

we have stayed at almost every Disney property in Florida, and we were curious about the Grand Californian and how it would rate. We found it very similar in architecture to the Animal Kingdom and Wilderness Lodge. What set this hotel apart was the wonderful guest service. (We arrived the day the war broke out and everyone was being a little nicer to each other!). Staff went out of their way to help us and were very friendly. The rooms were standard Disney, which is good. We had a view of the monorail and that was neat to see, especially for my son. The hotel has easy entrance to California Adventure and downtown disney. The food at the main resturaunt was very pretty generic and the  buffet was bland. However the characters at the character breakfast worked overtime to make the

We decided to splurge and talked ourselves into this expensive resort. It was advertised as lots of extras, and worth the $$.  We have stayed at other comparable star hotel resorts, and expected the utmost in friendly, available service. We found very little here....at our arrival in took us 35minutes to check in, the staff looked overwhelmed and our gentleman was not very friendly with no smiles or excitement to our family arriving to Disney. Our kids rec'd a cheap coloring book and crayons, and a pin. Our room was not available, so we were given a small room on the concierge level but were "told" we were not allowed to use any of the services.    The other big let down was the pool, advertised as three there was only 2 side by side and a kidee pool, very crowded and absolutely

Summary Heading: One of the Best Times We've Ever Had
Summary: My wife and 6 year old son just got back from a fabulous 5 day visit to the Grand Californian, Disneyland and Grand California Adventure.  We had a blast and enjoyed every day.  The hotel is fabulous and every person that worked there was friendly helpful and full of energy.  You could feel it every where you went.We stayed in a room that overlooked Downtown Disney which was great and my son enjoyed his own bunkbed.  What was nice is that at the end of a long day of rides and people we were able to make the short walk to the hotel, unwind, relax and enjoy the quiet.  We thought it might be noisy...after all Disneyland is for kids of all ages...but we didn't experience much noise at all.  The room was spacious, the service was great and we hope to go back soon and do it all over
Too many kids. Takes too long to walk to a room. The hotel needs more elevators.

The Hotel is 5-star all the way.  Other than a very unfriendly check-in person, the hotel is very conveniently located with easy access to the park.  My only complaint  was the long walk to the rooms and the hotel seems a lot larger compared to the Disneyland Hotel so it loses some of its cozyness.  The extra money for these hotels is well worth it and will make for great experience.

We had a lot of nice surprises at our visit (12/19 - 12/21/02).  We had gotten a special rate of $209. / night and had agreed to a Disneyland drive view.  My husband asked if there were any rooms with a view available and the lovely check-in lady upgraded us to a pool / theme park view on the 5th floor near an elevator (Rm. 5324) at no additional charge.  What a view!!!  We pre-checked in at 9:00 am and since the room was available they let us move right in instead of having to wait until 3:00 pm.  That was so nice to be in our room early and ready to start our day at Disneyland at 10:00 am.  Our room had a queen bed with a bunk bed / trundle that conviently slept all three of our children.  The bell hop gave us a lot of good information and was extremely helpful.  The room was

The Grand Californian is a beautiful hotel with it's own private entrance into Disney's Calfornia Adventure theme park.  I was impressed with the decor and the little extras that Disney always puts into the hotel theme. Likes: I love the location, the restaurants, the pool, and the decor.  Dislikes:  It was surprisingly noisey in the hallway with people and children talking. Reminded me of Motel 6 A resort fee of $20 a day is charged. I don't know why. Improvements:  They don't have a monorail stop at the hotel. That is a huge oversight.  There is no early entrance into Disneyland which I expected when staying on Disney property. Guest self parking is across the street. Amazingly far and not very guest friendly.

When we booked our room at the Disney's Grand Californian, the cost almost changed our minds, but oh what a hotel.  We are very glad that we didn't cancel, and look forward to returning very soon.  Our view faced the grand rapids attraction, the waterfalls looked and sounded fabulous.  The view was just the icing on the cake though.  Our room was spacious and housed all the amenities that we could of needed and then some. The staff was exceptional!  Very helpful with any requests and/or questions that we had.  We travel to Disneyland Anaheim resort several times a year and take our breakfast and lunch foods with us to cut the cost of feeding a family at the resort.  Our room had 2 good sized tables, one inside and one on the balcony which was excellent for morning coffee and

What a wonderful trip of a lifetime. (however I hope to make it again) As we pulled up to the front gate and were asked our names, I became concerned, but to arrive at the door filled with costume adorned gentlemen ready to unload our car, I knew this would be great. They explained that checkout had just begun, but they would be happy to hold our luggage until our room was ready. We entered the huge wooden wall as it parted, and went inside a fantasy lodge. We checked in and were shown to our room. Immeaditaely my 2 yr old noticed the park from our balcony, and we had to leave. We were surprised at how easy it was to enter the park (a private guest entrance located downstairs next to the pool) We were even allowed to return to our room with the rented stroller our child was

We just got back from three days/two nights at the Grand Californian, and would have stayed longer if we could have - but they were booked solid!  I would recommend staying at the Californian over any of the other Disney resorts.  It is beautiful, you  are IN the park (a big advantage at the end of a long day!)  Service was incredible and if you watch what you are doing associated expenses need not ruin the budget.  I would recommend it to everyone!

Even though the grand california hotel is nice, There are alot of hidden costs, The cost of eating their is high, there are plenty of eating places in and around disneyland, that are more affordable!!! especially if you bring children!!
